¶the preface ſir iohan bourchier knyght lorde berners sythe hyſtorie haue preface vpon fyrſt volume cronycles declared wytneſſe tymes lyght trouthe lyfe remembraūce maiſtres lyfe ye meſſanger olde ſeaſon wherof innumerable cōmodyties growen ne thynke labour myſpente highe cō maundement mooſt redoughted ſoueraygne lorde henry cyght kyng englande fraūce highe defender chriſten faythe c haue e • ployed aboute tranſlacyon nowe foure volume ſir iohan froiſſa • frenche englyſſhe tong certainly nat boū tie ſame cronycles conteyg •• warres theſe party whiche warres • ſc • yued frenche ſir iohan froyſſa •• ryght • nately many haue great vnderſtandynge dyuers tonges whome warres written plainly ſaye knyghtly feate • manhode humanyte paſſe ryght moche warres farre countreis great pleaſure thy noble countrey menne englande toke redynge ye worthy knightly dedes valyaunt aunceſtours encorageth halfe ſo moche princely exhorte whiche erthely kynges worſhyppe 〈◊〉 ou • foreſaid gracyous ſoueraygne gaue forthe manyfolde royall vertues highneſſe foūde nat two thre ſmall realmes 〈◊〉 worthy reygne kyng ouer vnyuerſall worlde • elyteth nothyng 〈◊〉 〈…〉 ſayd mooſt famous 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 ſubict 〈…〉 ou • 〈◊〉 • ought appere euery mannes • ight ouer howe worthy people 〈…〉 nowe 〈…〉 lyaunt 〈◊〉 contende vigorous vertue manhode folowe yea paſſe maye truely ymages vſed olde tyme erecte worſhyp remembraunce diſcended noble blode beare halfe wytneſſe noble dedes ſette hyſtorye done whiche well appereth wordes prudent kyng ageſilaus dying cōmaunded neyther ymage picture reſemblaūce ſhulde made haue ſayd noble thyng famouſly done ſhall beare wytneſſe ynough haue nought done certainly ymages lytell aueylen ſaythe ſuche thynges inought made mynde daſtardes neuer dyde worthy dede lyfe wherfore loue honour beare mooſt puiſſaunt ſoueraygne pleaſure ſubie • te bothe noble cōmons haue endeuored tranſlate frēche ſayd englyſſhe four volume ſir iohan froiſſart reduced twayne wherin haue erred praye ſhall defaute fynde cōſyder greatneſſe hyſtorie good wyll aſke nothyng elles great labour curteſy amende nede ſhalbe yet ſo doynge ſhall praye god finally ſende blyſſe heuen amen ¶thus endeth preface ſir iohan bourchier knight lord berners deputie calais trāſlatour preſent cronycle foloweth table chapter ſtande boke order c ¶herafter foloweth table preſent volume firſt howe ſyr iohan bourchyer gouernour gaunt durynge truſe newe vitayled towne gaūt howe maner people called comporſelles dyd moche hurte countrey capitulo primo ¶howe ye bridge taylbourcke frenche men howe engliſſhmen fortyfied ſelfe agaynſt cōmyng frenchman howe admyrall fraūce rout aryued ••• nborowe scotlande capi ii ¶howe frenche men found wylde countrey scotlāde yuell content admyrall howe pacyfied fayre wordes howe fraunces atreman company nerehande taken ardenbourke flaunders cap iii ¶howe lorde ſaint albyne enguerante zendequyn ſaued ardenbourke fro takynge howe quene hungery ſent ambaſſadours fraunce marry thetle valoyes eldeſt doughter cap iiii ¶howe ducheſſe brabant wrote duke frederyke bauyere maryage yonge frenche kyng neſe iſabell bauyer howe duke lady came queſnoy capi v ¶howe fraunces atreman toke towne dan howe frenche kynge wedded lady iſabell bauyere wente layde ſiege dan fo vi ¶howe dyuers burgeſſes sluſe behe ded howe sluſe chaunged lande bethune howe ſiege dan contynewed longe cap vii ¶howe gauntoyſe fledde dan nyght howe frenche men toke towne deſtroyed alſo howe kynge dyſtroyed countrey foure craftes capi viii ¶howe frenche kynge departed oute flaunders gaue leaue men departe howe came parys treate ambaſſadours hungry howe marque blanqueforte toke ſtrēght wyfe ſame lady 〈…〉 cap ix ¶howe duke burbone toke bertuell poictou alſo great aſſemble kynge scottes made entre englande cap x ¶howe frenche men ſcottes caſtell vatley dyſtroyed dyuers townes northumberlande howe withdrewe agayne scotlande whan knewe kynge englande cōmynge great puyſſaunce capi xi ¶howe ſyr iohan hollande ſlewe ſyr rycharde stafforde howe erle stafforde came kynge demaunde iuſtyce capi xii ¶howe kynge englande cauſed dyſtroyed churche mewreus scotlande howe barones scotlande aunſwered admyrall fraunce deuyſed leaue scotlande lette englyſſhe men alone cap xiii ¶howe kynge englande toke edenborowe chiefe tytle scotlande howe duke lancaſtre purpoſe retourne wale cloſe frenche men ſcottes frenche men ſcottes dyd ſayd countrey cap xiiii ¶howe erle oxenforde brake purſute kynge englande thought haue made wale frenchman ſcottes howe kyng retourned ſame way came howe frenche men ſcottes determyned retourne againe scotlande cap xv ¶howe frenche lordes great paryll ſcotlande coude nat fynde meanes paſſe ouer theſee ſhewed erles duglas morette hardneſſe founde countrey anſwere made cap xvi ¶howe admyrall enfourmed frenche kynge counſayle ſtate scotlande howe duke burgoyne great deſyre cauſe ye frenche kynge make iourney englande cap xvii ¶howe grace god two burgeſſes gaunt entred 〈◊〉 ye duke bu • goyne peace howe gaue charge therof knight flaunders anſwere duke gaue vnto ca xviii ¶howe theſe two 〈…〉 burgeſſes aſſembled frendes acomply ••• enterpriſe ſent ſyr iohan delle 〈…〉 letter peace cap • ii ¶howe ſyr iohan delle came gaunt markette place roger iaques alderman eytie howe delyuered letter fro duke burgoyne howe gaunt ſente turney confyrmacion peace charter made therof capi xx ¶howe ſir iohan froiſſart auctour cronycle departed fraunce went erle foyzland maner voyage cap xxi ¶howe prince wale princeſſe came tarbe requeſt yt counteſſe armynake mad prince princeſſe howe countrey gaſcoyne newly agayne warre cap xxii ¶of warres ye duke • niou made agaynſt englyſſhe men howe recouered caſtell maluoyſyn bygore whiche afterwarde gyuen erle foize cap xxiii ¶howe garyſon caſtell lourde caſte downe diſcomfyted great dylygence yt erle foiz made ca xxiiii ¶howe peace made bytwene ye duke berrey erle foyz begynnynge warre bytwene erle foiz erle armynake ca xxv ¶of great vertuouſneſſe large erle foize maner pytuous dethe gaſcone erles ſonne capi xxvi ¶howe ſyr peter byerne ſtronge dyſeaſe counteſſe byſquay wyfe cap xxvii ¶of great ſolēpnyte erle foiz made fyeſt ſaynte nycholas tale •• ſtot manlyon ſhewed ſir iohan fro ••• rt cap xxviii ¶howe dyuers capytayns englyſſhe dyſcomfyted towne saxere frenche men cap xxix ¶howe squyer called lymoſyn tourned frenche howe cauſed loyes rambalt cōpany armes taken ca xxx ¶of ſtate ordynaūce erle foiz howe towne yran rebelled great traueyle dommage outrage done therto cap xxxi ¶howe kynge caſtyle left ſiege ••• bone howe ſaynt prayne 〈…〉 ſelfe cap xxxii ¶ 〈…〉 batayle 〈…〉 kinge caſtyle kynge 〈◊〉 portugale cap xxxiii ¶of ſpanyardes howe ordred ſelfe batayle cap xxxiiii ¶howe frenche knyghtes gaſcons ſuche taken priſoners iuberoth portugaloyes ſlayne mayſters none eſcaped cap xxxv ¶howe kynge caſtyle great batayle diſcomfyted kyng portugale vyllage called iuberothe capi xxxvi ¶howe ſpiryte called orthone ſerued lorde coraſſe longe tyme brought euer tidynges partes worlde cap xxxvii ¶howe ſiege layde breſte bretayne howe dyuers englyſſh •• eſſes aboute countrey tholous recouered tourned frenche cap xxxviii ¶howe caſtelles conuall bygor • neſuyll taken 〈◊〉 taken ſlayne hanged cap xx •• ¶howe kinge cypre ſlayn • 〈◊〉 murthered bedde owne bro ••• exortacyon corruptyon lectyons warres bytwene cap xlii ¶howe portugale ſent meſſangers englande ſhewe tydynges countrey kynge englande great lordes cap xliii ¶howe laurens fongaſe ambaſſadour fro kynge portugale englande ſhewed duke lancaſtre maner diſcorde bytwene realmes caſtyle portyngale cap xliiii ¶howe laurence fongaſe ſhewed duke lancaſtre maner batayle iuberothe bytwene kynges caſtyle portyngale cap xlv ¶howe ambaſſadours portyngale aunſwere kynge englande great gyftes howe tooke leaue went countreys cap xlvi ¶howe duke lancaſtre aſſayled lordes knightes ſquyers baſtydes breſt bretayne howe defended ſelfe cap xlvii ¶howe duke lancaſtre hooſt whaſie ſoiourned moneth colongne departed rode towarde ſaynt iames galyce cap xlviii ¶of great apparell prouyſon generally made realme fraunce kynge counſayle iourney made englande alſo deth fraunces atreman cap lii ¶howe kyng portyngale wrote amyably duke lancaſtre whan knewe arryued ſaynt iames galyce ſocours kynge caſtyle ſent fraūce howe towne ruelles galyce taken englyſſhe men cap liii ¶howe duke lācaſtres marſhall men aſſayled towne vieclope galyce whiche yelded cōpoſycion ambaſſadours duke ſent kynge portyngale cap li ¶howe bayon yelded theym duke lancaſtre howe marſhall hooſt entred towne • ke poſſeſſyon therof cap liii ¶howe duke lancaſtre ducheſſe helde ſaynte iames galyce comforte frenche knyghtes gaue kynge caſtyle cap lxii ¶of great apparell ſhyppes galeys frenche men made ſee paſſe englande cap liii ¶howe frenche kinge vncles arryued sluſe flaunders cap liiii ¶howe frenche kynge taryed sluſe great hooſt entent entre englande cap lv ¶howe ſyr symon burle wolde haue counſayle ſaynt thomas caunterburyes ſhryne remoued ye caſtell douer wherby atchyued great hate cap lv ¶howe kynge armonye paſſed englande truſte fynde ſome meanes peace good appoyntment bytwene ye kynge englande frenche kyng cap lvi ¶howe kinge armony retourned englande aunſwere made hym cap lvii ¶howe duke berrey departed fro parys come sluſe howe conſtable fraunce toke ſee wynde contrary hym cap lviii ¶howe voyage englande broken reaſon wyndes wynter counſayle duke berrey ca lix ¶howe kynge charles fraunce frenche lordes returned yuell content fro ſluſe flaunders prouyſyons made haue gone englande feeſt made london cap lx ¶howe ſquier called iaques le griſe acuſed parlyament howſe parys lordes preſent knyght called iohan carongne iudgement gyuen vpon howe iuſted vttraunce paris place called ſaynt katheryne behynde temple howe iaques le griſe confounded cap lxi ¶howe kyng aragon dyed howe archebyſſhoppe burdeaux ſet priſone barcelona cap lxi ¶how batayle armes done burdeaux ſeneſchall dyuers cap lxii ¶howe iohan bretaygne ſonne ſyr charles bloyes delyuered priſon meanes ſyr olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce cap lxxii ¶howe duke burbone choſen go caſtyle dyuers howe ſyr iohan bucke admyrall flaūders token priſoner englyſſhmen ca lxxii ¶howe englyſſhe men aryued brent dyuers village cap lxxiii ¶howe duke lācaſters marſhall toke towne rybadane whiche ſtrongly kept cap xliii ¶howe duke lancaſtre ſent admyrall marſhall offycers come weddynge doughter kynge portyngale cap lxxiiii ¶howe duke lancaſtre men rode towardes cytie beſances howe towne made compoſycion capi lxxv ¶howe ducheſſe doughter went ſe kynge portyngale quene howe towne baſances ſubmytted vnder obeyſaunce duke lancaſtre cap lxxvi ¶howe baſances ben ſente kynge caſtyle came home towne rendred vp duke lancaſtre cap lxxvii ¶howe ſyr iohan hollande ſyr raynolde de roy fought togyder lyſtes duke lancaſtre towne beſances cap lxxviii ¶howe kynge portyngale duke lancaſtre determyned entre realme caſtyle cap lxxix ¶howe ſyr wyllm̄ lygnac ſir gaultyer paſſac came ayde kynge iohan caſtyle cap lxxx ¶howe great myſchiefe fell englande bytwene gentylmen cōmons accompte ſuche money reyſed cōmons cap lxxxi ¶of great dyſcordes englande breakynge vp frenche armye howe gouernours kynge conſtrayned cōmons good townes make acomptes ſuche money come handes ſeaſon ruled cap lxxxii ¶howe conſtable fraūce dyuers lordes knyghtes realme apparelled great prouyſions go englande wyn townes caſtels cap lxxxiii ¶howe duke bretayne ſent lordes kynghtes come counſayle vnto wannes counſayle deſyred conſtable go ſe caſtell ermyne howe toke hym priſoner lorde beaumanoyre hym ca lxxxiii ¶howe conſtable fraūce delyuered requeſt lorde de la vale parenge certayne raunſome howe conſtable delyuered duke thre caſtelles towne payed hūdred thouſande frankes cap lxxxv ¶howe writinges made duke bretayns deuyſe conſtable rendre towne caſtelles duke heyres euer delyuered duke cap lxxxvi ¶howe tydynges came frenche kynge fro partyes almayne whiche hym ryght diſpleaſaunt vnto vncles cap lxxxvii ¶howe duke lācaſters men aſſayled towne aurence toke gaue vp dyd cap lxxxviii ¶howe kynge portyngale brente towne whan departed fro porte beſieged two caſtles cap lxxxix ¶howe kynge portyngale hoſt came feroule aſſauted brought vnder obeyſaūce duke lancaſtre cap lxxxx ¶howe frenche ambaſſadours came duke bretayne vpon takyng conſtable fraunce anſwere made cap xci ¶howe kyng englandes vncles one acorde alyaunce agaynſt kynge counſayle murmurynge people agaynſt duke irelande aunſwere londoner duke glouceſtre cap xcii ¶howe day accompte came offycers appered preſens kynges vncles cōmons englande howe ſyr symon burle priſoner towre lōdon howe ſyr thomas tryuet dyed cap xciii ¶howe kyng englande departed fro london howe ſyr symon burle beheeded london nephewe alſo howe duke lancaſtre dyſpleaſed cap xciiii ¶howe counſayle drewe togyder reformacyon kynge realme howe counſayle duke irelande kynge accorde make warre agaynſt vncles agaynſt cyties townes cap xcv ¶howe kynge englande made • ō mon drawe towardes london howe ſyr roberte tryuylyen taken weſtmynſter beheeded cōmaundement kynges vncles cap xcvi ¶howe tydynges came kynge dethe knyght demanunded counſayle theron howe ordayned duke irelande ſoueraygne menne warre capi xcvii ¶howe ye duke irelande ſent thre kynghtes london knowe ſome tydynges howe kynges vncles london went feldes fyght duke irelande affinyte cap xcviii ¶howe kynges vncles wan iourney agaynſt duke irelande howe fledde dyuers company cap xcix ¶howe duke irelande company fled howe kynges vncles oxenforde howe ſyr nycholas bramble beheeded howe kynge ſent byſſhoppe cannterbury capi c ¶howe kynge vncles lordes englande ſente come weſtmynſter generall counſayle holden cap c ¶howe kynge portyngale puyſſaunce aſſembled duke lancaſtre puiſſaunce howe coulde nat paſſe ryuer dierne howe ſquyer caſtyle ſhewed theym paſſage capi c ii ¶howe tydynges ſpred abrode kynge portyngale duke lancaſtre paſſed ryuer dierne howe came kynge caſtylles knowledge howe certayne englyſſhe knyghtes came tode vyle arpent howe kynge portugale duke lancaſtre determyned tary cōmynge duke burbon cap c iii ¶howe duke lancaſtre gaue lycence men howe haraulde ſent kynge caſtyle howe thre knyghtes englande wente ſpeake kynge caſtyle ſaue conducte duke men paſſe thoroughe countrey capi ciiii ¶howe theſe three knyghtes optayned ſaue conducte kynge caſtyle people paſſe howe dyuers englyſſhe men dyed caſtyle howe duke lancaſtre fell great ſyckeneſſe capi cv ¶howe ſyr iohan hollande duke lancaſters conſtable tooke leaue duke wyfe retourned kynge caſtyle made hym good chere howe ſyr iohan dambrity court went parys accomplyſſhe dede armes bytwene hym ſyr boucyquant cap c vi ¶howe duke burbone departed fro auignon go caſtyle hooſt came burgus spaygne founde kynge caſtyle howe duke lancaſtre herde thoſe tydynge howe duke burbone departed fro kyng went ſtreyght agayne fraunce capi c vii ¶howe erle foiz receyued honourably duke burbon great gyftes gaue hym howe ſyr willyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſackes company departed spayne incydent fortuned towne ſaynte phagon capi c viii ¶howe kynge caſtyle counſayle yuell content ſyr willyam lygnac ſyr gaultier paſſackes company howe duke lancaſtre departed fro ſaynt iaques bayon cap c ix ¶howe erle armynake tooke great payne treate companyons departe realme fraunce cap c x ¶howe erle reynolde guerles layde landes guage wyſtenat came refuge archcbyſſhoppe coloygne vncle blamed hym howe ambaſſadours went berthaulte malygnes cap c xi ¶howe erle reynolde guerles maryed mary doughter berthalte malygnes whome hadde doughter maryed agayne englande hadde iſſue two ſonnes doughter howe ſyr iohan bloyes wedded eldeſt doughter erle guerles howe countie guerles remayned erle guerles yongeſt doughter capi c xii ¶howe theſe caſtelles gauleche buthe null came duke brabant howe duke iulyers ſuſtayned lynfars countre robbed maner people great aſſemble duke brabante made go iulyers howe dyſcomfyced cap c xiii ¶howe duke brabant dyed howe duke guillyam guerles treated ducheſſe brabante haue agayne thre caſtelles aunſwere howe made alyaunce kynge englande cap c xiiii ¶howe ducheſſe brabante ſent meſſangers frenche kynge complaynynge duke guerles howe kynge counſayle ſore buſyed incydentes fell realme fraunce well defyaunces guerles buſyneſſe bretayne cap c xv ¶howe ſtraunge fortune kynge nauer dyed cytie pampylona howe charles ſonne crowned howe vanchadore beſieged duke berrey howe duke burgoyne ſente ducheſſe brabante cap c xvi ¶howe frenche men brent ryfled towne seaull retourned garyſon ioye duke burgoyne ducheſſe brabant made dede howe ſyr iohan boeſme launce dyſcomfyted englyſſhe men capi c xvii ¶howe ſyr iohan boeſme launce ledde theſe priſoners mount ferante howe countrey gladde whan herde entrepriſe howe geronet company ſette raunſome delyuered money perot bierne lent hym cap c xviii ¶howe geronet mandurāt twelue company retourned mount ferant howe perot bernoys four hundred ſpeares wente mount ferante wolde nat entre towne none way gate cap c xix ¶howe geronet lette perot le bernoys company towne mount ferant wherof countrey frayde howe kynge vncles beynge parys therwith ſore dyſpleaſed alſo erle dolphyn auuergne cap c xx ¶howe perotte le bernoys company tooke counſayle determyned nat kepe towne mount ferant howe ſayd perot company departed then nyght withall pyllage priſoners wente refreſſhed towne ouſac cap c xxi ¶howe towne cleremounte made ſkrimyſſhe theſe pyllers taken robbed towne moūt ferant gate towne cap c xxii ¶howe duke berrey marryed lady mary doughter erle bloyes ſonne howe ſame yere ſonne duke berrey marryed lady mary fraunce ſuſter yonge kynge charles fraunce cap c xxiii ¶howe departynge duke lancaſtre euer wonne galyce frenche men recouered leſſe fyftene dayes howe englyſſhe men ben warre defamed ſpake yuell coūtrey galyce howe frenche kynge ſente duke irelande cap c xxiiii ¶howe conſtable fraunce wolde nat accorde kynge ſhulde goo almaygne bycauſe incydentes realme howe duke bretaygne fournyſſhed garyſons made alyaūce kynge englande kynge nauerre army made englyſſhe men cap c xxv ¶howe brabanſoyes layde ſiege towne graue howe conſtable fraunce tooke ſaynt malo ſaynte mathewes ſette men garyſone howe duke lancaſtre bayon greatly dyſcomfyted coulde get maner ayde cap c xxvi ¶howe duke berrey ſente letter duke lancaſtre bayon howe duke ſente copye ſame letter foyze nauerre entent haue publyſſhed spayne howe duke bretaygne demaunded counſayle men buſyneſſe capi c xxvii ¶howe duke bretayne delyuered vp thre caſtelles ſyr olyuer clyſſons howe receyued ioyouſly lorde coucy company ambaſſadours fro frenche kynge howe duke lancaſtre made great chere ſyr helyon lignacke ſeneſchall xaynton abmaſſadoure fro duke berrey cap c xxviii ¶nowe kynge caſtyle ſente ambaſſadours duke lancaſtre treate maryage hadde bytwene ſonne duke doughter howe requeſt duke berrey truſe made duke lancaſtre countreys tholouſyn rouergne cap c xxix ¶howe duke berrey burgoyne departed go bloyes howe duke bretayne came thyder howe duke dyd ſo moche hym parys maner agaynſt wyll capi c xxx ¶howe lewes kynge cycyle entred parys eſtate royall howe duke bretayne entred nyght ſaint johan baptyſt yere grace thouſande thre hundred fourſcore ſeuyn dede armes done kynge moutereau fault yon bytwene knyght englande called ſyr thomas harpyngham frenche knyght named ſyr johan de barres capi c xxxi ¶howe duke bretaygne entred parys came caſtell loure frenche kynge cap c xxxii ¶howe erle arundell beynge ſee moneth came hauen maraunt lytell fro rochell howe ſent meſſanger perot le bernoys capytayns ſhulde kepe feldes capi c xxxiii ¶howe marroys rochelloys ſore afrayde englyſſhe men lande howe rochell made aſk rymyſſhe theym howe englyſſhe men pylled countrey maraunt drewe agayne ſee pyllage whiche great capi c xxxiiii ¶howe perot le bernoys companyons reſorted agayne holdes great pyllage howe duke guerles coulde haue ayde englyſſhe men reyſe ſiege graue howe brabanſois made brige ouer ryuer meuſe whiche guerles dyd breake bryn dyſtroy ye ſhall capi c xxxv ¶howe brabanſoys paſſed ryuer towne raueſten ouer ye bridge ſo entred guerles duke departed fro nymay thre hundred ſpeares came agaynſt dyſcomfyted bytwene raueſten towne graue cap c xxxvi ¶howe duke guerles diſcomfyted brabanſoys went agayne nymay howe tydynges came frenche kynge howe kynge ſent ambaſſadours kynge almayne capi c xxxvii ¶howe frenche kynge gaue leaue duke bretaygne retourne countrey howe coūtrey brabant wolde nat conſent kynges paſſage army howe ambaſſadours fraunce ſpedde capi c xxxviii ¶howe erle bloys ſent frenche kinge two hundred ſpeares howe duke lorayne lorde henry bare came kynge howe duke julyers guerles knewe frenche kynge came capi c xxxix ¶howe ſyr hellyon lygnacke made reporte duke berrey howe lordes scotlande aſſembled toguyder cytie berdane determyned reyſe vp armye entre englande englyſſh ſquyer taken ſcottes knewe ſecretes bothe realmes englande scotlande capi c xl ¶howe kyng richarde yelded hym ſelfe erle derby go london cap fo ccc xi ¶howe erle duglas wan penon ſir henry percy barryers vpon newe caſtell vpon tyne howe ſcottes brent caſtell pondlen howe ſyr henry percy ſyr rafe brother tooke aduyſe folowe ſcottes conquere agayne penon loſt ſkrymyſſhe capi c xli ¶of ſtate quene iſabell englande howe ſhe newe ꝑſones apoynted wayte vpon howe kynge richarde ſette towre london capi cc xlii ¶howe ſir henry percy brother good nombre men armes archer went ſcottes wyn agayne penon erle duglas newcaſtell vpōtyne howe aſſayled ſcottes moūtberke lodgynges cap c xlii ¶howe erle james duglas valyantneſſe encoraged men reculed maner diſconfited ſo doynge wounded dethe capi c xliii ¶howe bataile ſir rafe percy ſore hurte taken priſoner ſcottiſſ knyght cap c xliiii ¶howe ſcottes wanne batayle agayuſt englyſſhe men beſyde ottebridge taken priſoners ſir hēry ſir rafe percy howe engliſſhe ſquier wolde nat yelde hym wolde ſcottyſſhe ſquyer ſo ſlayne bothe howe byſſhoppe durham cō pany diſconfyted amonge ſelfe capi c xiv ¶howe ſir mathewe reedman deparred fro batayle ſaue hym ſelfe howe ſir james lymſey taken priſoner ye byſſhoppe durham howe batayle ſcurrers ſent forthe diſcouer countrey cap c xlvi ¶howe ſcottes departed caryed erle duglas deed buryed hym abbey nimayes howe ſir archambault duglas company departed fro carlyle retourned scotlande cap c xlvii ¶howe duke jullyers came excuſed hym ſelfe defyaunce ſon duke guerles made frenche kyng ſo became ſubiette dyuers reates armes done bitwene frē che men almaygnes rencongne cap c xlviii ¶howe duke julyers archebyſſhop coloygne departed fro frenche kyng wente nimaye duke guerles howe meanes reconſyled brought peace frenche kynge ducheſſe brabant cap c xlix ¶howe erle arundell knyghtes englande beyng ſee fortune wynde came palyce beſyde rochell whoſe beynge ſignifyed ſir loyes xancere departyng erle arundell cap c l ¶howe admyrall fraunce ordayned frenche kynge counſayle ambaſſadour go kynge caſtile howe duke berrey ſent erle foize treate maryage bytwene duke berrey erles doughter bolonge cap c li ¶howe geffray tete noyre dyde choſe capitayne ouer company howe made teſtament ſo dyed howe duke guerles departed fro countrey go pruce incydence fell hym lande duke stulpe taken priſoner diſconfyted cap c lii ¶howe ſir johan vyen dyde meſſage kyng johan caſtyle fro frenkynge counſayle anſwers kynge caſtyle made hym capi c liii ¶howe ſir loyes xancere went ſe erle foize orthays howe duke lācaſtre burdeux dedes armes done bytwene fyue frenche men fyue englyſſhe men howe ducheſſe lancaſtre went doughter caſtyle kyng john̄ cap c liiii ¶howe ducheſſe lancaſtre departed fro kyng caſtyle wente mantuell bring father bone ciuyle howe frenche kyng ſent ambaſſadours erle foize treate mariage duke berrey vncle therie boloyns doughter cap c lv ¶howe certaygne wyſe men treated peace endure thre yere bytwene fraū ce englande alyes aſwell one parte lāde ſee cap c lvi ¶of ordynaunce entre quene iſabell towne paris ca c lvii ¶howe lorde caſtell morant therle ſaynt poule lefte behynde englande retourned fraunce charter truſe ſealed kynge richarde vncles endure thre yere ſee lande cap c lviii ¶the maryage kynge loyes ſonne duke aniou doughter kynge peter arragone howe went quene naples mother auignon ſe pope clement cap c lix ¶howe frenche kyng deſyre go viſyte ye farre partes realme howe went fyrſte burgoyne auignone ſe pope clement cap clx ¶howe ſir peter courtney cāe fraū ce armes ſir guye tremoyle howe lorde clary conueyed hym occaſyon dyde armes hym marcheſſe cali cap clxi ¶howe iuſtes ſaynt inguelyert otherwyſe called sandyngfelde enterpriſed ſir raynolde roye yonge ſir bouciquaūt lorde ſaynt pye capi c lxii ¶of complayntes made frenche kynge people languedocke towne beſyers agaynſt beuſache treaſourer duke berrey great extorcyons made conteſſyon cruell dethe hadde ſayd towne cap clxiii ¶howe frenche kyng beynge tholous ſent erle foize came thyder dyd homage kyng coū tie foize cap clxiiii ¶of feate couynaūt done bytwene kynge duke thoutayne brother whiche ſhulde ſoneſt come parys fro mountpellyer whiche hundred fyftie leages ſonder eche one knight capi c lxv ¶of dethe pope vrbayne rome called antepape howe pope clement wrote frenche kyng vncles vnyuerſite electyon pope bonyface cardynals rome capi c lxvi ¶of yeldynge vp takynge ſtronge caſtell vanchadore lymoſyn olde parteyninge ſir geffray teate noyre cap clxvii ¶of dedes armes ſaynt ingylbertes continewyng thyrtie dayes agaynſt cōmers realme englande countreis euery manne thre courſes capi c lxviii ¶of enterpriſe voyage ye knyghtes fraunce englande duke burbone chiefe armye requeſt genouoys go barbary beſiege ſtronge towne affryke cap clxix ¶of capitayne robber pyller countre called aymergot marcell helde ſtrong caſtell marcheſſe rouergne called roche vandoys howe beſieged vicount meauix takyng therof howe aymergot taken brought parys capi c lxx ¶howe chriſten lordes geno •• y beyng yſle conymbres ancre departed then go lay ſiege ſtrong cytie affryke barbary howe maynteyned ſiege cap clxxi ¶howe aduenture dōmage fell chriſten men reaſon aſſaute towne affryke ſo many knyghtes ſquyers deed maynteygned ſelfe wiſelyer dyde contynued ſiege longe ſeaſon cap clxxii ¶of feeſt iuſtes made kyng englande london whyle chriſten knyghtes ſquyers ſiege towne affryke agaynſt ſaraſyns howe feeſt publiſſhed dyuers countreis landes cap clxxiii ¶howe indydent ye ſiege reyſed towne affryke occaſyon howe euery man recourned owne countreis cap clxxiiii ¶of thenglyſſ knyghtes ſente parys frenche kyng fro kyng englande vncles treate peace capi clxxv ¶of dethe kynge iohan caſtyle crownynge kynge henry ſonne cap clxxvi ¶of army yonge erle iohan armynake voyege made lombardy howe dyed ſiege towne alexādre cap clxxvii ¶howe ſir peter craon fell frenche kynges diſpleaſure duke thourayns receyued duke bretayne cap clxxviii ¶of dethe yonge erle loyes chaſtellon ſonne therle guye bloys cap clxxix ¶of ſodayne dethe erle gaſcone foize howe erle chaſtellon cāe enherytaunce cap clxxx ¶howe treatie peace renewed tower thourayne bytwene frenche kynge duke bretayne maryage doughter fraunce ſonne bretayne iohan bretayne erle ponthieur doughter duke bretayne cap clxxxi ¶howe erle bloyes mary namure wyfe ſolde countie bloyes landes ye duke thourayn frenche kynges brother capi c lxxxii ¶howe ſir roger spayne ſir eſpaygne du lyon ſpedde frenche kynge counſayle vycount chaſtellons buſyneſſe howe ſet poſſeſſyon countie foize money payde cap clxxxiii ¶of great aſſemble made amyence frenche kynge coū ſayle kyng englandes vncles treatie peace cap clxxxiiii ¶howe ſir peter craon throughe yuell wyll ſubtile crafte beate downe ſir olyuer clyſſon wherwith kynge counſayle sore diſpleaſed cap clxxxv ¶howe great dilygence prouoſt parys purſued ſir peter craon capi c lxxxvi ¶of great armye voyage frenche kyng purpoſed make bretayngne agaynſt duke bycauſe ſuſteyned ſir peter craonne howe voyage kyng fell ſicke wherby voyage brake cap clxxxvii ¶howe duke thourayne brother frenche kynge reſigned duchy thouraynge kynges handes howe exchaunge kynge gaue hym duchy orlyaūce ſo euer called duke orlyaunce cap clxxxvii viii fo ccxxxiii ¶howe duke burgoyn berrey vncles frenche kynge gouernaunce realme howe chaſed toke ſuche gouerned kyng b • fore cap clxxxix ¶howe ſir olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce departed parys anſwere duke burgoyne made hym went mount le henry ••• then bretayne cap cxc ¶howe treatiſe whiche accorded bytwene englande fraunce thre yeres renewed cap cxci ¶of aduenture daunce made parys lykeneſſe wodhouſes wherin frenche kynge paryll dethe cap cxcii ¶howe pope bonyface cardynals rome ſente frere wyſe clerke frenche kyng cap cxciii ¶howe mariage treaſed ye lorde philyppe arthoyes erle ewel lady mary berrey wydowe doughter duke berrey howe admytted cōſtable fraunce cap cxciiii ¶of forme peace made bytwene frenche kyng kyng englāde meanes four duke vncles bothe kynges cap cxcv ¶of dethe pope clemēt au • gnon electyon pope benedic capi cxcvi ¶of clerke named maiſter iohan warennes cap cxcvii ¶howe kyng englande gaue duke lancaſtre heyres euer duchy acquitayner howe kynge prepared go irelande duke acouitayne cap cxcviii ¶of dethe quene anne englande wyfe kynge richarde doughter ye kynge boeſme emperour almayne cap cxcix ¶howe ſir iohn froiſſart arryued englande gyfte boke gaue kyng capi cc ¶of refuce acquitayne made duke lancaſtre howe ſente englāde kynge coū ſayle ſhewyng hym wyll hole coū trey aequitayne cap cci ¶the deuyſe conqueſt kynge richarde made irelande howe brought obeyſaunce foure kynges countray cap ccii ¶of ambaſſade kynge englande ſent fraūce treate ••• ryage bytwene lady iſabell frenche kynges eldeſt doughter hym ſelfe louynge aunſwere hadde cap cciii ¶of ſouper named robert 〈◊〉 howe ſent treaty peace holden balyngham howe ſente englande kynge rycharde vncles cap cciiii ¶of delyueraunce lorde de la riuer ſir iohn̄ le mercier howe putte priſone capi ccv ¶of peace bytwene duke bretaynge ſyr olyuer clyſſon cap ccvi ¶howe kynge hungery worte frenche kynge ſtate great turke howe iohan burgoyne eldeſt ſonne duke burgoyne chiefe heed armye went thyder fo cclxiii ¶howe erle oſtrenaunt enterpriſed go fryſe cap ccvii ¶of iudgement made parlyament quene naples agaynſte ſir peter craon cap ccix ¶of concluſyon maryage taken parys bytwene kynge englande iſabell eldeſt doughter frenche kynge howe duke lancaſtre remaryed cap ccx ¶howe great turke deſyred ſoudan many kynges saraſyns ayde hym men warre reſyſt agaynſt chriſten men howe many valyaunt ſaraſyns came hym farre countreis cap ccxi ¶howe lorde eoucy lordes chriſten men xv hundred ſpeares diſconfyted fyue thouſande turkes durynge ſiege nicopoly cap ccxii ¶howe peace bytwene englande fraunce contynewed maryage kyng englande doughter fraunce cap ccxiii ¶howe erle heynaulte erle oſtrenaunt ſonne made great armye men armes knightes ſquyets go fryſe cap ccxiiii ¶of armye frenche kyng ſent fryſe ayde coſyns lorde valeran erle ſaynt poule lorde charles de la brethe capitayns cap ccxv ¶howe maryage kynge englande doughter fraunce ordred howe frenche kyng delyuered doughter kynge englande tent bytwene arde calais cap ccxvi ¶howe ſiege nicopoly turkey reyſed lamorabaquy frenche men diſcōfyted howe hungaryons fledde cap ccxvii ¶of pouertie miſery chriſten knightes fraunce nacions endured cōmynge home countreis cap ccxviii ¶howe trewe tidynges batayle turkey knowen frenche kynges houſe cap ccxix ¶howe ducheſſe orlyaunce doughter duke myllayne hadde ſuſpecte frenche kynges ſyckeneſſe capi ccxx ¶howe duke burgoyn duches wyfe tooke great dilygence fynde meanes redeme priſone erle neuers ſ • nne priſoners beyng turkey cap ccxxi ¶howe duke glouceſtre ſubtelly ſought meanes howe diſtroy kynge richarde englande nephewe cap ccxxii ¶howe duke glouceſtre taken erle marſhall cōmaundement kynge cap ccxxiii ¶howe lordes fraūce retourned ſee venyce yſles founde waye capi ccxxiiii ¶howe retourne lordes fraunce frenche kynge entended myght ſette concorde peace churche cap ccxxv ¶of dethe ye duke glouceſtre erle arundell howe kynges vncles londoner tooke mater cap ccxxvi ¶of great armye made cytie reynes well emperoure realme fraunce ſtate holy churche cap ccxxvii ¶howe erle marſhall englande apealed guage vttraunce therle derby ſonne duke lancaſtre preſence kynge counſayle cap ccxxviii ¶howe kyng richarde gaue ſentēce wherby banyſſhed englande erle derby forten yere therle marſhall euer cap ccxxix ¶howe erle derby departed fro lō go fraunce erle marſhall went flaūders ſo lombardy cap ccxxx ¶howe lorde guyllyam erle oſtrenaunt ſent coſyn erle derby certayne meſſangers howe erle came parys howe receyued capi ccxxxi ¶howe treatie reynes bytwene frenche kynge kyng almaygne concernyng vnyte ye churche folowed howe byſſhoppe cambrey ſent ſayd kynges rome auignon wrote ſelfe pope thentent ſhuld depoſe themſelfe fro papalytees ſubmytte order theſe two kynges cap ccxxxii ¶howe frēche kyng aſſembled prelate noble mē realme vnyuerſyte parys take counſayle howe ſhulde order pope benedic auignon cap ccxxxiii ¶of anſwere duke lancaſtre knight ſent hym fro ſonne therle derby howe duke lancaſtre dyed capi ccxxxiiii ¶howe dethe duke lancaſtre knowen fraunce kynge englande wrote maner ioye frenche kynge therof wrote nothyng therof therle derby duke ſon capi ccxxxv ¶of treatie maryage bytwene erle derby duke berreys doughter howe kyng richarde englande dyde lette erle saliſbury cap ccxxxvi ¶howe kynge richarde ordayned go marcheſſe irelande cap ccxxxvii ¶howe archebyſſhoppe caunterbury ſente fraunce therle derby fro londoner counſayls englande haue hym retourne englande cap ccxxxviii ¶howe erle derby toke leaue frenche kyng went coſyn duke bretayne cap ccxxxix ¶howe erle derby arryued englande howe receyued ye lō doners capi ccxl ¶howe tidynges cāe kynges rycharde cōmyng therle derby great puiſſaunce capi ccxli ¶howe kyng richarde englande reſined crowne realme handes erle derby duke lancaſtre cap ccxliiii ¶of coronacyon kynge henry duke lancaſtre conſent realme maner feeſt cap ccxlv ¶howe newes takyng kyng rycharde knowen fraunce commynge thyder lady coucy howe frenche kynge diſpleaſed cap ccxlvi ¶howe frenche kyng reyſed vp armye ſende vpon tronters englāde cap ccxlviii ¶of dethe kynge richarde englande howe • reuſe bytwene englande fraunce renewed alſo depoſycion pope benedic auignon cap ccxlix ¶finis ¶howe ſir iohn̄ bourchier gouernour gaunt truſe newe vitayled towne gaunt howe maner people called comporſels dyde moche hurte countre capitulo primo sir iohn̄ bourchier ye gouernyng gaūt vnder kynge rycharde englande capiteyns cōmontie towne peter de boyes frā ce atreman peterle myttre prouyded ſurely warre duryng truſe greatly vitayled refreſſhed towne prouiſion parteyning warre alſo caſtell gauure place vnder rule ſame ſeaſon cōpany rutters gadered togyder wode reſpayle fortifyed houſe ſo coude nat lightly wonne people chaſed alos grantmount place flaūders loſt euer wyſt nat lyue robbyng pillyng whereſoeuer coude gete ſo ſpekynge theſe pygges reſpayle woode bytwene reguays grauntmount anghien lyſen dyde moche hurt lordſhip athe lande floberge lyſſues lande danghien theſe pyllers borne gaunt vnder coloure dyde moche hurt robbynge ſleynge wolde go heynalte take men woman beddes leade fortereſſe raunſome thē pleaſure made warre euery man capitayne athe called baudrius dela mocte layde often tymes awayte coude neuer trappe knewe ſo many ſhyftes ſo feared frōters heynalte brabant none durſt go waye countre duke burgoyne parte war • loked garnyſſhed prouided townes flā ders capitayne bruges lorde guyſtelles courtrey ſir iohan ieumount ſir willyam namure ſir willm̄ guyſtels lorde dan courtray ſir iohan ieumount ſir peter neyper lykewiſe townes fronter fraunce men warre ſet duke burgoyne towne ardenbourcke garyſon ſir guy pontaillyer marſhall burgoyn ſir ryflarte flaunders ſir iohan ieumont ſir henry coynge lorde montigny oſtrenant lorde longueuall ſir iohan barnet ſir peter baylleull philpot gany raoleyn dela foley dyuers theſe men armes two hundred ſo toke aduyſe toguyder wyll ryde foure craftes diſtroy countre moche vitayle came fro then gaū • ſo day departed toke way ſame day frenche men rydden forthe rydden forthe gaunt two thouſande men mete warre fraūces arreman capitayne ſo ſodainly mette frenchman village whan eche knewe ſawe well ſhuld haue batayle frenchman valiantly ſet fote erthe approched ennemyes gauntoyſe lykewiſe ſet beganne ſhole fight eche ſuche place gauntoyſe coude nat paſſe aduaūtage ſore batayle many feates armes done bothe partes dyuers caſte grounde sir riflart flaunders • good knight dyd valiantly knightes ſquyers fought valiantly gaū toyſe ſo behoued raunſome finally gauntoyſe ſuche nombre obteyned place frenchman conſtrayned lepe horſes el loſt gauntoyſe ſurmounted ſlayne ſir iohn̄ varlet ſir peter bailleule bell forrier philyppe gancy raolen dela foley dyuers whiche great domage fayne flye entre ardc̄bourcke el ben deed without recouerie aduenture vycount meaulx ſent garyſon ardenbourcke certayne nombre men armes newly repayred towne hym hūdred ſoeares good men armes ſir iohan ieumont great baylye flaunders ſo ben two yere greatly douted countre flaunders bycauſe valyantneſſe whan might get gauntoyſe went raunſome outher putte dethe el cutte handes fete putte oute eyen ſende home gyue enſā ple gauntoyſe ſo renoumed flaunders iuſtyce without pytie correctyng gauntoyſe ſpekyng flaunders hym thus euery realme worlde trouble well bitwene fraūce englande caſtell portyngale • warre newly renewed lady auiowe wrote ſelfe quene af naples hieruſalem come iuygnon pope kepte houſe ſon loyes called kynge cecyle whiche father hadde conquered quenes entencyon make warre prouence without countre wolde take lady become vnder obeyſaūce ſir bernarde de la salle entred pronence made warre quarell ſame ſeaſon ye lorde coucy alſo auygnon layen xv wekes bedde hurte hadde legge rennyng horſe whan hole oftentymes dyde vyſet quene recōforted whiche coulde rightwell quene taryed therefor abyde duke berrey alſo comynge auignon ſpeke pope ayde ſuſter quene frenche kyng vncles hadde ſente prouence ſir loyes sanxere marſhall fraunce fyue hūdred men armes warre coū tre without wolde come obeyſaunce vnder quene ſubmytted themſelfe nat howe cytie marcell gretteſt parte countre yelded quene cytie ayes prouence tarraſton dyuers knyghtes countre wolde nat yelde quene ſayeng howe ſhe ryght demaunde countie prouence tyll ſhe peaſably receyued lady ſonne kynge pulle calabre naples cecile whan ſhe hath poſſeſſion theſe prouēce ſhall obeye reaſon requyreth thoſe matcheſſe made warre erle sir charles dela pa •• e erle conuerſaunt ſir iohan luzenbourge ſonne quene auignon chefe counſayle ſir iohan baylleule ſame ſeaſon fell lombardye marueylous inſydence moche ſpoken throughe worlde erle vertu called ſir galea brother ſir barnabo gretteſt lombardy raygned longe gouerned lōbardy lyke two bretherne one ruled nyne cyties otehr tenne cyte millayne gouerned one yet one thother yere whan ſir galea dyed left behynde hym ſonne erle vertu named like father ſir galea ſwaged loue bitwene ſir barnabo vncle ſir galea doughted hym ſir barnabo vncle leeſt wolde take away lādes fro lyke dyde fro father vncle olde tyme toke awaye lande fro brother ſir mauffe cauſed dye thus therle vertu douted hym greatly vncle howe wrought ſubtelly bringe hym ſelfe inſuretie ſhall ſhewe howe sir barnabo vſage ſuche landes rule raunſomed thē ſo greuouſly wolde taxe men two thre tymes yere paye halfe thirde parte goodes none durſt ſaye agaynſt hym feare ſir galea erle vertu dyde otherwyſe entent gete loue toke none ayde men lyued onely reuenewes rule kept fyue yere dethe father ſo loue lombardy euery man ſaid wolde gladde lyue vnder hym euery man ſpake yuell ser barnabo priuely durſt bycauſe toke ſo exceſſyuely finally erle vertu thought execute entent doughted greatly vncle ſayde ſawe ſome lykelyhode day ſente ſecretely ſuche truſted beſt ſome ſhewed entent nat feare purpoſe ſhulde knowen ſo fortuned ſir barnabo daye rode forthe fro one caſtell another ſporte hym erle vertu nephewe knewe therof layde hym thre buſſhemeutes entent vncle ſhulde nat ſcape muſt nedes leaſt paſſe one erle cōmaūded take hym nat ſlee without made great defēce ſir barnabo roode forthe thought none yuell feare nephewe fell daunger one buſſhmentes whiche opyned approched hym ſperes couched reſt ſir barnabo hym ſquyer almaygne came hym ſayd sir ſaue ſelfe yonder company maketh yuell countenaunce agaynſt parteyning youre nephewe ſir galea sir barnabo aunſwered knowe nat howe ſaue ſelfe owe yuell wyll haue done treſpaſſe nephue wherby ought flye awaye ſo alwayes buſſhement drewe nerer nerer ſtreight vpon hym knight almaygne ſir barnabo whan ſawe company approche towarde maiſter ſir barnabos ſwerde hāde drewe oute ſheth tooke maiſter ſayd sir defende ſelfe knight drewe owne ſwerde lyke valyant man ſtande defence aueyled hym thyng incōtynent enuyroned mayſter alſo ennemyes ſayd knight • ſlayne bycauſe putte hym ſelfe defence wherof ſir galea afterwarde ryght ſore diſpleaſed ſir barnabo taken made defence none men ſo brought caſtell whe • nephue gladde comynge ſame day ser barnabos wyfe chyldren taken mary kepte myllayne priſon ſir galea toke ſeignories townes caſtels parteyned ſir barnabo lombardy poſſeſſyon vncle dyed nat ſaye howe thynke lette blode necke accordynge blode lettyng lombardy whan wyll auaūce mannes ende anone theſe tidynges ſprang abrode ſome glad therof ſome ſorte ſir barnabo hadde done tyme many cruell horryble dedes pytuous iuſtyce withoute reaſon ſo fewe people complayned trouble ſayde hadde well deſerued thus ended ſir barnabo dayes raygned puiſſauntly lombardy ¶nowe lette v retourne duke burbons erle marcheſſe army dyde poictou lymoſyn depted fro moleyns burbonoyſe ſo rode forthe great reuell duke company nephewe iohan harcourte ſpecyall nombre army came berry auuergne poictou rouergue xaynton lymoſyn met togider nyorte xii leages fro poicters meane ſeaſon ſir wyllm̄ lynacke right valyant knyght ſeneſchall xaynton gouernoure myllayne thoſe marcheſſe ſo came angoulinoys certayne nombre men armes two hundred reſted caſtell egle whiche engliſhemen wynter ſomer paſt greatly domaged countre ſir wyllyam lyghted fote ſo dyd cōpany valyantly aſſayled caſtell ſore aſſaute well contynued within defēded ſelfe feare lyues sir wylliam hym ſelfe day dyde right nobly gaue enſample howe men ſhulde aſſayle withoute ſparynge aſſaut ſo well contynued caſtell taken byforce frenche men entred ladder within ſlayne taken thus ſir wylliam lygnac dyde firſt enterpriſe ſeaſon abydinge duke burbone route whan duke burbone come nyorte company founde great nombre men warre abydinge hym redy coſyn erle marche great nō bre alſo vycount tonnere ſir henry thouars ſeneſchall lymoſyn lorde pons lorde parteney lorde thouars lorde puyſſaunce dyuers baron poytou xaynton ſir william lignacke came duke newly wonne caſtell egle wherfore duke gaue hym great thankes whan theſe men warre aſſembled toguyder ſeuyn hundred ſpeares beſyde geneuoys varlettes nombre two thouſande fightynge men thaſie toke aduyſe whyder ſhulde go outher vertuell taylboure mountlewe thynges conſydered determyned go mountlewe cauſe caſtell ſtandyng laundes burdeaur thought might get caſtell • ſhulde eaſyer wynne alſo ſhulde man come burdeaur without knowledge ſo rode thyderwarde paſſed angoleſme ſo came mountlewe layd ſiege chefe leader duke hooſt ſir iames pounſarte iohan bonne launce incontynent made redy aſſyle caſtell ſo enuyroned caſtell aboute gaue aſſaulte great courage within defended ſelfe valiantly surely harde aſſaute well contynued many proper dede armes done frenchman dilygently moū ted vp ladder fought dagger hande hande walles moche dyde frenche men pure aſſaute wan caſtell within ſlayne fewe ſaued whan frē men poſſeſſion moūtlewe new lye furuyſſhed men warre prouiſyon toke waye tayl bourcke whiche fortereſſe dynaudon perat capitayne proper man armes made lytell counte frenchman whyle duke laye ſiege caſtell company wanne two lytell fortreſſes whiche ſore harryed fronters poictou lymoſyn reaſon englyſſ • men theſe two fortreſſes called troucet archat within ſlayne caſtelles delyuered thē countre dyde beate thē downe grounde ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe bridge taylbourcke wonne frenche men howe englyſſhe men fortifyed themſelfe againſt comyng frenche men howe admyrall fraunce rout arryued edenborowe scotlande cap ſecundo thus ſiege layd tailbourcke four baſtedes▪ tail bourcke bridge ryuer charent englyſſhe men gaſcoyns well fortifyed ſo ſeaſon coude ſhyppe paſſe rochell xaynton without daūger truage frenche lordes aduyſed wynne bridge haue leſſe lye ſurer baſtydes cauſed come rochellſhippes ryuer charent theym certayne geneuoys croſbowes made ſcrymyſſhe bridge ſore aſſaute englyſſhe men gaſcons ryght well fortifyed bridge valyantly dyde defende thēſelfe aſſayled lande ryuer ¶iohan ſonne erle harcourt made knight reyſed baner duke burbone vncle made knight aſſault well cōtinued many feate armes • done geneuoys croſbowes ſhyppes ſhotte ſo rudely ſo hole toguyder bridge none durſte ſcantely ſhewe defence ſhulde make longe tale force aſſault bridge ryuer wonne foūde theron ſlayne drowned none ſcaped thus french men bridge taylbourc ſiege eaſyer thre leages fro faynt iohn̄s dangle two leages fro xauntes beſt countre worlde loſſe tayllebourke within dynaudon ſore diſmayed good cauſe loſt therby paſſage ryuer howe yet wolde nat yelde thought thēſelfe ſtronge place truſted ſome reſcue fro burdeaux ſhewed thoſe fronters englyſſhe fortereſſes duke lancaſtre elles erle buckyngham two thouſande men armes four thouſande archer ſhulde come burdeaux fyght frenche men reyſe ſiege greatly truſted fortuned otherwyſe ſhall ſhewe ordayned englande duke lancaſtre ſit iohan hollande brother kynge sir thomas percy ſix thomas tryuet lorde fitz water ſix wylliam wyndeſore ſit iohn̄ fitzwaren baron knightes ſquyers thouſande ſpeares thre thouſande archer ſhulde haue gone burdeaux haue ben ſomer haue refreſſhed mortayne boutuyll fortreſſes gaſcoyne lā guedocke fight frenche men founde countrey taryed ſeason haue gone fro then caſtell bayon nauarre treatie kyng nauer ymagined englāde tourned nought whan knewe certaynte admyrall fraū ce thouſande ſpeares choſen knightes ſquyers come scotlande chaunged purpoſe durſt ſende none men oute realme doughted greatly dedes frenche men scottes ioyned toguyder alſo ſame tyme ranne voyce englande howe ſhulde ſame somer aſſayled frenchman thre ꝑtes one bretaygne duke become frenche another normandye whiche ſayd conſtable frā ce made prouiſyon harflewe depe ſo longe sceſyde ſaynt valeries crotoy thirde scottes ſo dought wolde ſuffre knightes ſquyers go englande made prouiſyon defende hauyns porte ſee ſame ſeaſon erle arundell richarde admyrall see see thre foureſcore great ſhyppes furnyſſhed men armes archer hadde ſmall ſhippes ranne oute viewed boundes yles normandy knowe tidynges ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpeke duke burbone ſiege tayllebourcke laye nyne wekes let v ſhewe howe admyrall fraūce toke lande realme scotlande chere made firſte lodgynge frenche army went ſcotlande wynde wyll monethe maye whan water peaſeable meke ayre ſofte ſwete firſt coſted flāders holande zelande friſe laſt aproched ſight scotlande aryued • fell harde aduenture yonge knyght fraunce proper man armes called ſir aubert dāgyers knyght yong haute courage ſhewe ſtrength lyghtneſſe body lepte vp clene armed walle ſhyppe lightynge fete ſlypped ſo fell ouer borde ſee ſo coulde nat holpen incōtynent ſanke downe bycauſe ye weight harnes alſo ſhip ſayled euer forthe knightes aduenture barownes knyghtes ſore dyſpleaſed remedy ſo longe ſayled arryued edenborowe chiefe towne scotlande whe • kyng tyme peace mooſt cōmenly laye ſoone erle duglas erle morette knewe cōmynge wente hauyn mette receyued ſwetely sayeng howe right welcome countrey baron scotlande knewe ryght well ſir geffray de charney ſomer two monethes company ſir geffray acquaynted admyrall knyghtes fraunce tyme kynge scottes nat wylde ſcottyſſhe ſhewed theſe knight • howe kyng wolde ſhortly wherwith well content ſo lodged vyllages edenborough thoughe kynge kepte chefe reſydence parys scotlāde yet nat lyke tourney valencēnes towne nat foure thouſande houſes therfore behoued theſe lordes knyghtes lodged vyllages donfer lyne caſtell dōbare alueſt ſuche anone tidynges ſprange scotlande great nombre men armes fraū ce come countre therat dyde murmure grudge ſayde deuyll hath ſente theym nat maynteyne warre englande well ynoughe withoute helpe ſhall good longe v let ſhewed vnto may retourne agayne ſtronge ynough scotlande maynteyne warre without theym therfore wyll none company vnderſtande nat v therfore nat ſpeke toguyder wyll anone ryffle eate vp euer haue countrey ſhall doo v diſpytes domages thoughe englyſſhe men ſhulde fyght v thoughe englyſſhe men brinne houſes care lytell therfore ſhall make agayne chepe ynough axe thre dayes make agayne maye geate foure fyue ſtakes bowes couer ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe frenche men founde wylde countrey scotlande yuell content thadmyrall howe pacifyed thē fayre wordes howe fraunces atreman company nere hande taken ardenbourcke flaūders cap iii thus ſcottes ſayde scotlande comynge frenchman thyder dyde ſette nothynge hated courage diframed theym language moche myght lyke rude people without hououre thynges conſydered great armye ſo many noble men come scotlande knewe reaſon twentie thrittie knyghtes fraunce better nombre fyue hūdred thouſande cauſe ¶in scotlande ye ſhall fynde man light lye honoure gentylneſſe lyke wylde ſauage people wyll man acquaynted greatly enuyous honoure profyte man dought euer leſe haue poore countre whan englyſſhe men maketh roode voyage coū trey haue done often tyme thynke lyue muſte cauſe prouyſion vitayle folowe theym backe ſhall fynde nothyng coū trey moche payne ſhall fynde none yron ſhowe horſes leddar make harneſſe ſadelles bridelles ſuche thynges cometh redy made oute flaunders whan prouiſyon fayleth none gette countrey whan barownes knightes fraunce wonte fynde fayre hoſtryes halle hanged goodly caſtelles ſofte beddes reſte sawe ſelfe neceſſite began ſmyle ſaid admyrall sir pleaſure hath brought v hyder neuer knewe pouertie ment tyll nowe fynde nowe olde ſayengꝭ father mother true whan̄e wolde ſaye go waye ye lyue long ye ſhall fynde harde poore beddes whiche nowe fynde therfore lette v go oure voyage come lette v ryde englā de longe taryenge scotlande v nother honourable profytable admyrall apeaſed well myght ſayde sir behoueth v ſuffre lytell ſpeke fayre ſithe daunger haue great longe waye yet paſſe englande nat retourne therfore lette v take gree fynde nat alwayes parys dygeon beautie chalous behoueth wyll lyue worlde thynkynge haue honoure ſuffre ſomtyme well pouertie welth thus ſir iohan vien admyrall fraunce apeaſed companyons theſe wordes ſuche whiche nat reherce acquaynted mothe might barownes scotlande viſyted lytell haue ſayde thē lytell honour people yuell aquaynted withall mooſt company frenche men erle duglas erle morette theſe two lordes dyde theym ſolace reſydue scotlande yet another thyng right harde frenchman whan scotlande wolde ryde foūde horſes dere nat worthe tenne florens coude nat bye vnder threſcore hūdred yet moche payne gette money yet whan horſes hadde nother harneſſe ſadell bridell without brought flaū ders trouble daunger frenchemen yea moreouer whan̄e varlettes went forthe forragynge hadde charged horſes ſuche coulde gette retouruynge home ſcottes ſelfe laye wayte theym taken well beten ſome ſlayne ſo none durſte go forragynge feare ſlayne moneth frenche men loſte varlettes mo hundred went forthe thre foure toguyder neuer returned agayne thus frenche men handeled beſyde kynge scottes deſyred comeforthe ſo lordes knightes ſquyers realme aunſwered ſayd howe wolde make warre englande tyme ſayd thentent frenche men ſhulde paye well comyng kyng wolde come wylde ſcottyſſhe edenboroughe demaū ded haue great ſomme money hym people admyrall fraū ce ſayne promyſe ſeale kynge ſhulde haue certayne ſomme money company auoyded realme nat done thus ſhulde haue hadde none ayde ſcottes fayne make marchaundiſe elles worſe yet whan made beſt accorde • oyntment coude make theym hadde lytell profyte helpe ye ſhall hyſtorie ¶but nowe lytell wyll retourne tell aduentures flaunders maryage yonge frenche kyng howe ardenbourcke hadde nere taken ſtelthe vycont meaulx ſir iohn̄ ieumont laye garyſon diſconfyture ſir ryflarte flaunders made lande foure craftes gaunt came ardē bourcke thyder ſente garyſon ſir robert bethune vycoūt meaulx foūde ſir iohan iumont company thyder ſente xl ſpeares knightes ſquiers ſuche deſyred ſeke aduentures whan̄e vycount come thider entended fortify repayre towne poyntes fraunces atreman gaunte ſubtelly ymagyned night day howe might anoye domage enemyes ſhewed rightwell neighbour warp teremōde ardenbourcke bruges danne • scluſe euer ymagined howe wynne crafte ſay trouth ſuche cōpany mete execute ſuche dedes fortuned ende maye fraūces atreman ſeuyn thouſande hym departed fro gaunt thentent wynne ardenbourke ſtelth knightꝭ ſquyers therin ſpecially deſyred haue capitayne ſir iohan iumont bycauſe done many great domages takyng ſleyng puttyng cyen cuttyng handes fete eares men thus wedniſdaye aboute dawnynge day came ardē bourcke ſcalynge leddars redy vycounte meaulx ſir iohan iumount ſir ryflarte flaunders lorde damert ſir tercelette montigny ſir parducas pount ſaint marke lorde langueuall ſir iohan ſonne ſir hewe deſnell lorde de lalayne ſir reynolde lōmye dyuers lay ſlepyng beddes truſt watche nowe beholde aduēture watche watched nyght departed reliefe nat come ſame ſeaſon fraunces atreman gaūtoiſe ladder redy come dike ſo cāe walles dreſſed vp ladder began mount ſame ſeaſon aduēture walkynge within wall lorde ſaynt albyne hym ſquyer picardy named enguerant zēdequyn picarde moreſpike thynke ben watche ſame night nat departed ſay trouthe nat ben ardenbourcke taken knightes beddes ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe lorde ſaynt albyne enouerant zendequyn ſaued ardenbourke fro takyng quene hungry ſente ambaſſadours fraunce mary therle voloyes eldeſt doughter capi iiii whan ſir gouſſeaux ſaynt martyne enguerant zendequen ſawe howe gauntoyſe mounted vp walles ladder ſaw wher ther one puttynge legge ouer wall haue entred towne▪ thā ſore abaſſhed yet nat ſo moche toke conforte ſelfe ſawe well fledde towne loſt without recouery▪ parceyued well theyr entryng bytwene departyng watche comynge reliefe enguerant ſayd more pyke seppe forwarde beholde yonder gauntoyſe entrynge helpe defende v elles towne loſte ſo thre went ſame place ſawe gauntoyſe entrynge pycarde more pyke ſtrake hym entrynge ouer wall ſuche ſtroke hare hym clene fro wall ladder ſo fell downe dyke therwith watche aroſe ſawe howe dyke aboute great batayle gauntoyſe than̄e ſowned trumpette treaſon treaſon therwith towne ſtyrred euery man oute beddes harkened crye ſawe howe gaunte wolde haue ſtollen towne armed faſt might howe gauntoyſe dyde beſt haue entred towne ſayde thre perſones valyantly defended walles ſpace halfe hour agaynſt comer whiche turned great prayſe than̄e lordes knightes came thyder good array vycount meaulx bauer hym ſir iohan ieumont penon hym ſir ryflarte flaunders founde knight ſquyer more pyke fightynge defendynge walles than̄e cryed cryes reſcue whan fraunces atreman gauntoyſe parceyued matter howe hadde fayled entente withdrewe themſelfe fayre caſely reculed people ſo departed retourned rule four craftes ſo garyſon ardenbourke toke hede kepyng towne dyde honoured greatly among foreſaid thre perſones nat towne ben loſte throtes cutte ye haue herde howe duke aniou called hym ſelfe kynge naples cecyle hieruſalem made warre thre yeres pule calabre naples agaynſt ſir charles dela paix makynge warre dyed lykewiſe ſo dyde ſir charles dela paix ſayd ſlayne realme hungry conſentment quene dethe kyng hungry bycauſe ſir charles ſonne kynges brother therfore maynteyned realme ſhulde fall hym vncle kynge hungry dethe lefte behynde hym doughters therfore quene feared leeſt wolde diſheryte doughters therfore ſayd ſhe cauſed ſir charles dela paix ſlayne whoſe dethe ther great marueyle ſo therby quene ſore enforſed yonge ſonne kyng beyng auignon ſo made wary prouence kynge hungry lyuenge baron prelate hungry coūſayled hym gyue margarete eldeſt doughter whiche likely great enheritour loyes fraunce erle valoyes ſonne brother frenche kynge bycauſe thought ſhulde abyde among hū gry whan kynge deed ſent ambaſſadours fraunce kynge vncles ſhewyng howe quene hungry wolde haue eldeſt doughter erle valoyes requeſt ſemed kynge vncles baron fraunce right noble profitable excepte one thynge thought therby erle valoyes ſhulde farre fro owne nacion howe thynges conſydred thought noble right profitable thyng erle valoyes kyng hungry whiche one gretteſt realmes cryſtendome theſe ambaſſadours gretly feeſted nobly receyued thē gyuen many great gyftes ſo agayne went hūgry ambaſſ fraū ce byſſhop maylleretꝭ ſir iohn̄ la parſon ꝓcuracyon generall whan come hūgry wedded name erle valoyes lady margarete thanne byſſhoppe retourned fraūce alſo ſir iohan parſon wedded lady lyen bedde curteſly accordynge cuſtome ſuche matter requyred whan came fraunce ſhewed letter patentes publyke inſtrumentes ſo fraūce well content ſo longe erle valoys wrote hymſelfe kyng hungry alſo ye haue herde duke burgoyne duke aubert bauier lorde heynalte hollande zelande friſe maryed chyldren cambray toguyder maryage frenche kyng great tryumphe ſayde howe ſame tyme frenche kynge vncles duke burgoyne duke burbone duke aubert cambray lady burgoyne lady brabant lady heynalte howe procurement ducheſſe brabante ſecretely treatie maryage moued bytwene yonge kyng charles fraū ce lady iſabell doughter duke stephyn bauyer kyng charles fraunce laſte dyed dethe bedde ordayned charles ſonne ſhulde maryed almaygne ſawe place cō uenyent wherby almayns ſhulde alyed fraūce ſawe well howe kyng englande maryed kyng almaynes ſuſter wherby ſpedde moche better ducheſſe brabant ryght ſore ymaginatyue lady ſhewed many reaſons kynges vncles counſayle ſayenge howe lady doughter great lorde almaygne greatteſt bauyers howe thereby ſhulde haue great alyaunce almaygne duke stephyn ſhe ſayde ſo great manne myght well breke purpoſes great lordes thempyre great greatter kynge almaygne whiche enclyned ſoneſt counſayle fraū ce parceyuer mater howe matter handeled right ſecretely fewe knewe therof tyll doone cauſe vſage fraunce lady doughter great lorde yf kynge ſhulde mary firſte ſhe ſhulde ſene viewed naked certayne ladyes therto admytted knowe ſhe proper mete brynge forthe chyldren alſo bycauſe lady farre countre ſo ſhe ſhulde pleaſaunt kyng nat elles broken theſe cauſes matter kepte ſecrete lady feeſt penthecoſt ſhe brought brabant ducheſſe ioyfully receyued ordered accordynge vſage fraunce company duke frederyke bauyer vncle ſaye trouthe maryage firſte procured ſuche wayes ſhall ſhewe ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe ducheſſe brabaunt wrote duke frederyke bauyer maryage yonge frenche kynge neſe iſabell bauyer howe duke lady came queſnoy cap v whan duke frederyke bauier cāe firſt frā ce ſerue frēche kyng iourney made flaunders came ſiege boutbourcke true feeſted receyued kynges vncles bycauſe come ſo farre ſerue kynge coūtre bauyer whiche two hundred leages reputed great ſeruyce alwayes loged nere kyng token good loue fauour whan departed bauyer thought ſurly ſhulde batayle bytwene frenche kyng kyng englande marcheſſe flaūders fraū ce ſo ranne brute almaygne therfore kynge vncles gaue hym thanke thus kyng voyage burbourke bergues kingꝭ vncles curteſly demaūded day hym doughters mary▪ ſayeng howe lacked wyfe kyng howe rather kynge ſhulde mary bauyer rather than̄e place aunciently buyer counſayle fraunce duke aunſwered ſayd ſurely haue doughter mary myne elder brother duke stephyn bauyer hath right fayre lady doughter age ſhe quod lordes bytwene xiii fourtene quod duke deſyre quod kynges vncles therfore ſir whan ye retourne home bauyer ſpeke brother mater bring neſe pylgrimage ſaynt iohn̄s amyence kyng ſhalbe pleaſe hym drynke wyll deſyre loueth gladly ſe fayre thynges wyſſhe haue ſhe ſhall quene firſt procurement yt tyme done ſayde kynge knewe thynge theſe wordes whan̄e duke federyke bauyer retourned home ſhewed mater duke stephyn bauyer brother ſtudyed ſomewhat wordes laſt ſayd fayre brother beleue well ye ſaye doughter ſhulde happy ſhe myght come ſo highe honour frenche quene fraunce farre matter wiſely regarded make quene ſhulde ryght ſoore diſpleaſed doughter ſhulde caryed fraūce ſuche purpoſe ſente home agayne yet rather mary myne eaſe nerer home aunſwere duke stephyn gaue brother duke frederyke duke frederyke well content wrote aunſwere fraunce kynges vncles vncle duke auberte duches brabant hadde went duke frederyke forgoten matter aboute maryages kynge place kynge nere agreed doughter duke lorayne ſhe fayre damoſell age nere kyngꝭ age noble great generacyon houſe bloyes alſo ſpekyng doughter duke lancaſtre quene portyngale cōcluſion bycauſe warre therfore matter hanged ſtyll ſuſpence ye haue herde duches brabant whā ſhe camb • ay maryages burgoyne heynalte frenche kyng duke burbone burgoyn ſhe moued forthe maryage bauyer kyng affirmynge mooſt profitable honorable kynge bycauſe alyaunce almaygne madame quod kynges vncles nothynge therof well quod ducheſſe warrant ye ſhall ſomwhat therof ſomer paſte promyſe well fulfylled ſhe dyde ſo moche duke frederyke vncle damoſell ſo agreed brother duke stephyn ſhulde conuey lady fraunce ſhulde noyſed waye went pylgrimage ſaīt iohans amyence euery man ſuppoſed ſame almayns go often pylgrimage vſage whan duke frederyke neſe lady iſabell bauyer ben thre dayes bruſels toke leue ducheſſe intenſyon ſoone amyence ſoner came heynaulte queſnoy founde duke ducheſſe ſir wyllyam erle oſtrenaunt wyfe thy nobly receyued duke aubert vncle great marueyle brought countre demaū ded came thyder certaynlye quod duke frederyke haue moche payne bringe mater purpoſe ſo ſhewed hym mater ſayd haue brought brother mynde haue brought neſe hyder ye ſaye whan departed brother ſayd nowe frederike fayre brother ye leade iſabell doughter without ſure eſtate frenche kyng wyll refuſe ſhe ſhamed euer therfore aduyſe well matter come nat well paſſe ye ſhall haue enemy euer therfore fayre vncle ye maye ſe daunger haue putte ſelfe duke aubert ſayd fayre nephue nat diſmayde pleaſure god ſhe ſhalbe frenche quene than̄e ſhall ye quyte haue loue duke stephyn brother thus taryed queſnoy ſpace thre wekes ye ducheſſe ſage endoctryned yonge damoſell bauyer maner countenaunce chaū ged appayrell ſhe ſimplye arrayed ſtate fraunce thanne ſhe arrayed thoughe ſhe ben owne doughter whan euery thyng redy ye duches damoſelle rode forthe tyll came amience tyme come thyder duches burgoyne brabant alſo frenche kynge counſayle lorde de la ryuer ſit guy de la tremoyle barownes knightꝭ iſſued amyence mete receyue heynalte thus brought amyence moche honoure done lordes ladyes eche theym dyde vyſite louyngly moche payne kynge might ſlepe inwarde deſyre yt ſe ſhulde wyfe demaū ded lorde de la ryuer whan ſhulde ſe thoſe wordes lady great ſporte ſo fridaye whan damoſell redy thre ducheſſes ledde damoſell kynge ſhe kneled downe kynge toke vp hāde behelde well whiche regarde loue entred herre conſtable fraunce ſayd lorcoucy sir faythe ladye ſhall abyde v ſe well ye kyng eye gothe neuer whan ben kynge certayne ſpace ladyes toke leaue kyng went lodgynges yet knewe nat kynges intencyon duke burgoyn charged lorde de la ryuer enquere kyng mynde dyde ſo right dilygently ſayeng sir lyke youre grace howe lyke yonge lady shall ſhe abyde v yea truely ꝙ kynge ſhe right well pleaſeth v therfore ſhew vnto myne vncle burgoyne ſhe maye delyucred v whan lorde de la ryuer herde hym ſaye ſo incontynent ſhewed ye duke burgoyne ſtreight waye went ſhewed ladyes wherof great ioye cryed well thus lordes ladyes great ioye kynges vncles mynde haue maryage arras pleaſed nat kyng go ſoo farre therfore deſyred vncle might done ther well quod duke good hour ſo let duke burgoyne conſtable lorde de la ryuer lorde de la tremoyle dyuers company went lady heynault foūde neſe ſhewed thē theſe tidynges kyng broken purpoſe mariage ara ſayeng howe matter touched kyng ſo nere wherfore morowe next muſt heale ſickneſſe duches began ſmyle ſo departed eche fro great ioye ſolce ſame ſaturday night fraunces atreman gauntoyſe ſeuyn thouſande hym wente lā de foure craftes fayled takynge ardenbourke promyſed gaunt departynge wolde neuer retourne gaunt tyll ſome good towne gauntoyſe dyd might putte frenche men ſuche buſyneſſe ſhulde ſende companye scotlande admyrall make warre agaynſt englyſſhmen ther cōmon brute conſtable dyuers men arme certayne croſ bowes gene ſhulde entre ſee go scotlande reconforte men ther allredy makyng warre agaynſt englande frā ce atreman proper man armes iſſued ſayd ſaturday quarter called foure craftes night went coſtyng bruges truſtyng haue wonne wolde nat whan ſawe fayled wente danne ſpyes mette hym ſayde sir good ye went danne ſir roger guyſtelles capitayne nat nowe towne true goone bruges wenyng towne dan ben ſtrong ynoughe defence diſceyued ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe fraūces atreman toke towne dan howe french king wedded lady iſabell bauyer went layde ſiege danne whan̄e fraunces atreman knewe eſpyes yt ſir roger guyſtels nat dan deuyded company two tooke hym ſelfe leſſe nombre ſayd sir go yonder wayes ſuche gate whaſie ye blowe go barryers backe thē downe cōpany ſhall bete downe gate wyll ouer long entre ladder towne ſhalbe put dout done ordayned ſo wente leſſe nōbre ſo firſt went ladder dyke founde withſtandyng paſſed myre dreſſed vp ladder ſo entred towne came gate ſownynge horne without daunger good men ye towne beddes xvii day iuly thus came gate brake barrier without brake downe ye barrier ſo euery man entred towne began ſtyre late taken houſes many founde harneſſe defence ſlayne mercy thus good towne dan taken wherein founde great richeſſe ſpecially ſellers full malueſey wyne granade ſhewed howe great richeſſe thē bruges whiche brought thyder feare rebellyon cōmon people eraūces atreman whan ſawe lorde dan greatly reioyſed ſayd nowe haue well kept promyſe gaunte towne ſhall ſerue v well maiſter bruges sluſe ardenbourcke incontynent made crye man ſhulde ſo hardy touche diſpleaſure lady gētylwoman towne ſame tyme ſeuyn knightes wyues come thyder ſe lady guyſtelles ſhe redy lye downe chylde beed thus pilled towne ſlayne ſuche wolde nat take parte went repayre towne agayne whanne bruges herde therof werefore diſpleaſed nat without cauſe armed baner diſplayed came towne dan began ſcrimyſſhe aſſayle towne nought loſt thei wan ſo retourned agayne bruges whan theſe tidynges came gaunt greatlye reioyſed reputed enterpriſe noble dede fraūces atreman valyant man ¶nowe let v returne frenche kynges weddyng whan duches margarete heynaulte yonge lady kepynge whan ſhe ſawe day come ſhe apparelled lady honeſtly came duches burgoyne duches brabant accompanyed many ladyes damoſels theſe thre lady cōueyed lady iſabell bauiers chayre rychelye couered crowne heed worthe richeſſe realme whiche kynge ſent byſſhoppe ſame place dyde wedde preſens lordes ladyes maſſe ſolempnyte finyſſhed kyng went dyner whiche great ſumptuous erles barownes ſerued kynge ryche array thus day cōtynued great ſporte tyll night kyng went bedde newe wyfe feeſt endured tyll wedniſday tidynges came kynge counſayle howe fraunces atreman wonne towne danne alſo came haraude duke burbone brought letter kyng ſignifyeng hym howe taylbourcke wonne turned frenche howe duke burbone cōpany goyng ley ſiege vertuell howe poyctou xaynton limoſyn recōquered ſixe fortereſſes theſe tidynges ſomwhat reioyſed court ſette nought leſyng danne ſauyng cōcluded kyng ſhulde thing tyll ben flaunders agayne danne entre ſo farre four craftes whiche venym iſſued ſhulde leaue houſe ſtandynge dyſtroy meſſangers ſent ouer realme fraunce cōmaūdynge men warre firſt day auguſt ye marcheſſe picardy ley ſiege dan theſe tidynges ſpredde abrode realme fraunce euery knight ſquyer made redy come kyng cōmaunded ſame day duke federyke bauyer duke aubert barony toke leue kyng euery man retourned home owne lefte kyng lady iſabell bauyer frenche quene frenche kyng made cō maundement throughe realme ſayd howe wolde neuer come parys tyll ben towne danne ſo xxv day iuly departed fro amyence conſtable dyuers lordes houſe went arras taryed one night next day went lan atthoyſe dayly men warre came hym fro ꝑtes ſo laſt came iprſo ye firſte day auguſt dan laye ſo nere gonne ſhot paſſed ouer heed thre dayes came kynge wylliam neynaulte ryght welcome kynge duke burgoyne layde goodly ſiege dan therin encloſed fraū ce atreman bare ſelfe valiantly euery day outher ſcrimyſhe aſſaut without truſe lorde clary mayſter ordynaunce lorde coucy ſtriken quarell towne whiche ſtroke dyed whiche great domage noble knight ſiege danne came men oute good townes flaunders ipre bruges franke ſiege beyond hundred thouſande men kyng laye bytwene dan gaunte capitayne flemmynges lorde ſaynt pye lorde guyſtels xxv ſpeares laye myddes amonge feare diſcencion ¶howe dyuers burgeſſes sluſe beheeded howe sluſe chaunged lande bethune howe ſiege danne contynewed longe cap vii aſſault made knyght kynge wylliam heynalte day reared vp baner quytte hym ſelfe lyke good knight aſſaute frenche men loſte wanne fraunces atreman hym certayne archer englande greatly greued aſſaylantes alſo great plentie artillary whan towne wonne well furnyſſed alſo cauſed moche brought fro gaūt whan knewe ſhulde haue ſiege layde towne ſame ſeaſon whyle ſiege laye thus danne ſome greatteſt towne sluſe ſuche bare mooſt rule towne ſo wrapped treaſon yt wolde haue deliuered towne kinges enemyes haue murdred capitayne company beddes haue ſet fyre kynges nauy lay ancre laded prouiſyon kynge wente danne purpoſe haue gone scotlande admyrall alſo theſe treators thought haue broken downe ſee bankes therby haue drowned greatteſt parte kyngꝭ hooſt made marchaundiſe gaūte theſe treaſons ſhuld haue ben done one night ther good man towne hoſtry herde treaſon purpoſed incontynent went capitayne ſhewed hym mater named hym certayne thus conſpyred treaſon whan ye capitayne herde ſore marueyled toke threſcore ſpeares company wente fro houſe houſe treatours ſo toke ſette dyuers priſons ſure kepynge toke horſe rode kyng ſo came tente hym duke burgoyne ſhewed ye mater howe towne sluſe likely haue ben loſt kynges hoſt likely haue water breſtes wherof kyng lordes great marueyle capitayne cōmaunded ſhulde retourne sluſe incontynent ſtryke heedes withoute reſpyte therby take enſample capitayne retourned incontynent ſtrake heedes concluſion buſyneſſe duke burgoyne caſt aduyſe fynde ſome meanes entreat coſyn ſir william namure haue hym towne sluſe exchaunge landes ioyne towne countie flaunders moche thaduyſe ſir guy de la tremoyle ſormer ſoiourned sluſe certayne nombre men warre whan̄e ſir wylliam namure herde firſt ſpekynge matter marueylouſly diſpleaſed towne sluſe apendauntes profytes ſee fayre profitable herytage fallen aunceſtours wherfore loued better howe duke burgoyne lay ſo ſore hym therfore remedy make exchaunge duke entenſyon make ſtronge caſtell ſubdue come goer ſee entryng hauen sluſe kepe mē warre ſo none ſhulde entre ſee thoſe marcheſſe without daunger make towre ſo highe ſe troētie leages ſee thus breuely ſir wylliam namure ſo ſore deſyred duke burgoyne counſayle contente exchaunge sluſe landes bethune whiche fayre great herytage countrey haue hym heyres euer ſo incontynent duke burgoyn ſette worke men worke make caſtell sluſe ¶nowe lette v ſpeke ſiege danne nere euery daye aſſaute dyuers ſcrimyſſhes gate barrier ſo dyuers hurt ſlayne day lye frenchman coude nat well come walles bycauſe dyke full myre ben rayny wether hooſt ſhulde haue moche ſhulde haue ben fayne haue diſlodged wheder wolde nat ſpace moneth ſiege endured neuer rayned vitayle ynoughe howe bycauſe yuell ayre ſtynkynge deed beeſtes horſes ayre ſo corrupte dyuers knightes ſquyers therby ſore ſicke ſo dyuers went refreſſhe bruges place forſake yuell ayre kynge hym ſelfe went laye marles howe tentes ſtyll pight vp felde entent fraūces atreman holde ſtyll towne tyll ſocours came englande reyſe ſiege ſurely gaunte ſende englande reſcue ſurely kyng englandes vncles come ouer ſee ſufficiently garnyſſhed men warre tillarye haue reyſed ſiege lette bycauſe admyralles beyng scotlande acertayne nombre men armes alſo ſayde realme englande conſtable fraūce ſhulde come scotlande great puiſſan̄ce make warre englande wherby gauntoyſe nat reſrued wher fore behoued within towne dan make yuell bargayne ⸪ ¶nowe gauntoyſe fledde dan night howe frenche men toke towne diſtroyed alſo howe kynge diſtroyed countre foure craftes cap viii xxvii day auguſt towne dan whan fraunces atreman parceyued ſocour artillary began fayle ſom diſconforted hymſelfe ſayd coūſayle sir wyll gaunt go wayes lette v ſhewe one another ſecretely towne knewe deꝑtyng ſaue ſelfe wyues chyldren paraduenture wyll make ſhrewdemar chaundyſe v yea delyuer v oure enemyes ſo may reſt peace ſhulde coſte v oure lyues ſhall kepe theym well therfro wherfore let v kepe v toguyder let v go towne vyſite watche lette v cauſe men woman towne go mynſter makynge theym beleue morowe next ſhall haue great aſſaute bicauſe would yt ſhulde haue domage therfore wyll haue ſuretie churche waye ſhall ſaye watchemen wyll go make ſcrymyſſhe hooſt whan feldes lette v ryde ſpurres gaunte counſayle ſayd sir ye haue well ſayd ſo lette ſo euery man ordayned ſelfe purpoſed euenyng truſſed redy goodes ſuche might cary awaye put woman child priſoners mynſter ſpecially ladyes gētyl woman sayeng fayre ladyes ſhall haue morowe mornyng great aſſaute wolde nat ye ſhulde abaſſhed take domage thus lefte churche firſt hour night gauntoiſe went dyde viſyte watche walles none towne fraunces atreman ſayde sir make night good watche depart nat fro walles thyng ye orſe ye mornyng ſhall haue aſſaut yet firſt night wyll awake hooſt wordes well beleued euery man went ſayd trouthe whan ordayned euery thynge accordynge mynde cauſed gate opyned ſo company iſſued nat halfe leage fro towne day light towne parceyued well fraunces atremen company gone thought ſelfe deſceyued ye thefe towne began entreate men kynges priſoners ſayeng theym howe ſlayne fraunces atreman ſame night whan dyuers towne dan vnderſtode howe fraūces atreman cōpany gone howe gate opyn ran towne beſt might whan knowen thooſt breton burgonyons deſyring wyn mounted horſes fell chaſe purſued gauntoiſe tyll cāe within two leages gaunte chaſe many ſlayne taken mo fyue hundred fewe gaūtoiſe mooſt danne fledde towne meane ſeaſon towne aſſayled made defence frenche men entred euery ſyde ladder paſſed dyke moche payne whan within wende haue gret rich foūde nothyng poore people men woman chyldren great plentie good wynes ſo diſpyte diſpleaſure ſette fyre towne ſo nighe brent wherof kynge duke burgone ſore diſpleaſed coude nat amende howe ladyes gentyl woman moche payne ſaued fro hurt bodyes loſſe good takyng dan kyng counſayled diſſodge ſo king went lodged two leages fro gaunte towne called artulle whyles kyng lay men armes rode countrey four craftes diſtroyed countre bycauſe tyme paſt gauntoyſehad chiefe cō fort euer fro therefore brent downe towres church houſes chaſed men woman chyldren woodes whan frēchmen done diſtruction ordayned go lay ſiege caſtell gaure gaunte tourned nothyng tidynges came kynge beyng artuelle fro quene hungry byſſhop waſſelure ſayd quenes ambaſſadour dyuers knightes ſquyers company brought letter credence certifyeng ſaid quene comyng fraunce fetche lewes fraunce erle valoys haue hym hū gry doughter ſir iohan la parſon wedded procuracion name erle valoyes theſe tidynges pleaſed greatly kynge counſayle ſo thought honoure yonge lewes erle valois ſhulde returne fraunce thought hadde done ynoughe ſeaſon countre flaū ders ¶nowe frenche kyng departed flaunders gaue leaue men departe howe cāe parys treate ambaſſadours hungry howe marque blanquefort toke ſtrēgth wyfe ſame lady enherytoure hungry cap ix frenche kyng departed fro artuell xii day septembre gaue leaue men warre retourne owne houſes whiche deꝑtynge gauntoyſe ryght gladde kyng went craye quene wyfe whan went fro amyens flaūders ſent thyder kepe eſtate ſo taried certen dayes ſo kyng wente parys quene boyſe de vyncens kyng counſayle entended ordring yong erle valoyes wolde ſhulde go nobly hūgry toke hym kyng mater chaunged otherwyſe maſhorte ſeaſon realme hungry ye ſhall trouthe yt quene hūgry mother yonge lady whome erle valoys wedded ꝓeuracion ye haue herde entēt make god pleaſed wolde make ſuche voyage yt ſhulde honour ꝓfyte kyng ſent cōmaundement aſſemble power ſo day aſſigned redy xxx thouſande men horſe backe came lodged accordynge vſage countrey thynke nat eaſe sir iohan de vyen great deſyre ryde enploye tyme englande ſome great enterpriſe whan ſawe ſcottes come ſayd sir nowe tyme ryde haue lyen long ſtyll ſo ſettyng warde publyſſhed euery man thā toke waye roſebourcke iourney kyng nat abode ſtyll edēborow ſonnes army thou ſande complete harneſſe frenche men brought thē delyuered knightes scotlande norwiche yuell harneſſed whiche harneſſe great ioye ſo rode towarde northumberlande ſo longe rode came abbey mauues lodged ryuer tymbre nexte day cāe morlane roſeboucke kepar roſeboure vnder lorde mōtagu knight called ſir edwarde clyfforde admyrall fraunce ſcottes taryed behelde well caſtell thynges conſidred ſawe well aſſayle ſhulde lytell aucyle caſtell ſtronge well furnyſſhed artillary ſo paſſed drewe long ryuer ſyde aprochyng berwyke ſo long rode came two towres right ſtrong whiche kept two knightes father ſonne bothe called ſir iohan strande aboute theſe towres fayre landes fayre place whiche incontynent brent two towres aſſayled ther many feates armes ſhewed dyuers ſcottes hurte ſhotte caſt ſtones finally towres wonne knightes within playne aſſaut yet defended thē longe might endure ⸪ ¶howe frenchemen ſcottes wanne caſtell varley diſtroyed diuers townes thumberlande howe drewe agayne scotlāde whan knewe kyng englā de came great puyſſaunce cap xi conqueſt thes two towres went another caſtel called varley parteyning herytage ſir iohn montagu capitayne vnder hym ſir iohan luſſenborne hym wyfe chyldren good knewe well ſcottes wolde come thyder therfore purneyed caſtel beſt power abyde aſſaute caſtell taryed armye caſtell ſtode fayre countre fayre ryuer whiche cometh tymbre ronneth ſee day great aſſaut frenche men bare thē well ſame day moche better ſcottes dyd entred dyke paſſed moche payne many feates armes done aboue beneth frenche men moūted vp ladder fought hande hande daggars walles sir iohan luſſēborne dyd quyte hym ſelfe lyke valyant knight fought frenche men hande hande ladder aſſaute ſlayne knight almaygne called ſir bleres gaſtelayne whiche great domage many hurt day finally ſo moche people thaſſaute ſo well contynued caſtell wonne knight wyfe chyldren taken xl priſoners caſtell brent raſed downe ſawe well nat kept ſeyng ſo farr englande admyrall ſcottes rode towarde auwike ye lande lorde percy lodged brent certayne village ſo came another caſtell therle northūberlandes ſtandyng ſee ſyde aſſayled nat knew well ſhulde leſe payne ſo rode fronter halfwaye bytwene berwyke newcaſtell ryuer tyne vnderſtode howe yt duke lācaſtre therle northūberlande erle notingham lorde neuell baron thoſe march northūberlande byſſhoprikes yorke dyrham comynge great power whan thadmyrall fraunce knewe therof right ioy full ſo baron fraūce cōpany deſyred haue batayle ſcottes cared iytell therfore counſayled
