returne againe towarde berwyke bycauſe prouiſyon folowed alſo nere owne coū tre abyde ennemyes thadmyrall beleued thē returned towarde berwyke wherof ſir thomas redman capitayne hym right good men armes french men ſcottes lay towne aſſayled nat ſo paſſed next day toke waye burbourcke retourne owne countrees tidynges brought anon englāde howe frēchmen ſcottes northum berlāde diſtroyed brent coūtre kynge englande knewe rightwell comynge wherfore ye lordes redy felde toke way towarde ſcottes thenglyſſhmen made ſomer gretteſt prouiſyon euer made go scotlande bothe lande water xxvi veſſels fee charged ꝓuiſion coſtyng frōters englande redy entre euery hauen scotland kyng cāe ſelfe acōpanyed vncles therle cābridge ſir thoin̄s holand ther alſo therle saliſbury therle atūdell yong erle penbroke yong lorde spēſar therle stafforde therle myſien ſo many baron knightes four ſperes beſyde wt duke lācaſtre therle northūberlāde therle therle notynghm̄ lorde lucy lorde neuell lordes baron purſuyng ſcottes two ſpeares xv archer kynge lordes fyftie archer beſyde varlettes kyng folowed duke lancaſtre ſo faſt hoſt came march yorke way tidynges cāe kyng howe people likely fight ſcottes march northūberlande therfore made gretter haſt ſo kyng cāe laſt ſait iohn̄s beuerley march dyrhin̄ ther tidynges came kyng ſcottes returned owne countre ſo men warre lodged march northūberland ¶nowe ſhall ſhewe aduēture fell thēglyſſhe hooſt wherby voyage broken mortall warre bytwene certayne lordes ¶howe ſir iohn̄ hollande ſlewe ſir rycharde stafforde howe therle stafforde came kyng demaunde iuſtyce cap xii march ſait iohn̄ beuerley ye dyoces yorke kynge england lodged great nombre erles baron knightes euery man lay nere kyng might ſpecially two vncles ser thomas holande erle lien ſir iohan holande brother kynges company knyght boeſme come ſe quene englande loue ye quene kyng lordes made hym good chere name ſir myles freſſhe luſtye knight vſage almaygne ſo fortuned beſyde vyllage nere ſait iohans beuerley yt fell wordes bitwene knight two ſquyers ſir iohan hollandes brother kynge wordes came two archer ſir iohan staffordes wordes ſo multiplyed two archer toke parte ſtraunger blamed two ſquyers ſayng sir yedo wrō ge medyll knight ye knowe belongyng quene countre ye ought rather ſupport otherwiſe one ſquyers ſayd enuyous knaue haſt thou thoughe blame hym folly haue quod archer haue right well therwith companyon mayſter therfore wyll nat place ſuffre hym receyue villany yea quod ſquyer thought thou woldeſt ayde hym agaynſte wolde put ſwerd thy body made coūtnaūce thoughe wolde haue ſtryken archer ſtepped backe bowe whiche redy bente ſette arowe therin drewe vp ſhotte agaynſt ſquyer arowe pearſed thoroughe body hart ſo fell downe deed whan ſquyer ſawe felowe deed fledde awaye ſir myles retourned lodgynge two archer went maiſter ſhewed hym aduenture sir richarde stafforde ſayde thou haſt done right yuell sir quod archer coude none otherwiſe without wolde haue ſlayne ſelfe rather haue ſlayne hym thā ſhulde haue ſlayne well quod ſir rycharde go thy waye thou nat founde ſhall entreate thy peace ſir iohan holande father ſome archer deꝑted tidynges anone brought ſir iohan holande archer ſir richarde staffordes ſlayne ſquyer yt man loued beſt worlde ſhewed hym maner howe cauſe ſir myles ſtraū ger whan ſir iohan holande well enfourmed aduenture ryght ſore diſpleaſed ſayd ſhall neuer eate drike tyll reuenged lepte horſe toke certayne men hym departed fro owne lodgynge right late ſo rode feldes enquered ſir myles lodged ſhewed hym lodged reregarde erle deuurynters therle stafforde ſir iohan hollande toke waye thyder warde ſought fynde ſir myles men rode vp downe amonge hedge buſſhes ſtraite waye mette aduenture ſir richarde stafforde bicauſe night demaū ded quod rycharde stafforde hollande quod ſeke one thy ſeruauntes hath ſlayne beſt beloued ſquyer therwith drewe ſworde ſtrake richarde stafforde ſo ſlewe hym fell downe deed whiche great pytie paſſed knewe nat well done ſawe well one falle grounde sir richarde staffordes men ſore diſmayd whan ſawe maiſter deed cryed holande holande ye haue ſlayne ſonne therle stafforde wyll heuy tidynges father whan̄e knoweth therof ſir iohan holandes ſeruauntes herde well theſe wordes ſayde mayſter sir ye haue ſlayne ſir rycharde stafforde well quod ſir iohan hollade leauer haue ſlayne worſe better haue reuenged dethe ſquyer ſir iohan hollande wente ſtreyght ſaynt iohans beuerley tooke frauncheſſe towne abode ſtyll knewe well wolde moche hooſte dethe knight wyſt nat kynge wolde ſaye mater eſchue paryllce tooke ſentuarye towne ſaynt iohans beuerley tidynges anone came erle stafforde howe ſonne ſlayne yuell aduenture thafie erle demaunded ſlayne hym ſuche hym whan ſlayne ſayd ſir kynges brother ſir iohen holande dyd ſlee hym ſhewed hym cauſe howe ye maye well knowe loued entierly ſonne hadde mo hym fayre yonge knyght coutagyous marueylouſly ſore dyſpleaſed ſente incontynent frendes haue counſayle howe ſhulde vſe hym ſelfe reuengynge dethe mooſt wyſeſt man counſayle ſayd sir morowe mornynge ſhewe matter kyng deſyre hym haue lawe iuſtyce thus ſuaged ſom yre ſo paſſed night nexte mornynge rycharde stafforde buryed churche vyllage therby buryeng thoſe lynage baron knightes ſquyers armye obſequy done erle stafforde thre ſcore lygnage mounted horſes ſo came kynge well enformed yuell aduenture ſo erle founde kyng vncles toguyder great nombre knightes whan erle came kyng kneled downe wepynge ſayde ſoroufull harte sir ye kynge englande haue ſolemly ſworne kepe englāde right iuſtyce ser ye knowe brother wtout tytell reaſon hath ſlayne ſonne ayre sir requyre right iuſtyce el ye ſhall haue worſe enemy wyll ſir wyll ye knowe dethe ſon toucheth ſo nere nat brekynge voyage ſhulde bring hoſt ſuche trouble honour ſhulde amended ſo coū teruenged ſhulde ſpoken hūdred yeres hereafter englande nowe wyll ceaſe tyll voyage scotlande done ennemyes ſhall nat reioyſe trouble erle stafforde kyng anſwered knowe trouthe ſhall iuſtyce reaſon fatforthe barones wyll iudge ſhall nat fayle therof brother haue erles lynage ſayd sir ye haue ſayd well thanke therof thus lynage ſir richarde stafforde apeaſed ſo helde iourney scotlande iourney erle stafforde made ſemblant dethe ſonne wherin baron reputed hym right ſage ⸪ ⸫ ¶howe kyng englande cauſed diſtroyed church meurous scotlande howe baron scotlande anſwered admyrall fraunce deuyied leaue scotlande let engleſſhe men alone cap xiii thus auaunſed forthe kyng englande ſeuyn thouſande men armes threſcore thouſand archer ſtrength realme englāde ſayd howe admyrall fraunce wolde fight thē dede great deſyre wyll ſo ſayde baron scotlande came forthe sir make ſommons gette moche ſtrength ye englyſſhe men come scotlande wyll ſurely fight thē ſcottes ſayd howe content therwith howe toke aduyſe kynge englande paſſed forthe ſo fary paſſed dureſme newe caſtell ryuer tyne lande northumberlande ſo laſte came berwyke wherof ſir mathue redman capitayne receyued kynge ioyfully kyng taryed nat ther long paſſed forthe ouer ryuer twede toke lodgynge abbey mewrous whiche warres bytwene englande scotlande neuer hurt domage clene brnet exiled thentent englyſſh men nat retourne agayne englande tyll diſtroyed scotlande bycauſe fortifyed tyme frenche men whan̄e admyrall fraunce knewe kynge englande paſſed ryuer twede entred morlane scotlande ſayd baron scotlande sir ſytte ſtyll let v go forthe aduyſe ennemyes fyght ſhewed v came ye fraunce one thouſāde good men armes ye ſhulde ſtronge ynoughe fyght englyſſhe men enſure ye haue mo thouſāde fyue hundred cror bowes ſurely knightes ſquyers company ar parfyte men armes floure chiualrye wyll nat flye abyde ſuche aduenture god wyll ſende theſe wordes anſwered barones scotlāde knewe ſo well puiſſaunce englyſſhe men hadde wyll fight wherfore ſaid sir beleue well ye company choſen men great valure ſir haue knowledge power englande neuer ſo many englyſſhe men toguyder aſſembled nowe ye wyll ſhall bringe ſuche place ye ſhall well ſe aduyſe theym thanne ye counſayle ſhall fought ſhall nat refuſed v ſurely ſir ſuche wordes ye haue ſaid dyde ſpeke goddes name quod admyrall let one ſe thē ſo anon therle dugles baron scotlāde brought thadmyrall vnto highe mountayne vnder hyll paſſage wherby thēglyſſhe hoſt muſt paſſe hyll thadmyrall wt diuers knightꝭ fraūce company clerely ſawe englyſſhe men puiſſaunce ther nombred nere coude ſire thouſande men armes threſcore thouſande archer thynges cō ſydred ſayd howe nat puyſſaunce ſuffycient fight englyſſhemen paſſed nat thouſande ſpeares xxx thouſande men yuell armed admyrall ſayd etle duglas therle morette sir ye ſaye good reaſon thoughe ye haue wyll fight engliſſhe men therfore aduyſe ye wyll ſtronge ynoughe ouer ryde countrey diſtroy ſithe ye maye nat fight pray bring throughe countre ſome priuye waye englande maye ſhall make warre ſome parte v sir ꝙ barones ſhall well knowe dyuers wayes thus admyrall barones scotlande determyned forſake scotlande lette englyſſh men alone go entre wale go cytie carlyle reuenge lefte englyſſhe men toke foreſtes mountayns rode throughe scotlande diſtroyed wente brent townes vyllages maners cauſed men woman chyldren coūtre driue catayle go yt wylde foreſtes knewe well engliſſhe men wolde nat folowe thyder kynge scottes wente wylde ſcottyſſhe bicauſe wes nat ī good poynt ryde warfare taryed warre durynge lette men alone frenche men scottes paſſed highe mountayns bytwene northumberlāde scotlande entred lande wale began brenne village dyd moche hurte mombrayes landes erle notyngham erle stafforde barone graſoppe moſgr • ues landes ſo toke waye cytie carlyle ¶howe kyng englande toke edēborowe chefe cytie scotlande howe duke lancaſtre purpoſe retourne wale cloſe frenchman ſcottes frenche men ſcottes dyde ſayd countre cap xiiii admyrall fraūce erle graunt pre lorde ſaynt croix ſir geffray charney ser wyl lyam de brume ſir iames boeſme lorde pegny lorde hees lorde marnell ſir valeran rauenall barone •• ery barone fountayns lorde croye ſir brake braquemont lorde landury well thouſande ſperes baron knightes fraunce ſo lordes scotlande rode northū berlande bytwene mountayns fronters wale brennyng townes maners countrees kyng englande vncles baron knightes englāde companyes entred scotlande brent exyled parte ſo kyng came lodged edenborowe ye chefe towne scotlande taryed fyue dayes departyng ſet fyre brent vp clene caſtell hurt ſtronge ynough well kept whyle kyng lay edenborowe thenglyſſhmen rode abrode countre dyd moche hurt foūde nother man beeſt abrode withdrawen foreſtes englyſſhe hooſt mo hūdred thouſāde men well many horſe wherof nede great prouiſyon foūde none scotlande englande cāe thē great plentie bothe lande ſee kyng departed fro edēborowe rode towarde eſtruleyn good towne wherin great abbey blacke monkes mooſt cōmenly kynges scotlande buryed kyng lay abbey deꝑtyng abbey brent paſſed ryuer taxe whiche ronneth ſaint iohn̄s towne caſtell strulyn great aſſaute wolde nat wonne yet towne landes lorde vercy brent entent duke lancaſtre bretherne paſſe scotlande purſue ſcottes frenche men knew well gone waye wale go carlyle ſo thought encloſe thē bytwene englande scotlande fight aduauntage purpoſe thought veryly holde thenglyſſhe men ſpredde abrode scotlāde reſyſtence agaynſt thē countre voyde men warre gone englande admyrall fraunce ſo englyſſhmen brent towne ſaynt iohn̄s ryuer taxe rynneth good hauen ſayle then ouer worlde brent towne donde englyſſh men ſpared nother abbey minſters ſet fyre ſo vowarde ran bredan whiche cytie ſee ſyde thentre wylde ſcottyſſhe dyd hurte therto howe countrey right ſore afrayed cytie thought haue aſſaute feared leeſt ye kynge englande wolde haue come thyder haue ouer ron countre thus lykewiſe englyſſhemen dyde scotlande ſo dyd frenche men ſcottes englande marcheſſe northumberlande wale brent great countre went northumberlande entred wale whiche otherwiſe called wynſlande paſſed landes lordes grayſtocke clyfforde brent voyage dyuers great village men warre coūtre kyng came cyte catlyle wale whiche well cloſed gatꝭ walles dyke place auncyent tyme kynge arthure loued rightwell bycauſe great woodes many dedes armes done laye carlyle gariſon ſir lewes clyfforde brother ſir wyllm̄ neuell hym ſir thom̄s moſgraue dauy holgraue ſonne ſir dongorſſe dyuers marcheſſe fronters wale cytte carlyle chiefe cytie countre nede full good men warre • whan admyrall fraunce came thyder aſſayled cytie great force whiche aſſaute cruell fierſe thus cytie many noble dedes armes done ⸪ ¶howe erle oxenforde brake purſute kyng englād thought haue made wale frenche men ſcottes howe kynge retourned ſame waye came howe frenche men ſcottes determyned retourne agayne scotlā de cap xv kyng englandes vncles knewe well waye admyrall fraūce ſcottes helde ſaid thought ye beſt folowe theym ſerche tyll myght fynde ſo fight sayeng howe coude wyſe eſcape purpoſe duke lancaſtre bretherne dyuers great baron englande mooſt parte cōmons hooſt prouiſyon come well lande ſee kynge alſo agreed ſame purpoſe night erle oxenforde chiefe counſayle kynge bare rule kyng truſted man ſo moche turned kyng cleue fro purpoſe nat ſhewe cauſe enformed kyng knowen ſaid ſir thynke ye wyll ye folowe way vncles hath counſayled sir knowe trouth ye ſo ye ſhall neuer returne agayne ſir duke lācaſtre deſyreth none thynge ye deed might kyng howe durſt coūſayle yor grace go wynter ſeaſon ſtrange countrey sir wolde nat counſayle paſſe moūtayns northumberlande mo xxx ſtreightes paſſages ye cloſed ye ſhulde neuer come agayne without daunger ſcottes sir putte nat youre ſelfe daunger ſoeuer ſaye duke lancaſtre wyll go lette hym go haue charge therof counſayle ye ſhall nat go sir ye haue done ynough one tyme youre father neuer ſo farre within scotlande yet kynge edwarde youre graunt father therfore ſir oughte contente ſaue youre owne perſone ye yonge luſty ſuche ſheweth ſayre ſemblant loueth l • tell kynge gaue ſuche audyence ſayeng erle went neuer mynde ye ſhall herafter next mornyng lordes englande people ordred ſelfe deꝑte scotlāde folowe ennemyes fight concluded night duke lancaſtre came king nephue nat knowyng trouble chaunge purpoſe▪ kynge beyng malencoly aſſone ſawe hym ſayd great yre certeſſe vncle lācaſtre ye ſhall nat attayne yet entent thynke wordes yt wyll leſe ſelfe foliſſhely wyll nat beleue yet coūſayle ſe therby domage profyte v people ye wyll make voyage ye lyſte wyll nat wyll retourne englande nexte waye ſuche loue v wyll folowe v duke lancaſtre ſayd sir ſhall folowe ye haue neuer man company loueth ſo well alſo bretherne man wyll ſaye except perſone wolde thynge otherwyſe well people guage cōtrarie none wolde ſpeke worde kynge helde peace ſpake ſeruauntes mater orderyng hymſelfe returne englande ſame way yt came duke lācaſtre departed fro kynge right ſore troubled mynde returned cōpany made newe ordynaūce morning thought haue folowed frenchman march wale dyde nat ſo retourned next waye englande lo thus ye may ſe howe thetle oxēforde great kyng brake voyage dyuers great lordes ſayd kyng yuell counſayled seynge prouiſyon come ſayd might well haue folowed ſcottes wale ſo doyng ſhulde euer haue drawen englande warde ſome ꝑſons wery payne trauell ſaid howe thynges cōſidred better retourne go sayeng howe great ꝓuiſion muſt ſcrue ſuche hoſt howe yuell paſſe mountayns wynter ſeaſon wherby ſayd might rather leſe wynne thus ſeaſon brake vp iorney army englande kynge lordes retourned englande ſame way came hadde diſtroyed mooſt parte realme scotlande theſe tidynges came admyrall fraū ce ſcottes tooke counſayle beſt ſo concluded retourne agayne scotlande vitails began fayle poore countrey diſtroyed march carlyle landes barone clyfforde lorde maubray byſſhoprike carlyle cytie coude nat wynne frenche men ſayd howe brent diſtroyed byſſhorike dyrhame carlyle better worthe ye townes scotlande frenchman ſcottes retourned scotlande ſame waye came whan came scotlā de founde countrey diſtroyed people countre dyde ſette lytell therby ſaid howe thre four pole ſhortely wolde make agayne houſes ſaued moche catayle foreſtes frenche men tooke fayne paye truely therfore dere frenche men often great daunger ſcottes many debate vitayle ſcotes ſayd howe frenche men dyde demage englyſſhe men done demaunded ſo anſwered ſayde howe frenche men rode abrode beate downe deſoyled cornes whete barley otes wolde nat kepe highe wayes rather ryde throughe corne whiche demages ſaid wolde haue trewe recōpence departed scotlande ſayde howe ſhulde nother haue ſhyppe maryner paſſe thē ouer ſee without leaue lycēce dyuers knightes ſquyers complayned woodes cutte downe frenche men make lodgynges ¶howe frenche lordes great paryll scotlāde coulde nat fynde meanes paſſe ouer ſee howe ſhewed therles duglas morette hardneſſe foūde countre anſwere made cap xvi whan admyrall company returned scotlande come edenborowe endured great payne coude fynde nothing bye money wynes lytell ſmall ale bere bredde barley otes horſes deed hunger foū dred pouertie whan wolde haue ſolde thē wyſt nat ther none wolde gyue thē one peny nother horſe harneſſe ſoudyers ſhewed capitayns howe delte knewe right well experyence ſelfe men ſaid howe coude nat long endure payne ſaid realme scotlande ſuche countre nat kepe hooſt wynter ſhulde abyde tyll ſomer ſhulde deed pouertie ſhulde departe ſonder ſerche lyueng abrode ī coūtre douted ſcottes wolde ſlee beddes admyrall conſydred well theſe thynges ſawe clerely likely ſayde howe purpoſe abyde wynter ſende frenche kyng duke burgoyne certifyeng caſe haue newe prouiſyon money vitayls make newe freſſhe warre agayne nexte ſomer englande howe ſawe well yuels ſcottes conſydred yell people gaue leaue departe ſuche wolde departyng miſchefe lordes coude fynde paſſage thēſelfe men ſcottes wolde ſuch knightes ſquyers poore ſhulde departe thentent might rule remnant eaſe ſayd admyrall sir lette youre men departe whan wyll youre ſelfe ye ſhall nat departe coūtre tyll full ſatiſfied ſuche charge haue borne ſeaſon army theſe tidynges right harde admyrall baron fraū ce ſhewed mater erle duglas erle morette beſemynge right ſore diſpleaſed ſo hardely dalte ſaid right ſorie dealynge wyll cauſe neuer ſcottyſſhe knight ſhall come fraunce haue good ſo theſe two erles ſpake erles baron scotlande ſaid howe loſte well wherfore diſſymule wyll recōpenſed theſe two erles ſayd admyrall lordes fraūce howe coude nat rule lordes cōmons wherfore behoued purpoſed go realme ſatiſfy cōmons reſtore agayne domages whan admyrall ſawe wolde non otherwiſe thought wolde nat leſe leſſe conſydred well howe without conforte cloſed ſee ſawe howe ſcottes wylde opynion wherfore fayne agre ſcottes entent cauſed crye made maner perſons ſhulde come admyrall fraunce proue men done thē domage wolde recōpence value therof whiche crye apeaſed ſcottes▪ ſo admyrall became de • tour ſayd howe wolde nat departe scotlāde tyll complaynātes fully ſatiſfyed payed dyuers knightes ſquiers hadde paſſage ſo retourned ſome flaūders wynde weder wolde briue without horſe harneſſe ryght poore feble curſyng day euer came scotlande sayeng howe neuer men ſo harde voyage wyſſhing french kyng peace englande one yere two ſo bothe kynges togider go scotlande vtterly diſtroy realm euer ſaid neuer ſawe ſo yuell people ſo falſe traytours folyſſhe people feates warre admyrall fraunce thē departed firſt wrote letter frenche kyng duke burgoyne certifyeng caſe ſcottes delte hym wolde haue hym come home muſt ſende thyder ſuche ſō me money become dettoure payed knightes ſquyers commens scotlande ſcottes ſayd playnly warre made englande ſeaſon fraunce nat ſelfe therfore ſuche domages haue taken iourney wolde fully recompēſed agayne deꝑted ſcotlande whiche ſworne agreed frenche kyng counſayle boūde redeme agayne admyrall ſende hym thyder than̄e ſōmes money ordayned money payed exchāge towne bruges ſo ſcottꝭ contente admyrall departed scotlande whan thynges payed ſo toke leaue kynge wylde ſcottyſſhe erles duglas morette conueye • ſeeſyde ſo toke ſhyppynge edenborowe wynde wyll arryued sluſe flaū ders knightes ſquyers company returned nat agayne hym thought wolde ſe countrees ſo went dyuers partes mooſt parte retourned fraunce ſo poore nat able get thē ſelfe horſe ſome bought horſes ſpecially burgonions cā penoiſe barroiſe lorayns ⸪ ⸫ ¶howe admyrall enformed frenche kyng coūſayle ſtate scotlande howe duke burgoyne gret deſyre cauſe frenche kyng make iorney englande cap xvii whan admyrall retourned fraunce yonge kynge charles ye duke burgoyne made hym good chere reaſon demaūded hym condycion kynge lordes scotlande ſayd howe ſcottes ſomewhat reſembled englyſſhe men bicauſe enuyous ouer ſtrā gers moreouer ſayd rather erle sauoy erle arthoyſe kyng ſcottes ſayd howe hadde ſene power scotlande one daye gyder ſcottes ſayd ſelfe yeche neuer ſawe togyder paſt fyue hundred ſpeares xxx thouſande men warr whiche nombre agaynſt engliſſhe archer agaynſt thouſande good men armes coude longe endure admyrall demaunded ſene puyſſaunce englande anſwered yea day quod whan ſawe ſcottes flye awaye feare englyſſhmen deſyred bring might ſe aduyſe englyſſhe hooſt ſo dyde ſet ſtraite paſſage muſt nedes paſſe demyng ix thouſande men warre ſcottes ſayd power england none abydinge behynde kyng counſayle ſtudyed lytell laſte ſayd great thyng threſcore thouſande archer ſixe ſeuyn thouſande men armes maye well quod conſtable may make nombre yet rather fight theym home owne march halfe nombre ſo herde maiſter ſaye often tymes whan yonge faithe quod admyrall ye ben great nombre men armes ſuppoſed ye ſhulde haue bē thynke hadde famyſſhed scotlande thus conſtable admyrall deuyſed toguyder ſette duke burgoyne great deſyre make armye englā de ¶nowe let v leaue lytell ſpeke thē retourne buſyneſſe flaunders trouthe duke burgoyn ymagined mynde make nexte somer folowynge whiche ſhulde yere oure lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore fyue great army moue frenche kyng moche might go englande alſo conſtable frāce expert knight well beloued realme fraūce ben brought vp youthe realm englande lykewiſe gaue counſayle ſame enterpriſe ſo dyde lorde dela • emoyle bycauſe yt duke berrey poictou lymoſyn knewe nothynge counſayle duke burgoyne chiefe kynge dyuers ymaginacions thought well long warre contynued flaūders voyage ouer ſee englande coude nat well done wherfore troubled gaunte enclyned rather deſyres knewe well alyed thenglyſſhe men howe gaunte knight englande called ſir iohan bourchier ſent thyder kyng richarde gouerne towne counſayle theym howe gauntoyſe deſyred haue peace ſo ouerlayd warre mooſt ryche notableſt perſones towne nat maiſters owne goodꝭ wylde ſoudyours gouerned wyſe men ſawe well length coude nat endure great parell whan toguyder dyuers ten tymes marueyled howe endured ſo longe hadde done ſawe well rather force loue peter de boyſe alwayes parceyuered yuell opynions domages non durſt ſpeke hym peace knewe ꝑſone though neuer ſo ſage ſpake treatie peace incōtynent ſlayne murthered without pytie remedy warre gaunte hadde maynteyned agaynſt lorde therle loyes flaunders duke bourgoyne endured ſeuyn yere wherby ther ſuche hurte done great marueyle reherſe turkes paynim ſaraſyns ſorowed warre trouthe marchaundyſes eightene realmes arryued lightely sluſe delyueraunce danne bruges whiche let warre beholde cōſydre theſe farre ꝑties ſorowed warre moche ought ſorie landes nexte adioynynge therto none coude fynde meane peace ſo firſte grace god diuyne inſpyracion hūble prayer good folkes god opened eares pytie poore people flaunders peace came ſhall ſhewe fro poynt poynt ſhewed begynning ſo ſhall declare endynge begynnyng hatte iohn̄ de bare iohan piet gylbert mathue iohan lion ſuche deſyre herken thervnto ¶how grace god two burgeſſes gaunt enteredde treate duke burgoyne peace howe gaue charge therof knight flaunders aunſwere duke gaue vnto cap xviii ſeaſon towne gaunt ſir iohan bourchyer ruler vnder kynge englande peter de boyſe dyd aſſyſt hym ſuſteygned yuell opinyons ther ſome wyſemen right ſore diſpleaſed dyſcēcion bytwene naturall lorde towne durſt nat ſhewe forth entente harte one another durſt ſecretely peter de boyſe knowen made •• blant peace ſhulde haue ben ſlayne wt mercy lyke maner philyppe dartuell ſlayne ſir symon bec • e ſir gylbert brute kepe people gaūt feare cauſed dyuers ſlayne ſeaſon ſeaſon afore fraunces atremau putte oute towne dan frenche kyng diſtroyed coū trey foure mayſters kynge returned agayne fraunce ye haue herde gaūt began dout notable men towne ſuppoſed yt nexte somer frenche kynge wolde retourne agayne beſiege towne peter de boyſe ſuche ſecte made lyght therof sayenge howe wolde gladly ſe kynge towne ſayd ſuche alyaunce kyng englāde ſhulde ſoone ayded conforted ſeaſon towne two valyant men good lyfe good conuerſacyon meane lygnage nat beſt worſt whiche ꝑſones ſore diſpleaſed ſe diſcorde bytwene towne naturall lorde howe durſte nat ſpeke therof feare peter de boyſe one maryner bocher one called roger de creuyn iaques dardenbourke • theſe two perſones matter firſt ſet warke thē wyſe knight flaunders called ſir iohan delle tooke great payne therin knyghtes flaūders coude neuer haue brought paſſe nat ben meanes theſe two perſons knight ſir iohan delle welbeloued towne gaunt came wente pleaſure without ſuſpection theſe two forſayd ꝑſons great diſpleaſure debate • ſpake priuely togyder therof roger ſaid iaques wyll remedy foūde bytwene towne gaunte whiche borne nowe harde caſe duke burgoyn naturall lorde great almes dede make peace • ſo coude ſhulde haue thanke god great prayſe worlde meanes ye trouble ſhulde ceaſed euer ye ſaye trouthe ꝙ iaques harde thynge bringe peter de boyſe paryllous man none dare ſpeke peace feare hī well ꝙ roger yet nat alwayes thus laſt muſt nedes haue ende shewe quod iaques meanes myght wyll gladly quod roger ye chefe bochery mooſt beloued dradde ye might ſecretely ſhewe corage entent frēdes ye ſe howe enclyne ye maye ſpeke lytell lytell ſyde maryner beloued maner men knowe ſome coragꝭ howe warre diſpleaſeth haue great domage therby ſhall ſhewe mynde ſome ſhall drawe ye ſame purpoſe maye gette theſe two craftes accorde craftes good people ſuche deſyreth peace wyllnſone euclyne v well quod iaques ſhall ſpeke gladly thē crafte ſpeke deuyſed ſo done ryght ſecretely wiſely ſo grace holygoſt iaques dardenboure foūde tho bochery well enclyned wyll roger part meanes fayre language founde maryners ryght well agreed therto crafte nere loſte lacke vſage hus theſe two wyſe men ſhewed eche howe founde people diſpoſed haue peace ſaid howe muſt haue ſome ſage perſone ſhewe matter lorde laſt remembred knight called ſir iohan dell ſo went hym diſcouered hym entente ſecretly ſayd sir haue laboured ſo moche thē craftes well enclyned haue peace ſo lorde duke burgoyn wolde pardon graunt v aū cyent frauncheſſes according tenours charter bulles ſir iohan ſayd ſhall gladly go entreate hym ſo knight went towne ye duke fraūce kyng ſhewed hym forſaid mater dyd ſo moche fayre langage duke enclyned wolde ſaye deſyre duke make voyage englande lightlyer condiſcended haue peace gaunt alſo counſayle ſir guy de la tremoyle ſir iohan de vyen conſtable lorde coucy counſayled take peace thē duke anſwered ſayd ſir iohn̄ delle content mater ye wyll deuyſe ſo retourne ye agayne thē ſent hyder duke demaunded hym fraunces atreman counſayle treatie nat sir quod thynke knoweth nothynge therof kepeth caſtell gaure knowe nat ſent hider wolde ſhulde knowe nat tell thē quod duke ſpeke hardely mater thynke wyll nat agaynſt vnderſtāde deſireth gretly peace wt duke cōmaunded ſo knyght dyd retourned gaunt brought theſe good tidyngꝭ went caſtell gaure ſpeke fraunces atreman diſcouered entent ſecretely whan fraunces lytell ſtudyed merely ſaid lorde duke wyll pardon gaunt vpholde frauncheſes ſhall nat rebell agaynſt hym right diligent haue peace knight departed fro hym went agayne fraunce duke ſhewed hym mater duke herde hym gladly wrot letter open cloſe ſealed ſeale thē gaūte knyght thoſe letter retourned flaunders ſo came gaūt ſhewed nat letter ꝓmyſed roger iaques accōplyſſhe entente beholde nowe ꝑell knight ſir iohan bourchier peter de boyſe knowen mater worlde ſhulde nat haue ſaued lyues ⸫ ⸪ ¶howe theſe two foreſayd burgeſſes aſſembled frendes accomplyſſhe enterpriſe ſente ſir iohan delle duke letter peace cap xix than̄e roger iaques ſaid ſir iohn̄ dell sir ye ſhall come monday nexte comyng towne nyne clocke bringe duke letter ſhewe openly cōmons gaunte wherby ſhall gyue credence houre wyll lordes towne elles ſlayne quarell well quod ſir iohan ye ſaye ſo ended coūſayle tyme ſir iohan delle went towne accomplyſſhe purpoſe theſe two wyſemen ſtudyed howe bringe aboute purpoſe ſo ſpake ſome frendes alderman craftes ſo great nombre accorde determyned nexte monday nyne clocke ſhulde departe houſes banner flaūders cryeng lyon flaūders lorde countrey hath gyuen peace good towne gaunte hath pardoned clerely treſpaſſes mater ſagely hādeled yet came knowlege peter de boiſe ſoone knewe therof went ſtreight ſir iohan bourchyer ſoueraygne capitayne vnder kyng englande ſayd hym roger creuyn iaques dardēbourke wyll morowe nyne clocke market place banner flaunders theym wyll crye towne lyon flaū ders lorde countre hath gyuen peace towne gaunte hath ꝑdoned treſpaſſes ſhall kynge englande ſhall nat than̄e obeyed without preuent putte iuryſdyctions beſt quod ſir iohan bourchier aunſwered peter ſayd behoueth morowe mornyng aſſemble harnes men houſe de la vale let v go throughe towne kynge englandes baner v lette v crye alſo lyon flaunders kynge englande lorde countrey towne gaunte whan come market place ſuche partie wyll drawe v lette v flee treatours well deuyſed ꝙ ſir iohan bourchier lette ſo done ¶nowe beholde god dyde nat moche theſe two roger iaques enfourmed peter de boyſe deuyſe whan knewe nat abaſſhed late euenynge ſente frendes ſhulde nexte daye market place eight cloke wyſe deſyred ſeuyn clocke dyde preuent peter de boyſe poyntment euery man agreed monday mornyng ſir iohan bourchyer company came houſe called de la vale hym threſcore peter de boyſe came thyder xl armed thē good ordynaunce ſette ſelfe forwarde roger iaques aſſembled frendes togyder mooſt parte alderman burgeſſes gaunt came toke erles baner went towne cryeng foreſaid crye ſuche herde crye ſawe alderman craftes baners erle folowed came ſame cōpany ſo ſeuyn clocke came market place ſet thē ſelfe good order therles baners euer came mo mo theſe tidynges came anone ſir iohn bourchier peter de boyſe aſſemblynge people went forthe baners englāde wente cryed cryes deuyſed ſo came ſaid market place araynged ſelfe euer ſuche came mooſt parte went erles baners ſo hundred came fourſcore went thyder ſo moche place full men armes ſo ſtode eche regardyng whan peter de boyſe ſawe howe alderman craftes drewe roger iaques ſore abaſſhed douted greatly lyfe ſawe ſuche wont ſerue hym flye awaye fro hym ſo priuely ſtale awaye oute preaſe hydde hym ſelfe feare dethe whan roger iaques ſawe yt nighe people drewe parte right ioyouſe well cōforted nat without good cauſe ſawe well people gaunt wolde peace wt lorde departed certayne company baners flaunders ſo came ſir iohan bourchyer englyſſhemen nat ſure lyues whan ſawe come towarde roger demaūded ſir iohan bourchier wher peter de boyſe entent whyder frende enemy knight anſwered ſaid thynke peter de boyſe whan ſawe gone ſayd knowe nat wher become went company wyll ſeruaunt naturall lorde kyng englande ſende hyder owne deſyres ye well remembre true quod ye nat ben deſyred come hyder towne gaunte ye ſhulde haue ben ſlayne honour kynge englande ſende hyder requeſt ye ſhall nat nede feare non yo • ye ſhall haue hurte ſhall ſaue domages conducte towne calayes wherfore departe lodgynges peaſably • lyrre nat thynge ye ſe wyll vnder obeyſaūce oure naturall lorde duke burgoyne wyll make warre knyght ryght ioyouſe aunſwere ſo quyte ſayd sir ſythe wyll none otherwyſe ſo thanke ye offre tyme ⸪ ⸫ ¶howe ſir iohan dell came gaūt markette place roger iaques alderman cytie howe delyuered letter fro duke burgoyne howe gaunt ſent turney confyrmacion peace charter made therof cap xx ſir iohan bourchier departed peaſably fro place thengliſſh men ſuche gauntoyſe companye fledde awaye hydde thē ſelfe anone entred towne ſir iohan delle came market place duke letter ſende thyder duke opyned reed people whiche gretlye pleaſed theym fraunces atreman ſent fro caſtell gaure incō tynent came agreed treatie ſayd well ſo thervpon ſir iohan delle ſente agayne duke arras ſhewed hym demeanour gauntoyſe howe peter de boyſe rule audyence towne howe ben foū de ſlayne howe fraūces atreman dyde acquyte hym ſelfe valyātly confyrmable peace theſe thynges pleaſed moche duke ſo ſealed charter peace truſe endure vntyll firſte day ianuarye meane ſeaſon counſayle matter cytie tourney ſir iohn̄ delle brought agayne hym gaunte wherof people great ioye ſhewed howe great deſyre haue peace ſeaſon ſir iohan bow ser englyſſhe men peter de boyſe ſtyll gaunte man wolde thynge peter de boyſe lyued ſtyll reſt ſware ſhulde nat procure moue thynge ſhulde cauſe warre bytwene towne naturall lorde thus done meanes fraunces atreman ſpake hym wherby peter lyued reſte knewe well peter alwayes helde opynions true good capitayne truce durynge gaūte apoynted theym ſhulde go tourney conclude treatie fraūces atreman ſent thyder chiefe bycauſe man reaſonable well knowen lordes hym wente roger creuyn iaques dardēbourke came turney vtas ſaynt andrewe fyftie horſe lodged toguyder ſygne samon ſtrete ſaynt briſe v day decembre thyder came duke burgoyne ducheſſe wyfe lady neuers doughter entred turney gate towarde lyle agaynſt entrynge gaūtoyſe iſſued mete theym whan ſawe duke enclyned theym ſelfe horſes bare heeded duke paſſed lightely theym made haſte mere ducheſſe brabante comynge cytie gate malynes ſhe lodged byſſhoppes palays thus began treatie bytwene duke towne gaunt ſir iohan delle toke great payne go come bytwene ꝑties deſyre duches bourgoyne lady neuers duke forgaue yuell wyll peace made cryed accorded written ſealed bytwene party maner foloweth ⸪ ¶here enſueth tenoure letter charter peace ⸪ philyppe ſonne fraūces duke burgoyn erle flaunders artoyſe palatyne lorde selynes erle rethell malynes margarete ducheſſe counteſſe ſayd coſitreis heateth ſeyth preſent writynge ſende gretynge wyll knowen oure welbeloued ſubiectes alderman common good towne gaunte hath right humbly requyred lorde kyng v ſhulde haue pytie mercy pardone offence theym theym done kynge v pytie compaſſyon ſaid ſubiectes letter haue pardoned thē alſo haue confyrmed auncyent priuyleges frauncheſes cuſtomes vſage caſe wyll playnly obey kynge v whiche pardone gaunte parte taker haue receyued right humbly ſuche letter meſſāgers ſent v great nombre turney haue clene tenounſed debate warres good harte returned true obeyſaūce kyng v promyſyng henſ forthe true frendes faith full kynge v king ſoueraygne lorde v naturall lorde reaſon margarete wyfe naturall lady heretour wherfore kynge haue receyued grace ſaid ſubiectes haue gyuen letter ꝑdon pure remyſſion reſtytucyon priuyleges cuſtomes vſages whiche large appereth content oure letter whiche pardon ſayd ſubiectes haue made v dyuers ſupplycacions whiche haue receyued haue cauſed good delyberacyon ſene vyſited examyned counſayle whiche well ſene cōmen ꝓfite coūtre eſchue diſcēſions herafter might fall ſpeciall grace contēplacion good ſubiectes haue ordred determined maner foloweth firſte deſyre ſhulde confyrme aūcient priuileges tourney danduarde grauntmont meule teremounde ruplemount abſte atharcle breuelies douſe chateleyns playne countrey parteyning ſame townes haue ordayned inhabytaūtes ſayd townes ſhulde come v brīgyng priuyleges ſhalbe ſene coūſayle done ſhall ſo ſaid ſubiectes gaūt ſayd good townes ſhall reaſon holde content ſayde priuyleges loſt caſe fortune otherwyſe ſhall make good reformacion therof alſo haue deſyred courſe marchaundyſe haue cōſented haue auncyent courſe payeng cuſtome olde tyme contynewed alſo deſyre inhabytauntes towne gaunt adherentes happe arreſted tyme come countre countrey flaunders occaſyon debate foreſayd diſcenſyons ſhulde cauſe theym releaſed lyue reſte caſe haue graū ted arreſted yt cauſe ſhall ayde conforte defēde power agaynſt ſo ſhulde trouble boūde defende good true ſubiectes alſo requyre ſuche priſoners haue whiche ꝑtie ſhulde delyuered haue ordayned ordayne ſuche priſoners putte raūſome pay raunſome delyuered payeng alſo reaſonable expenſes theſe priſoners frendes kynne haue hādes fortreſſes kepyng agaynſt v firſt delyuer ſuche fortereſſes oure handes alſo lykewiſe delyuer ſuche priſoners haue handes moreouer habundant grace haue ordayned ordayne ſuche occaſions debate diſcencyons laſte oure countrey flaūders haue ben baniſſhed good townes bruges ipre countre francke townes place alſo ſuche hath ben banyſſhed iuſtyce lawe gaunt put iudged without lawe abſent ſuche reſtored maye retourne dwell ſayd towne ſuche hath taken parte reſtored agayne pleaſure ſuche place came fro whan entre agayne ſayd townes ſwere offycers true v kepe peace ſuretie ſayde townes beare yuell wyll priuely parte inhabytauntes ſayd townes yuell domage ſuche entre towne ſhall ſwere obey kynge v ſuche abſent tyme hereafter lymitted ſhalbe reſtored fee houſes rente herytages wherſoeuer natwithſtandyng forfayture done occaſyon ſayd diſcenſyons enioye primer ſtate alſo ſayd inhabytauntes towne gaūt adherentes towne countreis brabant holande zelande cambres byſſhoprike liege come ſubmytte ſelfe v ſuche ſhall appoynte wt ſpace two monethes publycacion peace enioye pardone foreſaid grace ſuche realme englande fryſelāde almayne ſyde great ſee come ſubmytte theym ſelfe within foure monethes notifycacion peace ſuche beyonde great see rome ſaynt iames haue reſpyte ſubmiſſyon hole yere knoledge peace thus ſworne may enioye ſayd pardone alſo ſuche hath ben banyſſhed iudged ſayd towne ſayde occaſyon reſtored fee houſes rente herytages whan ſoeuer wyll pleaſure mouable goodes hath ben taken eyther partie ſhalbe reſtytuicion made therof euery partie bequyte therof alſo oblygacions made mouable goodes taken ſaid occaſyons dyſchargynge conſcyence render agayne ſuche houſes ſhall delyuered agayne owner nothing taken theym nayled pynned yron leed fro thenſ forthe reuenwes payable owner alſo though ſo ſome ſubiectes gaunt haue done homage ſuche landes holde lordes true owner wherby landes myght fortifyed natwithſtandynge ſpecyall grace wyll ſhall ſtyll enioye ſuche landes doynge v homage holde v without meane holde alſo graunt diſenherytaunces recognyſaūces done lawe bytwene partes ſtande ſo ſubiectes gaūt alderman counſaylours cōmens ſame adherentes owne good wylles renounce alyaunces promiſes oblygacions made homage haue done made kyng englande deputy officer good wyllers ye kyng v frohens forwarde ſwere true kyng ſeueraygne lorde ſucceſſours kynges fraunce v ryght lorde lady ſucceſſours erles flaunders v ſeruyce true ſubiectes ought lorde lady defende perſons honour herytages rightes lette power ſuche wolde contrarye gyue knowledge therof v officer ſauynge alwayes priuyleges frauncheſſe alſo entent oure ſubiectes towne gaūt ſhulde alwayes good peace true obeyſaunce kyng v heyres erles flaunders eſchewe diſcēſyons debate myght fall wyll ordayne theſe ſayde artycles ſurely kepte without breakynge ſtraitely cōmaunde ſubiectes payne leſe maye leſe v occaſyon ſayd debate diſcēſyōs nothing openly priuely ī worde dede ſhulde preiudicall thē gaunt rebuke gyue theym yuell language contrarye theſe ſayde artycles iniury domage theym gaunte alyes helde partie occaſyon ſayd debate diſcencyons ſuche offence ſuche knowledge lordes offycers lawes appertayneth dede cremenell doer ayders counſayle kepars withoute fraude punyſſhed bodyes goodes brekers peace well iuſtyce officer lordes officer lawes countrey apparteyneth reaſonable ſatiſfactyon made partie hurte goodes treſpaſar reſudue v lordes ſoyle ſauyng euer townes priuyleges burgeſſes ſayd towne gaūt though nat banyſſhed lawe gyltie breakynge peace thynke reaſon priuylegꝭ olde tyme therby ſaued nat leſe goodes yet nowe wyll preſent treatie ſhall leſe goodes ꝑtie hurte ſatiſfyed therof ſaid reſydue come right heyres thoughe deed caſes ſauyng priuyleges towne gaunte ſuche yuell doer nat taken than̄e banyſſhed depriued fro goodꝭ alſo yt wordes otherwyſe contrarye ſaid ordynaunce cōe knowledge offycers wyll ſuche punyſſhed make amendes ſuche maner maye enſample punyſſhment done offycers lawe right apparteyneth natwithſtandynge priuyledge frauncheſſe place alſo perſone churche agaynſt ordynaſice delyuered ordynarie take ſuche vengeaūce breaker peace caſe requireth alſo wyll ſayd peace bytwene v oure ſubiectes cryed publyſſhed ſolempnely towne townes flaūders herafter dout made ſayd artycles cyrcumſtaunces therof ſhall declare cauſe declared counſayle euery thynge party ſhall reaſon holde content alderman burgeſſes cōmonties towne gaunt v oure adherentes receyue haue receyued hū bly ſayd grace pardon benefytes v done kyng charles ſouerayne lorde ſaid duke ducheſſe erle coū teſſe flaūders naturall lorde lady whiche grace pardon thanke hertes kyng ſouerayne lorde ſucceſſours naturall lorde lady aforſayd erle counteſſe flaunders make ſhall make ꝓmyſe trewe faythfull ſubiectes ought ſhall kepe defēde perſonages honour wytneſſe whiche thynges ſayde duke ducheſſe haue putte ſeales theſe preſent letter ſhyriffes alderman burgeſſes cōmons ſayde towne gaunt haue alſo putte ſeale towne gaunte moreouer ſayd duke duches praye requyre oure welbeloued aunte ducheſſe luſenbourcke brabant right welbeloued brother duke iubert bauyer alſo alderman cōmontie counſayle gaunt alſo duke ducheſſe burgoyne alderman counſayle cōmonties gaunt requyre praye barones noble countrey flaunders folowynge good townes bruges ipre ferrouer frāke good townes malynes auuers ye well peace knowledge ſuretie foreſaid thynges eche deſyre ſette ſeales iane grace god ducheſſe luſenbourcke brabaunt lancbourcke duke aubert bauyere baylye gouernour countrey heynaulte hollande zelande ſeignorie friſe wyllyam eldeſt ſonne erle namure lorde sluſe hughe lorde dā coyne chateleyne gaunt iohn̄ lorde guyſtelles harues henry de bures lorde dyſqueme haure iohan lorde gonuſeberge ientoyſe arnolde iouſte lorde eſtornay philyppe lorde daxalle loyſe halſe baſtarde flaunders gyrarde raſenhen lorde baſerode gaultier lorde halme philyppe namure lorde eque iohn̄ villayne lorde ſaynt iohans withoute chatcllayne ipre loyſe lorde lambres knyght borowe mayſters alderman bruges ipre philyppe redehen mountferant alderman moūtfranke mountamare knight ſhyrife terrouer franke name ſayd terrouer whiche hath ſeale common counſayls townes malynes auuers haue foreſayd prayer requeſt welth peace wytnes trouthe ſuretie ſayd thynges eche haue putte seales ſayd townes preſent treatie made tourney eyghtene day moneth decembre yere grace thouſande thre hundred fourſcore fyue makyng theſe preſent letter charter peace engroſed sealed publyſſhed duke one parte towne gaunt parte fraūces atreman cōmons towne gaūt beyng toke leaue humbly duke ducheſſe alſo lady brabāt thankyng thouſande tymes ayde helpe makynge peace offred ſelfe euer redy ſeruyce good lady thanked thē right ſwetely exhorted euer kepe fermely peace ſo ſtyrre ye people neuer rebell agaynſt lorde lady euery body departed went home owne duke duches retourned lyle gaunt returned towne whan peter de boiſe ſawe ſure confyrmacion peace people gaunt great ioye therof mynde wyll neuer rebell haue warr therof greatly abaſſhed dyuers ymaginacyons wheder ſhulde abyde ſtylle gaunte thynges pardoned duke charter ſealed ſeale elles departe englande ſir iohan bourchier englyſſhe men apparelled go thynges conſydred thought hym ſelfe coude nat truſt peace abyde gaunte whan fraunces atreman ſawe wolde nat abyde ſayd peter thynke ye ye feare ye knowe well treatie ſealed ye duke thing paſt ſhall neuer chalenge made peter anſwered ſayd yea letter written lyeth nat true ꝑdons pardoneth well mouthe gyueth writyng therof yet hatered remayneth ſtyll corages man towne gaunt ſmall reputacion baſe lynage power haue ſuſteyned rightes lyberties frācheſes towne thynke wtin two thre yere people wyll remēbre feare nay great lygnages towne gylbert mathewes bretherne wyll retourne enemyes mayſter iohan leon gladly wolde neuer ſe theym parentes ſir gylbert brute ſir symon becte ſlayne wherfore caſe nat ſure lyfe fraunces atreman wyll abyde amonge ſuche ſorte treatours haue ſo falſely broken othe promyſe kynge englande ſwere truely ye wyll repente wyll coſte youre lyfe nat ſaye quod fraunces truſte ſo well peace duke ducheſſes promyſe wyll ieoparde abyde peter de boyſe made requeſt alderman counſayle towne sayeng fayre lordes power haue truely ſerued towne gaūt haue ben many harde aduenture halfe good ſeruyce haue done name rewarde aſke none thynge maye ſauely conducted ſir iohan bourchier whome ye ſende englande demaunde aunſwered ſhulde done ſir roger emeryne iaques dardenbourcke whome treatie firſte moued ryght gladde departure ſo dyuers notable perſones gaunt ſuche loued peace thus peter de boyſe departed frome gaunte company ſir iohan bourchier toke hym ſubſtaūce hadde well furnyſſhed golde ſyluer ieowelles ſir iohan delle dyde conducte vnder duke ſalue conducte towne calais gauntoiſe retourned sir iohan bourchier peter de boyſe ſoone might wente englande came kyng vncles ſhewed dedes theym gaunte kynge made peter de boyſe good chere ſo dyde duke lancaſtre bretherne gaue hym great thanke come abandoned theym gaunte come englande kyng incontynent retaygned hym gaue hym hundred marke ſterlynge yerely payed staple wolles london thus peter de boyſe abode ſtyll englande good towne gaunt peace ſir roger emeryn made chefe alder man flete gaunt whiche good offyce great profyte whan ſhyppes myght haue courſe marchaundyſe ſir iaques dardēbourc made chefe ruler meane craftes towne gaunte whiche alſo great profytable offyce ⸫ ⸪ ¶howe ſir iohn̄ froyſſart auctour cronycle departed fraunce wente erle foiz maner voyage cap xxi longe nowe ſith made mencion buſyneſſes farre countreis buſyneſſes nerer home hath ben ſo freſſhe lafte mater write therof howe ſeaſon valyant men deſyring auaūce ſelfe realme caſtell portyngale gaſcoyne rouergue quercy lymoſyn bygore euery day ymagined ſubteltie coulde gette one another dedes armes ſtealyng townes caſtels fortreſſes therfore iohn̄ froyſſart haue taken cronycle preſent hyſtorie req̄ſt highe renomed prince ſir guy chatellon erle bloyſe lorde daueſnes beauuoys deſtonhon la guede ſouerayne mayſter good lorde cōſydring ſelfe howe great dedes armes likely towarde party picardy flaūders seyng peace made bytwene duke gaunt greatly anoyed ydell knewe well deth noble highe hyſtorie ſhulde haue courſe wherin dyuers noble men ſhulde haue great pleaſure delyte yet thāke god haue vnderſtandyng remembraūce thynges paſſed wyt quicke ſharpe ynough conceyue thinges ſhewed vnto touchyng princypall mater body yet able endure ſuffre payne thynges cōſydred thought wolde nat lette purſue ſayde firſt purpoſe •• tent knowe trouthe dedes done 〈◊〉 countrie • founde occaſion go •• ghe mighty prince gaſcone erle foiz byerne knewe well yt might haue grace come houſe leyſar coude nat ſo well enformed purpoſe none place worlde thyder reſorted maner knightes ſtrāge ſquyers great noblenes ſayd erle ymagined ſo dyd ſhewed redoubted lorde erle bloyes myne entent gaue letter recōmendacions therle foiz ſo rong tode without parell domage cāe houſe called ortaiſe coūtre berne ſaynt katheryns day yere grace thre hundred fourſcore eight ſayd erle ſoone ſawe made good chere ſmylyng ſayd howe knewe yet neuer ſawe often herde ſpekyng ſo reteyned houſe great eaſe helpe letter credence brought vnto hym ſo might tary pleaſure enfourmed buſyneſſe realmes caſtyle portyngale nauar aragon yea realme englande coū tre burbonoyſe galcoyne erle ſelfe dyd demaunde thyng dyde ſhewe knewe sayenge howe thy ſtorie begon ſhulde hereafter prayſed reaſon ſayd howe l yere paſſed done marueylous dedes armes worlde thre hundred yere thus court erle foiz well cheryſſhed pleaſure thyng mooſt deſyred knewe newes touchyng mater wyll lordes knightes ſquiers euer enforme alſo gentle erle hym ſelf ſhall nowe declare fayre langage enfourmed encreaſe therby mater gyue enſample thē lyſte auaunce ſelfe haue recounted great dedes armes takynge ſautynge townes caſtelles batayles harde encountrynges yet ye ſhall many mo whiche grace god ſhall make iuſt narracion ye haue herde whan lorde edmonde ſonne kynge englande erle cambridge de er ted fro realme portingale take ſhypping luſtbourke howe made c • u • nant iohan recouer herytage thus become byder paraduēture nat ſo many ye wrote ſuche haue ſuche good wylles dare well abyde aduenture batayle agaynſt thoſe yt nowe preſent erle tryſlmate ſurely ſhall nat content without haue batayle suche wordes lyke erle cambridge ſhewed kyng portingale departed whiche kyng herde thē well howe neuer durſte gyue batayle playne saluence whafic ſpaynierdes countre wolde nat gyue hym counſayle therto ſayde hym sir puyſſaunce kyng caſtell nowe ſo great fortune myſad • enture ye leſe • elde ye leſe youre realme euer wherfore better ye ſuffred thyng wherby ye ſhulde haue domage parell whan • e erle cambridge ſawe wolde none otherwyſe tourned luſenborne aparelled ſhyppes toke leaue kyng portyngale ſo toke ſee company wolde nat leaue iohan ſonne portingale kyng lady ſhulde mary chylde yonge ſo thus erle reteurned englande thus dealyng iourney portyngale erle cambridge retourned englande maner ye haue de ſhewed brother duke lancaſtre dealynge kynge ferant portyngale duke ſorie therof ſawe thereby conqueſt caſtell farre alſo kyng richarde englande abouth h • c • ūſayle nat apetyte ſpecially • le • forde chefe kinges fauour erle dyd ſet great trouble bytwene kyng vncles might ſaid oftentymes kyng ſir • fye wyll folowe myndes vncles duke lancaſtre crle cambridge ſhall well coſt treaſure englande warre spayne yet ſhall cēquere nothyng better kepe owne people money ſpende abrode ye gette profyte kepe defende owne rytage wherin ye haue war • e ſydes well fraunce scotlande rather enploy tyme countreis yonge kynge enclyned lightely wordes loued hart bicauſe noriſſhed vp toguyder erle great alyaunces dyuers lordes knightes englande dyde mater counſayle ſir symon burle ſir robert treuelyen ser nicholas brambre ſir iohan beauchampe ſir iohan saliſbury ſir mychaell de la pole alſo ſir thomas tryuet ſir wylliam helmon named ſame ꝑte ſo dyffernes diſcorde bitwene kynge vncles noble common realme many yuels came therby englāde ye ſhall hereafter hyſtorie nat longe erle cambridge departed portyngale kynge feraunt felle ſicke ſo contynued hole yere dyed mo chyldren quene spayne kynge iohan caſtell enformed deth howe realm portyngale fallen hādes howe ryghtfull heyre thervnto reaſon dethe kynge sother dyuers coūſayls kept mater ſome ſayd howe portingales ſo harde harted people yt wold nat without conqueſt dede whan portyngales ſawe howe without kyng determyned counſayle ſende baſtarde brother kynges ſage valyant man called deuyſe man relygton mayſter hoſpytals realme ſayd rather vnder rule maiſter denyſe vnder rule kynge caſtell reputed hym baſtarde hath good corage well whan mayſter denyſe vnderſtode cōmens wyll foure chiefe cyties portyngale hadde great affectyon crowne hym kyng wherof great ioye ſo wrote ſecretely frendes came lurbone whiche kay realme people towne receyued hym great ioye demaūded hym crowned kyng wheder wolde good thē nat kepe lande frauncheſe aunſwered ſayd wolde thē deſyred neuer better kynge wolde luxbone wrote connubres pount de portugale dourke theſe kayes realme ſo determyned crowne kyng mayſter denyſe ſage valyant man good gouernaūce brother kyng ferant ſawe well realme coude nat longe without kyng well feare ſpay mardes myſcreātes granado bongie marched theſe ſayde townes certayne lordes lande enclined ſome ye lordꝭ ſayd nat mete baſtarde crowned kyng people good townes ſaid ſhulde ſo neceſſyte muſt ſo ſithe none ſeyng valyant ſage man bothe wy • te dedes armes toke enſample kynge henry crowned kyng caſtell electyon countrey cōmon profyte done kynge peter beynge lyue thus electyon abode maiſter denyſe ſolemynely crowned cathedrall churche connubres accorde puyſſaunce cōmons realme ſware kepe iuſtyce ryght people kepe maynteyne frauncheſes lyue dye wherof hadde great ioye whan theſe tidynges came hearyng iohan kyng caſtell ſore diſpleaſed therwith two cauſes one bycauſe wyfe enheryter bycauſe people election hadde crowned maiſter denyſe kynge wherfore kyng iohan toke tytell make warr demaūde luxbone ſōme two hundred thouſande florens whiche ferant promyſed hym whan toke doughter wyfe ſende erle terme therle ribydea byſſhoppe burges portyngale ambaſſadours luxbone whan ſaynt prayne laſte towne caſtell towarde luxbone ſent haraulde kyng luxbone haue ſaue conducte go come furnyſſhe voyage whiche graunted lightly ſo came luxbone ſo towne aſſembled counſayle toguyder ambaſſadours ſhewed come thyder finally ſayde ye ſirs luxbone ye ought iuſtely nat marueyle kyng ſouerayne lorde demaundeth ſōme money ye bounde nat cō tent ye haue gyuen ye noble crowne portyngale clerke man relygion baſtarde thynge nat ſuffred rightfull election non nerer ye crowne thā alſo ye haue done without aſſent noble realme wherfore kyng maiſter ſaythe ye haue done yuell without ye ſhortely remedy make wyll make ſharpe war • whiche wordes feraunt gallopes de vyle fois notable burgeſſe cyte anſwered ſayd sir ye reproche v greatly electyon owne election moche reprouable ye crowned spaygne baſtarde ſonne iewe clerely knowen ryghtfull election kynge hath right realem portyngale right reſteth doughters kyng peter englande maryed bothe conſtaūce iſabell maryed duke caſtre therle cambridge wherfore ser ye may departe whan ye wyll retourne ſent hyder ſay electyon good whiche wyll kepe kyng wyll haue none long lyſte kyng ye ſōme money ye demaūde v ſay nothyng boū de therto take boūde therfore ſuche profyte therof anſwere kynge portyngall nat preſent • howbeit knewe well ſhulde ſayd whā theſe ambaſſadours ſawe coude haue non anſwere toke leaue departed retourned cyuell lafte kyng coūſayle ſhewed ſaid anſwere kyng spayne toke coūſayle beſt mater determyned kyng portyngale ſhulde deſied howe kyng spayne good quarell moue warre dyuers reaſons kyng denyſe defyed helper portyngale kyng spayne made gret ſōmons men war • lay ſiege cytie luxbone kyng ſayd wolde neuer departe then tyll anſwered hym ſo proudely ſhuld derely repent might ouercōe thus king caſtell puiſſaūce came ſaynt yrayne yt ſeaſon knight chaſed • ut court called ſir nauret kyng myght haue gette hym ſhulde haue coſt hym h • ed knight knowledge therof hadde many good frendes auoyded realme caſtell came luxbone kyng portyngale great ioye comynge retayned hym made hym great capitayne dyde moche hurte ſpayniardes kynge caſtell departed fro ſaynt yrayne came layde ſiege cytie luxbone encloſed therin kynge portyngale ſiege endured hole yere conſtable hoſt erle longueuyll marſhall hooſt ſir raynolde lymoſyn knight limoſyn long came spaygne ſir bertram cleſquy firſte warres made spaygne ſir raynolde valiant knight well proued kynge well maryed hym fayre lady fayre herytage two ſonnes raynolde henry greatly prayſed realme caſtell prowes kynge caſtell dagheynes mandake ſir dygo perſement peter roſeament maryche de verſaulx portugaleys turned ſpayniſſhe great mayſter caleſtrane brother yong knyght called dighemeres pier gouſſart ſelme iohan radigo de hoyes great mayſter ſaint iaques kyng well hym thyrtie thouſande men dyuers aſſautes ſcrimyſſhes many feates armes done one parte ſpaygnierdes knewe well kynge portyngale ſhulde haue none ayde noble realme common made hym kyng agaynſt wylles kyng caſtell intenſyon cōquere luxbone countre retourned ſawe well ſhulde haue none ayde without englande wherof mooſt doute yet whan well ymagined▪ ſawe well englyſſhe men farr herde howe kynge englāde vncles nat beſt acorde wherfore thought hym ſelfe ſur • tie ſiege whiche ſiege right plentyfull thynges market caſtell plentie ther kyng portyngale lay ſtyll cytie luxbone caſe coude nat take see fro hym deimyned ſende englāde kyng duke lancaſtre truſtie ambaſſadours renewe aliances made bytwene kyng kyng ferant brother alſo ambaſſadours charge ſhewe duke lancaſtre maryage wolde gladly haue doughter philyppe make quene portyngale ſwere ſeale ꝑpetuall peace alyance bytwene alſo promyſynge hym wolde come thyder two thre thouſāde men warre many archer helpe ayde hym cōquere enherytaunce caſtell meſſage apoynted two knightes ſir iohan rade goe ſir iohn̄ tetedore archedeaken luxbone called marche de la fugyre made redy toke ſee good wynde ſo ſayled towarde fronters englande ꝑte kyng caſtell laye ſiege counſayled write fraunce gaſcoyne ſome ayde knightes ſquyers ſpaynierdes ſuppoſed well kynge portyngale ſende ſocoure englande reyſe ſiege thought wolde nat ſo taken puiſſaūce might ſtronge ynoughe reſyſt englyſſhmen portugaleyſe counſayled ſo dyde ſende letter meſſangers fraunce dyuers knyghtes ſquyers ſuche deſyred dedes armes ſpecially countrey • rne countie foiz plentie good knightꝭ deſyring dedes armes though ben brought vp erle foiz good peace bitwene hym therle armynake theſe meſſages theſe two kyngꝭ nat ſone brought howe warres place ceaſed neuertheleſſe auuergne tholouſyn rouergue lande bygore ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpeke buſyneſſe portyngale lytell ſpeke mater ¶howe prince wale prince came tarbe requeſt coūteſſe armynake made prince princeſſe howe countre gaſcoyne newly agayne warre cap xxii bitwene countie foiz countre bierne lyeth coūtie bigore whiche countie ꝑteyned fraunce marcheſed coūtre tholouſin one parte countie con • uges bierne parte countie bygore lyeth ſtrong caſtell lourde whiche englyſſhe euer ſythe countie bigore yelded kyng england prince redempcion kynge iohan fraūce treatie peace made bertigny charter confyrmed calais hath ben ſhewed ye hyſtorie whan prince wale come englande kyng father bad gyuen hym herytage lande duchy acquſtayne wherin two archebiſſhoppes xxii byſſhoppes come burdea • x ryuer gyrone taken poſſeſſyōs theſe landꝭ lyen yere princeſſe deſyred erle iohan armynake wolde come countre bigore cytie tarbe ſe coū tre whiche nat ſene erle armynake thought prince princeſſe bygore erle foiz wolde come ſe wher dyd owe hym raunſome two hundred fyftie thouſande frankes thought wolde deſyre prince princeſſe requyre erle foiz forgyue hym ſame ſōme parte therof moche dyd erle armynake inſtance prince prince cāe cytie tarbe towne fayre ſtandeth playne countre amonge fayre vynes towne cytie caſtell cloſed gate walles ſeperated eche fro fro mountayns byerne catheloyne cometh fayre ryuer lyſſe whiche ronneth throughe tarbe clere fountayne fyue leages then towne morlance parteyninge erle foiz entre countie bierne vnder mountayne ſite leages fro tarbe towne panne whiche alſo ꝑteyneth ſayd erle ſame tyme prince prince tarbe therle foiz panne bylding fayre caſtell ioyninge towne without ryuer grane aſſone knewe comynge prince princeſſe beyng tarbe ordayned go ſe theym great eſtate mo ſixe hundred horſes threſcore knightes company comynge tarbe prince prī ceſſe right ioyouſe made hym good chere erle armynake lorde dalbret deſyred price requyre erle foiz forgyue therle armynake el parte ſomme florens ought haue prince wyſe ſage conſyderynge thynges thought might nat ſo ſayde sir erle armynake ye taken armes yt iourney batayle ye dyde putte coſyn erle foiz aduenture agaynſte thoughe fortune fauourable hym agaynſt valure ought nat made leſſe lyke dedes lorde father wolde nat contente ſhulde deſyred leaue haue wonne good aduenture batayle poicters wherof thanke god whan̄e erle armynake herde baſſhed fayled entente howe yet lefte nat ſo • red princeſſe good hert deſyred therle foiz gyue gyfte madame quod • le meane man therfore gyue great gyftes madame thyng ye deſyre paſſe nat valure threſcore thouſande frankes wyll gyue gladde chere yet princeſſe aſſayed agayne ſhe coude cauſe hym graunt full deſyre • rle ſage ſubtell thought verily deſyre haue hym forgyue clerely erle armynake dette ſayde agayne madame poore knight buyldeth townes caſtelles gyfte haue graunted ought ſuffyce princeſſe coude bringe hym farther whan ſhe ſawe ſhe ſaid gentyll erle foiz requeſt deſyre forgyue clerely erle armynake madame quod erle requeſt ought well condiſcend • haue ſayd deſyre paſſe nat valure threſcore thouſande frankes wolde graunt madame erle armynake oweth two hundred fyftie thouſande frankes requeſt forgaue hym therof threſcore thouſande frankes thus mater ſtode caſe erle armynake requeſt prince wan forgyueng threſcore thouſande frankes anone erle foiz returned owne countre sir iohan froiſſarde make narracion buſyneſſe bycauſe whan countie foyz bierne paſſed coūtie bygore demaunded enquered newes yt countrey ſuche knewe nat ſhewed howe prince wale aquitayne whyle tarbe great wyll go ſe caſtell lourde whiche thre leages nere entre mountayne whan well aduyſed towne caſtell coū tre prayſed greatly aſwell ſtrēgth caſtell bycauſe ſtode fronter dyuers countreis garyſone might ronne well realme arragon catellon barſelon prī ce called hym knyght houſholde great truſte loued hym entierly ſerued hym truely called ſir pyer ernalde countre bierne experte man armes coſyn erle foiz prince ſayde hym ſir ernalde inſtytue make chateleyn capitayne lourde gouernour countre bygore loke ye kepe caſtell ſe well ye make good accompte ther kyng father sir quod knyght thanke ſhall obſerue cōmaundement dyde homage prince prince put hym poſſeſſion knowen whan warre began renewe bytwene englande fraūce hath ben ſhewed erle guy ſaynt poule ſir hugh chatellon mayſter croſbowes fraunce tyme beſeged towne abuyle wan countre poitou ſame tyme two great baron bigore thone called ſir marnalte barbeſan lorde danchyn tourned frenche toke towne cytie caſtell tarbe whiche eaſely kept kynge englande ſtyll caſtell lourde handes ſir pier ernalt bierne wolde wyſe yelde vp caſtell made euer great warre agaynſt realme fraūce ſent great company aduenturers bierne gaſcoyne helpe ayde hym make warre ſo togyder many good men armes hym ſixe capitayns euery man fyftie ſpeares vnder hym firſt brother iohan bierne right expert ſquyer pier danchyne bygore brother germayne lorde danchyne wolde neuer tourne frenche nandon ſaynt colombe ermalton mount ague ſaynt baſyll bourge carnela theſe capitayns made dyuers iourneys bygore tholouſyn carcaſſene albygoiſe euer aſſone lourde lande enemyes ſomtyme wolde aduenture thyrtie leages fro holde goynge wolde take nothyng retourne nothynge coulde ſcape thē somtyme brought home ſo great plentie beeſtes priſoners wyſt nat howe kepe thus raūſomed coū trey excepte erle foiz landes landes durſte nat take chekyn withoute payed truely therfore diſpleaſed erle coulde nat longe haue endured theſe companyons lourde ranne ouer countre pleaſure rode nat farre fro theym thus cytie tarbe great doute ſo fayne make couynaunt thē bytwene tarbe lourde great vyllage good abbey called gynors lykewiſe fayne agre alſo ye parte ryuer lyſſe great towne called bagueres towne harde ſeaſon ſo haryed garyſon maluoyſen ſtandynge hylle ryuer lyſſe rynnyng vnderneth vnto walled towne called turney whiche towne lourde maluoyſen hadde euer recourſe whiche towne dyde hurte bycauſe reſorte thyder towne euer good market pyllage ſo diſſymuled euer whiche fayne elles coulde nat haue lyued ayde ſocoure perſone capitayne maluoyſen gaſcoyne name remonet de leſpe experte man armes company lourde raūſomed well marchauntes aragon catheloyne fraunce without agreed ſeaſon enterpriſed go ſe erle foiz ſe dyuerſities coū trey neuer ben whan departed fro carcaſſene lefte waye tholous wente monterorall ſo fonges bell firſt towne therle foiz maſters ſo caſtell sanredyn cāe good cytie pauyers ꝑteyning erle foiz taryed abydinge ſome company goyng countre byerne erle whan taryed thre dayes great pleaſure yt cytie deleetable ſtādyng among fayre vynes enuyroned fayre ryuer large clere called liege day ſo fortuned thyder came knyght erle foiz fro auignon warde called ſir eſpaenge de lion valyant experte man armes age l yeres ſo gate company greatly deſyrous mater fraunce ſo ſixe dayes iourney came ortayſe knyght euery day ſayd prayer mooſt parte day toke paſtyme demaundyng tidynges alſo whan demaūded thyng hym wolde anſwere purpoſe whan departed fro pauyers paſt moūt ceſſe whiche yuell paſſage ſo came towne caſtell ortayſe whiche frenche paſſed ſo came dyner caſtell • le foiz halfe leage then called carlat ſtandynge highe mountayne dyner knight ſayd ſir let v ryde toguyder fayre eaſely haue two leages ryde lodgyng ſo content knight ſaid haue day paſſed caſtell ortayſe dothe moche domage countre peter danchyn kepeth bath taken ſtollen realme frā ce threſcore thouſande frākes demaūded might ſhall ſhewe quod knight lady day auguſt euer great fayre coū tre reſorteth thyder moche marchā diſe day pier danchyn cōpanions lourde taken aduyſe determyned get towne caſtell ſo ſent two ſimple varlettꝭ ſemyng ſayd towne moneth maye get ſelfe ſome ſeruyce towne ſo dyde reteyned two maiſters dyde right dilygent ſeruyce mayſters ſo went maiſters buſyneſſe • without ſuſpeciouſnes thē ſo lady day auguſt ther many marchantes ſtrangers foiz bierne fraūce ye knowe well whan machantes mete ſawe nat togyder long wyll make good chere togyder ſo ſame houſes theſe two varlettꝭ ī ſeruice many marchantes drinkyng makyng good chere oſtes apoyntment midnight pier dāchin cōpany cāe ortaiſe enbuſſhed thē ſelfe wode whiche paſſed throughe ſo ſent ſixe varlettꝭ towne ii ladder paſſed dyke came walles reared vp ladder ii varlettes ſeruice towne dyd ayde thē mayſts ſat makyng good chere ſo theſe ſayd varlettes dyde put thē ſelfe aduenture one ſaid two varlettes brought ſixe gate within wher two men kepyng key varlet ſaid ſixe ſirs▪ kepe ſelfe priuy cloſe ſtyrre nat tyll ye whiſtle truſt make porter open gate warde haue keyes great gate therfore aſſone haue opyned warde wyll whyſtle ſteppe forthe ſlee porter knowe well ynoughe keyes gate haue oft tymes helped kepe gate maiſter deuyſed ſo dyd ſo varlet went gate ſawe herde howe porter drīkyng within warde called thē name ſaid ſirs open yor dore haue brought beſt wyne euer dranke maiſter hath ſent entent ſhulde kepe watche better knewe right well varlet beleued ſaid trouthe opyned dore whiſtled thother ſixe ſtept forthe entred dore ſlewe porter ſo priuely none knewe therof thā toke keyes went opyned ye gate let downe bridge eaſely yt none knewe therof blewe blaſt horne ſo yt enbuſſhed moūted horſes came ſpurres entred bridge come towne ſo toke men towne ſyttyng drīkyng • l beddes thus ortayſe taken pier danchin bigore cōpanyons lourde demaūded knight howe gat caſtell ſhall ſhewe ꝙ ſame tyme ortaiſe thus taken capiten caſtell yuell aduenture towne ſupped certayne marchauntes carcaſſen taken among ye next mornyng pier dāchyn brought caſtell wher wyfe chyldren made thē beleue wolde ſtrike heed wtout wife wolde delyuer vp caſtell ſhe wolde ſo ꝓmiſed delyuer huſbande quyte ſuffre hym deꝑte bagge baggage wtout hurt lady ſawe herſelfe harde caſe ſawe ſhe nat able make ware ſelfe ſauyng huſbādes lyfe ſhe yelded vp caſtell ſo huſbāde ſhe deꝑted went pauiers thus pier dāchin towne caſtell ortayſe ſame tyme entred cōpany wan aboue xxxm frākes marchandiſe priſoners frāce ſuche coūtie foiz b • erne clene delyuered wtout domage pier danchyn kept ortaiſe ſpace v yere cōpany oftymes wolde ron gatꝭ carcaſſon whiche ſixe leages then dyde great domage countre well raunſomynge townes pyllage ouer countrey meane ſeaſon pier dāchin gariſon ortaiſe night certayne cōpany went came caſtel called paiel • er good leage then wherof frenche knight called raymon du pailier owner ben ther often fayled purpoſe thā happe ſuche ſcaled caſtell toke knight lady beddes let lady child go fre kept ſtyll knight owne caſtell ſpace foure monethes laſt payed frākes raūſome fi • ally whan ſore ouerryden coūtre ſolde theſe two caſtels ortaiſe paielier thē coūtre viiim frankes went lourde prīcipall garyſon thus aduenture knightes dyd put thē ſelfe dayly alſo ſame tyme ther expert man armes ye caſtell lourde gaſcone borne called le mēgeant ſaynt baſyll tyme xxx deꝑted fro lourde rode aduenturee tho • ouſyn thought haue gote caſtell penne allugois myſt ••• ent whan ſawe fayled purpoſe cāe gate made great ſcrymiſſhe ſame proper hour ſeneſhall tholous rode forthe hym ſir hughe de froid wyll lx ſpeares came aduenture pan ſayd ſcrimyſſhe doyng incontynent ſette fote erthe came barryers ſo mengeant ouer matched ther fought valiantly hande hande woūded knight two thre place howe finally taken force men outher taken ſlayne ther fewe ſcaped mēgeant ledde tholous cōmons towne wolde haue ſlayne hym bitwene handꝭ ſeneſhall moche payne ſaue lyfe ſo brought hym caſtell ryght yuell beloued tholous yet happed ſo well hym duke berry cāe thider knyght ſuche frendes delyuered ſeneſhall thouſande frankes raūſome whan delyuered retourned lourde began agayne make newe enterpriſes ſo tyme departed fro lourde fyue hym without armoure dyde abbyt monke lyke thre monkes hym ſhauen crownes ſo euery man ſawe wende ſurely ben monkes abbit geſture came ſo well maner came mountpellyer toke vp lodgynge ſigne egle ſaid howe abbot high gaſcon goyng parys certayne buſyneſſe ꝑteyning houſe ſo gate famylier aquayntaūce ryche man towne called barēger alſo paris certayne buſyneſſe abbot ſaid howe wolde pay coſtꝭ lyſt go cōpany wherof good man right ioyouſe ſhulde haue charge borne ſo one varlet hym went forthe monke whan ryden thre leagꝭ coūterfet monke ſir mēgeant toke priſoner ledde ſecret wayes gariſon lourde dyd raūſome vm frākes ſaid ah ſaint mary mēgeant ſuche expert man arme • ▪ ye truely ſir ꝙ war dyed place wher ſhall paſſe thre dayes coūtre called layre ī bigore towne called lachmache well ſir quod ſhall remēbre therof whan come ther ſo rode tyll came mōſte que • good towne cloſed ꝑteyning therle foiz whiche armynagois labriſyēce toke ſtelthe ſeaſon kept nat thre dayes mornyng deꝑted fro mōſtequen rode towne palamuche good towne cloſed ryuer garon ꝑteyning therle foiz whan almoſt ther thought haue paſſed bridge garon haue entred towne coulde nat ye day ſo ſore rayned fro moūtayns chataloyne aragon wherby another ryuer ſo encreaſed whiche called saluz ran ſo faſt reyſed vp ryuer garon ſuche wiſe yt brake one arch bridge whiche tymbre wherfore returned agayne monteſtquen taryed day next day knight coūſayle paſſe ryuer botes towne caſſeres ſo rode thider dyd ſo moche yt paſt ryuer garon great payne ꝑell bote nat great coude nat take one tyme two horſes kepars ruled bote ſo whan ouer rode caſſeres bode daye meane tyme yt ſupper dreſſyng knight ſaid ſir iohan let v go ſe towne ſo paſſed long towne cāe gate towarde palamuche went therat came dyke knyght ſhewed pane wall ſaid ſir ſe yonder par • e wall whiche newer remnant yea ſir ꝙ i▪ well ꝙ ſhall ſhewe ſo ten yere paſt ſithe fortuned ye haue herde warre bytwene erle armynacke therle foiz howe nowe peace armynagoiſe labriſience wan lytell warre ſaynt nycholas euyn yere lorde thouſande thre hūdred threſcore two therle foiz toke batayle therle armynake lorde dalbret nephue noble men ſo ledde thē priſoners ortaiſe wherby erle foiz hath receyued ten tymes hundred thouſande frankes fortuned father erle armynake nowe lyueng called ſir iohan armynake made iourney toke towne caſſeres ii hundred men armes ſo thought kepe towne ſtrength theſe tidynges whan came knowledge erle foiz beynge tha •• e panne lyke ſage valyant knight called hym two baſtard bretherne his▪ called • arnalt guyllam ſir pier de bierne ſayd ſirs wyll ye ryde incontynent caſſ • eres ſhall ſende men euery ſyde within thre dayes ſhalbe ſelfe let none come towne ye fight thē ye ſhalbe ſtronge ynoughe whan ye come cauſe men countre bring thyder great plentie wode buſſhes fagottꝭ choke gate therwith wtout make ſtronge barryers wyll yt within ſo encloſed iſſue nat gares ſhall cauſe take another way theſe two knightes dyd cōmaū dement ſo wente palamuche men warre bierne folowed ſo came towne caſſeres within ſette lytell nat howe encloſed within towne ſo coulde nat iſſue oute gate thirde day erle foiz came thider fyue hūdred men armes ſone came cauſed barryers made rounde towne alſo barrier roūde hoſt bycauſe ſhulde nat troubled night tyme ſo caſe laye longe without aſſaut ſo moche vitayle began fayle within thoughe wyne great plentie nothyng eate coulde nat flye awaye ryuer than̄e depe thought better yelde thē ſelfe priſoners dye ſo ſhamefully famyne ſo fell treaty therle foiz agreed treatie ſo ſhulde nat iſſue oute gate make hole wall go therat come one one without armoure ſo yelde priſoners behoued thē take waye ſo made hole ye wall iſſued oute one one erle redy people order batayle receyue priſoners euer came erle ſent dyuers caſtelles priſoners coſyn ſir iohn̄ armynake ſir bernarde dalbret ſir manalt barlabaſon ſir raymōde de benache ſir benedicke de la corneyle twentie beſte perſonages ledde hym ortaiſe departed two hundred thouſande trāke • thus hole wall made wente ſupper nexte day rode longe ryuer garon paſſed palamuche entred lande erle comynges armynake ſyde ryuer garon lande therle foiz rode knight ſhewed ſtronge towne called marteras touſſa • ꝑteyninge therle comynges ſyde ryuer moūtayne ſhewed two caſtelles parteyninge erle foiz one called mountarall mountclare rode bytwene theſe townes caſtelles longe ryuer garon fayre medowe knight ſayd ſir iohan haue ſene many fayre ſcrimyſſhes encountrynges bytwene foizois armynakes towne caſtell well furnyſſhed men warre ſo warred eche vpon armynakes agaynſt yonder two caſtelles made baſtyde kept men warre dyde moche hurt erle foiz lande ſhall ſhewe howe fortuned erle foiz night ſent brother peter de bierne two hūdred ſperes four hundred villayns countre charged fagottꝭ moche wode buſſhes brought baſtide ſette fyre theron ſo brent baſtyde within without mercy ſithe neuer made agayne ſuche deuyſes rode day longe ryuer garon one ſyde ſawe many fayre caſtelles fortreſſes lyfte hande parteyned therle foiz ſyde parteyned therle armynake ſo thus paſſed montpeſac fayre caſtell ſtrōge ſtandyng highe rocke vnderneth towne highe way without towne lytell place called ala gardea towre bitwene rocke ryuer whiche towre gate portcolyſe yron ſixe men might well kepe paſſage agaynſt worlde coulde man paſſe two front towre one ſyde ryuer ſyde ſayd knyght ſir ſtronge paſſage myghtie countre true quod knight though thentre ſtronge yet erle foiz dyde conquere one paſſed ſame waye helpe archer englāde company great deſyre paſſe countre come ryde nere ſir quod ſhall ſhewe howe ſo rode iuſte hym • ſayd sir tyme erle armynake lorde dalbret fyue hūdred men warre cāe countre foiz march pauyers begynnynge auguſt whan men dyd gather cornes ye grape rype whiche tyme great habundaunce countre ſir iohan armynake company lodged towne sauredun lytell leage fro cytie pauyers ſente pauyers without wolde bye cornes wynes pay ſaid el wolde brinne diſtroy togyder pauiers great feare erle lorde farre fro byerne ſo fayne bye owne cornes payed fyue thouſande frankes deſyred fyftene dayes reſpyte whiche graūted erle foiz enformed būſyneſſe haſted hym moche might aſſembled toguyder men came ſodaynly cytie pauyers xii hundred ſpeares ſo fought ſir iohan armynake taryed departed wente countie comynges money pauyers leyſar tarye therfore therle foiz claymed ſame ſome ſayd come ſaued money corne put awaye ennemyes ſo paye men warre therewith taryed tyll inned corne vyntage ſo paſſed foreby caſtell called bretytte alſo another caſtell called bacelles parteyninge erle comynges rode long ryuer ſawe fayre caſtell great towne demaunded knight caſtell called ſaid named monteſplayne parteyninge coſyn erle foiz called ſir roger deſpaygne great barone countre tholouſyn ſeneſhall carcaſſoney demaunded knight kynne ſir charles spayne conſtable fraunce anſwered ſayde nat blode ſir loyes spaygne ſir charles ye ſpeke • came bothe realme spayne lynially extraught ſpayne fraunce mother ſyde coſyn germayns kynge alphons spaygne ſerued youthe ſir loyes spaygne warres bretaygne alwayes partie ſir charles bloyes agaynſt erle moūtforde ſo lefte ſpckynge matter rode ſaynte gouffens good towne erle foiz next day dyned monreyle good ſtronge towne frenche kynges ſir roger de spaygne kepte dyner rode waye towardes lourde ſo rode throughe great launde endurynge fyftene leages called laundes lann • de vous wherin many daungerous paſſages theues yuell doer launde ſtode caſtell meſere parteyninge erle foiz good leage fro towne tourney whiche caſtell knyght ſhewed ſayd sir beholde yonder maluoyſen ſir haue ye herde howe duke aniou whan countrey wente lourde dyde countre howe layde ſiege lourde wanne alſo caſtell gryngalet ryuer ſide ye ſe yonder v parteyneth lorde de la batte remembred ſelfe ſaid sir trowe neuer herde therof yet therfore pray • ſhewe mater ſir praye ſhewe ryuer garon become ſe ye ſay trouthe quod knight departeth thentryng theſe mountayns groweth cometh foūtayne thre leages hen way chatelomy caſtell called ſaynt beart fronter realme fraunce towarde aragon nowe ſquyer called ermalton otherwyſe called bourge de spaygne lorde therof • hatelayne coū trey coſyn germayne ſir roger de spayne ſe hym ſhall ſhewe goodly perſone good man armes hath done domage theym lourde knyght ſquyer countre erle foiz loueth ryghtwell companyon armes ¶i wyll leaue ſpeke hym thynke feeſt chriſtmas ye ſhall ſe erle foiz houſe nowe ſhall ſhewe duke aniou howe came countre dyde rode forthe fayre eaſely began ſaye foloweth ⸪ ¶of warr ꝭ duke •• u made agaynſt englyſſhmen howe recouered caſtell maluoyſen bigore whiche afterwarde gyuen therle foiz cap xxiii ⸪ ⸫ begynnynge warres whan̄e began wynne englyſſhe men helde acquitayne ſir olyuer ¶leſquyn become frēche ledde ye duke aniou bretaygne landes ſir robert canoll▪ ſege dyriuall ye haue herde thynke treatie ſix hughe br • ce coſyn made duke antou rēdre caſtell delyuer good hoſtages ſo duke aniou ſhulde nat cōe reyſe ſiege whan ſir robert canoll within caſtell dyriuall wolde holde tretie true ſir quod well quod haue herde ſcrimyſſhe caſtell • ſir ol • uer de cleſquyn wounded sir nat tell quod nat remembre wherfore ſir praye ſhewe ſcrimyſſhe ſiege came therof paraduentureye knowe ſome wayes ye ſhall retourne agayne well ynoughe purpoſe lourde maluoyſen true quod knyght ſo ſir garſes caſtella right valyaunt knight countre good frenche wente duke aniou cauſe hym come beauuoſyn duke made ſommons holde iourney dyriuall made ſir garſes valyantneſſe marſhall hoſt▪ true herde ſay yt whā ſawe ſir robert canoll wolde nat kepe tr • atie made wolde nat delyuer caſtell dyriuall came duke ſayd sir ſhall theſe hoſtages faulte caſtell nat gyuen vp great pytie ſhulde dye gē tylmen haue deſerued dethe duke ſaid good delyuer yea truely ſir quod knyght great • ytie otherwyſe well quod duke therin ye lyſte ſir garſes went delyuer wente ſir olyuer cleſquyn mette demaunded wheder went fro whens came come fro lorde duke aniou goynge delyuer hoſtages delyuer quod ſir olyuer abyde lytell retourne agayne duke ſo cāe duke lodgynge great ſtudy ſir olyuer ſaluted hym ſaid sir entent shall nat theſe hoſtages ſuffre deth faythe ſhall diſpyte ser robert canoll ſir byrre hath falſed faithe wherfore ser wyll ye knowe wtout dye ſhall weare armure hole yere none yor watres ſhulde ſcape thus good chep • ſiege hath coſte threſcore
