frankes newe wyll ſhewe grace enemy • epeth nother faythe trouthe thoſe wordes duke began chafe ſayd▪ ſir olyuer therin ye thynke beſt quod ſir olyuer wyll leſe lyues good cauſe ſithe kepe nat ꝓmyſe ſir olyuer departed fro duke came place caſtell ſir garſes durſt nat ſpeke one worde ſhulde haue loſt labour ſith ſir olyuer taken hym enterpriſe called hangman made hym ſtryke heedes two knyghtes two ſquyers whiche great pytie mo two hundred ho • ſt wepte incontynent ſir robert canoll opyned poſterne gate brimme dyke diſpyte frenche men cauſed ſtryke heedes priſoners without reſpyte incentynent opyned caſtell gate lette downe bridge iſſued 〈◊〉 barryers ſcrymyſſhed frenche men ſir garſes ſhewed ſore ſcrimyſſhe ſir olyuer cl • ſquyn hurt ſo returned lodgyng thre good men armes two ſquyers countrey b • erne bettram de baruge eualton de payne bothe ſore hurt next day duke diſlodged went fro dyryuall tholous entente diſtroye lourde tholous cōplayned greatly garyſon lourde ¶so duke went firſt layd ſiege maluoyſen whiche maye ſe yonder v duke company vi • thouſande men warre beſyde geneuoys cōmons good townes capitayne maluoyſen ſquyer gaſcoyne called raymonde de leſp • experte man armes euery day barrier ſcrimyſſhes goodly feates armes done duke laye yonder fayre medowes bytwene towne turney caſtell ryuer ſyde lyſſe ſiege enduryng ſir garſes marſhall thooſt went fyue hundred men armes two hundred archer croſbowes two thouſande cōmons layd ſiege caſtell trygalet whiche haue lefte hynde v whiche caſtell ſquyer gaſcoyne kepte lorde de la barde coſyn called baſtot manlyon within caſtella xl companyons dyd countre ſuche mayſtries none coude go waye taken priſoners without pylgrimes wente ſaynt iames ayde nother fortreſſe called nemeluz theſe two garyſons robber pyllers coū tre aſſembled euer agaynſt erle foiz alſo agaynſt erle army nake wherfore cared nat though duke aniou came coūtre whan ſir garſes come caſtell trygalet coulde nat approche one parte ryuer ſo gaue great aſſaute many men hurte bothe within without ſhot fyue dayes togyder ſir garſes made aſſautes ſo laſte artillary within began fayle frēche men ꝑceyued well gentylneſſe ſir garſes cauſed capitayne come ſpeke vnder ſaue conducte ſayd hym baſtot knowe well caſe ye ye haue artillary within nothyng defende fro ſante ſpeares knowe trouthe ye taken force nat ſaue lyfe none youre company cōmons countre wyll ſlee wolde lothe ſe ye coſyn therfore coū ſayle yelde vp fortreſſe ſythe yt deſyre ſo ye beare blame ſo doyng departe hen wheder ye lyſte ye haue kepte caſtell long ynough sir quod ſquyer wolde gladly folowe coūſayle dedes armes dede coſyn ſir nat yelde vp fortreſſe alone ſuche within haue good parte therof haue though holde capitayne sir ſhall go ſhewe ye haue ſaid accorde rendre vp ſhall nat ſay nay wyll kepe ſtyll whatſoeuer aduēture fall ſhall take ſuche parte well ſaid quod ſir garſes deꝑte whan ye wyll knowe entent baſtot manlyon retourned caſtell trygalet called company toguyder ther ſhewed ſayeng ſir garſes ſo demaunded thought beſt ſo counſayled toguyder longe ſpace ſome wolde abyde aduenture ſayd howe ſtronge ynough ſome wolde departe ſaid howe good tyme ſo ſeynge artillary ſawe well howe duke aniou cruell cōmons thoulous carcaſſon • townes ſore diſpleaſed great domages done thē thynges conſydred concluded yelde vp caſtell ſo might ſafely conducted caſtell culyer whiche kepte ſome companyons fronter tholouſin thus capitayne retourned agayne hoſt ſpeke ſir garſes agreed deſyres ſawe well caſtell wolde nat lightely wonne aſſaute without loſſe moche people prepared departe truſſed baggage moche pyllage toke beſt lefte reſydue ſit garſes conueyed thē culyer without daunger thus frenche men tyme gate caſtell trygalette ſir garſes dyd gyue caſtell cō men countre dyd raſe downe ye ſe ſo neuer none ſithe wolde reedify agayne ſo fro then ſit garſes wente towarde caſtell nantylleur ſtandyng theſe laundes nere caſtell lameu wente thyderwarde one ſhewed hym yt caſtell nantylleur voyde departed kepte than̄e ſir garſes taryed ſelde deuyſed beſt ſeneſhall beſen ſayd ſir caſtell nantylleur bayliwyke ought parteyne erle foiz praye let haue ſhall make ſo kepte proper coſte charge man wyll hurte contrarye ſhall neuer entre therin sir quod tholous ſayeth well valyant man better another well quod ſir garſes content thus caſtell nātylleur delyuered ſeneſchall nobeſen incontynent rode thyder founde clene voyde newly fortifyed broken heſet therin capitayne ſquyer countre called fortefey ſaynt poule retourned ſiege maluoyſen ye duke alſo thyder come ſir garſes company ſhewed duke done ſiege endured vi wekes nighe euery day ſcrimyſſhinge barryers laſte withoute ſtopped water ſo ſeſterns began drie ſixe wekes fell nat droppe rayne ſeaſon ſo drie hote wt eaſe ynoughe reaſon fayre ryuer whan wtin ſawe caſe ſore abaſſhed ſawe well coude nat long endure wyne hadde plentie freſſhe water fayled than̄e aduyſed fall treatie duke ſo dyde raymonde de leſpee purchaſed ſaue conduct go hooſt ſpeke duke ſo dyd ſayd sir ye wyll courteſſe company ſhall render youre handes caſtell maluoyſen curteſy wolde ye quod duke ſhulde ſhewe departe waye owne coū treis entre nat fortereſſe holdeth agaynſt v ye get ſhall delyuer ioſelyn ſhall make beerdes without raſoure sir quod raymonde ſhall deꝑte ſhall haue v bagges baggage haue wonne armes great aduenture duke ſtudyed lytell ſayd content ye bere moche ye may beare male ſomers none otherwiſe ye haue priſoners ye delyuer v cō tent ꝙ raymonde thus within deꝑted yelded vp caſtell duke anto raymonde de leſpe tourned came frenche ſerued duke aniowe longe tyme went italy dyed aſcrimyſſhe naples whan duke aniou duke sauoy made voyage howe gariſon caſtell lourde caſt downe diſconfyted great dilygence erle foiz made cap xxiiii thus quod knight duke aniou gatte caſtell maluoyſen wherof great ioye made kepte knyght bygore called ſir cyquart luperier gaue erle foiz kepeth yet wyll longe lyueth hath made capitayne knyght bygore one owne lynage called ſir raymon de lane whan duke aniou poſſeſſyon maluoyſen delyuered countrey fro englyſſhmen fro pyllers conntre wente layd ſeige caſtell lourde therle foiz douted greatly duke aniou bycauſe cam ſo nere hym wyſte nat entended therle foiz aſſembled togyder knightes ſquyers ſent thē aboute dyuers garyſons ſette brother ſir arnolde guyllame towne morlens two hundred ſpeares towne panne ſir peter cabeſton cite leſtrade two hundred ſpeares ſir monant nōnalles went towne hart let hundred ſpeares arnolde gehe rell towne montgeberell hū dred ſpeares ſit foulquant dortery towne sanetere hundred ſpeares eſpaygne lyon ſente mount marſon two hundred ſpeares caſtell bierne well prouyded men warre erle himſelfe laye ſtyll caſtell ortayſe florens ſir quod hath ſo great plentie florens ſir quod houre thynke hath well nōbre xxx tymes hundred thouſande lorde lyuenge ſo large lyberall gyueng gyftes demaunded hym maner people ſo lyberall anſwered ſaid ſtraungers knightes ſquyers comyng countre haraldes mynſtrels euery man ſpeketh hym none departeth fro without ſome reward refuſe gyfte nat content ſaynt mary ſir ꝙ entent kepeth ſo moche money wher dothe get renenues ſo great gader toguyder ſuche treaſure ſir wolde gladly knowe pleaſed well ſir ꝙ knight ye ſhall know ye haue demaū ded metwo thynges firſt ye haue demaū ded entent kepeth ſuche treaſure ſhall ſhewe therle foiz alway douteth warre therle arminake alſo buſyneſſe neighbour frenche kyng kynge englande wolde nat wyllingly diſpleaſe hath alwayes diſſymuled bytwene duryng wary ſeaſon vnto preſent tyme neuer armed hym ſelfe party hath alwayes euer good caſe bothe party ſaye ſo ye ſhall ſaye youreſelfe whan̄e ye haue one knowlege hym herde ſpeke one knowe order ſtate houſe ye ſhall ſe daye mooſt ſage prince worlde none ſo great lorde nother frenche kyng kyng englande yt wyll wyllingly haue yuell wyll neighbour kyng arragon kyng nauer eſtemeth lytell wyll fynde mo men armes reaſon ſuche frendes hath gote wt giftes money hath treaſure bothe thoſe kynges haue herde hym ſaye whan kyng cyper countre byerne moued haue gone voiage holy sepulture hadde thought ſame tyme haue made ſuche iourney frenche kyng kyng englande taken enterpriſe howe ther ſhulde haue ben lorde ſhulde haue brought ſuche company wolde haue done yet ſame mynde parte one cauſes gadereth ſuche treaſure prince wale ſeaſon raigned countre acquitayne beyng burdeux ryuer geronde thought haue made hym warre prince manaſſyde coūtre bierne wolde haue hym haue holde coū tre hym erle ſayd wolde nat ſayd howe countre bierne ſo free lande ought homage man worlde prince tyme great ſore feared ſaid howe wolde compell hym ꝑforce therle armynake lorde dalbret loued nat therle foiz bycauſe ſuche victory hadde tytled prince euer eare entyſed hym haue made warre agaynſt erle foiz voiage prince made spayne brake purpoſe alſo ſir iohn̄ chandos chefe coū ſayle prince agaynſt prince ſhulde make watre erle erle foiz loued right well ſir iohan chandos hym erle douted prince bycauſe fierſe coragious therfore gadered togyder moche treaſure coude gette thentent therwith defende hym nede ſo ſet great tayles tax coūtre euery towne whiche yet endureth ſhall long lyueth euery fyre euery yere two frā kes ryche beare poore therby gadered yet dothe great rich people payeth marueylous good wyll reaſon therof nother englyſſhe frenche robber reyuers yt dothe hurte value one pēny ſo countre ſauegarde iuſtice truely kepte doyng iuſtyce right cruell mooſt rightfull lorde yt nowe lyueng ſo theſe wordes came towne turney ſhulde reſt night knight ſeaſed talkyng remembred well lefte agaynſt next day lodged ſigne starre toke eaſe ſupper tyme capitayne maluoyſin called ſir raymonde lane came ſe v ſupped v brought hym four flaggons beſt wyne drāke iourney thoſe two knightes talked long togider whan late knight departed retourned caſtell maluoyſin next mornyng mounted horſes departed fro tourney paſſed gyde ryuer lyſſe rode towarde cytie tarbe entred bigore lefte waye lourde bagueres caſtell mountgaylliard lyfte hande rode towarde vyllage called teracimytat dyd cooſt came wode lande lorde barbaſan came nere caſtell called matheras entre countre layre knight ſaid sir iohan beholde place layre beholde well aduyſe coū tre ſemed right ſtrāge thought ſelfe loſt ther nat ben company knight remēbred wordes knight ſhewed ii thre dayes countre layre mēgeant lourde ſayd hym sir ye ſhewed laſt daye whan ſhulde coūtre layre ye wolde ſhewe maner mēgeant lourde howe dyed true ſir ꝙ knyght come ryde ſhall ſhewe rode nere hym wordes ſayde sir ſeaſon peter danchyne helde caſtell caſtell ortyngas haue ſhewed tyme gariſon lourde ſōtyme rode forthe aduenture farre fro garyſon howe nat alwayes aduauntage ye maye beholde caſtell barbaſon caſtell martheras wherin alwayes many men warre garyſons bagueces tourney mountgalyarde salenges benache gorre tarbe frenche townes garyſons whan theſe garyſons knewe lourde rode outher towardes tholous carcaſſone thā wolde laye buſſhementes ſomtyme take fro lourde praye pyllage ſomtyme ſcaped without rencounter tyme fortuned eruaulton ſaynt colombe mengeant ſaynte cornyle nombre ſixſcore ſpeares good men warre departed fro lourde moūtayns bytwene theſe two ryuers lyſſe leſſe ſo rode nere tholous retournyng founde medowes great nombre beeſtes ox keen hogges mottons lambes alſo toke dyuers good men countre priſoners ſo droue pray ſhewed capitayne tarbe ſquyer gaſcoyne called erualton byſette experte man armes howe garyſon lourde abrode comyng homewarde great praye ſente lorde benache engueroſe eldeſt ſonne ſir raymonde alſo lorde barbaſon certifyeng howe wolde ryde agaynſt theym lourde knyghtes ſquyers countrey bigore agreed ryde forthe aſſembled guyder tourney ther bourcke spaygne came fro garyſon ſaynt bearte nombre two hundred ſpeares ſpyes abrode countrey knowe lourde dyde ſyde lourd abrode ſpies knowe men warre abrode lette enterpriſe ſo moche dyde theſe yt eyther partie knewe dyde whan̄e lourde knewe howe frenche garyſons abrode taryed tourney doute toke coūſayle might beſt ſaue pray determyned departe company two one company driue praye varlettꝭ go couertly lane bourge ſo paſſe waye bridge tourney paſſe ryuer leſſe bytwene tourney lymoſyn company ryde batayle mountayns make ſhewe go agayne countre layre martheras ſo fall bytwene barbaſon mountgalyarde ſayd mete toguyder mountgaylliarde ſhulde ſauegarde ſhall ſoone lourde thus ordayned ſo dyde baſtarde caruyllacke guyllonet harmyes perot burcyer iohn̄ calleuyn baſile reed ſquier fourtie ſpeares varlettꝭ pray toke waye lane burge ſo paſſe ryuer bridge bitwene tourney maluoyſin thynkynge mete togyder bytwene eynitat moūtgaylyarde ſo departed cō pany erualton reſtue erualton ſaīt colombe mēgeant ſaynt coruyle fourſcore men armes nat x varlettes among made thē ſelf redy rode cloſe toguyder euer lokyng enemyes knewe well abrode watche lyke maner lourde taken aduiſe coū ſayle howe retourne lykewiſe frenche men tooke counſayle howe might encounter enemyes ſir monant barbaſan erualton byſſet ſayd companye sir knowe well howe lourde abrode feldes driueth great praye many priſoners ſhulde great dyſpleaſure v ſhulde ſcape therfore lette v put ſelfe two buſſhementes company ynough ſo ordayned erualton bourge spayne ſir raymonde benache anguerot lane hundred ſperes ſhulde kepe paſſage tourney knewe well lourd praye muſt nedes paſſe ryuer lyſſe ordayned lorde barbaſone erualton byſet hundred ſpeares ſhulde ryde aduentures deꝑted lorde benache bourge spaygne put ſelfe buſſhment bytwene maluoyſin turney company rode toke ſame waye nowe called layre mette thē lourde whan eche ſawe lyghted made redy fyght ſo came eche agaynſt cryeng cryes ſaynt george lourd lady bigore ſo eche came hande ſtrokes foyninge ſpeares eche great ſpace herde reported ther firſt brunt none ouerthrowen ſo whan eche thē great ſpace foyned eche caſte downe ſpeares toke ax gaue therwith eche great horrible ſtrokes euery man matche maner fought toguyder two houres whan fought ſo long lacked brethe wolde fayre eaſely departe go ſytte downe dyke ſyde full water put baſſenettes refreſſhe ſelfe whan well refreſſhed putte baſſenetes retourned agayne fight beleue nat ſuche buſyneſſe batayle ſo well fought ſithe batayle yt bretayne xxx agaynſt many martheras bigore thus fought hande hande erualton ſaynt colombe poynt haue ben diſconfyted aſquyer countre called guyllonet salynges erualton ſaint colombe varlet ſtode ſawe batayle fought nat ther none ſayd thyng hym whan ſawe maiſter almoſt vttraunce ſorie ſo came maiſter tooke axe handes ſayd erualton go waye reſt ye lengar fight axe wente ſquyer gaue ſuche ſtroke heed aſtonied nere hande fallen erthe whan̄e guyllonet felte hym ſelfe ſtryken ſore diſpleaſed came agaynſt varlet haue ſtryken hym varlet ſtepte vnder ſtroke enbraſed ſquyer ſore traueyled ſo long fightyng ſo varlet ouerthrewe hym wreſtlyng vnder hym thā varlet ſayde ſhall ſlee without thou wylte yelde thy ſelfe maiſter thy mayſter quod ſquyer erualton ſaynt colombe quod varlette whome thou haſte fought ſeaſon ſquyer ſawe nat vauntage vnder varlette daggar redy ſtryke hym yelded hym rendre body priſoner lourde within fyftene dayes reſcues reſcues ſeruyce dyd varlet maiſter ſir iohn̄ aſſure ther many feates armes done many ouerthrowen taken priſoners ſome yelde ſelfe certayne ſpace tarbe ſome come lourde fought day hande hande erualton ſet mengeant ſaynt baſyll dyde many feate armes bytwene thē fought ſo long till ſo wery coude ayde ſelfe lengar ther ſlayne place two capitayns mē geant lourde parte erualton byſſet ceaſed batayle agrement bothe party ſo wery coude ſcante holde ax handes vnarmed refreſſhe thē ſelfe lefte armure place lourde bare awaye mengeant ſlayne frenche men bare erualton byſſet tarbe thentent batayle ſhulde remembraunce wher two ſquyers fought ſet croſſe ſtone beholde yonder croſſe thoſe wordes came croſſe ſayd ſoules pater noſter aue maria faythe ſir quod gladde haue herde ſharpe buſyneſſe ſo lytell people ſir became wente praye ſhall ſhewe quod came ꝑte tourney beſyde maluoyſin haue paſſed ordayned ther founde buſſhment bourge spaygne brake buſſhment lourde coude nat recule backe remedy aduēture ſelfe tell trouthe ſore fight long endured lengar martheras erualton spayne dyde marueylous armes axe hande ſoeuer ſtrake therwith went erth bygge well made nat ouer charged moche fleſſhe toke ther owne handes two capitayns burge coruyle perot palatyne bierne ſlayne ſquier nauar called ferādo myrando expert man armes ſome buſyneſſe ſayd bourge spaygne ſlewe hym ſome ſayd ouercome heat harneſſe finally praye reſcewed taken ſlayne wente therwith ther thre ſaued ſelfe varlettes • departed wente ouer ryuer lyſſe thus became aduenture lourde neuer loſte ſo moche dyde courteſly raunſomed dyuers delyuered exchaunge one nother dyuers fought place layre taken thē lourd therfore euery parte courteyſe one another raunſomyng companyons ah ſaynt mary ſir quod bourge spaygne ſo bygge man ye ſpeke yea ſir truely quod gaſcoyne none lyke hym ſtrength body therfore erle foiz hath hym euer company paſte nat thre yere dyde ſporte great dede ſhall ſhewe chriſtmas day erle foiz helde great feeſt plentifull knightes ſquyers vſage colde day erle dyned hall hym great company lordes dyner deꝑted hall wente vp galarye xxiiii ſtayres heyght whiche galarye ther great chymney wherin made fyre whan therle ther tyme ſmall fyre erle loued great fyre hadde woode ynoughe bierne wode ynoughe ſame daye great froſt colde whan erle galarye ſawe fyre ſo lytell ſayde knightes ſquiers hym sir ſmall fyre day ſo colde erualton spayne went downe ſtayres beneth courte ſawe great meny aſſes laden woode ſerue houſe wente toke one gretteſt aſſes woode layde hym backe went vp ſtayres galary dyde caſt downe aſſe woode chymney aſſes fete vpwarde wherof erle foiz great ioye ſo hadde marueyle ſtrength howe alone came vp ſtayres aſſe woode necke toke great pleaſure tale knyght ſir eſpaygne de leon ſhewed wherby thought iourney moche ſhorter ſhewyng theſe mater paſſed paſe layre caſtell martheras batayle ſo rode nere caſtell barbaſon whiche ſtronge fayre within leage tarbe whiche ſawe v fayre waye coſtyng ryuer lyſſe comyng fro mountayns rode fayre eaſely leyſar refreſſhe horſes ſhewed ryuer caſtell towne mountgalyarde waye laye lourde than̄e came remembraunce demaunde knight howe duke aniou whan countrey caſtell maluoyſin yelded hī came lourde dyd right good wyll ſhewed ſaid whanne duke aniowe departed frome maluoyſin withall hoſt paſſed ouer ryuer lyſſe bridge tourney wente lodged baguiers good ryuer goynge tarbe ryuer tourney cometh nat thyder falleth ryuer garon beſyde moūtunllyon ſo duke went layd ſiege lourde ſir peter erualton bierne iohan brother peter danchyn erualton reſtue erualton ſaynt colombe mengeant lyueng ferando myrando olyuer barbe burge coruyllacke burge canuſe certayne cōpanions beyng within lourde whan well enfourmed duke comynge thyder fortifyed garyſon agaynſt hym helde towne lourde ſautes duke made whiche fyftene dayes contynually endured many feates armes done duke ordayned many inſtrumentes warre ſaute ſo finally towne wonne loſte neyther man woman good withdrawen caſtell knewe well length towne wolde nat holde cloſed dyke pale whan towne lourde frenche men great ioye ſo lodged towne roūde caſtell whiche nat prignable without long ſiege duke taryed ſixe wekes loſt wanne without coulde hurte within caſtell ſtandeth rounde rocke made ſuche maner man coude aproche ſcalynge wyſe one entre barryers many ſcrimyſſhes many feates armes done dyuers knightes ſquyers fraunce hurte ſuche wolde preſe nere whan duke ſawe howe coude nat haue entent gette caſtell lourde fell treatie capitayne within offred moche money gyue vp garyſon knight great valyanteſſe excuſed hymſelfe ſaid howe garyſon nat parteyned herytage kynge englande ſayd howe coude nat ſell gyue putte awaye without ſhulde tray tour whiche wyſe wolde trewe naturall lorde durynge lyfe moreouer ſayd whan caſtell delyuered hym condycion whiche ſware ſolempnely faythe prince wale hande yt ſhulde kepe caſtell lourde agaynſt men durynge lyfe excepte agaynſt kyng englande duke coude neuer haue anſwere hym gyfte promyſe coulde make whan duke aniou coūſaile ſawe howe coude haue nothynge el ſawe loſte payne diſlodged departynge clene brent towne duke aniowe drewe backe cooſtynge bierne rode towarde mount marſen knowledge howe erle foiz fortifyed garyſons men warre wherof nothyng dyſcontent diſpleaſed knyghtꝭ ſquyers bierne helde lourde agaynſt hym erle foyz haue ſhewed doughted greatly duke aniowe thoughe duke dyde hym hurte erle arminake lorde dalbret wolde haue duke haue made hym warre duke wyll whyle lodged bytwene mounte marſen boce dalbret ſent erle ortaiſe ſir peter beule erle receyued honorably lodged hym caſtell ortaiſe made hym good chere coude gaue hym mulettes courſers men great gyftes ſente hym duke aniowe foure courſers two allans spaygne fayre good ſecrete treaty bytwene erle ſir peter beule whiche treaty man knewe entent therof good ſpace ſuche euydent token appered ſuppoſed ſomewhat mater ſhall ſhewe tyme ſhall come tarbe anone duke aniou made voyage tholous erle foiz ſende letter certayne meſſangers lourde coſyn ſir peter erualton bierne deſyring hym come ſpeke hym ortayſe whan knyght reed therles letter ſawe notable meſſage dyuers ymaginacions wyſt nat wheder might go abyde thynges conſydred ſayd wolde go bycauſe wyſe wolde diſpleaſe erle whan departed fro lourde ſayd iohan bierne brother preſens companyons garyſon brother iohan erle foyz hath ſente nat tell ſythe pleaſure ſpeke wyll go hym feare greatly ſhalbe requyred gyue vp fortreſſe lourde duke aniou whan countrey coſted bierne entred nat therin erle foyz hath longe entended haue caſtell maluoyſin entent lorde lanede bourge fronters comynges bigore knowe nat treatie ther made bytwene hym duke aniou one thynge ſaye playnly longe lyue ſhall neuer yelde vp garyſon myne owne naturall lorde kyng englā de wherfore brother iohan caſe ſtablyſſhe myne abſence capitayne ye ſhall ſwere faythe gentylneſſe ye ſhall kepe caſtell lyke maner fourme lyfe dethe ye fayle nat iohan byerne ſware fulfyll deſyre ſir peter erualton wente ortayſe lyghted ſigne moone whan thought tyme wente caſtell ortayſe therle great ioye receyued hym made hym ſyt borde ſhewed great ſemblant loue coude dyner ſaid coſyn peter haue ſpeke wt dyuers thyngꝭ wherfore wyll ye departe nat without leaue knight ſwered ſayd ſir ſhall nat departe tyll pleaſur thirde day erle foiz ſaid vnto hym preſens vycount gouſſerant brother lorde dāchyn bigore dyuers knightes ſquyers erle ſayd loude yt euery man might hym peter ſende ye become wyll ye knowe duke aniou wolde moche yuell bycauſe gariſon lourde whiche ye kepe whiche cauſe lande nere hāde ouerron good frendes nat opynion dyuers company hateth bicauſe ſay howe maynteyne ſuſtayne yon bycauſe ye byerne nat mete haue yuell wyll ſo great prince duke aniowe wherfore cōmaunde ye wyll eſchewe diſpleaſure faythe lignage ye owe ye yelde vp garyſon lourde handes whan knyght herde theſe wordes ſore abaſſhed ſtudyed lytell remembringe aunſwere might make ſawe well erle ſpake good faithe howe thynges conſydred ſayd sir true owne faythe homage poore knyght yo • blode countrey caſtell lourde wyll nat delyuer ye haue ſent ye lyſt holde kyng englande ſette none lyueng wyll delyuer whan erle foyz herde anſwere blode chafed yre ſayd drawyng daggar treatour ſayeſt thou nay heed thou haſt nat ſayd nought ſo therwith ſtrake knight wounded hym fyue place knyght barone yt durſt ſteppe bytwene knyght ſayd ah ſit ye gentylneſſe ſende ſlee yet ſtrokes daggar therle cōmaūded caſt priſon downe depe dyke ſo ther dyed woundꝭ yuell loked vnto ah ſaynt mary quod knyght nat great crueltie whatſoeuer ꝙ knyght thus lette one aduyſe hym well diſpleaſe angry pardon helde one coſyn germayne vicoūt chateau bein heryter eight monethes towre ortaiſe priſon raū ſomed fourtie thouſande frankes ſir quod hath erle foyz chyldren truely ſir quod wyfe hath two yonge knightes yt baſtardes ye ſhall ſe loueth well hym ſelfe called ſir iohan ſir gracyen demaunded yf euer maryed yea truely quod yet wyfe nat hym ſir wher ſhe sir quod ſhe nauar kyng coſyn ſhe doughter kynge loyes nauar yet demaunded euer erle chyldren yes ſir ꝙ fayre ſonne father harte countrey loued hym hym countre biern reſt peace hath ben ſith debate ſtryfe maryed ſuſter therle armynake sir quod became ſonne maye knowen sir ꝙ ſhall ſhewe nat nowe mater ouer longe nere towne ye ſe therwith left knight peace ſo came tarbe toke oure lodgynge starre taryed day towne great eaſement bothe man horſe good hay otes fayre ryuer nexte day maſſe mounted horſbacke departed fro tarbe came towne called iorre whiche valyantlye alwayes helde agaynſt lourde ſo paſſed towne withoute entred countrey bierne knight ſtode ſtyll ſayd sir beholde bierne ſtode croſſe waye knight aduyſed bym whiche waye take outher morlens panne laſte toke way morlens ridynge ouer laūdes bierne whiche right playne thafie demaunded hym towne panne nere v ſayde yes ſo ſhewed ſteple howe diſtaūce farther ſemed anyuel way ryde bycauſe myres thē knewe nat countre nat farre then caſtell lourde demaunded capitayne ſayd ſeneſchall bigore capitayne admytted kynge englande brother ser peter bierne ye haue herde trewe ſir quod dyde neuer go ſe erle foiz anſwered ſayd sithe dethe brother neuer came company hath ben often erle peter dauchyn erualton reſtue erualton ſaynt colome sir quod hath erle foiz made amendes dethe knight ſorie dethe yes truely ſir quod right ſorie dethe amendes knowe none without ſecrete penaū ce maſſes prayer hathe hym ſame knightes ſonne called iohan byerne gracyous ſquyer erle loueth hym right well ah ſir quod duke aniowe wolde ſo fayne haue caſtell lourde ought well content erle foyz whan ſlewe ſuche knight owne coſyn accomplyſſhe deſyre faythe ſir quod ſo anone duke came frenche kyng kynge ſent countre ſir roger spaygne preſydent parlyament chambre parys letter ſealed makyng mencion howe kynge dyde gyue erle foiz coū tie bygore duryng lyfe holde ye ſame crowne fraunce erle thanked greatly kyng great loue ſhewed great gyfte without requeſt makynge ſayd ſir roger spaygne coude • ſaye ſhewe erle wyſe wolde take gyfte toke caſtell maluoyſin bycauſe fre lande caſtell purteynaūce holdeth man god alſo auncyently parteyneth enherytaunce frenche kyng meanes duke aniowe dyd gyue hym erle ſware ꝓmyſed take condycion ſhuld neuer ſette man ſhulde yuell realme fraunce ſo dyde ſuche ther feared moche thengliſſhe men frenche garyſons gaſcoyne bernoyſe durſt nat tonne countre foyz ⸪ howe peace made bitwene duke berry therle foiz begynninge warre bitwene therle foiz erle armynake cap xxv theſe mater ſir eſpayne de leon ſhewed right well cō tented euery nyght aſſoone lodgynges wrote euer al • • hat herde day better therby haue thē remēbraū ce writyng beſt remēbraūce may • ſo rode ſayd mornyng morlens came ſaid ſir haue forget demaūde whan ye ſhewed aduentures foiz dyde diſſymule duke berrey wyues doughter ſuſter therle armynake wheder duke berry made warre howe dyd howe dyd quod knight ſhall ſhewe tyme paſt duke berrey wolde moche yuell coude ymagyn nowe meanes whiche ye ſhall hereof whan ye come ortaiſe accorded ſir ꝙ cauſe duke ſhulde diſpleaſed hym helpe god ꝙ knight non ſhal ſhewe cauſe whan charles frenche kyng father kyng charles nowe dyſſeſſed realme fraūce deuyded two partes gouernyng therof duke aniou entended go italy dyd gaue v rule two bretherne duke berry duke burgoyne ye rule duke berry gouernynge languedocke duke burgoyne ruled languedoyle picardy whan languedocke vnderſtode yt duke berry gouernyng ouer ſore abaſſhed ſpecially tholous knewe well ye duke ſore taker golde ſyluer ſore oppreſſar people alſo ther carcaſſone rouergue breton tholouſins whiche duke aniou left coūtre robbed pylled brute ran yt duke berry maynteyned thētent ouer maiſter ye good townes ſeaſon ſpeke duke berrey nat coūtre kyng flaū ders tholous great puiſſant parceyued howe frenche kyng yonge greatly buſyed flaunders ayde vncle duke burgoyn ſawe well howe dayly robbed pilled briton ſo wyſte nat ſent treated erle foiz deſyring hym certayne ſōme money offred hym euery moneth payed wolde take gouernynge tholous coūtre tholouſin alſo deſyred townes lykewiſe deſyred hym bycauſe knewe hym iuſte man rightwyſe iuſtyce redouted enemyes fortunate buſineſſe alſo tholous loued hym euer good neyghbour thus toke charge gouernynge ſware maynteyne kepe countre ryght agaynſt men wolde wrong therto reſeruyng onely frenche kynges perſone ſette men warr watche wayes paſſages theſe robber pyllars vſed paſſe daye toke ſlewe drowned robeſton tholouſin mo four hūdred wherby gate great grace honoure tholous carcaſſone beſyers mountpellyer good townes ſo renome ran fraunce howe languedoke tourned taken lorde erle foyz duke berry ſouerayne toke therat great diſpleaſure therle foiz great hate bycauſe medled ſo farre buſyneſſe fraunce wherby maynteyned tholous ſtyll rebellyon agaynſt ſente men warre countre fierſly driuen backe agayne erles men ſo wheder wolde fayne drawe backe orels loſte ſhulde haue wonne duke berrey ſore diſpleaſed wt erle foiz ſayd howe therle foiz moſt preſumptuous proudeſt knight worlde duke coude ſuffre good ſpoken hym howe made hym warre erle foiz alwayes townes caſtelles ſo well prouyded none durſte entre lande whan duke berry came languedocke left rule wolde thā lengar exercyſe agaynſte duke diſpleaſure reſted ſtyll certayne ſpace nowe ſhall ſhewe meanes peace noriſſhed bytwene ten yere paſte lady ellyanour comynges nowe coūteſſe bouloyne nere coſyn therle foiz right enherytour countie comynges thoughe erle armynake hadde poſſeſſion came ortaiſe therle foiz brought yonge doughter thre yere age therle coſyn made good chere demaunded buſyneſſe • wheder ſhe goynge sir quod ſhe goynge arragon myne vncle aunte erle vrgell purpoſe abyde haue great diſpleaſure abyde huſbande ſir iohan boloyne thought wolde haue recouered myne enherytaunce comynges fro erle armynake kepeth fro hath ſuſter priſone wyll thyng mater ſo ſofte knight wyll nothynge take eaſe eate drinke ſpende hath folyſſhlye thynke whan erle wyll take pleaſure therfore wyll lengar abyde hym haue brought doughter wyll delyuer handes prayenge kepe noriſſhe vp truſt reaſon lygnage ye wyll nat fayle thus haue hoope ye wyll kepe moche payne gette awaye countrey handes huſbande father bycauſe take thē armynake myne aduerſaries • wolde gladly ſteale doughter awaye bycauſe ſhe enherytour comynges therfore haue brought vnto wherfore ſir requyre fayle nat buſyneſſe ſure father huſbande whan knoweth yt haue lefte wyll right ioyfull▪ hath ſayd often tymes doughter ſhulde put hym great doute whan erle well herde wordes lady elyanour coſyn right ioyfull ymagined ſelfe howe childe ſhuld hym ſome pleaſure meanes mother haue ferme peace wt enemyes el marry ſo highe place ennemyes ſhulde doute hym therby anſwered lady ſaid madame coſyn ye deſyre ſhall right good wyl bounde therto lynage doughter coſyn ſhall kepe well though ſhe myne owne proper chylde sir quod ſhe thanke thus yong doughter bouloyne abode erle foiz ortaiſe ſhe neuer departed then ſithe lady mother went arragon hath ſithe one twyſe toſe doughter ſhe neuer deſyred haue agayne therle kepte well ſhe owne chylde purpoſe meane peace ſhewed erle ymagined gette loue agayne duke berrey nowe preſent tyme duke berry hath gret deſyre marryed thynke herde auygnon pope coſyn germayne ladyes father ſhewed howe duke berrey deſyreth haue maryage ah ſaynt mary ſir quod howe wordꝭ right agreable hath done great pleaſure euer ye haue ſhewed whiche ſhall nat loſte ſhall putte remēbraunce cronycled god wyll ſende grace retourne towne valencēnes borne ſir ſore diſpleaſed one thynge ꝙ ſhall ſhewe faithe ſo hyghe valyant prince erle foiz ſhulde without laufull iſſue ſir quod knight one one ſhulde moſt ioyouſe prince worlde ſo wolde coūtre ſir quod lande withoute heyre nay ſir ꝙ vycount caſtell bone coſyn germayne heyre valyant man armes quod nay faythe ſir quod therfore erle loueth hym nat thynketh make two baſtarde ſō ne right valyant heyres thynketh marry highe lygnage hath golde ſyluer ynough wherby thynketh gette theym wyues ſuche ſhall ayde conforte sir quod maye well howe thyng nat reaſonable baſtardes ſhulde made herytours landes wherfore nat ſir quod lacke good heyres se nat howe ſpaynierdes haue crowned henry baſtarde kyng alſo portyngale crowned baſtarde kynge hath ſene worlde dyuers realmes baſtardes force hathe reygned nat wyllyam conquerour baſtarde ſonne duke normandy conquered englande kynge ſo kynges ſyth diſcended fro hym sir quod might well ther thyng may fall armynake right ſtronge ſo therby countrey ſhalbe euer warre ſtryfe ſir pray ſhewe iuſt cauſe warre firſt moued bytwene foiz armynake wyll ſhewe ꝙ knight enſure marueylous warre ſaye eche thē haue cauſe sir aunciently hū dred yere paſt lorde byerne called gaſcone ryght valyant man armes buryed freres right ſolempnely ortaiſe ye may ſe perſone ſtature body lyfe tyme pycture made latyn whiche yet gaſcone lorde bierne two doughters eldeſt maryed erle armynake than̄e yongeſt erle foiz nephue kyng aragon yet therle foiz beareth armes diſcended aragon armes palle golde goules ſo fortuned lorde biern gret warre agaynſt kynge spayne came biſquay wt gret nombre men warre entre bierne lorde gaſcone bierne whan enformed comyng aſſembled people ſydes might get men warre wrote letter two ſonnes lawe therle armynake therle foiz yt ſhulde come ſerue ayde hym defende herytage theſe letter ſene erle foiz ſone myght aſſēbled people prayed frendes ſo moche fyue hū dred knightꝭ ſquiers armed two thouſande varlettes ſpeares dartes paueſſes fote ſo came countre bierne ſerue father hym great ioye ſo paſſed bridge ortaiſe ouer ryuer lodged bytwene sanetere thoſpytall kyng spayne xxm men lodged nat far then ther lorde gaſcon bierne therle foiz taryed therle armynac thought euer yt wolde cōe ſo taried hi thre dayes iiii day therle armynac ſent letter haraulde lorde gaſcoine bierne ſente hym worde howe myght nat come howe hadde nothyng beare armes countre bierne whan lorde gaſcoyne herde thoſe tidynges excuſacions ſawe howe heſhulde haue none ayde conforte erle armynake ſore abaſſhed demaunded counſayle erle foiz barones bierue howe ſhulde maynteyne thē ſelfe sir quod erle foiz ſithe aſſembled let v go fight enemyes counſayle taken ordayned people twelfe hūdred men armes ſixe thouſande men fote erle foiz tooke firſt batayle ſo came kyng spaygne ſette lodgynges great batayle fierſe ſlayne mo ten thouſande ſpayniardꝭ therle foiz toke priſoners kynge spaygnes ſonne brother ſent father lawe lorde gaſcoyne bierne areregarde ſpaynyerdes ſo diſconfyted erle foiz chaſed porte ſaynt adrian biſquay kynge spayne toke abbey dyde veſture monke el ben taken erle foiz retourned lorde gaſcone bierne made hym good chere reaſon ſaued honour kepte countre bierne whiche el lykely haue ben loſte bycauſe batayle diſconfyture erle foiz made ſpaygnierdes takyng kynges ſonne brother lorde bierne hadde peace ſpaygnierdes owne wyll whan lorde gaſcoyne retourned ortaiſe baron foiz bierne preſent heſayd ſonne foiz fayre ſonne ye true faithfull ſonne ye haue ſaued myne honour coū trey erle armynake hath maryed myne eldeſt doughter hath ercuſed hym ſelfe fro buſyneſſe wolde nat come defē de myne herytage wherin ſhulde haue part wherfore ſaye ſuche parte ſhulde haue reaſon doughter hath forfait loſt clerely enheryte ſonne foiz dyſceaſe hoole lande heyres euer deſyre wyll commaunde ſubiectes ſeale accorde agre ſame anſwered howe well contente ſo thus meanes haue ſhewed aunciently erles foiz lordes countre bierne bare crye armes name profyte therof howe arminake nat clay quyte cauſe warre twene foiz armynake faythe ſir quod ye haue well declared mater neuer herde nowe yt knowe ſhall putte perpetuall memorie god gyue grace retourne countrey ſir durſte wolde fayne demaunde one thynge inſydent erle foiz ſonne dyed thafie knyght ſtudyed lytell ſayd sir maner dethe right pytuous wyll nat ſpeke therof whan ye come ortaiſe ye ſhall fynde thē wyll ſhewe ye demaunde helde peace rode tyll came morlens ⸪ ⸫ great vertuouſneſſe largeſſe therle foiz maner pytuouſe dethe gaſcone erles ſonne cap xxvi next day departed roode dyner moūtgarbell ſo ercye dranke ſonne ſetting came ortaiſe knight lighted owne lodgynge lyghted mone wher dwelte ſquier erles erualton de pyne well receyued bycauſe fraunce sir spayne leon wente caſtell therle founde hym galarye dyned lytell erles vſage alwayes hyghe noone aroſe bedde ſupped euer mydnight knight ſhewed hym howe come thider incontynent ſente ladgynge lorde worlde yt mooſt deſyred ſpeke ſtraūgers tidynges whan erle ſawe made good chere reteyned houſe wher bycauſe brought boke whiche made contēplacion vmſlance boeſme duke luzenbourge brabant whiche boke called melyader conteyninge ſonges baladdes rundeaux vyrelayes whiche gentyll duke made tyme whiche imagynacyon gadered toguyder whiche boke erle foiz gladde ſe euery night ſupper reed theron hym whyle reed none durſt ſpeke worde bycauſe wolde ſhulde well vnderſtande wherin tooke great ſolace whan came mater queſtyon wolde ſpeke nat gaſcoyne good fayre frenche eſtate houſe ſhall ſomewhat recorde taryed thereſo long might well parceyue knowe moche erle gaſcone foiz yt tyme fyftie yere age nyne ſay haue tyme ſene many knightes kynges prince neuer ſawe none lyke hym perſonage ſo fayre forme ſo well made vyſage fayre ſanguyne ſmylyng eyen gray amorous lyſt ſet regarde euery thyng ſo parfite nat praiſed moche loued ought beloued hated ought hated wyſe knyght highe enterpriſe good counſayle neuer myſcreant hym ſayd many oriſons euery daye nocturne pſalter matyns lady holy gooſt croſſe dirige euery day gaue fyue florens ſmall money gate poore folkes loue god large courteſſe gyftes coulde ryght well take parteyned hym delyuer agayne ought loued hoū de beeſtes wynter ſomer loued huntyng neuer loued folly outrage foly large euery moneth wolde knowe ſpended tooke countre receyue reuenewes ſerue notable ꝑſons ſaye xii receyuouts euer fro ii monethes two monethes two ſhulde ſerue receyte two monethes ende wolde change put two offyce one truſted beſt ſhulde comptroller hym ſhulde accompt comptroller ſhulde accōpt hym rolles bokes written thaccōptes remayne ſtyll therle certeyne cofers chambre whiche ofte tymes wolde take money gyue lordꝭ knyghtes ſquyers ſuche came hym none ſhulde departe fro without ſome gift yet dayly multiplyed treaſure reſyſt aduētures fortune douted good eaſy acquayntance euery man amorouſly wolde ſpeke thē ſhorte counſayle anſwers four ſecretaries riſyng muſt euer redy hande without callynge whan letter delyuered reed wolde calle write agayne el ſome thynge eſtate therle foiz lyued mydnight whan came chambre hall ſupper euer hym xii torch brennyng borne xii varlettes ſtandyng table ſupper gaue gret light hall euer full knightes ſquyers many table dreſſed ſuppe wolde none ſhulde ſpeke hym table called meate lightlye wylde ſoule legges wyngꝭ alonely day dyd lytell eate drike great pleaſure armony inſtrumē te coude right well hym ſelfe wolde haue ſonges ſong wolde gladlye ſe conſeytes fanteſies table whan ſene wolde ſende ye table bruely conſydred aduiſed came court ben many courtes kynges duke prince erles great ladyes neuer none yt ſo well liked ther none reioyſed dedes armes erle dyde ſene hall chābre court knightes ſquyers honour goyng vp downe talkyng armes amour honour ther founde maner tidyngꝭ euery realme countre ther might herde euery coūtre reſort valyantneſſe erle ther enfourmed mooſt parte dedes armes yt done spayne portyngale aragon nauar englande scotlande fronters lymitacions lāgue docke ſawe come thyder therle knightes ſquyers nacyons ſo enformed erle ſelfe thynges demaūded ther enq̄red howe gaſcon therles ſon died ser eſpayn leon wolde nat ſhewe thing therof ſomoch enq̄red yt aūcient ſquyer notable māſhewed ye mater began thus true quod erle foiz lady foiz wife agreeth nat well toguyder haue nat done long ſeaſon diſcorde bytwene thē firſt moued kyng nauar brother lady kyng nauar pledged ſelfe lorde dalbret erle foiz priſone ſōme fyftie thouſande frankes erle foiz knewe kyng nauarr craftie malycious beginnyng wolde nat truſt hym wherwt counteſſe foiz great diſpleaſur indignacyon agaynſt erle huſbande ſayd hym sir ye repute ſmall honour kyng nauar brother whā ye wyll nat truſt hym fyftie frankes thoughe ye haue armynakes labriſyence ye haue ought ſuffyce alſo ser ye knowe well ye ſhulde aſſigne dower whiche moūteth fyftie thouſande frā kes whiche ye ſhulde put hādes brother kyng nauarr wherfore ſir ye nat yuell payed dame quod ye ſaye trouthe thought kyng nauarr wolde ſtoppe payment cauſe lorde dalbret ſhulde neuer haue gone oute ortayſe ſo ſhulde haue ben payed laſt penny ſithe ye deſyre wyll nat loue loue ſonne theſe wordes kyng nauars oblygacion became dettoure erle foiz lorde dalbret delyuered quyte became frenche maryed fraūce ſuffer duke burbone payed eaſe king nauar ſōme fyftie thouſande frankes raunſome whiche ſōme kyng boū de therle foiz wolde nat ſende erle erle foiz ſayd wyfe dame ye muſt go nauarre kynge youre brother ſhewe hym howe nat well content hym wyll nat ſende hath receyued myne lady anſwered howe ſhe redy go cōmaū dement ſo ſhe departed rode panpylone kynge brother receyued moche ioye lady dyd meſſage fro poynt poynt kyng anſwered fayre ſuſter ſōme money therle ſhulde gyue dowre ſhall neuer go realme nauarr ſithe haue poſſeſſyon ah ſir quod ye lady ye ſhall ſette great hate bytwene therle huſbande ye holde purpoſe dare nat retoure agayne countie foiz huſbande wyll ſlee wyll ſaye haue diſceyued nat tell quod kyng ye wyll outher tarye deꝑte money wyll nat departe fro parteyneth kepe ſhal neuer go nauer counteſſe coude haue none anſwere kyng brother ſo ſhe taryed ſtyll nauar durſt nat retourne agayne erle foiz whan ſawe dealynge kynge nauar began hate wyfe yuell content howe ſhe faute ſhe returned nat agayne whan ſhe hadde done meſſage ſhe durſt nat ſhe knewe well therle huſbāde cruell toke diſpleaſure thus mater ſtandeth erles ſonne called gaſcone grewe waxed goodly maryed doughter therle armynake fayre lady ſuſter therle nowe lorde bertrande armynake contūctyon maryage ther ſhulde haue ben peace bytwene foiz armynake chylde fyftene ſixtene yere age reſembled rightwell father tyme deſyred go nauar ſe mother vncle kynge nauarr whiche anyuell hour hym countre whan come nauarre good taryed mother certayne ſpace toke leaue coude coude nat gette mother nauer haue gone hym foiz ſhe demannded erle cōmaunded hym ſo anſwered whan departed therle ſpake nothyng therof therfore lady durſt nat go thider ſo taryed ſtyll chylde wente panpylone take leaue kyng vncle kyng made hym great chere taryed hym ten dayes gaue great giftes men alſo laſt gyfte kyng gaue hym dethe ſhall ſhewe howe whan gētylman ſhulde depte kyng drewe hym parte chambre gaue hym lytell purſe full poudre poudre ſuche creature lyueng dyd ete therof ſhulde incōtynent dye without remedye kynge ſayd gaſcone fayre nephue ye ſhall ſhall ſhewe ye ſe howe erle foiz father wrongfully hath mother ſuſter gret hate wher ſore diſpleaſed ſo ought ye howe performe mater father ſhulde loue agayne mother entent ye ſhall take lytell powder put ſome meate father maye eate beware man ſe ſoone hath eaten ſhall entende nothynge haue agayne wyfe ſo loue euer whiche ye ought greatly deſyre ſhewe let man knowe kepe ſecrete el ye leſe dede chylde thought kyng ſayd hym ben true ſayde sir ſhalbe done ye haue deuyſed ſo departed fro panpylone retourned ortayſe erle father made hym good chere demaunded tidynges kyng nauar gyftes gyuen chylde ſhewed hym howe gyuen hym dyuers ſhewed hym excepte purſe pouder ofte tymes yong gaſcone yuan baſtarde brother laye toguyder loued toguyder lyke bretherne lyke arrayed apparelled nere greatneſſe one age happened tyme clothes laye toguyder beddes yuan ſawe purſe gaſcons cote ſayd thyng ye beare euer wherof gaſcoyne ioye ſayd yuan gyue cote ye haue nothyng therwith day gaſcone penſyue fortuned thre dayes god wolde erle ſhulde ſaued gaſcone brother yuan fell toguyder playeng tennes gaſcone gaue hym blowe chylde wente father chambre wepte erle hadde herde maſſe whan erle ſawe wepe ſaid sonne yuan ayleſt thou sir quod gaſcone hath beaten worthy beaten ſo quod therle incontynent ſuſpected ſome thyng faithe ſir ꝙ ſithe retourned nauar beareth priuely breſt purſe full pouder wote nat wyll therwith hath ſayde one twyſe lady mother ſhulde ſhortely agayne grace better loued euer ſhe peace quod erle ſpeke ſhewe man lyuenge sir quod ſhall erle entred ymaginacyon • ſo came houre dyner waſſhed ſat downe table hall gaſcone ſon vſed ſette downe ſeruyce gyue ſayes whan ſette downe firſt courſe erle caſt eyen hym ſawe ſtrynges purſe hangyng boſome blode chaūged ſaid gaſcone cōe byder wyll ſpeke thyne eare chylde came erle toke hym boſome founde purſe knyfe cut fro boſome chylde abaſſhed ſtode ſtyll ſpake worde loked pale aſſhes feare began trymble erle foiz opyned purſe toke pouder layde trenchour bredde called dogge gaue hym eate aſſoone dogge eaten firſt morſell tourned eyen heed dyed incontynent • whan̄e erle ſawe ſore diſpleaſed alſo good cauſe ſo roſe fro table toke knife wolde haue ſtryken ſon knightes ſquyers ran bytwene ſaid sir goddes ſake haue mercy nat ſo haſtye well enformed firſt mater ye yuell chylde firſt worde therle ſaid gaſcone treatour encreaſe thyne herytage yt ſhulde come haue warre hatered frenche kyng kyng englā de kyng spayne kyng nauar kyng arragon yet haue borne maleſſes nowe yu woldeſt murther moueth yuell nature firſt thou ſhalt dye ſtroke ſo ſtept forthe knife wolde haue ſlayne knightes ſquyers kneled downe hym wepynge ſayd ah ſir haue mercy goddes ſake •• ee nat gaſcone ſonne remēbre ye haue • chyldren sir cauſe hym kepte take good enformacion mater paradnenfure knewe nat bare paraduenture nothyng gyltie dede well quod erle incontynent put hym priſone let hym ſo kepte may haue reconyng hym chylde put towre erle toke great many ſerued ſonne ſome departed yet byſſhoppe laſcalle pan countre ſuſpect ſo dyuers therle canſed put dethe fyftene right horribly cauſe erle layde ſayde coulde none otherwyſe knewe ye chyldes ſecretes wherfore ought haue ſhewed hym haue ſaid sir gaſcone ſonne beareth purſe boſome bycauſe dyde nat thus dyed horribly wherof great pytie ſome thē freſſhe ioly ſquyers coūtre euer erle ſerued good men thynge touched erle nere herte well ſhewed day aſſembled ortaiſe noble prelate foiz bierne notable perſons countrey whan aſſembled ſhewed theym wherfore ſente thē howe foūde ſonne defaute whiche fayd entent putte hym dethe well deſerued ye people anſwered caſe one voyce ſayde sir ſauynge grace wyll nat gaſcoyne ſhulde dye heyre ye haue mo whan erle herde people howe deſyred ſonne ſōwhat refrayned yre thought chaſtyce hym priſone moneth two ſende hym ſome voyage two thre yere tyll might ſomwhat forget yuell wyll chylde might greatter age knowledge gaue leaue people depart foiz wolde nat departe fro ortaiſe tyll erle ſhulde aſſure gaſcoyne ſhulde nat dye loued chylde ſo well erle promyſed ſayd wolde kepe hym priſone certayne ſpace chaſtice hym ſo vpon promyſe euery man departed gaſcone abode ſtyll priſone theſe tidynges ſpredde abrode dyuers place tyme pope gregorie xi auygnon ſente cardynall amyens legacion byerne haue come therle foiz buſineſſe tyme came beſiers herde ſuche tidynges neded nat go mater herde howe gaſcon ſonne erle foyz deed sythe haue ſhewed ſo moche nowe ſhall ſhewe howe dyed erle foyz cauſed ſonne kepte darke chambre towre ortayſe tenne dayes lytell dyde eate drinke yet ynoughe brought hym euery daye whan ſawe wolde go therfro ſette lytell therby ſome ſayd meate brought hym ſtode hole entier day dethe wherfore great marueyle lyued ſo longe dyuers reaſons erle cauſed hym kepte chambre alone withoute company outher coūſayle conforte hym ſeaſon chylde laye clothes came argued ſelfe full malencoly curſed tyme euer borne engendred come ſuche ende ſame day dyed ſerued hym meate drinke whan came hym ſayde gaſcone meate made care therof ſayde sette downe ſerued hym regarded ſawe priſon meate ſtande hole brought hym ſo departed cloſed chambre dore went erle ſayd sir goddes ſake haue mercy ſonne gaſcone nere famyſſhed priſone lyeth thynke neuer dyde eate thynge ſythe came priſone haue ſene daye euer brought hym lyeng toguyder corner thoſe wordes erle ſore dyſpleaſed withoute worde ſpekyng went chambre came priſone ſome anyuell houre ſame tyme lytell knyfe hande pare withall nayles opyned priſone dore came ſonne lytell knyfe hande nat ynche hande great dyſpleaſure thruſte hande ſonnes throte poynt knife lytell entred throte certayne vayne ſayd ah treatour doeſt nat thou eate thy meate therwith erle departed without doynge ſayeng went owne chambre chylde abaſſhed afrayed comynge father alſo feble faſtynge poynt knyfe lytell entred vayne throte ſo fell downe ſodaynly dyed erle ſcante chambre kepar chylde came hym ſayd sir gaſcone ſonne deed deed quod erle yea truely ſir quod erle wolde nat beleue ſente thyder ſquyer went came agayne ſayd sir ſurely deed erle ſore diſpleaſed made great complaynt ſonne ſayd gaſcone poore aducnture yuell hour thou wenteſt nauar ſe thy mother ſhall neuer haue ye ioye therle cauſed barbour ſhaue hym clothed ſelfe blacke houſe moche ſore wepyng childe borne freres ortaiſe buryed thus haue ſhewed erle foyz ſlewe gaſcoyne ſonne kynge nauar gaue occaſyon dethe ¶howe ſir peter byerne ſtronge dyſeaſe counteſſe biſquay wyfe cap xxvii whan herde tale dethe gaſcone ſonne erle foyz hadde great pytie therof loue therle father whome founde lorde hyghe recōmendacyon noble lyberall curteſſe alſo loue countrey ſhulde great ſtryfe tor lacke heyre thanked ſquyer ſo departed fro hym ſawe dyuers tymes erles houſe talked often tymes hym tyme demaū ded hym ſir peter byerne baſtarde brother therle foyz bycauſe ſemed knyght great valure wheder riche maryed ſquyer aunſwered ſayd truely maryed wyfe chyldren nat company ſir quod ſhall ſhewe quod ſquier ¶this ſir peter bierne hathe vſage night tyme whyle ſlepeth wyll ryſe arme hym ſelf drawe ſwerde fyght aboute houſe nat tell whome gothe bedde agayne whan wakynge ſeruautes ſhewe hym howe dyde wolde ſaye knewe nothymg therof howe lyed ſōtyme ſeruautes wolde leaue non armure ſwerde chābre whan wold thus ryſe fynde non armour wolde make ſuche noyſe rumoure though deuylles helle ben chambre demaunded yf great landes wyfe yes truely ſir quod lady cometh lande ioyeth profytes therof ſir peter bierne hath fourthe parte sir quod wyfe ſir ꝙ ſhe caſtell kynge coſyn father erle biſquay c • ſyn germayne kyng dampeter ſlewe alſo wold haue lady haue put priſone toke poſſeſſion lande long lyued lady nothynge ſayd lady counteſſe biſquay dyſſeaſe father madame ſaue youre ſelfe kyng dampeter may gette wyll cauſe dye el put priſone ſo ſore diſpleaſed bycauſe ſayth ye ſhulde report beare wytneſſe yt cauſed quene wyfe dye bedde ſuſter duke burbone ſuſter frenche quene wordes ſayth beleued rather than̄e another bycauſe ye preuy chambre cauſe lady florens counteſſe biſquay departed countre ſmalle company cōmon vſage flye fro dethe nere men ſhe went countrey baſcles paſſed throughe ſo came hyder ortayſe erle ſhewed hym aduenture erle euer pyte ladyes damoſelles reteyned ſo ſhe abode lady caraſe great lady countre ſir peter byerne brother yonge knyght nat thanne vſage ryſe nyghtes dothe nowe erle loued hym well maryed hym lady recouered land▪ ſo ſir peter lady ſonne doughter mother caſtell yet yong therfore lady wolde nat leaue father ah ſaynt mary quod howe dyde ſir peter bierne take fantaſy firſt dare nat ſlepe alone chambre whan ſlepe ryſeth thus maketh ſyneſſe thynges marueyled faithe quod ſquyer hath ben often demaunded therof ſaythe nat tell wherof cometh firſt tyme euer dyde ſo night ben day huntynge wodes biſquay chaſed marueylous great beare ye beare ſlayne four houndes hurt dyuers ſo none durſt come nere ſir peter toke ſwerde burdeanx came great yre bycauſe houndes aſſayles beare fought longe hym great parell tooke great payne coulde ouercome hym finally ſlewe beare retourned lodgyng caſtell lāguedon biſquay made beare brought euery man marueyle greatneſſe beeſt hardneſſe ye knight howe durſt aſſayle beare whan̄e counteſſe biſquayes wyfe ſawe ye beare ſhe fell ſowne great dolour ſo ſhe borne chambre ſo day night nexte day ſhe ſore diſconforted wolde nat ſhewe ſhe ayled thirde dayeſhe ſayd huſbande sir ſhall nat hoole tyll haue pylgrimage ſaynt iames sir praye gyue leaue go thyder haue ſonne adrian doughter huſbande agreed therto toke golde towel treaſure ſhe thought neuer retourne agayne wher huſbande toke hede lady dyde pylgrimage made errande go ſe kynge caſtell coſyn quene made good chere ther ſhe yet wyll nat retourne agayne ſende chyldren ſo thus next night ſir peter thus chaſed beare ſlayne hym ſlept bedde fātaſy toke hym ſaid counteſſe wyfe knewe well ſone ſhe ſawe beare ſame father dyde one chaſe chaſyng herde voyce ſawe nothynge ſayd thou chaſeſt wolde hurte therfore thou ſhalt dye yuell dethe lady remembraunce whan ſhe ſawe beare ſhe herde father ſaye ſhe remembred well howe kynge dan peter ſtrake father heed without cauſe lykewiſe ſhe feared huſbande yet ſhe ſay maynteyneth yt ſhall dye yuell dethe dothe nothyng yet ſhall herafter nowe ſir haue ſhewed ſir peter byerue ye haue deman̄ded true tale thus thus fell howe thynke quod therby muſed great marueyle ſayd ſir beleue well ye haue ſayde ſir ſynde olde writyng aūciently ſuche called goddes goddeſſes pleaſure wolde chaunge tranſforme men beeſtes foules lykewyſe woman might ſo • ere ſome knight chaſyng foreſt biſquay paraduenture diſpleaſed yt tyme ſome god goddes wherby tranſformed vnto beare penaunce aunciently acteon chaūged vnto hart acteon quod ſquyer pray ſhewe ſtorie wolde fayne sir quod accordyng auncyent writynges fynde howe acteon iolye expert knight loued ſporte huntynge aboue game day chaſed wodes harte aroſe hym marueylous great fayre hunted hym daye loſt company ſeruauntes hoūdes right deſyrous folowe pray folowed fewe harttyll came lytell medowe cloſed rounde wodes highe tree medowe fayre fountayne whiche dyana goddeſſe chaſtyte bayninge ſelfe damoſelles knight cāe ſodaynly ware ſo farre forwarde coulde nat go backe damoſelles abaſſhad ſe ſtrā ger ran lady ſhewed ſhamed bycauſe ſhe naked whan ſhe ſawe knyght ſhe ſayde acteon ſente hyder loued lytell wyll nat whan thou arte gone hen place thou ſhuldeſt reporte thou haſte ſene naked damoſelles outrage thou haſt done thou mayſt haue penaunce therfore wyll thou tranformed lykeneſſe iame harte thou haſte chaſed daye incōtynent acteon tourned vnto harte naturally loueth water lykewiſe might beare biſquay howe lady knewe paraduenture ſhe wolde ſpeke tyme therfore ſhe ought better excuſed ſquier anſwered ſayd sir maye well lefte oure talkynge tyme ⸪ ⸪ ¶of great ſolemynetie erle foyz made feeſt faint nycholas tale maſtot banlyon ſhewed ſir iohn̄ froyſſart cap xxviii amonge ſolemynities erle foyz kepte hyghe feeſtes yere kept euer feſt ſaynt nycholas great ſolemynytie lande great feſt eſter ſhewed ſquier houſe thirde day came hyder ſawe ſelfe right well apparent ſame day firſt clergie towne ortayſe people men woman chyldren proceſſyon came caſtell fetche erle fote departed fro caſtell went clergy proceſſyon churche ſaynt nycholas clergy ſange pſalme pſalter benedictus dominus deus meus qui docet manus meas ad praelium et digitos meos ad bel lum c whan pſalme ſonge began ſyng dyde chriſtmas day eeſter daye pope chapell frenche kynges hym many ſyngars byſſhoppe pauyers ſange maſſe herde good playeng organ euer herde place ſpeke breuely accordyng reaſon erle foiz right parfyte thynges ſage parceyuing hyghe prince dayes none coude cō pare hym wytte honour large feeſtꝭ chriſtmas whiche kept euer right ſolemyne came houſe many knightes ſquyers gaſcone euery man made good ſawe burge spayne layde wodde aſſe fyre toguyder ſir eſpayne de lion ſhewed force gladde ſe hym therle foiz made hym good ſē blant ſawe alſo knightes aragon englande duke lācaſtres houſe laye burdeux erle made good chere gaue great gyftes acquaynted ſelfe thoſe knyghtes enformed many thyngꝭ fell caſtell nauar portyngale whiche ſhall ſpeke whan tyme • reth herafter day ſawe aſquyer gaſcone called baſtot manlyon man fyftie yere age expert man armes hardy ſemynge lighted lodgynge ortaiſe ſigne moone erualton de pyns brought hym ſomers caryages thoughe ben great barone ſerued bothe ſeruaūtes ſyluer veſſell whan herde name ſawe therle foiz euery mā hym ſo moche honour demaūded ſir eſpaygne de lion ſayd sir nat ſquyer departed fro caſtell trygalet whan duke aniou laye ſiege maluoyſin yes truely quod ſame good man armes good capitayne ſo fell aquayntaunce hym lodged coſyn called erualton capitayn carlate auuergne whome well acquaynted helped aquainted lykewiſe ſo dyd burge compare tyme talkyng deuyſinge armes ſytting fyre abyding mydnight therle ſhulde go ſupper ſquiers coſyn began reken vp life dedes armes ben ſayeng howe endured moche loſſe profite demaunded ſayd ſir iohn̄ haue ye hyſtorie thyng mater ſpeke anſwered ſaid coude nat tell tyll thē ſhewe forthe mater wyll gladly paraduēture haue herde ſom nat true quod ſquyer began ſaye thus firſt tyme bare armure vnder captall beufz ye batayle poyters happe daye thre priſoners knight two ſquiers whōe one another four e thouſande frā kes next yere pruce erle foyz captall ſonne vnder retourne meulx brye founde ducheſſe normandy ducheſſe orlyance great nombre ladyes damoſelles cloſed beſieged iaquery god nat helped thē ben enforſed defouled great puiſſance nōbre mo ten thouſande ladyes alone ſo ye ayde thoſe ladyes dyd ſette thē ſlayne iaquery mo ſixe thouſande rebelled neuer ſythe yt tyme truſe bytwene fraunce englande kyng nauar made warre owne quarell agaynſt frenche kyng regent erle foiz retourned owne countre maiſter captall abode ſtyll kyng nauar wage ayded v made great way fraūce ſpecially picardy toke many townes caſtelles byſſhoprike theſe beauuoiſe amyens lordes feldes ryuers conquered great fynance whan truſe fayled bytwene englande fraunce 〈◊〉 nauarre ſeaſed warre toke peace bytwene regent hym kyng englande great puyſſance paſſed ſee came layde ſiege towne remus kyng englāde ſent maiſter cleremont beamoyſin made warre kynge agaynſt countrey came kyng englande chyldren •• od ſquyer sir iohan thynke ye knowe redy mater howe kyng englande wedded wife howe came charter howe peace made bytwene theſe two kynges true ſir quod writyng haue contynue treaty baſtot manlyon ſpake agayne ſayde whan peace thus made bitwene theſe two kynges ordayned men warre companyōs ſhulde voyde leaue fortreſſes caſtels helde maner men warre poore companyons drewe toguyder capitayns tooke counſayle ſhulde ſayde thoughe theſe two kynges haue taken peace toguyder yet muſte lyue wente burgoyne capitayns nacyons englyſſhe gaſcons spany ardes naue • • ſe almayns scottes maner nacyons capitayne foūde burgoyne ryuer loyre cōpany xii thouſande one ſame cō pany ther thre four thouſāde good choſen men warre ſubtell dedes armes might apte aduiſe batayle take aduantage hardy ſcale aſſayle towne caſtell well ſene ye bataile brinay wher ouerthrue cōſtable fraūce therle foreſtz two thouſande ſpeares knightꝭ ſquiers vataile dyd great profite cōpanyons poore riche reaſon good priſoners townes caſtels wan biſſhoprike l • ryuer rone whan • ꝓont ſaynt eſprite departed warre made warr pope cardynalles coude nat quyte nat ben tyll founde another remedy pope ſent lōbardy marque moūtferant right valyant knight warre lorde myllayne whā come auignon pope cardynals ſpake hym ſuche wyſe entreted capitayns englyſſhe gaſcons almayns threſcore thouſande frākes pope cardynals ſhulde pay certayne theſe capitayns cō panyes ſir iohan haſtourde valyant englyſſhe knyght ſir robert briquet carſnell nandon le bagerant bourge camus dyuers ſo went lōbardy gaue vp ye poūt ſaynt eſprite route toke vi parte taried hynde ſir seguin bate • oile ſir john̄ ioell ſir james plāchyn ſir john̄ aymery burge piergourt eſpiot loys rābalt lymoſyn iaques tryturell dyuers kepte ſtyll lay ſaynt clement barell terrare brinay pont ſaynt denys thoſpitall ortifart mo xl fortreſſes houſes conutreis foreſtz velay baſe burgoyn ryuer loyre raūſomed coūtre coude nat quyte v nother payng well otherwiſe night toke fortreſſe charite abode yere halfe fro charite puy auuergne ſir seguyn batefoile lefte gariſon anſe helde bride auuerne wherby gret profite coūtre value cm frankes ryuer loyre orlians ryuer dalyer archpreſt capitayne neuars good frenche coude nat remedy countre knewe many cōpanyōs ſo deſyre ſōtyme leſſe hurte done archpreſt dyd ſame tyme moche good neuernoiſe cauſed ye cite neuers cloſed el ouerron robbed diuers tymes thoſe march townes caſtelles mo xxvi neyther knight ſquyer riche man agreed v durſt loke houſe warre made tytell kyng nauar ¶howe dyuers capitayns engliſſhe diſcōfited towne sāxere frenchman ſame ſeaſon fell batayle cocherell captall beufz capitayne kyng nauar dyuers knightes ſquyers company went hym ſir iaques planchyn ſir iohan ioell went ſerue hym two hundred ſpeares ſame ſeaſon kept caſtell called becke dalyer nere charyte goyng toward barbanoiſe vnder xl ſpeares made countre mylles greatly profyte ſaynt purcyn ſaynt peter de mouſtier whan herde howe captall mayſter conſtantyne aſſembled men warre great deſyre ſe hym departed fro garyſon xii ſpeares fell company ſir iohan ioell ſir iaques planchyn without buſyneſſe reencounter came captall thynke ſir iohan ye haue redy knowlege became buſyneſſe true quod taken captall beuſz ſir iohan ioell ſlayne ſir iaques planchyn true quod b • tefoyle manlyon alſo taken howe fortuned metely well ther coſyn myne called bernard terryde dyed portyngale batayle iuberot bernarde vnder ſir aymenon pomyers toke raūſomed felde thouſande frankes gaue good ſauecōducte retourne garyſon bec dalyer aſſoone came caſtell ſent ſeruaunt myne thouſande frankes coſyn parys quytaunce ſame ſame ſeaſon ſir iohan aymery englyſſhe knight greatteſt capitayne rode forthe coſtyng ryuer loyre come charite encoūtred abuſſhment lorde rugemōt lorde wodnay ſome archpreſtes men farre ſtronger ſo taken ouerthrowen raunſomed xxx thouſande frankes payed incontynent takyng loſſe ſore diſpleaſed ſware wold neuer entre owne garyſon tyll agayne moche loſt aſſembled togyder great nombre companyons came charyte loyre deſyred capitayns ther lamyt carſnell burge piergourt ſporte ther deſyred v ryde forthe hym demaunded hym wheder wolde ryde faythe ꝙ wyll paſſe ye ryuer loyre ſaint thybalte lette v ſcale aſſayle towne caſtell sāxere quod haue ſworne auowed wyll nat entre fortreſſe haue tyll haue ſene chyldren sanxere maye gette garyſon erles chyldren within iohn̄ loys robert ſhall well reuenged therby ſhalbe lordes countre thynke ſhall lightly come oure entent take hede v lyeng ſtyll dothe v maner ꝓfyte true ſir quod ſo promyſed ryde hym incontynent made v redy ſo fortuued ye oure purpoſe knowen towne sanxere ſame tyme ther was▪ capitayn valyant ſquyer goyne lowe marcheſſe called guyſſharte albygon toke great hede kepe well towne caſtell sanxer chyldren within ſir guyſſhart mōke brother abbey ſaynt thybalt whiche nere sanxere monke ſent charyte ryuer loyre brother beare certayn raūſome thider yt townes owed couynant ſo toke hede knewe entente howe nat tell name capitaynes nombre houre ſhulde departe howe determyned paſſe ryuer porte ſaynt thybalte ſo retourned went sanxere ſhewed brother oure myndes therle bretherne prouyded remedy ſente knightes ſquyers berry burbonoyſe capitayns garyſons therabout ſo foure hundred ſpeares good men warre made abuſſhment two hundred ſpeares without towne sanxere wode knewe nothyng ſonne goynge downe departed fro charyte rode good paſe tyll came penly porte hadde redy bootes barge paſſe v ouer oure horſes ſo paſte ouer ryuer loyre ordayned ouer mydnight bycauſe ye daye came ordayned hundred ſpeares abyde kepe oure horſes bootes remynaunt v paſſed forthe • frenche buſſhment whan paſte quarter myle brake buſſhment rode lefte behynde v ryuer ſyde anone diſconfyted ſlayne taken horſes wonne botes areſted mounted horſes came v ſpurres ſoone towne cryed lady sāxere erle hym ſelfe men bretherne ſir loyes ſir robert made buſſhement thus incloſed partes horſ backe aſſoone cāe v lighted afote aſſayled v fierſly thynge mooſt greued v coude nat enlarge ſelfe fight ſuche narowe waye cloſed bothe ſides hay hedge vyngardes alſo ſome enemyes ſuche knewe coūtre rydden gette vyngardes dyd hurt v ſore caſtyng ſtones coude nat go backe moche payne gette towne ſtode ſo hygh moū tayne ſore traueyled ſir iohn̄ aymery hurt ſouerayne capitayn hādes ſir guyſſhart albygon toke hym priſoner moche ſaue lyfe put hym houſe ye towne made hym layde bedde ſayd owner houſe kepe well priſoner ſe woundes ſtaunched lyue ſhall paye xx thouſande frankes ſo ſir guyſſhart lefte priſo • er retourned batayle quytte hymſelfe lyke good man armes wt chyldren sāxere come thider ayde countreis ſir guyſſhart dalphyn lorde marney ſir gerarde ſir wylliam burbone lorde couſant lorde de la pier lorde de la palys lorde neutry lorde de la coiſe lorde syette dyuers ſay ſir batayle right fell cruell defēded ſelf long might ſo bothe partꝭ ſlayne dyuers perſones many hurte ſhewed rather haue taken v lyue ſlee v finally taken carſayle launt nandon le bourge de pyergourt eſpyot burge leſpare angerot le moūt gyſe philyppe roe peter corthue peſat palyuiers bourge daruſen capitayns • ſelfe brought caſtell sāxere neuer realme fraunce companyons loſt ſo moche dyde iourney howe guyſſhart albygon loſte priſoner neglygence bledde ſo ſore dyed • defaute lokyng vnto thus ended iohan aymery iourney thus done beſyde sanxere charyte delyuered garyſons therabout compoſycion ſhulde quyte priſon ſo ſaue conducte departe countre whider lyſt fortuned v ſame ſeaſon ſir bertram cleſquy lorde beayne ſir arnolde dandrehen erle marche toke voiage go spaygne ayde kyng dampeter firſt bretayne bataile alroy vnder ſir hughe caurell recouered loſſe iourney ꝑte good priſoners two frankes went ten ſpeares ſir hugh caurell spayne helped put kyng dampeter realme whan ye alyances made bytwene kyng dampeter prince wale wolde abyde caſtell company ſir hugh caurell retourned hym acquitayne warre renewed bytwene frenche kyng prince moche ſore warre many capitayns englyſſhe gaſcoyns ſlayne yet thāke god lyue ther dyed ſir robert briquet bytwene lande duke orliance countre bloyſe place called oliuet company ouerthrowen aſquyer heynalt valyant man armes good capitayne called alar douſtienes ſurnamed barbaſon lynage gouernoure bloys kepar countre ſette lordes therof loys iohn̄ guy fortune encoūtre ſir robert briquet ſir robert cheney cōpany ſlayne ther non taken raunſome batayle nyorthe xayntaine carſnell ſlayne ſir bertram cleſquy ſeuyn c englyſſh men ſlayne ſaint seuere ſlayne englyſſhe capitayns rychard elys richarde helyn knewe fewe expert ſelfe yt ſlayne haue hold fronter made warre kyng englāde myne herytage lyeth burdelois somtyme haue ſo ouerthrowen pulled downe nat wherwith lepe horſ backe another tyme haue riche ynough whan good fortune came ſeaſon raymonet de la pee companion togyder tholouſyn frō ters bygore caſtell maluoyſin caſtell trygalet caſtell vāteulx whiche dyde v great profyte than̄e duke anion toke fro v byforce puyſſaunce raymonet de pee tourned frenche abyde ſtyll good engliſſhe ſhall whyle lyue true whan loſte caſtell trygalet cō ducted caſtell cuyllet duke gone backe agayne fraunce determyned ſomwhat outher gette ſome profyte el loſe dye payne cauſed ſpyall towne caſtell thury albygo well viewed whiche caſtell aueyled good fortune • ateſfyeng countrey hundred thouſande frankes ſhall ſhewe howe wanne without towne fayre foū tayne vſage euery mornynge woman towne wolde come thyder pottes veſſelles heedes fetche clere water ther toke fyftie cōpanyons garyſon cuillet rode daye throughe wodes buſſhes nexte night mydnight ſette buſſhment nere thury ſixe onely dyde v woman aray pottes handes ſo cāe medowe right nere ye towne hydde ourſelfe behynde great cockes hay ſtandyng feeſt ſaīt iohan whan make hay whan hour came gate opyned lette woman go water ſeuyn toke pottꝭ fylled fountayne wente towarde towne oure face wrapped kerchers ſo coude nat knowen woman mette goyng water ſaid v ah ſaynt mary goſſeppes ye vp tymes aunſwered lauguage faynt voyce true ſo paſte came gate founde body ſouter dreſſynge forthe baggage one v blewe horne drawe thyder cōpany buſſhment ſouter toke hede whan harde ye horne blowe demaūded thē blewe horne one anſwered ſayd preeſt wente feldes ah true quod ſouter ſir fraūces preeſt gladly gothe mornyngꝭ ſeke hare company came entred towne foūde man drawe ſwerde make defence thus toke towne caſtell thury wherby haue great profite yerely caſtell trygalet appurtenaūce worthe nowe wote nat treatie therle armynake dolphyn auuergne hath expreſſe authoritie frenche kyng bye townes fortreſſes companyons ſuch holde handes wherſoeuer outher auuergne rouerg • e lymoſyn quercy pyergourt albegois agen ſuche hath dothe make warre kyng englandes tytell many departed haue rendred fortreſſes nat tell wyll rendre myne nat worde ſayd burge compayne coſyn true carlat whiche holde auuergne cōe hyder ſome tidynges ſir loys sanxere marſhall frā ce wyll ſhortely nowe tarbe haue herde ſuche come then wt theſe wordes called wyne dranke baſtot ſayd ſir iohan ye well enformed lyfe yet haue aduētures whiche haue nat ſhewed wyll nat ſpeke ſir ꝙ haue well herde ¶howe ſquyer called limoſin turned frenche howe cauſed loys rambalt companyon armes taken cap xxx agayne demaunded hym rambalt expert ſquier great capitayne mē warr becōe bycauſe ſawe one auignon great aray ſhall ſhewe quod baſtot manlyon tyme paſt whan ſir seguyn batefoyle helde bride velay ten myle fro puy auuergne made warre countre conquered moche retourned gaſcon gaue loyes rābalt another cōpanyon called lymoſin bride anſe water sōme countre ſo deſolate full cōpanyons euery corner yt noue durſt go houſes bitwene bride auuerne anſe xxvi myle coūtre full moūtayns whan loyes rambalt wolde ryde pleaſure fro bride anſe rode without doute feare helde dyuers fortreſſes countie foreſtes therabout wher refreſſhed hym thā gentylmen auuergne foreſtz velaye fronters ſore traueyled ouer layde warre ſo taken raunſomed doughted warre none great lordes fraū ce ſente men warre coūtre frenche kynge yonge moche dyuers ꝑtes realme euery parte companyōs companyes rode dyd moche hurte ſo realme coude nat quyte thē alſo dyuers lordes fraunce englande hoſtage meane ſeaſon countreys men pylled robbed remedy men countre without corage defende themſelfe ſo rambalte lymoſin companyons armes fell ſhall ſhewe howe loyes rambalte bride fayre woman louer whome loued parfitely whan rode fro bride anſe cōmaunded lymoſin take good hede lymoſin companyon armes whome mooſt truſted toke ſo good hede damoſell pleaſure whan lyſte ſo loyes rambalte enfourmed therof coude ſuffre lengar toke ſuche hate agaynſt companyon cauſed hym taken ſeruauntes made hym driuen naked ſaue breche towne beaten ſcourges trū pettꝭ blowen certayne place dede openly cryed baniſſhed towne lyke treatour ſymple cote putte diſpyte dyd loyes rambalte lymoſin whiche diſpyte lymoſin toke greuouſly ſayd howe wolde reuēged euer laye power anone lymoſin whyle proſperite ridyng bytwene bride anſe euer forbare landes lorde voult dwellyng ryuer rone ſerued youthe thought go hym crye hym mercy deſyre hym make peace fraūce ſo cote fote went voulte knewe ryght well way ſo went houſe whan ſawe tyme wente caſtell porter wolde nat ſuffre hym entre laſt ſpake ſo fayre porter dyde lette cōmaunded hym go farther wt cōmaunded obeyed whan lorde vp went downe court ſporte hym ſo came gate lymoſin felle downe knee ſayde ſir ye nat knowe faithe quod lorde thought lytell ſhulde haue lymoſin whan well aduyſed hym ſayd thou reſembleſt well lymoſin one ſeruaunt sir quod • lymoſyn ſeruaunt cryed mercy thynges paſte ſhewed hym fro poynt poynt buſyneſſe howe loyes rambalte dalte hym ende lorde ſayd lymoſyn tho ſayeſt thou wylte becōe good frenche ſhall make thy peace faith ſir quod neuer dyde ſo moche hurte realme fraūce ſhall agayne ꝓfyte therto wolde ſe gladly quod lorde voult lorde kept houſe tyll made peace euery place whā lymoſin myght ſuretie ryde lorde voult armed hym brought hym ſeneſhall velay acquaynted hym ther examyned ſtate bride loyes rambalte whan rydeth waye taketh ſayd whan loyes rydeth hath nat paſt xxx xl ſpeares wayes kepeth knowe harte hym without hym haue rydden ofte tymes ſir ye wyll ſende forthe company men armes ieopardy heed ye ſhall haue within fyftene dayes capitayns ther toke hede ſayeng ſent ſpyes rambaulte ſpyed rydinge fro bride anſe beſyde lion ryuer rone whan lymoſin knewe ſhewed ye lorde voult ſayd sir loyes rābalte nowe anſe retournyng ſhall bring ſtreight wher muſt nedes paſſe lorde voult made aſſemble capitayne hymſelfe ſente bayly velay lorde mountelan ſir gerarde salyers ſonne ſir plā ſeart vernet lorde newcaſtell men armes therabout ſo thre c ſpeares aſſembled nonnay coūſaile lymoſin made two buſſhmentes vicoūt polygnac lorde chalencon rule one lorde voulte lorde mount clan guydynge buſſhment ſir loyes tornon lorde salyers hadde equally deuyded company firſte company kepte paſe nere ſaynt rambart foreſtes wher loyes rambalte ſhulde paſſe ryuer loyre el muſte haue gone guyde pynne whan loyes rambalt done came anſe departed xl ſpeares thought nat haue rencounter douted nothynge lymoſin leeſt thought lightely euer way rode outwarde wolde nat come homewarde came outwarde cāe ſaynt rambalte retourne toke another waye toke mountayns aboue lyon aboue vyenne vnder burge darlentall rode ſtreyght towarde mounaſtier thre lytell myle fro puye hadde paſſed bytwene caſtell moneſtrole mountfaucon ſo came aboute countre towarde vyllage called batery bytwene nonnay ſaynt iulyane wode ſtreyght paſſage whiche muſte • nedes paſſe el go nonnay whiche ſtreight laye lorde voult two hundred ſpeares loyes rambalt toke hede tyll among lorde voulte redy enterpriſe layde ſpeare reſt came cryinge la voulte daſſhed among companyons rode abrode withoute good arraye ſo firſt metyng many ouerthrowen erthe loyes rā baulte ſtryken fro horſe ſquyer auuergne called amblardon ſo toke hym priſoner taken ſlayne none ſcaped ther foūde boiettes thre frankes whiche loyes rābalte receyued anſe trybute certayne vyllages therabout wherof gladde euery man parte whan lymoſin ſawe rambalt trapped came hym ſayd reproche loyes loyes fauteth company remembre ye blame ſhame ye dyde put bride mayſtres wolde haue thought lytell woman ye wolde haue put ye dyd ye done moche wolde nat haue ſo angry two ſuche cōpanyōs armes myght haue paſt tyme well ynoughe one woman thoſe wordes lordꝭ laughed loyes rābalt ſporte herat takyng thus loyes rābalte bride delyuered ſeneſhall auuergne loſt capitayne chefe men wolde kepe lē gar lykewiſe ſo dyde anſe fortreſſes velay foreſtes parte within theſe treſſes right ioyouſe yelde vp holdes ſaue lyues loyes rābalte brought nonnay ſet priſone frēche kyng great ioye takyng herde reported beheeded newcaſtell beſyde auygnon thus loys rambalt dyed god haue mercy thus ſir quod baſtot manlyon haue holde talkyng paſſe awaye night ſir haue ſaid true sir quod herte thanke sir truſt ſayenges ſhall nat loſte ſir god ſuffre retourne myne owne countre haue herde ſaye haue ſene founde voyage ſhall put remembraunce noble cronycle erle bloys hath ſet warke ſhall write cronycle grace god entent ſhalbe parpetuall remembraunce bourge compayne called erualton began ſpeke wolde gladly ſhulde parceyue hym wolde ſhulde recorde lyfe bourge englyſſhe brother howe done auuergne place leyſar watche caſtell ſowned aſſemble mē towne come vp caſtell ſuppe erle foiz thanne theſe two ſquyers made redy lyghted vp torch ſo wente vp caſtell ſo dyde knightes ſquyers lodged towne ⸪ ⸪ ¶of ſtate ordynaunce erle foyz howe towne yran rebelled great traueyle domage outrage cap xxxi aſtate order erle foiz nat moche ſpoken prayſed ſeaſon yt ortaiſe foūde hym ſuche moche ſpeke whyle ſawe herde many thynges turned great pleaſure ſawe chriſtēmas day ſytting borde four byſſhoppes countre two clementynes two vrbanyſtes byſſhoppe pauyers byſſhoppe leſcalle clementynes ſatte higheſt byſſhoppe dayre byſſhop rone fronters burdeloys bayon vrbaneſtes ſatte therle foiz vycount roquebertyn gaſcone vycount brunyquell vycount ioſſeraūt knight englād duke lancaſters laye narbone duke ſent hym thyder knight called ſir wyllyam wylloughby another table ſatte fyue abbottes two knightes arragon called ſir raymonde de mount florentyne ſir marten de ruane another table ſatte knightes ſquyers gaſcone bigore firſt lorde daychin ſir gaylari de la mote ſir raymōde newcaſtell lorde chamōt gaſcone lorde compane lorde de la layne lorde mountferant ſir wylliam bernarde ſir peter corton lorde valenchyn ſir aungalle named baſell table knightes bierne great nō bre cheife ſtewardes halle ſir eſpaygne leon ſir siquart de boyes verdune ſir nonnans nonnallys ſir peter vaulx bierne two erles baſtarde bretherne ſerued ye table ſir erualton guyllame ſir peter byerne erles two ſonnes ſir yuan leſchell ſhewer ſir gracyen bare cuppe many mynſttelles well owne ſtraungers eche dyde deuoyre faculty ſame day therle foiz gaue harauldes minſtrelles ſōme fyue hundred frākes gaue duke tourayns mynſtrelles gownes clothe golde furred ermyns valued two hundred frankes dyner endured foure houres thus gladde ſpeke erle foyz houſe xii wekes well entreated thynges whyle might lerne tidynges countreis alſo gentyll knyght ſir eſpaygne leon whoſe company entred countre cauſed acquaynted knyghtes ſquyers ſuche coude declare thyng roude demaunde enformed buſyneſſe portingale caſtell maner warre made batayls rencounters bytwene thoſe two kynges aſſyſters whiche buſyneſſes ſhall make iuſte report ye haue herde howe kynge iohan caſtell hadde beſieged caſtell luxbone king iohan portyngale therin good townes crowned kyng valyantneſſe howe dede baſtarde alſo ye haue herde ſame kyng ſende englande duke lancaſtre erle cambridge maryage coſyns haue ſocour thē theſe meſſangers two knyghtes clerke ſir iohan radyngos ſir iohn̄ dore clerke lycenſiate lawe arche deaken lyſbone theſe meſſangers dyd ſo moche ſee came hampton taryed daye gate horſes none owne ſo rode london moneth auguſt kyng march wale huntyng pleaſure vncles duke lācaſtre therle cābridge ſir edmonde ſir thomas erle buckyngham alſo owne countreis ſportynge wherfore kyng portyngales meſſangers ſo firſt ſpake duke lancaſtre hertforde twentie myle fro london duke receyued ioyouſly opyned ye letter brought duke reed thre tymes better vnderſtande thē ſayd sir ye right welcome countre ye come worſt tyme yere haue ſpedy delyueraūce ambaſſade kyng bretherne ſparcled abrode • ye haue full anſwere tyll counſayle come toguyder london feeſt ſaynt mighaell ſythe great parte meſſage toucheth brother therfore write hym ſhalbe ſhortely london therabout ſhall take coū ſayle toguyder wherfore nowe ye ſhall retourne london whan brother come nere ye ſhall haue tidynges fro v ambaſſadours portyngale content ſo retourned london well lodged toke eaſe duke lancaſtre forgate nat ſayd hym ſo incontynent wrote brother therle cambridge buſyneſſe whan therle reed brother letter prepared hym ſelf rode hertforde beſyde ware whe • duke thre dayes togyder coū ſayle ſo ordayned go london duke promyſed ambaſſadours ſo
