came london theſe two lordꝭ portyngale great coūſayls bytwene erle cābridge ben portyngale nothyng cōtent kyng ferant portyngale laſt deed ſayd made warre ſlackely alſo agaynſt •• wyll hym englyſſh men toke peace ſpanyerdes wherfore erle ſayd doute counſayle myghelmas cōmontie wolde nat agre lightly make another vyage portyngale iourney thyder coſt greatly realme englande ꝓfyte therby ambaſſadours cōceyned well erles wordes ſayde sir nowe nowe kyng god pardon redouted greatly ye fortune worlde kyng mayſter nowe hath another mynde ymaginacion fynde felde enemyes thoughe leſſe power yet wyll gyue ſettyng whatſo euer fall therby ſir dare faythfully aſſure lordes beſyde quarell clere ouerron conquere realme caſtell enherytaunce parteyneth wyues chyldren conquere ye nat haue ſo good entre caſtell portyngale ſythe ye haue realme according therto therfore ſir one wyll come thyder ſuche ſuffycient nombre ayde ye ſhall haue ye ſhalbe able kepe felde duke lancaſtre anſwered sir lyeth nat v kyng realme ſhall oure good wylles ye maye ſure therof thus ended counſayle portyngalo laye ſtyll london abydyng mighelmas duke lancaſtre erle cambridge returned owne countreis march northe came myghelmas parlyament weſtmynſter kynge approched came wyndeſore ſo chertſey quene hym stanes alſo chefe counſayle erle oxenforde euery thyng done without hym nothynge ſame ſeaſon flaūders bytwene duke burgoyne gaūtoiſe great warre • newly retourned flaunders englande byſſhoppe norwiche ſir hugh caurell ſir wylliam helman ſir thomas tryuet ſame ſomer ben ſiege gauntoiſe ipre came frenche kyng cloſed burbonoiſe reherſed ī hyſtorie truſe bytwene fraunce englande flaunders endure tyll mydſomer ſcottes moche alſo london counſayle gaūt deſyred haue gouernour helpe ſuſtayne kepyng towne deſyred one kynges vncles el erle saliſbury counſayle london many counſayls well flē mynges portyngale scotlande made thē warre duke lancaſtre drewe parte might haue nōbre men warre archer go portyngale ſhewed lordes prelatꝭ comons howe bounde faythe othe ayde hym brother wynne herytage caſtell ſayde promyſed whan kyng nephue crowned apered letter ſealed moreouer duke complayned hym howe realme dyd hym brother wronge whan brother therle cambridge portyngale kepte ſmally couynaunt promyſed ſayd ꝓmyſed ſende hym thider two thouſande ſpeares many archer nothyng done wherby quarell right enherytaunce greatly hyndred duke wordes well harde reaſon mooſt notableſt ꝑſons yt counſayle ſaid howe right ſpeke dyd howe ſayd buſyneſſes realme touched nere muſt firſt ꝓferred wolde wyll ſhulde haue ben accomplyſſhed ſome ſaid ſhulde great outrage ſende realme two thouſande men warre four thouſande archer ſo long iourney ī portugale fortune ſee daūgerous ayre portyngale marueylous hote ſayeng realme englande ſhulde leſe ſuche company ſhulde domage irrecuparable howe thynges alledged finally ordayned duke lancaſtre ſhulde paſſe see ſeuyn hūdred ſpeares four thouſand archer euery man payed quarter yere howe reſerued yf accydent touchynge realme englāde meanes fraū ce scotlande ſhulde happen falle departure portingale tary duke agreed therto ſythe ſawe wolde none otherwyſe ye haue herde whan̄e duke lancaſtre redy men hampton take voyage portyngale ambaſſadurs retourned brought worde portyngale howe duke lancaſtre comyng ſuche nombre men warre portyngalois great ioye fortuned lette fell englande whiche taryed duke lancaſtre ſeaſon admyrall fraunce ſir iohan vien thouſande ſpeares good men armes toke ſhippyng scluſe ſayled scotlande made warre englande ſo realme came reſyſt thē ſhewed hyſtorie wherfore nede nat ſpeke therof agayne wyll ſpeke ſiege lixbone kynge spayne whome ſhall make true relacyon accordynge enformed kynge iohan caſtell beyng ſiege lixbone tidynges came hooſt marchauntes countrey came fro flaunders howe duke lancaſtre great nombre men warre comynge thyderwarde reyſe ſiege • theſe tidynges well beleued ſpanyardes knewe well howe duke lancaſtre wolde payne dilygence make warre realme caſtell bycauſe claymed part therof ryght wyfe howe kyng helde ſtyll ſiege ſent meſſangers letter haue ayde fraūce ſpecially ſent coūtre bierne lande erle foiz byerne iſſued four dayes reſpyte thre hundred ſpeares choſen men armes come ortaiſe realme fraūce go caſtell ſerue ye king sir iohan rue burgonyon ſir geffray richon breton ſir geffray de partenay eche thē company ſelfe bierne made thē redy lorde lynguaſſhe great barone companyon erle foiz ſir peter lyer ſir iohan de lespres lorde bordes ſir bertrande baruge lorde moriage ſir raymonde danſac ſir iohn̄ salagre ſir monan saruen ſir pyer robier ſir stephyn valentyne ſir raymonde raraſſe ſir peter hanefan ſir ogert domeſſon dyuers ſir eſpayngnolet spaygne eldeſt ſonne ſir roger spaygne coſyn lygnage armes erle foiz went company bierne theſe lordes knightes bierne made aſſemble ortaiſe therabout ſhewed ſawe deꝑte fro ortaiſe howe beſt armed apoynted company wente byerne many daye whan erle foiz ſawe ſurely howe wolde deꝑte go spaygne thoughe begynnynge ſomwhat conſented therto ſhulde receyue kyng caſtelles wage yet angry ſoroufull departyng ſawe well countre ſore febled therby ſent ſir eſpaygne de leon ſir cabeſtan theſe ſayd lordes knightes ſquyers deſyringe come toguyder caſtell ortaiſe entent gyue theym dyuer farewell knightes obeyed reaſon came ortaiſe ſe erle receyued gladde chere maſſe cauſed thē come ſecrete chambre maner counſayle ſaid ſirs entente deꝑte countre leaue handes warre erle armynake ye go make warre kyng spayne departure toucheth right nere sir quod muſte nedes go entent haue receyued ye kyng caſtels wage ſir warre bytwene spayne portyngale one atchyued ſhall retourne agayne ſauegarde atchyued ꝙ therle nay nat ſo ſoone nowe dothe begyn newe kynge portyngale hath ſent ayde englande therfore warre likely endure long ſeaſon ye kepe felde ye ſhall nat fought tyll duke lancaſtre cōpany come thyder ſo ye ſhall derely bye wage ye haue receyued sir ꝙ ſythe haue done ſo moche muſt nedes parforme voyage well god ſpede quod erle let v go dyner tyme therle theſe lordes knightꝭ went hall table great dyner great leaſer ſerued euery thyng day ꝑteyned dyner therle ledde hym cōpany galarye entred comunyng ſayd fayre lordꝭ frendes ſhall greue ſe departynge countre nat dyſpleaſed auauncementes honour caſes wolde gladly augment exalte honour profyte haue great pytie ye chefe flour chiualry countre bierne ye thus go ſtraunge countre wolde coūſayle yet agayne leaue voyage let kynge caſtell kynge portyngale make warre bytwene theym ſelfe ye nat bounde none otherwyſe sir ꝙ ſauynge diſpleaſure nat thus ſir ye knowe ye ſpeke haue taken wage gyftes kyng caſtell wherfore muſt nedes deſerue well quod therle yeſpeke well ſhall ſhewe ſhall come vyage outher ye ſhall retourne ſo poore ſo naked lyfe ſhall ſtrāgle el ye ſhalbe ſlayne taken knightes began laughe ſayd sir muſt abyde aduenture therle fell talkyng lefte reſt ſhewed maner communycaſion nature spanyardes howe ſluttyſſhe louſy enuyous mennes welthe wherfore quod reed take good counſayle demaunded wyne ſpyce made euery mā drinke toke euery man hande badde farewell departed fro thē went chambre fote caſtell knightes moūted horſes ſo rode sanetere • lodged night nexte day departed entred lande baſeles toke waye panpylone paſſed ſurely payed truely tooke ſame ſeaſon whyle kyng laye lixbone layen ſpace yere towne ſaynt yrayne rebelled agaynſt ye kyng caſtell cloſed gate ſayde nother french ſpayniſſhe ſhulde entre towne bycauſe domage done oppreſſyons ſome ſayd faute geffray rycous company ſir parteney cō pany breton toke euer might gette ſet nothyng peace cytezins toke two caſtelles ſayd wolde kepe towne agaynſt ꝑſons wolde thē hurte ſame day rebelled ſlewe mo threſcore breton nere ſlayne ſir geffray partenay ſaued hym ſelfe vnder ye walles towne yt nere lodgynge frenchman breton fierſly aſſauted ſaynt yrayne loſt wonne ſo dyd nothynge theſe tidynges came hooſt kyng caſtell howe ſaynt yrayn tourued portyngalois howe mynde delyuer towne caſtelles kyng portyngale whiche newes kynge nat content called hym marſhall ſir raynolde lymoſin ſaid take hundred two hundred ſpeares go ſaīt yrayne knowe men towne rebell occaſion haue haue done marſhall rode forthe hym two hundred ſpeares came ſaynt yrayne ſent hym haraulde ſhewe comyng howe wolde ſpeke barryers ſo dyde meſſage anſwered hym thē towne ſayeng sir haralde knowe right well sir raynolde lymoſin gentylman valyant knight marſhall kyng may rightwell come hyder pleaſe hym vnarmed towne el nat meſſage haralde brought mayſter than̄e ſir raynolde ſayd nat come hyder thē domage knowe entente one entre armed vnarmed knowe wylles ſo ſixe hym rode thyder vnarmed lefte cōpany behynde hym ſo lyghted barryers whan within ſawe eſtate opyned gate receyued towne made hym good chere aſſembled people market place ſayde sir ye dwell towne take hede ſaye ſente hyder kynge caſtell demaunde entēcion ye rebell cloſe gate haue ſlayne come hyder ſerue kynge knowe trouthe kyng ſore diſpleaſed alſo enfourmed howe ye haue taken poſſeſſyon two caſtelles towne whiche parteyneth enherytaunce howe ye wyll delyuer aduerſary kyng portyngale aunſwered ſayd sir raynolde ſauynge kynges grace nat ſo diſpoſed rendre mannes handes kynge kynge caſtell whome holde ſo gouerne v peace iuſtice yt haue done ye faut theſe robber pyllers breton lodged towne yf ſarazyns worſe people coulde nat haue ben worſe dalte withall rauyſſhinge wyues doughters breakynge vp coffer breakynge heedes veſſelles wyne beatynge meamynge v whan ſpeke worde therfore nat marueyled whan ſawe theſe outrage done v thē ſhulde defende v though diſpleaſed men wyll diſpleaſed leſſe cauſe sir ye maye ſhewe pleaſe one accorde whoſoeuer come wyll receyue towne nother frenche breton none kynges owne perſone ſuche ſhall pleaſe hym ſo nat traueyled putte vyolence whan̄e ſir raynolde herde ſaye ſo peaſed ſemed hym dyd wronge putte towne enemyes ſayde ye good people haue well herde well vnderſtande ye ſhall abyde peace wyll retourne kynge ſhewe hym ye haue ſayd good faythe ſhall moche poſſyble sir thanke quod truſt kyng haue yuell informacyon v yt ye wyll oure good meane ſir raynolde tooke leaue departed retourned company abode hym feldes ſo rode tyll came hooſt lixbone lyghted lodgynge went kynge ſhewed hym hadde harde founde thē yrayne whan kyng knewe trouthe ſayd faythe haue done wiſely man ſure thes robbets whan ſir geffray richone ſir geffray partenay companyes ſawe howe coulde haue none remedy ſaynt yrayne kynge caſtell diſſymuled ſore diſpleaſed ſayd among ſelfe haue well lefte realme fraunce come hyder ſerue kyng ſpayne thus ſhamed domaged ſorte villayns haue right truſt ſhortly hyder wyll come ſorte knightes gaſcone wyll ſuffre tyll come wyll agree togyder reueng companyons haue ſlayne yuell entreated tidynges came hooſt kyng counſayle breton ſore manaſſhed ſaynt yrayne maketh auaunte gaſcoyns one cōe howe ſhulde derely paye done wherfore kyng counſayled departe fro ſiege go refreſſhe hym ſeaſon ſaynt yrayns ſette mater good waye ſo • tary comyng gaſcoyns whome foure hundred ſpeares good men warre wherof kynge ioyfull wolde nat ſhulde fynde coūtre trouble comynge alſo moche people deſyred refreſſhe theym layen longe nothynge done commaunded euery man diſlodge drawe towarde ſaynt yrayne ſpanyardes dyſlodged ſo came marcheſſe ſaynt yrayne whan ſaint yrayne knewe howe kynge caſtell comyng towarde towne ordayned twelfe men moſt notableſt perſons towne mount horſes ſo dyde rode tyll came kyng knowe pleaſure kynge lighted vnder ſhadowe olyue tree refreſſhe hym great heate two leages fro ſaynt yrayne ſir raynolde lymoſin marſhall hooſt knewe comynge ſo preſent kynge whan came kneled downe ſaid foloweth ⸪ ¶howe kyng caſtell lefte ſiege lixbone howe ſaynt yrayne excuſed ſelfe cap xxxii right redouted prince noble kynge caſtell come hyder youre preſens ſende fro poore cōmynaltie poore towne bayliwike ſaynt yrayne thē gyuen vnderſtande howe ye greatly diſpleaſed ſir wheder thus ſhalbe right redouted ſir faute came nat reaſon iniuryes oppreſſyons breton hath done thē ſuche towne sir yuell dedes nat come knowledge ſir blame nat mayſters ſquiers knightes capitens onely dyded v hurte ſir theſe pyllers robber breton haue doone v ſuche dedes marueyle thynke recorde sir helde ſeaſon ſubiectyon towne countre ſaynt yrayne ſo herde theym many great complayntes ſir diſpyte v wolde breake vp oure cofers take vyolate wyues doughters face whan ſpake worde beten maymed ſlayne pouertie two monethes wherfore right redouted noble kynge beſech grace haue diſpleaſed cauſe maye pleaſe may haue true iuſtyce laufull informacyon maynteygne v ryght ye promyſed ſware v kepe v lyberties firſt tyme ſware kynge towne ſaynt yrayne ſir ye ſhall great almeſſe v ſir whan ye come thyder truſte counſayle ſuche nobleneſſe towne ſaynt yrayne ſhalbe opyned agaynſt comynge may pleaſe yor grace poore people cryeng mercy complaynynge iniuryes oppreſſyons done youre royall maieſtie noble counſayle wyll graunt grace remyſſyon paſte remedy wronges kyng ſtode ſtyll lytell ſir raynolde lymoſin kneled downe ſaid dere ſir ye haue herde people ſaynt yrayns complaynt ſhewyng hath ben wherfore may plaſe anſwere raynold quod kyng knowe well iuſte cauſe dyde go bydde ryſe go wayes ſaynt yrayne make redy comyng • wyll lye night alſo ſhewe thē howe ſhalbe well maynteyned right ſir raynolde roſe went thē ſayd sir ryſe kyng hath well conceyued ſayeng ye deſyre right iuſtyce ye ſhall haue go wayes apparell ye ought towne ſaynte yrayns agaynſt kynges comyng ſo may gyue thāke mater ſhall come well paſſe ſuche meanes ye ſhall haue ayde sir quod thanke toke leaue kyng retourned towne ſhewed herde kyng anſwere ſir raynolde lymoſin made kynges behalfe wherof towne gladde apparelled towne richely agaynſt kyngꝭ comyng ſtrawed ſtretes freſſhe grene herbes kyng entred euenyng lodged caſtell called lyon men towne many might mooſt ꝑte feldes village therabout • kyng well moneth ſo ye mater ſtode done loſt ⸫ ⸪ ¶of marueylous batayle iuberoth bytwene kynge caſtell kyng iohn̄ portyngale cap xxxiii whyle kynge caſtell ſaīt yrayns • come hym gaſcons bierne fayre cōpany ſir raynolde lymoſin rode receyue welcomed ryght ſwetely coulde right well brought thē kyng great ioye comynge cōmaunded ſir raynolde lymoſin ſe well lodged eaſe dyde ſo contented thus theſe buſyneſſes reſted kyng laye ſtyll ſaynt yrayns people kynge caſtell hadde abrode lodged feldes therabout four thouſande men armes xxx thouſande daye called barones fraunce counſayle knowe myndes howe ſhulde mētayne forthe warre layen great coſt li • bone done nothynge ſurely gaſcoins nat come encoraged kynge deꝑted fro ſaynt yrayns gone outher bergus galice people ſore anoyed lye ſo longe ye feldes whan knyghtes fraunce bierne come kynge ſayde fayre ſirs ye good men warre wherfore wolde haue coūſayle howe may maynteyne warre agaynſt lyxbonoyes portyngaloyes haue kepte felde yere yet haue done nothynge thought haue gotte lixbone haue fought wolde wyſe iſſue wherfore people gyue counſayle gyue euery man leaue departe owne houſes wherfore pray gyue youre aduyſe knyghtes fraunce byerne newely come deſyred armes nothynge done thynking deſerue wage receyued aunſwered ſayde sir ye puyſſant man landes lytell coſteth payne traueyle people ſpecially ſithe owne countrey wolde nat ſaye ſo moche yf ſtraunge countre clene without prouyſion nowe ſaye ought nat gyue ſuche counſayle great eaſe ſe though home sir ſaye nat maner determynate coūſayle ye wyſe ynough thynke highe prudence beſt chuſe yet kepe felde ye maye well kepe tyll feeſt ſaint michaell paraduēture tyme enemyes wyll aſſemble togyder drawe felde whan ye take leeſt hede therto ſo thā without fayle ſhalbe fought withall sir haue great deſyre wyn ſōwhat iourney hath coſt v moche great payne traueyle bothe ſelf horſes came coūtre therfore ſir ſhall nat opinyon company thus departe agayne faithe quod kyng ye ſpeke well truely warre ſhall vſe fro henſ forthe counſayle kyng father alſo haue founde alwayes youre countreis great trouthe faythfulneſſe god haue mercy ſir bertram cleſquyes ſoule true knyght whome tyme many recoueraunſes good iourneys wordes counſails kyng fraunce bierne anone knowen among lordes knightes spaygne wherwith ſore diſpleaſed two cauſes one bycauſe ſemed kyng truſt cō fydence ſtraungers liege men crowned hym kyng ſeconde fraunce counſayled kyng kepe ſtyll warre felyng ſelfe ſo wery warre ſo ſpake among ſelfe dyuers maners nat openlye priuely wolde ſaye kyng coude make warre frenchman lykewiſe coude father ſo great enuy frenche men whiche well appered whan frēche varlettes went forragyng ſpayniſſhe forrengers ſtronger wolde take forage fro beate mayme ſo complayntes came therof kynge blamed therfore marſhall ſir raynolde lymoſyn ſayde haue ye nat prouyded mater marſhall excuſed hym ſayde god might helpe hym knewe nothynge therof wolde prouyde remedy fro thenſ forthe incontynent ſtablyſſhed men armes kepe feldes frenche forrēgers rode ſuretie alſo made crye cōmaundement euery man vitayle prouiſion ſell ſhulde bringe felde ſaīt yrayns ſhuld haue priſe reaſonable euery thyng ſtraungers largely parte kyng ordayned ſhulde ſerued wherof ſpanyardes great diſpyte ſame weke kyng caſtell departed fro ſiege lixbone thre great ſhyppes men warre englyſſhe archer aryued lixbone nō bre fyue hundred one thirde parte cōpanyons aduenturers hauyng wage man ſome calys chierburge breſt bretayne mortaygne poytou herde warre bytwene caſtell portyngale came burdeux ther aſſembled ſayd let v go aduenture portyngale ſhall fynde wyll receyue v ſette v awarke sir iohan harpedan marſhall burdeux counſayled thē greatly therto wolde nat ſhulde abyde burdeloys might ther haue done hurte good bycauſe companyons aduenturers nothyng leſe arryued lixbon nat name thre ſquyers englyſſhe capitayns one called northbery another morbery thirde huguelyn harcerell none paſte age fyftie yere good men armes well vſed feates war • comyng theſe englyſſhe men lixbone right gladde ſo kyng portyngale wolde ſe thē ſo went palays kyng made great chere demaū ded duke lancaſtre ſent thyder sir quod northbery longe ſeaſon ſythe knowledge v hym sir men dyuers ſortes ſekynge aduentures ſome come ſerue fro towne calays faythe quod kynge bothe right hartely welcome comyng dothe great good ioye ſhortely ſhall ſette warke haue ben incloſed gret ſeaſon ſo wery therof nowe wyll large felde well enemyes hath sir quod deſyre nothynge el ſir deſyre ſhortely maye ſe youre enemyes kynge made dyner palays lixbone cō maunded ſhulde lodged cytie eaſe payed wage thre monethes kyng ſet clerkes awarke made letter ſente thē ouer realme cōmaundynge euery man able beare harneſſe drawe lixbone ſuche theſe letter came vnto obeyed nat many abode ſtyll ī houſes thre partes realme diſſymuled kynge theym lixbone bycauſe crowned kynge baſtarde ſpake great wordꝭ ther agaynſt priuely bycauſe great trouble dyfferēce kynge caſtell coū ſayle ſawe realme portyngale made hym auaunce hym ſelfe entent haue conquered countre sayenge howe ſhulde wonne one dayes iourney batayle yf lixbone might ouerthrowen reſydue countrey wolde nat ſorie put realme mayſter denyce elles ſlee hym ſhulde lande conqueſt hym wyfe ryght enherytoure yet good wyll kynge iohan caſtell wolde haue lefte warre people wolde nat ſuffre euer gaue hym corage sayeng quarell cauſe iuſte whan kynge portyngale ſawe commaundement nat obſerued moche people diſobeyed ser ue hym right penſyue malencolyous called hym ſuche truſted beſt lixbone knyghtes houſe dyde payne crowne hym alſo ſerued kyng ferant ſir iohan radygos ſir iohn̄ teatedore lorde siegere ſir gō tabeſton ambriſe condricho peter brother ser ouges nauaret knyght caſtell tourned portyngaloyes kynge iohan hadde chaſed hym realme kynge portyngale hadde reteyned hym made hym chiefe capitayne counſayle kyng ſhewed many thynges ſayde sir ye knowe well ye frēdes ye haue made kynge beholde nowe howe dyuers folkes realme excuſeth ſelfe ſo canne nat gette felde yf good wyll fight oure enemyes haue wolde right gladde therof nat ſo dyſpoſed ſe howe refrayne dyſſymule mater wherfore haue nede counſayle mater howe maye order myſelfe therfore praye lette haue aduiſe ſir gōme tabeſton knight portyngale ſayde sir counſayle youre honoure ſoone ye maye drawe ſelfe youre people felde aduenture alſo ſhall ayde dye quarell ye kynge portyngale rebelles diſdaynfull ſerue ſaye ſo ſaythe dyuers towne bycauſe ye haue nat iſſued oute ſhewe youre face agaynſt enemyes ye haue grace yet reputed valyaunt man armes ſaye nowe nede valyantneſſe fayleth hath ſet enemyes pride hath cooled ſubiectes ſawe dedes valure prowes wolde obey dout ſo wolde yo • enemyes heed ꝙ king ye ſay well ſo wherfore ſir wyll incontynent euery man make hym redy • wyll ryde ſhortely loke enemyes outher wyll wyn tyme leſe sir quod knyght ſhalbe done iourney god ſende good fortune ye ſhall kynge portyngale euer ye ſhall prayſed ſtraunge realmes knowledge therof ſhall come parfyte herytage portyngale ye nat attayne batayle ye may take enſample kyng henry coſyn father kyng iohan nowe kyng caſtell spaygne tolle • galyce corduane sibyle came theſe herytagꝭ batayle otherwyſe neuer ye knowe howe puiſſaunce prince wale acquitayne put kynge peter yo • coſyn poſſeſſion • theſe herytages landes cloſed within spayne afterwarde iourney batayle yt henry nauntuell agaynſt peter loſte agayne henry put poſſeſſion whiche iourney aduentured hymſelfe el nat ben kyng ther lykewiſe ſir ye muſt aduenture ye thynke lyue honour ſir quod kynge ye ſaye true wyll haue none counſayle profytable v thus departed counſayle ordayned yt within thre dayes euery man ſhulde drawe feldꝭ take ſome grounde abyde enemyes thoſe thre dayes kepte gate ſo cloſe lixbone nother man woman coude iſſue wolde nat yt enemyes ſhulde preuy entenſyon whan englyſſhmen vnderſtode ſhulde iſſue oute drawe towardes ſaynt yrayns loke enemyes ioyfull euery man made hym redy archer dreſſed redy bowes arowes euery thynge neded thurſdaye departed lixbone day lodged lytell riuer ſyde two leages fro lixbone face towarde ſaynt yrayns euery man ſayde good herte wyll wolde neuer retourne lixbone tyll ſene enemyes saye • g howe better ſhulde go requyre batayle enemyes rather ſhulde come ſaid ſene herde dyuers enſamples requyrers nat requyrers euer fyue foure hath optayned maner vyctories englyſſhmen haue fraūce euer requyrers naturally ſecars batayle ſtrongar couragyous aſſaylinge defendars opynyon nere ſome burgeſſes lixbone ſayde bruges flaūders whan gauntoyſe came towne requyred batayle agaynſt erle flaunders puiſſaunce knowe well philyppe dartuell petre de boyſe iohan clyquetiell fraūces atreman peter le myttier capitayns gauntoyſe brought oute gaunte mo ſeuyn thouſande men yet requyred batayle enemyes ouer came diſconfyted xi thouſande true without treaſon clene fortune batayle done ſaturdaye leage fro bruges herde reported nexte day whan wonne towne bruges thus dyde putte aduenture outher wynne leſe thus muſt thynke haue good ſpede thus theſe lixbonoyſe thurſday ſpake one another whan kyng enformed wordes great confort great ioye friday mornynge ſowned trumpettes made redy toke waye right hāde folowyng ryuer playne countre caryage folowed ſo rode daye four leages day tidynges cāe kynge caſtell laye ſaynte yrayns portyngalois lixbonoyes cōmyng towardes hym theſe tidynges anone ſpredde abrode hoſt wherof spaygniardes frenche men gaſcoyns great ioye ſayde beholde yonder lixbonoyes valyant men ſithe come ſeke batayle shortely let v go feldes lette v cloſe among v waye entent retourne nat agayne than̄e ordayned publyſſhed hooſt euery man saturdaye mornynge foote horſebacke ſhuld iſſue ſaynt yrayns drawe towardes ennemyes fyght euery man made hym redy ioyfull iourney ſaturday mornynge ſowned trumpettes kynge herde maſſe caſtell drāke lepte horſe euery man hym ſo drewe felde good aray batayle sir raynolde limoſin marſhall hooſt formaſt ſente forthe ſcurrers aduyſe dealynge ennemyes ſe nombre frenchman ſente forthe two ſquyers one burgonion gaſcone burgonyon called wylliam mōtigny ſir iohan rey gaſcoyne bierne ſent forthe bertrande barge bothe ſame day made knightes rode forth chatellayne caſtell good man armes called peter ferant medyne marueylous light genet whyle theſe thre rode forthe aduyſe enemyes ye reſydue hooſt rode ſofte paſe nombre two thouſande ſpeares knyghtes ſquiers gaſcoyns burgonyons frenchman picardes breton aſ well apoynted armed men might twētie thouſande ſpanyardes horſbacke nat rydden forthe vowe ſhotte ſtode ſtyll ſyde kynge portyngale lykewiſe ſent forthe thre ſcurrers vieu iuſtely demeanyng ſpaniardes wherof two englyſſhe ſquyers expert men armes one called iaquyne dartebery philippe barqueſton ferrant de la groſſe portingale well horſed rode forthe tyll came lytell hyll might well ſe behauynge ſpanyardes retourned kynge portyngale counſayle ther made relacyon done ſayd sir haue ben ſo farre forwarde haue ſene enemyes ſir ſurely great nombre welle thyrtie thouſāde horſe therfore ſir take aduyſe kyng demaunded rode one batayle nat sir quod ſutelye two batayls kyng turned hym towarde people ſayd loude sir nowe aduyſe well nedeth nowe cowardneſſe ſhall fight ſhortelye enemyes comyng hath gret deſyre fynde v ſo ſhall nat flye retourne iſſued lixbone great nombre people thynke ſirs well lette v ſelle lyues dere ye haue made kyng daye ſhall ſe yf crowne portyngale wyll abyde peaſably nat ſirs one thyng yeſure ſhall nat flye abyde aduenture anſwered good wyll ſo ſhall abyde englyſſhe capitayns called forthe northbery hartefell thē mooſt experte armes kynge demaunded counſayle wolde gyue hym howe abyde aduenture batayle ſayd knewe well muſt nedes fyght enemyes aproched faſte nombre four agaynſt one v englyſſhmen ſayd sir ſithe ſhall haue bataile greatter nombre wherfore harde ꝑtie nat cōquere without take ſome aduaūtage ſome hedge buſſhes lette v take ſuche groūde may fortify ſhall nat entre vpon v ſo lightely ſhulde playne felde sir quod kynge ye ſpeke wyſely ſhalbe ye haue deuyſed counſayle englyſſhmen kyng reſted ther toke aduyſe groūde might take nat farre fro towne iuberothe great vyllage thyder lixbonoyes ſent prouiſion ſomers caryages entenſion night lodge wheder batayle might ſcape honour without towne quarter leage therabout ther great abbey monkes whyder iuberothe vyllages wonte come maſſe churche ſtandeth lytell oute waye moote enuyroned great tree hedge buſſhes ſtronge place lytell helpe englyſſhmen called counſayle kynge thoughe fewe yet kynge wolde folowe moche aduyſe than̄e ſayde sir knowe hereby place mynſter without iuberoth among tree ſtandeth ſtronge place lytell amendement helpe ſuche knewe countre ſayd ſir true kyng ſayd let v drawe thyder let v order ſelfe men warr ought ſo whan oure enemyes come let thē nat fynde v vn ꝓuided incōtynēt done ſo came wher churche whan englyſſhe men ſir monges naueret dyuers valyāt men 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 portugale lixbone well aduyſed place roūde ſayd place ſtronge ynough lytell helpe ſo maye abyde aduenture ſyde nexte feldes cutte downe tree layde one ouer another thentente horſemen ſhulde nat come full courſe lafte one waye open nat large ſuche archer croſ bowes ſette euery ſyde waye men armes fote playne within way churche one ſyde ther kyngꝭ baners pight vp whan thus ordered euery thynge great ioye ſayd pleaſed god well ſuche place kepe longe make good iourney kynge ſayd fayre ſirs day euery man parte thynke nat flye nat aueyle v farr fro lixbone alſo chaſe ther recoueryng thre wyll ſlee beate downe xii flyenge therfore ſhewe daye ye men prowes ſelle derely lyues ymagyn ſelfe howe iourney ſhalbe ſhalbe god pleaſed ſhall moche honoured ſpoken ſtraūge countreis tidynges ſhall come alwayes victours exalted diſconfyted diſprayſed ſirs thynke howe ye haue made kynge wherfore ye ought hardy coragyous one thyng ye ſure long axe endureth hādes ſhall fight fayle orbreke ſhall get another ſhewe ſelfe wyll mentayne defende crowne portyngale ſelfe right haue ſucceſſyon brother whiche take ſoule myne enemyes traueyleth wrong fully quarell myne ſuche harde kynge ſayd ſir grace mercy ye admoneſt v wyſelye ſir ſhall helpe ayde maynteyne haue gyuen whiche owne sir ſhall abyde ſame place ſhall nat departe without god departe v sir make crye youre people euery man hath nat herde ſpeke cōmaundyng payne dethe man flye ſir faynt harted abyde batayle let come forthe gyue thē leaue departe fro one faynt harte may dyſcourage two doſyn good men el ſtryke heedes preſens gyue enſample kyng anſwered wyll ſo two knightes ordayned go ſertche euery cōpany demaunde abaſſhed abyde batayle meſſangers reported kyng whan retourned coude fynde man redy abyde aduenture batayle ſo moche better quod kyng kyng cauſed wolde made knightes come hym wolde gyue order knighthod name god ſaynt george vnderſtāde ther made threſcore newe knightꝭ wherof kyng great ioye dyd ſette front batayle ſayd thē ſirs order knighthode noble highe herte thynke knight ought cowarde ſhamefull ought fierſe hardy lyon whā helme heed ſeyth ennemyes bycauſe wolde ye ſhulde day ſhewe prowes wher ought ſhewed therfore ordayne firſt front bataile ſirs ſo maye haue honour alſo otherwyſe ſpurres yuell ſet euery knight anſwered tourne fell paſſed kynge sir pleaſure god ſhall ſo haue grace loue thus portyng alois ordred ſelfe fortifyed beſyde churche iuberoth portyngale daye engliſſhman wolde made knight yet deſyred kyng excuſed ſelfe day ¶of ſpanyardes howe ordered ſelfe batayle cap xxxiiii nowe let v retourne kynge iohan caſtell knyghtꝭ ſquyers fraūce gaſcone ther ſuch ſent aduyſe enemyes retourned agayne ſayd sir kyng ye lordes knightes preſent haue rydded ſo forwarde haue ſene oure enemyes accordyng iuge nat paſte ten thouſande men one mynſter iuberothe ther reſted ſette order batayle ſhall founde ſoeuer wyll ſeke kyng called hym counſayle ſpecially baron knightes fraunce demaūded beſt anſwered ſayd sir thynke beſt let fought incontynent ſe nothyng elles reported frayed great doute bycauſe ſo farre fro fortreſſe lixbone farre ſixe leages nat ronne thyder eaſe ſhalbe ouertaken ye waye without take aduaūtage night therfore ſir counſayle ſithe ye knowe order batayls go fyght whyle people good wyll well kyng demaunded thē owne countre opinyons ſir dangonyes mendant ſir dygo parſement pier gouſſart moūtdaſque pier ferrant valeſque great mayſter caletrane anſwered kynge ſayd sir haue well harde knightes fraunce howe wolde haue hotely ſette enemyes sir wyll ye knowe alſo come thē wyll nyght ye ſe ſonne draweth downe warde yet ye haue nat ordred youre batayls sir therfore thynke good ye taryed tyll mornynge lette v drawe ſo nere laye ſo good ſpyall dyuers place wolde diſlodge aboute mydnight departe lette v alſo dyſlodge nat flye ſcape v countre ſo playne place hyde lixbone whiche nat gette eaſe ſir counſayle gyne kyng ſtode ſtyll lytell caſte downe loke erthe tourned regarde ſtraūgers thā marſhall ſir raynolde lymoſin ſayd pleaſe frēchmen langage spaygne entent might better vnderſtande euery man ſo turned hym ſpanyardes ſuche gyuen kyng counſayle sayeng callyng euery man name ſirs howe ye ſage batayls vſed armes theſe valyant knightes preſent howe ye deuyſe thyng beyond ſhulde valure haue done nothyng el life dayes traueyll fro realme realme fynde dedes armes howe durſt deuiſe thyng agaynſt wordes whiche ſo noble ſo highe kepe honour kyng realme wherin ye haue greatter parte ye haue herytages bodyes haue nothyng nowe al onely bodyes whiche wyll firſte formaſt put aduenture ſo haue deſyred kyng haue firſt batayle kyng hath graunted regarde great noble courage whan wyll firſt aduenture thē ſelfe ſhulde ſeme ye haue enuy ye wolde profyte honoure ſhulde come whiche ye ought nat one accorde wyll alſo youre counſayle kyng hath ben feldes longe great coſt charge hym layne ſiege lixbone coude neuer haue aduenture batayle tyll nowe hym writeth hym ſelfe kyng portyngale wherin hath right baſtarde nat dyſpenſed felde ſuche frēdes hath whiche great nombre nowe crafte ſhulde agayne withdrawe hym ſelfe nat fought ye put ſelfe aduē ture hole hooſt ſhulde ryſe ſlee el kyng ſhulde repute traytours ſtrike heedes cō fyſke landes therfore ſe better way ſtyll let alone hath ſene ſuche buſyneſſes ye neuer ſawe haue done neuer ſhall ye kynge loked vp ſemynge gladde thoſe wordes ſpanyardꝭ abaſſhed feared done gretter treſpace dyd though marſhall reproued ſpake agaynſt yet well ſpoken truely coū ſayled kyng valyantneſſe pleaſe ſtrangers deſyred batayle marſhall ſpake dyde euery man ſtyll kynge ſayd wyll name god ſaynt iames enemyes fought ſuche wyll made knyghtes cōe forth wyll gyue thē thordre knight hode honour god ſaynt george ther came forthe many ſquyers frāce byerne made knightes kyngꝭ hande ſir roger ſpayne edmōde ſon ſir roger coūtie foiz ser bertrand barroge ſir peter salebere ſir peter valentyne ſir wylliam quere ſir anger sollenayre ſir peter vande ſir wyllyam montigny one nōbre hundred xl ther certayne baron bierne rayſed vp ther firſt baners alſo dyuers caſtell alſo ſir iohan rey might haue ben ſene amonge theſe newe knightes great nobleneſſe maynteyned ſelfe ſo goodly pleaſure beholde thē fayre batayle lorde loyngiache came kyng ſtrangers ſoeuer nacyon ſo ſpanyardꝭ named name ſtrangers ſaid kynge sir become fro farre partes ſerue sir requyre v grace let v haue firſt batayle content quod kyng name god ſaīt iames ſaynt george ayde ſpanyardes ſayd one another ſoftely beholde goddeſſake beholde howe kynge putteth truſte theſe frēchmen hath parfyte truſt none ſhall haue firſt batayle prayſe v nat ſo moche yt wyll take v wyll dede ſelfe lette v ſelfe let v let alone enterpriſe haue made auaunt howe ſtronge ynough diſcomfyte portugaloys lette ſo content good demaunded kynge wheder wyll abyde v el go frenchemen thervpon long murmuryng wheder ſhulde demaūde el ſtyll douted greatly wordes ſir raynolde lymoſin thynges conſydred thought none yuell demaunde hym queſtyon ſixe mooſt notableſt wente kynge enclyned ſelfe ſayd right noble kyng ſe vnderſtand well aparent ſignes day ye ſhall haue batayle youre enemyes god ſende grace honoure vyctorie greatly deſyre sir wolde knowe wheder pleaſure lyeth amonge fenēchmen el v fayre ſirs ꝙ kyng though haue graunted firſt batayle theſe knightes ſquyers ſtraūgers come farre ſerue valyant expert men warres yet renounce nat wyll abyde amonge therfore ſirs helpe defende anſwere ſpanyerdes great ioy well contented ſayd ſir ſo ſhall nat fayle dye quarell ſir ſworne ſo haue promiſed faithe bodyes whan ye crowned ſir loued ſo well kyng father nat ſayle wiſe truſt quod kyng thus kyng spayne abode among owne men well twentie thouſande horſmen couered ſtele sir raynolde lymoſin firſt batayle right ſo cauſe marſhall ſame ſaturday fayre daye ſonne tourned towarde euynſong firſt batayle came iuberoth kyng portugale men redy receyue thē theſe frenche knightes two thouſāde ſpeares freſſhe well ordred men coulde deuyſed ſoone ſawe enemyes ioyned toguyder lyke men warre aproched good order tyll came within bowe ſhotte firſt comyng ther harde rē countre ſuche deſyred aſſayle wyn grace prayſe entred ſtrayte way englyſſhmen policy fortyfied thē bycauſe thentre ſo narowe great preaſe great miſchefe ye aſſaylātes ſuche englyſſhe archer ſhot ſo holly toguyder arowes pearſed men horſe whan horſes full arowes fell one vpon another englyſſhmen armes portugaloys lyxbonoyes came cryeng cryes lady portugale good ſpeares ſharpe heedes wherwith ſtrake hurte many knightes ſquyers lorde lanache bierne beaten downe baner taken priſoner many men taken ſlayne alſo ſir iohan ree ſir geffray richon ſir geffray parteney cōpanyes entred within ſtrayte horſes ſo hurte tharchers fell mayſters one vpon another theſe frenchman great danger coulde nat helpe one another roume enlarge ſelfe fight wyll whan portugaloys ſawe myſchefe fall firſt aſſaylers gladde freſſhe coragyous fyght men might kynge portugale baners hym mounted good horſe trapped armes portugale great ioye ſe yt myſchefe fall enemyes conforte people laughed ſayd highe forthe good men defēde fight good wyll ther mo theſe nede nat feare knewe euer thynge batayle theſe thus kyng portugale reconforted people fought valiātly encloſed ſtreight firſt aſſaylers whome ther many ſlayne true firſt batayle whiche theſe knightes fraūce bierne ledde thought haue ben quickelyer ayded ſpaynerdes kyng caſtyle company twentie thouſande men come another parte aſſayled portugaloys lykely iourney haue ben dyde nothynge wherfore blame receyued domage alſo dede frenchman ſette ſoone dyde thentent haue honoure maynteyne wordes ſpoken kyng alſo enformed ſpaynierdes wolde nat ſette ſo ſoone loued nat frenchman ſaid lette alone ſhall finde right well whōe ſpeke theſe frēchmen ar great vantours highe mynded alſo kyng hath ꝑfite truſt thē ſith kyng wolde ſhulde haue honour iourney let v ſuffre take el ſhall haue entētes thus thſe meanes ſpanynierdes ſtode ſtyll great batayle wolde nat go forwarde whiche right diſpleſant kyng coude nat amēde ſpaynierdes ſayd bycauſe ther none retourned fro batayle ſir ſurely theſe knightes fraūce haue diſconfyted enemyes thonour iourney god gyue grace quod kyng ſo let v ryde ſomwhat forwarde rode croſbowe ſhotte forwarde agayne reſted great beautie ſe ſo well moūted armed mean ſeaſon frenchman fought ſuche leyſar light fought valiātly dyuers knightes ſquyers eyther partie dyd many feates armes one vpon another whan ſpeares fayled toke ax gaue many great ſtrokes helmes ſleyng maymynge eche ſoeuer ſuche caſe armes frenchman portugaloys iuberoth muſt abyde aduenture dyde without wolde flye awaye flyeng paryll abyde batayle flyeng lightly mooſt ſlayne batayle whan one ſeith ouermatched yeldeth hym ſelfe priſoner nat ſaid knightes fraunce bretayne burgoyne byerne right valiantly fought firſt encountre hardely handled counſayle englyſſhmen fortyfie place firſt batyle portugaloys ſtrōger enemyes ſo taken ſlayne fewe ſaued ſo firſte brunt thouſande knightes ſquyers taken priſoners wherof portugaloys ioyfull thought day haue batayle ſo made good chere priſoners euery man ſayd priſoners sir nat abaſſhed ye clene feate armes ſhall kepe good company wolde ye ſhuld ye hadde v lyke caſe ye ſhall come lixbone refreſſhe ſhalbe eaſe thanked theym whan ſawe none bote ſo ſome put fynaunce incōtynent ſome wolde abyde aduenture ymagined kynge spaygne great armye wolde ſhortely come delyuer ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe frenche knightes gaſcoyns ſuche taken priſoners iuberoth portugaloys ſlayne mayſters none eſcaped cap xxxv tidynges came felde kyng caſtyle companye aprochynge iuberoth thē fledde cāe cryeng great feare ſayd ſir kyng auaunce ſelfe ye vowarde outher taken ſlayne remedy delyueraunce without puyſſaunce whan kyng caſtyle herde thoſe tidyngꝭ ſore diſpleaſed good cauſe touched hym nere cōmaū ded ryde ſayd auaūce baners name god ſaynt george lette v ryde reſcue ſithe men haue nede therof ſpaynierdes began ryde better paſe clooſe toguyder good order tyme ſonne nere downe thā ſome ſayd beſt abyde tyll mornyng bycauſe ſo nere night ſaid coude make eaſy iourney kynge wolde ſhulde ſette incontynent layde reaſons ſaid ſhall leaue enemyes reſt nowe wery gyue leyſar te refreſſhe ſelfe whoſoeuer gyue counſayle loueth nat myne honoure rode forthe makyng great noyſe brunt ſo wnyng trumpettes tabour abaſſhe therwith enemyes nowe ſhall ſhewe kyng portugale dyd company ſoone diſcōfited vowarde taken priſoners ſawe none batayle comyng wt ſight yet wolde put truſt firſt vyctorie therfore ſent ſixe notable perſons go aui • coū trey ſe ſhulde haue rode forthe came ſawe kynge caſtelles great batayle comyng warde faſt approchynge iuberothe twentie thouſande horſmen retourned faſt might ſayde highe people sir aduyſe well yet haue done nothyng beholde yonder cometh kyng caſtyle great batayle mo twentie thouſande men none taryed behynde whā herde thoſe tidynges toke ſhorte counſayle whiche neceſſyte incontynent ordayned pyteous dede euery man cōmaunded payne dethe ſlee priſoners without mercy noble gentyll ryche none except lordes knightes ſquyers priſoners harde caſe prayer auayled fro dethe ſo ſlayne ſome one place ſome another ſpredde abrode vnarmed wenyng haue ben ſaued nat ſay trouth great pytie euery man ſlewe priſoner dyd nat men ſlewe th • handes portugaloys englyſſhmen gyuen counſayle ſayd better ſlee ſlayne kylle nat whyle fightynge wyll eſcape ſlee v • truſt mānes enemy thus ſlayne great miſchiefe lorde longnache ſir peter byerne lorde leſpres lorde • rne lorde boordes ſir bertrande bergues lorde morayne ſir raymōde douzanche ſir iohan fologe ſir manant sarenen ſir peter salybers ſir stephyn valentyne ſir raymon couraſe ſir peter hanſame nombre thre hundred ſquyers byerne fraunce ſir iohan rue ſir geffray richon ſir geffray partenay diuers lo beholde great yuell aduenture felle ſaturday ſlewe many good priſoners wolde well haue ben worthe one another foure hundred thouſande frankes ¶howe kynge caſtell great batayle diſcōfyted kyng portugale vyllage called iuberoth cap xxxvi whan lixbonoiſe englyſſhe portugaloyſe delyuered place ſlayne priſoners neuer one ſcaped without conueyed vyllage iuberoth caryages drewe togyder feirſe wyll ſame place firſt aſſayled ſonne goyng downe kyng caſtell puyſſant array baners penons dyſplayed mounted horſes well couered came cryeng caſtell began entre ye place fortified receyued ſperes ax firſt comyng ſhotte arowes greued ſore horſes ſo many therby ſlayne ouerthrowen ſeaſon kyng caſtell men knewe nat myſchiefe fallen vowarde nat ſlayne beleued ben ſtyll priſoners thynkynge recouer agayne ye haue herde harde batayle fyerſe many man caſte erthe portugalois ſuche aduaūtage nat fought valiantly ben loſte diſcō fyted ſaued thē enemyes coude nat come theym one narowe waye kyng portyngale lyghted fote toke axe hande dyd marueylous armes beate downe thre four owne handes ſo feared none durſt aproche nere ſhall ſhew ſome parte cōdycions ſpaniardes trewe firſt ſettyng fierſe coragyous great aduauntage hyghe mynded haue auauntage fight well horſ backe ſoone haue caſte two thre dartes gyuen ſtroke ſwerde ſe enemyes nat diſcōfyted therwith feare turne horſes flye awaye ſaue ſelfe beſt maye bataile iuberoth vſed ſame playe foūde enemyes harde ſtrong freſſhe batayle though done nothynge daye wherof marueyle alſo harde tidynges vowarde become ſpayniardꝭ euenyng harde fortune batayle perylous many entred ſtrength valyantneſſe feates armes ſlayne toke man raūſom whatſoeuer noble ſo lixbonoys ordayned wolde nat charged priſoners • ſlayne caſtell ſuche foloweth sir dangonnes nendreche ſir digo perſement ſir peter roſermont ſir mare verſaux great maiſter caleſtrane brother daye made knight called ſir dygomor ſir peter gouſſart mō deſque peter gouſſart sonuyll iohan radigo rouſell threſcore baronnes knightes spaygne batayle naders prince wale diſconfyted kyng henry caſtell nat ſlayne ſo many noble men caſtell batayle iuberoth whiche yere grace thouſande thre hū dred fourſcore fyue ſaturday oure lady day auguſt whan kyng caſtell vnderſtode ſawe howe menne thus diſconfyted howe vowarde clene diſconfyted without recouery ſir raynalt lymoſin deed marſhall ſawe howe noble chiualty loſt well owne realme fraunce elles ſuche come thider ſerue good wylles ſore diſpleaſed wyſte nat counſayle take ſawe mē began flye euery ſyde herde howe ſome ſayd hym ſir deꝑte hen tyme mater herde caſe ye nat alone diſconfyte enemyes recouer domages people flyeth euery man intendeth ſaue hym ſelfe sir ſaue youre ſelfe ye wyſely fortune day agaynſt another tyme ſhall better kynge caſtyle beleued coūſayle chaunged horſe mounted freſſhe courſer ſtrong light wheron man rydden daye kyng ſtrake horſe ſpurres tourned backe towarde enemyes toke waye towarde ſaynt yrayne whyder ſuche wolde ſaue themſelfe fledde ſame tyme kyng caſtell hadde knight houſe bare baſſenet whervpon ſercle golde ſtones valued twentie thouſande frankes ordayned went ſaynt yrayne knight ſhulde beare tyll came buſyneſſe delyuer kynge weare heed knight dyd nat ſo whan came ioyninge batayle preaſe ſo great knyght coude nat cōe kynge alſo nat called wherfore aproched nat ye kyng whan ſawe howe cōpany diſcomfyted portugaloys optayned vyctorie ſawe howe euery man fledde euery ſyde feared leſyng ſuch riche iowell ſet baſſenet owne heed ſo fledde toke nat ye way ſaynt yrayne toke another waye towne arpent thus ſome fledde way ſome waye lyke people ſore diſconfyted abaſſhed mooſt parte fledde ſaynt yrayne euenynge thyder came kyng ſore abaſſhed diſconfyture ſpaynierdes iuberothe portugaloys lixbonoys optayned place • great ſlaughter men ben gretter folowed chaſe thengliſſh men whan ſawe ſpaygniardes tourne backes ſayd kyng portugale men sir demaunde yo • horſes folowe chaſe fledde ſhalbe outher taken ſlayne naye nat ſo quod kynge ſuffyceth haue done oure men wery ſore traueyled nere hande night ſhall nat knowe whyder go thoughe flye yet great nombre paraduenture drawe v ſtrength ſo haue v eaſe let v daye kepe deed morowe take counſayle faythe ſir quod harteſell englyſſhman deed bodyes eaſy kept ſhall neuer v hurte ſhall haue profyte haue ſlayne many good priſoners ſtraungers come farre ſerue therfore wolde fayne wynne ſomwhat theſe calues flye without wynges banner wauyng wynde fayre brother quod kyng coueteth leſeth better ſure ſythe honour vyctorie god hath ſende v rather putte ſelfe paryll whan nedeth nat thāke god haue ynowe make ryche thus caſe buſyneſſe reſted thus haue ſhewed felle buſyneſſe iuberothe kynge portugale optayned vyctorie • ſlayne fyue hundred knightes many ſquyers whiche great pytie domage ſixe ſeuyn thouſande men god haue mercy ſoules night tyll ſōday hour prime kyng portugale men remoued nat fro place neuer vnarmed thē eate lytell drāke euery man ſtode whiche brought fro vyllage iuberothe ſonday mornyng ſonne ryſinge kynge cauſed twelfe knightes mount horſes ryde forthe ſertche felde • ſe newe aſſemble whan • ydden retourned ſhewed founde body deed men well quod kyng nede nat doute publyſſhed departe then go vyllage iube rothe thereto abyde day night tyll monday mornynge thus departed lefte churche iuberothe went vyllage lodged taryed ſondaye nexte nyght monday mornyng coū ſayled drawe towarde lixbone ſowned trumpettes diſlodge ſo gode order deꝑted rode towarde lixbone tueſday kynge entred ye towne moche people glorie tryumphe receyued proceſſyon ſo brought palays ryding ſtretes people chyldren made feeſt reuerence cryed highe voice lyue noble kyng portugale whome god hath gyuen grace haue vyctorie puyſſaunt kynge caſtyle hath diſconfyted enemyes bi iourney kyng portugale kyng caſtyle felle ſuche grace loue countrey realme portugale ſo ſuche batayle dyd diſſimule hym came hym lixbone hym homage ſayeng howe well worthy lyue howe god loued hym diſconfyted puiſſaūt kynge himſelfe wherfore worthy beare crowne thus kynge gatte grace people ſpecially common realme ¶nowe let v lytell ſpeke kyng caſtyle thus diſconfyted went ſaynt yrayn pynge lamentyng people curſyng harde fortune ſo many noble mē owne countre fraunce ſlayne felde ſame tyme entred ſaynt yrayne yet knewe nat domage ſō daye knewe ſende haraldꝭ ſertche deed bodyes thought mooſt parte ſuche harauldes foūde deed bene priſoners ſaued lyue nat appered ſo ſore diſpleaſed ſorie man coulde comforte hym whan herde reporte harauldes knewe certentie deed ſayd ſware ſhulde neuer haue ioye ſythe ſo many noble men deed quarell thirde daye kyng taryed ſaynt yrayne came knight baſſenet called ſir martyn haren delyuered baſſenet kynge whiche valued ye haue herde ben herde wordes ſpoken hym ſaid falſely ronne awaye fro kynge wolde neuer retourne agayne knight kneled downe kyng excuſed hym ſelfe ſo largely kynge counſayle well content hym fyftene dayes kynge caſtyle retourned bergus spayne gaue euerye man leaue deꝑte • meanes treaty made bytwene kynge caſtyle kyng portugale truce taken fro feeſt ſaynt mychaell firſt day may bothe lande see deed bodyes ſlayne iuberothe buryed churche iuberoth mother church aboute bone dyuers caryed ſeruaūtes owne countreis ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe ſpyrite called orthone ſerued lorde coraſſe long tyme brought hym euer tidynges frō partes worlde cap xxxvii great marueyle conſyder one thynge whiche ſhewed therle foiz houſe ortayſe hym enfourmed buſyneſſe iuberothe ſhewed one thyng haue oftentymes thought ſithe ſhall longe lyue ſquyer tolde trouthe nexte daye bataile thus fought iuberoth erle foiz knewe wherof great marueyle ſayd ſonday monday tueſday therle penſyfe ſo ſadde chere man coulde worde hym ſame thre dayes wolde nat iſſue chambre ſpeke man thoughe neuer ſo nere hym tueſday night called hym brother arnault guyllyam ſayde hym ſofte voyce men hath wherof ſorie come voyage ſayd departed arnault guyllyam ſage knyght knewe right well brother cōdicions ſtode ſtyll gaue none anſwere therle thought declare mynde plainlye long borne trouble therof herte ſpake agayne hygher than̄e dyd ſayd god ſir arnault ſaye ſhortely ye ſhall tidynges therof countrey bierne hūdred yere neuer loſte ſuche loſſe iourney haue done nowe portugale dyuers knyghtes ſquyers preſent herde hym ſay ſo ſtode ſtyll durſt nat ſpeke remembred wordes within ten dayes knewe trouthe therof ſuche ben buſyneſſe ſhewed euery thyng fortuned iuberothe therle renewed agayne dolour countrey ſorowe loſte parentes bretherne chyldren frendes saynt mary quod ſquyer ſhewed tale howe therle foiz coude knowe one day done within day two beynge ſo farre faythe ſir quod appered well knewe deuyner quod el hathe meſſangers flyeth wynde muſte nedes haue ſome crafte ſquyer began laughe ſayd surely muſte knowe ſome arte nigromanſye otherwyſe ſaye trouthe nat tell howe oure ymaginacions sir quod ſuche ymaginacion ye haue therin pleaſe ſhewe wolde gladde therof ſuch thynge ought ſecrete ſhall nat publyſſhe long countre ſhall neuer ſpeke worde thereof praye therof ꝙ ſquyer wolde nat ſhulde knowen ſhulde ſpeke therof ſhall ſhewe dyuers men ſpeketh ſecretelye whan togyder frendes drewe parte corner chapell ortayſe began tale ſayd well twentie yeres paſte countrey barone called raymon lorde coraſſe whiche ſeuyn leages fro towne ortaiſe lorde coraſſe yt ſame tyme plee auygnon pope dyſmes churche agaynſt clerke curate whiche preeſt cateloygne great cleke claymed haue ryght dyſmes towne coraſſe whiche valued hūdred florens yere right ſhewed proued ſentence diffynityue pope vrbane fyfte conſiſtory generall condempned knight gaue iugement preeſt laſt iugement letter pope poſſeſſion ſo rode tyll came bierne ſhewed letter bulles pope poſſeſſion diſmes lorde coraſe great indignacion preeſt cāe hym ſaid mayſter pe • maiſter marten name thynkeſt yu reaſon thy letter wyll leſe myne herytage nat ſo hardy yt thou take thynge myne thou ſhall coſte thy lyfe go thy waye ſome place get benefyce myne herytage thou getteſt parte one alwayes defende clerke douted knight cruell man therfore durſte nat parceyuer thought retourne auygnon dyde whan departed came knight lorde coraſſe ſayd sir force nat right ye take away fro right churche wherin ye greatly hurte cōſcience nat ſo ſtrong coū trey ye ſir knowe trouthe ſoone maye ſhall ſende ſuche champyon whome ye ſhall doute knight douted nothyng thretnynges ſayd god thou mayſt doute dethe lyfe thy wordes wyll nat leſe myne herytage thus clerke departed fro lorde coraſſe went nat tell wheder auygnon cateloygne forgate nat promyſe made lorde coraſſe departed afterwarde whan knyght thought leeſt hym thre monethes knyght laye nyght bedde caſtell coraſſe ladye wyfe came hym meſſangers viſyble made marueylous tempeſt noiſe caſtell ſemed thoughe caſtell ſhulde haue fallen downe ſtrake gret ſtrokes chambre dore good ladye wyfe ſoore afrayde knyght herde ſpake worde therof bycauſe wolde ſhewe abaſſhed corage hardy abyde aduentures noyſe tempeſt ſondrie place • caſtell dured longe ſpace laſte ceſſed nyght nexte mornynge ſeryaūtes houſe came lorde whan ryſen ſayd sir haue nat herde night haue done lorde dyſſymuled ſayd herde nothyng haue herde ſhewed noyſe hadd herde howe veſſell kechyn ouertourned lorde began laughe ſayde yea ſirs ye dremed nothynge wynde name god quod ladye herde well nexte night great noyſe greatter ſuche ſtrokes gyuen chambre dore wyndowes ſhulde haue broken peces knyght ſtarte vp bedde wolde nat lette demaunde chambre dore tyme ye night anone aunſwered voyce ſayde quod knyght ſent hyder clerke catelloygne ſent hyder quod voyce thou doſt gret wronge thou haſt taken fro hym ryghtes benefyce wyll nat leaue reſt tyll thou haſte made hym good accompte ſo pleaſed quod knyght thy name arte ſo good meſſangere ꝙ ame called orthone orthone quod knyght ſeruyce clerke lytell profyte wyll putte moche payne thou beleue hym pray leaue hym come ſerue ſhall gyue good thanke orthone redy aunſwere amouts knyght ſayde woldeſt thou fayne haue ſeruyce yea truely quod knyght ſo thou hurte perſone houſe wyll quod orthon haue power yuel awake thy ſlepe ſome well quod knyght tell ſhall ſoone agree leaue yuell clerke good thyng put payne therfore cōe ſerue well ꝙ orthon ſythe thou wylte haue agreed ſpyrite orthone loued ſo knight often tymes wolde cōe vyſite hym whyle laye bedde ſlepe outher pull hym care el ſtryke chambre dore wyndowe awake hym whan knyght awoke wolde ſaye orthon let ſlepe nay quod orthone wyll nat tyll haue ſhewed ſuche tidynges fallen late lady knyghtes wyfe wolde ſore afrayed heer wolde ſtande vp hyde ſelfe vnder clothes than̄e knight wolde ſaye tidynges haſte thou brought quod orthone come englande hungry ſome place yeſterdaye came then ſuche thynges fallen ſuche thus lorde coraſſe knewe orthon euery thynge done parte worlde caſe contynued fyue yere coude nat kepe owne counſayle laſte diſcouered erle foiz ſhall ſhewe howe firſte yere lorde coraſſe came daye orthayſe erle foiz ſayd hym ſir ſuche thynges done englā de scotlande almaygne countrey euer erle foiz founde ſayeng true great marueyle howe ſhulde knowe ſuche thyngꝭ ſo ſhortly tyme therle foiz examyned hym ſo ſtraitly lorde coraſe ſhewed hym toguyder howe knewe howe came hym firſte whan erle foiz herde ioyfull ſayd sir coraſſe kepe hym well loue wolde hadd ſuche meſſangere coſteth nothynge ye knowe hym euery thynge done worlde knight anſwered ſayd ſir true thus lorde coraſſe ſerued orthon long ſeaſon nat ſaye orthone hadde mo mayſters nat euery weke twyſe thriſe wolde come vyſite lorde coraſſe wolde ſhewe hym ſuche tidynges thyng fallen fro whens came euer lorde coraſſe whan knewe thynge wrote therof euer erle foiz great ioy therof lorde worlde mooſt deſyred newes ſtraunge place tyme lorde coraſſe erle foiz erle demaunded hym ſaid sir coraſſe dyd ye euer yet ſe meſſangere naye ſurely ſir quod knyght neuer deſyred marueyle quod erle well acquaynted hym ye wolde haue deſyred haue ſene hi wherfore praye deſyre hym tell whet forme facyon haue herde ſay howe ſpeketh good gaſcone outher truely ſir quod knight ſo ſpeketh well fayre v bothe ſurely ſir ſithe ye counſayle ſhall payne ſe hym ſo night lay bedde lady wyfe ſo enured orthon ſhe afrayde hym came orthon pulled lord eare faſt ſlepe therwith awoke aſked • quod orthon demaūded fro whens comeſt yu nowe come ꝙ orthon fro prage boeſme howe farre hen quod knyght threſcore dayes iourney quod orthone arte thou come then ſo ſoone quod knight ye truely quod orthon came faſt wynde faſter haſt thou wynges quod knight nay truely ꝙ howe canſte thou flye ſo faſte quod knyght ye haue nothyng knowe quod orthone quod knight wolde gladly ſe knowe forme thou arte well ꝙ orthon ye haue nothing knowe ſufficeth ſhewe tidyngꝭ faythe ꝙ knyght wolde loue moche better myght ſe one well ꝙ orthone ſir ſithe ye haue ſo great deſyre ſeme firſte thynge ye ſe morowe whan yt ryſe bedde ſame ſhalbe ſufficient quod lorde go thy way gyue leaue departe nyght next mornynge lorde roſe lady wyfe ſo afrayd ſhe durſt nat ryſe fayned ſelfe ſicke ſayd ſhe wolde nat ryſe huſbande wolde haue haue ryſen ſir quod ſhe ſhall ſe orthone wolde nat ſe good wyll well ꝙ knight wolde gladly ſe hym ſo aroſe fayre eaſely bedde ſat downe bedde ſyde wenyng haue ſene orthon owne ꝓperforme ſawe nothyng wherby might ſaye loyonder orthon daye paſſed nexte night came whan knyght bedde orthon came began ſpeke accuſtomed go thy waye quod knight thou arte alyer thou promyſeſt ſhulde haue ſene nat ſo quod ſhewed ſelfe nat ſo ꝙ lorde ꝙ orthon whā ye roſe bedde ſawe nothynge lorde ſtudyed lytell aduyſed hymſelfe well yes truely quod knyght nowe remembre ſatte beddes ſyde thynkynge ſawe two ſtrawes pauement tumblyng one vpon another ſame ꝙ orthone fourme dyde put ſelfe nat ynoughe quod lorde praye putte thy ſelfe ſome fourme maye better ſe knowe well ꝙ orthon ye wyll ſo moche yt ye wyll leſe go fro ye deſyre moch naye quod knyght thou ſhalte nat go fro let ſe one wyll deſyre well quod orthone ye ſhall ſe morowe take hede firſte thynge ye ſe ye chābre ſhalbe well quod knight cōtent go thy way lette ſlepe ſo orthone departed nexte mornynge lorde roſe yſſued chambre went wyndowe loked downe courte caſtell caſte eyen firſte thynge ſawe sowe greatteſt euer ſawe ſhe ſemed ſo leane yuell fauoured nothyng ſkynne bone long eares longe leane ſnout lorde coraſſe marueyle leane sowe wery ye ſight cōmaunded men fetche houndes ſayd lette dogges hunt dethe deuoure ſeruauntes opyned kenelles lette houndes dyde ſette ſowe laſte ſowe made great crye loked vp lorde coraſſe loked wyndowe ſo ſodaynely vanyſſhed awaye man wyſte howe lorde coraſſe entred chambre right penſyue remembred hym orthon meſſangere ſayd repent ſette hoūdes hym aduenture euer hym ſayd often tymes diſpleaſed hym ſhulde leſe hym lorde ſaid trouthe neuer came caſtell coraſſe alſo knight dyed ſame yere next folowynge lo ſir quod ſquyer thus haue ſhewed lyfe orthone howe ſeaſon ſerued lorde coraſſe newe tidynges true ſir ꝙ nowe firſte purpoſe erle foiz ſerued ſuche meſſangere surely quod ſquier ymaginacion many hath ſuche meſſāgers • nothynge done place ſette mynde therto wyll knowe whan men thynke leeſt therof ſo dyde whan good knightes ſquyers countrey ſlayne portugale iuberothe ſaythe knowledge ſuche thynges hath done hym moche profyte value spone loſte houſe none wyll knowe whe • thus toke leaue ſquyer went cō pany bare well awaye tale ¶nowe wyll leaue ſpeke buſynes portugale spaygne ſpeke buſyneſſe languedocke fraūce ⸫ ⸪ ¶howe ſiege layde breſte bretaygne howe dyuers englyſſhe fortreſſes countre tholous recouered turned frenche cap xxxviii ſeaſon whyle theſe aduentures thus felle caſtyle far • marcheſſe ordayned ſir olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce make baſtyde ſtrong caſtell breſt bretaygne whiche englyſſhmen helde done longe wolde nat departe nother frenche kyng duke bretayne caſtell ſhulde partayne duke berrey duke burgoyne frenche kynges counſayle hadde oftentymes written duke bretayne deſyring hym putte payne dilygence gette agayne enheritaūce caſtell breſt gretly preiudyce ſuffre englyſſhmen enioye duke prayer ſayde lordes alſo bycauſe wolde gladly haue poſſeſſion breſt owne hādes tyme layd ſiege therto nothyng wan ſo departed then ſayd howe coude nothyng • wherat ſome knightes ſquyers murmured ſayde howe duke dyd diſſimule ſuche • tooke theym nat frendes wolde nat peace made caſtell breſt ſhulde frenche kynges handes frenchman helde ſhulde nat lorde therof yet rather englyſſhe men handes englyſſhe men durſt nat diſpleaſe wherfore thynges cōſydred conſtable fraūce thought caſtell breeſt towne nat mete enemy realme fraunce thought nat honorable duke knyghtes bretaygne ſuffre dyde therfore ordayned laye ſiege therto great nombre knyghtes ſquyers bretaygne made chiefe capitaynes lorde moleſtroyt vycount barleere morfane lorde roche duraunt theſe foure valyant men wente layde ſiege nere breſt might made baſtyde cloſed pale ſtones tooke fro breſt iſſues excepte see whiche nat power cloſe fro often tymes ſcrimyſſhes feates armes done ye barryers ſuche without deſyringe dedes armes wolde cōe valyantly barryers within receyued theym valyantly ſo often dyuers hurt bothe ꝑties fewe dayes ſome dedes armes done ſame ſeaſon marcheſſe tholouſyn valyant knyght fraūce called ſir galtier paſchac good capitayne men warre nacyon berrey fronters lymoſyn comynge ſeneſchall tholous ſir roger spaygne ſir hugh frodeuyll ſeneſchall carcaſſone hadde written fraunce conſtable ſtate countre tholous robeſtan howe dyuers companyons aduenturers ſuche yſſued lourde caſtell cuyllet made warre englyſſhmen helde handes fortreſſes folowyng ſaynt forget baſſere meſuylle purpuron cōuall roch • fort th • do iulyen naueret dyuers wherby ſo enuyroned cytie tholous people coude nat yſſue oute labour vynes landes go marchandyſe great paryll without truce pateſed theſe caſtels chiefe capitayne expert man warre baſque called eſpaigoullet dyd many marueylous dedes armes toke tyme ſcalynge caſtell armayle whyle lorde therof ſir raymonde gone tholous kepte yere meane ſeaſon whyle kepte cauſed made myne caue whiche went caſtell feldes whan caue made cloſed vp entre ſtones ſo coulde nat parceyued waye vnder yerthe ſame meane ſeaſon lorde raymonde armayle treated eſpayguollet haue agayne caſtell money whan caue finyſſhed agreed lorde delyuer vp caſtell two thouſande frankes deꝑte lorde entred agayne caſtell repayred defaulte fyftene dayes eſpaiguollet cō pany night came wode yſſue caue entred ſo hour mydnight toke caſtell lorde lyenge bedde raunſomed hym agayne two thouſande frankes let hym go eſpayguollet kept ſtyll caſtell good gariſon whiche ſore traueyled countrey alyaunce company theſe maner people robbed pylled thus march tholous rouergue vnder colour englyſſhmen therfore thyder ſente ſir gaultier paſchac certayne nombre men armes delyuer countre fro enemyes ſo came tholous ſent knyghtes ſquyers therabout wrote ſir roger spaygne ſeneſchall carcaſſone came ſerue hym ſir gaultier cōmiſſyon generall ouer offycers languedocke ſo ſuche ſent came ſuche nombres might make sir roger spayne came threſcore ſpeares hundred paueſſes ſeneſchall rouergue ſir hugh frodeuyll came many mo whan togyder four c ſpeares paueſſes alſo ſonne therle tereache fayre cōpany lorde barbaſon ſir benedic faguell willm̄ caudron breto • cōpanyes ſo one day departed fro tholous came ſaynt forgette reſted capitayne man bierne great robber called bourge taylſacke whan theſe lordes companyes come forget incontynent went aſſaut genowayes began ſore ſhote ſo yt ſcant within durſte apere defence frenchman myſt purpoſe firſt aſſaute▪ ſo lodged night toke eaſe ynoughe wherwith mornyng betymes armed throughe hoſt ſowned trumpettes aſſaute ſo came good ordre fote dyke ſene men armes entre dyke targettes ouer heedes taſted dyke ſpeares paſſed ouer fote wall wolde haue taken great pleaſur whan firſt paſſed ouer dyke ſhewed way folowed great wyll ben great blame taryed behynde cōpany ſuche folowed matockes pykes hādes pearſe withall walles couered heedes targettes receyue ſtones caſte downe whiche great plentie genowayes ſhotte ſo ſurely croſbowes non durſte put heedes defence genoways croſbowes ſhotte ſo ſurely lightly myſt nat leuell ſo ther many within ſore hurte quarelles ſo moche doughted ſore ſhotte ſaute ſo ſore contynued mynours ouerthrewe pane walle within ſore abaſſhed wolde haue yelded lyues ſaued enemyes luſte therto felle ſo good handes ſlayne ſir galtier capitayne cōmaūded ſhulde ſo ſo none taken mercye ſlayne nat one ſcaped thus theſe lordes fraunce firſt comynge caſtell forget ſir gaultier delyuered owner therof loſte ſame yere lacke good kepyng dyuers caſtelles bene fraunce ⸪ takyng caſtell forge • ſir gaultier delyuered ye owner knight newe repayred nede frenche men ſore dyſtroyed ye aſſayling therof went caſtell baſſe whiche erualton batefoyle capitayn greatly fortifyed thought frenche men wolde viſyte hym dyde whan frenche men came thyder layde ſiege therto aduyſed whiche ꝑte might beſt aduauntage gyue aſſaute determyned place ſo day came ſaut parte thought mooſt feble genowayes croſbowes ordayned ſhote aſſauters behynde thē acquyted ſelfe truely doyng feate ſhot ſo rudely within non durſt ſhewe thēſelfe erualton batefoyle ye gate great aſſaute dyde marueylous armes ſo moche enemyes ſayd among ſelfe beholde yonder ſquyer great herte whome harneſſe well enployed valyantly defended hym ſelfe well done ſome bodye ſhewe hym beſt hym yelde vp caſtell departe ſome elles ſhewe hym ſir gaultier paſchac wynne hym parforce ther man ſaue hym fro dethe hath ſworne many wynneth parforce ſhall dye hanged ſeneſchall tholous cōmaunded ſquyer gaſcoyne called wyllyam alyedell knewe ryght well erualton ben dyuers tymes hym armes companyon gladde go lothe erualton ſhulde haue hadd domage myght hym good ſo came aſſaute made token wolde ſpeke erualton great profyte anſwered content ſaut reſted ſyde nat parte wylliam ſayd erualton ye happy certayne yonder lordes haue ſende haue pyte ye taken parforce remedy dethe oure ſoueraygne capitayne hath ſo ordayned none ſhall ſcape dethe ser ued ſaynt forget therfore alſo wolde coū ſayle yelde vp ye fortreſſe rather abyde thaduēture one thyng ye may ſure ſhall nat departe hen tyll ye taken erualton ſayd william knowe well thoughe tyme ye agaynſt ye wolde nat coūſayle thyng diſhonour knowe trouthe rendre vp holde ſhalbe ſo myne may ſafely departe carye v moche maye ſafely conducted caſtell lourde condycion wyll ken elles nat sir quod wylliam haue nat ſo farre charge commen gladly ſhal ſpeke maiſters ſo retourned ſeneſchall tholous ſhewed hym theſe wordes ſir hughe frodeuyll ſayd lette v go ſpeke ſir gaultier nat tell wyll ſithe haue gone ſo farr mater wyll ſe came ſir gaultier ſtyll ſaute ſir hughe frodeuyll ſayd sir gaultier haue treated capitayne caſtel well wyllynge yelde vp caſtell v ſo maye go quite maye cary ſafely conducted caſtell lourde therfore nowe ſir loke ye wyll ſhulde leſe one knightes ſquyers outher ſhotte caſt ſtones perylous accident ſhulde gretter domage haue profyte puttyng dethe whan haue whiche nat yet wyll coſte v ſome people ſir true quod ſeneſchall carcaſſone ſuche aſſautes nat without ſome dethe ſore hurtyng thoſe wordes ſir galtier paſchac ſayd well cōtent ceaſe aſſaut haue place thus lytell lytell ſhall wynne caſtelles theſe pyllers holde though departe nowe good market paraduenture herafter maye fall agayne hādes one tyme ſhall paye euer yuell dedes come yuell ende dayes haue hanged drowned ſuche robber fyue hundred hereafter ſhall come fame pricke went treatie came agayne barryers erualton batefoyle wylliam ſaid faithe erualton maye thāke god ſir hughe frodeuyll hath made treatie ye demaunde ye may departe ſafely beare awaye moche ye ye ſhall ſafely brought lourde well quod erualton contente ſythe wyll better knowe trouthe wylliam ſhall departe fro fortreſſe ſore agaynſt wyll haue great profite therby ſyth taken bridge turnay beſyde maluoyſin burge ſpaygne raūſome two thouſande frankes ſaye trouthe haue well recouered ſelf euer haue ben theſe fronters whiche loue well whan ſo euer rode forthe lyghtely founde ſome good auēture outher ſome marchaūt robeſton tholous rodes mooſt parte euer gatte ſomwhat wylliam ſayd ſir beleue well ye wyll become frenche vndertake ye ſhalbe clene pardoned haue thouſande frākes gyuen wyll become youre ſuretie ye ſhalbe euer good frenche ye wyll ſwere ſelfe ſo sir ꝙ erualton thanke wyll nat wyll ſtill yet englyſſhe god helpe nat fynde herte good frenche returne company ſhewe daye wyll order oure buſyneſſe morowe mornyng ſhall delyuer vp caſtell departe wherfore ſe oure conducte redy ceaſſed ſaute frenchemen went lodgyngꝭ ſo paſſed night eaſe hadde well wherwith mornyng whan euery man redy hooſt redy yt ſhulde conducte cōpanyons caſtell lourde ſir hughe frodeuyll ſeneſchall tholous went take poſſeſſyon caſtell whan came caſtell founde erualton batefoyle company redy departe truſſed wolde cary knight lourde called ſir monant salenges conueyed thē ſafely wheder wolde thus caſtell baſſe wonne ſquyer countrey kepynge therof gyuen hym countrey called bertram monteſquyen theſe frēchmen went forthe came caſtell pulpuron wherof lytell mechyne ſouerayne capitayn done great domage countre therabout wherfore ſir galter paſchac ſware father ſoule yt non ther ſhuld take 〈◊〉 raūſome hanged might gette thē ſo 〈◊〉 ſiege caſtell ſtode rocke goodly caſtell loke ſir gaultier ſware neuer departe then tyll hadde pleaſure • many aſſautes wan lytell caſtell well defended well quod ſir galtier nat tell howe wyll frenche kynge ryche ynough kepe ſege wyll nat departe one yere without haue caſtell pleaſure ſuche hym beleued hym well ordred ſelfe therafter ſhall ſhewe howe fortued whan capitayns within ſawe ſurely howe frenchman wolde nat deꝑte then tyll caſtell ſoeuer coſt douted thē aduyſed departe then wheder frēchmen wolde nat might well hadde caue went caſtell vnder groūde wode halfe leage ſo whan angerot capiteyne caſtell ſawe dealyng frenchman knewe howe promiſed nat deꝑte then tyll caſtell outher famyne otherwiſe douted ſayd companye sir iſe well ſir gaultier paſchac hath v greatly hatered feare longe ſiege ſhulde famyſſhe v nedeth nat make baſtyde let kept hūdred ſpeares ſo none v dare deꝑte therfore ſhall ſhewe ſhall lette v take haue nyght wyll departe caue vnder erthe fayre great without faut ſhall bring v wode leage hen ſhall parell man hoſt knoweth agreed counſayle night whan hadde truſſed toke torch fagottes entred caue whiche fayre clere ſo iſſued therof wode halfe leage fro caſtell • ynowe knewe wayes fortereſſes lymoſin rouergue ſome whan oute parelles toke wayes ſayd howe wolde folowe warres lengar angerot fyue hym wente towne caſtell piergourt called mountroyall lorde therof receyued hym ſwetely landes good englyſſhe wolde neuer tourne frenche whan dyd howbeit dyuers opynion ⸪ thus garyſon pulpuron ſaued ſelfe left perſone hynde nere • wolde frenchman knewe deꝑtynge thirde day departyng frē chemen ordayned gyue aſſaut made ingyn four ſtages euery ſtage might twentie croſ bowes whan redy ſet forthe ingyn whiche named paſſe weykeſt ſyde caſtell geno way within ingyn whan wolde haue ſhotte agaynſt caſtell body dyde appere anone parceyued caſtell voyde bycauſe body came defēce ceaſſed ſhot bicauſe wolde nat leſe quarelles came downe fro ingyn came ye capitayns marueyle ment ſayd sir without fayle body within caſtell howe knowe quod ſir gaultier sir quod knowe none appereth defence ſhot • ordayned ladder ſette vp agaynſt walles moūted paſſed ouer walles entred caſtell founde creature therin wente gate founde great bundell kayes among founde kaye gate opyned barryers one another wherof lordes great marueyle ſpecially ſir gaultier paſchac wende ben deꝑted caſtell enchaūtment demaūded hym howe might ſeneſchall tholous ſayd hym sir ſurely nat thus gone without haue ſome ſecrete waye vnder erthe thynke thanne caſtell ſought euery corner ſuche waye ſhulde founde cellar mouthe alley open lordes dyde beholde ſir galtier great marueyle therof demaunded • neſchall tholous knewe 〈…〉 ſir ꝙ haue herde therof thought nothyng wolde haue thus departed waye faythe quod ſir gaultier begone ſame waye haue caſtelles countre ſuche ordynaunce sir quod ſir hughe dyuers ſuche caſtelles olde tyme ꝑteyned raynalt montabon hath ſuche cōueyaūce whan bretherne kepte warre agaynſt kynge charlemayne frannce made maner counſayle aduyſe maugis theyr coſyn ye kynge beſyeged puyſſaunce ſawe coulde reſyſt hym wolde departe without ony leue takynge meanes theſe paſſages vnder erthe surely ſayd ſyr brew lawde gretly yt ordynaunce ſay yf euer ſhall haue ony warre agaynſt kynge duke ony neyghboure haue ſone retourned countrey ſhall cauſe ſuche myne made caſtell paſac thus toke poſſeſſyon caſtell ſet therin men warre kepe garyſon ſo wente towardes ye caſtell conuall eſpaygnolet papereaw baſque capytayne hym good nombre theſe pyllers robber theſe lordes theyr company came garyſon conuall robeſtan layde ſyege therto ſyr gaultyer demaunded ſeneſhall tholous yf conuall auncyently perteyned raynalte monutalban ſayd yes caue vnder grounde ſayd ſyr gaultyer ſyr true ſayd ſyr brew reaſon ther eſpaygnolet wanne ſeconde tyme owner within fyr gaultyer ſente ye knyght owner therof ſayd hym ſyr good ye enfourmed v myne yt caſtell yſſue therof ſyr raymonde conuall ſayd ſyr ſurely way vnder grounde ther taken loſt caſtel longe tyme decayed deſtroyed theſe robber newe repayred yt way came ſyr yſſue therof wood farre hence wel ſayd ſyr gaultyer well ſo iiii dayes wente ſame wood hym cc men wel armed ſawe hole yſſue cauſed erthe buſſhes auoyded lyghted vp many fagottes ſayd yt ordeyned go caue ſyr folowe caue ſhal brynge hall conuall ye ſhal fynde dore breke vp ye ſtronge ynough ſo fyght ſo entred came ye grece nere hall dore ye caſtell grete ax ſtrake dore yt tyme nere nyght within caſtell made good watche perceyued howe myne wolde haue entred caſtell eſpaygnolet goynge reſt came thyder caſt ſtones bench tymbre caue dore ye entente none ſholde entre thoughe dore broken vp done ſhyfte none defence myne anone brake dore peces yet wer neuer nere whē ſawe impoſſible entre retourned agayne ooſt tyme myduyght thē ſhewed founde howe conuall perceyued ſo fortefyed caue dore poſſyble entre way caſtell ¶howe caſtelles conuall bygore meſnyll taken within taken ſlayne hanged ca xxxix ſyr gaultyer paſchat ſente baſſe grete engyne whiche taken downe brought thyther rayſed vp wheles ſholde alſo apparelled inſtrumentes ye aſſawre al redy ſyr gaultyer gretly deſyred wynne caſtell cauſed trompettes ſowne aſſawte ſeneſhall tholouſe company ye one ſyde ſyr roger ſpayne ſeneſhal carcaſſō ſyde alſo lorde barbaran ſyr benedic lorde benoch lorde countye deſterac ſyr raymonde lyſle knyghtes ſquyers countrey began ſawte within defende themſelfe whiche nede ſawe themſelfe harde parte knewe wel ſyr gaultyer wolde take none mercy therfore thought defende themſelfe longe myght ſell theyr lyues derely geneways croſſe bowes ſhot ſore hurte many within ſo none within doubted gretely ſyr gaultyer paſac dyd meruayles armes ſayd company ſyr • ſhall theſe raſcalles holde v hande daye thus yf agaynſte good men armes wolde meruayle mo feaces warre theſe raſcalles within myne entent dyne within caſtell nowe ſhall ſene yf ye wyll accomplyſſhe deſyre thoſe wordes ſuche deſyred good wyl aduaū ced themſelfe forthe toke many ladder ſet vp agaynſt wall engyne ſtode croſſe bowes ſhot ſo fyerſly none within durſt ſhew themſelfe thus clene aſſawte ye frenſſhe men entred ye caſtel conual theyr ſwordes theyr handes chaſynge theyr enemyes many ſlayne taken euery mā entred ye gate demaunded ſyr gaultyer ſholde done thē taken ſaynt george ſayd wyll hanged incontynent commaundement done eſpaygnoy let began fyrſt lordes dyned caſtel people towne taryed day • ſyr gaultyer delyuered agayne ye lorde conuall towne caſtell ordeyned departe then thus takynge caſtell conuall ye haue herde frenſſh men wente another holde called maſtull whiche done grete domage ye countrey made aſſawte wtin defended themſelfe yt longe clene aſſawte wonne caſtell alſo within ſlayne hanged vp ratchfort caſtelles knewe howe ſyr gaultyer wonne ſo many caſtelles toke none mercy outher ſlayne hanged doubted moche comynge ſame ende wherfore departed ye nyght tyme tell whether wente vnder grounde aboue bytwene ye caſtell rochefort caſtell royr caues vnder erthe auncyently perteyned raynolde mountalban frenſſhmen founde theſe caſtelles clene voyde came thyder newely repeopled men warre prouyſyon toke theyr way towarde tholous go bygore ye fronter tarbe two caſtelles one called thedos iulyan nauaret whiche gretely trauayled countrey ye good towne tarbe londes lorde dauchyn ſyr gaultyer paſac lordes fraunce languedoc well refreſſhed theym cyte tholous departed toke waye bygore ſo came caſtell ledos iuly ā taryed ſayd wolde goo tyll wonne thyder came ſyr gaultyer paſac ye seneſhal nob • ſan perteynynge erle foys ſyr gaultyer ſente hym helpe dryue countrey pyllers robber renne well countrey nobeſſan place alſo ye erle foys conſented ſholde ſo elles durſt haue done ſo do iulyā xv dayes yt caſtell ſtronge good capytayne therin ſquyer gaſcoyn called bruer de brome ¶howbeit laſt hadde aſſawte treaty within departed theyr lyues goodes ſaued alſo falſely conuayed lowrde ſquyre called bertram mountdyghen theſe lordes fraunce do iulyen toke aduyſe whether myght kepe ſtyll raſe downe erthe counſayled bete downe bycauſe lowrde crafty ſubtyle fearynge yt whē ſholde gone wolde wynne agayne ſo better downe yet ſtones lye hepe lykely neuer buylded agayne thus became do iulyan thē wente nauaret wherin alſo companyons aduēturers kepte yere knewe howe do iulyā departed lyke wyſe dyde ſaufconduyte wente lowrde whiche theyr chefe refuge knewe well man wolde ſeke thē wolde leſe theyr payne ye caſtell lowrde impoſſyble taken force frenſſhe men raſed caſtel do iulyā wente nauaret founde voyde ordeyned beten downe ſo wherof tarbe nothynge myſcontent yt garyſon done thē grete domage wente caſtell dauchen bygore ſtandynge amonge mountaynes entre byerne xv dayes ſeaſon made dyuers aſſawtes wanne baſe courte al theyr horſes ſtronge towre rocke yt coulde wonne whē lordes ſawe howe loſt theyr payne yt wyllyam morenton kepte ye holde wolde yelde vp ſell herkē treatye thē departed retourned tarbe ſyr ganltyer paſſac gaue leue men warre departe payde theyr wage ſuffycyent ſygnement ſo yt pleaſed wente carcaſſon theraboute refreſſhed hym whyle lay tydynges came hym fraunce cōmaundement fro kynge ſholde drawe garyſon bounteuyll xainton march burdeloys poyctou whiche garyſon kepte capytayne called saynt foy gaſcoyne ſayd fraunce yt ſyr iohn̄ harpedan ſeneſhall burdeaus made grete aſſemble men warre lyborne rayſe baſtydes yt poictou xainton hadde layde bounteuyll kynges commaundement obeyed ſyr gaultyer reaſon toke hym lx ſperes c croſſe bowes geneuoys ſo departed fro carcaſſon paſſed rouergue agen coſted pierregourt ſo came bounteuyll founde ſeneſhalles rochel poictou pierregourt dagen grete nombre men warre ¶in farre countres maye well meruayled noble royalme fraunce therin ſo many cytees townes caſtelles whiche without nombre well farte partyes therof harte royalme ye ſhall fynde goynge cyte tholous cyte burdeaus ſtondynge ryuer garon fyrſt langurant rions caldiac bangou ſaynt macayre caſtell dorthe candoch geronde larull myllant ſaynt baſyll marmande cōmont tannus lemna dagenes montour agyllon thouars porte ſaynt mary clermont agen ambyllart caſtell ſaraſyne iehedo verdun vell mote takynge way ryuere dordone whiche falleth garon ye ſhall fynde theſe caſtelles one ſyde ye brouech frouſach liborne ſaynt milion chatellon mote ſaynt peſant montremell ſaynt foy bergerach mortquinormons caſtell oftene theſe caſtels ſome englyſſhe ſome frenſſhe ſo contynewed warre ſeaſon gaſcoynes wolde haue none otherwyſe haue choſen xx yere neuer made othe promyſe ony man true ye gaſcoynes fyrſt theyr meanes kynge edwarde chefe poſſeſſyon gaſcoyne alſo prynce ſone put agayne fro clerely conteyned hyſtory good wyt aduyce kynge charles ſone kynge iohn̄ drewe loue fayre meanes grete gyftes ye gretteſt lordes gaſcoyne ye erle armynake lorde dalbret prynce loſt pryde iohan froyſarde wrote hyſtory ſame ſeaſon buroeaus yt prynce wente spayne ye englyſſhe mē ſo prowde yt ſet nothyng ony nacyon theyr owne gentylmen gaſcoyne acquitayne ſuche loſt theyr goodes ye warre yet coulde gete maner offyce theyr coun • rees englyſſhemen ſayd worthy able haue ony wherwith ſore grudged theyr myndes myght ſhewed bycauſe hardnes ye erle armynacke lorde dalbret founde ye prince forſoke hym became frenſſhe ſo dyde dyuers knyghtes ſquyers gaſcoyne kynge phylyp fraū ce kynge iohn̄ ſone loſt thē pryde hyghe mynde lyke wyſe ſo dyde ye prince kynge charles wynne fayrnes large humylyte ſo wolde gaſcoynes delte withall kynge charles entente loue theſe lordes ſholde longer contynewe made
