maryage bytwene ſyſter lady iſabell burbon lorde dalbret bytwene fayre chyldren cauſe loue endured longer tyme paris herde lorde dalbret ſpeke worde whiche well noted byleue ſpake ſporte howbeit ſpake grete ſadnes knyght brytayne ſerued hym knyght demaunded hym ye buſynes countrey howe contente frenſſhe anſwered ſayd thanke god metely well howbeit money mē alſo whē made war kynge englonde haue rode forthe aduenture foū de euer ſome ryche merchaunt tholous condon bergerath lyghtely day gate cuer ſome good pray freſſhe ioly nowe deed knyght began laughe ſayd truely lyfe gaſcoynes lyghtly wolde euer haue mēnes domage therfore harde theſe wordes ſay thought yt lorde dalbret repented hym yt become frenſſhe ye lorde muſydent gaſcoyne taken batayle anne • ſware handes duke aniow yt wolde come parys become frenſſhe euer ſo came paris kynge charles made hym good chere yt euer kynge dyd ye lorde muſydent departed agayne fro parys without ony leue wente coūtrey became agayne englyſſhe brake ye promyſes yt made duke aniow lykewyſe ſo dyde lorde rouſen lorde dura lorde languerant suche nacyon gaſcoyne ſtable loue yet englyſſhe men better frenſſhemē theyr warre agaynſt ye frenſſhe men profytabe agaynſt englyſſhe men pryncypall incydent yt mooſt inclyneth therto ¶howe kynge cypre ſlayne murdred bedde owne broder exhortacyon corrupcyon infydelles bountye hardnes hym capitulum xl ſame ſeaſon came tydynges ī fraū cefor th • der came kyng lyō armony wt grete company man chaſed royalme wherof kynge turkes al royalme wonne excepte one caſtel ſtandynge ye ſee called courthe whiche kepte gen • uoys bycauſe caſtell key yſſue entre ſee go alexandria sowdans londe theſe geneuoys gothe marchaundyſe meanes truage yt pay rude preſter iohn̄s londe euery place welcome bycauſe ye golde ſyluer yt brought thyder merchaūdy ſe yt exchaunge alexandria cayr dama place amonge sara ſyns ſuche maner worlde gouerued yt one countrey another therby euery thynge knowen geneuoys thoſe yt furtheſt doth aduenture theyr merchaūdyſe lordes ye porte ye ſe aboue ye veniſiās feared doubted amonge ſaraſyns thē ony people ſee valyaunt men grete entrepryſe galy well furnyſſhed ye geneuoys dare well aſſay iiii galeys saraſyns turke tartaryes ſholde moche domage cryſtendome yf geneuoys bycauſe renomed chefe lordes ſee marchynge infydelles therfore haue euer l galeys grete ſhyppes rynnynge ſee defende iles ye ile cypre ile rodes ye ile doſtye boundes ſee grece vnto turkye haue towne caſtel pere ſtō dynge ſee conſtantyne le noble whiche kepte theyr coſt charge iii iiii tymes euery yere refreſſhed yt yt neceſſary tartaryes turkes haue dyuers tymes aſſayed gete coulde neuer attayne therto haue euer loſt haue wonne ye caſtell pere ſtondeth rocke one entre whiche geneuoys gretely dyde fortefye alſo geneuoys haue towne caſtell iaſon whiche ryght noble grete profyte nere countres cryſtendome yf pere iaſon stycye rodes ayde geneuoys infydelles wolde ſoone come gaiet yea naples porte cornet rome ye ſayd garyſons whiche alwayes well prouyded men warre geneuoys ſhyppes galeys euer redy defende wherfore turkes dare aduenture partyes yt ye fronters conſtantyne le noble towarde hungery yf noble kynge cypre peter lieſieguen ſo noble valynnt prynce conquered ye grete cyte alexā drie satalye yf lyued longer wolde haue gyuen sowdan turkes ſo moche ſyth godfrey boloyns dayes neuer ſo moche yt ryght wel knewe turkes tartaryes infydelles ſuche knewe prowes hygh dedes therfore haue hym dyſtroyed made merchaundyſe kynges broder called iaquet yt ſholde ſlee kynge broder ſo dyd ſlewe bed whiche fowle dede bloode ſlee ſo valyaunt mā kynge cypre intended ymagened nyght day none thynge myght wynne holy londe haue handes ye infydelles ſyr phelyp mayſyeres chauncellour peter lieſiegnen kynge cypre wrote tombe foloweth copy wherof ye chapytre houſe freer celeſtynes paris peter lieſiegnen ye vi kyng latyne iheruſalē godfrey boloyne kynge cypre grete prowes hyghe empryſe toke batayle coſt theſe cytees alexandrie egypte triple surie layas armony sytalie turkye dyuers cytees caſtelles ye infydelles enemyes lawe iheſu cryſt animaeius requieſcat pace ¶and geneuoys loued hym gretely reaſon knewe dethe prepared vii galyes ſente cypre toke perforce cyte samagoſe iaquet within ouer ranne beſt parte ye royalme wolde haue deſtroyed royalme bycauſe ſtronge townes fortreſſes kepe fronter warre agaynſt turkes therfore lefte ſtyl mennes handes countre excepte cyte samagoſe whiche kepte ſtyll fortefyed wanne fyrſte grete ryches ſo ledde gene iaquet murdred broder true kyng cypre fayre ſone maryed crowned kynge put iaquet ſtrayte pryſon wolde put hym dethe kepte ſtyll theyr hā de samagoſe knowe yf kepe yet within ſeaſon ye yonge kynge cypre dyed bed wherof ye geneuoys ſore dyſpleaſed coulde amende ſo ye lande without ony heyre tell gouerneth nowe ſame yere yt erle foys houſe ſhewed knyght biern lorde valenchyn howe geneuoys grete parte lande helde ſtyl samagoſe countrey crowned theyr kynge ſayd iaquet lacke heyre tell meanes came pryſon handes ye geneuoys ſayd kynge lyon armony came fyrſt fraunce ye kynge lordes made hym good chere reaſon come thyder farre countre ſo hym knowen tydynges royalme grece empyre conſtantyne le noble examyned puyſſaunce ye turkes tarcaries put hym royalme anſwered ſayd yt grete tacō tarcarie alway made hym warre yt put royalme thē demauded yf yt tacon tartarie puysſaunt ye truely ſayd puyſſaunce puyſſaunce ſowdan hath ſubdued emperoure conſtantyne le noble kepte lawes tartary kyng anſwered ſayd nay tacon tactarie ſowdan haue longe made warre agaynſt emperour conſtantyne le noble laſt fayne make ende elles coulde haue pea whiche emperour cō ſtantyne le noble ſone lady mary burbon ſone emperour hugues leſiegnē whiche emperour fayne giue doughter maryage • ye ſone ye tacō tarcarie howbeit emperour abydeth ſtyll cry • tē lawe reaſon comyctyon maryage thē demaū ded hym ye erle co •• er sauoy dyd yt countrey ſeyng ſo valyaunt mā ſo grete puyſſaunce kynge anſwered ſayd yt erle sauoy ye empyre hūgry made warre agaynſt turkes tartaryes valyauntnes conquered tartaryes sowdans lande two good townes calipole lobeme lefte men kepe retourne erle sauoy townes kepte ſtyll cryſtē longe good kynge cypre lyued ſoone sowdan tacon tartarie knew dethe feared nothynge empeof conſtantyne le noble rayſed army cm horſemen ſo came ranne cōſtantyne le noble fro then wente beſyeged calipole conquered perforce ſlewe cryſten men yt within made ſo grete warre agaynſt emperour cōſtantyne le noble yt puyſſaū ce coulde reſyſt thē forbare hym reaſon doughter ſone ye grete tacon coueted haue maryage whiche harde caſe tyme come offycers tacon cyte conſtantyne le noble ſo yt grekes lyue vnder thē truage yf kynges cryſten put therto remedy lengthe matter ſhall go ſo euyll yt turkes tartary ſhall conquere grece tourne theyr byleue ſo make theyr auauntes mocke pope wherof one rome another auignyon ſay yt ii goddes cryſtendome warreth eche agaynſt wherby afferme lawe feble lyghter dyſtroyed condempned lay therto reaſon yt ſholde cxalte cryſten fayth ye fyrſt mynyſſheth dyſtroy demaū ded kynge armony whether sowdan tacon tartarie ii gretteſt prynces amonge infydelles yt knowen grekes kynge anſwered ſayd nay ſurely ye greteſt alwayes turkes noble greter ſage redoubted warre longe haue good heed gouernour haue c yere thoughe ye tacon tartarie holde ſubieccyon emperoure conſtantyne le noble yet ye lorde turkey holdeth lykewyſe ye tacō lorde turkey called lamorabaqum ſay trouthe valyaunt mā armes wyſe man lawe lamorabaquin cōplayne neuer dyd hurte hath alwayes kepte warre agaynſt emperoure hungery ye lordes fraunce demaunded hym yf lamorabaqum ſo grete ſo feared ſayd ye truely ſayd kynge armony ſpeke emperour cōſtantyne le noble emperoure hū gery feareth hym lykewyſe doth sowdan babylon tacon tartarie haue herde ſay ye tartaryes yt tacon wolde tyme haue put vnder ye emperoure conſtantyne le noble doubte lamorabaqum ye tacon knoweth hym nature ſo well ſone knoweth one gretter hymſelfe wyll neuer haue ioy tyl haue put hym vnder wherfore tacon wyll cōſtantyne le noble yt myght well yf wolde demaunded yf lamorabaquin ony grete power men ye kynge ſayd ye ſurely xxx yere ſoeuer wente euer company cm horſes alwayes lodged ye feldes neuer entreth ony towne garde hath euer xxm turkes • whereſo euer goeth hath fader hym hymſelfe lx yere age fader lxxx x loueth moche ye frenſhe language ſuche cometh then deſyreth ſe grete lordes ye worlde ye frenſſhe kynge eſtate ordre one ſpeke hym fraunce well content ye kynge demaūded ye lamorabaqum ſuffred ye tacon pea ſyth ſo grete emperour bycauſe ſayd ye kynge yt tacon feareth hym dare make hym warre alſo certayne townes porte tartarie yt yerely payeth trybute lamorabaquin alſo al one lawe wyl lyghtly dyſtroy theyr owne lawe meruayleth gretely ye warre amonge cryſtē mē howe eche dyſtroyeth wherfore often mynde come cryſtēdome wyn hym wolde lāde rather thē ye tacon ben better demaūded anſweſwered ſayd lamorabaquin lorde noble cōdycyon yf xxx yere yonger lykely make grete cōqueſtes wolde employ warre hath wonne countrey towne ſygnory deſyreth nothynge truage leueth ſtyll euery man owne byleue putteth neuer mā fro herytage deſyreth nothynge ſouerayne domynacyon wherfore ſaye yf conquered ye royalme armony tartary haue ſuffered pea royalme ſtyll owne byleue knowled gynge hym ſouerayne grete lordes yt marche nere hym grekes tracyens take hym theyr ſouerayne lorde wherby doubte ſoueraynte sowdan tacon tartarie lorde satalie lorde dela palice lorde hawlte lodge theſe iii lordes theyr landes pea reaſon truage yt pay lamorabaquin ther turke tartarien yt dare thē ony wronge domage demaūded ye kynge armony yf lande ſo clerely loſt myght recouered agayne truely ſayd kynge without recouery without puyſſaunce cryſtendome come thyder ſtronger thē turkes tartary haue ſayd ferther come forwarde lykely cōquere excepte one towne called courth whiche fyrſt towne royalme armony yet cryſten mennes handes al ye reſydue ye royalme ye infydels handes ye chyrches wonte ſet vp theyr ydolles theyr mawmettes demaunded towne courth ſtronge ye truely ſayd ye kynge wyll wonne without lōge ſyege elles betrayed ſtandeth nere ſee drye place bytwene ii rockes whiche cā approched yf yt turkes tartary theyr hādes another good towne ferre then called adelphe grece dyſtroyed hungery ſholde haue moche demaunded yf hungery marched nere tartarie turkes kynge ſayd ye truely nerer turkes lamorabaquin ony lordes ſayd grete meruayle ye lamorabaquin ſuffereth hym reſt ſyth marcheth ſoo nere hungery beynge ſo valyaunt man ſo grete conquerour name god ſayd kynge armony tyme hath ſtudyed moche myght haue done domage royalme hungery yf incydent ben ben farre countrey hungery demaunded incydent kynge ſayd ſhal ſhewe ¶howe kynge armony examyned howe xxxm turkes ſlayne dyſtroyed royalme hungery ca xli lamordbaquin ſaw yt ye lordes yt marched nere hym fered doubted hī cō queſtes prowes yt al boūdes ye ſee hūgery obeyed hym alſo ſaw wel ye valyaunt kyng hungery frederycke deed royalme fallen womā wherfore aduyſed hym conquere yt royalme ſo made grete ſomons turkye ſuche ſente came hym ſo thē lamorabaquin went forthe lodged ye playnes satalie bytwene palice haulte lodge gyue feare enemyes entencyō entre ye royalme hūgery bycauſe yt hungery royalme coūtrey cloſed en • yronned wt hygh rockes moūtaynes wherby ye ſtronger thē ſente hym ambaſſadours heraldes wt mulet charged wt wylle cōmaunded thē go hungery ye erle lazaran whoſe lādes lyeth twene ye mountaynes melcabe robee whiche way purpoſed army ſholde pa ſhewe hym cōmaunded hym yf thynke lyue reſt haue lande pea yt obey v lykewyſe lorde palice lorde satalie lorde haulte lodge hath done yt open gyue v fre paſſage thrughe landes yf ſay ſ • ay rebell agaynſt v ſhewe hym behalfe yt ſhall brynge many men dyſtroy coūtrey graynes mylle ſacke ambaſſadours departed wel īſtructed yt ſholde ſo rode theyr iourneys tyll came hungery ye lande erle lazaran ſoūde hym caſtell called archforme erle lyke ſage lorde receyued theſe ambaſſadours right ſwetely made thē good chere meruayle ſawe entre courte mule charged ſacke wyſt thought ben golde precyous ſtones yt lamorabaquin ſente hym drawe hym therby conſente ſuffre hym haue fre paſſage thrugh coūtrey howbeit ſayd hymſelfe yt wolde neuer corrupted maner ryches yt ſholde preſented hym thē theſe meſſagers came erle ſayd ſyr lazaran vnderſtāde ſente fro hyghe redoubted lorde ſouerayne kynge lamorabaquin lorde turkye wt apertenaūces ſay behalfe yt cōmaūdeth come obey ſaunce lyke maner ye knowe yt neyghbours haue done lorde de la palice ye lorde haulte lodge lorde satalie haue done hym homage yt ye open hym paſſages countrey yf ye thynge lyue reſt ſo doynge ye ſhall deſerue gretely grace loue yf ye rebell diſobey charged ſay yt lorde lamorabaquin wyl brynge coū trey mo mē armes graynes mylle ſacke therwt opened ye ſa • ſhewed hym wtin ye erle lazaran vnderſtode ye ambaſſadoure lamorabāquin determyned hymſelfe anſwere temporatly wolde dyſcouer thought ſodaynly ſayd cloſe vp ye ſacke ſe ryght wel therin haue well harde thynge lamorabaquin demaundeth wtin theſe iii dayes ſhall make āſwere requeſt demaūdeth coūſayl anſwered ſayd ſyr ye ſpeke wel ſo truſtyng haue • ſwere taryed iii dayes ſhall ſhewe ye erle lazaran dyd ye ſpace theſe iii dayes ſent ꝓuyded ye caſtell mo iim capōs hēnes cloſed thē vp houſe wtout ony maner mete ſo yt iii dayes etc thynge daye came wolde anſwere ambaſſadours thē ſent galary lokynge downe courte ſayd ſyrs come hyder leane ſhal ſhewe newe thynge ſo anſwere knowynge wolde doo leaued downe wyndowe hym gate cloſed courte grete ſo men redy doo ordeyned opened chambre dore ii pollayne yt eten mete ii dayes ſeruauntes toke grayne yt ſacke caſt aboute capon hennes ſo yt within halfe houre al corne etē vp clene wolde haue eten yf erle ſayd meſſagers ſyrs ye haue ſene howe grayne whiche haue brought hyder mayſter clene eten deuoured brought thynge theſe pollayne yet wolde ere yf yt trueſyr ſayd wherby ſpeke yt ſay ſayd ye erle anſwere lyeth therin enſāple ye haue ſene lamoraba quin ſayth yt yf obey hym wyl brynge lande men armes without nombre wherfore ſay vnto hym fro wyl abyde ſhall brynge ſo many ſhal al deuoured corne deuoured pollayne ambaſſadours harde ſwere ryght penſyue ſo toke theyr leue departed dyde ſo moche theyr iourneys yt came lamorabaquin ſhewed hym erle ſayd ſaynge ſemynge ſet lytell manaſſyng wt anſwere lamorabaquin ſore dyſpleaſed ſayd howe matter ſholde reſt ſo whether erle wolde wolde entre coūtre hūgery wolde dyſtroy erles countrey cauſe anſwered hym ſo preſumptuouſly ¶nowe ſhall ſhewe crle dyd ſawe well defyed lamorabaquin knew wel ſholde ſhortely tydynges hym therfore made prouyſyon defende hym wrote al knyghtes ſquyers come hym ſtoppe entre lamorabaquin hungery cōmaundynge euery man ſyght letter drawe hym certefyenge thē howe lamorabaquin ye playnes haulte loge ſuche erle ſente obeyed wyllyngly ſo came erle defende cryſten dome dyuers came hym yt ſente ſuche harde therof exalte cryſten faythe dyſtroy ye infydelles alſo erle lazaran cauſed foreſtes hyghe tree hewē downe layde trauers one ouer another wherby turkes ſholde fynde ony newe way power came certayne paſſage lamorabaquin ſholde paſſe entre hungery erle hym xm men hungery x croſſe bowes dyd ſet thē bothe ſides way alſo redy iim mē countre hauynge grete ax cut downe tree wolde haue al done ſayd yt aboute hym ſyrs without doubte lamorabaquin wyl come ſyth ſente worde wolde ſo therfore ſyrs quyte yourſelfe well valyauntly kepe defende paſſage yf yt turkes wynne al hungery grete peryll loſt ſtronge place one v worth iiii alſo better dye honoure defendynge herytages fayth ieſu cryſt thē lyue inſhame ſeruage vnder dogges infydels thoughe lamorabaquin noble wyſe man lawe ſyr ſayd ſhal abyde y• aduenture let turkes come wyll ſhall redy receyue ordenaunce paſſage turkes knewe nothyng erle lazaran doubte ſpyes ſet men ſuche truſted well hymſelfe kepe ye paſſages yt mā ſholde go turkes nother day nyght lamorabaquin forgate entrepryſe ſayd wolde go vyſyte lande erle lazaran grete domage wolde reputed lyer yt promyſed ſo toke lxm mē ſet ouer thē iiii capytaynes houſe holde duke manſyon mecque ye keper dan • et alphalor • samarie ye prynce corde called brachyn theyr departynge ſayd thē ſyrs go waye wt cōpany ye ſuffycyent open ye paſſages hūgery entre ye lāde ye erle lazaran dyſtroye ſoone may know ye ye ſhal come thyder ye reſydue people wyl put hungery vnder ſubiectyon royalme almayne enchauntours countrey egypte ſaye deſteny lorde kynge worlde place wolde mooſt gladlyeſt ſe rome auntyently enherytaūce predeceſſours cōquered gouerned dyuers tymes wyll crowned galafre landas racon tartarye sowdan babylone ſhal crowne hym theyr knee anſwered ſayd ſyr ſhall accomplyſſhe deſyre cōmaundement ſo departed wt lxm turkes amonge xxm mooſt experte men warre beſt armed turkye ledde vowarde longe iourneyed yt came amonge mountaynes lazaryn founde let entrynge y• countrey ſo ye vowarde entred duke mecque duke daniuet ledde ſo vowarde paſſed erle lazaryus enbuſſhement erle hungeryons ſawe theyr tyme ſet theyr worke mē worke cut downe tree ſtoppe ſo ye wayes yt coulde mo entre comen recule ſo cloſed yt poſſyble ony mā go ony ſo thus encloſed xxxm turkes refyerſly aſſayled hungaryons ſo handeled bothe ſydes way ſlayne one yt ſkaped ii duke alſo ſlayne ſome thought haue ſaued themſelfe woodes ſo chaſed yt ſlayne areregarde tourned backe whē ſaw coulde entre tree yt ſtopped ye way ſo retourned lamorabaqum ſhewed hym grete myſchef yt fallē people wherof meruayllous ſory dyſpleaſed thē called coūſayle know beſt hym loſt ye floure chyualry ſo retourned dyd tyme ye kynge armony ſhewed owne eſtate frenſhe kynge baron fran̄ce counſayle hym grete pyte bycauſe come fro ſo ferre coūtre grece ſeke counſayle ayde bycauſe kynge chaſed royalme thynge lyue maynteyne eſtate ¶the frenſſhekynge yonge ſayd wyl yt kynge irmony come hyder ſe v hope haue ſome cōforte helpe ayde v kepe eſtate aperteyneth hym kyng wel whē may weſhal ayde hym wt men warre helpe recouer • herytaūce wherto haue good wyl bounde exalte ye cryſten faythe frenſſhe kynges wordes well harde vnderſtande reaſon none yt ſayd contrary kynges vncles counſayle deſyrous accomplyſſhe entent ſo kynge armony maynteyne eſtate aſſygned hym certayne rente reuenues chambre accomptes ſo well truely payde euery moneth aſſygnement vim frankes yere delyuered hym fyrſt vm frākes prouide lodgyng veſſel thynges neceſſary lodgynge apoynted ſaynt andon beſyde ſaynt denyce kepe houſe thus ye kynge armony reteyned ye frenſſhe kyng fyrſt comynge dayly encreaſed apayred ſomtyme frenſſhe kynge ſpecyally hyghe feeſtes ¶howe pope vrban pope clemēt grete dyſcorde togyder howe cryſten kynges varyaunce theyr lectyons warres bytwene ca xlii ſame ſeaſon came au • gnyon ſe pope clement ſyr othes breſnyl haue money ye warre made hym agaynſt ye romayns bertram • gles wrote hymſelfe pope vrban ye vi cōteyned hyſtory ſyr othes ſhewed dyuers thynges pope ye cardynalles wherin wel byleued harde money coulde gete none ye pope chambre ſo clene voyded fro golde ſyluer yt ye cardynals coulde haue ye money yt perteyned theyr hattes ſyr othes breſnyll departed fro thē wel content auyg • yon delyuered hym frankes ſet lytell therby wherby pope clementes warre ſore weked ſyr othes wolde wyſe medle ony pope warres thē margaret dura gaiecte aduerſary agaynſt quene naples wyfe ſōtyme kynge lewes duke aniow ſente ſyr othes ayde y• warre yt ſhe made agaynſt napolytanes ſyr othes certayne ſpace exſcuſed hymſelfe dyſſymuled foded forth tyme wyſt ſome counſayle dyde put hym mynde go margaret dura enherytoure naples cycyle helpe ayde defende heritage take wyfe ſhe contente mary hym bycauſe noble blood hyghe extraccyon lorde kynge countrey called daure ſome coūſayle counſayled hym contrary ſaynge myght therby come euyll ende chyldrē kynge lewes naples crowned kynge cyte bare thoughe yonge yet grete frendes kynſmen ſpecyally frenlſhe kynge theyr coſyne germayne wyl ayde theyr moder iohan duches amowe mayneal theſe doubtes ſome counſayle ſhewed hym wherfore ſyr othes forbare longe ſeaſon dyſſymuled mater toke none bothe partyes ſame ſeaſon ye ſowdyours pope clement encloſed ye cyte peras pope vrban beſyeged lorde moctroy valiaunt knyght countye gene sauoy ſyr talebart knyght rodes ſyr bernarde de la ſale pope vrban ſore conſtrayned yt poynte haue ben taken enformed ſome xxm frankes capytayne almayne grete company hym called erle courant wolde haue delyuered pope vrban ye handes pope clement whervpon ſyr bernarde de la ſale ſent auygnyon pope clement ye ſayd ſome money pope cardynalles coulde make money ye pope courte ſo poore money ſo ſyr bernarde de la ſale retourned euyll content ſyege pruce ſo dyſſymuled matter prucyens lykewyſe alſo erle courant ſo pope vrban yſſued pruce peryll wente rome abode knowe ryght well tyme come wolde moche theſe thynges howe churche ſholde fall ſuche trouble endure ſo longe plage ſent fro god clargy aduyſe conſydre well theyr grete eſtate ſuperfluyte many dyde ſette lytell therby ſo blynded pryde eche one thought good another wherfore wente euyll yf fayth ben confyrmed ye handes grace ye holy gooſt • nlumyned harte yt gone ryght way helde ferme vnyte elles fayth gretely defourmed grete lordes erthe begynnyng dyd nothynge laughe chyrche tyl cronycled theſe cronycles yere lorde iheſu cryſt mccclxxx x moche comon people meruayled howe grete lordes frenſſhe kynge kynge almayne kynges prynces cryſtendome dyd prouyde remedy caſe one thynge reaſonable appeaſe comon people eſcuſe hyghe prynces kynges duke erles lordes enſample yolke egge without whyte whyte yolke maye clergy lordes one without another lordes gouerned ye clergy coulde lyue beeſtes clergy ye clergy counſayleth exhorteth lordes ſay ſurely haue ben tyme dyuers partyes worlde accomplyſſhe pleaſure ſe noueltyes worlde haue knowledge conqueſtes aduentures wryten boke truely ſeaſon yt wente thus aboute worlde coulde lyghtly ſe grete lorde marmoſet ye clergy boy ſymple lygnage mounted vp honoure reaſon theyr iangelyng raylynge excepte erle foys neuer none ſuche naturally ſage wyſdome better ony yt coulde gyuen hym yet ſay ſuche lordes ruled ſuche marmoſettes fooles rather fooles ſore blynded yet haue two eyen whan knowledge came fyrſt ye frenſſhe kynge charles dyfference bytwene theſe two pope dyd put matter ye clergy whiche way ſholde take clergy fraunce determyned toke pope clement mooſt ſureſt parte frenſſhe opynyon acorded kynge caſtel kynge scottes bycauſe ſeaſon ſcyſme thus chyrche fraunce caſtell scotlande ioyned togyder alyaunce kynge englonde ye kynge portyngale contrary oppynyō agaynſt theyr enemyes erle flaundres neuer inclined courage pope clemēt yt ſholde ryght pope bycauſe vrbā fyrſt choſen rome archebyſſhop bare clement beynge cardynall geane wrote lettres vnto noble erle flaunders howe pope choſen due electyon rome named vrban wherfore wolde byleue yt clement longe lyned opynyon ſo kynge almayne empyre alſo ye kynge hungry thus put wrytynge ſtate dyfferences yt ſene dayes worlde ye chyrche meruayle thoughe ye lordes worlde ſuffered dyſſymuled ye matter brought remembraunce howe yt yonge pope innocent caygned auygnyon helde pryſon freer mynoure called freer iohn̄ roche tayllad clerke ſayd haue herde pryuely dyuers place ſhewed aledged dyuers auctorytes incydentes fortune yt fell dayes ye royalme fraunce alſo ſpake takynge kynge iohn̄ ſhewed certayne thynges reaſonable howe chyrche ſholde ſuffre moche ye grete ſuperfluytes yt ſawe priſon ſhewed ſayd cardynall oſtie called dearras ye cardynall auxere wente vyſyte hym argue hym thē layde enſample hereafter ye ſhall lordes ſayd freer one fowle appered worlde without ony fethers al fowles knew yt borne came ſe hym bicauſe ſo fayre pleaſaunt beholde ymagyned amonge myght byrde without fethers knewe well coulde lyue ſayd wolde ſholde lyue bycauſe ſo fayre thē euery fowle gaue hym theyr fethers fayrer byrde mo fethers gaue hym ſo fayre byrde well fethered began fle ye byrdes gyuen hym theyr fethers whē ſawe hym flee toke grete pleaſure whē byrde ſawe hymſelfe ſo well fethered fowles honoured hym began ware prowde toke regarde made hym pycked ſpurred contrary byrdes drewe togyder demaunded eche beſt done byrde made vp nought ſo dyſdayneth pecocke ſayd gretly beautyed reaſon fethers wyl take agayne fro hym name good ſayd fawcon ſo wyll haue myne ſo ſayd al byrdes began take agayne fro hym al fethers yt gyuen hym whē byrde ſaw humbled hymſelfe knowledged ye welth honour hymſelfe knewe came ye worlde naked bare ye fethers myght wel take fro hym agayne whē lyſt cryed mercy ſayd wolde amende hymſelfe noo prowde ſo agayne theſe gentyll byrdes pyte hym fethered hym agayne ſayd hym wolde gladly ſe ye f • e amōge v ſo thou wylte humble thou oughteſt knowe ſurely thou ony prowde dyſdaynous wyll take yu thy fethers ſet founde yu fyrſt ¶thus ſayd ye freer iohn̄ ye cardynalles preſence syrs thus ſhall fall chyrche emperour rome almayne kynges cryſtened hyghe prynces worlde haue gyuen goodes poſſeſſyons ryches entente ſerue god ye ſpende pryde ſuperfluyte ¶ye rede lyfe ſaynt sylueſter pope rome ſaynt peter ymagyne conſyder howe emperour cōſtantyne gaue hym fyrſt ye dyſmes ye chyrche condycyon saynt sylueſter rode nother cc ccc horſe abrode worlde helde hymſelfe ſymply cloſed rome lyued ſoberly chyrche aungell god ſhewed hym ye emperour couſtā tyne infydell ſholde fende hym lykewyſe emperour reuelacyon aungell sylueſter ſholde ſhewe hym ye way helthe ſyke lypper ſo yt fleſſ fell peces whē sylueſter came hym ſhewed hym way baptyme ſo cryſtened hym incontynent hole whiche ye emperoure conſtantyne byleued god empyre gaue sylueſter chyrche dyſmes emperoure rome helde beſyde gaue hym many fayre gyftes grete ſygnyoryes augmentynge fayth chyrche entencyon goodes ſyguyoryes gyuē hym yt ſholde gouerne humbly truely ſpē de pompe pryde nowe dayes chyrche contrary wherwith god dyſpleaſed hereafter wyll dyſpleaſed ſo grete lordes erthe wyll ware colde theyr deuocyons ſo lyberall gyuynge ony thynge ye chirche rather redy take fro yt gyuen thynke wyll longe beſene ¶thus freer iohn̄ roche tayllayd whome cardynalles helde pryſon auignyon ſhewed theſe wordes dyuers wherof cardynalles abaſſhed wolde gladly haue put hym dethe yf myght haue founde ony iuſt cauſe agaynſt hym coulde fynde none ſo ſuffred hym lyue durſt let hym pryſon ſhewed matter ſo parfyte layde hym hyghe ſcryptures peraduenture myght haue made many worlde haue arred howbeit ſuche toke hede ſayenge dyde ſawe many thynges fall accordynge ſayd wrote pryſon yt ſayd wolde proue apocalyps true prowes wherwith armed hymſelfe ſaued hym fro brennynge alſo ſome cardynalles pyte hym wolde theyr vttermooſt hym nowe let v leue ſpeke theſe narracyons retourne pryncypall matter hyſtory spayne portyngale fraunce englonde recorde fortune fell ſeaſon whiche forgotten ¶ye haue herde howe kynge iohn otherwyſe called mayſter denyce portyngale baſtarde broder kyng ferant poſſeſſyon royalme portyngale helpe onely iiii cytees portyngale noble knyghtes royalme portyngale begynnynge acquyted truely kynge peter kynge iohn̄ caſtell wyfe lady beatryce yet thoughe ſome helde opynyon lady neuertheleſſe named baſtarde ſhe doughter lady portyngale called elynoure fyrſt huſbande lyue knyght yt countre ſyr iohn̄ laurence coygne ye kynge portyngale taken fro hym kynge maryed put huſbande portyngale wente dwelled kynge caſtell durſt dwell portyngale fere kynge helde wyſe yet hyghe lygnage theſe thynges meruaylled kynge ferant portyngale reputed doughter lawfully begotten dyſpenſacyon pope vrban vi ye pea made bytwene ii kynges caſtell portyngale knyght royalme portyngale called ſyr iohn̄ ferant andere chefe counſayle kynge portyngale treated pea made ye mariage bytwene kynge ferant portyngalles doughter kynge iohn̄ caſtell thē wyddower maryed ye doughter peter kynge aragon thoughe ye kynge caſtell counſayle dyd caſt theſe doubtes howe fered leſt kynge portingales doughter ſholde taken heyre portyngale faders dyſſeas put ſuretye therof ye kynge caſtell kynge portyngale cauſed dyuers chefe lordes portyngale ſwere kynges dyſſeas take theyr lady tourne royalme portyngale ye kynge caſtel alſo ye kynge portyngale bounde certayne good townes kynge caſtel take hym theyr kynge ye payne forfayture ii thouſande frankes thoughe knyght iohan ferant andere dyde buſynes good entente make pea concorde bytwene caſtell portyngale ye inſtaunce lorde yet ye comons lyrbone ſlewe hym chaſe theyr kynge mayſter deuyce ſayd wolde vnder ſubiectyon caſtell hated ſo moche coulde neuer loue togyder alſo ſayd yt crowne portyngale myght go woman quene caſtell true herytour baſtarde worſe baſtarde kynge ferantes lyuynges dethe iohan ferant coygne lyued huſbande ladyes moder therfore chaſe mayſter denyce crowned theſe iiii cytees lyrbone vyc eure porte portyngale ſayd wolde haue kynge amonge one chefe incydentes moued ye comons agaynſt kynge caſtell ſhall ſhewe spanyardes call caſtellyans maryage made bytwene portyngale ye kynge portyngale graunted dyſſeas royalme ſholde go kyng caſtell euer spanyardes mette ony portyngales wolde mocke thē ſay ſyrs whether ye wyll nowe ye ſhall come daunger ſhall holde vnder ſubiectyon ſeruage kepe lyke ſlaues iues lyſt wolde anſwere ſaye truſted ſholde neuer neuer vnder ſubiectyon ony man lyuyng excepte god ſuche cauſes wordes reprouable spanyardes ye portyngales toke mayſter denyce baſterde broder kynge ferant made hym kynge broders dayes rekenynge made hym kynge comons wolde neuer haue choſen hym theyr kynge forſake doughter dyd howbeit often tymes ſayd knyght ſyr iohn̄ ferant andere ſayd kynge mayſter denyce baſterde broder gretely grace comons royalme wherfore ſayd ben good ben put dethe kynge ferant anſwered ſayd howe comons ſholde neuer haue puyſſaūce ony thynge agaynſt wyll noble men countrey ſone lawe kynge caſtell ſholde euer puyſſaunt ynough conſtrayne chaſtyce yf rebelled dyſſeaſe wherfore ſayd noo cauſe put baſtarde broder deth put hym pryſon ſayng broder man relygyon ynoughe lyue beſyde crowne portyngale ſo lefte alyue theſe foreſayd poyntes artycles true auctoure booke haue ben ſufficyently enfourmed therof noble portyngale thynge meruayled make baſtarde kynge portyngale ſaye yet ſayth quene caſtel lady b • autryce doughter ye lady elynour coygne baſtarde therfore wolde take quene portyngale none heyre came ſame opynyon erle foys layde ye knyghtes countrey wente spayne ayde kynge caſtel ben ſuffycyently infourmed matter bytwene portyngale caſtel wherfore ſayd thē theyr departyng syrs ye haue nothynge buſy yourſelfe bytwene caſtell portyngale quene caſtell doughter kynge ferant portyngale warre euyll begon maye moche euyl come buſye matter anſwered hym ſyth receyued wage ſuche man kynge caſtell muſt nedes go ſerue hym ſo wente mooſt parte dyed ye haue herde nowe let v retourne buſynes portyngale lefte grete aduentures hathe fallē cronycle al thynges haue fallen entente tyme come ſholde founde wryten regyſtred yf aduentures knowen grete domage clerkes yt auncyently haue wryten regyſtred hyſtoryes bookes therby ye hyſtories knowen ſo perpetuall memory wrytynge truely ſaye wyll come ſholde knowe knowe trouth hyſtory haue taken therin grete payne dayes haue ſerched many royalmes countreys knowe trouthe haue acquayntaūce many valyaunt mē haue ſene dyuers bothe fraunce englonde scotlande caſtell portyngale landes duchyes countyes ſuche theyr landes hath ben conioyned theſe warres haue ſpoken ben inſtructed infourmed wolde ony enqueſt ſholde paſſe vnknowen ſyth knewe true notable whyle byerne ye erle gaſton foys enfourmed dyuers buſyneſſes ſuche fell bytwene caſtell portyngale retourned agayne countrey countye heynalte towne valencennes refreſſhed ſeaſon determyned folowe hyſtory yt begon aduyſed myne ymagynacyon howe coulde ſuffycyently inſtructed herynge ſuſteyned opynyon kynge caſtell lykewyſe ought portyngales well gaſcoynes spanyardes herde houſe erle foys waye goynge thyder retournynge toke noo regarde payne trauayle body ſo wente bruges flaundres fynde ſome yt royalme portyngale lyxbone euer ſome y• countrey beholde myne aduenture good yf ſought ſeaſon vii yere coulde haue come better poynte dyd ſhewed wolde go meldeboure selande ſholde fynde knyght portyngale valyaunt man ſage kynge portyngales counſayle newly come thyder goynge then ſee pruce howe coulde iuſtly playnly ſhewe buſynes aduentures portyngale knewe ben ouer countrey theſe tydynges reioyſynge ſo wente fro bruges one portyngale company knewe ryght wel knyght ſo came sluſe toke ſee dyd ſo moche grace god came meldeboure portyngales company aquaynted knyght founde hym ryght gracyous ſage honourable courtoys amyable acquayntable ſo hym vi dayes aboute knyght enfourmed ye buſynes bytwene royalme caſtel portyngale ſyth dethe kynge ferant tyll departynge knyght countrey ſhewed euery thynge ſo playnly ſo gracyouſly toke grete pleaſure hym wryte enfourmed hym deſyred knowe toke leue hym conueyed ſhyp ſo dyd dyuers ryche merchauntes countrey come fro bruges fro place ſe hym company ſone nauarre portyngale dyuers knyghtes ſquyers royalme chefe honoure amonge certaynly coulde ſe ymagyne hym eſtate worthy haue honour noble porte goodly ſtature lykely valyaunt man whē retourne agayne fro rome myne owne countrey ſhall buſy make relacyon wordes gentyll knyght called ſyr iohn̄ ferant porteler ſhall cronycle hathe fallen portyngale caſtell vnto yere lorde mccclxxx x ¶howe portyngale ſent meſſageres englonde ſhewe tydynges theyr coūtrey kynge englonde grete lordes ca xliii howe ſheweth hyſtory yt mayſter denys kyng iohn̄ portyngale dyſcomfyted kynge iohn̄ caſtell yt batayle iuberoth nere ye abbaye called ye cabbaſe ſo many noble knyghtes ſquyers fraunce gaſcoyne byerne ſlayne kynge portyngale fayre vyctoryous iourney gretely doubted honoured portyngales receyued vyctory lyxbone grete glory al people grete tryumphe crowned lawrell auncyently kynges wonte crowned dyſcomfyted ony kyng batayle lyxbone grete feeſt departure ſuche knyghtes ſquyers counſayles good townes cytees yt royalme parlyament counſayle holden howe might perceyuer theyr opinyon honourably certayne ſages royalme ſayd howe neceſſary ſe myght fortefye themſelfe agaynſt ye kyng caſtel puyſſaunce ſo yt myght honourably abyde theyr victory multiply exalte parlyament lyxbone holdē cathedrall chyrche ſaynt dominicke many deuyſes recyted whiche nede reherſed reſt concluſyon parlyament ſholde ſende englonde duke lancaſtre claymed ryght enherytaūce caſtell reaſon yt lady conſtaunce wyfe eldeſt doughter kynge peter caſtell wryte hym euer wolde clayme ony ryght royalme caſtell ſet forwarde buſynes whiche longe hath hanged balaunce aduenture loſt yt wolde come portyngale company men armes archer tyme conuenyent hym ſo erle nauarre conſtable portyngale fayre language ſayd syth agreed ſende englonde duke lancaſtre whome thynke ayded whiche mooſt profytableſt waye v cauſe enemyes feare v therfore let v aduyſe royalme ſage perſonages notable meſſage enfourme ſo ye duke lancaſtre counſayle come countrey ſo ſtronge reſyſt enemyes ſuche ayde ſhall haue v may well ſuppoſe kynge caſtell wyll gete grete ayde frenſſhe kynge frenſſhe men warre wote better enploy theyr ſeaſon haue pea wt englonde vnto feeſt ſaynt iohn̄ alſo frenſſhe men haue ferme pea yt flemynges hath occupyed dyuers yeres erle nauerres wordes well accepted euery mā ſayd howe ſpake well poynte yt ſo wolde named ſad dely beracyon counſayle grete mayſter ſaynt iaques portyngale laurence fongaſſe ryght ſage dyſcrete ſquyer coulde ryght well ſpeke ye language fraunce howe ſholde goo meſſage englonde coulde ſende none counſayle portyngale better coulde doo meſſage letter wryten good frenſſhe latyn kynge englonde yt duke lancaſtre bretherne ye erle cambrydge bokyngham theſe letter wryten groſed vp frenſſhe latyn redde yt kyng counſayle well lyked ſo ſealed delyuered grete mayſter ſaynt iaques laurence fongaſe toke thē ye charge bere englonde ſo myght paſſe daungere ſee encoūteryng ony enemyes robber ye ſee wel robber ye ſee ye lande toke ſhyp called ye lyn whiche wolde ſayle maner wyndes ſurelyer ony ſhyp day toke theyr leue kyng archebyſſhop connymbres grete counſayle portyngale wente ſee ſayled towarde englonde iii dayes ye ſee without ſyght lande fourthe day ſawe cornewall ſped ſo well theyr iourneys ayde god good wynde yt coſted cornewell yt boundes englonde ſo aryued ſaufely without peryll hauen hampton caſt ancre ſo yſſued theyr ſhyppe wente refreſſhed yt towne examyned baylyffe hampton ſuche kepers y• coſt coū trey fro whens came whyther wolde anſwered theyr demaundes ſayd howe royalme portyngale ſente thyder fro theyr kynge counſayle welcome good chere refreſſhed prouyded horſes theyr ſeruauntes rode london guydes knew countrey ſo lodged ſygne fawcon ſente backe agayne theyr horſes fortuned ſo well ye kynge vncles weſtmynſtre wherof ioyfull came londō fore noone ſo dyned dyner toke theyr letter wente duke lancaſtre duches yt duke duches knewe theyr comynge ryght ioyfull deſyred tydynges fro portyngale ben ſhewed thē dyuers tydynges gretely dyd byleue bycauſe letter therof y• countrey ye grete mayſter ſaynt iaques laurence fongaſe entred duke chambre duches preſent becauſe yt laurence fongaſe coulde ſpeke frenſſhe ſpake fyrſt made reuerence duke duches delyuered letter fro portyngale ye duke toke duches ſo red theyr letter duke ſayd meſſageres syrs ye ryght welcome coutrey morowe ye ſhall go kynge ſhall ayde reaſon duches drewe laurence fongaſe parte demaūded hym tydynges caſtell portyngale euery thynge laurence anſwered yt duke called wyne ſpyce ſo dranke toke theyr leue retourned theyr lodgynge ye mornyng wente agayne ye duke herde maſſe ſo entred barge wente water weſtmynſtre ye kynge mooſt parte counſayle duke entred counſayle chambre ſayd kynge syr ye grete mayſter ſaynt iaques portyngale hath brought letter fro ye kynge wyl pleaſe ſe good wyll ſayd ye kynge ii meſſagers kneled downe kynge laurence fongaſe delyuered letter kynge toke cauſed redde alſo delyuered letter erle cambrydge erle bokynghā eche redde theyr letter kyng anſwered ye meſſageres ryght ſwetely ſayd ¶syrs ye welcome countrey comynge dothe v grete ioy ye ſhal departe without anſwere ſuche ſhall pleaſe buſynes let myne vncles haue remembraunce ſo thanked kynge departed y• counſayle chambre wente downe palays abydynge duke lancaſtre taryed tyll hyghe noone duke lancaſtre toke two bretherne hym dyner wente water theſe meſſageres thē erle cambrydge knewe ryght well grete mayſter ſaynt iames laurence fougaſe ſene portyngale wherfore dyner comoned thē dyuers thynges preſence two bretherne demaunded maryage caſtell ſholde haue ben doughter lawe lady beautyce demaundes ambaſſadours anſwered wyſely truely wherby lordes ryght well contente pleaſed trewe theſe ambaſſadours comen englonde duke lancaſtre erle cambrydge broder dyuers counſayles togyder ryght claymed theyr wyſtes erle cambrydge ye haue herde well contente kynge ferant portyngale men warre lodged xv dayes feldes ye caſtellyans yet kynge ferant portyngales wolde neuer fyght thē yet erle ſame tyme ſhewed ye kynge defaulte ſayd ſyr haue company poore englyſſhe mē c ſperes archer al wyllyng fyght enemyes abyde aduenture god wyll ſende v kynge ferant anſwered euer counſayled fyght wherfore erle ſaw departed then toke hym agayne ſone portyngale departed kynge portyngale accorded kynge iohn̄ caſtell maryed doughter hym make pea treatye made ſyr iohn̄ audre knyght portyngale kynge truſt hym kynge portyngale demaunded doughter whether ſhe rather haue kynge caſtel erle cambrydge ſone anſwered ſayd howe ſhe loued better iohn̄ englonde iohn̄ caſtel kynge demaunded ſhe ſayd ſoo ſhe anſwered bycauſe iohn̄ englonde goodly perſonage age cauſe ſhe wolde haue kynge caſtell howbeit fader haue pea spanyardes made maryage alſo erle ſayd duke lancaſtre broder kynge ferant one deed doubted comons royalme portyngale wolde rebell agaynſt lady beautryce mooſt parte royalme al yt theyr kynge maryed moder lady elyanoure coygne yet helde kynges doughter borne lawfull maryage reputed baſtarde mermured theron whyle erle wherfore gladder take away ſone then duke lancaſtre y• matter touched nerer erle cambrydge bycauſe maryed eldeſt ſyſter heyre caſtell fayre chylde lady conſtaunce wyfe wherfore euer deſyred truely iuſtly enfourmed yt buſynes thoſe partyes dyd ſet mynde howe myght exalte tytle ſawe clerely coulde haue ſo good entre caſtell royalme portyngale ſpecyally ſeynge howe deſyred requyred kyng portyngale baron comons royalme alſo conſyderynge howe kynge portyngale noble ſage prynce valyaunt ſeynge howe dyſcomfyted kynge caſtel playne batayle puyſſaunce wherby duke ye ſoner enclyned go portyngale alſo kynge englonde counſayle agreed therto entente iuſtly enfourmed buſynes ſtate condycyon countrey caſtell ryght lady beautryce claymed crowne portyngale alſo ryght kynge iohn̄ portyngale whome comons crowned theyr kynge entente daye duke made dyner theſe ambaſſadours portyngale owne lodging dyner made euery man departe called theſe ambaſſadours hym ryght amorouſly demaunded buſynes portyngale bycauſe laurence fougaſe coulde ſpeke frenſſhe duke addreſſed wordes vnto hym ſayd laurence requyre ſhew poynte poynte conducyon maner londe portyngale hath fallen caſtell ſyth broder erle cambrydge kynge portyngale hath wryten man portyngale yt enforme iuſtly ye ye ſhall grete pleaſure ſyr ſayd y• ſquyer ſhall fulfyll pleaſure began ſpeke ſayd maner syrſyth departure broder erle cambrydge portyngale hath fallen grete trouble dyſcencyō royalme grete aduenture haue ben loſt thanked god buſyneſſes nowe good poynte fermely ſtablyſſhed god wrought grace matter gone euyll thrughe defaulte kynge ferrant laſt dyſſeaſed oppynyon mooſt parte royalme kynge ferrant dayes loued ſore lady wyfe knyght called ſyr iohn̄ laurence coygne bycauſe beautye wolde haue force lady withſtode kynges deſyre longe ſhe myght laſte ſayd dame ſhall make quene portyngale thoughe loue hurte exalte wyl mary lady knee wepynge ſayd ſyr ſauynge dyſpleaſure haue none honour quene portyngale knowe ſo doth worlde haue huſbande redy haue hadde v yere elyanoure ſayd kynge make none eſcuſe wyll haue none wyfe ſhall quyte huſbande mary lady coulde gete none wordes kynge ſhe ſhewed matter huſbande yt knyght knewe therof ſory maleneolyous regarded ſtudyed beſt hym ſayd hymſelfe wyll thus leue wyfe howbeit doubted kynge wente royalme portyngale caſtell kynge henry receyued hym reteyned hym houſe longe lyued ſoo dothe kynge iohn̄ nowe thus kynge portyngale accomplyſſhe folyſſhe pleaſure ſente knyght lady knyght goone kynge ſente byſſhophe connymbres chauncelloure portyngale kynges counſayle kynge ſhewed hym entent wolde wedde elyanoure coygne byſſhop fered kynge bycauſe knewe hym hyghe fyerce condycyon therfore durſt ſaye contrary kynges pleaſure alſo ſyr iohn̄ ferant audere chefe counſayle kynge pleaſe kynge ayd ye byſſhop syr ye may wed wel ynoughe one ye kynge ſhal make recompence ſo ye byſſhop wedded lady crowned quene ſo reputed al ye grete cytees portyngale moche honoure reuerence euer hadde ony quene royalme portyngale kynge doughter nowe quene caſtell true whyle kynge ferant lyued ſente day lyxbone prelate noble men countrey counſayles cytees porte townes portyngale broder erle cambrydge came portyngale kynge made euery man ſwere promyſe dyſſeaſe ſholde take doughter lady beautryce fyue yeres aege herytoure ye royalme portyngale euery man ſware whether wolde howbeit mooſt parte yt knewe ryght well ſhe baſtarde borne aduoutrye moders huſbande ſtyll lyuynge called ſyr iohn̄ laurence coygne lyued caſtell kynge longe kynge ferant portyngale lyued lenger bert ſyr thynke ſurely yf kynges doughter ben ſone comonaltye portyngale wolde ſoner haue agreed hym thē doughter ſayd wolde neuer agree rather dye vnder ſubiectyon royalme caſtell ¶for yet royalme portyngale royalme caſtell neuer loued parfytely togyder hathe often tymes haryed made warre eche lykewyſe royalme scotlande dothe yt royalme englonde duke lancaſtre demaunded laurence fongaſe kynge iohn̄ nowe broder kynge ferrant kynge ferrantes dayes syr ſayd ſquyer royalme portyngale houſe relygyon wherin knyghtes ordre whyte habytes reed croſſe ſouerayne houſe called mayſter deuyce kynge ſet lytell broder made hym ruler houſe denyce alſo kynge iohn̄ nowe medled nothynge buſynes royalme thought nothyng crowne therof yf kynge ferrant portyngale thought ony thynge fallen ſyth loued lady elyanoure lady beautryce doughter wolde haue ſlayne broder nowe kynge bycauſe ſawe kepte houſe bretherne ordre ſo mekely duely ſuſpecte hym ſo let hym lyue pea ſyr dyſſencyon nowe bytweportyngale caſtell ſurely ſyr ſaye trouthe therin ye spanyardes cauſe ther ſo ſayd ye duke ſhall ſhewe ſayd ſquyer caſtellyans ſawe kynge ferrant maryed doughter theyr kynge began prowde began ſpeke grete wordes whiche ſore greueo portyngales spanyardes wolde ſay oye portyngales rude people lyke beeſtes tyme nowe come ſhall haue good market ye haue ben ſhall ſhall deuyde ſet companyes iues dwelleth truage vnder v ye ſhall ſubiectes venymous wordes often tymes ſayd thus met portyngales whyle kynge ferrant lyued maryed doughter caſtell engendred ſuche hate murmured ſayd better deed thē vnder daunger ſubieccyon ye caſtellyans ſo kynge ferrant fell ſyke whiche endured hole yere deed buryed chyrche ſaynt fraunce relygyous houſe freers cyte lyxbone cytees good townes caſtelles portyngale cloſed theyr gate ſente kynge nowe lyxbone knewe ryght well entente iii cytees connymbres porte eure ſayd mayſter deuyce ſo called wyll make kynge royalme thoughe ye baſtarde ſay coſyn lady beautryce quene caſtell borne rather baſterde yet lyueth moders fyrſt huſbande ſyth ſo crowne portyngale fallen two wayes wyll take v mooſt profytable alſo mooſt parte royalme enclyneth make kynge crowne portyngale ſhall go woman wyll vnder ſubieccyon kynge caſtell caſtellyans rather ye ſholde take haue ayde maynteyne v fraunches thē caſtellyans ſholde mayſters ouer v wherfore ſyr receyue gyfte wyl ſhal thus mayſter denyce nowe kynge wolde receyue theyr offre fyrſt ſeconde requeſt anſwered ſayd good people knowe well good affeccyon entyer loue ye offre crowne portyngale whiche grete thynge ye ſaye haue grete ryght crowne co • yn quene caſtell lykewyſe thynke ſame true ſhe baſterde yet lyueth moders huſbande caſtel one poynte ye alone matter behoueth al noble grete parte agre therto thē lyxbone anſwered ſayd ſyr haue ynowe knowe redy courage dyuers alſo oppynyon iii chefe cytees royalme beſyde v connymbres porte eure kyng ſayd let ye wyl content ye know well lady elyanoure called quene royalme yet cyte counſaylloure ſyr iohn̄ ferrant audere wyll kepe crowne portyngale herytage therof ye quene caſtell made fyrſt maryage make pea bytwene caſtell portyngale peraduenture kynge caſtell wyll ſende hym haſtely helpe ſubdue rebelles wherfore nowe obſequye broder whiche ſhal ſhortely wherat moſt parte noble royalme cytees wyl good prouyde remedy behalfe preſente ſayd ſyr ye ſaye true ſhall prouyde therfore ſhall ſyr iohn̄ ferrant ſpeke ſo theyr counſayle ended longe obſequye kepte lyxbone freers kynge ferrant lyeth many noble portyngale deſyred ſo ye quene ſyr iohn̄ ferrant audere gouerned quene kynge nowe grete nombre comons countrey ſpecyally thre cytees connymbres eure ye porte portyngale agreed conſented lyxbone obyte done ſyr iohn̄ ferrant audere deſyred quenes name noble preſente ſholde departe then daye nexte ſaynge howe quene wolde haue theyr counſayles ſholde done ſende caſtel kyng iohn̄ wyfe lady beautryce theyr lady herytoure ryght royalme portyngale noble grete parte herde wordes made lytel ther doubted ſore comons eſſembled herde dyuers murmure ſaynge wolde crowne theyr kynge mayſter denyce alſo ſyr iohn̄ ferrant audere herde lyke wordes therfore deſyred noble royalme abyde hym ayde ſuſteyne opynyon fayled hym ſone kynges obyte done foreſayd freers yt quene elyanour retourned lodgyng euery man cryed horſe ſo al mooſt parte mounted theyr horſes ſo departed fro lyxbone ſome taryed ftyll ſuche kynges partye yt nowe wente theyr lodgynges kepte themſelfe pryuely dyſſymuled matter well ymagyned matter fall fell ſhall ſhewe howe kynges obyte done comons lyxbone thre cytees ſuche retourned ſhortely theyr lodgynges wente cathedral chyrche lyxbone called ſaynt domynycke aſſembled mayſter denyce grete counſayle togyder whiche counſayle endured longe kynge nowe ſayd vnto ¶all ye good people vnderſtande ye wolde make kynge ſurely ſaye ryght yf ye wyll perceyuer purpoſe tyme ſette worke ſhewe dede • uyſſaunce ye knowe ryght well ſyr iohn̄ ferrant audere dothe procure noble royalme ſende ye kynge caſtell ſayth maynteyneth crowne portyngale perteyneth kynge caſtel ryght coſyne wyfe ſaye yf ye wyll ayde ryght rather ye knowe maner man broder kynge ferrāt ſone good kynge peter portyngale gouerned valyauntly true coſyne quene caſtell doughter kynge ferrant lawfull maryage lyxbone ſayd vnto hym syr true wyll haue none kynge wyll make kynge loke theron wyll ye ſhall ſwere vnto v ye ſhall good v kepe iuſtyce ye ſhall flatter grete lordes ſmall people ye ſhall kepe ſuſteyne good herte ayde ſhall gyue ryght perteynynge portyngale kynge anſwered ſayd syrs ſwere pryncypally requyre go ye lodgynge called ye monnoy ſyr iohn̄ ferrant audere elyanoure coygne wyll ſlayne hath deſerued agaynſt agaynſte ſuſteyneth maynteyneth quarelles agaynſt wylles • enne one voyce anſwered wyll done ſurely diſobeyſaunt rebell agaynſt wherfore lette hym put dethe rebellyons agaynſt wherby royalme ſhall take enſample departed togyder mynſtre ſaynt domynycke nombre xvc one oppynyon kynge nowe ſoo wente thrughe towne lodgynge called monnoy quene ſyr iohn̄ ferrant audere came brake vp gate lodgynge entred therin perforce wente chambre quene ryght ſore afrayde whē ſhe ſawe ſo moche people comynge vpon incontynent ſhe fell downe knee mayſter denyce prayed hym haue pyte compaſſyon vpon ſaynge vnto hym ſhe knewe nothynge ony dyſpleaſure ſhe hadde done agaynſt hym agaynſt ony alſo ſhe ſayd vnto hym howe touchynge crowne herytage portyngale ſhe claymed parte mayſter denyce requyre people preſent conſydre kynge ferrant made quene agaynſt wyl mayſter denyce ſayd fayre lady doubte ye nothynge ye ſhall haue hurte come therfore traytoure iohn̄ ferrant audere ſhall dye begyn withall lette kynge caſtell reuenge deth yf hath ben longe proctoure countrey worde auaunced forth ſuche ordeyned ther toke knyght put hym dethe hurte dyd perſone ſo retourned theyr lodgynge kynge yt nowe wente dethe iohn̄ ferrant lady elyanoure ben quene portyngale toke counſayle determyned herſelfe go portyngale caſtell kynge quene doughter ſhe ſuche fray dethe knyght ſyr iohn̄ ferrant audere ſhe thought lenger abyde portyngale ſhe ſawe ſhe coulde haue ther honoure reſt ſhe cauſed mayſter denyce kynge deſyred ſuffre departe lyghtly agreed therto ſayd howe pleaſed hym well yt ſhe ſholde peparte ſayd ſhe good cauſe ſoo lady departed fro lyxbone company ſhe rode ſo longe iourneys ſhe came syuyll kynge caſtell quene laye ſame ſeaſon lady came thyder aſſembled nere noble caſtell grete counſayle buſynes portyngale kynge iohn̄ toke counſayle howe myght ſcynge royalme portyngale fallen hym ſucceſſyon dethe kynge ferrant fader quene wyfe agreed dyed ſholde ſo countrey lyke wyſe lady elyanoure receyued kynge quene doughter ryght honourably reaſon ſhe examyned buſynes portyngale ſhe ſhewed trouthe ſhe hadde ſene knowen alſo ſhe ſayd howe well appered lykelyhede comons portyngale wolde crowne theyr kynge mayſter denyce kynge caſtell agaynſt made reſyſtence defence cauſe hadde ſlayne knyght ſyr ihon̄ ferrant audere bycauſe ſuſteyned alwayes done kynge caſtelles quarell lady ſayd ſhe wel byleued ſawe well apparent alſo certayne baron knyghtes royalme portyngale ſuche hadde better affeccyon kynge caſtell thenne ſhe kynge nowe bycauſe kynge ferrantes doughter accomplyſſhe fulfyll theyr othes made kynge caſtell deſyre theyr kynge iohn̄ ferrant gaue doughter maryage kynge caſtell therfore acquyte theyr promyſe departed royalme portyngale wente caſtell lefte theyr owne landes herytages aduenture recouer agayne erle alphons seroll ye grete pryour ſaynt ihn̄s portyngale ſyr delagare broder ange syluaſte geneull iohn̄ auſſall dyuers nombre xxv wherby ye royalme portyngale ſore febled royalme caſtell enforced kynge caſtell made ſomons thrughe royalme noble men able bere armure bytwene xv xl ſholde haſt come hym felde sebyll ſayd wolde puyſſaunce entre royalme portyngale conquere owne herytage commaundement euery man obeyed reaſon ſuche helde hym ſo came felde sebyll aſſembled nombre lxm men one ſyr laurence coygne huſbande lady elyanoure whome kynge ferrant portyngale toke wyfe quene portyngale vnderſtode ſhe come portyngale caſtell wente certayne kynge caſtelles counſayle ſayd demaundynge counſayle lordes grete frendes howe ſhall wt elyamoure wyfe come portyngale countrey knowe ryght well kynge ferrant toke force agaynſt wyll nowe kynge ferrant deed ye knowe well reaſon ought haue wyfe agayne counſayle wyll ye gyue therin ſuche ſpake vnto gaue hym counſayle ſayd iohn̄ counſayle make ſc •• blaunt therof demaunde agayne take ye ye ſhall gretely abate honoure lady alſo blemyſſheth honoure quene caſtell doughter ye ſholde make worſe baſterde ye ſe howe ye kyng caſtell wyll demaunde thynke conquere royalme portyngale owne ryghtfull herytage ryght wyfe thus ye ſhode open clerely whiche nowe ſomwhat doubte trouble without ye take good hede wyll coſt lyfe yf ye make ye quene caſtel baſtarde countrey ſuſteyne quarell ſay ſhe borne iuſt maryage dyſpenſacyon pope well ſayd knyght beſt ſhall ſhewe ſayd beſt thynke yt ſone ye gete caſtell go agayne enherytaunce portyngale leue lady elyanoure doughter ſe none ſaufegarde fayth ſayd ye knyght byleue well ye counſayle truely lyke good frendes ſyr iohn̄ laurence coygne taryed longe caſtell departed wente lyxbone founde mayſter denyce kynge ſayd come ſerue hym wolde vnder obeyſaunce wolde take hym kynge mayſter denyce grete ioye ſayd howe welcome hym ſo gaue hym agayne herytage made hym capytayne lyxbone thus ſyr haue ſhewed fell buſynes bytwene portyngale caſtell ¶howe laurence fongaſe ambaſſadoure fro kynge portyngale englonde ſhewed duke lancaſtre maner dyſcorde bytwene royalmes caſtell portyngale ca xliiii duke lancaſtre toke grete pleaſure 〈◊〉 laurence fongaſe ſpe •• ſpake ſo attemperaci •• • good frenſſhe 〈◊〉 bycauſe matter touch •• hym nere en • e •• wolde come botom deſy •• ſayd laurence ſpeke hardely 〈◊〉 harde ſtraunger ſpeke two yere tha • rather ſpeke ye go • trouthe matter alſo letter 〈◊〉 haue brought fro kynge portyngale teſtefyeth howe nothynge th •• hath ben done bytwene portyngale caſtell ye iuſtly informe ther • ▪ syr ſayd ſquyer lytell thynge hath •• ben done dedes armes haue ben wherfore well ſpeke ſyth pleaſure volante yt ſhall purſewe wordes ſhall ſhewe euery thynge knowe thus ſhewed kynge iohn̄ caſtel aſſ • bled people ſoone myght ſo came grete puyſaunce ſtrength towardes lyxbone kynge portyngale nowe crowned put portyngales feare ſhewe howe hadde ryght herytage portyngale ſo fyrſt came ſaynt yrayne whiche entre portyngale reſted two dayes towne gouernours therof grete feare comynge bycauſe ye grete nombre men warre yt hym ſoo yelded vp theyr towne hym taken theyr poſſeſſyon lefte men armes kepe towne feare rebellyon departed ooſt ſoo wente tyll came towne tuy whiche ryght ſtronge layde ſyege grete parte tuy helde quene caſtell lady elyanoure lymytted dowry wherfore lyghtely yelded kynge caſtell became ſubiectes vnder obeyſaunce kynge caſtell hadde taken poſſeſſyon lefte men armes kepe hadde ſoo done paſſed ryuer wente towne valencennes portyngale thereto layde ſyege ſente meſſagere vnto whithin ſholde yelde theyr towne vnto hym valence anſwered ſayd let kynge caſtell paſſe forth go lixbone ſoone myght knowe hath wonne cyte outher loue feare perforce incontynente wolde delyuer vp keyes theyr towne hym anſwere pleaſed ryght well kynge caſtell ſo departed fro valence lykewiſe dyd another cyte called serpe whiche ſtronge fayre kyng thought haue gone thyder knewe theyr compoſycyon content came ſo toke waye lyxbone knewe yf myght ſubdue cyte ſholde haue reſydue countrey caſe ſoeuer wente hym quene wyfe ſhewe therby ye portyngales ryght good iuſt cauſe wolde conquere wy •• e herytage thus kyng iohn̄ caſtell came ooſt lyxbone layde grete ſyege ſhewed wel ſyege wolde departe then tyll ye cyte pleaſure gretly thretened mayſter denyce within ye cyte ſayd howe yf myght gete hym ſholde dye euyll dethe rebelles hym kynge caſtelles ooſt grete moche people spanyardes frenſſhe men cloſed ſo ye cyte aboute none coulde yſſue entre wt taken ſlayne ſomtyme fell ſkyrmyſſhes otherwyſe spanyardes toke ſome portyngales ye spanyardes wolde put theyr eyen ſtryke fote arme ſome membre ſo ſente agayne cyte commaū dynge ſaye dyd dyd dyſpyte ye lyxbonoys theyr mayſter denyce wolde make theyr kynge alſo ſhewe playnly ſhall holde ſyege ſo longe ſhall haue perforce famyne otherwyſe ſhall dye euyll dethe ſet fyre cyte without mercy pyre lyxbonoys toke ony dyd ſo kynge nowe portyngale made well kepte theyr eaſe ſo ſent agayne ooſt without ony hurte domage theyr perſones wherfore ſome ſayd ye ooſt done grete gentylnes rendred good euyll ſyr whyle ſyege endured whiche hole yere euery weke one two ſkyrmyſſhes dedes armes done ſome hurte ſlayne one parte kynge caſtell helde well ſyege water lande plente vytaylles came ooſt partyes caſtell day happened ſkyrmyſſhe made one ye gate ſyr iohn̄ laurence coygne capytayne cyte yſſued barryers penon armes coygne hym hym good nombre propre men warre ſkirmyſſhe done many propre feate armes many darte caſt fayth ſayd duke lancaſtre feates armes caſtellyans countrey dothe vſe caſtynge theyr dartes beſt pleaſeth gladly wolde ſe ſay yf ſtryke one aryght without well armed darte wyll perce hym thrughe fayth ſyr ſayd ſquyer ye ſaye trouthe haue ſene many grete ſtroke gyuen wt whiche one tyme coſt v derely v grete dyſpleaſure ye ſayd ſkyrmyſſhe ſyr iohn̄ laurence coygne ſtryken wt darte ſuche wyſe heed perced plate cote mayle iacke ſtopped ſylke paſſed thrughe body ſo fel downe deed therwith ſeaſed ſkyrmyſſhe bycauſe ye dethe yt knyght ſo lady elyanoure wydowe one yere bothe huſbandes ſyr iohan laurence cygne made grete mone valyaūt knyght full good counſayle dethe choſen capytayne lyxbone coſyne ryght valyaunt mā called pouuaſſe coyne made agaynſt ye spanyardes thre foure yſſues dyd grete domage ¶thus contynued ſyege lyxbone ſurely often tymes within towne ſore abaſſhed coulde ſe comforte come frome ony parte ſawe none came englonde wheron lay theyr truſt thē kynge nowe counſayled haue taken ſhyp ſo haue come hyder englonde ſyr iohn̄ vadigothz paſſe ſyr iohn̄ cete dore archedeacon lyxbone ſent hyther englonde kynge erle cambrydge broder haue ſome cōforte ayde retourned lyxbone brought tydynges howe yt ye wolde haue comforted name god ſayd duke trouthe ſo done redy ye poynte haue departed warre flaundres gaunte dyd let gauntoys came hyder ayde helpe ſo ſuche mooſt parte ſholde haue gone wt portyngale wente flaundres ye byſſhop norwyche ſyr henry percy ſo letted iourney portyngale name god ſayd ye ſquyer thought amonge v ſome grete let englonde ſo yt coulde come hyder howbeit dyd well myght maynteyned ourſelfe valyauntly agaynſt kyng caſtell puyſſaunce whiche ſmall thynge mo lxm mē ſee lande thretened byrne exyle v without mercy ſyr thus whyle ſyege endured erle countrey portyngale called erle angouſe dyd v day grete ſocour wherby attayned grete honoure xx galeys aryued porte portyngale good nombre men armes prouyſyon ſo came ſaylynge ye ſee valence thrughe ye grace god came ye kynge caſtelles army lay ancre lixbone mo c grete veſſelles howbeit dyd entrepryſe ſo gracyouſly wynde ſo good poynte dyſpyte enemyes entred ſaufely without peryll galeys hauen lyxbone comynge conquered iiii ſhyppes enemyes brought hym ye hauen whoſe comynge lyxbone ryght ioyous cō forted gretely fayth ſayd duke lancaſtre erle angouſe yt tyme dyd fayre ſeruyce nowe fayre laurence ſhewe howe ſyege rayſed maner wolde gladly ſpeke therof ſyr ſayd ſquyer ſhall ſhewe ryght good wyll haue ſhewed ſyege endured yere lyxbone kynge caſtell ſworne auowed wolde departe frome ſyege tyll cyte vnder obeyſaunce without puyſſaunce gretter kynge rayſed hym therfro force truly al thynges conſydered kynge caſtel kepte wel auowe ye puyſſaunce gretter kyng rayſed hym cauſed hym departe ſhall ſhewe howe peſtylence mortalyte meruaylous ferefull fell ooſt ſuche wyſe mē dyed ſodeynly ſpekyng one another dyed mo xxm perſones wherof ye kyng ſore afrayde wherfore counſayled hym departe then drawe ſaynt yrayne ſome parte breke vp ſyege gyue leue people departe tyll peſtylence ſeaſed whiche dyd ſore agaynſt wyll bycauſe ſworne ſo ſolemply kepe ye ſyege howbeit neceſſyte fayne departe therfore ſyr ſay hath ben ſayd portyngale comon opynyon god dyd ſende peſtylence kyng caſtelles ooſt ayde v kynge nowe cyte wherin cloſed dyed nother man womā y• ſykenes grace god dyd v kynge caſtell dyſlodged fro lyxbone kynge portyngale nowe cauſed ſuche within cyte armed lepe theyr horſes folowe trayne kynge caſtelles ooſt dyd grete domage dyſlodged good aray wherby • oſt parte theyr men promocyon kyng portyngale made crye payne dethe take ony thynge yt founde felde brynge ony thyng therof cyte commaunded euery thynge brente entent ſholde brynge infeccyon cyte prouyſyon euery thynge conuerted flame fyre howbeit thynke ſuche founde golde ſyluer money place brent ſaued well myght thus kyng caſtel wente ſaynt prayne ye entre countrey taryed ſeaſon ſent ſocour fraūce ſpecyally gaſcoyne byerne ye lādes ye erle foys ſent thyder iii ſomers laden wt noble caſtel floreyns gyue preſt knyghtes ſquyers knewe well otherwyſe ſholde haue come theyr houſes baron knyghtes ye royalme portyngale ye partye ye kyng nowe ſawe howe kynge caſtell rayſed ſyege whiche endured yere toke grete courage ſo dyd comons countrey ſpecyally porte ewre connymbres toke counſayle togyder ſhortely crowne theyr kynge mayſter denyce choſen gyuen hym theyr loue ſayd goddes wyll yt ſholde theyr kynge ſhewed vertue agaynſt spanyardes commaundement made thrughout portyngale euery mā come cōmmbres certayne daye lymytted coronacyon mayſter denyce ſuche toke parte came thyder accordynge puyſſaunce royalme moche people kynge iohn̄ portyngale crowned byſſhoppes prelate royalme grete ſolempnyte aperteyned trynyte • ondaye yere lorde god mccclxxx iiii cathedrall chyrche cō nymbres called ſaynt mary whiche daye ye kyng made newe knyghtes owne countrey ſtraungers ye nombre lx kepte grete feeſt ii iii dayes kynge renewed homage erles baron knyghtes ſquyers ſuche helde hym kyng ſware kepe royalme ryght iuſtyce maynteyne al theyr iuryſdyccyons euery man ſware take hym theyr kynge heyres comynge hym male female dye payne neuer forſake thus kynge iohn̄ portyngale crowned kynge kynge caſtell knewe comons portyngale crowned mayſter denyce theyr kynge ſworne hym faythe homage dyſpleaſed thought wolde haue done ſo ſodeynly bycauſe many noble portyngale hym ſayd ſe well behoueth perforce conquere yt myne yf wyll haue ſhall neuer peace bytwene caſtell portyngale tyll ye portyngales haue amended yt haue done ſo kynge crowned came lyxbone taryed toke grete dylygence ſet good way ye buſynes royalme gete therby grace good wyl loue people ſent knyghtes men warre dyuers garyſons townes caſtelles fronters spayne ye kynge caſtell lay sybyll kyng portyngale ſent garyſon trentouſe ſyr iohn̄ ferant perteler experte man armes valyaunt knyght hyghe entrepryſe hym ſyr martyn va coygne broder ſyr wyllyā va two experte knyghtes vnder cc ſperes good men warre well horſed ye caſtell lene towarde iuberoth ſente ſyr iohn̄ radygos l ſperes ye cyte valence portyngale ſente ſyr iohn̄ iames saulles lye garyſon agaynſt ſtronge towne tuy whiche yelden ye kynge caſtell whē came towarde lyxbone tuy lay garyſon grete nombre men armes frenſſhe caſtellyans ye cyte serpe ſente ſyr nondech radygo noble knyght l ſperes porte ewre connymbres ſente men warre kynge thought ſtronge ynoughe themſelfe true faythfull hym thus ſyr ſame yere yt kyng thus crowned garyſons well prouyded often tymes encountrynges ſkyrmyſſhes aſſawtes bothe partyes one tyme men wanne another tyme loſt aduenture armes falleth ſpecyally afore encountre garyſon treucouſe agaynſt caſtellyans laurence ſayd ye duke lanclaſtre paſſe matter ſo breuely let knowe howe done mette feldes wolde gladly ſpekyng dedes armes syr ſayd ſquyer ſhall ſhewe done ſame renconntre preſent bare yt day ye baner ſyr iohn ferant perteler buſynes began capytayne treutouſe kynge caſtell prouyded mē warre ye fronters portyngale ſomtyme v domage aſſembled thē ſelfe togyder toke ye feldes ſomtyme loſt ſomtyme wanne ſo ſeaſon vii capytaynes spanyardes good knyghtes hyghe lygnage aſſembled togyder nombre iiic ſperes well horſed hauynge grete deſyre v domage well ſhewed came entred portyngale toke grete praye many pryſoners yf wolde myght haue entred agayne caſtell ony encountrynge ſoo hyghe mynded prowde ſayd wolde goo ſe garyſon treutouſe ye playne countrey fledde ſoo tydynges came treutouſe ſyr iohn̄ ferrant partelere knewe caſtellyans rode abrode called harneys cauſed trompettes beſowned ſo awoke knyghtes ſquyres towne euery man armed hym grete haſte mounted theyr horſes yſſued treutouſe ye feldes cc ſo put thē ſelfe good ordre ſhewed howe grete affeccyon fynde theyr enemyes demaunded came flyenge ye towne theyr enemyes anſwered ſayd howe farre then howe rode ſofte pace bycauſe grete praye caryed thoſe tydynges ſyr iohn̄ ferrant partelere ryght ioyous ſayd company ſyr iohn̄ martyne va ſyr wyllyam va broder syrs requyre let v auaunce forwarde wyll entre ony towne caſtell portyngale tyll haue ſene enemyes fyght put payne trauayle recouer praye pryſoners leede ſayd laurence dyſplay baner tyme ſhall fynde ſhortely enemyes dyd cō maunded ſo rode forthe good pace laſt ſawe duſt roſe horſes enemyes toke vauntage ſone came ye caſtellyans ſawe v helde themſelfe cloſe togyder ordred themſelfe ſet theyr pryſoners pray theyr one ſyde approched ſo nere togyder myght ſpeke v ſawe howe iii baners iiii penons iudgement ccc horſe fyrſt ſyr iohn̄ radigos de caſtenans knyght baron caſtell ſyr sylue grefye albenes ſyr adioutall tolet caſſell ſyr iohn̄ radigo eure dioſtenſes angouſe thē lyghted foote lykewyſe ſoo dyd delyuered theyr horſes page varlettes began caſt darces doo ony feate armes capytaynes ſpake eche preſent herde wordes ſpoken bothe partyes mayſter ſyr iohn̄ ferrant partelere whoſe baner bare one ye formeſt ye wordes ſpoken hym hym fyrſt demaunded rode portyngale ledynge away ſuche prayes pryſoners taken ſyr adioutall tolet anſwered ſayd wolde ryde lyſt punyſſhe dyſobeyſaunt kynge caſtel herytage portyngale perteyned rauſe founde rebelles therfore ſayd ouer rynne y• countrey take prayes pryſoners well ſyrs ſayd ſyr iohn̄ ferrant ye ſhall lede longe wyll reſcue ye haue noo ryght come ouer rynne countrey ye knowe wel ynoughe haue kynge redy wyll kepe royalme ryght kepe iuſtyce punyſſhe theues robber therfore ſaye vnto behalfe ye haue taken royalme portyngale leue behynde departe hen elles ryght iuſt quarell wyll fyght spanyardes anſwered ye pryſoners haue taken wyll delyuer agayne ye praye wyll take aduyſe thē vii capytaynes caſtell drewe togyder ſhewed come ſe garyſon treutouſe yet wolde haue ben glad haue departed without batayle counſayled thē ſayd howe wolde leue theyr pray behynde pryſoners wolde lede nay ſo ſayd portyngales wyll ye leue elles ye ſhall haue batayle ſo wente togyder ſore batayle bothe partyes good men warre felde fought fayre playne caſt eche dartes ſo ſore ſoo euer ſtryken without wel armed ſlayne ſore hurte many propre feates armes done ſyr iohn̄ ferrant partelere fought axe ryght valyauntly ſo dyd ii companyons partye spanyardes fought ryght valyauntly thus fought ſpace iii houres whiche meruayle mē coulde endure ſo longe theyr armure fyghtynge grete dyſyre eyther partye wynne honoure cauſed endure payne ſyr ſurely spanyardes portyngales harde men batayle ſpecyally ſe neceſſyte thus fought longe mā knewe better theyr batayle ſo egall ſyr thanked god nother baner penon ſyde day ouerthrowen fynally theyr ſyde began open beten downe euery ſyde ſo dyſcomfyture fell theyr page fled awaye ſaue themſelfe vii capytaynes yt preſent ſcaped away one ye meanes page brought hym horſe dyd mayſter good ſeruyce day yt adyentall caſſel vi ſlayne neuer man taken raunſome thus ſyr iohn̄ ferrant partelere company obtayned vyctory theyr enemyes thre agaynſt two tuyſday moneth octobre nere treutouſe yere lorde mccclxxx iiii ¶howe laurence fongaſe ſhewed duke lancaſtre maner batayle iuberoth bytwene kynge caſtel kynge portyngale caxlv dyſcomfyture enemyes men mounted theyr horſes delyuered ſuche pryſoners caſtellyans taken alſo gaue ſuche pyllage theyr enemyes gotten excepte ye beeſtes whiche nombre viii hundreth thoſe draue garyſon treutouſe vatayllynge towne reaſon receyued grete ioye wyſt chere make v bycauſe delyuered y• coūtrey theyr enemyes reſcued loſt wherby grete prayſe thrughe ye townes portyngale ſyr ſame yere men another fayre iourney theyr enemyes ye felde sybylle ſyr fyrſt ſhall ſhewe mooſt happyeſt iourney kynge portyngale ony kynge hym cc yere whiche done within iiii monethes yt kynge ſente v hyther enemyes iiii agaynſt one good men warre hyghe empryſe wherfore iourney ought ye prayſed ſyr thinke ye haue herde therof al redy wherfore thynke beſt ſpeke therof nay ſayd duke ye ſhall leue ſo ye ſhall ſhewe hole proceſſe wolde gladly ſpeke therof yet trouthe haue heraulte called derby batayle ſayth ſhewed ſuche englyſſhe men dyd meruaylles armes reporte thē bileue trouth grete nombre wherby ony grete feate ſholde done broder ye erle cambrydge came portyngale brought agayne hym ſuche englyſſhmen wente thyder many theſe heraultes ſuche lyers wyll exalte ſuche lyſt beyonde meaſure noblenes good loſt enpayred thoughe ſhewed therfore good knowe reporte knoweth ¶syr ſayd laurence ſtraungers batayle iuberoth ye kynge portyngale paſſed two hundred men englyſſhe gaſcoynes almaynes gretteſt capytaynes ſtraungers two gaſcoynes one almayne duchy guerles gaſcoynes called ſyr wyllyam mountferrant bernardon ye almayne albert englyſſhmē certayne archer herde none named ii ſquyers northbery hartecell called counſayle kynge lordes batayle well ſayd duke proſede forthe tell iourney howe fought requyre ſyr ſayd ye ſquyer ryght good wyl ſyr ſhewe howe ſente hyther fro kynge mayſter laurence fongaſe renewed tale ſpake buſynes iuberoth ſayd thus ſyr ye haue herde alſo coronacyon kynge portyngale connymbres yt kyng caſtell rayſed ſyege fro lyxbone dethe peſtylence fell • oſt ſo wente yrayne ſayd howe greued hym ſore enfourmed coronacyon redoubted lorde kynge iohn̄ portyngale kynge caſtell claymed yet dothe ryght herytage crowne portyngale tytle wyfe doughter kynge ferrant whiche denyed yet ſuche cauſe haue ſhewed ſo thus kynge caſtell counſayled ſende mē war myght gete ſpecyally fraunce ye frenſſhmen alwayes ayded hym ſuſteyned quarell ye kynge fader lykewyſe ſayd hym counſayle ye nede nothynge one iourney agaynſt portyngale puyſſaunce ye may kepe felde fyght thē ye ſhal come entente grete varyaunce redy portyngale ye ſe perceyue well nobleſt perſones ye royalme haue ſubmytted thēſelfe vnder obeyſaunce whiche thynge gretely furdereth warre ye auaunce yourſelfe puyſſaūce fyght baſtārde portyngale yt comons haue crowned theyr kynge gete ayde englyſſhemen ye lyke ouerthrowe hym yf ye wynne iourney royalme grete matter wyn ſoo ſuche counſayle thynges iohn̄ caſtell auaunced hym ſelfe ſende letter meſſageres fraunce poictou bretayne normandy borgon dyuers place thought haue men armes knyghtes ſquyres money loue ſuche helde ony thynge hym ſpecyally came many knyghtes ſquyres hym byerne ſo daye ſaynt yrayne auewed people ye nombre vi viic ſperes xxxm ſpanyardes horſoacke hauynge deſyre v domage tidynges came portyngale kynge ye lordes good townes cytees ſuche kynges partye ſhewed nombre puyſſaunce kynge caſtell howe fully determyned come lay fyege agayne lyxbone kynge portyngale counſayle aſſembled togyder moſt notableſt perſones royalme ſayd yt kyng beſt go cyte mete enemyes rather encloſed ony cyte towne portyngale yf beſyeged ſholde haue moche buſynes defende theyr cyte meane ſeaſon ye caſtellyans myght ryde abrode theyr eaſe lyſt conquere townes cytees caſtelles outher force loue dyſtroy ye playne countrey peraduenture lengthe within cyte wherfore ſayd kynge syr yf go agaynſt take place conuenyent fyght thynke beſt mooſt profytable ſyr knowe well ye ſhall peaſybly enioy crowne portyngale wherwith haue crowned without batayle leeſt one twyſe ouerthrowe aduerſary kynge caſtell puyſſaunce yf may dyſcomfyte hym ſhal lordes country yf ouercome royalme aduenture better v ſeke batayle ſought honourable v ſyr hathe ben often tymes ſene ſetters hath auauntage defender therfore ſyr wyll counſayle ſende forthe letter meſſagers ſuche ye thynke wyll ſerue ye kynge anſwered ſayd ſyrs ye ſpeke wel wyl ye haue ordeyned ye kynge ſet clarkes warke wryte letter wrote euery man ſholde come porte portyngale nere aboute certayne day lymytted howbeit ſuche wryten vnto came thyder royalme toke full parte hym dyſſmuled taryed ſe howe ye matter ſholde frame lengthe ſome gone theyr owne countrey kynge caſtell bycauſe ſayd kynge caſtell ryght crowne portyngale kynge howbeit yt kynge ſouerayne lorde wente connymbres made aſſemble ſuche men warre coulde gete truely hym yt choyſe men portyngale mooſt auctoryte erles baron knyghtes ſquyers alſo xxv hundred ſperes ſquyers xiim foote mē ordeyned conſtable marſhall conſtable erle nauare ye marſhall ſyr alne perriere bothe ryght ſage knyghtes conduyte men warre departed fro connymbres toke waye cabaſe iuberoth rode fayre eaſely eaſe themſelfe theyr horſes yt theyr prouyſyon myght folowe good ordre rore ryders one • ewe demeanynge caſtellyans tyme ſyr iohn̄ ferrant pertelere come kynge garyſon dorech v legges fro iuberoth thynke knewe kynge ſholde fyght enemyes suppoſe kynge caſtell wel enfourmed howe kynge portyngale comynge hym warde puyſſaunce knewe therof grete ioy ſo men ſhewed anone determyned come agaynſt v tyght v ſpecyally ye gaſcoynes byerne ſore deſyred fyght v deſyred haue ye fyrſt batayle ſo ſyr wyllyam mounferrant gaſcoyne partye ſayd ſurely howe ſholde haue batayle bycauſe byerne agaynſt v euer deſyreth nothynge batayle ¶then kynge caſtell batayle came nexte daye lodged caſtell lerre two legges fro iuberoth nexte day came cabaſe lodged yt nyght kynge caſtel lodged lytell legge fro iuberoth knewe well way toke howe lodged iuberoth syr portyngales hath alwayes gre • e truſt confydence god ye good • ortune yt place iuberoth therfore tyme reſted ſayd ye duke haue ſo good hope place rather another ſyr layd ſquyer auncyently ye grete charlemayne kyngge fraunce almayne emperoure rome tyme grete conqueroure place iuberoth dyſcomfyted vii kynges ye myſereauntes ſlayned ye infydelles cm ſyr auncyently founde hyſtoryes cronycles reaſon batayle conquered coanymbres countrey portyngale brought cryſten fayth bycauſe ye grete victore yt agaynſt goddes enemyes founded abbaye blacke monkes gaue grete rente portyngale caſtell alſo ſyr aboute cc yere paſt ſame place grete betayle fayre iourney acheued lorde tyme broder kyng caſtell tyme neuer kynge portyngale called countye portyngale ſo theſe ii bretherne ye kynge caſtell erle portyngale mortall warre togyder partycyon landes ſo yt coulde founde pea bytwene mortall warre togyder matter touched ſoo moche erle portyngale portyngales yt rather haue ben deed haue ben vnder ſubieccyon kynge caſtel ſo toke day batayle kynge caſtell ſo puyſſaūt yt x agaynſt one ſo yt ſet nothynge portyngales ſo cabaſe iuberoth theyr batayle ryght cruell fynally portyngales obteyned y• vyctory caſtellyans dyſcomfyted kynge caſtell taken whoſe takynge erle portyngale pea lyſt boundes ſet departyng caſtell portyngale bycauſe ye portyngales ſaw yt god ſente vyctory ſo ſmal nombre agaynſt ſo grete puyſſaunce thought augment theyr lande make royalme ſo ye prelate noble countrey crowned theyr fyrſt kynge connymbres made hym ryde thrughout royalme crowne lawrell heed ſygnyfyenge honoure vyctory aunently kynges wonte ſo euer ſyth royalme hath kynge ſyr ſurely rather portyngales wolde vnder ye ſubieccyon caſtellyans wolde take one ferre fro blood ye kynge portyngale kynge deed without yſſue male ſyr ye kynge portyngale nowe came place iuberoth theſe matter ſhewed hym thus whyles conſtable marſhall orderynge theyr batayles came kynge ſyr iohn ferrant partelere came ſame morenynge fro garyſon dorech brought hym lx ſperes ye kynge grete ioye comynge bataylles ordeyned abode nothynge enemyes fore ryders ſente forth aſpye theyr dealynge kynge ſouerayne lorde came amonge men cauſed fylence made ſayd ſyrs ye haue crowned kynge ſhewe nowe trouth faythfulnes ſyth ſo forwarde ſpecyally place iuberoth ſhal neuer retourne agayne portyngale without fyght wt myne enemyes euery man anſwered ſayd ſyr ſhall abyde wt knowe trouthe ſhall flye daye tthus batayles approched caſtellyans grete deſyre fynde v fyght well ſhewed ſente forthe fore ryders ſe knowe enemyes dyd taryed fro v iii houres herde tydynges thē ſo thought loſt howbeit ye laſt retourned brought v ſure worde nombre lykelyhode ſhewed v howe theyr vowarde viim men armes armed capa pee freſſhe well horſed coulde deuyſed ye kynge caſtelles rerewarde xxxm horſe good men armes kynge company knewe nombre theyr enemyes howe yt theyr vowarde ii legges ye kynge gaſcoynes ſtraungers well accorde caſtellyans determyned kepe v cloſe togyder ſtrength make ii wynges batayle men armes wherof iim ccccc ſperes bytwene ii wynges ſyr myght well haue ben ſene good ordre batayle people well recomforted cōmaunded kyng payne dethe yt man take daye pryſoner determyned amonge v beſt ye lordes capytaynes ſayd ſholde entende take pryſoners ſholde deceyue v make v take hede yt ſholde ſayd better v fyght wel take hede takynge pryſoners ſel lyues derely good people ought worde vpholden obſerued enemyes came v cloſe togyder lyke good men warre alyghted foote trymmed theyr harneys let theyr horſes go ſo came approched v fyerſly ſurely floure chyualry ſhewed well bytwene v lyt • ell dyke gretter yt knyght armed myght well paſſe ouer howbeit v ly • tell aduauntage ye paſſynge ther • en yt bothe wynges wt theyr dartes • yd hurte mayme dyuers dyd ſore trouble ouer dyke aſſembled agaynſt v thought yt kynge caſtell grete batayle folowed hande ſo dyſcomfyted ſlayne kynge caſtell came nere hande v ſhal ſhewe meanes cloſed bytwene v comons countrey layde behynde ax wepons without ſparynge men armes freſſhe came agaynſt thē cauſed thē recule backe fall ye dyke one vpon another ſyr al done leſſe halfe houre ſlayne felde men armes mo iiiim none taken raūſome whē ony knyght ſpere wolde haue taken ony pryſoner theyr cōpany wolde ſlee thē theyr hādes thus clerely without recouery vowarde enemyes dyſcomfyted came kynge caſtel batayle wherin xxxm men well horſed approched nere nyght knewe nothynge myſchefe fallen theyr vowarde came muſtred themſelfe v ccccc thē lepte theyr horſes ouer dike ſyr al ſuche paſſed ouer neuer repaſſed agayne ſlayne grete parte noble men ſuche deſyred feates armes grete nombre baron knyghtes portyngale ſuche ye kynge caſtell agaynſt v people ſawe enemyes ſo dyſcomfyted paſſed ouer dyke xl place ye dyke ſtopped wt deed mē toke horſes folowed ye chaſe yt ferre nyght wolde folyſſhly go
