ferre doubte buſſhmē te alſo ſo well horſed caſtellyans ſurely yf receyued domage dyd ye kynge caſtell taken ſlayne nyght came ſo darke ſaued hym many ſyr ſhall ſhewe name ye mooſt parte noble men fraunce gaſcoynes portyngales dyed felde batayle iuberoth firſt erle iohn̄ alphons serole portyngale grete pryour ſaynt iohn̄s portyngale dilgaures broder ange saluace geneue iohn̄ auſalle ſyr dangoues medrich dricho perſement peter reſermant lugares verſaunt grete mayſter caleſtrane broder called dygo dygares peter gouſſart seball iohn̄ radigo herriers grete mayſter ſaynt iaques freſſhmen ſyr iohn̄ rys ſyr ieffrey ricon ſyr godfrey pertenay ſyr eſpaynolet spayne ſyr reynolde solyere knyght called lymoſyn marſhall kynge caſtelles ooſt gaſcoyns bierne lorde bierne ye lorde mortan ye lorde bryngoles ſyr raymonde durach ſyr bertram varuge ſyr iohn̄ aſolgme ſyr raymonde valentyne ſyr adam mouraſe ſyr menuent sarement ſyr peter sarembiere dyuers mo xiic knyghtes ſquyers gentyll men nowe ſyr ſhall ſhewe ye name ſlayne party fyrſt ye erle nauare cōſtable portyngale galopes porteke peter porteke agalype ferrant porteke broder pōnaſe coygne egeas toille podich daſſue vaſſe martyne mielx ſone vaſſe martyne ſtryken darte clene thrughe body alſo ſlayne gouſſalenas merlo alue porie marſhall ye ooſt good knyght radigos perriere iohn̄ iames salues iohn̄ radigo coſyn ye kynge ammoudeſque radigo radiges valero • ceaux mendignes valconſeaux duke lancaſtre began laughe laurence fongaſe demaunded ſayd ſyr laughe ſayd duke good cauſe neuer herde ſo ſtraunge name haue herde reherce syrſayd fayth theſe name haue countrey ſtraunger byleue well ſayd duke laurence became kynge caſtell dyſcomfyture made ony recouery dyd cloſe hymſelfe ony townes dyd ye kynge portyngale folowe hym nexte day nay ſurely ſyr ſayd laurence folowed furder abode ſtyl ſame place yt felde nyght nexte daye tyll noone retourned caſtell alerne ii lytel legges fro iuberoth ſo fro then connymbres ye kynge caſtel went ſaynt yrayne toke barge xiiii hym rowed greteſhyp ſo wente ſee sybyll ye quene men wente ſome one way ſome another lyke people dyſmayde wt recouery loſt moche theyr domage lyke recouer grete ſoaſon wtout ye puyſſaūce ye frenſſhe kynge bycauſe kynge portyngale counſayle knowe well yt caſtellyans wyll pourchace ayde fraunce bycauſe alyened togyder therfore ſent countrey ye kynge englande ye duke ſayd laurence ye ſhal departe hen tyl ye bere wt good tidinges pray ſhewe encountrynge yt men felde sybyll ye ſpake ryght nowe wolde gladly dedes armes thoughe good knyght myſelfe ſyr ſayd ye ſquyer ryght good wyll ſhall ſhewe fayre honourable iourney ye kynge iohn̄ portyngale cabaſe iuberoth retourned grete tryumphe ye cyte lyxbone yt tydynges ony newe aſſembly ye caſtellyans frenſſhmen helde thē garyſons kynge caſtel departed fro sybyl quene wyfe hym wente burgus caſtell ſo men theyrs made warre togyder garyſons ſo tyme erle nauare conſtable portyngale entred caſtell feldes sybyl xl ſperes came towne called valewyde within whiche cc men armes caſtell ye erle nauare came baryeres ſhewed wel howe demaunded batayle thē within made ſemblaūt yſſue howbeit armed thē men ben longe pleaſed thē thē retourned ryden paſt legge yt coūtrey yt ſaw thē ye garyſon valewyde come galopyng capytaynes thē diogenes padillo experte man armes ye grete mayſter ſaynt iaques galyce men ſaw thē ſo comynge lyghted fote delyuered theyr horſes theyr page spanyardes grete nombre wolde haue ſet ye page varlettes haue taken theyr horſes fro ſome ſayd let v wyn theyr horſes gretter dyſpleaſure put thē payne make retourne foote mayſter ſaynt iaques ſayd naye let v ſo wyn mayſters ſhal ſoone haue ye horſes let v alyght fote fight thē ſhall endure agaynſt v thus whyle ye caſtellyans arguynge mē paſſed oure lytell water yt behynde thē toke grete groūde fortefyed made ſemblaunt though caryed nothyng theyr horſes caſtellyans ſawe yt paſſed water repented thē yt ſet ſoner thē dyd howbeit thought ſoone ouercome men ſo came began caſt dartes caſtellyans enployed al theyr artyllery mo dartes caſt ſoo contynued theyr aſſaulte fro noone tyll nere nyght men ſawe yt theyr enemyes ſpente theyr artyllery ye erle nauare made baner paſſe water company daſſhed amonge caſtellyans anone begā open wereſore trauayled weryed chaſed theyr harneys ſo yt coulde helpe themſelfe ouerthrowne dyſcomfyted mayſter oeſaynt iaques ſlayne mo lx hym fled ſo ſaued theyr horſes wan many fro caſtellyans ſay ſyr mē yt day fayre aduenture yes faythe ſayd duke lancaſtre ¶howe ambaſſadours portyngale anſwere kynge englande grete gyftes howe toke theyr leue wente theyr countreys ca xlvi ſyr bycauſe ſuche rencountres dedes armes yt men haue theyr enemyes ſyth ye eleceyon kyng iohn̄ portyngale portyngales entred grete ioy moſt comonly ſay ye god theyr ryght ſyr ſay moche amys ſay ye god wt thē euery thynge touchyng ony dede armes lytell moche euer ſyth dethe kynge ferrant haue vyctory ye erle foys yt nowe one ye greteſt lordes worlde full hyghe prudence knowe countrey ſayd yt fortune v portyngale yf knyghtes byerne byleued hym whā departed couutrey ſholde haue armed themſelfe agaynſt kynge portyngale yt nowe wyſe dyſcrete man fereth god loueth holy chyrche exalteth moche may often tymes oratory knee herynge deuyne ſeruyce hath ordeyned yt ſo euer buſynes yt none ſpeke hym tyll oratory grete clerke taketh lytell hede ony grete ſermones ſpecyally wyll haue iuſtyce kepte royalme poore men maynteyned theyr ryght thus ſyr requeſt haue ſhewed maner countrey yt knowe kynge counſayle thē cōmaunded departyng fro ſhewe euery thynge yt knewe wherfore ſyr maye pleaſe myght haue anſwere laurence ſayd duke tyme▪ haue ſhewed yet agayne ſay comynge theſe tydynges doth grete pleaſure ye ſhall departe fro tyll ye ſatyſfyed requeſtes well anſwered ye come ſyr ſayd ſquyer thanke duke called wyne ſpyces ſo toke theyr leue wente theyr lodgynge arcorch houſe ye fawcon london lodged thomelyn colebrunque longe duke lancaſtre erle cambrydge broder counſayle togyder yt buſyneſ▪ caſtell portyngale wherof ye erle cambrydge well contente ben yt countrey yere glad condycyons tytles kynge portyngale quene caſtell ſayd broder ſyr kynge ferrant lyued chanon robſart ſyr wyllyam wyndeſore dyuers knyghtes yt ſhewed nowe fallen ſayd herde dyuers ye ſame coūtrey murmure quene caſtelles tytle portyngale therfore toke away ſone grete affeccyon maryage name god ſayd ye duke ſquyer portyngale hathe declared matter thynke haue ſo fayre entre caſtell portyngale royalme aragon ferre alſo kynge chyldren haue alwayes ben fauourable frenſſhe partye thenne v therfore good ſyth kynge portyngale maketh v good 〈◊〉 refuſe day matter parlyament holden weſtmynſtre accorded yt duke lancaſtre ſholde haue coſtes ye royalme bitwene xiic ſperes choſen men iim archer yomen paydein hande halfe yere therwith kynges vncles well contente ſpecyally duke lancaſtre pryncypally ye matter touched yt ſholde chefe ye armye dyſpatche theſe ambaſſadours portyngale kynge englande wrote kynge portyngale louynge letter conteynyng grete amyte yt wolde bere portyngale grete gyftes gyuē ye mayſter ſaynt iaques portyngale laurence fongaſe alwayes ye duke lancaſtre wt erle cambrydge ſo day theſe ambaſſadours toke theyr leue ye kyng coūſayle dyned yt daye wt ye duke lancaſtre erle cambrydge nexte day delyuered vn derſtode duke lancaſtre ſente letter kynge portyngale alſo credence yt ſholde ſende vii galeys xviii xx veſſelles porte bryſtowe fronters wale hym company paſſe portyngale ſo ambaſſadoures departed wente hampton founde theyr ſhyp yt taryed ſo entred ſee wynde theyr wyl ſo entred ye hygh spaynyſſhe ſee within v dayes hauen porte portyngale whiche tyme kynge ryght ioyfull theyr comynge ye grete mayſter ſaynt iaques portyngale laurence fongaſe ſhewed ye kynge counſayle al yt ſene herde englande well ye kynge vncles delyuered theyr letter whiche certefyed al theyr ſaynges anone kynge portyngale gretely deſyred ayde englande ye entente cauſe enemyes haue fere determyned wt coūſayle yt mayſter alphons v • etat chefe patron mayſter ſhyppes galeys portyngale yt ſholde prepayre redy vii galeys xviii grete chyppes ſayle englande fetche ye duke lancaſtre cōpany ſo alphons cōmaunded thus incontynent dyd ſo ſo daye departed fro porte portyngale vi dayes arryued bryſtowe whiche ſeaſon lordes englande ye mooſt parte aboute ye march wale kynge duke lancaſtre knewe comynge theſe ſhyppes ryght ioyfull knyghtes ſquyers al ſuche ſholde go hym ſente ſo porte bryſtowe cc veſſelles flete portyngale redy apparelled ye duke company duke entencyon haue hym wyfe chyldrē make ſome good maryages caſtel portyngale retourne agayne englande thought ſhortely retourne ſaw buſynes englande lykely harde ſharpe kyng neuewe yonge aboute hym peryllous counſayle wherfore ye gladder gone departed preſence bretherne ordeyned ſone ye lorde henry erle darby lieutenaunt yt englande ſet aboute hym wyſe ſad counſayle luſty yonge knyght ſone duches lancaſtre lady blaunche doughter quene phylyp englande neuer ſawe ii better ladyes noble condycyon neuer ſhal thoughe ſholde lyue thouſande yeres whiche impoſſyble duke iohn̄ lancaſtre ordred buſynes englonde thē toke leue kyng bretherne ſo wente bryſtowe taryed xv dayes ſhypped horſes bagages mo iim hay lytter freſſhe water duke entred galey well apparelled hym grete ſhyp yfnede hym duches conſtaunce wyfe wente iourney good courage ſhe truſted recouer herytage caſtell quene ſhe retourned agayne ſhe doughter called katheryne fyrſt huſbande ii doughters izabel phylyp whiche phylyp maryed ſyr iohn̄ holande conſtable ye ooſt marſhall ſyr thomas mor • aur alſo maryage one doughters howbeit ſhe baſtarde moder ye lady mercell damoyſel mary ſaynt hyllary hauman admyral ye duke nauey ſyr thomas percy alſo ſyr yon fythwaren lorde lucy ſyr henry beaumond de poumins ſyr iohn̄ nuell lorde talbot lorde baſſet ſyr wyllyam bea • champ ſyr wyllyam wyndefore ſyr thomas tracon ſyr hughe spenſer lorde wylloughby lorde braſton ſyr wyllyā fermiton ſir iohn̄ dambricourt ſyr hughe haſtynges ſyr thomas wanceſtre ſyr mauburyn liniers ſyr loys rocheſtre ſyr iohn̄ souſtre ſyr phylyp tacyel ſyr iohn̄ bouboufer ſyr robert clycon ſyr nycholas trenton hugyn caurele dauyd houlegiax thomas allerey hobequyn beauceſtre dyuers penons beſyde ye baron ſperes knyghtes ſquyers good men armes iim archer tawle yomē fayre ſeaſon ye moneth may whiche lyghtly pleaſaunt peaſyble ſo ſayled cooſtynge ile wyght gernſey tyll came open ye cooſt normandy cc ſayles grete beautye ſe galeys glyde ſee approchynge lande full men armes arch ſekynge ſome aduentures ſayd armye normandy ſee truely ſo tyll englyſſhe flete appered ye boundes ouarentyne knewe theyr balengers armye englande comynge therfore withdrewe themſelfe hauen harflewe lyghtely nothynge knowen ſpecyally dedes armes lordes knyghtes ſquyers wyl gladly talke togyder therof dyſcomfyture iuberoth kynge caſtell toke ſuche loſſe ye haue herde tydynges therof came franuce reaſon many loſt ye batayle theyr frendes kynſmen warre ſo lykely caſtell alſo herde true reporte howe ye duke lancaſtre claymed ryght enherytaunce herytage caſtell howe rayſed englonde grete armye entente drawe caſtell portyngale ſo knyghtes ſquyers ye low march auaunce theyr honoure drewe ſente eche determyne howe myght beſt drawe caſtell ſome coūſayled go thyder lande eſchewe ye perylles ye ſee alſo ſcape fro encountrynge ye englyſſhe nauye ſome ſayd nay therto ſayd ye paſſage lande ouer longe alſo thought yt kynge nauare clerely fauourable ye frenſſhe partye frenſſhmen loued ſmally togyder ſayd true frenſſhe men taken fro hym enherytaūce normādy howbeit tell yf quarel iuſt ſo thus theſe cōpanyōs doubted gretely perylles yt myyght fall goynge lande well kynge nauare thought ſholde neuer come way thrugh aragon ſo laſt concluded go rochell dyd take theſe rygged xviii veſſelles toke fewe horſes wt whē redy wynde theyr wyll entred theyr veſſelles ſo ſayled towarde bayon yt waye nere therto muſt nedes paſſe yt company ye lorde courſey ſyr iohn̄ handoy ye vycoūt verliere ſyr peter vellamines ſyr guy baueux ſyr iohn̄ caſtell morant ye lorof ſaynt liger ſyr iames fougeres ye lorof bellannes ſyr tryſtram langurant ye lorde bartoys barres dyuers ſo yt ccc knyghtes ſquyers choſen men deſyrynge armes thus ſayled ſee wynde wether wolde wyſſhe ſo aryued without peryl domage porte ſaynt andrewe byſquay ye yere lorde miiiclxxx vi ye xiiii day moneth may theſe knyghtes ſquyers fraū aryued ſaynt andrewes refreſſhed ii dayes ſpace drew theyr ſhyppes theyr horſes bagages ſet forthe demaunded ſholde fynde kynge caſtell ſhewed howe ſholde fynde hym cyte burgus spayne thē grete counſayle ye buſynes royalme theſe knyghtes ſquyers toke theyr way burgus ſo came thyder kynge caſtell ryght ioyfull theyr comynge demaūded tydynges fraunce way came thyder anſwered howe came ſee fro rochel ſayd fraūce yt duke lancaſtre grete army mē armes archer come ye ſame ſeaſon caſtel elles portyngale alſo ye kynge portyngale ſent nōbre galeys ſhyppes englāde hym theſe tydynges ye kyng spayne penſyue thē made ſemblaunt well thought ſholde haue ſore warre ſeaſon made good chere theſe knyghtes ſquyers fraunce thanked gretely theyr comynge ſayd ſyr robert braquemont ſyr iohn̄ broder syrs ye departed fro yere paſt deſyred ſoeuer ye retourned agayne hyder ye ſholde brynge tenyſe balles parys v play togyder ben better hadde charged haue brought good ba • ſenetes good harneys thynke ſhall fynde ſeaſon well enploye syr ſayd knyght haue brought bothe ſyr alwayes armed alwayes play thus kynge caſtell made ryght good chere affeccyon god pylgrymage ſaynt iames ſyth ye countrey ſome auowed ſo ſo rode togyder company truſſed theyr harneys thought ſholde haue gone batayle dyd wyſely theyr ſo doynge ſtode good ſtede retourned agayne ye ſhall nowe let v retourne ye duke lancaſtres armye cooſt normandy lyke maner cōparyſon fawcons pelegrynes haue ſtande • eſted longe perche hath grete deſyre flye abrode lyke maner knyghtes ſquyers englonde deſyred fynde dedes armes auaunce themſelfe ſayd eche ye aryue go ſe boundes porte normandy knyghtes ſquyers awake v fyght v theſe wordes multyplyed came ye duke eyre duke departed englonde knewe ſyr iohn̄ maleſtroyt lorde cambor morfonac grete nombre knyghtes ſquyers bretayne lay ſyege baſtydes caſtell breſt commaundement conſtable fraunce ye duke herde grete deſyre yt men fynde ſome dedes armes ſayd admyrall ſyr thomas percy conſtable armye ſyr iohn̄ holande commaundynge addreſſe theyr nauey towarde bretayne ſayenge howe wolde goo ſe caſtell breſt vyſyte comforte ye companyons therin loke thē yt without baſtyde theſe tydynges ye englyſſhe men ioyful alphons vietat chefe patron nauey portyngale knew ryght well way entree bretayne whiche ryght peryllous daungerous made galey lede trace ſhewed ye way ſeaſon ſayre pleaſaunt ſee peaſyble ſoo ſayled towarde hauen breſt taryed tyde knewe well fludde ſholde ye hauen breſt grete pleaſure trompettes claryons ſame ſeaſon ſyr iohn̄ maleſtroyt vycount combor morfonac ſyttynge dyner whē tydynges came englyſſhe armye come roſe armed knewe wel whē ye duke lancaſtre taken lande wolde fyght rayſe theyr baſtydes ſoo well armed good mynde defende yf aſſaylled ccc knyghtes ſquyers englyſſhe men ryght ioyful whē hauen breſt vnderſtode howe ye breton helde theyr baſtydes ſayd howe wolde go ſe fyght thē grete deſyre doo ſome dedes armes ¶howe duke lancaſtre aſſayled lordes knyghtes ſquyers baſtydes breſt bretayne howe defended themſelfe ca lxvii thus duke lancaſtre company toke lande lytell beſyde caſtell breſt lefte theyr horſes prouyſyō ſtyl theyr ſhyppes ladyes damoyſelles toke lande refreſſhe ye fyrſt day dyd thynge apparelled themſelfe lodge ye erthe ii iii dayes pauylyons along ye ſee ſyde ſo lay yt day nyght nexte mornyng ye conſtable marſhall army ſowned theyr trompettes cauſe euery mā armed ſo dyd good ordre wente towarde ye caſtell ye baſtydes whiche ſtrongely made maner haue endured ix x yeres aboute ye baſtides dyke gate towres good walles made grete tymbre knyghtes ſquyers englonde ſuche deſyred dedes armes came barryers ye baſtides begā ſkyrmyſſhe wt feruent wyl wyn ye baſtydes breton knyghtes ſquyers within baſtydes redy defende entente fyght large hande hande dyd put away barryers theyr defence wherin dyd grete foly truſted moche theyr owne chyualry doone many goodly feate armes herde rencountrynges ſore foynynge ſperes dyd beſt beſt breth howbeit many ye englyſſhmen therfore gaue breton moche ſo clene force armes englyſſhmen wanne baylles ſo yt within cloſure ye towne mo c men armes ſo ye breton poynte haue loſt ſyr iohn̄ maleſtroyte vycount combor ſawe maner cryed crye ſayd ſyrs ſhall loſe thus forwarde fyghtynge ſholde faynte outher dethe honoure breton cloſed togyder grete courage pytched theyr ſperes glayues erthe helde ſtrongly theyr place fought couragyouſly many fayre dedes armes done ſo force englyſſhe men fayne recule backe ſoo wel reſyſted coulde gete grounde ſo clene beten ye baylles ſo day coulde wyn agayne another corner theyr baſtydes towre ſtone deſcendynge downe rocke whiche breton helde theyr aduaūtage kepynge theyr baſtydes therat made grete aſſaulte archer meane ſeaſon whyle men armes fyghtyng barryers englyſſhe men paſſed ouer lytell dyke ſo came foote towre wt pycke ax mattockes theyr handes ſo began myne ſore ye towre ſuche defended themſelfe theyr towre valyauntly englyſſhe archer ſhotte ſoo hooly togyder none durſt appere theyr defence without ſore paueſſed ye englyſſhe men vndermyned ſo ſore foundacyon towre raue clene ſondre one parte fel downe yt ſawe wolde fall drewe parte ſtode ye englyſſhe men made grete ſhowte tyme late ſowned ye retrayte ſayd done ynoughe daye englyſſhe men departed ſayd breton ſyrs abyde al nyght make good watche morow wyll come loke agayne ye ſe well ynoughe caſe ye nothyng ſhadowe v entente englyſſhe men nexte daye retourne agayne aſſayle baſtydes conquere ſuche within whiche ryght well theyr puyſſaunce ſoo haue done thus englyſſhe men paſſed nyght often tymes ſayd moche thynges ſholde fall mennes thoughtes yf coū tre thoughtes agaynſt ſay bycauſe thoughe englyſſhe ooſt ſubtyll wyſe men warre yet breton yt within baſtydes ſuffycyently prouyded wyſdome welconſydered thynge myght auayle thynge theyr domage ſawe well muſt nedes departe then elles taken ſlayne determyned truiſe myght departe leue theyr baſtyde ordeyned ſo dyd lepte theyr horſes lefte theyr baſtydes toke feldes ſo toke way hambont iiii myle then dyd wyſely therin feared purſute englyſſhe men bycauſe theyr horſes lande thus ſyr iohn̄ maleſtroyte company rode ye ſame nyght hānybout founde opē feared lytell englyſſhe men nexte day trompettes blewe euery man ooſt armed hym drewe towarde aſſaulte baſtyde herde tydynges breton departed lefte baſtyde voyde ye englyſſhmen repented layde buſſhment wherby ſholde haue loſt ſo theyr pray brake downe baſtyde ſet fyre theron thus duke lancaſtre ye baſtydes rayſed breſt ſame day duke ſyr iohn̄ holande certayne lordes wente ſe caſtell breſt ladyes wt ete drāke made chere ſo wente agayne theyr lodgynges ye nexte day whiche ye iii day refreſſhed theyr ſhyppes wt freſſhe water iiii daye toke ſhyppynge ſo departed fourthe day duke company maryners toke counſayle togyder whiche waye ſholde drawe whether ſholde take lande lyxbone porte portyngale byſquay coulongne longe counſayle fully determyned alphons vietat patron galeys portyngale ſente ye queſtyon demaunded hym anſwered ſayd syrs cauſe ſente portyngale fro kynge mayſter ſyr knowe trouthe ſoeuer ye aryue countrey ye ſhall ryght welcome hym ſhall ryght ioyfull hym gretely deſyreth comynge ſe thus ſpace houre poynte haue landed porte portyngale xxx myle lyxbone howbeit chaunged theyr purpoſe ſayd amonge ferre honourable lande march theyr enemyes lande theyr frendes ſaynge alſo yf theyr enemyes knowe yt landed ſhal feared reſted take lande coulongne galyce ye maryners ſet theyr courſe way wynde wether wyll ſo departed fro breſt ye v daye came hauen coulongne taryed fludde wherfore ſholde approche nere lande nowe ſhall ſhewe knyghtes fraunce lorde barroys ſyr iohn̄ braquemont ſyr iohn̄ caſtell morant ſyr peter bellames ſyr tryſtrā come pylgrymage ye towne compoſtella lyeth body ſaynt iames whē done theyr pylgrymage offered theyr lodgynges tydynges came howe englyſſhe men cooſt lykelyhode aryue coulongne coulde vntruſſe theyr harneys diſcharge theyr mule armed quyckely determyned go thyder defende porte caſtell towne ſuche knewe ye countrey ſayd ſyrs auaunce forwarde ſhortely yf englyſſhe men happen wynne towne caſtell coulongne wyll lordes countrey aboute theſe knyghtes dyd ſuche dylygence came ſame nyght towne coulongne whiche xiiii longe myles then coū trey full wylde laboure came ſo poynte entred ye towne caſtell ſame ſeaſon englyſſhmen came hauen theyr comynge towne caſtell ryght ioyfull nyght came theyr caryages ſomers mornyng grete beautye beholde entrynge hauen ye galeys ſhyppes charged men prouyſyon trompettes claryons ſounde trompettes claryons ye towne caſtell dyd ſounde lykewyſe agaynſt thē ye englyſſhe men knew wel men warre towne caſtel yſſued theyr galeys ſhyppes ye feldes approchynge towne ſawe well ye towne ſtronge well prouyded men warre without towne certayne fiſſher houſes ye englyſſhe lordes made theyr lodgynges ſoo laye ſtyll iiii dayes doynge none thynge dyſchargynge theyr ſhyppes ſo grete prouyſyon theyr horſes ſet lande whiche ben ye ſee xv dayes ſore oppreſſed furoure ſee nombre people euery ſhyppe yet ben well kepte haye ootes freſſhe water ſufficyent whā euery thynge voyded galeys ſhyppes demaū ded ye duke wolde haue done nauey anſwered ſayd wyll al maryners payde theyr wage let euery man owne profyte gyue good leue wyll euery man knowe wyll neuer paſſe agayne ſee englonde tyll haue full pleaſure royalme caſtell elles wyll dye quarell ye maryners payde ſo euery man contente ſo departed myght hauen coulongne ſome wente portyngale ſome lyxbone ſome bayon albay bretaygne englande ſoo none abode behynde thus duke lancaſtre men lodged without coulongne ſuche lytell houſes founde abrode feldes bower made grene bowes lyke men warre aboute ſpace moneth duke laye coulongne remeued without huntynge hawkynge ye duke lordes englande brought hawkes houndes theyr ſporte ſparowe hawkes ladyes alſo brought ye ſhyppes mylles grynde corne ouyns bake theyr forager wente dayly foragynge thought ſpede howbeit founde grete plenty forage lodged poore countrey deſerte wherfore dryuen go ferre forage alſo garyſon coulongne ye barroys barres ryght wel coulde take vauntage enemyes nede companyons ſawe englyſſhe forager ryde forthe ſo folyſſhly thought daye thē make pay ſo daye armed cc rode guyde nyght aboute woodes mountaynes ſo brekyng day came wood mountayne called eſpynet taryed ſhewed howe englyſſhe forager rode abrode true ye nombre iiic theſe forager ben brode ii dayes gotten moche forage retourned towarde theyr ooſt theyr waye laye paſſe pace pynet buſſhment brake cryed barroys barres forager abaſſhed mooſt parte vnarmed ſyxe ſocore archer dyd put themſelfe good ordre defence began ſhote dyd hurte wounde men horſes theyr ſhot paſt caſt away theyr bowes fell defence ſuche wepons ſome hyd ſaue themſelfe ſholde make longe tale theſe englyſſhe forager ſlayne c c ſaued themſelfe wel myght buſſhes hedge horſmen coulde come ſuche fled came coulongne ſhewed ye barroys barres ouerthrowen ooſt began ſtyre arme ſyr thomas moreaux marſhal ooſt ccccc mounted theyr horſes penon ſaynt george ſet forth grete deſyre fynde frenſſhe men rode ſoo longe came eſpynet founde theyr men lyenge deed thynge elles frenſſhe men departed ſoo retourned without doynge ony thyng elles wtin halfe myle theyr ooſt ſawe frenſſhmen entred theyr garyſon coulongne wherwith ſore dyſpleaſed coulde amende day marſhal ſore blamed ſome ooſt ſente forthe ſuffered go forth ony forager without ſure conduyte conſyderynge theyr enemyes beynge lodged ſo nere ſure holde ſuche nombre able ouerthrowe v vic forager duke lancaſtre conſtable ſo blamed hym ſore aſhamed therof excuſed hymſelfe ſayd howe ben forth x tymes hurte well ſayd duke take better hede another tyme caſe may fall houre daye peraduenture ſhall fall agayne hundreth dayes ¶howe duke lancaſtre ooſt ſoiourned momoneth coulongne departed rode towarde ſaynt iames galyce ca xlviii duke lācaſtre ſoiourned coulongne ye ſpace moneth coūſayled dyſlodge thēs drawe towardes ſaynt iames galyce better countrey plentyfull men horſes ſo departed rode thre batayles fyrſt marſhal ccc ſperes vic archer duke cccc ſpere ladyes damoyſelles company arrere garde conſtable ſyr iohn̄ hollande wt cccc ſperes viic archer thus rode fayre eaſely iii batayles rydynge thre dayes bytwene coulongne ſaynt iames countrey galyce ſore afrayde duke comynge thyder fered gretely puyſſaūce marſhall vowarde came compoſtelia ye body ſaynt iames lyeth towne cloſed agaynſt hym howbeit men warre garyſon men ye towne yt kepte frenſſhmen wolde vndertake kepe vtteraunce ſtronge ynoughe kepte agaynſt ſuche men warre duke brought thyder marſhall ooſt ſente thyder heraulde armes knowe theyr entente wolde heraulde came barryers foūde ye capytayne ytwarde called alphons ſene heraulde ſayd ſyr capytayne lytel beſyde duke lancaſtres marſhall hath ſent hyder wolde gladly ſpeke wel ſayd yt capytayne pleſeth wel let hym come hyder ſhal ſpeke wt hym ye heraulde retourned ſhewed marſhall ſayd ye marſhall wt xx ſperes wt hym wente thyder foūde barryers ye capytayne certayne ye chefe heedes towne ye marſhal lyghted fote iii hym lorde baſſet ſyr wyllyā fremyton ye marſhall ſayd ye capytayne men lorde duke lā caſtre lady lady lancaſtre doughter kynge peter lorde kynge hath ſent hyder ſpeke know ye wyll ſay outher receyue ye ſhowe ſouerayne lorde lady elles aſſayle take perforce ſurely knowe trouth ye taken perforce al ye within towne ſhall ſuffre dethe wt ſwerde gyue enſample ſyr ſayd capytayne wyl vſe v reaſon wolde gladly acquyte v yt belonge know ryght well yt lady cōſtaū ce lancaſtre doughter kynge petero caſtel • ſ yt kynge peter abyden peaſybly ſtyl kyng ſhe ben ryghtfull enherytoure caſtell matter chaūged otherwyſe al ye royalme caſtel abode peaſybly kyngē henry broder reaſon batayle yt nātuel ſo yt al countrey ſware holde kynge henry kyng kepte longe lyued alſo haue ſworne holde kyng iohn̄ ſone kyng ſyr ſhewe v haue coulongne done ſayd maye ſo ſyth ye haue lyne moneth yt haue made ſome maner treaty yt true ſayd marſhal treaty wt elles ſcaped dyd yet towne coulongne twyſe ſo ſtronge towne ſhall ſhew treaty haue made v ye mē ye towne haue pryuely made compoſycyon • v ſaynge wyll euery thyng accordynge ye though ye wyl ſuffre yourſelfe aſſayled dyſtroyed yet ſoo wyll yf countrey galyce yelde lorde duke lady wyll lyke wyſe haue good pledge ſuffycyent wel ſayd ſayd capytayne lykewyſe wyll holde ſame treatye royalme many mo good cytees townes ryde forth leue v peaſe wyll yt wyl delyuer good pledge oſtages nay ſyr ſo ſayd marſhall lorde ye duke lady wyl ſuffre yt wyl come lodge towne kepe theyr eſtates ſholde theyr owne herytage therfore anſwere v ſhortely ye wyll outher yelde aſſayled taken force deſtroyed ſyr ſayd capytayne gyue v lytell leyſure yt may ſpeke togyder ſhal anſwere ſhortely contente ſayd marſhall capytayne entred ye towne cauſed euery man come hym wyſely ſhewed frome poynte poynte ye haue harde fynally agreed receyue duke ye duches peaſybly theyr lorde lady abyde theyr towne longe pleaſed without puyſſaunce kynge iohn̄ dyd dryue then alſo whē taryed pleaſed yere ii longer ſhorter departed ye countrey without lefte ſuffycyent garyſon defende fro theyr enemyes elles rendre agayne kynge iohn̄ marſhall yf ſoo commaunded ſo quyte theyr fayth promyſe made treatye ye marſhall ſyr thomas moreaur accepted ſayd ſayd ought duke ye duches deſyred nothynge elles marſhall retourned men ſo duke taryed hym feldes ſhewed ye duke trety wher wt duke content ſoo good ordre batayle duke rode towne ſaynt iames within ii lytell frenſſhe myles ſaynt iames galyce came proceſſyon clergy y• towne croſſes relykes mē woman chyldren tomete duke duches men towne brought key thē whiche preſēted duke duches theyr good wylles ſemblaunt ſay dyd theyr good harte kneled downe receyued theyr lorde lady entred ye towne ſaynt iames fyrſt voyage made wente chyrche theyr chyldren made theyr prayer offrynge wt grete giftes ſhewed yt duke ye duches theyr ii doughters phylyp katheryn lodged abbay kept theyr houſe ye lordes ſyr iohn̄ holāde ſyr thomas moreaux theyr wyues lodged y• towne al baron knightes lodged abrode ye felde houſes bowres bowes ynowe coūtrey foūde fleſſhe ſtrong wyne ynough whereof ye englyſſhe archer drāke ſo moche yt ofte tymes drōken wherby ye feuers elles ye mornyng theyr hedes ſo cuyl yt coulde helpe thē ſelfe day whē ye barroys barres iohn̄ caſtel morant ye knyghtes ſquyers ye caſtel coulōgne herde ye duke duches entred peaſybly ſaynt iames yt receyued thē toke coūſayle togyder beſt thē ſayd foly tary ther ony lenger haue good aduē ture let v go burgus ye kynge ſe wyl none otherwyſe wyll go agaynſt theſe englyſſhmen yf ſuffre thē lodge thus reſt lytell lytell ſhall cōquere lordes caſtell wherfore honourable v go thyder thē abyde coūſayle helde ye beſt ſo made thē redy departe truſſed yt ſo yſſued ye caſtell coulongne toke theyr leue yt foūde entred fyrſt toke gydes ſuche knew y• coūtrey elles ben encoūtred ſo rode thrugh byſquay coſtyng galyce ſo came lyon ſpayne ye kynge quene ye kynge welcomed frenſſhe knyghtes reaſon demaunded thē tydynges howbeit knew ynoughe al redy ſhewed hym entred coulongne ye ſame tyme yt englyſſhmen entred hauen englyſſhmen foūde hauen vii galeys veſſelles byſquay laden wynes whiche englyſſhmen theyr profyte merchauntes ſone ſolde ye ſayd kynge ſo goth warre wyſe tary knew army englonde theſe myght haue gone ſome quarter ſyr ſayd ye knyghtes come thyder truſt ſaufegarde ſayd wynes marchaundyſe yt ſholde go flaundres de wel ye maryners ſaynt andrewes yt englyſſhmen ſee boundes cooſt byſquay true y• kynge portyngale ſent thē galeys gret ſhyppes thyn kynge wolde haue landed ye porte portyngale lyxbone dyd cōtrary appered entred galyce coulongne well ſyrs ſayd kynge among knyghtes fraūce knoweth dedes armes thē mē coūtrey ye haue haunted vſed warre thē haue thynke englyſſhmē haue borne thēſelfe al ſeaſon ſyr ſayd haue borne themſelfe lyke good mē warre ſo cloſe pryuy yt harde knowe entende ſuppoſyng thynke ye duke lācaſtre wyl abyde nexte wynter ſaynt iames towne people theraboute ouer rynne ye coūtrey galyce wyn ye ſmall holdes gete vytayles prouyſyons tyl ſomer come lykelyhode ſhall ſome treatye made bytwene hym kynge portyngale elles neuer one poynte yt cauſeth v byleue yt ſome alyaunces ſhal cōcluded bytwene thē yt ye duke hath brought englāde hym al doughters maryed mary hath ii mary thynke ye kyng portyngale aduerſary ſhal haue one wel ſayd ye kyng thynge beſt ſyr ſayd ye knyght ſhal ſhew cauſe al townes caſtels ye • ron • er galyce wel kepte ſuche ſtrēgth ſuche ſtrength cauſe thē beten downe ſhewed v men ye coūtrey fortefy minſters chyrches ſteples bryng thē al theyr goodes ſyr ſurely ſhal loſſe confuſyon royalme whē ye englyſſhmen ryde abrode theſe ſmall holdes chyrches ſteples ſhal holde agaynſt thē ſhal refreſſhed nouryſſhed wt ſuche prouyſyon ſhall fynde whiche ſhal helpe furteth wynne ye reſydue therfore ſyr ſay yt ye wel cauſe al ſuche holdes beten downe le ye haue leyſure make crye yt wtout euery thyng auoyded ye good townes ſtronge caſtelles bytwene feeſt ſayntes elles let forfayte abandō tt mē warre ſo euer catche furcheſt feeſt ſaynt andrewe better owne mē profyte ther rather enemyes ſyr ſende ſpecyally certayne perſones counſayle ye frenſſhe kyng certefyeng hym caſe countrey thus ſyr ſende kyng vncles ye duke berrey ye duke borgoyne ſhewyng thē ſurely yt lykelyhode nexte ſomer ye ſhal haue ye gretteſt war yt euer made ſpayne ye prynce ony ſyr wryte pyteous letter deſyrynge kynge vncles cōforte grete nede wt ſome good mē armes reſyſt enemyes kepe def • de royalme grete alyaunces redy bytwene frenſſhe kynge lykewyſe hym fader ſyr ſurely wyſe ye frenſſhe kyng noble royalme fraū ce whiche may dede thē englande portyngale ioyned togyder caſe wyll fayle whē ye frēſſhe kyng coū ſayle iuſtly enfourmed euery thynge ye ſhal wel perceyue wyl take ſuche regarde therto yt ye ſhal take lytell domage war knightes ſquyers fraūce deſyring auaunce theyr dedes wt lytell worde cō maūdement wyll drawe theſe partyes fynde dedes armes nowe wote employ theyr tyme better fraū ce flaūders accorded whiche hath ben war long ſeaſon alſo truce bytwene fraūce englāde beyonde ye ryuer loyre endure ye feeſt ſaynt iohn̄ baptyſt therfore ſyr ye ſhal ſe knyghtes ſquyers fraūce come hyder good nombres well fynde dedes armes ſe coūtrey mete ye englyſſhmē ſyr coūſayle ꝓfyre yt al theſe ſmal holdes chyrches mynſters ſteples abrode ye coūtrey let thē de put downe ye thynke haue ioy ye reſydue thē kyng caſtel ſayd ſyrs ye coū ſayle truely thus wyll fro hence forwarde thē without takyng ony coū ſayle cōmaunded al ſuche holdes grete ſtrength beten downe abandoned ye frenſſhe knyghtes al yt founde thē ſe yt done deuyſed ſyrſayd yt wel ſayd ſyr ſhal ſe accōplyſſhed ſhal helpe ſaue reſydue worde yt kyng caſtel ſayd thē fraūce auctorite yt gaue thē wel worth thē ccm frankes profyte ſpecyally thē yt came fyrſt caſtell whē duke lācaſtre aryued coulongne thus thrughout al royalme caſtel al ſmal holdes chyrches ſteples ſuche ſufficyent kepte put downe ye goodes thē abandoned mē warre ſo people ye countrey atrapped begyled ſuche fortefyed ſuche place put thē theyr goodes wyne corn • fleſſhe thī ge thynkyng haue kepte thē ſure fell cōtrary knyghtes ſquyers ſente thyder theyr mē toke al brought ſuche prouyſyon foūde theyr mayſters lodgynges golde ſyluer ſuche foūde ſuche money made vylaynes pay theyr owne goodes yt money neuer came knowledge yt kepte ſtyll theyr purſes ſome ye poore cōpanyons ſuche ſubtyl thē mooſt aduentured therby wan mooſt often tymes ſuche cometh fro theyr owne howſes mooſt poreſt ſuche caſes ſoneſt moūted good horſes genettes v vi theyr ſtable gyrdelles chaynes golde ſyluer iim frankes theyr purſe whē theyr owne coūtrey fayne go fote nagge thus ye cōpanyons yt came fyrſt caſtel wan moche ryches poore mē ye coūtrey payde al robbed ryfled wt theyr owne mē wolde yt theyr enemyes ſholde haue ony ꝓfyte therof theſe tydynges came fraūce cōpanyons ye pore knyghtes ſquyers yt gone caſtell made ſo ryche eger go theyr houſes draw ſpayne cōſideryng myght well pyll robbe theyr frendes theyr enemyes ¶of grete apparell prouyſyon generally made royalme fraūce kyng coūſayle iourney made englande alſo dethe frauncis atreman ca lii frenſſhe kyng counſayle wel enfourmed ye voyage yt duke lācaſtre ſholde make caſtel departed ye voyce flewe quyckely yt royalme caſtel ſholde haue moche yt ſomer fynde ſome remedy theragaynſt duke burgoyne made ſo lyghtly pea wt gaū • ſe ye entente ayde ye neceſſyte ye kyng caſtel wherto frenſſhe kyng royal fraūce bounde dyuers reaſons ye kyng caſtel men ſhyppes ye ſee buſynes ye royalme fraunce good ſtate alſo beſyde yt yonge kynge charles fraūce grete affeccyon go wt army ye royalme englande knytes ſquyers fraūce well agreed therto ſpecyally vncle ye duke burgoyne conſtable fraunce al yt wyfe ſyſter kyng rycharde englande alſo ye lorde coucy theſe lordes moſt parte ye chyualry fraūce ſayd ſholde one go englande ſe countrey people teche way haue done fraunce ſo ye yere lorde mccclxxxvi ye entente breke ye duke lancaſtres voyage cauſe hym retourne caſtel gyue feare ye englyſſhmē grete ordenauūce yt voyage made traūce tax tallages ſet allyſed cytees good townes ye playne countrey yt c yere none ſuche ſene alſo grete apparel made ſee al y• ſomer tyll ye moneth ſeptembre dyd thyng elles y• ſee cooſt grynde corne bake byſket tournay lyſle doway arras amyas bethune ſaynt omers townes aboute sluſe ye frenſſhe kynges entencyon counſayle take ye ſee sluſe ſo entre englande diſtroy ye countrey yt ryche men ye royalme fraūce ye ayde voyage taxed tayled iii iii parte • theyr goodes many payde thē worth beſyde accōplyſſhe ye payment men warre fro spayne fro porte ſybyll pruce grete ſhyp ye ſee yt ye frenſſhmen coulde lay theyr handes vnder theyr owne obeyſaunce reteyned ye frenſſhe kynge men prouyſyon came fro al partyes aryued flaunders wyne ſalte fleſſhe hay tonne otes ony ons byſket floure egges pypes al maner thynges yt coulde deuyſed ſo yt tyme come coulde byleued thē yt ſawe lordes knyghtes ſquyers men war wryten vnto deſyred come ſerue ye kyng iourney sauoy almayne fro y• ſone goynge downe ye lande ye erle amynacke ſo theſe lordes farre countreys erle sauoy reteyned vc ſperes alſo ye erle armynacke ye dolphyn awuergne theſe lordes thoughe farre coūtreys knew ende warre ſholde come yet made theyr ꝓuyſyons ſo grete coſtly yt gret meruayle thynke therof wonder conſyder fro whens ſuche prouyſyon came lande ſee flaūders bruges dan sluſe ſo ſent holāde zelande meldebourge zerechyel dourdreſt ſtonehone townes ye ſee cooſt ye ryuers entryng ye ſee al maner ſhyppes yt coulde ony ſeruyce al brought sluſe ye holanders ye zelanders ſayd thē yt reteyned thē yf ye wy • haue ſeruyce pay v wage clerely elles wyl go parte ſo payde wherin dyd wyſely trowe ſyth god created ye worlde neuer ſene ſo many grete ſhyppes togyder yt yere ſluſe blanquerge • ye moneth ſeptēbre ye ſayd yere nobred xiiclxxxvii ſhyppes sluſe maſtes ſemed ye ſe lyke grete wood cōſtable fraunce ſhyp apparelled lentregmer bretaygne alſo cōſtable cauſed made bretaygne tymbre cloſure towne lyke parke yt whē takē lande englade cloſe theyr felde lodge therī theyr caſe wtout waking ſkries whēſoeuer ſholde remoue theyr felde y• cloſure ſo made yt myght take ſonder peces grete nombre carpēters receyned wage atende thereon herde yt ye duke bretaygne made ony prouyſyō go iourney duke tourayne kynges yonger broder erle bloys al myght go ſome muſt abyde behynde kepe ye royalme ſo ben y• ſeaſō bruges dan ſluſe ſene ye buſynes chargynge ſhyppes wt hay ſackyng byſket ladyng onyons peſon benes barley candelles hoſen ſhoos ſpurres knyues dagger ax war ax hew wtal mattockes nayles beddes couch horſeſhoos pottes pānes cādelſtyckes al maner neceſſaryes kechyn botery al •• yces euery thyng yt coulde thought neceſſary ſerue mā horſe al ſhyppes one thyng ſo euer ſene ben ſeke thynke wolde clene haue forgoten al ye payne ye cōpanyons fraūce rekened none otherwyſe amonge thēſelfe whē ſpake togyder yt royalme englāde ſholde clene haue ben loſt exyled wtout recouery al ye men woman chyldrē therin ſlayne taken caryed fraūce ſeruytude grete apparel thus made come englande ye kyng englāde coūſayle wel enfourmed therof ſurely affyrmed fenſſhmē wolde come thyder ſo ſurely ſworne meruayle though grete apparel ſomwhat ye begynnyng abaſſhed ye englyſſhmē alſo y• matter ſhewed moche dede alſo yt englyſſhmen ſure cer • aynte whether preparacyon come englande elles lay ſyege caleys bothe lande ſee englyſſhmē knewe wel yt townes worlde ye frenſſhmen moſt deſyred haue caleys wherfore kyng englande ſent caleys grete prouiſyon whete cornes ſalte fleſſhe fyſſhe wyne bere thynges thyder ſent ſyr thomas holāde erle kente ſyr hughe caurell ſyr wyllyā helman ſyr dangouſes ſyr water vurnes ſyr water paulle ſyr wyllyā toucet ſyr loys mountalban ſyr colars dābrychcourte vc men armes vc archer ye erle rycharde arū del ſyr henry ſpenſer ordeyned kepe ſee xl greteſhyppes wel decked men armes archer ye nombre ccc men armes vic archer ſyde ſayd dyuers place fraunce haynalte pycardy yt ye frēſſhe armye yt thus apparelled flauders nother go englande calays rather retourne al ye matter ſet ye towne gaunte enfourmed ye towne gaunte y• ſame ſeaſon doubted gretely yt ye apparell come thē wronge byleue ye duke borgoyne theyr lorde wolde nothyng thē good reſt pea thoughe yt frauncis atreman ſlayne anone makyng pea tournay deth ye duke nothyng blame duke none euyll wyl hym though ye ſeaſon war dyd many feates armes ye towne agaȳſt duke hath ben declared playnly though came euyl ende owne defaulte byleued peter du boy ben otherwyſe hym pea made bytwene ye duke borgoyne gaunt retourned fro tournay gaunt yt peter du boy made hym redy go englande ſyr iohn̄ bourſer peter ſayd hym fraū ci wyll ye wyl ye go englande v ſayd wolde abyde ſtyll gaunt ſayd peter thynke abyde pea grete hatred agaynſt wyll abyde nothynge tryſt ye comontye ye haue herde gaunt ſlue murdred valyaunt iaques artuell done ſo moche good towne bothe counſayle armes lytell cauſe vyllaynes ſlue hym honeſt men towne dyd ſaue hym rather dyſſymuled glad dethe lykewyſe frauncis wyll yf abyde wyll tary therfore adue ¶why ſayd frauncis duke borgoyne hath pardoned thynges hath reteyned yf wyll go hym ſquyer ſtable iiii horſes alſo ſyr guy tremoyll ſheweth grete ſygne loue name god ſayd peter du boy ſpeke lorde ye duke borgoyne knyghtes thynke wyll kepe well pea ſpeke comons gaunt ſome yt ye haue alwayes pleaſed remembre ye lorde sargelles ye made ſlayne knowe trouth yt theſe paſſed hatredes wyl contynue theyr harte yf ye abyde amonge thē yet better go dwell ye duke borgoyne well ſayd frauncis ſhal take aduyſe englande wyl go thus frauncis atreman abode ſtyll peterdu boy wente ſyr iohn̄ bourſer anone yt pea cryed publyſſhed partyes flaunders made crye none ſholde bere ony armure ſworde hym frauncis atremā ſtyll gaunt kepte grete eſtate warre durynge thought contynue ſomwhat honeſtye euer went iii iiii ſeruauntes waytynge hym armed beryng ſwordes wepons thē crye made duke name thought ſholde rynne hym none ſeruauntes thought hymſelfe ſoo well fauoure towne deceyued within vii viii dayes cry proclamed ye duke baylyffe came perſonally hym ſayd fraūcis ye put lorde duke offycers grete ſuſpecte go aboute ye towne harneys ſeruauntes beryng ſwordes wepons defence thoughe y• tyme war whiche pleaſeth v wherfore cōmaunde duke name lay downe frauncis thought none euyll yt dyd maynteyne eſtate anſwered ſayd ſyr baylyffe wyll obey reaſon thanke god hate perſone wolde yt ony ſholde haue ony hurte ſake howbe thought haue aduaūtage ye towne gaunt yt myght haue ſeruaūtes theyr ſwordes nay ſayd baylyffe ſo ſuche towne ye haue done ſeruyce vnto ſpeke theragaynſte haue meruayle therof demaunde ſuffre ſaye ſemeth wolde renewe agayne olde warre whiche wyll ſuffre wherfore fraūcis pray ſo therof yf ye wyll obey muſt repute enemy lorde duke lady borgoyne ſo baylyffe departed fro hym frauncis wente lodgynge cauſed ſeruauntes lay downe theyr armure ſo entred ſuche fantaſye mooſt parte wente ye towne alone one hȳ chylde ſeruaunt daye feeſt kepte without towne gaunt abbey ſaynt peter frauncis atre man wente thyder one ſeruaunt hym without armure wepyn ſpyed pourſued baſtarde ſone lorde harzelles cauſed ſlayne fore wherfore thē ſone thought reuenged faders deth baſtarde prouyded matter pourſued frauncis tyl came towne farre fro ony company cryed hym ſayd thou frauncis atremā thou ſhalte dye thou cauſed fader ſlayne ſhall ſlee fraū ci tourned hym baſtarde ſtrake hym ye heed ſworde ſo weyghty ſtroke claue heed tethe ſo fell downe deed erthe baſtarde wente way fayre eaſely man pourſued hym ſo frauncis atreman wel worthy dye wolde byleue peter du boy tydynges came englande peter du boy knew therof toke ſmal thought hym ſayd departed fro graunt well aduyſed hym let v ſe nowe wyll amende duryng warre dyd gretely honoure hym ſuche doubtes byleued ſyr iohn̄ bourſer came englande nowe let v retourne prouiſyons made ſeaſon dan sluſe remembraūce mā wrytynge neuer none lyke ſene herde golde ſyluer ſpared thoughe rayned clowdes ſcomed ye ſee grete lordes fraunce ſent theyr ſeruauntes sluſe apparell make redy theyr prouyſyons ſhyppes furnyſſhe euery thynge nedefull kynge hymſelfe yonge wyl iourney ony alwayed ſhewed ende therof euery mā helped make prouyſyō garnyſſhe theyr ſhyppes paynte theyr armes paynters good ſeaſon wan ſoeuer deſyred yet coulde ynow gotē money made baners penons ſtanderdes ſylke ſoo goodly yt meruayle beholde thē alſo paynted theyr maſtes theyr ſhippes fro one ende glyteryng golde deuyſes armes ſpecyally ſhewed yt lorde guy tremoyle garnyſſhed ſhyp rychely payntynges yt made coſt iim frankes whatſoeuer ony lorde coulde deuyſe theyr pleaſure made ſhyppes pore people royalme payde al tallages ſo grete fournyſſhe voyage yt moſt ryche ſorewed poore fled yt euer done fraunce flaū ders place voyage wel knowen englande made moche gretter dede wherof people dyuers place royalme ſore abaſſhed made generall proceſſyons euery good towne cyte prelate men chyrche iii tymes euery weke whiche made grete deuocyon harte holy prayer oryſons god delyuer fro y• peryll howbeit englande cm deſyred hartely ye frenſſhmen myght come aryue englande ſuche lyght companyons comfortynge themſelfe abaſſhed ſayd let theſe frenſſhmen come ſhall one tayle retourne agayne fraunce ſuche perſones det cared ye payment therof gretely reioyſed ye comynge frenſſhmen wolde ſay theyr credytours demaunded theyr det ſyrs holde ſtyll forge fraūce new floreyns wherwith ye ſhall payde ye truſt therof lyued ſpente largely whē myght truſted wolde ſay wolde ye haue v better ſholde ſpende frely goodes royalme rather thē frenſſhmen ſholde fynde haue ſo meanes ſpente outrage englande poū de ſterlynge ſeaſon ye kyng englāde ye march walles wt hym erle oxenforde euery thynge done englāde wtout hym nothyng done chefe ye kynges coūſayle ſyr symon burle ſyr nicholas braule ſyr robert tauylyon ſyr robert beauchamp ſyr iohn̄ ſalwen ſyr mychel de la polle alſo named ye byſſhop norwyche ſyr wyllyā neuell broder ye lorde neuel al theſe ſayd dyd wt ye kyng lyſt ye kynges vncles ye erle cambrydge erle buckynghā coulde nothyng wtout agreable ye ſayd trouble differēce amō ge thēſelfe well knowen fraūce whiche gretly auaunced theyr iourney wolde haue ye duke lācaſtre haue withdrawē iourney caſtell toke hede therof let voyage whē ye lordes englā de prelate ye people ye good townes cytees comons royalme iuſtly credybly enfourmed ye frenſſhe kyng redy come englande dyſtroy drew togider coūſayle thē ye kyng wryten vnto vncles yt ſholde come londō certefyeng hym ye comons royalme cōtent hȳ counſayle ye kyng counſayle wolde refuſe ye goyng thyder ſo departed ye march wale ben long quene alſo ſo came wyndeſore taryed certayne dayes ye kyng lefte ye quene ſo went weſtmynſtre palace taryed thyder came hym al ſuche toke coūſayle ſholde demeaned agaynſt iourney ye frenſſhe kyng erle salyſbury ryght valyaunt prudent knyght ſayd ye kyng vncles al ye prelate lordes englande yt p̄ſent ſyr ſouerayn lorde al ye lordes ought meruayled aduerſary ye frenſſhe kyng wyll come ryn vpō v ſyth ye deth laſt noble puyſſaunt kyng edward noble memory royalme hath ben gret aduēture haue ben loſt dyſtroyed ye vyllaynes y• ſame alſo well knowen fraunce al one accorde wherfore trouble appereth ye whiche lytel foole yt fereth enemyes longe royalme englande vnyte ye kyng people wt hym thē proſpered reygned vyctoryouſly ſawe founde none yt dyd v ony grete wronge wherfore nedeful neuer nede apperd englande yt cōferme ourſelfe reſt loue vnyte thynke come ony honour yt ordeyne ye porte hauens englande ſuche prouyſyon defence countrey receyue blame domage noble royalme englande hath ben lo • g • ſeaſon tryūphaunt floure euery man knoweth well thynge yt floure hath nede wel kepte thē whē tourned parfyte fruyte therfore ought ſe cōſyder royalme flouryſſhynge floure within xl yeres knyghtes ſquyers therof bothe within ye royalme wtout haue honoure ony nacyō therfore let v put paynes yt long lyue may kepe honour thē euery mā ſayd yt good yt wereſo erle ſalyſburies wordes wel herde accepted wordes counſayle noble valyaunt ſage knyght yt ſayd hym deuyſed among thē wyl long reſt theron thynke know al know wel yt towne caleys kepte ſayd ordeyned kepe ye hauyns porte ſuppoſed yt ye frenſſhmē wolde aryue ye erle ſalyſbury bycauſe parte lande marched nere ye yle wyght whiche ryght oueragaynſt normandy coūtrey • aulx therfore ſet mē archer y• countrey erle deuynſhyre hampton cc men armes vic archer kepe hauyn ye erle northūbrelande rye cc mē armes vic archer ye erle cā brydge douer wt vc mē farmes xiic archer broder ye erle buckynghā sādwyche vic mē armes xiic archer ye erle ſtafforde ye erle penbroke ſent wel hauyn vc mē armes xiic archer ſyr henry percy faulx percy yarmouth wt iiic mē armes vic archer ſyr symon burle capytayne douer ca •• el al ye hauyns porte bytwene ye ryuer humbre cornewal refreſſhed mē war archer ye moū taynes hylles coſtyng ſee fronters agaynſt flaūders fraūce ſet watche mē watcher dyuers maners cā tel empty pypes fylled wt ſāde one ſet another hyght thē place mē ſyr whiche nyght day kepte watche lokynge ſee charged yt yf ſaw ye frenſſhe nauy aproche towarde lāde thē make fyers alofte ye hylles ſtyre ye coūtrey drawe ye cooſt ye fyers apered ordeyned yt ſholde ſuffre ye frenſſhe kyng peaſybly take lande al ſuffre hym entre ye lāde iii iiii dayes ſo thē fyrſt go ye ſee landed fyght wt ſhyppes wyn yf colde dyſtroy thē take al theyr prouyſyon th ••• folow ye frenſſh • ē incōtynēt fyght wt thē hary thē kepe thē wakynge kepe thē fro goynge foragynge dyſtroy thē yt abrode ye countrey ſo yt therby ſholde famyſſhe thē ye opynyon coūſayle englāde rocheſtre brydge broken grete ryuer rynnynge fro arundel ye coūtye eſſex entreth ye ſee tamyſe agaynſt ye yle tenet brydge londō bet downe ye ſurer tax tallages grete fraūce ye men ye townes lykewyſe grete y• ſeaſon englā de ſo yt ye royalme ſorowed grete ſeaſon glad pay ye ſowdyours therby defēded redy englāde c archer axm men armes beſyde ye grete cōpany ye duke lancaſtre caſtel wyll ſpeke ſomewhat ſhew ye aquayntaūce yt bytwene hym ye kyng portyngale ſhal retourne ſpeke agayne englande ye matter requyreth ſpeke wel ye one ¶how kyng portyngale wrote amyably duke lancaſtre whē knew aryued ſaynt iames galyce ſocours kyng caſtel ſent fraunce towne ruelles galyce taken englyſſhe men ca liii ye haue herde hyſtory ye duke lācaſtre fayre cōpany mē armes archer aryued coulongne galyce cōpoſycyon ye towne ye caſtel yelden h • thus ſayd wolde townes galyce dyd ſo therby aſſayled thē ye duke wyfe chyldren came towne ſaynt iames called cōpoſt • lia laye • purpoſe tyl herde tydynges fro ye kyng portyngale knewe ſurty yt duke ſaynt iames wherof grete ioy thynkyng yt bytwene thē ſholde make goodly war caſtell thē wrote letter ryght amyably wt grete ſalutacyons ſent thē certayne meſſagers ye duke duches receyued ye letter ryght ioyouſly ye duke knew wel ſholde haue gretnede ye kynge portyngale wtout hym comforte ſaw well ſholde make ſmal ſpede buſynes portyngale caſtel ye duke gaue ye meſſagers grete gyftes wrote agayne letter wt grete ſalutacyons amytyes ye kyng portyngale certefyeng hym letter yt deſyred gretely ſe ſpeke wt hym thus meane ſeaſon ye letter meſſagers wente bytwene ye kyng portyngale duke lācaſtre y• tyme paſſed kyng iohn̄ caſtel fortefyed hym al yt myght ſent • e fraūce letter meſſagers deſyryng haue ayde mē war defende kepe royalme caſtel ſayng yt ye ſomer folowyng thought ſholde haue grete war bycauſe ye kynge portyngale englyſſhmen ioyned togyder alyaunce wherby ſholde ſtronge ynoughe ouer ryn ye royalme caſtel wtout withſtāded ye frēſſhe kyng coūſayle wrote agayne ye kynge caſtel byddyng hym take thought doubte within y• moneth ianuary wolde gyue englāde ſo moche yt ſholde know ſayenge yt dyſtroyed al englande thē ye ſomer wolde take ye ſee agayne ſo paſſe galyce portyngale yt ye englyſſhmē ye portyngales kept ye felde wolde cauſe thē flee ſo yt within yere wolde make ende al ye warres ſo kyng caſtel cōtēted hȳſelfe āſwere ſaw wel coulde haue none y• tyme ſo came none fraūce hȳ ſuche al knyghtes ſquyers farre nere wente parys pycardy ſo lyſle way tournay y• coūtrey iii myle length ful mē warre y• nombre ſo grete yt ſuche ye rule nauy ſayd yt coulde paſſe ye fyrſt paſſage xlm mē thē ordeyned aduyſed yt ſholde ſuffre mā paſſe without ꝓpre mā armes yt euery knyght ſholde haue one varlet baron ii ſquyers horſe ſholde paſſe onely ye lordes execute mēſet sluſe ſe yt none ſholde paſſe howbeit ſuch nombre raſcalles flaūdres theraboute yt ete vp al countrey pore men coūtrey payde theyr charge durſt ſpeke agaynſt thē worſe ye countrey thē yf englyſſhmen theyr enemyes lyen grete doubte yt kynge lordes one paſſed ouer englāde ſuche people abyde behynde leſt aſſēbled togyder dyſtroy al ſurely ſo done iourney done amyſſe let v retourne duke lancaſtre ¶in meane ſeaſon whyle duke lancaſtre duches chyldren cōpany lay ſaynt iames knyghtes ſquyers cōpany lyued aduenture might catche day ſyr thomas moreaulr marſhal ooſt 〈◊〉 hym ſyr mauburne luners ſyr iohn̄ dā brychsourte tyrry wyllyā sonnayne cc ſperes vc archer rode forth galyce ſo came walled towne vii myles fro ſaynt iames called ruelles vylaynes yt dwelte therin wolde tourne ye duke rebell often tymes ouerthrowen duke forager paſſed ye barryers theyr towne broken ſo ye wayes yt coulde repaſſe none way theyr barryers ſawe vaūtage wolde yſſue lyke theues dyſtroy forager paſſed wherof ye cōplayntes came marſhal yt ſholde prouyde ſome remedy acordyng offyce • wherfore came towne ruelles ye watche ye towne wel blowen theyr comyng wherby • hey within cloſed faſt theyr barryers gate ſo yt none abode wtout •• ſo moūted vpon walles marſhal whē ſaw theyr demeanyng ſaw well • wolde abyde ſaulte ſayd ſyr iohn̄ dā brychcourte tyrry sonnayne ſyrs take horſes ryde aboute towne holde wel may beſt aſſayle ye towne leeſt hurtynge men ſo mounted theyr horſes rode aboute towne grete crycute wherfore retourned agayne ſoner wel aduyſed euery place ſo came marſhal ſayd ſyr towne ii gate ye one fore ryght ouer agaynſt ſyr thynke theſe ii place moſt eaſy v gyue ony aſſaulte rounde aboute ye towne elles grete dyke depe ryght euyll go downe worſe mounte vp agayne hedge buſſhes thorne yt growe therin byleue well ſayd marſhal ſyr mauburne ſhal haue certayne cōpany wt go gate ſhall abyde let v giue aſſaulte one wote ſhal come v gladly wolde ſe yonder vyllaynes yt lenynge ye batylmentes walles theyr towne loke v ſe wyll lyke ape etynge peres chyldren wolde take fro ye marſhalles wordes cōpany laughed loked vp ye walles beholde ye vyllaynes thē ſyr maulburyne wente forth wt penō hym c ſperes iiic archer wente ye gate taryed ſo thē anone ye aſſaulte bega ii partes right ſharpe fyers mē within towne ouer ye gate threwe downe dartes ſo fyerſly yt troubled ye archer croſbowes hurte many thē theyr ſhot bycauſe none barrier defende thē al cloſed wtin towne defended thēſelfe wt ſhot caſt dartes ſo engliſſhmē brake vp ye barryers came ye gate bet ruſſhed ſo therat ye made gate trymble ſhake wtin ſaw theyr gate lykely brokē vp went downe fro walles ye ſtrete bare grete tymbre wood gate thē womē chyldren al maner people bare ſtones fylled empty tonne pypes ſet thē agaynſt theyr gate ſo ſet aboue thē fylled thē lykewyſe one vpō another ſome ſtyll ouer gate dyd caſt downe grete barres yron ſo yt none durſt aproche nere ye gate wtout wolde ſlayne thus vylaynes ruel kepte theyr towne agaynſt ye englyſſh men ſo yt loſt lytell yt day ſo englyſſhmē retourned backe alōge myle yt coū trey towne perſone abydynge lodged tyll nexte mornyng yt nyght mē ruelles counſayled togyder know ſholde ſholde maynteyne thēſelfe agaynſt ye englyſſhmē ſent theyr ſpyes ſe ye englyſſh men ſuche ſent forthe retourned agayne reported ſurely howe lodged bace towne ſenace yt al ſymylytude wolde retourne agayne ye aſſaulte nexte mornyng thē ſayd among thē ſelfe foly begyn foly contynewe haue blame though yelde v duke lancaſtre marſhall haue defended towne hole daye amonge ourſelfe without counſayle comforte ony gentyll man ony man warre lengthe cannot endure agaynſt ſyth know waye thyder better v yelde ony aſſayled takē perforce ſhal leſe bodyes goodes ſo al opynyon yt yf englyſſhe men retourned ye next day wolde treate thē yelde vp theyr towne theyr lyues goodes ſaued englyſſhmen mornynge retourned anone vpon ſone ryſynge go ſaulte y• towne ſawe yt ſent iiii theyr men make theyr treaty marſhal rode vnder penon ſaw felde theſe iiii mē ſayd yonder thynke men ruelles comynge ſpeke v brynge thē hyder come yt marſhal kneled downe ſayd ſyr mē ye towne ruelles haue ſent v hider ſpeke wt pleaſeth v yes ſayd marſhal ſay ye wyl ſyr ſayd redy put poſſeſſion ye towne ruelles ſo wyl ſaue lyues goodes wyl accepte lorde duke lancaſtre lady duches lorde lady lyke maner coulongne ſaynt iames haue done wel ſayd marſhal cōtent wyl aſſure prouyſyon behoueth men lyue ſyr ſayd yt ryght prouyſyon ynough coūtrey ſyr pleſeth tary lytell ſhal retourne towne ſhewe haue ſayd ſyr tryſt ye wyll vpholde couenaunt ye truely ſayd ye marſhall therfore retourne agayne breuely ſo retourned theyr towne ſhewed howe ſpoken yt duke marſhal made hym ſuche treaty yt ſholde ſaufegarde theyr bodyes goodes excepte vytayles towne ſayd god graunt ſo thē dyd rydde theyr gate tonne ſtones tymbre yt ſet opened gate wyde ſo came barryers key theyr hādes ſayng ſyr know wel ye hider ſent fro lorde duke lancaſtre fro lady wyfe ſyr rendre keyes towne put poſſyſſyō therof ſuche cōdycyons men haue made reporte v ſame condycyon ſayd marſhal receyue ſo entred towne menlodged theyr pleaſure taryed al day departed ſayd ſyr maulburyn ſyr delyuer towne cōpany ye ſhal haue fayre garyſon ſyr ſayd yt true take wt good wyll garyſon pleaſeth well ſyr maulburyn luners abode garyſon ruelles galyce vnder hym lx ſperes c archer ſyr thomas moreaulx retourned ye duke duches ſaynt iames ¶howe duke lancaſters marſhall men aſſayled towne vyeclope galyce whiche yelded cōpoſycyon ambaſſadours duke ſente kynge portyngale ca li anone yt marſhal retourned fro towne ruelles daye rode forthe agayne iiic ſperes vic archer ſo rode lōge dayes iourney came towne called vyleclope whiche kepte ſuche villaynes dwelte thē yt marſhal cauſed ye towne auewed ſe pregnable whē wel aduyſed ſayd myght wel aſſaulte thē lyghted fote ſēt theyr horſes backe theyr varlettes deuyded themſelfe iiii partes made themſelfe redy lyke men warre ſyr thomas moreaulx guydynge one company theſe conde ſyr yon fythwaren thyrde ſyr iohn̄ dambrychcourte fourthe another knyght euery partye foure ſcore men armes vii ſcore archer approched towne wente downe dyke therin water mounted vp agayne ſyde well paueſſed archer ſtode y• ſyde dyke ſhot ſo fyerſly none durſt appere theyr defence howbeit theyr ſhot within defended themſelfe valyauntly grete nombre within caſt dartes wt longe fethers ſharpe heddes ſo rudely yt ſo euer fully ſtryken wt thē without well armed outher ſlayne ſore hurte howbeit knyghtes ſquyres auaunce thēſelfe came ye fote ye walles al ye ſtones yt fel theyr baſenettes theyr bodyes ii ſquyers haynalte tyrrye gyllyā sonnayne dyd dyuers goodly fete armes made grete hole thrughe wall ſuche helpe hadde • ought ſore hande hande within theſe ii bretherne wan vii dartes caſt thrughe y• hole pulled theyr enemyes handes theſe ii brotherne vnder y• ſtandarde ye lorde fyth waren ye parte ſyr iohn̄ dambrychcourte ſhewed valyauntnes lyke noble knyght foote walle penon pytched erthe hym pykeaxe hande myned therwith beſt power breke wall ought meruayled howe theſe vylaynes abaſſhed ſe themſefe ſoo aſſayled al partes howbeit coulde ſo longe endure many handes defende themſelfe withal laſt aduyſed ſawe aſſaulte ſeaſed yelde themſelfe ye baylyffe towne cauſed ſo longe contynue came ſayd marſhall ſyr cauſe aſſaulte ſeaſe ye men towne wyll treate well ſayd marſhall contente cauſed heraulde ryde aboute ye towne ſayd euery man ſyrs ſeaſe aſſaulte tyl ye marſhalles trompet blowe agayne ye aſſaulte treaty ye towne thoſe wordes ſeaſed reſted ſome nede therof wery aſſaylynge towne entred theyr treaty ſayd howe wolde yelde themſelfe lyues goodes ſaued townes done galyce naye ſayd marſhall ye ſhall ſcape ſo good chepe haue done ye haue put v moche payne hurte dyuers men ſe clerely ye longe endure agaynſt v wherfore muſt houe bye peaſe loue elles wyll retourne agayne aſſaulte wynne perforce ſyr ſayd ye baylyffe raunſome wyl ye aſke v goddes name ſayd marſhall xm frankes ye aſke grete ſome ſyr ſayd ye baylyffe ſhal yf pleaſe cauſe haue iim frankes ſyr towne poore hathe ben ſore charged tax nay ſayd ye marſhal wyl yt wyl gyue reſpyte take coūſayle togyder iii iiii frankes ye ſhall ſcape al yf lyſt alſo blamed company make ony treaty therfore ſhortely determyne outher leue baylyffe wente towne called euery man hym ſayd syrs wyll ye ſuffre ony mo aſſaultes englyſſhe men wyll conquere v perforce ſo ſhall dye leſe al goodes demaunded v xm frankes haue offred iim knowe well ouer lytell wyl neuer agree therto therfore muſt exalte ye raunſome ii iiim frankes ye towne doubted loſe yt theyr lyues alſo ſayd baylyffe forſake marchaundyſe rather wyl ony aſſayled wyl pay iiiim frankes ſayd baylyffe yt well ſayd yet wyll treate came agayne marſhall vnderſtande theyr peaſe made paynge vim frankes gate ſet open euery man entred lodged lyſt taryed ii dayes marſhall delyuered towne yon fythwaren cc ſperes cccc archer lay garyſon viii monethes raunſome towne wente duke lancaſters profyte marſhall frankes towne vyleclope yelden vp duke marſhall retourned ſaynt iames duke duke wolde haue hym aboute hym ſometyme rode fronters caſtell spayne gyue fere frenſſhe men longe englyſſhemen kepte felde galyce none came agaynſt kynge caſtell counſayled ryde forth wt ony ooſt kepe warre garyſons abyde forſocours fraunce ye duke lancaſtre coū ſayled ſayd hym yt good kynge portyngale myght ſpeke togyder ſayenge alſo ſyr wrytynge rynneth thus bytwene good ynoughe frenſſhe men ſubtyle ſe ferther theyr buſynes thē ony people yf couertly happen make treaty kynge portyngale alſo kynge caſtell hathe aboute hym coūſayle dyuers lordes portyngale infourmed ſo peraduenture theyr meanes myght make peaſe mariage otherwyſe ſo yt hym ye ſholde haue noo comforte ſholde fall ye ſholde worſe caſe euer ye thē caſtellyans wolde ſet lytell v caſtellyans mooſt ſubtyleſt people worlde trowe yt kynge portyngale wolde contente reſt buſynes yf kynge caſtell wolde ſuffre hym kynge portyngale lyfe hym ye kyng caſtel ſyr doubted thoughe haue ſente ſo ye coulde tourne backe agayne myght ouerthrowen alſo ſyr ye know ſtate englande whiche hath nowe ynoughe doo kepe thēſelfe agaynſt theyr enemyes wel frenſſhmen skottes therfore make good war ye cā ſuche people ye haue truſt comforte ayde englande outher men armes archer ſurely ye lyke haue ony ye two yeres aboute gete ye haue kynge nephewe ſeeth thynges yonge byleueth yong counſayle wherby royalme englande lyeth peryll grete aduenture wherfore ſyr approche ſoone ye kynge portyngale ſpeke hym worde ſhall profyte letter ye wryte iiii monethes duke lancaſtre noted well theſe wordes knew wel yt true truely counſayled duke ſayd gaue hym counſayle wyll ſholde anſwered ſayd ſyr ſende kynge portyngale v vi knyghtes leeſt baron let ſhewe kynge howe ye haue grete deſyre ſe hym let wyſe yt ye ſende let thē fynde meanes ye maye ſpeke togyder ſhortly content ſayd ye duke ſente portyngale fro duke ye lorde poynynges grete baron englande ſyr iohn̄ abruell ſyr iohn̄ dambrychcourte ſyr iohn̄ souſter baſtarde bretheren ſyr iohn̄ holande conſtable ooſt theſe departed fro ſaynt iames c ſperes cc archer day al theſe letter made ſealed came duke fro kynge portyngale knyght ſquyer xii ſperes called ſyr vaſe martyne cougne ſquyer ferrant martyne merle kynges hous nere perſone lodged theyr eaſe towne ſaynt iames brought duke duches ſo preſented theyr letter alſo preſented duke duches theyr doughters fayre whyte mule well aumblynge wherof glad howbeit iourney englyſſhmen kynge portyngale brokē ſtopped iiii dayes v daye departed knyght ſquyer togyder company duke ſente kynge portyngale token loue ii fawcons pelegrynes good coulde deuyſed vi englyſſhe greyhoundes good maner bee • te • portyngales englyſſhmen rode togyder ouer al lande galyce fere ye caſtellyans ferre ynoughe ofrro waye rode ſyr iohn̄ dambrychcourre martyn ferrant merle fell talkynge togyder ſeaſon ſquyer ben armes ſyr euſtaſe dambrychcourte vncle ſayd ſyr iohn hym dyed quarencyne talked togyder rode behynde theyr company met heraulde varlet comyng fro connymbres kynge laye rydynge towarde ſaynt iames duke lancaſtre heraulte perceyned ye kynge portyngale called connymbres heraulte ſpoken lordes ſhewed ſuche tydynges knewe ferrant martyn merle ſaw hym comynge ſayd ſyr iohn̄ dambrychcourte beholde yonder cometh heraulte ye kynge portyngales longe ſyth countrey wyl demaunde hym ſome tydynges met togyder ye ſquyer ſayd connymbres haue ben ſo longe yere ſyth ſaw ye countrey ſyr ſayd haue ben englande haue ſene kynge lordes haue made ryche grete gyftes haue fro then retourned ye ſee bretayne ye maryage duke bretayne grete feeſt kepte cyte nauntes aboute ii monethes paſt hath wedded ye lady iahan nauare fro then ſee went irelande fro then porte portyngale talked togyder ſquyer behelde ſcochyn ye heraulte bare breſt wherin graued inamyled ye kynge portyngales armes ye armes dyuers lordes ſquyer ſet fynger one armes perteynynge knyght portyngale ſayd aſe ye armes me gentyll knyght ſyr iohn̄ partelere fayth glad ſe perteyne gentyll knyght tyme dyd grete profyte ought well remembre therwith toke iiii floreyns golde purſe gaue heraulte thanked hym ſyr iohn̄ dambrychcourte behelde well armes felde ſyluer endenture gooles ii chanders fable ſo heraulte departed ſquyer ſayd ſyr iohn̄ ſaw neuer knyght bare ye ſayd armes prayſe ſo moche tell ſayd ſyr iohn̄ leeſt praye ſhewe yt courteſy one dyd wolde glad haue nothynge elles talke contente ſayd ſquyer ſhewe knyght well worthy ſpoken began tale thus fortuned lytell batayle iuberoth kynge portyngale wente fro connymbres thyderwarde ye kynge ſente countrey warne certayne knyghtes come hym hȳ iourney ſo rode forth one page rode happened mete xxv ſperes gaſcoynes ware tyl amonge toke demaunded whether wente ſhewed thē rydynge caſtell ronte demaunded ſayd go ſeke ſyr iohn̄ ferrant partelere come ye kyng portyngale iuberoth ſayd ſyr iohn̄ ferrant parteler capytayne caſtel ronte redy ye kyng portyngale ſurely ſyrs ſayd ſhortely wyll yf one knowe kynges pleaſure well ſayd ſhall knowe wyll ryde thyder ſo toke waye ye caſtell ronte within ſyght caſtell watche caſtell ſayd ſaw men armes approchyng towarde caſtell ſyr iohn̄ ferrant demaunded fro parte comynge ye watche ſayd comyng towarde porte ſayd caſtellyans rydeth aduenture towarde ſaynt irayne wyl go loke ſhall tell tydynges kynge ſo lepte horſe xx hym toke penon hym rode caſtell grete galop come ye caſtellyans drawen buſſhment made one theyr company ryde forthe genet ſyr iohn̄ ferrant ſaw geneture ſayd ſquyer galop forth thy genet aſſaye ſpeke yonder geneture ſquyer galopped forth folowed hym nere euer lykely take hym fled ſoftely hym ye entente brynge hym ye buſſhment nere buſſhment brake hym tourned quyckely backe chaſed hym cryed caſtell ſyr iohn̄ ferrant beynge vnder penon ſeynge ſquyer retourned ſuche haſt ſayd chaſe ſquyer none company caſtellyans ſet crye portyngale wyll fyght toke ſpere ranne fyrſt met withall wente erthe ſeconde alſo xxv caſtellyans yt x lay ſhortely grounde chaſed ſome ouertaken ſlayne hurte glad ſe ſaw delyueraunce ſhorte ſeaſon lefte alone came ye knyght ſaluted hym ſoone ſaw knewe demaunded fro whens came dyd ſhewed hym myne aduenture caſtellyans chaſed toke well ſayd knowe kynge portyngale fayth ſyr ſayd morowe ſhall haue batayle iuberoth agaynſt kynge caſtel ſente countrey gyue warnynge therof ye knyghtes ſquyers knoweth entente ſholde reſorte hym morow ſayd ye truely ſyr ſayd yf ye byleue demaunde theſe caſtellyans ye haue taken demaunded tydynges ſayd howe ſurely nexte day ſholde batayle bytwene ii kynges whiche tydynges ryght glad ſayd openly caſtellyans ſyrs good tydynges yt ye ſhewe quyte raunſomes departe ye wyl ſo ye acquyte ſquyer ſo thus cauſed quyted fro ſo departed y• ſame day retourned • onte made hym redy departed then mydnyght company fro then cabaſe iuberoth whiche vi myles yt countrey eſchewe encountrynges rode ſomwhat waye mornynge herde ſholde batayle ſame daye ſawe batayles approched batayles raynged feldes kynge caſtell ye one partye kynge portyngale ye fyrſt knewe whiche caſtellyans whiche portyngales tyll laſt ſyr iohn̄ ferrant partelere ſayd byleue ſurely gretter ooſt caſtellyans rode forth fayre eaſely tyl came nere ſawe well caſtillyans trowe ſome gaſcoynes brake agaynſt v ſyr iohn̄ ferrant ſayd let v auaunce forthe ſe yonder enemyes comyng v thē ſtrake horſes ye ſpurres rode cryenge portyngale folowed v company portyngules ſawe v came forth reſcued v al batayles brake theyr aray ſo ſyr iohn̄ ferrant came ye kynge acquyted hym day ye beſt thus ſyr haue ſhewed howe dyd grete courteſye delyuered pryſon ben ye batayle ben therfore ſyr dyd goodly pleaſure yes truely ſayd ſyr iohn̄ dambrych courte alſo knew batayle yt true ſayd ſquyer rode forth tyll ouertaken theyr companuy came ſame day connymbres comynge theſe englyſſhe knyghtes ye kynge portyngale ryght ioyfull cōmaunded ſholde well lodged theyr eaſe redy martyn coygne ferrant martyn merle englyſſhe knyghtes wente kynge receyued ioyouſly thē englyſſhmen dyd theyr meſſage preſented kynge fawcons greyhoū de whiche kynge grete ioy loued houndes hawkes thanked kynge duke parte goodly mule ſente duke ye duches ſayd ſmall preſent another tyme wyll ſende gretter gyftes aquayntaunce loue lordes ought one another nouryſſhe loue amyte wyne ſpyces brought knyghtes englande dranke ſo toke theyr leue tyme retourned theyr lodgynges ſouper ye nexte day dyned kynges palace ye lorde poynynges ſyr iohn̄ bancell ſate ye kynges table ſyr iohn̄ dambrychcourt ſyr iohn̄ soultyer ſate another table ye baron countrey ſuche laurence fongaſe ſquyer honoure kynges knewe ryght well knyghtes ſquyers englande ſene englande made ye beſt chere coulde well ſerued dyner dyner brought counſayle chambre ye englyſſhe knyghtes began ſpeke ye kynge ii erles preſent ye erle angoſe erle nauare ſayd ſyr lyke grace beſyde ye recommendacyons duke lancaſtre hath ſente vnto gaue v charge ſay deſyreth ſore ſe kynge ſayd glad ſe hym requyre ſhortely may ſe ſpeke togyder ſyr ſayd erles good ſo tyll ye togyder ye ſhal loue parfytely ye may take aduyſe togyder howe ye may maynteyne warres agaynſt ye kynge caſtel ſyr true ſayd knyghtes englande ſayd kynge let done ſhortely duke deſyre ſe lyke wyſe deſyre ſe hym ſo fell talkynge ye kyng charged counſayle agre aſſygne certayne daye ſholde mete togyder aſſure englyſſhe knyghtes therof ſo dyd agreed kynge portyngale ſholde come cyte countrey called porte duke lancaſtre ſholde ryde alonge ye frontere galyce ſo partyng bothe royalmes mete ſpeke togyder ſo concluſyon meſſagers departed retourned towarde galyce rode came tyll came ſaynt iames ſhewed duke duches howe ſped whiche tydynges ye duke ioyfull ſo cauſe buſynes began approche ye ſeaſon came yt duke lancaſtre ſholde departe fro ſaynt iames lefte ſtyll marſhall al company excepte iiic ſperes vic archer ſyr iohn̄ holande wedded eldeſt doughter hym many knyghtes ſquyers duke rode fronters galyce approched nere portyngale kynge laye porte knewe well comynge ſo departed vi hundreth ſperes came fronters portyngale lodged towne called mouſon laſt towne portyngale ſyde duke lancaſtre came another towne fyrſt towne galyce ioynyng portyngale called margaſſe bytwene mouſon margaſſe ryuer fayre medowes grete playne brydge called mor brydge thurſday mornynge kyng portyngale ye duke lancaſtre theyr companyes met togyder goodly louyng metynge lodgynges made feldes kynges ſyde thyder went duke lancaſtre dyner whiche dyner well ordred ſate ye kynges table ye byſſhop connymbres ye byſſhop porte archebyſſhop bargus portyngale duke lancaſtre lytell byneth late ſyr iohn̄ holande ſyr henry beamonde englande plentye mynſtrelles ſo ſporte tyll nyght daye kynge portyngale apparelled whyte reed croſſe ſaynt george habyte ye houſe called mouſon otherwyſe called denyce portyngale whiche ordre kynge crowned called mayſter therof euer bare ſtyll deuyſe honoure god ſaynt george men arayed whyte reed whē began late retourned theyr lodgynges tyll nexte daye kynge wente mouſon duke margaſſe bytwene bothe ye medowe ryuer paſſe fryday whē herde maſſe toke theyr horſes ſo rode agayne mor brydge met agayne goodly lodgynge made kyng duke theyr chambres hanged tapyceryes curteynes well kynge ben lyxbone ye duke london dyner counſayled togyder ſtate theyr buſynes howe ſholde maynteyne theyr war ſholde ſet forth determyned wynter ye kynge ſholde tary owne countrey duke ſaynt iames let theyr marſhal dele marche kyng duke theyr men aſſemble togyder go fyght kyng caſtel ſoeuer ſholde thē ſayd ſholde englyſſhe portyngales togyder xxx thouſande al concluded kynges counſayle comoned amonge themſelfe maryage theyr kynge tyme royalme wolde maryed honoure profyte haue good alyaunces tyme come ſayd knewe ſholde mary profyte welthe comons houſe lancaſtre ſhewed ye duke ſawe kynges entencyon howe kynges daunger ſeynge come englande fronters portyngale demaunde herytage caſtell anſwered ſmylynge ſayd kynge preſente ſyr haue towne ſaynt iames two doughters wyll gyue one whome pleaſeth choſe syr ſende thyder counſayle ſhal ſende ſyr ſayd kynge thanke ye offre deſyre coſyn katheryne wyll leue ſtyll phylyp doughter demaunde wyl wedde make quene portyngale ſo brake vp theyr counſayle wente dyner ſate dyd daye ſerued notably accordynge vſage ye countrey dyner duke retourned margaſſe kynge mouſon ſaterday maſſe met agayne ſayd place daye duke lancaſtre made dyner ye kynge portyngale company chambres halle hanged arras enbrowdery rychely thoughe ben london portyngales prayſed moche englyſſhe maner dyner thre archebyſſhoppes vii byſſhoppes ſyttynge hyghe table byſſhop lyxbone byſſhop porte byſſhop connymbres archebyſſhop bargus kynge ſate ye myddes table duke lytell bynethe hym bynethe duke ye erle nauare erle angoſſe another table ſate fyrſt mayſter denyce grete mayſter ſaynt iames portyngale pryour ſaynt iohn̄s galopes percler iohn̄ ferrant ſone ponnayſe congne va martyn congne ye podych senede va martyn merle albarons abbot cabaſe iuberoth ye abbot ſaynt mary eure ſyr alue perere marſhall portyngale iohn̄ radygosdeſar dyuers knyghtes ſquyers portyngale ſate daye englyſſhmen knyghtes ſquyers englande ſerued many mynſtrelles duke gaue c noble herauldes moche dyner thynges accomplyſſhed toke leue amyably eche tyll another ſeaſon kynge retourned porte ye duke marga • ſe toke way galyce erle nauare conueyed duke c ſperes tyll daunger ye erle toke leue retourned portyngale duke rode ſaynt iames galyce moche deſyred duches lancaſtre retourne ye duke huſbande tydynges concluſyons takē ſo duke well welcomed home reaſon duches demaunded hym howe lyked kynge portyngale fayth ſayd ye duke gracyous man body maners lyke valyaunt man thynke ſhall reygne grete puyſſaunce well byloued mē ſay kynge c yere ſo wel pleaſed age paſt xxxvi yere ſtronge knyght hardy accordynge nature portyngale well made body endure grete payne ye ſyr ſayd yt lady ſayth ony maryage haue agreed hym ſayd duke ſhall haue one doughters dyd put hym choyſe outher katheryne phylyp wherof gaue grete thāke reſted phylyp hath good reaſon ſayd ye duches doughter katheryne yet yonge hym thus duke duches paſſed daye ſo ye tyme paſſed wynter approched howbeit ye countreys galyce portyngale lytell wynter alwayes hote graynes fruytes groweth quyckely dyuers fruytes rype marche benes perſon cheryes al freſſhe crbes groweth february ſo place make wyne mydſoner yt tyme harueſt paſt thoughe yt duke ye duches taryed towne ſaynt iames laye ſtyll yet men ſtyred abrode conquered countrey galyce townes caſtelles howe wonne ſhall ſhewe ye trouthe name thē iuſtely therof infourmed knyghtes ſquyers wel englande portyngale ſuche ben preſent theyr conqueſtes ſpecyally ye gentyl knyght portyngale haue ſpoken ryght amyably myddelbourge zelande came fro voyage pruce enfourmed haue named knyght yet agayne name hym name ſyr iohn̄ ferrant partelere ſo ſyr thomas moreaulx marſhall duke lancaſtres ooſt duke retourned fro fronters portyngale come agayne towne ſaynt iames ſayd wolde ſy • te ſtyll ſyth countrey conqueſt ſayd wolde ryde forthe ſet company worke whiche ſore deſyred ſo made aſſemble ſayd wolde entre galyce brynge townes caſtelles vnder duke obeyſaunce ſoo day departed fro ſaynt iames vic ſperes xiic archer toke way good towne galyce called poceueyed whiche rebell agaynſt towne knowledge ye englyſſhmennes comyng comon people fled theyr countrey good townes toke coū ſayle ſholde doo outher yelde holde longe coulde endure ſo one accorde comen people wolde haue yelded baylyffe 〈◊〉 kyng caſtel rychemen wolde yelde ſo ſone ſayd ſholde norher haue honoure profyte theyr doynge ſo coūſaylynge togyder whē ye watche ye towne ſowned gaue knowledge ye englyſſhmens approchyng thē brake vp theyr counſayle euery man went defence ran ye walles bare barres ſtones dartes iauelyns ſhewed well howe wolde defende themſelfe yelde ſo lyghtly duke marſhall company come towne ponceuayde lyghted ſore delyuered theyr horſes theyr varlettes deuyded theyr companyes gyue aſſaulte archer araynged thēſelfe aboute towne wt theyr bowes redy ſhote men armes well paueſſed armed entrynge ye dyke marſhalles trompettes ſowned ſowte men armes clame vp dyke pykeaxes mattockes wynne walles men towne wt caſt downe ſtones thynges yt troubled mynours ſore done archer ben ſhot ſo hooly togyder none durſt appere walles dyd hurte many within ſpecyally baylyffe towne ſtrykē arowe perſed baſenet entred heed ſo yt fayne borne place lodgynge yet ye euyll people ye towne wolde yelde baylyffe ſore hurte ye rather angry redy defende thus ſaulte endured tyl nyght ſowned theyr retrayte men hurte bothe partyes englyſſhmen rotourned fro ſaulte wente thery lodgynges entency ye nexte mornynge retourne ſaulte leue tyll gotten ſame nyght ponce voyde toke counſayle togyder ſayd amonge themſelfe folyſſhe people thus hurte troubled nothynge vylodes coulongne hath done yelded duke lancaſtre lady cuſtaunce doughter kynge peter let v yelde lyke good townes haue done wherin wyſe therby ſate reſt well ſayd let v lyke wyſe baylyffe hath counſayled v contrary therfore hath payment lykely dye ſome ſayd yet let v go hym wyll ſay certaynly morowe englyſſhmen wyl retourne wyl let v pea wyl outher haue v perforce loue counſayle agreed xii beſt towne wente baylyffes lodgynge whoſe name dyon table lyon founde hym bed newely dreſſed wounde ſo made came hym ſemblaūt good chere whatſoeuer felte demaunded aſſaulte perceyuered ther anſwered ſayd dyd well thanked god excepte hurte haue taken ſmall domage morowe lyeth doubte ſure haue new aſſaulte mē defence ſymple people wote meaneth therfore come haue counſayle beſt v ye englyſſhmen ſore threteneth v yf taken perforce ſhall put ſworde leſe lyues yt haue name god ſayd baylyffe ye haue • blame thoughe ye yelde make wyſe treaty yt ruler towne ye may ſaye ye wyll gladly vnder obeyſaunce duke lancaſtre duches lyke maner coulongne ſo englyſſhmen come within ye towne ſende prouyſyon towne theyr money thus ye thȳ ke wyll glad obeyſaunce haue many moo townes wynne galyce wherfore thynke wyll lyghtlyer go hous ye ſay well ſyrſayd ſhal thus ſyth counſayle v ſo determyned purpoſe ſo paſſed y• nyght well myght ye mornyng ſone ryſynge ordeyned certayne mē go towne inſtructed charged
