truce ſholde make marſhal yf coulde vii came marſhall redy retourne ſaulte kneled downe ſalutynge hym ſayd ſyr ſente hyder fro towne ponce voyde haue commaunded v ſay theyr name yt gladly wyll put themſelfe vnder ye obeyſaunce duke lancaſtre lady duches maner fourme coulongne hath done prouyſyon ye ſhall haue ynoughe towne payenge courteyſly therfore ſyr entencyon hathe ſente v hyder ye ſholde enforce thē ony none entre towne ony army yf ſome company wyll entre ſymply ye ſhall welcome marſhall englyſſhman hym vnderſtode ſpeche galyce ſhewed marſhall englyſſhe wordes ſpoken marſhall anſwered ſayd ſyrs ſhortely retourne agayne towne cauſe come barryers ſuche ſente hyder ſpeke wyl gyue thē aſſuraūce day morowe ſone ryſyng without agreed ſo departed wente theyr towne founde barryers mooſt parte towne made relacyon theyr meſſage ſayenge howe incontynent marſhall wolde come ye barryers ſpeke yf ye company ynowe ſende ſuche mo ye wyl haue ſo notableſt men ye towne drewe togyder marſhall xl ſperes came thyder alyghted came ye barryers ſayd thus ye ſyrs ponce voyde ye ſente v vii men byleue ſurely ye dyd put truſt ſayd howe ye wolde gladly knowledge lorde duke lady ſoueraynes maner fourme coulongne hath done ye wyl haue none gouernours ſelfe within towne pray ſoueraynte ſholde haue ouer without men ſet towne vnder elles ye wyll ye wyll vnder hym ye lyſt forſake hym ſurely myne entencyon al company ordeyne good capytayne true wyſe gouer mynyſtre true iuſtyce put al offycers ſet kynge caſtel yf ye wyll thus anſwere determyned wyll deſyred lytell take counſayle togyder ſo dyd ſayd ſyr haue good truſt doubte theſe pyllers robber haue ben ſore beten wt ſuche people tyme paſt ſyr bettram cleſquy breton came fyrſt countrey lifte v nothynge therfore fere nay ſyrs fere ſayd marſhall ſhall noo pyllers robber entre towne ye ſhall leſe nothynge v deſyre noo thynge obeyſaunce ſo thoſe wordes accorded marſhall certayne men entred towne ooſt abode without tentes pauylyous ſent towne lordes iiii ſomers laded good wyne moche brede polayne grete plenty marſhal abode yt day towne ſet offycers ye duke lācaſtre made capytayne galyſyan alwayes ben englande ye lady cuſtaunce towne well contented nexte day ye marſhall retourned ye ooſt thē determined go another towne vi myles then galyce called dyghos ſo rode forth thyderwarde wtin ii myles ſent meſſagere ye towne know whether wolde rebel elles yelde thē ponce voyde haue done yf ſholde ſaulted ye nexte daye dyghos made care meſſage ſayd care none aſſaulte haue bē aſſayled tyme loſt nothynge whē anſwere ſayd marſhall ſayd ſaynt george ſhall fyerſly aſſayled theſe vyllaynes ſo proude gyue ſuche anſwere ſo paſſed yt nyght toke theyr eaſe nexte mornynge ye ſone ryſyng dyſlodged ſoo came towne lyghted foote ſet ordre go aſſaulte within made redy defende theyr towne towne grete ſtronge byleue yf ony good mē warre theyr towne englyſſhmen ſo ſoone haue thē ſone within towne ſaw aſſayled felte arrowes ye archer englande ſawe howe dyuers thē ſore hurte euyl harney ſed began abaſſhed ſayd doo ſuffre ourſelfe thus ſlayne hurte kynge caſtell good v haue lorde duke lancaſtre ſyth hath maryed doughter kyng peter ye ſone kyng henry know well yf taken perforce ſhall dye ſe comforte fro parte moneth ſyth ſent kynge caſtel burgus spayne ſhewed counſayle peryl knewe wel englyſſhmen wolde come v kyng ſpake knyghtes fraūce ſpecyall coūſayle gaue hym counſayle ſende noo garyſon hyder noo parte galyce ſemynge kynge leue galyce loſt ſaued anſwered meſſagers ſyrs retourne towne ye beſt yourſelfe wherby may well vnderſtande nede ſuffre ourſelfe ſlayne taken perforce therwith ye men towne came gate mounted vp wyndowe made ſygne ſpeke treate herde marſhall came thyder demaunded wolde anſwered ſayd ſyr marſhall cauſe men ſeaſe aſſaulte wolde yelde v name ye duke lancaſtre lady cuſtaūce lyke maner townes galyce haue done ſhall yf ye well haue ony prouyſyon towne ye ſhall haue ryght courteyſly refreſſhe army ſhall none entre treaty wyll deſyre marſhall anſwered ſayd agreed vpholde ye demaunde wyll ordeyne good capytayne defende counſayle buſynes anſwered ſayd wel ſyr content therwith ſo aſſaulte ſeaſed marſhall ſyr fythwaren lorde • albot ſyr iohn̄ aburnell ye lorde popnynges ſyr iohn̄ dambrychcourre certayne knyghtes entred towne refreſſhe taryed al day yt without brede wyne vytayles ynoughe towne thus ye takynge towne dyghos galyce lordes well refreſſhed marſhall ſet capytayne aſquyer englande called thomas albery ſage man valyaunt xii archer hym marſhall departed entred coū trey galyce coſtynge spayne ye mountaynes caſtell come grete towne called bayon maroll ii myle then lodged ye nexte day good • aye came nere towne deuyded two bataylles ſent • aulte armes towne knowe wolde whyder wolde come obeyſaunce without aſſaylynge heraulte came barryers founde grete nombre vyllaynes euyll harneyſed ſayd theyr language heraulte portyngale called connymbres ſyrs among towne thynge thynke doo wyll ye aſſayled elles yelde vnder obey • aunce lorde duke lancaſtre lady marſhall hath ſent hyder knowe ye wyll men ye towne drewe counſayle began murmure ſayd one another ſhall yelde ourſelfe ſymply defende v auncyent man ſene moo many ſayd ſyrs nedeful take ſhorte counſayle ye englyſſhmen v grete courteſy ſyth ſuffre v take counſayle ye ſe well appereth none ayde fro parte comforte v alſo kynge caſtell knoweth wel caſe ſtande hath done euer ſyth duke lancaſtre aryued fyrſt coulongne prouydeth nothynge v aboute prouyde yf ſuffre aſſayled trouth towne grete cyrcute ſmall defence wyl harde v attende euery place englyſſhmen ſubtyll warre wyll moche payne wyn v try • pyllage couetous ſo men warre towne reputed rycher deed wherfore wolde counſayle ye beſt put ourſelfe towne vnder obeyſaunce duke duches let v ſo rebel cauſe ſelfe taken perforce ſyth maye come pea meane counſayle gyue al anſwered ſayd wyl thus byleue ye mā towne grete parage may moche deſyre make anſwere ye heraulte good wyll ſayd reaſon ye gaue heraulte rewarde wyll v courteſye reporte good v lordes ſente hym hyder ¶howe bayon yelded duke lancaſtre marſhall hooſt entred towne toke poſſeſſyon therof ca liii aūcyent mā came heraulte ſayd syr retourne mayſters ſente hyder ſaye fro v wyl amyably put v vnder obeyſaunce lorde duke lancaſtre lady duches wyfe lyke maner fourme townes galyce haue done wyll pray frende wyll gyue xx moryſkes golde ye heraulte herde hym ſay ſo ſayd ye floreyns dyd gyue hym ſo retourned lordes marſhal demaū ded hym tydynges ſaye yonder vyllaynes wyll aſſayled nay truely ſyr ſayd heraulte haue wyll therto haue ſayd ye ſholde come thyder wyll amyably receyue put themſelfe clerely vnder obeyſaunce lorde duke lady duches townes haue done well ſayd marſhall ſo better v treaty ſaulte leeſt men ſhall hurte marſhall company came ye towne lyghted foote barryers founde moche people towne theyr armure worth x frankes ſee engglyſſhmen auncyent man make theyr treatye ſoone heraulte ſawe hym ſayd vnto duke ¶syr ſpeke vnto yonder auncyent man maketh courteſye hathe auctoryte towne handes marſhall ſtepte forth ſayd ſyr ſaye wyll ye wyll ye yelde lorde lancaſtre lady ſouerayne lorde lady ye ſyr ſayd yelde v name put towne vnder theyr obeyſaunce townes galyce haue done yf pleaſe entre towne ye ſhall welcome paynge prouyſyon yf ye take ony wel ſayd marſhall ſuffyſeth wyll nothyng obeyſaunce loue countrey ye ſhall ſwere yt yf kyng caſtel come hyderor ſende hyder yt ye kepe agaynſt hȳ alyes anſwered ſayd ſyr wyl ſwere wt good wyll yf come hyder wt puyſſaunce ſende ſhal cloſe towne agaynſt hym ſende worde therof yf ſtronger wyll abyde ſtyll vnder ye ſhall fynde v maner offrawde ynoughe ſayd marſhal aſke better yere ende matter ſhal determyned herytage crowne caſtell spayne cordewayne galyce syuyll ſhal abyde hym ſtrongeſt ſhall ſene theſe countreys ende auguſt many dedes armes done grete armye appere caſtell hathe ben ſene c yere paſt well ſayd auncyent man let wyll let ryght go ryght countrey galyce dare well abyde aduenture ye rebelles brought forth towne ſware gouerne theyr towne well truely ſubiectes ſholde theyr ſouerayne lorde lady knowledge duke lancaſtre wyfe theyr lorde lady townes galyce done ye marſhall theyr name receyued theyr othes ſware agayne kepe maynteyne pea good iuſtyce whē al matter done ſworne promyſe opened theyr gate barryers euery man entred wolde lodged abrode towne iiii dayes refreſſhe theyr horſes abyde fayre ſeaſon iiii dayes neuer ſeaſed raynynge wherfore loth departe ye ryuers waxed ſo grete yt man coulde paſſe without grete daunger alſo ſeaſon aduyſed thē ſelfe whyder wolde go bezanſes rybadane another ſtronge towne wherin mooſt prowdeſt people mooſt traytours al ye countrey galyce fyrſt day ye marſhal departed fro ye towne bayon marol feldes founde ye ryuers withdrawen wherof ryght ioyful rode forth towardes rybadane grete caryage moche prouyſyon rode pea none yt ſtopped theyr way lordes galyce yt ſtyred ſo rode tyll came nereto towne lodged vnder ye olyues fayre playne within halfe legge towne determyned ſende theyr heraulte ſpeke wt rybadane ye marſhall well herde howe falſeſt people merueyleſt condycyons yt royalme grete royalme dyd neuer ſet ye kynge mā elles helde alonely thē ſelfe theyr towne ſtrong ſo ye heraulte ſent knowe theyr entencyons came thyder barryers cloſed gate alſo began call knocke noo man wolde anſwere hym yet ſawe men go vp downe garettes gate walles nothyng coulde creature wolde ſpeke one worde hym ſo ſtode callynge makynge ſygnes houre ſayd hymſelfe ſawe coulde haue nothynge elles trowe theſe men rybadane haue ſpoken bayon dyſpleaſed gaue xx floreynes dyd ſo lytell therfore nowe wyll make bye dere fere wolde haue tary tyll late take hange ſo therwith retourned marſhall demaunded tydynges whyder wolde aſſayled yelde townes done ſyr ſayd heraulte ſurely tell ſo prowde ony cryenge callynge yt coulde make none yt wolde gyue ony anſwere ſyr iohn̄ abaurell ſayd ſaweſt thou perſone peraduenture fled awaye fere v fled away ſayd ye heraulte ſyr ſauynge grace thynke ſcorne therof ye haue towne wyll put payne townes galyce ſyr knowe trouthe therin men ynowe ſawe grete nombre thē called thē hyghe ſayd ſyrs heraulte ſent ſpeke wt therfore helde theyr pea loked laughed ſayd ye marſhall falſe vyllaynes ſhall well chaſtyſed wyll departe then tyll haue brought obeyſaunce wt lorde duke lancaſtre communde contrary let v ete drynke go aſſaulte wyll ſe lytell nerer ſyth ye vyllaynes ſo prowde done ye marſhall ordeyned eten dronken lepte theyr horſes ſown̄ted theyr trompettes makynge grete noyes within whyle came towne ſome knyghtes ſquyers ran barryers founde body ouer ye gate many croſſe bowes began ſhote dyd hurte dyuers horſes englyſſhe archer araynged ye barryers ye dyke began ſhote agaynſt croſſe bowes ſo ſore aſſaulte whiche longe endured true towne rybadane ryght ſtronge coulde wonne ye one ſyde ſtandeth rocke ſo yt man mounte therto ſyde ye ſaulte cōtynued playne groū de grete dyke drye without ony water euyll mounte vpō knyghtes ſquyers auayled downe began mounte agayne targes pauaiſes ouer theyr heedes defence ſtones caſt downe archer raynged alonge dyke ſhot ſo hooly togyder defendauntes durſt appere abrode daye grete aſſaulte dyuers hurte bothe within without nyght ſowned retrayte ſaulte ſeaſed englyſſhmen drewe theyr lodgynges toke theyr caſe dreſſed hurte ſame daye thyrty sonnayne ſtryken quarell arme ſo yt moneth coulde ayde hymſelfe yt arme bare towell ¶hoowe duke lancaſtre duches helde ſaynt iames galyce comforte frenſſhe knyghtes gaue vnto kynge caſtell ca lii ſame ſeaſon yt duke laucaſtres marſhal rode abrode ye coūtrey galyce made ye coūtrey tourne ye obeyſaunce ye duke duches lay towne compoſtella otherwyſe called ſaynt iames galyce oftē tymes herde tydynges fro ye kynge portyngale ye kynge fro ſente wrote eche wekely party kyng iohn̄ caſtell lay ſeaſon valeolyue ye knyghtes fraunce hym ſpake often tymes buſynes demaūded counſayle ſomtyme ſayd thē syrs haue grete meruayle yt cometh ayde fraūce leſe countrey lyke loſe without fynde ſome remedy englyſſhmen kepeth ye feldes knowe well duke lancaſtre kynge portyngale haue ben togyder myne aduerſary kynge portyngale ſhall haue maryage one ye duke doughters ſone wedded ye ſhal ſe bothe theyr puyſſaunces ioyne togyder entre royalme ſo gyue moche frenſſhe knyghtes anſwered comforte kynge ſayd ſyr take thought therfore yf englyſſhmen wyn ye one ſyde leſe ye know ſurely frenſſhe kynge mo cm men warre nowe royalme englande dyſtroyeth conquereth countrey haue done brought al englande ſubieccyon ye frenſſhe kynge wyl take agayne ye ſe ſomer paſt aryue coulogne galyce wyn agayne moneth ye haue loſt hole yere duke lancaſtre ſhal ſo incloſed yt ſhal fayne fle portyngale ſo ye ſhal take vengeaūce enemyes ſyr know ſurely yt buſynes offraūce ben ſo grete voyage englande ye ſholde haue iii iiiim ſperes frenſſhmen ye frenſſhe kynge vncles coūſayle haue grete affeccyon cōforte ayde brynge warres ende ſyr care though ye englyſſhmen nowe kepe ye feldes wyn lytel countrey surely ſyr ye feeſt ſaynt iohn̄ baptyſt ſhal al dryuen away ye kyng toke theſe wor good toke cōforte thē ye frenſſhe knyghtes ſayd nothyng thought true reputed ſurely ye frenſſhe kynge aryued englande ſo brewted spayne galyce portyngale ſurely fourth parte tydynges yt englyſſhmen herde pylgrymes merchauntes comynge fro flaunders ſhewed duke lancaſtre alſo kynge portyngale al wrote often tymes duke yet ſomwhat dyſſymuled ouer haſty ſende lady phylyp wyfe counſayle ſayd hym ſyr ſurely tydynges come fraunce flaunders yt royalme englande grete aduenture dyſtroyed yf yt ſo ſholde auayle comforte duke lancaſtre wedde doughter ſholde nothyng auayle wherfore couertly delayed buſynes entente ſe ende yt matter howbeit letter meſſagers reteyned ſtyll duke loue fauoure nowe let v leue ſeaſon ſpeke buſyneſſes caſtell portyngale let v treate matter fraunce ¶of grete apparell ſhyppes galeys frenſſhmen made ſee paſſe englāde ca liii apparel ſhyppes galeys veſſelles ye frenſſhe kyng made paſſe englāde ſo grete ſumptuous yt eldeſt man thā lyuyng neuer ſaw herde lyke ye knyghtes ſquyers reioyſed departed fro theyr houſes go wt frenſſhe kynge englande ſayd nowe let v go theſe curſed englyſſhmen haue done ſo many euylles perſecucyons fraunce nowe ſhall reuenged faders bretherne kynſmen haue ſlayne dyſcomfyted ſurely xii wekes doynge pourueynge ſuche prouyſyons frenſſhe lordes made ſo grete meruayle conſyder ſayd flaunders kynge cometh morowe alſo men came thyder gaſcoyne armynacke comynges tholowſyn fro al lymyttes fraunce came lodged flaunders artoys came myddes auguſt ye voyage ſholde approche entente make farre countreys make ye haſt gyue enſample yt kynge toke voyage wt grete deſyre kynge toke leue ye quene wyfe quene blaunche ye duches orlyaunce ye ladyes fraunce herde maſſe ſolemply ladyes chyrche paris entencyon neuer retourne agayne paris tyll ben fyrſt englande ſo kynge rode senlyſe al yt ſeaſon duke berrey ſtyll coū trey berre howbeit prouyſyon made flaunders ſluſe hym done alſo ye duke borgoyne countrey ſo toke leue duches chyldren determyned take leue grete aunte duches brabant ſo departed borgoyne rode grete eſtate admyrall fraunce company ſyr guy tremoyle ſo came bruzelles founde duches ladyes receyued hym wt grete honour ii dayes taryed toke leue fro then rode mon heynalte founde doughter ye lady oſtrenant duke aubert ſone ſyr wyllyam heynalte erle oftrenant receyued duke grete ioy ſo brought hym valencennes duke lodged erles palace duke aubert lodgynge vycongnet lady oſtrenant fro then ye duke rode doway ſo arras founde duches wyfe taryenge hym frenſſhe kynge came compaygne ſo noyon fro then perone bapalmes ſo arras dayly came downe people fro partes ſo grete nombre ye coūtrey clene eten vp nothyng lefte abrode countrey taken wtout payenge ony thynge ſo yt poore comon people gadered togyder theyr cornes nothynge lefte ſtrawe yf ſpake therof beten ſlayne theyr water fyſſhed theyr houſes beten downe fyer wood yf englyſſhemen aryued countrey coulde wolde haue done ſo grete dyſtruccyon hurte frenſſhmen themſelfe dyd ſayd poore men ſyrs haue nowe ſyluer pay retourne ſhal haue ynoughe ye ſhall clerely payde poore people ſaw theyr goodes taken ſpente away durſt ſpeke theragaynſt curſed bytwene theyr tethe ſayenge go englande deuyll neuer retourne agayne ¶howe frenſſhe kynge vncles aryued sluſe flaunders ca liiii frenſſhe kynge came lyſle flaunders two vncles hym ye duke borgoyne duke borbon thē duke berrey behynde owne coūtrey ordeyned buſynes ye kynge lyſle duke bare duke lorayne erle armynacke erle sauoy erle dalphyn awuergne erle geneue erle ſaynt poule erle ewe ye erle longueuyle grete lordes fraunce ſuche nombre neuer name ſayd ſholde paſſe englande xxm knyghtes ſquyers whiche ſay trouth fayre company alſo xxm croſſe bowes geneways beſyde xxm men warre ſyr olyuer clyſſon bretayne ordeyned therfore buſynes nauye ſholde brynge hym ye cloſure felde made tymbre whiche ordeyned ſet vp euery nyght one englande ſyr olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce ſholde come bretayne beſt knyghtes ſquyers therin vycount rohan ye lorde ray lorde beawmanoyre ye lorde de la vale lorde rochforte lorde maleſtroyt ſyr iohn̄ maleſtroyte vc ſperes brerons choſen men warre conſtables entencyon mā ſholde entre englande without mā armes choſen gaue charge admyral ſayng take hede ye charge ſhyppes varlettes boyes ſhall v domage profyte ſo ii iii knyghtes without grete mayſters thoughe hyred ſhyppes theyr money yet ſholde haue one horſe ouer one varlet ſay trouthe ordeyned al theyr buſyneſſes good ordre opynyon dyuers yf myght aryue togyder englande entended lande orwell hauen howe ſholde ſore abaſſhe countrey ſo ſholde without doubte grete lordes ſpyrytuall temporall people good townes grete doubte comons poore companyons cared nothynge therfore dyd pore knyghtes ſquyers deſyred warre outher wynne loſe ſayd one another god hath ſent v good ſeaſon ſyth frenſſhe kynge wyll come coūtrey valyaunt kyng thynke ccc yere paſſed fraunce kyng yt courage maketh men good mē warre bleſſyd maye ſyth wyll come vyſyte v nowe ſhall dye elles ryche none otherwyſe ¶howe frenſſhe kynge taryed sluſe grete ooſt entente entre englande ca iv apparell voyage grete ſumptuous flaunders sluſe lykewyſe englāde haue ſhewed ſomwhat therof wherfore paſſe ouer breuely yf tax tallages grete fraunce lykewyſe englande ſo many man ſorowed longe bycauſe comons ſawe nedefull ſayd agaynſt reaſon thoughe taxed nowe gyue goodes knyghtes ſquyers defende theyr herytages rayſed ſame tyme englande defence countrey ii mylyons floreyns receyuours therof archebyſſhop yorke broder lorde neuell erle oxenforde ſyr nycholas branbre ſyr myghell polle ſyr symon burle ſyr peter gauloufer ſyr robert tryuylyen ſyr iohn̄ beauchamp syr iohn̄ salyſbury kynges pryuy counſayle kynges vncles nothynge done wolde medle therwith brynge royalme trouble toke good hede maynteyne honoure ye royalme kepe ye paſſages porte byleued ſurely haue y• ſame yere ye frenſſhe kyng wt puyſſaūce aryue englande ſo theſe ſayd lordes knyghtes receyued tax dyd lyſt chefe mooſt profyte ye erle oxenforde hym euery thynge done without hym nothyng done ſo whē theyr buſyneſſes paſſed people made trouble knowe ye money became ſome cytees good townes englande wolde haue accomptes therof ye ayde kynges vncles ye ſhal tyme ſhall ſpeke therof ſhall forgotten hyſtory ¶howe ſyr symon burle wolde haue counſayle ſaynt thomas cauntorburyes ſhryne remoued caſtell douer wherby acheued grete hate ca lv sir symon burle capytayne caſtel douer herde often tymes newes calays fyſſhers kepte ſtyll theyr cuſtome fyſſhynge somtyme boloyne porte whytſande frenſſhe fyſſhers met wolde tel eche tydynges ſomtyme knewe fyſſhers ſee ſoo euer warre bytwene englande fraunce dyd hurte one another frendes aydynge eche bought ſolde eche fyſſhe one ſped better another yf ſholde haue made war one wt another durſt none haue gone fyſſhynge wtout conduyte men warre thus ſyr symon burle vnderſtode ye fyſſhers ſurely frenſſhe kynge wolde paſſe ouer englande take landyng douer sandwytche ſyr symon byleued wel thoſe wordes thought true ſo dyd englande ſo daye came cauntorbury wente abbaye demaunded hym tydynges ſhewed moche knewe wordes ſhewed ſaynt thomas ſhryne whiche goodly ryche ſurety bycauſe towne ſtronge ſayd frenſſhemen ſholde come thyder whiche lykelyhode wolde couetyſe wynnynge robber pyllers wolde robbe towne abbey chyrche wyll cary awaye ſhryne yf fynde wherfore wolde counſayle aduyſe cary ye caſtell douer ſhal ſuretye thoughe al englande loſt abbot couent toke counſayle though ment well grete dyſpyte dyſpleaſure ſayenge ſyr symon wyll ye depoſe chyrche fro ſygnory yt ye afrayde make yourſelfe ſure thoughe ye cloſe yourſelfe ye caſtell douer forfere yet frenſſhmen ſhall ſo hardy come hyder v ſo symon burle multyplyed ſo moche inwardes maynteynynge requeſt ye comons countrey ſore diſpleaſed hym reputed hym profytable yt countrey ryght well ſhewed theyr dyſpleaſure ye ſhall ſtory ſyr symon burley wente douer agayne frenſſhe kynge came lyſle ſhewe ye iourney pleaſed hym approche ſoner paſſage ſo kyng approched ſayd flaunders actoys ſhall take ſhyppyng outher satterday monday tuyſday ſo euery day y• weke ſayd ſholde departe morowe ye nexte day broder duke tourayne byſſhop beawuoys chauncellour fraunce dyuers grete lordes toke theyr leue ye kyng lyſl retourned parys ſhewed howe kynge gyuen gouernyng royalme broder duke tourayne tyll retourne agayne ayde dyuers lordes fraunce ſuche ordeyned go englande ye erle bloys yet ſeaſon ye duke berry behynde came fayre eaſely grete appetyte go englande longe taryeng dyſpleaſaūt kynge duke burgoyne lordes wolde gladly ben come ſtyll grete prouyſyon made whiche coſtly dere thynge worth franke ſolde iiii howebeit money ſpared euery man deſyred well ſtuffed euery thynge maner enuy euery mā better appoynted thoughe grete lordes well payde theyr wage poore companyons bought bergayne owynge monethes wage yet coulde gete nothynge treaſourer warres clarkes ye chambre accomptes ſayd ſyrs abyde tyll nexte weke ye ſhall payde ſoo anſwered wekely yf ony payment made viii dayes owynge viii wekes ſoo ſome ſawe maner dealynge howe ſoo euyll payde ſore dyſpleaſed ſayd ſurely voyage ſhall ſmall effecte lykelyhode money gadered ye tax wyl breke iourney retourne home agayne theyr owne countreys ſuche dyd caſt ſuche doubtes prouided therafter wyſe poore knyghtes companyons ſuche • eyned ye grete lordes ſpente euery thynge ſo dere flaunders harde gete outher brede drynke yf wolde ſell theyr wage armure money gete yf ony bought dere ſoo moche people aboute dan bruges ardenbrughe ſpecyally sluſe kynge came thyder wyſt lodge erle ſaynt poule lorde concy dolphyn auuergne lorde dantoygne dyuers lordes fraunce lye theyr caſe lodgynge bruges ſomtyme went sluſe kynge know ſholde departe euer ſayd within iii iiii dayes duke berrey come yt haue wynde ſtrue v ſo euer tyme paſſed day ſhortened began foule colde nyghtes longe wherwith dyuers lordes contente tary ſo longe alſo theyr prouyſyons mynyſſhed ¶howe kyng armony paſſed englande truſt fynde ſome meane pea good appoyntment bytwene kyng englande kynge fraunce ca lvi thus abydynge duke berrey conſtable behynde kynge lyon armony fraūce aſſygned hym ye kynge vim frankes ye yere maynteyne eſtate toke hym good entente go englande ſpeke kyng counſayle ſe myght fynde ony maner pea bytwene two royalmes englande fraūce ſo departed fro lodgynge ſaynt albeyne beſyde ſaynt denyee alonely wt owne company grete apparel soo rode boloyne toke ſhyp ſo ſayled forth tyll came douer founde erle cambrydge erle buckyngham mo c mē armes iim archer laye kepe paſſage brute ranne ye frenſſhmen ſholde lande sandwyche kynge laye london parte counſayle hym dayly herde tydynges fro porte englande kynge armony aryued douer good chere bycauſe ſtraū ger ſo came kynges vncles ſwetely receyued hym tyme conuenyent demaunded hym fro whens came whether wolde kyng anſwered ſayd truſt goodnes come thyder ſe kynge englande counſayle treate pea bytwene englande fraunce ſayd thought warre mete ſayd reaſon warre bytwene theſe ii royalmes whiche hath endured ſo longe ſarazyns iewes turkes waxed proude none maketh ony warre occaſyon therof haue loſt lande royalme lyke recouer agayne without ferme pea cryſtendome wolde gladly ſhewe matter toucheth cryſtendome kynge englande counſayle haue done frenſſhe kyng kynges vncles demaunded hym yf frenſſhe kynge ſent hym thyder noo anſwered ſayd nay noo man yt ſent come hyder myne owne mocyon ſe yf kynge englande counſayle wolde ony thynge leane ony treatye pea demaunded frenſſhe kynge anſwered byleue sluſe ſawe hym ſyth toke leue hym senlyze demaunded howe coulde make ony treatye pea charge ſo ſyr yf ye conuayed kynge nephewe counſayle frenſſhe kynge meane ſeaſon entre puyſſannce englande ye may happen therby receyue grete blame perſone grete ieoperdy countrey kynge anſwered ſayd ſuretye frenſſhe kynge haue ſente hym deſyrynge tyll retourne agayne remoue fro sluſe repute hym ſo noble ſoo well aduyſed yt wyll graunt deſyre wyll entre ſee tyl come agayne hym wherfore ſyrs praye inſtaunce loue yea conuey ſpeke kynge deſyre gretely ſe hym elles ye vncles yf ye haue auctoryte gyue anſwere demaundes erle buckyngham ſayd ſyr kynge armony ordeyned kepe defende paſſage fronters englande kynge counſayle haue charge medle ony buſynes ye royalme without otherwyſe commaunded kyng ſyth ye come good entente countrey ye ryght welcome ſyr ony ferme anſwere ye haue none v nowe coū ſayle ſhall conuey kynge wt peryll domage kynge thanked ſayd deſyre nothynge elles ſe kynge ſpeke hym ¶howe kynge amony retourned englande anſwere made hym ca lvii kynge armony refreſſhed douer day ſpoken wt kynges vncles good leyſure departed towarde london good conduyte lordes appoynted hym fere ony rencountres ſo longe rode came london rydynge thrughe london well regarded bycauſe ſtraūger good chere made hym ſoo brought kynge laye ryall quenes warderobe counſayle london theyr lodgynges londonners fore fortefyenge theyr cyte comynge kynge armony knowen kynges counſayle drewe kyng tydynges kyng brought troublous ſeaſon kynge armony come kynges preſence made ſalutacyon began proceſſe ſtate howe come fraunce pryncypally ſe kynge englande whome neuer ſene ſayd howe ryght ioyous preſence truſtynge ſome goodnes ſholde come therby ſhewed wordes withſtande grete peſtylence yt lykely englande therfore come owne good wyl ſome good therin myght ſent fro frenſſhe kynge wyllynge ſet ſome accorde pea bytwene yeii royalmes englande fraunce many fayre pleſaunt wordes kynge armony ſpake yt kynge englande counſayle ſhortly anſwered thus ſyr kyng ye welcome royalme kynge ſouerayne lorde glad ſe ſyr ſaye yt kynge hath counſayle ſhortely ſhall ye ſhall anſwered kynge armony contente therwith ſo retourned lodgynge wt iiii dayes kynge counſayled thynke ſente vncles knowe theyr entente preſent anſwere gyuynge go palays weſtmynſtre counſayle hym ſuche aboute hym ſende kynge armony come thyder come preſence kynge englande counſayle kynge ſate downe kynge armony hym prelate counſayle ye kynge armony reherſed agayne requeites yt made alſo ſhewed wyſely howe cryſtē dome ſore decayed feblyſſhed occaſyon warres bytwene englande fraū ce howe al knyghtes ſquyers bothe royalmes entended nothynge elles alwayes ye one parte ye wherby empyre conſtantynoble leſeth lyke leſe warre ye knyghtes ſquyers wonte aduenture themſelfe alſo kynge armony ſhewed yt occaſyon war loſt royalme armony wherfore deſyred goddes ſake myght ſome treatye pea bytwene ii royalmes englande fraunce theſe wordes anſwered archebyſſhop cauntorbury charge ſo ſayd ſyr kynge armony maner neuer ſene bytwene ii ſuche enemyes kynge englande frenſſhe kynge yt kynge souerayne lorde ſholde requyred pea entre landes puyſſaunt army wherfore ſyr ſay yt yf pleaſe ye maye retourne frenſſhe kynge cauſe hym puyſſaunce retourne backe theyr owne countreys euery man home yf pleaſe ye maye retourne agayne hyder ſhall gladly entende treatye anſwere kynge armony coulde gete ſo dyned kynge englande hadde grete honoure coulde deuyſed kynge offered hym many grete gyftes golde ſyluer wolde take noone though nede therof alonely rynge value c frankes dyner toke leue retourned vnto lodgynge nexte daye departed two dayes douer toke leue ſuche lordes ſo toke ſee paſſagere aryued calays fro then wente sluſe ſpake frenſſhe kynge vncles ſhewed howe hadde ben englande anſwere frenſſhe kynge vncles toke regarde ſayenge ſente hym agayne backe fraunce theyr full entencyon entre englande ſoone myght haue wynde wether duke berre conſtable came wynde ſore contrary therwith coulde neuer entre englande wynde good goo scotlande ¶howe duke berre departed parys come sluſe howe conſtable fraunce toke ſee wynde cōtrary hym ca lviii thus duke berre herde maſſe lady chyrche parys toke leue ſayd wolde neuer entre agayne tyll hadde ben englande howbeit wordes thought contrary deſyre therto wynter ſeaſon ſore come waye came letter fro kynge fro duke borgoyne haſtynge hym certefyenge hym howe taryed noo thynge elles comynge soo duke berre rode alwayes forwarde ſmall iourneys ¶and conſtable fraunce departed fro cyte lentryngyet ſtandynge ſee ſyde bretayne grete nombre men armes prouyſon lxxii ſhyppes hym hadde cloſure felde made tymbre conſtable company good wynde begynnynge approched nere englande wynde roſe fyerſe grete entre margate tames mouthe wynde ſoo grete whether wolde theyr ſhyppes departed ſoo xx abode togyder ſome dryuen perforce tames taken englyſſh men ſpecyally taken iii iiii ſhyppes laden parte cloſure tymbre ordeyned cloſe felde certayne mayſters carpenter artficers ſo brought london wherof kynge grete ioye ſo hadde londonners vii conſtables ſhyppes dryuen wynde prouyſyon taken zelande conſtable lordes grete payne came sluſe frenſſhe kynge conſtables comynge company frenſſhe kynge ryght ioyfull kynge ſayd hym ¶syr conſtable ſhall departe certaynly haue grete deſyre ſe englande wherfore praye auaunce forth buſynes haſty maner let v entre ſee ſhortely myne vncle duke berre wyll v within theſe two dayes lyſle syr ſayd conſtable departe tyll wynde ſerue v ye wynde ſore agaynſt v ſoo ſtraynable maryners ſaye haue herde none ſuche grete ſeaſon conſtable ſayd kynge haue ben veſſell pleaſeth gretely ayre ſee byleue ſhall good maryner ſee dyd hurte name god ſayd conſtable hath done hurte ſyr grete peryll comynge fro brytayne hyder kynge demaunded hywe ſoo conſtable ſayd fortune ſee grete wyndes roſe agaynſt v fronters englande ſyr haue loſt ſhyppes men wherof ryght ſory yf myght amende ſyr without remedy tyme thus kynge conſtable deuyſed togyder wordes alwayes tyme paſſed wynter approched lordes laye grete colde peryll flemynges gladly wolde haue hadde retourne agayne thrughe theyr countrey ſayd one another deuyll dothe frenſſhe kynge paſſe ouer englande taryeth ſo longe countrey pouertye ynoughe thoughe frenſſhe men make v poorer thynke wyll paſſe englande yere royalme englande ſo eaſy wonne englyſſhmē condycyon frenſſhemen wyl englande ye englyſſhmē fraunce ouer rode theyr countreys thē hyd themſelfe theyr fortreſſes fled larke dothe ye hawke towne bruges mooſt reſorte frenſſhmen murmured redy waggyng ryſſhe make debate ſtryfe al began frenſſhe lakeys beten hurte ſome flemynges ſo yf honeſt men towne armed drawen market place appeaſe ryot lorde knyght ſquyer fraunce haue ſcaped vnſlayne comon people towne bare grudge theyr myndes batayle roſebeque theyr faders br • ther ne frendes ſlayne frenſſhmen god ſent thyder tyme frenſſhmen lorde guyſtell bruges vnderſtode howe ye comons wente harneys fered ſholde loſt without remedy howbeit lepte hors v vi hym rode ſtretes met ony armed goynge marget place warde ſayd ſyrs whether goo wyll loſe yourſelfe haue ye warre youghe ſo ye haue moche gete lyuynge retourne houſes nothynge ye may put yourſelfe towne ſuche ieoperdy ſhall loſt knowe frenſſh kynge puyſſaunce armye countrey ſoo fayre wordes appeaſed theym cauſed theym retourne theyr houſes whiche hadde ſo lyghtly haue ben done yf ben frenſſhmen ſuche fere cloſed themſelfe theyr lodgynges abyde theyr aduenture ¶howe voyage englande broken reaſon wyndes wynter counſayle duke berre ca lix fynally duke berre came sluſe kynge kynge ſayd hym fayre vncle gretely haue deſyred ſe haue taryed ſo long ben nowe englande fought enemyes ye ben come duke began ſmyle exſcuſe hymſelfe ſhewed incontynent laye harte fyrſt thought wolde ſe prouyſyon ordenaunce made ſe nauey named ſo goodly soo vii dayes euery daye ſayd ſhall departe morowe howbeit ſurely wynde ſoo contrary wyſe coulde ſayle englande wynter well paſt ſaynt andrewes tyde good ſeaſon ſo many noble men take ſee many theyr ſhyppes redy croſſed redynes departe ſome theyr ſhyppes formoſt ſholde paſſe ſyr robert ſyr phylyp artoys ſyr henry bare ſyr peter nauare dyuers kynges coū tayle drewe togyder ſe howe ſholde perceyuer theyr iourney duke berre brake ſhewed ſo many reaſons reaſonable ſuche mooſt deſyre goo gretely dyſcouraged ſayd grete foly counſayle frenſſhe kynge maner chylde take ſee ſeaſon yere go fyght ſuche people knowe theyr condycyon way thyder ſayd euyll coū trey make warre thoughe al lande yet wolde fyght v lyſt dare leue prouyſyon behynde v yf wyl loſt wyl make ſuche voyage ſo ferre hath nede begyn harte ye yere wynter call maryners togyder loke yf wyl ſaye wordes good thoughe nowe thouſande v hundred ſhyppes yet come ſhal iii hundred holde peryll ſholde put ourſelfe ſaye bycauſe wolde haue iourney lefte ſpeke waye counſayle ſyth mooſt parte royalme enclyneth iourney therfore fayre broder borgoyne wolde ſholde go wolde counſayle kynge ſholde goo yf ony myſfortune ſholde fall ſhal layde v well ſayd ye frenſſhe kynge preſent thoſe wordes yf none wyll go wyll go lordes began ſmyle ſayd kynge hath couragyous wyll howbeit toke counſayle deferre voyage tyll aprell may nexte theyr prouyſyons byſquet powdred fleſſhe wyne ſholde kepte ſaufely tyll ordeyned lordes theyr companyes ſholde retourne thyder agayne moneth marche anone knowen ſo brake voyage ſeaſon ye whicoſt royalme fraunce cm frankes xxx tyme tolde ¶howe kynge charles fraunce frenſſhe lordes retourned euyll contente fro sluſe flaunders theyr prouyſyons made haue gone royalme englande feeſt made london ca lx ye haue herde made grete apparell fraunce kynge lordes grete coſt charge ſhyppes galayes paſſe ſee englande make warre howe voyage broken wether bycauſe yt wynter ſo nere hande ordeyned counſayle kynge lordes ſholde retourne euery man owne home euery thynge abyde ſame ſtate vnto moneth marche aprell euery man redy kynges commaundement myght well haue ben ſeene lordes knyghtes ſoore dyſpleaſed ſpecyally ſuche farre coūtreys ſore trauayled theyr bodyes ſpente theyr money truſt haue good ſeaſon erle sauoy erle army • ake erle daulphyn awuergne c grete lordes departed grete dyſpleaſure bycauſe ben englande lykewyſe ſo dyd frenſſhe kynge thenne coulde amende ¶so thus departed maner people ſome mery ſome gretely dyſpleaſed angry offycers abode ſtyll behynde make ſhyfte ſell theyr prouyſyons theyr mayſters profyte take money yf myght wyſt whome coſte hundred frankes ſolde x frankes leſſe money erle dalphyn awuergne ſayd vnto faythe hadde prouyſyons whiche coſte hym ten thouſande frankes retourned homewarde agayne loſt togyther ſoo ſayd many knyghtes ſquyers people fraunce ¶and theſe tydynges knowen royme englande ſome ryght ioyfull gladde therof ſuche people doubted frenſſhe mennes commynge ſome angry dyſpleaſed therwith whiche ſuche people thought haue ſome promocyon profyte thenne made cyte london grete feeſt thyther came lordes ſuche hadde kepte porte paſſages royalme englande ¶and kynge helde alſo noble feeſt weſtmynſtre cryſtmaſſe day thre duke made ¶fyrſte erle cambrydge made duke yorke erle buckyngham broder made duke gloceſtre thyrde erle oxenforde made • irelande feeſt endured grete reuelles tryumphes ¶so thus people royalme englande thought themſelfe hadde eſcaped grete peryll thenne dyuers ſayd amonge themſelfe wolde neuer ſette frenſſhe men thought aſſemble frenſſhe men made sluſe fere englyſſhe men haue cauſed duke lancaſtre company retourne agayne spayne ¶howe ſquyer called iaques le grys accuſed parlyament houſe parys lordes preſent knyght called iohn̄ carongne iugement gyuen vpon howe iuſted vtteraunce parys place called ſaynt katheryne behynde temple howe iaques le grys confounded ca lxi tyme grete brute fraunce lowe march feate armes ſholde done parys vtteraunce ſoo matter iudged parlyament chambre parys whiche plee hadde endured yere bytwene theſe two partyes one aſquyer called iaques le grys partye knyght called iohn̄ carongne bothe lande houſholde erle peter alanſon welbyloued theyr lorde ſpecyally ſquyer iaques le grys byloued tryſted lorde aboue ony perſone courte houſholde bycauſe mortall batayle folowed bytwene beynge bothe one lordes houſholde euery man hadde grete meruayle therof soo dyuers countreys grete multytude people came parys daye batayle ſe ſhall ſhewe hole matter enfourmed soo ſeaſon knyght called iohn̄ carongne toke entrepryſe vpon hym goo ouer ſee auauncement honoure vnto hadde ben longe tyme accomplyſſhe ¶soo departed lorde erle alanſon doo voyage alſo toke leue wyfe reputed fayre lady yonge lefte caſtell owne march perche otherwyſe called argentuell ſo entred voyage wyfe laye ſtyll caſtell wyſe ſage maner ¶soo beganne matter deuylles temptacyon whiche entred body ſquyer iaques le grys erle alanſon lorde one counſayle ſo determyned mynde doo euyll dede whiche derely bought afterwarde howbeit euyll dyd coulde neuer proued hym wolde neuer confeſſe ſquyer iaques le grys ſette mynde wyfe foreſayd knyght iohn̄ carongne abſence huſbande knewe well ſhe caſtell argentuell owne company houſholde ſeruauntes ¶and ſoo mornynge toke good hors departed alanſon ſo rode ſpurres grete haſte tyll came ladyes caſtell thyder come ladyes ſeruauntes made hym good chere bycauſe theyr mayſter companyons felowes togyder ſerued bothe one lorde mayſter lady ſhe thought none euyll hym ſhe knewe nothynge entente wherfore come thyther howbeit ſwetely ſhe receyued hym ledde hym chambre ſhewed hym parte buſynes ſquyer faques le grys accomplyſſhe folyſſhe appetyte deſyred lady myghte ſe dongeon ſayd grete parte comynge thyder ſe lady lyghtly graunted hym deſyre ſoo ſhe wente thyder alone nother chamberer varlet entred lady noo myſtruſt hym ony dyſhonoure ſone entred dongeon iaques le grys cloſed doore theym lady knewe therof ſhe wente thought wynde ſhotte dore ſo togyder thus alone iaques toke lady armes enbraced dyſcouered entent lady ſore abaſſhed wolde gladly haue gone dore ſhe coulde bygge man ſo layde downe carpe • ſo force dyd pleaſure done lyſt opened dore ſo departed lady ſore dyſpleaſed abaſſhed yt aduēcure 〈…〉 alone donteonbut knyghtes departed ſhe ſayd wypynge iaket iaket ye haue well done thus ſhame blame ſhall reſt yf god ſuffre huſbande one retourne home agayne soo iaket toke horſe departed rode agayne mayſter erle • alanſon ryſynge aboute ix clocke iiii ye clocke mo • e mornynge ſene ſhall ſhewe ſpeke theſe wordes bycauſe grete plee folowed ye comyſſaryes parly ament parys matter eramynacyon thus lady carongne abode ſtyl caſtel ſorowfull deed done dyſcouered matter creature kepte ſorowe ſecrete ſhe myght ſhe ſawe wel ſpeke therof myght haue blame honoure ſhe remembred well day houre tyme dede doone ſoo tyme came lorde caroagne came home voyage lady wyfe made hym good chere day paſſed nyght came knyght wente bedde lady wolde wherof knyght grete meruayle often deſyred come bedde euer ſhe bleſſyd walked vp downe chambre ſtudyenge muſynge fynally ſeruauntes gone bedde ſhe came huſbande fell downe knee lamentably ſhewed hym aduenture knyght coulde byleue howbeit lady 〈◊〉 ſoo moche agreed well ſo ſayd certaynly lady ſyth ye matter ſo ye ſhewe pardon knyght ſhall 〈◊〉 dede aduyſe counſayle 〈◊〉 frendes youres yf 〈◊〉 founde vntrue ye ſhall neuer come company lady euer 〈…〉 true ſo night paſſed nexte daye knyght wrote many letter ſente wyffes frendes alſo owne ſoo ſhorte tyme come aſſembled togyder caſtell argentuell chambre began ſhewe cauſe hadde ſent made wyfe ſhewe matter fro poynte poynte wherof hadde grete meruayle ſo demaunded thē counſayle counſayled ſholde drawe lorde erle alanſon ſhewe hym matter ſoo dyd erle gretely loued foreſayd iaques le grys wolde byleue hym ſoo gaue daye partyes hym day lymytted alſo commaunded lady hadde appeched iaques le grys ſholde preſente ſhewe playnly trouthe matter ſoo ſhe grete nombre lygnage ſoo pletynge grete longe erles preſence iaques le grys accuſed dede knyght lorde carongne relacyon wyfe ſhewed caſe fallen iaques le grys exſcuſed hymſelfe ſayenge howe gylty therin lady layde ſore charge euer denyed hadde meruayle wordes lady dyd hate hym proued erle alanſons houſe ſame daye foure clocke mornynge ſene mayſters caſtell mayſter ſayd affyrmed ix clocke hym vp ryſynge wherfore erle ſayd poſſyble hym go come dede foure houres halfe ryde xxiii myles wherfore erle ſayd lady howe ſhe dyd dreame wherfore wolde maynteyne ſquyer commaunded lady ſpeke noo matter knyght grete courage well truſted leued wyfe wolde agree oppenyon ſoo wente parys ſhewed matter parlyament appeled iaques le grys appered anſwered appele layde pledge accomplyſſhe ordenaunce parlyament plee bytwene endured yere halfe coulde agreed foreſayd knyght helde hymſelfe ſore informacyon wyfe bycauſe matter ſo ſore publyſſhed abrode ſayd wolde maynteyne quarell dethe wherwith erle alanſon ſore dyſpleaſed poore knyght often tymes wolde haue hym ſlayne matter parlyament ſo longe theyr plee endured yt parlyament determyned bycauſe lady coulde make proffe agaynſt iaques le grys owne wordes ſholde batayle vtteraunce bytwene ſoo daye prefyxed knyght wyfe ſquyer beynge preſent iudgement gyuen nexte mondaye mortall batayle ſholde done bytwene knyght ſquyer whiche yere oure lorde god mccc lxxx vii whiche tyme frenſſhe kynge lordes sluſe entente paſſe ouer ſee englande kynge herde matter howe daye batayle taken parys kynge ſayd wolde ſe batayle bytwene knyght ſquyer duke berre duke borgoyne duke borbone conſtable fraunce alſo grete deſyre ſe batayle ſayd kynge ſyr good reaſon ye done preſence kynge ſent parys comaundynge iourney batayle bytwene ſquyer ye knyght ſholde relonged tyl comynge parys ſo cōmaundement obeyed kynge retourned fro sluſe helde feeſt cryſtmas arras duke borgoyne lyſle meane ſeaſon men warre paſſed retourned fraunce euery man place ordeyned marſhalles grete lordes retourned parys ſe ſayd batayle thus kynge vncles conſtable came parys lyſtes made place called ſaynt katheryne behynde temple ſoo moche people meruayle beholde one ſyde lyſtes made grete ſcaffoldes lordes myght better ſe batayle ii champyons ſo bothe came felde armed peace eche ſet theyr chayre erle ſaynt poule gouerned iohn̄ carongne erle alanſons company iaques le grys knyght entred felde came wyfe ſyttynge chayre couered blacke ſayd thus dame enformacyon quarell put lyfe aduenture fyght iaques le grys ye knowe cauſe iuſt true ſyr ſayd lady haue ſayd wherfore ye maye fyght ſurely cauſe good true thoſe wordes knyghte kyſſed lady toke hande bleſſyd hym ſoo entred felde lady ſate ſtyll blacke chayre prayer god vyrgyne mary humbly prayenge theyr ſpecyall grace ſende huſbande vyctory accordynge ryght lady grete heuynes • ſhe ſure lyfe yf huſbande ſholde haue ben dyſcomfyted ſhe iudged without remedy brente huſbande hanged ſay whether ſhe repented yt matter ſo forwarde bothe ſhe huſbande grete peryll howbeit fynally ſhe muſt abyde aduenture theſe two champyons ſet one agaynſt another ſo mounted theyr horſes behaued nobly knewe perteyned deades armes many lordes knyghtes fraunce come thyder ſe batayle ye two champyons iuſted theyr fyrſt metyng none dyd hurte iuſtes lyghted foote perfourme theyr batayle ſoo fought valyauntly fyrſt iohn̄ carongne hurte thyghe wherby al frendes grete fere fought ſo valyauntly bette downe aduerſary erthe threſt ſwerde body ſoo ſlewe hym felde demaunded yf done deuoyre anſwered hadde valyauntly acheued batayle iaques le grys delyuered hangman parys drewe hym gybet mountfawcon hanged hym vp iohn̄ carongne came kynge kneled downe ye kynge made hym ſtande vp hym ſame daye kynge cauſed delyuered hym thouſande frankes reteyned hym chambre pencyon ii hundred pounde yere durynge terme lyfe thanked kynge lordes went wyfe kyſſed wente togyder chyrche lady parys made theyr offerynge retourned theyr lodgynges ſyr iohn̄ carongue taryed longe fraunce wente ſyr iohn̄ boucequant ſyr iohn̄ bordes ſyr loys grat theſe wente ſe vyſyte holy ſepulture ſe lamorabaquyn whome thoſe dayes moche ſpekynge wente robonet bolowne ſquyer honoure frenſſhe kynge dayes made many voyage aboute worlde ¶how kyng aragon dyed howe archebyſſhoppe burdeaus ſette pryſon barcelona ca lxi ſame ſeaſon aboute candelmas kynge peter aragon fell ſyke bed ſawe yt ſholde dye cauſed two ſones come hȳ iohn̄ elder martyne duke blaſmont aragon ſayd fayre ſones leue good poynte buſynes royalme ſtandeth well clere kepe pea loue bytwene kepe fayth honoure eche ye ſhall doo better feates chyrche accordynge conſcyence mooſt ſure way haue alwayes holden new tralyte bytwene ye ii pope ſo wolde ye ſholde tyl determynacyon bytwene apere clerely two ſones anſwered ſayd ſyr gladly ſhall obey ye commaunde ordeyne reaſon thus caſe dyed kynge peter aragon ben ryght valyaunt prynce dayes gretely augmented crowne royalme aragon conquered royalme mayiorke anexed owne crowne buryed good cyte barcelona lyeth dethe knowen auygnyon pope clement cardynalles wrote incotynent ye frenſſhe kynge vncles duke barre duches theyr oppynyon fader moder yonge quene ſholde aragon lady yolent alſo wrote theſe ſholde ſtyre moue yonge kynge aragon theyr opynyon frenſſhe kynge duke berre duke borgoyne ſente aragon legacyon cardynall preche ſtyre yonge kynge broder people royalme aragon take oppynyon clement cardynall dydde ſoo moche ayde lady yolent barre quene aragon gladly enclyned way bycauſe ſhe ſo inſtantly requyred therto fader moder frenſſhe kynge duke berre burgoyne coſyns ſoo ſhe brought kynge royalme oppynyon pope clement howbeit kynge wolde haue ben ſtyl newter fader ſame ſeaſon kynge aragon thus dyed barcelona archebyſſhoppe burdeaus whome duke lancaſtre ſente thyder ambaſſade ſhall ſhewe yon cauſe ¶the prynce wale bycauſe duke lorde countrey acquytayne neyghbours doubted hym frenſſhe kynge kynge aragon kynge spayne kynge nauare yea alſo kynges ſarazyns harde grete ſpekynge hym good fortune noble chyualrye hadde certayne alyaunce confyderacyon kynge peter aragon whiche leage ſworne ſealed bytwene confyrmed kynge englande fader prynce amonge thynges compryſed kynge englande duke lorde acquytayne ſholde make ony warre conſente make ony warre agaynſt roayalme aragon whiche kynge aragon ſware ſealed hym ayres euery yere ſholde ſerue prynce acquytayne nombre fyue hundred ſperes agaynſt ſo euer hadde doo withall elles ſende vnto hym moche money ſholde wag • fyue hundreth ſperes ¶and ſoo x yeres rynne aterages kynge aragon payde nothyng done ony ſeruyce ye kynge englande deputyes duke lancaſtre wente englande hadde hym letter patentes ſealed grete ſeale englande wherby ſtablyſſhed kynges lyeutenaunt march burdeaus bayon acquytayne kynge gaue hym fall puyſſaunce auctoryroyall demaunde ryghtes due accyons well royalme aragon elles wolde duke ſholde haue y• profyte without ony excepcyon ſoo euer dyd ferme ſtable ſo thus whē duke lancaſtre ben ſeaſon towne ſaynt iames galyce remembred hymſelfe buſynes aragon perceyued well reaſon commyſſyon howe kynge aragon ſore det grete ſome money longe renne arerages whiche thought myght gete ſholde gretely ayde hym warres caſtell ſoo ſente archebyſſhop burdeaus ſyr iohn̄ harpedan ſeneſſhall burdeloys commaundynge thē bothe leeſt one go aragon ye kynge ſhewe hym playnly howe grete arrerages kynge englande duke acquytayne archebyſſhoppe seneſſhall behelde well duke lancaſtres letter ſoo toke counſayle togyder theron determyned beſt yt seneſſhall ſholde •• ry ſtyll burdeaus byſſhop take hym charge voyage ſoo dyd came aragon ſo euyll ſeaſon kynge relaye ſyke dyed kynges dethe archebyſſhop pourſued cauſe folowed kynges chyldren ye counſayle royalme came kynges enterment ye cyte barcelona byſſhop purſued ambaſſade ſo affectuouſly ſet courtoyſe pryſon ſo coulde departe wolde theſe tydynges came burdeaus ye ſeneſſhall ſayd thought neuer none wyſe ye archebyſſhop haſty heedy thynke nowe ben better gone wolde haue ſpoken moore mekely maner thrughout worlde howe demaunde mannes ryght ſeneſſhall ſente theſe tydynges duke lancaſtre galyce therwith ryght ſore dyſpleaſed euyll contente kynge aragon counſayle put archebyſſhop pryſon doynge ambaſſade duke lancaſtre wrote companyons garyſon lourde ſholde make warre agaynſt barcellona archebyſſhoppe burdeaus pryſon iohn̄ byerne capytayne ſeneſſhall bygore pier dauchyn ernalton reſten ernalton ſaynt colombe garyſon lourde gretely reioyſed herde tydynges began rynne royalme aragon porte barcelona ſo merchaunt durſt go abrode ¶alſo aragon another myſchefe yonge kynge iohn̄ aragon wolde haue ben crowned kynge aragon good townes wolde conſente therto without ſware fyrſt ſolemply ſholde neuer demaunde tayle taxe inpoſycyon ye countrey dyuers thynges ſholde ſwere put wrytynge ſealed yf wolde crowned kynge whiche thynge ſemed hym counſayle ryght preiudycyall wherfore thretened make warre ſpecyally cyte barcelona kynge ſayd ryche prowde ſame ſeaſon langue docke fronters auuergue rouergue warde pezanas ye cyte duzes maner men armes called ye rowtes dayly multyplyed euyll iiii men armes capytaynes demaunded warre agaynſt euery man cared agaynſt theyr name peter mount fawcon geffray chaſtelyer hamgue de forge goulent foure hundreth men vnder ryfled pylled countrey conuerſaunt enfourmed ye archebyſſhop burdeaus pryſon aragon duke lancaſtre contente aragonoys alſo kynge aragon euyll pleaſed good townes royalme countrey theſe tydynges gretely reioyſed ſuche people rather pleaſed euyll dedes good toke counſayle bytwene determyned approche aragon gete ſome forterers thoſe fronters thynkynge duke aragon elles ſome ye good townes wolde entreate theyr profyte rode coſtynge countrey ſet theyr myndes gete yf myght caſtell dulcen beynge ye archbyſſhopryche narbone bytwene royalme aragon fraunce departynge bothe royalmes came thyder ſuche poynte nyght founde ſymply watched kepte dyd ſoo moche yt wan lordes thereof wherby al countrey afrayde ſpecyally parpygnen iiii legges then alſo lourde gate ye ſame weke caſtell aragon iiii legges fro barcelona called olde caſtell rolbays perteynynge counteſſe caſtell boze coſyn germayne erle foys lady gretely abaſſhed caſtell ſo taken ſhe ſente coſyn erle foys deſynge hym goddes ſake rendre agayne ſayd caſtell whiche coūtrey berne taken fro ye erle ſent yt ſhe ſholde afrayde ony thynge certefyenge yt taken alonely make war agaynſt thē bercelona helde pryſon ſmal cauſe ye byſſhop burdeaus ſayenge howe ſhe ſholde haue ryght well agayne without ony domage ye lady well peaſed anſwere dyſſymuled matter went lay another caſtell nere roqueberton caſtell rolbays dulcen lourde made ſore warre fronters aragon ſay trouth kynge dyſſymuled ye matter chaſtyſe therby ye good townes yt agaynſt hȳ ſo ye good townes ſore dyſpleaſed kynge barcelona perpygnen townes coulde exercyſe theyr merchaūdyſe taken raunſomed barcelona aduyſed delyuer archebyſſhop burdeaus pryſon delyeraunce ſpeke kynge reaſon ſoo pryuely meane treated kynges broder ſyr martyne duke blaſemont gretly ye grace ye people deſyrynge hym meane kynge broder yt myght pea wt lourde rolbays promyſed beſt kepe fauoure dyd ſo moche kynge broder archebyſſhop burdeaus delyuered pryſon ſente burdeloys alone erle foys dyd ſo moche vycounteſſe recouered agayne caſtel ſuche helde departed ſeruyce dyd erle foys yere duke lancaſtre kynge aragon ſawe counteſſe caſtell boze ſoo ſoone agayne recouered caſtell ſent ſhe came hym kynge layde charge howe ſhe ſuffered ye englyſſh men entre caſtell make warre royalme ſaynge ſhe done hym grete treſpace lady truely excuſed ſayd ſyr god knoweth fayth owe day houre tydynges came ye takynge caſtell lourde neuer treaty wt englyſſh mē ſyr incōtynent ſent coſyn ye erle foys prayng hȳ goddes ſake gete agayne caſtell ſeynge yt gotten countrey byerne yſſued lourde erle ſente bad doubte ſayenge takyng make warre agaynſt barcelona wel ſayd ye kynge proue wordes coſyn erle foys ye ſhall enioy peaſybly ſtyll caſtell wt good wyl ſyr ſayd ye lady ſhe ſent coſyn erle foys ortays byerne prayng hym apeaſe matter ye kynge aragon erle ſent letter ye kynge knyght called ſyr cycarte saurelyn deſyrynge kynge ſuffre coſyn vycountes pea lyue reſt vnder hym elles ſurely wolde dyſpleaſe hym ye kynge aragon toke excuſacyons gre made grete chere erles knyght ſayd howe counteſſe wel doneſyth coſyn erle foys dyd ſo largely excuſe thus lady lyued pea merchauntes barcelona ye fronters aboute reſt lourde often tymes taken pylled without agreed pateſed ſo dyuers caſtellon aragon lyke wyſe ſo dyd ye garyſon dulcen dyd worſe dyd egre ouer ran ye countrey aragon lourde dyd bycauſe poore cared toke well offycers kynges ſquyers merchauntes ſoo kynges counſayle toke aduyſe bycauſe good townes murmured ſayd howe kynge dyſtroyed ought ſuſteyne yonge kynge aragon vnderſtode yt men murmured ſpake hym otherwyſe ſholde bycauſe garyſon dulcen therwith ſore dyſpleaſed bycauſe newly fallen faders herytage ſo well byloued royalme people ſpake coſyn grete baron aragon ſyr raymon baghes ſayd ſyr raymon deſyre ryde dulcen demaunde thyng deſyre royalme trete ſo may departe thēs outher fayrnes otherwyſe knyght departed ſente dulcen heraulde hym ſhewynge howe wolde trete mountfawcon le goulus capytaynes vnderſtode ſyr raymon baghes wolde trete thought leeſt gete ſome money ſayd heraulde ſyr ſaye mayſter fro v maye come v ſurely wyll hurte hym heraulde retourned ſyr raymon vpon wordes departed fro paregant came dulcen demaūded taryed ye fronters aragon anſwered ſayd abyde army fraunce yt ſholde go caſtel go cōpany ſyrs ſayd ſyr raymon yf ye tary therfore ye ſhall abyde grete ſeaſon kynge aragon wyll retayne ſo longe yet countrey ſuffre ſo longe well ſyr ſayd wyll enterteyne v ſo longe withall yet muſt lyue yf countrey wyll garyſon wyll departe elles well ſayd ſyr raymon wyll ye deſyre departe anſwered lxm frankes iiii capytanes eche v xv frankes name god ſayd ſyr raymon money ynoughe wyll ſpeke kynge ſo departed ſayd better comon profyte ye countrey kynge payde money take greter domage ſayd appeaſe howbeit thought contrary thus departed fro gaue vnderſtandynge ſholde haue moche deſyred rode kynge perpyghnen ſhewed hym theſe pyllers deſyred well ſayd ye kynge behoueable ye countrey delyuered payde theues brybours ſholde payde yf may gete ſhall hanged payment gete none dyffyculte gete theyr garyſon ſyr ſayd ſyr raymon yt ſhall done ryght well let alone well ſayd kynge doo ye thynke beſt wyll medle therin wolde delyuered countrey day ſyr raymon gathered company togyder men armes v hundred ſperes ſecretly made ſquyer gaſcoyne capytayne valyaunt man armes called nandon seghen layde buſſhment within lytell myle dulcen ſayd ſyrs garyſon yſſue ſo may taken ſlayne countrey maye clene ryd ſyr raymon ſente dulcen ſholde lepe theyr horſes yſſue rynne ye towne perpyghnen put vyllaynes therof fere elles wolde obey gyue nothynge dulcen ryght ioyfull theſe tydynges thynkynge ben trouth ſo armed ſame day buſſhment layde ſo departed fro garyſon rode towarde perpyghnen ſo came barryers made theyr muſters theyr retournynge thynknge haue paſſed ſurely pea myddes way ſodaynly encountred nandon seghnen company nombre vc ſperes ſo daſſhed amonge ſaw wel howe dyſceyued trapped drewe togyder fought longe myght endure whiche longe many euyll armed ſo ſhortely dyſcomfyted ſlyne geffray chaſtelyer hauge deſorge guyot moreſque iohn̄ de guenlant many taken peter mountfawcon amlardan ſaynt iuſt xl brought pryſoners perpyghnen paſſed thrughe ſtretes ye towne yſſued theyr houſes halowed thoughe ben wolues ſo ſet pryſones ſame ſeaſon duke berre come carcaſſone ye fronters aragon came fro auygnyon fro pope herde howe dulcen ſlayne taken wrote kynge aragon coſyne yoſant bare deſyrynge ſende peter mountfawcon company incontynent delyuered ſente duke berre grace yt duke dyd elles dyed ¶howe batayle armes done burdeaus lene ſhall dyuers ca lxii ſame ſeaſon burdeaus feate armes done ſeneſhall ſyr iohn̄ harpedon bytwene lorde rochfoucaulte frenſſhmā ſone captall buze 〈◊〉 ſyr wyllyam mountferant englyſſhman rynne iii courſes iii ſperes iii ſtrokes ſworde iii dagger iii axe dede armes done ye lordes ladyes ye countrey beynge burdeaus erle foys ſente thyder knyghtes houſe ſerue counſayle ye lorde rochfoucaulte ſone coſyn germayne alſo ſent hym good ho •• harneys ſpere heedes daggers▪ wordes • e howbeit ryght wel purueyed day theſe ii knyghtes armed wel accompanyed grete cheualry eyther partye lorde rochfoncaulte company cc knyghtes ſquyers lyg • age ſyr wyllyam mountferant many mo hym lorde rohen lorde 〈…〉 lorde dura lorde curton 〈…〉 languras lorde de la barde lorde mountcroy pyergourt 〈◊〉 lyguage ¶bycauſe feate 〈◊〉 ſholde done bytwene ſuche ii noble 〈…〉 knyghtes many came thyder 〈◊〉 farre nere theſe two knyghtes mountedon theyr horſes wt theyr 〈◊〉 targes redy apparelled theyr ſperes 〈◊〉 ranne togyder fyerſly 〈…〉 eche theyr helmes ye 〈…〉 theyr helmes ſtryken theyr heedes felde ſo paſſed forth theyr courſe bare heeded excepte theyr coyues thē lordes ladyes ſayd euery man howe hadde nobly encountred theyr fyrſt metynge theyr helmes newe ſet faſtened ſo ranne valyauntly theyr ii courſe alſo iii breuely al theyr feates nobly accomplyſſhed grete pleaſure lordes ladyes regarders euery man ſayd howe eche hadde valyauntly acheued theyr feates ſeneſhall burdeaus ſyr iohn̄ harpedon gaue ſame daye ſupper al lordes ladyes yt preſente nexte daye euery man wente theyr owne herytages lorde rochfoncaulte prepayred hymſelfe go caſtell kynge iohn̄ ſente hym ſeaſon drewe nere ſyr wyllyam mountferant ordeyned go portyn gale kynge alſo ſent hym ſuche noble hyſtory whiche ſyr iohn̄ froyſart haue purſued hytherto god hath ſent grace lyue ſo longe ſe ſo many thynges haue done noo reaſon ſholde forgete ony thynge haue knowen done bycauſe ye warres brytayne ii ſones charles bloys longe ſeaſon called hymſelfe duke bretayne maryage ye lady iahan bretayne ought haue ben ryghtful enherytour bretayne hath ben ſhewed hyſtory whoſe ſones englande hoſtage theyr fader yet haue made mencyon became came pryſon daunger kynge englande wherin theyr fader ye lorde charles bloys lefte ye knowe wel hath ben wryten howe kynge edwarde englande make warre fraū ce fayrer ſtronger alyed hymſelfe wt erle montforde alwayes dyd counſayle ayde hym power dyd ſoo moche erle monforde came entente duke bretayne otherwyſe coulde neuer haue come therto bretayne ye lorde charles bloys vii euer v party hath ben ſhewed howe yere lorde mccc xlvii grete batayle bretayne ree doryent counteſſe mountfordes party ſyr iohn̄ harcell dyſcomfyted ſyr charles bloys taken pryſoner led englande good chere quene englande ye good quene phylyp who ſeruaunt myne yongth ſhe ryghtfull gouernacyon coſyn germayne ye lorde charles bloys ſhe dyd put payne delyuerauce howbeit counſayle englande wolde ſholde delyuered duke henry lancaſtre ſayd lordes englande yf pryſon hym myght made many grete recoueraunces royalme fraunce kynge phylyp frenſſhe kyng vncles affyrmed longe kepte pryſon theyr warre fraunce ſholde ye eaſyer howbeit thoſe wordes ſhewed kynge good meanes noble good quene ſet fynaunce paye ccm noble whiche grete ſome payde lordes lyued another maner thē nowe nowe men may pay theyr predeceſſours myght haue done nowe tayle theyr people theyr pleaſure lyued theyr rente reuenues nowe duchy bretayne wtin yere two able pay helpe theyr lorde iim noble lorde charles bloys layde kynge englande ii ſones pledge ye ſayd ſome afterwarde lorde charles bloys ſo moche purſuyng warre duchy bretayne pay ſouldyours kepe eſtate alwayes hopynge come good ende warre ſo yt able quyte ſones englande ye holy man purſuynge herytage dyed ſaynt batayle bretayne aulroy ayde englyſſhe men agaynſt hym deed yet warre ended kynge charles fraunce lyfe doubted gretly fortune warres ſawe erle mountforde englyſſhe men ſeaſed ſtyll wente forwarde wanne townes fortreſſes bretayne fered yt yf ye erle mountforde myght come entente duchy bretayne wolde holde homage hym promyſed alleageaunce kynge englande ayded alwaye hadde done maynteyne warre treted wt erle mountforde counſayle hath ben ſhewed wherfore wyll ſpeke therof ye erle moūtforde abode duke bretayne ſholde homage holde ſoueraynte crowne fraunce ſame trety ye duke ſholde ayde helpe gete delyuered pryſon englande ii coſyns ſones lorde charles bloys whiche artycle neuer dyd accomplyſſhe alwayes doubted yf retourned wolde put hym ſome buſynes ye duchy bretayne fered leſt bretayne wolde receyue theyr lordes enclyned thē hym wherfore wolde ſpeke theyr delyueraunce thus theſe ii chyldren abode ſo longe englande pryſon ſomtyme ye kepynge lorde roger beawchamp lady sybyll wyfe ſomtyme ſyr thomas dambrychcourte tyme yonger guy bretayne dyed iohn̄ bretayne abode ſtyll pryſon alone often tymes ſad beynge pryſon coulde amēde often tymes remembred loſſe yonge dayes mooſt noble generacyon worlde lykely leſe wolde often tymes wepe wyſſhed hymſelfe rather deed lyue xxxv yeres theraboute ben daunger enemyes englande coulde ſe noo maner meanes delyueraunce frendes kynne drewe fro hym ſome laye ſo grete wyſt ſholde payde without god helped hym duke anioy puyſſaunce proſperyte wedded ſyſter germayne ii fayre ſones loys charles dyd nothynge hym ſhall ſhew howe iohn̄ bretayne delyuered ¶howe iohn̄ bretayne ſone ſyr charles bloys delyuered pryſon meanes olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce ca lxxii hathe ben ſhewed hyſtory erle buckynghā made voyage thrughe royalme fraunce came bretayne duke bretayne deſyred hym ſo doo bycauſe parte countrey wolde vnder obeyſaunce erle buckyngham company lay al y• wynter begynnyng ſomer 〈◊〉 grete pouerte nantes wennes tyll maye retourned englande erle thomas buckyngham company laye wennes lodgynges without dyuers ſkyrmyſſhes bytwene englyſſhment frenſſhmen thyder came olyuer clyūon conſtabable fraunce ſe warre yt made ſpeke ye englyſſhe knyghtes knewe well yongth brought vp amonge thē englande ſoo made good company wt diuers maners noble men armes wyll eche frenſſhmen englyſſhmē haue alwayes done good cauſe ſo entended purpoſe whiche touched hym ryght nere wolde dyſcouer entente noo man lyuynge alonely ſquyer alwayes ſerued ye lorde charles bloys yf conſtable dyſcouered entente ouy man ben hope haue ſped brought aboute purpoſe whiche grace god atteyned vnto conſtable coulde wyſe loue ye duke bretayne hym longe tyme ſhewed ſawe iohn̄ bretayne pryſon englande therof grete pyte whē ſawe duke bretayne poſſeſſyon herytage bretayne thought mooſt loue ye duke ſayd ſyr ye put payne coſyn iohn̄ bretayne kyng englandes pryſon ſyr ye bounde therto othe promyſe ſyr countrey bretayne treaty ye prelate noble men good townes cyte nantes archebyſſhop reynes ſyr iohn̄ craon ſyr boncequalte marſhall fraunce • reted wt pea compercorentync ye ſware yt ye ſholde full puyſſaunce delyuer coſynes pryſon ſyr ye haue done nothynge matter wherfore ſure countrey bretayne loueth leſſe oweth ſmaller fauoure ye duke demaū de dyſſymuled ſayd holde pea ſyr olyuer ſhalde gete iii iiiim frankes demaunded theyr raunſomes syr ſayd conſtable yf countrey bretayne ſawe wel wyllynge matter wolde contente pay taxe • fowage delyuer pryſon er lyke dye priſon without god helpe ſyolyuer ſayd ye duke countrey bretayne ſhall taxed coſynes haue grete prynces theyr lygnage ye frenſſh kynge duke anioy may helpe delyuer haue alwayes ſuſteyned warre agaynſt ſware ayde theyr delyueraunce myne entencyon none otherwyſe ye frenſſhe kynge theyr kynſmen ſholde pay theyr raunſomes conſtable coulde gete ye duke none anſwere thus haue begon ſhewe conſtable ſawe clerely howe ye erle bu • kyngham baron knyghtes englande ſuche hadde ben hym voyage thrughe fraunce ſo bretayne nothynge contente duke bretayne bycauſe wolde open townes lyke promyſed departed englande whyles englyſſhmen lay wennes ſubbarbes nanibont endured grete pouerte hadde nothynge ete theyr horſes dyed fawte foode englyſſhmen fayne gather thyſtelles feldes braye morter tempre water make ther paaſt ſo bake ete ſuche pouerte endured ſayd amonge themſelfe duke doth acquyte hymſelfe nobly agaynſt v ſyth haue put hȳ poſſeſſyon ye ſygnory bretayne yf ſholde well ſholde take fro hym agayne gete pryſon iohn̄ bretayne aduerſary make hym duke countrey loueth hym better duke better reuenged hym ſoner cauſe hym leſe duchy bretayne conſtable fraunce knewe ryght well wordes ſore murmuracyons englyſſhmen amonge themſelfe agaynſt duke bretayne wherwith nothynge dyſpleaſed euery euyll worde ſpake wolde ben xii howbeit made therof ſemblaunt dyd ſquyer bretayne whome broken mynde go englande meſſage ſquyer called rollant ſo ſyr iohn̄ harleton capytayne chyerbourge conſtable caſtel ioſſelyn vnder ſaufconduyte conſtable made hym good chere company kepte englyſſhmen good company coulde rather therby gete theyr good wylles ye conſtable ſquyer auaunced forth ſpake ſyr iohn̄ harleton conſtable ſayd ſyr iohn̄ ye ſholde grete pleaſure one thynge whiche ſhall coſt nothynge ſyr ſayd y• knyght loue conſtable though coſt contente ſholde ſyr ſayd ſquyer yt myght aſſured go englande ſemyne olde mayſter iohn̄ bretayne gretteſt deſyre haue worlde ſe hym fayth ſayd ſyr iohn̄ harlton ſhal let ye ſhal go ſoone retourned chyerbourge wyll go englande ye ſhal go ſhal bryng thyder requeſt refuſed ſyr ſayd ſquyer thanke repute grete curtoyſy thus ſquyer wente ſyr iohn̄ harlton chyerbourg made euery thyng redy departed entred ſee iohn̄ rollant company ſo came london brought ſquyer ye caſtell iohn̄ bretayne knewe hym fyrſt metynge ye laſt called hym remembraunce ſo ſpake togyder ſhewed iohn̄ bretayne howe conſtable fraunce dyd wolde payne delyueraunce howe yt ſayd iohn̄ bretayne ſyr ſayd y• ſquyer ſhall ſhewe lorde conſtable hath doughter mary ſo yf ye wyll ſwere promyſe ye retourned bretayne take wyfe wyll delyuer englande hath founde well meanes ſyr howe ſay wyll ye thus ye truely ſayd ye ſhall retourne conſtable ſay name howe nothynge may doo delyuered wyll doughter gladly wyll take wyfe thus ſquyer iohn̄ bretayne departed paſſed englande retourned bretayne recorded conſtable yt ſene harde cōſtable deſyred aduauncement doughter maried ſo highly iohn̄ bretayne neglygent buſynes ſtudyed meane englande brynge aboute purpoſe without founde meanes dyd ſholde neuer haue come purpoſe whiche gete ye erle oxenforde parte moſt pryuy ye kynge englande matter ſhortly brought paſſe longe ye duke lancaſtre englande iourney ſpayne dyſcouerynge kynge tretye delyueraunce iohn̄ bretayne ye erle buckyngham retourned bretayne renome ran thrughe al royalme ye duke bretayne falſely acquyted hym ſelfe englyſſhmen wherfore ſpoken ye euyll coulde deuyſed iohn̄ bretayne brought kynges preſence vncles ſayd hym iohn̄ bretayne yf ye wyll releue holde duchy bretayne kynge englande ye ſhall delyuered pryſon ſet poſſeſſyon ſygnory bretayne ſhall ryght hyghly maryed countrey ye ought ye duke lancaſtre wo • de haue gyuen hym doughter phylyp maryage quene portyngale iohn̄ bretayne anſwered yt wolde neuer agree tretye neuer wolde enemye contrary crowne fraunce ſayd contente take duke lā caſtres doughter maryage ſoo myght delyuered pryſon englande whē ſawe wolde none otherwyſe ſet agayne pryſon erle oxenforde called duke irelande ſawe duke lancaſtre gone englande caſtell tretye maryage doughter iohn bretayne paſſed ye duke lancaſtre doughter hym caſtell thought ratrete ye kyng englande gyue hym rewarde ſuche ſeruyce done entended iohn̄ brtayne yf coulde gete hym kyng agreed conſtable fraunce haue raunſome two paymentes vi ſcore frā kes ye fyrſt lxm payde ſone iohn̄ bretayne ſent delyuered ye towne boloyne ye lx payde parys wherſoeuer wolde haue delyuered ye duke irelande coueted theſe floreyns dyd ſo moche kynge englande yt kynge gaue hym iohn̄ bretayne clerely wherof many englande grete meruayle lyſt ſpeke wolde ſpeke none thynge duke irelande cauſed hym delyuered boloyne conſtable made redy euery thynge hym dnd ſo rode parys founde kynge lordes lygnage made hym good chere conſtable alſo brought hym bretayne iohan bretayne wedded doughter promyſed ye duke bretayne knewe iohn̄ bretayne retourned fraunce clene delyuered englande ayde purchaſe conſtable fraunce ye cōſtable double hatred ſayd weneth ſyr olyuer cleſſon put myne herytage ſheweth wel token therof hath delyuered pryſon iohn̄ bretayne hath gyuen hym doughter marriage whiche thynges ryght dyſpleaſaunt ſurely ſhall well ſhewe one daye howe hath wel done peraduenture whē taketh leeſt hede therof ſayd truely ſhewed quyckely ye yere paſſed ye ſhall ſtory fyrſt wyll ſpeke buſynes caſtell portyngale armye ſee yt englyſſhmen made come sluſe ye haue herde ye frenſſhe kynges armye ſee haue gone englande broken vp ſame ſeaſon ye frenſſhe kynges good wyll alway ſhewed good courage haue paſſed englande ſawe howe ye iourney brake dyſpleaſed ony fawte layde vpon duke berre howbeit thought yt ſaw depelyer matter ony counſayllynge leue iourney honoure profyte royalme fraunce▪ ſoo euer enterpryſed doo thynge ought regarde ende may come therof duke berre ben ſo longe englande hoſtage ye kyng fader ben ſo cōuerſaunt among ye englyſſh men ſene ſo moche ye countrey knewe reaſon effecte goynge englande ſholde haue come ye cauſe mooſt exſcuſable go bycauſe wynter ſo farre ronne ſayd yt conſtable fraunce nexte ſomer ſholde goo englande vi men armes many croſſe bowes thought hymſelfe ſayd howe nombre ſufficy fyght englyſſhe men reaſon conſtable ought haue knowen ben nouryſſhed yonge dayes whē theſe lordes retourned fraunce thē determyned ſende ſocours caſtell ayde kynge agaynſt kynge portyngale duke lancaſtre thought ſhortely ſholde ſome dedes armes englyſſhmen kepte felde conſydered yt coulde ſende noo men warre thyder without grete coſt charge iourney ferre lytell money kynges treaſoury treaſourers handes ſome money ben gadered people royalme ſpente waſted wherfore ſtudyed howe gete ſoo newe tayle taxe deuyſed ryn thrughout royalme fraunce payde incontynent without delay noyſynge howe comfortynge ye kynge spayne dryue englyſſhmen royalme tayle publyſſhed euery place kynges commyſſyoners ſente euery good towne cyte ſayd gouernours townes syrs thus moche towne taxed whiche ye muſt pay incontynent ruler ſayd ſyrs ſhall gather ſome ſende parys nay ſyrs ſo ſayd commyſſaryes wyl abyde ſo longe wyll otherwyſe ſo commaunded kynges name x xii beſt towne goo pryſon without payde ſome without ony longer delay honeſt men fered pryſon kynges dyſpleaſure wherfore drewe togyder payde money incontynente recouered agayne poore mē thus dyd euery good towne ſo ſo many tayles tax one ther fyrſt ſcante payde another began thus ſeaſon noble royal fraunce gouerned ye poore people ouer ledde many auoyded theyr townes forſoke theyr herytages houſes fayne ſell ſome wente dwell haynalte byſſhopryche lyege ranne taxe tayllage ¶howe duke borbon choſen goo caſtell dyuers howe ſyr iohan bucke admyral flaunders taken pryſoner englyſſhe men ca lxxii yt deuyſed capytaynes ſholde go spayne fyrſt apoynted ye gentyll duke borbone yt ſholde ſouerayne capytayne aboue departed apoynted ii capytaynes ye vowarde duke borbon rerewarde iim ſperes knyghtes ſquyers theſe ii capytaynes yt ſholde ye vowarde ſyr wellyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer hf paſſac theſe ii lordes knewe yt ſholde capytaynes certayne men armes go caſtel prepayred thē ſelfe yt iourney knyghtes ſquyers ſente aboute royalme fraunce go caſtell paſſages opened well nauare aragon thenne knyghtes ſquyers departed fro bretayne poycton aniowe mayne torayne bloys orleaunce beauſe pycardy borgoyne berre awuergne fro boundes royal fraunce euery man toke theyr way go caſtell formeſt company ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac leders exalte theyr honoure departed good araye theyr companyes good ordre thus whyles theſe knyghtes ſquyers royalme fraunce prepayred thē goo caſtell ſuche fyrſt redy fyrſt departed ſpecyally yt farre countreys many yt deſyred dedes armes ſame ſeaſon englyſſhmen ye ſee bytwene englande flaunders wherof rycharde erle arundell admyral cōpany ye erle deuonſhyre ye erle notynghā byſſhop norwyche vc men armes archer lyen ancre grete ſeaſon abydyng ſome aduēture often tymes refreſſhed thē ye coſt englande aboute ye yles cornewall bretayne normādy ſore dyſpleaſed yt flete flaunders ſcaped fro thē gone rochell ſpecyally yt cōſtable fraunce gone fro lentrygner ſluſe paſſed calays met wt hym gladly wolde haue fought wt hym yet ye conſtable many ſhyppes paſſed thē reaſon ye wynde fludde yt ye nyght tyme ye englyſſhe nauy lay ancre mergate ye tames mouthe towarde sandwyche abydynge theyr aduenture ſpecyally abydyng ye ſhyppes yt gone rochell thought wolde ſhortly retourne ſo dyd ye merchauntes flaunders rochel haynalte place doubte ye englyſſhmen conioyned togyder departed flauders ꝓmyſed eche go retourne togyder take eche others parte done theyr buſynes rochel ye coūtrey xainton charged theyr ſhyppes wt wynes ſoone good wynde dyſancred departed ye hauen rochell toke theyr way ye ſee goo flaunders sluſe fro whens departed ſayled ſo longe yt paſſed ye raſe ſaynt mathewe bretayne without peryll domage ſo coſted baſe bretayne thē mandy ſo came ryght ouer ye tames mouth ye englyſſhe nauy lay flemynges perceyued laye hyghe ſhyppes ſayd theyr cōpany ſyrs aduyſe wel ſhall met ye englyſſhe armye haue perceyued v wyl take ye aduaū tage ye wynde tyde ſhal haue batayle nyght yt tydynges pleaſed well al partyes ſpecyally ye merchauntes flaūders haynalte countreys theyr merchaūdyſe abrode wolde gladly haue ben then yf myght howbeit ſyth ſawe remedy fyght ordred thē ſelfe therto croſſe bowes mē harneyſed defenſably arayed mo thē viic amonge thē valyaunt knyght flaunders theyr capytayne admyrall ſee ſet duke borbone called ſyr iohn̄ bucke ryght ſage hardy armes done grete domage ſee englyghmen ſyr iohn̄ bucke ſet euery thyng good ordre decked ſhyppes wel wyſely yt coulde ryght wel ſayd ſyrs abaſſhed mē ynowe fyght wt ye englyſſhe army ye wynde wyl ſerue v yt euer fyghtyng ſhal aproche nerer nerer sluſe ſhall cooſt flaundres ſome toke good cōforte wt thoſe wordes ſome ſo put thēſelfe good ordre defence made redy theyr croſſe bowes gonues englyſſhe ſhyppes aproched certayne galays fournyſſhed wt archer came formeſt rowynge wt owers gaue fyrſt aſſaulte archer ſhotte fyerſly loſt moche theyr ſhotte flemynges couered vnder ye deckes wold apere draue euer forth wynde whē ye englyſſhe archer ſhot dyd let fly theyr quarelles wher hurted many approched ye grete ſhyppes englande erle arundel wt company byſſhop norwyche ſo lordes ruſſhed amonge flemynges ſhyppes rochell yet flemynges croſſe bowes defended thē ſelfe ryght valyaūtly theyr patron ſyr iohn̄ bucke dyd euer comforte thē gret ſtrong ſhyp wherin iii gonne ſhotynſo grete ſtones ſoeuer lyghted dyd grete domage euer fought drewe lytell lytell towarde flaunders ſome lytell ſhyppes theyr merchauntes toke cooſtes flaunders lowe water therby ſaued ye grete ſhyppes coulde folow lacke water thus ye ſe harde batayle ſhyppes broken ſunken bothe partyes toppes caſt downe grete barres yron wente botom harde batayle well fought endured iii iiii houres day fayled withdrewe eche fro caſt ancre reſted nyght dreſſed theyr hurte men ye fludde came dyſancred drewe vp ſayles retourned agayne batayle wt englyſſhmen peter du boy gaunt certayne archer maryners made flemynges moche ben maryner wherfore knewe arte ſee fore dyſpleaſed yt flemynges merchauntes endured ſo longe alwayes ye englyſſhmen wanne aduauntage ye flemynges ſo came bytwene blanqueberg sluſe agaynſt gagant ye dyſcomfyture ſocoured creature alſo yt tyme noo ſhyppes sluſe men warre true ſquyer man armes sluſe called arnolde mayre harde howe batayle ſee bytwene armye englande flaunders toke barke owne entred therin hym certayne men sluſe twenty croſſe bowes rowed force tyll came batayle yt poynte dyſcomfyture tyme englyſſhmen ſeaſed mooſt parte flemyſſhe ſhyppes taken ſyr iohn̄ bucke theyr capytayne ſhyp within arnolde mayre ſawe ye maner batayle made croſſe bowes ſhote iii tymes retourned chaſed hauen sluſe englyſſhmennes ſhyppes ſo grete coulde approche ſo nere ye lande barke dyd therby ſaued hymſelfe company men towne sluſe ſore abaſſhed harde thoſe tydynges ſo wyſt gyue vp theyr towne forſake elles entre ſhyppes laye ſo defende hauen ſurely yf englyſſhmen knowen caſe ben lordes towne caſtel yf byleued peter du boy ſore counſayled ſholde incontynent haue ſet towne sluſe wonne yf ſoo done englyſſhmen courage therto ſayd grete foly v entre ye towne sluſe bruges dan ardenbourge ſhall come beſyege v ſo peraduenture ſhall leſe al haue wonne better v kepe make wyſe warre folyſſhly leſe thus englyſſhmen kepte ſtyll ſee determyned brenne nauye ſhyppes yt lay ancre hauen sluſe ſuche ſhyppes hadde wonne toke parte thē ſuche moſt olde drye lyghteſt greſed wel bothe within without ſet fyer ſo lete go wynde ye tyde hauen ye entente ſholde haue faſtened ſet fyer ſhyppes yt lay spayne place howbeit god wolde fyer dyd noo hurte domage none ſhyp ¶howe englyſſhmen aryued brente dyuers vyllages ca lxxiii englyſſhmen dyſcomfyted ſyr iohn̄ bucke came fro rochell wherby grete profyte ſpecyally wyne ix tonne wyne wherby wyne derer yere flaunders holande brabande better chepe englande reaſon ſuche aduentures worlde one haue domage another hathe profyte thus ſtyll ye englyſſhe men lay sluſe • r • ſomtyme theyr barkes barge ſet lande ſyde agaynſt sluſe ryuer paſſe brente mynſtre townes alonge ſee ſyde dygnes called torne hoque murdequer toke men pryſoners countrey lyenge x dayes layde byſſhmentes bytwene dan sluſe way coceler taken iohn̄ lannay man armes tourney come thyder lorde eſtrynay ſyr blanquart calomne came theues ye ſpurres fro tourney xl ſperes alſo ſyr robert merchaunt knyght flaunders wyfe baſtarde doughter erle flaunders bruges tydynges ſpred abrode englyſſhmen ſo departed came sluſe entred ye caſtell whiche founde ſmall defence yf englyſſhmen taken lande sluſe dyd ſyde water taken theyr eaſe caſtell towne ſuche ſholde haue defended towne ſo abaſſhed yt man toke ony hede defence knyght gaue harte ſayd ayeſyrs good men sluſe howe maynteyne yourſelfe yt ye ſhewe yourſelfe dyſcomfyted without ony ſtroke ſtrykynge men valure good defence ought ſo ſholde ſhewe forth good vyſage longe coulde endure leeſt tyll ſlayne taken therby ſholde attayne grace god prayſe worlde thus ſayd ſyr robert came sluſe ye meane ſeaſon whyle ye englyſſhmen sluſe theraboute al ye coū trey bruges afrayde euery day abrode foragynge foote horſes ſomtyme wolde entre far countrey day brente ye towne coceſy downes grete vyllage way towarde ardenbourge ſo ſee ſyde called hoſebourcke dyd lyſt myght haue done yf knowen caſe countrey whē taryed theyr pleaſure ſawe man came agaynſt toke theyr ſhyppes drewe vp ſayles ſo retourned englande ccm frankes profyte ſo came tames ſtreyght london receyued wt grete ioy good wynes poycton xamton determyned haue ben dronken flaunders haynalte brabant dyuers place pycardy englyſſhmen brought englande lorde departed london place englande wyne ſolde iiii pen galon certayne merchauntes zerecyell zelande loſt parte ſame wyne reſtytucyon agayne theyr loſſes zercyell wolde neuer agree go make warre englande wolde ſuffre none theyr ſhyppes goo ye iourney wherby atteyned grete loue englyſſhmen ſyr iohn̄ bucke put pryſon curioyſly london myght go lyſt euery nyght lodge ye cyte coulde neuer
