come raunſome yet duke borgoyne wolde gladly haue hym exchaunge baſtarde broder ye kynge portyngalles breuelet taken ſee comynge meldeboure thus ſyr iohn̄ bucke pryſoner thre yeres englande dyed ¶howe duke lancaſtres marſhal toke towne ribadane whiche ſtrongly kepte ca lxxiiii howe yt y tyme retourne buſynes caſtell portyngale ſpeke duke lancaſtre beynge galyce ſuche buſynes fall yt ſeaſō whiche ſmal alſo ſhewe ayde comforte ye frenſſhe kynge ſent yt tyme caſtell elles kynge iohn̄ spaynes buſynes eaſely gone forwarde ſay ſurely y• ſame yere yt duke aryued countrey loſt lā de ye ayde frenſſhe kyng ben ye know wel yt tydynges ſpredeth euer farre kynge portyngale knewe ſoone ye duke lancaſtre ony mā ye frenſſh kynges army yt lay ye ſee haue gone euglande brake theyr iourney kyng portyngale lay thē ye cyte porte ſtrō ge towne haue wel vſed reaſon merchaūtes yt reſorted thyder knew ye brekynge ye frenſſhe kynges army glad therof benſhewed hym englande lykely haue ben loſt wherfore ſom dyſſymuled duke lancaſtre dryuynge takyng doughter maryage ſtyll draue hym fayre wordes ſalutacyons iuſtly enfourmed departynge ye frenſſhe kynge fro sluſe called counſayle ſayd ſyr ye knowe well howe ye duke lancaſtre galyce duches coſyne hym vnknowen howe counſayle togyder howe agreed ſholde haue doughter maryage ſo wyll perceyuer ye ſame eſtate wyll demaunde honourably reaſon apertenent ſuche prynce duke lancaſtre kynge portyngale wyll make lady quene portyngale ſyr ſayd counſayle ye doo accordynge reaſon ye haue ſo ſworne promyſed well ſayd kynge let v ſende duke appoynted archebyſſhop braſchez ſyr iohn̄ radyghen sar go ambaſſade ſente kynge ſo toke voyage cc ſperes ¶nowe let v ſpeke ye ſyege ſyr thomas moreaus marſhall duke lancaſtres coſt layde towne rybadane ſhewe became theron byleue rybadane thought haue ben comforted kynge iohn caſtell knyghtes fraunce lay ye towne valcolyue elles wolde neuer haue endured ſoo longe haue meruayle howe ſuche ſorte vyllaynes coulde endure agaynſt ſuche ſloure archer men armes abaſſhed euery day aſſaulte ſayd ſyr thomas moreaus maner counſayle mooſt valyaunt knyghtes company ſyr leue towne euyl fyer may b • enne let v go countrey maynes noye beſances alwayes may retourne agayne lyſt fayth ſayd ſyr thomas ſhall neuer ſayd vyllaynes haue dyſcomfyted v wyll departe hen thoughe ſholde tary ii monethes without y• duke ſende thus marſhalles mynde oppynyon kepe ſtyll ſyege kynge caſtell laye valeolyue ſente ſpecyally ayde fraunce harde dayly howe rybadane defended themſelfe valyauntly wolde yelde name god ſayd barroys barrers gretely dyſpeaſeth yt ſent thyder frenſſh men wolde gretely haue recomforted men towne alſo contente ſyege leeſt ſholde haue honoure theſe vyllaynes haue nowe ſurely yf knowen trouthe ſtrength towne wolde haue refreſſhed haue put myſelfe aduenture therin well god ſholde haue ſente grace haue defended towne theſe vyllaynes thus deuyſed kynges preſence frenſſhe knyghtes deſyred dedes armes ſayd kynge ſyr ſende c ſperes theſe townes noye calongne ſo hath thoſe ii caſtelles hath ii ſydes ye lande galyce go thyder dyuers dyd preſent thē ſelfe kynge ſyr tryſtram roy ſyr raynolde broder ſyr aulberte braquemont ſyr tryſtrā galle ſyr iohn̄ caſtell morant ſyr barroys barrers kynge herde well contente wt theyr offres ſayd fayre ſyrs thanke good wylles howbeit ye maye go ſome muſt abyde ſtyll aduentures may fall preſente tyme deſyre barroys barrers take hym charge yf pleaſe hym ye knyght ryght glad yt iourney thought lyen longe ſayd kynge ſyr thanke grace ſhall kepe defende power ſhall departe then tyll ye ſende ſo goodes name ſayd kynge thynke ſhortely ſome tydynges fraunce knyghtes knewe frenſſhe kynges departynge fro sluſe kynge knewe well ynoughe duke borbon wryten hym buſynes fraunce howe apoynted come caſtell wt iii ſperes hym open ye paſſages ſholde come iiim ſperes vnder gydynge ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac frenſſhe knyghtes deſyred ye kyng ſhewe ſome tydynges fraunce good wyll ſayd kynge kynge ſayd ſyrs ſurely duke borbon choſen pryncypal capytayne come countrey ye frenſſh kynge counſayle hath apoynted hym come vi thouſande ſperes knyghtes ſquyers alſo two valyaunte knyghtes choſen capytaynes come hym ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac ſhall come fyrſt iii ſperes voyage ye ſee englande broken vp ſeaſon tyll conſtable fraunce erle ſaynt poule ye lorde concy iiii ſperes ſhall goo englande nexte maye howe ſaye ſyrs ſayd kynge ſyr ſayd theſe ryche tydynges haue better nexte ſomer dedes armes ſhalbe wel ſhewed countrey yf vi apoynted wyll come ix ſhall ſurely fyght englyſſhmen kepe nowe felde ſhal cloſe togyder mydſomer ſyr theſe knyghtes come ryght valyaunt ſpecyally duke borbon proued knyghtes worthy gouernours mē armes anone ſpred abrode ye towne valeolyue abrode caſtell grete comforte ayde ſholde come fraunce fyrſt daye maye wherof knyghtes ſquyers ryght ioyous thus barroys barres departed l ſperes rode caſtell noye tydynges came duke lancaſtres marſhall howe frenſſhmen brode rydynge l ſperes come reyſe ſyege rybadane marſhal harde thoſe tydynges byleued lyghtly ſhewed hym therof affyrmed true ſaynge ſene ryde ouer ryuer dorne toke theyr lodgyng ye towne arpent ye marſhal doubte toke coūſayle determyned ſende worde therof duke lancaſtre lorde ſo dyd ſente ſyr iohn̄ dambrecycourt heraulde knewe wayes galyce marſhall made euer good watche ſpyal doubted aſcryed nyght halfe doſt watched euery nyght whyle ſlepte ſyr iohn̄ dambretycourt heraulde came towne ſaynt iames duke duches ye duke knewe theyr comynge ſayd ſurely ſhall ſome tydynges ſoone came preſence duke demaunded tydynge ſyr ſayd none yt good marſhall hath ſente v hyder knowe pleaſure ſholde reported hym certayne frenſſhmen aſſembled togyder caſtel ryde faſt paſſe ryuer come fyght men lyenge ſyege rybadane ſyr theſe tydynges yt haue brought name god ſayd duke theſe none euyll tydynges ſhall ſhortely prouyde behelde ſyr iohn̄ holande conſtable admyrall ſyr thomas percy ſayd ſyrs take ccc ſperes ccccc archer go company rybadane doubte yt frenſſhmen ſholde come aſſayle theſe ii knyghtes made redy toke iii c ſperes v c archer departed fro duke rode ſoo longe came rybadane theyr cōpanyons lodged gretly reioyſed theyr comyge ſyr iohn̄ holand ſayd marſhall ſay rybadane wyll yelde fayth ſayd marſhal prowde people ſe countrey aboute doo yelde yet kepe ſtyll theyr opynyons yet many vyllaynes amonge one gentylmā name ſyr holde pea ſayd ſyr iohn̄ holande within theſe iiii dayes ſhal brynge poynte ſhal glad yelde themſelfe ony wyll take mercy ſyr praye ye frenſſhmen ryde abrode ye ſurely ſyr ſayd haue ben well enfourmed howe ryde nombre v c ſperes one company whiche maye well dayely cometh men warre fraunce haue knowledge barroys barrers caſtell noye l ſperes knowe thus lodged togyder well myght made grete prouyſyon came aboute iiii dayes iohn̄ holande ſyr thomas percy men marſhalles doſt ordeyned make grete aſſaulte cauſed made grete engyne tymbre wheles remoued ſtrenthe men whyther lyſt within myght eaſely c knightes c archer fylled ye dyke engyne ſholde paſſe began aſſaulte engyne approche ſtrength men therin archer well prouyded wt arowes fyerſly ſhotynge within towne within caſtynge dartes ſtones meruaylouſly byneth couered wt mantelles oxe hydes defende thē fro ye ſtones dartes vnder yt couerture men armes approched well paueſſed wt pyke ax perſe walle ſoo enpayred walle within coulde defende walle bycauſe archer ſhotte ſo holy togyder none durſte appere theyr defence ſo hewynge reuerſed dyke grete pane wall ſawe themſelfe ſoo grete myſchefe gretely abaſſhed cryed lowde yelde ourſelfe yelde v noone made ony anſwere englyſſhe men dyd laughe ſayd theſe vyllaynes haue put v moche payne • nowe mocke v wolde haue v take mercy nowe ye towne owne ſome englyſſhe men anſwered within ſayd syrs knowe ye ſay ſpeke spanyſſhe ſpeke good frenſſhe englyſſhe yf ye wyll ſholde vnderſtande thus cu • red paſſed forthe chaſed theſe vyllaynes fledde ſlewe hepes daye ſlayne one iewes yt moo xv hundred thus towne rybadane taken force ſuche fyrſt entred grete pyllage ſpecyally founde golde ſyluer iewes howſes ony place takynge rybadane whiche wonne pure aſſaulte englyſſhe men pylled theyr pleaſure demaunded ye marſhall ſholde done towne yf ſholde brente naye ſayd marſhall wyll kepe newe repayre nowe whether ſhall prepayre determyned drawe maures good towne galyce apoynted ſholde abyde rybadane repayre lefte ſyr peter clynton ryght valyaunt knyght xx ſperes lx archer made grete prouyſyon founde ſpecyally yoke good wynes whiche ſo ſtronge myghty englyſſhe men coulde drynke therof dranke moche caſe coulde helpe themſelfe two dayes thus dyſlodged fro rybadane rode towardes towne maures caryed peces y• grete engyne ſawe well dyd good ſeruyce ferefull men townes maures vnderſtode howe englyſſhmen comynge warde haue towne vnder duke duches lancaſtres obeyſaunce knewe howe rybadane taken force brought deuyll ſtede engyne ſo grete coulde dyſtroyed doubted gretly ooſt engyne wente counſayle ſe beſt doo outher yelde make defence well counſayled togyder coulde ſe none thynge yt farre better yelde defende conſydered yf taken force ſholde leſe body goodes comforte appered fro ony parte ſage ſayd syrs beholde howe rybadane taken theyr defence yet ſtronge ſtronger beſyeged moneth yet hadde nother ayde ſocoure vnderſtande kynge caſtel accompteth ſeaſon al ye countrey galyce loſt ryuer dorne thynke yere cometh frenſſhe men ayde wherfore let v yelde ourſelfe mekely without domage townes haue done euery man behelde ſame oppynyon ſome ſayd howe maye done well ynoughe ſayd ſages ſhall go mete waye bere keyes ye towne v preſent englyſſhe men courtoys people wyll v hurte yf receyue curtoyſly agreed yſſued ye towne fyfty perſones yt mooſt noble ſoone knewe yt englyſſhe men approched yſſued aboute quarter legge taryed enghyſſhe men tidynges came englyſſhe men howe towne maures yſſued fyght yelde keyes towne whiche brought wt ye lordes rode ſe matter cauſed archer ooſt tary behynde galycyens came forthe ſayd syrs beholde lordes englande ſente duke lancaſtre conquere countrey ſpeke yf ye lyſt kneled downe ſayd syrs poore men maures • wyllyngly wyll vnder obeyſaū ce duke lancaſtre lady duke lancaſtre lady duches wherfore deſyre accepte v mercy haue iii lordes englande eche others aduyſe anſwered ſayd ye good people maures ſhall go wt towne parte • ur ooſt al ye ſhal make promyſe othe good people ought theyr lorde lady ſyrs ſayd ſhall doo good wylles ſayd lordes go wayes open gate ye ſhall receyued mercy wente theyr towne opened theyr gate barryers ſuffred conſtable lordes entre iiii c ſperes reſydue ooſt lodged without feldes prouyſyon towne ſuffycyent lordes lodged within towne toke othes towne maures ſayd ¶howe duke lancaſtre ſente admyrall merſhal offycers come weddynge doughter kynge portyngale ca lxxiiii nexte daye towne maures gyuen vp euery man made redy go cyte beſances came tydynges letter fro duke lancaſtre commaū dynge ſyght letter ſo euer eſtate repayre preſence certefyenge loked ſhorte ſeaſon archebyſſhop braghes ſyr iohn̄ radyghes de sar ambaſſade fro kynge portyngale comynge wedde doughter procuracyon lede cyte porte kynge portyngale taryed theſe lordes vnderſtode theſe tydȳges retourned theyr waye ſayd requyſyte duke haue lordes counſayle aboute hym ye receyuynge theſe ambaſſadours ſo retourned lefte men warre ye garyſons wonne ſo came towne ſaynt iames duke commaunded within iii dayes thyder came ye byſſhop braghes ſyr iohn̄ radyghes de sar cc horſes well lodged redy apparelled ye ambaſſadours lordes theyr company wente duke duches good aray receyued grete ioy declared cauſe theyr comynge duke herde well wel reioyced therwt bycauſe ye auauntement doughter alyaunce kynge portyngale whiche thought ryght behouable hym yf wolde entre conquere caſtell byſſhop ſhewed duke duches theyr counſayle howe auctoryte procuracyon perſonally wed lady phylyp lancaſtre name kynge portyngale wherwith duke duches well contente thus ſyr iohn̄ radyghes de ſar vertue procuracyon wedded ye lady phylyp lancaſtre name kynge portyngale byſſhop braghes wedded ſoo layde curtoyſly bed huſbande wyfe ought nexte day lady company redy departe ſo toke leue fader moder ſyſters ladyes damoyſelles baſtarde ſyſter wyfe ye marſhall went ſyr iohn̄ holande ſyr thomas percy ſyr iohn̄ dambrychcourte c ſperes cc archer ſo rode cyte porte portyngale agaynſt comynge yonge quene portyngale yſſued cyte porte honoure reuerence prelate chyrche ye byſſhops lyxbone deure connymbres porte temporall lordes erle dangoſe erle nouayre erle leſcal galope ferant patryke pymaſſe martyne de marlo mo xl knyghtes grete nombre theyr people many ladyes damoyſelles clergy reueſted habytes proceſſyon thus lady phylyp lancaſtre brought cyte porte portyngale ſo • kynges palace kynge toke hande kyſſed ladyes damoyſelles come brought chambre toke leue ye ladyes lordes englande lodged theyr eaſe theyr men cyte porte grete cyte yt nyght kepte vygyll feeſt nexte day ladyes daunſynge paſſynge theyr tyme nyght tuyſdaye ye kynge portyngale prelate lordes countrey redy mornynge kepte theyr horſes palays ſo rode ye cathedrall chyrche called ſaynt maryes caryed quene came accompanyed ladyes damoyſelles thoughe ſyr iohn̄ radyghos de sar wedded kynges behalfe yet agayne openly ye kynge wedded ſo retourned ye palays made grete feeſt ſolempne dyner iuſtes tournays kynge quene nyght pryſe gyuen thē without ſyr iohn̄ holande ye chalengers knyght kynges called ſyr iohn̄ tet dore pryſe ſo day nyght perceyuered grete tryumphe ioye kynge lay quene reuome ranne countrey courte ye kynge clene mayde nexte daye feeſt renewed newe iuſtes pryſe chalengers va martyne merlo without ſyr iohn̄ dambretycourte ye nyght grete daunſyng ſyngynge ſportynge euery day knyghtes ſquyers iuſted ſuche tryumphes iuſtes ſportes ye haue harde quene portyngale receyued fyrſt comynge cyte porte theſe feeſtes endured x dayes kynge gaue grete gyftes ſtraungers ſo well contente knyghtes englande toke theyr leue kynge quene retourned ye cyte ſaynt iames duke duches demaunded tydynges ſhewed yt ſene harde howe kynge portyngale quene dyd commaunde ſayd ſyr laſt worde yt kynge ſayd v howe deſyreth drawe ye felde pleaſe lykewyſe ſo wyl drawe caſtell theſe good tydynges ſayd duke thus aboute xv dayes conſtable admyral retourned fro ye kynge portyngales maryage ye duke lancaſtre prepayred iourney go conquere caſtells townes galyce duke lorde ye townes countrey ordeyned yt duke ſholde departe fro ſaynt iames duches doughter katheryne ſholde lykewyſe departe goo cyte porte portyngale ſe kynge ye yonge quene theyr doughter towne ſaynt iames delyuered kepynge englyſſhe knyght called ſyr loys clyfforde xxx ſperes hym c archer ¶howe duke lancaſtre men rode towardes cyte beſances howe towne made compoſycyon ca lxxv thus duke lancaſtre departed mē ſuche ordeyned abyde garyſon abode duke duches rode towardes beſances one ye laſt townes bytwene galyce portyngale ryght waye porte connymbres bycauſe ye duches lancaſtre doughter ſholde go ſe kynge portyngale therfore helde way beſances knewe yt ye duke comynge ooſt drewe counſayle many oppynyons fynally determyned ye beſt ſent duke duches vi chefe towne deſyre trete abſtynence warre viii dayes ye meane ſeaſeon ſende kynge caſtell ſhewynge hym without came ſoo ſtronge fyght duke yelde vp theyr towne without ony meane departed fro beſances vi men rode mete yt englyſſhmen fyrſt encountred vowarde whiche marſhall led ſtopped demaunded wolde anſwered beſances appoyntemente towne charged goo ſpeke duke marſhall ſayd ſyr iohn̄ souſtre ſyr go brynge theſe men ye duke ſaufgarde fere leſt archer ſlee ſayd ſyrs goo wayes knyght ſhal guyde ſo rode forthe laſt founde duke duches doughter ſyr iohn̄ holande ſyr thomas percy dyuers ſportynge vnder ſhadowe fayre olyue tree behelde wel ſyr iohn̄ souſtre comynge themwarde ſyr iohn̄ holande demaunded hym ſayd ſyr iohn̄ thoſe pryſoners nay ſyr ſayd pryſoners men beſances ſent merſhall ſpeke lorde ye duke thynke wyll make ſome tretye duke duches herde al thoſe wordes ſyr iohn̄ souſtre ſayd ye good men auaunce forth beholde lorde lady▪ theſe vi men kneled downe ſayd ryght redoubted lorde lady comonaltye towne beſances haue ſente v preſence ſyr vnderſtande howe ye comynge ſendynge armye agaynſt thē deſyre ſpecyal grace forbere theſe ix dayes meane ſeaſon wyll ſende kynge caſtell towne valcolyue ſhewe hym daū ger ſyr without come theſe ix dayes ſuche ſocoure fyght wyll yelde vnto obeyſaunce yf ye lacke ony prouyſyon vytayles ony thynge meane ſeaſon ye ſhall haue towne money pleaſure men therwith duke ſtode ſtyll ſpake noo worde ſuffred duches ſpeke bycauſe countrey ſhe behelde duke ſayd ſyr ſay madame ſayd ſay ye herytoure haue therfore ye ſhall make anſwere wel ſyr ſayd ſhe thynke good receyue haue demaunded byleue kynge caſtell hathe nowe noo grete deſyre ſo ſhortly fyght tell ſayd duke wolde god wolde come ſhortely batayle ſholde ſoner delyuered wolde ſholde within vi dayes wherfore ye haue deuyſed contente ſo ye duches tourned towarde vi men ſayd ſyrs departe ye lyſt matter ſped ſoo ye delyuer hoſtage marſhall xii beſt towne ſuretye vpholde tretye well madame ſayd contente ſyr iohn̄ souſtre commaunded ſhewe tretye marſhal ſo dyd wherwith merſhall well contente vi men retourned beſances ſhewed howe ſped xii men mooſt notableſt towne choſen ſente marſhall thus towne beſances reſt pea foreſayd tretye towne ſente ſame vi men wente ye duke kynge caſtell counſayle kynge knewe nothynge compoſycyon howe englyſſhe men beſances meane ſeaſon theſe ſyxe men goynge kynge caſtell duke ordeyned duches doughter katheryne ſholde goo cyte porte ſe kynge portyngale yonge quene doughter theyr departynge duke ſayd duches ¶madame coſtaunce ſalute fro kynge quene daughter lordes portyngale ſhewe ſuche tydynges ye know howe beſances compoſycyon yet knowe wheron grounde themſelfe whether aduerſary iohn̄ tryſtmor haue made make tretye wyl come fyght v knowe well loke grete comforte come fraunce ſuche deſyre dedes armes aduauncement honoure wyl come ſoone wherfore behoueth alwaye redy abyde batayle ye may ſhewe kynge portyngale counſayle yf ſe ſhall haue ony thynge ſhall ſhortely ſende kynge worde therof wherfore ſaye deſyre hym redy ayde defende ryght lyke maner haue promyſed ſworne togyder madame ye retourne agayne leue doughter katheryne ſtyll quene ſyſter ſhe better kepynge ſyr ſayd lady ſhall doone duches doughter ladyes damoyſelles toke theyr leue departed ſyr thomas percy admyral accompanyed ſyr non fythwaren ye lorde talbot lorde iohn̄ dambretycourte ſyr namburyne lyuyers hundred ſperes two hundred archer ſoo came cyte porte portyngale ¶howe duches doughter wente ſe kynge portyngale quene howe towne beſances ſubmytted vnder obeyſaunce duke lancaſtre ca lxxvi whenne kynge portyngale vnderſtode duches lancaſtre doughter comynge hym warde therof ryght ioyfull ſente receyue gretteſt mē courte erle angoſes erle nouayre ſyr iohn̄ radyghos de sar ſyr iohn̄ ferrant perteke ſyr va martyne marlo ſyr egeas colle xx knyghtes mette duches two grete legges ioyfully receyued duches made frendly chere al lordes knyghtes bothe wordes countenaunce thus came cyte porte ye ladyes damoyſelles lodged palays kynge came met ladyes kyſſed came ye quene receyued duches mooer ſyſter ryght honourably ſhe coulde ryght wel kynges courte ryght ioyfull comynge theſe ladyes damoyſelles wyll ſpeke theyr acquayntaū ce good chere preſent knowe nothynge reporte gently knyght ſyr iohn̄ ferrant perteke preſent enfourmed know matter many duches deuyſed kynge portyngale ſhe ſawe tyme ſhewed hym wordes duke huſbande gyuen charge ſhewe kynge anſwered ryght ſagely ſayd fayre lady coſyn redy yf kynge caſtell come forth feldes within iii dayes ſhal haue r • dy iilm ſperes redy felde fronters caſtell alſo haue redy xx comons royal refuſed dydde good ſeruyce day batayle iuberoth syr ſayd lady ye ſpeke well thanke therof ſyr yf ony thyngs happen fall lorde huſbande wyll incontynente ſygnyfye therof theſe wordes kynge duches deuyſed togyder ¶nowe let v tourne beſances ſhewe howe ſped theſe vi men beſances kynge caſtel kneled downe ſayd ryght redoubted lorde may pleaſe vnderſtande ſent hyder fro towne beſances force compoſycyon duke lancaſtre ye duches hath obteyned ſufferaunce warre ix dayes ſoo yf ye come ſende ſuche ſtrength able reſyſt duches puyſſaunce ye towne abyde ſtyll vnder obeyſaunce elles boū de haue layde hoſtage delyuer vp towne duke lancaſtre wherfore maye pleaſe grace gyue v anſwere ſhall caſe kynge anſwered ſayd ſyrs ſhall take aduyſe gyue anſwere therwith kynge departed fro entred ſecret chambre cannot tell counſayle toke howe ye matter wente theſe vi men viii dayes maner anſwere ſawe kynge soo day came towne ſholde gyuen vp thē theyr meſſagers retourned agayne ye duke lancaſtre ſent beſances marſhall x day ſpeke cōmaunde rendre vp theyr towne elles ſtryke heedes hoſtages ye marſhall came beſances barryers ſpake towne ſayd ye ſyrs beſances take hede ſaye lorde duke lancaſtre hath ſente demaunde ye haue brought hym keyes towne ſubmyt vnder obeyſaunce ye ought ix dayes paſt ye knowe well yf ye wyll thus hoſtages ſhall leſe theyr heedes ſhall aſſayle take perforce ye ſhall dye without mercy lyke thē rybadane whē ye men beſances herde thoſe tydynges gretly doubted alſo fered leſe theyr frendes hoſtage duke ſayd marſhall ſyr lorde ye duke hath good cauſe ſay ye haue reported ſyr yet tydynges fro men ſente kynge caſtel ſame cauſe wote become syrs ſayd marſhall peraduenture kepte ſtyll tydynges haue brought kynge caſtell whiche pleſaunt hym lorde duke wyl abyde longer wherfore aduyſe make ſhorte anſwere elles ſhortely ye ſhall haue aſſaulte ſpake agayne ſayd ſyr requyre let v aſſemble togyder towne take aduyſe ſhal anſwere content ſayd marſhall retourned towne blaſtes trompettes euery ſtrete aſſembled gather ye market place declared comonte foreſayd wordes ſo fynally accorded rendre vp theyr towne ſaue theyr eſtates yt pryſon retourned marſhall ſayd ſyr al demaundes fynde nothynge reaſon requyreth content receyue lorde duke lady duches towne put thē poſſeſſyon therof ſyr keyes ſhall goo thē theyr lodgynge yf pleaſe brynge v thyder ryght good wyl ſayd marſhal yſſued beſances lx mē berynge keyes theyr towne marſhall brought ſtreyght duke ſhewed hym theyr entente duke receyued thē delyuered thē theyr hoſtages ſame day entred cyte beſances lodged company many myght ¶howe beſances ben ſente kynge caſtell came home theyr towne rendred vp duke lancaſtre ca lxxvii afoure dayes beſances gyuen vp vi men ſent valeolyue ye kynge caſtell retourned home theyr towne demaūded taryed ſo longe anſwered howe myght therwith amende ſaynge howe ſpoken kynge promyſed thē take counſayle gyue anſwere whiche anſwere taryed viii dayes yet ſayd retourned without anſwere aſked moo queſtyons ſayd howe kynge caſtell loked moche people come fraunce dyuers come lodged abrode countrey capytaynes ſyr wyllyā lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac come ſuche knyghtes ſquyers spayne ſholde vnder guydynge thoſe ii capytaynes redy apparelled ſuche reteyned apoynted vnder duke borbon ſtyll theyr owne houſes vpon redynes thus ye haue herde ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac paſſed thrughe royalme fraunce came 〈◊〉 mo ſperes knyghtes ſquyers al countreys aſſembled carcaſſone narbonoys thoulouſayne came ſoo lodged good countrey many payde lytell nothynge toke tyoynges came erle foyze beynge ortays men warre fraunce approched nere coū trey wolde paſſe thrughe go spayne ſayd hym ſyr pay nothynge take wherfore comon people flyeth thē though englyſſhmen capytaynes carcaſſone theyr men theraboute ſo paſſeth ryuer garon thoulouſe wyl entre bygore ſo incontynent countrey haue done way ſhall grete euyl coū trey byerne therfore ſyr take good hede ye wyll hehalfe ye erle foyze ſoone counſayled hymſelfe ſayd wyll townes caſtelles well foyze byerne prouyded men warre countrey redynes entre batayle yf nede wyll bye derely warre caſtell lanoes free yf frenſſhe men wyll paſſe thrughe ſhall pay truely euery thynge take elles paſſages countrey ſhal kepte cloſe agaynſt ſyrs ye ſyr arnalte wyllyam ſyr peter byerne charge defende kepe countrey theſe ii knyghtes baſtarde bretherne ryght valyaunt men armes toke charge erle foyze countrey ordeyned euery man ſholde haue armure redy wonte haue better redy dayly whenſoeuer commaunded byerne foyze thoulouſe euery man redy entre batayle ſente ye cyte palmes c ſperes good men armes syr eſpayne du lyon ſent sanredun ſyr cycart ſaynt lygyer maryzes ſyr peter byerne c ſperes bellpount entre erldome foyze ſaynt thybaulte ye ryuer garon ſyr peter caleſtan ſyr peter meaus noyalles l ſperes polamnuche ſyr peter toce caſtell meſun baſtarde eſperung e morleus ſyr arnolde wyllyam c ſperes pan ſyr guyde de la mote mounte marſen ſyr raymon newe caſtel sauuetere ſyryuayne foyze erles baſtardes ſone mounteſquyn ſyr • doll neuoſan ſyr iohn̄ ſaynt marcell oron ſyr hector de la garde mounte garbell iohn̄ nowe caſtell ertyell erle ſente ſyr iohn̄ lane beynge caſtell beawuoyſon take good hede fronters ſent ſaynt gaudes coſyn ſyr ernalton spayne breuely nother towne caſtel foyze byerne refreſſhed wt newe men war ſayd men ynowe reſyſt double ye nombre mē armes ye nombre xxm men war choſen men tidynges came ſyr wyllyam lygnac beynge thoulouſe ſyr gaultyer paſſa • beynge carcaſſone howe ye erle foyze prouyded men armes furnyſſhed euery garyſon renome ranne wolde ſuffre none paſſe thrughe countrey wherof theſe ii capytaynes ſore abaſſhed apoynted mete myd way ſpeke togyder caſtell daurey howe ſholde erle foyze ſyr wyllyam ſayd ſyr gaultyer ſay truly grete meruayle frenſſhe kynge coūſayle haue wryten hym open peaſybly countrey well ſyr ſayd ſyr gaultyer neceſſary ye go ſpeke ye erle ſhewe hym curtoys maner ſente frenſſhe kynge way paſſe peaſybly pay take ſurely erle foyze ſo grete myghty yf lyſt gete noo paſſage thrughe countrey muſt paſſe thrughe aragon whiche farre tell erle maketh ſuche doubtes ſoo fortefyeth garyſons whether haue made ony alyaunce ye duke lancaſtre deſyre go hym knowe trouthe ye ſe howe men dayly paſſe bygore contente ſayd ſyr gaultyer ſo toke theſe ii capytaynes leue eche ſyr wyllyā lygnac retourned thoulouſe ſyr gaultyer xl horſe wente paſſed ye ryuer garon ſaynt thybaulte founde ſyr menalte nouayles made hym grete chere ſyr gaultyer demaūded hym ſholde fynde erle foyze anſwered hym ortays theſe ii knyghtes ſeaſon togyder comoned dyuers matter ſyr gaultyer departed came ſaynt gaudes good chere nexte day rode ſaynt iohn̄ de ryuyer rode lawne bonc coſted mauuoyſyn lay tournay cloſe towne ye nexte daye rode dyner tarbe taryed day founde lorde dauchyn ſyr menalte barbaſon two grete lordes bierne ſpake hym many thynges bycauſe lorde barbaſon partye erle armynacke coulde ſpeke good worde erle foyze nexte daye departed wente morlaus byerne founde ſyr raynolde wyllyā baſtarde broder erle foyze receyned hym good chere ſhewed ſyr gaultyer howe ſholde fynde erle ortays howe wolde ryght glad comynge god graunte ſayd ſyr gaultyer ſpeke hym come countrey soo dyned togyder dyner ſyr gaultyer wente lodgynge mounte gabryel nexte daye iii clocke came ortays coulde ſpeke erle yt day tyll nexte daye noone erle accuſtomed come abrode nexte daye erle foyze knewe ſyr gaultyer paſſac come ſpeke hym ſomwhat made haſt yſſue chambre ſyr gaultyer dyd ſalute hym erle knew moche honour ony knyght dyd ſaluted hym agayne toke ſyr gaultyer ye hande ſayd ſyr ye right hartely welcome buſynes hath brought countrey byerne ſyr ſayd knyght ſyr wyllyam lygnac commytted frenſſhe kynge conduyte caſtell certayne men armes ye haue herde howe yt ye wyl let iourney cloſe countrey byerne agaynſt v company erle foyze ſayd ſyr gaultyer ſoo wyll cloſe kepe countrey agaynſt agaynſt ony man yt wyl peaſybly paſſe pay people take whiche fredome haue ſworne kepe maynteyne mynyſtre iuſtyce euery lorde bounde ſubiectes entente lordes haue theyr ſygnoryes hath ben ſhewed ye brynge maner breton barroys loraynes borgonyons knowe payne meaneth agaynſt ſuche people wyll cloſe countrey wyll kepe people theyr fraunches ryghtes ſyr ſayd knyght entente companyon none ſhall paſſe thrughe lande without pay peaſeably agrement poore mē elles taken corrected accordynge vſage countrey make reſtytucyon euery domage done elles ſatyſfye theyr treſpaſſes ſo theyr bodyes may delyuered v without gentyll man ſhal make iuſtyce done body men ſhall take therby enſample yf gentyl mā ſhal cauſe hym rendre reſtore ony domage hym done elles ſhall doo hym crye ſhall make trompet euery mannes lodgynge alſo declare agayne entre ony parte lande ſo none ſhall exſcuſe neglygence ſyr may ſuffyſe content ye erle ſayd ſyr gaultyer yf done well contente ye ſhall welcome countrey wyll glad ſee let v go • dyner ſhall talke togyder syr ſayd erle curſed ye warre bytwene portyngale caſtel ought gretly complayne neuer loſt ſo moche dyd one ſeaſon ye warre bytwene thoſe two royalmes chefe men warre byerne ſlayne yet ſhewed wente ſholde make theyr warre wyſely ſayd portyngales harde men mete withall cruell dedes yf haue ouer hande theyr enemyes haue mercy ſyr gaultyer ſpeke ye companyon come caſtell ſyth ye two chefe capytaynes paſſed ſhall paſſe peraduenture ye ſhall requyred kynge caſtell gyue counſayle aduyſe wel aduyſed ye gyue haſty coūſayle aduaunce fyght aduerſaryes ye duke lancaſtre kynge portyngale englyſſhe men portyngales theſe famylyer togyder one englyſſhe men deſyre haue batayle ii reaſons one grete ſeaſon haue noo profyte poore haue wonne nothynge longe tyme rather ſpende haue loſt wherfore wyll redy auaunce themſelfe hope gete ſome newe profyte ſuche people aduenturers deſyrynge mennes goodes wyll fyght hardy courage often tymes fortune ſerueth well reaſon duke lancaſtre knoweth ſurely come parfytely peaſybly herytage caſtell whiche demaundeth haue ryght wyfe calleth ryghtfull enherytoure onely batayle knoweth well yf myght haue obteyne one iourney agaynſt kynge caſtell countrey wolde yelde hym trymble hym entente come galyce hath gyuen one doughters maryage kynge portyngale entente ſholde ayde quarell ſyrs ſaye matter ſholde fall otherwyſe well ye felowe ſhall bere blame ony syr ſayd ſyr gaultyer thanke good aduertyſement ſyr ſeruyce ſhall redy doo pleaſure day ye amonge cryſten prynces reputed one mooſt ſageſt happeſt aduentures ſyr companyon haue one aboue v chefe ſouerayne company duke borbon tyll come caſtell ſhall make haſt fyght enemyes ſoeuer ony man ſaye ſo entred talkynge tyll erle foyze demaunded wyne dranke ſoo toke leue erle entred chambre ſyr gaultyer retourned lodgynge well accompanyed erles knyghtes ſo ſupped togyder nexte day dyner yr gaultyer toke leue erle foyze ſyde thynges erle gaue hyym fayre courſer mule ſyr gaultyer thanked erle ſo departed ortays lay ſame nyght ercyell nexte nyght tarbe rode daye grete iourney determyned ſende fro then ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſoo dyd aduertyſynge hym howe ſpedde erle foyze deſyrynge hym come forwarde theyr companyes ſhewynge hym howe countrey byerne good townes ſholde open payenge trewely take elles ¶this meſſagere dydde ſoo moche came thoulouſe dydde meſſage delyuered letter ¶and ſyr wyllyam hadde redde contynewe hereof made knowen company ſholde ſet forwarde ſoo ſoone entred ony parte erle foyze lande pay euery thynge ſholde take elles theyr capytaynes anſwere euery thynge cryed ſounde trompet fro lodgynge lodgynge entente euery man ſholde knowe euery man dyſlodged ye march tholouſe carcaſſone lymous marbon ſo entred bygore ſyr wyllyam lygnac toke hors rode tarbe ſyr gaultyer companyon made good chere togyder theyr bandes row • e paſſed aſſembled togyder bygore ryde company thrughe countrey byerne paſſe ortays ye ryuer gaure whiche renneth bayon yſſuynge countrey byerne entre countrey b • ſquey ye whiche countrey ye kyng englande helde grete landes ye byſſhopryches burdeaus bayon lxxx townes ſteples helde kynge englande vnderſtode ye paſſage theſe frenſſhmen thrugh theyr countrey doubte ouer rynnynge brennynge exylynge men war theyr partye countrey defende theyr fronters ſage men drewe togyder ſente trete frenſſhe capytaynes bye theyr pea ſent ortays iiii men hauynge auctoryte make theyr pea theſe iiii men met way ſquyer erle foyze called ernalton du pyn ſhewed hym theyr matter deſyrynge hym helpe thē ſpeke ſyr gaultyer paſſac ſyr wyllyam lygnac came ortays whiche ſholde within iii iiii dayes helpe ayde make theyr pea anſwered wolde ſo good wyll nyght capytaynes came ortays lodged ye ſame ſquyers houſe ayded byſquey make theyr apoyntment pay iim frankes theyr countrey ſaued fro brennynge robbynge erle foyze gaue dyuer theſe capytaynes ſyr wyllyam lygnac fayre courſer nexte daye paſſed sameterre entred countrey byſquey whiche redemed toke vytayles myght gete ſo paſſed thrughe countrey without doyng ony domage ſo came ſaynt iohn̄s de pye porte entre nauare ¶howe ſyr iohn̄ holande ſyr raynolde de roy fought togyder lyſtes duke lancaſtre towne beſances ca lxxviii ye haue herde howe towne beſa • ce put compoſycyon ye duke lancaſtre howe yelden vp hym ye kynge caſtell dyd comforte nothynge howe ye duches lancaſtre doughter came ye cyte porte portyngale ſe kynge quene howe kynge ye lordes receyued ioyfully reaſon thus whyle duke lancaſtre ſoiourned towne beſances tydynges came thyder fro valeolyue brought heraulde fraunce demaunded lodgynge ſyr iohn̄ holande ſo brought thyder kneled downe hym delyuered hym letter ſayd ſyr offycer armes ſent hyder fro ſyr raynolde du roy ſaluteth yf pleaſe rede letter ſyr iohn̄ ſayd wt ryght good wyll thou arte ryght welcome opened letter redde wherin conteyned howe ſyr raynolde du roy deſyred hym way amour loue lady delyuer hym chalenge iii courſes ſpere iii ſtrokes wt ſworde iii dagger iii axe wolde pleaſe hym come valeolyue wolde prouyde hym lx horſe ſure ſaufcō duyte yf wolde come beſances xxx horſes ſo wolde gete hym ſaufcondyte duke lancanſtre ſyr iohn̄ holande red theſe letter began ſmyle behelde heraulde ſayd frende yu arte welcome thou haſt brought tydynges yt pleaſeth ryght wel accepte deſyre yu ſhalte obyde houſe wt company morowe yu ſhalte haue anſwere armes ſhal accomplyſſhed outher galyce caſtell ſyr ſayd ye heraulde pleaſeth god ¶the heraulde eaſe ſyr iohn̄ wente duke founde hym talkynge marſhall ſhewed tydynges letter well ſayd duke haue ye accepted deſyre ye truely ſyr ſayd deſyre nothynge ſo moche dedes armes knyght hath deſyred nowe ſyr ſhall pleaſure doo armes duke ſtudyed lytell ſayd wyll done towne make ſaufconduyte hym ſhall pleaſe ſhall ſeale name god ſayd ſyr iohn̄ well ſayd ſaufcondyte wryten hym xxx knyghtes ſquyers come ſaufe go ſaufe ſyr iohn̄ holande delyuered heraulde gaue hym mantell furred myneuer xii aungell noble heraulde toke leue retourned valeolyue mayſter ſhewed howe ſped delyuered ſaufconduyte ye parte tydynges came cyte porte kynge portyngale ladyes howe theſe dedes armes ſholde done beſances well ſayd kynge wyll therat quene wyfe ladyes damoyſelles duches lancaſtre thanked kynge ſhe ſholde retourne accompanyed kynge ye quene longe tyme approched kynge portyngale quene duches doughter ladyes damoyſelles rode • orth grete aray towarde beſances duke lancaſtre knew ye kynge came thyder toke hors many lordes yſſued beſances met kynge ye ladyes ye kynge duke made grete chere togyder ſo entred togyder ye towne theyr lodgynge appoynted aperteyned accordynge maner ye countrey ſo eaſye large thoughe ben parys aboute iii dayes kynge portyngale come beſances thyder came ſyr reynolde du roy well accompanyed knyghtes ſquyers hadde vi ſcore horſes well lodged duke lancaſte hadde prepayred redy theyr lodgynges ye nexte daye ſyr iohn̄ holande ſyr raynolde roy armed mounted theyr horſes ſoo came fayre place redy ſan • ed ſholde doo theyr armes ſcafoldes redy made kynge ladyes duke lordes englande come thyder ſe ye dedes armes theſe ii knyghtes came felde well appoynted coulde deuyſed brought theyr ſperes theyr ax theyr ſwordes well horſed ſo eche good dyſtaunce fro made theyr tournes fryſkes freſſhly knewe well regarded euery thynge ordeyned theyr deſyre theyr armes graunted excepte vtteraunce howbeit man knewe ſholde fal theyr bodyes ſyth thyder come muſt nedes mete ye poynte theyr ſperes theyr ſwordes ax dagger loo daunger entente exhaulte theyr honoure theyr lyues lay myſaduenture one ſtroke thus ranne togyder met euen thoughe hadde rynne lyne ſtrake eche vyſoure theyr helmes ſo ſyr raynolde du roy brake ſpere iiii peces ye ſheuers flewe grete hyght ye ayre whiche courſe gretely prayſed ſyr iohn̄ holande ſtrake ſyr raynolde lykewyſe ye vyſoure ſtroke force ſhall ſhewe ſyr raynolde vyſoure helme made auaūtage tyed ſmall laſe laſe • rake y• ſtroke helme flewe heed ſo knyght bare heeded ſo paſſed forth theyr courſe ſyr iohn̄ dyſcharged bare ſtaffe freſſhely euery man ſayd goodly courſe theſe knyghtes retourned theyr owne place ſyr raynolde helmed agayne newe ſpere ſo ranne togyder agayne bothe wel horſed coulde well guyde thē ſtrake eche helmes ſo fyer flewe ye ſperes brake ſyr raynoldes helme agayne flewe heed ſayd englyſſhmen ye frenſſheman hath auauntage helme faſt bocled ſyr iohn̄ holandes thynke dothe wronge let hym ſet helme lyke caſe companyon hathe done holde pea ſyrs ſayd duke lancaſtre let dele armes let euery mā take aduauntage thynketh beſt yf ſyr iohn̄ holande thynke yt knyght haue aduauntage let hym ſet helme lyke maner ſayd duke lyke armes theſe ii knyghtes wolde haue helme faſt bocled coulde thynke many ſame oppynyon englyſſhe men ſpake moo wordes ladyes damoyſelles ſayd howe knyghtes iuſted well goodly kynge portyngale ſayd ſame ſpake ſyr iohn̄ ferant ſayd ſyr iohn̄ countrey knyghtes iuſt goodly maner ſyr ſayd theſe knyghtes iuſt wel ſyr haue ſene ye frenſſhmen iuſt ye kynge broder elyres agaynſt kynge caſtell lyke iuſtes ſawe bytwene ſyr wyllyam wyndſore another frenſſhe knyght theyr helmes faſter tyed knyghtes helme kynge regarded agayne two knyghtes ſe theyr thyrde courſe thus ranne togyder ye thyrde courſe regarded eche wyſely take theyr aduauntage myght well ſo doo theyr horſes ſerued theyr wyſſhyng ſo ſtrake eche agayne helme ſuche wyſe yt theyr eyen trimbled theyr heedes theyr ſta • e brake agayne ſyr raynoldes helme flewe heed ſo eche paſſed forth theyr courſe demeaned themſelfe freſſhly ſo euery man ſayd howe nobly iuſted englyſſhmen blamed gretely ſyr raynolde du roy helme faſter ſet heed duke lancaſtre blamed hym nothyng ſayd thynke hym wyſe feates armes ſeke lawfull aduauntage ſemeth well yt ſyr raynolde lerne iuſt knoweth therin ſyr iohn̄ doth thoughe haue borne hymſelfe ryght well thus theyr courſes theyr ſperes toke theyr ax dyd theyr armes gaue eche iii grete ſtrokes theyr helmes fought theyr ſwordes theyr dagger done none hurte frenſſhmen brought ſyr raynolde lodgynge englyſſhmen ſyr iohn̄ holande ſame day duke lancaſtre made dyner frenſſhmen lodgynge duches ſet table duke ſyr raynolde du roy bynethe dyner wente counſayle chambre ye duches toke ſyr raynolde hande made hym entre ſone herſelfe ſhe comoned hym frenſſhe knyghtes tyll tyme call drynke ye duches ſayd frenſſhe knyghtes ſyrs haue meruayle ye ſuſteyne ye wronge oppynyon baſtarde ye knowe well ſoo dothe worlde henry ſomtyme called kynge caſtel baſtarde therfore iuſt cauſe haue ſuſteyne quarell ayde power dyſheryte ryght ayre caſtell knowe well ſoo dothe worlde ſyſter doughters lawfull maryage kyng peter wherfore god knoweth ryght haue royalme caſtell good lady whē ſhe ſpake fader ſhe wepte ſyr raynolde du roy made obeyſaunce ſayd madame knowe ryght well trouth ye haue ſayd howbeit ye kynge mayſter contrary oppynyon agaynſt ſubiectes muſt make warre pleaſure go wyl ſende v maye ſay nay duches departed duke ye frenſſhe knyghtes dranke toke theyr leues wente theyr lodgynge euery thynge redy departe mounted departed fro beſances rode ſame daye noy reſted rode forth tyll came valeolyue ¶howe kynge portyngale duke lancaſtre determyned entre royalme caſtell ca lxxix theſe dedes armes done haue recorded kynge portyngale duke laucaſtre toke counſayle togyder determyned ryde entre caſtell within ſhorte ſpace kynge portyngale power ſholde ryde fronters ſo entre caſtell duke rowte entre boundes galyce conquere ſuche townes fortreſſes agaynſt hym yf iohn̄ caſtell dyd aſſemble ooſt agaynſt make batayle thē bothe theyr ooſtes drawe togyder thought mooſt neceſſary haue theyr ooſtes ſondre tyll nede rather togyder exchewe ſykenes yt myght fall haue eaſyer lodgynge foragynge exchewyng debate dyſcordes englyſſhmen haſty prowde ye felde portyngales hote dyſdaynful ſuſtre thought yt grete iourney batayle ſholde ryght wel agree togyder coūſayle determyned kynge ſayd duke ſyr ſoone haue knowledge ye ſet forwarde ſhall doo lyke caſe men redy deſyre nothynge elles batayle ſyr ſayd duke ſhall longe ſyr ſtyll ſhewed howe yet certayne townes galyce yt rebell agaynſt v wyll goo vyſyte wyll ſeke enemyes wherſoeuer fynde thus kynge portyngale toke leue duke duches lyke wyſe ſo dyd quene phelyp yonge ſyſter katheryne ordeyned yonge lady ſholde abyde al warre ſeaſon ſyſter quene cyte porte portyngale thought ſhe coulde ony better kepynge ye duches retourned ſaynt iaques galyce ſo thus euery body departed thyder ſholde doo kynge cyte porte duches towne ſaynt iaques well accompanyed knyghtes ſquyers duke taryed beſances aboute prepayred ſhortly ſet forwarde deſyrous departe bycauſe ioly luſty moneth aprell whiche ſeaſon galyce graſſe full growen theyr corne herbes floures fruytes redy rype countrey ſo hote yt begynnynge iune harueſt paſt duke thought ſeaſon goodly ſet forwarde army ¶nowe let v ſomwhat ſpeke orderynge frenſſhmen kynge iohn̄ caſtell well haue done englyſſhe men ¶howe ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac came ayde kynge iohn̄ caſtell ca lxxx ye haue herde howe ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac dyd ſo moche theyr wyſe entreatynge erle foyze yt ſuffred peaſybly paſſe thrughe countrey byerne go caſtel beſyde erle gaue grete rewardes noo knyghtes ſquyers ſtraungers came ſe hym wolde largely rewarde accordynge theyr degree ſome c floreynes ſome cc floreynes xxx xl ſo ſayd fyrſt paſſage frenſſhe men coſt erle foyze owne treaſourer ſhewed ſome frankes beſyde horſes thynges gaue ſay trouth ſurely grete domage yt ſuche perſone ſholde olde dye mermoſettes aboute hym ſay ſyr take gyue pynche pyl people ſurely none ſuche aboute hym • dyd euery thynge owne mynde naturally grete wyſdome coulde gyue nede take became hym beſt reaſan large grete expences ſomtyme trauayled ſubiectes reuenewes ſuffycyent bere gyftes whiche yerely lxm frankes ye whiche lyke haue ben ſene herde ony yet aſſembled treaſoure doubte aduentures xxx yere xxx tymes cm frankes yet people alwayes prayde god longe lyfe herde reported howe dyed foyze byerne xm perſones ſayd yt wolde gladly haue dyed hym wherby thought ſayd ſo without ben grete loue yt theyr lorde ſurely loued hym dyd ryght accordynge reaſon alwayes maynteyned theyr ryght kepte euer true iuſtyce la • de people therin grete lyberte frauncheſſe lyued good pea thoughe ben paradyſe terreſtre ſay flattery fauour loue bere hym gyftes hath gyuen well proue haue ſayd ſure knyghtes ſquyers wyll ſaye ſame nowe let v retourne ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac capytaynes ſouerayne leders frenſſhe armye paſſed countrey byſquey paſe rounceuall whiche coſt iii dayes paſſynge mountaynes ſo full ſnowe moneth aprell yet theyr horſes hadde moche payne paſſe thrughe came towardes panpylona founde royalme nauare redy open ſuffre paſſe thrughe kynge nauare wolde doo dyſpleaſure kynge caſtell bycauſe ſone ſyr charles nauare wyfe kynge caſtelles ſyſter pea made bytwene kynge henry fader kynge iohn̄ nauare made promyſed grete alyaunce togyder whiche longe kepte kynge nauare able reſyſt kynge caſtell without grete alyaunce comforte ye kynge ſo aragon elles ye kynge englande theſe capytaynes fraunce came pampylona kynge nauare receyued ioyfully made dyne hym palays dyner led chambre comoned wt dyuers thynges ye kynge wyſe man ſubtell well langaged amonge thynges ſhewed howe ye frenſſhe kynge counſayle ben dyſpleaſed hym without cauſe wrongfully taken fro hym herytage landes normandy whiche ought haue ſucceſſyon predeceſſours kynges fraunce nauare whiche ſayd coulde forgete ſeynge taken fro hym normandy languedoc barony mountpellyer ſome lxm frankes yerely reuenues ſayd wyſt whome complayne haue ryght onely god ſyrs ſayd kyng ſay bycauſe ye ſholde addreſſe wronges knowe well lyeth power thynke frenſſhe kynge wyll lytell behalfe ye none counſayle ye knyghtes aduentures ſowdyours go ſoeuer ſende ſpeke maner complaynte al knyghtes fraunce paſſe ſyr gaultyer paſſac ſayd ſyr wordes true yf ſaye kynge v wyll nother gyue take ſurely ſyr counſayle redy go wyll ſende v ſyr duke borbon ſouerayne capytayne vncle kynge cometh v ſame waye outher goynge retournynge ye maye ſhewe hym buſynes hym ye maye addreſſed complayntes ſyr praye god may rewarde honour ye haue done v ſyr ſhall ſhewe curtoyſye kyng counſayle retourne fraunce alſo duke borbone chefe capytayne whome truſt ſe ſe kyng wyne brought dranke toke theyr leue kynge ye kynge rewarded largely ſente eche theyr lodgyng goodly horſes wherof grete ioye thus theſe men warre paſſed thrugh royalme nauare came groyne demaunded ſholde fynde kynge caſtell ſhewed howe lyen valeolyue grete ſeaſon ſayd thought burgus spayne makynge prouyſyon toke way burgus lefte way galyce waye ſure englyſſhe men ſore abrode countrey tydynges came kynge caſtell howe ſocoures came hym fraunce nombre iim ſperes wherof ryght glad ſo departed fro valeolyue rode burgus vim hors thus theſe frenſſhmen armes came burgus lodged theraboute abrode countrey dayly thyder came men warre ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac came kynge palays receyued ſwetely thanked payne grete trauayle taken ſake come thyder ſerue hym knyghtes made theyr reuerence ſayd ſyr yf maye ony ſeruyce pleaſe paynes ſhall ſoone forgoten ſyr pleaſe take aduyſe howe ſhal outher ryde agaynſt enemyes elles make warre garyſons tyll ſuche ſeaſon duke borbon come ſyr yf pleaſe ye maye ſende ſyr olyuer clyſquy knowe well countrey ſyr peter vyllaynes barroys barres chatell morant companyons haue haunted countrey haue done longe v let v al counſayle togyder goddes grace royalme ſhal haue honoure profyte syrs ſayd kynge ye ſpeke wyſely thus ſhal done clerkes ſet worke letter made meſſagers ſent forthe dyuers place knyghtes men warre ſpred abrode countrey knewe ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac burgus kynge gretely reioyced therof theſe knyghtes companyons departed fro theyr garyſons lefte ſure kepynge ſo rode burgus ſpayne ſoo grete nombre frenſſhe men warre kynge caſtel lordes knyghtes fraunce went coūſayle togyder ſe ſholde maynteyne theyr warre knewe well theyr enemyes rode abrode kepte ye feldes wherfore thought prouyde ſome remedy honoure kynge profyte royalme caſtell many matter debated counſayle theyr people nombred ſayd royalme ſelfe myght well brynge togyder xxxm horſes men well armed vſage caſtell dartes iauelyns foote men caſtynge ſtones ſlynges xxxm frenſſhe knyghtes amonge themſelfe conſydered al ſayd one another grete nombre people good men warre lytel worth haue ſene ſuche ſlowfulnes haue grete truſt appered well batayle marres prynce wale vyctory 〈◊〉 ye batayle iuberoth portyngales gaſcoynes alwaye spanyardes dyſcomfyted erle lune ſuſteynynge ye caſtellyans exſcuſynge ſayd ſyrs batayle marres ſhall anſwere trouthe yt ſyr bertram clyſquy grete nombre knyghtes fraunce fought valyauntly taken ſlayne ye haue herde ye know well agaynſt floure chyualry worlde bothe wyſdome valyauntnes prowes whiche nowe duke la • caſtre prynce teh batayle marres xm ſperes vim archer ſuche men iiim euery man worth rowlande olyuere duke lancaſtre hathe none ſuche paſſeth xii xvc ſperes iiiim archer vi ſperes ſhall fyght agaynſt rowlande olyuer syr iohn̄ chandos ſyr thomas felton ſyr olyuer clyſſon ſyr hughe caurel ſyr rycharde pountchardon ſyr garſis lorde ryeux ſyr rycharde dangle coulde name vc ſuche deed ſhall fynde none ſuche nowe wherfore matter ſoo peryllous tyme paſt yf ye wyll byleue ſhall go fyght paſſe ryuer derne ſhall tourne v grete valyauntnes counſayle erle lune dyd gyue wel herde many helde ye ſame oppynyon ſyr olyuer clyſquy ſayd ſyr erle lune knowe well ye haue ſayd procedeth grete wyſdome valyauntnes ſyr take ſo goo fyght duke lancaſtre yf ſholde well ynoughe ſyr ye leue ye gretteſt matter behynde kynge portyngale puyſſaūce enfourmed xxvc ſperes xxxm men war truſt kynge portyngale ye duke lancaſtre entred galyce haue made grete alyaunce togyder kynge hath maryed duke doughter nowe ſyr ſaye name god ſayd erle lune ye knyghtes fraunce ſuffycyent fyght duke lancaſtre kynge caſtell caſtellyans ſay xxm horſe xxx foote may fyght kynge portyngale dare well abyde ye aduenture amonge frenſſhmen ſawe erle lune layde ſo ſore theyr charge ſayd ſyr ye ye ryght ye wronge ſyr ſholde haue ſayd ye ſyr let ſoo wyll none v ſhall ſaye agaynſt wyll ſyrs ſayd kynge requyre counſayle truely haſt pryde ſad aduyſe humylyte let v take beſt waye wyll conclude accepte iourney wyl mete agayne togyder morowe ſame chambre ye ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac ſente hyder countrey frenſſhe kynge duke borbon requyre go togyder take aduyſe counſayle ſhall thought mooſt beſt honourable royalme ſhall lye whether ſhall fyght enemyes made theyr reuerence ſayd wolde obey commaundement ſo departed thus euery man daye departed theyr lodgynges frenſſhmen togyder grete communycacyon ſome ſayd honourably fyght enemyes tyll duke borbon ſouerayne capytayne come tell yf wolde fyght ſoo fyght haue vyctory duke borbou wyll ſore dyſpleaſed v ſpecyally v frenſſhe capytaynes yf fortune ſholde fall agaynſt v ſholde bothe loſe bodyes royalme yf ouerthrowen recouery caſtellyans kynge caſtell lyke leſe royalme tyme ſholde bere fawte ony ſholde layde howe cauſed batayle gaue good counſayle alſo noo ſuretye yf royalme ſure kynges partye whether haue couertly ſente duke lancaſtre wyfe reputed heyre caſtell ſhe doughter kynge peter worlde knoweth ſo people ſe duke wyfe ye englyſſhmen felde demaundynge crowne caſtell affyrmynge haue ryght therto kynge iohn̄ kynge ſone baſtarde peraduenture may tourne theyr parte dyd ye grete batayle maures ſoo ſholde abyde deed felde ſo thinke double peryll bothe kynge v ſuche folyſſhe people gyue kynge counſayle batayle herde ſholde ſpeke well ſyrs ſayd ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac morowe ſhall knowen euery mannes opynyon day nyght frenſſhmen dyuers communycacyons lyke wyſe ſoo ſpanyardes suche loued kynge wolde counſayle hym fyght dyuers reaſons one fought loſt batayle loſt royalme without recouery kynge hymſelfe thought good fyght fered ſore fortune warre alſo knewe euery mannes mynde loued hym dyd thus matter reſted tyll nexte daye euery man retourned palays kynge entred counſayle counſayle many opynyons euery man power wolde truely counſayle kynge dyuers counſayled hym ſholde enclyne haſtely batayle puttynge hym remembraunce harde iourney iuberoth kynge portyngale dyſcomfyted hym wherby ſuche domage yf ſuche another chaunce ſholde fall ſholde leſe royalme euer kynge demaunded euery man herde theyr oppynyons ſayd ſyr wyllyam lygnacke ſyr gaultyer paſſac ſyrs let oppynyons ſhal ordeyned ſeynge ye chefe capytaynes frenſſhe men ſente hyder frenſſhe kynge counſayle theſe ii knyghtes regarded eche ſyr wyllyam ſayd ſyr galtyer ſyr ſpeke anſwered ſayd nay wyll ſpeke ye haue vſed armes haue done ſyr wyllyam aduyſed hymſelfe ſayd ſyr lyke grace thynke ye ought gretely thanke noble chyualry fraunce come hyder ſerue ſoo farre ſyr hathe ſhewed well howe haue none affeccyon wyll cloſed ony cyte towne caſtell garyſon ye haue haue ben deſyrous kepe feldes fynde fyght enemyes whiche thynge nowe ſauynge grace ſuffred dyuers reaſons pryncypall reaſon ſyr tary duke borbon onr ſouerayne capytayne wyll ſhortely ſhall gretely enforce v newe freſſhe men many nowe v neuer countrey neceſſary lerned maner countrey two thre monethes proueth ſeldome well haſtely fyght oure enemyes lette v make wyſe warre garyſons two thre monethes let englyſſhemen portyngales ryde abrode galyce lyſt yf conquere certayne townes ſmall matter ſoone departed countrey wyll ſoone wonne agayne alſo ſyr one poynte armes lyeth many aduentures ſyr let ryde abrode countrey whiche hoote ſtronge ayre maye take ſuche trauayle ſykenes maye happen repente haue come ſoo forwarde ſhall fynde ayre ſoo attemperate englande fraū ce wynes ſo pleaſaunt galyce ryuers troublous coolde bycauſe ſnowes dyſcende downe frome mountaynes wherby theyr horſes theyr trauayle daye hoote ſone ſhall morfoundred ware made ſtele yet yron lengthe ſhall endure hote countrey caſtell men thus thynke better bete let go lyſt ſhall fynde nothynge playne countreys delectable place refreſſhe vnderſtande open countrey redy dyſtroyed owne men alowe well aduyſe yf doo wolde counſayle ſame ſyrs yf ony ſpeke better let hym ſpeke ſhall glad hym ſyr gaultyer deſyre thus doo anſwered one voyce lette aduyſe admytted conſyder better profytable way kynge caſtel royalme concluded ſholde make countenaunce warre tyll duke borbon theyr prouyſyons come theyr men warre put dyuers garyſons fronters theyr countrey ſuffre englyſſhmen portyngales go royalme caſtell theyr pleaſure ſayenge howe coulde bere awaye countrey ſo euer retourned thus ended counſayle kynge caſtel ſame daye dyner hym palays burgus spayne ryght plentyfull vſage spayne nexte daye none al men armes departed thyder appoynted theyr capytaynes ſyr olyuer clyſquy erle longueuyle thouſande ſperes wente ſtronge towne fronter galyce called vylleſaunte ſyr raynolde ſyr tryſtram roye ſente another garyſon x legges fro fronter galyce called agyllar felde thre hundred ſperes syr peter bellyſme two hundred ſperes wente pouelles vycount • lune wente towne marolle ſyr iohn̄ barres thre hundred ſperes ſente caſtell noye within galyce syr iohn̄ caſtell morant ſyr tryſtram iayell dyuers ſente cyte palance vycount belyer wente towne rybede hym ſyr iohn̄ braquen ſyr robert braquen▪ ¶thus theſe men armes deuyded ſyr olyuer clyſquy made theyr conſtable ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac abode ſtyl kynge burgus caſe ſtandynge buſynes caſtell abydynge comynge duke borbon ſtyll fraunce makynge prouyſyon iourney ¶nowe wyll ſuffre reſt ſeaſon armye caſtell duke lancaſtre alſo kynge portyngale tyme requyreth ſhal retourne ther agayne nowe lette v ſpeke aduentures fell ſame ſeaſon fraunce englande whiche troublous peryllous bothe royalmes ſore dyſpleaſaunt vnto kynges bothe theyr counſayles ¶how grete myſcheffe fell englande bytwene gentyll men comons accompte ſuche money hadde ben reyſed comons ca lxxxi ye haue herde howe frenſſhe armye ſhyppes ye ſe aſſembled sluſe haue gone englande daſſhed broken vp yet ſhewe courage deſyre goo another ſeaſon englande ſholde ſayd frenſſhe men recreaunt haue made voyage therfore ordeyned incontynent entre may ſee myght fayre pleaſaunt conſtable fraunce ſholde make iourney englande iiii men armes iim croſſe bowes ſholde aſſemble togyder cyte agaynſt fronter cornewall called lentrygnyer made theyr prouyſyon ordeyned euery man haue horſe eaſely • yde abrode englande thought without horſe coulde make noo warre ſholde auayle ſoo aſſembled hauen lentygnyer goodly apparell ſhyppes barkes bagengers galeys wel fournyſſhed wynes ſalte fleſſhe byſquet thynges ſo largely ſuffycyent lyue foure fyue monethes without takynge byenge ony thynge countrey ye conſtable company knewe well ſoone englyſſhe men knewe ſuche company men warre comynge wolde dyſtroye theyr owne goodes abrode playne countrey rather ſholde haue ony caſe therof therfore conſtable made prouyſyon redy ſyde ſee alſo ordeyned another flete shyppes hauen harflewe lorde coucy lorde ſaynt poule admyrall fraunce ſholde take ſhyppynge two thouſande ſperes lykewyſe goo englande brute wente done drawe backe agayne duke lancaſtre duches caſtell ſame ſeaſon duke borbon parys thought ſurely duke lancaſtre ſholde retourne home agayne englande wherfore thoughe ſholde haue thynge doo go caſtell trauayle body ſo farre forthe determyned conſtables armye ſholde goo breton augenyms poyetenyns manceaus xayngrons knyghtes ſquyers lowe march lorde ſaynt poule lorde coucy ſholde go frenſſhmen norman pycardes duke borbon ſholde goo two thouſande ſperes berrey auuernake lymoſyn borgoyne bace march thus ſeaſon matter concluded fraunce euery man knewe ſholde outher go englande caſtell true royalme englande ſame tyme grete peryll gretter ieoperdye vyllaynes eſſex kent rebelled agaynſt kynge noble royalme whiche tyme came vnto london ſhall ſhewe reaſon ſeaſon noble men royalme toke one parte togyder kynge agaynſt comons nowe ſoo noble vary amonge themſelfe kynge agaynſt owne vncles duke yorke duke gloceſtre agaynſt hym varyaunce dyd ryſe meanes duke irelande bare chefe rule aboute kynge comons englande dyuers cytees knewe well dyſcorde ſage men reputed grete euyl fered moche trouble ſholde growe therby ſuche lyght perſones made noo rekenynge therof ſome ſayenge enuye kynges vncles hadde agaynſt kynge theyr nephewe bycauſe ſawe howe crowne englande began growe farre frome ſome ſayd kynge yonge byleued yonge counſayle howe better hym byleue hys vncles mente noo thynge hym al honoure pro • yte royalme englande rather ruled prowde duke irelande neuer ſawe ony thynge perteynynge honoure neuer ony batayle thus euery man dyffered royalme englande whiche trybulacyons well knowen fraunce wherfore made grete prouyſyon goo thyder theyr puyſſaunce thynkynge doo grete feate ſyde prelate englande hatred one another archebyſſhop cauntorbury neuelles blood archebyſſhop yorke yet countrey men borne hated mortally eche bycauſe lorde neuell hadde rule gouernaunce northumbrelande ſoo march skotlande aboue erle northumbrelande chyldren lorde henry lorde raffe percy whiche rule lorde neuelles broder gotten hym one chefe aboute kynge duke irelande ¶of grete dyſcordes englande brekynge vp frenſſhe armye armye gouernours kynge conſtrayned comons good townes make accomptes ſuche money come theyr handes ſeaſon ruled ca lxxxii ſone englyſſhmen knewe voyage ſee frenſſhmen ſholde haue made beynge sluſe daſſhed broken englande began dyuers murmuracyons ſundry place ſuche loued euyll rule rather good ſayd nowe theſe grete entrepryſes theſe valyaunt men englande yt dayes kynge edwarde thyrde prynce ſone wonte go fraunce put backe enemyes ſuche maner none durſt make batayle v yf dydde ſoone dyſcomfyted dede noble kynge edwarde aryued normandy conſtantyne paſſed thrugh royalme fraunce goodly entrepryſe acheued waye creſſy dyſcomfyted kynge phylyp puyſſaunce fraunce retourned wan towne calays nowe knyghtes men warre englande doo none ſuche feates ¶alſo prynce wale ſone noble kynge dyd take frenſſhe kynge iohn̄ dyſcomfyted pyſſaunce poycters ſmal nombre people agaynſte people kynge iohn̄ hadde thoſe dayes englande fered doubted ſpoken thrughe al worlde ye floure chyualry nowe man ſpeketh v nowe noo warre made poore mennes purſes therto euery man enclyned fraunce nowe kynge chylde yet hath done agaynſt v ony predeceſſours alſo ſhewed grete courage haue come englande lette therof hym men tyme hath ben ſene yf ſuche apparell ſhyppes ben made sluſe ſholde haue ben foughten withall theyr owne hauen nowe noble men englande ioyfull maye ſytre reſt ſuffre pea yet ſuffre poore men reſt put buſynes paye money tyme hath ben grete conqueſtes haue ben done fraunce without payenge ony money ſuche ryches hath ben gotten hath ben ſpred abrode royalme become ye grete fynaunces tayles hath ben gadered royalme kynges rente accoſtomed reuenues outher haue loſt taken fro behouable knowen howe royalme englande gouerned howe kynge ledde good ſholde longe knowen royalme englande ſoo ryche ſo puyſſaunt bere lyke charge royalme fraunce dothe ¶alſo appereth wel royalme englande febled wyttes grace wonte knowe euery thynge done fraunce thre foure monethes caſe fell wherby myght conuenyently make prouyſyon reſyſtence nowe knowe noo thynge frenſſhe men knoweth ſecretes counſayles cannot tell whome fawte wyll knowen vpon daye ſome preuy traytours better knowen betymes late maye knowen ſoo la • e wyll paſt remedy thus dyuerſely men talked englande well knyghtes ſquyers comons ſoo royalme laye harde caſe grete peryll grete aſſembly kyng vncles counſayle hadde made grete expence dyuers maners reſyſt frenſſhe kynge beynge sluſe redy entre englande ſuche knyghtes ſquyers redynes wolde payde theyr wage ſo entente parlyamente ſomoned holden london noble prelate comons englonde pryncypally ordeyned ſholde reyſed grete tayle ſubſydye thrughe royalme englande ryche bere poore parlyament remoued weſtmynſtre thyder came ſuche ſente many moo tydynges ¶there kynge two vncles edmunde thomas many noble royalme amonge thynges yt ſayd kynges treaſoure ſubſtaunce ſkante maynteyne kynges eſtate ſoberly wherfore counſayle ſayd howe muſt leuyed ſubſydye thrughe royalme englande yf ſuche coſtes charge ſholde payde hathe ben done defence royalme englande agaynſt frenſſhe men agreed well byſſhopryche norwyche alſo archebyſſhopryche cauntorbury countye eſſex countye hampton warwykeſhyre lande ye erle salyſbury agreed ſoner ferther countreys north march wale cornewall al theſe rebelled ſayd haue ſene none enemyes come countrey ſholde greued haue done fawte yes yes ſayd ſome let byſſhop yorke ſpoken withall kynges counſayle duke irelande hathe lx thouſande frankes conſtable fraunce redempcyon iohan bretayne money ought tourned comon profyte englande ye ſpeke ſyr symon burle syr wyllyam helmen syr thomas branbe syr robert tryuylyen ſyr iohan beauchampe haue gouerned kynge royalme yf make good accompte haue receyued delyuer comons ſhall ſytte reſt euery thynge payde ought ¶when theſe wordes came abrode herynge kynges vncles ryght gladde therof made well al thoſe named agaynſte coulde bere noo rule courte wherfore ayded people theyr oppynyons ſayd theſe good men thus ſpeketh well counſayled deſyre haue accompte wyll paye ony money ſurely outher kynges treaſure elles theyr purſes gouerne hym muſt nedes grete treaſure thus lytell lytell multyplyed theſe wordes people beganne waxe bolde deny paye ony money reaſon ſawe kynges vncles theyr accorde ſuſteyned ¶and archebyſſhop cauntorbury erle salyſbury erle northumbrelande dyuers lordes englande put taxe tyme deferred theyr counſayle myghelmaſſe whiche tyme promyſed retourne agayne knyghtes ſquyers ſuche thought haue money arrerages theyr wage hadde noo thynge wherfore dyſpleaſure kynge counſayle apeaſed well myght euery man departed kynge toke leue vncles hym kynge counſayled drawe march wale tary tyll herde tydynges ſoo contente doo departed fro london without leue takynge ony man toke hym counſayle excepte archebyſſhop yorke wente backe •• ne countrey whiche happy hym thynke yf hadde ben ſholde haue ben ſerued ye ſhall requyſyte ſpeke well fraunce englande matter requyreth ¶howe conſtable fraunce dyuers lordes ſquyers royalme apparelled grete prouyſyons go englande wynne townes caſtelles ca lxxxiii ſeaſon ſomer come ioly moneth maye yere lorde god mccc foure ſcore vii ſame ſeaſon duke lancaſtre galyce conquered ye kynge portyngale grete puyſſaunce rode abrode caſtell without ony withſtandynge thenne ordeyned fraunce ye haue herde howe conſtable fraunce one army erle ſaynt poule lorde coucy ſyr iohan vyen another armye one lentrygnyer bretayne harflewe normandy ſholde ſame ſeaſon make voyage englande vi thouſande men armes two thouſande croſſe bowes vi thouſande men warre ordeyned none ſholde paſſe ſee goo englande without well armed prouyſyon vytayles ſpace thre monethes prouyſyon hay ootes theyr horſes daye prefyxed amonge capytaynes ſholde departe determyned lande englande two hauens douer orwell thus daye approched theyr departure lentrygnyer prouyſyon made put ſhyppes ſholde paſſe then lyke wyſe done harflewe euery man war payde theyr wage xv dayes iourney ſoo farre forwarde thought coulde haue ben broken ¶nor alſo brake noo cauſe capytaynes ordeyned goo voyage brake another incydent meruayllous matter fell bretayne wherwith frenſſhe kynge counſayle ſoore dyſpleaſed coulde amende wherfore behoued wyſely dyſſymule ye matter tyme remedy ¶alſo tydynges came vnto frenſſhe kynge partyes almayne ſhall ſhewe hereafter tyme place ſhall requyre fyrſt wyll ſpeke matter bretayne almayne bretayne fell fyrſte worſte reputed thoughe coſt yf ſholde ſaye ſuche matter fell ſeaſon open clerely mater whiche grete peryllous horryble myght cronycle n • hyſtory myght let ouerpaſſe yf lyſt wyll doo ſoo ſhall declare caſe ſyth god hathe gyuen knowledge therof tyme leyſure cronycle matter lengthe ¶ye haue herde dyuers place hyſtory howe ſyr iohn̄ mountforde named duke bretayne ſurely ſo conqueſt ryght lyne howbeit alwayes maynteyned warre oppynyon kynge englande chydren agaynſt frenſſhe kynge alſo good cauſe ſoo doo partye without ayde englande hadde atteyned dyd nother alroy place alſo ye haue herde howe duke bretayne coulde haue entente noble countrey good townes ſpecyally ſyr bertram cleſquy longe lyued ſyr olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce lordes de la vale beawmanoyre lorde raſe dygnant vycount rohan lorde rochforde whereas theſe lordes enclyned nyghe bretayne folowed contente take parte theyr lorde duke agaynſt maner men excepte agaynſt crowne fraunce ſurely ſe ymagyne waye breton pryncypally regarded euer honoure fraunce maye well appere wrytten hyſtory ſaye noo corrupcyon fauoure haue erle guy bloys hath ben good lorde vnto haue hadde moche profyte hym nephewe nexte erle loys bloys broder germayne ſaynt charles bloys longe lyued duke bretayne truely ſaye cauſe onely declare trouthe alſo gentyll prynce erle hathe cauſed wryte ſtory wolde wyſe ſholde ſwarue trouth nowe retourne purpoſe ye knowe well longe duke iohan bretayne lyued coulde neuer attayne haue men euery poynte agree oppynyons ſore fered leſt laſt ſholde haue taken hym put hym pryſon fraunce wherfore departed bretayne wente englande houſeholde ye lady wyfe iahan holande doughter ſomtyme good knyght ſyr thomas holande thus ſeaſon became ſeruaunt kynge rycharde englande afterwarde wente flaunders ye erle bloys coſyn germayne taryed yere halfe ¶fynally owne countrey ſente hym ſoo good accorde thyder wente ¶and came countrey certayne townes cloſed ſtyl agaynſt hym rebelled ſpecyally cyte nauntes lordes knyghtes prelate accorde excepte lordes reherſed haue ſygnory gete fauoure good wyll good townes cytyes put frenſſhe kynge fere bycauſe wolde ouerpreſſe tax ſubſydyes dyd fraunce pycardye whiche wolde ſuffre bretayne therfore ſente vnto kynge englande ſocoure ayde men warre archer promyſynge yf kynge englande wolde come bretayne elles one vncles grete puyſſaunce men armes archer howe countrey bretayne ſholde opened redy receyue hym company ¶the kynge englande counſayle gladde thoſe tydynges thought good concluded ſende thyder thē prouyſyon made thyder ſente erle buckyngham iii men armes viii archer aryued calays paſſed throughe royalme fraunce without ony reſyſtence hathe ben ſhewed demaundynge noo thynge batayle ſo came bretayne truſtynge haue founde countrey redy open receyue refreſſhe •• rely made longe voyage howbeit founde contrary dyſpoſed duke bretayne ſoo ledde men ſo wyſely entreated made pea bytwene hym yonge charles kynge fraunce kynge charles fader coulde neuer haue pea hated hym ſoo ſore duke borgoyne one cheſe gouernours royalme fraunce ayded gretely make pea ſo deſyred lady wyfe bycauſe duke bretayne nere theyr lygnage ſoo fayne breke promyſes englyſſhmen coulde ſuffred accomplyſſhe couenaunt breton wolde conſent yelde kynge englande make warre agaynſt fraunce ſayd neuer oppynyon neuer wolde ſo behoued englyſſhmen take theyr lodgynges ye march wannes ſuffered moche pouerte euer dyd men one tyme ſpecyally theyr horſes dyed hungre pouerte ſoo tyme ſomer departed bretayne euyl contente duke bretayne myght without cauſe ſpecyally erle buckyngham baron englande company retourned englande made grete complayntes kynge duke lancaſtre counſayle deuyſed ordeyned iohn̄ bretayne ſholde delyuered brynge hym puyſſaunce bretayne make warre agaynſt duke bretayne englyſſhe men ſayd howe ſyr iohn̄ mountforde knewe well howe put hym poſſeſſyon ſygnory bretayne without v hadde neuer come therto nowe play v tourne cauſe v trauayle bodyes ſpende kynges treaſoure behoueth v ſhewe hym fawtes better reuenged delyuer aduerſary brynge hym bretayne countrey wyll delyuer hym townes cytees fortreſſes put duke clene thus hathe mocked dyſceyued v ¶thus englyſſhe counſayle one accorde iohn̄ bretayne brought kynges preſence ſhewed hym howe wolde make hym duke bretayne recouer hym herytage bretayne ſholde haue wyfe lady phylyp lancaſtre ſo wolde holde duchy bretayne fayth homage kynge englande whiche poynte vtterly refuſed take duke doughter maryage contente ſwere agaynſt crowne fraunce noo wyſe wolde conſente rather abyde pryſon lyfe kynge counſayle ſawe withdrewe grace hadde thought haue ſhewed hym thenne delyuered kepynge ſyr iohan dambretycourte ye haue herde haue made nowe relacyon theſe matter bycauſe incydentes folowed appered duke bretayne duke knewe well howe gretely fauoure noble men royalme englande alſo comons ymagened hatred bare hym voyage erle buckyngham hadde made thrughe fraunce come bretayne wenynge haue founde duke countrey open agaynſt duke bretayne hadde promyſed whiche englyſſhe men founde contrary ¶alſo ſawe well howe kynge englande hadde wryten vnto hym ſoo amyably hadde done often tymes ſpecyally hadde done erle buckynghams voyage ¶and alſo doubted kynge englande ſholde delyuer iohan bretayne entente make hym warre ¶thenne duke caſt ymagynacyon myght fynde remedy matter brynge good poynte doo entente ſoo ſecretly englyſſhe men ſholde well content pleaſed hym knewe well man worlde whome englyſſhmen hated mooſt ſyr olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce dede ſyr olyuer clyſſon euer ſtudyed nyght daye howe myght doo dyſpleaſure englyſſhe men duke knewe ryght well armye made god englande bocke harflew lentrygnyer ſayd vnto hymſelfe entente pleaſe englyſſhe men ſhewe dyd ſet moche frenſſhe men founde meanes breke voyage commaundynge men bretayne payne leſynge theyr herytage go englande ayde frenſſhe partye dyd ſhewed outwardly warre hym dyd entrepryſe couertly caſte ymagynacyon myght doo honourably profyte take conſtable fraunce pryſoner elles ſlee hym therby knewe well ſholde pleaſe englyſſhe men hated hym thought yf waye cared reſydue lygnage knewe well able make hym warre conſtable hadde two doughters one maryed vnto iohn̄ bretayne doughter maryded vnto erle rohans ſone thought withſtande wel ynoughe lygnage yf hadde ſlayne hym ſayd hadde ſlayne baron none wolde make hym ony warre ſake ¶howe duke bretayne ſente lordes knyghtes come counſayle vnto wannes counſayle deſyred conſtable goo ſe caſtell ermyne howe toke hym pryſoner lorde beaumanoyre hym ca lxxxiii foreſayd ymagynacyon duke bretayne reſted come entente ſomoned counſayle come wannes deſyred lordes knyghtes bretayne effectuouſly come thyder dyd ſende letter vnto ſpecyally requyred ſyr olyuere clyſſon conſtable fraunce ſholde fayle ſayenge howe wolde gladlyer ſe hym ony conſtable wolde exſcuſe hymſelfe bycauſe duke bretayne naturall lorde gladde haue good wyll ſoo came wannes ſoo dydde grete nombre lordes bretayne ¶this counſayle longe many matter debated therin touchynge duke countrey without ony worde ſpekynge voyage purpoſe make englande duke dyſſymuled matter counſayle cyte wannes caſtell called mote ¶the duke made lordes grete dyner fedde fayre louynge wordes tyll nere nyght retourned theyr lodgynges ſubbarbes withoute cyte conſtable fraunce pleaſe knyghtes ſquyers bretayne deſyred nexte daye dyne hym ſome dyd ſoo ſome departed theyr owne howſes take leue theyr wyues parentes conſtable purpoſed ſoone h • departed then ſtrayght goo vnto nau • e lentrygnyer duke bretayne knewe ryght well ſpake noo worde therof makynge ſemblaunte thoughe knewe noo thynge soo dyner ended mooſt parte baron bretayne ſodaynly vnto came duke bretayne ryght amorouſly ſemynge thought otherwyſe harte none knewe therof ſuche hadde dyſcouered mynde vnto ſoone entred conſtables lodgynge ſome ſayd beholde cometh duke euery man roſe reaſon ſwetely receyued hym ought doo theyr lorde delte ryght getylly ſate downe amonge ete dranke kepte good company ſhewed token loue euer dydde ſayd vnto fayre lordes louers frendes god ſende well goo well come agayne ſende ioye maye doo ſuche dedes armes maye pleaſe maye honourable vnto herde theſe ſwere wordes duke anſwered ſayd syr thanke god rewarde grete kyndneſſe pleaſeth come ſe v departynge ſame ſeaſon duke bretayne makynge caſtell nere wannes called caſtell ermyne whiche nere furnyſſhed entente attrappe conſtable ſayd vnto hym vnto lorde de la vale lorde beawmanoyre lordes syrs requyre ye departe come ſe newe caſtell armyne ye ſhall ſe howe haue deuyſed alſo howe purpoſe doo ¶they agreed vnto hym bycauſe ſawe hym come ſoo louyngly amonge thought none euyll ſoo mooſt parte mounted theyr horſes rode forth duke caſtel armyne duke conſtable lorde de la vale lorde beawmanoyre dyuers lordes knyghtes alyghted theyr horſes entred caſtell duke ledde conſtable ye hande fro chambre chambre euery houſe offyce made drynke ſeller duke brought chefe towre dore therof ſayd conſtable syr olyuere knowe noo man ſyde ſee knoweth buyldynge ye doo wherfore praye mounte vp ſtayres beholde buyldynge towre yf well contente yf ony thynge amyſſe yt ſhall refourmed deuyſe ye conſtable thynkynge none euyll ſayd syr ryght good wyl pleaſe goo ſhall folowe naye ſyr ſayd duke goo waye vp alone meane tyme wyll talke lorde de la vale conſtable wente vp ſtayres aboue paſte fyrſte ſtage mē chābre layde buſſhment opened dore ſome wents downe dyd ſhote dore bynethe wente vp armed conſtable toke ledde hym chambre fetered hym iii boltes yron ſayd hym syr pardon v muſt nedes thus commaunded lorde duke bretayne yf ye conſtable abaſſhed tyme meruayle cōſtable ought haue grete meruayle ye chaunce dyſpleaſure fell bytwene duke hym ony letter duke coulde wryte hym ony deſyre ſaufconduyte come goo ſaufely yet conſtable wolde neuer come duke preſence durſte truſt hym nowe come myſfortune founde duke grete dyſpleaſure hym well ſhewed lorde de la vale beynge bynethe ſtayre foote ſawe dore cloſed blood began trymble grete fere broder behelde duke waxed pale grene lefe knewe matter wente amyſſe ſayd ſyr goddes ſake haue mercy wyll take none euyll wyll agaynſt conſtable ſyr ſayd duke take ye horſe departe ye maye goo ye wyll knowe well ynoughe haue syr ſayd lorde de la vale wyll de parte hen without haue broder conſtable thoſe wordes came vnto lorde beawmanoyre whome duke alſo hated lyke wyſe demaū ded haue conſtable duke drewe dagger came vnto hym ſayd beawmanoyre wylte thou ſame poynte thy mayſter syr ſayd truſt mayſter good caſe well ſayd duke demaunde yf thou wylte lyke caſe ye ſyr ſayd thenne duke toke dagger poynte ſayd yf thou wylte lyke caſe behoueth put one thyne eyen lorde beawmanoyre ſawe well matter wente well ſawe duke waxe pale angre kneled downe knee ſayd syr repute ſoo grete noblenes truſt god ye wyll doo v ryght mercy come hyder requeſt truſt ye wyll dyſhonour yourſelf • e accomplyſſhe ony euyll wyll ye haue v ſholde ſtraunge nouelte well ſayd duke come thy waye thou ſhalte haue noo leſſe ſhall haue soo ledde another chambre fetered alſo thre payre yrons abaſſhed hadde grete cauſe perceyued well duke loued hym lytell conſtable alſo remedy one tydynges ſpredde ouer caſtell alſo towne howe conſtable fraunce lorde beawmanoyre alſo lorde de la vale taken pryſoners howe lorde de la vale myght departe wolde duke demaunded thynge hym wherof people hadde grete meruayle alſo grete cauſe euery man ſayd howe duke wolde put bothe dethe hated ſo mortally duke gretely blamed knyghtes ſquyers herde therof ſayd neuer gretter dyffamacyon ony prynce duke bretayne ſeynge deſyred conſtable dyne hym ſe houſe make hym good chere ſoo take hym pryſoner ſayd neuer herde caſe lyke wherfore infamed neuer man dyſhonoured therby noo man ſholde truſt ony prynce ſyth duke dyſceyued theſe noble men wyll frenſſhe kynge ſay knoweth voyage englande broken neuer ſoo grete ſhame ymagyned nowe duke ſheweth laye harte tro neuer ſene bretayne caſe lyke none place yf poore knyght done ſuche dede dyſhonoured euer ſholde man truſt lorde ye lorde ſholde maynteyne hym ryght doo hym iuſtyce ſhall make correccyon dede none frenſſhe kynge nowe ye duke ſheweth playnly howe englyſſhe parte wyll ſuſteyne holde oppynyon kynge englande ſyth hath thus broken voyage ſee ſholde haue gone englande ſhall become nowe knyghtes ſquyers bretayne ſhall theſe tydynges nothynge contynent come fro theyr houſes lay ſyege caſtell armyne cloſe duke within tary tyll haue taken hym outher deed quycke lede hym lyke falſe prynce frenſſhe kynge thus knyghtes ſquyers aboute march wannes ſpake comoned togyder ſuche come thyder counſayle ſayd lordes grete doubte duke wolde put dethe ſome ſayd lorde de la vale ieopardy ſoo wyſe wyll tempre duke buſynes truely ſo dyd ben conſtable ben deed fyrſt nyght lyues ought byleued ſyr olyuer clyſſon caſe ſaw hymſelfe ſoo taken attrapped fetered kepte xxx perſones hadde noo comforte knewe wyll theyr lorde ſoo rekened hymſelfe deed man alſo hadde noo hope lyue tyll nexte daye ſurely grete daungere iii tymes vnfetered brought haue ben beheded elles drowned ſurely ſo ben yf lorde de la vale ben lorde de la vale herde duke ſtrayte cōmaundement put hym dethe kneled downe hym lyftynge vp handes ſore wepynge ſayd ſyr goddes ſake take mercy aduyſe ſhewe cruelte agaynſt conſtable hath deſerued dethe ſyr grace may pleaſe ſhewe cauſe dyſpleaſure agaynſt hym ſyr ſwere vnto ony treſpace hath done ſhall make ſuche amendes body goodes elles hym ye yourſelfe ſhall demaunde iudge ſyr remembre howe yongth ye ii companyons togyder brought vp bothe one houſe duke lancaſtre ſoo gentyll prynce none lyke hym alſo ſyr remembre howe pea made frenſſhe kynge alwayes truely ſerued ayded recouer herytage ye haue alwayes founde hym good comforte coū ſayle yf ye moued enfourmed agaynſte hym otherwyſe reaſon ſholde requyre yet hathe deſerued dethe ſyr de la vale ſayd duke let haue wyll olyuer clyſſon hath ſoo often tymes dyſpleaſed nowe houre come maye ſhewe hym dyſpleaſure wherfore departe hen let ſhewe cruelte wyll ſhall dye ſyr ſayd lorde de la vale refrayne euyll wyll moderate courage regarde reaſon yf ye puth ym deth neuer prynce ſoo dyſhonoured ye ſhall ſhall bretayne knyght ſquyer cyte caſtell good towne noo man ſhall hate dethe doo dyſenheryte kynge englande counſayle ſhall gyue thanke therfore ſyr wyl leſe ſelfe dethe one man ſyr tourne ymagynacyon thought noo thynge worth dyſhonourable ye ſholde cauſe ſuche honourable knyght ſyr olyuere clyſſon dye comynge vnto owne deſyre ¶surely ſyr dede ſholde treaſon grete reproche bothe god worlde deſyre hym thus dyner comynge ye went hym towne deſyrynge hym ſe newe buyldynges obeyed euery thynge dranke wyne ye grete loue ye ſhewed hym put hym dethe neuer ſoo grete blame layde ony lorde ſhall layde ye worlde ſhal reproche hate mortally glad make warre ſyr ſhall ſhewe ye ſhall ſyth ye ſoo ſore hate hym put hym raunſome grete ſome floreynes ye may well holde outher towne caſtell ſholde demaunde thē agayne ye ſhall haue loke couenaunt ye make hym ſhall become pledge therfore duke herde lorde de la vale ſpeke ſo reaſonably preſſed ſo ſore hym maner nyght wolde departe hym duke ſtudyed lytell ſomwhat refrayned euyll wyll laſt ſpake ſayd ſyr de la vale ye good meane hym howbeit wyl ye knowe ſyr olyuer clyſſon man worlde moost hate ye ſholde ſkape without dethe ſame nyght wordes hath ſaued hym go hym demaunde yf wyll paye c frankes incontynente wyll nother haue hym pledge nothynge elles redy money beſyde yelde iii caſtelles towne ſuche ſhall
