name caſtell breth caſtel ioſſelyn caſtel blancke towne iugon put poſſeſſyon deputyes done ſhall delyuer hym ſhal done ſayd lorde de la vale ſyr thanke ye wyl thus deſyre ſyr ſure ye haue demaunded ſhall done theſe caſtelles towne delyuered theſe c frankes payde departe lorde de la vale gretely reioyced ſawe conſtable peryll deth towre dore opened ye lorde de la vale mounted vp came ye conſtable ſyttyng ſore abaſſhed loked nothynge dethe ſawe lorde de la vale herte reuyued thought ſome tretye hande lorde de la vale ſayd ſyrs take yrons yt maye ſpeke hym fro duke ſayd hym ſyr howe ſay wyll ſhall ſhewe ye truely ſyr ſayd conſtable yrons taken lorde de la vale drewe hym parte ſayd fayre broder grete payne moche buſynes haue ſaued lyfe made ende ye muſt pay ye departe hen redy money c frankes ouer yelde vp duke iii caſtelles ye towne iugon otherwyſe ye haue delyueraunce conſtable ſayd wyll refuſe ye bargayne ſhall go clyſſon fetche money fayre broder ſayd conſtable thynke ye muſt fayne go therfore naye ſyr ſo ſayd lorde de la vale haue promyſed neuer departe caſtell tyll haue knowe wel duke ryght cruell peraduenture myne abſence wyll repente hym ſome lyght informacyon ſo al loſt ſhall go ſayd conſtable ſyr ſayd lorde beawmanoyre ſhall goo pryſon wel ye ſhal make al prouyſyon well ſayd ſayd conſtable go waye downe ordeyne euery thynge ye lyſt ¶howe conſtable fraunce delyuered requeſt lorde de la vale payenge certayne raunſome howe conſtable delyuered duke iii caſtelles towne payde c frankes ca lxxxv thus lorde de la vale wente downe towre ye duke goynge bed nyght ſlepte lorde de la vale kneled downe ſayd ſyr ye ſhall haue al demaunde ſyr ye muſt delyuer lorde beawmanoyre maye ſpeke ye conſtable muſt go fetche raunſome put men poſſeſſyon caſtelles ye deſyre haue wel ſayd duke delyuer pryſon put chambre meane theyr tretye wyll ſe retourne agayne haue ſlepte wyll ſpeke ye lorde de la vale yſſued chambre went two knyghtes thyder lorde beawmanoyre pryſon gretely abaſſhed doubted ſore dethe fered herde dore open come haue put hym dethe ſawe lorde de la vale entre harte reuyued herde hym ſpeke ſayenge ſyr beawmanoyre delyueraunce made wherfore ye maye gladde fetter taken ſo wente another chambre conſtable alſo brought thyder mete wyne brought ſeruauntes howſe gladde theyr delyueraunce ſory caſe howbeit myght fynde remedy behoued obey theyr mayſters commaundement ryght wronge ſoone caſtell gate ſhote brydge drawen entred yſſued nother man woman keyes duke chambre ſlepte tyll iii clocke knyghtes ſquyers without abydynge theyr mayſters ſore abaſſhed ſayd nowe ſeaſon voyage ſee loſt broken conſtable myſhap fallen counſayle hath dyſceyued counſayle ye made aſſembled wannes made none entente atrappe ye wonte oppynyon yf duke ſente hadde made aſſuraunces yet ye wolde haue gone come commaundement ye doubted hym ſo ſore nowe ye wente ſymply deſyre euery man thrughe duchy bretayne complayned conſtable wyſt ſay knyghtes ſquyers ſayd go encloſe duke caſtel ermyne yf haue ſlayne conſtable ſerue hym lyke maner yf kepe hym pryſon let v doo ſoo maye haue hym agayne fell neuer ſuche myſchefe bretayne thus one ſayd none ſtyred forwarde taryed newes thus tydynges ſpred abrode ſoo within two dayes parys wherwith kynge vncles duke berrey duke borgoyne grete meruayle ye duke borbon gone aupgnyon go caſtell ſene pope clement way theſe tydynges came hym lyon ſure le rone hym erle sauoy erle ſaynt poule lorde coucy admyrall fraunce beynge harflewe redy haue entred ſee towarde theyr voyage herde howe duke bretayne hadde taken conſtable fraunce pryſoner caſtell ermyne lorde de la vale lorde beawmanoyre hym brought thoſe tydynges ſayd howe bruyte ranne bretayne howe duke bretayne hadde putte dethe conſtable fraunce lorde beawmanoyre theſe harde tydynges theſe lordes ſayd nowe voyage broken lette v gyue leue men warre departe let v goo parys kynge ſe wyll ye admyrall ſayd good ſoo let men departe peraduenture kynge wyll ſende ſome parte may happen caſtell ye duke borbon goynge thyder elles peraduenture wyl ſende bretayne make warre agaynſt duke thynke yt ye frenſſhe kynge wyl ſuffre ye matter thus ouerpas nay ſurely ye kyng ſhal receyue bergayne domage ſome ii c floreynes beſyde ye loſſe hurte done conſtable yf ſcape lyfe euer caſe lyke thus ye kynge breke voyage good mynde haue done domage enemyes let v tary ſtyll ii iii dayes peraduenture ſhall ſome tydynges fraunce bretayne ¶howe wrytynges made duke bretaynes deuyſe conſtable rendre towne caſtelles duke heyres euer howe delyuered duke ca lxxxvi howe let v ſpeke lytell duke bretayne hadde ſlepte roſe made hym redy ſente lorde de la vale came hym togyder longe ſpace fynally letter wryten accordynge duke wyll makynge mencyon yt conſtable ſyr olyuer clyſſon renounced clene tytle euer ſayd towne caſtell yelded purely duke bretayne heyres euer theſe wrytynges ſholde permanent without ony repell ye lorde beawmanoyre ordeyned conſtable goo theſe caſtelles cauſe rule departe then put poſſeſſyon ye duke men beſyde leuy redy money cm frankes pay duke concluded gate caſtell opened lorde beawmanoyre yſſued charged ordeyned ye conſtable accomplyſſhe theſe ordeynaunces deſyred make al dylygence myght hym wente ſeruauntes duke noyſed wente howe conſtable ſure lyfe • put raunſome ſuche loued hym knyghtes ſquyers glad therof ſo therby ſate ſtyll determyned haue gone layde ſyege caſtell ermyne haue cloſed duke therin neuer dyd thynge wolde haue ben gladder theſe tydynges ranne abrode wynde ſo lordes knyghtes beyng harflewe herde therof certayne knowledge conſtable ben deed lorde de la vale ben ſayd delyueraunce towne caſtelles ſhall recouer agayne elles tyme leyſure frenſſhe kynge hath ynowe hym yf nede nowe maye departe fro hen voyage broken let v gyue men leue departe let v goo parys lerne tydynges ſaye ſuche lentrygnyer countermaunded ye whiche ſygne ſhal go ſeaſon thus gaue lycence al theyr men warre departe themſelfe departed towarde parys kynge lorde beawmanoyre dyd ſo moche within iiii dayes ſet duke bretaynes ſeruauntes poſſeſſyon foreſayd caſtelles towne iugon payde cm frankes conſtables raunſome duke commaunded done lorde de la vale ſayd ye duke ſyre haue nowe demaunded cm frankes towne iugon caſtell boureke whyte caſtell ioſſelyn therfore ſyr nowe delyuer conſtable contente ſayd duke let hym goo wyll gyue hym leue thus ye conſtable delyuered lorde de la vale departed fro caſtell ermyne abrode feldes ye conſtable made longe taryenge bretayne mounted good horſe page another ſo rode within two dayes came paris alyghted owne howſe wente caſtel lowre kynge vncles duke berrey borgoyne men folowed hym theyr leyſure kynge knewe delyueraunce knewe ſo nere glad herde therof cauſed chambre dores ſet open agaynſt hym ſo came kynges preſence kneled downe hym ſayd ryght redoubted lorde fader whome god pardon made conſtable fraunce whiche offyce power haue well truely exercyſed yf ony excepte grace lordes vncles wyll ſaye haue acquyted myſelfe truely done ony thyng contrary crowne fraunce redy caſt gage quarell kynge none made none anſwere thoſe wordes ſayd ryght dere ſyr noble kynge fortuned bretayne doynge myne offyce duke bretayne toke helde caſtell ermyne wolde haue put deth without reaſon reaſon fyers courage god ben lorde de la vale ſo conſtrayned wolde delyuered handes delyuer hym towne myne bretayne iii caſtelles ſome cm frankes wherfore ryght dere ſyr noble kynge blame domage duke bretayne hath done gretely regardeth mageſte royall y• voyage company ſholde haue made ſee broken wherfore ſyr yelde vp offyce conſtableſhyp ſyr prouyde another ſuche ſhall pleaſe wyll noo bere charge therof ſholde haue none honoure conſtable ſayd kynge knowe well ye haue hurte domage thynge gretely preiudyce royalme wyll incontynente ſende peres fraunce ſe ſhall beſt done caſe therfore take ye thought ye ſhal haue ryght reaſon ¶then kynge toke conſtable hande reyſed hym vp ſayd conſtable wyl ye departe offyce maner wyll ye vſe tyll take counſayle conſtable kneled downe agayne ſayd syr matter toucheth ſoo nere cannot vſe offyce grete muſt ſpeke anſwere euery man ſo troubled anſwere man wherfore ſyr requyre grace prouyde another ſeaſon ſhall alwayes redy commaundement ſyr ſayd duke borgoyne offereth ynoughe ye ſhall take aduyſe true ſayd kynge conſtable aroſe wente duke berre duke borgoyne aduyſed ſhewe buſynes enforme thē iuſtely matter ſeynge caſe touched gretely gouernynge royalme ſpekynge herynge hole matter perceyued ye matter touched ſoo ſore made ſoo fynally blamed hym goynge wannes ſayenge hym ſyth nauy redy knyghtes ſquyers taryed lentrygnyer ¶and alſo ye wannes hadde dyned duke retourned agayne caſtell bourke ony thynge tary ony longer goo agayne duke caſtell ermyne syr ſayd conſtable ſhewed ſoo fayre ſemblaunt durſt refuſe conſtable ſayd duke borgoyne fayre ſemblauntes grete decepcyons repute ſubtel take nowe go way y• matter ſhall well ynoughe ſhall regarde leyſure conſtable perceyued well theſe lordes harder ruder hym kynge soo departed wente owne lodgynge thyder came hym certayne lordes parlyament ſe hym ſayd hym matter ſholde doo ryght well alſo came hym counſayle hym erle ſaynt poule lorde coucy admyrall fraunce ſayd hym conſtable make noo doubte ye ſhall haue reaſon duke bretayne hath done agaynſt crowne fraunce grete dyſpleaſure worthy ſhamed put countrey goo wayes paſſe tyme mount le herry ye ſhal owne let v alone matter peres fraunce wyll ſuffre matter reſt thus conſtable byleued theſe lordes ſo departed fro parys rode mount le herry soo offyce conſtableſhyp voyde ſeaſon ſayd ſyr guy tremoyle ſholde conſtable ſoo ſoo well aduyſed wolde take handes ſyr olyuer clyſſon ¶howe tydynges came frenſſhe kynge partyes almayne whiche hym ryght dyſpleaſaunt vnto vncles ca lxxxvii ſame weke tydynges came parys takynge conſtable came alſo tydynges frome partyes almayne whiche ryght dyſpleaſaunt kynge vncles ſhall ſhewe wherfore duke guerles ſone duke iulyers alyed kynge englande make warre agaynſt fraunce hadde taken pencyon foure thouſande frankes yere whiche pencyon duke iulyers fader hadde tyme paſt kynge englandes cofers dyed renounced ſone yonge toke agayne kynge englandes deſyre ſo wolde defye frenſſhe kynge make warre agaynſt hym enclyned take englyſſhe parte bycauſe warre lady brabant ſawe well duchy brabant fauourable royalme fraunce ſholde retourne duke borgoyne chyldren therfore duke guerles wolde ſhewe matter touched hym ſo nere wolde doo domage myght royalme fraunce theyr alyes ſente letter defyaunce ye frenſſhe kynge whiche thynge pleaſaunt accepted kynge counſayle ſhall ſhewe hereafter hyſtory ſhall conuenyent ſpeke therof ſhewynge warre bretayne guerles frenſſhe kynge made noo ſemblaunt therof made good chere ſquyer guerles hadde brought defpaunce howbeit afrayde came cyte tourney wolde haue gone f • rther ſhewed defyaunce pro • oſt towne ſo wolde haue 〈…〉 agayne ſayenge ſuffycyent declare meſſage ſoo noble towne tourney towne ſo 〈◊〉 areſted ſquyer put hym ſure pryſon ſente worde therof duke borgoyne know pleaſure duke wrote prou • ſt tourney ſholde ſende hym ye ſquyer defyauces ſo brought parys fered leſt ſholde dye came parys kynge vncles lordes dyd noo thynge hym courtoyſye frenſſhe kynge gaue hym goblet ſyluer weynge iiii marke l frankes within gaue hym sa • f • onduyte retourne countrey ſo reaſon theſe tydynges ye courte fraunce ſore troubled frenſſhe counſayle ſore troubled conſtable fraunce came made complaynte duke bretayne ſawe well trouble expence began ryſe euery ſyde ſawe well howe muſt enploy theyr wyttes exchewe ſuche inconuenyentes thought conſtable ſerued kyng ſoo longe • launders place ſholde haue ſome helpe duke bretayne hadde raunſomed hym taken caſtelles without tytle good reaſon ſpecyally lorde coucy admyrall ſore dyſpleaſed ¶nowe let v retourne duke lancaſtre kynge portyngale galyce made ſore warre agaynſt kynge caſtell ¶howe duke lancaſtres men aſſayled towne aurene toke gaue vp dyd ca lxxxviii ye haue herde dedes armes done bytwene ſyr iohan holande ſyr raynolde roy preſence kynge portyngale wyfe kynges departynge promyſed duke ſoone retourned cyte porte wolde tary paſt vi dayes army ſholde ſette forthe thenne duke ſente conſtaunce wyfe towne ſaynt iames vnder guydynge lorde fythwater grete baron englande hundred ſperes two hundred archer ye duke ſayd madame ye ſhall kepe cyte compoſtella kynge portyngale ſone people ſhall goo caſtell ſeke enemyes fyght thē wherſo euer fynde nowe ſhall ſene yf euer ſhall haue ony thynge royalme caſtell syr ſayd lady god wyll ſo thus departed preſent tyme ſyr thomas percy lorde fythwaren conueyed duches two hundred ſperes daungers thenne retourned duke departed fro beſances towardes towne galyce named aurene whiche rebelled agaynſt hym wolde obey bycauſe ſtronge therin garyſon breton hadde theyr parelles vndertaken kepe well fortefyed bycauſe hadde knowledge duke wolde come thyder marſhall duke ooſt hadde well herde howe aurene galyce wolde obey dayly fortefyed counſayled conſtable goo thyder ſoo euery man drewe parte ſoo came lodged nere ſeaſon fayre aboute aſcencyon tyme tentes pauylyons pyght vp fayre playnes vnder olyues ſoo laye al fyrſt nyght nexte day without gyuyng ony aſſaulte thynkynge towne wolde haue gyuen vp dede men towne wolde gladly haue yelded lordes capytaynes wolde ſuffre thē breton companyons aduenturers two breton capytaynes called baſto • alroy baſtarde peneforte good men warre well appered toke kepe yt towne ſo farre ſocour agaynſt duke lancaſtre iii daye englyſſhemen thus lodged aboute towne well regarded howe myght theyr aduauntage aſſayle towne thenne conſtable marſhall admyrall cauſed theyr trompettes ſounde aſſaulte euery man drewe forth felde deuyded iiii bandes aſſayle towne iii iiii partes ſo goodly ordre approched towne taryed dyke wherin water well fortefyed pale hedge aſſaulte began iii iiii partes men armes wente downe dyke ax theyr handes therwith cutte downe hedge within caſt downe dartes thynges yf hadde ben well paueſſed hadde ben many ſore hurte ſlayne alſo edge dyke archer ſhotte ſo fyerſly within durſte appere duke lancaſtre came beholde aſſaulte whiche made ye fyerſer ſate horſbacke ſpace thre houres ſuche pleaſure regarde thē fyrſt aſſaulte dyke clenſed thycke hedge ſoo men myght goo pale retrayte ſowned day thē duke ſayd marſhal ſyr thomas men haue done theyr deuoyre daye let withdrawe caſe themſelfe ſyr ſhal done ſayd marſhall ſo ye aſſaulte ſeaſed euery man wente lodgynge hurte dreſſed ſo paſſed nyght wynes drynke plentye ſoo hoote myghty moche payne drynke ſuche dranke without water caſe yt coulde helpe themſelfe nexte day nexte day aduyſed ſholde make none aſſaulte bycauſe daye ſoo hoote theyr men ſoo wery ouercome ſtronge wynes determyned nexte daye ſholde begyn theyr aſſaulte ſone ryſynge endure tyll iii clocke noone ſo euery man cōmaunded take theyr eaſe tyll herde ſowne marſhalles trompet ſame daye ye duke lancaſtre herde tydynges kynge portyngale howe departed fro cyte porte drewe towardes porte ſaynt yrayne waye purpoſed entre caſtell bothe ooſtes mete ryuer derne beſyde ye towne perpygnen elles towne arpent thus portyngales deuyſed kynge caſtell frenſſhe men dyd encountre yf lykely ſo doo drawe togyder ſoner theſe tydynges duke ryght ioyous gaue meſſagere tydynges x noble mornynge whenne daye marſhalles trompet began ſowne ye lodgynges reyſe vp euery man knyghtes ſquyers began make redy euery man vnder owne ſtanderde marſhall drewe felde ſuche ordeyned goo ye aſſaulte towne knowledge howe englyſſhemen wolde aſſayle theyr watche men herde merſhalles trompet breton reyſed vp euery man woman towne ſayd ſyrs ſhewe yourſelfe lyke good men abaſſhed nothynge ye ſe ſtronge ynoughe haue dartes ſperes ſtones artyllery ſuffycyent withſtande enemyes worſte fall tymes wyll take v mercy worſe doo v haue ben dyuers place farre febler yet haue kepte without daū ger domage ſoo reaſon theyr wordes galycyens incouraged themſelfe hadde rather haue yelded vp accordynge trouthe comons caſtell galyce lytell worth batayle euyll armed ſmall courage gentyll men ryght good horſe backe thus englyſſhemen redy apparelled aſſaulte aboute ſone ryſynge came dyke iuſte vnto pale are wepons bet downe pale theyr feete yet walle thenne hadde another dyke paſſe large thenne moche payne paſſed dyke came walles within ſawe come ſoo nere defended themſelfe valyauntly ¶thenne galycyens caſt dartes ſuche wyſe whome ſoo euer ſtrake ſoore hurte without well paueſſed thenne reyſed vp ladder mounte vp walles knyghtes ſquyers auaunced themſelfe mounte targyes ouer theyr heedes ſwordes theyr handes ſo came fought hande hande bretous defended themſelfe ryght nobly repute grete valyauntues wol • e abyde aſſaulte knewe well ſholde haue thenne ſocoure determyned bytwene kynge caſtell frenſſhe men ſuffre englyſſhmen tyme lyft galyce elles paſſe without batayle ſome englyſſhe men ſayd yf townes caſtell gyue v moche doo doth ſhall longe wynne royalme thenne ſayd moche pyllage within towne brought thyder countrey aboute therfore lothe yelde vp towne thenne ſome demaunded capytaynes within ye towne ſuche knewe ſayd two baſterdes breton borne good men armes experte ſyeges one called baſtarde pennefort baſterde aulroy ſoeuer valyaunt men armes ſe none apparence ſocoure yet wyll yelde vp ſuche mounted vp beten downe agayne perforce duke lancaſtre vp redy herde bruyre aſſaulte ſayd wolde goo beholde ſoo lepte courſer vnarmed rode aſſaulte ſtanderde hym hele armes englande fraunce comynge aſſaulte encreaſed thenne euery man auaunced hymſelfe gete lawde prayſe lyke wyſe within whenne ſawe duke enforced themſelfe ſhewe theyr valyauntnes thus aſſaylynge defendynge contynued tyll thre clocke apparent ſholde haue wonne ye towne aſſaulte thenne duke demaunded capytaynes within towne ſhewed hym thenne ſayd wolde marſhall ſholde ſpeke know yf wyll yelde thynke haue yet ben demaūded wherfore byd marſhall come ſpeke knyght wente hym ſayd syr lorde ye duke wolde ye ſholde come ſpeke hym came ye duke duke ſayd marſhall knowe ye yf theſe breton wyl put themſelfe vnder myne obeyſaunce trauayle ſore men dyuers ſore hurte waſte artyllery tell ſhall haue nede therof wherfore praye goo take ſome treatye syr ſayd ſhall done ſyth ye wyll take mercy reaſon herde ſpeke marſhall wente duke ye aſſaulte ſayd heraulte go thy way fynde meanes ſpeke ye capytaynes within towne ſhewe thē wolde ſpeke heraulte departed wente dyke cote armure backe armes duke lancaſtre ſoo comoany made hym waye commaundement marſhall baſtarde alroy ſawe wel heraulte ſo came wall ſayd heraulte wolde one capytaynes thynke ye ſente trewe ſyr ſayd heraulte called percy ſyr marſhall deſyreth come barryers ſpeke hym contente ſayd baſtarde ſoo ye cauſe men leue aſſaulte otherwyſe wyll come thynke ſhall ſoone done ſayd heraulte ſoo retourned marſhall ſhewed hym ye haue herde ¶then marſhall called trompet cauſed hym blowe retrayte ſoo dydde thenne aſſaulte ſeaſed partyes thenne capytaynes came barryers redy marſhal ſyr iohn̄ holande ſyr thomas moreaus dyuers englyſſhemen syrs ſayd englyſſhemen wyll ye taken perforce vtterly loſt ſlayne poore ryche knowe well comonte towne wolde gladly yelde lorde ye duke lady duches gyuen vp towne ye ben wherfore yf ye taken euyll one thynge ye maye ſure wyll departe hence tyll haue outher fayre meanes otherwyſe therfore ſpeke ye togyder aduyſe gyue anſwere knowe charge syr ſayd baſterde agreed redy togyder yf ye wyll cauſe v ſurely conduyted towne arpent without daunger peryll ſhall yelde vp towne soo men wom • n within maye lyue pea ſurety vnder obeyſaunce duke lyke maner townes galyce none otherwyſe knowe well ye marſhall ooſt treatyes perteyneth ſoeuer ye duke wyll agree ſame trewe ſayd ſyr thomas ſhall ye deſyre ſoo ye bere nothynge owne robbe pyll towne ye haue wonne ye countrey may cauſe ryot made bytwene men ſyr ſayd baſtarde ſhall cary nothynge v owne yf ony company haue bought ony thynge ony towne euyll payde yet ſhall make noo ryot therfore thynke mete drynke ſyth came hyder garyſon men haue payde thynge ſayd marſhall excepte take vytayle aduauntage ſoo wyl men ſay ye ſhall cary away mouables syr ſayd barſtarde ſoo wyſe men ſome company wyll take ſomwhat well ſayd ſyr iohan holande let paſſe theyr owne theyr owne wyl go ſo nere ſerche theyr male ſoo ſayd marſhall abſtynence made daye nexte daye ſholde departe ye englyſſh men went theyr lodgyng vnarmed toke theyr eaſe ye breton daye truſſed gad • red togyder grete pyllage wonne ye countrey caſtell abandened ſoo therby ſuche came fyrſte countrey wanne grete good ſo truſſynge theyr baggage toke many thynges men towne clothe fethers ſtuffe ſuche founde ony ye poore men ſpake ſayenge ſyrs good ye take none good ye brought hyder ye breton wolde ſay agayne holde pea ye vyllaynes haue commyſſyon kynge caſtell paye ourſelfe wage ye wyll paye v thoughe ye hadde payde v well truely yet muſt haue newe wage agayne therfore take owne nexte daye marſhall lepte horſe lx ſperes company ſoo came barryers towne taryed ſpace thenne capytaynes breton came thyder marſhall ſayd syrs ye redy depart ye ſyr ſayd ſo may haue conduyte guyde v whether wyll go ſayd marſhall towne arpent ſayd well ſayd quod marſhall beholde ſhall conduyte thenne called forthe knyght englande called ſyr steuen stebery ſayd hym take x ſperes brynge theſe breton arpent retourne morowe dyd commaunded ſoo guyded forthe theſe breton moche baggage whenne al departed thenne marſhall company entred towne people towne made hym grete reuerence many thought ben ye duke hymſelfe marſhall ſawe theſe breton departe ſo grete caryage demaunded towne yf hadde taken away ony theyr goodes ye ſyr truely ſayd yt grete ſubſtaunce dyd ſayd marſhall ſhewe yt betymes ſholde haue cauſed haue rendred agayne ſyr ſayd durſt thretened ſlee v yf ſpake therof ſyr curſed people none ſtronge thefe noo meruayle thoughe robbe v eche thē wyll robbe marſhall ſmyled ſente chefe men towne came hym made ſwere holde towne aurene duke lancaſtre euer lyke maner fourme townes galyce hadde doone ¶then ordeyned newe offycers toke euery man theyr faythes othes ſo dranke retourned duke felde vnder ſhadowe olyue tree hete ſone whiche ſoo exceſſyue hoote man horſe coulde abyde noo man durſt ryde foragynge tyll houre iii hete greteſt ymagynacyon duke hadde ſhewed hym howe kynge caſtell abrode grete armye comynge agaynſt hym fyght ſawe well coulde perfytely come chalenge caſtell force batayle ſoo ſente oute ſpyes euery cooſt thenne ſurely enfourmed hym ſpyes pylgrymes kynge caſtell made none aſſembly come felde kepte hymſelfe men garyſons alſo duke borbon come caſtell tydynges comynge soo duke hadde taryed fyue dayes march auranches determyned goo noye aſſaye aſſaulte paſſe brydge ouer ryuer erne ¶then knyght conduyted breton towne arpent retourned agayne demaunded hym company men warre garyſon ſayd howe ſyr olyuer cleſquy thouſande ſperes breton frenſſhemen conſtable marſhall ſayd duke ſyr well done wente ſcrymyſſhed peraduenture wyll yſſue demaunde dedes armes ſome hath grete deſyre therto con • ente ſayd duke let v dyſlodge take noo profyte ordeyned dyſlodge nexte mornynge goo noye thenne arpent ¶nowe 〈…〉 ſpeke kyng portyngale waye toke entre royalme caſtell thenne ſhall retourne agayne duke lancaſtre ¶howe kynge portyngale brente towne departed fro porte beſyeged ii caſtelles ca lxxxix kynge portyngale departed porte lefte ye quene wyfe ſyſter doughter duke lancaſtre kepe cyte ordeyned ye erle nowar abyde hundred ſperes portyngales gaſcoynes ſuche come ſerue hym rode forthe fyrſt nyght lodged thre legges cyte porte nexte daye departed thre batayles fayre ſofte pace bycauſe fote men wherof xii thouſande caryage kynge folowed thouſande ſperes hym galoys ferrant partecke ponnaſe de cougne va marten de cougne bare kynges baner alſo iohn̄ radyghes de sar mayſter denyce called ferrant radyghes grete baron knyghtes reregarde ledde conſtable portyntyngale erle angouſe erle eſcall lytell dan de mondeſt radygo radyghes vale conſeaulx auge saluage geneue iohan anſale popelan lordes knyghtes nombre fyue hundred ſperes thus rode forth tooke waye ſaynt yrayne ſmall iourneyes toke theyr lodgynge euer thre clocke ſo came cabaſe iuberoth taryed ii dayes then two iourneys rode aurach portyngale reſted ii dayes came ſaynt yrayne lodged towne lefte voyde euer ſyth batayle iuberoth people drawen caſtel exepte caſtelles wherin breton poyctenyns garyſon kynge portyngale determyned bothe caſtelles ſholde aſſayled thought honoure myght paſſe without ſhewynge ſome dedes armes caſtellyans hadde wonne caſtelles therfore thought aſſaye wynne agayne kynge hadde brought hym cyte porte certayne engynes knewe well ſholde haue ſome aſſaultes waye thus kynge portyngale men lodged match ſaynt yrayne whiche entre royalme caſtell longe ryuer peſe rynnynge syuyll grete foreſayd ryuer myght well brought ooſt maner thynges frome lyxbone frome porte ſoo thyrty thouſande one conſtable rowte halfe comonte laye caſtell perrade eeſt parte aboute ye caſtell weſt parte called tayllydon lay ye marſhall company caſtell perrade capytayne knyght bretayne called ſyr moreys fouchance experte man armes caſtell tayllydon ſyr iaques mountmellyer knyght poyctou eche hadde l ſperes ſyege thus lay xv dayes without doynge ony thynge ſauynge engynes reyſed vp dydde caſt x xii tymes daye grete ſtones agaynſt walles lytell hurte dyd couerynge houſes houſes within well vawted ſtone ſo engynes ſpryngalles dyd men ſmall domage kynge ſawe caſtelles wolde wonne men began waxewery determyned dyſlodge entre galyce approche nerer duke lancaſtres ooſt entente myght determyne togyder waye beſt take soo day dyſlodged truſſed departed fro ſaynt yrayne whiche tyme brente towne ſuche wyſe place lefte vnbrente able lodge horſe caſtell ſawe departe ryght ioyous ſowned theyr trompettes made grete chere melody tyll paſte daye ooſt wente lodged pount ferraunt galyce nexte daye vale ſaynt katheryne iii day came feroull galyce ſtronge towne holdynge kynge caſtelles parte reſted ¶howe kynge portyngale ooſt came feroull aſſaulted wonne brought vnder obeyſaunce duke lancaſtre ca lxxxx kynge portyngale men feroull founde good countrey conſtable marſhall ſayd ſholde aſſaulted affyrmynge howe preygnable two dayes without ony aſſaulte gyuynge truſtynge wolde haue gyuen vp dyd within breton borgonyons ſayd wolde defende thyrde daye engynes reyſed vp marſhall ſowned trompettes aſſaulte euery man made hym redy approche towne within whē herde trompettes blowe aſſaulte drewe euery man theyr defence woman caryed brought ſtoones caſte caſtell galyce woman grete defence grete courage maner grete men portyngales came dyke whiche depe water boldely entred dyke clymed vp agayne ſyde moche doo ſauynge well paueſſed walles caſte downe ſtoones hurte many cauſed reeule alſo ther good caſtynge dartes bothe outwarde inwarde thus aſſaulte endured tyll thre clocke men fore chaced ſone hoote dyke hadde none eyre wynde ſo thought peryſſhed hete ſoo therby aſſaulte ſeaſed ſeaſon engynes dydde caſte towne aduenture thenne marſhall counſayled noo moore aſſaulte towne ſtyll let engynes caſte ſcrymyſſhe barryers ſhewe ſome dedes armes ſo deuyſed doone dayly ſcrymyſſhes made within often tymes cloſed gate bytwene barryers gate ſcrymyſſhe moore theyr eaſe ¶and whenne marſhall portyngale ſawe theyr maner deuyſed theron ſayd ſyr iohn̄ ferrant ſe well ſowdyours within ſome ſeaſon cloſed bytwene gate barryers let v take v vic men laye byſſhment fewe perſones let v ſcrymyſſhe whyle withdrawe lytell lytell ſhall ſe wyll yſſue oute truſte wynne ſome v thenne let v tourne agayne ſodaynely barryers buſye ſomewhat thenne enbuſſhe horſe men ſodeynly come ſe wyll forſake theyr barryers open gate entre ſoo peraduenture may entre leeſt yf within open gate without ſhal al oures true ſyr ſayd ſyr iohn̄ ferrant well ſayd marſhall called ſyr alue perreer ye one feate ſhall doo goo ſyr martyne de marlo pomas de congne kepe enbuſſhe ſhall go make ſcrymyſſhe perteyneth myne offyce deuyſed ſo dyd appoynted v c horſe men kepe enbuſſhe ſo iii dayes made noo ſcrymyſſhe wherby within garyſon hadde meruayle ſayd galycyens within towne loye vnhappy people ye wolde haue gyuen vp towne theyr fyrſte comynge ben haue gretely preſerued honoure towne ye ſhal ſe kynge portangale ooſt ſhortely departe hen without doynge ony domage v fourthe daye marſhall deuyſed began ſcrymyſſhe ſmall company horſe men laye ſtyll pryuely theyr buſſhment breton within ſawe theyr enemyes truſt gete ſome good pryſoner opened theyr gate lefte ſtyll open entente ſholde redyer theyr retourne tryſted gretely galycyens within towne ſo came barryers dyd apperteyned ſcrymyſſhe marſhall ſawe tyme made ſ • mblaunt thoughe men hadde ben wery halfe dyſcomfyted reculed lytell lytell breton ſaw thought haue wonne opened theyr barryers one yſſued came toke xxv pryſoners hadde ſo moche haſte gete towne lefte theyr barryers ſtyll open marſhall made ſygne buſſhement brake vc horſe came galoppe entred barryers freniſhemen breton ſawe wolde haue reculed theyr barryers coulde portyngales entred ſoone towne thus towne wonne dyuers ſlayne ſowdyours therein garyſon taken pryſoners excepte ſuche ſaued themſelfe another gate ſoo yſſued feldes rode arpente ſyr olyuer elyſquy thou • ande ſperes hym ſhewed howe towne feroull loſt thus haue ſhewed fell towne feroull galyce portyngales wanne dydde put vnder obeyſaunce duke lancaſtre whoſe tytle made warre kynge portyngale gretely reioyced men hadde done ſoo well incontynente ſente worde therof duke lancaſtre ſhewynge hym howe hadde encreaſed herytage hadde wonne hym towne truſted wynne moo duke gretely reioyced thoſe tydynges thē come noy wherin barroys barreys ſyr iohn̄ chatelet mouraunte ſyr tryſtram de la gayle ſyr raynolde du roy ſyr wyllyam mongteney dyuers knyghtes ſquyers fraunce duke marſhall ſawe caſtell noye ſayd loke coulongne one keyes caſtell towarde ſee ſoo caſtell noye another keye towardes caſtell lorde caſtell without lorde coulongne noye lette v goo loke company ſhewed howe baroys barres experte man armes fraunce thynke entrey brydge ſhall haue ſome ſcrymyſſh syr ſayd ſyr lamburyne luners ſyr iohn̄ dambreticourte wolde gladly ſe vaungarde wherin vc ſperes good men armes rode forthe good ordre duke ſente parte company thyder make gretter muſtre knewe well marſhall wolde ſhewe ſome dedes armes watche caſtell ſawe vowarde approche ſowned alaram thenne capytaynes knewe incontynente englyſſhmen came thyder armed put themſelfe good ordre hundred men armes ſome came theyr barryers xii penons ſyr barroys barres mooſt reputacyon ¶and alſo hadde chefe charge alſo ſyr iohan chatell morant nexte ſyr thomas moreaus marſhall ooſt ſawe nere towne alyghted foote company delyuered theyr horſes theyr page ſo came togyder ye barryers theyr ſperes theyr handes euery vi pace reſted kepe themſelfe cloſe togyder goodly ſyght beholde ſo fronte came barryers receyued valy auntly thynke yf ben playne felde ben noo goodlyer dedes armes done done yet barryers bytwene marſhall without matched wt ſyr iohn̄ ye chateau morant within eche ſore trauayled hurte eche theyr armure ſo good noone toke domage ſyr thomas percy coped le barroys mauburyn lyuyers ſyr wyllyam mongteney ſyr iohn̄ dā bretycourte ſyr reynolde roy lorde talbot tryſtram de la gayle thus matched ſcrymyſſhed togyder wt theyr ſperes wery reſted knyghtes ſquyers came ſcrymyſſhed theyr place ſcrymyſſhe endured tyll hyghe noone archer came ye place gentylmen departed ſet croſſe bowes ſhote agaynſt englyſſhe archer ſpanyarde dartes ſcrymyſſhed tyl paſt one clocke came yomen varlettes ſoo ſcrymyſſhed tyll nyght englyſſhemen retourned caſtell retourned theyr garyſon made good watche aboute halfe legge frome caſtell noye alonge ryuers ſyde englyſſhe men laye whiche ryuer dydde grete eaſe theyr horſes grete lacke water tyll came refreſſhed v vi dayes wente ye towne arpente ſe dealynge conſtable caſtell frenſſhmen herde tydynges kynge portyngale laye playnes feroull ooſt purpoſe come towne padron galyce whiche ye waye towarde duke englyſſhemen ordeyned kynge ye duke ſholde mete togyder comon determyne howe ſholde perceyuer theyr warre ¶they ben moneth brode countrey hadde nere hande brought galyce theyr obeyſaunce coulde tydynges ye kynge caſtel ye frenſſhe men wherfore hadde grete meruayle ſayd yt kynge caſtel ſomoned people burgus fro partyes royalme caſtell syuell cordowayne collede spayne lyon struges vale olyue sury yt lxm men vi ſperes pure frenſſhe men howe thyder ſholde come ye duke borbon ſayd departed fraunce come thyder therfore portyngales englyſſhmen thought drawe togyder ſtronger redyer yf theyr enemyes come byleued theſe tydynges trouthe wherfore ioyfull wolde gladly haue made ende batayle otherwyſe ſawe well coulde atteyne theyr deſyred entrepryſe ſyr wyllyam lygnac ſyr gaultyer paſſac alwayes aboute kynge caſtell euery weke tydynges fraunce buſynes departynge duke borbon howe toke waye auygnyon ſe pope clement cardynalles euer counſayled kynge fyght tyll duke borbon come amonge tydynges herde duke bretayne howe taken caſtell ermyne ye conſtable fraū ce raunſomed cm frankes iii caſtelles towne delyuered duke bretayne howe therby iourney boyage englande broken meruayle purpoſe duke bretayne dyd ſuppoſed counſayle therof came englande thus haue ſayd royalme fraunce brought trouble ſpecyally kynges vncles ſore moued defyaunce came fro duke guerles fell rude courſe defyaunces ſhall ſhewe declare matter alſo frenſſh kynge vncles ſore dyſpleaſed yt duke bretayne broken theyr voyage englande ye ſee chefe entrepryſe taken conſtable fraunce raunſomed ſayd cm frankes taken fro hym iii caſtelles towne whiche thynge gretely preiudycyall kynge royalme fraunce howbeit kynge ſonne paſſed ouer matter yo • ge wherfore regarded ſo ſore though ben perfyte age ſuche auncyent wyſe ſayd yt ſuche lyke matter royalme fraunce hath moche tyme paſt kynge nauare cauſed ſyr charles spayne conſtable fraunce ſlayne whiche cauſe kynge iohn̄ neuer loued kynge nauare toke fro hym landes normandy ſome wolde ſaye yf kynge charles fader kynge nowe lyue loued conſtable ſoo well ſurely wolde reuenged make warre duke bretayne take fro hym landes ſoo euer coſt hym thus euery man ſpake dede ſayd euyll done kynges vncles counſayle royalme ſomwhat ſatyſfye people ſore dyſpleaſed ye duke bretayne determyned prelate iii baron ſholde ſente duke ſpeke hym reaſons commaū de hym come parys make exſcuſe yt done thyder ſholde go byſſhop beawuoys ſyr myles dornams ſage ryght valyaunt man well langaged hym ſyr iohn̄ bean ſyr iohn̄ beuell lorde de la ryuer theyr charge ſholde ſaye byſſhoppe beaw • oys toke waye mount le herry conſtable ye towne caſtell perteyned hym kynge charles gyuen hym heyres whyle byſſhop ſykenes toke hym ſo lay feuer xv dayes dyed ſtede ſente byſſhop langers toke waye bretayne myght demaunded howe knewe theſe matter ſpeke ſo proprely anſwere ſuche haue made grete dylygence dayes knowe haue ſerched many royalmes countreys come true knowledge ye matter conteyned hyſtory wryten wryten god gaue grace haue layſure ſe dayes haue acquayntaunce hyghe myghty prynces lordes well fraunce englande yere lorde god miiiciiii ſcore x laboured xxxvii yeres age lvii yeres xxxvii yeres man beynge ſtrength wel reteyned euery cooſt yonge dayes kynge englandes courte v yeres quene alſo welcome kynge iohn̄ fraunce kynge charles ſone myght well lerne many thynges ſurely alwayes chefe ymagynacyon pleaſure enquyre retayne wrytynge howe enfourmed takynge conſtable fraunce ſhall ſhewe yere matter fell rode cyte angyers towres towrayne laye nyght beauforte ye vale nexte day met knyght bretayne called ſyr wyllyam daucemys rydynge ſe lady mayll towrayne coſyne chyldren newly wydowe fell aquayntaunce knyght founde hym ryght curtoys ſwete wordes demaunded hym ſome tydynges ſpecyally takynge conſtable whiche matter glad knowe trouth therof ſhewed ſayd howe ben ye parlyament wannes ye lorde aucemys coſyne grete baron bretayne lyke maner ſyr eſpayne de lyon enfourmed thynges fallen foyze byerne gaſcoyne alſo ſyr iohn̄ ferrant parteke ſhewed matter portyngale caſtell lyke maner knyght ſhewed many thynges wolde haue done ryden longer company thus bytwene mounte le herry premylly iiii grete leages rode ſoftely way ſhewed many thynges ye whiche bare well remembraunce ſpecyally aduentures bretayne thus rode came nere premylly entred medowe knyght reſted ſayd god haue mercy ſoule good conſtable fraunce dydde one goodly iourney profytable royalme vnder baner ſyr iohn̄ de bewell conſtable newly come spayne demaunded hym howe ſhal ſhewe ſayd whē horſebacke ſo mounted rode forthe fayre eaſely rode ſayde ſeaſon haue ſhewed quod knight countre full englyſſhmen robber pyllers gaſcoyne breton almayns aduenturers nacions countre bothe ſydes ryuer loyre replenyſſhed warre bytwene fraūce englande newly renewed ſo maner theues robber entred countrey aſſembled fortifyed thē ſelfe conquere caſtell beauforde valey ye ſawe late handes countrey thus come purpoſe englyſſhmen gaſcoyns handes towne caſtell prinulley gretly fortifyed helde alſo ſmalle fortereſſes longe ryuer loyre whan ſo euer wolde ryde nombre bytwene thouſande eyght hundred fightynge men ſir bertram ſir iohan beull lorde mailly knyghtes countrey ſette ymaginacions howe myght delyuer coūtrey theſe people gathered toguyder fyue hūdred ſpeares ſpyes knewe whan englyſſhe men wolde ryde purpoſe come samure capytayns fortreſſes aſſembled guyder prinully whiche lytell v frenchman rode paſſed water ye ſe v layde thēſelfe buſſhment wode lytell beſyde ryght hande mornynge ſonne riſynge englyſſhe men departed prinully nyne hundred men whanne oure men ſawe knewe well muſt fyght cōmuned toguyder crye ſhulde call daye wolde haue cryed crye ſir bertrame wolde wyſe agre therto ouer ſayd wolde diſplaye baner day wolde fyght vnder baner ſir iohan de beull ennemyes came medowe lyghted right nowe ſoone entred brake buſſhement entred medowe ſoone ſawe v lyghted fote lykewiſe ſo entred eche within • ſore foynynge eche agaynſt dyuers bothe party ouerthrowen thus batayle endured longe ſpace without knowyng ſhulde haue vyctorie ſaye ye trouth choſen men armes many ennemyes yuell armed theues robber howbeit founde v worke ynoughe oure handes full ſir moris creſiquede ſir geffray richone ſir geffray careſnell morſonaſe folowed ſir bertam ſpurres came refreſſhed v threſcore ſpeares good men armes ruſſhed horſes brake oure ennemyes ſo brode coude nat aſſē ble toguyder agayne whanne capytayus theſe pyllers ſawe iourney wente agaynſt tooke horſes nat abode felde thre hundred ſlayne taken chaſe endured ſaynt mors ryuer loyre entred baſtell ſir robert sem robert herne richarde gylle iacomyne clerke theſe foure ſaued ſelfe paſſed ouer ryuer loyre ſo entred foure fortreſſes men helde ſyde ryuer taryed nat longe rode auuergne lymoſyn thus iourney coūtre aboute delyuered robber aſſembled nomore toguyder therfore ſaye ser bertram conſtable valyaunt man profitable realme fraunce ſir quod trewe valyaunt man ſo ſir olyuer cleſquyn whan named hym cleſquyn knight ſmyled demaunded hym ſmyled ſir quod ſhall ſhewe bycauſe ye name hym cleſquyn nat right name neuer thoughe euery man call hym ſo yet bretayne call hym ſame ser bertram lyued wolde gladly haue hadde refourmed coude nat amende worde redyer falle mannes tonge right name deſyred hym courteſy ſhewe great difference bytwene name nay ſir quod great difference called cleſquyn ſhulde named glaye aquyne ſhall ſhewe haue herde reported howe name came hym trouthe ye ſhall fynde written auncyent cronycles bretaygne wordes knight greatly pleaſed ſaid hym sir ye ſhall great pleaſure ſhewe mater ſhall neuer forgete ſir bertram ſo valyaunt knyght dedes ought put remembraunce true ꝙ knyght ſhall ſhewe thus ſir wyllyam aunſiens began tale ſeaſon whan charles great raigned fraunce conquered augmē ted faythe emperour rome kyng fraunce almaygne lyeth ayes chapell kynge charles rede fynde auncyent crony cles ye knowe well knowlege worlde knowen writyng haue nothyng ſounde vpon trouthe aproue ſcripture kyng charles spayne diuers tymes one tyme ſtyll ix yere without retournyng fraunce ſtyll went forthe conqueſt ſame ſeaſon • kyng ſarazyn called aquyn kyng bougie barbary right ouer agaynſt ſpaigne spaygne great countrey begynnyng ſaynt iohn̄s pie du porte realme arragon nauer biſquay portugale cōnymbres lixbone ciuyle tollet cordwayne lyon theſe incloſed within spayne great kyng charlemayne cōquerid theſe countreis ſeaſon kyng taryed ſo longe kyng aquyn bougy barbary aſſembled mē came ſee bretaygne arryued porte wannes hadde hym wyfe chyldren conquered went forwarde kynge charles well enfourmed viage howe kynge aquyn proſpered bretayne wolde nat breke vyage ſayd lette hym alone bretaygne ſhalbe ſmall mater delyuer countrey hym whan haue one • ubdued countrey brought holy faythe kynge aquyn buylded towre see ſyde nat farre fro wannes goodly fayre towre called glaye kynge aquyn lay moche whan kyng charles accompliſſhed vyage acquyted galyce spaygne myſcreantes kynges sarazyns deed ſlayne lande tourned chriſten faythe retourned bretaygne daye hadde great batayle agaynſt kynge aquyne nyghe myſcreantes ſlayne ſo kynge aquyne fledde caſtell glaye hadde redy foote towre ſhyppe therin entred wyfe chyldren wyfe made ſuche haſte ſo nere chaſed hadde leyſar take yong ſonne laye ſlepte towre yere olde thus kynge wyfe departed ſee chylde founde towre glaye brought kynge charlemaygne right ioyouſe hym ſaid howe ye chylde ſhulde baptyſed ſo rouland olyuer helde hym ouer fonte named olyuer kyng gaue landes father aquyn conquered chylde whan came age man good knight men called hym ſir olyuer de glaye aquyn bycauſe founde towre glaye ſome kynge aquyn thus haue ſhewed firſte fouudacyon ſir bertram cleſquyn ſhulde called glaye aquyne ſir bertram dayes puttynge kynge dōpeter caſtyle crowned kyng henry ſayde howe wolde go bougy demaūde herytage without fayle ſo done kyng henry lent hym men ſhyppes go bougye great armye great lette nat broken voyage whan̄e prince wale made warre vpon ſayde kynge henry dyde put hym downe puiſſaunce dyde ſette caſtyle agayne dō peter batayle marres ſir bertram taken priſonner ſir iohan chandos ſette raunſome hū dred thouſande frankes another tyme alſo taken batayle alroy raunſomed agayne hundred thouſande frankes thus ſir bertrams purpoſe brokenne warres bytwene englande fraunce renewed hadde ynoughe thus lynially diſcended fro kynge bougy named aquyne whoſe kyngdome barbarye thus haue ſhewed ryght diſcente ſir bertram cleſquyn thanked hym ſo came towne prinulley ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe frenche ambaſſadours came duke bretayne vpon takyng cōſtable fraūce aunſwere made cap xci ben longe cōpany knight ſir guyllyam aunſens ſir eſpayn de leon whā rode hym fro cyte pauyers ortayes byerne elles long ben ſir iohn̄ ferant pertelette portyngale wolde haue ſhewed many thyngꝭ nat ſo dyner whan rydden ii leages came forked waye one way right towres towrayne whether ſuppoſed ryde waye maylle whether knyght determyned ryde waye brake company takyng leaue eche bytwene prinulley departynge ſhewed many thynges ſpecially buſyneſſe bretayne howe byſſhoppe langers ſent ſtede byſſhoppe beawuoys dyed waye byſſhoppe langers ſir iohan de bowyll came duke bretayne anſwere informacyon knyght toke foundacion haue written foloweth ye haue herde fore howe theſe ambaſſadours departed fro parys fro kyng counſaye well ſtructed ſhulde ſaye ſo long rode iourneys aryued nauntes demaunded duke ſhewed thē howe marcheſſe wānes whe • moſt accuſtomably lay rode thyder ſo came cytie wannes xx myles bytwene duke caſtell called le mote came duke ſemblant made thē good ſwete recule byſſhoppe langers bycauſe prelate began ſpeke make prepoſicyon well ſagely ſayde sir duke ſente fro kynge maiſter fro vncles duke berrey burgoyne ſhewe vnto howe haue great marueyle voiage wolde haue made englande meanes broken haue taken raunſomed conſtable fraunce ſo highe raūſome ryght ſorie therof moreouer ye wyll haue thre caſtelles bretaygne whiche ſhalbe great anoyaūce reſydue coūtre ſhuloe holde agaynſt ayde towne iugone whiche pertaynynge conſtables herytage therfore charged ſhewe ſaye vnto meſſangers fro kynge mayſter vncles ye rendre agayne cōſtable fraū ce herytage ye holde hym ſette hym agayne peaſable poſſeſſyon accordyng vnto ryght lyke maner whan delyuered perforce none ryght tytell ye haue alſo ye reſtore agayne entierlye money ye haue hadde hym commaundement kynge counſayle ye come ꝑſonally parys ſhall pleaſe kyng aſſygne make excuſe repute hym ſo benygne pacyent ye blode royall wyll excuſe nat reaſonable duke berrey duke burgoyne wyll ſo temper hym ye ſhalbe frendes coſyn kynge reaſon ye ought byſſhopp̄ tourned hym ſir iohan beull ſaid sir nat kynges pleaſure ſayde yes ſo dyde ſir iohan de vyen theſe wordes mo preſent foure whan duke bretaine herde byſſhoppe langers ſpeke ſtudyed lytell good cauſe great matter laſte ſayde sir haue well vnderſtande wordes good reaſone ſo bycauſe ye ſent kyng vncles wherfore behalfe wyll honour reuerence bounde therto demaūde requeſt requyreth counſayle wherfore ſhall take counſayle myne make ſuche anſwere ye ſhall contented sir ye ſaye well quod ſuffyceth v departed wente lodgynges nyght deſyred dyne nexte daye duke nexte daye came duke well receyued ſo waſſhed went dyner ſatte downe firſte byſſhoppe langers bycauſe prelate duke admyrall fraunce thanne ſir iohan de beulle hadde great dyner well ſerued dyner entred counſayle chambre talked dyuers mater herde mynſtrelſy theſe lordes fraunce thought ſurely haue hadde anſwere hadde none wyne ſpyces brought ſo made collaſyon toke leaue departed lodgynge nexte daye apoynted come duke ſo dyde duke receyued ſwetely laſte ſayd sirr knowe well ye looke aunſwered wordes haue herde ſaye ye charged kyng vncles bring anſwere wherfore ſay yt haue done nothynge ſir olyuer cleſquyne wherof ſhulde repente ſauynge one thynge hadde ſo good markette eſcape lyue ſaued lyfe loue offyce nat perſone hath done ſoo many diſpleaſures ought hate hym deedly ſauynge diſpleaſure kyng vncles coūſayle takynge ſir olyuer haue nat therby broken voyage ſee wyll well excuſe ſelfe therin thought non yuell daye toke hym man ought take ennemy wherſoeuer fynde hym deed wolde thynke realme fraunce well ruled better counſayle caſtelles holde whiche hath delyuered poſſeſſyon ſo wyll withoute puyſſaunce kynge take fro rendringe money aunſwere haue ſo moche tyme paſte meanes ſir olyuer clyſquyn ranne dette gretlye therby nowe haue payde bounde vnto reaſon dette anſwere duke bretaygne made kynges ambaſſadours layde forthe reaſons enduce duke ſome reaſonable waye anſweres tourned euer one concluſyon whan ſawe none waye toke leaues departe ye duke gaue leaue than̄e retourned dyd ſo moch iourneys came parys houſe beautie beſyde wynſentes kyng quene thyder came duke berrey duke bourgoyne hauyng great deſyre knowe anſwere duke bretaygne haddemade aunſwere ye haue herde nede nat ſhewe agayne kyng counſayle nat content duke bretaygne ambaſſadours hadde made better exployte ſayde howe duke proude man preſumptuous mater ſhulde nat ſo reſte peace ſeynge matter ſo preiudyciall crowne fraunce entenſyon kyng counſayle make warre agaynſte duke bretayne duke loked nothynge elles ſawe knewe well howe greatly diſpleaſed kyng counſell hated ſo mortally conſtable toke fro hym good order reaſon repented hym ſore nat putte hym dethe whan hadde hym daunger thus mater contynued longe ſeaſon duke bretayne laye wannes lytell lytell rode ouer countrey freared greatly embuſſhmentes kepte ſtyll loue fauour cyties good townes made ſecrete treaty englyſſhmen made caſtelles fortereſſes well kepte thoughe opyn warre many imaginacions dede done somtyme wolde ſay wolde nat taken conſtable howe ſayd euer ſtoppe mennes mouthes ſir olyuer cleſquyn ſore diſhleaſed hym ſo many man ſayd elles wolde neuer haue done therby brought coūtre feare ſmall ſignorie prince nat feared douted menne worſte fall maye haue peace whan lyſt ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpeke duke bretaygne let v ſomwhat ſpeke buſyneſſe realme englāde whiche ſame ſeaſon horryble marueylous ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe kyng englandes vncles one accorde aliaūce agaynſt kyng counſaile murmurynge people agaynſt duke irelande aunſwere londoner duke glouceſtre cap xcii ye haue herde howe kyng englandes vncles duke yorke duke glouceſtre therle saliſbury erle arundell erle northumberlande erle notyngham archebyſſhoppe caūterbury theſe one alyaunce accorde agaynſt kynge counſayle theſe lordes nat content wt kynges counſayle ſayd among ſelfe duke irelande dothe kynge lyſte realme kyng wyll nat counſayled vnhappy men baſe lynage taketh regarde great lordes realme longe hath ſuche counſayle hym buſyneſſe englande nat well realme nat well gouerned kynge well counſayled ſuche vngracious people ſene poore man moūted gret eſtate fauoure mayſter often tymes corrupteth diſtroyeth people realme man baſe lynage canne nat knowe parteyneth honoure deſyre euer enryche haue thēſelfe lyke otter water whiche coueteth haue fyndeth hath profyte duke irelande ſo great kyng knowe full well fro whenſe came yet ſe realme ruled hym nat kynges vncles none blode ought nat ſuffred knowe well ynoughe erle oxenforde neuer ye grace valyaunt dede realme honour wyſedome counſayle gentylneſſe ryght well knowen well knowen one ſir iohan chandos prince wale houſe ſaynt andrewes burdeaux another demaūded mater ſhall ſhewe quod knyght preſent wyne brought day prince chambre many lordes englande hym whan prince dronke bicauſe ſir iohn̄ chandos conſtable acquitayne prince ſente hym cuppe firſt drinke toke cuppe dranke made therof none offre firſte erle oxenforde father duke irelāde ſir iohan chandos dronke ſquyer bare cuppe erle hadde ſuche diſpyte ſir iohan chandos hadde drōke hym refuſed cuppe wolde nat drinke ſayde ſquyer maner mocke go thy mayſter chandos bydde hym drinke shall go ſaid ſquyer hath dronke redy therfore drinke ſythe hath offred ye wyll nat drinke ſaynt george ſhall caſt drinke face therle whan herd douted squyer wolde ſayde ſo toke cuppe ſette mouthe dranke leeſt made ſemblant drinke ſir iohan chandos nat farre then ſawe well mater helde hym ſtyll tyll prince gone came erle ſayde sir aubery ye diſpleaſed dranke conſtable countrey maye well drinke ſythe lorde prince lordes cō tente therwith trouthe ye batayle poycters ſuche knoweth nat ſo well ye dyd • ſhall declare ¶whanne lorde prince hadde made voyage languedocke carcaſſone narbone retourned hyther towne bourdeaux ye toke go englande kynge ſayde cōmynge knowe right well yet nat demaunded ye hadde furnyſſhed voyage ye done ſonne prince ye aunſwered howe ye lefte hym good helth bourdeaux kynge ſayde howe durſte ye ſo bolde retourne without hym commaūded whan ye departed ye ſhulde nat retourne without hym payne ye myght forfayte retourne ſtraitly commaunde within four dayes ye auoyde realme retourne agayne hym fynde within realme fifth day ye ſhall leſe lyfe herytage euer ye feared kynges wordes reaſon ſo auoyded realme ſo aduē ture fortune good truely ye lorde prince foure dayes batayle poicters ſo ye hadde day batayle fourtie ſpeares vnder charge threfore nowe ye mayeſe wheder ought drinke nat ſyth conſtable • equytaygne erle orenforde ſhamed wolde gladlye hadde ben then tyme fayne ſuffre thoſe wordes ſir iohan chandos ſayde hym opyn preſence therfore nat marueyled thoughe duke irelande ſonne ſayd erle oxenforde diſdaynfull folowynge ſteppes father taketh vpon hym rule englande aboue kynges vncles well quod ſome ſhulde nat ſythe kyng wyll haue ſo thus people realme murmured dyuers place agaynſt duke irelande dyde one thyng greatly abated honour firſte wyfe doughter lorde coucy lady iſabell fayre lady good noble blode fell loue another damoſell quenes englande almaygne borne dyde ſo moche pope vrbayne rome deuorſed fro doughter lorde coucy without tytell reaſon preſumpcion ſynguler appetyte wedded quenes mayde kynge rycharde conſēted ſo blynded duke irelande ſayd ſir whyte tho ben blacke ye kyng wolde nat haue ſayd contrarye duke mother greatly diſpleaſed dede toke cōpany firſt wyfe lady coucy duke dyde yuell therfore length yuell came hym firſt princypall cauſe behated englande euery thyng turneth yuell muſt haue begynning yuell duke irelande truſted ſo moche grace fauour kyng beleued man ſhulde trouble hym cōmon renome englāde • ſhulde newe taxe rayſed realme euery fyre ſhulde paye noble riche beare poore kynges vncles knewe well wolde harde mater bringe cauſed certayne wordes ſowen abrode cyties good townes englande ſaye howe people englande ſore greued tare talenges howe great rycheſſe rayſed common people wolde haue accomptes gouernours therof archebyſſhop yorke duke irelande ſir symon burle ſir mychaell de la pole ſir nycholas brāble ſir robert try •• lyen ser peter golouſer ſir iohan saliſbury ſir iohan beauchampe maiſters staple wolles common ſayd wolde make trewe accōpte ſhulde founde golde ſyluer ſuffycient without rayſing newe ſubſydies common vſage none gladde pay money opyn purſes may lette brute noyſe ſpredde ſo brode englande ſpecially cytie london whiche chyefe cytie realme cōmons roſe ſayde howe wolde knowe howe realme gouerned ſayenge howe longe ſyth accompte made firſte theſe londoner drewe theym ſyr thomas woodſtocke duke glouceſtre thoughe yonger brother ſir edmonde duke yorke common people reputed duke gloceſtre valyant ſage diſcrete parſon whan came hym ſayde syr good cytie london recōmaundeth people ingenerall requireth take vpon gouernynge realme knowe well nat vnknowen howe kynge realme gouerned cōmon people complayneth ſore kynges counſayle demaundeth tayles vpon tayles aydes vpon aydes ſo realme hath ben greued tayles ſubſydies nat accuſtomed ſythe kynges coronacyon fyftie yere nat knowen richeſſe become wherfore ſir maye pleaſe prouyde ſome remedy elles mater wyll go yuell common cryeth theron duke anſwered ſayde fayre ſirs haue herde well ſpeke alone nat remedy mater howe ſe well ye haue cauſe cōplayne ſo hathe people though vncle kynge ſonne kyng though ſhulde ſpeke therof yet nothynge ſhalbe done kyng nephue hath ſuche coū ſayle nowe hym whome beleueth better hym ſelfe whiche coūſayle ledeth hym lyſte ye wyll come effecte deſyres muſt behoue haue youre accorde agrement cyties good townes englande alſo ſome prelate noble ꝑſonages realme ſo come toguyder kynges preſens brother ſhalbe ye maye ſaye kynge ryght dere ſir ye crowned yonge yuell ye haue ben counſayled yet hyther vnto ye haue nat takenne good regarde buſyneſſe realme reaſon poore yonge counſayle ye haue aboute wherby matter realme hath hadde ſmall yuell effectes ye haue ſene knowen ryght well god haddenat ſhewed grace realme loſte diſtroyed therfore ſir prenſens vncles requyre youre grace humble ſubiectes ought deſyre prince grace wyll fynde ſome remedy noble realme englande noble crowne therof whiche diſcended noble kyng edwarde thirde ye mooſt noble kynge euer ſythe englande firſte enhabyted maye ſuſteyned ſproſperyte honour people complayneth kepte maynteyned ryght whiche grace dyde ſwere daye youre coronacion maye pleaſe call togyther thre eſtates realme prelate barownes wyſemen cyties good townes may regarde gouernyng realme paſt well nat ſir parceyue hath well thanne ſuche offyce remaygne ſtyll longe ſhall pleaſe grace founde contrarye thaūe courteſſe maner auoyded fro perſone notable dyſcrete perſones ſette offyce firſt noble aduyſe conſent lordes vncles noble prelate barones realme ſirs quod duke glouceſter whan ye haue made ſupplycacion kynge wyll thanne make ſome maner anſwere ſaye wyll take counſayle mater deſyre haue aſhorte day peyſe ſo mater hande putte kynge ſuche marmoſettes hym ſome feare saye hym boldely realme wyll lengar ſuffre marueyle howe haue ſuffred ſo longe brother byſſhoppe caunterburye erle saliſbury erle arundell erle northumberlāde wyll without preſent ſpeke worde therof greateſt ꝑſonages englande ſhall ayde ſuſteyne wordes ſhall ſay howe deſyre reaſonable whan hereth v ſpeke wyll agre el dothe amyſſe thervpon apoynt tyme beſt counſayle gyue londoner anſwered ſayde sir ye counſayle v nobly ſir wyll harde v fynde ye kyng theſe lordes toguyder one place nay nay quod duke maye well done ſaynt george daye nowe within ſyre dayes kynge wyll wyndſore ye knowe well duke irelande wyll ſir symon burle many brother therle saliſbury ſhall therfore prouyde y• mater ayenſt tyme sir quod ſhalbe done ſo departed ryght well contente duke glouceſter whan ſaynt george daye came kyng quene wyndſore made great feeſt predeceſſours hadde done next daye feeſt ſaynt george thyder came londoner nombre threſcore horſe yorke many many othes dyuers good townes englande lodged towne wyndſore kyng determyned departe place thre leages then whan knewe commyng people ſpeke wt hym wolde ſooner haue ben gone ſayde wolde wyſe ſpeke vncles therle saliſbury ſayd ſir ye may nat honour thus departe people youre good townes englande come hyder ſpeke sir neceſſary ye knowe demaunde ye maye aunſwere el take counſayle aunſwere thus full ſore agaynſt kynges mynde fayne tarye came preſ • n great hall alowe kynge bothe vncles archebyſſhoppe caunterbury byſſhop wyncheſter chaunceler erle saliſbury erle northumber lande dyuers people made requeſt kyng burges london ſpake named ſir simeon subery ſage man well langaged declared well boldely effecte thinformacyon duke gloceſter ſhewed thē ye haue herde whan kyng herde hym well ſayd amonge cōmons realme requeſtes great long nat ouer ſoone ſpedde ſhall nat toguyder agayne long ſeaſon alſo great parte counſayle nat preſent therfore ſaye vnto gette home agayne ſytte reſte come nat agayne tyll feeſt myghelmas without ye ſente whiche tyme parlyament ſhalbe weſtmynſter come bringe requeſtes ſhall ſhewe counſayle good ſhall accepte ought refuſed ſhall condempne ſirs thinke nat wyll rewled cōmon people ſhall neuer ſene gouernynge gouernaunce yt rule vnder v ſe nothynge right iuſtyce ſeuyn one voyce anſwered ſayde right redouted ſouerayne ſayng gracyous diſpleaſure iuſtyce realme right feble grace knoweth nat canne nat knowe grace nouther demaundeth enquereth therfore ſuche coūſayle forbere ſhewe bycauſe owne profyte ſir iuſtyce cutte heedes handes fete ſuche maner punyſſhmentes nat laudable ſir good iuſtice kepe people ryght ſette ſuche wayes order myght lyue peace ſhulde haue none occaſyon grudge make commoſyon ſir ſaye ye ſette v longe daye mighelmas ſir may neuer ſo well eaſed nowe wherfore ſir ſaye one aſſente wyll haue accompte ſhortely hath gouerned realme ſythe coronacyon wyll knowe youre reuenewes become tax tayles ſubſydies nyne yeres paſte wheron haue beſtowed ſuche treaſourers make good accompte nere thervnto ſhall ryght ioyouſe ſuffre gouerne ſtyll nat acquyte ſelfe therin trewly ſhalbe refourmed youre deputyes eſtablyſſhed purpoſe lordes vncles thoſe wordes kynge behelde vncles helde peace ſe wolde ſaye ſir thomas duke glouceſter ſayde sir requeſt prayer theſe good people common realme ſe nothynge therin ryght reaſone sir quod duke yorke trouthe ſo ſayde prelate baron preſent duke glouceſter ſayde agayne sir reaſon ye knowe good become kyng ſawe well howe one accorde ſawe howe chafe marmoſettes durſt ſpeke worde many gret men agaynſt well quod kyng content lette rydde awaye ſommer ſeaſon cometh huntynge tyme whervnto wyll nowe entende kynge ſayd people sir wolde ye haue mater ſhortely diſpatched yea ſir quod humbly beſeche grace alſo beſeche lordes ſpecyally lordes vncles content quod apeyſyng party well kynge realme oure parte lyeth therin ſayde agayne deſyre alſo reuerende father god archebyſſhoppe caunterbury byſſhoppe lyncolne byſſhoppe wyncheſter aunſwered ſayde content ſo agayn deſyred lordes preſent erle saliſbury erle northumberlande ſir reynolde cobham ſir guy brian ſir iohn̄ felton ſir mathewe gourney moreouer ſayd wolde ordayne euery good cytie towne englande ſhulde thre four notable perſons ſhulde determyne hole cō montie englande mater determyned aſſemble vtas ſaint george weſtmynſter ye treaſourers collectours offycers kynges make accomptes theſe ſayd lordes kyng content therwith brought fayreneſſe nat byfore deſyre vncles lordes ſemed hym behouable knowe treaſoure become thus amiably euery man deꝑted fro wyndſore lordes went london treaſourers offycers ſende throughout realme come full accomptes payne diſhonourynge loſſe lyfe ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe day accompte came officer appered preſence kynges vncles commens englāde howe ſir simon burle priſoner ī toure london howe ſir thomas tryuet dyed cap xciii day prefixed came ꝑtes apered weſtmynſter ſuche ſhulde make accomptes apered kynges vncles ſuche prelate lordes aſſigned thē accompte endured moneth ſome made accomptes nother good honourable ſuche puniſſhed bothe bodyes goodes ſir symon burle caſt arerage iic lm frankes bycauſe one gouernours kynges youthe demaunded good beſtowed excuſed hym ſelfe byſſhop yorke ſir wylliam neuell ſayeng howe dyde nothyng counſayle kynges chamberleyns ser robert tryuilyen ſir robert beauchampe ſir iohn saliſbury ſir nycholas braule ſir peter goufer whan demaūded therof counſaile denyed mater layd faute hym duke irelande ſayd hym priuely bytwene two sir symon vnderſtande ye ſhalbe arested ſette priſon holde tyll ye haue payed ſōme demaunded nothyng ſhalbe abated go waye whether ſoeuer ſende ſhall rightwell make peace thoughe ſworne contrary ought receyue conſtable fraūce threſcore frankes raunsome iohan bretaygne ſonne ſaynt charles bloys whiche ſōme ye knowe well owyng ſhall preſent counſayle therwith tyme fynally kyng ſoueraigne lorde ſhall pardon forgyue clerely ye profet ought mannes el syr ꝙ ſir symon burle thought nat ye ſhulde helpe agaynſt kynge beare dedes wolde departe englande go almayne kyng beame thyder coulde welcome ſo let mater rynne ſeaſon tyll worlde better apeaſed duke ſayde ſhall neuer fayle companyons one ſect ye ſhall take day pay demaūde knowe well ye maye pay ye lyſte redy money hundred thouſande frankes ye nede nat feare dethe ye ſhall nat brought poynte ye ſhall ſe mater otherwiſe chaunge feaſt ſaynt michell whan haue kyng one wyll wherof ame ſure dothe tyme force agaynſt wyll muſte apeaſe theſe curſed londoner lay downe ſlaunder brute nowe rayſed agaynſt v sir symon burle lytell truſte wordes duke irelande ſo came lordes englande duke erles baron counſayle good townes ſayde hym sir symon ye haue alwayes ben notable knight realme englāde ye well beloued lorde prince ye duke irelande haue maner gouernynge kyng haue ſene mater well examyned whiche nother good faire gretly diſpleaſeth v owne ſake clerely determynyd hole generall counſayle ye muſt go priſon ye towre london remayne tyll ye haue brought chambre money kynges realmes ye haue gathered whiche apereth treaſourers rolles draweth ſome two hundred fyfty thouſande frankes nowe loke ye wyll ſay ſyr symon halfe diſcomforted ſaid sir ſhall good wyll alſo behoueth ſo fulfyll yo • cōmaundement ſhall go ye commaunde lordes require let haue clerke aſſigned maye write ſuche expenſes haue layde oute tyme paſt almayne beame procurynge kinges maryage reaſt beſeche let haue kynges grace may haue reaſonable dayes pay sir quod lordes content thus ſyr symon burle priſon towre london conſtable ſpake ser willyam helmon ſir thomas tryuet nat greatly ye fauour ſome barones englande commontie realme vyage made flaunders ſayd neuer englyſſhmen made ſo ſhamefull vyage byſſhoppe norwyche ſir hughe caurell capitayne calais excuſed layde others charge howe hadde taken money gyueng vp burbourcke grauelyng ſayd dede trayſon ſent ſir wylliam helmon came ſir thomas tryuer excuſed ſhall ſhewe howe ¶the ſame weke ſente beyng owne houſe northe ꝑte rode feldes vpon yonge horſe hadde ſpurred hym ſo horſe ranne awaye hym ouer buſſhes hedge laſte fell dyke brake necke ſo ſir thomas triuet dyed whiche great dōmage dethe greatlye complayned many good menne realme yet heyres fayne paye certayne ſomme floreyns counſayle kynges behoue ſayde chiefe encytyng thoſe mater came kynges vncles generall counſayle coū trey appered englande trouthe thoughe duke glouceſtre yongeſt brother age yet mooſt auncyent buſyneſſe realme drewe opinyon mooſt noble menne prelate common helde whan ſir them̄s tryuettes cōpoſicion made dethe maner ye haue herde therby penaūce ſir wylliam helmon greatly aſſwaged entred counſayle meanes valyantneſſe body good ſeruyce done dyuers tymes englande well bourdeloyes guyen picardye alwayes proued good knight nothynge layde reproche takynge money delyueraūce burborcke grauelynge excuſed hymſelfe fayre ſwete wordes made dyuers reaſonable reaſons ſayd lordes ſo euer lyke caſe yt tyme garyſon bourburke thynke wolde dyd haue herde ſir iohn̄ chandos ſir gaultier manny ſay dyuers tymes right wyſe gret valure howe man ought two iii wayes choſe beſt waye wherby moſt endomage enemyes thus ſir thomas tryuet beyng garyſons bourburke grauelyng ſawe howe encloſed party conforte aperyng v parte parceyued well howe coulde nat endure many aſſautes laye v choſen men armes euer ſawe trowe englyſſhemenne knewe iuſtely reporte harraude leeſt ſyxtene thouſande men armes knyghtes ſquyers xl thouſande nat paſte thre hundred ſpeares many archer alſo garyſone ſuche cyrcuyte coude nat entēde euery place well ꝑceyued aſſaut made v daye whyle oure defence one parte caſte fyre parte wherby gretly abaſſhed ennemyes right well parceyued therfore ſaye trouthe frenche kyng counſaile wrought great gē tylneſſe ſeyng ye caſe gyue v trewſe gyuen v another aſſaute nexte daye ordayned thynke hadde taken v pleaſure yet courteſly treated v meanes duke bretayne tooke great payne mater ſhulde haue gyuen theym money raunſommes hadde ben taken lykely gaue v money wherby dyde dommage haue endomaged v thought conquered greatly whan money departed oure ſelfe ſafe withoute trouble hadde v warre tyme fronters flaūders lordes beſyde pourge blame ꝑſone englande without knight eſquyer except ꝑſons lordes duke lācaſtre yorke gloceſter wyll ſaye abyde therby haue done vntrouthe kynge naturall lorde accuſe trayſon redye receyue gauge putte body aduenture dedes armes proue cō trarye iudge therto aſſigned ſhall ordayne theſe wordes ſuche valyauntneſſe knighte excuſed hym greatlye ſaued hym frome parell dethe afterwarde retourned agayne fourmer eſtate ryght valyaunt knyght auaunſed kynges counſayle tyme ſir symon burle nat delyuered priſone kynges vncles hated hym gretlye ſoo dyde commontie englande ky • ge dyde myght haue hadde hym delyuered ſeaſone laye shene counſayle ſaid myght nat rekenynges nat clere kynge departed ye duke irelande company rode towardes briſtowe quene ladyes damoſelles ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe kynge englande departed london howe ſyr symon burle beheded lō nephue alſo howe duke lancaſter dyſpleaſed cap xciiii kynge departed marcheſſe london yet kynges vncles counſayle departed nat taried ſtyll london ye haue herde often tymes ſayde heed ſicke membres nat well malady muſt firſt pourged ſaye bicauſe duke irelande ſo great kyng ruled hym lyſte ſir ſymon burle two princypall coū ſaylours kynge hadde longe ſeaſon gouerned kynge realme ſuſpecte hadde gadered richeſſe without nombre renoume ranne dyuers place duke irelande ſir symon burle long ſeaſon gathered toguyder money ſente almayne come knowledge kynges vncles counſaylours good cyties townes englande helde partie howe ſente caſtell douer ſee night tyme almayne certayne cofers cheſtes full money ſayd falſely felonouſly done aſſemble rycheſſe realme ſende ſtraūge coūtreys wherby realme greatly impoueryſſhed ye people ſoroufull ſayde golde ſyluer ſo dere gette marchandyſe deed loſte coulde nat ymagin meanes theſe wordes multiplied ſuche wiſe ordayned ye kynges vncles counſayles good townes anne • ed vnto ser symon burle de ser ued puniſſhment dethe alſo archbyſſhoppe caunterbury ſayd ſeaſon whan frēche kyng ſhulde haue come armye englande ſir symon burle gaue counſayle ſhrine ſaynt thom̄s caū terburye ſhulde haue taken downe brought douer caſtell noyſe wolde haue ſo thentent ben dāger haue taken ſtollen conueyed englād theſe mater ſo layde charge yt none excuſe coulde herde daye brought towre beheeded lyke traytour god haue mercy ſoule write ſhamefull dethe ryght ſore diſpleaſeth howe muſt nedes folowe hyſtorie greatly complayne dethe whan̄e yonge founde hym gentyll knyght ſage wyſe enfortune dyed nephewe heyre ſir richarde burle duke lancaſtre galyce ſameſeaſon caſe fell englande one ye moſt renoumed hooſt nexte conſtable ſouerayne marſhall hooſt chiefe coūſayle duke ye may well beleue whan knewe dethe vncle ſore diſpleaſed alſo gētyll knight ſir richarde burle dyed ſame iourney bedde reaſon ſickeneſſe many dyde ye ſhall place tyme conuenyent whan kynge rycharde knewe dethe knyght marcheſſe wale ſore dyſpleaſed ſware howe mater ſhulde nat paſſe ſithe ſo put dethe knyght without good reaſon tytell right quene alſo ſorie wepte dethe bycauſe fetched oute almaygne suche kynges coūſayle douted greatly duke irelande ſir nicholas brā ble ſir thomas tryuilyen ſir iohn̄ beauchampe ſir iohan saliſbury ſir mychaell de la poule alſo kyngꝭ vncles put offyce archebyſſhoppe yf yorke named wylliam neuell brother germayne lorde neuell northūberlande whiche byſſhoppe longe ben treaſourer englande duke glouceſtre charged hym medell buſyneſſe realme payne lyfe ſhulde go yorke therabout whe • pleaſed hym benifyce dwell ther medell alſo ſhewed hym howe honoure lynage preeſt excuſed hym many great mater ſore preiudiciall honour alſo ſhewed hym mooſt parte counſayle cōmontie wolde haue diſgrated putte dethe lyke maner ſir symon burle departed fro london wente northe dwell benifyce lynage ſore dyſpleaſed thought ſurely erle northombrelande brought mater paſſe lygnage neyghbours rome choſen right valyant wyſe ſage clerke ye archebyſſhop caunterbury gretely fauour kynges vncles come mountague salyſburies vncle erle salyſbury made kynges counſayle aduyſe comons therle salyſbury erle rycharde arundell erle northumberlande erle deuonſhyre erle notyngham ye byſſhop norwyche called ſir henry spenſer byſſhop wyncheſtre chauncellour englande abode ſtyll offyce kynges vncles moſt renomed man ye counſayle nexte ye duke gloceſte ſyr thomas mountague archbiſſhop caūterbury well worthy dyſcrete prelate toke grete payne reforme royalme brynge ryght waye kynge ſhulde put hym marmoſettes troubled royalme often tymes wolde ſpeke duke yorke yt matter duke wolde ſaye hym ſyr byſſhop truſt matter ſhall otherwyſe fall lytell lytell kynge nephewe ye duke irelāde thinketh muſt done accordynge reaſon abyde tyme haſty good meane ſurely yf hadde nat perceyued tymes wolde haue brought kynge royal ſuche caſe ſhulde haue ben poynte leſynge frenſſhe kynge counſayle knewe ryght well dealyng caſe cauſed yt frenſſhe men auaunce themſelfe haue come hyder ſo puyſſauntly wolde haue done haue dyſtroyed v ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe counſayle drewe togyder reformacyon kynge realme howe counſayle duke irelande kynge accorde make warre agaynſt vncles agaynſt cytees townes ca xcv lyke maner kinges vncles ye newe counſayle englande beynge london deuyſed buſyneſſe englā de reforme bring good eſtate ſyde duke irelande counſayle ymagined nyght daye howe myght contynue eſtates condēpne kynges vncles ye ſhall hereafter whanne kyng richarde come briſtowe quene hym kepte ſelfe caſtell men farre beleued ye kyng laye ſauour duke irelande ſaid wolde go irelande ſayd kyng wolde ſe hym diſpatched agreed generall coūſaile wolde go irelande ſhulde haue coſte realme fyue hūdred men armes fyftene hundred archer ſhulde abide thre yere well trewly payde howe duke great wyll make vyage ſawe well kyng yonge myght rule lyſt therfore feared ſhulde go farre loue fauour kynge ſhulde aſſwage alſo beſyde ſuche loue one quenes damoſelles called lancegrone yt wyſe coude leaue ſyght fayre pleaſaunt vamoſell come ye quene realme beame duke loued ſo entierlye wolde gladly deuorſed fro owne wife doughter lorde coucy dyde ſende entente rome pope vrbayne good people realme marueyle therof diſpreyſed hym greatly good lady dought̄ doughter good kyng edwarde ye good quene philyppe duke yorke duke glouceſtre toke dede great diſpyte hate duke irelande ſet lytell therby ſo blynded louynge damoſell promyſed deuorſed mary douted nat pope graunt ſo myght gette kynges quenes good wyll reputed wyfe frēche brought vp fraunce ſo father ye lorde coucy made warre agaynſt pope vrbayne tytell pope clemēt wherfore pope vrbayne loued nat yt blode therfore ſayde pope wolde enclyne lyghtlyer deuorſe mater duke dyde putte forthe promyſed lā cegrone mary duke mother wydowe called olde counteſſe oxenforde ſhe agreed nat opynion ſonne blamed hym greatly folye ſayde howe god wolde ſore diſpleaſed hym paye hym one day than̄e wolde late repente ſhe toke ducheſſe kept ſtyll eſtate ſuche ought ladye good wyll gaue great thankes therfore thus haue ſhewed parte buſyneſſe englande fell ſeaſon yet ſhalle procede enfourmed ye haue herde howe duke irelande aboute kynge march wale nyght daye ymagyned none thynge howe myght bringe entent ſo ſerued kynge quene fayre wordes pleaſe theym cauſed knyghtes ſquyers come buſtowe ſe kyng ye quene made great ſporte huntyng kynge ſuffred hym lyſte ſame ſeaſon kynge laye briſtowe ryuer syuerne march wale duke irelande tooke great payne ryde ſpecially wale ſayd ſuche wolde hym gentylmen howe kynges vncles haue ſoueraygntie realme hadde diſmyſſed kynges coūſayle noble valyaunt ſage perſonnages archebyſſhoppe yorke byſſhoppe dyrhame byſſhoppe london ſir mychaell de la poule ſir nicholas bramble ſir iohan saliſbury ſir robert tryuilyen ſir iohan beauchampe hym ſelfe hadde putte dethe valyaunt knyght ſir symon burle multiplye eſtate wyll diſtroye englande duke irelande dyde ſo moche preached ſo people knyghtes ſquyers wale countreis aboute mooſt parte beleued hym daye came ingenerall kynge briſtowe demaū ded hym pleaſure duke irelande hadde ſhewed theym kynge aunſwered ſayd yea truely prayed commaunded loued hym beleue hym ſayd wolde auowe ſhulde affyrmyng thought vncles hygh mynded ſo feared leſte wolde ſurmounte hym take awaye realme hym march wale alwayes loued prince wale father ye kyng ye tidynges herde march london thought iuſtely kyng duke irelande good cauſe ſo demaunded kynge pleaſure kynge aunſwered ſayd howe wolde gladly lōdoners hadde done hym ſo great treſpaſſes corrected brought reaſon vncles lykewiſe wale ſayd bounde obey kyng ought fayth homage man hym kynge ſoueraygne lorde wherfore ſayde redy go whyder ſoeuer kyng dyd commaunde kynge well cō tente aunſwere lykewiſe ſo duke irelande whan duke ſawe kyng wolde ſhewe buſyneſſe parteynynge hym ſelfe hadde ſo good deſyre diſtroye aduerſaries bringe theym reaſon hadde therof great ioye ſayde thē counſayle nat better retourne london ſhewe puiſſaunce ſo outher fayre wordes otherwyſe bring lōdoners accorde obeyſaunt kynges commaundement alwayes enfourmed kynge howe great loſſe realme whan many heedes chefe gouernours howe coude good come therby kynge affyrmed ye ſame ſayde howe wolde lenger ſuffre wolde fynde ſuche remedy realmes ſhulde take enſample realme nowe ſirs reporte haue nat good cauſe ſaye ye realme englande ſeaſon great paryll aduenture haue ben loſt without recouery kynge moued agaynſt vncles agaynſt great parte ye great lordes realme agaynſt hym cytes good townes one againſt another prelate hadde great indignacyon one agaynſt another ſo none coude remedy alonely god whan duke irelande ſawe agrement kyng mooſt ꝑte thē coūtrey wale came kyng ſayd ſir ye wyll inſtytute make lieutenaunt ſhall take xii fyftene thouſāde men go marcheſſe london oxenforde cyte myne wyll ſhewe puyſſaunce agaynſt theſe londoner vncles haue ſo great indignacyon agaynſt haue putte dethe ſome counſayle ſir outher fayre wordes otherwyſe ſhall bringe reaſon kynge ſayde content sayeng wyll ordayne cheife ſouerayne realme reyſe vp men ye gette theym leade wheder ye thynke beſt augment ſygnorie realme entent euery man ſhall clerely ſe hoole realme parteyneth wyll ye beare banner ſtanderdes abylmetes warre ſuche wolde beare ſelfe batayle thynke people ſe banner diſplayed ſhall take corage hardyneſſe ſuſteyne quarell wyll ye punyſſhe ſuche rebelles wyll nat obey ſuche wyſe maye take enſample beleue ſuche ſhall ſe banner waue wynde ſhall put ſelfe vnder ſhalbe afrayde diſobey cōmaū dement theſe wordes greatly reioyſed duke irelande ¶ohwe kyng englande made ſōmons drawe towardes london howe ſir robert tryuylyen taken weſtmynſter beheeded commaundement kynges vncles capi xcvi kyng made aſſemble countrey wale frō ters briſtowe longe ryuer syuerne dyuers lordes knightes ſende ſome excuſed ſelfe laufully ſome came kynges commaūdement howe douted leſte great yuell ſhulde come enterprice meane ſeaſon kynge duke irelande ſecrete counſayle bytwene determyned ſēde ſome men marcheſſe london ſe knowe howe kynges vncles dyd purpoſed ſtudyed whome myght ſende buſyneſſe knowe trouthe knyght coſyn duke irelande coū ſayle called ſir robert tryuilyen ſayd ſir ye make doute whome ſende truſty london loue ſhall take iourney wherof duke thanked hym lykewiſe ſo dyde kyng therwith ſir robert tryuilyen departed briſtowe diſguyſed maner poore marchaunt vpon lytell nagge ſo came london tooke lodgynge vnknowen ſo taryed certayne ſpace lerned coulde laſt vnderſtode kynges vncles newe counſayle englande wolde kepe ſecrete parlyament weſtmynſter wherfore thought go lye lerne ſhulde doone ſo came lodged weſtmynſter ſame daye counſaile began lodged al • houſe right ouer agaynſt palys gate chambre lokyng wyndowe downe courte myght ſe went coūſaile knewe nerehāde euery man none knewe hym bycauſe apparel laſt day aſquyer duke glouceſters knewe hym often tymes ben cōpany aſſone ſir robert triuylien ſawe knewe well withdrewe hym ſelfe ye wyndowe ſquyer ſuſpecious therof ſayd hym ſelfe thynke ſe yonder ſir robert triuylen thentent knowe trouthe entred lodgyng ſaid wife dame aboue chambre alone cōpany sir quod ſhe nat ſhewe hath longe ſpace therwith ſquier went vp better aduyſe hym ſaluted hym ſawe well true fayned hymſelfe tourned tale ſayde god ſaue good man pray nat myſcontented toke farmour myne eſſere ye lyke hym sir quod kente farmour ſir iohan hollandes men byſſhop caūterburyes wolde wrong come hyther complayne coūſayle well quod ſquier ye come ye palys wyll helpe make waye ye ſhall ſpeke lordes counſayle sir thanke ꝙ ſhall nat refuce ayde ſquyer called potte ale dranke payed badde hym farwell departed neuer ſeaſed tyll came coūſayle chambre dore called vſſher open dore vſſher demaūded wolde bycauſe lordes counſayle anſwered ſayd wolde ſpeke lorde mayſter duke glouceſter mater ryght nere toucheth hym counſayle thanne vſſher let hym whan came mayſter ſayde sir haue brought great tidynges quod duke sir quod ſquyer wyll ſpeke loude toucheth lordes preſent haue ſene ſir robert triuylyen diſguyſed vyllayns habytte alehouſe without gate triuylien quod duke yea truely ſir quod ſquier ye ſhall haue hym ye go dyner pleaſe contente quod duke ſhall ſhewe v ſome newes mayſter duke irelande go thy waye fetche hym loke thou ſtronge ynoughe ſo thou fayle nat ſquier went forthe toke foure ſergiauntes hym ſayd sir folowe farre ſoone make ſygne laye hande man go take hym lette hym nat eſcape therwith ſquyer entredde houſe tryuylien went vp chambre ſoone ſawe hym ſayd triuylien ye nat come countre goodneſſe lorde duke glouceſter cōmaūdeth ye come ſpeke hym knyght wolde haue excuſed hym ſelfe ſayde nat triuylien fermour ſir iohan hollandes nay naye quod ſquyer body triuylien habytte nat therwith made token ſergiauntes ſhulde take went vp chambre toke hym ſo brought hym palays ye may ſure great preaſe ſe hym well knowen takyng duke glouceſtre ryght ioyefull wolde ſe hym whan preſens duke ſayd triuylien thinge make countre kyng lefte hym triuylien whā ſaw ſo well knowen none excuſacion coude
