aueyle hym ſayd ſir kynge ſente hyther lerne tidynges briſtowe hunteth along ryuer syuerne quod duke ye nat cōe lyke wyſe man rather lyke ſpye yf ye wolde haue come haue lerned tidynges ye ſhulde haue come ſtate knyght sir quod triuylien haue treſpaſſed pardone cauſed well ſir quod duke mayſter duke irelande sir quod trouth kyng ſhewed v quod duke aſſembleth moche people kynge hym wheder wyll lede people sir quod go ireland irelande quod duke glouceſter yea ſir truely quod triuylien duke ſtudyed lytell ſayde triuylen triuylien youre buſyneſſe nouther fayre good ye haue done great folly come countre ye nat beloued ſhall well ſene ſuche affinyte haue done great diſpleaſures brother ye haue troubled power youre yuell counſayle kyng dyuers noble ye realme alſo ye haue moued certayne good townes agaynſt v nowe daye come ye ſhall haue payment dothe well reaſon ſhulde fynde thynke youre buſyneſſe wyll nother eate drinke tyll ye deed worde greatlye abaſſhed triuylen gladlye man wolde ende wolde fayne haue excuſed hym ſelfe fayre language lowly humblyng hym ſelf coude nothyng apeaſe duke ſo enfourmed hym duke irelandes ſecte nothyng aueyled hym ſhulde make lengar mater ſir robert triuylien delyuered hangman ſo ledde weſtmynſter beheeded hāged gibet thus ended ſir robert triuylien ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe tidynges came kyng dethe knight demaū ded counſayle theron howe ordayned duke irelande ſoueraygne men warre capi xcvii shortely theſe tidyngꝭ came kynge richarde duke irelande beyng briſtowe howe ſir roberte tryuylyen ſhamefully putte dethe kyng toke mater great diſpite ſayd ſware mater ſhulde nat reſt caſe howe vncles done yuell without tytle reaſon put dethe men knyghtes ſuche truely ſerued hym father prince wherby ſayde ſemed wolde take fro hym crown englande ye mater touched hym nere archbyſſhope yorke ſouerayne counſaile ben longe ſaid sir ye demaunde coūſayle ſhall gyue counſayle vncles ſuche ben accorde erreth greatly agaynſt ſemeth thē wolde ſhewe howe ye coūſailed traytors wolde haue none beate rule ſelfe great parell ye realme cōmons ſhulde ryſe rebell gret myſchefe ſhulde fall englande lordes great men nat frendes toguyder one wherfore ſir counſayle fynde remedy puiſſaūce ye countrey well peopled named sende cōmaundement ſuche boūde ſerue gentylmen whan aſſembled ſende marcheſſe london make generall capitayne duke irelāde gladly wyll take hym ye charge let baner penon borne onely ſhewe therby matter toucheth man countrey goyng thyder wyll tourne take parte wt drawe baners parauenture landoners wyll take parte hate nat ye dyde neuer diſpleaſure hurte ye haue vncles haue cauſed sir ſir nicholas bramble hath ben mayre lōdon ye made hym knyght ſuche ſeruyce dyde daye knoweth ought knowe maner lōdon borne ther nat yt hath good frēdes therfore ſir deſire coūſail mater yt toucheth ſo nere ſir yuell enformacyon rumoure people ye maye leſe ſignorye kynge ſpake ſir nicholas bramble requyred hym ſpeke kynges requeſt ſir nycholas ſayd sir lyke grace lordꝭ preſent ſhall ſpeke gladly lytell knowledge haue fyrſt ſaye nat beleue mooſt ꝑte londoner oweth loue fauour kyng perfitely loued prince father well ſhewed whan villayns rebelled accordyng ye trouthe hadde taken parte villayns diſtroyed kyng realme moreouer kynges vncles haue nowe good tyme diſport ſelfe among enforme people lyfte none ſaye agaynſt haue put kynges fycers haue put affynite haue ſente kynge hyder one border realme good ymagined nat knowen per •• rely entende herde mater ſhewe wolde putte kyng realme go puyſſaunce kynge dothe gentylneſſe haue put dethe gentyll knyght ſir symon burle hath doone kyng moche fayre ſeruyce realme englade place layde great falſeneſſe hym ſhulde haue delyuered caſtell douer frenche men enformed people cauſed frenchman come flaūders sluſe whiche nothyng ſo alſo diſpyte kyng haue ſhā fully ſlayne ſir robert triuylien ſo wyll maye atteygne entente wherfore ſaye better kyng vſe rygour puyſſaūce gentylneſſe euery man knoweth thorough realme kyng howe weſtmynſter ye noble kyng edwarde made euery man ſworne bothe lordes prelate good townes dyſceaſe ſhulde take kynge ſoueraygne lorde ſame othe made thre vncles ſemeth many men dare ſpeke holde nat ſtate fourme kynge may nat owne lyſt driue hym penſyon quene alſo whiche herde thyng kyng quene ſhulde ſeme wolde ſhewe wytte rule themſelfe coūſaylours traytours ſaye theſe thynges nat ſuffred hadde rather dye longe lyue daūger peryll ſe kynge ledde vncles wolde haue hym kynge thanne ſayd surely pleaſeth nat v ſaye ye haue counſayled honourably maye honour v realme counſayle briſto ordayned duke irelande ſhulde ſoueraygne kynges men warre ſuche coude get go lō knowe perfyte entente londoner truſtynge myght one ſpeke • ourne acorde reaſon ſuche proftes wolde make kynges name ſo within ſhorte ſpace duke irelande fyftene thouſand men deꝑted fro briſtowe rode cytie oxenforde aboute lodged people baners diſplayed kynges armes none ſhewe dyde kynges tytell quarell tydingꝭ came kynges vncles duke irelande aproched towardes lōdon xv thouſande men kynges baners diſplayed daye lordes counſayle weſtmynſt • r thē chefe lōdon ſuche truſted beſt ſhewed duke irelāde comyng agaynſt armye royall londoner enclyned partie ſayde ſirs let thē come name god yf duke irelande demaūde v batayle ſhall haue incō tynent cloſe gate haue xv men nat xx duke right ioyfull anſwere incō tynent ſent knyghtes ſquyers meſſangers aſſemble men warre togyder fro dyuers ꝑties ſuche ſent obeyed ſo ſworne promyſed men came fro ye byſihaprike caū terbury norwiche coūties arundell suſſex saliſbury southampton countreis therabout london ſo great nombre people came lōdon knewe nat ſhulde ¶howe duke irlande ſente thre knyghtes london knowe ſome tydynges howe kynges vncles london went feldes fyght duke irelande affinyte cap xcviii nowe let v ſōwhat ſpeke duke irelande coūſell oxford xvm men howbeit moſt parte come thyder conſtraynt rather good corage ye duke irlande aduiſed knowe thentētes thē lōdon ſende ſir nicholas brā ble ſir peter golofer ſir michaell de la pole towre london go thyder water ſet kynges baners hyght towre ſe londoner wolde theſe thre knyghtes ye duke irlandes requeſt deꝑted fro oxēforde next day paſſed tēmes bridge stanes rode dyner shene ye kynges place taryed tyll late fro then rode another houſe kyngꝭ called kenyngton lefte horſes toke botes went downe water ye tyde paſſed lōdon bridge ſo came towre nat knowen man ware comynge froūde redy capitayne ye towre kynge ſette hym theſe knyghtes knewe moche dealyng lōdon kynges vncles capitayne ſhewed howe come thyder lodge great daūger ſo ꝙ kynges ſeruaūtes may well lodge houſe nat ſo quod capitayne cytie counſaile wolde gladly vnder obeyſaūce kyng ſo wolde ruled vncles none ſhewe good wyll boūde ſhew coūſaile beſt power dout morowe whan day cometh knowen london ſeruauntes kynges become hyther ye ſhall ſe towre beſieged bothe lande water londoner nat deꝑte hen tyll ſe knowe lodged within ye founde ye ſhalbe incontynent preſented kynges vncles ye may well ymagin ende ye ſhall come thynke ſo ſore diſpleaſed agaynſt kynges coūſayle agaynſt duke irelāde ye taken ye ſhall nat eſcape lyues ſtudy well vpon theſe wordes aſſure true ¶than theſe thre knightes wende haue done marueyls fore abaſſhed determyned tary night ſecrete coulde feare ſpyeng capitayne promyſed kepe ſure nyght ſo kept keyes hym mornynge theſe kynghtes dyuers ymaginacions counſayles ſe howe ſhulde deale thynges cōſydred durſt nat abyde aduenture knowen feared greatly beſeged day came whan fludde come tooke barge paſſed bridge went kenyngton whan daye toke horſes rode wyndſore taryed nyght nexte day rode oxēforde founde duke irlande men ſhewed theſe tidynges howe durſt nat tary towre lōdon duke penſyfe thoſe tidynges wyſt nat ſay knewe well people yt aſſembled nat one corage wherfore wyſt nat wheder better retourne ye kyng abide toke counſayle knyghtes fynally coūſayle reſted ſythe ye kyng ordayned hym conſtable ouer people correcte punyſſhe rebelles ſhulde kepe felde ſhulde otherwyſe ſhulde great blame rebuke bring indignacion kyng ſhewe quarell nother good right alſo ſaid better dye honour abyde aduenture ſhewe falſe corage counſayled hym ſende worde caſe kyng briſtowe yet ſayd bleſſed god kepte feldes none recoūtre thus ye duke ſent kyng deſyring hym ſende hym ayde kyng dyde daylye tidynges came kynges vncles lōdon duke irlande company marcheſſe oxenforde toke counſayle beſt kynges vncles archebyſſhop caūterbury erle arundell erle salyſbury erle northumberlande dyuers lordes knyghtes englānde ruler london ordayned duke glouceſter without delay ſhulde iſſue feldes mayre london ſhulde putte harneſſe people euery warde ſuche wolde ayde sayeng ſurely howe wolde go fyght duke irlande wherſoeuer coude fynde hym mayre london man armes toke choſen men bytwene age twentie yeres xl lordes thouſande men armes departed fro london went lodged braynford nexte daye colebroke dayly nombre encreaſed ſo toke waye redyng paſſe temmes aboute bridge bytwene wyndſore stanes broken cōmaundement duke irelande long iourneyed aproched nere oxenforde tidynges therof none came duke irelande beganne dout toke counſayle coū ſayled take feldes put people order batayle diſplay yt kynges baners ſayeng grace god ſaynt george iourney ſhulde deuyſed ſo doone ſowned trumpettes euery man armed hym iſſued oxenforde order batayle kynges baners diſplayed day fayre clere pleaſaunt ſeaſon ⸪ ⸪ ¶how kynges vncles wan iourney agaynſt duke irelāde howe fledde dyuers company cap xcix tidinges came duke glouceſter beyng within thre leages oxenforde ryuer ſyde whiche falleth tē me lytell beſyde oxenforde howe duke irelande drawen feldes order batayle wherof duke glouceſter great ioye ſayde howe wolde fyght hym myght paſſe ryuer trumpettes ſowned ye diſlodging ordered ſelfe redy fyght within two leages ennemyes ſertched paſſe ryuer ſente oute people ſertche depneſſe water foūde ryuer ſuche apoynt xxx yeres nat ſo baſe ſo ye ſcurers paſſed eaſe rode aduyſed maner ennemyes retourned duke glouceſter ſayd sir god ryuer daye parte ryuer ſo lowe nat horſe bely ſir haue ſene maner duke irelāde redy raynged felde good maner nat ſaye kyng kyngꝭ baners armes englande fraunce none well ꝙ duke goddes name ſo armes brother haue parte auaūce forward name god ſaynt george let v goſe thē nerer euery man rode forthe great courage whan knewe myght paſſe ryuer eaſe ſo ſhortlye hooſt paſſed ryuer tidynges came duke irelād howe kynges vncles paſſed ryuer tēmes ſhulde haue batayle brefely duke irelande abaſſhed knewe well taken ye duke gloceſter wolde cauſe hym dye ſhamefully nouther golde ſyluer ſhulde raunſome hym ſayde ſir peter golofer ſir mychaell pole ſirs ſurely corage beareth yuell agaynſt iourney dare nat abyde ye bataile agaynſt kynges vncles take ſhall dye ſhamefully howe deuyll paſſed ryuer tēmes poore token v ſir quod two knyghtes wyll ye wyll ſaue myſelf alſo quod duke reſt ſaue well ſir quod knyghtes lette v drawe ſelfe ſyde wynge ſo ſhall haue two ſtrynges bowe ſhall ſe howe men well ſhall abyde honour ye kyng hath ſent v hither diſcōfited ſhall take yt feldes take aduauntage flyeng ſaue ſelfe may coūſayle holden good duke theſe two knyghtes rode long batayle made good vyſage ſayd sir kepe batayls good order grace god ſaynt george ſhall haue daye fayre iourney ryght kynges quarell therfore ſhall ſpede better thus rode vp downe diſſymulynge laſte gette ſelfe preaſe ſo came one corner batayle made wynge therwith came duke yorke duke glouceſtre lordes baners diſplayed makyng great noyſe trumpettes ſoone duke irelandes company ſawe cōmynge ſo good order ſo fierſly ſo aba • ſhed helde none arraye tourned backes fledde ye noyſe ran howe duke irelande coū ſayle • edde gone ſo euerye man fledde ſome hyther thyder wyſte nat whyder without makynge defence duke irelande two knyghtes counſayle fledde biforce horſes mynde returne towne oxenforde withdrewe then moche myght whan ye duke glouceſter ſawe demeanour enemyes ſawe howe fledde hadde remorſe conſciēce wolde nat ye yuell myght haue done knewe well many preſente rather conſtraynt inſytacion duke irelande good loue therfore ſayd men sir iourney charge euery man payne dethe ye ſlee man without make defence ye gete knightes ſquyers bring cōmaundement done ſo fewe ſlayne without preaſe rode one ouer another ye chaſe taken lytell ſir iohan beauchampe ſir iohan saliſbury preſented duke gloceſter right ioyous duke tooke waye oxenforde gaue leaue men warre retourne owne houſes thanked ſeruyce done hym brother ſayd ye mayre london company sir departe home agayne wherof gladde thus departed armye ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe duke irelande company fledde howe kynges vncles oxenforde howe ſir nycholas brāble beheeded howe kynge ſent byſſhop caunterbury capi c howe ſhall ſhewe became ye duke irelande ſir peter golofer ſir michaell de la pole ſhewed ſaued thēſelfe nedefull thē hadde ben taken ſuffred dethe without mercy nat ſaye went kyng nat dyde taried nat long departed realme englāde aſſone coude haue herde reported rode wale toke ſhypping carleon ſayled scotlande came edenborowe toke another ſhyppe ſayled coſtyng friſelande yle theſeley coūtre hollande ſo came arryued towne dondreſt gladde enformed duke irelāde long cōueyed lōbardes moche golde ſyluer brugꝭ feare caſueltes though great kyng yet always douted ye kynges vncles cōmons realme wherfore made prouiſyon hande money ayde hym whan nede ſhewed threſcore thouſande frankes receyued redempcyon chyldren bretayne ſpecially iohn̄ bretayne guy deed whiche money ſayde founde redy cō mynge ſhulde receyue thre yere threſcore thouſande frankes wherfore nat abaſſhed ſubſtaūce ſuffycient longe ſpace whan duke aubert bauyer haynalte holande zelande gouernaunce vnder erle willyam brother lyuynge whan vnderſtode duke irelande come fugetyue englande towne dordreſt ſtudyed imagyned lytell thought ſhulde nat longe abyde ſeynge fledde englande yuell wyll coſyn germayns whome bare loue fauour alſo conſydred howe duke irelande dalte yuell coſyn germayen lady iſabell englande lady coucy wherfore commaunded duke irelande bycauſe hadde diſpleaſed coſyns englande broken laufull mariage wolde mary another wyfe ſhulde departe countrey gette hym another lodgynge ſhulde nat ſuffred abyde towne countrey whan duke herde douted ſhulde taken delyuered handes enemyes humyled hym ſelfe greatly ſente hym ſayde wolde gladly obey duke aubertes commaundement ſo payed truſſed entred veſſell ryuer mornegue dyd ſo moche water lande came berette whiche towne pertayned byſſhoppe trece well receyued taryed tyll harde tydinges nowe let v leaue ſpekyng hym ſpeke englande endynge iourney kynges vncles agaynſte duke irelāde beſyde oxenforde euery man gone home byſſhoppe caunterbury two duke taryed ſtyll oxenforde nat tell howe long beheededde lytell beauchampe ſir iohan saliſbury iuſtyce two duke retourned lō taryed ſeaſon ſome tidynges fro kynge coulde none briſtowe thanne lordes weſtmynſter inſtigacion archebyſſhoppe caunterbury determyned ſhulde honourable ſende kynge briſtowe ſhewe hym amyably hath ben certayne ſpape agaynſt mooſt parte realme loued hym better gladder kepe honour ſuche marmoſettes hath beleued realme hath ben great trouble peryll meane ſeaſon brought lōdon ſir nycholas bramble taken wale fledde iourney haue ſaued hym ſelfe whoſe takynge kynges vncles right ioyfull ſayde howe wolde make ſtoore hym ſhulde go ſame waye hadde done coude neuer excuſe hymſelfe muſt dye beheeded without london dethe ſore complayned ſome men london hadde mayre london well gouerned offyce dyde one day great honour kyng whan ſlewe owne handes lyſter wherby rebelles diſconfyted good ſeruyce kynge made hym knyght maner haue ſhewed beheeded reaſon ouermoche beleuynge duke irelande dethe ſir nicholas bramble kynges vncles ſawe ſuche hated wolde haue oute kynges counſayle deed fledde waye thought kynge realme ſhulde brought good order thoughe ſlayne ſome kynges counſayle chaſed theym awaye yet coude nat take awaye ſignorie kyng thought rule realme good forme honour kynge realme ſayd byſſhop caū terbury sir ye ſhall go lyke ſelfe briſtowe kyng ſhewe hym caſe buſyneſſe realme recōmaunde v hym ſhewe hym behalfe gyue credence lyght enformacion agaynſt v hath beleued ſome moche owne honour ꝓfyte realme ſaye alſo hym requyre hym ſo good people london wolde come hyder ſhalbe welcome receyued wt gret ioye ſhall ſet ſuch coūſaile hym yt ſhalbe well pleaſed charge retourne nat agayne withoute hym deſyre hym nat diſpleaſed thoughe haue chaſed awaye meny traytours hym realme great paryll leſynge byſſhop ſayd ſhulde ryght well meſſage ſo departed rodde forthe lyke great prelate ſo came briſtowe kynge priuye cōpany ſuche wont haue ben counſayle deed fledde awaye ye haue herde byſſhop towne two nightes day ye kyng wolde ſpeke hym ſo ſoore dyſpleaſed vncles driuynge awaye duke irelande whome loued aboue men ſleeynge knyghtes finally ſo entyſed conſented archbyſſhop ſhulde come preſens whan came hym humyled hym ſelfe greatlye kynge ſhewed kyng euery worde kynges vncles gyuen hym charge ſhewed hym pleaſure come londou palys weſtmynſter vncles mooſte parte realme wolde ryght ioyeouſe elles wyll ryght ſorte yuell diſpleaſed ſayde ſir without comforte ayde accorde vncles lordes knyghtes prelate good cyties townes englāde ye canne nat come youre entente ſpake theſe wordes boldelye ſayde moreouer sir ye canne nat reioyſe ſo moche youre ennemyes make warre youre frendes kepe youre realme warre myſchiefe yonge kynge reaſone byſſhoppes wordes beganne enclyne howe beheedynge knyghtes counſaylours came ſore courage dyuers ymaginacions finally refrayned diſpleaſure good meanes quene ye lady boeſme ſome wiſe knightes hym ſir rycharde stoner thanne kyng ſayd byſſhoppe well content go lō wherof biſſhop right ioyous alſo hym great honoure hadde ſpedde iourney ſo well within ſhorte ſpace kyng departed lefce quene ſtyll briſtowe ſo came towardes london ye archbyſſhoppe company ſo came wyndſore kyng taryed thre dayes tidynges came london howe kynge commynge euery manne gladde ordayned mete hym honourablye daye departed fro wyndſore way fro braynforde london full people horſe backe foote mete kynge two vncles duke yorke duke glouceſter iohan ſonne duke yorke erle arundell erle saliſbury erle northumberlande dyuers lordes knyghtes prelate departed london mette kyng two myle fro braynforde receyued hym ſwetely ought ſoueraygne lorde kynge bare yet ſome diſpleaſure herte paſſed made ſmall countenaunce thē waye talked mooſt biſſhop lōdon laſt came weſtmī ſter kyng alyghted pali whiche redy apparelled ye kyng dranke toke ſpyces vncles alſo prelate lordes knyghtes ſome tooke leaues kynges vncles archebyſſhoppe caunterburye counſayle taryed ſtyll kyng ſome palais ſome abbey towne weſtminſter kepe kynge company nere toguyder co commune buſyneſſe determyned ſhulde done ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe kynge vncles lordes englande ſente come weſtmynſter generall counſayle holden cap ci generall parlyament ordeyned holden weſtmynſtre prelate erles baron knyghtes ye counſayles good townes cytees englāde ſent ſuche helde kyng archebyſſhoppe cauntorbury ſhewed kynges vncles counſayle kynge rycharde crowned kynge englande euery man ſworne made theyr releues hym whā receyued theyr faythes homage within age knyge ought nat gouerne royalme tyll xxi yeres age meane ſeaſon gouerned vncles nexte kynne wyſe men byſſhop ſayd bycauſe kynge newlye come age xxi yeres wherfore counſayled euery man ſhulde newe ſworne renewe releues euery manne newe knowledge hym ſoueraygne lorde counſayle excepted kynges vncles coūſayle entent prelate lordes counſayles good cyties townes ſent come weſtminſter daye aſſigned euery man came thyder none diſobeyed ſo moche people london weſtmiſter kyng richarde chapell palys rychely apareyled crowne heed archebyſſhoppe caūterbury ſang maſſe maſſe ye biſſhoppe made collaſyon kyngꝭ vncles dyde homage kyng kyſſed hym ſware ꝓmyſed hym faithe homage euer lordes ſware prelate handes ioyned togyder dyde homage aparteyned kyſt kynges cheke kyng kyſt good wyll ſome nat nat warde loue behoued hym ſo wolde nat go fro counſayle vncles ſurely might haue entent wolde nat haue done dyde rather haue taken crewell vengeaunce deche ſir symon burle knyghtꝭ putte fro hym ſlayne without deſert thought ordayned ye coū ſayle archebyſſhop yorke ſhulde come pourge hym ſelfe hadde alwayes duke irelandes parte agaynſt kynges vncles whan yt byſſhop yorke herde douted hym ſelfe knewe well nat ye fauour kynges vncles therfore ſente excuſe nephue ſonne lorde neuell came london came firſt kynge ſhewed hym vncles excuſe dyde homage byſſhoppes behalfe kyng toke well loued hym better byſſhoppe caunterbury ſo hym ſelfe excuſed byſſhoppe elles ben yuell kynges loue forbare hym toke excuſe ſo taryed ſtyll byſſhoprike longe ſpace durſte nat lye yorke taryed new caſtell ryuer tyne nere brother lorde neuell coſyns eſtate tyme buſyneſſe englande ſo longe ſpace ye kyng nat mayſter ouer counſayle vncles bare rule nowe wyll leaue treat mater englāde ſpeke buſyneſſe kyng caſtyle kynge portyngale warres ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe kynge portyngale puiſſan̄ce aſſembled duke lancaſtre puyſſaunce howe coude nat paſſe ryuer derne howe ſquyer caſtyle ſhewed thē paſſage cap cii reaſon ſythe mater ſo requyreth retourne agayne ye duke lācaſtres iourney howe ꝑceyuered al ſeaſon galyce ſhall begyn lefte haue great deſyre make ende ſtorie whan duke lancaſtre conquered towne caſtell dauranche galyce brought vnder obeyſaunce refreſſhed hym foure dayes founde well wherwith fyfthe day departed ſayde wolde go caſtell noy ſo dyde lay four dayes fayre medowe alonge ryuer ſyde grounde dried vp reaſon heate ſonne water corrupted ſo horſes wolde nat drinke therof ſuche dyde dyed thanne ordayned diſlodge then tourne agayne auranch ſir richarde burle ſir thomas morryaulx marſhalles hooſt ſayd nat poſſyble get ſtrong raſtell noy longe ſiege great wyſedome diſpence moche artillary alſo tydinges came duke lancaſtre kynge portugale approched hooſt nombre thouſande ſpeares tenne thouſande able men two hooſtes togyder lykely great dede duke lancaſtre hadde fyftene hundred ſpeares knightes ſquiers ſixe thouſande archer theſe tydinges reioyſed greatly duke lancaſtre ſo diſlodged fro noy wente agayne auranche galyce duke ſente ducheſſe wyfe ladyes damoſelles duke ſayd wolde abyde kynge portugale ſo dyde ye ſhall knowe whan kyng iohan portugale marſhalles take towne feroullꝭ rode aproched auranch come duke lācaſtre way founde towne padrone whiche rebelled againſt thē firſt comyng yelded kynges obeyſaunce kynge taryed march fyftene dayes waſted greatlye countrey vitayls yet great plentie comyng dayly fro portugale thus theſe two great hooſtes galyce greatly impoueryſſhed countre dayes waxed ſo hote yt man coude ſtyrre nyne clocke without wolde brent ſonne duke lācaſtre ducheſſe aurache men abrode countrey great pouerie lacke vitayls thē ſelfe horſes nothynge good ſwete coulde growe grounde ſo drie brent ſōne grewe lytell worthe ſeaſon ſo hote brent englyſſhe men wolde haue thynge ſelfs or▪ horſes behoued ſeruauntes go forragyng xii ſixtene twentie myles great payne daunger englyſſhmen founde wynes ſo ſtronge hoote brynning corrupted heedes dried bowelles brente lightes lyuers remedy coude fynde lytell good water temper wynes refreſſhe whiche cō trary nature englyſſhe men owne coūtreis ſwetely noriſſhed brēt within endured great pouertie great lordes wanted accuſtomed vnto owne countreis whan knyghtes ſquyers englande ſawe daunger myſchefe likely lacke vytayle heate ſonne whiche dayly encreaſed began murmure ſaye hoſt dyuers place feare iourney wyll come ſmal effect ende lye long one place true ſayd two thynges greatly contrarye v leade company woman wyues deſyreth nothyng reſt one dayes iourney wylles wolde reſte fyftene diſtroyeth v wyll ſoone came coulongne gone forwarde ſpedde well brought countre good obeyſaunce none wolde haue ben agaynſt v longe taryeng hath enforced ennemyes nowe haue prouyded men warre fraunce thē townes cyties paſſages kepte cloſed agaynſt v thus diſconfyted v withoute batayle nede nat fyght v realme spayne nat ſo pleaſaunt lande traueyle fraunce englande wherin good village fayre coūtreis ſwete ryuers faire medowes attemperate ayre menne warre contrarye ment oure lorde duke lancaſtre thought wynne countrey leade company woman chyldren great let without reaſon knowen spaygne el bretherne true enherytours countrey leeſt wyfes doughters kyng peter doyng conqueſt tournyng townes woman lytell therin thus haue ſhewed people langled duke lancaſters hooſt one another tidynges came duke kyng portugale aproched nere wherof ioyfull whan kynge within two leages duke knyghtes mounted horſes rode mete hym mette amiably companyes kynges hole hooſt nat taryed behynde guydyng ſixe great lordes portugale ponnaſe congne vaſe martyn de merlo poſdiche de aſne degouſe salnaſe de merlo ſir anlne perrier marſhall iohan radighes deſar dyuers kyng thre hundred ſpeares aurāche kynge duke togyder fyue dayes toke counſayle toguyder fynall concluſyon ſhulde ryde togyder enter countrey campe go towne arpent ſir olyuer cleſquyne conſtable spaygne wyſt nat paſſe ye ryuer derne whiche fell orgulous certayne tymes ſpecially rather ſomer wynter whan ſnowe froſte melteth moūtayns reaſon ſonne ryuer mooſt depeſt moſt dangerous paſſe wynter froſyn ryuers baſe lowe yet yt concluded ryde coūtre campe truſtyng ſome place fynde ſome paſſage concluſyon publyſſhed throughe hooſtes wherof euery man ioyfull lyen along ſpace ſore oppreſſed great daunger auranche ther many ſore diſeaſed thus kyng portugale yt duke lācaſtre departed fro auranche rode toguyder hoſtes ſeperated two partes bycauſe none vnderſtode maner aqueyntāce toguyder alſo eſchewe riottes debate myght haue fallen bytwene portugales hote haſtye lykewiſe englyſſhmen diſpytefull fierſe thus apoynted man hals bothe hoſtes lodge forrage diuers partes nat toguyder thus rode forthe chat puyſſaunce able fyght iourney kynge iohan caſtell adhenrentes longe iourneyed came ryuer derne whiche nat eaſy paſſe depe highe bankes full great broken ſtones ſo certayne bridge whiche broken elles ſo well kepte yt maner impoſſyble paſſe might nat gette ouer theſe two hoſtes great ymaginaciōs might paſſe ſo fell ſir iohn̄ holande conſtable englyſſhe hooſt marſhalles ſir richarde butle ſir thomas moreaulx forragers rode encountred ſquier caſtell called donnage bangher knewe well paſſages countrey knewe one paſſage bothe horſmen fote men might eaſelye paſſe riuer came ouer ſame paſſage taken brought ſayd lordes ryght glad ſo ſtreitly examyned alſo wordes conſtable ſayde hym howe wolde quyte raūſome gyue hym good rewarde wolde ſhewe myght paſſe ſurely ryuer ſayde herde howe one ſure paſſage ouer ryuer ſquyer toke lyght aduyſement couetous conſtables offre gladde delyuered handes ſayd sir knowe well paſſage ſhall ſhewe ſhalbe guyde ye youre menne maye paſſe without daunger conſtable marſhalles great ioye ſo rode forthe toguyder ſent worde tydinges duke lancaſtre ſo folowed vowarde conſtables marſhalles came paſſage ſpanyſſhe ſquyer entred firſte ryuer ſhewed way whan ſawe paſſage ſo pleaſaunt ryght ioyfull ſo euery man paſſed ouer whan vowarde ouer lodged gyue knowledge folowed conſtable kepte promyſe ſquyer gyde ſo departed fro rode medena del campo kynge caſtyle lay good towne countrey campe kynge portugale duke lancaſtre came paſſage called plaſce ferarde bycauſe grauell ſande firme ſtable without parell hooſtes paſſed ouer next day rerewarde lay coūtrey campe tydinges came ruelles cateſeris medena vyle arpente ſaynt phagon cyties townes caſtels countrey campe spayne howe englyſſhemen portugaloyſe paſſed ouer ryuer derne founde paſſed wherof euery man maruayle ſayd nat done without trayſon ſhulde neuer haue founde paſſage ſome countre ſhewed kynge caſtelles lordes knewe ſquier caſtyle ſhewed guyde thervpon taken knowledged trouth hadde done thanne iuged dye brought vyle arpent beheeded ¶howe tydinges ſpred abrode kynge portugale duke lancaſtre paſſed ryuer derne howe came kyng caſtels knowlege howe certayne englyſſhe knyghtes came rode vyle arpente king portugale duke lancaſtre determyned tary cōmyng duke burbone cap ciii whan kynge caſtyle knewe howe kyng portugale duke lancaſtre yt feldes great puyſſance daily aproched wherof ſore abaſſhyd called hym ſyr gaultyer paſſac ſyr willyam lignac ſayde haue great maruayle duke borbon commeth nat enemyes aproche kepe feldes none encoūtreth waſte countrey people realme yuell contente fyght nat theym wherfore ſirs requyre gyue counſayle beſt theſe two knyghtes knewe dedes armes kyng dyd vſed therfore thyder ſente oute fraunce ſayde syr ſurely duke borbon cometh without fayle whan cometh ſhall take counſayle ſhall tyll come let v make countenaunce batayle let enemyes go come whyder lyſt lette kepe feldes ſhall kepe townes ſtronge well prouyded bothe men vytayles ſhall ſonne great heate ſhall ſhadowe freſſhe ayre ſhall fynde ye countrey waſted pylled forewarde go leſſe ſuſtynaūce ſhall fynde therfore ſyr begynnynge eſchewe inconuenyentes lytell hooldes beaten downe maners church ſuche men coūtrey wold haue put goodes wyſely done el nowe enemyes ſhuld haue founde place haue reſted nowe ſhall fynde nothyng without brynge theym heate ſonne heedes whiche ſhall burne ſlee ſir townes cyties caſtelles well garnyſſhed prouyded good men armes artyllery vytayles thynke ſhalbe ſkrymyſſhed withall lyfe noryſſhynge men warre paſſe tyme ryde aboute worlde ſeke aduentures therfore ſir nothynge abaſſhed truſte beſynes ſhall haue great domage kynge reaſon theſe knyghtes wordes greatly recōforted perceyued well ſhewed trouth reaſon nowe let v ſpeke duke lancaſtre kyng portugale feldes countrey campe wolde gladly haue bene ſome towne haue refreſſhed theym forager whe • ſo euer went coude fynde thing feare encountrynges rode nat great companyes ſomtyme whan ſawe village hyll playne reioyſed wolde ſay go thyder ſhalbe ryche well prouyded thyder wolde ryde great haſte whan founde thynge bare walles howſes broken downe nother catte dogge cocke hen man woman childe waſted frenchemen thus loſte tyme horſes leane feble reaſon poore noriſſhyng happy whan founde paſture ſome ſo feble coulde go dyed great heate pouertie ye alſo ſome great men dyed ſore dyſpleaſed hoote feuers nat wherwith refreſſhe ſome tyme ſodeyn coldee toke ſleping ye nyght caſe ſpecyally duke lancaſtres hooſt engliſſhmen febler complexion portugaloys coulde well endure payne harde accuſtomed ayre caſtyle caſe haue ſhewed engliſſhmen many dyed namely ſuche ſmale prouiſyon ſelfe sir richarde burle ser thomas moreaulr ſir thomas percy lorde fitzwater ſyr mabetyne linyers ſir iohn̄ dam breticourt thyrrey guyllyam souuayne theym two hundred horſe men knyghtes ſquyers ſuche wolde auaunce theym ſelfe deſyringe dedes armes tyme mounted horſes beſte hadde entente ryde vyle arpente awake frēchmen therin herde ſurely howe ſir dlyuer clyſſon within towne conſtable caſtyle hym great nombre good men armes theſe lordꝭ company rode forthe morenynge came lytell ryuer ranne towne paſſed ouer larome roſe towne brute englyſſhe men come barryers thanne knyghtes ſquiers armed quickely came cōſtables lodginge varlettes ſadled horſes brought thē maiſters conſtable wolde nat wyll haue ſuffered haue iſſued agaynſte englyſſhmen coulde nat let corages ſo fierſe ſo iſſued well horſed good ordre firſte iſſued ſir iohan barres vicounte barlier ſir iohan brakemoūt ſir pyer wyllannes ſir triſtam de la gayll dyuers great deſyre fyght agaynſt engliſſhmen whan englyſſhmen made courſe towne paſſed agayne ryuer paſte drewe gyther ye ſandes fayre eaſely drewe fro ryuer thre bowſhottes frenche knightes came cryeng cryes euery manne ſpeare thyghe whan englyſſhmen ſawe ſodeynly tourned ſpeares reſtes ſore rencoūtre dyuers ouer throwen ſandes bothe party whan courſe done lefte nat ſo ſkrymyſſhed gyther powder ſubtyle ſandes roſe vp ſo thycke one coulde natſe nother knowe eche ſo themſelfe horſes could ſkant drawe brethes mouthes ſo full duſt therby eche party fayne withdrawe cry thus departed manne ſlayne greatly hurte bycauſe courſe englyſſhe knyghtes made paſte daye one leage fro towne arpente ſo retourned lodgynges ſyckneſſe toke heate colde feuers duke lancaſtre wyſte nat ſaye ſawe well howe men fell ſicke dayly lay beddes hymſelfe ſoo wery heuy gladly wolde haue layen bedde nat ben diſcoragynge people day ſpake kynge portugale demaunded counſayle hym deſyringe hym gyue beſte aduyſe beſte feared great mortalyte fall hoſt kyng ſayd syr ſemeth well howe ſpaynyardes frēchmen wyll nat fyght v time purpoſe ſuffre v waſte ſelfes prouyſions ſir quod duke wyll ye coū ſayle v ſhall ſhewe ꝙ kyng portugale ſeaſon whyle ſonne ſo hoote ye people drawe againe galyce let euery man refreſſh ſelfe marche aprill come felde agayne ſo moch newe ayde comfortemaye come oute englande one bretherne realme nat ſo ſoone wonne ſpecyally agree ayre nat acuſtomed let men go paſſe tyme ſuche townes fortereſſes ye haue galyce vnder obeyſaunce may well quod duke maye fortune fall ſhall ſhewe whan enemyes ſeeth departed one fro another portugale galyce ſaynt iaques colongne kynge spayne wyll ryde great puyſſaunce haue herde hathe foure thouſande ſpeares frenchman breton ſhall fynde many mo owne countrey alſo duke burbon vncle frenche kyng cometh two ſpeares aſſone cometh wyll ſet forwarde ſo home oure countreys aſſemble togyder agayne nowe enemyes ſhall v great domage thanne kynge ſayde well lette v kepe ſtyll feldes name god men freſſhe ynough good mynde abyde aduenture thus determyned abyde cōmynge duke burbon ſe ſhulde fought withall thanne nat demaūded nothinge batayle tyme went euer forwarde ſonne mounted dayes chafed meruaylouſly aboute mydſomer whan ſonne ſtrength ſpecially spayne granade farre countreyes septentryon aprell fell rayne ſwetnes fro heuyn wherby euery thynge brente erthe engliſſh men eate grape whan myght get dranke hote wynes dranke ſet fyre therby brente lyuers longes dyete contrary nature englyſſh men noriſſhed good mete ale kepeth bodyes temper nyghtes hoote bycauſe great heate day mornyng meruaylouſly colde whiche dyſceyued nyght coulde ſuffre thynge ſo ſlepte naked mornynge colde toke waxe caſte feuers flyxes without remedy well dyed great men meane people ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe duke lancaſtre gaue lycence men howe haraulte ſente kinge caſtyle howe thre knightes englande went ſpeke king caſtyle ſaueconduct duke men paſſe coū trey cap ciiii beholde nowe ſe howe fortune tourned ye maye well beleue duke lancaſtre beynge realme caſtyle coulde neuer haue loſte batayle men dyſcomfetted loſte men dyd voyage reaſon ſycknes hym ſelfe alſo nygh deed ſir iohan holande conſtable hooſt whan ſawe frendes men thus infected malady without remedy herynge complayntꝭ one ſayeng eche ah duke lancaſtre hath brought v dye spaygne curſed voyage wyll neuer haue englyſſhman come englande ſerue hym ſpurneth agaynſt ye pricke wolde men ſhulde kepe countrey whan wonne whan men deed ſhall thanne kepe ſheweth nat ſkyll warre ſythe ſeeth none cometh agaynſt v fight batayle dothe nat drawe portugale ſome place ſhulde nat haue domage loſſe heth thus ſhall dye without ſtrokes whan ſir iohan holande herde vnderſtode theſe wordes honoure loue lorde duke lancaſtre whoſe doughter maryed came duke ſayd quickly sir muſt behoue take newe ſhorte counſayle people harde caſe lykely dye ſyckeneſſe nede ſhulde fortune nat able ayde wery harde caſe horſes deed ſo noble men ſo diſcoraged nat lyke good ſeruyce tyme ſayd duke beſte wyll beleue counſaile reaſon syr quod conſtable thynke beſte ye gaue lycence euery man departe thynke beſte ſelfe drawe outher portugale galice ye nat caſe ryde forewarde trewe quod duke ſo wyll saye howe gyue leaue departe whyder pleaſe thē outher caſtyle fraunce ſo make falſe treaty enemyes ſe well ſeaſon warre paſte paye euery man wage rewarde theym coſtes syr quod conſtable ſhall done sir iohan holande made knowen trumpet euery lodgyng entencion duke lancaſtre howe dyd gyue lycence euery man departe whyder lyſt euery capytayne ſhulde ſpeke conſtable ſhulde ſo payed ſhulde content tydynges reioyſed ſome ſuche deſyred departe chaunge ayre barones knyghtes englande toke counſayle howe myght retourne englande thought impoſſyble retourne ſee ſhyppes redy farre fro porte alſo men ſo ſicke feuers flixes many deed ſo ſicke coude nat endure ye trauayle ſee thynges conſydered thought beſt repayre home thorough realme fraunce ſome ſayde howe maye enemyes realmes muſte paſſe firſt spayne haue made theym open warre kynge nauer lykewyſe ioyned warre kynge caſtyle alſo kynge aragone alyed frenche kynge alſo hath done v great dyſpite hath take layd priſon barſelona archebyhop burdeaux wente thyder demaunde arerages realme aragonoweth kynge englande ſoueraygne lorde ſende frenche kyng harde v farre peraduenture whan oure meſſanger cometh kynge yonge peraduenture counſayle wyll nothynge v ſir olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce hateth v mortally wyll ſay duke bretayn great aduerſary wyll become engliſſh ſome great wyſdome imaginacyon ſaid thinges conſydred thinke beſt aſſay kyng caſtyle thynke wyll lyghtly condyſcende ſuffre v paſſe countrey peaſably gette ſaueconduete fro kynges fraunce aragon nauer counſayle taken kepte herde haraulde called derby ſente forthe kynge caſtyle letter haraulde rode forthe came medena de campo founde kynge caſtyle kneled downe delyuered letter kynge opened redde written frenche whan hadde well vnderſtande turned hym ſmyled ſayde knyght go make haraulde good chere ſhall anſwered nyght departe morowe kynge entred ſecrete chambre ſent ſir wyllyam lygnac ſir gaultyer paſſac red letter demaunded beſte ¶i ſhall ſhewe ſubſtaunce matter syr iohan holande conſtable duke lancaſtres hooſt wrote kynge caſtyle deſyring hym ſende herault letter ſafecōducte ii thre englyſſhe knightes go come ſafe ſpeke treat hym theſe knightes anſwered ſayd ſir good ye dyde ſhall knowe demaūde well quod kyng thynke good aſafecōducte written cōteyninge ſixe knightes might ſafely go come poyntyng conſtable ſealed kynges great ſeale ſygned hande deliuered heralt xx frankes rewarde returned aurāche duke ye conſtable herault deliuered ſafecōduct cōſtable knyghtes choſen yt ſhulde go ſir mauberyn linyere ſir thom̄s morell ſir iohan dambreticourt theſe thre knyghtes charged go meſſage ye kynge caſtile deꝑted aſſone might ſome thought long many ſicke lacked phiſicions medicins alſo freſſhe vitaylles theſe englyſſhe ambaſſadours paſſed towne arpent conſtable caſtyle ſir olyuer cleſquy made thē good chere made ſupper next daye ſent knyght tyntemache breton bring ſurelyer kyng encoūtryng ye breton many ſprede abrode ſo long rode came medenade campo founde kynge gret deſire know wolde whan lyghted lodgyng chaūged refreſhed thē went king made thē gode ſemblaunt brought hiby ye knightꝭ houſe delyuered kyng letter fro duke conſtable none fro hym ſelfe wolde nat write kynge ſayd sir kyng ſent hyder fro erle huntyngdon conſtable duke lancaſtre certaynynge great mortalyte ſickeneſſe amonge men therfore conſtable deſyreth ye wolde ſuche deſyreth haue helthe opyn cyties good townes ſuffre entre refreſſhe recouer helth maye alſo ſuche haue deſyre paſſe englande lande maye paſſe without daunger kyng nauer frenche kyng peſably retourne owne coutreis ſir deſyre requeſt make vnto tyme kyng anſwered ſaid ſoberly sir ſhall take coūſayle aduiſe good v ye ſhalbe anſwered knyghtes ſayd ſir ſuffyceth v ¶howe theſe thre knyghtes obteyned ſaueconduct kyng caſtyle people paſſe howe dyuers thēglyſſhmen dyed caſtyle howe duke lancaſtre fell great ſyckeneſſe cap c v thus departed fro kynge tyme went lodgynges taryed yt day next day tyll none went ye kyng ſhall ſhewe anſwere ye king coūſaile requeſt gretly reioyſed kyng ſawe well enemy wolde deꝑte realme thought hymſelfe wolde agre therto yet coūſayled cōtrary ſent ii frēche capitayns ſir gaultier paſſacke ſir willm̄ lignac whan come right ſagely ſhewed thē deſire req̄ſt ye cōſtable englyſſhe hoſt hervpon demaūded haue coū ſayle firſt deſyred ſir water paſſacke ſpeke lothe ſpeke kynges coūſayle fayne ſo kyng ſo ſore deſyred hym ſo kynges cōmaundement ſpake ſayde sir ye come ſame ende haue alwayes ſaid yt enemy ſhulde waſt thē ſelfe nowe diſconfyted without ſtroke ſtrikyng ſir ye ſaid folkes deſyre haue comforte refreſſhyng countre gentylneſſe ye maye well graūt ſo whāſoeuer recouer helthe retourne nat agayne duke kynge portugale deꝑte ſtreight way owne countreys terme ſixe yere arme nat agaynſt agaynſt realme caſtyle thynke ye ſhall gette rightwell ſafeconducte kynge fraunce kynge nauerre paſſe peaſably realmes anſwere kynge ryght ioyfull counſayled hym accordynge pleaſure nat cared bargeyn made ſo myght haue benquyte englyſſhmen ſayd ſir water paſſacke sir ye haue well truely counſayled thanke ſhall accordyng aduiſe thre englyſſhe knyghtes ſent whan come entred counſayle chābre byſſhop burges chaunceller spayne well langaged ſayd ſirs ye knyghtes englād perteyning duke lācaſtre ſent hyder fro conſtable vnderſtande kyng pytie gentylneſſe wyll ſhewe enemyes grace maye ſirs ye ſhall retourne cōſtable ſhewe hym fro kyng caſtyle ſhall make knowen al hooſt ſowne trumpet realme ſhalbe open redy receyue englyſſhmen hole ſicke ſo thentre euery cyte towne laye downe armure weapon ſhall fynde men redy bring lodgiges name written delyuered capitayne towne thentent ſhulde nat retourne agayne galyce portugale maner buſyneſſe deꝑte countreis aſſone may aſſone kyng caſtyle ſouerayne lorde hath optayned ſafecōducte paſſe realmes nauer fraunce go cali porte hauen pleaſure outher bretaygne xaynton rochell normādy picardy alſo ye kynges pleaſure ſuche knightꝭ ſquiers nacyon ſoeuer entred vyage wyſe arme nat ſelfe ye ſpace ſixe yere agaynſt realme caſtyle ſwere thus whan take ſafecōducte cōpoſycion ye ſhall haue letter open beare conſtable ſuche cōpanyons ſent hyder theſe knyghtꝭ thanked kynge counſayle anſwere ſayd ſir certayne artycles anſwere cā nat tell accepted nat nat ſhall ſende agayne heraulte come nat ſhall accept ſayeng well ſirs kyng content quod counſayle kyng went chambre ſir water paſſacke ſir wyllm̄ lignacke kepte ſtyll company englyſſhe knyghtes brought fayre chābre dyner redy apparelled thē dyned dyner wyne ſpyces kynges chambre toke leaue letter redy toke horſes ſo departed rode vyle cloppes next day came towne arpent dyned night lay noy galyce next daye came auranche founde ye conſtable fortuned mean ſeaſon one duke lancaſters great baron died right valyant man called lorde fitz water greatly bemooned agaynſt dethe none maye ſtryue enterment honorably done kyng portugale duke lācaſtre preſent whan theſe thre knyghtes come duke lodgyng ſhewed done ſhewed letter confyrmacion ſame ſome ſayd herde couenaunt ſome ſayde nay holdyng opinyon right courteſſe perfitely conſyderyng danger theſe tidynges anone ſprede abrode hoſt duke gyuen lycence euery man departe ſo lyſt ſuche ſycke feble deſyring freſſhe ayre deꝑted ſoone might toke leaue duke cōſtable truely payd wagꝭ curteſly might ſome content fayre wordes ſo departed cōpanyes ſome went arpent ſome ruelles ſome vilcloppes ſome noy ſōe medena de cā po place euery place welcome brought lodgynges name preſented capitayne greatteſt parte gentylmen went arpent bycauſe towne many ſtraungers breton frenchman normayns poicteuyns ouer whome ſir olyuer de cleſquyn capitayne englyſſhemen truſted better dyde spaynyerdes good cauſe thus haue ſhewed duke lancaſtres army brake vp tyme caſtyle euery man ſought beſt hym ſelfe ye maye well beleue dyde greatly trouble duke lancaſtre great cauſe ſawe enterpriſe • ore putte backe brought herde caſe howe lyke valyaunt ſage price cōforted hym ſelfe aſwell myght ſawe well coulde none otherwyſe whan kyng portugale ſawe howe matter went yt army broken gaue lycence maner men except thre hundred ſpeares come ſerue hym retaygned ſtyll ſo departed fro aurāche duke lācaſtre wyfe rode ſaynt iaques called cōpoſtella whan kyng duke kynge taryed four dayes departed men retourned countrey wyfe laye porte good cytie portugale nowe ſhall ſhewe befell dyuers knyghtes ſquyers ſuche departed fro duke gone caſtile dyuers entecte ſickeneſſe chaungynge newe ayre newe medycins yet coulde nat ſcape peryll dethe dyuers dyed arpent meane ſeaſon king caſtyle ſent kynge nauerre frenche kyng ſauecōductes paſſe peſably whiche nat ſoone optaygned dyuers lordes knyghtes ſquyers englāde dyed beddes whiche gret domage great loſſe countrey arpent dyed thre great barones englande ryche men firſt ſir richarde burle ben marſhall ye duke hooſt another lorde ponynges thyrde lorde percy coſyn germayne erle northumberlande towne noy dyed ſir mauberyn lymers poyteuyn ryght noble expert knyght towne ruelles dyed great baron called lorde talbot died xii gret lordes fourſcore knightes two hū dred ſquyers great dyſconfetture without ſtroke ſtryken dyed meane men mo fyue hundred herde reported knyght englande retourned fraūce name ſir thom̄s quynbery fyftene hundred men armes foure thouſande archer duke lancaſtre hadde brought realme englande neuer returned agayn halfe parte duke lancaſtre fyll perylous ſickeneſſe towne ſaynt iaques often tymes brute ranne caſtyle fraunce howe deed ſurely great aduēture lyfe thyrrey souuayne ſquyer honour ſquyer ye duke body taken ſickeneſſe dyed beſances naturally borne countie heynaulte brother wyllyam souuayn hym tyll dyed like wyſe great aduenture lyfe trouthe none ſo hardy ſo ryche ſo tolye feare thē ſelfe euery day loked none thyng deth ſickeneſſe none infected alonely duke lancaſters cōpany among ye frēchmen none ſicke wherby dyuers murmuracyons among ſpanyerdes ſayeng ye kyng caſtyle hath done great grace theſe englyſſhmen ſuffre lye reſt countie good townes feare wyll coſt v greatly haue lyke bring countrey great mortalyte wolde ſaye ah chriſtenmen ought cōpaſſion pyte taken one another cōmunyng among true yt ſame ſeaſon knyght fraūce dyed caſtile gret ſorowe made gracyous courteſſe hardy armes brother ſir iohan ſir raynolde ſir launcelotte voy called ſir iohn̄ voy howe dyed ſhall tell towne caſtyle called seghome laye garyſon impoſtume body yonge luſty tooke hede therof day lept great horſe rode feldes ſpurred horſe ſo gambaldyng horſe impoſtume brake body whan retourned lodgynge layde bedde ſicke ſemed well fourthe daye dyed wherof frendes right ſoroufull ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe ſir iohan holāde duke lancaſtres conſtable toke leue duke wyfe retourned king caſtyle made hym good chere howe ſir iohan dambreticourt wente parys acomplyſſhe dede armes bytwene hym bouciqualt cap cvi ye maye well knowe euery man eſchewed ſickeneſſe amonge englyſſhmen fledde therfro aſmoche myght ſeaſon ſir iohan holande duke conſtable ſtill duke certayne knightes ſquyers ſeynge ſeaſon warre paſte thynkynge eſchewe peryll ſickeneſſe ſayd conſtable sir let v retourne wyll go bayone burdeux take freſſhe ayre eſche ſickenes whan ſo euer duke lancaſtre wyll haue v agayne lette hym write v ſhall ſoone hym whiche better kepe v daunger parell called ſo often hym day ſhewed duke murmuraryons duke ſayde syr iohan wyll ye retourne take men recomende lorde kyng bretherne englande right good wyll ſir quod conſtable ſyr though ſycke men haue great curteſy conſtable caſtyle ſuffering entre byde caſe tyll recouer helthes yet maye nat retourne agayne caſtyle portugale outher take waye calays throughe fraunce muſt bounde beare none armure ſyxe yere againſt realme fraūce without kynge ſouerayne lorde preſent propre perſone duke ſayd syr iohan ye knowe well frenchemen take men caſe ſe daunger vaūtage therfore ſhall ſhewe whiche way ye ſhall paſſe curteſly realme caſtyle whan ye come entre nauarre ſende kynge coſyn tyme paſt hadde great alyaunce guyder whiche nat yet broken ſith warre began bytwene ye kyng caſtyle haue amiably written eche coſyns frendes warre hath ben made ſee bitwene v frēchmen haue wherfore thynke wyll lightly ſuffre paſſe realme whan ye ſaynt iohan pie de porte take waye biſquay ſo bayon ye herytage fro then ye may go cytie burdeux without daunger frenche men refreſſhe eaſe whan ye haue wynde weder wyll ye maye take ſee lande cornwall hampton wynde wyll ſerue ſir iohan ſaid counſayle ſhalbe fulfylled without faute nat long conſtable company departed taryed ye duke duches mo owne houſholde ſeruauntes ſir iohan holande wyfe hym ſo came cytie camores founde kynge caſtyle ſir gaultier paſſacke ſir wyllm̄ lignacke made hym good chere lordes knyghtes whan mete eche truely kyng caſtyle gladde toſe departyng englyſſhmen ſemed hym yt warre ende thought wolde neuer iſſue agayne englande ſo many good men warre duke lancaſters tytell make warre caſtyle alſo knewe well howe great trouble dyſcorde within realme englande whan tidynges ſprede abrode caſtile good cyties townes englyſſhe men lay ſicke ſeke helthe howe ſir iohan hollande • ome thyder retourne agayne englā de ryght gladde therof ſo drewe hym entent retourne hym lorde chameulx ſir thomas percy lorde lelynton lorde braſeton dyuers nombre thouſāde horſes ſuche ſicke thought ſelfe halfe hole whan knewe ſhulde retourne voyage paſte ſo paynfull whan ſir iohan hollande toke leaue ye kyng caſtyle kyng gaue hym cōpany great giftes mule mulettes spaygne payde coſtes rode ſaynt phagons refreſſhed thē thre dayes euery place welcome well receyued knyghtes kynges dyde conducte theym payde alwayes coſtes longe code paſſed spaygne came naueret batayle ben ſo pauyers groyne reſted nat certayne kynge nauerre wolde ſuffre paſſe throughe realme nat ſent hym ii knightes ſir peter byſſet ſir wylliam norwiche founde kynge tudela nauer ſpake hym ſpedde ſo well graūt paſſe nauer payeng ſhulde take way ſoone theſe knyghtꝭ retourned departed fro groyne ſo came pampylona paſſed mountain roūceaux lefte way bierne entred biſquay ſo go bayon laſt thyder came ſir iohan holande taryed long ſpace wyfe englyſſhmen rode burdeaux thus armye brake vp ſeaſon whyle theſe warres endured caſtile yt engliſſhmen kepte feldes lorde bouciqualt elder ii bretherne ſent herault ſir iohan dābreticourt deſyring hym dedes armes thre courſes 〈◊〉 thre axe thre dagger 〈…〉 knight agreed therto ſir iohan dambreticourt ſent dyuers tymes accōplyſſhe feate bouciqualt came nat forwarde tell ye cauſe wyll nat ſay tight good knight mete haue done greatter feate armes whan ſir iohan dābreticourt come bayone company ſir iohan holāde dyuers ymaginacions chalēge thought honorably might nat departe thoſe partes ſeyng chalenged dedes armes graunted therto without fulfylled ſame returned england wtout doyng thyng thought frenchman wolde ſaye deꝑted feare toke coūſayle ſir iohn̄ holāde beſt counſayled take waye fraūce ſafeconducte yt duke burbon gotte hym ſo go parys demaunde ſir bouciqualt el way therby leſt honour ſhulde excuſed counſayle knight beleued folowed ſame ſo deꝑted fro bayon entred biern ſo came artoys founde therle foiz made hym good chere deꝑtyng erle gaue hym iic florens good horſe rode forthe byern entred coūtre bigore ſo tholouſin carcaſſynois cōpany wylliam souuayne ſquiers heynault retournyng countreis longe rode came parys tyme kyng normandy ſir boucikalt ſhewed hym aragon ſir iohn̄ dambreticourt acquyte enterprice preſēted hym ſelfe certayne great baron fraunce beyng parys ſhewed thē howe come thyder acquite hymſelf chalenge whan hadde taryed viii dayes deꝑted came calais heynault owne countreis thus lytell litell army yt went spayne portugale brake vp ¶howe duke burbone deꝑted fro auygnon go caſtyle hoſt came burgus spayne foūde kyng caſtyle howe duke lancaſtre herde thoſe tidynges howe duke burbone departed fro kyng went ſtreyght agayne fraunce cap cvii ought ſuppoſed duke loys burbon begynnyng enterpriſe armye caſtyle ordaynedde chefe well enformed howe mater went knowen yt ſhuld haue ben ſo wolde haue made haſte long entred spaygne toke longe waye auignon ſe hym wrote hymſelf pope clement taryed long ſpace whan departed rode mountpelyer taryed fyue dayes alſo beſyers carcaſſone narbone parpinyon entred realme aragon toſe yonge kynge coſyn ye quene yolant bare ſo rode baſelona founde kyng quene coſyn great nombre lordes countrey come thyder ſeſt hym ſo dyde whan ben ſixe dayes went valēcenſia great herde ſure tidynges howe ye englyſſhe armye withdrawen paſſed homewarde howe ſir iohan hollande nauer goyng hōwarde great parte cōpany howe ben great dethe among alſo herde howe coſyn duke lancaſtre laye ſicke compoſtella galyce dyuers place ſayde howe deed howe though thanne lytell spaygne yet thought paſſe ſende worde comyng kyng caſtile ryght gladde therof mete hym came burgus spayne prouyded greatly receyuynge ſuche hym fraūce ryght gladde ſe duke burbone thus duke paſſed valencenſia saragoſa porte entred spayne came burgus well receyued ſir olyuer cleſquyn conſtable caſtyle ſir wylliam lignacke ſir gaultier paſſacke ſir iohan barres ſir iohan ſir raynolde roy dyuers knyghtes fraunce lefte garyſons come ſe duke burbone doute englyſſhmen portugalois withdrawen englyſſhmen forſoke garyſons galyce knewe well coude nat reſyſt army fraunce ſeyng compaignyons departed dyuers wayes ye haue herde tidinges came galyce howe duke burbon cōe spaigne brought hym great nōbre knyghtes fraūce brute noyſe thanne dede one halfe cōmons great dout ye duke burbon wolde haue entred wt great force puiſſaunce duke lā caſtre amonge greatly conforted tidynges came duke lancaſtre howe coſyn duke burbone come spayne burgus kynge incontynent ſent worde therof kynge portugale deſyring hym gather agayne toguyder people knewe nat ye frenche men wolde ſeyng englyſſhe men auoyded coūtrey kyng portugale reaſon ſuche alyaunce bytwene conſented departed fro lirbone came conymbres made ſōmons realme euery man redy came cytie porte drawe nere countrey galyce father lawe duke lancaſtre nat good poynte ryde ſickeneſſe howe beit began amende nowe let v ſpeke duke burbon kyng caſtyle made hym good chere coude prelate lordes realme many counſayles bytwene determyne ſhulde outher ryde galyce el returne kyng caſtyle counſayle ſawe clerely howe mater ſhulde beſte profyte ſayd eche whan togyder reaſon theſe frenchman landes waſted dyſtroyed though come kepe haue taken great domage wherfore thinke ſhulde good thāke duke borbon payne trauayle hathe endured cominge hyder lette v deſyre hym louyngly drawe men warre ſeynge henedeth nat tary warre apatente galice recouery therof ſhall ſmall mater v thus kynges counſayle comuned eche ſaid one receyue theſe people muſt payed wage nat pyll robbe realme comon people redy begynneth complayne therfore thynke beſt gyue thē honeſt congy departe counſayle vpholden kynge well conſented ſawe well moſt proftye people realme coulde take hurte ſhulde domage preiudice one daye kynges preſence archebyſſhop burgus duke burbon many knightes fraunce ſhewed declared theym entente ye haue herde duke burbon dyuers knyghtes fraunce rather retourne byde countrey nat mete complerions well contente retourne prepared themſelfe thervpon bycauſe duke burbone laſte came retourned firſt toke leaue kynge ſaid howe wolde returne realme nauerre great gyftes gyuen departed might haue wolde haue taken refuſed euery thynge except mule mul • tte • dogges spayne publiſſhed frenchman might pleaſure departe spayne retourne fraunce taryed ſtyll ſir olyuer cleſquyn conſtable spayne marſhals thre hundred ſpeares breton poicteuyns xayngtons thus duke burbone returned whan taken congy kynge quene lordes caſtyle conueyed groyne ſo nauarre ſo euer came welcome well receyued duke burbone gracyous curteyſe honorable well renomed kynge nauer receyued louyngly neuer ſhewed maner yuell wyll towardes frenche kynge taken way fro enherytaūce countye eureur normandy ſawe well frenche kyng nephewe duke burbon defaute therof whā done yonge ſwetely ſhewed duke buſyneſſe deſyringe hym good meane bytwene hym coſyn frenche kynge duke promyſed hym ſo duke departed paſſed thorough realme nauer peaſably ſuche wolde paſſe thus paſſed mountayns rouſeaulx alonge countrey baſtelles ſo entred bierne saluaterra ¶howe therle foize receyued honourably duke burbon great giftes gaue ſir willyam lygnac ſir gaultier paſſackes cōpany departed spayne incydent fortuned towne ſaynt phagon cap cviii whan erle foyz beynge ortays vnderſtode duke burbon saluaterra glad therof ſente knightꝭ aboute day great araye rode fyue hundred knyghtes ſquyers two leages ortays mette duke burbon lykewyſe rode great rout knyghtes ſquiers met amyably great prynces ought whan comuned togyther certayne ſpace ſhewed whan ortays erle foize drewe hym parte felde company duke abode ſtyll nother parte erle ſente duke thre knyghtes named ſyr eſpayne de lyon ſir peter capeſtan ſir menaunt nowalles whan came duke ſayd sir preſent lorde erle foiz hath ſent returnynge spayne knoweth well ye haue great dyſpence therfore ſyr dothe gyue entring countrey bierne eyght thouſande frankes mulette two courſers two palfrey syrs quod duke thanke erle foyze floreyns wyll take none preſente wyll receyue good wyll thus florens refuſed mule horſes receyued erle foyz came duke brought hym towne ortays lodged owne place lodged towne duke thre dayes ortays great dyners ſuppers erle foize ſhewed ye duke great parte eſtate fourthe daye duke departed erle gaue ye knightes ſquiers great gyftes ſhewed comynge thyder duke burbon coſte erle foize ten thouſande frankes thus duke departed went fraunce rode mountpelyer cytie puy countye foreſtes wherof lorde lady wyfe departyng ye duke burben ye haue herde spayne ſir willyam lignac ſir gaultier paſſac departed nat ſo ſoone companyes nombre thre thouſande ſpeares ſyre thouſande men warre lytell lytell euer departed many wage wery warres ſo retourned yuell horſed yuell aparelled torne ragged metynge ſuche people nothynge profytable vnhorſed whome ſoeuer met made warre marchaūtes men churche poore people countre thinge gette theſe rutters ſayde howe warre vndone howe kynge caſtyle hadde yuell payed theym wage wherfore ſayde wolde pay themſelfe ſurely ſuche cyties caſtels good townes nat ſtronge caſtyle douted greatly agaynſt townes cyties cloſed gate feare parels hauocke without well defended suche knightes ſquyers came erle foyze ſe hym well receyued gyftes rewardes gyuen ryght largely ſhewed comyng retournynge men warre paſſed therle foize ſayd iourney coſte hym ſome xl thouſande frankes ſeaſon fell incydent towne ſaynt phagon spaygne departynge duke burbone whiche coſte fyue hundred mennes lyues whan ſir gaultier paſſar ſir willyam lignac entred firſte spayne companyes ſpredde abrode dyuerſe place countrey aboute towne ſaynte phagon whiche good plentuous countrey many breton poicteuyns augenyns rainton men lowe countreys whan entred fyrſte ſaynt phagon entred ſyxe ten fyftene twenty ſo laſte mo fyue hundred one mayſters ſeruauntes euer came lodged ſelfe pilled robbed hoſtes brake vp cofers cupbordes wolde take foūde whan citezyns ſawe demeanoure entent ſhulde mo entre whan theſe ſtraungers reſte cryed alarum towne ſpanyardes redy ſame day ſo entred lodginges ſtraungers founde ſlayne without pytie mercye happy ſaued ſame nyght ſlayne mo thanne fyue hundred nexte mornyng theſe tydinges came capytayns comynge ſame towne warde drewe togyder take counſayle capitayns determyned tyme reuenged dyde ſhulde fynde townes cyties againſt wherof enemyes woldbe right ioyous ſayde whan voyage ſhulde haue ende yt retourning wolde thanke accordynge deſertes paſſed forwarde ſpake nothynge therof thought nowe ſo happend whan euery man returned except ſuche ſtyll abydinge conſtable ſir olyuer clyſſon ſpecially thoſe ye lowe countreys whan came togyder ſayd eche nowe lette v paye welcome ſaynt phagon lette v quyte departyng agreed ſo gathered togyder ſōme thouſande fightynge men aproched ſaynt phagon entred towne without myſtruſte cytie truſted thynges ben forgoten ſtraungers cryed alarum hūdred place cryed ſlee villayns towne take haue haue well deſerued thanne theſe breton entred howſes thought wyn moſte brake vp cofers ſlewe mē downe euery place ſlewe ſame day mo foure hundred towne robbed ſpoyled halfe brente whiche great domage thus theſe rutters reuenged dethe companyons departed fro ſaynte phagon ¶howe kyng caſtell counſayle yuell contente ſir willyam lignac ſyr gaultier paſſackes cōpany howe duke lancaſtre departed fro ſaynt iaques bayon cap cix tidynges came king caſtyle howe theſe companyons robbed pylled good towne ſaynt phagon ſlayne cytezyns nobre four hūdred nigh brent towne ſayd englyſſhe men wonne aſſaute wolde nat haue daulte ſo cruelly dyd ſame tyme two knyghtes preſent kynge greatly reproued kyng counſayle excuſed ſayd god might helpes knewe nothynge therof ſayd herde howe nat contente towne bycauſe whan entred firſte realme came ſaynte phagon certayne company ſlayne grudge lyklyhode haue borne euer ſythe hertes behoued kyng caſtyle let mater paſſe wolde haue coſte hym ouer moche haue hadde amended bare nat ſo good wyll capytayns dyd well ſene whan departed toke leaue kyng retourne fraūce ben pleaſed ought ſuppoſed ſhulde haue better payed wage duke burbone came laſte firſte departed company chere well rewarded thus theſe people iſſued caſtyle dyuerſe wayes ſome biſquay ſome aragon suche noble honeſte knyghtes ſquyers lyued well kepte good rule departed pore yuell horſed ſuche hardy aduentured robbe pylle well horſed well furniſſhed gold ſyluer male full baggage thus falleth ſuche aduentures ſome wyn ſome leſe kyng caſtyle ioyfull whan ſawe clene delyuered ſuche people nowe let v ſomwhat ſpeke duke lancaſtre laye ſicke bed towne ſaynt iames duches wyfe hym doughter katheryn thought duke day nyght nat without anoyaūce ſawe buſynes harde parte many good knyghtes deed ſuche moche payne brought englāde none wolde treate compoſicyon bytwene hym kynge caſtyle wolde take duches wyfe enheritour caſtell gyue parte herde men ſaye enfourmed pylgrymes came ſaynt iaques oute flaunders brabant heynaulte countreis came throughe realme spaygne herde men warre ſaye sir ye ſhall go ſaynt iaques ye ſhall fynde duke lā caſtre kepeth chambre feare ye lyght ſonne recōmaunde v hym demaunde hym oure behalfe haue made hym fayre warre cō tent v nat engliſſhmen wont ſay coude better daūce make warre nowe ye tyme come reſt ſynge kepe feldes fronters ſuche wyſe leſe nothing take domage suche tale tolde duke toke worthe none remedy ſoone myght ryde departed ye duches doughter fro ſaynt iaques kyng portugale ſente hym erle noware conſtable fyue hū dred ſpeares hym ſir iohn̄ ferant ponaſe congue ageas coylle venaſe martyn de malo galope ferrant ſir aulde perre nedighes de fay gannes de falues baron thus departed fro compoſtella ſo rode tyll came cytie porte kynge quene portugale made good chere anone kyng quene deꝑted wente conymbres dayes iourney fro then duke taryed aii monethes meane ſeaſon ordayned buſyneſſe hadde galyes kyng apparelled hym mayſter patrone portungale named alphons brecart whan ſawe good tyme take ſee ye duke entred veſſelles diſacred toke ſee within day halfe bayon whiche threſcore 〈◊〉 leages duke toke lā dynge founde nat ſir iohan hollande englyſſhe men departed gone burdeux toke ſhippyng ſo englande duke taryed bayon longe ſpace lyued reuenewes bayon burdeux lande acquitayne vnder obeyſaunce kyng richarde englande commiſſyon ſuffycient receyue profytes thoſe landes called duke gouernour ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpeke ſeaſon duke lancaſtre ye englyſſhmen let v treat mater ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe erle armynake toke great payne treate cōpanyons departe realme fraunce cap cx reaſon erle armynake auuergne intreatyng companyons ſuche laye fortreſſes garyſon auuergne querſy lymoſen erle hadde great deſyre cauſe theſe capitayns departe realme fraunce leaue ſuche holdes theſe lādes ſore oppreſſed greatly impoueriſſhed ſo cōmunycacion except geffray teate noyre helde wenchadore agaynſt erle armynake theſe ſayd capitayns ſhulde receyue one payment two hundred l thouſande frā kes paye ſōme ſayde landes bounde glad delyuered theſe people otherwiſe coude nat labour erthe occupy feate marchaundiſe thyng feare theſe pyllers without pateſed ye charge pateſyng drewe well yerely ſōme ſhulde pay haue delyuered thoughe theſe countreis warre englyſſhmen yet amonge fewe nacyon englande gaſcoyns breton almayns foyzons men dyuers countreis gathered toguyder yuell dedes whan cō poſycions redempcion made agreed excepted geffray teate noyre forterers wolde nothynge erle armynake prayed erle dolphyn auuergne great capitayne ſhulde treate ye ſayd geffray wolde ſo moche go fraunce kyng coū ſayle duke berrey burgoyn gouernyng ye realme haue counſayle aſſyſtence without aduyſe agrement durſt reyſe vp tayle countrey erle dolphyn auuergne requeſt erle armynake toke iourney paris kynge nat roane thyder rode erle ſhewed mater kynge counſayle nat ſhortely diſpatched douted treatie theſe people ſaid sir erle dolphyn knowe well erle armynake wolde right gladlye honour profyte realme partes lyeth therin ye haue fayre landes doute greatly whan theſe capitayns gaſcoyns bernoyes payed ſuche ſomes money compoſicyon requyreth wherby countre ſhulde enpoueriſſhed yt within thre four monethes ſhulde retourne againe make worſe warre dyd entre agayne theſe fortreſſes erle dolphyn anſwered ſayd ſirs entente tayle ceſſed gadered money ſhall nat paſſe cleremonde ryon tyll certifyed ſuretie theſe people well quod duke content money leuyed put ſure kepyng ſome place ſame countre leeſt ſhall ſerue make warre wyll nat come ſome amyable treatie erle armynake byſſhoppe cleremonde biſſhoppe puy take ye charge mater ſo may honour profite coūtre right good wyll ſir quod erle ſo deꝑted fro kyng vncles fro roane founde erle armynake brother cleremont auuergne many lordes countre taryenge vpon commyng ſhewed worde worde frēche kyng vncles doutes made ye mater howe entente tayle ſhulde gadered money ther gadered toguyder putte ſuretie ſome certayne place tyll entente theſe pyllers might knowen kepeth caſtels gariſons agaynſt realme ſame entencion quod erle armynake ſithe pleaſeth kynge counſayle ſhall go mater ſuretie muſt behoue v haue good ſure truſe thē countrey tyll tayle ceſſed gadered ambaſſadours aſſigned erle armynake go ſpeke perot le bernoys amergot marcell theſe two ſouerayns fortreſſe helde ſyde ryuer durdone alſo ſpeke borge compaigne bernarde ye iſles olyuer barbe abton seghewe lorde laenplayre dyuers theſe capitayns acorded nat togyder one wolde ye wolde nat ſhal ſhewe reaſon dyuers opinyons dyuers countreis armynake ſuche vnder obeyſaunce erle armynake ſoone agreed wolde nat ruled hym chefe company ſuche moſt renomed vſe grete robbery pillery bierne countie foiz howbeit ſaye nat erle foiz wolde honour realme fraunce whan herde firſt howe erle armynake dyde treate ſuche fortreſſes helde auuergne quercy lymoſyn deſyred knowe hole ſubſtaūce mater demaunded enfourmed hym therof erle armynake mynded ye men garyſons whan departed holdes whyder wolde ſet thē buſyneſſe nat anſwered ſaid hym sir erle armynake wolde kepe wage occupy lombardy ye knowe well ſuſter maryed ſhe gaſcone ſon̄e thought ſhalbe moche lombardy whervnto erle foiz gaue none anſwere fell talkyng howbe thought neuertheleſſe apered af • hādled mater couertly ſhall ſhewe howe erle armynake treatie coude countre bierne teneurs therle foiz ſuche owed hym fauour coude neuer cauſe agree departe gariſons wolde nat go nother erle armynake bernarde brother lawe therle foiz full great prudence conſydred theſe two lordes armynake coſyns labriciens puiſſaunt men ſawe howe gate frendes euery parte thought ſhulde nat renforſed ought ſerue hym one thynge reaſonable erle foiz ymagined ſir eſpaygne de leon ſhewed whan ortays lykewiſe ſo dyde erle compane capitayne carlot auuergne alſo ſo dyde bourge englande ſayd howe erle foiz regarded howe open warre armynake thoughe peace bytwene whiche trueſe whiche dyuers tymes renewed bytwene theym therfore thought • hat erle armynake thoſe companyons vnder gouernaunce warres ſhulde fayrer armynakes labricience alyes myght hym great diſpleaſure cauſe ſuche owed fauour therle foiz wolde nat agte erle armynake howe made thē beleue wolde dyd diſſemble brake apoyntmētes howe rode nat abrode ſo moche dyde wherby alwayes erle armynake thought haue come purpoſe agreed hym perotte de bernoys helde ſtronge caſtell salucette whiche chefe ſoueraygne auuergne lymoſyne pateſyng endured rochell alſo guyllyam ſaynt foye helde caſtell bonteuyll alſo margote marcell helde loyſſe ſaynt flour auuergne bourge compaygne englyſſhe bourge helde carlotte margote marcell ſayde contente ſo myght haue lykewiſe perotte bernoys geffray teate noyre helde vādachore ſouerayne aboue dyde mocke diſſemble mater diſdayned fall treatie erle armynakes thought caſtell imprignable well prouyded ſeuyn eyght yeres paſſage two coude nat taken fro hym myght iſſue whan lyſte refreſſhe hym ſelfe company geffray wrote hym ſelfe ſaueconductes geffray teate noyre duke vandachore erle lymoſyn lorde ſoueraygne capitayns auuergne rouergue lymoſyn let v leaue ſpeke theſe mater farre coūtreis tyll haue cauſe returne therto agayne nowe wyll ſpeke matter nerer home myne owne nacyon hath ben ſhewed whan treated ende warre flaunders charter peace duke burgoyne ducheſſe dyde gyue graunt ſealed gaunt good towne noble cytie tourney therfore nowe enforce mater hiſtory wyll ſpeke nowe warres guerles brabant quickened ſo bycauſe frenche kyng duke burgoyne mater greatly touched inſydentes gendred therby fayne ſet hādes ſame warre come bottom therof contynue length true hyſtorie mater ſaye thus foloweth ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe erle reynolde guerles layde landes guage wyſt nat cāe refuge archebyſſhoppe coleygne vncle blamed hym howe ambaſſadours wente berthaulte malygnes cap cxi alonge ſeaſon guerles brabant grete hatered toguyder ſo dyd countreis adioyninge reaſon certayne bondes one agaynſt another mooſt hatered brabanders duke guerles heyres towne graue whiche duke guerles holden per force longe ſeaſon agaynſt brabanſoys ſayd bycauſe yt towne grane ſtode ſyde ryuer mueſe towardes brabant duke guerles helde wrongfully yt tyme dyuers cōmunycacions poyntmentes taken howbeit alwayes guerloys ſtacke hertꝭ alſo ye guerloys hated brabāſoys bycauſe thre fayre caſtels yt ſyde ryuer gaulech buthe nulle whiche caſtelles duke brabāt helde alſo peforce reaſone redynge ſhall begynne duke guerles theſe hatereddes often tymes renewed bytwene guerles brabant ſuppoſed dyuers knightes ſquyers knewe dedes armes ſir edwarde guerles ſlayne marueylous incydent batayle iulyers ye ſhote archer duke vyncelant boem duke luſenbourge brabante lyued men vyctorie hadde come entente gettyng agayne thre caſtelles lo valiant man ſo hardy wolde haue conquered agayne ¶nowe wyll declare haue promyſed maner theſe foreſayd caſtelles came ſignorie brabanſoys firſt wyll begyn duke guerles tyme whan wrote ordayned hyſtorie erle guerles called raynolde bycauſe guerles riche countre ſo great duchy brabant erle came lande yonge man frewyll diſpende largely thought full lytell ende myght come cared nothynge accomplyſſhe pleaſure haunted iuſtes tourney gret coſt gette hym renome euery yere ſpended four tymes moche value reuenewes landes borowed lombardes dyuers place ſo lyberall outragious ran ſo dette coulde nat ayde hym ſelfe thynge ſo parentes frendes greatly blamed hym ſpeciallye vncle mother ſyde came houſe orcle archebyſſhop coleygne ſayd hym maner gyueng hym counſayle fayre nephewe raynolde ye haue ſo demeaned youre ſelfe nowe ye become poore manne lādes lyeth pledge dyuers place throughe worlde lytell accompte made poore lordes thynke ſuche haue hadde theſe great giftes profite wyll rendre againe god ayde whan ſe poore caſe haue gyue wyll flye fro youre company mocke youre foule large ye ſhall fynde frendes thynke nat though byſſhoppe coleyne ought breke myniſſhe myne eſtate helpe gyue patrimony churche surely wyll nat conſcyence ſhall neuer agre therto alſo ye pope cardynals wyll nat ſuffre therle heynalt hath nat behaued hym ſelf ye haue done hath gyuen margarett eldeſt doughter maryage kynge almayne loys bauyers yet hath thre wyll marry highly yf ye hadde well borne ſelfe nat haue layde heritage pledge put hādes none caſtels townes ye might ryȝtwell haue fortuned haue one doughters maryage caſe ye ye ſhall neuer come therto ye haue nowe nother townes caſtels ye maye endowe woman nat ſo moche poore lordſhyppe erle guerles ſore abaſſhed wordes byſſhop vncle knew well ſhewed hym trouthe loue kyndred deſyredde counſayle counſayle fayre nephue quod byſſhop late ye wyll cloſe faſte ſtable whan horſe loſte howe ſe buſyneſſe one remedy remedy quod erle ſhall ſhewe ꝙ byſſhoppe berthaulte malygnes nowe renomed rycheſt man ſyluer golde knowen place reaſon courſe marchaundiſe vſeth bothe lande ſee occupyeth dāmas cayre alexādre galyes marchaūdyſe worthe hundred thouſande floreyns hath pledge parte herytage berthault hath fayre doughter mary hath mo chyldren great high baron almaygne thoſe march haue deſyred maryage ſelues ſonnes knowe well yet coude neuer come entētes ſome refuſed ſome thought nat worthy wherfore wolde counſayle yt ye ſhulde treate berthault deſyring haue doughter maryage ſo yt wyll redeme landes paye dettes bring agayne hādes townes caſtelles lordſhippes perteyning vnto herytaunce ſuppoſe bycauſe ye high lynage great ſignorie haue many townes cyties caſtels bytwene ye ryuers meuſe ryne wyll enclyne requeſt sir ꝙ therle guerles ye counſayle truely ſhall ſo therle guerles aſſembled togider coūſayle frendes ſuche loued hym beſt diſcouered entent deſyred go name ye ſayd berthault malignes treate honorably hym mater whan theſe knightes clerkes came berthalt ſent fro erle guerles made good chere made curteſſe anſwere ſaid wolde take aduyſement riche beyond meaſure worthe v ſixe hūdred florens deſyred aduaū cement doughter thynkynge wyſt nat mary highly thā therle guerles thought accepte maryage fullye aſſented therto hymſelfe dyuers ymaginacions caſt many doutes ſayd hymſelfe yf mary doughter erle haue chyldren ſhe happen dye thynges fall dayly ſhalbe made riche goodes put againe poſſeſſyon townes caſtelles happe mary agayne ſecondly ſome high blode haue child agayne thoſe chyldren cōmynge noble lynage mother ſyde ſhall made ye chyldren iſſued doughter yea moreouer lyke dyſenheryted wherfore without artycled wyll neuer conſent therto wyll anſwere theſe meſſanges cōmyng pleaſeth greatlye doughter ſhulde happy ſhe myght cōe ſo great perfection conioyned maryage erle guerles thoughe ſhulde coſt right derely ſo ye mater clere nowe euery man knoweth well nat clere ſore trouble alſo hath forfayted herytage bytwene ryuers mueſe ryne wherfore quyte euery man maye ſe clerely demaundeth doughter maryage gyue hym wyll knowe howe ſhall alſo caſe doughter haue ſonne dough • hym wyll know ſhalbe heyres guerles maryage erle may happe haue alyaūce wyll haue good ſuretie hym next blode ſuche haue ryght demaunde ſucceſſyon countrie guerles alſo promyſe noble men good townes countre thus berthaulte malygnes determyned hym ſelfe make anſwere therle guerlrs cōmyſſyoners next daye hour aſſigned erles meſſanges came berthaldes lodgynge ſhewed well ryche man berthault mette hall ſwetely recyued thē ſpake merilye ledde fayre chambre apparelled dreſſed benfor kyng hym ſome frendes whan aſſembled doore cloſed berthaulte deſyred ſhewe cauſe cōmynge whervpon wolde make fynall anſwere ſo dyd deane coleygne ryght ſage clerke coſyn erle guerles ſpake ſhewed theffecte ambaſſade ſuche wyſe ioye hym wordes requeſtes nede nat ſpeke haue ben ſhewed touched length berthaulte anſwered deuyſed hym ſelfe day ſayd fayre lordes repute ſelfe gretly honored dough • alſo might come ſo hygh en • priſe erle guerles deſyreth whan mater begon wolde nat prolōged ſaye bycauſe alyaunce maryage made bytwene hyghe prince redouted lorde erle guerles mary doughter pleaſeth rightwell ye make requeſt landes whiche preſente tyme ſo ſore charged layde pledge handes certayne lombardes reaſon maryage ſhulde quyt ſhulde rydde hym dette thynges nowe darke ſhulde make clere thanke god puiſſaūce lyeth thus good wyll ſo firſt couenaunt fully agreed written ſealed maye ſuretie without trouble debate ye chyldren comyng doughter maye enherytours erldome guerles lymites therof ſtretche lorde therle guerles fortune dye doughter wtout iſſue bytwene doughter may enioye herytage guerles duryng lyfe af • dyſceaſe returne ye rightfull heyre alſo ſaye doughter haue heyre heyres lorde therle ſhe fortune dye thoughe erle remacy againe ſeconde tyme haue iſſue ſeconde wyfe yet doughters heyre heyres ſhall nat diſheryted pleaſe erle remary agayne contente make ſeconde wyfe dower ſuche landes hath beyond ryuer muſe marchyng byſſhoprike liege duchy brabant nat charge princypall ſignorie guerles thus erles frendes parentes ſuche next blode haue chalenge ſignory guerles good townes countrey wyll ſeale vpholde theſe deuyſes couenaū te cōtent wyll aſſent maryage ye may nowe anſwere ye haue charge ſo knyghtꝭ anſwered whan lytell counſayled toguyder one ſayd ſir haue well herde anſwere haue none auctorite confyrme graunt ſo farforthe ye demaunde ſhall retourne lorde therle coūſaile ſhewe hym anſwere demaūde ſhortely ye ſhall fro hym agayne berthalte ſaid ſirs god wyll ſo thus deꝑted chambre ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe erle raynolde guerles maryed mary doughter berthault malignes whō doughter maried agayne englande iſſue two ſonnes doughter howe ſir iohn̄ bloyes wedded theldeſt doughter erle guerles howe coūtie guerles remayned therle guerles yongeſt doughter cap c xii ye haue well herde anſwers demaundes bytwene foreſaid party wherfore ſpeke therof ye haue herde whan therle guerles meſſangers returned home agayn erle hoote mater ſawe well coude better thā mary berthalt malygnes doughter ſo riche man erle counſaile made deuyſed writynges ſufficient therle ſet ſeale next frēdes parētes lykewiſe ſo dyd knightes guerles good townes whan confyrmed done berthaulte content ye maryage made erles dettes payde landes clerely quytte daunger erle toke newe counſayle began newe lyfe ſtate called good named better well wherwith lacked nothyng berthault malygnes myght ayde hym erle bare hym wyfe ryght honourably ſhe fayre lady good ſage deuout prudent nat toguyder paſt four yeres lady dyed ſhe doughter called iſabell whan therle guerles wydower yong maryed agayne ryght highly kynge edwarde englande father good kyng edwarde beſeged tourney wanne ealis gaue erle raynolde doughter named iſabell erle thre chyldren two ſonnes one doughter ſir raynolde ſir edwarde iane afterwarde duches guerlers lykewiſe bertram malignes ymagined begynnyng whan doughter maryed erle guerles euyn ſo fell trouthe kepte hym whan kynge edwarde englande vncle erle guerles chyldren came firſt almayne emperour loyes bauyers whiche emperour inſtytuted kynge edwarde vycar generall throughe march empyre conteyned begynnyng boke coūtie guerles made duchy countie iulyers made marque iulyers augment dignity come mater duke raynolde guerles nephue kynge edwarde dyed without iſſue ſir edward guerles maryed heynault wyfe yongeſt doughter duke aubert lady ſo yonge ſir edwarde neuer touched carnallye ſo ſir edwarde alſo dyed withoute iſſue ryght valyaunt knight ſlayne batayle yt bytwene duke brabant duke wincelant iulyers ſuſter iane maryed duke guylliam iulyers chyldren ſhe ſucceſſyon bretherne ſaid toke vpon heyre duchy guerles lykewyſe ſo dyde eldeſt ſuſter firſte maryage two bretherne ſeconde maryage bothe deed withoute laufull iſſue wherfore ſhe ſayde ſhe enherytoure thus fell difference bytwene two ſuſters ſome countrey wolde haue one ſome eldeſt ſuſter counſayled mary ſome high lygnage myght ayde chalenge defende herytage treatie made byſſhoppe coloygne lorde ſir iohan bloyes therle loyes brother lyued byſſhoppe
