ſayd ſhulde therby duke guerles ſucceſſyon two bretherne deed withoute iſſue male therfore right mariage ye right ſhuld retourne none coude chalēge right ſhe ſir iohan bloyes alwayes ben nouriſſhed brought vp party hollande zelande fayre herytage language countre neuer wyll mary fraūce layde eare glad lye treatie ſawe well myght therby haue great poſſeſſiōs march loued beſte alſo knyghtes hollande counſayle counſayled hym therto accepted maryage firſt wolde conclude ſayd wolde ryde heynault queſnoy ſpeke coſyn duke auberte ſe counſayle wolde gyue hym ſaye trouthe duke aubert wyſt nat counſayle hym dyd made ſemblaunt therof diſſymuled mater lytell ſir iohn̄ bloyes wolde lengar tarye haue counſayle toke horſe retourned ſoone coude guerles wedded lady dyd put poſſeſſion countre ſome wolde nat receyue hym lorde lady mooſt parte knyghtes ſquiers good townes countre helde ducheſſe iulyers lady hadde fayre chyldren wherfore guerles loued better thus ſir iohn̄ bloys wyfe poſſeſſyons whiche coſt hym moche erle loys brother dyed erle bloyes lorde dauenes heynault landes hollande zelande ſayd coū tie great herytage alwayes coūſayle counſayled hym purſue ryght ought haue wife guerles ſo dyde power almayns ſo couetous wolde make warre hym lengar money endured chalenge yt made duchy guerles dyd neuer ꝓfyte great domage dyed gentyll knight ſir iohan bloyes caſtell towne eſlone houe yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore one ye moneth iune buryed freres valencenes beſyde ſir iohan heynault brother ſir guy bloyes erle helde landes ryght ſucceſſyon yt two bretherne helde aſwell fraunce picardy heynalt hollande zelande countie bloyes knowe nat howe many yeres lady dyed ben wyfe therle iohn̄ bloys ſuſter duches iuliers abode peſably duches guerles ordayned thaccorde countre requeſt knightes good townes duchy guerles yt ſhulde take lorde ſir willm̄ iuliers eldeſt ſon duke iuliers lāde came hym rightfully ſucceſſion vncles reaſon therof duke aubert ye duches wyfe gaue hym doughter maryage ben maried ſir edward guerles thus lady doughter heynault duches guerles whan ſhe maried duke guerles ſonne duke iulyers bothe one age wherfore maryage agreable yong duke guerles helde hym owne countrey thelder waxed loued dedes armes iuſtes tourney alwayes duke rather englyſſhe trēche ſhewed well long lyued alwayes bare mynde yuell wyll predeceſſours duchy brabant alwayes ſought occaſion might make warre two reaſōs one bycauſe alyed faythe homage kyng richarde englande bycauſe wyncelant boeſme duke luſē burge brabant bought therle mors great lorde almayne thre foreſaid caſtelles whiche ſhall name agayne quicken mater gaulech buch nulle otherſyde ryuer muſe lande falquemount whiche caſtels aunciently ꝑteyned ye duke guerles enherytour thē therfore yōg duke willm̄ iuliers duke guerles ſore diſpleaſed might nat recouer herytage long duke wyncelant brabāt lyued ſpake worde therof nowe ſhall ſhewe howe fortuned thentent mater ſhulde ye clerer vnderſtanded ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe theſe caſtelles gaulech b • th null came duke brabant howe duke iuliers ſuſteyned linfars coū tre robbed maner people great aſſemble duke brabant made go iulyers howe diſcōfyted cap cxiii duke reynolde guerles coſyn germayne prince guerles brother enguaged threfor ſaid caſtels ſōme florens high baron almayn called therle mors erle helde theſe caſtels ſeaſon whan ſaw yt coude nat get money lende ſore diſpleaſed ſent ſuffycient ſō monynge duke raynolde guerles duke made compte therof nat wherwith redeme agayne erle mors ſawe came ye duke brabant treated hym haue agayn money ſayde caſtelles duke herde hym well bycauſe caſtels marched lande faulquemoūt whiche lāde lorde ye duke glad encreſe enheritaūce thought wel ouer lyue ye lady iane duches brabant wife ſoe gate ī poſſeſſion ye ſaid thre caſtelles firſt ſet lorde kalle chefe ſouerayne whan duke guerles deed ſir edwarde guerles toke hym herytage ſent ye duke brabant ambaſſadors deſyring hym might haue agayne thre caſtelles money payde thē duke wolde make ſuche bargayne denyed whiche anſwere ſir edwarde guerles nat content dalte hardely wydowe lady iſabell brabant yonger ſuſter duches whiche lady wedded duke raynolde guerles thus troubled dowrie lady wente brabant complayned duke brabant brother ducheſſe howe ſir edwarde guerles dyde great wronge iniury bycauſe grudge bytwene brabanſoys guerloys lande towne grance whiche brabant ſyde ryuer mueſe therfore duke brabanſoys enclyned ayde lady day aſſembled togyder callyng duke brabant great nōbre men warre xii hundred ſpeares ſir edwarde guerles made aſſemble parte caſe likely haue batayle bytwene duke aubert duke mours duke iullyers mette togyder treatie ſo aſſemble departed ſondre wt thyng doyng ſame yere ye duke wyncelant brabant ouerthrewe companyons coūtrey luſenburge greatly waſted lande putte many exyle towre caſtell luſenburge dyed ſouerayne capitayne called lytell meſlyn alſo ye ſame yere ſir charles boeſme raigned kynge almaygne emperour rome inſtytuted duke wyncelāt boeſme made hym ſouerayne regarder inſtytucion ordynaunce called almayne le langue fride ſay holding couert ſure wayes maner people myght go come ryde fro towne towne ſurely ſauegarde emperour gaue hym great parte lande countrey dauffay bothe ſydes ryuer ryne defende hym therin agaynſt lynfars maner people ryght peryllous great robber without pytie alſo emperour gaue hym ſouerayntie good riche cytie straubourcke made marque holy empyre augment therby eſtate ſurely coulde nat gyue hym moche duke wyncelant lyberall ſwete courteſſe amyable noble armes likely atchyue many thynges hadde lyued long dyed floure youthe wherof haue written hyſtorie make great complaynt hym lyued lengar tyll xxiiii yere age theſciſme churche greatly diſpleaſed hym ſhewed often tymes priue acquayntaūce dayes traueyled great parte worlde two great prince knewe non hūble tretable noble prince one good mayſter lorde guy bloys cōmaunded make hyſtorie theſe two prince dayes wereful humilyte large bountie without malyce lyued lyberally owne without oppreſſynge people reyſing vp yuell cuſtomes lā de ¶nowe let v retourne pythe mater haue begone whan ye duke iulyers ſir edwarde guerles called thēſelfe bretherne hertes good engliſſhe ben long alyed ye kyng englande loue fauour alwayes ayded warres whan ſawe duke brabant hadde ſo hygh ſignory lorde ſouerayne regarder emperonr chiefe correctour myſdoers robber founde lyueng highe wayes almaygne therat indygnacion enuy nat dyde well helde iuſtyce corrected yuell doer ſouerayne regarde ſignory ouer lāgue fride whiche parte lande whiche offyce firſt inſtytued yt marchautes might peſably paſſe fro brabant heynault flaunders fraūce fro liege coleyne cyties townes fortreſſes almayne nother marchauntes coulde nat paſſe entre almayne landes daungers duke iulyers ye duke guerles ſoo certayne robber wayes linfars done vyolence paſſynge landes duke iuliers ſhewed duke lente horſe caſtels great complayntes came duke wyncelant brabant luzenbourge bruſelles howe languefryde wherof ſouerayne regarder keper broken violated howe dyde vyolence robbed countrey ſoiourned euer retourned duchy iulyers duke brabante yonge luſty puyſſaunte lynage landes toke great diſpyte offence people complayned ſaid wolde fynde ſome remedy ſeynge charge kepe defende languefride wolde nat neclygence ſhulde take reproche blame conclude dede ſette reaſon demaunde counſayle aduyſe ſente duke iulyers notable perſones lorde vrquon lorde bourguenall ſyr scelar archedecon heynalt geffrey de la towre great rowter brabante ſhewyng wyſe ſwete maner offence whiche greatly toucheth preiudyciall duke brabante keper ſouerayne regarder languefride duke iulyers fayntely excuſed hym ſelfe ſhewed lefe haue warre peace ſo duke brabantes meſſangers nat well cōtent ſo toke leaue duke iuliers reiourned ſhewed duke brabant herde ſene whan duke herde demaūded beſt aunſwered coūſayle ſayenge ſir ye knowe beſt ſelfe well quod duke ſaye yt entenſyon wyll nat ſlepe ſo blame ſhall said ſlouth faynte hert ſhulde ſuffre vnder ſauegarde robber vilaynes robories vnpunyſſhed ſhewe wyll ſhewe coſyn iuliers aydes mater toucheth nere duke cooled nat entent contynent ſet clerkes warke ſent thought wolde ayde hym prayed ſome commaunded ſente ſufficyent knoledge mynde duke iuliers alies bothe theſe lordes made great preparacion duke iulyers lytell ayde brother ſyr edwarde guerles greatly cōforted men frendes theſe two lordes ſent priuely men farre almayne bycauſe almayns couetous deſyring wynne bene longe place myght get good aduenture wolde haue come habundaunce nat knowen ſhulde haue agaynſte duke brabante duke brabante great aray departed fro bruſelles went louayne fro thence treete ryuer mueſe founde thouſande ſpeares abydinge hym always came menne hym fro partyes fro fraunce fro flaūders fro haynalt fro namure fro lorayne countreys ſo two thouſande fyue hundred ſpeares good men warre alſo came hym burgoyne lorde graunt hym foure hundred ſpeares came late knewe nat daye buſyneſſe ſhall ſhewe wherwith ſore dyſpleaſed whanne herde mater done without duke brabant beinge trect herde lytell newes enemyes departed fro trect wednyſdaye wente lodged lande enemyes lay nyght thurſday tyll herde certayne tydynges ſhewed hym corours enemyes abrode rode forwarde cōmaunded burne duke iuliers landand thurſday toke lodginge betymes vowarde kept erle guy ligney erle ſaynt pole ſir valeran ſonne yong ſixtene yere age made knyght duke iuliers came ſame thurſday lay nere one another lyklyhode ye almaynes knewe demeanour brabanſoys better dyd fridaye betymes whan duke brabant herd maſſe felde thought nat haue fought ſo ſoone came redy duke iuliers ſir edwarde guerles well mounted great batayle one ſayd duke brabante ſyr beholde yōder enemy put helmes heedes name god ſaynt george worde duke great ioye ſame day four ſquiers great price worthy ſerue hyghe prince aboute hym ſene many dedes armes called iohan de valcon baudwyn beauforde gyrarde bye roulande colongne aboute duke bruſelloys ſome horſebacke varlettes behynde botelles wyne truſſed ſadelles paſtyes ſamonde troutes elys wraped towel theſe horſemen greatly combred place ſo ſuch preaſe man coude ſtyrre gyrarde bi •• ſaid ye duke ſi • cōmaunde theſe horſes voyde place ſhall greatly let v nat ſe aboute v haue knoledge reregarde vowarde marſhall ſir roberte namure let quod duke commaunde ſo gyrarde toke glayue handes ſo dyd companyons began ſtryke helmes horſes ſo none place voyded man glad haue horſe ſlaine hurte duke iuliers ꝓ edwarde guerles company came theym founde erle ſaynt poule ſonne vowarde daſſhed ſo ferſely amonge anone broken diſcomfited many ſlayne taken hurte batayle moſte ſlayne guy erle ſaynte poule ſir valeran ſonne taken batayle tourned herde parte duke brabante men honour fewe ſaued outher ſlayne taken duke brabante taken ſyr roberte namure ſyr loys namure brother ſir willyam namure ſonne erle namure many alſo duke iulyers parte ſome ſlaine hurte ye know well generall rule great loſſe euer reſteth diſconfyted howe domage duke brabante iourney yet hadde one great poynte remedy comforte ſir edwarde guerles wounded dethe ſaye bycauſe opinyon dyuerſe lyued wolde haue rydden ſo forwarde puyſſaūce wolde haue come bruſelles conquered coū treye none wolde haue reſyſted hym hardy fierſe hated brabanſoys bycauſe thre caſtels helde agaynſt hym iourney victory duke iulyers ye yere lorde god thouſande thre hūdred leuen ſaynt bartylmewes euyn fridaye duches brabant purchaſed frendes counſayle charles frenche kyng nephue duke brabāt bretherne chyldren ſuſter ſhe counſayled kynge go kynge almayne emperoure brother duke brabante whoſe ſake duke huſbande taken domage lady dyd ſo came conualence ryuer ryne founde emperoure wyſely ſhe made complaynte emperoure herde well whiche boūde vnto dyuerſe reaſons one bycauſe duke brother another bycauſe inſtitude hym vycare ſouerayne regarder languefryde comforted lady ſayd next ſōmer wolde fynde ſome remedy lady retourned brabante well comforted emperour ſir charles boeſme ſlept nat buſynes waked mater ye ſhall ſoone wynter paſt aproched noble cytie coloyne made prouyſion ſuche wyſe though wolde go conquere realme defence wrote duke erles helde hym commaunded thyrde day iune ſhulde hym ayes fyfty horſe pece payne leſyng landes ſpecially cōmaunded thre duke auberte erle haynalte ſhulde come ayes fyfty horſe ſo dyd whanne theſe lordes come moche people ſyr charles ſonne ſayde wolde go entre ye landes duke iulyers deſtroy bycauſe great outrage done enteryng felde army againſt emperours vycaire brother ſentēce gyuen playne iudgement emperours chambre mater regarded archebyſſhoppe treues archbyſſhoppe coloyne byſſop marauce byſſhoppe liege duke aubert bauier duke oſte brother diuerſe baron almayne thought dyſtroy landes ſo valyaunt knyght duke iulyers ſhulde yuell done alſo nere kynne ſayde better fyrſte ſende hym myght come obeyſaunce apoyntment holden beſt loue bothe partyes duke auberte brother came iuliers found duke abaſſhed wyſte nat counſayle beleue ben ſhewed aſſemble emperour made come hym without frendes dyd ſtoppe whan theſe lordes come duke gladd ſpecyally comynge two coſyns germayns duke aubert bauiers duke oſte brother knewe well wolde nat dyſhonoure rather gyue hym good coūſayle dyd counſayle ſhewe breuely ſhulde ſende ſome honorable perſones duke luſenburge brabant whome helde curtoyſe priſon caſtell nideque ſo dyd whan come thoſe lordes dyd hym great honour reaſon departed togyder came ayes toke lodgynges duke auberte brother foreſayd prelate meanes treatye ſore entreated emperour counſayle ſhewed emperoure howe ye duke iuliers coſyn owne free wyll come ſe hym put hym ſelfe poorely reſeruacyon obeyſaunce commaundement knowledge hym ſoueraygne liege lorde theſe ſwete amyable wordes molefyed greatly emperours ire emperoure ſayd lette duke come ſo dyde kneled downe emperoure ſayde ryght redoubted ſouerayne beleue well ye dyſpleaſed bycauſe brother lawe duke brabante whome haue helde longe priſon cauſe ſubmytte ſelfe abyde ordre counſayles worde themperour gaue none aunſwere ſonne ſir charles called kynge boeſme aunſwered ſayde duke iulyers ye haue ben outragyous kepe vncle ſo longe priſone nat deſyre well loued coſyns duke auberte duke oſte bauyers buſyneſſe wolde haue ben ſoer layd charge ye haue well deſerued hyghly punyſſhed chaunge copye ſo haue cauſe renew yuell wylles agaynſte ye wyll coſtly duke iulyers beynge kne emperoure ſate chayre imperiall ſayde ryght redoughted ſouerayne lorde puyſſaunt hyghnes knowledge ſelfe haue treſpaſſed youre maieſte army came againſt coſyn vycaire empyre haue helde hym priſoner delyuer hym vnto freely quyte requyre grace beare yuell wyll fro hence forthe prelate prince beynge preſente helpe forwarde wordes ſayde ryght noble prince ſuffyſeth coſyn iulyers hath ſayd well quod emperour content ſo toke hym vp hande ſhewed confyrmacion loue kyſt duke mouth alſo ſonne kynge boeſme duke brabante delyuered priſon ſuche priſoners vnder duke iulyers nat raunſomed delyuered quyte reaſon compoſycion treatie done euery manne retourned owne emperour wente prage almayne duke brabant brabante whanne duke brabante retourned reyſed newe tayle coūtrey reſtore knightes parte domages ⸪ ¶howe duke brabante dyed howe duke guylliam guerles treated duches brabante haue agayne thre caſtels aunſwere made alyaūce kynge englande cap cxiiii ⸪ ⸪ yet wyllynge treate matter lengthe renforce hyſtorye brynge poynte wolde come vnto declare trouthe charles frenche kyng came great puyſſaunce almayne might haue ſhewed haue prolonged thingꝭ though date ſeaſon paſte yet ought ſhewed hyſtory whan knowe frenche kynge kynge england began beſy began wake procede hyſtory dyd therfore ſaye thus whan duke wyncelant returned countrey clerely delyuered perſon ye haue herde wyll vyſyte landes caſtels well duchy luzenbourge elſe toke iourney good cytie straweſbourge throughe lande fauquemount behelde ye thre caſtels whiche occaſion duke guerles yuell wyll founde theym ſtronge fayre loued thē loued moche better cauſed newly fortyfied ſet workemen worke maſons carpēters dykemakers amende euery place departynge ſet valyaunt knyght ſoueraygne keper theſe thre caſteles knyght called ſir iohan groſſet duke commaundemente toke hym charge parell duke paſſed vyſited coū trey pleaſure retourned agayne brabante abydynge ſeaſon ſyr iohan blo • wedded olde lady duches guerles herytage right came hym deth ſir edwarde guerles brother ſlayne ye haue herde batayle iulyers ſuſter duches iulyers ſtroue hym made chalenge moſte parte knightes good townes inclyned moſt ladyes parte bycauſe ſhe fayre ſonne able ryde well ſene always warres ſo ſir iohn̄ de bloyſe wyfe coulde neuer haue peaſable poſſeſſyon chalenge ryght wyfe purſute therof coſte hym aboue hundred thouſāde frankes ſonne duke wyllyam iuliers ſhewed well youth noble hardy loued dedes armes came noble ertractyon ſo duke guerles mariage eldeſt doughter duke auberte ben wedded ſir edward guerles neuer carnally coupyled ſhe yonge thus ſhe maryed lorde willyam iulyers ſhe moche one age ſoo ſhe ſtyll duches ſhe yonge duke increaſed honour wytte prowes great wyll haūte dedes armes augment herytage • e rather englyſſhe frenche ſayd always yong wolde ayde inſteyne kynge englandes quarell nerer blode hym frenche kyng ſhewed hym dyuerſe tymes howe brabanſoys dyd great wronge kepe fro hym thre caſtels aunſwered ſayd let v ſuffre ſenſon euery thynge muſte haue turne ſeaſon yet awake coſyn brabante hathe many great frendes ſage knight tyme may come yt ſhall wake thus mater ſtode ſeaſon tyll god toke oute lyfe duke wyncelante dyed duke boeſme duke luſenbourge brabante hath ben conteyned hyſtory dethe duke duches brabant loſte moche yonge duke guerles ryght valyaunt lykely dyſpleaſe enemyes thought get recouer agayne thre caſtelles bycauſe debate ben bytwene brabante vncle lorde edwarde guerles ſente treate duches brabant delyuer caſtelles ſomme money laye pledge always affyrmynge howe laye guage lady anſwered meſſangers ſhe poſſeſſyon helde owne ryght enherytaunce bycauſe ſhe wolde duke ſhulde good neyghbour brabaunte ſhulde leaue gyue vp towne graue whiche helde duchy brabant whan ye duke guerles herde aunſwere nothynge well contente thought great diſpyte therof thought ymagined many thynges couertly treated knyght called ſir iohan groſſelotte chiefe capitayne ſayde caſtelles aſſaye coude gette hym byeng money otherwyſe knyght trewe ſage wolde wyſe harken therto ſente duke deſyringe hym ſpeke therof dye therfore ſhuld neuer faut founde hym wolde conſente trayſon naturall lady whan duke guerles ſawe enfourmed dyde ſo moche ſir raynolde dyſcouorte toke ſmall occaſyon diſpleaſure agaynſt knyght daye mette feldes ſlayne wherwith ducheſſe brabante ſore diſpleaſed ſo countre caſtelles putte kepynge agrement duches counſayle brabant thus matter ſtode certayne yeres euer noriſſhed couert hate towne graue one parte thre caſtelles parte bytwene duke guerles duches brabant countreis fronter guerles bare alwayes yuell wyll couerlly againſt brabant ſuche marched nere dyd euer moche dyſpleaſure coude ſpecially ſuche towne graue bytwene duke woode towne graue four leages playne countrey fayre feldes ryde guerles dyde alwayes great diſpyte brabanſoys myght mater went ſo forwarde ye duke guerles paſſed ſee went englande ſekyng rycharde coſyn coſins duke lancaſtre duke yorke ye duke gloceſtre great baron englande good chere deſyred ſe hym haue acquayntaunce englyſſhe men knewe well duke herte corage ymaginacion affection rather englyſſhe frenche vyage made great alyaunce kynge englande bycauſe tyme helde nothynge kynge englande wherby ſhulde beare hym faythe homage ſeruyce therfore kyng richarde gaue hym pencyon coffer thouſande marke yere counſayled aſſaye gette right fro duches brabant promyſed haue aide englyſſhe men ſuche wyſe ſhulde take domage meanes ſware true faithfull kyng realme englande whan alyaunce made tooke leaue kynge coſyns baron englande retourned owne countrey guerles ſhewed duke iulyers hadde done howe ſhulde haue ayde helpe englyſſhe men duke iulyers experyence age knewe farther duke ſonne dyde made countynaunce great ioye ſayd sonne wyllyam ye haue done ſo moche bothe maye fortune repent youre goyng englāde ye nat knowe howe puyſſaunt duke burgoyne duke myghtie loketh herytage brabant howe maye ye reſyſt agaynſt ſo puyſſaūt lorde howe may reſyſt quod duke guerles ye duke iulyers father rychee myghtier better make warre agaynſte hym hadde rather haue ryche man hath great poſſeſſiōs herytage hym hath nothynge leſe nothynge cō quered one buffet ſhall receyue wyll gyue ſire alſo kynge almayne alyed kyng englande nede ſhalle haue ayde hym well quod duke iuliers wylliam fayre ſonne feare ye wyll playe fole wyſſhes enterpriſes lyke vnacomplyſſhed atchyued ſhall ſhewe duke iulyers ſpake ſomwhat agaynſte wyll ſonne duke guerles made dout enterpriſe kynge charles fraunce laſte diſceſſed ſeaſon yt ſpeke dyde moche coulde alwayes gette hym frendes partes ſtode hym hande ſo coude nat ſo moche make reſyſtēce againſt ennemyes howe dyde moche coude gyftes fayre promyſes ſytte reſt haue ayde ſo gate hym ſelfe many frendes empyre place whan duke iulyers quyte delyuered oute priſone come duke brabant kynge great frendes toguyder ordynaūce emperour rome dyde ſette duke iulyers wente parys ſe kynge nobly receyued great gyftes gyuen hym knyghtes made relefe kynge ſignorie vyerſon whiche parteyned coūtie bloys whiche lande laye bytwene bloys berrey worthe yere fyue hundred pounde money curraunt fraunce duke iulyers ſware yt ſhulde neuer beare armure agaynſt crowne fraunce ſo longe kyng lyued kept othe ſurely long kyng charles lyued dyde hym maner domage conſented none done crowne fraunce whan kyng charles deed charles ſonne kynge reaſon warres flaunders hath ſhewed hyſtorie tooke creacyon parys hadde ſo moche coude nat take hede euery place duof iulyers came nat fraunce made relyefe landes vierſone wherfore duke berrey toke hym ſelfe ſoueraygne ſayde howe relefes parteyned hym ſo ceaſed landes toke ye profytes therof puyſſaūce putte fro ryght erle bloyes howe ſame tyme ſawe bothe oftentymes togyder neuer debate made bytwene ſayd landes yuell wyll ſhewed good cauſe theym frendes toguyder loyes ſonne erle bloyes maryage lady mary doughter duke berrey duke iuliers wolde gladlye haue entred herytage regarded ſonne ſhulde heyre therfore made lytell counte alyaunce ſonne duke guerles hadde made englande reaſon ſpake wordes ye haue herde duke guerles whan retourned englande howe duke guerles yonge coragyous toke lytell regarde father wordes ſayde sir haue done wyll vpholde rather haue warr̄ frenche kynge peace rather hym poore man ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe ducheſſe brabante ſent meſſangers frēche kyng complaynyng duke guerles howe kynge counſayle ſore buſyed inſydentes fell realme fraūce well defyances guerles buſyneſſe bretaygne capi cxv ducheſſe brabant beynge bruſelles well enformed theſe trouble howe duke guerles thretned theym brabante make theym warre ducheſſe feared ſame ſayde ah god aſſoyle ſoule lorde huſbande hadde lyued duke guerles durſt nat haue ſpoken ſuche matter nowe bycauſe woman aged wyll make warre agaynſt lady called toguyder counſaile knowe ſhe beſt ſhe knewe well duke hote haſty coragyous ſame ſeaſone whyle ladye takynge counſayle frendes frenche kynge defyed duke guerles wherof ranne great brute throughe realme realmes therto adioynyng marueyle theſe newes bycauſe duke guerles ſmall prince regarde ſmalle landes men ſpake therof dyuers maners euery man opynion than̄e ducheſſe counſayle ſayde madame ye haue nede counſayle ſhall counſayle ſende frenche kynge duke burgoyne tymes ye haue herde howe duke guerles hathe defyed frenche kynge alyes purpoſe make warre realme fraunce brute ronneth wyll bycauſe englyſſhemen almaygnes alyaunce haue better entre realme fraūce throughe youre countrey wherfore good kynge duke burgoyne aduertyſed therof youre caſtels fronters well fortifyed garnyſſhed nat ſo ſmall ennemye doubted ſaye nat ye ſhulde haue great nede ſeke ayde confore onely guerles good regarde alyaunces maye lightlye gette well englyſſhe men almaygnes alwayes couetous deſyreth make warre realme fraunce truſt wynnyng ducheſſe ſayd coūſayle ſirs ye ſaye trouthe ſhalbe ye haue deuiſed ſuche ſhulde go meſſage apoynted lorde bourguenall cheife stewarde houſe ſir iohan opeyn gracyous knyght clerke ſquyer honoure clerke called ſir iohan grane ſquyer nycholas de la monoy four preuy coū ſayle ducheſſe brabant departed fro bruſelles letter credēce rode parys tyme nother kynge duke burgoyne natte rohane normandye went fro parys roane kynge whan theſe ambaſſadoures came rohane firſte treated duke burgoyne made thē good chere knewe well delyuered letter hym receyued reed whā tyme brought kynge loue lady receyued thē louyngly kyng reed letter herde ſpeke aunſwered ſayde sir wordes requeſtes demaundeth counſayle reſorte alwayes vncle burgoyne ſhall diſpatche youre buſyneſſe ſhortely maye thoſe wordes contented greatly theſe ambaſſadours ſo went lodgynges kynge vncles counſayle dayly toguyder counſaile dyuers cauſes inſydentes newe fallen defyance duke guerles nothyng pleaſaunt alſo knewe nat duke bretayne purpoſed bycauſe taken conſtable fraunce priſoner ſet hym raūſome cm frankes taken fro thre caſtelles good towne greatly fortifyed men vitayls artyllary garyſons townes ſent dyuers tymes letter meſſangers englande kyng vncles duke lancaſtre tyme galyce coūſayle fraūce moche prouyde euery buſyneſſe wherby lengar ye duches brabantes ambaſſade anſwere finally ye duke burgoyn made thē anſwere ſayd ſirs ye ſhall retourne lady aunte ſalute fro v delyuer theſe kynges letter ſhewe yt buſineſſe let nat abaſſhed thyng ſhe ſhalbe cōforted ſuche wyſe ſhe ſhall well ꝑceyue countre brabant ſhall take domage reproch fayre anſwere contented greatly ambaſſadours brabant thus departed returned parys fro thēs bruſels made relacion aunſwere ye haue herde wherwith duches well content ſame ſeaſon newes ſprede abrode holy ſaynt peter luſenbourge cardynall whoſe body dyde myracles cytie auygnon holy cardynall ſonne erle guye ſant poule dyed batayle iulyers holy cardynall tyme good man noble holy deuoute lyfe dyde many dedes pleaſaūt god ſwete courteſſe meke mayde body great almeſſe man gyaynge poore people kept nothynge hym ſelfe goodes churche bare lyueng mooſt parte day nyght prayer allwayes fledde fro vanyties ſuperfluyties worlde ſo yonge dayes god called hym company anone diſceſſe dyde great myracles ordayned buryed amonge poore people dayes vſed humylyte buryed chapell ſaynt mychaell pope cardynalles whan ſawe myracles body dyde daylye encreaſe multiplye wrote frenche kynge ſpeciallye brother erle valeranne ſaynt poule deſyringe hym come auygnon erle wolde nat excuſe hym wente thyder gaue goodlye lampes ſyluer hange aulter hadde great marueyle great beleue viſytacion people made dayly▪ ſe hym wente thyder fro countie foize daylye workes encreaſed ſayde ſhulde canoniſed nat tell fell ¶nowe yt haue ſhewed dethe ſhall ſhewe dethe another haue nat ſpoken dethe kyng whome great mencyon hath made hyſtorie howe dyde many dedes vnreſonable hym meanes realme fraūce moche tyme kyng nauer ¶howe ſtraunge fortune kynge nauer dyed cytie pampilona howe charles ſonne crowned howe vā chadore beſeged duke berrey howe duke burgoyne ſente ducheſſe brabant capi cxvi ſayd trouthe nothyng certayne dethe ſaye bycauſe yt kynge nauer whan dyed thought full lytell ſo nere ende knowen therof paraduenture wolde haue taken better hede dyde cytie pā pylona nauerre ymagined howe wolde reyſe great taylage realme ſōme two hundred thouſande florens ſente counſayle ſaid howe wolde haue money reyſed counſayle durſte nat ſaye nay cruell prynce moſte notable perſones cyties townes realme ſente come panpylona came thyder durſt nat diſobey whan come togyther kynges palays kynge hym ſelfe declared forthe mater ſent king ryght ſubtyle ſage well langaged concluſion ſayde howe towardes nedes muſt haue ſōme ccm florens reyſed ſubiectes maner riche pay x frankes meane ceſſed fyue frankes one franke requeſt abaſſhed greatly people yere ben batayle nauer reaſon wherof tayle rayſed ſomme hundred thouſande floreyns beſyde maryed doughter lady iane duke iohan bretaygne great parte money thā nat payde vngadered whan kynge hadde made demaunde deſyred haue anſwere requyred take counſayle ſpeke toguyder king gaue reſpite xv dayes chefe make anſwere brute taylage ſpredde abrode nauerre euery man baſſhed therof xv dayes ende moſte notable perſones good cyties townes returned panpilona nombre threſcore perſones charge aunſwere hole realme kynge preſent anſwere makyng whiche done fayre garden farre fro people cloſed aboute hygh walles aunſwered one accorde ſhewed pouerte realme alleged howe former tayle nat leuyed gadred wherfore beſought goddeſſake haue pytie ſayd ſurely realme nat able beare whan king ſawe coude nat eaſely attayne purpoſe ſore dyſpleaſed departed fro ſayd sir ye yuell counſayled take counſayle agayne ſpeke yet agayne togyder ſo went chambre counſayle hym theſe good perſones togyder garden faſte cloſed hygh walles kynge commaunded wyſe ſuffer iſſue haue lytell meate drinke great doute lyues none durſte ſpeke ſo ſuppoſed conſtreynt deſyre ſtrake thre heedes ſuche moſte contrary entente • gyue feare enſample fell ſtraunge inſydence marueylous ſodayne aduēture whiche god ſent lyke myracle ſhall ſhewe enfourmed countie foize ortays erles houſe men panpylona paſt nat thre four dayes iourney thence ſhewed howe kynge nauer dayes loued well woman ſame tyme fayre damoſell louer wydower longe ſeaſon nyght laye ſpace retourned chambre feuer ſayd ſeruauntes dreſſe bedde wyll reſt ſeaſon ſo went bed trymbled colde coulde take heate aged man aboute threſcore yere age vſage bedde wont chaſed baſon hote cole make hym ſwete whiche often tymes vſed dyd hym hurte tyme ſeruaūtes dyd ſame outher god wolde deuyll burnynge flame toke ſhetes ſuche maner coulde reſkewed brente bowel ſo wrapped bytwene ſhetes lyued fyftene dayes great payne myſery inſo moche phyſyke ſurgery coulde helpe hym dyed ende kynge nauerre ſo poore men countrey quyte taylage delyuered fro payenge charles ſonne noble good knyght yonge kynge nauerre crowned kynge ſame ſeaſone wrote hyſtory anone obſequy done father cytie paupylona ye haue well herde treatyes hadde ben made county armynake dolphenty auuergne lymozyn enemyes neyghbours many well content departe thought warred trauelled realme fraunce longe ynoughe thynkynge goo robbe pyll place duke armynake promyſed theym leade lumbardy erle foyze wolde nat lyghtly dyſceyued thought contrary helde hym ſelfe ſtyll ſe ende buſyneſſe euer dylygentely enquyred howe treatyes wente forwarde thoſe party whan theſe men warre ſhulde departe whyder ſhuld drawe men countrey ſayde renome howe wolde go rynne bowfe robbynge pyllynge thanne erle caſte downe heed ſayde alwayes newes rynne amonge warre erle armynake bernarde brother yonge knowe well loue nat countrey theſe men warre may happe meanes rynne countrey howe wyll prouyde fore ſuche wyſe truſte ſhall take domage ſayd longe prouyſion maketh ſure poſſeſſyon thus erle foyze ſayde counſayle folyſſhe imagynacyon apered maye atteygne tretynge therof ye haue herde reherſed geffrey tete noyr breton hadde longe kepte garyſon ſtronge caſtell vandachor lymozyn fronter auuergne burbonoys wolde wyſe departe ye caſtell helde owne propre enherytaunce patyſed countrey aboute vnder pateſyng people labored peaſe reſte thus geffrey kepte eſtate greate lorde cruell man dyſpleaſure hadde pytye ſlee man beeſt nowe come purpoſe whan tydinges ſpred abrode auuergne lymozyn tayle gathered countreys entente voyde countrey theſe men warre brewted men warre fortreſſe vandachor ſhulde departe gyue vp fortreſſe duke berrey reaſon tydynges people contente pay tayle whan ſawe contrary moſt hurte garyſon vandachor thought money payed firſt gatherynge loſte ſayd howe wolde paye croſſe mayle without vandachor conſtreyned departe countrey theſe tydynges came • yng duke berrey ſoueraygne charge countrey auuerge lymozyn gelnadan duke counſayle ſayde surely theſe poore men haue good cauſe ſaye ſo lothe pay money nothinge ouer ſayde howe hym ſelfe counſayle blame layde nat ſiege aboute fortreſſe kepe garyſon fro iſſuyng thanne duke berrey ordeyned coſt charge countrey foure hundred ſpeares good men armes beſiege vandachor baſtydes ſoueraigne capytaynes company ſyr willyam lygnac ſyr iohan boeſme launce valyaunt knyght burbonoyſe theſe men armes knyghtes nere myght layde ſiege vandochor made ba • tydes foure place men countrey made great trench defence vpon ſtraytes ſtoppe iſſuinge capytayne geffrey ſet lytell therby knewe well gariſon well furnyſſhed maner thynges thoughe came newe vytayle ſeuen yere alſo caſtell ſtode ſo ſtrong place vpon rocke coude take domage aſſawte ſiege baſtydes within wold often tymes iſſue preuy poſterne whiche opened bytwene two rockes ſo wolde iſſue vnder couerte ryde abrod countrey toke priſoners thynge wolde bringe none fortreſſe coulde nat bycauſe ſtrayte wayes ſtronge mountaynes muſt paſſe iſſue coulde nat ſtopped fro aley vnder couert endured fro garyſon ſeuen eight leages came feldes whanne retourned agayne tyme entered thre leages ſure within caſtell maner vſed longe ſeaſon ſiege laye yere caſtell ¶nowe let v leaue ſpekynge vandachor tyll nother ſeaſon ſpeke newe mater duke burgoyne forgate nat promiſe made aunte duches brabante ordayned foure hūdred men armes burgonyons made two knyghtes capytayns one ſir guylliam tremoyle burgonyon ſir geruays merande almayne duke ſayd ſirs ye ſhall go charge fronters brabant guerles duches brabante wyll apoynt make enemyes good warre ye canne knyghtes ſayde ſhulde beſte fulfyll commaundemente made redy gadred men wente forthe ſoone myght drewe brabante ſente worde comynge duches brabante ſo paſſed lande luſenburge ordynaunce marſhall brabant ſente thre caſtels duke guerles chalēged wolde haue againe bycauſe ben layde pledge ſay buth gaulyth nulle helde garyſon made good fronter warre ſomtyme rode abrode encountre enemyes duke guerles fortefyed hym ſelfe agaynſte furnyſſhed townes caſtels agaynſt ſawe well warre open fortuned ſyr willyam tremoyle deſyringe auaunce hym ſelfe ſome thynge myght ſownde honoure ſet imagyncion day towne guerles foure leages fro fortreſſe towne called seaulle ſhewed ſecretely entenſyon ſyr geruays merande companyon lightly accorded mynde gathered company togyder departed aboute mydnyght rode rounde paſe towne guydes brought seaule tyme daylight reſted apoynted wolde ſhewed ſyr geruays xxx ſpeares went wyn̄e gate ſir willyam tremoyle folowe bycauſe feared ſhulde haue rydden togyder haue ſpyed thought towne ſhulde thynke none ſhulde certayne nombre men armes ſent thyder duke guerles refreſſhe garyſon thus knyght ſir geruays xxx ſpeares rode towne seaulle mornynge founde men woman goynge towne markette day ſaluted theym langage almayne rode forthe poore men went ſurely men countrey perteynynge duke guerles rydynge garyſon syr geruays company rode forthe tyll came gate founde open ſmall warde ſo erly moſte parte people beddes reſted lordes gate incontynent ſir willyam tremoyle route came galopynge thyder faſte myght entred towne cryed cryes thus towne wonne without defēce men towne thought full lytle frēchmen wolde haue done ſuch enterpriſe ye moſte parte thē beddes ¶howe frenche men brente ryfeled towne seaulle retourned garyſon ioy duke burgoyne duches brabante made dede howe ſir iohn̄ boeſme launce diſcomfyted englyſſhmen cap cxvii enterpriſe done nyght ſaynt marten wynter thre dayes came thyder knyght englā de ten ſpeares xxx archer ſente kynge englande knyght called ſyr guylliam fykaole whan larum began ryſinge bed herde towne wonne demaūded whome aunſwered done breton ah ꝙ knight breton yuell people wyll burne pyll towne departe crye crye ſyr ꝙ crye tremoyle englyſſhe knyght cloſed caſtell helde hym ſelfe company within ſe reſkewe came euery man ſo abaſſhed fled hyther thyder poore people fledde ye mynſter ſome auoyded ye towne another gate frenchman ſette fyre towne dyuerſe place howe many howſes ſtone bricke ye fyre coulde nat lighty burne moſte parte towne brent pylled robbed ſo nothyng lefte good rycheſt men towne taken priſoners englyſſhe knyght taken laſte whan ſawe loſt opened howſe douted fyre whan ſawe flame ſmoke euery corner ye towne ſo came penon hym company archer valiauntly defended ſelfes longe ſeaſon fynally taken yelden priſoner ſir guylliam tremoyle company taken fewe ſlayne whan frenchemen done wylles towne seaulle guerles varlettes driuing pyllage departed thought foly byde went gariſon fro whēce came thus duke guerles firſt buffet domage wherwith ſore dyſpleaſed whan knewe therof ſo came thyder great nombre menne warre thought well haue founde frenche men gone newe renpayred towne furniſhed newe men warre dilygēt kepe towne thanne thus daily aduētures warre fell ſome loſte one daye ſome another duches brabante tho countrey gretly reioyſed aduenture ſir gillyam tremoyle ſyr geruais merande atchyued great grace countrey ſayde nexte ſommer folowyng wolde wynne agayne whan duke burgoyne herde theſe tydinges howe men yt garyſon brabant dyd well valyauntly gladde therof incorage theym wrote pleaſaunt letter often tymes ſyr guylliam knyght thus taryed wynter kepinge well fronters defendynge ſelfe fro domage caſtelles fortereſſes guerles better taken hede vnto nowe ſhall ſhewe another enterpriſe perote bernois dyde auuergne gate gret profite meanes dyd ſhall ſhewe lenght fortuned ſame yere ſeaſon aboute tyme myddes maye xl companyons aduenturers iſſued caluſet whiche perot bernoys helde fortreſſe ſtode lymozyn theſe companyons rode forthe aduenture auuergne gaſcoyne ſquyer capytayne called geronet durante experte man armes bycauſe countrey alwayes doute ye men warre fronters burbonoys knyght duke burgoyne called ſyr iohan boeſme launce gracyouſe amorous knyght hauynge great corage auaunce hymſelfe whyle theſe englyſſhe men rode brode deman̄ded nombre ſhewed hym howe aboute xl ſpeares quod lytell regarde xl ſpeares wyll ſet many againſt ſo departe fro thence went chefe charge vandachor gate togyder xl fifty ſpeares lymozyn auuergne burbonoyſe hym knyght called ſir loys dambter alſo ſir loys dabton lorde ſaynte obyſe ſo toke feldes without kepyng high way knewe countrey came paſſage enemyes muſte nedes paſſe reaſone mountaynes ryuers whiche greate depe occaſion ſnowe fallyng fro mountayns nat ben halfe hour thenglyſſhment came thyder nat ware rencountre boeſme launce cōpany cauched ſpeares came agaynſt enemyes cryed cryes whan engliſſhment ſawe howe muſt nedes fight turned face enemyes defended ſelfe ſore rencountre certayne ouer throwen bothe partyes ſay trouth frenchman better expert men armes auenturers ſemed well none aduenturers returned agayne without varlettes fledde ſaued ſelfe whyle dyd fyght xxii taken ſyxtene ſlayne place capitayne taken priſoner thus departed ¶howe ſyr iohan boeſme launceled theſe priſoners moūte ferant howe countrey glad whan herde enterpriſe howe generot company ſette raunſome delyuered money perot bitrne lente hym cap cxviii rydyng ledynge theſe pryſoners boeſme lauce aduyſed remembred hymſelfe howe moneth ben towne mount ferante auuergne ſportyng amonge ladyes damoſels howe hadde deſyred hym tyme ſayeng fayre brother boeſme launce ye ryde often tymes abrode feldes may nat ſo fortune yt ſomtyme ye myght rencounter enemyes ſhall ſhewe quod one damoſels ſuch one great fauoure boeſme launce syr quod ſhe wolde fayne ſe englyſſhman aſquyer countrey called gurdines hathe ſhewed often tymes howe englyſſhmen experte men armes whiche ſemeth ryght well betrewe ryde often tymes abrode many propre deades armes taketh dyuerſe caſtels kepeth whiche tyme gētleman boeſme launce anſwered ſayd dame euer fortune take ye ſhall ſe hym syr thanke quod damoſell thus foreſayde enterpriſe whan promyſe came mynd forſoke way cleremonte whiche nat farre tourned way mountferant nat farre thence comyng mountferant iourney yt atchyued agaynſt aduenturers ſore troubled countrey people moūtferant right ioyfull made hym good chere toke lodgynge vnarmed hym ladyes damoſels came make hym chere receyued ryght ſwetly ſage knyght thanked ſayde deſyred hym ſe ſome englyſſe man dame wyll acquyte made promyſe nat paſt moneth go myght fortune take englyſſhe man ſhewe hym day god hath gyuen ye grace mete ſome ryght valyant armes haue gyuen v ynoughe howe hadde victory englyſſhe men naturally borne gaſcoyns make warre englyſſhmen byerne hyghe gaſcoyne ye ſhall ſe good leyſer loue haue brought towne • ſhall remayne tyll raūſomes payed ladyes damoſelles laughed tourned mater great ſporte ſayd hym sir thanke ſo taryed thre dayes amonge kept good company priſoners put raunſome ſawe well poore companyons aduenturers thought better hange drowne raunſome rather thanne ſuffre ſo many abyde ſtyll towne ſo whan departed thence ſayd geronet syr ye ſhall abyde certayne reſte company ſhall departe go ſeche raunſome ye ſhall paye ſhall apoynte ſhall receyue whanne money payed ye ſhall departe therfore remembre well nowe herafter hap lyke caſe lykewyſe syr quod geronet bounde ſo ſo thus boeſme launce departed retourned agayne ſyege vandachor twelue pryſoners taryed ſtyll mounteferante departed went galuſet perot bernois haue hym xxii hundred frankes taryed ſtyll moūtferant lay made good great watche layde went vp downe towne pleſure ſo fyftene dayes ſeaſon lerned moche ſtate towne whiche coſt hūdred thouſande frankes whan capytayne galuſet infourmed aduenture gere mandurant company ouer throwen ſir iohan boeſme launce made lytell therof ſaid theym came hym money raūſomes syrs ye come money delyueraunce howe ſaye ye nat ſo yes truely ſir quod truſt ſhall nat alwayes loſſe haue gage well ſirs quod nother care pledge yet loſſes ſhall haue nothynge made nat go rode owne aduēture therfore ye may ſhewe let aduenture delyuer thynke wyll enploye money ſorte nay ſurely canne haue alwayes cōpanyons ynowe ryde ſagely dyd forme wyll quyte man without taken company fynall anſwere coulde gette geronet ſayde amonge themſelfe beſt two thre v retourne agayne geronet ſhewe caſe thre retourned mountferante rode paſſed cleremoūt ſawe well walles nat great heyght ſayd one another towne prignable come hyder nyght maye gette great watche kepte muſte one tyme bargayne another tyme bye nat bargayne bye one daye thus rode forthe rode mountferante founde geronet companyons ſhewed anſwere perot bernoys wherof baſſhed wyſte nat howe gette raunſome thus daye nyght great dyſpleaſure next daye geronet ſayde brought thoſe newes syrs requyre retourne agayne capytayne ſhewe hym fro yt haue power whyle hym ſerued truely wyll yet pleaſure ſhewe hym tourne become frenche delyuer ſelfe ſhall wyn lytell therby god knoweth ſhall full ſore agaynſt wyll ſhall forbeare longe canne ſhewe hym wyll nowe delyuer v fro hence within moneth ſhal bring hym ſuche botye company ſhall wynne hundred thouſande frankes meſſage thre companyons retourned agayne galuſet ſhewed perot meſſage thanne ſtudyed lytell ſayd maye well ſayeth aduenture ſhall delyuer incontyuent ſo opened cofer wherin threſcore thouſande frankes nat gathered rente hadde byerne moſte parte pyllage towne dwelte fore warres twelue houſes erle foiz chefe lorde therof towne called dadam within thre leages ortays tolde oute xxii hundred frankes pynch frende knowen ſhall put aduenture well able wyn agayne mo wyll thus departed fro galuſet retourned mount ferante xiiii great leages bytwene good ſauecōduct wherby paſſed without daunger whan geronet knewe howe company ſhuld delyuered right ioyfull ſente ſhulde receyue money ſayde syrs holde tell money owe tolde xxii hundred frankes rekened expenſes lodgynges payed euery thynge largeſte ſo euery man contente whan payed gerenot hyred men horſes bringe theym galuſet whan ſyr iohan boeſme launce certifyed receyte money thynke dyd ſende el lefte ſtyll truſt ſtrength garyſon ſame ſeaſon ſir peter gyache chauncellour fraunce left • treaſoure whiche loſt ſame yere moſt parte whan geronet retourned galuſet companyons made hym good chere thre foure dayes perot le bernoys called hym ſayde geronet promyſe ye made ſeruantes cauſe delyueraunce nothyng el nat boūde paye raunſome ſeynge ye departed without leaue ye rode forthe aduenture therfore nowe holde promyſe el ſhall diſpleaſure bytwene wold ye knowe haue nat lerned leſe rather wynne capytayne quod geronet ye haue reaſon ſay ye ſir ſaye thus ye lyſte ſhall ſet towne mount ferant within xv dayes whiche towne great treaſure pyllage ryche marchaundyſe ryche villaynes therin great plenty chauncellour fraunce ſyr peter giache infourmed hathe great ryches within ſame towne knowe well towne moſt ſympleſt kept leſte taken hede towne realme syr ſaye promyſe haue made name god quod perot le bernoys well ſayd conſente therto ye knowe well maner towne howe kepte fortifyed enterpriſe dothe requyre great nombre syr quod geronette thre four hundred ſpeares ſhall well accomplyſſhe feate within towne men great defence well quod perot contente ſhall ſingnyfye capytayns fortreſſes aboute mater ſhall aſſemble gyder go thyder ¶howe geronet mandurante twelue company retourned mountferant howe perot bernoys foure hundred ſpeares went mount ferant wolde nat entre towne none waye gate cap cxix determynacion perot ſent capytaynes nexte aboute hym apoynted euery man mete ouſac caſtell byſſhopriche cleremount nat farre thence wherof ſomtyme barbe great pyller gaſcoyne capytayne companyons ſeuen fortreſſes aſſembled togyder ouſac englyſſhe men four hundred ſpeares well mounted ſixe leages ryde firſt came ouſac perote bernoys ſhewe enterpriſe take coūſayle capytayns aduyſe geronet accordyng informacyon gyuen hym geronet twelue hym arayed theym lyke rude vyllayne marchauntes cote fryſe ledde horſes tyed one another baggage accordynge cuſtome countrey thus departed fro ouſac brekynge daye ſo rode towardes mountferant lyke marchauntes entred towne noone none toke hede men thought full lytell hadde ben men warre towne demed ſurely ben marchaūtes come thyder fayre haue bought cloth dyaper ſaid came fro mounte pellier bye marchaūdyſe againſt fayre come thyder moche marchaundyſe fro cyties townes realme geronet company wente lodgynge ſyne crowne ſette vp horſes toke vp fayre chambre thē kepte theym ſtyll therein without goynge aboute towne feare ſpyenge ſo ſate made mery thought well wolde pay nothynge expenſes nyght beſy dreſſe horſes ſaid hoſt oſtes horſes hadde ſore trauayled day wherfore nede reſt prouyded plenty candels ſo went chambre dranke made mery wolde nat go bed hoſt hoſtes wente beddes lette alone ſuſpecte ſhall ſhewe perot company dyd ſayd day hym ſeuen capytayns firſte perot le bernoys chefe bourge compaygne called arnaldon bourge anglois ye bourge carlat apthon seguyn olyue barbe bernadon iſles great routter byerne lorde launce playne hym bourge compayne afterwarde enfourmed enterpriſe whiche done aboute candelmas whan nightes long colde ſame nyght rayned wynde blewe ſo ſtormy ſeaſon wherfore capytayne watche mountferant iſſued nat nyght lodgynge ſent ſonne forthe yonge ſyxtene yere age wente fro one gate foūde four poore men watchinge nygh deed colde ſayd yonge man syr take eche v blanke let v go home warme v paſte leuen clocke yonge man coueted money toke departed fro watche wente owne houſes geronet company watched hoſtes dore ſe whan watch men ſhulde retourne ſawe whan yonge man came fro watche watche men hym geronet ſayde mater goeth well lyke good nyght v euery manne towne nowe gone bedde watche paſte nede take care parte ſure perotte le bernoys company rydynge hyder warde faſt may dede ye ſame tyme comynge came nere cleremounte mette aymergotte marcell hundred ſperes capytayne fortreſſe aloſe beſyde ſaint floure whan eche knewe made good chere demaunded eche whyder wolde ſought countrey amergot aunſwered ſaid come fro fortreſſe aloſe ame goynge carlate name god ſayd two capytaynes bourge angloys bourge compaigne sir wolde ye thynge ſpeke wyth v yea quod amerigot ye haue certayne pryſoners countre dolphyn auuergne ye knowe well treatynge togyther meanes erle armynake wherfore wold gladly make exchaunge certayne priſoners haue garyſon ſore deſyred thus coū te dolphyn right good lady well worthy done pleaſure vnto bourge compaigne ſayd aymergotte ye greatly bounde ſome pleaſure lady within thre yere ye hadde ſyluer thre hundred frankes redemynge caſtell mercyer ſyr pray therle dolphyn ſeaſon syr quod ſhewed fraunce comunynge vpon treatie ye know hande erle armynake erle dolphyn perot le bernoys ſayde sir leaue thir comunynge come v ſhall profyte ye ſhall haue parte botye sir quod aymergot whyder go fayth ſir quod perot go ſtreyght mount ferante nyght towne ſhall yelden aymerygot ſayd ſyr yuell done ye go aboute ye knowe well treatie erle armynake coūtrey wherfore townes caſtels rekeneth themſelfe halfe aſſured wherfore ſhall greatly blamed thus ye ſhall breke treatye faythe quod perot wyll agre treatye longe maye kepe feldes behoueth companyons lyue come way v ye ſhall haue nothynge carlat companyons fortreſſe ſuche left behynd wyll nat ſuffre entre till company come home well ser quod aymerigot wyll nat go wyll returne agayne fortreſſe ſyth mater thus thus de parted one fro nother perot helde waye mountferant whan vnder cleremount reſted imagyned newe enterpriſe ſpecially certayne gaſcoyns knewe nat enterpriſe geronet ſayd capytayns sir beholde cytie cleremonte whiche ryche cytie rather prignable mount ferant haue ladder let v ſcale ſhall haue profyte mount ferante poynte nere greed thanne chefe capytayns ſayd sir cleremonte puiſſant towne well peopled men well harneſſed one moued wyl aſſemble togyther put theym ſelfe defēce doute ſhulde haue great aduaunatage ſhulde reculed perforce horſe taken loſte ſhulde yuell eſcape farre fro home coūtrey ſhulde ryſe purſue v ſhulde great daunger thynke better go forthe folowe fyrſt enterpriſe ſekynge newe enterpriſe per aduenture myght coſt v dere counſayle taken ſo rode forthe without makynge noyſe ſo aboute xi clocke nere mount ferant whan ſawe towne ſtode ſtyll thre bowe ſhot fro ye towne perotte ſayde beholde mount ferant company went towne kepe ſtyll cloſe gyder wyll go downe valaye ſe may ſe newes geronet hathe brought v enterpryſe departe nat tyll come agayne ſir quod go waye ſhall abyde therwith perot departed four hym wether ſo darke man coulde ſe acre brede fro hym alſo rayned blewe ſnewe meruaylouſe yuell wether geronet walles taryed ſome newes loked dowe ouer walles thought ſawe ſhadowe ſome men goynge long dyke ſyde began lytle ſtell ſoftely whā without herde came nerer wall dyke ſyde hadde water geronet demaūded without perot knew voyce ſayd perot le bernoys geronet art thou yea ſir quod make redy aproche men ſhall lette towne tho within towne ſlepe beddes quod perot ſhulde entre ye ſtande god kepe fro wyll nat entre entre wyll entre gate none place wyll quod geronette aſſure lyeth nat power ſyr bring ladder hyder ſpare nat ſckale aſſure none ſhall let well quod perot thou haſte promyſed lette towne ſurely wyll nat entre without gate well quod geronet nat mende nat lette gate faſte ſhytte kepers within ſlepe whyle ſtryfe certayne geronettes cōpany within went vp downe vpon walles ſe myght noyſe lytell poore houſe foote wall howſe ſtode alone farre fro houſe poore man dwelte therin taylour watched nyght tyll ſame tyme thanne goynge bedde wynde caryeth noyſe farre herde thought men ſpekynge walles nyght tyme man ſhall farre therwith wente howſe wente vpon walles ſo met men ſoone ſawe began crye one ſtept forthe toke throte ſayd vyllayne thou arte deed thou ſpeke one worde ſoo helde peace feared dethe geronet herde noyſe ſayde sir ſlee hym nat ſhall v good ſeruyce god hath ſent v hym ſhall furnyſſhe enterpriſe geronet ſayde perotte le bernoys ſyr retourne company whan ye fyrſt gate open come forthe youre ax breke downe gate next ſhewed aduenture man taken walles thanne perot departed wente company ſhewed mater ye haue herde ¶howe geronet lette perot le bernoys company towne mountferant wherof countrey frayde howe kynge vncles beynge parys therwith ſore dyſpleaſed alſo erle dolphyn auuergene cap cxx geronet ſayd man yt taken without thou fulfyll oure deſyre thou arte deed incontynente wolde ſhulde quod wyll quod geronet thou go gate wake porter ſay howe capytayne wolde haue gate opened el let delyuer key lette certayne marchauntes mounte pellyer without fardelles marchandyſe come fayre sir quod man wyll nat byleue yes warante quod geronet tell theym token nat watche laſt night ſent ſonne without thou meſſage well wyſely ſhall ſlee dagger ſo thy faute leſe nat myne enterpriſe whan poore man ſawe howe manaſſed perceyued howe redy ſlee ſore abaſſhed ſayd sir ſhall ye cōmaunde vttermeſt power ſo came gate knocked ſo longe tyll woke porter ſayd arte thou wakeſt v tyme nyght ſuche one quod named name haue ben nyght buſy makyng certayne geare capytayns ſo haue borne home whyle worde came hym howe certayne marchauntes mount pellier without gate marchandyſe ſore trauayled weate fowle wether wherfore capitayne commaundes open gate let come el gyue keyes ſhall let ſame token nat watche ſelfe nyght ſent ſonne trewe ꝙ porter abyde lytell thou ſhalt haue keyes incontynent one roſe toke key hanginge pyn opened lytell wyndowe delyuered keyes man toke theym incontynente geronet toke aduenture put right key locke opened ye gate went vtter gate wyſe coulde open perot company without taryenge openynge gate geronet ſayd ſirs helpe ſelfe auaunce forth wyſe open ſeconde gate breke vp ax otherwyſe ye nat entre towne without redy ax wedge hewed ye gate lyke carpenter ſoone coulde gette hole put ax wedge geronet company ſhuld hewe ſonder barres gate dyuerſe men herynge noyſe aroſe beddes meruayle myght thought full lytell englyſſhe men ſhuld haue reyſed beddes tyme night kepers gate yuell kept warde herynge men ſpeke horſes braye crye knewe well dyſceyued roſe came wyndowes gate beganne cry hygh voyce trayſon tray • towne began ryſe great feare many thought ſaue goodes ſelfe fledde caſtell • fewe entred chatelyn within caſtell whanne vnderſtode englyſſhe men wonne towne feare leſynge wolde nat lette downe bridge frendes came firſt lette come meanes planke whanne herde great brewte towne drewe gayne planke wolde put forthe wente aboute ſe defence ſhulde make caſtell aſſayled thus haue ſhewed howe fyrſte gate opened ſecond broken ax wedge entred fayre eaſely theſe capytayns companyons entred houſe rode ſtreates towne togyther ſe aſſemble make defence whan ſertched euery place founde man make reſiſtence certayne ſuche gone haue entred caſtell made lytell defence ſoone taken ſlayne ſhulde make longe proceſſe thus towne mounte ferante auuergne taken thurſday nyght thyrtenth day february perot le bernoys company whan ſawe howe lordes towne toke vp lodgynges eaſe without ſettynge houſe fyre doynge vyolence perot le bernois charged payne dethe man vyolate maner woman mayden ſette houſe fyre take good priſoner lytell greate tyll fyrſte knowledge therof alſo man ſhulde ſo hardy hurte churche trouble man churche take thynge therof maner euer perot vſed whan ſo euer wanne towne fortreſſe geffary tele noyre dyd always contrarye neuer cared churche nothynge el ſo myght haue get good cared nat howe ſame mornynge whanne tydinges dede came knowledge cleremounte whiche ſmall leage then ſore abaſſhed good cauſe enemyes nere wyſte nat ſaye toke good bede defende towne theſe newes ſpredde brode caſtell neuffe thyon vyc iſſoire ryon fro thence auige perſe caſtell mounte pencyer theſe townes countreys haue named moſte parte pertayned duke berrey farre countreys theſe tydynges ſpred brode howe theſe englyſſhe men gaſcoyns wonne taken good towne mount ferante auuergne many herde therof meruayled greatly doute countreys adioyning halfe frayde auuergne burbonoys foreſtes berrey whan theſe newes came parys kyng vncles ſore diſpleaſed whiche good reaſon ſame tyme erle dolphyn parys orderynge countrey hadde ſoueraygne charge kepynge therof erle armynake therfore dede greatly diſpleaſure thought ſhulde beare ſome blame dede bycauſe vnder rule excuſe reaſonable well knowen howe treatie companion wherfore thought countre tyme hadde ben good ſuretie incontynent erle dolphyn departed fro parys go auuergne ſette order countre lefte trayne behynde hym ſo rode alonely page toke waye moulyns burbonoyes go auuergne chaunged euery daye freſſhe horſes rode haſte ſaynt pier mynſter herde tidynges yt hadde nat herde ſhall ſhewe ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe perot le bernoys company toke coūſaile determyned nat kepe towne mountferante howe ſayde perot cōpany deꝑted then night pyllage priſoners went refreſſhed thē towne ouſac cap cxxi whan fridaye mornynge towne wonne thurſdaye nyght ye haue herde theſe capitayns lordes towne boū de faſte men ſo coude thē dommage ſertched aboute truſſed fardelles clothe naprye gownes furres thynges ſuche thought haue profite thā toke coūſayle whether ſhulde kepe ſtyll towne opynion kepe ſtyll fortifye mooſt parte ſayde abyde great follye ſo ſhulde encloſed rounde ſhulde farre fro ſocours fortreſſes ſo ſhulde beſieged ſhulde nat able withſtande ennemyes lykely haue ſocours ſo longe ſiege ſhulde famyſſhedde aboute many great gentylmen cyties good townes alſo whan duke berrey ſhulde knowe enterprice wyll ſēde hyther mareſhall fraunce ſir loyes sanxere alſo erle dolphyn auuergne erle armynake wyll come ſende beſiege v many great lordes lorde towre lorde dapthon lorde dapthyer lorde reuell lorde de la palayes dyuers yea ſpecially hyther ſhall come ſir iohan boeſme launce great nōbre theſe doutes ſage perot le bernoyes olyue barbe dyde caſt cōiecte ſayde taken ſhulde leſe haue fayne delyuer vp fortreſſes theſe capitayns concluded ſame nyght departe take botye priſoners mo than̄e two hundred ſet ſure garde gate thentent none ſhulde iſſue bewray entreprice ¶nowe ſhall ſhewe ſcrymyſſhe cleremount made ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe towne cleremont made ſcrimyſſhe theſe pyllers taken robbed towne mountferante gate towne cap cxxii whan̄e theſe tydynges knowen cleremōt englyſſhe menne takenne moūtferant ſoore abaſſhed nere neyghbours cleremont toke counſayle toguyder without towne cleremounte waye towardes mountferant churche frier fayre ſtronge well buylded realme fraunce whervnto parteyned great cloſe enuyroned ſtronge hyghe walles cloſe full vynes one yere another frier therof ſixſcore veſſelles wyne ſome ſayde within towne ſhulde beſt beate downe frier bycauſe ioyned ſo nere gate elles might diſtruction ſayde naye affyrmynge howe ſhulde great pytie dommage diſtroye ſo goodly houſe ſayde sir lette v go mount ferant ſermyſſ ennemyes let v beſiege ſhall neuer ſcape v knyghtes squyers countrey burbonoys foreſtes wyll drawe hyther within theſe foure dayes ſurelye ſhalbe beſieged whyle thus debatynge matter threſcore compaygnions made ſelfe redy departe towne go ſe ennemyes ſerimyſſhe theym man dyde lette theym beſt towne company deſyringe wynne honoure toke xxx croſbowes ſo rode towardes mount feraunt thanne iſſued cleremounte mo two hundred men fore folowed thanne horſemen rode ſtreyght barryers mount feraunte tidynges came towne capitayns howe cleremount come vyſette barryers whiche tidyngꝭ greatlye reioyſed hundred armed moūted horſes opyned gate iſſued fronte cryed ſaynt george whan cleremō toy ſawe cōmyng ſo fierſely afrayed vanquyſſhed within ſelfe beganne recule without ſhewynge face defence ſo fledde hyther thyder beſt horſed cō mynge cleremount formaſt ſayeng howe wolde fyrſte ſhulde make aſſaute fyrſt retourned agayne towne gaſcoyns gaſcons horſes go cleremontoys hadde fewe entred agayn towne howe beit chaſed tyll mette fote men lykewiſe fledde kepte none order lepte vynes dyke ſaue themſelfe croſbowes came cleremount kepte better array company dyde cloſe toguyder toke vyne yarde bent bowes made vyſage defence kepte ſelfe tyll englyſſhe menne withdrawen backe agayne mountferant cleremont loſt twētie men ſixe ſlayne fourtene taken thus fell enterprice day euery mā truſſed made redy departe ſame nyght ſixe clocke euery man hadde truſſed vp baggage laded horſes ſette ſelte foote paſt nat threſcore horſebacke ſo ſette forwarde ſtretes ſomers caryages hadde well foure hundred horſe charged clothes naprie furres thynges neceſſary founde towne cofes preſſes full ſtuffe lafte clene voyde bounde priſoners two two toguyder whan redy nyght opyned gate iſſued taryed mount feraunt eyghtene houres ſette cariage thā priſoners foote men capitayns horſebacke came nyght darke countrey nat aduyſed departynge wherfore nat purſued mydnight came ouſacke fro whens came ſeconde day reſted ſhewed wanne ſame voyage hundred thouſande frankes beſyde priſoners sir peter gyache chauncelloure fraunce loſte parte redy money thyrtie thouſande frankes aboue companyons well counſayled leaue mount feraunt auuergne ſo ſoone dyde taryed two dayes lengar dyde hadde nat departed without great daunger paraduenture loſſe lyues knyghtes ſquiers countrey gathered toguyder came thyder puyſſaunce haue layde ſiege towne lordes coū trey ye haue herde named none taryed behynde erle dolphyn come within two dayes iourney herde tidynges howe englyſſhmen gaſcoyns departed owne fortereſſes trouthe hole mater ſhewed hym whan̄e knewe trouthe rode eaſe came ſaynt purſayne fro then moulyns burbonoyes foūde duches burbone doughter ſore frayde aduenture howe whan ſhe knewe aduentures gone ſhe gladde therof thanne ſhe thought countrey ſurer faythe quod erle wolde coſte greatly taryed ſtyll mount ferant tyll come thyder nowe ſhulde haue yuell ende coulde nat haue better enterpriſe auuergne wherby haue recouered fortreſſes holde ſemeth well ſkylfull men warre taryed lengar gone owne holdes pyllage priſoners thus erle ducheſſe doughter cōmuned toguyder perot le bernoys olyue barbe bourge cōpayne bourg angloys apthon seguyn capitayns fortreſſes whan cōe ouſacke departed botye pyllage priſoners ſome raunſomed ledde fortreſſes carlat ſome gaſlucet countre auuergne toke better hede holdes hadde done howe erle armynake erle dolphyn ſente perotte le bernoys ſayeng howe falſely traytourouſly taken ſtollen towne mountferant robbed ledde away priſoners counſaylynge hym make therof amendes conſydringe howe treatie toguyder • peace perotte aunſwered ſayde sauyng grace ſelfe ſeuyn capitayns takynge mountferant neuer maner treatie theſe erles toke nat towne fraudulently ſtale entred gate whiche opyned redy receyue company hadde ſworne treatie wolde haue kepte ſurely neuer entencyon wyll caſe mater ſtoode lordes coude haue none anſwere sir peter gyache ſore diſpleaſed loſſe hadde mounte ferant recouered ſelfe well myght thus aduentures fell ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe duke berrey maryed lady mary doughter erle bloys ſonne howe ſame yere ſonne duke berrey marryed lady mary fraunce ſuſter yong kyng charles fraunce cap cxxiii yere lorde god thouſande thre hūdred fourſcore ſixe moneth auguſt guye erle bloyes lady mary wyfe departed fro ye towne bloyes well acompanyed knightes ſquyes ladyes damoſelles go berrey theym yonge ſonne hadde fyaunced yere mary doughter duke berrey entencyon erle bloyes coūteſſe wyfe whan ſhulde come burgus berrey ꝓcede ye ſayd maryage lykewiſe entencyon duke berrey duches wyfe thus whā theſe ꝑties come togyder theſe two chyldren ioyned togider mariage churche ſaynt stephyn burgus cardynall chauncellour berrey byſſhoppe poyters yere enſured theym toguyder maryage loyes bloyes lady mary berrey cytie burgus made great feeſt tryumphes iuſtes turneyes feeſt endured eight dayes whā accomplyſſhed erle bloyes counteſſe tooke leaue duke berrey ducheſſe ſo returned bloyes hadde yonge doughter alſo ſame yere iohn̄ berrey ſonne duke berrey called erle mountpenſier maryed lady mary fraunce ſuſter yonge kynge fraū ce ſame yere theſe maryages thus made tyme lente ducheſſe berrey mary fraunce doughter ſonne rode towne bloyes ſe erle bloyes counteſſe chyldren receyued caſtell bloyes great ioye theſe mater ſir iohan froiſſarte preſent whan great feeſt thre dayes departed toke way poyters went water ryuer loyre amboyſe fro then chares horſebacke tyll came poytou ducheſſe helde houſe mooſt cōmonly good caſtell good towne called chynon yere dyed mary fraunce beyng yonge wyfe erle mountpenlier lykewiſe ſoone dyed lady iane armynake ducheſſe berrey thus duke berrey ſonne marry agayne dyd nat ouer ſoone whiche maryages ſpecyallye duke ſhall ſhewe whan mater ſhall requyre haue declared ye haue well herde howe duke guerles defyed french kyng diſpyte fully whiche ſpoken • ſar nere brute nat done curteſſe maner ſtyle vſage defyances trouthe ſawe ſelfe certayne writynges paper whiche ſayde true copy bycauſe ſawe nat vnderſeale aproued ſuch mater ought touche great prince ſuche frenche kyng therfore gaue greatcredence therto howe ſemed well defyaunce diſpleaſaunt realme wolde haue amended duke guerles ſhulde excuſe hym ſpytefull wordes defyaunce kynges coūſayle wolde wyſe mater ſhulde reſt ſo great lordes fraunce ſayde without kyng founde ſome remedy realme ſhulde greatly blame ſayd howe kynge yonge forwarde yt well ſene iourney flaunders go nat forwarde nowe reuenge dede men wolde ſpeke dyuerſlye noble realme fraunce ſhulde counſayle kynge ſworne kepe defende honour refourme myſordred entent kynge realme ſhulde beare blame lorde coucy toke payne mater ſhewed well howe mater touchedde hym nere knewe almayns better thā dyde hadde often cōpanyes well chalenge made duchy auſtryche inſydentes hadde amonge kynges vncles ſawe well howe noble realme well enclyned haue mater redreſſed ſpecially duke burgoyne hadde great affectyon therto duke guerles haryed pylled ducheſſe brabantes countrey whiche enherytaunce ſhulde retourne hym ye dethe two ladyes right aged duches ſuſtre wherfore wolde outher warre meanes duke guerles apeaſed howe fyrſt requiſyte make membres fraunce one one opinyon ſhulde farre iourney kynge go fraunce almaygne conquere landes countreis whiche kynge coulde nat without hole puyſſaunce hym nat knowen whyder almaygnes couetous people wolde helpe aſſyſt duke guerles nat alſo furthermore duke burgoyne noble men fraunce ſawe well howe duke bretayne great differēce realme fraunce began marueylouſly ſhewed dedes lyue haue warre ye realme fraūce peace lordes knewe well howe prouyded townes caſtels cyties great prouiſyon men vitayls artillary defende ſiege beſydes often tymes wrote englande louynge treatable wordes make alyaunce euer englyſſhmen wyllyng therto entent warre fraunce myght better thanne counſayle fraūce wolde nat ſhulde lefte behynde ſuche myſt bretaygne firſt myght putte waye good meanes condute thought wolde nat putte realme doute kynge ſhulde go almaygne leaue realme deſtytute kynges vncles ymagined wyſte nat howe ſtoppe duke bretayne ſuche ſent thyder retourned byſſhoppe lā gers ſir iohan vyen ſir iohan de beull ſhewed kyng vncles howe done nothyng purpoſe thā duke berry aduyſed ſende bretayne entreat duke coſyn erle stampes ſage perſone treatable duke deſyred hym ſayde fayre coſyn behoueth ye go bretaygne ſpeke coſyn duke ye fynde hym harde highe wordes chafe nat hym treate hym ſwetely good maner ſpeke ſagely hym bring hym good reaſon may ſhewe hym howe kynge brother burgoyne wolde nothing hym good loue peace wyll abyde holde v ſhall alwayes redy hym pleaſure alſo ſhewe hym caſtels holdeth cōſtables ſmall occaſion hath ceaſed wolde pleaſe hym rendre agayne ſhulde greatly honour howe kynge ſhall gyue hym fayre good place wyll choſe realme good coſyn ſo moche bringe v ſome good tydinges tarieng departe nat fro tyll ye bring ſome mater paſſe haue well remembraūce buſyneſſe anſwere order eſtate erle stampes anſwered ſayde sir ſhalbe done right gladly erle stāpes charge fro duke berey go bretayne duke coſyn taried nat long made hymſelfe redy paſſed chartres good countre mayne ſo came anger founde quene naples hadde ben wyfe duke aniou called kyng naples cicyle hieruſalem duke pole calabre erle prouence company two fayre ſonnes loyes charles lady receyued coſyn erle stampes ioyfully iohn̄ bretayne loued nat duke bretayne nat power ſhewe forthe yuell wyll amende whan therle stampes ben daye night tooke leaue departed rode chaſteaulx iourneyed ſo long came cite naū te refreſſhed hym demaūded duke ſhewed hym howe march wē ne therefoūde duke receyued ioyouſly nere coſyns togider erle stampes right well coude acquyte hymſelfe amonge great prince ladyes brought vp amonge theym youthe acquytedde hym ſelfe right ſagely duke ſhewed nat princypall affectyon corage fyrſte commynge diſſymuled two thre dayes whan ſawe tyme humyled hym ſelfe greatlye duke rather therby drawe hym entent ſayd sir right dere coſyn ye ought nat marueyle thoughe come ſo farre ſe greatlye haue deſyred notably ſhewed hym charge hadde ſaye hym behalfe duke berrey whiche wordes duke made light reſolucion anſwere tyme duke ſayde coſyn knowe well ye haue ſayde trewe ſhall remembre ye ſhall abyde v long ſhall pleaſe comyng dothe v great pleaſure aunſwere erle coulde nat haue tyme erle taryed fyftene dayes duke ſhewed hym gret loue ſhewed hym fayre caſtell ermyn whiche nere wannes whiche duke newely made toke parte paſtaūce alwayes whanne ſawe conuenyente tyme ſhewed ſwetely ſagely cauſe comyng euer duke aunſwered hym ſo couertly erle coulde haue ſuretie aunſwere make reſtytucion hundred thouſand frankes caſtels helde conſtables whiche yet ende dyd without requeſt perſone whan leſte loked ſhall ſhewe hereafter enfourmed whan ye erle stampes ſawe laye vayne thought take leaue retourne fraunce ſo dyd duke gaue hym leaue departynge gaue hym fayre whyte palfrey aparelled ben kynge gaue hym fayre rynge ſtone well worthe thouſande frankes thus erle departed retourned anger founde quene napoles iohan bretayne greatly deſyred tydynges ſayd fayre coſyn thynke ye haue ſped well ye haue taryed longe erle ſhewed parte buſyneſſe fynally howe ſpedde nothynge whan taryed day departed went towrs laſt came berrey founde duke mehyn caſtell whiche newly made workemen dayly theron whan duke berrey ſawe erle stampes made hym good chere demaunded tydinges bretayne declared fro poynt poynte ſente herde ſayde howe wyſe coulde breke duke bretayne fro purpoſe duke berrey paſſed mater lyghtly whan ſawe wolde none otherwyſe ſo retourned fraunce king duke burgoyne brother ſhewed theym howe ſente bretaygne duke coſyn erle stampes declared euery poynt howe ſpedde thus mater reſted whan ſawe none remedy ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe departynge duke lācaſtre euer wonne galyce frenchman recouered leſſe fyftene dayes howe engliſſhmen ben ī warre defamed ſpake yuell coūtrey galyce howe frenche kynge ſent duke irelande ca cxxiiii hath reſyted hyſtory howe engliſſhmen dyd galyce howe duke ducheſſe doughter came ye porte portyngale taryed ſeaſon kynge iohan portugale yonge quene doughter duke lancaſtre ye haue herde anoyed greatly duke nat without cauſe done nothynge profyte ſeaſon caſtyle hadde done great domage men deed ſykenes beſt company knyghtes ſquyers ſuche conqueſt hadde made great payne coſt ſawe well ſhulde beſoone recouered agayne kynge caſtell dede ſo ſone departed entred portugale ſpanyardes knyghtes fraunce ſuche taryed ſyr olyuer cleſquyn conſtable caſtyle ſawe duke lancaſtre departed maner englyſſhe men departed fro hym ſette forwarde reconquere agayne ben loſte realme caſtyle whiche ſone done townes caſtels cyties galyce rather haue ben vnder obeyſaunce kynge caſtyle vnder duke lancaſter without able haue kepte felde haue defended countrey caſtyle lombardy italy vſage euer ſaye lyue ſtrongeſt wynneth euer duke lancaſtre wonne fro feaſt eaſter begynnynge iuly wonne agayne refreſſhed newe frenchman men caſtyle englyſſhmen left duke garyſons thought haue taryed peaſably wynter ſone put outher fayre meanes perforce ſome ſlayne ſuche wolde nat yelde vp ſome returned ſauecōducte paſſe portugale ſo bayon burdeaux duke lancaſtre well aduertyſed beynge cytie porte portugale coude nat remedy whiche ryghtſore dypleaſaunte herte nat beleued contrary noble valyaunt ſage man diſpleaſures hym bytter paynefull howe duke wolde ſay often tymes bare good face haue loſt yere grace god nother ſeaſon ſhall v fortune worlde meruaylous nat always permanente alſo kynge portugale gaue hym alwayes good comforte ſayde syr ye may abyde kepe aſtate wryte youre bretherne frendes englande maye ſende nexte marche fyue ſyre hundred ſpeares two thouſande archer ſhall gather gyder power people haue good myndes make warre caſtyle ſo ſhall make good warre ſomtyme one countrey wynneth nother leſeth duke lancaſtre thanked kynge portugale good comforte offre howe beit kyng ye duke ſonne lawe maryed doughter ſayde good wyll yet duke diſcouered nat corage knewe well englande trouble great debate monge lordes howe lordes hadde mater yno attende vnto well kepynge fronters agaynſt scotlande treate duke bretaygne kyng knewe well whan duke came englande ſette forwarde armye wherfore thought ſhulde harde get newe ayde thence ſeinge realme ſo many great charge redy alſo thought well ſuche englyſſhmen retourned wolde come thyder agayne thought rather ſhulde dyſcorage come duke conſidered theſe mater mynde whan ben ſeaſon cytie porte kynge portugale daye ſayd syr ſhulde profyte retourne bayon march burdeaulx dyuerſe reaſons ſawe well beynge portugale coulde lytell aduaūtage nat herytage deſyred ſayde goynge archebyſſhoppriche burdeaux auloſe ſo retourne bygore ſo lande lombriſience countie foyze countie armynake ſo garonne dordone entrynge pier gourte querchyn rochelloys xayntone criſtynge poictou auuergne lymoſyn wherin many garyſons caſtels holden engliſſhe parte wolde make warre ſake wherfore ſayd better hym amonge theym counſaile encorage place alſo ſayde howe portugale farre newes englande alſo knewe well yt englyſſh men wolde lothe come thyder bycauſe long voyage ſee alſo knewe well ſhyppes spaygne galyce caſtyle goynge comynge ſee flaunders marchandyſes whiche alſo great daunger encountrynge theſe thynges conſydred duke lancaſtre prepared departynge ſhyppes apoynted hym kynge patrone called alphons bretat whan theſe galyes redy wynde good duke duches doughter toke leaue kynge portugale quene ſo toke ſhyppynge entred ſee abydynge goddes pleaſure wyndes wynde wether pleaſure ſo aryued bayon whoſe comynge countrey ioyfull deſyringe ſore ſe whan duke duches doughter aryued bayon tydynges therof ſpredde abrode burdeloys ryght ioyfull therof ſir iohan harpdame ſeneſſhall burdeaux ſeneſſhall landes came thyder ſe duke ſo dyd gentleman countrey lorde mucydente lorde dura lorde roſem lorde landuras lorde leſpare lorde newechaſteaur knyghtes ſquyers countrey thus came dayly ſome one tyme ſome another offred hym ſeruyce ought lord thus duke taryed bayon often tymes ſente englande kynge nephewe bretherne writynge nothynge comforted nother men armes archer worlde wente duke buſyneſſe lytell taken hede vnto lorde knyght ſquyer make haſt auaunce forwarde ayde duke lancaſtre ſuche ben portugale made ſuche reporte realme englande man corage auaunce thyder euery man ſaid voyage caſtyle farre fro v profytable v haue warre fraunce good ſwete countrey temperate good lodgynges fayre ſwete ryuers caſtyle thynge harde rockes mountaynes whiche nat good eate vntemperate ayre troubled ryuers dyuerſe meates ſtronge wynes hote poore people rude yuell arayed farre fro maner wherfore folly go thyder entre great cytie towne wenynge fynde maruayles ſhall fynde nothynge wyne larde empty cofers contrarye realme fraunce whan fortune wyn towne cytie fynde ſuche rycheſſe baſſhed therof good make warre may haue profyte let v aduenture leaue vnhappy warre caſtyle portugale thynge pouuertye domage thus englyſſhe men ſayde englande ſuche caſtyle ſo lordes perceyued well howe voyage fauoure englyſſhe men alſo realme trouble iuſtyce triuylyen outher newly done duke irelande departed realme kynge rycharde came guydynge newe counſayle whiche hadde nat well lerned reaſon ſuche inſydentes matter abode harde caſe duke lancaſtre beynge cytie bayon helde ſeaſon theſe buſyneſſes well caſtyle portugale englande departyng duke irelande well knowen frenche kynge counſayle haue parfyte knowledge ordayned frenche kynge vncles ſende trecte ye duke irelande gyue hym ſure ſaueconduct come fraunce tarye longe bothe partyes pleaſed behouable ſende hym ſpecyall meſſangers ſure wrytyng fro kyng el duke irelande wolde nat haue come knewe well loue fauoure lorde coucy great baron realme fraunce great lynage cauſe loue hym ye haue herde acordynge trouthe duke nat well acquyted hymſelfe wyfe doughter lorde coucy certaynly principall thing toke awaye good renome honour bothe fraunce place lykewyſe blamed defamed hated englande well fraunce whan frenche kynge concluded ſende duke irelande lorde coucy ſpake moche agaynſt myght ſo many reaſons layde hym alſo bycauſe kyng wolde haue contente ſuffre frenche kynge yong deſyred greatly ſe duke irelande bycauſe reputed good knyght alſo bycauſe ſayd howe ſo well beloued kynge englande thanne ſente knyght clerke notary kynges whan duke irelande herde fyrſte howe frenche kynge ſente hym maruayle therof hadde dyuerſe imagynacyons entente ſhulde ſente fraunce howe fynally thought myght go ſurely fraunce ſe kynge reaſon ſaueconducte returne agayne pleaſure departed fro trecte rode forthe theym kynge ſent hym rode ſo longe came paris kyng caſtell lowre duke well receyued kynge vncles frenche kynge deſyred abyde ſtyll apoynted hym place kepe houſe aſtate duke ynough ſo conueyed englande good ynough alſo ye conſtable fraūce ought hym certayne money raunſome iohan bretayne whiche nat payed thus duke wente whan pleaſed hym ſe kynge hadde good chere feaſtes iuſtes triumphes duke alwayes ſente ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe conſtable fraunce wolde nat acorde king ſhulde go almayne bycauſe inſydentes realme howe duke bretaygne fournyſſhed garyſons made alyaunce kyng englande kynge nauerre army made englyſſhe men cap cxxv ye haue herde howe erle de stampes ſent bretayne duke berrey thynkynge haue brought duke bretayne fayre wordes mynde entenſyon coulde nat brynge aboute retourned agayne without atteynynge thynge purpoſe wherof fraunce greatly abaſſhed ſpecially ſuche kinges coūſayle knewe well kyng great deſyre go almayne ſe landes coſyns duke iulyers reuenged hygh wordes cruell defyaunces duke guerles wyſe men counſayle fraunce ſuche conceyued well mater imagyned therin great parell realme clerely perceyued howe duke bretayne wolde wyſe condyſcende reaſon helde ſtyll purpoſe thought greatly preiudycyall honoure realme fraunce hym take conſtable fraunce ſette hym raunſome hundred thouſande frankes kepe thre caſtelles good towne alſo ſawe howe duke bretayne makynge great alyaunces kynge englande knewe well howe duke fortifyed greatly townes caſtels bretayne went aboute get hym frendes dyuers partyes ſo moche many noble menne bretayne wyſte nat outher go fraunce byde ſtyll duke take parte agaynſt kynge realme fraunce whiche neuer thought moſte parte knyghtes squyers bretaygne alwayes good frenche counſayle fraunce doubted kynge wente realme puyſſaunce whiche muſte nedes ſhulde goo almaygne duke bretayne bring countrey englyſſhmen outher ſaynte malowe ſaynt mathewes lamballe camperle lantriguier guerrando bownte wennes ſee coſte englyſſhemen coulde nat haue better entre fraunce bretayne knewe nat kynges honour ſaued howe breke duke bretayne fro purpoſe kynges counſayle ſayde ſhall kynges dyſhonour breke nat duke purpoſe ye duke nat lorde peaſably ouer owne countrey thynke lordes knyghtes ſquyers bretayne wyll nat agaynſt v mayntayne duke opynion therfore name god lette kynge kepe voyage lette conſtable
