lordes byde countreys defende realme opynyon well vpholde many kynges counſayle ſome ſayde naye therto ſayde howe kyng coulde nat well go realme without conſtable hym wyſer hathe experyence warre great nombre thus argued ſome ſayd lette two kynges vncles go one leſt layde duke burgoyne ſhulde go two thouſande ſpeares ſyre ſeuen thouſande men warre ſayde moſte meteſt hym go warre touched hym nere bycauſe moued reaſone duchy brabante ſhulde haue brabante whome ſhulde fynde nombre ſome ſeuen hundred ſpeares xx thurty thouſande comons countrey brabante nother ſorte ſayde ſirs opynyons nat good kyng wyll go nameth hymſelfe chyefe warre defyed wherfore muſte go conſydrynge charge good go yonge contynueth warre better ſhall loue ſome ſayd ſo hardy counſayle kynge go almayne ſo farre countrey amonge theym hyghe prowed people great parell entre vpon kynge entred yet great daunger retournynge agayne whan ſhall knowe kynge noble fraunce entred countrey wyll aſſemble togyder kepe ſuche countrey knowe nat ſo maye v great domage couetous people aboue haue pytie haue vpper hande harde yuell handelers priſoners putteth ſondry paynes compell theym make raunſomes greater haue lorde great man priſoner make great ioye therof wyll conuey hym boeſme auſtryche xaſenne kepe hym ſome caſtell inhabytable people worſe ſarazins paynyms exceſſyue couetouſneſſe quencheth knowledge honoure lette v go put kynge daunger amonge theſe people thynge happen fall myſſe chaunces fortune maruaylous ſhall ſayde howe haue brought kynge thyder betray dyſtructyon realme nat augmentynge therof god defende realme fro domage parell kyng go muſte haue parte noble men hym myſſe fortune fall realme fraunce loſte without recouery therfore loke wyſely good counſayle kyng go voyage almayne ſome ſuche wyſely coniected parelles imagynacyons ſayd name god lette nother kynge go yet ſende thyder puyſſaunce though duke guerles yonge youthe wytte haue made hym defye kynge whiche nat done greate wyſdome good counſayle rather done foliſſh pride yonge people wolde flye haue wynges ſythe hathe thus defyed kynge lette hym alone ſuffre hym purſewe deſyaunce realme fraunce great entre realme maner wyſe kinge ſhall ſone enfourmed therof ſhall haue iuſte cauſe ſtyre vp people go fyght agaynſte hym ſo euer fynde hym el make hym flye yelde hym felde therby kynge ſhall haue honour leſſe charge go guerles ſuche knowe countrey ſaye come duke lyſte muſt paſſe foure great ryuers lyſte great ryuer loyre namur charite alſo ſay fowle countrey yuell lodgynges noble men counſaylouts fraunce thus dyuers imagynacyons voyage kynge wolde make almayne ſurely ben auaunſed ſoner forwarde nat douted venym myght growe occaſyon bretayne duke mater drewe theym backe indede good cauſe doute duke bretayne well infourmed defyaunce duke guerles hadde made frenche kynge howe yonge kinge charles wolde go almayne duke loked nothyng el kynge ſhulde one departed realme fraunce hadde ordeyned concluded bytwene hym englyſſhe men ſuffre engliſſhe army entre countrey alſo ſubtyle meanes drawen acorde moſte parte good townes bretaygne ſpecyally nauntes wennes rennes lentriguier guerrādo lambale ſaynte malo ſaynte mathewe defyn poterne noble men coulde nat gette opynyon duke imagyned lordes ſhulde go conſtable fraunce almayne thanne warre entente ſhulde ſoner come paſſe cauſed townes caſtels well prouyded vytayles artyllary ſhewed well howe inclyned rather warre haue peaſe alſo great alyaunce charles yonge kyng nauerre duke promyſed hym might come entent haue puyſſaunce men armes archer englāde wolde bringe ſtreight normandy recouer fyrſt good townes caſtels kynge charles fraunce vncle kynge nauerre taken fro hym men lorde coucy outher kynge nauer great truſt reaſon therof helde humble loue duke lancaſtre bayon bytwene theym great alyaunces ſawe great apparence ſhall ſhewe yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore eyght ſeuenth daye aprell concluded kynge englande counſayle vncles duke yorke duke gloceſtre erle rycharde arundell ſhulde heed chefe army ſee hym thouſande men armes thre thouſande archer hamton fyftene day may fynde nauy redy apparelled euery man apoynted go redy daye kynge englande ſaynte george daye nexte helde great feaſt caſtell wyndeſore chefe lordes ſhulde go therle arundell toke leaues kynge quene ladyes ſo came hampton daye apoynted entred ſhyppes twenty day may whiche fayre clere day erle arundell erle notyngham erle deuonſhyre ſyr thomas percy lorde clifforde ſir iohn̄ ware wyke ſir willyam de la selle lorde cameux ſyr stephyn de libery ſyr willyam helman ſyr thomas moreaur ſyr iohan dambreticourt ſyr roberte sere ſir peter mountbery ſir loys clombo ſir thomas coq ſyr willyam pulle dyuers good men armes thouſand ſpeares aboute thre thouſande archer theym horſes truſted might come entente entre bretayne refreſſhe ſhulde fynde horſes ynowe good price ſerue daye departed fro hampton ſo fayre peaſable meruayle drewe towardes normādy nat purpoſyng lande parte paſſe fronters normandy bretayne tyll herde newes nauy certayne veſſels called ballengers ſayled ſe myght fynde aduenture lyke maner knyghtes lande go bataylles dyſcouer coūtrey enbuſſhes ¶nowe ſhall leaue ſeaſon ſpekynge army ſpeke ſomwhat buſyneſſe guerles brabant ſhewe howe ſiege layde graue ¶howe brabanſoys layde ſiege towne graue howe conſtable fraunce toke ſaynte malo ſaynte mathewes ſet men garyſon howe duke lancaſtre bayon greatly dyſcomforted coulde gette maner ayde cap cxxvi hath ſhewed auncyent duke guerles howe eldeſt ſonne duke guerl • whome treat preſent tyme maryed doughter berthalce malynes therby bringe daunger redeme againe herytage whiche ſore trouble duke guerles ſonne duke iulyers entertayne kepe ye towne graue agaynſt brabanſoys cauſe iuſte tytle whan ſawe howe coulde nat gette agayne thre caſtels gauleth buth nulle ryuer muſe pertaynynge herytage countrey guerles thought attrybute towne graue herytage euer duke baſtarde doughter maryed ſonne lord bruke enherytour towne graue amyable treatye bytwene bytwene fader ſonne lorde bruke gaue towne ſygnory graue duke guerles preſence knyghtes guerles iuliers cauſe duke guerles dyd recompence lorde bruke landes breſde ryuer lighen duchy guerles marchyng countrey holande aboue brabaunte towne breſde fayre caſtell towne great profytable towne graue better duke guerles dyd entent haue iuſte tytle kepe towne graue agaynſt brabanſoys duches brabant brabanſoys ſaid howe lorde bruke pledge myght quyte whan wolde duke guerles ſayd nayetherto reaſon wherof warre moued moneth may brabanſoys came layde ſyege towne graue many lordes knyghtes ſquyers puyſſaunce good townes brabante thyder brought engyns ſpringals habylimentes warre xl thouſande one ſkrymyſſhynge dayly towne graue ſtandeth ryuer mueſe ſyde brabante bridge ouer ryuer go countrey guerles ſiege euery thynge plenty good chepe euery thynge though bruſels euery day ſkrymyſſhynge barryers graue ſuche wolde aduenture ſelfe sometyme put backe ſome tyme droue enemyes towne chaunce aduenture fell duke guerles well infourmed ſiege laye foure leages fro nymarſe wrote often tymes englande truſted haue ſocoure reaſon englyſſhe army wherof erle arundell capytayne ſee ſone wynde wether wyll ſerue come guerles reyſe ſyege graue duke guerles knewe well towne graue ſtrong well forty fyed ſo thought coulde nat wonne none aſſaute outher trayſon treatye truſted theym gruae ſure faythfull hym thus ſiege endured longe grane erle arundels army ſee tooke lande ſtyll kepte fronters normandy norman fro agaynſt mounte ſaynte mychell downe alonge depe ſaynt valery croty nat well aſſured wherto ſhuld take hede porte hauens normandy refreſſhed frenche kynge good men armes croſe bowes reſyſte agaynſte parelles marſhall blankewyll ſette towne carentyne ſtandyge ſee whiche olde tyme pertayned herytage kynge charles nauerre lorde ambre lorde coucy two gret lordes normandy conſtable fraunce toke towne ſaynte malo towne ſaynte mathews ſoone knewe englyſſhe men ſee ſette men thoſe townes name frenche kyng ſeaſon thought ſurely haue open warre duke bretayne knyghtes ſquyers ſayde armye ſee englyſſhmen ſente thyder none purpoſe ſente duke bretayne lande countrey ſayd none lykely alwayes ſhyppes kepte coſte bretaygne without force wetherſome tyme cauſed departe yet alwayes breuely retourned agayne ſame coſte ye haue herde howe duke lācaſtre departed realmes caſtyle portugale imagynacyons turned hym great dyſpleaſure ſawe well buſyneſſe ſore troubled darked fortune often tymes falleth ſondrie ꝑſons ſomtyme good ſomtyme yuell whan leſt thought whan duke lancaſtre departed realme englande acō panyed good mē armes archer thought haue ſped otherwiſe dyde ſawe herde howe xv dayes loſte galyce whiche long ſeaſon ſpace xvi wekes beſyde men deed ſparcled abrode ſome ſōe hoped conforte englāde englyſſhmen wery warre spaygne thought ouer long farre fro duke lancaſtre thought buſyneſſe harde caſe ſeyng comforte ſpake lytell thought moche ymaginacyon lyconed iourney voiage duke aniou made realme naples whan departed realme fraunce well furnyſſhed maner thyng wente great richeſſe puiſſaunce great nombre noble men armes knightes ſ •• uiers ende ſlayne loſt thus duke lancaſtre reckoned v • yage come nothynge reaſon ſuche diſconforte erle foiz countre bierne eight ſage ymaginatyue ſayd accompeed duke lacaſters vyage loſt inrecoueryng realme caſtyle whiche chalenged duke lacaſtre ſage wiſe prince valyaunt amonge diſconfytures yet ſomtyme toke cōforte hym ſelfe ſhall ſhewe howe meanes ſawe well fayre doughter lady cuſtaunce wyfe doughter done peter kyng caſtyle whoſe right clayme made warre caſtyle thought thoughe fortune agaynſt hym tyme yet myght tourne good doughter fayre yonge ſhe ryght heritage caſtyle reaſon mother thought yt ſome valyaunt man fraunce wolde gladde couet haue maryage well right ſhe hadde realme caſtyle hyghe lynage myght well ſayde extraction hygheſt lynage chriſtendome wherfore duke lācaſtre wolde gladly haue ſome treatie mariage ſome noble mā fraunce knewe well frēche kyng yong brother called duke towrayne thought ſhulde able recouer doughters ryght caſtyle knewe well puyſſaunce fraunce helde aduerſaries herytage caſtile wherfore thought yt wolde take parte myght lightly putte doughter poſſeſſyon realme caſtyle myght marry frenche kynges brother ¶howe duke berrey ſent letter duke lancaſtre bayon howe duke ſent copye ſame letter foiz nauer thentent haue publyſſhed spayne howe duke bretayn demaūded coū ſayle men buſyneſſe cap cxxvii ymaginacyon reſted duke lancaſtre nat onely duke towrayne alſo duke berrey ye haue herde ye duke berrey ſonne wodowers bothe wyues deed mater auctour boke knewe ſuretie ſame tyme fronters berrey poitou countie bloys right honorable lorde guy erle bloys deſyre folowed cō tynuaūce hiſtorie duke berrey ſet entencion pleaſure agayne maryed oftē tymes wolde ſay among men howe lorde lytell worthe without lady another mā wyfe ſome coūſayle ſayd hym sir marry agayne ſon therby houſe ſhalbe ioyfull aſirs ꝙ duke ſonne yong ſir ꝙ haue ye nat ſene howe erle bloyes hath maryed ſonne yonge doughter trouthe quod duke let ſe name wyfe ſir quod ſhall name duke lancaſters doughter worde duke ſtudyed ſeaſon gaue none anſwere ymagined ſore ſuche ſecrete counſayle ſayd ye ſpeke mary iohan ſonne coſyn duke lancaſters doughter ſaynt denyce ye haue well deuyſed ſhe ſhulde good wyfe ſelfe ſhortely ſhall write coſyn duke lancaſtre bayone enformed wolde ſende hym worde howe ſhall ſende ſhortely hym ſome counſayle treate maryage ſaye nat ſonne ſhall marry hym ſome place whan coūſayle herde hym ſaye ſo ſmyled ye duke demaunded wherat ſmiled sir ꝙ laught ye rather haue good tourne ſelfe ſonne ſhulde faythe ꝙ duke good reaſon fayre coſyn lancaſtre wyll nat ſo ſoone agre ſonne ſelfe incontynent letter written highe gaſcoyne bayon duke lācaſtre ſente honourable meſſangers whan came ye duke delyuered letter duke toke reed thē whan well parceyued theffecte mater right ioyfull made good chere meſſāgers ſhewed well content therwith wrote agayne letter ryght amiably certifyeng duke berrey howe right ioyfull letter theſe meſſangers returned foūde lorde poitou preparyng hym ſelfe go fraunce frēche kyng duke burgoyne ſent hym cōmune ſtate bretayne oppned letter coſyn duke lancaſtre ſente hym ioye anſwere thought ſurely purſue matter effecte myght nat leaue voyage fraunce ſo went thyder ſhortely coulde thanne wrote knyght called ſir helyon lignacke ſeneſchall rochell countre rocheloys cōmaundyng hym incou • ynent ſight letter ſette thyng good order come hym parys withoute fayle whan ſir helyon lignac rochell vnderſtode thoſe tidynges parceyued duke berreys letter howe ſent haſt made hym redy abſence made two capitayns rochell two valyaunt men gouerners rocheloys countre becaulſe one called ſir peter yon ſir peter tayllepy done ſir helyon tooke waye fraunce ſhorteſt way coude knewe nat duke wolde hym ſente hym ſo haſtely nowe let v ſōwhat ſpeke duke lancaſtre bayon great ymaginacions yt buſyneſſe coſyn duke berrey written hym firſt wolde nat ſhulde hydden rather publyſſhed abrode entent ennemyes ſhulde knowe ſpecially houſe kynge iohan caſtyle ſo duke lancaſtre wrote dyuers ſent copye duke berreys letter shewynge writyng great affectyon treate maryage bytwene doughter duke berry firſt ſent letter erle foiz bycauſe knewe well yt erles houſe prepared maner gentylmen knightes ſquyers well cōmyng goynge kyng spayne pylgrimage ſaynt iames alſo wrote kyng nauer wyfe ye kyng caſtels ſuſter many chyldren thentent brute therof ſhulde better certifyed kyng caſtels court rather flyeng wordes alſo duke wrote mater kyng portugale wrote worde therof ī england kyng bretherne knewe well ſhulde haue thanke enterprice nat content dede ye ſhall whan ye mater requyreth meane ſeaſon ſhall ſpeke mater duke bretayne mater lyeth whan duke berrey come fraunce kyng duke burgoyne brother counſayle byſſhoppe langers byſſhoppe laon ye lorde coucy baron fraūce beyng thereof kynges ſecrete counſayle many metynges cōmune toguyder well ſtate guerles whyder kyng great affection go duke bretaygne coude bring reaſon wolde nat obey wyſte nat ſende hym wolde beleue hadde ben many valyant men ſage hym aueyled nothyng coude bring nothyng paſſe deſyred wherof kyng counſaile ſore troubled vnderſtode well duke bretaygne wynter prouyded fortifyed townes caſtelles ſhewed howe lykehode hadde rather haue warre peace wyſeſt counſayle ſayd ſpeke goynge almayne ought rather ſpeke goynge bretaygne putte downe duke ſo highe mynded wyll reaſone alwayes agaynſt crowne fraūce diſdayneth obedyent thervnto ſhal haue reaſon hym without force therto ſuffred wyll preſumptuous feareth man loueth prayſeth man hym ſelfe clere caſe kynge go almaygne leaue realme bare men muſte go thyder duke bretaigne wyll ſuffre engliſſhe men come countrey ſo entre fraū ce apparaunce herof great redy great army archer ſee kepe ſtyll coſte bretaygne wynde wether putte theym yet euer drawe thyder agayne lyeth ancre beſemyng taryeng tyll warre opyn wherfore thynke good yet ſende agayne duke biſſhoppe langers erle ſaynt poule duke erle haue maryed two ſuſters naye ſirs nat ſo ꝙ maiſter yue breton ye wyll ſende duke agayne ye ſende one agreable hym lorde coucy lykewyſe haue maryed two ſuſters haue loued marueylouſly togyder haue euer written eche fayre brother lorde coucy ſende ye wyll well quod duke burgoyne maiſter yue ſithe ye haue begon name reſt sir right good wyll ſithe pleaſeth lorde coucy ſende ſir iohan vyen lorde de la ryuer theſe ſuche thre lordes ſhall bring hym reaſon wyll euer come thus let ꝙ duke berrey burgoyne apoynted charged ſhulde ſaye whervpon ſhulde groude mater handell hym fayre wordes thus taryed certayne ſpace departed fro parys duke bretayne knewe well comyng deꝑted fro parys coude nat tell whan ſawe well mater touched highlye lorde coucy came duke many ymaginacyons mater diſcouered mynde certayne coū ſayle lorde mountbouchier demaunded counſayle hym ſayd sir brute rōueth duke lācaſtre ſhulde mary doughter fraunce duke berrey mater ſo forwarde ſir helyon lignacke goyng duke bayon duke greatly enclyneth maryage wherof haue great marueyle fayre brother lancaſtre hath nat written therof ſo knowe nothyng mater heryng ſaye nat accuſtomed ſo mater touchyng fraū ce wount write coū ſayle anſwered ſaid sir thus muſt behoue chaūge purpoſe el ſhalbe greatly loſſe daunger bring coūtre warre whiche good eſchewe ye nede nat make warre ſythe ye maye peace yea deſyred therto alſo lady wy • e great chylde whiche ye ought regarde kynge nauer tytell ayde hath ynoughe hym ſelfe alſo duke lācaſtre ſage valyant prince ſayd ſhall mary doughter duke berrey ſhalbe gret begynnyng entre treatie peace bytwene englande fraūce elles longe truſe reaſon therof ye ſhall ſe ende kyng caſtell putte realme haue kepte hym rather duke lancaſtre englyſſhe men agreed hym alſo trouthe lorde coucye admyrall fraunce lorde de la ryuer cōmyng hyder ye maye well knowe ſome great cauſe touchynge kyng buſyeth hym ſelfe cōſtable realme lykelyhode kynge vncles wyll knowe preſiſely ye wyll wheder ye wyll kepe ſtyll opinyon nat ye kepe ſtyll purpoſe ymagined great armye prepared go guerles ſhall tourne agaynſt nowe remembre well conforte ye likely haue yf ye haue warre fraunce whiche ye mooſt lykely haue duke lancaſter marry doughter fraūce ſemyng wyll nat beſtowe better recouer herytage alſo ye knowe well mooſt parte prelate baron knyghtes ſquyers cyties good townes maner ye agaynſt therfore ſir ſithe ye demaunde counſayle v ſaye ye neuer ſo moche cauſe aduyſe ye haue nowe therfore putte hande kepe well herytage whiche hath coſt ſhedyng ſo moche blode ſweate traueyle refrayne ſomwhat yre hatered knowe well ye beare great dyſpleaſure ſir olyuer clyſſon hath done many diſpleaſures ye hym paraduenture may though nat lyke vnto frē che kynge vncles wyll maynteygne hym agaynſt ſhall conſtable kynge charles laſte dyed loued hym ſo well hadde lyued ye done ye haue done knowe well ſhulde rather haue coſt kynge halfe realme thanne wolde haue ſuffred kynge charles ſonne yonge taketh nat • good hede mater nowe wolde tenne yeres cometh ye ſhall go ye encre newe warre agaynſt frenche men beſyde haue ſhewed ye ſhall without counſayle without counſayle man loueth behoueth diſſemule whatſoeuer ye purpoſe nede kepe thre caſtelles parteynyng ſir olyuer clyſſons herytage maner toke wheder ſo ye haue peace warre ſhall coſte kepynge theym thre yeres ſhall profyte twelue yeres sir delyuer agayne handes without deſyre whan renome therof ſpredeth abrode nothynge done wyll knowen yt without cōſtreynt ye haue delyuered owne mynde ye ſhall therby attemper molifye euery mannes diſpleaſure ſhall greatlye pleaſe duke burgoyne ye knowe well hath nat done ſo moche agaynſt myght buſyneſſe meanes good lady wyfe coſyn hath many fayre chyldren nexte blode therfore ſir conſyder fro whens ye came iſſued departe nat farre fro then ye ought approche nere follye englande ye hadde neuer thyng alſo englyſſhmen haue ynoughe amonge themſelfe ſhewe fayre ſemblaunt loue promyſe yt maye owne aduauntage nothynge elles ye haue proued ye noriſſhed amonge thē youthe ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe duke bretayne delyuered vp thre caſtelles ſir olyuer cliſſons howe receyued ioyouſly lorde coucy company ambaſſadours fro frē che kyng howe duke lā caſtre made grete chere ſir helyon lignacke ſeneſchall xaynton ambaſſadoure fro duke berrey cap cxxviii whan duke bretayne herde counſayle ſpeke caſt ſo many reaſonable doubtes abaſſhed ſtoode ſtyll ſeaſon without ſpekynge worde leanyng wyndowe lokyng downe courte counſayle beyng aboute hym ſtode great ſtudy laſt tourned ſaid ſirs ſe well ye haue highly coū ſayled ſe well haue nede nothynge ſo moche good counſayle howe may loue noriſſhed thyng hate howe maye loue olyuer clyſſon hath done ſo many dyſpleaſures wherfore thynges euer dyde worlde mooſt repente dyd nat put hym dethe whan hym caſtell ermyne name god ſir quod counſayle ben ſlayne ye ought nat haue raunſomed hym taken herytage iohan bretayne vycount rohers ſonne heyres herytours landes doughters wyues wherfore wolde haue entred heritage owne reſort parlyament chambre parys ye haue receyued redy great blame fraunce ye haue done kepynge thre caſtelles conſtable hath entred quarell plee agaynſt parlyament houſe parys ſentence wyll gyuen agaynſt none anſwere agaynſt artycle conſtable hath layde agaynſt ſir olyuer clyſſon heyres ſhall haue iuſte cauſe quarell make warre agaynſt owne tytell kynge owne countrey bretayne wyll make warre ayde ennemyes ye haue nede than̄e haue puyſſaunce defende thaſie ſe ye lyke haue wherfore ſir plee hangeth ye beſt delyuer agayne thre caſtelles haue thā ke abyde ſentence gyuen agaynſt sir agre ſuche dommages ye haue done well ye canne therby ſhall wade ſclaundre whiche prince ought dout diſhonour ſir cōferme peace contynue loue ye ought frenche kynge ſoueraygne naturall lorde lorde duke burgoyne coſyns chyldren ye may take enſample ye haue ſene youre dayes coſyn germayne therle flaū ders myghte prince ſage yet inſydētes thende dayes fell hym ſuche marueylous aduentures yt without humyled hym ſelfe frē che kynge vncles noble realme loſte herytage ayde helpe recouered well ſirs quod duke ſithe haue demaunded counſayle behoueth take accepte wordes ye haue ſpoken mater wente ſo forwarde duke bretayyne poſſeſſyon thre caſtelles conſtables ye haue herde ſent men rydde handes clene ſtablyſſhed men conſtable reſtytuicion nat ſuffycient opynion frenche kynges counſayle wt duke reſtored agayne money hadde taken conſtable beſyde duke come perſonally kyng parys make excuſe peres realme abyde mendes makynge ſuche kyng coū ſayle ſhulde iudge good delyberacion whan knowledge reſtytucion theſe caſtels come lorde coucye lordes apoynted go bretaygne duke lorde coucy ſayde company sir haue leſſe beleue duke wyll gyue credence v whan heareth v ſpeke enfourmed theſe thre baron departed fro parys duke berrey bourgoyne counſayle ſayde sir ye muſte entreate duke bretaygne fayre ſwete wordes nat rigorouſly ſhewe hym howe ye duke bourgoyne wolde ſhulde come parys kyng leeſt ſhewe hym howe muſt come halfe way towne bloyes ſhall mete hym ſpeke toguyder theſe thre lordes ſaid wolde cōmaūded rode forthe came cytie rennes bretayne demaūded tidinges duke ſhewed howe wannes rode tyhder cōmynge anon knowen duke court ſent herbygers take vp lodgynges duke hym counſayle greate lordes ſuche truſted moſt honourably receyue theſe lordes whan entred towne wānes good chere lordes knyghtes duke mette ſpecially lorde de la wall lyghted lodgynges refreſſhed ſelfe mounted horſes rode duke caſtell called la mote foūde duke came agaynſt receyued thē right ioyouſly ſayd howe right hertely welcome toke lorde coucy hande made hym good chere ſayde fayre brother ye welcome gladde ſe bretayne ſhall ſhewe ſporte huntyng harte flyeng haukes deꝑte ſōdre sir quod lorde coucy thanke company ſhall gladde ſe ſhewed bytwene great lykelyhode loue duke brought hym chambre ſportyng talkyng many ydell matter lordes often tymes whan mete haue nat ſene toguyder longe wyll fynde many ſondrie paſtymes ſpecially knewe four lordes beſt entertayners euer knewe duke brabant erle foiz erle sauoy eſpeciall lorde coucy accordynge myne aduyſe goodly paſtymes ſouerayne maiſter • whiche brute bare amonge lordes ladyes fraunce englande almaygne lombardy place ben conuerſant tyme ſore traueyled ſene moche worlde alſo naturally enclyned gentyll thus whyle theſe lordes mery talkynge toguyder brought ſpyces wyne ſo dranke toke leaues retourned lodgynges thus mater went ye fyrſt day without makyng mencyon thyng come nowe let v ſomwhat ſpeke ſir helyon lygnacke duke berrey hadde ſent duke lancaſtre knyght came bayon lyghted lodgynge apparelled hymſelfe go ſpeke duke lācaſtre knewe well cōmyng ſent right honourably two knyghtes mete hym brought hym duke whan ſir helyon duke preſens kneled downe ſaluted hym aperteyned duke receyued hym right honorably tooke hym vp armes toke hym ye hande ledde hym chā bre mette hym hall thanne knyght delyuered letter fro duke berry duke reed thanne drewe ſir helyon knight declared cauſe cōmyng duke anſwered right courteſly ſayd sir ye right welcome ſayd howe mater weyghtie cōe wherfore requyred counſaile delyberacion thus ſir helyon taryed bayon duke lancaſtre moneth alwayes ſerued fayre wordes duke alwayes foded hym forthe made ſemblant great affection treate mariage duke berrey howe trouthe cōtrary ſhewed diſſymulacion cauſe helde ſo long hym none thing brute therof myght ronne abrode ſpecially ye realme caſtyle lay affection duke ſayde ſir helyon sir treat duke berrey haue doughter maryage than̄e muſt ioyne puyſaūce encounter myne aduerſaries spayne wyll recouer heritage doughter ſhulde haue wyfe ſir helyon ſayd sir haue charge confyrme thynge ſo forwarde ſir pleaſe deꝑte ye maye write pleaſure ſhall returne ſhewe lorde duke berrey entent ſure hath ſuche affection mater wyll agree euery thynge may reaſon deſyre quod duke lancaſtre thus ſir helyon lygnacke taryed ſeaſon bayon good chere made hym duke cōmaundement ⸫ ⸪ ¶howe kynge caſtyle ſente ambaſſadours duke lā caſtre treate maryage bytwene ſonne duke doughter howe requeſte duke berrey truſe made duke lancaſtre countreys tholouſyn rouergne cap c xxix tidingꝭ came realme caſtyle dyuerſe place ſpecyally kyng iohan caſtyle ſayde hym sir ye knowe nothyng treatye bytwene duke berrey duke lancaſtre duke berrey wolde haue maryage lady katheryne doughter duke lancaſtre lady cuſtance wyfe maryage take effecte lyke ſhalbe great alyaunce duke berrey nowe one chiefe ruler realme fraunce vncle kyng ſhalbe beleued ſoeuer ſaye purpoſe reaſon wheder meanes peace longe truſe parte duke lancaſtre eldeſt bretherne vncles kyng ſhall alſo beleued ſage puyſſaūt ſemeth englyſſhmen wery warre maryage bytwene duke lancaſters doughter duke berrey lykely great meane make good peace bytwene fraūce englande ſhal ſticke ſtyll warre duke lācaſtre wyll folowe purſue chalenge realme caſtyle right yt hath wyfe ſhall gyue doughter ſo ſhall haue warre bothe fraunce englande theſe doutes layde kynge caſtyle tyme frenchman ſerued long realme caſtyle retourned fraunce chiefe kynge caſtyls counſayle ſayd hym ſir take hede v ye neuer ſo great nede good counſayle ye haue preſente tyme ſir peryllousmyſt lyke engendred bytwene duke lā caſtre ſhall come meanes fraūce howe ſo quod kyng howe may name god ſir quod brute renome ſpredeth throughe countrey el howe duke berrey ſhall mary duke lācaſters doughter ſir ye maye ſure ſhall nat meanes great alyaūce ſo therby ye maye farre caſt behynde ye haue ben auaunced whan kyng caſtyle knewe thoſe tidynges right penſyue ſawe well howe counſayle ſhewed hym trouthe demaunded rounſayle truſted beſt howe ſhulde perceuer deale buſyneſſe counſayled hym well truely mater requyred ſhall ſhewe ye knowe well ye haue herde hyſtorie howe kynge henry spaygne made peace peter kynge arragone full poyntment kyng arragon ſhulde gyue doughter maryage kynge caſtyle iohan nowe kyng coniunction maryage ī peace realmes iohan ſonne henry doughter arragon came ſonne dyed lady dethe kynge henry caſtyle kyng iohan coūſaile men maried agayne lady beatrice doughter fernando kynge portugale hadde ſonne called henry yonge counſayle caſtyle ſayd kyng sir ſe theſe doutes one remedy quod kyng iohan sir ſhall ſhewe quod yong ſonne henry may well breke maryage bytwene duke berrey duke lancaſters doughter beleued duke lācaſtre duches wyfe rather marchant ſonne duke berrey name god ꝙ kynge ye ſaye well ſhall herken mater thynke people wyll lightly enclyne thervnto mariage ſhulde haue peace englande • bothe lande water therfore ſirs thoſe mete go name treate mater duke lancaſtre sir ꝙ requiſyte diſcrete perſones matter wiſely handeled ſecreteſt maner maye entente ye ronne nat indignacyon frenche kynge nowe dayes enuy rayneth greatly ſooner reporte made yuell good yuell ſooner reyſed vp good fraū ce knowe ye treate duke lā caſtre frenche kynge counſayle wyll demaūde whervpon ye treate duke reaſone great alyaunce made tyme paſt bytwene father fraūce alſo frenche men haue alwayes ſuſteyned warre wherfore ſir • treaty muſt done ſecretely ſende duke ſage men ſecrete well enſtructed buſyneſſe ſende nat forthewith booſt pride tyll euery thynge ſure caſe true quod kynge name mete go voyage sir quod ſende confeſſour frere fernā farre byſſhoppe geghene ſomtyme confeſſour kynge father peter gardelopes well languaged content ꝙ kynge lette ſente well enfourmed ſhall ſay wolde tyme haue treated peace wolde natte duke lancaſtre wolde none wyſe ſhulde haue forſaken crowne caſtyle whiche wyll neuer theſe thre ſent burgus spayne kyng ſayd kynge priu • e counſayle sir ye muſte go bayon duke lancaſtre ſhewed inſtructions ſayde redy accomplyſſhe kynges comman̄dement ſo ſette forthe iourney • nat gret eſtate ſymply wolde nat knowen wente duke lācaſtre ambaſſadours treate alyaunce knewe nat howe ſpede thus entred nauerre came pampylona founde kynge quene firſt came thyder bycauſe quene ſuſter kynge caſtyle hadde good chere nouther ſhewed kyng quene wente ſo paſſed thorough countrey mountayns roſeaulx entred biſquay ſo rode tyll came bayon whan̄e come towne bayon ſir helyon lignacke ſtyll ſente fro duke berrey ye haue herde cōmynge caſtilyans taryed nat longe frere fernando kynge caſtyls confeſſour came duke lancaſtre knewe hym better began ſomwhat breke mater ſhewe cauſe cōmynge duke opyned eates wordes gladde thoſe tidynges ſayde frere fernando ye welcome ſame day ſir helyon lignacke delyuered vnderſtode duke accorded ſame tyme truſe partes ſuch made warre hym acquitayne bygore thoulous place endure vnto firſte day maye yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore nyne truſe contynue countrey ryuer loyre trueſe concluded requeſt duke berrey entent myght ſende duke lancaſtre fortreſſes mortaygne ye ſee bonteuyll rouuergue quercyn pyergourt ryuer garon people without mercy wolde knowe manne wherfore theſe two duke accorded trueſe whiche well kepte whan ſir helyon lignacke departed fro ye duke great loue ſhewed duke ſaid howe mater pleaſed right well howe duke ſayd playnlye wolde neuer marry doughter fraunce without conſent accorde kyng englande nephue alſo agrement counſayle englāde ſayd truſted ſo order mater ſhulde well thus ſir helyon lignacke departed returned fraū ce ſhewed duke berrey letter duke lancaſtre ſent ſhewed hym mouthe maner howe euery thyng wente ſo ye duke well content ¶nowe lette v ſpeke kynge caſtyls ambaſſadours whome duke lācaſtre gaue good eare ſo dyd duches hertes ymaginacions lay euer chalenge spayn duke made theſe ambaſſadours good chere came duke ducheſſe ſhewed meſſage firſt treted peace frere preached duke chā bre ducheſſe preſent ſhe ſhewed duke entent wordes ye duke vnderſtode hym nat parfitely lady vnderſtode hym well youthe ſhe brought vp spaygne duke mater cōmyng pleaſaūt yet diſcouered nat haſtely entente ſayd sir wyll harde make peace place great hatered warre reſydent ſpecially diſheryted kepte herytage sayeng howe wolde nat leaue warre withoute myght haue crowne caſtyle whiche ſayde right frere biſſhoppe ſayd sir bytwene right ye ryght kynge lorde one meane haue founde may pleaſe waye quod duke sir quod ye haue lady youre wyfe feyre yonge lady marry kynge caſtile ſouerayne lorde hath feyre yong ſonne two myght mary toguyder realme caſtyle ſhulde peace right ſhulde retourne ſir better ye nat beſtowe heyre diſcēded right lyne caſtyle entent ye arme fyght aduenture youre ſelfe traueyle body onely right heyre trewe ꝙ duke wyll coſtes yt haue ſuſteyned purſute recompē ſed wyll ye knowe hath coſt realme englande fyue hundred thouſande frākes wherof wolde gladly ſe ſom recoueraūce sir quod frere treatie agreable truſt fynde ſuch meane mater ſhall take good effect well quod duke ye welcome ſoeuer howe ſoeuer ſhalbe retourne englande outher caſtyle fraunce ſhall mary doughter haue dyuers offres moued vnto mater ſo great weyght nat lightly cōcluded firſt tyme doughter whome repute rightfull enheritour ſpayne wyll knowe well yt ſhall haue maryage reaſon quod frere thus haue ſhewed treatie began bytwene duke lācaſtre theſe party well caſtyle fraū ce made euery partie good chere made full anſwere ymaginacion treatie spayne kynges ſonne mary doughter ſemed beſt purpoſe bicauſe tyme come doughter ſhulde quene caſtyle alſo duches wyfe enclyned mooſt treatie ¶nowe let v leaue ſpeke duke lancaſtre theſe treatyſe retourne ſpeke duke bretaygne ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe duke berrey burgoyne departed go bloys howe duke bretayne cāethyder howe duke dyde ſo moche hym parys maner agaynſt wyll cap cxxx haue ſhewed ye duke bretayne made good chere french ambaſſadours ſpecially lorde coucy enformed ye chiefe brake duke fro purpoſe reaſon fayre ſwete wordes howe lorde iohan vyen lorde dela ryuer dyde ryght well deuoyre often tymes great prince lordes wyll ſoner entreated one man rather another moche payne cauſe duke bretayne agre go towne bloys mete duke berrey burgoyne brought thyder fayre wordes ſayde ſurely wolde go thanne towne bloys lorde couey ſayd deſyred nothynge elles theſe lordes duke bretaynge certayne dayes toke leaues retourned fraunce ſhewed duke berry burgoyne howe hadde ſpedde thervpon theſe two duke made redy go bloyes mete duke bretaygne ſente thyder make prouiſyon apertayned firſte thyder came duke berrey lodged caſtell founde counteſſe ſonne doughter receyued hym honourably erle guye bloys owne countrey caſtell reygnaulte made greate counte commynge duke bretaygne thought ſufficyent wife chyldren thyder came duke burgoyne goodly trayne company came ſir wyllm̄ heynaulte ſonne erle oſtrenante iohan burgoyne ſonne duke called erle neuers duke lodged alſo caſtell helde eſtate came duke bretaygne great trayne houſe paſſed nat thre hūdred horſes entēcyon whan one ſene two duke ſpoken retourne owne countre without goynge fraunce entente two duke otherwiſe ſaid whyder wolde nat ſhulde go parys duke bretaygne hym ſelfe lodged caſtell bloyes chanons houſe ſaynt sauyour men lodged downe towne ſo dyd ye duke ſeruauntes lordes laye ye caſtell whiche fayre great ſtronge one fayreſt caſtelles realme fraunce theſe duke made good togyder ſhewed great 〈◊〉 thanked duke bretayne cōmyng towne bloyes duke anſwered ſayde howe come thyder loue great payne fayned hym ſelfe nat well eaſe theſe two duke fell communynge duke bretayne ſhewyng hym ſithe come ſo farr forwarde done nothyng without went parys ſe kynge greatly deſyred ſe hym duke bretaygne began greatlye excuſe hym ſelfe voyage layde many reaſons ſayd howe nat well caſe make ſo longe iourney alſo nat accompanyed therafter ſwetely anſwered ſauyng diſpleaſure ſhulde nede great trayne go ſe ſoueraygne lorde rydinge ſhulde lacke nouther chayre lytter labour eaſe ſaid bounde homage kynge nat done duke ſayd excuſynge hymſelfe whan kynge come laufull age hole realme owne gouernaunce wolde come parys whyder ſhulde pleaſe kynge homage acordyng reaſon duke ſayd kynge age wyſdome ſuffycient receyue homage howe lordes realme excepte done homage made reliefe affyrmynge howe kynge xxi yere age whan duke bretaygne ſawe howe excuſes coude nat taken herde ſayde well ſirs go parys ſhalbe greatlye agaynſt wyll preiudyce whan come ſhall fynde ſe daylye ſir olyuer clyſſone nat loue neuer dyde ſhall attempte rygorous wordes lordes regarde well inconuenyentes ſhall enſue goynge thyder sir ꝙ duke burgoyne fayre coſyn haue ye dout therin ſhall ſwere ſolempnely withoute ſhall owne pleaſure ye ſhall nouther ſe ſpeke conſtable iohan mountforde longe ye ſhall ſir ye ſhall ſure ye ſhall ſe kynge deſyreth ſe lordes knyghtes ſquyers fraunce ſhall make good chere whanne ye haue done ye loke ye ſhall retourne agayne without peryll dommage wherto ſhulde make longe proceſſe moche duke bretayne deſyred faire wordes conſented go parys promyſe conſtable iohan mountforde ſhulde nat come preſēce whiche duke ſware faythfully vpholde thervpon ꝓmyſed go parys fyue dayes theſe duke bloyes eche feeſted ryght nobly coūteſſe chyldren lyke maner whan euery thyng accomplyſſhed two duke toke leaue ye duke bretaygne retourned parys ſir wylliam heynaulte retourned nat parys duke burgoyne faire father rode firſt wt counteſſe bloyes made hym right good chere taryed thre dayes toke leaue retourned fraunce caſtell dune bonyuall ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe lewes kyng cycyle entred parys eſtate royall howe duke bretayne entred nyght ſaynt iohn̄ baptyſt yere grace thouſande thre hundred fourſcore ſeuyn dede armes doone kyng mountereau faulte bytwene knyght englande called ſir thom̄s harpingham frenche knyght named ſir iohn̄ de barres cap cxxxi duke bretaygne rode boygency ryuer loyre ordered buſineſſe go parys ſame tyme ye duke bretaygne entered parys entred quene cycyll hieruſalem ſomtyme wyfe duke aniou called kynge thoſe countreis alſo naples yonge ſonne lewes thanne fraunce named kynge ſaid landes company iohan bretaygne brother lady ſente worde cōmynge duke berrey burgoyne aduertyſyng thē howe ſhe brought company yonge ſon lewes nephue deſyring knowe whether ſhulde entre paris kynge elles ſymply lewes aniou two duke ſente worde aduiſynge coūſayling ſhulde entre kyng naples cycyle hieruſalem ſente worde thoughe nat thanne poſſeſſyon realmes yet wolde entyſe frenche kyng ſhulde ayde hym conquere ſo ſware brother kyng lois maner lady prepared ſelfe came entred parys made ſonne ryde throughe hyghe ſtretes ſaynt iaques ſo lodgynge grene eſtate royall accompanyed duke erles prelate great nombre lady taryed ſonne thanne wente ſe kynge caſtell loure abydinge commynge duke bretaygne ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe duke bretaygne entred parys came caſtell loure frenche kynge cap cxxxii whan duke bretayne aproched nere parys reſted one nyght quenes bourge nexte daye entred paris great lokyng hym paris bycauſe putte daunger conſtable fraunce ben ſente dyuers tymes wolde neuer come tyll men ſpake therof dyuerſly ſondaye beynge mydſomer daye tenne clocke afore noone duke bretaygne entred yere lorde god thouſande thre hū dred fourſcore eight parys hell gate paſſed long ſtrete ye harpe ouer bridge ſaynt michell ſo palais well accompanyed lordes knyghtes ſir wyllyam heynaulre erle oſtrenaunt faire brother iohan burgoyne roode ſir wyllyam namure thus came caſtelle loure alyghted rode throughe ſtretes greatelye regarded common people whan duke lyghted entred gate remembred ſhulde ſaye hym lorde coucy erle sauoy ſir iohn̄ vyen ſir guye de la tremoyle ſir iohn̄ vernayle erle meauir ſir iohan voye ſir iohan barres nere hym ſir wyllyam namure iohan burgoyne erle oſtrenaunte behynde hym lorde mountforde bretayne lorde maleſtroyt kynne priuy coūſayle great preace ſe hym halle lytell boordes couered kynge go dyner kynge ſtoode redy table iii vncles beſyde hym duke berrey burgoyne burbone ſoone duke entred euery man made place ſo ye duke myght ſe kynge firſte made one curteſy ſo paſſed forthe renne xii pace made ſeconde curteſy roſe agayne ſo paſſed forthe tyll came kynge thirde tyme kneled downe bare heeded ſaluted kyng ſayd sir come ſe grace god maynteyne youre proſperyte thanke ſir quod kyng haue great deſyre ſe ſhall ſe ſpeke leyſar therwith toke hym vp armes duke enclyned hym ſelf prince eche ſtode ſtyll kynge without ſpekynge worde kyng ſore behelde hym thanne stewardes offycers came forthe water ye kyng waſſhed duke bretaygne putte hande baſon towell whan kyng ſette duke toke leaue kyng vncles lorde coucy erle ſaynt poule lordes conueyed hym court horſes mounted ſo returned lodgynge ſtrete yt harpe none taryed hym conueyed hym ſuche came hym bretaygne parys duke bretaygne ſpake leyſar kynge vncles ſo euery man well contente hym tooke well euery thynge ben promyſed hym ſawe nouther conſtable iohn̄ bretayne whan ye lordes ſawe euery thyng good ſtate neded nat doute duke bretaygne ſeynge hym paris thought ſhulde nat departe then tyll done maner euery thyng kynge wolde thought good tyme ordeyne forth voyage guerles whyder kyng great affection go ſubdue duke guerles ſo ſhamfully defied kyng whiche cōſydred nat thoght good ſuffred ordayned lorde coucy ſhulde drawe march rennes chalous champayn regarde kynges paſſage waye moue knyghtes ſquyers bare lorayne go whyder wolde lede nat ſpekynge kyng bearyng hande wolde go recouer ryght auſtryche lorde coucy thus departed fro parys wente chalous champayne taryed moneth retaygned partes knyghtes ſquyers ī bare lorayne champaygne retheloys frēche kyng departed fro parys whan cōmuned duke bretaygne dyuers mater nat fully accomplyſſhed ſute courte fraunce longe whan lyſte right well canne foode forthe people make theym ſpende moche bringe lytell effecte kynge came mouſtreau faulte marcheſſe brie gaſtenoys helde courte ten tymes chaſed harte wylde beeſtes foreſt brie ſame ſeaſone dede armes done bitwene engliſſhe knight duke irelande called ſir thom̄s harpyngham ſir iohan barres wherof great brute made fraunce place chalenge fyue courſes ſpeare fyue ſtrokes ſworde fyue daggar fyue axe weapon brake gette newe tyll chalenge accō plyſſhed theſe two knyghtes day lept horſes well armed appertayned kynge lordes beyng preſent moche people ranne toguyder foure courſes ryght valiauntly thought vſage than̄e helmes tyed lace entente ſpeare ſhulde take holde fyrſt courſe ſir iohan barres ſtrake englyſſhe knyght targe ſuche wyſe bare hym ouer horſe crope ſo laye ſtonyed grounde moche payne releue perfourmed forthe reſte chalenge ſo goodly maner kyng well cō tent ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe erle arundell beyng ſee moneth came hauyn marante lytell fro rochell howe ſent meſſā gere perotte le bernoys capitayns ſhulde kepe feldes cap cxxxiii long ſythe made mencyon englyſſhe armye ſee wherof rycharde erle arundell capitayne wt hym many knyghtes ſquyers archer englande ſhall nowe ſomwhat ſpeke hym mater requyreth ye haue herde treatie kyng englande made duke bretaygne nauy ſee ſeaſon laye euer cooſtynge fronters bretaygne normādy ioynde wether draue thē then euer came thyder agayne flete ſome ſmall veſſelles called balyngers wente euer ſcoured ſee flete layne ancre moneth agaynſt yſle breſhatte bretayne herde tidynges howe duke bretaygne gone bloyes ſpeke duke berrey burgoyne howe ſo agreed duke gone parys renoeranne throughe bretaygne howe duke hadde good chere frenche kynge welcome hym couſayle parys ſhulde nat departe then tyll mater good eſtate whanne erle arūdell herde thoſe tidynges penſyue wente counſayle beſt whyder beſt drawe enploye ſeaſon determyned drawe rochellois though caſtelles yet hadde men ynowe kepe felde abyde puyſſaunce xaynton poyctou ſo ſhulde ſignify eſtate auuergne lymoſynne ſo myght ſende paſſe throughe bretaygne treuſe nat confyrmed ryuer loyre treatynge begynne fyrſte daye auguſte ſir helyon lignacke goyng cōmyng erle arundell ymagined outher duke lancaſtre bayone elles retournynge fraunce hadde nauye breton bretonaunt nacyon wannes ſeruaunt ſir wyllyam helmon coude ſpeke well foure maner language ſaye bretyſſhe englyſſhe spaynyſſhe frenche gaue hym commaundement go lande ſayde hym go thou mooſt preuyeſt wayes thou canſte thou knoweſt preuy wayes countrey gette garyſon chaluſet haue v recommaunded perotte le bernoys ſhewe hym fro v ſette forthe company men armes ſuche garyſons forthe kynge englande make warre tytell yu ſhalte beare letter feare takynge thou mayeſt go lyke marchaunt rochell wynes ſaye perot reyſe vp theſe men warre kepe coūtreys berrey auuergne lymoſyn doute kepe feldes ſhall lande rocelloyes ſhall make ſuche warre ſhalbe herde well knowen breton ſayde ſhulde meſſage hadde great lette waye ſet lande ſandes knewe countrey bretayne went great townes paſſed countrey poyctou entred lymoſyn ſo came chalucet wherof perot le bernoys capitayne meſſangere came barryers gaue knowledge cōmynge garyſon ben examyned gate lette ſo brought perotte dyde well meſſage wherof perot great ioye greatly deſyred tidynges army ſee ſayd breton thou arte welcome bothe companion haue great deſyre ryde forthe abrode ſo ſhall accomplyſſhe thou haſt ſhewed v thus perotte le bernoys made hym preſt ſente carlate bourge champaygne capitayne ouſacke olyue barbe capitayn aloyſe beſyde ſaynt floure aymergotte marcell capitayns longe countrey auuergne lymoſyn oeſyryng theſe make thē redy wolde ryde oute abrode ſawe good ſeaſon cōmaundynge leaue ſure men gariſons tyll returne theſe companyons hadde great deſyre ryde abrode perot coulde nat ware ryche withoute ſome loſte made thē redy came chalucet aſſembled well nombre foure hundred ſpeares thought themſelfe ſuffycient great feate knewe lorde countrey able reſyſte breke enterprice ſiege vandachore ſir wyllyam lignacke boeſme laūce nat defeated thus rode forthe lordes feldes paſſed auuergne ryght hande tooke ryght waye berrey knewe well ye duke nat fraunce kyng moūtereau faulte ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpeke perot le bernoys enterprice ſpeke erle arundell armye ſee ſhewe howe perceuered departed fro coſt bretayne whan erle arundell ſuche lordes hym departed fro coſt bretayne ſayled good wynd wether ye tyme fayre pleaſunt goodly beholde ye ſhippes ye ſee ſixſcore one baners ſtremers wauynge wynde glytrynge lordes armes agaynſt ſonne thus went ſaylyng ſee freſſhly like horſe newe cōmyng ſtable brayeng cryeng fomyng mouth ſee ſo prompt ſo agreable thē thoughe fygure ſee ſhulde haue ſaid mery ſirs ſhall bring good porte hauen without peryll thus theſe lordꝭ ſayled frontyng poyctou xaynton caſt ancre rochell ye hauen towarde marant ſome cōpany ſeyng fludde cōmyng entred full water bottes mo two hundred one arryued nere towne marant watche marant ſpied englyſſhe flete ſawe howe bottes commyng lande warde fludde blewe trūpe made great noyſe awake men towne ſaue ſelfe ſo many men woman toke goodes wente ſaued caſtell whiche came well paſſe el loſt whan ſawe englyſſhmen come lys toke lefte reſt ſaued bodyes englyſſhe archer entred towne fell pyllage therfore came thyder lytell founde ſauyng coffer voyde emptye goodes withdrawen caſtell corne wyne ſalte becone prouiſion foūde ynoughe four hundred tonne wyne towne wherfore determyned abyde certayne ſpace kepe prouiſyon came well paſſe ſayde ſhulde departe then ſhulde withdrawen fortreſſes caryed awaye ryuer fountney moche myght reſte diſtroyed taryed night towne came thyder euenyng ſente worde ſee caſe cauſe taryed erle arundell lordes ſayde howe done well nyght paſſed nexte mornynge whan tyde began retourne diſancred ſmall veſſelles euery man wente putte harneſſe bottes barge lafte great ſhippes ſtyll ancre coude nat cum nere lande lacke water laſte hundred men armes two hundred archer ſtyll kepe ſhippes whiche laye mouthe hauyn thā ſmalle veſſelles arryued marant toke lande leyſar ſo lodged bytwene marant ye towne rochell whiche four leages fro then tidynges ſpredde abrode countrey howe englyſſhe men arryued barante four hundred fightyng men playne countrey good townes caſtelles ſrayde made good watche vyllages fledde amaye caryed goodꝭ foreſtes place ſhortely myght ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe marroys rochellois ſore afrayed englyſſhmen lande rochell made ſerimyſſhe howe englyſſhmen pylled countrey marant drewe agayne ſee pyllage whiche great cap cxxxiiii englyſſhmen ben furnyſſhed horſes greatly profyte ye countrey vnpro •• ded men warr namely ſuche able haue merre true lord parteney lorde pons lorde lymers yt lorde tanyboton ſir geffray argenton lorde montendre ſir aymery roch chouart vycont war dyuers knyghtes ſquyers poictou xaynton countrey nat toguyder euery man owne fortreſſe nat ware englyſſhe men commynge thyder hadde knowen moneth englyſſhe menne wolde haue ryued wolde haue prouyded therfore knewe nat fell ſodaynly wherfore afrayde euery man toke hede kepe owne men countrey gette cornes begynnynge auguſte alſo heed capitaygne countrey bringe menne toguyder duke berrey cheife ſoueraygne poittou newely gone parys ſeneſchall xaynton nat countrey seneſchall rochell ſir helyon lignacke nat rochell countrey great buſyneſſe ryde bytwene ye duke berrey duke lancaſtre theſe reaſons countrey feble defaulte good heedes muſt nedes defaulte body fote hath foote nothynge worthe thus theſe lordes feare two wayes englyſſhmen armed came fro ſee ſyde herde newes fro berrey fro limoſyn perot le bernoys rode abrode fyue ſixe hundred fyghtynge men hym entred berrey wyſt nat wher ſhulde take hede euery manne kepe owne renome wente howe theſe two hooſtes ſhulde mete toguyder outher countrey poictou xaynton opinyon dyuers true towne rochell ſame ſeaſon englyſſhe men landed marant two valyāt knyghtes one called ſir peter iouy ſir taylle pie whome ſir helyon lignacke lefte rochell kepe towne countre therabout whan tidynges came rochell erle arundell armye ben ſo longe ſee lande lodged beſyde marant theſe two knightes ſayd thē vnder charge mayre rochell men towne ſirs muſt behoue v go loke theſe englyſſhe menne ſhewed v howe arryued theſe party companion wyll go gyue welcome whiche ſhall paye v el ſhalbe blamed ſuffre reſt peace ſythe haue charge kepynge countre one poynte good v haue horſes men ſee well mounted ſhall ſende croſbowes fore ſhall wake ſhote hurte whan haue done ſhall retourne englyſſhe men wyll iſſue fote ſhall ſuffre croſbowes paſſe homwarde ſhall receyue enemyes ſpere poynt ſhall haue ſuche aduaūtage ſhall great domage euery man herde theſe knyghtes ſpeke reputed thē noble valyaunt men agreed counſayle aſſembled toguyder one twelue hundred nexte mornynge breakyng daye euery mā redy aſſembled togider croſbowes men fote iſſued went great pace reyſe englyſſhmen lodgynges meane ſeaſon horſmen made redy vpon iii hūdred dyuers knyghtes ſquyers cōe rochell certainly maner inſpyracion thenglyſſhmen knowen cōmynge might haue made embuſſhe two hundred archer hūdred men armes nat one frenchman retourned agayne whā rochell came englyſſhe men lodgynges carely morenynge watche retourned lodgynges frenche croſbowes began ſhote entred among lodgynges hurte many englyſſhe men lyeng ſtrawe marueyle noyſe many hurte knewe frenche men whan croſbowes ſhotte euery man ſixe ſhottes retourned apoynted aproched horſmen entred among lodgynges therwith hooſt began ſtyrre knyghtes ſquyers drewe toguyder felde whan frenche men ſawe hooſt ſtyrre drawe toguyder drewe backe retourned towarde rochell good pace feare ſhotte englyſſhe men folowed nere rochell erle arundell foure hundred men armes folowed great pace euery man ſpeare hande necke preace frenche fotemen great entrynge rochell alwayes two frenche knyghtes behynde ſette men forwarde tyll within barrier euer englyſſhe men folowed ſuche wyſe ye two frēche knightes great daūger taken ſlayn ſore ſette bycauſe ſemed chiefe capitaynes dede ſo ſir peter iouy hadde horſe ſlayne vnder hym great payne men ſaued hym drewe hym within barryers ſir peter taylle pye ſtryken thye glayue arrowe throughe ye baſſenet heed horſe fell downe deed within ye gate entrynge towne many ſlayne hurte mo xl men towne aboue ouer gate caſte downe ſtones ſhotte bombardes ſo englyſſhe men durſte aproche nerer thus wente firſt ſcrimyſſhe bytwene rochell englyſſhe men whan hadde ſcrimyſſhed nere noone erle arundell ſowned retrayte withdrewe good order retourned lodgynges vnarmed toke eaſe well wherof lacked nouther wyne fleſſhe englyſſhe men taryed fyftene dayes abydinge aduentures rochell iſſued oute ſcrmyſſhe ſawe well engliſſhe men wiſe valyaunt alſo ye two capitayns hurt wherfore good cauſe ſytte ſtyll reſt erle arundell ſent thre four tymes abrode countrey rochelloys towarde breſmure lande towars dyde great dōmage wherof countrey frayde englyſſhmen done great enterprice ben furnyſſhed horſmen countre gatte ſewe ſoone herde landynge euery man caryed hadde fortreſſes whan army taryed fyftene dayes well refreſſhed ſawe man came againſt parceyued wynde good thē drewe ſhippes caryed moche wyne freſſhe fleſſhe ſo entred veſſelles drewe vp ſayles toke ſee ſame daye mette xii ſhippes bayon goynge englande charged wynes marchaūdiſes ſo ioyned toguyder made good chere gaue erle arundell two peces gaſcoyn wyne thus ſayled forthe aduēture ¶nowe lette v ſpeke perot le bernois capitayns cōpany howe drewe agayne fortreſſes ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe perot le bernoys cōpanyons reſorted agayne theyr holdes great pyllage howe duke guerles coulde haue ayde englyſſhe men reyſe ſiege graue brabanſoys made bridge ouer ryuer meuſe whiche guerles dyde breke brinne dyſtroy ye ſhall cap cxxxv ſame ſeaſone englyſſhe armye marant perot le bernoyes route nōbre four hundred ſperes abrode paſſed lymoſyn came berrey daye tooke marchauntes towne blake berrey whiche daye great fayre wherby great profite good priſoners paſſed came selles berrey pylled robbed towne thus perot companyons rode abrode countre dyde great dōmage none came agaynſt countrey ſore frayde bothe ſydes ryuer loyre vnto coūtie bloys thourayne coude nat ymagin theſe two armyes purpoſed ſome ſayde ſhulde mete togider dyd nat army ſee drewe agayne ſee perot lykewiſe fortreſſe whā pylled wonne great richeſſe countrey euery man wente owne fortreſſe ſaue gotte none dede armes done ſeaſon auuergne lymoſyn than̄e began truce ſyde ryuer loyre whiche ſhulde endure moneth marche ſtyll ſiege endured vandachore ſir wylliam lignacke ſir iohan boeſme launce ſir iohan butlere ſir geffray teate noyre ſo proude cruell ſette nouther truce peace truſte ſtrength fortreſſes ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpeakyng ſiege vandachore ſhewe ende toke ſpeke nowe brabaunte guerles ye knowe well hath ben cōteyned hyſtorie ducheſſe brabant determyned make warre agaynſt duke guerles cauſed ſiege cōtynue towne graue great puyſſaunce knyghtes ſquyers men good townes brabante entencion nat departe then tyll towne graue wyll ducheſſe ſhewe yt mater touched nere laye 〈◊〉 four leages then hooſt plentifull euery thynge often tymes refreſſhed newe prouiſyon cōmyng fro dyuers partes aſwell ſee freſſhe water ryuer muſe lande brabant ſiege long endured great ingyns ſore towne caſte great ſtones whiche dyde great domage beſyde enfecte people within caſte towne deed careyne wether hote whiche greatly anoyed within clere ayre ſore corrupted yuell ayre somtyme knyghtes ſquyers brabant wolde come barryers ſcrimyſſhe ye towne many feates armes done men towne ſette duke guerles redye ſhewe forthe prowes whan tyme duke guerles lay nimay coude nat remedy mater reyſe ſiege yet fight enemyes puiſſaunce therto hadde ſente englande certifyeng caſe ſtode truſtynge haue ſocours fro then none tyme moche trouble englande ſette newe counſayle kynge meanes vncles tharchbyſſhop caū terbury feeſt ſaynt iohan baptyſt coūſayle englande knowe ſhulde ſente ayde men armes archer duke guerles nat euery thyng conſydred thought beſt naye renome ran englande howe frenche kyng made gret aſſemble manne knewe whyther ſhulde drawe englyſſhe men ymaginacyon douted wolde cōe ca ••• otherſyde douted ſcottes wherfore wolde nat ſende men armes archer realme alſo knewe howe many menne warre ſee wherfore cōuenyent kepe owne realme therfore noble men englande ſayd lette duke guerles alone ryght valyant ī ſtronge countre wyll well ynoughe agaynſt brabanſoys alſo ſhalbe conforted ye almayns nede alyed hym neyghbours haue bene hym agaynſt frenche men thus mater wente englande within towne graue endured payne ſautes ſore ſcrimiſſhing brabante deuyſed whyle laye ſiege make bridge tymbre ouer ryuer meuſe therby entre duchy guerles ouer ronne coū trey kepe vitayle ſhulde come towne graue therby beſege bothe behynde partes kepe fro vitayling men ynowe ſo ſette many carpentars worke dilygence dyde ſo moche worke ſo forwarde yt bridge nere ouer water within ſpeares caſt duke guerles perfite knowledge makyng bridge dyde lette alone tyll nyghe made whan ſawe nerehande fyniſſhed came gonne artillarye ſhotte fyre bridge ſuche wiſe bridge brente broken brabanſoys loſte labour wherwith ſore diſpleaſed toke counſayle beſt ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe brabanſoys paſſed ryuer throughe towne raueſten ouer bridge ſo entred guerles duke departed fro nimay thre hundred ſpeares came agaynſt thē diſconfyted bytwene raueſten towne graue cap cxxxvi thre lytell leages fro ye towne graue caſtell raueſten parteyninge lorde bourne ſubiecte helde duchy brabant deſyred ducheſſe counſayle lordes knyghtes ſhulde open towne raueſten ſuffre hoſte paſſe throughe entre countrey guerles deſyres content duke guerles lyenge nymay ſurely infourmed ſuche ſpyall howe lorde bourne wolde gyue enemyes fre paſſage entre countrey towne raueſten wherof penſyue malēcolyous ſawe well nat men ynowe reſyſte puyſaunce brabante well xl thouſande menne one duke many ymagynacions fynally thynges conſydred determyned mynde aſſemble men toguyder take feldes come towardes towne graue entente brabant entred guerles wolde entre brabant thought ſurely nat incloſed within walles towne duke ſpake lorde gheſime great baron guerles princypall counſaylour ſhewed hym ſayd mynde entente fyrſte lorde nat opynyon duke ſhulde take feldes ſo ſmall nombre well quod duke ſhall shall ſuffre ſelfe incloſed one townes meane tyme ſhall brynne exyle countrey ſhulde ouer dere abyde make vowe godde lady quod duke wyll drawe feldes reſyſt domage nere may ordeyned ſo dyd next mornyng departed fro nymay ben churche made offrynge lady nymay men dranke lytell ſo mounted horſes thre hūdred ſpeares rather leſſe mo tooke feldes drewe towardes enemyes next way beholde great corage duke ſayd great outrage howbeit lyke coragyous knyght full comeforte ſayde forwarde name god ſaynt george agaynſte enemyes rather dye felde honoure dyſhonour cloſed within towne hym lorde gheſime valyant ſage knyght chyefe ruler armye lorde hauſeberth lorde huckelin ſir oſtez lorde vaſpre dyuers good knyghtes ſquyers valyaunt corage ſame daye duke guerles feldes early mornyng ſeneſchall brabant men knyghtes ſquyers men good townes brabant conſente lorde bourne paſſed ryuer bridge raueſten nombre ten thouſande men ſeneſchall brabante lorde lygnier lorde bourguenall lorde gence ryght ioyfull whanne ſawe ouer ryuer meuſe ſaid amonge themſelfe howe wolde go ſame day make courſe nymay burne mylles fawbours village ſoone herde tydynges fore ryders ſuche ſent diſcouer countrey tydinges alſo came duke guerles howe ten thouſande enemyes paſſed ryuer meuſe bridge raueſten duke ſtode ſtaye toke counſayle beſte ſore abaſſhed bycauſe handefull men regarde enemyes thurty xl againſt one ſayde howe myght endure thre hundred ſpeares agaynſte ten twelue thouſande men lyeth nat puyſſaunce ouercome lyeth well power ſoone ouercome v knyghtes came duke coūſayled drawe towardes graue thanne duke ſayde wolde nat wyſe wolde cloſed towne hadde ſayde ſurely wolde go fyght enemyes corage ſayd gaue hym dyſcomfyte ſaid dyd rather wold dye honour lyue ſhame ſhall quod day ouercome enemy wherby ſhall haue greate profyte honoure therfore loue ſet forwarde folowe quyckly wordes duke ſpake incoraged men ſpecyally ſuche herde hym euery man ſhewed ſemblante great corage fight euery man made hym redy laſed baſnet gyrte horſes ſet ſelfe good aray togyther rode forthe eaſy paſſe kepe horſes well brethed certayne newe knightes made thus rod good araye towardes raueſten tyme brabanſoys ouer ryuer thanne tydynges came seneſchall brabante duke guerles felde ſo nere incontynent ſhuld mete togyder suche herde thoſe tydinges firſt meruayle aduēture beleued ſurely euery man duke guerles ſyre reſted ſette ſelfe ordre leyſar ther came duke guerles route cloſe togyder faſte ſpurres wolde dryue horſes cryenge cryes lady guerles ſpeares reſtes ſquier guerles greatly prayſed great deſyre exalte renome galoped batayls firſte iuſted entred amōge enemy ſquier called arnolde morber courſe bare one erthe rudely canne nat tell euer releued nat preaſe ſo greate harde one downe releued agayn without great helpe firſt rencountre brabanſoys ſire ſcore borne erthe many beaten downe ſmall defence made brabanſoys ſodenly taken ſo ſhulde men warre thinke domage enemyes brabanſoys ſo greate nombre ſo many great men yet ſo farre ſonder araye coulde nat gette togyther ordre batayle batayle pearſed throughe ſparkled brode ſome ſome ſo lordes brabante coulde nat come owne men menne theym ſuche behynde whanne herde noyſe brewte ſawe ye duſt powder ryſe ſemed properly voyce dyſcomfetture came theym howe company ouercome feare therof cauſed tourne flye towardes raueſten agayne ſome toke ryuer aduenture bothe foote horſebacke without ſerrchyng depeneſſe without hauynge guyde fledde thought euer enemyes backes dyſcomfettynge ſelfe drowned parell moo twelue hundred ryuer meuſe lepte one vpon nother lyke beeſtes without ordre reaſon ſome great lordes barones brabante whome wyll nat name ſhulde blame heyres noted flye away ſo ſhame fully ſeke ſauegarde nother right paſſage ryuer yet hygh way towne raueſten rather ſtraunge wayes flye fro enemyes myſchyefe fell daye chyualrye brabante bytwene towne graue raueſten many ſlayne taken ſuche came raunſome yelded lightly almayns gladde take profyte thought haue theym ſuche retourned lodgynges graue abaſſhed lyenge ſyege came lyke men clene diſcomfyted came flyenge ſo faſte lacked brethe ſo coulde ſkante ſpeke worde ſayd syrs gette v hence dyſcomfyted comeforte whan hooſt vnderſtode trouthe mater ſawe company caſe ſo baſſhed frayed leyſar puyſſaunce take owne goodes take downe tentes pauylyons truſſe horſe carte wagon ſodaynely departed without byddynge adewe lefte behynde ſo frayde made countenaunce bydynge toke theym nother vytayle caryage ſuche hadde horſes lepte fledde waye towardes duke wodde el towardes hondan mount ſaynte geruays gertras dordec none care ſaue ſelfe fro enemyes within garyſon graue ſoner knowen dyſcomfetture greatly profyte ſlayne taken many enemyes flyenge knewe nat tyll late howbeit whan iſſued foūde great plentye tentes pauylyons prouyſion engyns gonne artyllery brought towne good leyſar none ſaye naye thus brake vp ſiege graue gret domage brabanſoys wherof great brute ranne dyuers countreys howe handefull men dyſcomfyted xl thouſande reyſed ſiege taken lorde bourguenall lorde linyer nombre ſeuentene baners hanged ymage lady nymay perpetuall memory ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe duke guerles dyſcomfyted brabanſoys wente agayne nymaye howe tydynges came frenche kynge howe kyng ſente ambaſſadours kyng almayne cap cxxxvii haue great payne recorde wryte ſhamefull dyſcomfyture brabanſoys blemyſſhynge honoures bycauſe promyſed ſaid begynnyng boke ſhall write truely hyſtory muſt make true relacion mater ſo euer touche nowe procede yonge duke guetles optaygned iourney yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore eyght aboute mawdlyn tyde moneth iuly whanne dyſcomfyture chaſe paſſed felde clene delyuered whiche done within ſpace two houres guerloys aſſembled togyder felde mad good chere ioyfull good cauſe ſo good aduenture many pryſoners mo themſelfe nombre haraudes ſought deed bodyes bothe partyes amonge ſlayne yonge man ſonne therle namure called vaſſyer colles lorde balaſter whoſe dethe duke gnerles ſory ſore dyſpleaſed ſhewed well greatly complayned deth ſayde howe dethe yonge knyght dyſpleaſed hym greatly ryght luſty knyght pleaſaunte ioly alſo yere ben pruſe duke guerles counſayled duke retourne towne graue refreſſhe theym brynge thyder priſoners naye nat ſo quod duke army departynge fro nymay auowed lady ſpedde well returne thyder offre lady wherfore wyll mery chere retourne thyder thanke lady hath ſent v vyctory enemyes man durſte ſaye naye agaynſt duke mynde ſo rode thyder good paſe two good leages fro thence batayle anone came thyder whan tydynges came nymay trouthe buſynes men woman child ioyfull clergy iſſued receyued duke great ioy duke guerles incontynent knyghtes wente churche ymage lady whome duke great affyaunce chapell vnarmed peces doublet gaue armure churche honour bleſſed lady thankynge iourney hadde atchyued penons lordes taken day hanged vp lady canne nat tell yet nat duke went lodgynge ſo dyd euery manne priſoners thought ſurely ſhulde well paye ſcot therfore made good chere great brute ſpred abrode duke guerles thus ouer throwen brabanſoys wherby douted duches brabante laye duke wood trayne whan ſhe ſawe howe yuell mater wente agaynſt ſyege graue rayſed ſhe ſore diſpleſed good cauſe touched nere ſhe ſette garyſone duke wood kepe fronter ſo retourned champayne came bruſelles wrote often tymes duke burgoyne aduertyſynge hym ſtate hope recoueraunce hym ye may well knowe byleue diſcomfyture brabanſoys ſoone knowen french kinges courte made lytell accōpte therof ſyth ſawe kynge ſuche affection go guerles kynges counſayle wrote ſyr wyllyam tremoyle ſir geruais myrande ſoueraygne capytays men warre duke burgoyne ſente countrey kepers thre caſtels ryuer meuſe buth gaulgeth nulle commaundyng kepe well fronters nat make iſſue wherby take domage tyll ſhewynge theym ſurely howe kynge pr • pre perſone ſhortly wolde go ſe duke guerles owne countrey ſir willyam ſore dyſpleaſed aduenture fallen party tydynges fraunce comforted hym agayne ordred hym ſelfe acordynge commaunded nowe lette v retourne counſayle fraunce great deſyre go guerles toke ſuche dyſpleaſure defyaunce duke ſente kynge nother regarded begynnynge myddes ende ſayd ſo euer coſte wolde make duke repent dede denye el wold diſtroy burne landes father alſo duke iulyers duke erles barones knyghtes ſquyers warned euery man redy acordyng apertayned ſo longe voyage ordeyned one marſhals fraunce ſhulde abyde ſtyll realme ſyr loys porteuyr take hede fronters ſyde ryuer dordone ſee languedoc bytwne ryuer gyronde dyſcendynge ryuer loyre truce bytwene ordeyned marſhall ſyr moton blamuyll ſhulde go kyng maruayle thynke great prouyſyon lordes made fyrſte kyng duke berrey burgoyn tourayne burbon cyties reynes chalous troy coūtreys champayne raynes byſſhopprike laon lander carte caryages taken vp partyes marueyle conſyder great aparell made iourney guerles ſeaſon duke bretaygne parys coulde nat delyuered kyng moſt parte al ſeaſon mouſtreuell faulte yon alwayes good chere alwayes ſerued fayre wordes curteyſe lordes wolde deſyre hym nat thynke longe ſhortly ſhulde delyuered ſhewed hym kynge ſo moch vyage almayne coulde attende nothynge el duke fayne ſuffre coulde none ſeyng parys thought wolde nat departe without good wyll kynge laye great coſte charge whan certayne knowen voyage guerles tayles reyſed throughe realme paye euery man wage ſhulde ſerue kynge many wyſe men realme well ſome counſayle ſayd howe great outrage counſayle kyng go farre ſeke enemyes ſhulde therby put realme great aduenture kynge yonge greatly fauoure people wherfore ben ſuffycyente hym haue ſuffred one two vncles haue gone thyder conſtable fraunce ſixe ſeuen thouſande ſpeares nat kyng propre perſone kynges vncles ſame oppynyon often tymes counſayled kynge forbeare iourney ſelfe whan ſo euer ſpake hym therof dyſpleaſed wolde ſaye go without company ſhall agaynſt wyll beſyde ye ſhall haue money otherwyſe nat reſtrayne whan duke berrey burgoyne herde kynges anſwere ſawe great affection kynge hadde go voyage aunſwered ſayd syr goddes name ye ſhall go without wyll nothing therfore ſir good comfort kynges counſayle regarded one thyng whiche thought ryght neceſſary bytwene frenche kynge kynge almayne longe tyme ben ordynaunces made bytwene none ſhulde entre army neyghbours landes frenche kynge make warre agaynſt kynge almayne agaynſt kynge payne ryn ſentence holy church therto bounde ſolempely ſworne day coronacyon entente kepe realmes peace reſte wherfore aduyſed kyng ſhulde go voyage guerles whiche holden kynge almayne fyrſt counſayle ſhulde ſuffycyently informe kyng almayne howe duke guerles ſhamefully defyed frenche kynge fell wordes ſtyle vſage lordes wonte dfye eche warre entente cauſe duke denye dede repente hym frenche kynge wyll come almayne nat agaynſt kyng almayne ſignory agaynſt enemye ſeke ſo euer fynde hym go meſſage charged ſyr guy hancorte ryght ſage dyſcrete knyght hym one mayſters parlyament called mayſter yue orient theſe two called counſayle charged go voyage kynge almayne well informed ſhuld ſaythus departed toke waye chalous champayne rode good trayne lyke notable perſons ambaſſadours fro frenche kynge founde lorde coucy chalous lay retayned knyghtes ſquiers barre lorayne champayne go voyage hym vowarde made theſe ambaſſadours good chere made theym great dyner lodgynge nexte daye departed rode towardes ſaynte menehont towardes coūtrey luſenburgh certayne tydynges kynge almayne ¶how frenche kyng gaue leaue duke bretayne retourne coūtrey howe countrey brabant wolde nat conſente kynges paſſage aremy howe ambaſſadours fraunce ſped ca c xxxviii whyle theſe frenche ambaſſadours wente ſpeke kyng almayne ye meane tyme french men lette nat ſtyll make prouyſions commaundement gyuen euery manne felde myddes auguſte champayne aboute kynge wolde redy tyme wolde nat tary aunſwere fro kynge almayn frenche kyng vncles thought good duke bretaygne ſhulde departe home ſente kynge monſtreuell faulte good chere kyng duke burgoyne duke tourayne duke berrey nat owne countrey aſſemblyge men togyder ſente cōmaundement poyctou knyghtes ſquyers ſhulde drawe felde kynge duke burgoyne treated amyable duke bretaygne ſhewed hym nothyng loue ye haue herde duke rendred agayne conſtable thre caſtels towne iugon hundred thouſande frankes receyued lothe rendre agayne axed alowaunce ſuche prouyſyons made fortifyenge garyſons caſtels townes retayning men warre kepynge theym wynter thought haue warre kyng counſayle fedde hym ſo ſwete pleaſaunte wordes fynally agreed pay agayne hundred thouſande frankes fyue yere xx thouſande euery yere tyll paied duke bretayne departed ryght amyably kynge gaue hym many fayre iouels ſo returned parys duke burgoyn made hym great dyner toke leaue eche thanne duke bretaygne payed dyſpenſes toke waye eſtampes rode beaulce bogency ye ryuer loyre men wente paſſed countreys bloys mayne thourayne aniou entred bretayne duke hym ſelfe redy boygēcy nauy entred fayre ſhyp hym lorde mountforde lorde maleſtroit ſo ſayled downe ryuer loyre paſſed vnder bridge bloys ſo went longe ryuer naūtes owne countrey ¶nowe let v leaue ſpeke duke bretayne farre coulde helde well couenaunte made bytwene frenche kynge hym dyd nothyng remembred tyll cloſed boke nat tell wyll herafter ſhall ſpeke therof acordyng ſhall knowe nowe wyll retourne frenche kynge prepared iourney guerles whan ye lorde coucy cōe kyng monſtreau ſhewed kyng counſayle howe ſped howe knyghtes ſquyers bare lourayne burgoin riuers ryne redy go hym kyng therof gret ioy ſayd grace god wold ſame yereſe coſyns duke iuliers guerles fyrſte determyned whiche way ſhulde take ſureſt way ſhorteſt ſome ſayd yt ryght way go thyreaſhe paſſe fronter haynalt liage paſſe brabāt ſo entre guerles paſſe ryuer meuſe trecte ſo entre lande iuliers fro thence guerles determynacion kynge counſayle wrote duches brabant countrey ſhewnge waye french kynge purpoſed kepe pleaſed ryght well duches countrey wolde nat agre therto ſayd howe kynge frēchmen ſhulde haue paſſage way ſhulde greatly domage good townes knyghtes brabante ye opynyon ſayd lady duches ſhe cōſented ſuffre frenche men entre countrey wolde neuer ayde ſocoure agaynſt duke guerles ſurely ſayd wolde cloſe townes go defende landes againſt ye frenchman ſayeng howe ſhuld leſe paſſinge countrey enemy myddes therof whan duches parceyued wylles entente people aſwell knightes ſhe ſawe remedy dyſſymule mater ſhe charged ſir iohan orpen ſyr iohan graue nycholas de la money go fraunce ſpeke frenche kyng duke burgoyn excuſe countrey brabant ſhuld nat take voyage waye countrey thinke ſhuld ſore greued diſtroyed ſhulde paſſe countrey ſhe cōmaunded ſaye herſelfe ſhe coude well content therwith done ſhe coulde myght ſo haue ben acordynge ladyes mynde departed fro bruſels rode towardes parys dyd ſo moche iourneys came mouſtreau fault yon kynge vncles nothynge ſpoken goynge guerles ducheſſe ambaſſadours fyrſte came ye duke burgoyne ſhewed letter meſſage requeſt aunte meane kynge counſayle alſo lorde coucy dyd myght ſo moche firſte purpoſe paſſynge brabant entre guerles broken duches countrey excuſed aduyſed ſhuld go along realme whiche way ſayd moſte honourable kynge alſo brabanſoys burgonyons ſauoyſyns cōcluded ſuch named ſhulde go vowarde ordeyned xxv hundred hewer woodes hedger dykers make playne wayes frenche men way good ynough thorough realme tyll came ardayne good wayes began fayle founde hygh wodes dyuers ſauage walles rockes mountaynes theſe pyoners ſente vangarde thouſande ſpeares aduyſe beſt paſſage kyng hooſt caryage wherof xii carte beſyde caryages hewe downe hygh wodes ardane make playn make newe wayes neuer none man paſſed way euery man toke great payne dylygence ſpecyally ſuche aboute kynge neuer ſo great affection go flaūders go guerles lorde coucy ſent •• gnon hym called hym ſelfe pope clement knowe nat cauſe vicount meaulx ſir iohan roy lorde de la bone goueruaūce men tyll retourned agayne nowe let v ſomwhat ſpeke ſir guy hācourt maiſter yue orient ſent kynge almayne rode ſo long came cōualence kyng whan hadde refreſſhed thē went towardes kyng enformed cōmyng great deſyre know entent came aſſembled counſayle theſe two lordes came kyng almayn curteſſy dyd ſalute hym delyuerd letter credēce fro french kyng ye kyng toke reed regarded thē ſaid ſir guy ſhewe forthe charge ye knyght ſpake ryght ſagely great leyſar ſhewed kyng coūſaile frenche kyng wt army royall wyll come frōters almayne nat make warre agaynſt hym agaynſt enemy ye duke guerles highly defied kyng maiſter ſhamfull wordes ſtyle defyaūces ye whiche frenche kyng coūſaile wyſe ſuffre wherfore ſir ꝙ kyng requyreth ye noble king blode ye worlde knoweth yt ye wyll nat ſuſtayne ayde mentayne pride duke ye holde ye aliances cōfyrmacions ſōtyme done ſworne bytwene thempire almayne realme fraūce ye whiche wyll fermly kepe ꝑte ye kyng anſwered ſaid ſir guy enformed yt coſyn frēche kyng wyll aſſemble togider great nōbre people neded nat ſo ſmal mater aſſemble ſuche people ſpende ſo moche ſeke ennemy ſo farr deſired wt leſſe trauayle coude well haue cauſed ye duke guerles hame cōe mercy reaſon ſir ꝙ knight thanke yt pleaſeth ſay ſo kyng maiſter regardeth lytell expenſes trauell men regardeth honour coūſaile agreed ſyth yt coūſayle nat myſcontent maiſter wyll wyſe violate breke ye ordinaūces confirmaciōs olde tyme made bitwene ye two realmes fraūce almain kepe mentayne paynes ye ordayned therfore ſir ſent nowe well ꝙ kyng beleue well coſyn ye frenche kyng ſhalbe welcome theſe ꝑtes forme thynke nat ſtyrre ther wt meſſāgers ryght ioyous thought ſped well thā deſyred haue letts agayne ye kyng ſaid ſhulde haue day taryed dyned kynge good chere dyner wente lodgynges wherto ſhulde make long ꝓceſſe ſped ſo well letter ſuche anſwere pleaſed thē well toke leaue ye kyng almayne retourned ſame way came nowe let v ſpeke frēche kyng ¶howe therle bloys ſent frenche kyng ii c ſpeares duke loraine lorde henry bare came kyng howe duke iullyers guerles knewe frenche kyng came cap c xxxix accōplyſhe vyage euery lorde fraūce aꝑelled thē ſelfe euery thyng nedefull ye lordꝭ knightes ſquiers men warre departed fro thir owne place well fro auergne couergne quercy lymoſyn poytou xaynton fro bretayne normādy aniou tourayn chāpayn fro lymitaciōs ye realme frā ce feweſt men came fardeſt coūtreis ye moſt nōbre burgoyn picardy bare lorayne bicauſe body fraūce waye therfore beſt trauelled ordayned ye kyng coūſayle yt man ſhulde take thyg ye coūtre wtout payeng therfore thēcent ye pore men ſhulde nat greued yt ordinaūce ye whiche well knowen ſprede abrode vpon payne great puniſſyon yet men warre ofte tymes ſore trauelled ye coūtries paſſed coude nat abſteyne yuell payde wage muſt nedes lyue excuſe whan blamed pyllage conſtable marſhalles capitaynes erle bloyes ſente vnto ſende two hundred ſpeares choſen men promyſed well payde nat ſaye howe dalte ſente ſerue kynge two hundred ſpeares countie bloyes capitayns lorde vyenne ſir guyllyam ſaynt martyne ſir wyllyam chaumont lorde montigny theſe foure gouernaunce erle bloys bande drewe lytell lytell towardes chāpayne thyder ordayned go frenche kynge departed mouſtreau faulte yon tooke waye chalous champayne duke berrey nat come departyng loked tidynges fro ſir helyon lignacke ſente duke lancaſtre bayon haue wyfe ye duke doghter ye haue herde nat duke lancaſtre diſſymuled hym helde ſtyll knyght hym bayon treated two party rather enclyned kynge caſtyle duke berrey lyke wyſe ſo dyde lady cuſtaunce wyfe duke made good chere bothe party entent enflame ſoner maryage doughter kyng caſtyls meſſangers ſore traueyled treatyng maryage reſted nat ryde bytwene party offered great gyftes thoſe meſſangers fred nothynge ſir helyon lignacke whan knowen ye realme fraūce kyng chalous waye towardes duchy guerles euery man departed fro houſes drewe kyng came duke berrey lodged eſpinay duke burbone another place erle marche ye erle dolphyn auergne erle ſaynt pole erle tourayne kynge duke burgoyne duke lorayne duke tourayne conſtable fraunce ſir guye tremoile ſir iohan beull countrey chalous raynes xii leages clene eaten vp men warre lorde coucy nat retourned fro pope retourned ſir wyllyam hācourt mayſter yue orient founde kynge vncles chalous kyng ioyouſe cō myng demaunded tidynges ſhewed kyng founde done ſayd howe kynge almaygne made good chere ſaid kyng sir whan kyng reed copye ye defyaunce duke guerles ſent bothe coūſayle yuell cōtent therwith ſayd howe done great preſūpcyon pride parceyue none coūſaile well content enterprice ye ſhall haue let hym kynge well content vpholde maynteyne auncient alyaūces bytwene empyre fraūce ſaythe ye ſhall haue dout ther herof frēche kyng right ioyfull howe ſome ſayd wheder kynge almayne wolde nat kyng puiſſaunce ſuffycient wolde without daūger kyng ordeyned departe fro chalous champayn ſo deꝑted toke way right great pre whan kynge came great pre taried ther thre dayes coude make gret iourneys ſo moche people hym behynde rounde hym ſo conſtrayned ryde eaſely haue good lodgyng bicauſe great ꝓuiſyon folowed hooſt fro firſt company laſt cōtayned xxiiii leages countrey ſtyll dayly came people therle great pre receyued kynge towne countre offred kynges pleaſure kyng well cō tent hym therle apoynted vantgard thyder came kyng ye duke lorayne ſir henry bare faire company men armes duke loraine ordayned ſonne lorde coucy ſir henry bare abide kyng pioners ſore beſyed foreſt ardane cutte downe wode make wayes neuer non great payne fyll valeys make waye playne caryage paſſe thre dyde nothyng el whan ye duches brabāt knewe ſurely howe kyng waye approched foreſte ardayne ſhe therof ryght ioyfull ſhe thought voyage ſhe ſhulde well reuenged duke guerles howe frenche kyng ſhulde bring hym reaſon alſo father duke iulyers done many anoyaunces ſhe departed fro bruſelles company erle sammes ardain lorde bocelairs dyuers toke waye luſenbourge ſe kynge ſpeke hym paſſed ye ryuer meuſe ryuer huy laſte came baſconque taryed kynge ſhulde paſſe therby ſo dyde whan departed graunt pre paſſed ryuer meuſe morſay hooſt rode ſmall iourneys tidynges came duchy iulyers guerles frenche kynge cōmynge hundred thouſande men neuer ſo moche people toguyder nat ſo great company whanne came burboure thought englyſſhe army ben gretter founde theym duke iulyers began dout duke guerles made nothing therof ſayde lette come come weryer ſhall caryages ſhall waxe feble prouiſyons ſhall waſte wynter ſhall drawe ſtronge countrey ſhall nat entre eaſe ſhall recule backe ſomtyme otherwiſe ſowne trumpettes ſhall behoue alwayes toguyder nat wyll entre coūtre diſrought ordre ſhall ſoone taken vp wheder wyll nat howe ſaye trouthe quod duke coſyn fraūce good corage ſheweth dothe ſhulde thus duke guerles deuyſed amonge knyghtes duke iulyers ſore abaſſhed ſawe well french kynge wolde lande brente loſte toke counſayle brother archebyſſhoppe colonge coſyn byſſhop leage ſir arnolde horne howe ſhulde ſaue lande fro brennyng exylyng theſe two
