haue ſhewed ſomoche ſyr though wolde neuer arme take parte hath good cauſe warre bytwene englande fraūce haue nothynge therwith holde countrey bierne man good ſworde haue put ſelfe ſeruytude dyſpleaſure one kynge yet knowe well myne aduerſaryes armynake haue done bring indyngnacion bothe partyes prince wale wente spayne informacyon erle armynake prince wolde haue made warre ſo ſore moued therto done ſo ſir iohan chandos nat broken purpoſe thanke god alwayes haue borne ſelfe mekely curteyſſy coulde ſhall longe lyue whan deed let mater go wyll thus erle foyze marſhall paſſed tyme togyder departure erle gaue hym fayre courſer fayre mule nother good horſe thre togyther rychely ſadylled aparelled gaue ſyr roberte challus ſyr rycharde dolphyn eche two hūdred frankes fyue ſquyers eche fifty frankes marſhall toke leaue departe tholous ſyr iohan froyſart ſame tyme wolde haue departed fro ortays hym erle foyze wolde nat ſuffre ſayd ſhulde nat departe behoued byde pleaſure sir loys departed fro ortays rode tarbe lorde dolphyn bygore conueyed ſir peter caleſtan one erle foiz knyghtes aboute ſame ſeaſon burdeaux dede armes done duke lancaſtre fyue engliſſhmen owne houſe fyue frenche menne ſome theym marſhall fraunce houſe fyrſt ser pecton dallagnie gaſcone englyſſh agaynſt ſir more mannigmente frenche seconde bytwene ſir aragon raymon englyſſhe agaynſt baſtarde chauigny frenche thyrde bytwene loys malapus capytayne agremortes frenche agaynſt iaquemyn corne de cerfe englyſſhe fourthe bytwene archambalte de villyers frenche ſonne lorde chaumonte gaſcone englyſſhe fyfte willyam foucalt frenche againſt brother lorde chaumont englyſſhe ſe theſe armes acomplyſſhed dyuers knyghtes ſquiers bierne therle foiz houſe toke way towarde burdeaux wente company bytwene ortars burdeaux xxiiii myle ſawe ſayde armes done ſaynte andrew preſence duke lancaſtre duches doughter ladyes damoſels coūtrey theſe knightes nat armed one euery man hym ſelfe felowe aparte armes thre courſes ſpeare thre ſtrokes ſworde thre thre dagger horſehacke dyd thre dayes none tenne hurte ſir raymon ſlewe baſtardes horſe wherwith duke lancaſtre ſore dyſpleſed blamed greatly knight bicauſe bare ſtaffe ſo lowe duke gaue baſtarde one horſes whan accomplyſſhed euery man deꝑted owne houſes one ducheſſe lancaſtre ordayned goo caſtyle leade katheryne doughter ſhulde haue maryage kynge caſtyls ſonne ducheſſe entente fyrſte ſhe wolde entre caſtyle go mantuell ſomtyme ye batayle bytwene kynge peter father agaynſte kynge henry caſtyle ſir bertram cleſquyn ſhe purpoſed make iuſte enquiry kynge father lay buryed dygge vp bone haue cytie cyuill bury theym agayne rychly appertayned kynge begynnynge marche whanne ſonne beganne mount dayes encreaſe duches lancaſtre redy doughter ſo departed fro burdeaux went bayon duke lancaſtre toke leaue retourned burdeaux ladyes rode forthe dape ſhe well receyued cyte dape vnder obeyſaunce kynge englande ſhe reſted two dayes paſſed throughe countrey baſquence paſſed paſſe rouceualx entred nauerre came panpilona founde kyng nauer quene receyued ducheſſe honourably quene nauer ſuſter kynge caſtyle duches doughter monethe paſſynge throughe realme nauer taryed kynge quene certayne ſpace coſtes charge borne payed entred spaygne entre realme founde kynge caſtyls ſeruauntes redy receyue theym acordynge commaunded yonge prince called prince galyce ¶howe duches lancaſtre departed fro kynge caſtyle wente mantuell brynge father bone ciuyll howe frenche kynge ſent ambaſſadours erle foize treate maryage duke berrey vncle doughter erle boloyne cap clv whan theſe matter renewed maryage confyrmed ducheſſe lancaſtre lefte doughter king yonge huſbande ſhulde mary age eight yeres duches toke leaue ye kynge go mantuell kyng ſent greateſt men courte company thus ſhe came mantuell dyd ſo moche ſhe knewe trouth father buryed dygged vp bone waſſhed bawmed wrapped leade brought cytie ciuyll receyued proceſſyon without cytie bone brought cathedrall churche reuerently ſolēply obſequy done king iohan yonge ſonne prince galyce moſt parte prelate baron realme obſequy doone euery man retourned owne place kynge caſtyle wente vale sory ſon̄e yonge wyfe hym ducheſſe lancaſtre medena de campo good towne wherof ſhe lady reaſon confyrmacyon peace ſhe lay ſeaſon ¶ nowe lette v leaue ſpeke caſtyle tyll nother tyme let v ſpeke maryage duke berrey alſo inſydentes folowed duke berrey maryed lady iane armynake firſt wyfe ſhe dyſſeaſed hadde great imagynacyon maryed agayne well ſhewed whan ſawe howe myſſed duke lancaſtres doughter ſet clerkes write ſent meſſangers therle gaſcon foiz kepyng erle boulonges doughter ſpace nyne yeres bycauſe duke berrey coulde nat come maryage daunger erle foize nother pope father mother frende damoſell erle wolde nothynge without owne pleaſure duke berrey deſyred effectuouſly frēch kynge nephue duke burgoyne brother helpe aſſyſt hym maryage frenche kyng laught good ſporte duke berrey vncle bycauſe olde ſo hote loue ſaid fayre vncle ſhall ye yonge mayde ſhe nat twelue yere age ye xl faythe great foly thynke therof ſpeke coſyn iohan ſonne yonge mater mete hym ſyr quod duke haue ſpeken redy ſonne erle foize wyll wyſe agree therto bycauſe ſonne blode armynake warre togyder haue ben longe lady yonge ſhall ſpare thre four yere tyll ſhe parfyte woman well fayre vncle quod kyng feare ſhe wyll nat ſpare ſo longe ſeynge ye haue ſo great affection therto ſhall ayde moche may nat longe kynge ordayned lorde de la ryuer ſyr bureau ſouerayne chamberlayne go yt voyage erle foiz erle daſſy duke burgoyne ordeyned go thyder halfe byſſhop anthune ſir gylliam tremoyle duke berrey deſyred iohan erle sanxer ſage valyaunt knyght go theſe fyue lordes apoynted go erle foize deſyre haue yonge lady maryage duke berrey theſe lordes departed apoynted mete togyder auignon pope clement candelmas departed toke waye nyſmes ſo auignon paſſed mounte pellyer rode ſmall iourneys great exſpence paſſed beſyers came carcaſſone founde ſir loys xancere marſhall fraunce receyued good ſhewed theym moche erle foiz eſtate ben within two monthes departed fro carcaſſone wente tholous reſted ſente meſſangers erle foiz ortays byerne began treate maryage farre begynnynge erle foyze colde bycauſe duke lancaſtre ſente hym haue ſame lady ſonne lorde henry erle derby reaſon longe taryenge delayeng treatye ſaid noyſed maryage ſhulde nat aunſweres fro erle foize wickely ſente worde therof duke berrey nonnecte auuergne duke none deſyre bringe mater aboute wrote often tymes agayne freſſhe meſſangers deſyrynge nat ceaſe tyll brought mater paſſe erle foyze ſage ſubtyle ſawe well ardent deſyre duke berrey hoter colder handeled matter ſo wyſely full agrement partyes yet ſore deſyred therto hadde thyrty thouſande frankes charge ladyes expenſes ſuche yeres ſhe hym demaūded ſhulde haue dyd ſo haue thanke duke berrey ſhulde perceyue done ſome hym whan mater concluded partyes agreed thanne erle foiz ſente coſyn lady morleaus accompanyed fyue hundred ſpeares whome capytayns ſyr eſpaigne du lynn ſyr raynolde guyllam ſyr peter caleſtan ſir adam cacaſſe ſir manalte nonnables ſir pier kees feldes lady delyuered frenche ambaſſadours behalfe duke berrey ſyr loys xancere fyue hundred ſpeares company receyued lady tooke leaues departed foize retourned frenche men ledde forthe lady duke berrey ſente chares chareottes rychely garnyſſhed horſe hackeneys aparell body heed freſſhe ryche though frenche quene thus rode forthe ſir iohan froyſart auctor boke rode company often tymes whan wolde haue taken leaue erle foiz wolde ſaye howe dede make ſo great haſte badde whan wolde retourne go good company ſo retourned ſayde company yonge ducheſſe berrey ſo wyll name fro hence forthe company rode ſo longe came nere auignon ſhe reſted towne called vile neufe without towne auignon houſe pope nexte daye aboute nyne clocke cardynals tyme mette ſo paſſed bridge roſue grete eſtate lady rydynge whyte palfrey whiche pope ſent ſhe came pope palays auignon alighted went ſe pope ſate cōſyſtory chayre pontyficall pope kyſt mouth bycauſe lygnage ducheſſe company wente dyner many cardynalles houſe cardynall thuryn nere pope palyce wednyſdaye nexte daye dyned ſame houſe agayne may well ſaye comyng lady auignon coſt pope ſome tenne thouſande frankes fridaye ſhe ſupped palays tooke leaue pope ſaturday ſhe departed rode dyner orange lay night coſyn germayne princeſſe therof ſonday ſhe departed • caryage paſſed valance vien ſo lyon ſur le rone reſted two dayes fro then breſ • e ſo entred countie foreſtes paſſed countrey ſo came la paleſſe burbonois ſo quiſſy hanche ſo ryon auuergne reſted two dayes duke berrey came thyder came thyder whytſoneuyn whytſonday betymes maryed lady noble weddynge gret feeſt erle boloyne erle eſtampes erle dolphyn auuergne feeſt iuſtes endured foure dayes ſir iohan froyſart auctor boke ſawe myne eyen preſente ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe certayne wyſe men treated peace endure thre yeres bytwene fraunce englande alyes aſwell one parte lande ſee cap clvi ye haue herde howe treuſe taken bytwene partyes garyſons bytwene ryuer loyr ryuer dordone geronde vnto feeſt ſaynt iohan baptyſt coūted yere grace thouſand thre hundred fourſcore nyne treuſe dutynge ſome great men ſage bothe partyes bothe englande fraunce buſyed themſelfe treate peace endure thre yeres water lande entenſyon ye treated mater compriſe treatye frenche party ſuche beſyed warre firſt haue compryſed realme caſtyle holy well lande water lyke maner realme scotlande englyſſhe partye ſhulde compriſed alyes kynge realme portugale dyuers barones hygh gaſcon theſe entreatours moche payne trauayle came entente ſcottes wolde wyſe cōſent whanne worde therof came kynge roberte scotlande fro frenche kynge owne perſone wolde lyghtly haue greed therto deſyred warre daye called hym barones prelate scotlande ſuche ought gyue counſayle mater without knowlege kynge wolde nothyng done wolde nat haue kepte openly redde preſence letter frenche kynge ſente thyder kynge realme scotlande entente wherof frenche kyng wolde haue scotland compriſed 〈◊〉 agre treuſe thre yeres lande water bytwene englande theym tydynges harde ſayde frenche kynge canne nothynge haue treuce whan tyme make warre haue yere ouercome englyſſhmen ſeaſon ryght good lykely ſhall ouercome agayne ſeconde tyme yea thyrde alſo great debatynge matter bytwene wyſe wolde conſente therto fynally acorded ſende byſſhoppe thre knyghtes fraunce kynge counſayle entent breke treaty ſhewe good wyll ſcottes warre byſſhoppe ſaynt andrew ſyr archambalte duglas ſyr willyam lymſey ſyr iohan ſaynt clere theſe departed ſoone myght toke ſee arryued sluſe rode parys kyng counſayle ſhewed letter credence ſente name barones prelate realme scotlāde well herde frenche men percyued well great affection hadde procede contyne warre agaynſte englande howe treatye ſo farre paſt promyſed coulde nat reuoked agayne ſcottes ſwetely anſwered howe remedy muſte nedes procede peace thus frenche men tooke treuſe meanes ſuche treated mater dyuers metynges bytwene partyes balingham bytwene boloyne calays often mette debated mater treuce taken gyuen acorded bytwene englande fraunce ſuche treater mater prelate gret lordes wyſemenne bothe realmes adherentes alyes ſee lande endure fermely without diſſymulacyon ſhadowe male engyn ſpace thre yeres entreatours frenche partye boloyne byſſhoppe bayeur erle valery ſaynt pole ſir willyam melyn ſir nycholas bracque ſir iohan le mercier calays englyſſhe parte byſſhop durham ſir willyam montague erle saliſbury ſir wyllyam beauchampe capitayne calais iohan lauon nycholas gaberthe richarde roell clerke doctor lawe theſe mette togyder myddes waye bytwene calays boloyne place called balyngham tyme great brute fraunce place great feeſt iuſtes yonge kyng charles wolde make parys fyrſt entryng iſabell ye frēche quene agaynſt whiche feeſt knightes ſquyers ladyes damoſelles apparelled tryumphe whiche feeſt ſhall ſpeke charter peace engroſed ſealed bytwene party ye ſhall knowe whan ſir iohan froyſſarte authour hyſtorie departed fro ortays fro erle foiz ye haue herde wente cōpany lorde de la ryuer lorde guyllyam tremoyle brought yonge ducheſſe berrey doughter erle boulonge ye duke berrey wedded towne ryon auuergne conteyned hyſtorie theſe mater preſent wherfore maye well ſpeke therof whan came parys foūde gentyll lorde coucy good lorde myne newly maryed yonge lady doughter duke lorayne whiche lorde made good chere demaunded newes countrey foiz biern pope clement beyng auygnon maryage bytwene berrey boulonge another great frende myne good lorde mayſter therle beraunt dolphyn auuergne demaūdes anſwered knewe ſo content deſyred go hym cambreſys caſtell kynge gyuen hym called creue cure two leages fro cābrey nyne leages fro valenſenes ſo rode cō pany rode way ſhewed howe byſſhoppe bayeux erle ſaynt pole boloyn ſent thyder frēche kyng cōclude truce howe kyng richarde kynge englāde calys byſſhop durham therle saliſbury wt howe ſpace thanne moneth abydynge ambaſſadours scotlande newly come thyder ſayde howe coſyn erle ſaynt pole writen hym therof howe frenche kynge ſente kynge scottes counſayle ſhulde agree truce englyſſhe men wolde conſente peace without ſcottes compriſed ſame thus rode tyll came creue cure hym thre dayes thā toke leaue hym went valencennes taryed fyftene dayes wente holande ſe gentyll lorde good mayſter myne erle bloyes founde hym eſtōchoucke made good chere demaunded ſome tidynges ſhewed ſuche knewe taryed hym moneth gede retourned fraunce knowe trouthe cōcluſion taken bytwene englande fraunce balyngham alſo purpoſed feeſt ſhulde parys entre frenche quene knowe trouthe theſe mater retourned throughe brabaunt ſo came parys eyght dayes feeſt began fell company lordes fraunce scotlande ſuche ben makynge truce bytwene englā de fraunce fell acqueyntaūce ſir guyllyam melyn ſhewed hole mater howe erle ſaynt pole paſſed englande ſe kynge rycharde confyrme truce graunted thre yeres ſhulde retourne agayne ſaid gret feeſt demaūded ſaid ſir guillyam lordes scotlande ſayd treatie demanuded bycauſe youthe ben scotlande ſerched realme wylde ſcottes taried ſpace yt court kyng dauyd scotlande acqueyntaūce moſt parte ye lordes knightes scotlāde therfore demaūded ſir melyn anſwered ſaide howe ben byſſhop bredon ſir iames ſir dauyd lymſay ſir water ſaynt clere bare ſayeng awaye dyde putte writynge hadde ſene herde ſhall ſhewe trouthe ſawe knewe feeſt fyrſt entryng quene ſabell parys ⸫ ⸫ ¶of ordynaunce entre quene iſabell towne parys cap clvii ſonday twētie daye iune yere oure lorde god thouſande thre hundred foure ſcore nyne people paris ſuche nombre marueyle beholde ſame ſondaye mornyng aſſēble made churche ſaynte denyce noble ladyes fraunce ſuche ſhulde accompany quene ſuche lordes ſhulde aſſyſt quenes lytters ladyes burgeſſes parys twelue hundred horſebacke raynged feldes bothe ſydes way aparelled gownes one ſute clothe baudkyn grene crymoſyn olde quene iane doughter ducheſſe orlyance entred fyrſte parys one houre noone lytter couered well companyed lordes paſſed hyghe ſtrete ſaynte denyce ſo rode palays taryed kynge day theſe two ladyes went ye frenche quene ladyes ſet forwarde ducheſſe berrey ducheſſe burgoyne duches thourayn duches bare counteſſe neuers lady coucy ladyes damoſelles good ordre lytters aparelled richly myghte ye duches thourayne lytter ſhe rode lone vpon fayre pal frey rychly aparelled ſhe rode one ſyde quenes lytter aſſyſted duke thourayne duke burbone fore heed bothe ſydes myddes bothe ſydes lytter duke berry duke burgoyne fete lorde peter nauer therle oſtrenaunt quenes lytter richely apparelled diſcouert nexte folowed ryche apparelled palfrey ducheſſe berrey ſhe aſſiſted erle de la marche erle neuers ſhe rydinge ſofte pace bytwene bothe than̄e folowed lytter diſcouered open ducheſſe burgoyne margarete heynalte doughter coūteſſe neuers lytter aſſyſted lorde henry bare yonge erle namure called ſir guylliam ye lady orlyaunce palfrey richely apparelled lorde iames burbone lorde philyppe dartoys aſſyſted lady orlyaunce another lytter ducheſſe bare doughter lorde coucy ladyes damoſelles came chariottes palfrayes knightes folowed mē cion made ſergeauntes offycers armes buſyneſſe ynoughe make way breke preace ſuche people ſtretes ſemed worlde ben fyrſt gate ſaynt denice entryng parys heuyn made full ſterres within yonge chyldren apparelled lyke angelles ſwetely ſyngynge amonge ymage lady holdyng fygure lytell chylde playeng hym ſelfe lytell myll made great nutte heuyn hyghe richely apparelled armes fraunce baner ſonne ſhynyng golde caſtyng rayes deuyſed kynge feeſt iuſtes quene ladyes paſſed vnder ye gate great pleaſure beholde ſo paſſed whan quene ladyes paſte came ſofte pace foū tayne ſtrete ſaynt denice whiche condyte couered ouer clothe fyne aſure paynted full floure de lyces golde pyllers ſerte full armes dyuers noble lordes fraunce foūtayn iſſued great ſtremes punent clarre foū tayne yonge maydens richely apparelled ryche chapelettes heedes ſynginge melodiouſly great pleaſure helde handes cuppes goblettes golde offryng gyueng drinke ſuche paſſed quene reſted regarded great pleaſure deuyſe ſo dyde ladyes damoſelles ſawe vnder mynſter trinyte ſtrete ſtage thervpon caſtell longe ſtage ordeyned paſſe kynge salhadyn dedes perſonages chriſten men one parte sarazins parte perſonages lordes name olde tyme hadde ben armed done feates armes ye paſſe salhadyne armed ſuche armure vſed thanne lytell aboue perſonages frenche kynge twelue peeres fraunce armed blaſon armes whan frenche quenes lytter come ſtage ſhe reſted ſeaſon thanne perſonages ſtage kyng rycharde departed fro company wente frenche kynge demaunded lycence go aſſayle sarazins ye kyng gaue hym leaue kynge rycharde retourned twelue companyons than̄e ſette order incontynent wente aſſayled kynge salhadyne sarazins ſporte ſemed great bataile endured good ſpace pagiaunt well regarded than̄e quene paſſed forthe came ye ſecōde gate ſaynt denyce caſtell ordayned fyrſte gate heuyn clouded full ſterres richely deuyſed therin fygure god lyttynge maieſtie father ſonne holygooſt within heuyn chyldren fygure angelles ſwetely ſyngyng whiche pagiaunt greatly prayſed quenes lytter paſſed vnder gate paradiſe two angelles came came downe holdynge handes ryche crowne golde garnyſſhed precious ſtones ſette fayre eaſely crowne ye quenes heed ſynging right ſwetely verſe dame ye encloſed bytwene floure de lyces ſo ye quene realme fraunce ſo drewe agayne paradyſe paſſed forthe came chapell ſaynt iames ſcaffolde richely deuyſed right hande quene rode couered ouer ryche arras drawen aboute curteyns maner chambre within mē playeng vpon orgās ryght ſwetely ſtrete ſaynt denyce couered ouer clothes ſylke chamlet ſuche plentie thoughe ſuche clothes ſhulde coſt nothynge ſir iohan froiſſart authour hyſtorie preſent ſawe great marueyle ſuche nombre clothes ſylke goten great plentie though ben ī alyſandre dama houſes bothe ſides great ſtrete ſaynt denice vnto bridge parys hanged clothes arras dyuers hiſtories whiche pleaſure beholde thus paſſed forthe ſoft pace ſo came gate chatelet parys quene reſted ſe goodly deuyſes ordayned gate chatelet parys caſtell made woode tymbre ſtrōgly made ſhuld haue endured xl yeres whiche caſtell enbatylled euery lope man armes armed peces ye ſame caſtell bedde made richely encourteyned apparelled haue ſtande kynges chambre bedde called ye bedde iuſtyce bedde lay figure ſaynt anne caſtell playne caſtell cōteyned gret ſpace playne full tree full hare cone byrdes flewe whan brode flewe thider agayne feare ye people theſe tree iſſued whyte harte wente bedde iuſtyce parte wode iſſued lyon egle properlye freſſhely approched harte bedde iuſtyce came tree xii yonge maydens richely apparelled chapelettes golde heedes holdynge naked ſwordes hādes wente bytwene harte lyon egle ſhewed ſelfe redy defende harte bedde iuſtyce deuyſe ye quene great pleaſure regarde paſſed forthe came bridge parys whiche couered richely beſene couerynge grene crimoſyn full ſterres ſtretes hanged ladyes churche tyme quene ladyes paſte bridge approched churche oure lady late waye wente rode ſofte pace quene lady entred churche lady foūde waye playes paſtymes greatly pleaſure amonge mayſter came geane tied corde hygheſt houſe bridge ſaynt myghell ouer ye houſes ende tyed hygheſt towre lady churche ye quene paſſed great ſtrete called ladyes ſtrete bycauſe late ſayde mayſter two brinnynge candelles handes iſſued lytell ſtage made hyght ladyes towre ſyngyng went vpon corde longe great ſtrete ſo ſawe hym hadde marueyle howe myght bare ſtyll hādes ye two brinnynge cādelles ſo myght well ſene ouer parys two myle without parys ſuche tombler lyghtneſſe greatlye prayſed churche lady byſſhoppe parys reueſted armes lorde ieſa chriſt colledge great nō bre clergy quene lyghted lytter takenne downe four duke ſaye duke berrey duke burgoyne ye duke thourayne duke burbone ladyes lykewiſe taken downe theym aſſyſters bothe lytters fro horſes good order entred churche byſſhoppe clergy thē ſyngyng ye honour god bleſſed lady quene ledde aſſyſted brought vp hyghe auter ſhe kneled downe ſayde prayer ſuche pleaſed offred treſorie lady four clothes clothe golde goodly crowne angelles dyde ſet heed incontynent ſir iohn̄ de la ryuer ſir iohan le mercyer delyuered byſſhoppe parys rycher crowne byſſhoppe four duke dyde ſette quenes heed than̄e retourned agayne churche quene ladyes ſette agayne lytters mo fyue hūdred torch brinnyng late thus brought palays parys kynge olde quene ducheſſe orlyaunce doughter quene ladyes lyghted fro lytters eche theym brought ſeuerall chambres lordes went lodgynges daunſynge paſte nexte daye monday kynge made dyner pali houre high maſſe quene ledde foreſayd foure duke holy chapell maſſe ſeaſon quene ſacred anoynted quene ought archebyſſhoppe roane dyde obſeruaunce called ſir wyllyam vyar maſſe ſonge ſolempnely kynge quene retourned chābres lady ſuche chambres palays anone kyng quene retourned halle ladyes great table marble alwayes ſtandeth ſtyll halle made lengar great plaunche borde oke foure inch thycke whiche borde richelye couered aboue great table agaynſte one pyllers kynges dreſſyng borde ſtandynge full veſſell golde ſyluer whiche greatly couered many ſawe table longe diſcendyng downe barryers made wode thre alyes ſergeauntes vſſhers great nombre kepynge entree entente none ſhulde entre ſuche ſeruytours ye table ye hall ſo full people man coulde nat tourne hym wt moche payne mynſtrelles great nombre pleſauntly played euery man facultie kyng prelate quene ladyes waſſhed ſate downe table kynges table ſate downe chiefe byſſhoppe noyan byſſhoppe langers kynge kynge archebyſſhoppe rohan kynge ſatte ſurcote ſcarlette furred armyns ryche crowne golde heed quene kyng armyne duches berry duches burgoyne ye duches thourayne lady neuers good damoſell bare lady coucy mary harecourt mo ſate nat highe table ſauynge beneth ſatte lady sailly wyfe ſir guye tremoyle two table longe downe hall ſate mo fyue hū dred ladyes damoſels preaſe ſo great great payne ſerue thē meſſes whiche great table haue nat make great ꝓceſſe therof ſhall ſo ſpeke paſtymes yt made bitwene meſſes whiche great pleaſure kyng haue ſene taryed hole dyner firſte myddes palays caſtell made tymbre xl fote longe twentie fore brode foure towres euery quarter one one myddes hygher caſtell fygured cytie troye towre myddes palays ylion penōs armes troyans kyng priamus hector ſonne chyldren alſo armes ſuche kynges prince encloſed troye kynge priam caſtell went vpon wheles whiche myght tourned euery waye properly caſtell came aſſayle another ſorte therby pauilyon whiche alſo wente vpon wheles ſo ſoftely couertly mouynge therof coude nat parceyued ye armes kynges grece ſuche ſiege alſo ſhyppe properlye deuyſed wherin myght well hūdred men armes moued crafte wheles bothe caſtell pauilyon ſhip pauilyon shyppe aſſayled euer caſtell within caſtell made great defence ſporce endure nat longe preace people ſo ſore man coulde ſtyrre people ſore chafed heate putte moche payne table parlyament chambre dore ſatte many ladyes damoſelles reaſon preace ouerthrowen erthe ladyes cauſed ſodainly ryſe without order ſore chafed preace heate palays quene herſelfe poynt haue ſore diſpleaſed perforce backe doore broken vp gette freſſhe ayre ladye coucy ſore diſeaſed whan̄e kynge ſawe mater commaunded ceaſe table great haſt taken vp let ladyes damoſelles large lefte takynge wyne ſpyces wente chambres ſome ladyes taryed ſtyll palays ſome wente towne lodgynges eaſe preace heate ſore greued lady coucy wente lodgynge helde tyll late fyue clocke frenche quene accompanyed foreſayd ducheſſes departed fro palays parys toke lytters open ſo wente throughe ſtretes kynges lodgynge called ſaynt polle ryuer sayne quene mo thouſande horſes kyng went fro palays ryuer sayne toke barge wente water houſe ſaynt polle ye houſe great large well amended yet ye kyng cauſed great court nere gate fro ryuer made great halle whiche couered ouer clothes armes normandy walles hā ged clothes arras ſondrie hyſtories hall kynge gaue ladyes ſupper quene kepte chābre ſhe ſene yt nyght lady kyng lordes daunſed reuelled nyght nerchande tyll daye mornyng euery perſon departed went lodgynges ſlepe good tyme nowe ſhall ſhewe gyftes preſētes parys gaue tueſday noon ye quene ducheſſe thourayne newly come fraunce oute lombardy ſhe doughter duke myllayne ſhe ſame yere wedded loyes duke thourayne named valentyne ſhe neuer ben parys therfore burgeſſes parys gaue welcome tueſday aboute xii clocke xl burgeſſes parys moſt notableſt perſons cytie one ſute clothynge came kynges houſe ſaynt polle brought preſent quene ſtretes parys preſent lytter richely wrought borne bytwene two ſtrong mē properly apparelled lyke two auncient ſage perſones lytter celler thynne fyue clothe ſylke ſo iewelles litter might well ſene whan came ſaint polle firſt cāe kynges chambre whiche redy apparelled receyue alwayes ſuche bringeth thyng welcome thā theſe burgeſſes ſette downe lytter two treſtels myddes chambre kneled downe kyng ſaid right dere lorde noble kyng burgeſſes parys preſenteth grace theſe iewelles lytter welcomȳg grace gouernaūce realme fraunce kyng ſayd good men thāke right goodly riche burgeſſes roſe drewe backe therwith toke leaue whan gone kynge ſayd ſir wyllyam lordes montague hym sir let v go nere lytter ſe theſe preſentes nerer kynge well regarded fyrſt foure pottes golde ſixe lauers golde ſixe platte golde veſſell wayed hūdred fyftie marke golde lyke maner nother ſorte burgeſſes richely apparelled one lyuerey came quene preſented another lytter whiche borne chambre ſhewynge howe good men parys dyde recōmende grace ſent preſent whiche preſent ſhippe golde two great flagōs golde two dredge box golde two ſaltes golde ſixe pottes golde ſixe lauers golde xii lampes ſyluer two baſons ſyluer ſōme thre hundred marke golde ſyluer preſent brought lytter bytwene two men one ſemblaunce beare ſemblaunce vnycorne thirde preſent lykewiſe brought duches thourayns chambre two men fygured fourme two blacke moore richely apparelled white towelles heedes lyke ſarazins lytter fayre riche couered fyne clothe ſylke brought xii burgeſſes one apparell gaue preſent ſayd ducheſſe whiche preſente ſhippe golde great potte golde two ewer golde two great platte golde two ſaltes golde ſixe pottes ſyluer two doſin ſaucers ſylner two doſyn boule ſyluer sōme golde ſyluer two hūdred markes preſent greatly reioyſed duches thourayne reaſon goodly riche curteſly ſhe thanked gyfte thus tueſdaye theſe preſentes gyuen kyng ye quene ducheſſe thourayne greatly conſydred valeur theſe preſentes alſo puyſſaunce pariſyens ſhewed one ſawe theſe p̄ ſentes coſt pariſiens threſcore thouſande crownes golde theſe preſentes delyuered tyme go dyner daye kynge quene ladyes dyned chambres ye ſoner haue done thre clocke dyner ſhulde drawe felde ſaynt katheryne ordayned ſtages ſcaffoldes great nombre kynge quene beholde iuſtes ¶nowe ſhall name order knyghtes called kynges knyghtes ſonne golde thyrtie thē firſte duke berrey duke burgoyne duke burbone erle de la marche ſir iaquemarte burbone brother lorde guillyam namure ſir olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraūce ſyr iohan vien ſir iames vien lorde eſpaigny ſyr guy tremoyle ſir gillyam brother ſir phylyp bare lorde rocheforde bretone lorde ray lorde beamond ſyr iohan barbencon hazle fraūce lorde tourty norman ſyr iohan barres lorde nantoyllet lorde rochfouca • lord garanciers ſir iohan harpedante barone dinury ſyr willyam marcyell ſyr raynolde roye ſyr geffrey caryn ſyr charles changeet ſir gylliam lignac theſe knyghtes armed ſheldes lyke ſonne raye aboute thre clocke place ſaint kateryne thyder come ladyes damoſels firſte quene came thyder chare rychely aparelled ladyes good ordre entred ſcaffoldes ordeyned came frenche kyng redy apparelled iuſte whiche paſtyme loued ryght well well accompanyed iuſtes beganne many lordes dyuers countreys syr gyllyam heynalt erle oſtrenant iuſted ryght goodly ſo dyd ſuche knyghtes came hym lorde gomminies ſir iohan andregenes lorde cautan ſyr auſell tranſegynes ſir clinquart hermo dyde well deuoyre prays ladyes alſo iuſted well duke irelande ſeaſone frenche kynge alſo iuſted well knyght almayne beſyde ryne called ſir seruays mirando theſe iuſtes well contynued ſo many knightes one coulde nat rynne another duſte rynnynge horſes ſo great troubled ſore lorde coucy dyd maruelouſly well theſe iuſtes contynued tyll nyght departed ladyes brought lodgynges kynge company brought lodgynge ſaynt pole ſupper ladyes ſuche haboundaūce harde recorde feeſt reuell ſyngynge daunſyng tyll next mornynge ſonne ryſinge priſe iuſtes aunſwerers beſt done lengeſt contynued gyuen frenche kynge conſente ladyes iudgement harauldes chalengers halze • launders baſtarde brother ducheſſe burgoyne knightes complayned duſt ſo ſome ſaid loſte dedes reaſon therof kynge made prouyſion ordeyned mo two hundred barrelles mater watred place wherby groūde well amended yet nexte day hadde duſte ynough moche wednyſdaye came parys erle ſaynte pole frome oute englande made great haſte come theſe iuſtes feeſt lefte behynde englande ſir iohan chatell morant bringe charter treuce hym erle ſaynte pole well welcomed kynge lordes quene glad comynge wednyſdaye dyner euery man drew felde ladyes came thyder goodly aray done daye mounted vpon ſtages iuſtes began fyerſly well contynued tyll nyght euery perſon retourned ladyes great ſupper ſaynte polle pryſes gyuen conſente ladyes iudgement harauldes anſwerers priſe gyuen ſquyer haynalte called iohan de flaron come thyder company therle oſtrenant chalengers priſe gyuen ſquyer duke burgoyns called iohan de pokerers agayne thurſdaye iuſted knightes ſquyers togyther euery man payned hym ſelfe well endured tyll nyght ladyes ſupped agayne ſaynt polle priſe gyuen vtter partie ſir charles armoyes within ſquyer quenes called lons frydaye kynge made dyner ladyes damoſelles aboute ende dyner entred hall kyng ſytting table ducheſſe berrey ducheſſe burgoyne duches thourayne coūtes ſaynt polle lady coucy great meny ladyes damoſels brought two knyghtes horſebacke armed peces iuſtes ſpeares thyes one ſir raynold roy ſir bouciquant ye yonger two iuſted goodly togyther came thyder knightes ser raynold troyes ſyr gyllyam namure ſyr charles armoyes lorde garancyers lorde nantoyllet lardenoys oſtende dyuers theſe iuſted ſpace two houres kynge ladyes returned lodgynges fryday ſuche ladyes damoſels wolde retourne owne houſes toke leaues kynge quene alſo ſuche lordes wolde departe kynge quene thanked payne taken comynge feeſt ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe lorde chateau morante erle ſaynte polle lefte behynde hym englande retourned fraūce charter treuce ſealed kynge rycharde vncles endure thre yere ſee lande cap clviii theſe lordes ladyes returned fro greate feeſt owne houſes lorde chaſtell morant whome lorde ſaynte polle left england retourned fraunce kynge counſayle ſhewed forth charter treuce ſealed kynge rycharde englande vncles endure thre yere well ſee lande wordes charter ſayd whoſoeuer breketh maner cōdicion poynte artycle conteyned treatie ſhulde taken reputed traytours rynne mortall punyſyon bycauſe lorde coucy ſouerayne capytayne choſen kinge counſayle defende kepe outwarde march bytwene ryuer durdone ſee countrey iuuergne lymoſyn copy treatye delyuered hym entente ſhulde publyſſhe ſhewe wolde thynge contrary alſo entent vandachor chaluſſet dorbeſidouſac garyſons ye made warre englyſſhe tytle ſhulde haue knowledge treuce ſhulde make none excuſe fell payne lykewyſe marſhall fraū ce lorde loys xancer alſo copy therof whiche ryght nedefull gouernour outwarde march languedoc fro ryuer ronne bridge amyngnon aboute countreys ſignories apendaūt ryuer dordone coūtreys beaucaire carcaſſone tholous rouergne dagen querca bygore pyergourte lymogines theſe countreys dyuers garyſons ſmally regarded obeyed peace truce alwayes entended make marre caſtell cullyer ſtronge caſtell londre bygore fronters byerne greatly feared neyghbours ⸫ ⸫ ¶the maryage king loys ſonne duke aniou doughter kynge peter aragone went quene napoles mother auignon ſe pope clemente cap clix tyme treatye made maryage bytwene loys aniowe ſonne duke aniou wrote himſelf kynge napoles cycyll iheruſalem erle prouynce doughter kyng peter arragon quene napoles went auygnone ſe pope clement ſhe founde lorde coucy company yonge ſonne loys lorde coucy ryght ioyous cō mynge quene receyued ryght honorably pope clement cardynalles ſhe well worthy ſhe noble woman dilygent buſyneſſe ſhe deſyred lorde coucye helpe conuey ſonne loyes realme arragone tyll maryed lorde coucye wolde nat refuce ordayned hym ſelfe ſo ſayde dame vyage ſeuyn yere wolde gladder accompliſſhe go march cicyll naples wich lorde ſonne lycence kyng ſouerayne lorde sir quod lady thāke ſe well good wyll doute nat kyng wyll content ye go ſonne aragon quene arragon wyll glad ſe doughter hath maryed brother ſir hēry bare lorde coucy agreed go voyage thus younge kynge cicyll tooke iourney well accompanied whan taken leaue pope mother wepynge departynge mother ſonne cauſed hertes relente ſhulde departe farre ſō der knewe nat whan ſe togyder agayne ordayned whan maryage accomplyſſhed yonge kynge yonge quene ſhulde take ſee porte barcelone ſo go arryue porte naples nere myght longe yonge kynge loyes iourneyed paſſed mountpellyer beſyers ſo came narbone receyued ioyfullye euery man refreſſhed thē horſes one day departed wente parpygnen fyrſt towne realme arragon cōmyng yonge kynge well knowen court kynge arragon ſente menne mete hym conuey vycount ro • uebertyn ſir raymonde baighes long rode cāe cytie barcelone kynge quene doughter yonge kyng nobl • receyued ſpecially quene arragon ryght ioyouſe cōmynge lorde coucy thanked yonge kynge ſonne ſhulde bringynge hym company ſayd mater ſhulde atcheue better maryage confyrmed bytwene theſe two chyldren bycauſe wynter approched delayed voyage goyng see wynter great see perillous ſaid wolde make prouiſyon wynter go naples nexte marche lorde coucy beyng arragon receyued letter fro frenche kynge commaundynge hym retourne toke leaue kynge arragon quene yonge kyng wyfe lordes ſuche departed myght haue leyſar wolde haue retourned auignon haue ſene pope olde quene af naples ſente excuſe retourned auuergne fraunce whan̄e maryage made bytwene yonge kyng loyes cycyll doughter kynge arragon wherby great alya • ce bytwene party arragon bounde ayde ſerue yong kynge bringe hym realme naples nat leaue hym tyll realme peſably naples cicyll appendaūtes paule calabre cytie gaiet whiche margarete dura helde aragonoys ſhulde ſerue hym longe warre endured ii hundred ſpeares coſte charge thouſande croſbowes thouſande bregandiers whan ſwete tyme marche come wyndes apealed ye water ſwaged rage wodes reuerduced prouyſions made redy barcelone galees redy ſuche ſhulde go yong kynge yonge quene tooke leaues kynge aragone quene wept departyng quene recōmaunded yonge quene doughter erle roodes valyaunt knight ſir raymon baighes theſe two toke ye ſpeciall charge natwithſtādinge erle vrgell erle lyne great company theſe galees fyftene hūdred ſpeares two thouſande croſbowes two thouſande men warre dartes paueſſes wente thus fortifyed well acompanyed reſyſt better nede agaynſt ennemyes alſo reſyſt rencoūters vpon ſee longe waye ſee fro barcelone naples margarete dura aduerſary myght trouble thē way therfore thought go ſurelye ¶ nowe wyll leaue ſpeke yonge kyng cicyll ſpeke buſyneſſe realme fraunce ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe frenche kynge deſyre go viſyte farre partes realme howe went fyrſt burgoyne auygnon ſe pope clement cap clx great feeſt accompliſſhed euery lorde lady gone home owne houſes ye haue herde frē che kyng ſawe truce englande thre yere hadde ymaginacion go viſite realme ſpecially vtwarde marcheſſe languedocke lorde de la ryuer ſir iohan mercier chefe preuy coūſayle exhorted hym go auygnon ſe pope clement cardynalles deſyred ſe hym alſo go tholous ſayd kyng sir kyng youthe ought viſyte realme knowe people lerne gouerned whiche ſhulde greatly profyte better beloued ſubiectes kyng lyghtly enclyned counſayle deſyre traueyle ſe newe thynges ye lord de la ryuer newly come thoſe marcheſſe herde great complayntes people tholous carcaſſone beaucayre deſired greatly ſe kyng ben ſore charged tayles aydes ye duke berrey informacion ſeruaunt called betyſache pytie man ſo pylled people nothynge lefte therfore counſayled kynge go thyder prouyde ſome remedy alſo kynge ſhulde ſende erle foize come hym tholous kyng made redy go thyder ſente afore way prouiſyon ſhulde made cōmyng ſente worde therof vncle duke burgoyne aūte ducheſſe wolde come longe throughe countrey wolde ſe coſyns chyldren bring company brother duke thourayne vncle burbone whiche pleaſed greatly ye duke ducheſſe duke cauſed proclamed feeſt iuſtes holden dygnon knightes ſquiers burgoyne sauoy march adioyning requyred feeſt ſo euery man ordred themſelfe accordingly thus whyles kynges prouiſyon makyng go auignon languedocke duke burgoyne parte made great prouiſyon receyue kynge ſo dyde euery man marcheſſe purpoſed ye feeſt dignon ſame ſeaſon mater fell fraunce ye haue herde howe duke irelande called erle oxenforde banyſſhed oute englande vncles kyng richarde ſpeciallye duke glouceſtre gretteſt dyſpleaſure hym ſo ſaue hym ſelfe fledde hollande taryed ſmall ſeaſon towne dordregh fayne departe then duke aubert lorde towne holande denyed hym taryeng coū trey wolde nat kepe hym agaynſt wyll coſyns germayns englande kynge englande written hym yet fayne departe go trecte fraunches towne maner people payeng take duke irelande ynoughe paye beſyde brought threſcore thouſande frankes fraunce fro conſtable redempcion iohan bretayne come ye frē che kyng vnder ſaueconducte hym yere kyng made hym good chere bycauſe ſtraūger howe trewe thoughe duke kyng yet ye lorde coucy hated hym herie good cauſe though duke affayres prouyded wytte honoure eloquence great largeſſe yet greatly treſpaſſed agaynſt lorde coucies doughter wyfe laufully ſpouſed forſoke without tytell reaſon falſe yuell temptacyon diſceyte diſceyued toke another wyfe damoſell quene englandes countrey boeme kyng ye quene englāde ſynfully conſented therto diſpenſed pope vrbane rome inſtaūte deſyre kynge quene englande ſynne greued greatly conſcience duke irelande bycauſe lorde coucy counſayle fraū ce well worthy ſo done good ſeruyce well able ꝓcured ſo moche meanes frendes ſir olyuer clyſſon lorde de la ryuer ſir iohan marcyer ſayde duke irelande ſhulde departe fraunce go choſe hymſelfe another place abyde lyſt ſo nat realme fraūce thyder ſhulde ſurely cōueyed duke irelande ſawe well howe dayly paryll meanes ye lorde coucy lygnage wherfore thought ſhulde beſte hym go farre rather abyde nere aduiſed drawe brabant deſyred kyng write ducheſſe brabant yt wolde pleace ſuffre hym peſably abyde coū trey kynge wrote aunte ducheſſe brabant ſhe condiſcēded kynges deſyre duke irelande conducted men kynges louayne taryed ſomtyme went caſtell nat farre fro towne louaygne whiche borowed knyght brabant duke irelande archebyſſhop yorke lykewiſe banyſſhed englande one cauſe byſſhoppe one neuelles englande countrey northūberlande puiſſaunt men bothe landes lynage taryed theſe two lordes louayne herde ſaye longe lyued coude neuer come mercy peace ye kynge englandes vncles farther ſpeke feeſt ſaynt mychell frēche kyng departed fro houſe beautie beſyde parys lefte quene toke waye troy champayne go burgoyne vncle duke burbone duke loyes thourayne lorde cou • many lordes knyghtes company kynge rode ſo longe came dignon duke burgoyne erle neuers ſonne come chatelon ryuer sayne whā kyng come dignon ducheſſe burgoyne coūteſſe neuers doughter receyued kyng ioyfully lordes loue kyng welcomynge dygnon many ladyes damoſels come thyder ſe hym lady sully lady vergy lady pagny dyuers fayre lady freſſhe well apparelled began feeſtynge daunſynge carolynge theſe ladyes enforſed themſelfe daunce ſyng make ioye loue ye kyng ye duke thourayne duke burbone lorde coucy monday tueſday wedniſday thre dayes ther goodly iuſtes price gyuen ye beſt doer kynge eight dayes ye towne dignon great triūphe ſporte x daye toke leaue vncle duke burgoyne ducheſſe child thentent ye duke burgoyne ſhortely folowe kyng nephue go hym iourney kyng deꝑted fro dignon whan taken leaue ladyes damoſelles rode ſo long iourneys came vile neufe beſyde auignon houſe royall apparelled hym cardynals amyens aigreuell ſaint marcell chatell neufe mo xiii came mette kyng felde gladde kynges cōmyng duke berrey come auygnon lodged pope palais cāe vyle neufe kynge laye lyuere arras called amontays way mountpellyer duke burgoyne arryued next day ye kyng came thyder water rone duke toke barge lyonſur le rone thus kynge theſe four duke togyder determyned paſſe bridge auignon go ſe pope ix clocke mornyng kyng paſſed bridge acompanyed brother thre vncles xii cardynalles ſo went pope palays pope clement redy chambre conſyſtorie ſyttyng chayre papalyte whan frenche kyng came chambre ſawe pope enclyned hym ſelfe whan came nere ye pope roſe kyng kyſt hande mouthe pope ſate downe cauſed kyng ſyr downe hym place purpoſely prepared hym ye duke kyſt pope hande ſate downe amōge cardynals anone tyme dyner drewe pope great chambre table redy couered pope wa • ſhed ſatte downe table alone kept eſtate frenche kyng ſatte downe another table alone cardynalles duke ſatte downe order dyner plentyfull dyner wyne ſpyces kyng ye four duke went chābres eche chambre apparelled palays taryed certayne dayes v day kyng came thyder ye yonge erle sauoy coſyn king nephue duke burbone came thyder kyng right ioyfull cōmyng frenche kynge duke thourayne brother erle sauoye lyght corage ſpyrite thoughe lodged pope palais nere pope cardynalles yet wolde nat abſteyne daunce caroll make ſporte amonge ladyes damoſelles auignon erle geneſne brother pope brought theym aquayntaunce ladyes damoſelles towne kynge gaue great giftes ladyes damoſelles wherby great laude prayſe pope cardinal ryght ioyfull kynges beyng reaſon ſhulde ſo without loue frenche kynge porte ſhulde haue ben ſmall cō ſydred ought haue conſydred kynge chriſtned obedyent except loue fauoure alyaunce frenche kyng kynge spaygne kynge scottes obeyed pope clement kynge aragon newly ſo determyned made quene yolande bare coſyn germayne frenche kynge elles nat done ſo kynge aragon father hym neuter therfore pope cardynalles ought well feeſt frenche kyng ſeynge puyſſaunce profyte lyued kepe eſtate came meanes frenche kyng thus kyng taryed certayne ſeaſon great ioye ſporte ioye kynges cōmynge thyder pope opyned grace clerkes beyng courte ſpace moneth gaue nomynacions kyng coledges cathedral euery coledge two prebendes reuoked grace gyuen wolde kynges grace ſhulde ꝓcede dyd wherby many kynges clerkes promoted alſo pope gaue grace duke thourayne duke berrey duke burgoyne lorde coucy ſtopped ben graunted pope ſo curteſſe lyberall loue kynges cōmyng graūted euery thyng aſked whan kynge ben certayne ſpace pope ſhewed hym complaynt howe pope rome greatly hyndred ryght made moche trouble diffrence ye churche kynge herde hym well promyſed pope clement returne agayne fraunce wolde entende none thynge bringe churche one accorde thoſe wordes pope greatly conforted kynge toke leaue retourned vyle neufe ſo dyde brother vncles berrey burgoyne daye kynge made dyner cardynalles erle geneſne brother pope dyner toke leaues kyng ſayd nexte day wolde ryde towarde moūtpellyer thanked reuerēce done hym cardynalles retourned auygnon ordayned kynge ſhulde departe nexte daye brother duke burbone company ſo dyd toke leaue vncles berey burgoyne ſayde howe ſhulde retourne owne countreis ſhulde go hym tyme ſayde wolde go tholous ſende therle foiz come thyder vncles cō tent therwith kyng ſuche counſayle hym duke berrey duke burgoyns voyces nat herde without ſmall mater gouernyng lāguedocke taken awaye fro duke berrey deuyded seneſchaunces kynges profyte wherof countreis marcheſſe carcaſſone beſyers narbone fonges bygore tholous greatly reioyſed ſeaſon ſore oppreſſed tayles duke berrey reyſed ye ſhall whan mater requyreth whan duke berey duke burgoyn ſawe kyng wolde go moūtpellyer viſyte lāguedoc wolde nat ſuffre thē go cōpany ſore diſpleaſed therwt howbeit ſagely diſymuled mater ſayde eche kyng gothe languedoc make • ſycyon thē gouerned make treatie wt therle foiz ye moſt proudeſt erle lyuēg neuer loued prayſed neyghbour euer nouther frenche kyng englande spaygne arragon nauer kyng taketh counſayle mo ryuer mercier mōtague beghe villayns howe ſaye brother ꝙ duke berrey duke burgoyne anſwered ſayd kynge nephue yonge beleueth yonge counſayle ſhall diſceyue hym ſurely concluſyon ſhall nat good ye ſhall ſe muſt behoue v ſuffre p̄ſente tyme tyme ſhall come ſuche coūſaileth ſhall repent kynge alſo let hym go goddes name whider ſhall pleaſe hym let v retourne owne coutreis long holde guyder none ſhall v wronge two chefe membres fraunce thus theſe two duke deuyſed togyder frenche kyng departed nexte day toke waye nymes rode thyder dyner ſaid two duke taryed ſtyll pope thre dayes ye lorde coucy lykewiſe fourthe daye departed rode owne countreis kyng went fro nymes laye nyght lunell whan kyng deꝑted fro lunell went dyner moutpellyer thre lytell myles receyued ye burgeſſes ladyes damoſelles towne greatly deſyred ſe kynge many riche preſentes gyuen hym moūtpellyer puiſſaunt towne ryche full marchandiſe kynge prayſed towne moche well conſydred puiſſaūce ſhewed kyng towne hadde ben moche richer thanne preſente tyme duke aniou duke berrey eche tourne hadde greatlye pylled kyng ſorie ye good people endured ſo moche dōmage ſayd wolde reforme countre better ſtate ſhewed kynge pouertie towne nothyng ſhulde fynde forwarde towne ſelfe hath good meanes recoueraūce reſon marchandiſe yt vſed bothe lande ſee marcheſſe carcaſſone tholous therabout ſaid two duke gouernaunce loke thyng puyſſaunce laye handes nothyng left taken away ye ſhall fynde ye people ſo poore ſuche wont riche puiſſaunt nowe ſcant able labour vynes landes great pyte ſe wyues chyldren haue euery yere fyue ſixe tayles layde ſhulders raū ſomed thirde fourthe parte ſubſtaunce ſomtyme toguyder one tayle coude nat payde yt another redy ye necke therof ser well knowen theſe two duke vncles ruled lāguedocke haue leuyed ye countrey fro vyle neufe tholouſyn rounde ryuer garon retournyng ryuer dordone ſōme xxx hundred thouſande frankes ſpecially ſythe duke aniou departed duke berrey hath done dōmage founde playne countrey cōmontie good caſe duke aniou tooke ryche men wherwith paye duke berrey ſpared nother poore riche gadered ſpecially one counſayle treaſourer named betyſache nacyon cytie beſyers ye ſhall complayntes people wyll crye hym theſe wordes kyng ſaid god haue ſoule ſhall prouyde mater retourne ſhall puniſſhe treſpaſours ſhall make inquyſycion ſeruantes • nycers myne vncles ſuche ruled parcies languedocke ſuche haue deſerued ſhalbe corrected kynge taryed mount pellyer ſpace xii dayes order towne paſtyme ladyes damoſelles ſuche foūde pleaſed hym greatly ſaye trouthe kynge tyme luſty youthe lyght quycke ſpyrite daunſed caroled amonge fryſco ladyes damoſelles ye towne ſomtyme nyght gaue made bankettes ſuppers largely wolde gyue ladyes damoſels rynges golde chaynes reputed worthy kynge dyde ſo moche great laude prayſe ſome wolde taryed lengar dyd kepte reuell daunſyng ſolas euery day newe begyn ¶ ye haue herde oftentymes ſaid howe ſporte lady damoſels encorageth hertes yonge luſty gentylmen cauſeth deſyre ſeke gette honour ſay bycauſe kyng thre gentylmen highe enterprice great valure well ſhewed ye ſhall fyrſt yonge ſir boucequant ſir raynold roy thirde lorde ſaynt pye theſe thre knyghtes chamberleyns kyng well beloued well worthy freſſhe ſerued hym well armes mater theſe thre beyng mountpellier among ladyes damoſels toke armes next ſomer enformed ye prīcipall cauſe enclyned thē therto ſhall ſhewe ye knowe well hath ben reherſed hyſtorie howe ye dayes kyng charles englyſſhe knyght called ſir peter courtney valyaunt knight armes cāe englande fraūce paris demaūded armes ſir guy tremoyle preſence kyng ſuche wolde ſe ſir guy wolde nat refuce offre preſence kyng lordes armed daye ran toguyder one courſe kyng wolde nat ſuffre ryn agayne toguyder wherwith thēglyſſ knyght right yuell content ſhewed wolde haue furnyſſhed chalenge vttraunce apeaſed fayre wordꝭ ſayde hym done ynough ought content therwith kynge duke burgoyne gaue hym fayre gyftes preſentes retourned agayne towardes calays lorde clary friſcay luſty knyght charged conuey hym rode ſo longe toguyder came lucynen counteſſe ſaynt poule laye ſuſter kynge richarde englande lady ioyfull cōmynge thyder ſir peter courtney ſhe hadde maryed fyrſte coſyn lorde courtney dyed yonge ſhe maryed erle ſaynt poule engliſſhe men called madame courtney nat counteſſe ſaynt poule ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe ſir peter courteney came fraunce armes ſir guye tremoyle howe lorde clary cōueyed hym occaſyon dyde armes hym marcheſſe calais cap clxi thus ſir peter courtney lorde clary lucenen arthoys coūteſſe ſaynt paule right ioyouſe commynge deuyſed many thynges counteſſe demaunded ſir peter courtney thought ſtate fraunce aunſwered ſayd certaynly madame ſtates fraū ce well goodly ſerued nat ſo ſerued countrey sir quod lady lordes fraunce maner contente haue nat made good chere surely madame quod contenteth paſſynglye well caſe paſſed see haue eaſely acquyted therin madame wyll ye knowe lorde clary preſent hadde come englande deſyred haue done armes man ſhulde nat haue departed hadde ben anſwered pleaſure ſerued contrary trewe ſir guye dela tremoyle armed felde eche agaynſt ranne toguyder one courſe ſhewed fro kynge ſhulde ſayenge howe hadde done ynough wherfore madame ſaye wyll ſay ſoeuer become coulde fynde none armes nat defaute knyghtes fraunce lorde clary noted well wordes helde peaſe great payne howe ſuffred hym bycauſe charge cō ueyaunce hym counteſſe ſayde sir ye departed right honorably fro fraū ce whan ye obeyed kynges deſyre ye coude ſythe pleaſure ye ſhulde nat cōmyng returnyng doyng ye haue done none laye faute ſuche ſhall ſyde ſee ſhall repute honour blame wherfore ſir requyre contente therwith madame quod knight ſo ſhall ſhall neuer take thought thus lefte mater fell talkynge taryed daye night nexte mornynge ſir petr court nay toke leaue counteſſe ſaynt poule ſhe gaue hym departynge lytell chayne golde lorde clary another thus mornynge departed fro lucenen toke waye bouloygne came thyder laye nyght nexte daye rode towardes margyſon go calais bitwene boloygne calays ſeuyn eight leages fayre playne waye whan came nere calais ſir peter courtney ſayd lorde clary sir nowe kyng englandes lande ye haue well acquyted conueyaunce company thanke lorde clary diſpleaſure hert wordes ſir peter ſpoken lucenen preſens counteſſe ſaynt pole whiche wordes thought wolde nat ſuffre reſte caſe reputed haute hyghe agaynſt honoure chiualry fraunce vnderſtode hym ſaid howe come oute englande fraunce armes none wolde aunſwere hym lorde clary leaue takynge ſayde sir peter ye nowe kynge englandes lande ſir haue conueyed hyder commaundement kynge maiſter duke burgoyne ye remembre well laſte daye whan ye counteſſe ſaynt poules chambre made v good chere ye ſpake ouer largely thynketh great preiudyce blame knyghtes fraunce ye ſayde howe ye came fro kynges courte coude fynde none armes ye whiche wordes maye vnderſtande knyght fraunce dare armes iuſt thre courſes ſpeare wherfore ſir wyll ye knowe offre ſelfe thoughe one ye mooſt ſympleſt knyghtes fraunce ſaye iuſtifye realme fraunce nat ſo voyde knyghtes ye ſhall well fynde yuowe dedes armes ſir ye lyſte ye ſhall fynde redy aunſwere incontynente nyght morowe ſaye nat hatered haue perſone onely maynteyne honour ꝑtie wolde nat ye ſhulde retourne calais englande make youre auaunt without ſtroke ſtryken ye ſhulde diſconfyte knyghtes fraunce sir anſwere pleaſe wordes sir peter courtney ſoone coūſayled anſwere make ſayde sir clary ye ſpeke well accepte demaunde wyll morowe ſame place ye armed pleaſure ſhall lyke wiſe lette v rynne eche thre courſes ſpeare therby ye ſhall wynne agayne honour frenche courte ye ſhall greate pleaſure sir quod lorde clary ꝓmyſe ſhall nat fayle hour ye haue aſſigned thus theſe two knightes promyſed eche iuſt lorde clary retourned marguyſen prouyded hym armure ſhelde ſpeare horſe hadde anone lacked fronters calays boloyne men ſoone prouyded made prouiſyon ſhortely myght wolde natte ouer many ſhulde haue knowen therof lyke manner ſir peter courtney whan̄e came calays forgate nat promyſe made prouyded hym good armure euerye thyng elles harneſſe redy ſuche caryed hym englande fraunce tyme ſir iohan berne capitayne calays sir peter ſhewed hym promiſe yt made bytwene hym lorde clary ſir iohan berne ſayde howe wolde accompany hym thyder good felowes calays nexte daye theſe two knightes came place apoynted englyſſhe knyght came moche better accompanyed dyde frenche knyght capitayne calays hym whan come togyder fewe wordes bytwene theym knewe well ynough wherfore come bothe well armed horſed toke ſheldes toke ſpeares ſharpe heedes well fyled ſpurred horſes ranne toguyder fyrſt courſe fayled wherwith bothe ſore diſpleaſed ſeconde iuſte mette ſo toguyder lorde clary ſtrake englyſſhe knyght throughe • arge throughe ſhulder handfull therwith felle fro horſe erthe lorde clary paſſed forthe kepte courſe turned ſtode ſtyll ſawe well howe englyſſhe knight vnhorſed howe many men hym thought ſurely hurt ſpeare brokenne peces rode englyſſhe men came lorde clary ſayd sir ye courteſſe iuſter wherfore quod lorde clary bycauſe ꝙ ye haue hurt knightes ſhulder ye might curteſly haue iuſted ſirs ꝙ curteſy laye nat ſeyng apparelled iuſte ſame caſe worſe myght haue fallen aſwell hym howe ſir requyre demaunde hym elles wyll whyder wyll • atte ſir iohan berne ſayde nay naye ſir knyght ye may departe whan ye lyſte ye haue done ynough lorde clary departed company englyſſhe men ledde ſir peter courtney calays healed hurtes lorde clary retourned fraunce thynkynge hadde right well done ſhulde haue dede great laude prayſe ſhall ſhewe fell therof whan tidynges came frenche kyng duke burgoyne counſayle howe lorde clarye done armes ſir peter courtney retournynge calais ſo ſayde ſir peter hurte paryll dethe kynge duke ſpecially ſir guye tremoyle ſore dyſpleaſed lorde clary ſayde howe done leeſt moche leſe landes bannyſſhed realme fraunce euer without repele ſōe ſuche wolde hym good wyll ſayde howe hadde done lyke falſe traytoure ſeynge ſtraunge knyght vnder kynges ſaue garde ſhulde requyred hym dedes armes yt meanes brought ieopardye dethe ſayde ſuche dede ought nat pardoned lorde clary ſente came kynge duke burgoyne examyned layde charge demaūded howe durſte ſo outragious knyght ſtraunger come kynges court good loue exalte honoure feates armes deꝑted then good loue ioye entente ſhulde nat troubled way retournyng delyuered hym conduyt deꝑtynge bothe realmes ſo bolde armes hym cāpe iuſtes mortall without lycence ſoueraygne lorde holdeth lande ſhewed hym treſpaſſe ſo great nat pardoned punyſſhed ſo highely ſhulde take enſample therby lorde clary whan herde thoſe wordes abaſſhed thought hadde done well haue thanke ſayde lordes trouthe ſir peter courtney delyuered conducte kepe hym company tyll came calais frōters therof hadde charge haue well truely acquyted ſelfe nede ſhall proue wytneſſe hym ſelfe trewe ye waye whan came lucyen counteſſe ſaynt poule receyued made v good chere ſir peter courtney hadde certayne wordes ſhall ſhewe counteſſe demaūded hym ſayde ſir peter courtney howe ye contente lordes fraunce maner fraūce anſwered courteſly ſayd madame maner fraunce ryght noble goodlye lordes fraunce right well content chere excepte one thyng great payne traueyle great coſte haue iſſued oute englāde dedes armes ſo came frēche kynges court knew nat armes thus lordes whan herde hym ſaye ſo preſēce ſo noble lady counteſſe ſaynte poule ſuſter kynge englande wordes right heuy beare ſuffred tyme bycauſe charge conueyaunce hym neuer made ſemblaunt therof hym longe company togider within realme fraunce leaue takynge marcheſſe calais trewe layde vnto hym ſayde wordes ſayd howe nat courteſly ſpoken honorably wordes ſounded chiualry fraunce ſo abated none durſt dedes armes ſayd wolde abyde therby one knightes fraunce borne nacyon ſayd wolde nat ſhulde make auaunte englande coude nat fynde fraūce waye whome armes therfore ſayde redy deſyred armes hym fulfylle pleaſure deſyre rynne thre courſes ſpeare ſame daye nexte certaynly lordes ſayde theſe wordes honour realme fraunce chyualry therof thonght great ioye therof accepted armes nexte day ſo dyde nexte day mette ſame place cō panyed garyſon calais certayne fronters knyghtes ſquyers ye lorde mount carell ſir iohan longuyllers iuſted toguyder well coude aduenture armes fell ſo yt ſeconde courſe ſtrake ſhulder ſo fell erthe retourned againe knowe wolde capitayne cali ſaid ſufiycient done myght departe whan lyſt retourned beleued ryght well done well defended honour realme france knightes therin thus haue ſhewed trouthe dede well doyng amēdes ſhall folowe reporte wyll abyde iugement lorde conſtable lordes highe marſhalles fraūce beſyde voice diſcrecion knyght hymſelfe ſir peter curtney whoſe requeſt dyde theſe armes alſo reporte knyghtes ſquyers honour bothe fraunce englande credably enfourmed hole mater whan lorde clary ſhewed mater ſagely made excuſaciōs ye haue herde greatlye aſwaged theyre diſpleaſure th •• complayned hym howe wordes excuſacions coude nat delyuered cōmytted priſone taryed long ſeaſon great daunger leſyng landes banyſſhed euer lorde coucy • duke burbon labored ſore delyueraūce moche payne made peace ayde counteſſe ſaynt puole wordes ſpoken deliueraūce ſaid hym sir clary ye ſuppoſed haue done ryght well howe ye dyde ſhamefully whanne ye offred armes ſir peter courtney vnder kyngꝭ ſaue garde deliuered conducte calays kynges cōmaundement ye dyde great outrage whan ye renewed wordes whiche ſpoken ſport coūteſſe ſaynt poule ye done ye ought haue returned ye kyng haue ſhewed hym ye wordes ſhulde haue ſowned agaynſt honour ye knyghtes fraūce coūſayle king gyuen ye ought haue folowed bycauſe ye dyde nat thus ye haue hadde payne beware better another tyme thāke lorde burbone lorde coucy delyueraunce haue ſore labored alſo ye lady ſayut poule quod lorde clary lordes thāke howe thought hadde done well thus departed ⸪ ⸫ ¶howe iuſtes ſaynt inguelyert otherwiſe called sādyngfelde enterpriſed ſir reynolde roy yonge ſir boucyquant lorde ſaynt pye cap clxii frenche kyng lay good towne moūtpellyer gret myrthe ſport banket kynge made lady damoſelles towne reherſed ſayd mater lorde clary ſir peter courtney true began ſpeke thre valyaunt knightes yonge ſir bauciquaunt ſir reynolde roy lorde ſaynt pye whiche thre enterpriſed dedes armes fronter beſyde calais tyme somer nexte abyding knightes ſquiers ſtraungers terme xxx dayes ſoeuer wolde iuſte thē iuſtes peace warre bicauſe thenterprice theſe thre knyghtes ſemed frēche kyng coūſayle high enterprice ſaid ſhulde putte writyng bycauſe kyng wolde ſe thartycles therof hygh outragyous kyng might amende bycauſe king counſayle wolde nat ſuſteyne thynge ſhulde vnreſonable theſe thre knyghtes anſwered ſaid reaſone thus ſhall done toke clerke cauſed write foloweth great deſyre haue come knowledge noble gentleman knightes ſquiers ſtraungers well realme fraunce el whereof farre countreys ſhall ſaynt ingylbertes march calays twenty day moneth may nexte commyng contynewe thyrty dayes complete frydayes onely excepte delyuer maner knyghtes ſquyers gentleman ſtraungers maner nacyon whatſoeuer wyll come thyder breakynge fyue ſpeares outher ſharpe rokettes pleaſure without lodgynges ſhall ſheldes armes ſheldes peace warre ſo euer wyll iuſt lette hym come ſende day rod touche whiche ſhelde pleaſe touche ye ſhelde warre nexte daye ſhall iuſt whiche thre wyll touche ſheld peace ſhall haue iuſtes peace warre ſoeuer touche ſheldes ſhew cauſe ſhewed name ſuche ſhalbe lymyted v receyue name ſuche knightes ſtraungers wyll iuſte bringe ſome noble man partye ſhall inſtructed v ought done caſe requyre knyghtes ſquyers ſtraūgers wyll come iuſte thynke ymagyn v pride hatred yuell wyll onely haue honorable company acquayntaunce whiche entier harte deſyre none ſheldes ſhall couered yron ſteell none wyll come iuſt v without maner fraudes aduauntage male engyn euery thynge ordered ſhall cōmytted eyther parte gouerne iuſtes bycauſe gentleman noble knyghtes ſquiers ſhall come knowlege ſhulde reputed ferme ſtable haue ſealed preſent writynge ſeales armes written mountpellier twenty daye nouembre yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore nyne ſigned thus raynolde du roy boucyquant ſaynte pye high courage enterpriſe theſe thre knyghtes french kynge ryght ioyefull therof mater went forwarde euery thynge well examyned ſene faulte ſhulde therin founde kinges counſayle thought nat reaſonable theſe armes ſhulde doone ſo nere calays englyſſhe men might take preſumpcyon whiche wolde eſchewed bycauſe treuce yt taken bytwene englande fraūce endure thre yere wherfore ſayde ought nothynge wrytten doone ſhulde occaſyon dyſcenſyon bytwene realmes kynges coūſayle reſted mater hole day wyſte nat wolde faynt haue broken suche ſage ſayde nat good alwayes conſente purpoſe yonge people often tymes therby maye growe incydentes rather yuell thanne good howe kynge yonge inclyned greatly theſe knyghtes ſayd lette enterpriſe yonge coragyous haue promyſed ſworne ladyes mountpellyer wyll mater go forwarde let purſe enterpriſe whanne euery man ſawe kynges pleaſure none durſte ſay agaynſt wherfore knyghtes ryght ioyfull ſo concluded agreed matter ſhulde go forwarde knightes written ſealed kynge ſent thre knyghtes chambre aparte ſaid syrs doynge regarde wyſely honour v realme mayntayne aſtate ſpare nothynge ſhall nat fayle expence ten thouſande frankes thre knyghtes kneled downe kynge thanked grace thus frenche kynge toke ſporte good towne mountpellyer fyftene dayes moſte parte ladyes damoſels kynge counſayle parfytely regarded buſyneſſe neceſſyties towne princypally come thyder ſame cauſe aduyſe counſayle euery thynge well refourmed brouggt good aſtate oppreſſyons one awaye wherby good people ſore traueyled kynge toke leaue ladyes damoſelles mornynge departed wente dyner al • pyam nyght lay vbere nexte day beſyers goodly receyued good men towne greatly deſyred ſe hym ſo dyd countreys bothe peſenas cabeſtan narbone redy make complayntes kynge duke berreys offycer called betiſache pylled countreys betyſach fro tyme kynge came fro auignon rode alwayes company man ſhewed hym thought myght haue gyuen hym warnynge lyſte draue hym forthe fayre wordes ſuthe promyſed hym nothynge honoure thought contrary kynge entred beſyers bytwene thre foure noone met proceſſyon without ye towne clergy burgeſſes ladyes damoſelles kynge came rydynge bothe ſydes waye dyd reuerence came cathedrall churche alyghted dore auter made rychely garnyſſhed iewelles relykes kynge kneled downe dyd prayer entred churche byſſhoppe beſyers vncle duke burbone lordes folowed thanne kynge wente lodgynge palyce whiche nat farre thence brother duke thourayne duke burbone lordes lodged abrode towne well eaſely lodged beſyers good cytie ⸪ ¶of complayntes made kyng people languedoc towne beſyers agaynſt betyſach treaſourer duke berrey great extorſyons made confeſſion made cruell dethe ſayde towne cap clxiii thre dayes kynge beſyets greate ioye reuell amonge ladyes damoſels tyme betyſache nothynge ſpoken vnto enquiſirours • ordeyned kynge dyd ſecretly enquyre dedes founde enqueſt dyuers caſes horryble nat pardoned fourth day kynge ben betyſache called kynges counſayle chambre ſtraytely examyned ſayd hym betyſache aunſwer wyſely theſe writynges ye ſe ſhewed hym greate nombre bylles complayntes put vp kynge agaynſt hym makyng menſyon errorcyons done people theſe bylles complayntes redde hym one another ſome aunſwered wyſely makynge excuſe ſome playnly denyed ſayde knowe nothynge thoſe mater laye ſeneſchalles beaucayr carcaſſone chauncellour berry partayneth theym aunſwere thoſe matter howe fynally ſhewed muſte kepe pryſone tyme tyll mater better examyned obeyed bycauſe myght nat chuſe ſone priſon inquyſitours wente lodgynge toke handes ſuche writyngꝭ acomptes founde whiche partayned ſuch mater intermedled auewed leyſure founde theym rekenynges great ſōmes money ſuche ben rayſed leuyed people demaunded money become whether ſommes trewe nat aunſwered ſayde ſōmes trewe money delyuered duke berrey ſo paſte throughe handes treaſourers whereof haue good quyttaunces lodgynge ſuche place whiche quitaūces ſente counſayle redde agreed ſōmes receyte counſayle enquyſytours apeaſed betyſache ſente agayne curteſſe pryſone counſayle cōmuned togyther matter ſayd ſemeth betyſache clere ſuche cauſes layde charge money hathe reyſed duke berrey hathe howe ſo euer hath ben ſpente thinges conſydred betyſache excuſacyons lawfull duke berrey moſte couetouſe man worlde ſo myght gette good cared nat howe hadde whan wolde beſtowe ſymply many lordes haue doone tymes paſte thus kynges counſayle ſawe faute betyſache wherby ſhulde leſe lyfe ſome opynyon ſome contrary ſaid betyſach hath done ſo many cruell dedes hathe ſo ſore inpoueryſſhed people acomplyſſhe deſyre lorde duke berrey blode poore people cryeth ſayeth howe hathe deſerued dethe manne borne theſe partyes counſayler maiſter ſeynge pouerty people ought good maner haue ſhewed trouth duke mayſter duke wolde nat haue herde hym ſhulde haue come kynge counſayle haue ſhewed theym pouertie people howe duke berrey daulte ben well excuſed betyſache ſente agayne counſayle ſtraytely examyned money hadde gathered become founde ſōme thyrty hundred thouſande frankes receyued anſwered therto ſayd lordes herde tell lorde duke berrey hathe beſtowed moche hath layde byldynges reparacyons caſtels houſes alſo hath bought certayne landes countye boloygne countye eſtampes alſo hathe ſpente moche byenge precyous ſtones iewelles whiche ye knowe well hathe alwayes deſyrous bye alſo well ſtuffed mayntayne aſtate hathe alwayes kepte alſo hath gyuen ſuche gyftes rewardes thybaulte morynot ſeruaūtes aboute ſuche wyſe ryche men well betyſache quod counſayle ye haue parte ſynguler profyte hundred thouſande frankes lordes quod haue hadde conſente lorde duke berrey wolde ſeruauntes ſhulde become ryche counſayle ſayde one voyce betyſach worde folyſſhly ſpoken rycheſſe nat good reſonable yuell gotten ye ſhall retourne agayne priſon ſhall take aduyſe ye haue ſayd ſpoken ye muſt abyde pleaſure kynge whome ſhall ſhewe excuſacions lordes quod ſhall god wyll agayne ſette priſone remayned four dayes ſente agayne whan theſe tydynges ſpredde abrode countrey betyſach priſon inquyre made dedes publyſſhed ſo euer matter hym ſhulde come forthe therby moche people came beſyers put vp ſupplycacions kynge cruell dedes betyſach complayned hym hadde dyſheryted without cauſe reaſon complayned hym hadde force taken wyues doughters whan kynges counſayle ſawe ſo many gret cauſes laide betyſache wery therof beſyde theſe complayntes ſore behated people came hym reaſon fyll duke berreys purſe dyd euer wolde haue hym kynges counſayle wyſte nat come thyder two knightes fro duke berrey lorde nantonelet ſyr peter meſpyn brought letter kynge fro duke duke behalfe auowed euer betyſach doone duke requyred kynge counſayle haue agayne man treaſourer kynge greate hatred betyſach bycauſe yuell name fame ranne vpon hym kynge duke thourayne brother inclyned greatly haue hym hanged ſayenge howe hadde well deſerued kynges counſayle durſte nat iudge hym dought duke berrey ſayde kynge ſyr duke berrey auowe dedes ſo euer canne nat ſe waye reaſon hath deſerued dethe ſeaſone medled theſe countreys ceſſynge tayles ſubſydyes aydes receyuynge dyd inſtaūce duke berrey tyme puyſſaunce royall well ye haue nowe ſyr acordynge deſertes dedes ye maye ſeaſe handes mouables herytages leaue hym ſame caſe duke berrey founde hym fyrſte goodes make reſtytucion ſuche poore men vn done hym ſhulde make longe proceſſe betyſache poynte delyueraunce loſſe goodes tyll laſte tydynges came place ſhall ſhewe knewe nat coulde nat knowe knowledgyng ſelfe dede ſo yuell iudged himſelfe ſayd herytyke done many horryble dedes ſhewed came ſome hym nyght beynge priſone put hym feare whether frendes fooes knowe nat ſayde betyſach thou art harde caſe french kyng brother duke burbone dothe hate mortally ſo many complayntes put vp agaynſte fro dyuers place ſuche oppreſſyons ye haue doone whan ye rule languedoc ſo iudge hanged ye canne nat ſcape loſſe goodes whiche hath offred kynge kynge hateth mortally hath aunſwered howe goodes body alſo whiche ſayeth wyll nat kepe longe ſhew good wyll morowe thought ye ſhall delyuered iudged dye thoſe wordes greatly afrayed betyſach ſayd ah ſaynt mary remedy yes quod morowe ſay ye wolde ſpeke kinges counſayle outher wyll come ſende whan ye preſence ſay thus lordes knowledge ſelfe haue greatly diſpleaſed god diſpleaſure hath falſe ſlaunder reyſed wyll demaunde wherin ye ſhall aunſwere howe ye haue longe ſeaſon arred faythe ye herytyke kepe ſtyll opinyon whan byſſhop beſyers ſhall wyll chalenge haue kepynge ye ſhall delyuered hym ſuche cauſes ought declared lawe churche thanne ye ſhall ſente auignon wyll none againſt duke berrey pope wyll nat diſpleaſe hym meanes ye may delyuered nother leſe body goodes ye byde ſtyll caſe ye ye ſhall nat ſkape paſte morowe ye ſhall hanged kynge hateth bycauſe ſlaunder people betyſache truſted falſe infourmacyon parell dethe knoweth nat well wherfore aunſwered ſayd ye frende coūſayle truely wher god thanke truſt tyme ſhall come ſhall thanke next mornynge called gayler ſayde frende requyre cauſe ſuche menne ſuche come ſpeke named ſuche enquyſitours ouer gayler ſhewed theym howe betyſache wolde ſpeke came hym demaunded wolde aunſwered ſayd sir haue ſerched cōſcience knowledge ſelfe haue hyghly diſpleaſed god longe tyme haue arred agaynſt ye fayth neuer beleued trinyte ſonne god wolde come ſo lowe come fro heuen come worlde take humayn kynde woman beleue ſaye whan dye nothynge ſowle ah ſainte mary quod betyſach ye greatly againſt holy churche wordes demaundeth fyre aduyſe better canne nat tell quod betyſache whether wordes demaūdeth fyre water haue holden opinyon ſythe haue knowledge ſhall holde tyll dye enquyſitours wolde hym tyme gladde fynde ſuche mater againſt hym therby put deth cōmaunded gailer kepe ſtraytely ſuffre man ſpeke hym entente ſhulde nat tourned fro opynyon thanne wente kynges counſayle ſhewed mater wente kynge ſhewed hym maner betyſache ye haue herde wherof kynge great marueyle ſayd wyll put dethe yuell man falſe herytyke thefe wyll brynte hanged ſhall haue hath deſerued ſhall nat e • cuſed myne vncle berrey anon theſe tydynges ſpredde abrode cytie beſyers howe betyſache hadde owne voluntary wyll without conſtraynt confeſſed howe herytyke vſed longe ſynne bowgery howe kynge ſayde howe ſhulde brynte hanged wherof moche people right ioyouſe ſore hated two knyghtes come thyder fro duke berrey greatly abaſſhed wyſt nat ſuppoſe ſyr peter meſquyn ſayde lorde nantonelet syr feare betyſache betrayed peraduenture ſome perſone hath ben hym ſecretly priſone hathe borne hym hande holde horryble erroure churche ſhall chalenge hym ſo ſente auignon pope therby delyuered ah fole dyſceyued kyng ſayeth wyll haue hym bothe brente hanged lette v go priſone hym reforme hym bringe hym nother ſtate farre waye yuell counſayled wente ſtrayte priſone deſyred gayler might ſpeke betyſache gayler excuſed hymſelfe ſayde syrs ye muſte pardone ſtraytely charged ſuffer manne ſpeke hym alſo four ſargeauntes armes ſente kynge kepe hym dare nat breke kinges cōmaundement two knyghtes ſawe well howe labored vayne howe remedy lykelyhode betyſache ſhulde dye retourned lodgynge rekened payed toke horſes returned lorde duke berrey ſhewed hym caſe cōcluſion betyſach ſuche nexte daye 〈◊〉 tenne clocke taken pryſone brought byſſhoppes palays redy iudges offycers ſpyrituall bayly beſyers brought forthe priſoner ſayde beholde ſyrs betiſache whome delyuer herytyke ſynnet bo • gery nat ben clerke iudged acordynge deſertes offycyall demaūded betyſach hym acordynge acuſed confeſſe frouth openly people betyſache thought haue ſaid well haue ſcaped reaſon confeſſyon aunſwered ſayde trewe demaunded thre tymes euery tyme confeſſed trewe people thus ye maye knowe whether dyſceyued nat • made ſuche confeſſyon delyuered duke berrey fully auowed dedes whiche doone commaundemente countrey langue doc ſuppoſed fortune played tourne hym whanne thought haue moſte aſſuredeſt heyght fortune whele tourned vp ſo downe fro whele ſhe hathe doone hundred thouſande mo ſythe worlde began betyſach delyuered agayne ſpirytuall iudge bayly beſyers vnder kinge ruled temperalte whiche betyſache without delaye brought place palays ſo haſted forwarde leyſure aunſwere ſaye nay whan ſawe fyre redy prepared ye place ſawe handes hangman ſore abaſſhed ſawe well dyſceyued betrayed cryed loude requirynge herde hede taken ſayenge hangeman ſayde ordeyned ye ſhall dye yuell warkes hathe brought yuell ende haſted forwarde dethe fyre made redy alſo reyſed payre galowes therto tyed chayne yron ende therof coler yron whiche put aboute necke chaine drawen vp hye tyed rounde aboute galowes cryed ſayde duke berrey cauſe dye without reaſon wronge ſone tyed galows ſetre rounde aboute drye ſegge rede • ago •• e fyre put therto incontynente faggortes fyre thus betyſache hanged brente frenche kyng chaumbre myght well ſe hym wolde poore ende came betyſache ſo people reuenged hym ſaye trouthe doone many extorcions domages people whyle gouernynge countrey languedoc ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe frenche kynge beynge tholouſe ſente erle foiz came thyder dyd homage kynge conntie foiz cap clxiiii cruell iuſtyce french kyng taryed nat longe beſiers departed toke way carcaſſone always ſythe departure fro auygnon marſhall ſyr loys xancere rode company kynge rode ſo longe iourneys vyſited countreys kepte nat right hyghe wayes cabeſtan narbone lymons mounte royall fongaur retourned carcaſſone taryed foure dayes rode paſſed vyle franca auygnollet mongiſtarte ſo came tholouſe burgeſſes greatly deſyred ſe kynge receyued hym ioyfully mette kyng without towne lyuery ſo greate ſolempnyte brought caſtell thoulouſe cytie gaue kinge many fayre preſentes wherwith kynge greatly reioyſed whan kynge thre dayes counſayled ſende erle foiz come byerne countie foiz towne naſiers four leages fro thoulouſe knew kinges ſtate ordynaūce marſhall fraūce lorde de la ryuer apoynted go erle foize departed wednyſday laye cytie tholouſyn called iordayn next day came naſyers erle foiz knewe well comynge receyued theym nobly loue kynge alſo knewe lordes well ſene syr loys xancere wordes ſaid syr lorde foiz kynge ſoueraygne lorde hath ſente v cōmaundyng come ſe hym thoulouſe el wyll traueyle ſo farre wyll come ſe owne countrey greatly deſyreth ſe erle foyze aunſwered ſayd syr loys wolde nat kynge ſo great traueyle mete haue hym wherfore pleaſe ye ſhall ſhewe hym ſhall tholouſe within foure dayes well ſayde ſyr quod ſhall returne ſhewe theſe tydynges fro ꝙ howe ye ſhall abyde daye refreſſhe ſelfes morowe ye ſhall departe obeyed taryed daye nyght pleaſure erle deuyſed theym ſagely craftely man reaſon fayre langage drawe one meanes ſecretes ons herte nexte daye toke leaue eche rode ſo long ſame day came tholouſe founde kinge playenge cheſſe vncle duke burbone kynge demaunded alowde ſayde syrs howe ſaye wyll erle come yes ſir quod lorde de la ryuer hath gret affection ſe grace wyll within theſe foure dayes well quod kynge wyll gladly ſe hym two knightes departed fro kynge lefte hym playeng went ſupper reſte rydden daye great iourney erle foiz naſyers remembred well voyage made hym redy ſente tholous ꝓuiſyon acordingly ſent bierne knightes ſquiers mo two hundred ſerue accompany hym voiage daye erle foiz apoynted entred cytie tholous mo ſyxe hundred horſes well acompanyed knyghtes ſquyers hym bōnuquell ſir iohā brother ſir roger spaygne coſyn lorde couraſe ye lorde valētyne lorde quare lorde burnge ſir eſpaygne du lyon lorde roquepayre lorde lane lorde beſache lorde perle ſir peter cabeſtayne ſir monaunt nonnalles ſir richarde de la meete ſir arnolde ſaynt baſyll dyuers sir peter byerne ſir arnolde two bretherne two baſtarde ſonnes ſir iobbayne ſir gracyen foiz entencion erle enherite thoſe two ſonnes mooſt parte lande bierne whiche lande myght therwith pleaſure helde frāke free holdynge man godde thus erle toke lodgynge freers preacher kept houſe men lay nere myght burgeſſes tholous made great chere loued well alwayes good neyghbour curteſſe tretable neuer ſuffred cō pany diſpleaſure vyolēce wherfore loued hym moche better gaue many fayre p̄ſentes wyne thynges ſo well contente entred tholous whan nere nyght nexte daye ten clocke toke horſe ſuche company pleaſed hym mo two hundred knyghtes ſquyers men honour eſtate rode long ſtretes caſtell kynge lyghted fyrſt court entryng caſtell erle moūted vp greces great hall frēche kyng come chambre hall taryed erle great deſyre ſe hym great valure renome ran hym therle foiz goodly prince formall ſtature beare heeded entred hall whan ſawe kynge lordes fraū ce kynges brother vncle made reuerence kyng none kneled downe one knee roſe paſſed forthe thirde tyme kneled nere kynge kyng toke hym hande enbraſed toke hym vp ſayde erle foiz fayre coſyn ye right welcome cōmyng greatlye reioyceth v sir quod erle thāke grace pleaſe ſay ſo kynge erle talked toguyder whiche wordes herde nat than̄e kynge went dyner kynges table vpper ende ſate archbiſſhop tholous kynge vncle duke burbone nexte erle foiz ſir iohn̄ burbone erle marche vandone table ſate mo ſeconde table ſatte ſir iohan de la brethe erle harcourte ſir philyppe bare foure knightes erle foiz another table ſate marſhall ſir loyes ſanxere ſir roger spayne eyght knightes erles great dyner well ſtuffed thynges dyner grace ſayd toke paſtymes great chābre heryng inſtrumentes wherin erle foiz greatly delyted than̄e wyne ſpyces brought erle harecourt ſerued kynge ſpyce plate ſir gerrarde de la pyerſerued duke burbone ſir monnaunt nonnalles ſerued erle foiz thus four clocke erle tooke leaue kyng lordes iſſued hall courte hourſes redy men erle moū ted ſuche accompanyed hym ſo retourned lodgynge well contente chere hadde ben made hym prayſed moche knightes tthus bytwene frenche kynge erle gaſcoyne foize beynge tholous dyuers treaty apoyntmentes loue marſhall fraunce lorde de la ryuer dyde payne helpe forwarde erle foiz made dyner duke thou rayne duke burbone therle de la marche great lordes fraunce dyner great ſumptuous ſyttyng table mo ii hundred knightes dyner fullye ended frenche kyng dyned caſtell hym ſir charles de la brethe ſir philyppe bare two coſyn germayns kyng ſayde go thyder ſo dyde xii company erle foiz greatlye reioyſed pleaſed kyng cōe lodgyng ſo company ſporte dyner wreſtlyng caſtynge barre ſtone darte bytwene frenche men gaſcoyns thus
