paſſed tyme tyll nerehande nyght kynge lordes retourned erle foiz gaue ſame daye kynges knightes ſquyers ye duke thourayne duke burbone mo thā threſcore courſers palfrayes mulettes whyte ſadels redy dreſt apoynt alſo gaue kynges mynſtrelles two hundred crownes golde heraudes offycers armes two hundred crownes ſo euery man prayſed large erle foiz fourthe daye erle came kynges palais well acompanyed lordes knyghtes byerne foiz ſe kynge requyred ſaye homage countie foiz appendauntes reſeruyng lande bierne ſecretely great treaty bytwene kynge erle foiz meanes lorde de la ryuer ſir iohan mercier byſſhoppe noyon newly come thyder fro auygnon ſayd erle deſyred ye kyng ſonne iobbayne foiz myght erles diſceaſe enheryte countie foiz erle whan ſoeuer dyed ſhulde leaue kyng hūdred thouſande frankes money ſir gaſyon brother haue land ayre bierne cytie mounte marcen landes erle foiz hadde bought bierne ſhulde retourne herytaūce vycount caſtyllon theſe aſſygnementes debate dyfference bytwene erle barones knightes countrey ſayde coude nat thus generall conſent byerne foize bycauſe meane homage countie foize dewe frenche kyng therfore kyng ſayde erle baron foiz sir holde handes homage lande foiz ſo dayes lande foiz vacant dethe coſyn erle foiz ſhall ſo determyne apoynt aduiſe good counſayle iobbayns foiz men coūtie foiz ſhall holde thē content thoſe wordes well cōtented therle foiz lordes knyghtes foiz preſent theſe ordynaunces written ſealed erle toke leaue kynge great lordes daye dyned kyng went lodgyng nexte day departed fro tholous lefte furrier behynde hym paye euery thyng erle paſſed ryuer gyronde ye bridge tholous retourned countrey mount marſen ſo ortayes gaue leaue euery man departe ſauyng ordynarye ſhewed beleue well cōmynge frenche kyng lāguedocke tholous thoſe marcheſſe coſt erle foize threſcore thouſande frankes erle ſo lyberall whatſoeuer coſt hym payde wyllyngly ⸫ ⸫ ¶of feate couenaunt bytwene kyng duke thourayn brother whiche ſhulde ſoneſt come parys fro mon̄tpellyer whiche hū dred fyftie leages ſondre eche one knyght cap clxv frenche kynge tholous ordred buſineſſe remoued renewed ſeneſchales officer reformed countrey good eſtate ſo euery mā well contented day kyng preſent brother vncle burbone lordes fraūce gaſcoyne thentent haue perpetuall memorie gaue coſyn germayne ſir charles de la brethe augmentacion honour two quarter armes fraūce floure delyces fore ye lordes de la brethe bare alwayes armes felde goules playne without thyng nowe quartred armes fraūce whiche thyng lorde de la brethe toke great gyfte whiche lorde made ſame daye great dyner whiche coſt hym thouſande frankes gaue heraudes mynſtrels ii hundred frankes anone ordayned kyng ſhulde departe fro thoulous retourne fraunce euery man made hym redy toke leaue kynge byſſhop tholous ſeneſchall burgeſſes lordes damoſelles towne kynge deꝑted rode nyght newe caſtell alroy ſo forwarde euery daye ſo came moūtpellyer ioyfully receyued taryed thre dayes ladyes damoſels pleaſed hym moche gret defyre returne paris ſe quene daye cōmuned ſporte brother thourayne ſayd fayre brother wolde paris eſtate ſtyll haue great deſyre ſe quene fayre ſuſter thourayne duke ſayde sir nat wyſſhing farre iourney hen true ꝙ kyng yet thynke might beſoone wolde ye ꝙ duke helpe good horſes ſo coude horſe muſt beare well quod kyng laye wager ſhall ſoneſt content ꝙ duke euer redy wyn money kyng wager layde bitwene ye kynge duke ſoeuer thē twayne came ſoneſt paris ſhulde wyn fyue thouſande frākes departe nexte day one hour eche take one knight ſeruaūt man durſt breke wager ye nexte day departed ordayned lorde garāciers rode kyng lorde viefuyll duke thourayn thus theſe four rode night day lyke yong luſty galātes chaūged many horſes thus rode poſt ye duke burbone retourned puy auuergne rode ſe graūtfather way therle dolphyn auergne counteſſe chyldren whō nōbre eight ſōnes doughters bretherne ſuſters ye duches burbone wife reaſon two maryages thus frenche kyng brother duke thourayne rode great haſt eche thē wyn wager cōſyder well great payne theſe two great riche lordes youthe lybertie corage made thē enterprice eſtates abode behynde frenche kynge made foure dayes halfe came paris duke thourayne four dayes quarter day folowed eche ſo nere ye duke wan wager reaſon yt frenche kynge reſted himſelf viii ye clocke trois chāpayne duke toke barge ye ryuer seyne went longe ryuer melyn toke horſe rode ſo tyll came paris ſo wente ſaynt poule quene wyfe demaunded tidingꝭ kyng wyſt nat wheder come nat whan knewe yt king nat come ioyfull ſaid quene madame ye ſhall ſhortly tidynges ye kyng ſayd trouthe kyng cāe ſoone whan duke thou rayn herde kyng come went met hym ſayd ſir haue wager let payd reaſon ꝙ kyng ſo ye ſhall ſhewed ye lady iorney yt four dayes halfe cōe fro mountpellier paris whiche cl leages ſondre ladyes tourned mater ſporte laughing well iuged endured moche payne iuged youthe corage herte cauſed thē duke thourayn truely payd wager ¶of dethe pope vrbayne rome called antepape howe pope clement wrote frenche kyng vncles vniuerſite election pope boniface cardinalles rome cap clxvi ſayd ſeaſon dyed rhome pope vrbane vi romayns ſore diſpleaſed dethe well beloued buryed churche ſaynt peter obſequy done well reuerētly cardynalles went conclaue chuſe newe pope ſo dyde pope clement knewe therof auynon ten dayes paſt knewe aſſone pope clement cardynalles knewe therof aſſembled togyder pope palays great cōmunycacion toguyder great hope buſyneſſe churche ſhulde leue concluded come full vnyon errour longe endured thought cardynals rome ſhulde nat agre ſo ſoone entre conclaue rather ſubmitte themſelfe pope clemēt auignon ſent alſo worde frē che kyng ye dethe vrban called antepape deſyred hym ſoner come purpoſe wolde write coſyns kynge almayne kynge hungy therle vertues duke auſtrych euer holden pope vrbane ſhulde nowe ceaſe helpe make reſt peace ye churche ſhewe letter faythe ought varyacion one god heuyn ſo ther ought one god erthe ſame ſeaſon ye duke burgoyne kyng parys whō pope clement cardynals wrote lyke maner kyng ſhewed vncle theſe newes right ioyfull ſaide fayre vncle haue gret deſyre go wt great puiſſaūce rome diſtroy thenfidels nowe iourney well ſhorted vrbane antepape deed clement hath written v thynketh cardynals wyll nat entre cōclaue chuſe newe pope rather come auignon ſubmyt thē ſelfes vnder pope clemēt deſyred hym cardynals auignon ſuretie write pleaſaūt letter coſins ye kyng almayne brother kyng hūgry ye erle vertues ye duke auſtriche coūſayle wyll ye gyue duke burgoyne ſayd sir trewe pope vrbane deed yet knowe nothynge ſtate cardynals rome romayns whether wyll kepe olde opinyon nat feare wyll harde leaue romayns mayſters ouer cardynalles byforce made chuſe archebyſſhoppe bare made hym pope ſo maynteyned hym thende ſo nowe ꝑforce cauſe cardynalles entre conclaue chuſe pope pleaſure wherfore ſir ye ſhall nat nede entre ſo farre mater deſyre wyll lytell haue ſhewed yet hydervnto suffre ſir tyll ye newes paraduenture maye ſo cardynalles rome ſhall nat one accorde paraduēture wyll diſſymule romayns chuſe none pope clement apeaſe furour promyſe cauſe clement come rome whiche wyll right gladlye condycion mater go ſo ſhall tyme write ye prince chriſtned opinyon cō trarye beſt maner ye canne voyde sciſme bring churche vnyon peace reaſon euery man ought yet ye nat ſure howe mater gothe beſt ye abyde aduē ture therof ſhall nat longe tidynges whan duke burgoyne hadde ſayde theſe wordes kyng coūſaile none ſpake contrarye therto kynge thought wordes reſonable ſayd fayre vncle beleue good reaſon ye ſaye yeſe clerer mater thā buſyneſſe churche wyll nothynge therin youre counſayle aduyſe thus ceſſed cōmunycacion great murmuracyon monge clerkes vniuerſite thoſe tydingꝭ wherby ceſſed rede ſtudye entended nothynge herken knowe howe cardynalles rome maynteyned ſelfe wheder wolde electe newe pope el retourne pope auignon dyde caſt many doughtes argued one another knewe well howe clement written kynge duke thourayne duke burgoyne kynges counſayle lykewiſe letter written generally vnyuerſite yt ſhulde conclude vnyuerſall peace churche thus clerkes deuyſed amonge themſelfe ſuche wolde aduauncement clement ſayde nowe tyme kyng lordes fraūce write great prince chriſtendome kynge almaygne kynge hungry lorde myllayne duke auſtryche ſuche opynion thentent yt ſhulde retourne ſame ſtate ſuche writyng maye moche aueyle thre dayes thre tymes notable clerkes vniuerſyte parys aſſembled togyder laſt came ſaynt poules ſpeke kyng coū ſayle deſyre hym ſet hande oppreſſe cyſme churche entende ordynaūce pope clement humbly written hym whan cāe ſaint poules nat anſwered kynge diſſymuled mater thē ſo yuell cōtent finally kyng contented thē ſayeng howe ſhortely ſhulde newes ſo dyd cardinal rome entred cōclaue made newe pope cardynall naples noble valyant clerke called bonyface whan frenche kyng coūſayle herde therof penſyue well ymagined howe ye cyſme lykely endure longe duke burgoyne ſayde kyng sir nowe regarde wheder writynges hadde nat ben loſte nowe fallen ſayd fayre vncle quod kyng ye ſaye trouthe than̄e grace opyned clerkes rome bonyface promyſes certifyed ſuche vnder obeyſaūce ſuche wolde receyue ſuche grace wente towardes rome whan approched marcheſſe danconne rode great paryll ſir bernarde de la salle kepte fronters made warre romains quarell pope clement toke ſuche clerkes paſte dyde moche trouble many ſlayne loſte ¶ nowe lette v leaue ſpekynge theſe pope tourne mater ⸫ ⸫ ¶of yelding vp takyng ſtronge caſtell vanchadore lymoſyn olde parteyning ſyr geffcay tete noyre cap c lxvii ye haue herde howe ſir geffray tete noyre ben longe capitayns caſtell vanchadore lymoſyn raigned valiauntly howe helde fortreſſe agaynſt men longe lyued lyfe dayes pa • eſed coūtrey xxx long hym alſo ye haue herde howe dyed incydence howe dethe bedde ordayned ii nephues alayne roux peter roux capitayns caſtell vāchadore dethe cauſed preſence companyons gariſon ſwere faythe trouthe homage ſeruyce trewe obeyſaunce ſayd two capitayns ye dethe geffraye tete noyre theſe two bretherne raigned certayne ſpace held alwayes coūtrey warre compoſycion pateſyng bycauſe caſtell parteyned herytage duke berrey bought erle moūt penſyer ſonne iohan berey bare name therby therfore duke ſore diſpleaſed handes coude nat amende yet layd ſiege therto dyuers tymes baſtides none otherwyſe within ſette lytell therby wolde iſſue ryde abrode ye countrey pleaſure alayne peter wolde wyſe obey peace truce taken bytwene englāde fraunce ſayde nat bounde obey wolde make warre pleaſure wherby countreis auuergne lymoſyn ſore traueyled duke berrey reſyſt cauſed ſir wyllyam butler gentyll knyght auuergne ſir iohan boeſme launce ſir loyes dā bier dyuers knightꝭ ſquyers auuergne lymoſyn laye ſiege baſtydes caſtell vanchadore laye coſt countrey laye louge ſeaſon fell ſame ſeaſon ſhewed alayn peter roux toke aduyce toguyder denyſed attrappe take crafte ſir wyllyam butler ſir iohan boeſme launce hadde done dyuers diſpleaſures theſe two bretherne ymagined bytwene thē ſayde one another howe wolde ſecretely ſay howe wolde yelde vp fortreſſe certayne ſōme floreyns ſay howe wery wyll kepe gariſon lengar retourne owne countreis whiche deuyſe ſayde ſurely duke berrey wyll gladly leane vnto alſo deuyſed demaunde tenne thouſande frākes bycauſe ſomme myght ſoone made alſo ſayde wolde haue agayne money two knyghtes alſo priſoners reaſon buſſhment wolde laye great towre beholde nowe foliſſhe ymaginacion theſe two breton betray theſe two knyghtes haue money iuell came therby ought nat cōplayned vpon determynacion putte caſtell one varlettes ſayde hym go thy waye frēche baſtydes ſuffre take thā requyre brought ſir wyllyam butler ſir iohan boeſme launce delyuer letter fro v demaunde anſwere mater toucheth v alſo greatly varlet ſayd ſhulde done thought none yuell ſo went frenche baſtides whan came nere baſtydes demaūded wolde anſwered ſayd wolde gladly ſpeke ſir wyllyam butler ſir iohan boeſme laūce brought toguyder whan ſawe made reuerence drewe aparte delyuered letter alayne peter roux ſente tydinges great marueyle ſo toke letter reed therin founde alayne peter roux wolde ſpeke profite whan herde marueyle than̄e douted trayſon howe ſent worde wolde come caſtell ſpeke without wolde aſſure entre agayne fortreſſe without daunger trouble anſwere yt varlet brought maiſter thanne alayne peter roux ſaid thynke may ſure ynough theſe wordes ſythe faythes ſeales writyng true knyghtes alſo ſhall ſpeke treatie whervnto thynke wyll gladly entende nexte mornynge opynned wycket ioynyng gate aueyled downe planche borde hangyng two chaynes iſſued ſtode planche ſir wyllyam butler ſir iohan boeſme laūce came thyder lyghted horſes made menne drawe abacke two capitayns within ſaid sir may ſurely come ſpeke ye ſurely quod knyghtes ſhall ſure agayne parte without trayſon ye ſir ſurely quod without doute alayne peter roux paſſed bridge came thē ſo four toguyder company two frenche knightes ſaid sir howe ſaye cōmunycacion wyll ye haue v ye mynde yelde vp caſtell v ye truely ſirs quod condycion gyue v ten thouſande frākes ye prouiſyons caſtell wery ye warre wolde drawe bretayne theſe two knyghtes ryght gladde thoſe wordes ſayd ah ye ſpeke v marchandyſe ſhall gladly nowe haue nat money redy ſhall prouyde well ſirs ꝙ vanchador whan ye redy gyue v knowledge ſhall kepe couenaunt ſirs kepe mater ſecretly ſagely knowen amonge myne owne company wolde take v perforce ſlee v ſhulde bothe fayle entente syr quod dought nat therof ſhall ſo conuey mater yt ye ſhall take domage therwith departed one fro nother breton entred vanchador frenche knyghtes retourned baſtydes sir willyam butler ſyr iohan boeſme laūce mater thought nothynge good ſuppoſynge breton wolde nat dyſceyue theym haue money betraye alſo contynente wrote duke berrey ryon auuergne ſent letter gentleman named guyomell ſaynte wydall infourmed hym mater thynkyng howe ſhulde ioyouſe tydynges duke greatly deſyred haue caſtell ſquyer tooke letter departed fro baſtydes rode ſo longe lymoſyn auuergne came ryon founde duke berrey delyuered hym letter fro two knyghtes duke reed letter whan well vnderſtande contentes therof duke gladde anone duke called counſayle treaſourers ſaid sir beholde newe tydynges knyghtes kepeth baſtydes vanchador haue written v certayne treatie capytayns within caſtell offer yeld vp fortreſſe ſōme tenne thouſande frankes great ſōme euery yere coſte lymoſyn auuergne kepe warre againſt threſcore thouſande frankes wyll accepte offre betymes leſte repente herafter therfore treaſourers make vp ſōme tenne thouſande frankes wyll lende countrey whan poſſeſſion caſtell wyll rayſe tayle lymoſyn fronters whiche vnder pateſynge ſhall pay double sir quod treaſourers ſhall made redy within theſe fyue ſyxe dayes well quod duke contente thus matter concluded treſourers made redy money crownes ſonne put foure cofers ſame daye money ſhulde haue ſente came ryon duke berry dolphyn auuergne lorde reueyll certayne mater touchynge ſelfe welcome duke duke ſo ioyfull treatie vanchador coude nat kepe ſecrete ſhewed theſe two knightes letter ſente hym fro ſyr willyam butler ſyr iohan boeſme launce whan herde ſtudyed lytell duke ſayde ſyr wheron yemuſe ſe ſuſpectiouſnes mater pray ſhewe ſende money syr quod erle dolphyn ye know well howe therle army nake ordeyned gette agayne many fortreſſes coude coūtreys auuergne carneſyn rouergne lymoſyn dyuers made treatyes yt euer coulde coulde neuer brynge vanchador herkyn leane maner treatie nother gyue vp ſelle whan ſpake therof wolde ſkante make v aunſwere ſyr knowe nowe wyll make treatie nat defaute vitayles none came theym eyght yere yet haue ynough wherfore haue maruayle ſhulde moue therto preſente tyme therfore maketh v doute trayſone men warre incloſed fortreſſes ſore imagyners whan imaginacion inclyneth yuell dede wyll craftely colour wherfore ſir take good aduyſe well ſyrs quod duke ye haue ſayd well ſhall prouyde mater ſubſtancyally thought haue done thanne duke berrey called hym one knyghtes called ſyr peter meſpyn ſayde hym syr ye ſhall go money baſtydes vanchadore ſaye ſyr wyllyam butler ſyr iohan boeſme launce mater wrote deale therin ſubſtancyally truſt nat moche breton within vanchador ſhewe haue herde tydinges ware wherfore lette theym well aduyſed poyntes thus knyght departed fro ryon money rode company tyll came baſtydes whyther welcome ſomers money dyſcharged put ſauegarde ſyr peter meſpyn opened meſſage ſaid syrs lorde duke berrey ſendeth worde touchynge treatye ye hande withall touchyng garyſon vanchador cōmaundeth worke wyſely ye leſe nat bothe bodyes money hath ſent alſo ſayth hath herde tydynges pleaſeth hym nothynge wherfore wyll ye take good hede well aduyſed douteth trayſon ſayeth often tymes coūtrey auuergne lymoſyn wolde haue gyuen fortreſſe vanchadore threſcore thouſande frankes nowe offre ten thouſande cauſeth lorde duke counſayle haue ſuſpecte two knightes whan herde penſyue aunſwered ſayde ſe well double wytte better ſyngle ye ſay well thanke aduyſe ye ſhall abyde ſtyll v helpe counſayle v reaſon within theſe two day ſhall ſe howe ye mater ſhall come paſſe ſayde contente ſo thanne anone theſe two knyghtes ſente varlet caſtell vanchador treuce bytwene party ſignyfyed alayne rour peter rour tenne thouſande frankes redy deſyringe theym kepe promeſſe anſwered varlet wold kepe promeſſe ſurely whan ſo euer wolde come ſende theym worde therof alayne peter rour thought good knowen ꝓued whan purpoſe broken knowen deuyſed haue taken ſir willyam butler ſyr iohan boeſme launce ſhuld haue entred caſtell vanchador reaſone great towre within caſtell whiche always able beate caſtell theſe two knyghtes breton entended nothynge maleſſe layde buſſhement towre thyrty men harneſſe entent whan frenche men entred caſtell thynkynge lordes therof night theſe thyrty ſhulde iſſue ſlee take frenche men pleaſure whan thus ordayned ſente ſyr willyam butler ſir iohan boeſme launce ſhulde come bringe money ſhulde haue caſtell opened theſe newes frenche men ioyous ſayd meſſanger retourne mayſters ſhewe morowe mornyng ſhall come thyder meſſanger retourned ſhewed mayſters frenche knyghtes wente counſayle togyder dyd caſt doutes dyd reaſon wordes duke berrey ſente ſix peter meſpyn ordeyned concluded lay buſſhemente men nere caſtell thyrty men harneſſed vnder couert ſhulde go entre caſtell regarde wyſelye caſtell within caſt maner doutes ſe thynge ſuſpecte one blowe horne kepe bridge gate open ſowne horne buſſhement come gate faſte canne entre take ſeaſon caſtell thus ordayned ſo done next mornyng euery man redy buſſhement layde ſyxe ſcore ſpeares two knyghtes thyrty company couertly armed came vanchador ſyr peter meſpyn money truſſed properly thre panyers vpon two ſomers founde two breton redy barryers opened barryers agaynſte comyng whan entred within gate two breton wolde haue cloſed gate frenche knyghtes ſaid nay ſyrs nat ſo ye true marchauntes nat ye knowe well ye muſte yelde vp v caſtell payeng ſōme tenne thouſande frankes redy ye maye ſe vpon ſomer ye kepe trouth v ſo ſhall yon thoſe wordes alayne peter rour wyſte nat ſay bringe frenche men ſuſpecte aunſwered syrs ye ſaye well contente ye pleaſe thus wente forthe lefte barryers open hadde ben cloſed buſſhment coulde nat haue entred haue come tyme ynough haue reſyſted falſe turne breton deuyſed ymagyners ſhulde haue euery thyng lyſt nat counter ymaginers agaynſt thē bothe frenche men breton entred gate alayne peter roux wolde haue cloſed gate frenche men ſayd syrs let gate alone wyll haue open reaſon redy delyuer money acordynge promeſſe well ſyrs quod breton lette ſe laye forthe money good wyll quod frenche men layde forthe couerlet florens layde abrode ye meane ſeaſon whyle alayne peter roux behelde fayre ſōme florēce frenche knyghtes went aboute ſe maner caſtell thanne ſyr peter meſpyn came ſyr willyam butler ſayd ſyr cauſe great towre opened ye paye money may within buſſhmente wherby maye atrapped loſe bothe bodyes money alſo ſyr willyam ſayd alayne syr open towre wyll ſe open delyuer money syr quod alayne canne nat ſo keyes loſt thoſe wordes frenche knightes ſuſpecte mater ſaid alayne nat ye ſhulde leſe keyes ſoueraygne towre caſtell open fayreneſſe el ſhall open perforce forye haue promiſed ſworne rendre v caſtell without fraude male engyn therfore haue ten thouſande frankes whiche ſōme redy delyuered alayne aunſwered agayne ſayd wyll nat open tyll haue receyued ye money layde ſauegarde whan haue receyued money ſhall ſerche ye key sir quod wyll nat abyde ſo longe ſe clerely wordes meanyng nat good wyll dyſceyue betraye v wherfore lay hādes alayne brother peter name kynge ſoueraygne lorde duke berrey wyll haue towre incontynent opened perforce ſerche euery place within caſtell bothe aboue beneth ſe ye haue layde buſſhemente nat fynde caſtell thyng done ought nat done ye loſte without redempcyon pardone reaſone wyll ſo fynde caſtell ought ſhall kepe bargayne well truely ſhall conducte whyder ye lyſte gate auignon ye wyll whan alayne peter roux ſawe howe mater wente areſted ſore abaſſhed halfe deed repented doone ſo moche ſawe well dyſceyued frenche knightes perceyued well howe culpable mater nat well made ſigne hym bare horne blowe ſo dyd whan french buſſhement herde came ye caſtell faſte horſes coulde ryn ſayd go vanchadore blowe v ſemeth men hath nat founde caſtell acording promyſed thynke ſome trayſon anon come caſtell nat farre barryers open kept frenchman breton within nat mayſters caſtell buſſhemente within towre frenche men entred founde capytaynes courte comunynge breton alayne peter ſore abaſſhed ſeynge ſo many enemyes aboute within towre knewe nothynge beſyneſſe coude ſe nothyng towre ſo thycke ſome ſayde harke ſyrs thynke moche murmurynge without may dyſceyued frenche men ſubtyle thought take feare taken capitayn alayne dyſceyued feare ſhall nat iſſue without congye thus whan frenche men ſawe howe lordes caſtell bolder tooke put vp agayne floreyns ſayd alayne delyuer v keyes towre wyll ſe within breton prolonged mater ſayde syrs begynne fyrſte ſerche outher place thā returne towre frenchman anſwered alayne ye prolōge mater wyll begynne fyrſt one delyuer keyes el thou ſhalte ſlayne theſe dagger whan two bretherne herde douted dethe fledde fro longe myght howe ſaye trouth honorable haue ſlayne haue taryed longer afterwarde dyed ſhamefull dethe ye ſhall alayne roux beyng daunger yet practyſed another crafte wolde haue ſerued ſayd syr willyam ſyr iohan trouth within toure thirty men harneſſe brother dyd ſette moche payne knewe well wolde neuer agree apoyntemente therfore haue cloſed theym within towre ſure tyll ye haue full poſſeſſyon caſtell ye may haue ye wyll good priſoners delyuer v money ye haue promyſed lette v go wayes whan french knightes herde ſomwhat better content ſtudyed lyttell ſir willm̄ butler ſaide ſo euer delyuer money wyll haue knowledge keyes caſtell therfore ſhew v whan alayne ſawe wolde none otherwyſe ſente chambre whan brought place demaū ded whiche keyes ſerued ye towre alayne full ſore agaynſte wyll ſhewed forthe keyes great towre opened towre founde within thyrty companion harneſſe hydde priuely within towre alayne brother ſore abaſſhed whan ſawe frenchman entre towre harde wordes ſir willyam butler ſayd whiche theſe syrs iſſue fayre eaſely one one nat ye deed take priſoners feare nat dethe ye ſhall haue hurte ſo ye wyll ſhewe trouth ſhall demaunde whan ſawe frenche men vnderſtode ſhulde nat ſlayne taken priſoners layde downe weapon harneſſe yelded ſelfes ſawe well defēce coulde nat aueyle thyrty men taken put parte examyned iuſtyfyed trayſon alayne peter roux coulde nat denye knyghtes fraunce ſayde syrs greatly dyſpleaſeth v fynde defaulte canne nat punyſſhe mater cauſe ſo weighty ſhall put diſcrecyon duke berrey wyll haue pytie ſhall gladde therof truſt wyll ioye wyll haue recoueryng caſtell place moſt deſyred haue agayne world theſe wordes ſomewhat comforted theym put chambre vnder ſure kepynge dyuers chambres towres caſtell ſerched aboue beneth founde great prouyſyon lefte ſtyll toke away nothynge therof departynge golde ſyluer harneſſe therof made boty euery man parte priſoners knyghtes parte thus haue ſhewed ſtronge caſtell vanchadore taken frenche men ſeaſon ſyr wyllyam butler ſette capytayne ſquyer lymoſyn valyaunt man called pier mardych hym thyrty ſpeares good men warre raunſomed pryſoners ſuche worthy raunſomed ſuche great pyllers robber frenchman borne ſtrake hedes hanged vpon gybettes newe made caſtell gate frenche knightes departed go ryon duke berrey toke alayne peter roux tydinges ſprange abrode howe ſtronge caſtell vanchadore taken wherof countrey auuergne lymoſyn thoſe marcheſſe greatly reioyſed caſtell frenche mennes handes fyftene yere durynge ſeaſon garyſone done great domage countrey sir willyam butler founde caſtell yonge ſquier bretayne fayre yong man named monadich coſyn geffray tetenoyre newely come thyder lerne exercyſe dedes armes ben brought vp abbaye bretayne come houſe bycauſe wolde monke frenche men wolde haue ſtryken heed among ſir willm̄ butler pytie hym ſaued lyfe wolde become frenche ſerue hym thus frenchman rode duke berrey brake vp baſtydes men armes departed went euery man owne ye capytaynes came ryon duke berrey led breton deſyred thē waye yt ſhulde nat enfourme duke berrey ſore agaynſt frenchman promyſed fulfyll deſyre longe rode came ryon founde duke ducheſſe receyued great ioy rekened gret acte conquering caſtell vanchadore gaue fayre gyftes preſentes demaunded duke pleaſure ſhulde done alayne peter roux anſwered wolde take aduyſe matter ſo toke counſayle determyned ſhulde ſende kyng ſo delyuered ſeneſchall auuergne cōueyed parys put priſon caſtell ſaynte anthony kepynge vycount affer tyme kepynge yt caſtell nat ben longe delyuered prouoſt parys put chatellet iudged dye traytours robber realme fraunce delyuered hangman faſt bounde layde carre brought trompettes place execucion named ye halle ſet pillery turned four tymes aboute ſyght people openly red publyſſhed dedes thā beheeded quartered quarter ſent four chefe gate cytie thus alayne peter rour loſt ſhamfully lyues caſtell vanchadore ¶of dedes armes ſaint ingylvertes contynuyng thyrty dayes agaynſte cōmers realme englande countreys euery man thre courſes ca clxviii ſeaſone meane tyme trueſe thus bytwenene englande fraunce bothe lande ſee though kinges ſubgiettes helde well peace yet certayne pyllers robber auuergne made warre poore men bothe ſydes ryuer dordone capytayns gyuē vp fortreſſes reaſon treatie dyſſymuled matter reaſon diſſymulacion coūtrey auuergne receyued great domage ſo yt complaintes therof came parys french kyng counſayled ſende kynge englande ſignyfyenge hym ſtate theſe robbes made warre thus countrey vnder coloure pateſynge ought nat done thinke king englande excuſed hym ſelfe mater prouyde therfore ſame ſeaſon thre fore ſayd knyghtes ſay yonge bouciquant raynolde roy lorde ſaint pye enterpriſed armes march calays nere ſaynte ingilbertes made redy cōplyſſhe deſyre fulfyll promeſſe right armes openly declared publyſſhed ſpecyally ye realme englande realme knyghtes ſquyers quyckened mater gret imagynaciōs knowe might beſt ſaid ſhuld greatly blame reproche ſuch enterpriſe taken ſo nere calays without paſſed ſee loke thoſe knightes ſhulde armes suche ſpake moſt mater firſt ſyr iohan holande erle huntyngdon great deſyre go thyder alſo ſir iohan courtney ſir iohan traicton ſir iohan golouffer ſyr iohan ruſſell ſyr thomas shyrborne ſyr willyam clyfton ſir willyam clynton ſir willym̄ taylboys ſir godfrey seta ſyr willyam hacquenay ſyr iohan vobeas ſyr iohan dambretycourt ſyr henry beamond dyuers mo hūdred knightes ſquters theſe ſayd let v prouyde go calays knightes fraunce hath nat ordayned ſporte ſo nere march entent ſe v ſurely haue done well lyke good companion ſhall nat fayle buſynes matter ſo publiſhed abrode englande many ſuche deſyre dedes armes theym ſelfe yet ſayd wolde loke ſhulde suche thought ſent afore calays make prouyſion kepe aſtate ſente ouer horſe harnes bothe peace warre whan day aproched ſir iohn̄ holāde brother kyng englāde fyrſt paſſed ſee mo lx knightes ſquiers hym aryued calys toke vp lodgyngꝭ thentryng ye ioly freſſhe moueth may theſe thre yong knyghtes fraūce ſuche ſhulde dedꝭ armes ſaynt ingilbertꝭ thus firſt cāe boloyne taryed ſeaſon came thabbay ſame ingilbertꝭ vnderſtode great nōbre knyghtes ſquyers cōe englande calays wherof ryght ioyfull entent brute ſhulde cōe calays ordayned fayre playne bytwene calays ſaynt ingilbertes thre freſſh grene pauilyōs pyght vp entre euery pauylyon hanged two ſheldes armes knightes one ſhelde peace another warre ordayned ſuche ſhulde ryn dedes armes ſhulde touche one ſheldes cauſe touched whiche pleaſeth ſhulde delyuered acordyng deſyre ſpeke mater ſhall ſhew xxi day moneth may acordyng ben publiſſhed theſe thre frēch knyghtes redy place furnyſſhe interprice ſame day knightes ſquyers iſſued calays ſuche wolde iuſt alſo ſuche pleaſure regarde ſporte came ſayde place apoynted drewe ye one parte place iuſt farre grene playne syr iohan holande firſt ſente touche ſheld warre ſir boucyquant incontynent iſſued pauylyon redy mounted ſhelde ſpeare theſe two knightes drewe fro certayne ſpace whan eche well aduyſed ſpurred horſes came togyther rudely boucyquante ſtrake erle huntyngton ſhelde ſpearcheed glente ouer arme dyd hym hurt ſo paſſed forthe tourned reſted paſe courſe greatly prayſed ſeconde courſe met without hurte ynge thyrde courſe horſes refuſed wolde nat cope erle huntyngton gret deſyre iuſt ſomwhat chafed came place abydynge ſir boucyquant ſhulde take ſpeare dyd nat ſhewed wolde tynne day agaynſt therle whan erle ſawe ſent ſquyer touche ſhelde warre lorde ſaynt pye wolde nat refuſe iſſued pauylion toke horſe ſhelde ſpeare whan erle ſawe redy ſpurred horſe ſaynt pye lykewyſe couched ſpeares metyng horſes croſſed croſſynge ſpeares erle vnhelmed retourned men incontynent rehelmed toke ſpeare ſaynt pye ran agayne met eche ſpeares myddes ſheldes ſo nere hande bothe borne downe erthe gryped faſt horſes legges ſo ſaued ſelfes retourned place toke brethes syr iohan holande great affection honorably toke agayne ſpeare ſpurred horſe whan lorde ſaynt pye ſawe hym comyng daſſhed forth horſe encountre hym eche ſtrake helmes ye ſpre flaſſhed yt ataynt lorde ſaynt pye vnhelmed ſo paſſed forthe came agayne owne place courſe greatly prayſed frenche englyſſhe ſayd thoſe thre knyghtes erle huntyngton ſir bouciquant lorde ſaynte pye ryght well done deuoyrs without domage eyther agayne erle deſyred loue lady haue another courſe refuſed ſir iohan holand went renke gyue place ronne ſire courſes well valyaūtly ſo laude honoure partyes ſtept forth gentle knight englāde called erle marſhall ſent touche ſhelde warre ſir raynolde roy iſſued pauylyon armed peces toke horſe ſhelde ſpeare whan theſe two knyghtes ſonder ſpurred horſes came fyerſly togyther firſt courſe fayled outragyng horſes wherwith ſore dyſpleaſed ii courſe ſir raynolde ſtryken ſpere broken iii courſe eche ſtrake helmes wt ſuche force yt fire ſlewe therle marſhall vnhelmed paſſed forthe retourned place iuſted yt day ynough cāe forth ye lorde cl • fford right apt valyāt knight englāde coſyn germayn ſir iohn̄ chādos noble valiant knight dayes ſent touche ſhelde warre ſir bouciquant incontynent knight iſſued pauilyon wt ſhelde ſpere theſe two knightes came rudely togider ſtrake eche ye helm fyre ſparcled ſpeares brake nat knightes loſt ſtyropes ſo paſſed came place made thē redy ryn ii courſe ſo came togyder wtout ſparing ſir bouciquāt brake ſpere vnhelmed yet fell nat paſſed forthe came place sir loyes clifforde made hym iuſt agayne bouciquant dyd nat put agayne helme yt ſeyng lorde clifforde aduyſed ꝑforme courſe another ſente ſquyer touche ye helde warre ye lorde ſaynt pye came forthe redy iuſte ran toguyder met eche ye lorde clifforde brake ſpeare thre peces ye lorde ſaynt pyes ſhelde lorde ſaynt pye ſtrake lorde clyfforde helme ſo diſhelmed ſo paſſed forche eche drewe place lorde clyfforde ran day ſhewed hym howe right honorably borne hym ſelfe daye came forth noble knight englāde called ſir hē ry beamōde cauſed touched ſir bouciquantes ſhelde warre ſoone redy anſwere ran togyder lorde beamōde croſſed bouciquant ſtrake hym ſo rudely bare hym therche paſſed forthe ye knight releued men ſet agayne horſ backe ran togyder two courſes without dō mage thā ſir peter curency great deſyre ryn ſixe courſes cauſed ſquyer touche thre ſheldes warre wherof ye frēchmen marueile dema • ded entēded therby anſwered pleaſure ryn eche knight ii courſes without lette way de • yre graunted ſir raynolde du royran firſt came togider good aduyſemēt howbeit firſt courſe fayled horſes refuſed ye cope wherwith ſore diſpleaſed railed nat ye ii courſe ſir raynold diſhelmed engliſſhe knyght paſſed forth retourned place held hī ſtyl ron two courſes ye lorde ſair pye ca • e forthe iuſt ran eche agaynſt brake ſperes ii courſe lorde ſaint pye ſtrake ſir peter courtney croſſe ſir pet ſtrake hym ye helme vnhelmed hym ſo cāe owne place ſir bouciquat acōpliſſhe ſir peter deſire came forthe ran met eche ye myddꝭ heldes ſo rudely yt horſes ſtakered place hurt nat ye ii courſe vnhelmed eche theſe vi courſes done ſir peter courtney deſyred ryn one courſe one ye thre knightes pleaſed thē refuſed ſayd yt done ynough ye day ſo reſted preced forthe gētyl man englande called ſir iohn̄ gouloufer ſent touche ye ſhelde ſir raynolde 〈◊〉 roy redy anſwere ran frely togider ataynted eche helmes without diſhelmyng brekyng ſperes ſo paſſed ſecōde courſe horſes refuſed mete iii courſe met ſheldes brake ſtaues fourth courſe miſt v courſe vnhelmed eche retourned place valiant knight englande called ſir iohn̄ rolſcau well trauelled knight well knowen touched ſhelde ye lord ſaint pye yt knight redy anſwere ran togyder met ſo rudely yt horſes ſtayed ye cope ye ii courſe horſes ſwarued aſyde myſt eche wherof knightꝭ diſpleaſed iii courſe met ſtrake eche ye viſer helmes ſo yt bothe vnhelmed englyſſhe knyght retourned cōpany iuſted came forthe ſir peter shirborne yong knight touched ye ſheld ſir bouciquant ye knight redy ran togider myſt outraging horſes taried nat long ran togider agayne ii courſe ſtrake eche ſyght helmes ſir bouciquātes ſpere brake thenglyſſhe knyghtꝭ ſpere helde ſo yt therby ſir boucyquant vnhelmed ſo rudely yt blode ran noſe ſo returned pauſiyon ran day nere night ſir peter ſhirborne wolde nat leue ſo wolde ryn iii courſe ſent touche ſhelde lorde ſaint pye incōtynent redy ran togider tainted eche ye helmes ſperes grated nat mooſt lykelhod taken hurte ii courſe ſtrake eche ye ſheldes brake ſtaues thre peces thēgliſſhe knight borne therthe ran yt day nere night englyſſhmen drewe togider deꝑted rode calays deuyſed nyght ben done day lykewiſe frēchmen rode ſaynt ingylbertes cōmuned deuiſed yt ben done ye ſame day tueſday maſſe ſuche ſhulde iuſt day wolde gyue lokyng rode cali came place apoynted frēchmen redy receyue thē day fayre hote whan thenglyſſhmen armed ſir wyllm̄ clyfron expert knight englande cauſed ſquier touche targe ſir bouciquant incōtinent knight iſſued pauylion armed peces two knightes came toguider taynted eche ſhelde paſſed without brekyng ſpeares ii courſe croſſed helmes iii courſe encountred ech ſo ye ſheldes yt horſes ſtode ſtyll iiii courſe well employed vnhelmed eche englyſſhe knight ran ſaid hym done ynough thēgliſſhe ꝑte came forthe luſty yong knight called ſir nicholas clynton touched ye lorde ſaynt pie ſhelde knight anon redy met togider ſo euyn yt eche thē brake ſperes iii peces ſuche force yt knight daūger haue taken domage paſſed cāe place ii courſe tainted eche ye helmes paſſed ye iii courſe horſes croſſed fayled ye iiii courſe ye lorde ſaynt pye vnhelmed englyſſhe knight ran yt daye men ſaid well valiantly done quited hymſelfe muſt haue place iuſt thā kynſman therle hūtingdon cāe forthe called wyllm̄ stamert cauſed touche ye ſhelde ser raynold roy ran togider wt frewyll tainted eche ye englyſſhe knight loſt ſpere ii courie met thēgliſſhe knight warued aſide nat tell wheder faut knight ye horſe ſir raynolde ſtrake ſo rudely ye targe yt ſore reuerſed ſo paſſed made thē redy ryn third courſe ſo tainted eche ye helmes yt fire ſprang loſt ſperes ye iiii courſe ataynted ech ye ſight helmes wt courſe ſir wyllm̄ ſtamert diſhelmed nigh borne therthe howbeit fell nat returned cōpany ran yt day another ſquier englāde cāe forth called lācaſtre ſent touche ye ſhelde ſir bou • iquant ran togider tainted ech ye helmes yt fire flewe marueyle yt nat ben vnhelmed nat long tyll ran ii courſe horſes croſſed thirde courſe vnhelmed englyſſhe ſquyer iuſted yt day yonge knight called ſir iohn̄ tayl boiſe iuſted lorde ſaynt pye encoūtred eche ye ſheldes brake ſtaues ii courſe horſes croſſed iii courſe bothe vnhelmed engliſſhe knight ran day ſtepte forthe godfray seca gentyll knight good iuſter well ſene hym encoūtred ſir raynolde du roy came right toguyder mette ſheldes ſperes good wolde nat breke ſo yt made horſes reeule recouered kepte ſtyll ſperes ran agayne theſe coude courſe reſſed fante horſes nat knyghtes loſt bothe ſtaues ran agayne iii courſe englyſſhe knight ſtrake ſir raynolde helme vnhelmed ſir raynolde ſtrake yt englyſſhe knight targe ſo rudely ſuche ſtrength called one beſt iuſters realme fraunce alſo lyued amour yong lady whiche aueyled hym buſineſſe perced thēgliſſhmans targe clene ſpeare heed entred arme ſpere brake trouchon ſtacke ſtyll ye ſhelde knyght arme yet yt knight made turne came place freſſhly cōpany drewe trouchyon bounde arme ſir raynolde retourned cōpany courſe ſir roynolde du roy greatly prayſed bothe ꝑties ye hurtyng knight ſuche aduētures armes ſome good ſome yuell came forthe eſquyer englande called balquet ſent touche ſhelde lorde ſaynt py redy anſwere couched ſpeares ran toguyder ye firſt courſe taynted eche helmes loſte ſtaues toke ſtaues agayne ye aprochyng horſes croſſed ſo paſſed retourned agayne place taryed nat long ran eche yt courſe blaque • ſtrake ye lorde ſaynt pye hye ye helme gaue hym ſore ſtroke ſaynt pye ſtrake ſight heelm ſorer ſtroke ſo therwith ſo vnhelmed ye bocle behynde brake helme fell groūde blaquet retourned copany iuſted day ye lorde ſaynt pye ſate ſtyll horſe abyding comer gentyll knight englande called ſir iohn̄ bolcas touched ſhelde lorde ſaynt pye redy anſwere ſtrake eche ſhelde marueile nat perced ſperes ſtrong paſſed loſt ſpeares without dōmage ii courſe taynted helmes without hurte paſſed ye iii courſe croſſed iiii courſe lorde ſaynt pye vnhelmed rude lye ſir iohan bolcas courſe engliſſhe knight ran yong knyght englande richely armed named thomelyn maſſydone touched ye ſhelde warre ſir bouciquant incontynent anſwered firſt courſe croſſed helmes ii courſe met thomelyn brake ſpere trōchions bouciquant ſtrake hym ſo ſore bare hym erthe ouer horſe backe cōpanyon toke hym vp iuſted another ſquier englande called nauerton touched ſhelde ſir bouciquant ſayeng howe wolde reuenge company bouciquant ouerthrowen p̄ſence redy anſwere firſt courſe ſtrake eche viſer helmes without dō mage ii courſe ſtrake eche ſheldes ſo yt horſes reculed brake ſpeares thre peces retourned place toke newe ſpeares met agayne togyder ſir bouciquant receyued great ſtroke ye ſhelde ſtrake nauerton ſuche wyſe vnhelmed ran day euery man ſayde well acquyted hym ſelfe another ſquyer called sequaqueton experte man armes ſente touche ſhelde ſir raynolde du roye knyght redy anſwere well moūted ſhelde ſpeare mette ſo rudely sequaqueton bare hym ſelfe well fro fallynge ſuche ſtroke ſore reuerſed howbeit releued paſſed forthe loſt ſpere next courſe meete rudely helmes ſo fyre flaſſhed iii courſe sequaqueton vnhelmed ſo bothe horſe aſtonyed retourned company iuſted day man el night aproched englyſſhe men retourned calys frēchmen ſaynt ingylbertes ye may well knowe charles frenche kyng ſore deſyrous thoſe iuſtes yonge lyght ſpiryte glad ſe newe thynges ſhewed fro begynning thendyng preſent diſgyſed vnknowen ſo none knewe hym lorde garaſyers cāe alſo hym vnknowen euery day returned margiſon ye wedniſday engliſſhmen rode fro calais came place ye iuſtes ſquier englande called iohn̄ sauage ſente touche ſhelde warre ſir raynold roy knight redy pauylion iſſued moūted horſe thā came togider great randon ſtrake eche ſheldes ſuche wiſe ſheldes nat broken outher one men bothe ben ſtriken ye groūde goodly daungerous courſe howbeit knightꝭ toke dōmage ſperes brake hādes heedꝭ ſtacke ſtyll ſheldꝭ euery man fered ben hurt ſo euery ꝑtie cāe cōpany whan knowen hurt euery man ioyfull ſayd howe done ynough day thoſe wordes pleaſed nothyng iohan sauage ſayd nat come ouer ſee ryn one courſe thoſe wordꝭ ſhewed ſir raynolde du roy anſwered ſayd reaſon aunſwered outher ſome cōpany toke newe ſheldes ſpeares ran agayne toguyder▪ cope horſes croſſed ſo fayled ech wherwith ſore diſpleaſed angre caſt awaye ſperes toke newe thirde courſe taynted eche ſyght helmes ſuche wyſe bothe vnhelmed euery man prayſed courſe englyſſhe men came iohan sauage ſaid howe ryght honorably acquyted hymſelfe daye howe done ynough ryn obeyed ran lyghted horſe lept ſmall hackeney ſo rynne squyer englande came forthe coſyn erle marſhall called wyllyam baſquenaye touched ſhelde ſir bouciquant knyght redy anſwere came togyder ſtreyght coude deuyſe ſtrake eche ſyght helmes ſuche wyſe yt bothe vnhelmed paſſed forthe courſe frāke frely anone agayne helmed ran togider ſtrake eche ſheldes brake ſpeares withoute domage thirde courſe croſſed wherwith ſore diſpleaſed fourthe courſe wyllm̄ baſquenay agayne vnhelmed ſo ran daye another englyſſhe ſquyer called scot ran agayne lorde ſaynt pye fyrſt courſe encoūtred ſo rudely yt horſes ſtakered ſperes helde yet loſt ſperes made redy ryn ſeconde courſe met ſuche wyſe yt lorde ſaynt pye vnhelmed ſquier moche prayſed courſe agayne thirde courſe encoūtred eche ye ſheldes ſuche wyſe iohn̄ scot ſtryken downe ouer horſe crope thus lorde ſaynt pye reuēged thēglyſſh ſquyer releued brought cōpany ran day another englyſſhe ſquyer called bernarte stapleton touched ſhelde ye lorde ſaynt pye came togider taynted eche helmes yt fyre flaſſhed ſo paſſed without dōmage kepte ſtyll ſperes ii courſe mette ſheldes rudely yet kept horſes ſo paſſed forth courſe thirde courſe vnhelmed eche thenglyſſh ſquyer ran daye ſtepte forthe gentyll knyght englande yonge freſſhe iolly daūcer ſynger called ſir iohn̄ arūdell ran agayne ser raynold du roy firſt courſe mette rudely ſtrake eche ſheldes helde ſelfes without fallynge paſſed forthe courſe loſt ſtaues ii courſe attaynted eche helmes ſparcles fyre flewe without dōmage iii courſe croſſed loſte ſtaues iiii courſe taynted helmes v courſe brake ſperes ſheldes ſir iohn̄ arūdell ran day another ſquyer englāde called nicholas scon proper man armes ran agaynſt ſir bouciquāt firſt courſe ſtrake eche helmes great attaynt ii courſe ſtrake eche ſheldes ſuche wyſe horſes aſtonyed loſt ſpeares ye iii courſe ſtrake eche helmes nicholas seon vnhelmed ran another ſquyer came forthe called iohn̄ marſhall ran agaynſt ſir bouciquant redy lokyng nothyng iuſt toke ſpeare couched reſt firſt courſe mette rudelye ſheldes loſt ſtaues ſeconde courſe taynted helmes third courſe aduyſed well eche met rudely iohan marſhall brake ſtaffe thre peces ſir boucyquant ſtrake hym helme ſuche wyſe vnhelmed ſo returned ran yt day cāe forthe luſty yonge knight englande deſyred greatly wyn honour called ſir iohn̄ clinton bare ſyluer broken azure molet ſyluer ye chefe touched ye ſhelde ſir reynold du roye redy anſwere gladde cōmynge knyght came place toke ſpeares fyrſt courſe taynted helmes paſſed forthe ſeconde courſe ſtrake eche ſheldes paſſed loſt ſtaues thirde courſe taynted helmes ſo fyre flewe oute fourthe courſe croſſed fythe courſe well enployed eche brake ſpeares two knyghtes ſore chafed ſhewed well howe gret deſyre proue ſelfes ſixte courſe eche thē vnhelmed courſe greatly prayſed englyſſhe knight ran daye done ynoughe thanne roger leau another englyſſhe ſquyer auaunced forthe bare ſyluer ſables quarterly myddes croſſe goules touched ſhelde lorde ſait pye firſt courſe encountred ſo rudely horſes aſtonied ſpeares helde ſeconde courſe taynted helmes paſſed forthe thirde courſe roger leau vnhelmed ranne auaūſed forthe ryght gentyll knight nacyon heynaulte marcheſſe oſtrenaunt fro youthe brought vp courte noble kynge edwarde englande knyght called ſir iohan dambrety court brother good knyght ſir euſtace bare armure partie golde ermyne touched ſhelde ſir raynolde du roye fyrſte courſe taynted helmes fyre folowed ſecōde courſe entred ſo rudely marueyle howe ſcaped without dōmage eche thē noble iuſters feared nother payne dethe thirde courſe ſir raynolde du roye rudely vnhelmed ſir iohan dambretycourt paſſed forthe turne came agayne place ſir raynolde du roye retourned company ſhewed howe wolde iuſte daye englyſſhe knight deſyring iuſt ſent touche ſhelde ſir boucyquant ran toguyder ſo fierſly ſtrake eche ſheldes marueyle nat ben pearced throughe ſeconde courſe taynted helmes paſſed forthe loſt ſpeares thirde courſe mette ſo rudely eche thē vnhelmed englyſſhe men drewe toguyder ſawe nerehande nyght toke leaues deꝑted towarde calais nyght none cōmunynge iuſtes hadde ben done day frenche men wente margyſon deuyſed pleaſure thurſdaye fourthe day weke englyſſhe men calais aſſembled togider ſuche nat iuſted come ouer ſee entent cōcluded returne agayne ſaynte ingylbertes armes ſo moūted horſes rode calays came ye place iuſtes ſhulde done redy thre knightes fraunce pauylions ſuche ſhulde ſerue fyrſt came place knight englā de called ſir godfray euſtace touched ye ſhelde ſir boucyquant incontyuent iſſued pauylion redy anſwere knyghtes aduyſed eche ran toguyder taynted helmes paſſed forthe courſe kept ſtyll ſtaues ſeconde courſe ſtrake eche myddes ſheldes ſpeares brake without dōmage paſſed forthe came agayne place thirde courſe eche vnhelmed englyſſhe knight iuſted ſayd hym right valyauntly acquyted hym ſelfe alſo muſt ſuffre iuſte englyſſhe ſquier came forthe iuſte called alayne borowe touched ſhelde lorde ſaynt pye knyght redy anſwere fyrſte courſe taynted helmes fyre flewe paſſed forthe courſe returned agayne place ye ſeconde courſe brake bothe ſtaues iii courſe vnhelmed eche englyſſh man ran behoued iuſt another englyſſhe ſquyer called scrope touched ſhelde ſir bouecyquant fyrſte courſe croſſed ſeconde courſe taynted helmes thirde courſe scrope ouerthrowen thā releued brought company ran knyght behaygne one quene englandes knyghtes called herchaunce bare armes ſyluer thre gryffens fete ſable armed azure demaunded whome wolde iuſte anſwered bouciquant made redy ran toguyder knyght behaygne made forfaite wherof greatly blamed yt demeaned courſe ſo yuell englyſſhe men ſawe well howe forfaite armure horſe frenche men wolde courſe great cōmunycacyon bytwene party finally pardoned better pleaſe englyſſhe men herchaūce requyred agayne iuſte one courſe demaunded againſt whome wolde ryn ſente touche ſhelde ſir raynolde du roy redy anſwere fyrſt courſe mette myddes ſheldes ſir raynolde du roye one beſt iuſters ye realme fraūce ſtrake thother knight clene fro horſe ſuche wyſe menne thought deed herchaunce moche payne releued broght company engliſſhe men nat diſpleaſed ouerthrowen bicauſe ran fyrſte courſe ſo vngoodly ran daye came ſquyer englande called robert storborne touched ſhelde ye lorde ſaynt pye redy anſwere fyrſt courſe taynted helmes ſecōde courſe ſtrake ſheldes loſt ſpeares thirde courſe eche vnhelmed englyſſhe ſquyer ran iohn̄ morlande touched ſhelde ser raynold du roy redy anſwere firſt courſe taynted helmes ſeconde courſe encountred eche horſes aſtonyed loſte bothe ſtaues thirde courſe iohan morlande ſtryken grounde releued iuſted thanne another ſquyer called iohan moten touched ſhelde bouciquant knyght redy firſt courſe taynted paſſed forthe ſeconde courſe taynted helmes loſt ſtaues thirde courſe iohan moton vnhelmed ranne daye gaue place iaqueuyne scrope touched ſhelde lorde ſaynt pye redy mounted fyrſt courſe horſes croſſed wherwith ſore diſpleaſed ſeconde courſe taynted helmes fyre flewe loſt ſperes thirde courſe iaqueuyne scrope brake ſpeare lorde ſaynt pye ſtrake hym ſo rudely yt fell ouer horſe crope erthe releued ranne daye another ſquier cāe forthe called guyllyam maquelee ran agaynſt ſir boucyquaunt redy anſwere firſte courſe taynted helmes fyre flewe ye courſe prayſed euery partie ſeconde courſe ſtrake eche ſheldes loſte ſtaues thirde courſe vnhelmed eche ſo bothe ſate bareheeded coyfes ran daye done yough another squyer englande called nycholas leau touched shelde lorde ſaynt pye redy anſwere firſt courſe ſtrake eche ſo ſore ye ſheldes ſtaues nat broken ben great dōmage helde thē ſelfes well fro fallyng ſecōde cope attaynted eche helmes fyre flewe oute ſtrokes croſſed ſo paſſed thyrde goodly courſe ſtrake eche ſo euin ye ſight helmes eche vnhelmed ſo clerely helmes flewe felde ouer horſe cropes iuſters ceaſed daye none engliſſhe man offred iuſt day erle huntyngdon erle marſhall lorde clyfforde lorde beamont ſir iohan clynton ſir iohan dambretycourt ſir peter shyrborne knyghtes iuſted thoſe four dayes french knightes thanked greatly paſtaunce ſaid ſyrs ſuche wolde iuſte partie haue accompliſſhed deſyres wherfore nowe wyll take leaue wyll returne calays ſo englande knowe well ſo euer wyll iuſt ſhall fynde theſe thyrty dayes acordynge tenoure chalenge one come englande ſuch knightes deſyre dedes armes ſhall deſyre come vyſite thre knyghtes thanked ſayd ſhall right hertely welcome ſhall delyuer acordynge ryght armes haue done ouer thanke curteſy yt ye haue ſhewed v thus curtes maner englyſſhe men departed fro ſaynte ingilbertes rode calays taryed nat longe ſaturdaye toke ſhyppynge ſayled douer noone ſondaye rode rocheſter nexte day london ſo euery man owne thre frenche knyghtes kepte ſtyll place ſaynt ingylbertes frenche kinge lorde garancyers ben ſeaſon vnknowen whan englyſſhe men departed neuer ſeaſed rydynge tyll came crayll ryuer oyſe quene tyme englyſſhe men came englande herde nat mo came ouer dedes armes ſaynte ingylbertes howe thre frenche knyghtes helde ſtyll place tyll thyrty dayes accomplyſſhed leyſar retourned euery manne came parys ſe kyng duke thourayne lordes parys tyme made good chere reaſon requyred valyauntly borne ſelfe wherby atcheued gret honour kyng realme fraunce ⸪ ¶of enterpryſe voyage knyghtes fraunce englande duke burbone chefe army requeſte genouoys go barbary beſiege ſtrong towne auffryke cap clxix shall nowe declare maner hygh noble enterpriſe done ſeaſō knightes fraūce england countreys realme barbary syth haue concluded armes doone ſaynt ingylbertes nowe wyll ſhewe mater great pleaſure declare pleaſure nat inclyned write enquyre trouthe many matter neuer come ende haue done nowe ſayeth texte mater wyll procede yt ſeaſon newes ſpredde abrode fraunce dyuers coūtreys genouoys wolde make army go barbary gret prouyſion well byſquet freſſhe water wyneger gale veſſelles knyghtes ſquyers wolde go voyage cauſe moued thus ſhall ſhewe alonge tyme affrycans made warre ſee fronters genouoys pylled robbed ilandes ſuche obeyſant alſo ryuer gene lay euer parell daunger auffryke whiche ſtronge towne ye party garnyſſhed gate towres hyghe thycke walles depe dyke lyke ſtronge towne calays key wherby ſoeuer lord therof may entre realme fraunce flaunders pleaſure maye ſee lande ſodenly inuade great puyſſaunce many great feates lyke wyſe comparyſon towne auffryke key barbaryns realme auffryke realmes bougne thunes realmes infydeles thoſe party towne dyd moch dyſpleaſure genouoys greate marchauntes aufryke often tymes taken ye ſee went returned fro feate marchaundyſes genouoys ryche puyſſaunt bothe lande ſee hauyng great ſygnories regarded dedes affrycans alſo conſydred complayntes ſuche iſles vnder obeyſaunce iſle dable iſle syre iſle guerſe iſle boſtan iſle gorgennem vnto ye gulfe lyon iſles sardonne finiſſe vnto iſle mayllorke whiche thre iſles vnder obeyſaunce kynge aragon genouoys comon acorde agreed ſende frenche courte offre knightes ſquiers wolde go ſiege towne aufryke fynde galees veſſels charged byſquet ſwete water wyneger coſte charge ſo one frenche kynges vncles el brother duke thourayn yonge luſty lykely conquere honour ſhulde capytayne generall genouoys furthermore promiſed xii thouſande croſbowes genouoys well furnyſſhed eyght thouſande ſpeares paueſſes coſt charge genouoys dyde bycauſe knewe trewce bytwene englande fraunce thre yere wherfore ſuppoſed knyghtes īquyers well fraūce englande wolde glad doynge ſome parte whan tydynges came firſt fraūce voyage knightes ſquiers countrey right ioyfull meſſangers fro genne aunſwered ſhulde nat departe tyll well herde ſo haue ſocour requeſt ſo reaſonable augmentynge cryſten faythe thus cauſed tary ſeaſon parys debate mater ſe ſhulde chefe ſoueraygne armye voyage whome euery man ſhulde obey duke thourayne owne volūtary wyll offred hym ſelfe go kyng vncles wolde wyſe agree therto ſayenge howe voyage hym conſydred well howe yt genouoys deſyred outher haue el one kynges vncles agreed duke burbone vncle kynge ſhulde ſouerayne chefe armye ſhulde haue company lorde coucy whan ambaſſadours gene aunſwered concluded without fayle yt ſhulde haue ayde knightes ſquyers fraunce kynges vncle duke burbone ſouerayne chefe capytayne wherof theſe ambaſſadours well contente toke leaue kynge counſayle retourned owne coūtrey tydinges anon ſpred abrode yt realme fraunce af voyage barbary ſome pleſaunt ſome nat delectable many wolde haue gone wente nat none went owne charge coſte lorde ſente owne ſeruauntes alſo ordeyned none ſhuld paſſe nacyon fraunce without lycence kynge kynge wolde nat ſo many ſhulde haue gone leaue realme deſtitute knyghtes ſquyers alſo agreed varlettes ſhulde paſſe gentle men men feate defence alſo pleaſe nacyons knyghtes ſquiers ſtraungers fre lyberty come entre honorable voyage wherof knyghtes ſtraungers greatly prayſed frenche kynge counſayle dede duke burbone one chefe realme ſent incontynent officer gennes make prouyſyon acordynge aſtate gentle erle auuergne ſent alſo gennes make prouyſions lorde coucy nat behynde alſo ſyr guy de la tremoyle ſir iohan vyen admyrall fraunce lordes knightes ſuche ordeyned go voyage ſent make prouyſions euery man degre alſo ſo dyd ſir philyppe de arthoys erle eawe ſir phylip bare lorde harcourt ſir henry dantoinge alſo bretayne normandy many lordes aparelled ſelfes go barbary alſo haynalt lorde ligne lord haureth thē flaunders great ꝓuyſion made alſo duke lācaſtre baſtard ſonne called henry lancaſtre deuocion go ye ſame voyage prouyded good knightes ſquyers englande acompanyed hym voyage erle foiz ſent baſtarde ſonne called iobbayne foiz well prouyded knightes ſquiers bierne euery man prouyded ſelfes nobly eche myddes may yt furtheſt fro gene ſet forwarde come gennes whereas ye aſſemble apoynted galees veſſelles aſſembled moneth coude aſſemble genouoys right ioyfull comyng gaue great preſentes chiefe lordes better therby wynne loues nombred whan togyther ye marſhals xiiii hundred knyghtes ſquyers entred galees veſſelles prouyded well furniſſhed thynges neceſſary thus departed fro porte gennes aboute feeſt mydſomer yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore ten great pleaſure behold departynge ſe ſtandardes getorns penons wanynge wynde ſhynynge againſt ſonne ye trompettes claryons ſownyng ayre mynſtrelſy fyrſte night lay ancre entryng high ſee varlettes horſes abode behynde horſe worthe fyfty frankes departyng ſolde ten frankes many knyghtes ſquiers wyſte nat whan ſhulde returne coulde nat haue fyue horſes kept gennes franke daye therfore departynge made money lytell hūdred galees garniſſhed men warre croſbowes paueſſes mo c veſſels laden ꝓuyſion neceſſaryes next day breke daye weyed ancres rowed day force owers nyght folowynge coſtyng lāde thyrde day came portefyn caſt ancre taryed night next day came another porte towne called porte vēder taryed refreſſhed next day paſſed gret ſee name god lady ſaynte george firſte founde iſle dable yt iſle guerfe iſle argenen iſle sardyns paſſed gulfe lyon daungerous doutfull paſſage coulde nat eſchewe waye yt toke great parell haue ben loſt ſeaſon ſo troublus tempeſtes ſo terryble ye wyſeſt maryner yt coulde gyue coūſaile abyde aduēture wyll god wherby flete departed ſonder ſome ſome wyſt neuer tempeſt endured day night whan tēpeſt ſeſt ye wyndes pacifyed patron pylottes ſet courſes drawe iſle cōmeres xxx myle fro auffryke fro towne thyder entented go goynge gulfe lyon patrones ſayde one nother fortune driuen ſonder force wynde wether lette v drawe iſle cōmeres lette v tary eche hadde deuyſed ſo dyd fyrſt came thyder taryed tyll laſt came coulde aſſemble togyder nyne day iſle cō mere pleaſaūt iſle thought nat gret lordes refreſſhed theym thanked god whhan ſawe loſte none company thanne lordes patron toke counſayle beſt conſyderinge ſo nere ye towne aufryke ¶nowe wyll leaue ſpeke theſe lordes fraunce ſeaſon ſpeke mater done ſeaſon fraūcel ſpecyally countrey auuergne march lande erle dolphyn forthe ſayd voyage ⸪ ⸪ ¶of capytayne robber pyller countrey called aymergot marcell helde ſtronge caſtell march rouergne called roche vandois howe beſieged vicount meaulx takynge therof howe aymerygotte taken brought parys cap clxx ſeaſon whyle aſſēble making go barbary good entente exalte criſten faythe certayne robber pyllers auuergne rouergne lymoſyn contrary myndes though coūtreis thought themſelfe ſuretie reaſon chartre treuce taken bytwene englande fraunce whiche ben ꝓclaymed publyſſhed fortreſſes capitayns made warre helde fortreſſes engliſſh parte artycle ſo euer brake violated poynt artycle compriſed treaty ſhuld receyue punyſſyon dethe without hope remyſſion ſpecially perot le bernoys capytayne caluſet amergot marcell olyue barbe capytayne douſac march auuergne encloſed name charter treuſe entent dyd conſented thynge contrary yt ſhulde nat ercuſe ſelfe ſome capytayns feared dye ſhamfull dethe rynne indygnacion frenche kynge helde ſurely poyntes charter ſome dyd nat ſo whiche derely bought ye ſhall ye ſhall knowe hath ben reherſed howe iohan erle armynake bernarde dolphyn auuergne therle clermounte treatie certayne capytayns helde fortreſſes ſaid coūtreys agaynſt frenche kynge theſe ſayd lordes made ſuche dylygence brought dyuers theſe capytayns compoſycion ſellyng fortreſſes treaty compoſicyon yt ſhulde renounce warre bytwene englande fraunce durynge treuce go erle armynake lombardy whyder wolde leade ayde hym warre gaynſt lorde galea erle vertues diſheryted coſyn germayns chyldren vncle lorde barnabo hath ben ſhewed ſo haue ayde auoyde countrey theſe robber pyllers done ſo moche hurte countrey bothe men woman ſayd erle armynake erle dolphyn coſyn toke gret payne mater inſtant requeſtes prayer good menne cyties townes playne countreys aforeſayd ſo tayle gadred auuergne guynaldan rouergne carnoſyn lymoſyn ye ſōme two hundred thouſande frankes ſo poore riche payed ſomoch dyuers ſolde layde pledge herytages glad ſo lyue reſte countreys good men thought reſon payeng money aduoydyng ſayd fyue robber pyllers ſhulde haue ben quyte euer proued nat ſo dyuers place ſpecially aymergot marcell men caſtell aloys yelden vp ſolde aymergot marcell erle armynake whiche fortreſſe ſtode herte auuergne aymergot well worthe redy money hūdred thouſande frankes whiche goten robory pyllage raunſominge men pateſynge countrey kept ye rule ten yere therle armynake deſyred gretly haue company ſayd aymergot mercell thought nat leaue behynd two reaſons one bycauſe wolde gladly haue counſayle aduyſe hym experte ſubtyle feates armes ſautynge ſealynge ſtealynge fortreſſes ſeconde reaſon erle feared aymergot ſhulde byde behynde countrey thoughe hadde ſolde hym fortreſſe aloyſe fortreſſes yet might moche domage coūtrey auuergne rouergne wherfore therle made great labour haue hym alwayes aymergot diſſymuled mater ſaid whan ſe certayne erle armynakes departyng knowe myne owne wyll ſo good yt wyll nat byde behynde aunſwere erle coulde nat get hym erle armynake laye commynge aboute tholouſyn countrey made aſſemble whiche voyage haſted voyage auffryke hadde nat letted hym ſeaſon dyuers knyghtes ſquyers went voyage promyſed hym voyage barbary came ſo ſodenly hyndred voyage whan tydynges knowen fraunce treaty erle armynake made ſayde capytayns auuergne made moche haſte myght pay money capytayns aymergot marſell ſore dyſpleaſed hym ſelfe ſolde deliuered ſtronge caſtell aloyſe ſawe owne auctorite therby greatly abated parceyued well howe leſſe feared ſeaſon kept doubted feared honoured men warre parte kept great aſtate alwayes caſtell aloyſe pateſynge countreys helde vnder ſubiection well worth yerely twenty thouſande florayns whan remembred ſoroufull treſour thought wolde nat mynyſſhe wonte dayly ſerche newe pyllages wherby encreſed profyte ſawe cloſed fro hym ſayde imagyned pyll robbe thynge conſydered good lyfe ſo repented hym good tyme ſaid olde companyons sir ſporte glory worlde amonge men warre vſe ſuche lyfe haue done tyme paſt ioy v whan rode forthe aduenture ſomtyme foūde way ryche priour marchaunt route mulettes mountpellyer narbone lymons fongans beſyers tholous carcaſſone laden clothe bruſelles peltre ware comynge fro fayres laden ſpycery fro bruges fro dama fro alyſaūder ſo euer met el raunſomed pleaſures dayly gate newe money vyllaynes auuergne lymoſyn dayly prouyded brought caſtell whete mele breed redy baken otes horſes lytter good wynes beffes fatte mottons pullayne wyldefoule euer furnyſſhed though ben kingꝭ whan rode forth ye coūtrey trymbled feare goynge comynge howe toke carlaſte bourge compayne perot bernoys tooke caluſet howe dyd ſcale lytell ayde ſtronge caſtell marquell pertayninge erle dolphyn kepte nat paſt fyue dayes receyued fayre table fyue thouſande frankes forgaue one thouſande loue erle dolphyns chyldren faythe fayre good lyfe wherfore repute ſelf ſore diſceyued haue rendred vp fortres aloys wolde haue ben kepte fro worlde daye gaue vp fournyſſhed vytayles haue kepte ſeuen yere without reuytaylynge erle armynake hathe dyſceyued olyue barbe perotle bernoys ſhewed howe ſhulde repente ſelfe certayne ſore repent haue done whan ſuche companyons ſerued hym longe herde hym ſpeke thoſe wordes parceyued well howe ſpake herte vnfayned ſayd hym aymergot redy yet ſerue lette v renewe agayne warre lette v gette ſome ſtronge holde auuergne lymoſyn let v fortifye ſyr ſhall ſoone recouer domages ſhall make goodly flyght auuergne lymoſyn nowe erle dolphyn hugh brother countrey dyuers knightes ſquyers company voyage barbary ſpecyally lorde coucy hath ſouerayne regarde vnder kynge thoſe march therfore ſhall nat nede feare hym duke berrey parys ſo thus ſhall haue nowe good ſeaſon well quod aymergot haue good wyll thus ſauynge ame name expreſſed chartre treuce ſyr quod company ye nede nat care therfore ye lyſte ye nat ſubiecte frenche kynge ye owe hym nother faythe obeyſayunce ye kynge englandes manne herytage whiche dyſtroyd loſt lyeth lymoſyn ſyr muſt lyue though make warre lyue englyſſhmen wyll nat myſcontent v ſuche caſe wyll drawe v ſyr haue nowe good tytle make warre nat auuergne couenaunte made bounde vnto lette v ſende vyllayns vyllages whanne one ſtronge holde commaunde paye v truage el make theym ſore warre well ſyrs quod aymergot fyrſt lette v prouyde ſtronge place abyde drawe vnto whan nede theym ſayde ſyr knowe ſtronge holde lytell newe fortifyenge pertaynynge herytage lorde towre man kepeth lette v drawe thyder fortifye may eaſe rynne auuergne lymoſyn lyeth place quod aymergot syr quod within leage towre called roche vandoys trewe quod aymergot knowe well mete place v lette v go thyder fortify thus purpoſe concluded day aſſembled togyther wente roche vandoys aymergote auewed place ſe worthe fortifyenge therof whan well auewed ſytuacion therof defence myght made pleaſed hym ryght well thus toke fortifyed lytell lytell began dyſpleaſure countrey whan ſawe place ſtronge ſufficyently reſyſt gaynſte ſyege aſſaute well horſed well prouyded thynges neceſſary defence beganne ryde abrode countrey tooke priſoners raunſomed prouyded holde fleſſhe meale waxe wyne ſalte yron ſtele neceſſaryes came nothynge amyſſe theym without hadde ben heuy hote countrey aboute people wenynge haue ben reſte peace reaſon truce made bytwene two kinges realmes began ſore abaſſhed theſe robber pyllers toke houſes ſo euer founde feldes laborynge called ſelfes aduenturers whanne lorde towre knewe ſuche neyghbours ſo nere hym nat well aſſured hym ſelfe fortifyed made good watche townes caſtelles counteſſe dolphyn ryght valyaunt lady great prudence beinge chyldren good towne ſtronge caſtell called sardes ſhe nat well aſſured ſelfe whan ſhe herde aymergotte company fortifyed yt roche vandoys ſent incontynente caſtell furnyſſhed men warre marquell oudable chyllac blere place entente ſhulde nat ſurpryſed ſhe greatly douted aymergot bycauſe hadde one paymente fyue thouſande florayns surely countrey auuergne lymoſyn began greatlye frayde thanne knyghtes ſquyers men good townes cleremount mounte ferante ryon determyned ſende frenche kinge ſo dyd meane ſeaſon whyle ſayde counteſſe good men countrey dyd ſende frenche kinge duke berrey parys aymergot company fortifyed greatly roche vandoys firſt made lodgynge horſes whan aduētures diſcharged wage herde howe aymergot made warre agayne ryght ioyfull therof many came hym anone mo theſe robber pyllers wolde haue demaunded wage hym onely myght bande ſuche myght company knewe well ſhulde lyghtly wynne ſomewhat habandoned robbe pyll thus rode vp downe made ſelfe knowen dyuers place ſpekynge auuergne lymoſyn roche vandoys coūtrey ſore afrayde caluſet wherof perotte le bernoys capytayne helde kepte fermely treuce made whan ſawe aymergot marcell ouer ranne ſo countrey ſore dyſpleaſed hym ſayde howe dyd yuell ſent hym worde none ſhulde come caluſet none place rewle aymergot cared nothynge hadde place ynowe drawe vnto beſyde menne ynowe dayly encreaſed ſuche mynded yuell drewe hym dayly perot bernoys charged ſuche vnder reule payne lyues none ſhulde ryde domage neighbour ſayde wolde ſurely kepe trewce olyue barbe captayne ouſac dyſſymuled mater ſayeng howe wolde kepe treuce howe ſhewed ſome men ſomtyme wolde ryde forthe ſecretlye wanne wolde haue profyte therof men countreys cleremount mount ferant ryon goynge meſſage frenche kynge duke berrey ſped ſo iourneys came parys founde kynge duke berrey duke thourayne conſtable fraunce ſir olyuer clyſſon came fyrſte duke berrey counſayle ſhewed cauſe commyng howe aymergot marcell made warre dyſtroyed countrey auuergne howe yuell people daily multyplyed wherfore deſyred goddeſſake haue ſome remedy ſayenge theſe yuell people ſhulde longe contyne wolde diſtroy countrey auuergne fronters lymoſyn whan theſe tydynges came kynge duke berrey ſore dyſpleaſed thought peace reaſon treuce kyng demaunded garyſon caluſet ouſac dyd yuell nat aunſwered ſayd complayned man al onely aymergot marcell company hathe fortifyed roche vandoys thanne kynge duke berrey aunſwered ſayd syrs ye good people take good herde ſelfes ſhall prouyde ſhortely remedy ye ſhall well perceyue▪ retourne place ſhewe aunſwere theym ſente hyther theſe good men auuergne well content aunſwere taryed two dayes thanne retourned toke leaue ſpecyally duke berrey ſo departed frenche kynge counſayle forgate nat theſe tydynges duke berrey whome matter touched greatly bycauſe helde great herytages auuergne therfore auaunced buſyneſſe ye haue herde howe lorde coucy ordayned kynge coūſayle capitayne haue ſoueraygne rewle countrey fro ſee rochell vnto ryuer dordone burdeaux ryuer geron lorde coucy nat countrey goynge voyage barbary lordes fraunce countreis howe departynge ordayned coſyn ſir robert bethune vycount meaulx lyeutenaunt ſayde countrey kyng ſayde howe mooſt meteſt vycount meaulx ſhulde haue charge voyage go lāguedocke rather than̄e perſone coude ryuer marne kynge wrote hym meſſangere founde hym wyfe counde delyuered letter fro frenche kynge vycount receyued theym whane knewe mente ſayde wolde obey kynges commaūdement prepared hym ſelfe ſoone myght departed fro coūde rode ſo long cae parys founde kynge counſayle ſayd vnto hym vycount make redy aſſemble men warre retynue ye muſt go auuergne thes pyllers robber whome aymergotte mercell chiefe enfourmed diſtroyech ſore traueyleth good people ye ſo moche driue theym countrey ye maye attrap ſayde aymergotte bring hym v ſhall haue great ioye therof ordayned ſhalbe delyuered ſuche ſommes money cleremount ſhall ſuffyce men warre go fro hen thider ſpeke oure treaſourers ſhall delyuer expenſes make haſte requyreth dyligence vycount aunſwered howe redy ſo went lodging wrote letter knyghtes ſquyers fraūce picardy acquayntaunce retynewe haſt ſhulde mete hym charter make muſters ſuch wrote vnto obeyed loued vycount helde hym good capitayne came cytie charter day prefyxed aſſembled two hūdred ſpeares good men warre whan̄e aſſembled departed fro charter tooke waye towardes auuergne ſo came burbonoys tidynges came auuergne howe ſocours cōmyng fraunce wherof countrey reioyſed nedefull theſe men warre came thyder ſo ſoone dyde hadde taryed ſixe dayes lengar aymergot marcell bande thought haue ouer ronne playne countrey bytwene cleremount moūtferante ryon ganape made voyage hadde done great dommage countrey valewe hundred thouſande frankes thoſe marcheſſe laye rycheſſe auuergne man ſhulde haue reſyſted thē countrey than̄e voyde man warre alſo brute aymergotte mercelles company farre mo nombre than̄e dede aymergotte redy haue made iourney tidynges came hym howe ſoeuer pylgrimes eſpyes vycoūt meaulx great company comynge agaynſt hym make hym warre putte hym fortreſſe roche vandoys theſe newes letted enterprice kepte hym ſelfe within holde thought ſhulde beſieged aymergot marcell began dought repented hym hadde done knewe well takenne ſhulde raunſome go hym thanne ſayd ſome company ſhamed haue beleued yuell counſayle couytouſneſſe ſhall diſtroye without haue conforte than̄e ſayde hym sir dought ye thus haue ſene hardyeſt man armes theſe marcheſſe haue good garyſon well prouyded men defence loue well defende oure bodyes ye defende ye leſe nothynge muſt leſe alſo aduenture ye taken ye ſhall make fynaunce accordynge reaſon ye haue good ynoughe haue nothynge taken lyeth heedes gette none remiſſion ſhall ſell ou • lyues dere lette v defende ſelfe aſwell nat abaſſhed thynge ſe thynke ſhall natte nede care ſiege lette v warre wiſely thus theſe companyons conforted aymergot marcell vycounte meaulx company came forward tyll came moleyns burbonoys ducheſſe burbone doughter erle dolphyn receyued vycount knightes ryght honorably made theym dyne paſſed forthe laye nyght ſaynt purſant fro then ganape ſo argre proſe ryon fro then cleremount well receyued byſſhoppe theym towne men warre money tayle gadered delyuered cleremont thanne paſſed forthe came oure lady dorinall four leages fro roche vā doyes vycount reſted ſente knyghtes ſquyers auuergne lymoſyn aſſembled nombre foure hundred ſpeares one hundred croſ bowes genowayes vycounte meaulxe lorde montague vermendiſyens brother lorde dommart ſir bernard de la ryuer ſir guyllyam butler lorde domme lorde de la roche lorde towre ſir loys dambyer lorde ſaynt ampyſſe ſir robert dalphyn dyuers capitayns genowayes two valyaunt ſquyers one named aubert neſpynolle callenace chefe stewarde vycount meaulx gentyll ſquyer called loyes leſglynell theſe genowayes croſ bowes armed peces elles ſhulde nat haue paſt wage vycount ⸪ whan̄e aymergot marcell guyotdu sall vncle vnderſtode theſe men war fraunce picardy auuergne gene come lady dornall mynded come laye ſiege holde roche vā doys aduyſed beſt make defence firſte conſydred well • kepe horſe ſeyng ſhulde beſieged nat farre fro roche vandois another ſtronge holde called ſaynt souperye vnder rule aymergotte mercell wyfe thyder ſente page horſes mooſt parte rycheſſe roche vandoys well fortifyed ſtode ſtronge grounde lorde towre ſore blamed countrey lefte place vnfortifyed vnprouyded cōmonly ſayde auuergne yt myght thanke lorde towre dōmage taken bicauſe might well haue kepte roche vandoys wolde nat haue kepte coſt myght haue delyuered men countre yt myght haue raſed ſuche wyſe ſhulde nat haue ben tenable left walles hole entyer founde roche vandoys ſette amonge highe mountayns rocke ſtandeth parte one ſyde walles rocke ſo fortifyed coude nat aſſayled fore parte ſcrymyſſhynge vycount meaulx deꝑted fro lady dorcynall knightes ſquyers genouoys croſ bowes ſo came roche vandoys lyke good men warre layde ſiege lytell lytell amended lodgynges whan̄e counteſſe alfyne beinge sardes knewe trewe tidynges roche vādoys beſieged ſhe right ioyfull bycauſe ſhe thought vicount meaulx come ſo farre fraūce picardy brought hym tentes pauilyons ordayned hym two fayre good tentes parteyning therle dolphyn ſente vycount maner lendynge hym durynge ſiege vycount toke preſent good gree recōmaunded hym hertely counteſſe thākyng tentes ſhe ſente hym ſhulde hym good ſeruyce lorde towre owne countrey within myle caſtell owne ſo yt lacked nothyng knyghtes ſquiers made prouiſion well myght vitaylles plentie fro partes reſonable price ſeaſon fayre drie hote ye moneth auguſt knyghtes cō panyons refreſſhed theym ſelfes vnder grene bowes tidynges came hooſt dyde put lordes companyons dout ſhewed gariſons ennemyes caluſet douſacke aſſembled toguyder determyned morenynge awake hooſt ware reyſe ſiege vycount meaulx knyghtes toke counſayle togyder determyned ſende heraude perot bernoys capitayne caluſette olyue barbe capitayne douſac knowe myndes entent nat ſurpriſed myght aſſured englyſſhe garyſōs accordyng aunſwere agayne therafter prouyde ſelfe ſente heraude enſtructed hym ſhulde ſaye heraulde departed fro hooſt rode caluſet thereby aduenture founde perotte barryers many company ſportyng caſtyng ſtone meſſanger lyghted horſe demaunded capitayne brought hym whan came hym dyde meſſage fro poynt poynt perot le bernoys ſayde heraude ſaye youre mayſters wyll holde kepe affermely trewly truece taken bytwene englande fraunce lyke maner wolde ſhulde kepe v knowe wyll breke vyolate peace maner incydent maye take ſhall ſuche correctyon aparteyneth doone haue promyſed wyll ye ſaye youre mayſters loke aymergotte hath done without counſayle neuer ſhewed v purpoſe dyde charge hym ſhulde nat medyll ſeignorie dyde ſhulde haue yuell ende heraulde hadde fortreſſe dyned tooke leaue gyuen hym ten frankes departed demaūded way douſacke founde olyue barbe capitayne fortreſſe heraulde ſpake hym lyke maner hadde doone perot le bernoys olyue barbe anſwered wyſe wolde breke treuſe bycauſe wolde nat diſhonored gaue hym ten frankes departed retourned mayſter ye roche vandoys knyghtes ſore deſyrous tidynges drewe vycoūt heraude ſhewed ben calyſet douſacke anſwere capitayns vicount prayſed moche perotte le bernoyes olyue barbe doute ſo contynued ſiege ſiege beyng roche vandoys euery day ſcrimyſſhing often tymes ſome hurte ſhotte genouoys croſ bowes genouoys good ſhoters thus ſiege cōtynued nyne wekes thenterprice garyſon greatlye aduauntage within ſhall ſhewe maner howe certayne place might iſſue pleaſure diſpyght ennemyes ſhulde haue kepte fro iſſues nede haue mo ſixe men thus durynge ſiege aymergot ryght ymaginatife conſydred thynges ſawe well howe nat done well tourne dede good maner thentent roche vandoys ſhulde ſtyll remayne wt hym ſent englande varlet letter credence kynge englande duke lancaſtre purpoſe brake mynde vncle called guyot du sall man thre ſcore yere age greatlye vſed dedes armes knewe moche ye worlde whan aymergote ſhewed hym maner howe wolde ſende englāde guyotte well agreed therto ſayde howe ſende wyſe man thyder coulde hurte ſente varlet ben brought vp among aymergot enſtructed hym ſayde ſhall ſette houſe ſaue garde peryll thou ſhalte haue golde ſyluer ynoughe thou ſhalte go englande theſe letter one kynge another duke lācaſtre thirde kynges counſayle theſe letter credence wyll demaunde occaſyon thy cōmynge thyder thou haſt made thy recōmendacion thou ſhalte ſaye yt aymergot mercell poore ſoudyour ſubiecte redy good wyll ſeruyce encloſed beſeged lytell fortreſſe parteyning feaultie lymoſyn belongyng kynge englandes herytage lye ſiege traueyleth taketh great payne daylye wyn v dothe defende fortreſſe capitayne without lorde coſyn lorde coucy called ſir robert vycount meaulx ſet frenche kyng therfore deſyre kynge counſayle ſpecially duke lancaſtre hath ſouerayne gouernaunce burdeloys kyng englādes heritage theſe ꝑties wolde pleaſe write cōmaunde vycount meaulx deꝑte fro ſiege reyſe army write vycount breke peace taken balyngham bytwene boloygne calays bycauſe doute aunſwere vicount wyll make theſe letter ſomwhat ſtronge fro warde therfore deſyre maye haue lykewyſe letter fro kyng counſayle fro duke lancaſtre duke berrey duke berrey wyll incontynent ſiege ſhall rayſed ſuretie deſyre haue ye ſome knight honoure kynges houſe duke lancaſters ſuche one duke berrey knoweth lordes fraunce ſhewe hym fro ſhall gyue hym c frankes remembre theſe wordes thy meſſage acordingly ſhewe thē thou ſpekeſt withall lytell fortreſſe haue fortified maye abyde ſtyll englyſſhe ſhall come well poynte ſpecially thē wyll make warre theſe party kynge englande fortreſſe ſtādeth frō ters countrey therby maye ſeaſon auuergne lymoſyn two thouſande frankes whan aymergot marcell guyotdu sall vncle well enſtructed varlet letter credence written ſealed delyuerd varlet departed nyght well accompanyed conueyed fote another fortreſſe ꝑteynynge aymergot called ſaint soupery toke horſe ſuche wolde choſe hadde great iourney ryde rode forthe realme fraūce lyke frenche man auuergne ſo came calais acquaynted hym ſelfe capitayne ſir iohan beauchampe ſhewed hym parte buſyneſſe entent haue ſoner paſſage came douer toke iourney lōdon fortune kynge englande two vncles duke lancaſtre kynges coūſayle ſame tyme palais weſtmynſter counſayling mater northumberlande ſcottes helde nat well trueſe complayntes made ſame tyme aymergottes varlet came lōdon toke lodgynge ſhewed hoſt parte ye cauſe commynge hoſt brought hym weſtmynſter cauſed hym firſte ſpeke duke lancaſtre chambre went counſayle ye varlet delyuered hym letter duke toke reed drewe hym parte demaunded credence varlet ſhewed hym hole mater ye haue herde duke herde hym well demaunded mo letter ſayd letter kyng counſayle well quod duke ſhall cauſe haue audyence duke went counſayle whan ſawe hour tyme moued varlettes mater duke aduauncement varlet ſente delyuered kyng coūſayle letter opyned reed demaunded credēce varlet hardy nat abaſſhed ſhewed buſineſſe aymergot marcell right ſagely better aſſured bycauſe euery man gaue hym good audiēce whan ſaid moche wolde thā anſwered kyng wolde take coūſayle mater make anſwere went counſayle chambre taryed tyll anſwere aunſwere kynge wolde write vycount meaulx alſo duke berrey accordyng aymergot requyred lykewiſe ſo promyſed duke lancaſtre whan letter writen gentylman duke lancaſtres apoynted bere theſe letter paſſed ſee went derby heralde better forther mater bycauſe aquaynted lordes auuergne ſpecially duke berrey gentylman duke lancaſters named herbery went better wyll bycauſe varlette promyſed hym behalfe aymergot hundred frākes thus thre departed came douer fro then tyde cali whan horſes vnſhypped toke waye boloygne ſo throughe picardy went parys fro then auuergne whan approched nere lymogines coūtre roche vā doyes ſette rode ſecretely come thyder thus haue ſhewed thes meſſangers dyde ſo moche came nere roche vā doyes whanne nere ſiege laye ſquyer heraulde thought beſt nat entre towne preſent tyme ſent varlet towne ſayeng wolde well ynough without company ſayd ſhulde ſene ſiege wolde ſuppoſe ben ſente englande thē varlet obeyed night entred ye towne without daūger
