aymergot marcell guyot du sall made hym good chere marueyle ſpedde iourney ſo ſhort ſpace ſhewed howe ſpedde howe ſquier duke lācaſters heraude come letter fro kyng fro duke lancaſtre bothe vycount meaulr duke berrey nede quod aymergot mercell nat come hyder caſtell sir ꝙ varlet ſayd two wolde meſſage well inough wold haue man ſene cōpany ſhulde come fro wyſer ꝙ guyot du sall therby ſhall ſeme mater toucheth kyng englāde duke lancaſtre sir trewe quod barlet thoſe tidynges aymergot ioyfull ſayde varlet thou haſt well dilygently ſpedde thy mater ſhorte ſeaſon ſhall well rewarde thy labour thus ſquyer heraude came ſtreight ſiege demaū ded vycoūtes lodgynge brought thyder founde vycount beholding men caſtyng ſtone kneled ſaluted hym agayne demaūded fro whens came anſwered ſaid howe cāe englande ſent thyder kyng duke lancaſter ye welcome ꝙ vycount mater hath brought wylde countrey sir quod heraude beholde ſquier duke lācaſters hath brought letter fro kynge englande fro duke lancaſtre pleaſe rede thē bycauſe ſōwhat knewe countrey come company ſquyer delyuered letter vycount receyued behelde ſeales knewe well came englande tooke one aparte coude rede reed letter fro poynt poynt two thre tymes tyll knewe well ment thā ſtudyed regarded well kyng englandes writyng ſayd writynge marueyle wolde lodge ſlepe reſte hym army men warre herytage dothe daylye breke peace whiche ought wyſe greatly • iudiciall haue ſette ſeales confyrmacion peace concluſyon letter howe kyng cōmaunded incontynent ſight letts company ſhulde departe reyſe ſiege ſuffre aymergot mercell peſably enioye houſe parteyning heritage whiche hath coſt hym great goodes fortifieng theſe wordes ſuche encloſed theſe letter ayde aymergot marcell lyke maner kynges letter ſpake duke lancaſter ſange ſame note commaundyng lyke excellent duke acquitayne duchy whan vicount meaulx well aduyſed hym ſelfe ſayde fayre ſirs theſe tidynges ye haue brought requyreth counſayle aduyſe ſhall take coūſayle ye ſhall anſwered made drīke vycountes wyne meane tyme vycount toke counſayle ſent lorde towre ſir guyllyam butler ſir robert dolphyn ſir loyes dābyer alſo lorde montaguy ſir berat de la ryuer houſe whan toguyder renewed wordes ſhewed cauſe ſent cauſed ye letter reed whan theſe lordes herde great marueile theſe letter coude brought englā de nat layne ſiege paſt moneth ſhall ſhewe quod vycount ſuppoſe aymergot marcell ſubtell man ſoone ſawe ſhulde beſieged thynke ſent incō tynent ſome meſſanger englande attayne theſe letter whiche maye obey lyſte ſhall anſwere ſhortely kyng england duke lancaſtre cōmaundeth wyll nothynge obey cōmaundementes nat bounde obey thē onelye frenche kynge whoſe cōmaundement ſent hyder call forthe ſquier heraude ſhall make anſwere brought forthe vycount began ſpeke foloweth derby tomelyn herbery thus ye named accordyng tenour letter apereth ye ſent hyther frothe kynge englande fro duke lancaſtre enfourmed nat tell howe outher aymergot marcell ſome wolde ayde hath ben england name howe preſent tyme army men warre lodged herytage kynge englandes commaundeth departe reyſe ſiege ſuffre aymergot marcell peaſably enioy lytell fortreſſe whiche hathe coſte ſo moche fortefyenge alſo ſende worde howe put ſelfe parell dyſhonorynge ſhulde conſent breke peace ſealed conf • rmed endure thre yeres bytwene two kynges alyes fayre ſirs ſay vnto wyll nothyng ſhall againſt charter peace wyll kepe treuce nothynge agaynſt though lodged breketh peace treuce ſubget frenche kynge hath ſent hyther hath admytted marſhall ſmall armye came knowledge kynge mayſter counſayle greuous complayntes noble men countrey auuergne lymoſyn howe taken great domages loſſes meanes aymergot aduyſed ſtrong place bytwene coūtr •• voyde nat inhabyted toke fortefyed hath nat made houſe peace ſolace ſtronge fortreſſe reſortynge place theues robber murderer whervpon cōmaūded defende countrey entent ſuche aſſembled fortteſſe ſhulde nat multyply wickedneſſe punyſſhe ſuche ſentence apartayneth treſpace entente put payne take whiche cōmaundemente mayſter wyll obey ſhall deuoyre acquyte truly fro hence wyll nat departe ſo euer cōmaundemente haue tyll haue fortreſſe within aymergot marcell wyll ſay auaunced breke peace lette hym come forthe ſhall fought withall one better ſhal cauſe proued dyuers poyntes artycles hym ſelfe breaketh peace sir thynges conſydred make aunſwere ye maye retourne whan pleace whan ye come ye wold ſay none otherwyſe leſſe haue ſayde often tymes reportes nat truely ſet enfourmeth lordes often tymes otherwyſe trouthe dede syr quod ſquyer come hyther none purpoſe reporte trouth ſe ſythe ye wyll none otherwyſe nede lenger abyde ſo toke leaue gyuen haraulde ten frankes honour kynge englande duke lancaſtre whan departed toke hyghe way cleremount ſayd wolde agayne parys whan halfe leage way began entre mater ſayd yet haue done nothynge behoueth v go duke berrey auuergne lorde countrey writeth hym ſelfe duke berrey auuergne counte meaulx dare nat diſpleaſe duke cōmaunde hym departe haue letter fro kynge mayſter fro duke lancaſtre hym wherfore reaſon delyuer maye knowe entente concluded purpoſe ſo rode cleremounte thyde • welcome haraulde knewe countrey whan demaūded anſwered meſſangers ſent fro kynge englande demaunded duke berrey ſhewed duke duches caſtell named nonec • e haraulde knewe well departed fro cleremount rode vyore fro then nonect hyghe mountayne paſſe one come caſtell whan came ye duke berrey many ſportynge without gate harauld knowen dyuers brought ye duke loue kynge englande duke lancaſtre made good chere ſquyer delyuered letter duke receyued opened red length two tymes ouer ſtudyed lytell anſwered curteſly ſayde syrs loue coſyns englande ſhall gladly power aunſwere ſquyer haraulde ryght ioyouſe thought howe ſped mater nat ſo ye ſhall howe duke berrey begynnynge dyd deuoyre haue rayſed ſiege pleaſe therby kynge englande duke lancaſtre deſyred ſiege myght reyſed roche vandoys lytell fortreſſe myght abyde ſtyll aymergot marcell haue done thyng dyſpleaſe frenche kyng coūſayle kynge englande wolde ſe ſhulde amendes made duke berrey bycauſe wold acquyte truely englyſſhe mennes deſyres ſuche houſe wrote incontynente letter well endyghted vycount meaul • theſe letter red ſealed englyſſhe men thought well ordayned theſe letter ſente notable ſquyer duke berreys vycount meaulx receyued opened vycount cauſed redde ſuche lordes hym whyle meſſanger drinkynge made hym good chere loue duke berrey reaſon sir quod vycounte ſhall nat reſt ſyth duke berrey wyll beare aymergot man world twelue yere hath moſte gr • ued traueyled coūtrey auuergne thought duke hated hym greatly ſemeth nay ſythe hath • rpreſly cōmaunded ſhulde departe fro hence faythe tyme wyll nat obey letter wyll make excuſe reaſon kynge coūſayle ſent hyder departynge fro parys ſtraytly cōmaunded cōmaundemente fro perſone nat fro kynge kymſelfe ſhulde nat departe fro hence tyll taken ſtronge holde roche vandoys aymergot therin whiche wyll canne nowe duke berrey cōmaundeth contrary chargeth incontynent letter ſene ſhulde reyſe ſyege faythe wyll nat syr quod aboute hym ye ſpeke royally truely ſhall abyde ſuppoſe occaſion duke berrey writeth thus aymergot englyſſh ſquier haraulde hath thus deſyred write thinke alſo haue brought letter hym fro kynge englande fro duke lancaſtre brought day ye ſay well quod vicounte ſhall knowe came duke berreys ſquier ſent haue anſwere vycount ſayd pyer wyll well ye knowe owe obeyſaunce duke berrey ſo nere kynne kynge dare nat dyſpleaſe hym companyons haue ben theſe fyue wekes ſiege wyn fortreſſe take theues within ſtrayte cō maundement kynge counſayle haue great marueyle good cauſe howe lorde berrey dothe commaunde v maketh requeſte enemyes ſhulde reyſe ſiege reaſon ſay generally ſhal gyue enſample theues robber ſuche wyll ouer ron realme worſt canne wherfore pyer ye ſhall ſay duke berrey fro v ſhall redy inclyned thynge commaundeth v caſe ſo ſtraytely enioyned cōmaunded kyng coūſayle kepe ſiege contynewe tyll haue fortreſſe within pleaſure whiche cōmaundemente dare nat brake ſay ſurely wyll obey cōmaundement alonely kynges whoſe ſubget iame whome ſente hyther ſir requyre ſhewe one thynge ye hath made requeſt aymergotte marcell hath done ſo moche yuell anoyaunce countrey auuergne lymoſyn nowe atrapped lyke traytoure ſhulde nere come yuell ende whiche hathe well deſerued hath erred done contrary othe syr quod ſquyer came lorde duke berrey two men englande haraulde another brought letter lorde fro kynge englande fro duke lancaſtre made greate requeſt aymergotte beleue well quod vycounte derby haraulde ſquyer called herbery brought daye lyke letter wherfore ſuppoſe kynge englande duke lancaſtre wrote duke berrey mater wherfore ſhewe lorde berrey deſyre conſydre thinges well theſe requeſtes come fro ſyde ſee deſyres purchaſed enemyes lorde ſyde ſee loue honoure profyte realme fraunce ſhulde enclyne condyſcende sir quod ſquyer ſhall forget nothynge ye haue ſhewed loue nat aymergot rather ſe punyſſhmente thanne delyueraunce squyer departed rode nonecte founde duke berrey dyd meſſage ryght ſagely concluſyon vycounte meaulx ſayde ſurely wold nat departe fro ſiege ye roche vandoys without kynge ſente hym ſtrayte commaundemente ſo aunſwere duke berrey nat well contente thought well commaundement ſhulde haue obeyed ſpecyally auuergne whan englyſſhe ſquyer derby haraulde herde anſwere made duke berrey howe ſiege nat rayſed ſory ſawe well traueyled vayne ſayde duke syr wyll ye counſayle v ſhall thus departe frome without ſpedynge thynge purpoſe kynge englande duke lancaſtre haue great truſte affyaunce ye ſhuld cauſe ſiege reyſed bycauſe roche vandoys vnder ſignoury syrs quod duke ſuffre ſeaſon aymergot marcell ſtronge place nedeth nat feare takyng without great vnhappe ſhortely purpoſe goo fraunce kynge thanne wyll ſpeke kynge counſayle loue coſyns englande ſhall beſte canne bringe matter paſſe ye ſhall go ſe howe ſhall ſpede thoſe wordes squyer haraulde contente fourth day duke departed fro nonecte lefte ducheſſe wyfe gret parte houſeholde ſo duke rode ryon auuergne taryed thanne eyght dayes erle sanxere lorde rule gone auignon aboute duke buſyneſſe whan come departed fro ryon togyther toke waye throughe burbonoys laſte came bourges berrey duke taryed two dayes rode mehun ryuer yeure caſtell one ye fayreſt houſes worlde thanne duke newly bylte coſte hym thre hundred thouſande frankes duke taryed fyftene dayes wherwith englyſſhe meſſangers ſore troubled howbeit coude fynde none remedy duke made lytell force delyueraunce aymergot ſhall ſhewe howe meanes erle sanxere lorde rule chefe duke counſayle ſyr peter meſpyn fayre maner blamed duke ſayde howe hadde nothinge medell buſyneſſe aymergot ſayenge lyfe hathe alwayes dyſhonourable howe falſe palyarte alwayes agaynſte crowne fraunce doone many vyllayne dedes roboryes auuergne lymoſyn mete parſone entreated wherfore ſyr quod ſuffre kynge counſayle deale hym lyſte theſe wordes ſuche refrayned duke berrey ſpeke mater howe two englyſſhe men dyd beſt remembre duke duke diſſymulynge aunſwered curteſſy ſayde syrs ſuffre ſeaſon ſhall ſhortely parys wordes taryed ſtyll mehun thanne thre wekes deuyſynge mayſter workeman keruers paynters therin great fantaſy mayſter workeman called maiſter andrewe one ye beſt worke men worlde englyſſhe man borne dwelte fraunce haynalte longe ſeaſon nowe ſhall ſhewe fortuned aymergot marcell roche vandoys aymergot farre caſtynge man whan ſawe yt ſiege nat reyſed thought well kyng englandes meſſangers coude nat ſpede ſute thought another turne departe then ryde nyght daye ſpeke capitaynes piergourt pyerguyſe guyot ſaint fayth ernalton ſaynt calombe ernalton roſtem iohn̄ morſen pier danchin remonet cōpayne dyuers gaſcoyns bernoyſe englyſſhe garyſons thought fayre wordes ſhuld cauſe aſſemble togyther come auuergne truſte wynne great botyes ſo mornyng night come reyſe ſiege vandoys take frenche men priſoners whiche ſhulde worthe hundred thouſande frankes beſyde botyes thanne ſhewed vncle guyot du sall purpoſe anſwered ſayd sir ſe nothynge good otherwyſe nat delyuered fro theſe frenche men well vncle ꝙ aymergot ſhall meſſage ſelfe ſyth ye counſayle therto ſhall deſyre one thynge departe quod ſo quod aymergot ſo euer ſkrymyſſhe frenche men make iſſue wyſe gate open nat barryers ye ye may rather leſe wynne sir quod guyot ſhalbe ware ynough ther ſhall kepe ſelfes cloſe within tyll retourne tydynges fro well fayre vncle requyre ſo canne nat diſpleaſe v none otherwayes aſſautes ſkrymyſſhes ye nede nat feare ſo ye kepe ſelfes cloſe within thus within thre dayes aymer gote departed fro roche vandoys onely acōpanyed page paſſed forth without daunger frenche men entenſyon brynge thyder companyons aduenturers rayſe ſiege many within houſe knewe nothyng departure myght departe whan loſt without knowlege euery day ſkrymyſſhynge aſſautes barryers within fyue ſixe dayes ye departure aymergot great aſſaute made frenche men thre partes guyot du sall good man armes longe tyme vſed exerciſyng therof howe day fortuned yuell reaſon lytell pryde brake ordynaunce coſyn aymergot ſet departed charged hym maner aſſaute ſhulde nat iſſue barryers aſſaute thre ſquyers french party two auuergne one bretayne ſkrimyſſhing valyauntly vpon pane wall nere fortreſſe theſe thre ſquyers aboue daye dyd moſte valyauntly auuergne called rycharde de la violecte lubinet rochfort breton named monadyke taken lymoſyn caſtell vanchador parteynynge ſir willyam butler aſſaute endured tyll nyght theſe thre ſquyers atcheued great laude prayſe traueyle payne wan nothyng another aſſaute vicount meaulx made buſſhment twelue men armes companyes layde olde houſe without fortreſſe commaūded another ſorte go ſkrymyſſhe barryers ſayenge thynke ſurely ſhall ſe within iſſue couetouſe wyn ſo withdrawe ſelfe lyt • lytell tyll paſt buſſhment ſhall breke alſo retourne agayne thus ſhall encloſed taken ſlayne beſt way ſe aduauntage thus vicount deuyſed ordeyned done named ſhulde lye buſſhment loys leſglynell robert bertencourte guylliam de saulſoy pyer du ſaynt vydall guyonet villeracque pier colle iohn̄ salmage nombre twelue layde themſelfe olde houſe without fortreſſe another ſorte went ſkrimyſſhed ye barryers belynot rochfort rycharde violecte monadyke freſſhly armed aparelled thentent within ſhulde haue corage iſſue alſo twelue alonly whan came bartyers began ſkrymyſſhe fayntly lyke ſuche perſones coulde lytell ſkyll feates armes wherfore guyot du sall made lytell force iſſued ſayde companyons▪ ſaynt marcell wyll iſſue barryers ſorte yonge cō panyons ſhewe knowe lytell dedes armes ſhall teche knowe ſhalbe priſoners nat eſcape v therwith opened barryers iſſued fyrſte guyot du sall remembred nochynge charge aymergot gyuen hym departynge great deſyre dedes armes wynne ſomwhat made begyn ſkrymyſſhe whan french men ſawe guyot du sall company come barryers ryght ioyfull began drawe backe lytell lytell fortreſſe purſewed wente ſo farre paſſed buſſhment whan ſawe tyme brake buſſhment bytwene fortres cryeng coucy vycount thus fortreſſe incloſed behynd whan guyot ſawe knewe well doone myſſe ſawe well harde hym ſcape reculed get agayne garyſon frenchemen waye whervnto ſhulde make longe proceſſe taken nat one eſcaped brought vycountes lodginge knyghtes hadde great ioye takynge thus counſayle bycount meaulx guyot du sall company atrapped taken brought lordes fraunce auuergne whan vycount ſawe guyot du sall demaunded aymergot marcell charged hym ſaye trouthe thought ben ſtill fortreſſe guyot du sall aunſwered howe coulde nat tell departed twelue dayes paſte lordes thought ſurely gone purchace ſome ayde priſoners cōmaunded parte vicount demaūded knightes auuergne beſte guyot du sall company ſayenge howe wolde vſe hymſelfe acordyng counſayle ſyr willyam butler aunſwered ſayde syr quod ſuppoſe aymergot gone ſocour rayſe companyons garyſons pyergourt pierguyſe ſhall fynde ſome alwayes come vpon v earely late beware theym wherby maye v domage peace trewce taken aymergot ſubtyle man ſyr let v one thyng ſhew vnto guyot du sall company without cauſe fortreſſe rendred handes ye wyll ſtryke heedes incontynente without thus let nat ſpared counſayle good quod vycounte dede chefe occaſyon become hyder haue fortreſſe though nat haue tyme aymergot marcell another ſeaſon ſhall fortune ryght well vycount lorde towre ſyr roberte dolphyn came fortreſſe nere myght aporche thyder brought guyot du sall company vycount ſpake ſayd guyot du sall guyot company knowe trouthe incontynent heedes ſhall ſtryken without ye yelde vp fortreſſe roche vandoys ye wyll rendre vp ſhall ſuffre go quyte nowe aduyſe ye well way ye wyll take lyfe deth thoſe wordes guyot company ſore abaſſhed laſt thought beſt ſaue lyues guyot anſwered ſayde syr ſhall beſt canne fortreſſe may yelden came barryer ſpake within rekened themſelfes clene dyſcomfyted ſeynge hadde loſt two mayſters beſt company ſoone guyot hadde ſpoken theym declared caſe ſtode agreed yelde vp fortreſſe condicionally yt myght departe bagge baggage moch coulde cary haue reſpyte moneth withdrawe whyther lyſte graunted ſute ſaueconducte made ſealed thus frenche men roche vandoys delyuered reaſon good fortune laſt ſkrimyſſhe wherfore comenly ſayde fortune good yuell falleth often tymes armes foloweth warre whan roche vandois yelded vp lordes fraunce auuergn • countrey ryght ioyous therof lordes helde well truely promeſſe made guyot du sall▪ whan caryed away moche coulde departed good aſſuraunce moneth go whyder pleaſed vycount meaul • abandoned roche vandoys men countrey incontynente dyd raſe downe ſuche wyſe lefte wall hele houſe ſtone vpon ſtone reuerſed erthe frenche men kinges ſeruice vycount toke leues knyghtes ſquyers auuergne ſo departed auuergne lymoſyn went owne houſes vycount meaul • gaue leaue parte company went rochell lodged ſaint iohans dangle kepe fronter coūtrey ſome pyllers robber ran ſometyme xantoigne whan ſawe aduauntage maner fourme haue ſhewed ye fortreſſe roche vandoys cōquered raſed downe wherof countrey ioyfull better ſuretie ſay trouth cōtynued wolde haue done many diſpleaſurs tydynges dede came knowledge duke berrey cautelon place owne ſtandynge bytwene charter mount le herrey nyne leages fro parys cared nothing colde grace kynge aymergot whan derby haraulde infourmed ſome duke knyghtes howe roche vandois taken beten downe ſayde ſquyer came thyder hym ſyr ye haue loſt hundred frankes aymergot promyſed howe ſo quod ſquier surely quod harauld roche vandoys gyuen vp rendred frenche men haue wonne therfore lette v take leaue duke berrey retourne englande haue nothynge well quod ſquyer ſythe ſo accorde therto toke leaue duke duke wrote kynge englande duke lancaſtre gaue haraulde departynge xl frankes ſquyer horſe thus departed toke next waye calays ſo englande tydinges came aymergot marcell purchaſyng frendes haue reyſed ſiege fortreſſe vandoys gyuen vp whan herde therof demaunded howe fortuned ſhewed hym howe reaſon ſkrymyſſhe iſſuyng vncle guyot du sall vnaduyſedly ah olde traytour ꝙ aymergot ſaynte marcell hym nowe ſhulde ſle hym myne owne handes hath dyſhonoured companyons departynge ſtraytely enioyned hym maner aſſaute ſkrymyſſhe made frenchman ſhulde wyſe open ye barryers hath done contrary domage nat recouered wote nat whether go caluſet douſac wyll kepe peace companyons ſpredde abrode lyke men dyſcomfyted dare neuer aſſemble agayne togyther though togyther yet wote nat whyder bring thus thynge conſydred harde parte haue gretly dyſpleaſed french kynge duke berrey lordes auuergne people countrey haue made warre peace durynge truſted haue nowe great aduenture leſe wotte nat reſorte counſayle wolde nowe goodes wyfe englande ſhulde ſurety howe ſhulde get thyder cary ſtufe ſhulde robbed twenty tymes coulde gette ſee paſſages poictou rochell fraunce normandy pycardy ſtraytely kept wyll harde ſcape fro takyng taken ſhall ſente frenche kynge ſo ſhall loſte myne thynke ſureſt waye drawe burdeaulr lytell lytell get good thyder abyd tyll warre renewe agayne haue good hoope treuce warre ſhall open agayne bytwene englande fraunce thus aymergot marcell debated matter hym ſelfe heuy ſorowfull wyſ • e nat waye take outher recouerſōe fortreſſe auuergne el go burdeaux ſende • wire thider goodes lytell lytell ſecretely hadde done ſo taken ſureſt waye dyde contrary therby loſt lyfe godes thus • ortune payeth people whan ſhe hath ſette thē higheſt parte whele ſodainly ſhe reuerſeth loweſt parte enſample aymergotte ſayd well worthe hundred thouſande frakes loſt daye wherfore may well ſaye fortune hath played pagiaunt hym ſhe hath done many mo ſhall aymergot trybulaci • remēbred hym ſelfe howe coſyn germayne auuergne ſquyer named tourne myne determyned go hym ſhewe hym trouble take counſayle deuyſed ſo dyd page onely came ye caſtell tourne myne thynkyng haue ben ſuretie bicauſe lynage proued contrary ſquyer nat duke berryes grace fauor whan ſawe coſyn aymergot houſe aduyſed take hym priſoner aduertyſe duke berey yt wolde forgyue hym diſpleaſure yuell wyll wolde ſend hym aymergot mercell hym pleaſure deuyſed ſo dyde whan aymergot within coſyns caſtell brought chābre layde ſwerde chaunged aparyll demaūded ſeruauntes ſayd coſyn tourne myne yet haue nat ſene hym sir quod chambre pleaſe come ſe hym ryght good wyll quod aymergotte ſeruauntes knewe ryght well mayſters pleaſure whan aymergot chaunged aparell doone cote defence wo • vſualy weare layde awaye ſwerde ſayd sir lette v go wolde ſe coſyn tourne myne long ſithe ſawe hym brought ſtreight tourne myne whan came hym aymergot dyde ſalute hym thought none yuell tourne myne aunſwered ſaide howe aymergotte▪ ſente come hyder ye wolde diſhonour wherfore take areſt priſoner otherwyſe ſhulde nat acquyte ſelfe truely crowne fraū ce lorde duke berrey ye falſe traytour ye haue broken truce wherto ye muſt anſwere cauſe lorde berrey hateth deedly nowe ſhall make peace ſhall delyuer hym outher quycke deed whiche wordes aymergotte ſore aba • ſhed ſaide howe ſo ſir youre coſyn certaynte ye ſhewe ſpeke • ſaye come hyder great truſt haue ſhewe buſineſſe make ſuch cruell chere gyue ſo harde word haue great marueyle nat tell quod tourne myne wha • ye wyll ſay haue ſaid ſhall fulfyll ſo layde hades hym ſeruauntes knowynge maiſters pleaſure toke aymergot without de ••• e makyng without weapen arm • r • alſo encloſed caſtell wordes coulde ſaye taken yrons putte vpon legges layde towre ſure kepars hym whan done cauſed caſtell gate ſhytte toke keyes hym ſelfe commaunded ſeruauntes payne lyues none ſo hardy go gate without ſent thyder comaandement vpholde wrote letts pleaſure dyrected duke berrey certifyeng hym howe hadde aymergot marcell priſone •• wolde ꝑdone hym yuell wyll wolde delyuer aymergot hanoes whan letter written ſealed commaunded one ſeruauntes ſuche truſted go fraunce duke berrey delyuer hym letter recōmende hym lowly hym nat retourne anſwere varlet toke letter moūted good horſe ſo deꝑted rode ſo longe came parys duke berey delyuered hym maiſters letter duke toke ye letter reed ſmyled ſayd ſuche knyghtes hym ſ • r wyll ye newe tidynges aymergot marcell taken priſoner owne coſyn germayne tourne myne hath taken hym ye knightes anſwered ſayd ſir good tidynges countrey auuergne lymoſyn haue hym longe ſeaſon yuell neyghbour hath done ſo moche yuell pleaſe worthy peyſe gybet ought haue none raunſome pardon nat ſaye ꝙ duke kyng counſayle wyll ſaye therto wyll ſpeke therin nat longe duke berrey toke barge ryuer seyne ſo came caſtell lour kyng coūſaile ſhewed theſe newes cauſed letter turne myne ſent hym reed whiche tidynges euery man ioyfull lordes ſaide well ſene ſuche maner robber pillers neuer cōe good ende duke berey deſyred ſende hym ſeneſchall auuergne brought paris put ye caſtell ſaynt antony furthermore ordayned tourne myne good ſeruice hadde done crowne fraūce diſpleaſures ſhulde clene gyuen hym thervpon letter patentes made ſent hym ſeruaunt wherof well content truſted thoſe letter ſhorte ſpace ſeneſchall auergne cōmiſſion fro duke berrey came caſtell tourne myne aymergot marcell delyuered hym wherof aymergotte ſore abaſſhed whan ſawe hym ſelfe cōpany enemy wherto ſhulde make lōge proceſſe ſeneſhall caried hym men armes long countrey paſſed ryuers seyne marewe bridge charenton ſo fro then caſtell ſaynt antony vicount darchy charged hym than̄e capitayne caſtell kepte hym nat long yt delyuered prouoſt chatelet parys trewe aymergot offred raunſome threſcore thouſande frankes wolde nat taken anſwered kyng riche ynough ſente chatelette nat long kepte iuged dye ſhamefully lyke traytour crowne fraunce ſoo daye caryed chariot place called halle ſette pyllary treſpaſſes reed hym hym ſir wylliam trune ſpake moche hym thought yt knowe ſtate certayne capitayns auuergne whether conſentyng dedes nat lordes knewe well coude neuer haue knowlege therof thus executed heed ſtryken body quartred quarter ſette euery gate parys ende came aymergotte marcell wyfe goodes knewe nat becāe ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe chryſten lordes geno wayes beyng yſle conymbres ancre departed then go laye ſiege ſtronge cytie aufryke barbary howe maynteyned ſiege cap clxxi haue ſpoken length lyfe aymergot mercell furnyſſhe hyſtorie condycions bothe yuell good ought alwayes treated hyſtory ſpecially whan toucheth great feate enſample gyue mater occaſyon well aymergotte ledde lyfe good vertues ben man great valure bycauſe dyde cōtrary came yuell ende ¶ nowe let v leaue ſpekyng hym let v retourne hyghe enterprice chriſten knyghtes fraunce nacyous dyd ſeaſon realme aufryke wyll begyn lefte ſayd lordes aſſembled yſle conymbres paſſed tempeſtes paryls goulfe lyon taryed eche cytie aufryke xxx thouſande yſle conymbres nyne dayes refreſſhed patron galees ſayde lordes sir lande next aprochyng marcheſſe aufryke whider grace god ye purpoſed go laye liege wherfore behouable take co • ſayle eche howe maye entre hauen take lāde ſaue ſelfe beſt ſenoe formaſt lytell ſhyppes called brigandyns let v tary mouthe hauyn ye firſt day aproche nyght nexte mornynge take lande grace god leyſar lodge ſelfes nere cytie maye without ſhotte artyllary let v ſette croſbowes genouois order ſhal redy defende ſcirmyſſhes ſuppoſe well whan ſhall take ladynge ye haue ī cōpanyes many yong ſquyers enhaūce honour wyll requyre haue order knighthode ſtructe wiſely ſwetely howe ſhall mentayne themſelfes lordes knowe trouthe ſee men ſhall acquyte v vnto well truely alwayes ſhewe maner order ſhall mooſt greue enemyes ſhall take payne ſtudy howe cytie aufryke may ofte tymes haue done v great dōmage coſte chiefe key barbary realmes foloweth firſt realme aufrike mallorques bougy god grace wyll conſent maye wyn cytie aufrike sarazyns wyll trymble realme liby sury ſo worlde ſhall ſpeke therof ayde chriſten realmes yſles marchyng nere aufrike ſhall always refreſhed vitayls newe men cōmon vo • age euery man wyll deſyre dayly dedes armes ſpecially goddes enemyes thus cō cluſion proceſſe patron ſaid lordes ſay nat preſūpcion maner teche ye ſhuld haue ſayd onely loue humilyte ye noble men ſage valyant better order euery thyng deuyſe ſpeke lorde coucy ſaid ſirs good counſayle aduyſe ought gretly content v ſe thyng therin good ſirs ye ſure ſhall nothyng without coū ſayle ye haue brought v hyder dedes armes thus preſence duke burbone lordes coū ſayled toguyder yſle conymbres myght aproche ye ſtrong towne aufryke whan euery thyng well aduyſed ſette good order admyrall patron galees wynde wether ſerued euery lorde entred galee amōg owne men hauyng great deſyre encoūtre enemyes ſarazyns trūpettes blewe vp departyng great pleaſure beholde ore howe rowed abrode ſee whiche peaſable calme fayre ſo maner ſee ſhewed ſelfe ſhe great deſyre yt chriſten men ſhulde come ſtronge towne aufryke chriſten nauy goodly regarde well ordred great beautie ſe baners penons ſilke armes badge ye lordes wauyng wynde ſhynyng agaynſt ſon̄e within hour noone chriſten men perceyued ye hygh towres towne aufrike farder ſayled nerer ſhewed ſyghtes wherfore euery man reioyſed good cauſe ſeyng deſyred cōe thyder thought thā maner paynes releaſed voyage accomplyſſhed thus aproched thentre realme aufryke cōmuned deuyſed among themſelfe lyke maner ſarazyns within towne aufryke ſpake deuyſed ſore abaſſhed whan ſawe enemy aproche ſuche nombre ſayles ſayde ſurely lykely beſieged howe thought towne ſo ſtrōg towres walles artyllary therwith reconforted toke corage gyue warnyng countrey ſoone ſawe enemyes see hyghe towres ſowned tymbres tabour accordynge vſage ſuche wyſe men abrode countrey drewe toguyder suche men barbary ben ſente thyder kynge aufryke kynge thunes bougy whan knewe chriſten mennes cōmynge reaſon noyſe tymbres tabour thentent ſhulde nat entre farre coū treis euery man tooke hede charge ſente certayne capitayns see ſyde ſe aprochyng ye chriſten men beholde dealyng nyght alſo prouyded defende towres gate hauyn aufryke entent negligēce towne aufryke ſhulde take dōmage whiche towne ſo ſtrong nat lykely take great hurte without longe ſiege iohan froyſſart auctour cronycle bycauſe neuer aufryke bycauſe myght truely write maner faſcion enterprice alwayes deſyred ſuche knyghtes ſquyers ben ye ſame voyage enforme euery thyng bycauſe oftentymes dayes calays demaunded alſo ſuche ben ſayde voyage ſhewed ſuretie ſarazyns amonge ſelfes ſayde howe chriſten men expert ſubtyle men armes whervpon auncyent ſarazyn ſayd company sir thynges cōſydred beſt chriſten men begynnyng ſe nat ſtrength puiſſaunce alſo haue nat men ſuffyciēt fyght daylye men wyll cōe v wherfore thynke beſt ſuf • thē take lāde haue horſes ouer ron countrey wyll nat ſprede abrode kepe togyder feare v towne ſtronge ynoughe well prouyded nede nat feare aſſautꝭ ayre hote wyll hotter lodged ſonne ſhadowe ſhall dayly waſt vitaylles ſhalbe • ute hope recouer newe lye long ſeaſon ſhall haue plē tie owne countrey ſhall oftētymes awaked ſcrimyſſhed withall dōmage aduauntage lette v nat fight wyſe nat diſconfyte v haue nat ben vſed ayre countrey whiche contrary nature thynke beſt waye ſaieng aūcient knight ſarazyn agreed than̄e cōmaunded payne dethe man ſhulde go ſee ſyde ſcrymyſſhe chriſten men without cōmaunded kepe ſelfe cloſe lodgynges ſuffre chriſten men take lande determynacion vp holde none durſt breke ſent certayne archer towne aufryke ayde defende sarazyns ſhewed theme ſelfes nothyng though ther men countrey chriſten men lodged night mouthe hauyn aufryke nexte mornynge wether fayre clere ayre good temper ſonne roſe pleaſure beholde than̄e chriſten men began ſtyrre made thē redy hauynge great deſyre approche towne aufryke take lande trumpettes claryons began ſowne gallees veſſelles made great noiſe nyne clocke whan chriſten men taken lytell refreſſ hynge drinke reioyſed lighted accordyng apoynted ſent fyrſt lyght veſſelles called brigandyns well furniſſhed artyllary entred hauyn came armed galees ſhyppes flete good order tournyng towardes lande ſee ſyde ther ſtrong caſtell hyghe towres ſpecially one towre whiche defended ſee ſyde lande alſo towre bricoll engyn whiche nat ydell ſtyll dyde caſt great ſtones amonge chriſten men ſhyppes lyke wiſe euery towre towne agaynſt see ſyde engyns caſte ſtones ſarazyns well prouyded towne loked euer longe whane ſhulde beſieged whan chriſten men entred hauen aufryke take lande pleſaunt ſyght beholde order claryons trumpettes ſounde ſo hyghe clere dyuers knightes valyaunt men realme fraū ce ſprede abrode day baners dyuers newe made knyghtes lorde iohan lignye firſte made knight countrey chauny made handes coſyn named ſir henry dantoygne ſprede abrode firſt baner felde golde bende goules companye coſyn germayne lorde hauret chauny thus lordes knyghtes ſquyers great deſyre auaunced toke lande lodged lande enemyes ſight falſe ſarazyns wedniſdaye euenyng mary magdaleyne yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore toke lāde lodged marſhalles ſarazyns within ye towne prayſed moche chriſten mēnes order bycauſe great galees coulde nat aproche nere lande men yſſued bottes toke lande folowed baner lady sarazins within towne ſuche abrode countrey ſuffered chriſten men peſably take lande ſawe well ſhulde nat aduauntage haue fought landyng duke burbone chefe chriſten armye lodged myddes company ryght honorably baner diſplayed poudred full floure du lyces ymage lady myddes ſcochynne armes burbone vnder fete ymage ¶ fyrſte ryght hande duke lodged brother ſir guylliam tremoyle penon lorde bordenay baner ſir helyon lygnacke penon lorde tourſe penon henowers ſtanderde lorde wyllyam heynaulte erle oſtrenaunt eldeſt ſonne duke aubert bauyere erle heynaulte hollande zelande deuyſe ye ſtanderde herſe golde ſtandyng bell goules lorde haureth wt baner lorde ligny baner ſir philyppe dartoys erle ewe baner lorde mateſelon baner lorde calam penon seneſchall ewe penon lorde lynyers baner lorde thune baner lorde ameuall baner ſir water champenon penon ſir ioh • caſtell morant baner marſhall sanxeres brother penon lorde coucy baner beſte apoynted nexte duke burbone ſir stephyne sanxere penon frēche kynges penon deuyce therby ſir iohan barroys penon armes ſir guylliam morles baner lorde lōgueuall penon ſir iohan roye baner lorde bourſe penon vycount dauſney baner lorde admyrall baner called iohan vyen ¶ nowe foloweth duke lyfte hande lyfte hande loyes duke burbone lodged foloweth firſt lorde auſemont bauyere ſir iohan beauforde baſtarde ſonne duke lancaſtre baner diſplayed ſir iohan butler englyſſhe penon ſir iohan crama baner souldyche leſtrade penon ſir iohan harcourt baner ye lorde beraulte erle cleremount dolphin auuergne baner ſir hugh dolphyn brother penon lorde bertencourt penon lorde pyer buffyer baner lorde ſaynt semere baner lorde lauuart marſhall hooſt baner lorde bergue beauſſe penon lorde louuy baner ſir gerarde lymo • yn brother penon lorde ſaynt germayne baner penon ſtāderde deuyce duke burgoyn ſir philyppe barre baner ſir geffray charney baner ſir loyes poicters penon ſir robert calabre penon vycount s baner lorde montague baner lorde vyle neufe penon ſir wyllyam molyne penon lorde lōgny penon ſir angorget damboyſe penon ſir aleyne chāpayne penon theſe baners penons ſette front ye towne aufryke beſyde great nombre knyghtes ſquyers ryght valyaunt men • fhighe corage lodged abrode felde cannat name alſo wolde long writyng fourtene thouſande gentylmen companye great feate ſuſteyne great batyle ſarazyns come forthe haue gyuen batayle whiche dyd nat yt day ſhewed maner defence caſtyng towres great ſtones whan chriſten men lodged well myght refreſſhed ſelfes ſuche brought myght nat ryn abrode countrey gather bowes tree make lodgynges • ben domage aduentured themſelfe abrode lordes tentes pauiliōs brought fro geane thus lodged good order croſbowes genouoys lodged wynges cloſed lordes occupyed great ſpace groūde great nombre prouiſyons galees day maryners conueyed ſtuffe • ande bottes whan chriſten yſles adioynyng naples • cicyll alſo mayne landes puylle calabre whan knewe howe chriſten men beſieged ſtrong caſtell aufryke dyd coude vitayle chriſten army ſome haue aduaūtage therby ſome loue affection genouoys fro yſle caude came good malueyſies great plenty without whiche conforte coude nat longe haue endured great nombre good drinker good caters howe prouiſ • ons came nat alwayes thē lyke maner ſomtyme plentie ſome ſeaſon wanted ¶ nowe ſhall ſomwhat ſpeke ſarazyns aſwell haue done chriſten men reaſon cō clude thynges trewe aufrike barbary knewe longe howe genowayes hadde thretned loked none thyng ſame yere beſieged dede hadde made prouiſyon reſyſt agaynſt whan tidynges ſprede abrode countrey howe chriſtenmen come aufryke dout nat wiſe feareth nat ennemyes thoughe neuer ſo fewe howe ſarazyns reputed chriſten men right valyant good men warre wherfore greatly douted entent reſyſt defende fronters countreys aſſembled toguyder dyuers party lande ſeignorie aufrike realme maroche ye realme bougye beſt men warre thoſe countreis ſuche leeſt feared dethe thus came lodged ſandes agaynſt chriſten men behynde highe wode thentent ſhulde receyue ſyde dōmage meanes buſſhmentes ſcrimyſſhes theſe ſarazins lodged ſelfes right ſagely ſurely men warre xxx thouſande good archer ten thouſande horſemen mo howe chriſten men coude neuer knowe ſurely nombre ſuppoſed greater nombre lodged woodes whiche myght ryght well owne coūtre might go come hoſt houres without paryll dommage owne lybertie often tymes refreſſhed newe vitayls brought ſomers camelles ſecōde day englyſſhe men lande mornyng breke day ſame nyght lorde henry dautoygne kepte watche two hundred men armes thouſande croſbowes genowayes ſarazyns came awake ſcrimyſſhe theym whiche endured ſpace tow houres many dedes armes atchyued ye ſarazins wolde nat ioyne fyght hande hande ſcrimyſſhed caſtyng dartes ſhotynge wolde nat folyſſhely aduenture thēſelfes wiſely ſagely reculed chriſten hooſt apparelled go ſcrimyſſhe ſome great lordes fraunce came thyder ſe deme anour ſarazyns therby know n • ther tyme maner ſkrymyſſhynge thus ſarazyns drewe lodgynge cryſten men durynge ſiege cryſten men neuer ſuretie reſt outher euenynge mornynge ſarazyns wolde awake ſkrymyſſhe amonge ſarazyns yonge knight called agadingor dolyferne alwayes well mounted redy lyght horſe ſemed whan horſe ranne dyd flye ayre knyght ſemed good man armes dedes bare always vſage thre fedred dartes ryght well coulde handle acordynge cuſtome clene armed long whyte well aboute heed aparell blacke owne coloure browne good horſeman cryſten men ſayde thought dyd ſuche dedes loue ſome yonge lady countrey trewe loued entyrely kynge thunes doughter named lady azala ſhe enherytour realme thunes ye diſceaſe kyng father agadingor ſonne duke olyferne nat tell maryed togyther nat ſhewed knyght loue ſayd lady durynge ſiege dyd many feates armes knyghtes faunce wolde fayne haue taken hym coulde neuer atrape encloſe horſe ſo ſwyft ſo redy hande yt alwaies ſkaped cryſten men wolde gladly haue taken ſome ſarazyn entente haue knowen ſtate towne countrey ſkrymyſſhynge coulde neuer gette none ſaraſyns toke good hede themſelfe dyd paueſſe themſelfe agaynſt croſebowes genouoys werenat ſo well armed criſten men nat vſage armorer metall forge harneſſe withall moſt comenly lacke yron ſteele euer armed lether beare targettes aboute neckes couered made cure boley capadoce wepen perce lether nat hote ſo whan come nere enemyes caſt dartes one whan genouoys ſhote theym couche ſelfe lowe couer targes whan ſhotte paſte caſte agayne fedred dartes thus ſpace nyne wekes durynge ſiege often tymes ſkrymyſſhed ſo dyuers hurte bothe party ſpecially ſuche lyghtly without uyſement aduentured ſelfe thus cryſten men toke good hede themſelfe ſo dyd ſarazyns parte lordes fraunce ſuche com • thyder ayde gladly regarded dealynge ſarazyns ſaye trouthe lordes aſtate gret men newelties dylectable cryſten men hadde pleaſure beholde ſarazyns great pleaſure regarde maner cryſten men amonge yonge luſty knyghtes great pleaſure beholde armure baners ſtandardes penons rycheſſe nobleneſſe amonge cryſten men nyght whan lodgynges ſpake deuyſed ſhewed one thynge amonge marueyled ſhall ſhewe ſarazyns within towne aufryke great marueyle tytell inſtaunce yt cryſten men came thyder ſo ſtrongly make warre ſhewed howe toke aduyſe amonge howe knowe trouth therof determyned ſende cryſten men knowe myndes ſo toke truchman coulde ſpeke italyan commaunded hym go cryſten hoſt demaūde tytle inſtaunce come make v warre come ſo ſtrongly empyre barbary lande auffryke ſaye howe haue nothynge treſpaſed trouth afore tyme hath ben warre bytwene v genouoys warre reaſon ought nat touche cryſten men farre countreys genouoys neyghbours take v haue auncyente enemyes ſhall excepte whan treuce bytwene v meſſage trucheman departed rode cryſten army mette fyrſt genoway ſhewed hym howe meſſanger ſent fro ye ſarazyns ſpeke ſome lorde fraunce genoway name anthony marthy centuryon croſbowes brought meſſanger duke burbon lorde coucy gladly herde hym ſpeke wordes ſpake owne langage centuryon genoway expowned theym frenche whan meſſanger declared meſſage deſyred haue anuſwere lordes fraunce ſayde ſhulde haue firſt wolde take aduyſe mater xii greateſt lordes drewe togyder counſayle duke burbons tent concluded ſo ſent meſſanger genouoy made anſwere al name sayeng howe tytle quarell made warre bycauſe ſonne god called ieſu chryſt trewe profyte lyne generacyon put deth crucyfyed bycauſe iudged god deth without tytell reaſon therfore wolde haue mendes punyſſhe treſpace falſe iudgement lawe made alſo bycauſe beleued nat holy baptyme euer contrary faythe lawe alſo bycauſe beleued nat virgyn mary • ther iheſu cryſt f • r theſe cauſes ſayd toke ſarazyns ſecte enemyes ſayd howe wolde reuenge diſpytes doone dayly god cryſten faythe anſwere treuchman retourned without parell domage ſhewed mayſters ye haue herde aunſwere ſarazyns dyd nothinge laugh ſayd howe aunſwere nothynge reaſonable iewes put chryſt dethe nat thus ſiege ſtyll endured euery party making good watche anone ſarazyns toke counſayle togyder determyned ſeuen eight dayes togyther ſhulde ſuffre cryſten men reſte nat make maner ſkrymyſſhe ſodaynly nyght hour mydnyght ſette hooſt truſtynge therby great feate ordayned ſo dyd eyght dayes togyther made ſkrymyſſhe ix day mydnight ſecretly armed ſuch armure accuſtomed ſo came cloſe togyder without noyſe nere lodgynges cryſten men enterpryſed haue done great feate haue entred nat ſide watche parte felde watche kept come entente god properly nat ben agaynſt ſhewynge apparante myracles ſhall ſhewe howe ſarazyns aproched ſawe ſodenly great company ladyes damoſels whyte colour one eſpecyall beauty without compariſon exceded borne baner whyte reed within ſyght ſarazyns ſo abaſſhed lacked ſpyrite force go ſo ſtode ſtyll ladyes alſo ſhewed genouoys great dogge company brought theym knewe nat fro whence came none chalenged dogge whiche dogge dyd theym great ſeruyce ſarazyns coulde neuer come ſo pryuely ſkrymyſſhe dogge wolde bay make ſuche brewte wold nat reſt tyll ſuch ſlepe awaked euery man knewe whan herde dogge baye ſarazyns commyng ſkrymyſſhe wherby euer aparelled ſelfe reſyſt genouoys called dogge lady dogge ſame ſeaſon ſarazyns ſtode ſtyll traunce ladyes dogge n • ydell made gret brute ranne bayeng fyrſt ſtande watche lorde coucy ſir henry dantoigne kept watche night whan euery man herde dogge make ſuche brute roſe armed redy knew well ſarazyns dyd aproche awake trewe vyrgyn mary company defende cryſten men fro parelles ſo toke nyght maner domage ſarazyns durſt nat aproche retourned lodgynges cryſten men toke better hede watche ſarazyns knyghtes ſquyers ſuche ye towne aufryke ſpecially ſuche ſene theſe ladyes ſo abaſſhed wyſte nat thynke cryſten knightes ſquyers lay ſiege ſtudyed day nyght howe myght wyn towne within ſtudyed agayne howe defende towne ſeaſon hote drye ſonne moſte ſtrength moneth auguſt march aufryke ryght hoote reaſon ſande alſo nerer ſonne wynes cryſten men came fro pulle calabre hote drye farre fro nature french wynes wherby many fell hoote feuers conſydre acordynge reaſon nat tell howe frenche men lowe countreys coulde endure payne hote groſe ayre founde without refreſſhynge good ſwete freſſhe water whiche lacked yet made fountaynes welles ſande whiche dyde theym great pleaſure found • freſſh water often tymes water ſore chafed reaſon heate alſo often tymes great defaute vytaylles ſome ſeaſon ynough comynge fro cicyll fro iſles adioynynge suche werehole comforted dyſſeaſed ſuche vytayles departed theym lacked wyſe coulde nat haue endured dalte eche lyke bretherne frendes lorde coucy ſpecyally chyefe reſorte gentleman coulde behaue hym ſelfe ſwetely amonge moche better duke burbone duke ſome high corage proude preſumptuous ſpake nat ſo ſwetely ſo humbly knyghtes ſquyers ſtraungers lorde coucy dyd moſte comenly duke burbone wolde ſytte daye without tente legges acroſſe ſo euer wold ſpeke hym behoued haue procurer make great reuerence conſydred nat ſtate poore men ſo well lorde coucy dyd wherfore grace loue people thanne duke burbon ſhewed • e dyuers knyghtes ſquyers ſtraungers opynyons lorde coucy ben ſoueraygne capytayne alone ſped otherwyſe dyd reaſon pride duke burbon many feates enterpriſes lefte vndone opynyon many kepte hym ſelfe ſure ynough fro takynge ſiege enduringe towne aufryke whiche contynewed lx dayes one many ſkrymyſſhes made bothe party • abrode barryers towne nedefull within make good defēce againſt floure chyualry ſquyry knyghtes aduenturers ſayd one another maye get towne aſſaute otherwyſe may refreſſhe ſelfes wynter ſomer great armye cryſten men wyll come byther ther ſhall haue goodly entre realmes barbary aufryke thunes dyd ſay wolde god ſo thanne ſuche ſhulde lodged ſhulde lye honorably dayly ſhulde redy dedes armes within towne doubted greatly mater wherfore tooke great payne defende ſelfes great heate brinnynge ſonne dyd put cryſten men great payne traueyle whan harneſſe reaſon heate brente within armure marueyle ſkaped dethe reaſon heate myddes auguſt ayre ſore corrupted beſyde fell another marueylous incydente whiche longe endured ben deed without ſtroke reaſon great heate corrupcyon ayre fell amonge ſuche ſorte great flyes couered hooſt man wyſte howe defende hym ſelfe euery daye weke togyder encreaſed wherof euery man abaſſhed howe grace god vyrgyn mary whome euery man auowed ſelfe day dyd ſende remedy fell ſuche hayle lyghtenyng fro heuen ſlewe ſayde flyes reaſon hayle ayre brought good temperateneſſe wherby ye knyghtes ſquyers better aſtate ſo euer caſe theſe cryſten men yt tyme muſt haue behoued take euery thynge gree coulde nat haue euery thynge wyſſhynge demaunde whan fell ſicke behoued well kepte el ſhulde haue dyed come thyder ſo good wylles affection purpoſed honourably accomplyſſhe voyage whiche mynde greatly ſupported thē endure payne traueyle thynges mete complexion wanted nothynge came realme fraunce tydynges fraunce knewe ſomtyme came army fro cytie barcelone realme aragon galey prouyſion wherin mo orenges pomegarnettes thynge theſe frutes yet refreſſhed greatly appetytes cryſten men whan ſo euer galey came retourned nat agayne doute encoūtryng ſarazyns ſee abyde ſe concluſyon ſiege yonge kynge cicyll often tymes ſente hooſt vytaylles nerte cryſten prince adioynynge ſarazyns ben ſtrength haue ſtopped paſſage ſee fro haue kepte fro ſuche vytayls prouyſions came armye fro pule calabre naples cicyll cryſten men ben deed without ſtroke ſtryking made warre lande alſo nat ſuche puyſſaunce ſee nother gale veſſels genouoys venyſians ſarazyns ſee ſtelthe dare nat abyde cryſten men without haue farre aduaūtage galey cryſten men well armed wyll diſcomfyte four galees ſarazyns trewe turkes greater force better men armes outher lande ſee ſecte myſcreantes contrary beleue dwell farre fro lande aufryke affrikans nat ayded thē turkes certayne knowledge howe towne aufryke beſyeged cryſten men wyſſhed often tymes cryſten men ſtudyed howe domage ſarazyns lyke wyſe ſo dyd ſarazyns agaynſt chryſten men ſtudyed howe delyuer coūtrey day agadingor doliferne madefer de thunes belyns madages brahadyn bougy dyuers ſarazyns deuyſed amonge ſelfes ſayd beholde cryſten men enemyes lye face owne countrey yet nat diſcomfyte handefull men regarde v howe thinke veryly haue ſome great confort ſome valyaunt men owne countreys maner ſkrymyſſh make euer take neuer priſoner myght take one two valyaūt men ſhulde greatly honour knowe demeanour puyſſaunce purpoſe syrs ꝙ agadingor let ſe counſayle beſt caſe one yongeſt yet ſpeke fyrſt contente therwith quod ſay ye wyll syrs quod deſyre greatly ſome dede armes ſome cryſten man thynke veryly matched one dyſcomfyte hym playne batayle ſyrs ye wyll ſo myght fynde xx xxx valyaunt men monge v ſhall cauſe canne cryſten men ſette forthe many quarell good haue cauſe reaſon make warre againſt v thynke reaſon iuſte quarell good corage ſhall gyue v victory madyfer thunes aunſwered ſayd syr wordes nothyng honour morowe ye wyll ryde former fronte batayle trucheman make ſome token ye wolde ſpeke ſome cryſten man ſo moche offre batayle x agaynſt ten ſhall ye ſe wyll aunſwere yet howe ſo euer anſwere may aduyſed wyll leſte cryſten men ſhall repute v valyaunt agreed apoyntmente ſo paſſed nyght next mornyng rode forth ſkrymyſſhe enemyes agadingor formeſt mounted good horſe trucheman daye clere bright lytell ſonne ryſynge ſarazyns ſet ſelfe ordre batayle ſame nyght ſir willyam tremoyle kept watch ye cryſten parte hym ſir guy brother ſarazins apered criſten men within thre croſbowe ſhot agadingor truchman rode cō pany made token ſpeke ſome cryſten man one wynge felde gentle ſquyer called affrenall ſeyng ſarazyn ſygnes made rode fro company ſayd syrs ſtande ſtyll wyll go ſpeke yōder ſarazyn torne agayne hath truchman hym cometh ſpeke ſome man ſquier came ye ſarazyn taryed truchman ſaid ye cryſten man noble man man armes redy gyue aunſwere demaunde ſuche one quod affrenall ſay pleace ye ſhalbe harde receyued quod trucheman ſyr beholde gentleman noble man demaundeth batayle fyght hande hande ye wyll haue mo ſhall fynde nombre ſixe redy fight vi quarell men ſhalbe ſay wyll iuſtifye faythe better valure faythe lawe hath ben written ſyth begynning worlde lawe foūde one man whome iewes hanged croſſe ahſyr quod affrenall ſpeke mater appertaygneth nat ſpeke diſpute fayth lawe ſay ſarazyn ſwere fayth beleue afferme batayle let hym bringe nombre x gentleman name armes within thre houres ſhall bringe many try mater truthman reſyted thoſe wordes ſarazyn ſemyng gret ioy accept afferme batayle thus toke enterpriſe bytwene twayne departed returned owne companyes tydinges herof came ſir guy tremoyle ſyr willyam brother whan met affrenall demaunded fro whence came done ſarazyn affrenall ſhewed hym hole mater taken batayle wherof ſayd two knightes ioyfull ſayd affrenall ſpeke two ſhall nombre ten ſyr quod affrenall god wyll ſo truſt ſhall fynde ynowe wolde glad fyght ſarazyns anone affrenall mette lorde thune ſhewed hym aduenture demaūded wolde one company lord thune wolde nat refuſe gladlye graunted one company euery one affrenall dyd gette myght haue goten c wolde sir boucyquant yonger ſyr helyons lingnac ſyr iohan ruſſell englyſſhe ſir iohan harpedon aleys bodet bochet theſe accepted batayle whan nombre ten accompliſſhed euery man drewe lodgynge arme incontynent batayle whan knowen ye hooſt knyghtes named taken enterpriſe knyghtes ſquyers ſayd theſe ten knightes borne good houre haue founde day ſo happy aduenture wolde god quod dyuers yt nombre euery knight ſquyer ioyfull enterpriſe greatly prayſed aduenture ſauynge gentle lorde coucy nat cotente therwith lorde thune company lorde coucy ſhewed couenante made affrenall one ten fight ten ſarazyns many herde therof prayſed greatly aduenture lorde coucy ſpake againſt ſayd ah ſirs ye yonge people yt knowe lytell worlde rather exalte folyſſhe ded wyſe dede enterpriſe ſe reaſon dyuers cauſes one ten knyghtes ſquyers men gentleman name blode muſt fyght agaynſte many ſarazyns howe ſhall men knowe whether gentleman lyſt may ſet agaynſt men ten rybauldes varlettes hap dyſcomfyted ſhall wyn nothynge ten varlettes yet ſhall neuer nerer wyn ye towne aufryke ſhall thus put good men aduēture peraduenture wyll ſet buſſhment whan ten men felde tary men wyll cloſe roūde wherby ſhall leſe ſomoche febler ſay quod lorde coucy yt affrenall hath nat wrought wyſely mater firſt whan ſarazyn dyd defye ſhuld haue made nother maner aunſwere dyd ſhuld haue ſayd howe nat chefe heed army rather one pooreſt ye blame faythe byleue ye nat mete haue anſwer made therof ye lyſt ſhall brynge great lordes armye ſhall take vnder ſaueconducte ye ſhall go returne ſauegarde ſuretie • ye ſhall lordes ſpeke thus affrenall ſhuld haue ledde ſarazyn duke burbone counſayle ſhulde haue herde leyſer anſwered good aduyſe ſuche defyaūce armes ſuche quarell ought nat paſſe without great deliberacion good coūſayle batayle ben agreed vnto v yet wolde haue ben knowen men name ſurname ſhulde acomplyſſh batayle thervpon haue choſen men honour profite thervpon hane ſarazyns ſuretie hoſtage v ben metely maner haue vſed wherfore treatie might withdrawen reaſon ſhulde well doone wyll go ſpeke duke burbone take counſayle lordes armye knowe wyll ſay therto thus lorde coucy departed fro lorde thune wente duke burbons tent baron aſſembled togyder take coūſayle mater lorde coucy ſayde theſe wordes lorde thune maner good counſayle aduyſe yet lefte nat armed hymſelfe ſo came forth company redy fight ſarazyns ſir guy tremoyle formeſt knight thus lordes fraunce coūſayle duke burbons tent thought defiaunce reaſonable ſuſteyned greatly wordes opinyon lorde coucy ſayeng howe better make nother maner treatie ſome ſpecyall lorde loys erle arthoys ſir philyp bare ſayd syth armes taken accepted parte ſhulde great blame let wherfore name god lady let knyghtes ſquyers furnyſſhe enterpriſe purpoſe holden ſuſteyned thynges conſydred thought beſt hole hoſt ſhulde armed ordre batayle thentent ſarazyns wolde falſneſſe ſhulde redy reſyſt accomplyſſhed euery man well armed drewe ye felde good ordre batayle redy fyght genouoys croſebowes one ſyde knyghtes ſquiers ſyde euery lord vnder baner penon armes goodly ſyght beholde cryſten men ſhewed well howe great deſyre ſarazyns ſhuld haue come fought ten cryſten knightes ſquiers redy felde aloue fro company abydynge ten ſarazins ſhulde haue fought ſemed well wyll therto whan ſawe howe cryſten men ordred ſelfe redy batayle douted durſt nat come forwarde thre tymes many men cryſten men ſaraſyns wolde often tymes come well mounted ſkrymyſſh cryſten mennes batayle returne againe dyd pure malice put cryſten men payne traueyle day ſo hote ſonne ſuche ſene ſo moſte luſty freſſhe ſo ſore chafed harneſſe nere ouercome faute ayre wynde always x cryſten men taryed parte ten ſarazyns nother ſawe herde tydynges aduyſed aproche towne aufryke aſſayle ſeynge redy armed redy batayle day kepe honour ten knightes kept felde tyll night went aſſaute knyghtes ſquyers deſyringe dedes armes hote ſore chafed yet traueyled ſelfe ſaraſyns well knowen caſe ye cryſten men might haue done thē great domage reyſed ſiege lykelyhode haue victory ye cryſten men ſo wery ſo ſore traueyled lytell ſtrenght howe conquered aſſaute firſt wall towne man dwelte ſarazyns retrayed ſeconde fortreſſe ſkrymyſſhynge without takynge great domage cryſten men domage ynough ſkrimiſſhyng aſſautynge heate ſonne duſte ſandes tyll myght wherby dyuers knyghtes ſquiers toke dethe whiche great pytie domage ſaid occaſion dyed firſt ſyr willyam gacill ſir guyſſharde de la garde ſyr lyon scalet ſir guy de la ſalueſt ſyr willm̄ staple ſyr wilyam guyret ſyr geffrey ye chapell lorde pierbuffier lorde bonet ſir robert hanges ſir stephyn sanxere ſir aubert de la mote ſir alaine champayn ser geffrey freſiers ser rafe couffan lorde bourke artyſion ſir iohan crey baſtarde ſir bertram de sanache ſyr pyncharde morlayne ſir tryſtram brother ſyr ayme couſay ser ayme tourmay ſir foukes stanfours ſir iohan chateuas theſe knightꝭ dyed ſquiers foucans liege iohan iſles blondelet areton iohn̄ de la mote boūberis florida roque ye lorde belle brother willyam fondragay water cauforus iohan morillen pier malnes gyllot villaine iohn̄ lound iohn̄ perier iohan menne iohan lauay willyam parke dyed mo lx knightes ſquyers whiche wyſely conſyder great loſſe ye lorde coucy ben beleued nat fortuned kepte lodgynges dyd receyued ſuche domage ¶how aduenture domage fell cryſten men reaſon aſſaute towne aufryke ſo many knightes ſquyers deed mayntayned ſelfe wyſely dyd cōtynued ſiege longe ſeaſon cap clxxii foreſaid aduenture knightes ſquiers hoſt ſore diſpleaſed abaſſhed euery man bewayled frēdes nyght drewe lodginges made gretter watche made dout ſarazyns paſſed nyght without dōmage aduenture ſarazins knewe nothyng knowen caſe chriſten men might haue done great dōmage alwayes feared chriſten men durſt neuer aduēture auaūce thē ſelfe ſcrimyſſhing caſtynge dartes mooſt renomed armes partie agadyngore olyferne loued doughter ye kyng thunes wherby mooſt freſſheſt ioly dedes armes thus contynued ye ſiege towne aufryke realme fraunce englande ſuche countreys theſe knightes came fro herde maner tidynges wherof frendes ſore abaſſhed wyſt nat ſaye thynke dyuers place bothe englande heynalte fraūce proceſſyōs made pray god ꝓſperite theſe chriſten men thentencion chriſten men beyng ſiege abyde tyll cōquered town affrike outher force famyne treatie kyng cicyll wolde gladly ben ſo ſo wolde xp̄en yles adioynyng towne affrike vtter enemye ſpecially genouoys toke great payne ſerue lordes pleaſure thētent ſhulde nat anoyed reaſon long ſiege ſpeke proꝑly marueylous enterprice came highe corage chriſten knightes ſquyers ſpecially frenchman loſſe knightes ſquiers pouertie endured yet cōtynued ſtyll ſiege great coſtes chargꝭ without ayde cōforte genouoys ye firſt ſetters enterprice began faynt diſſymule bruteran wolde haue ben gladde haue made treatie sarazyns haue lefte knyghtes fraunce englande chriſten countreys ſtyll buſyneſſe ſhall ſhewe enformed ¶ nowe preſent tyme lette v leaue ſpeke ſiege aufryke ſpeke feſt kynge englande made ſame ſeaſon london ⸫ ⸫ ¶of feeſt iuſtes made kyng englande lōdon whyle chriſten knyghtes ſquyers ſege towne aufryke agaynſt ſarazyns howe feeſt publiſſhe dyuers countreis landes cap clxxiii ye haue herde hyſtorie feeſt holdē paris whā quene iſabell fraunce made firſt entre whiche feeſt tidynges ſprede abrode euery coūtre kynge • icharde englande thre vncles ••• yng goodly feſt paris ye reportes ſuche knyghtes ſquyers owne ben ſame feſt ordayned great feſt holden cyte lōdon ſhulde iuſtes lx knyghtes abyde cōmers thē lx ladyes freſſhely apparelled kepe thē company theſe knightes iuſt two dayes beſyde ſonday chalenge begyn next ſonday ye feſt ſaint michaell yere lorde god mccc fourſcore ten whiche ſonday ſaid lx knightes lx ladyes two ye clocke noon ſhuld iſſue oute towre london ſo cōe long cytie chepe ſo smyth elde daye xii knightes redy abyde knyghtꝭ ſtraūgers ſuche wolde iuſt ſōday called ſonday feſt chalenge mōday next ſayd lx knightes ſame place redy iuſte abyde cōmers curteſly ron rokettes beſt doer ſyde ſhulde gyuen hym price riche crowne golde beſt doer ſyde duely examyned ladyes quenes chambre ſhulde haue price riche gyrdell golde tueſday folowynge knightes ſhulde agayne ſame place abyde maner ſquyers ſtraūgers ſuche wolde iuſt rokettes beſt iuſter ſyde ſhulde haue price courſer ſadled chiefe doer ſyde ſhulde haue faucon maner feſt thus ordayned deuiſed herauldes charged crye publyſſhe feeſt englande scotlande almayne flaūders brabant heynalt fraunce heraldes departed ſome hider ſome thider theſe tidyngꝭ ſprede abrode dyuers coūtreys heraudes daye tyme ſuffycient knightes ſquiers dyuers coūtreys apparelled ſelfes feeſt ſome ſe maner englande ſome iuſte whan theſe tidynges came heynalt ſir wyllyam heynault erle oſtrenaunt yonge lyberall deſyrous iuſte purpoſed hym ſelfe go feeſt englā de ſe honour coſyns kyng rycharde englande vncles whome neuer ſene hadde great deſyre aquaynted deſyred knightes ſquyers kepe hym cō pany ſpecially lorde gomegynes bycauſe well acquaynted englyſſhe men ben dyuers tymes amonge thanne ſir wyllyam haynaulte purpoſed whyle made prouiſyon go hollande ſe father auberte erle heynaulte hollande zelande entente ſpeke hym take leaue go englande deꝓted fro queſnoy haynault rode tyll came haye hollande erle father tyme ſhewed father purpoſe go englande ſe countrey coſyns neuer ſene therle father anſwered ſayd wyllyam fayre ſon ye haue nothyng englāde nowe ye couenaunt maryage alyed realme fraunce ſuſter maryed duke burgoyne wherfore ye nede nat ſeke none alyaunce dere father quod wyll nat go englande make alyaūce feeſt make myrthe coſins yet neuer ſawe bycauſe feeſt whiche ſhalbe holden london publiſſhed abrode wherfore ſyth ſignifyed therof ſhulde nat go thyder ſhulde ſayd proude preſuptuous wher fore ſauynge myne honoure wyll go thider therfore dere father requyre agree therto sonne quod ye lyſte thynke ſurely better ye taryed home whan erle oſtrenaunt ſawe wordes contented nat father wolde ſpeke therof fell cōmunicacion thought well ynough wolde ſo dayly ſent prouiſyon towardes calais gomegynes heraulde ſente englande fro therle oſtrenaunt gyue knowlege kynge rycharde vncles howe wolde come honorably feeſt london thoſe tidynges kynge vncles ryght ioyouſe gaue heraulde great giftes whiche ſtode hym great ſtede ende dayes fell blynde nat tell god diſpleaſed hym nat dayes lyued marueylouſly wherfore olde dayes hadde loſte ſyght fewe ſorte therof thus erle oſtrenaunt departed haye hollande toke leaue father ſo retourned queſnoy heynaulte coūteſſe wyfe noble feeſt wherof make mē cyon publyſſhed cryed dyuers place wherby knyghtes ſquyers aduaunſed ſelfes go thyder erle walleran ſaynt pole wyfe kyng richarde englandes ſuſter prepared greatly go englande ſo came calys alſo erle oſtrenaunt departed fro heynaulte well accompanyed knyghtes ſquyers ſo paſſed throughe countrey arthoys came alſo cali founde erle ſaynt poule ſhyppes paſſagers douer redy whan ſhippes charged wynde good theſe lordes tooke ſee howe ſhewed thynke true therle ſaynt poule paſſed firſt englande erle oſtrenaunt whan came london founde kyng brother lawe ſir iohan hollande lordes knyghtes englande receyued hym great ioye demaūded hym tidynges realme fraunce aunſwered well wyſely therle oſtrenaunt paſſed ouer thurſdaye ſo cāe cauterbury friday viſyted ſaint thomas ſhrine offred mornyng laye daye nexte day rode rocheſter bycauſe ſo gret company cariages rode ſmall iourneys eaſe horſe ſondaye rode dyner dertforde dyuer london feeſt whiche began ſame ſonday ſonday nexte feeſt ſaynt michaell feeſt tryū phe ſhulde begyn daye done smythfelde iuſtes called chalenge ſame ſonday thre clocke noone iſſued towre london firſt threſcore courſers apparelled iuſtes euery one ſquier honour ridyng ſofte paſe iſſued threſcore ladyes honour mounted fayre palfrey ridyng one ſyde richely apparelled euery lady ledde knight cheyne ſyluer knightes apparelled iuſt thus cam ridynge longe ſtretes london great nombre trumpettes mynſtrelles ſo came smythfelde quene englande lady damoſelles redy chābres richely adorned ſe iuſtes king quene whan ye ladyes ledde knyghtes come place taken downe fro palfrey moū ted vp chambres redy aparelled thē ſquiers honour alighted fro courſers knightes good order moū ted helmes ſette made redy poyntes thyder came erle ſaynt poule nobly accompanyed knyghtes ſquyers armed harneſſe iuſtes begynne feeſt whiche incontynent beganne iuſted knyghtes ſtraungers ſuche wolde hadde leyſar ſpace nyght came thus theſe iuſtes chaleng began cōtynued tyll night knyghtes ladyes withdrue ſelfes quene lodged beſyde poules byſſhoppes palace ſupper prepared ſame euennynge came therle oſtrenaunt kyng nobly receyued ¶ nowe theſe iuſtes ſonday aunſwerer without erle walleran ſaynt poule price chalengers erle huntyngdon goodly daūſyng quenes lodgyng preſence kynge vncles baron englande ladyes damoſelles contynuyng tyll daye whiche tyme euery perſone drawe lodgynges except kyng quene lay byſſhoppes palays laye feeſtes iuſtes duryng nexte day whiche mondaye ye myght haue ſene dyuers place cytie london ſquyers varlettes goynge aboute harneſſe doynge buſyneſſe maiſters noon kynge richarde came place armed richely apparelled accompanyed duke erles lordes knyghtes one inner partie quene well accompanyed ladyes damoſels came place iuſtes ſhulde mounted chā bres ſcaffoldes ordayned thē came felde erle oſtrenaunte well accōpanyed knyghtes coū trey redy iuſte came erle ſaynt poule knyghtes fraunce ſuche wolde iuſte began iuſtes euery man payned hym ſelfe gette honour ſtryken fro horſes theſe iuſtes contynued tyll nere nyght euery ꝑſon drewe lodgynges knyghtes ladyes ye hour ſupper euery man drewe courte goodly ſupper well ordayned day price gyuen erle oſtrenaunt beſt iuſter vtter partie well deſerued price gyuen hym ladyes lordes herauldes ordained iudges inner partie knyght englande called ſir hughe spenſer price nexte daye tueſday iuſtes agayne ſame place maner ſquyers whiche endured tyll nyght preſence kyng quene lordes ladyes euery man drewe lodgyngꝭ done dayes ſupper retourned byſſhoppes palais kyng quene ladyes goodly coſtely ſupper great daunſynge contynuynge nyght wedniſdaye dyner iuſted ſame place maner knightes ſquyers ſuche wolde iuſte ſore rude iuſtes enduryng tyll nyght wtdrue hour ſupper reſorted ſupped thurſdaye kyng made ſupper knyghtes gentylmen ſtraungers quene ladyes damoſelles friday duke lancaſtre made dyner knightes ſquyers ſtraungers whiche goodly dyner saturdaye kyng lordes departed fro lōdon wyndſore therle oſtrenaunt erle ſaynt poule knightes ſquyers ſtraungers deſyred acompany kyng wyndſore euery mā rode reaſon caſtell wyndſore began agayne great feeſtꝭ dyners ſuppers gyuen king ſpecially kyng dyde great honour erle oſtrenaunt coſyn whiche erle deſyred kyng vncles wolde content take hym order garter erle aunſwered howe wolde take coūſayle mater coūſayled lorde gomegines fierabras vertan baſtarde wyſe wolde diſcorage counſayle hym refuce order garter toke hym wherof knightes ſquyers fraūce ſuche great marueyle murmured ſore therat among thē ſelfe ſayeng erle oſtrenaunt ſheweth well courage enclyneth rather englyſſhe frenche whan taketh hym order garter weareth kynge englandes deuyſe ſheweth well regardeth nat houſe fraunce houſe burgoyne tyme wyll come ſhall repent hym ſelfe thynges cōſydred knoweth nat hath done welbeloued frenche kynge duke thourayne brother blode royall ſuche wyſe whan came parys place euer made hym honour coſyns thus theſe frenche men euyll accuſed hym without cauſe done nothyng contrary hurtfull realme fraunce coſyns frendes fraunce thought none otherwyſe honour loue pleace coſyns englande therby rather good meane bytwene fraūce englande nede daye toke hym order garter othe euery man maye well vnderſtande made none alyaunce preiudyce realme fraunce dyde loue good company howe man canne let enuyous ſpeke yuell whan daūced ſported certayne • pace caſtell wynſore kyng hadde gyuen many fayre gyttes ye knightes ſquy ••• honour realme fraunce heynaulte ſpecially yonge erle oſtrenaunt euery man toke leaue kynge quene ladyes damoſelles kynges vncles than̄e erle ſaynt poule frenche men henowayes almaygnes departed thus ended great feeſt cytie london euery man went owne fortuned none brute ronneth farre frenche kynge brother vncles enfourmed ſuche hadde ben englande ſayde feeſt euery thyng hadde done ſayd nothyuge forgotten rather putte exaltyng yuell dedes fortheryng good dedes ſhewed kyng playnly erle oſtrenaunt ben englande taken great payne exalte honoure englyſſhe men helpynge forwarde feeſt holden london howe hadde chiefe priſe honoure iuſtes aboue ſtraungers howe ſpoken ſo fayre englyſh men become kynge englandes man made ſcruyce alyaunce hym taken hym order garter chapell ſaynt george wyndſore whiche order fyrſte ſtablyſshed kynge edwarde thirde ſonne prince wale howe man myght entre confrary company without make ſeruyaunt othe neuer beare armoure agaynſte crowne englande whiche promyſe ſayd erle oſtrenaunt made oute reſeruacyon theſe tidynges frenche kynge brother vncles ſore troubled greuouſly diſpleaſed erle oſtrenaunt frenche kyng ſayde lo ſirs ye maye • e hym nat yet yere paſte ſythe deſyred brother myght byſſhoppe cambrey theſe tidynges gyfte rather preiudyciall realme fraunce auaū cement hadde better gyuen coſyn ſaynt poule heynoways dyd neuer good v neuer wyll proude preſumptuous fierſe alwayes haue owed better good wyll englyſſhe men v daye ſhall come ſhall repent wyll ſende erle oſtrenaunt cōmaū dynge hym come v v homage coūtie oſtrenaunt el ſhall put hym fro annexe oure realme counſayle anſwered ſayde sir ye haue well deuyſed lette done ye haue ſayde maye well thought duke burgoyne whoſe doughter erle oſtrenaunt wyfe nothynge content thoſe tidynges alwayes auaunſed ſonne oſtrenaunt towardes kyng coūſaile mater nat forgotten incontinent frenche kyng wrote ſharpe letter therle oſtrenaūt queſnoy heynaulte cōmaundyng hym come parys homage kynge peeres fraunce coutie oſtrenaut el kyng wolde take fro hym make hym warre whan erle well ouerſene theſe letter parceyued howe frenche kyng counſayle diſpleaſed hym make anſwere aſſembled counſayle lorde fountayns lorde gomegynes ſir wyllyam hermes lorde traſſegnies bayly heynaulte lorde sancelles ſir raſe montigny abbot criſpyne iohan sulbart iaquemart barrier valencennes theſe wyſemen counſayled togider anſwere might made kynges letter many reaſons alleged laſt thynges conſydred thought beſt write frenche kynge counſayle take daye anſwere clerely maner demaundes mouthe certayne credyble ꝑſons none writyng meane ſeaſon ſente certayne notable perſonages erle heynaulte duke aubert holāde haue coū ſayles anſwere make thus dyde wrote ſwetely courteſly kynge counſayle ſo thoſe fyrſt letter kyng coūſayle well content therle coū ſayle ſent hollande lorde traſſegines lorde sancelles iohan semart iaques barrier rode erle heynault ſhewed hym ſtate countie heynault letter frenche kyng hadde ſent ſonne erle oſtrenaunt erle heynaulte marueyle mater ſaid sir thought neuer otherwyſe ſhulde come thus paſſe wyllyam ſon̄e nothyng go englāde haue delyuered hym rule gouernaunce coūtie heynaulte might haue done vſed hym ſelfe accordyng counſayle countrey sir ſhall tell ye ſhall go fayre coſyn duke burgoyn lyeth well power regarde ſette order thynges demaunded frenche kynge canne gyue better counſayle anſwere departed hollande came heynault ſhewed anſwere wherwith erle counſayle content aſſigned go fraūce duke burgoyne lorde traſſegnies ſir wyllm̄ hermyes ſir raſe montigny iohan semart iaques barrier ſhewe declare ye proceſſe ſute made frenche courte ſhulde ouer longe reſyte finally thynges concluded yt duke burgoyne coude non remedy erle oſtrenaunt muſt come perſonally parys knowe homage due frenche kyng countie oſtrenaunt el ſurely haue warre lorde coucy ſir olyuer clyſſon toke great payne erles ſake ſir iohn̄ mercier lorde de la ryuer labored contrarye ſyde moche might ¶ nowe let v leaue ſpeke mater retourne ſpeke lordes knyghtes fraunce ſiege ſtrong towne aufryke agaynſt ſarazyns ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe incydent ſiege reyſed towne aufryke occaſyon howe euery man retourned owne countreis cap clxxiiii ye haue herde howe chriſten men beſieged ſtronge towne aufryke lande ſee settyng entente howe conquere thought might wyn brute therof ſhulde ſounde great honour prayſe howe myght kepe ſelfe toguyder reſyſt agaynſt ennemyes ſayenge howe ſhulde alwayes haue conforte chriſten men ſpecially frenche kyng yong deſyrous dedes armes conſydring howe truce englyſſhmen two yeres cōe ſarazyns feared ſame wherfore dayly made prouyſyon towne refreſſhed alwaies towne newe freſſh men hardy aduenturers accordynge vſage thus ſeaſon paſſed chriſten men hadde ſuffred great loſſe companyons lytell wynnynge aduauntage partye hole hooſt maner dyſcomforted coulde nat ſe howe reuenged many theym beganne murmure ſayenge lye vayne ſkrymyſſhes make therby ſhall neuer wyn towne auffryke ſlee eche wyll gette agayne ten owne countrey haue vytayles prouyſyons pleaſure haue great daū ger parell ſhall thynke lye wynter longe colde nyghtes ſhalbe morfounded froſen dethe thus ſhall herde caſe dyuers wayes firſt wynter man dare take ſee cruell tyrryble wyndes tempeſtes ſee ſees tempeſtes fierſer wynter ſomer ſhulde lacke vytayles eight dayes togyther ſee wolde ſuffre none come v deed loſt without remedy secondly though ſo vytayles thynges neceſſary daunger yet howe coulde watche endure payne traueyle contynually watche euery night parell aduenture ouer herde v beare enemyes owne countrey knowe countrey may come nyght aſſayle v great aduauntage v great domage haue done redy thyrdly faute good ayre ſwete freſſhe meates wherwith haue noryſſhed mortalyte hap fall hooſt ſhall dye euery man fro haue remedy reſyſt agaynſt alſo furthermore genouoys turne agaynſt v rude people traytours may nyght tyme entre ſhyppes ſo leue v pay ſcotte theſe doutes conſydred capytaynes lye eaſe regarde nat caſe in▪ alſo ſome genouoys ſpared nat ſpeke ſayd raylynge cryſten men men armes ye frenche men whan departed fro genne thought within fyftene dayes ye layen ſiege towne aufryke ye ſhulde haue conquered nowe haue ben thanne two monthes yet haue done nothyng ſuch aſſautes ſkrymyſſhes ye make towne nedeth nat feare yere yet nexte maner meanes ye ſhall neuer conquere realme aufryke yet thunes comunynge ſpred ſo abrode hooſt came knowlege gret lordes capytaynes armye ſpecyally lorde coucy ſage diſcrete whoſe coūſayle chefe parte hoſt inclyned euer vnto ſayd ſelfe conſidred howe theſe doutes greatly feared entente ordayn haſtely remedy aſſembled ſecretly great lordes hooſt togyder counſayle bycauſe wynter aproched counſayle kept duke burbons tente concluſyon dyſlodge ſeaſone euery man retourne ſame way came lordes prepared ſecretly patron galees ſente purpoſe ſhewed vnto wyſt nat ſay contrary laſte ſayde lordes take doute ſuſpecte v haue made promeſſe wherfore wyll acquyte v truely wolde haue enclyned treaty affrykans wolde gaue deſyred haue peace v bnt wold neuer gyue heryng wyll kepe faythe ſyth haue promyſed ſo sir quod lorde coucy repute good trewe valyaſit men haue conſydred dyuers thynges wynter aprocheth deſtytute vitayles prouyſions grace god one retourned realme fraunce ſhall ſo enfourme kynge yonge luſty deſyrous knowe maner theſe march ſeynge hath treuce englyſſhe men thynke ſmall counſaylynge wyll cauſe hym come hyther puyſſaunce royall well ayde king cicyll make ſome conqueſt vpon ſarazyns wherfore ſyrs requyre make redy galees veſſels wyll departe within ſhorte dayes genouoys nothynge content frenche men wolde departe fro ſiege ſtronge towne aufryke coulde fynde none remedy wherfore behoued ſuffre generall brute ran hooſt howe genouoys aboute bargayne ſarazyns take parte betray ye cryſten men cryſten men beleued true ſome ſaid one ſouerayne capitayns duke burbone erle dolphyn auuergne lorde coucy ſyr guy de la tremoyle ſyr iohan vyen ſyr phylyppe bare knowe ſurely howe euery thynge gothe therfore ſhall thus ſodaynely departe fro ſiege departure publyſſhed throughe hooſt euery man cōmaunded conuey euery thing ſhyppes ſaruaūtes varletres redy truſſe maner baggage cary veſſels lyenge ancre whan euery thyng cōueyed euery man entred ſuche ſhyppes came dyuers barones knyghtes made couenaūt patron mayſters ſhyppes ſome ſayle naples ſome cicyll ſome cyper ſome rodes entent go iheruſalem thus departed fro ſiege aufryke toke ſee ſyght ſarazyns within towne whan ſawe departure made gret noyſe blowyng horne ſownynge taburs ſhoutynge cryeng ſuche wyſe hoſt ſarazyns lay abrode knew therof ye ſhuld haue ſene yonge ſarazyns moūte horſes came place ſiege layne ſe coulde haue founde thynge agadingor olyferne brahadyne thunes formeſt ſawe howe chriſten men ſo clene departed lefte nothynge behynde myght cary ſarazyns rode vp downe two houres ſe maner howe cryſten men lodged theym ſelfe ſiege greatly prayſed cryſten mennes ſubtyltie made ſo many pyttes erthe haue therby freſſhe water whan hadde certayne ſpace well regarded galees ſhyppes ſee ſome theym entred towne aufryke ſe frendes alyes departed agayne lodgynges made boſt voyage ſayenge howe cryſten men durſt abyde lengar ſayd howe puiſſaunce nothynge regarde wolde neuer ſette ſomoche frenche men genouoys done ſayd trouth ſhall tell howe wherfore ſiege thus contynued enfourmed ye ſarazins waxed proude ſawe well howe genouoys done full power hurte anoy ſawe voyage great coſte yet lytell whiche trouthe ſeaſon ſarazyns knewe nothing deth ſo many cryſten knyghtes ſquyers ſlayne great ſkrymyſſhe ſame day cryſten men departed knowledge therof ſhall ſhewe meanes ſarazyns founde felde varlet genouoys lyenge grounde ſore ſycke hote feuer nat able go galees whan felowes departed fyndynge varlet ſarazyns ryght ioyfull brought lordes ſhewed howe founde hym trucheman ſet examynacion begynnynge wolde ſhewe nothyng reekened himſelfe deed deſyred ſarazyns incontynent wolde put hym deth lordes hooſt agadingor dolyferne brahadyn thunes dyuers thought ſhulde cauſe hym dye ſhulde wyn nothyng therby yet rather ſaue lyfe ſo yt wolde ſhewe trouthe ſhulde demaunded ſhewed hym wolde without lyenge ſhewe trouth lyfe ſhulde ſaued delyuered franke free ſent owne coūtrey firſt ſhyp ſhulde come thence outher lande geneue marcyll alſo ſhulde haue gyuen hym c beſantes golde whan varlet feared dethe herde promeſſe well comforted knew well ſo euer ſarazyns promyſe faythe ſhulde truely kepte alſo ye knowe well naturally euery man lothe dye ſaid truchman cauſe lordes ſwere lawe vpholde ye ſayd ſhall aunſwere ſhalbe examyned farre forth knowe trucheman ſhewed lordes made faythfull promeſſe fayth fullfyll promeſſe ye varlet ſayd nowe demaund ye wyll ſhall anſwere firſte demaunded whence anſwered ſayd portnances demaunded hym feates frenche men ſiege named dyuers hadde kepte often tymes cōpany harauldes whome lerned dyuers name deſyred knowe ye occaſion departed ſo ſodaynely fro ſiege wher anſwered wyſely ſayd nat tell ſuppoſynge acordyng haue herde ſpoken hoſt neuer counſayle lordes brute went frenchman doute genouoys ſhulde betray genouoys denyed ſayd neuer thought neuer wolde blamed frenchman yt ſhulde ſo ſlaunder alſo ſayd parte occaſyon departure bycauſe wynter druenere afrayde taking ſuche domage receyued domage quod lordes syrs ꝙ ſame daye ten men ſhulde haue fought ten loſt lx knightes ſquiers name armes genouoys ſayd cauſe departed beleued well ye varlet whiche newes lordes ſarazyns great ioye enquered hym vphelde promeſſes ſo retourned portnances geane ſhewed aduenture ſaid herde receyued blame therof ſarazyns ſayd amonge ſelfe ſhulde nat nede care frenche men genouoys longe ſeaſon ſaid howe towne aufryke taken profyte howe ſayde wolde take better hede porte hauens ſee coſtes realmes ſpecyally ſtraytes marroke ſet ſure watche genouoys venyſians ſhulde nat paſſe wayes englande flaunders marchaundyſes without payenge great trybute yet greate grace lycence thus ſarazyns aſſembled alyed togythers dyuers realmes aufryke thunes bogy martoke belmaryn tremeſſyans granade agreed togyder kepe ſtraytly porte paſſages ſette galees armed ſee great nombre entent lordes maiſters ſee dyd great hatred frenchman genouoys bycauſe ben ſiege aufryke thus dyd great trouble goer commers ſee ſo moche yuell myſchefe grewe therby meanes ſarazyns thus lordes ſee ſuche marchaundyſes came fro dāmas fro cayrel fro alexaunder fro venyce fro naples fro geane yt ſeaſon ſo dere flaunders ſo ſcarce many thynges coulde nat gotte nouther golde ſyluer ſpecially ſpycery wonderfull dere gayſon ye haue herd howe cryſten men departed ſiege aufryke paſſed ſee aryued nat one porte ſome ſo ſore tourmented ſee retourned great daunger howe ſome theym returned geane proceſſyons made fraūce good ſpede tydynges herde lady coucy lady sulley lady dolphyn auuergne ladyes fraūce huſbandes voyage great ſorowe longe voyage endured whan tydynges came howe paſſed ſee ryght ioyfull duke burbone lorde coucy retourned priuely lefte behynde caryage trayne ſo came parys aboute ſaynte martyns tyde wynter frenche kynge ioyouſe comynge reaſon demaunded tydinges barbary voyage ſhewed al knewe herde ſene kynge duke thourayne glad ſpeke kyng ſayd bringe aboute make peace churche bytwene v englāde ſhall gladly make voyage army royall thoſe party exalte cryſten fayth confounde infydels acquyte dedes predeceſſours kyng ppilyp kinge iohan bothe eche tooke croſſey haue gone holy lande gone thyder ye warres nat fallen realme lyke wyſe wolde gladly make ſuche voyage thus frenche kynge comuned theſe lordes ſo day paſſed lytell lytell men came home fro voyage kynge helde hym ſelfe ſeaſon moſt comenly parys ſomtyme ye caſtell lowre nother tyme howſe ſaynt powle quene moſt comenly laye fell ſame ſeaſon aboute feeſt ſaynt andrewe knyghtes ſquyers retourned fro voyage barbary wherof yt worlde ſpake frenche kynges court mocyon moued newe
