iourney made thyder bycauſe frenche kynge gret affection dedes armes counſayled exorted therto ſayde hym syr ye haue deuocyon great ymagynacion go ouer ſee fyght agaynſt infydels conquere holy lande trewe quod kynge thought nyght day none thyng enfourmed ye lord tremoyle ſir iohan mercier theſe wordes king owed fauour pope clement beynge auignon loke two ſayd ye kyng wolde agre moſt ſpeciall fauour ſayd kynge syr ye nat good conſcience take voyage firſt church one ſyr begyn firſt heed enterpriſe ſhall take good concluſyon quod kynge wolde ye haue begyn syr quod preſent tyme ye nat charged great buſyneſſe ye haue treuce englyſſhe men longe ſpace wherfore ſyr pleaſe peace durynge ye myght make goodly voyage ſyr ſe better honourable voyage thanne go rome great puyſſaunce men armes pull downe dyſtroy antepaye whome romayns force hath created ſet ſeate cathedrall ſaynt peter ye wyll ye maye well accomplyſſhe voyage ſuppoſe ye nat paſſe tyme honorably ſyr ye maye well know antepape cardynals knowe one yt ye mynded come army wyll yelde ſelf aſke mercy kynge remēbred hym ſelfe lytell ſayd howe wolde deuyſed ſurely ſaid moche bounde pope clement yere paſt ben auygnon pope cardynals made hym ryght honourable chere gyuen demaunded bothe hym ſelfe brother vncles wherfore kynge ſayd hadde deſerued haue ſome recompence alſo departure fro auignon promyſed pope helpe aſſyſt hym quarell ſeaſon parys kyng duke berrey burgoyne agreed concluded nexte marche kynge ſhuld departe fro parys take way towardes sauoy lombardy erle sauoy ſende coſyn germayne hym kynge haue vnder charge duke tourayne brother four thouſande ſpeares duke burgoyne two thouſande ſpeares duke berrey two thouſāde conſtable fraunce two thouſande ſpeares breton raintoners lowe march duke burbon thouſāde ſpeares lorde ſaynt poll lorde coucy thouſande ſpeares theſe men armes payed hande thre monethes ſo fro terme terme whan thoſe tydynges knowen auignon pope clement cardynals greatly reioyſed thought maner enterpriſe atcheued alſo kinge coūſayled nat leaue duke bretayne behynde hym ſende deſyre hym prepare hym ſelfe go voyage kyng wrote notably hym ſent letter man honour offycer armes ſignyfyenge duke letter ſtate voyage whan duke red theſe letter turned hym ſelfe ſmyled called hym lorde mountboucher ſayd syr harke regarde well frenche kyng hath written hath enterpriſed departe next marche great puiſſaunce go rome diſtroy ſuche take parte pope bonyface god helpe iourney ſhall tourne nothynge ſhorte ſpace ſhall haue flax dyſtaffe well ſpynne thynke wyll leaue ſoone folyſſh thought alſo deſyreth go hym two thouſande ſpeares howebeit wyll honour ought wyll write ioyouſly bycauſe ſhall contente ſhewe hym howe go voyage ſhall nat go without ſeyng pleaſeth haue company howe ſir moūtboucher ſay vnto wyll nat traueyle man myne yt kyng hath purpoſed ſayd nothynge ſhall done behalfe duke bretayne wrote goodly letter ſwete frenche kynge officer armes returned theym parys delyuered kynge redde well contented aunſwere ⸫ ⸫ ¶of englyſſhe knyghtes ſente parys frenche kynge fro kynge englande vncles treate peace cap c lxxv wyll purpoſe frenche kynge none wolde breke pleaſed greatly knyghtes ſquyers fraunce bycauſe wyſt nat better enploy ſeaſon euery man prepared towardes voyage namely clergy prouynces realme ordayned graunted tayle ſende coſtes charge men warre kynge howe voyage tourned nothynge duke bretayne ſayd ſhall ſhewe incidence ye feeſt candelmas came tydynges frenche kyng counſayle whiche loked nothynge certayne kynge englandes coūſayle ſuche priuy chambre ſent nobly parys frenche kyng chefe legacyon ſyr thomas percy ſyr loys clyfforde ſir robert briquet dyuers knyghtes company herde mo named whan theſe thre knyghtes come parys hym french kyng deſyrous knowe myght meane kynge englande dyd ſende ſo haſtely counſayle hym theſe knyghtes englande ſyr thomas percy alyghted parys ſtreate called croſſe ſigne caſtell frenche kynge lay caſtell lowere brother duke tourayne hym thre vncles lodgynges cytie cōſtable ſyr olyuer clyſſon nere hāde noone whan englyſſhe men came parys kept lodgynge day nyght next day aboute nyue ye clocke lept horſes ryght honorably rode caſtell loure kyng brother vncles erle ſaint poll lorde coucy conſtable fraūce ſir iohan vien ſir guy de la tremoyle dyuers baron fraunce redy receyue englyſſhe ambaſſadours alyghted ye gate entred receyued lord de la ryuer ſyr iohan mercyer ſir lyon lignach ſir peter villers ſir willyam tremoyle ſyr marcell receyued honourably brought theym chambre kynge taryed dyd bonettes kneled downe ſyr thomas percy hadde letter credence kynge englande ſente frenche kynge delyuered kyng tooke cauſed knyghtes ſtande vp ſtepe ſome backe kynge opyned letter red ſawe well credence called hym brother vncles ſhewed letter vncles ſayd syr call forthe knyghtes wyll ſay aproched cōmaunded declare credence ſi • thomas percy ſpake ſayd dere ſir entencyon ſouerayne lorde kinge englande wolde gladly ſuche ſpecyall counſayle vncles duke lancaſtre yorke gloceſtre prelate englande ſuche ſpecyall 〈…〉 might come preſence counſayle ſhortely myght treate maner peace ſo togyther myght couenably reſonably con • oyned meanes ſounde haue concluſyon peace wold therof right ioyfull entente wolde nouther ſpare owne payne laboure yet none men nother come hym ſelfe ſende ſuffyciente perſones ouer theſee cytie amyence place aſſigned ſyr come hyder entente knowe pleaſure behalfe kynge aunſwered ſayde syr thomas percy company ryght hertely welcome youre comynge wordes ryght ioyfull ye ſhall • ary paris ſeaſon wyll ſpeke counſayle make ſuche couenable anſwere ye depart ſhall ſuffyce anſwere englyſſhe men well content nere dyner tyme englyſſhe men deſyred tary dyne ſo lorde coucy brought chambre lorde de la ryuer dyned layſer dy • er retourned kynges chambre wyne ſpyces thanne toke leaue kynge wente lodgynge comynge ſyr thomas percy company fraūce tydynges brought pleaſed greatly frenche kynge duke burgoyne dyuers counſayle nat • ſpecially ſuche ayded ſuſtayne pope clementes quarell ſawe well theſe tydynges frenche kynge enclyned treatie ſhulde greatly let hynder voyage mynded go rome diſtroy pope bonyfac • cardynals el bringe beleue pope clemente mater treatie peace ſo • egh touched ſo moche welthe prefyte cryſtendome ſo perſone durſt ſpeke againſt duke burgoyn counſayle kynge brother duke burbone one acorde kyng made good chere ser thomas percy englyſſhmen amonge one knyght called ſir robert briquet wheme frenche kynge loued nat frenche man borne alwayes helde ſelfe outher naueroys englyſſhe one king englandes priuy chambre frenche kynge diſſymuled hym ſagely whan ſpake theym alwayes kynge wolde tourne ſelfe ſyr thomas percy el ſyr loys clyfforde ſayd syrs wolde gladly ſe peace bytwene v aduerſary kynge englande quarell warre hath longe endured bytwene v one thinge wyll ye knowe yt ſhall nat hyndred parte though gretly coſt sir quod kyng ſouerayne lorde hath ſent v hyther hathe great affection haue peace ſaythe ſhall nat let parte hath marueyle warre dyſcenſyon bytwene landes hath endured ſo longe good amyable meanes hathe tyme frenche kynge anſwered ſayd ſhall ſe good affection hath thervnto theſe englyſſhemen taryed parys vi dayes euery day dyned one duke fraunce meane ſeaſon determyned frenche kynge vncles priuy counſayle ſhulde amyence myddes marche next abyde coming kynge englande vncles counſayle wolde come thyder englyſſhe knyghtes ſayd made doute leſt kynge englandes vncles ſhulde day aſſigned amyence concluſyon treatie daye ſhulde departe parys kynge came ye palays vncles made dynner englyſſh knightes cauſed ſir thomas percy ſytte borde called hym coſyn reaſon northumberlandes blode dyner gyuen ſir thomas percy englyſſh knightes ſquiers great gyftes fayre iewels gyunge ouer ſlypte ſyr robert briquet ſyr peter villers chefe ſteward frenche kynge delyuered gyftes ſaid ſyr robert briquet sir whan ye haue done ſuche ſeruyce kynge maiſter ſhall pleaſe hym ryche puiſaunt ynough rewarde whiche wordꝭ ſir robert briquet ſore abaſſhed parceyued well therby ye kyng loued hym nat fayne ſuffre dyner mynſtels began play paſtyme one paſt ſir thoms percy cāe kyng ſayd sir company haue great marueyle one thing yt ye haue made v ſo good chere gyuen v ſo great gyftes ſir robert briquet hath nothynge knight maiſters preuy chambre sir deſyre knowe cauſe therto anſwered frenche kyng ſayd sir thomas knyght ye ſpeke ſyth ye wyll knowe yt mater hath nede batayle agaynſt taken priſoner raunſome ſhulde ſoone payde therwith kyng entred cōmunycacion wyne ſpyces brought forthe ſo tooke leaue retourned lodgynge made reconyng payde euery thyng nexte daye departed ſpedde ſo iourneys arryued englāde ſhewed kyng vncles howe ſpedde greatly prayſed frēche kyng chere made ſhewed gyftes iewels gyuen ¶ nowe lette v leaue lytell ſpeke englyſſhe men ſome ſhewe kyng iohan caſtyle ⸫ ⸫ ¶of dethe kyng iohn̄ caſtyle crownyng kynge henry ſonne cap c lxxvi ye haue herde hyſtorie peace made bytwene kynge caſtyle duke lancaſtre chalenged haue ryght realme caſtyle reaſon lady cuſtaunce wyfe doughter kyng dō peter meanes fayre doughter yt duke lancaſtre ſayde lady cuſtaunce peace made confyrmed ſayde kynge iohan caſtyle ſonne heyre called henry prince galyce henry maryed duke lancaſters doughter wherby good peace made bytwene englande caſtyle within two yeres maryage kynge iohan caſtyle dyed buryed burgus spaygne anone dethe prelate lordes spaygne drewe toguyder determyned crowne yonge herytoure prince galyce prince henry crowned nynth yere age wyfe doughter duke lancaſtre fyfteene yere age thus duke doughter lady cuſtaunce quene caſtyle lady heritour landes ſeignories kyng dompeter kyng henry kyng iohan helde excepte duke lācaſtre father wyfe mother durynge lyues whiche penſyon hundred thouſande doreyns yere foure beſt erles spayne pledge dettours ſame thus duke lancaſtre ſawe two doughters one quene spaygne quene portugale beſtowed ¶nowe lette v ſpeke yonge erle armynake voyage made lombardy matter requyreth ſhall leaue ſpeke kynge caſtyle ⸫ ⸫ ¶of army yonge erle iohan armynake vyage made lombardy howe dyed ſiege towne alexandre ca c lxxvii hath ſhewed great fectyon yonge erle armynake go lombardy menne warre ayde aſſyſte ſuſter germayne brother lawe huſbande lorde barnabo eldeſt ſonne lorde barnabo whome duke myllayne cauſed ſlayne marueylouſlye duke myllayne erle vertues named galea whoſe doughter duke orlyaunce hadde wyfe ſayd lady doughter olde erle armynake ſuſter yonge erle greatly abaſſhed diſconforted truſte brother ſignified hym eſtate pouertie neceſſyte dō mage ſhe ſuffred humbly requyred brother wolde helpe kepe defende agaynſt tyraunt erle vertues wolde diſheryte without tytell reaſon requeſt ſuſter erle armynake condiſcended ſayde ſoeuer ſhulde coſte hym wolde deuoyre ayde ſuſter promyſed accō pliſſhed dede ayde erle dolphyne auuergne made dyuers treaty auuergne rouergue quercy lymoſyn piergourte engoulmoys agenoyes bought certayne fortreſſes whiche kepte englyſſhe men gaſcoyns breton ſuche hadde made warre agaynſt realme fraunce vnder colour kyng englande ſuche hadde agreed withall hadde pardon frenche kyng beſyde kyng gaue golde ſyluer gyuen amonge theym bounde erle armynake go hym lōbardy ayde hym warres euery man ſhewed hym ſelfe therto well wyllynge euery man drewe ryuer roſne ye ryuer soſne duke berrey duke burgoyne ſuffred countreys take vitaylles pleaſure wolde gladly haue clene delyuered countre yt ſeaſon vnder kyng ruled dolphynry lorde engueram durdyn kynge written hym commaundyng theſe men warre parteynyng erle armynake ſhulde peſably paſſe throughe countrey haue neded money whan erle foiz beynge byerne caſtell ortays vnderſtode howe erle armynake aſſembled men warre toguyder began muſe man greatly ymaginatife well herde howe brute erle armynake made aſſemble go lōbardy agaynſt lorde myllaygne bycauſe tyme paſt erle armynake predeceſſours brother bernarde armynake made hym warre therfore douted leſt ſayde aſſemble ſhulde tourne agaynſt hym wherfore thought wolde nat vnprouyded prepared fortreſſes men warre made ſuche prouyſion aſſayled reſyſt puiſſaunce erle armynake brother nothynge purpoſe thought ſurely vpholde ye treuce bytwene atcheue enterprice lombardy many knyghtes ſquyers englyſſhe gaſcoyns breton bounde ſerue erle armynake warres ſhulde haue made warre agaynſt erle foiz wolde haue taken erle foiz parte haue forſaken erle armynake erle foiz ſo welbeloued men warre wyſedome largeſſe proweſſe hym whan̄e ducheſſe thourayne enfourmed howe therle armynake redy paſſe ouer mountayns entre lombardy puiſſaunce men warre make warre agaynſt duke myllayne father howe frēche kyng vncles duke berrey burgoyne conſented therto bycauſe wolde haue countreis clene auoyded cō panyons route pyllars ſuche often tymes greued ſore coūtreys lady thought nat forgette matter wrote father duke millayne ſhe knewe entente ſhulde take hede hym ſelfe countrey lorde myllayne well enformed buſyneſſe prouyded menne warre might gette refreſſhed townes cyties caſtelles vitayle munyſiōs warre loked ſurely haue warre erle armynake hadde dede myddes moneth marche mooſt parte theſe cō panyons aſſembled toguyder marcheſſe auignon longe ryuer roſne nombre fyftene thouſande horſes paſſed ryuer ſo entred dolphynny vyen lodged abrode vyllages ſome paſſed forwarde haue eaſy paſſage thoroughe mountayns whiche peryllous paſſe bothe man horſe erle armynake brother certayne knyghtes wente auygnon ſe hym called pope clemente cardynalles offred ſeruyce pope ayde hym agaynſt tyrantes lombardes whiche offre thanked whan ben eight dayes great parte company paſte forwarde tooke leaue pope cardynalles prepared folowe men two bretherne departed ſondre erle iohan armynake ſir bernarde brother erle ſayde brother ye ſhall retourne backe armynake kepe herytage comynges armynake yet fortreſſes nat delyuered fro companyons yet garyſon lourde peter arnaulte kepeth vnder kynge englande alſo garyſon bounteuyll whiche kepte ſir iohan granley ſonne captall buſe thoughe ſo nowe haue peace erle foiz yet good doubte hym cruell haſtye thought vnknowen therfore good landes nat dyſpurueyed wherfore brother theſe cauſes ye ſhall retourne home ye ſhalle often fro fro sir bernarde lightlye agreed purpoſe deuyſe ſemed good hym alſo great affeccyon go forthe iournay departynge erle brother ſayde hym brother youre retournyng ye ſhall go coſyn raymonde thourayne holdeth lande pope countie venus maketh warre agaynſt hym coſyn hath maryed doughter prince orenge ſhewe hym howe deſyred pope requyre hym go voyage ſhall make hym companyon euery thynge ſhall tary hym cytie gappe bytwene ye mountayns sir quod bernarde ſhall meſſage thus two bretherne departed ſondre felde neuer mette guyder agayne erle armynake toke waye cytie gappe ye lande ganos bernarde brother went caſtell bolongne ſir raymonde thouraygne receyued coſyn ioyouſly ſir bernarde ſhewed hym meſſage ſaye fro brother erle armynacke fayre wordes coulde deuyſe rather therby enclyne hym therto ſir raymonde aunſwered layd fayre coſyn brother erle armynake entred farre lōbardy hath beſieged towne ſhall folowe hym yet ſoone men go forwarde write vnto brother coſyn yt aboute moneth maye ſhall folowe hym ye tyme truſt haue ende war betwene myne vncle pope clement cardinal auignon yet wyll ryght kepeth awaye fro ꝑforce myne vncle pope gregorie gaue wene wery ſhall nat deſyre knyghtes ſquyers gyueth theym pardon make warre agaynſt haue lyſt therto canne haue mo men warre thouſande floreyns one daye haue abſolucions ſeuyn yere fayre coſyn quod ſir bernarde trewe kepe purpoſe wolde nat counſayle otherwyſe ye haue aunſwered ſo ſhall write brother therle armynake quod ſir raymonde thus toguyder hole daye than̄e ſir bernarde departed paſſed ryuer roſne bridge saynt eſpyrite ſo retourned query rouergue mountayns ſo came thyder wolde lefte erle armynake brother alone warre againſt duke myllayne erle vertues departed fro bolonge wrote brother newes knewe anſwere ſir raymonde thourayne erle armynake receyued letter waye goyng cytie gappe redde letter ſo paſſed forthe made great force matter wyll contynue ſpeke yonge erle armynacke ſhewe feate ſpeke mater thus ſay good loue great affection conforte ſuſter brother lawe huſbande erle vertues called hym ſelfe lorde myllaygne falſely diſheryted withoute cauſe tytell • cauſed erle ioyouſly paſſe iourney farre pyemount lombardy two great reaſons cauſed erle armynake aſſemble make iourney tyme fyrſte realme fraunce therby clene rydde route theſe companyons hadde done moche hurte reaime therby countreys better aſſured ſeconde reaſon ayde ſuſter great pytie ſhe huſbande ſhulde leſe herytage wherby ſhulde lyue maynteyne eſtate theſe conſyderacions toke hym enterprice capitayns companyons ſayde one another lette v ryde forthe merily agaynſt theſe lombardꝭ haue good quarell inſte tytell haue good capitayne wherby warre ſhalbe moche better alſo ſhall go beſt countrey worlde lombardy receyueth fro coſtes fatneſſe worlde e lombardes naturally euer riche cowardes ſhall attayne agaynſt theym moche profyte none v capitayns ſhall retourne ſo ryche ſhall neuer nede make warre agaynſt man thus companyons de uſed one another whan came plentuous countrey wolde tary ſeaſon refreſſhe horſes ſame ſeaſon good abuēturous fought englande ſir iohan hacton marcheſſe florēce made warre agaynſt florētyns quarell pope bonyface rome rebell agaynſt pope cōmaundement ſo alſo peruſyns erle armynake thought might get englyſſhe knyght take parte hym ſhulde haue great treaſure hym bycauſe wyſedome valyauntneſſe erle wrote hym ſignyfieng hym hole mater enterprice deſyringe hym ayde whiche letter ſente diſcrete perſon ſir iohan hacton beyng marcheſſe florence two thouſande fyghtynge men receyued letter redde whan hadde well vnderſtande ſubſtaunce therof ryght ioyfull aunſwered ſayde owne warre one atchyued wolde nothyng tyll company erle armynake meſſanger ſayde sir ye ſaye well requyre write mynde lorde erle armynake wyll better beleue ryght good wyll ſir quod knight reaſon ſo englyſſhe knyght wrote delyuered letter meſſangere retourned came agayne lorde founde hym marcheſſe pyneroll gret treatie bitwene hym marque salues ſhulde alyed hym ayde warre agaynſt duke myllayne erle vertues tidynges erle armynackes squyer brought hym fro ſir iohan hacton wordes written within letter erle greatly reioyſed ſayd truſted make ſuche warre duke myllayne wolde bring hym reaſon elles dye payne whan company paſſed ſtraytes mountayns good countrey piemounte nere thouraygne rode abrode dyde moche hurte vyllages ſuche coude nat holde agaynſt erle layde ſige aſte pyemount entended rary ſir iohn̄ hacton prouiſyon came fro partes alſo companyons wan certayne ſmall holdes toke vitayls within countre pyneroll landes marque mount feraunt opyned apparelled delyuer vytayles thynges nerceſſary ye hooſt bothe men horſe alſo great prouiſyon came ye dolphyne countie sauoy many folkes greatly enclyned erle armynake bycauſe ſawe quarell good iuſt alſo bycauſe erle vertues cauſed ſlayne owne vncle ſir bernabo enuy ſette agayne lordes lombardy herytages diſheryted coſyn germayns wherof many great lordes thoughe ſpake lytell therof yet hadde great pytie caſe whyle erle laye thus ſiege aſte herde tidynges ſir iohn̄ hacton wherof greatlye reioyſed tidynges florentynes come pope mercye alſo veniſyens howe ſayd ſir iohn̄ ſhulde haue threſcore thouſande floreyns hym company money one payde receyued delyuered ſhulde departed promyſed fyue hundred ſpeares thouſande brigans fote come fronter gēnes paſſe ouer ryuer wheder ennemeys wolde natte ſo come erle armynake ſoeuer ſhulde theſe tidynges greatlye reioyſed erle armynake company ayde ſir iohn̄ hacton right pleaſaunt erle armynake counſailed deꝑte then go laye ſiege great cytie called alexandre entryng lōbardy whan̄e go breſuell whiche alſo good cytie fayre thus erle armynake company layde ſiege cyte alexaundre ſtandyng fayre countrey playne departyng pyemount entrynge lombardy way go ryuer gē ne theſe men warre paſſed ryuer theſyn lodge eaſe large countrey good pleſaunt aboute lorde galea lorde myllayne erle vertues towne called cytie pauy daylye herde tidynges enemyes dyde marueyle one thynge howe therle armynake coude gette rycheſſe pay wage ſo many men warre hadde brought hym counſayle anſwered hym ſayde sir haue marueyle therof men hath ſuche companyons deſyreth wynne ryde aduenture haue vſed longe ouerron realme fraūce take holdes garyſons countrey ſo ye countrey coude neuer delyuered ſo nowe late duke berrey dolphyn auuergne whoſe coū trey theſe rutters dyde moche dōmage kepte againſt lordes wylles ouer ranne beſt parte rytages made theym warre cauſed erle armynake treate theſe companyons ſo frenche kyng ſhulde ſuffre thē come coutrey make warre therby meanes certayne money gyuen auoyded oute fortereſſes countrey alſo beſyde frenche kynge hath ꝑdoned ſuche made warre agaynſt hym ye cōdycion ſhulde ſerue erle armynake warres coude get ſhulde owne demaunde none wage ſuche named men armes amonge theym fyue ſixe horſes owne countreys wolde go foote poore men great parell ieopardy fyght agaynſt ſuche men alſo lightly good men warre wherfore ſir beſt counſayle gyue kepe townes fortreſſes ſtronge well prouyded ennemyes haue none artyllary engyns ſaute regarded maye well come barryers townes ſcrimyſſhe dōmage none appereth well haue ben coūtrey two monethes yet haue taken fortreſſe lytell gret sir let alone ſhall wery thē ſelfe diſtroyed ende ſo ye fyght nat whan haue diſtroyed playne countre haue lyue ſhall fayne returne famyne without yuell fortune fall meane tyme ſhall well done men warre fortreſſes kepe toguyder ayde eche tyme nede ſir ſende ſuche place ye thynke enemyes wyll beſiege reſyſt thē townes men haue ſmall defēce nat ſo vſed accuſtomed warre nouther aſſaut defende men armes knightes ſquyers noriſſhed brought vp therin ſir ſende men warre cytie alexandre therby ye ſhall haue double profyte cytie ſhalbe defended people ſhall loue better whan ſe ye ayde confort ſir therto ye boūde ſithe ye haue gouernaunce ouer paye rente ſubſydies aydes ye haue demaunded dyuers tymes enemyes nat ſo ſtrong felde alexaundre towne ſhulde cloſed rounde haue ſuche nombre wherfore men ſhall entre towne caſe whan towne ſhall ſe ſel • e refreſſhed men warre ſhall haue ye corage loue moche better ſhall putte hertes maner treatie ennemyes counſaile lorde mayllayne greed incontynent aſſembled toguyder men warre fyue hundred ſpeares made capitayne thē auncient knight called ſir iaques byerne expert man armes rode coūtrey priuely ſo nyght entred towne alexaundre towne greatly reioyſed cōmyng good cauſe bycauſe erle armynake ſawe menne ſtyrynge towne therfore thre dayes toguyder ſauted ſcrimyſſhed barrier yet ſmall nombre armynakꝭ ſo well reſyſted wan nothyng whan ſir iaques de la byerne company entred ſtrong cyte alexaundre lodged refreſſhed gouernour cytie came vyſite thē lodgynge ſir iaques demaunded ſtate cyte demeanour enemyes take coū ſayle thervpon anncient men moſt ſageſt anſwered ſayd sir ſithe erle armynake hath layde ſiege v euery daye haue aſſautes ſcrimyſſhes barryers well ſirs ꝙ knyght morowe ſhall ſe wyll knowe nat cōmyng wyll make ſecrete iſſue lye enbuſſhe ah ſir quod ye haue nede ware ye ſixtene thouſande horſes diſcouer felde without bataile ſhall reyſe ſuche duſt horſes agaynſt company ye ſhalbe clene diſconfit among ſelfe well quod knyghtes mo owe ſhall ſe howe mater ſhall go muſt ſome feate armes ſithe become hyder euery man retourned lodging knight gaue know ledge cōpany howe next mornyng ſecretely wolde iſſue cytie lye buiſhment feldes cō maunded euery man redy nexte mornyng ſir iaques dela bierne armed hym company iſſued ſecretely hym ioure hundred halfe myle out towne aſſembled valey cauſed two hundred abyde ye barrier cōmaunded enemyes came aſſayle ſhulde make faynt defence recule backe thy derwarde wolde lye ye buſſhement daye fayre clere erle armynake yong luſty herde maſſe pauilyon armed hym diſplayed penon toke hym hundred men thynking man ſhulde encountre hym ſo came company barryers lytell lytell ſome folowed hym ſome ſatte ſtyll ſayd nede arme v whan come barryers ſhall ſe man ſo ſatte ſtyll eatyng drinkyng therle armynake went ſcrimyſſhe barryers began ſcrimyſſhe one another within ſhorte ſeaſon defender beganne recule lytell lytell tyll came enbuſſhe whan ſir iaques de la bierne ſawe enemyes cōe hym diſcouered hymſelfe ſet acmynagoys valyauntly defēded themſelfe alwayes lytell lytell ſocour came many feate armes done ſaynte chriſtofers daye daye ſo hoote ſuche harnes thought verily ben furnes wether ſo faynt wynde ſo luſtyeſt moche feate armes partye myllayne thre agaynſt one duſte powder ſo great coulde ſcante ſe one nother ſpecially erle armynakes parte fell erle great aduenture ſo oppreſſed heate ſo feble coulde ſcant helpe ſelfe ſo drewe aparte one ſyde felde man founde lytell ryuer whan felte ayre water thought paradyſe ſate downe alone beſyde water moche payne dyd baſenet ſate bareheded waſſhed face dranke ye water wherby worſe coldneſſe water coled ſo blode faynter thanne fell palueſy ſo loſt ſtrength body ſpeche men loſte hym many taken knight duke millayns foūde erle armynake whan ſawe hym meruayle parceyued wel knyght man honour knight ſaid sir yelde ye pryſoner erle vnderſtode hym nat coulde nat ſpeke helde vp hande made token yelde hym knyght wolde haue hadde hym ryſe coulde nat knyght taryed ſtyll whyle dyd fyght whiche batayle many feate armes done whan ſyr iaques de la bierne ſage knyght ſawe howe iourney good party howe gret nombre enemyes taken ſlayne alſo ſawe well owne men world • ery enemyes began multyply freſſhe men reculed towarde cytie ſkrymyſſhynge defendynge knyght taken erle armynake thought nat leaue hym behynde thought ſurely ſome man honoure deſyred company ayde hym beare priſoner ye towne promyſynge haue parte raunſome dyd ſo moche payne brought cyte vnarmed layde bedde ſyr iaques de la bierne entred cytie toke lodgynge vnarmed hym refreſſhed company whan erle armynacke myſt hooſt without ſore dyſmayed wyſt nat ſay ſome came place batayle ben ſeke hym returned agayne clene dyſcomfyted knyght taken erle armynake great deſyre know man priſoner came another ſquyer lykewyſe taken priſoner gaſcon deſyringe mayſter ſuffre hym go hym lodgynge ſo went togyder lombarde knyght led ſquyer fraunce chambre brought hym bedde erle armynake lay ſore complaynyng cauſed torch lyghted vp ſaid french ſquyer sir knowe nat man ſquyer regarded hym well ſayd knowe hym well ought ſo capitayne erle armynake whiche wordes lombarde ioyfull erle ſo ſycke vnderſtode nothynge ſayd hym mayſter ſayd go hence let hym reſt thus left ſame nyght dyed paſſed tranſitory lyfe next day whan knowen erle armynake deed alexaunder bedde ſyr iaques bierne wolde nat dethe ſhulde vnknowen cauſed publyſſhed hooſt ſuche priſoners ſe enemyes wolde hoſt ſore dyſcomfyted well ſhewed capitayne drawe vnto companyons gadred partes ſayd let v returne ſaue ſelfe haue loſt tyme anon knowen cytie howe armynois diſcōfyted capytayne armed iſſued horſebacke foote ſet hooſt cryenge pauy lorde myllayne taken ſlayne without defence conqueſt botye great companyons come thyder ſyr iaques bierne armynage yelded ſelfe without defence caſt away armure ſledde chaſed lyke beaſtes lo harde aduenture therle armynake company bad entente well tourned hym great yuell lyued fyue dayes lenger ſyr iohan acton come hym fyue hundred ſpeares thouſande brigandyns foote wherby myght haue done many feates armes loſt harde aduenture whan duke myllayn knewe trouth enemyes ſlayne taken ſpecyally erle armynake ſlayne ioyfull therof loued ſyr iaques de bierne better herte made hym ſoueraygne ouer chyualry made chefe coūſayle duke myllayne auoyde countrey enemyes gaue euery pryſoner gentylman horſe euery man florayne quyted clene raunſomes departynge cauſed ſwere ſhulde neuer arme agaynſt hym thus theſe companion departed lombardy piemount entred sauoy dolpheny ſuche pouertie marueyle paſſed euery towne cloſed agaynſt theym anone euery man ſpent florayn ſome pytie dyd gyue almes charite ſome rebuked mocked ſayenge go wayes ſeke erle armynake drinkynge well alexaundre yet myſchiefe whan came ryuer rone thought lightly haue paſſed ouer realme fraūce dyd nat frenche kynge hadde cōmaunded paſſages cloſed kept agaynſt wherby fell great daunger pouertie coulde neuer aſſemble togyther agayne thus yonge erle armynakes army brake ſonder ſuſter abode ſtyll yuell caſe ſhe ye duke myllayne ſent byſſhop coūtrey ſuche moſt next erle armynake ben hym iourney duke cōmaunded therles body ſhulde baumed ſente brother ſyr barnarde ryght ſorowfull thoſe tydynges good cauſe remedy erle armynake buryed cathedrall churche rodays lyeth ought knowen hath ben contayned hiſtory ſyr thomas percy ſent kyng rycharde englande realme fraūce ſhewed well howe gret affectyon haue ferme peace bytwene englande fraunce ſpecyally two kynge englandes vncles duke lancaſtre duke edmonde yorke kynges vncle duke gloceſtre conſtable englande wolde wyſe acorde haue peace french men without kynges honoure myght rendred agayne ſuche cyties townes caſtels landes ſygnories whiche gyuen kynge englande heyres whiche falſely ben taken away frenchman without tytell reaſone beſyde ſōme four thouſande frankes whiche owyng whan frenchman began warre agayne opynyon dyuers lordes englande ſayenge ye dethe wolde iuſtifye ſame many ſayd duke gloceſtre good ryght reaſon ſuſtayne opinyon diſſymuled mater couertely bycauſe ſawe ye kynges mynde affection enclyned greatly haue peace poore knightes ſquyers archer englandrather enclyned haue warre ſuche ſuſteyned eſtates reaſon warre conſydre well howe peace loue acorde might bytwene theſe party frenche men treatie demaunded haue ealays beaten downe haue ſygnorie guyſnes hammes marke dye landes froyton dependantes guyſnes vnto lymyttes water grauelyng frenche kynge offred delyuer crowne englāde moch landes value acquytayn againſt whiche artycle yt duke glouceſtre helde ſaid frenchman wyll paye v owne knowe well ynough howe haue charter ſealed kynge iohan chyldren hole acquytayn ſhulde haue delyuered v without reſorte ſoueraynte man euer haue doone ſythe hath ben fraude falſe engyn nyght day entende thyng diſceyue v calays ſuche landes demaunde delyuered handes ſhulde lordes ſee coſte conqueſtes nothynge ſhall rather neuer agree peace long lyue ⸫ ⸫ ¶how ſyr peter craon fell french kynges diſpleaſure duke thourayns receyued duke bretayne cap clxxviii ſaid ſeaſō knyght fraunce countrey aniou gentle knight noble extraction called ſyr pyer craon marucylouſly well beloued ſpecially duke thourayne aboute duke thynge doone hym alſo knyght helde gret aſtate duke aniou called kynge naples cicyll iheruſalem alſo ryche aſclaunder brought vp hym realme fraūce howe robbed yonge kynge cycyll duke aniou whiche brute ſayd ſir peter abſented ſelfe fro yonge kynge fro mather ben wyfe olde duke aniou howe delte ſo welbeloued frenche kynge brother duke thourayne alſo ſame ſeaſon ſyr olyuer clyſſon thanne conſtable fraūce greatly fauour kyng duke thourayne whiche fauour get reaſon good ſeruyce done armes well fraūce el kynges dayes father dayes kinge charles ſir olyer clyſſons doughter wedded iohan bretayne brother germayne quene iheruſalem ſyr olyuer clyſſon reaſon alyaunce maryage iohan bretayne greatly duke bretayns indignacion ſomoch duke helde mortall enemy iohan bretayne lykewyſe duke bretayne repented hym nat ſlaine ſir olyuer clyſſon whan hym priſone caſtell ermyn ſyr peter craon ſuche fauour duke bretaygne myght lyſt coſyn whyle fauour frenche kynge duke thourayn wolde gladly haue brought kynges fauoure ſyr olyuer clyſſon conſtable coulde haue brought aboute thus enuyous whiche couertely always hath reygned fraunce diſſymuling mater tyll come yuell concluſion conſtable fraunce alwayes ben ſo true dedes ye crowne fraunce euery manne loued hym except duke burgoyn loued nothyng hatred came duches burgoyne lady hygh corage ſhe coulde nat loue conſtable duke bretayne nere blod father erle flaunders loued ſhe loued ſuche hated ſhe dyd ſame ſhe condycion ſyr peter craon whyle frenche court great duke thourayne wrote often tymes duke bretayne ſecretly euery thynge knewe duke wrote agayne hym theffecte writynges coude nat knowe iohan froy ſart auctor hyſtory tyme whan parys night whan great myſchefe lykely haue fallen vpon ſir olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce marueylous enterpriſe ſyr peter craon ſhall herafter playnly declare whan tyme ſhall requyre bycauſe ſawe mater darke obſcure lykely great trouble daunger dyd payne coulde knowe grounde occaſyon mater ſyr peter craon ſo ſodaynly banyſſhed fro frenche kynges loue duke thourayns suche ſerche made ſuche enquery knewe mater ſome enfourmed trouth fame renome ran fyrſt duke thourayn dyſpleaſed ſyr peter craon owne faute dyſcloſed ſecretneſſe bytwene duke thourayne another lady dyd ſo dyd yuell duke thourayne ſuche fauour ſyr peter craon toke hym companyon ware euer lyke apparell hym alwayes hym ſo euer wente ſhewed hym ſecretes duke thourayn yonge amorous gladly wolde company ladyes damoſels ſporte hym amonge ſpecially ſhewed loued entierly fayre lady paris yonge freſſh loue ſecretes knowen ſuche wyſe turned great dyſpleſure duke wyſte nat whome blame ſyr peter craon duke ſhewed hym ſecretes mater taken hym company whan wolde ſecretly ſpeke ſaid yonge lady duke tyme promyſed ſayd lady thouſande crownes golde ſo myght haue pleaſure lady refuſed ſayd howe ſhe loued hym nat golde ſyluer pure loue enclyned beare hym good wyll golde ſyluer ſhe wolde nat ſell honoure theſe wordes promeſſes knowen duches thourayne incontynent ſent ſaid yonge lady chambre ſhe called name gret diſpleaſure ſayd wylte thou wronge lorde huſband yonge lady abaſſhed wepynge ſayd nay madame grace god neuer dyd thynke neuer wyll ducheſſe ſayd thus iame enfourmed lorde huſbande loueth mater ſo farre gone bytwene ſuche place ſuche tyme promyſed thouſāde crownes golde haue pleaſer howe ye dyd refuſe wherin ye dyd wyſely therfore tyme ꝑdon charge derely ye loue lyfe yt ye commune talke hym ſuffre hym paſſe herkyn nat comunynge whan yonge lady ſawe ſelfe accuſed trouth ſhe anſwered ſayd madame ſhall delyuer fro ſone ſhall ſo deale ye ſhall haue cauſe dyſpleaſure mater therwith ducheſſe gaue leaue departe ſo ſhe returned lodgyng duke thourayne knewe nothynge mater yt entierly loued yonge lady fortuned day come ſhe whanne ſhe ſawe hym ſhe eſchewed company made hym maner ſemblant loue dyd clene cōtrary ſhe vſed ſhe durſt nat alſo ſhe ſworne promyſed duches whan duke ſawe countenaunce penſyue thought wolde knowe ſhe delte ſo ſtraungely demaunded cauſe ſtraungnes yonge lady wepynge ſayd syrye haue bewrayed loue ſecrete promeſſe offre ye made lady wyfe el ſome remembre wel ye haue ſhewed ſecretneſſe ſyr great daunger lady wyfe none haue ſworne promyſed tyme wyll neuer cōpany talke wherby ſhe ſhulde haue ielouſy whan duke harde yt ſore wordes greatly diſpleaſure ſaid ah ſayre lady ſwere faythe rather mater ſhulde haue ben ſhewed wyfe loſte hundred thouſande frankes ſythe ye haue ſworne kepe promeſſe ſo euer coſte wyll knowe trouth hath bewrayed ſecretes thus duke departed fro yonge lady made ſēblant pacyentely ſuffred howe thought nyght came wyfe ſupper ſhewed token loue euer dyd befor dyd ſomoche fayre wordes ducheſſe ſhewed matter howe ſhe knewe ſyr peter craon duke ſpake tyme nyght paſſed nexte day nyne clocke toke horſe rode fro howſe ſaynte poll caſtell lowre founde kynge brother heryng maſſe kyng ſwetelye receyued hym loued hym entyerly kynge ſawe well duke maner ſome dyſpleaſure mynde ſaid ah fayre brother mater ſemeth ye troubled syr quod good cauſe wherfore quod kynge praye ſhewe duke wolde hyde thynge fro kynge ſhewed hym hole mater complayned greatly agaynſt ſyr peter craon ſayd syr faythe iowe god nat honoure wolde ſlee hym ſhall well ynough quod kynge ſhall warned counſayle auoyde houſe ſeruyce lykewyſe cauſe auoyde houſe company well content ꝙ duke ſame day lorde de la ryuer ſir iohan mercyer ſayd vnto ſyr peter craon kynges behalfe ſhulde auoyde kynges courte ſeruyce go lyſte lykewyſe ſyr iohan buell lord dernaulx ſeneſchall thourayne gaue hym lyke commaundement duke thourayns behalfe whan ſyr peter craon ſawe abaſſhed tooke great dyſpyte coude nat ymagyn ſhulde trewe deſyred come kinges preſence duke know cauſe dyſpleaſure aunſwered nother kynge duke wolde nat hym ſpeke whan ſawe none remedy apparelled hym ſelfe departed parys great diſpleaſure hert ſo rode aniou caſtell owne called sable taryed ſeaſon fore troubled mynde ſawe well chaſed frenche courte houſe thourayn alſo houſe quene naples iheruſalem whan parceyued theſe thre howſes cloſed fro hym thought go duke bretaygne coſyn ſhewe hym aduentures ſo dyd rode bretayne founde duke wannes made hym good chere knewe ſomwhat trouble ſyr peter ſhewed hym caſe whan duke bretaygne well herde mater ſayde fayre coſyn recomforte ſelfe ſurely brought aboute ſyr olyuer clyſſon rote foundacyon hatred multyplyed greatly ye ſhall hyſtory syr peter craon taryed ſo longe duke bretaygne forgate fraunce conſtable ſyr olyuer clyſſon kynges counſayle agaynſte hym alſo nat contente duke bretayne kepte ſir peter craon houſe duke bretaygne cared nat greatly neyther good wyll yuell wyll frenche kynge prouyded ſuffyciently cyties townes caſtelles ſuche wyſe loued well warre peace euer dyd well knowen fraunce kinges counſayle ſuche nexte aboute kynge reputed duke bretaygne prowde preſumptuous thretened greatly duke dyde ſette lytell therby ſayde wolde make warre agaynſt erle pointhieur iuſte quarell erle pointhyeur coſyn wryteth nameth hym ſelfe iohan bretayne though herytour countrey wyll called iohan name erle pointhieur wyll put armes ermyns write himſelfe iohan bloys chatellon none wyll nat thus ſhall cauſe take fro hym lande holdeth faythe homage v herytage bretaygne hathe nothynge therwith ſo ſhulde returne haue bothe ſonnes doughters ſhall myne heyres let hym purchaſe hym landes ſome place hath fayled thus often tymes duke bretayne wolde deuyſe ſir peter craon wolde nat replye agaynſt pleaſure rather dyd yuell wyll bare conſtable ſyr olyuer clyſſon counſayle fraunce ⸪ ¶nowe let v leaue ſpekynge mater treate lytell another pytuous mater concernynge erle guy bloys mencyon made hyſtory ⸫ ⸫ ¶of dethe yonge erle loyes chaſtelone ſonne erle guy bloys cap clxxix hath ſhewed hyſtory whan̄e ſpake alyaūce maryage lois chatellon ſonne erle bloys maryed ye lady marye doughter duke iohan berrey confyrmacyon maryage duke berrey prouyded greatly doughter ſhe aſſigned dowry coūtie bloys ſomme ſyxe thouſande pounde money corante fraunce payed florayns foreſayd loys bloys dyed wyfe countie blois boūde pay theſe foreſayd ſyre thouſande frankes ſo fortuned feeſt ſaint iohan baptyſte yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore leuen yonge loys bloys ſonne erle guy departed fro father fro caſtell moltyz bloys go haynalt ſe mother wyfe whan came beaumonte haynault fell ſycke feuer reaſon rydden great iourneys ſeaſon boote yuell kepte tendre age xiiii yeres whiche ſyckenes dyed helpe phyſycions coulde nat put way hote feuer ye maye well knowe father mother ryght ſoroufull whan knewe dethe thier ſonne heyre lykewyſe ſo wyfe yonge lady berrey loued hym entierly thought ſelfe hyghtly maryed ſpecyally trouble father right gret ymagyned duke berrey ryght couetouſe feared leſte wolde entre countie bloys put dowry doughter thus duke berreys two doughters bothe wydowes one yere eldeſt called boeſme counteſſe sauoy huſbande yonge erle sauoy called ame dyed ſame yere ryght marueylouſly whoſe deth came great buſyneſſe layde ſir othe grau • • ome ſuche wyſe fayne flye sauoy fraunce almayne ſo wente dwelte realme englande ⸪ ⸪ ¶of ſodayne dethe erle gaſcon foiz howe erle chaſtellon came herytaūce cap clxxx ſame ſeaſone alſo dyed noble gentle erle foiz ryght marueylouſly ſhal ſhewe incydente truely ſportes erle loued hūtynge houndes grey houndes well prouyded always cōmaundement mo xvi hundred erle barrey march orthays wente dayly huntynge woodes saluaterra way panpylona nauerre ſame daye dyed hunted kylled beare tyme high noone erle demaunded aboute hym dyner prouyded ſhewed hoſpytall ryon two lytell myles fro ortays ſo thyder rode dyner ſo lyghted went chambre whiche ſtrawed grene herbes walles ſette full grene bowes make chambre freſſh ayre without marueylouſly hote moneth may whan felte freſſhe ayre ſayd freſſhneſſe dothe moche good daye hath hoote ſo ſate downe chayre talked deuyſed ſyr eſpayne du lyon houndes whiche ronne beſt thus deuyſed cāe chambre ſir ienbayne baſtarde ſonne ſir peter cabeſtan table redy couered ſame chambre water brought forthe waſſhe coiandon spaygne toke aſyluer baſon ſir tybaulte toke towell erle roſe put handes waſſhe ſone colde water fell fyngars waxed pale face ſodainly herte fayled hym ſo fell downe fallynge ſayd ah deed god haue mercy neuer ſpake worde howe dyed nat ſo ſoone laye great payne knyghtes hym ſore abaſſhed ſo ſoone tooke hym armes layde hym bedde couered hym truſſtynge traunce ii knyghtes gyuen hym water entent ſhulde nat ſayde enpoyſoned hym toke baſon ewer ſayde sir preſence beholde water whiche toke aſſaye yet wyll drā ke therof ſo euery man cōtent put erles mouthe drinke ſpyces thynges comfortable aueyled nothyng leſſe halfe houre deed yelded vp brethe ſwetely god pytie haue mercy ſuch greatly troubled abaſſhed cloſed chambre doore entent dethe ſhulde nat ſo ſodaynly knowen abrode knightes behelde ſir ienbayne ſonne wepte pituouſly wrang hādes knightes hym ſayde sir ienbayne ye haue nowe loſte youre father knowe well loued entierly leaue ſorowe leape horſe ryde orthayes take poſſeſſyon caſtell father treaſoure within euer dethe father knowen abrode sir ienbayne enclyned thoſe wordes ſayd sir thanke good couuſaile whiche ſhall deſerue than̄e lette haue ſome token father elles ſhall nat ſuffred entre caſtell trewe ſir quod take ſōe token fro father toke rynge fro father fynger knyfe bare alwayes hym theſe token porter caſtell knewe well hadde nat brought ſhulde nat haue enered thus ſir ienbayne foiz deꝑted hoſpytall ryone thre hym rode haſte caſtell orthayes rode throughe towne man myſtruſted hym ſo came caſtell called porter aunſwered ſayd ſir wolde haue lorde father hoſpytall ryon quod knyght hath ſent certayne thynges chambre muſt returne agayne entent thou ſhuldeſt beleue beholde rynge knyfe porter opyned wyndowe ſawe tokyns whiche knewe well porter opyned wicket entred varlettes dyd ſet vp horſe ſoone entred ſayde porter cloſe agayne gate toke porter ſayd delyuer kayes el thou arte deed porter abaſſhed ſayde sir ſay ye thus bycauſe quod father deed wyll haue ye poſſeſſyon treaſour come porter obeyed durſt none otherwiſe loued ſir ienbayne well another knyght knewe ryght well treaſour laye whiche ſtronge towre wherto belonged thre ſtronge dores ſurely bolted barred dyuers kayes parteynyng whiche kayes coude nat fynde redely cofer ſtele locked lytell kaye stele whiche kaye erle euer bare hym wherſoeuer wente lytell purſe aboute necke whiche ſir ienbayne departed fro hoſpytall founde knightes deed corſe thā marueyled kaye ſhulde erle bare ſo priuely hym ſelfe therles chapelayne called ſir nicholas eſcall knewe erles ſecretes erle loued hym well euer whan went treaſorie houſe chapelayne hym ſayde ſoone ſawe kaye ah ſir ienbayne hath loſt payne kaye lytell cofer wherin kayes towre cofer wher erles treaſour lyeth knyghtes ſayde sir nicholas go ryde orthayes beare hym kaye sir quod ſythe ye gyue counſayle ſhall better father treaſoure another alſo knowe well father loued hym entierly tooke horſe tooke kaye rode caſtell • hayes ſeaſon ſir ienbayne ſertchynge aboute kayes coulde nat fynde thē wyſt nat howe get towre dore opyn ſo ſtronge alſo hadde inſtrumentes breke opyn meane ſeaſon men towne hadde ſoone knowledge varlettes woman came hoſpytall howe therle ſhulde deed theſe harde tidynges erle welbeloued withall people towne aſſembled guyder markette place ſayde one another ſuche hadde ſene ſir ienbayn paſſe towne alone haue ſene ſir ienbayne paſſe towne alone towardes caſtell ſemed councynaunce nat content surely ſome thyng myſſe ſor nat wonte cōe home father thus cōmunynge toguyder came towne erles chapelayne than̄e men towne came aboute hym demaūded newes therle lorde hath ſhewed v deed ſo nat nay quod preeſt deed ſore ſicke come home cauſe thynges dreſſed hym muſte retourne agayne hym ſo therwith paſſed forth caſtell dyde ſo moche entred whoſe commyng ſir yuan great ioye without kaye brought coulde nat haue entred towre treaſour men towne hadde great ſuſpecte erles dethe ſayde nere hande nyght yet nothynge lorde none offycers ſir yuan chapelayne entred caſtell ſuſpeciouſly let v watche caſtell night morowe ſhall tidynges lette v ſende ſecretely ye hoſpitall ſhall knowe howe mater gothe alſo knowe well mooſt parte erles treaſour caſtell ſtollen awaye crafte ſhalbe blamed ignoraunce ſhall nat excuſe v thought beſt ſo than̄e men towne drewe caſtell kepte gate towne ſurely none ſhulde entre iſſue without lycence thus watched nyght mornyng parfyte knowledge dethe lorde euery man woman chylde cryed wepte pituouſly erle welbeloued watchman doubled encreaſed harneſſe aboute caſtell whan ſir yuan foize ſawe maner men towne ſawe well howe ꝑceyued knewe certayntie dethe father ſayde ſir nycholas sir haue fayled myne entēt ſe well nat departe hen without lycence men towne haue knowledge father dethe aſſemble great nombre ye caſtell behoueth humble ſelfe force nat aueyle ſir ye ſaye trouthe quod preeſt ye ſhall wyn ſwete fayre word rude frowarde dealynge go waye ſpeke ſir yuan went towre nere gate opyned wyndowe ouer bridge whiche towre brought vp tyll maryed lady iane boloyne afterwarde ducheſſe berrey ye ſhall hyſtorie sir yuan opyned wyndowe ſpake princypals towne cāe bridge nere windowe wolde ſaye ſpake loude ſayde ye good people orthays knowe well cauſe aſſēbly nat wtout great occaſion requyre derely ye loued lorde father ye nat diſpleaſed thoughe haue aduaunſed ſelfe entre caſtell firſt ſhude entre take poſſeſſion therof ſuche goodes within wyll nothyng good ye knowe well lorde father loued well entierly owne ſonne wolde fayne haue foūde wayes haue made enherytour nowe hath pleaſed god call hym mercy without accomplyſſhyng thynge myne aduauncement nowe hath lefte amonge haue brought vp lefte nowe poore knyght baſtarde ſonne erle foize without haue ayde helpe wherfore ſirs requyre goddes behalfe haue pytie wherin ye ſhall great almeſſe ſhall open caſtell ſuffre entre wyll nat kepe agaynſt aunſwered ſayde sir yuan ye haue ſpoken ſo nobly ought ſuffyce ſir ſaye wyll abide entent kepe caſtell goodes vicount chaſtellon coſyn next enherytoure countrey byerne nexte parente father come hyder challenge herytage mouables haue ſhall knowe well howe ſhall defende right fro hym fro brother ſir gracyen ſuppoſe whan̄e frenche kynge laſte tholous lorde youre father hym ſome order takenne touchyng father enherytaunce ſir roger spaygne coſyn tell man better ſhall write ſhewe hym dethe erle father deſyre hym come hyder helpe counſayle v thynges concernynge landes bierne foiz alſo mouables thentierment lorde youre father promyſe faythfully vpholde aunſwere ſir yuan well contente thanne opyned gate caſtell orthayes ſuche entred wolde ſame daye erles body brought thyder metyng corſe men woman wepte pituouſly remembraunce nobleneſſe puyſſaunt eſtate wytte prudence proweſſe largeſſe great proſperyte lyued nouther frenche englyſſhe durſte dyſpleaſe hym mooſt parte people ſayd nowe neyghbours wyll make v war wonte lyue peace fredome nowe ſhall bondage miſery ſubiectyon nowe none ayde v ah gaſcone gaſcone fayre ſon̄e dyde ye euer ſo dyſpleaſe father yt coſte lyfe ye ben lefte v ſhulde nowe haue ben v great cōforte loſt yong father hath taryed ſhort ſeaſon v threſcore thre yeres age myght haue lyued age many yere lengar great age ſuche prince hauynge euery thyng eaſe wyſſhe ah thou lande bierne deſtytute without conforte noble herytour ſhall become thou ſhalte neuer haue agayne ſuche another gentyll erle foiz ſuche lamentacions wepynges body noble erle borne throughe towne orthayes eight noble knyghtes firſt vycounte brunyquell agaynſt hym lorde compayne thirde ſir roger spaygne agaynſt hym ſir raymonde layſne fyfthe ſir raymonde de la mote agaynſt hym lorde beſache ſeuenthe ſir menault noualles agaynſt hym rycharde ſaynt george behynde ſir yuan baſtarde ſonne lorde coraſe lorde barantyne lorde baruge lorde quere mo threſcore knyghtes byerne ſoone come hoſpytall ryone whan knewe erles dethe thus caryed wt open vyſage freers orthayes enbaumed layde leed ſo lefte vnder good kepynge vnto day entierment nyght daye withoute ceaſe brinnynge aboute body four twentie torch borne eight fourtie yomen foure twentie nyght foure twentie daye ⸪ dethe noble erle foiz anone knowen dyuers countreis mo rather ſorie dethe gladde dayes giuen ſuche gyftes ſo liberally coulde nat eſchewed wherfore loued euery man knewe hym pope clement whan knewe dethe right ſoroufull hym bicauſe taken great payne fortherynge maryage coſyn iane boloygne ducheſſe berrey ſame ſeaſon auignon byſſhop palmes durſt nat com benifyce diſpleaſure erle foize hym yet lynage cauſe byſſhopp̄ wolde haue exalted iuriſdiction abated therles therle made hym byſſhop pope ſente byſſhoppe come palais whan cōe pope ſayde sir byſſhoppe palmes peace made erle foiz deed thoſe tidynges byſſhoppe glad within ſhorte ſeaſon departed fro auignon wente byſſhoprike countrey foize tidynges dethe erle anone come fraū ce kynge counſayle frenche kyng brother duke burbone ſorie dethe bycauſe nobleneſſe counſayle ſaide kyng sir coūtie foiz right ſucceſſyon ſeyng erle foiz deed without heyre body laufully begotten man canne debate therin alſo countie thynke ſame ſir one thyng helpeth gretlye tytell ye haue lende fyftie thouſande frankes sir ſende take poſſeſſyon guage kepe youre owne enherytaūce ſame coū trey deſyre vnder youre hande fayre countre ſhall come good purpoſe marcheth nere realme arragone alſo chattelone paraduenture ye may happe haue warre kyng arragon countie foiz ſhalbe good fronter therin many fayre ſtronge caſtelles kepe men warre make good garyſons kyng herde well thoſe wordes anone enclyned counſayle ſayde sir lette ſe whome ſhall ſende meſſage than̄e determyned ſende ye lorde de la ryuer bycauſe knowen countrey hym byſſhoppe noyon theſe two lordes prepared ſelfe go legacyon whan̄e departed rode leyſar ſmall iourneys toke waye auignon meane ſeaſon worde ſente vicount chaſtellon beyng realme arragon dethe coſyn erle foiz rode tyll cāe bierne ſtreyght orthays towne made hym good chere howe toke nat lorde ſaide howe countrey nat aſſembled firſt muſt aſſemble toguyder prelate lordes men good townes counſayle toguyder ſhulde sayeng good coū trey holdeth hym ſelfe lordes dwelleth therin hath herytages free than̄e aduyſed beſt firſt make entierment erle gaſcone foiz orthays ſende noble bierne foize ſuche wolde come take counſayle whō ſhulde accepte lorde barones prelate heedes good townes bierne foiz ſent bierne cāe thyder foiz refuſed come ſayde wolde kepe countrey herde ſaye frenche kyng wolde ſende thyder chalēge countre foiz howe byſſhop palmes deſyred come orthais bycauſe lynage ſo came thyder good array hym apparteyned day obſequy gentyll erle gaſcon foiz laſt erle name done freres towne orthays yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore xi monday moche people countrey bierne place bothe lordes knightes prelate four biſſhoppes byſſhop palmes ſayd maſſe byſſhoppes ayre auron tenues bierne goodly herſe well ordred duryng maſſe tyme holden aulter four knightes foure baners armes foiz bierne firſt helde ſir raymon newcaſtell ſeconde ſir eſpaygne du lyon thirde ſir peter deguier fourthe ſir menaulte noualles ſir roger spaygne offred ſworde bytwene bourge campaigne pier arnaulte bierne capitayne lourde ſhelde bare vicount bruniquell bytwene ſir iohan newcaſtell iohn̄ chanteron helme offred lorde valētyne bierne bytwene arnalton roſtem arnalton ſaynt colombe horſe offred lorde coraſe bytwene arnalton spayne raymonet campaygne entierment honorably done accordyng vſage ye countre two baſtarde ſō ne erle foiz ſir yua • ſir gracien vicount chaſtel • baron bierne ſome foiz aſſone ſeruyce done foiz departed rode ſame daye dyner herytell two myles fro orthais ye next day tymes byſſhoppe palmes deꝑted wolde nat generall ꝑlyament whiche ſame daye monge bierne thus erle buryed ye freers hyghe aulter mencion made hym god haue mercy vpon ſoule ¶nowe let v ſpeke order taken orthais enformed ſaid vycount chatelion sir knowe well next blode ye ought ſuccede herytagꝭ well bierne foiz nowe nat receyue oure lorde therby myght bring lande bierne great trouble warre daunger vnderſtande frenche kynge good neighbour dothe ſēde hyder coū ſayle knowe nat entent tyll ſpeke knowe well ſo lorde erle whome god pardone laſt yere tholous frenche kyng ſecrete cōmunycacion toguyder whiche firſte hath nede declared haue gyuen releaſed frēche kyng foiz bietne kyng puiſſance wyll haue optayne wherfore thing wyll know artycles byern caſe cōdycion foiz fre without homage ſeruytude countie foiz holden frenche kynge alſo people foiz hertes ſo frenche lightly wyll receyue frenche kyng lorde ſoucraygne haue ſayde ſithe erle deed hath none heritour body laufully gotten wherfore countie foize ſaye ſhulde parteyne ordynaūca frenche kyng ſir ſhall kepe holde wyll ſerue lorde ſuche ought wheder frēch kyng ſir wyll counſaile worke wyſely buſyneſſe treatie otherwyſe vycount ſaid ſirs meanes wyll ye coūſayle worke haue promiſed worke aduyſe euery thyng accordyng reaſon ſir quod wyll aduyſe deſyre ſir roger spaygne coſyn kepe company coſt charge go countie foiz treate prelate noble men theym good townes wolde receyue lorde elles ſytte ſtyll diſſymule mater tyll ye haue apeaſed ye french kyng taken hym ſome cōpoſicion meanes golde ſiluer ye might haue enheritaunce reſt peace ye thus ye wiſely ye maye herde ſente fro frenche kynge countie foize thoughe coſt hundred thouſande two hūdred thouſande frankes ye ſhall fynde ynoughe paye erle deed hath lefte ynoughe behynde hym howe beit ſir wyſe wyll two baſtarde ſonnes haue parte largely goodes lorde anſwered ſayde sir content ye wyll coſyn ſir roger spaygne youre preſences deſyre hym ryde iourney ſir roger anſwered ſaid sir content ryde meane bytwene bothe ꝑties frenche kyng ſouerayne lorde ambaſſadours deſyre coūſayle orels cōmaūde nat medell muſt nedes leaue vycount content ſaide coſyn truſt wyll nat agaynſt take fro may haue nere thynke make good ende buſyneſſe enformed vycount chaſtellon made requeſt thē borowe fyue vi thouſande frankes performe iourney alſo two baſtardes made requeſt might haue parte father richeſſe coūſayle toke aduiſe togider laſt acorded vicoūt ſhulde haue fyue thouſande frankes two baſtardes foiz eche two thouſāde frankes incōtynent tre • ourers cōmaunded delyuer money offycers erles dayes ſuffred occupy ſtyll without chaungyng kepers ſette kepe caſtell orthais richeſſe within vicount firſt cōmynge orthais gaue pardon priſoners caſtell wherof great nombre erle foiz cruell man wolde ſpare man punyſſhe pleaſure though neuer ſo great ꝑſonage one priſone ſaid vycount chaſtellon botome dongion eight monethes coſyn germayne whan̄c delyuered ſette hym raūſome xl thouſāde frankes whiche truly payde alſo longe lyued loued hym neuer ſo vicount durſt neuer come ſight erle lyued two yeres lengar vicount ſhulde neuer haue parte ye heritage foiz bierne thus counſayle orthays brake vp euery man departed lefte vycount prepare iourney made hym redy ſoone might deſyred certayne knightes ſquiers go hym thus departed fro orthais two hundred horſe rode moriens good towne fronter bytwene byerne bygore four myles fro pauy ſixe myle fro tarbe ſeconde day rode ſaynt gauſens another good towne entre coūtie foiz ryuer garone tidynges came hym howe byſſhoppe noyon ſir buryaulx de la ryuer ye frenche kynges counſayle cōe tholous vycount tooke counſayle ſir roger spayne beſt ſir roger anſwered ſayd sithe haue herde tidynges let v tary ſe wyll thynke wyll ſende ſhortely v ſo taryed dede coulde go countie foiz good townes caſtelles paſſages cloſed agaynſt calumuche caſteres moūtteſquen carthas ortyngas foſſat cytie palmes caſtell montaunt caſtels fronter aragon countie foiz ſayd ſtraūger puiſſaunce ſhulde entre caſtell towne countrey tyll mater determyned countrey ſhewed themſelfe better mynded frenche gouerned ſeneſchall countre cytie tholous carcaſſon beauuoyre rather vnder ruler howe mater went otherwyſe ye ſhall whan frenche kynges cōmyſſaries come tholous demaunded newes archebyſſhoppe ſeneſchall foiz bierne ſuche ben orthays buryeng erle foiz enformed caſe countre ſtode toke aduyſe togyder determyned ſende ſir roger spaygne bycauſe frenche kynges man faythe homage oftycer ſeneſchall carcaſſone ſent credable perſone letter hym meſſanger rode ſaynt gauſens xii myle fro then delyuered ſir roger spaygne letter ſir roger toke reed ſayd ye ſquyer sir ye ſhall tary day morowe ye ſhall departe thynke ye ſhall nat go without company ſir roger vycount counſayled toguyder thought beſte ſir roger spayne ſhulde ryde tholous ſpeke byſſhop noyon lorde de la ryuer knowe wolde ſay next day ser roger spayne meſſanger rode forthe togyder came y• ſame nyght tholouſe syr roger toke vp lodgyng meſſanger went mayſters cōmyſſioners ſaid morowe ſhall tydynges ſeynge ſir roger come next day maſſe ſyr roger drewe byſſhop lorde de la ryuer made good chere eche bycauſe aquayntaunce communed cauſe cōmynge kinges cōmyſſyoners ſhewed forth kinges procuracions howe ſet ſtablyſſhed take poſſeſſyon ſeaſon countie foiz whan ſyr roger well herde length replyed ſwete wordes ſayde lordes nat ſo nere ye kinges coūſayle ye ſauynge correction wolde counſayle kyng ſhulde take agayn money ſomwhat trewe hath lente money herytage foize reyſed dethe erle yet let kynge leaue ryght enherytaunce nexte enherytoure blode ſhall kynges profyte honour ſaluacyon ſaye ſhall laye dyuers reaſons ye wyll one thynge whiche clere erle foiz layde lande pledge fraude golde ſyluer ynough dyd nothynge dyſheryte vicount chaſtellon wrōgfully bycauſe hated hym without cauſe alſo touchyng kynges profyte enſure kepyng lande foize ſhulde coſte kynge rente reuenues cometh vnto thyrdly kyng ſhall leſe therby homage ſeruyce ſuche man able good ſeruyce ought well regarded alſo ſhulde great charge kynges conſyence dyſheryte perſone without reaſonable cauſe herytage foiz ſhuld haue ben bought ſolde fyrſte ſuche claymeth ryght therin ſhulde haue ben greed ſatyfyed whiche nat ſo wherfore lordes theſe reaſons well conſydred ſeynge ye great wyſe men counſaylours kynge take good hede ye ye pronounce thynge ſhulde tourne kinges ſclaunder hurte conſcyence ye otherwyſe great ſynne yet tyme ſuffycyente fynde remedy coſyn vicount chaſtellon hathe ſente hyther ſhewe mater ryght effectuouſly deſyreth ſo name take regarde behalfe nat good conuenyent man take euery thynge byforce maye take whan ſayde byſſhoppe lorde de la ryuer loked eche laſte byſſhop ſayde syr rodger ſe knowe well ye haue ſayd good entente cōmyſſyon ſtretcheth nat ſo farre quyte bargayne bytwene kyng therle foize howe loue bringe matter ſomwhat good purpoſe partyes myght cōtent ſhall put mater ſuffraunce ye ſhall take pay • e ryde v fraunce kynge counſayle ſhewe reaſons ye ſhall thinke beſt meanes ye cauſe vycount chaſtellon enioy herytage foiz enherytoure therto ye ſaye ſhall ryght gladde therof wyll dyſheryte perſon syrs quod ſyr roger well contente ſayenge pleaſe abyde ſeaſon coſtes ſhall borne good caſtell orthays thyrde day ſir roger spayne tooke leaue kynges cōmyſſyoners ſayde syrs thynke bringe mater good purpoſe muſt fayne make iourney fraunce tary longe pray nat myſcontent ſhall nat faulte ſhall ſende daily meſſangers letter thus departed taryed tholous ſir roger rode ſaynt gauſens vycount chaſtellon ſhewed mater vycount ioyfull thoſe tydynges ſayd fayre coſyn ſyr roger truſt mater toucheth nere thenherytaunce wherof beare armes nat tell whome ſende fraunce onely ſhewe tytle kynge coūſayle wherfore ſir loue may deſerue tyme come take charge voyage ſyr rodger ſayd syr loue lynage ſhall ſir roger prepared iourney ryde fraūce ſo toke way rodes ſhorter way truce bytwene fraunce englande el way toke nat ſure hym fronters rouuergue quercy lymoſyn many fortreſſes made warre englyſſhemen ¶nowe wyll leaue ſeaſon ſpekynge ſyr roger spayne ſpeke frenche kynge duke bretayne ⸪ ⸪ ¶how treatie peace renewed tower thourayn bytwene frenche kynge duke bretayne mariage doughter fraunce lonne bretayne iohn̄ bretayne erle pointhieur doughter duke bretaygne cap clxxxi ye haue herde dyuers place hyſtory howe duke bretayne ſyr olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce hated mortally eche beſyde hatred duke ſyr olyuer gret enuy ſo great kinge ſo ſecrete counſayle gladly wolde haue troubled hym doughted ye kynges diſpleaſure often tymes duke repented hym nat ſlayne hym whan hym priſone caſtell ermyn thought ſlayne hym ſhulde neuer haue trouble hym yuell wyll hym cauſed hym harde mynded obedyente crowne fraunce howe knewe well dyd yuell therfore ſuffred thynge paſſe aduenture helde loue englyſſhe men prouyded ſuffycyently townes fortreſſes artyllery vytayles ſent priuely englande men armes archer dyd ſet garyſons made beleued loked haue warre men kn • nat whome howe euer dyd knowen fraūce many ſpake largely againſt knewe well certrayne lordes fraunce nat contente hym dyd ſet lytell therby ſo paſſed tyme great affyaunce coſyne ducheſſe burgoyne reaſon ſpecyall ſupporte ayde lady bycauſe lygnage loued hym bycauſe erle flaunders father coſyn germayne duke alwayes loued comforted hym trybulacyons lady burgoyne good lady ſo duke huſbande wolde nat gladly diſpleaſe good cauſe ye duke helde great herytages fayre chyldren realme fraunce bounde loue ſhe nat ben great dyſcenſions moued bytwene party natwithſtandynge duke bretayne ben paris french kyng made hym homage yet nat well ſay good herte ſone duke retourned bretaygne apered hym ſmall amendemente ſworne obeyſaunce obedyent pope auignon nat rather diſpyſed hym wordes alſo wolde ſuffre man promoted countrey pope bulles helde hym ſelfe newter dyuers thynges wolde gyue benefyces hym ſelfe clerke coulde atteygne promocyon benefyce countrey without ben well pleaſed therwith alſo cōmaūdements came parlyament chambre parys ſette nothynge therby prelate byſſhoppes bretayne loſt great parte iuriſdictions duke ſo great complayntes therof made parlyament parys hadde ſmall remedy whan ſent come parysꝭ el ſende thyder ſome able perſonages make aunſwere ſuche matter ſhulde aledged agaynſte hym whan kynges offycers came bretaygne ſomon hym apere thanne wolde nat ſpoken withall euer made ſondry ſeues whan kinges officer dyd departe againe then wolde ſay wyll go parys ſe ryght ſhall haue nat yet thre yeres ſence ſe ryght ſhulde haue coulde ſe ryght mynyſtred lordes parlyament tourne euery thynge lyſt reken yonge ignorante ledde lyſt wolde knewe men duchy bretaygne one accorde obedyent pleaſure ought wolde gyue realme fraunce ſo moche wolde bringe theym vnreaſonable reaſon ſuche hath done trewly ſhulde rewarded acordyngly ſuche haue deſerued haue iuſtyce ſhulde haue haue deſerued ſuche wolde haue right ſhuld haue thus many complayntes made often tymes kynge ſuche ſecrete counſayle ſaid duke ryght preſumptuous proude ſythe wyll brought reaſon ſhulde thus ſuffred lewde opinyon ſhulde greatly enfeble nobleneſſe realme hym lordes ſhall take enſample yuell therby iuryſdictyon realme lytell lytell ſhall loſte deuyſed withſtande fynde remedy ſuche inconuenyentes ſende ſwetely hym come towrs thourayne mete french kyng duke berrey duke burgoyne byſſhop charter byſſhoppe dothune theſe four ſpecyally named bycauſe duke loued beſt aboue lordes fraunce excepte erle eſtampes lorde coucy thus ſente bretayne duke erle eſtampes mayſter iue noyent toke great payne traueyle moue duke mete frenche kynge towrs ſpake ſo fayre freſſhe coloured wordes armed reaſon duke agreed go towrs ſayd wyſe wolde go alſo ſhulde nat ſe enemy ſyr olyuer clyſſon wyſe acorded agreed wolde come towrs theſe ambaſſadours retourned fraunce ſhewed kynge counſayle howe ſpedde contente therwith ſythe coulde brynge hym none purpoſe kynge coūſayle made redy go towrs tary two thre monethes thought treatie ye duke bretayne ſhulde nat ſone acompliſſhed thus frenche kinge duke thourayne brother duke berrey burgoyne iohan burgoyne ſonne duke burbon lorde coucy erle marche erle ſaynte poll counſaile fraūce came towrs thourayn alſo thyder came conſtable fraū ce iohan bretayne ſonne lawe counſayles hadde mater fyftene dayes thyder came duke bretayne came ſayd wolde nat come thre tymes ſent excuſe hym ſelfe ſayenge ſpeke coude nat ryde finally came lodged eaſe ſyr roger spaygne haue ben aunſwered kynge counſayle ſomoche duke bretayns mater coulde entende nothyng el ſyr roger two monethes coulde aunſwered daily anſwered yt ſhulde herde longe fyrſte alſo ſame tyme fell another let thyder came fro kyng rycharde englande ſyr iohan clapam one kynges counſayle chaumbre rycharde choall clerke doctour lawe ſpeke frenche kynge counſayle ſame matter ſyr thomas percy lorde clyfforde ben parys kynge whan englyſſhe men come towrs treaty cloſed vp entended delyueraunce ſhewed brought letter credence kynge duke berrey burgoyne herde credence kynge englande vncles wolde knowe frenche kynge counſayle wyll mynde kepe metyng amyence treate peace bytwene two kynges alyes confederate frenche fynge ſhewed deſyred thynge ſo moche peace anſwered ſaid redy accomplyſſhe promeſſes ſayenge ſoone delyuered duke bretayne departed fro towrs wolde entende nothynge e • tyll come amyence abyde englyſſhe ambaſſadours make good chere coude englyſſhe ambaſſadours well cōtent fyue dayes towrs kynge tooke leaue kynge lordes kynge gaue great gyftes coſtes payed ſo departed ſeaſon ſawe nat duke bretayne ſpake nat hym duke welde nat leſte frenche men ſhulde haue ſuſpecte hym thus englyſſhmen retourned calays ſo douer london founde kynge counſayle weſtmynſter ſhewed done herde ſene anſwere brought pleaſed well kynge counſayle ordeyned iourney go amyence ¶nowe let v ſom ſpeke meſſangers ſente frenche kynge fro vycount chaſtellon foize bierne sir roger spayne ſir eſpaygne du lyon ſent fraunce fro vicounte chaſtellen toke theym great payne traueyle purſewe cauſe certayne clerkes knightes kinges counſayle aduyſed kynge take countie foiz attrybute crowne fraunce ſythe countrey wolde agree therto kynge enclyned well therto duke burgoyne ſage ymagynatyue wolde nat agree therto ſayd alwayes let kynge take agayn money ſomwhat howe ſhewed duke burgoyne coulde nat herde duke berrey toke buſyneſſe meanes ſhall ſhewe ye haue herde fell bytwene hym olde gaſcon erle foize whan duke ſente bierne erle ſuche notable perſones erle sanxete vicount daſſey lorde de la ryuer ſyr wyllm̄ tremoyle treate maryage lady iahan boloyne whome erle foize kepinge tyme erle well content maryage ye duke berrey ſhulde haue ſo wolde pay thyrty thouſande frankes kepyng bringynge vp lady duke payed ſaid ſome ſo lady wyfe duke berrey remembred mater ſente ſyr roger spayne ſyr eſpayne du lyon come ſpeke hym chambre ſo ſecretly ſayde syrs ye wyll come good concluſyon ſute ye ſhall attayne therto meanes fyrſt wyll haue agayne thyrty thouſande frankes whiche payed olde erle foiz whan wyfe haue alwayes ymagyned myght ouer lyue erle foiz haue money agayne whan theſe two knyghtes herde duke ſay ſo regarded eche ſpake neuer worde duke ſayd agayne syrs ſay trouthe haue taken wordes fro ſpeke togyther aduyſe well without treatie ye ſhall nat attayne purpoſe brother burgoyne wyll wyll haue hym hath gouernaunce countrey picardy languedocke agaynſte wyll man wyll ſpeke vycount chaſtellon ſhall fynde good ynough erle deed rycheſſe kynge hath treaſour ſyr roger spayne ſayde ſir though wolde agre demaunde yet haue nat v treaſure contente withall ah ſyr roger quod duke ſhall nat let hyndre mater ye promyſe dette faythe writynge wyll beleue greater mater syr quod knyght thanke ſhall ſheke togyder gyue anſwere pleaſeth well quod duke departed fro duke went lodgynge toke counſayle togyther whether ſhulde retourne agayne home without agrement el acorde duke demaunde ſo heritage might clerely remayne abyde vycount chaſtellon nexte daye retourned duke offered hym demaunde ſo ſyr roger spayne ſyr eſpaygne du lyon became dettours duke berrey xxx thouſande frankes condicion ſhulde meane kynge ſhulde take agayne ſōme money lente erle foize vicount chaſtellon might peaſably enioy herytage well quod duke lette alone ſhall truſte day duke berrey deſyred haue theſe xxx thouſande frankes ſo good adūocate vycount chaſtellon concluded buſyneſſe owne wyll kynge counſayle put mater pleaſure ſo theſe two knyghtes letter ſealed confyrmacyon countie foiz trewe enherytaūce vicount chaſtellon letter therof adreſſed ye byſſhop noyon lorde de la ryuer beynge tholouſe • enour letter enfourmed ſuche credyble perſones went ſame legacyon foloweth charles grace god kynge fraunce ſende cōmende v ryght reuerende byſſhoppe noyon knight chambrelayne lorde de la ryuer wyll ye ſuffre vycount chaſtellon enherytour foiz bierne enioy poſſede heritage countie foiz purtenaūces ſo ye take poſſeſſyon ſōme lx thouſande frankes one payment money payed ſeneſchall tholouſe make ſure quytaunce recryte therof alſo nother paymente wyll ye receyue twenty thouſande frankes coſtes charge goynge retournyng money payed make quytaunce therof vnder ſeale offyre tholouſe alſo wyll ſyr yuan ſyr gracyen foiz baſtarde ſonnes erle gaſcon foiz haue parte ceaſonable aſſignement bothe landes goodes father aduyſe dyſcrecyon ſyr roger spayne vicount bruny quell ſyr raynolde newcaſtell lorde coraſe whome ſhall write maye ſo aquyte dyſcharge conſcyence made ſuche promyſe erle father faute theſe four lordes rebellyon vycount diſanull ſayde treatie wyll ſtande boyde wytneſſe theſe letter haue ſette ſeale cytie towrs xxii yere oure teygne twenty day moneth decembre theſe letter made ſealed delyuered knyghtes foiz retourned fro towrs leaue taken ſeaſon ſyr loys sanxere marſhall fraunce lay march carcaſſone ſoueraygne gouernour inſtytuted kynge byſſhoppe noyon lorde de la ryuer ſent hym tholouſe whan come thyder ſayde hym syr marſhall vycount chaſtellon reputeth hym ſelfe enherytour country foiz haue ſent fraūce kynge knowe counſayle wyll ſaye mater wherfore ye redy menne armes fronters foiz ſoone ſyr roger spayne ſyr eſpayne returned haue meſſage fro kynge agree nat peace king wyll haue lande foiz entre incontynent take poſſeſſyon acordynge ye right puyſſaunce kynge hathe gyuen v quarell thus marſhall redy prouyded euery day loked aunſwere fro kynge ¶nowe wyll leaue ſpeakyng mater ſhewe ſomwhat duke bretayne ye haue herde treatie towrs thourayn bytwene frenche kyng duke bretaygne whiche duke dyde put kynge counſayle moche payne wolde fall reaſon ſayde kynge demaunded hym refuſed lykewyſe demaunded kynge refuſed moche treatie concluſion taken duke redy ſerue kynge hym homage farre forthe bounde thanne kynges counſayle ſayd hym sythe ye knowledge yourſelfe kinges liegman wyll ye nat obey reaſon ſyrs quod wherin rebell layde dyuers poyntes fyrſte beleuynge pope auygnon whome ſayde kynge toke trewe pope ye dyffer ther fro dyſſymule mater ye wyll obey none cōmaundementes gyue benefyces ſelfe bretaygne ſuche brynge bulles fro pope ye wyll nat knowe theym agaynſte mageſty royall great ſynne cōſcyence ſoule duke aunſwered ſayde conſcyence man ought ſpeke therof iudge onely god ſoueraygne iudge ſuche cauſes ſyth • ye argue appoſe maner▪ ſhall aunſwere theſe pope indyfferent ſure declaration made ſeaſon firſt tydynges came choſynge pope vrbayne towne gaunt coſyn erle flaunders receyued letter ſealed pope ſeale called robert queſne cardynall letter certifyed erle coſyn grace god deuyne ſpyratyon choſen pope hadde name vrbayne howe canne vndone agayne thynke harde wyll nat argue agaynſt kinges maieſte coſyn lyege man ſhall well trewly ſerue hym whan ſo euer requyred farre forthe bounde wyll ſpeke agaynſt counſayle nat kynge well ſyr quod ſhewe v nat counſayle kynge ought ſhall fynde remedy syrs • ye knowe better ye company oftener touchynge benefyces countrey nat ſo haute ſo cruell agaynſt ſuche deſyre ſuffre clerkes countrey en • oy bulles pope clement ſuche cerkes nat ſame countrey refuſe cauſe ſhall ſhewe wolde beare away rycheſſe countrey therof deſerue nat whiche agaynſt ryght conſyence wher fore nat agree therto ye ſaye rebell 〈◊〉 agaynſt kynges offycers whanne come coūtrey nat ſo wyll nat ye ought knowe ye nat lerne fee • uchy bretayne ſo noble condycion ſoueraygnely ought none enterpriſe mater alonely owne naturall lorde ſay duke bretayne holdeth court open ryghtes offycers execute ryghtes lande bretaygne acordynge offyce haue offycer dothe contrary ryght outher ſtraunger haue cauſe complayne punyſſhe ſhall ſhall take enſample ouer ſay ſome kynges counſayle ſo ought reproued moche maye noryſſhe warre hatred bytwene kyng cauſe clere ynough ſuffre coſyn iohn̄ bloys two thynges agaynſt vnreaſonable fyrſte writeth hym ſelfe iohan bretayne reaſon name ſemeth entendeth attaygne herytage bretaygne whiche without ſhall haue chyldren ſonne doughter ſhall ſuccede secondely beareth ermyns whiche armes bretaygne trouthe dyſpleaſure withall ſir olyuer clyſſon mayntayneth opinyon longe caſe wyllagre treatie kynge warre wyll make none kyng bycauſe naturall lorde yuell informacyon ye kyng make warre ſhall defende ſhall fynde myne owne countre wyll kyng knowe thus treatie bytwene kynge duke bretayne contynued rygorouſly duke lorde mayſter counſayle frenche kynge nat ſo ruled ſyr olyuer cliſſon begue vyllains ſyr iohan mercyer ſyr willyam montague duke burgoyne clere vnderſtandyng euery thynge ſuffred duke bretaygnes reaſons defence ſayde place couertly ſuſteyned duke berrey opynyon hated inwardly kynges priuy chambre bycauſe dyſtroyed treaſourer betyſache ſhamfully iuſtyce beſyers ye haue herde ſuffred ſawe tyme reuenged dyfference duke bretaygne taryed towrs thre monethes treatie coulde come good concluſyon poynte haue departed kynge wyll ſoone retourned fraunce make great aſſemble make warre next ſomer bretayne agaynſt duke ſuche acorde leaue buſines duke berrey burgoyne lorde coucy therle ſaint poll ſir guy tremoile chanceller fraūce dyuers prelate high baron fraūce ſuche ymagined withſtāde rigorous rebelliōs ſpake togider ſaid kyng ſir iouerayn lordes pier realme nere lygnage ſhulde haue treatie next lent peace amiēce thenglyſſhmen wherfore ſir ye nede make haſte leaue yuell wyll bytwene duke bretayne duke deꝑte hen without agrement made bytwene thenglyſſhmen wyll ye harder treaty wyll thynke thē ayded cōforted duke bretayne countrey duke hath thengliſſhmen hande whan wyll haue warre atones bothe englyſſhmen breton haue wyll put v great payne theſe lordꝭ dyde ſo moche kyng coūſayle laſt founde meane bytwene kyng duke ſhewe ſurely without ſame meanes ben founde ſhulde haue come concluſion good acorde ye frenche kyng doughter duke bretaine ſonne maryage made bytwene ſon̄e dought lykewiſe iohn̄ bretayne ſon̄e dought ſir olyuer clyſſon duke bretayne doughter thought make ſure peace yt mariage bytwene thē two neceſſary theſe maryages agreed concluded howbeit theſe alyaunces yet iohn̄ bretayne ſhulde leaue armes bretayne beare chaſtellon bycauſe extracte mother ſyde duke bretayne mother doughter duke bretaygne therfore alowed bere armes bordet ermyne thre label goules heed ſcochyn ermyns thus bare theſe deuiſes euery thynge apeſed duke bretayne gate loue kyng vncles dyned kyng ſo iohn̄ bretayne erle pon • hieuts thus ſhewed great loue togyder meanes theſe mariages howe duke wyſe wolde ſe ſpeke ſir olyuer clyſſon ſuche diſpleaſure hym howebeit ſir olyuer made lyght therof hated duke alſo puiſſaūce theſe mariages thus acorded lordes ſworne bounde fulfyll thē whan chyldren ſhulde ſōwhat age theſe lordes determyned departe fro tourſe drawe parys tyme aproched ſhulde amyence perſonally frenche kyng brother vncles coūſayle mere kyng englande vncles counſayle ſhulde duke bretayne toke leaue frenche kyng brother vncles ſuche loued beſt ſo deꝑted fro tourſe went owne coūtre lykewiſe ſo dyd lordꝭ duke berrey duke burgoyne lorde coucy taryed ſtyll ſhall ſhewe ¶howe therle bloys mary namure wyfe ſolde countie bloys landes duke thourayne frenche kynges brother cap clxxxii ye haue herde hyſtorie howe loys bloys ſon̄e therle guy bloys died whan yonge ye towne beauniont heynalt wher lady mary doughter duke berrey widowe therby ſhe loſt welthe worlde chylde gret enheritour lyued ben great lorde ſpeke bycauſe ſhulde knowen tyme come thenheritaūce whome went right lyne maner therle blois mary namure wyfe nat ye caſe engēdre child togider great drīkyng moche eatynge wete delycate meates ouergrowen fatneſſe ſo erle coude nat ryde alwayes caried lytter fro one place another whan wolde go huntyng haukyng whiche ſporte gretly vſed wt lordꝭ fraūce ſame ſeaſon whyle frenche kynge tourſe duke thourayne ymaginacion whiche brought effect ſhall ſhewe duke thourayne knewe well moche rycheſſe lying hym paraduenture myllion floreyns whiche reaſon mariage lady valentyne myllayne doughter erle vertu wyſt nat howe enploy theſe flornes remē bred howe erle guy bloys great herytagꝭ dethe likely go dyuers ꝑſones erldome bloys ſhulde retourne iohan bretayne erles coſyn germayne landes heynault ſhulde go duke iulyers duke lancaſtre except chinay whiche ſhulde go conflans homage coūtie soiſſons whiche parteyned therle bloys aūciently alyed hym lorde coucy enherytour therof reaſon delyueraūce priſone englād alſo landes drages monny ſhulde retourne heyres landes holande zelande ſhulde retourne erle heynaulte thus theſe fayre heryteges ſhulde ſparcled abrode knewe well lordes fraūce wherfore duke thourayn money lyeng hym thought bye theſe lādes might haue reſonable bargayne thā thought entreate kyng moue therle blois mater ſpecially leſt bye countie bloys whiche fayre noble countrey well ſyttinge hym countie bloyes marched duchy thouraygne countie bloys parteyned many goodly fee duke thourayne reſted ſtyll purpoſe ſeaſed nat tyll ſpake ye kynge brother ye duke burbone lorde coucy bycauſe great ye erle blois wyfe doughter coſyn germayne duke loreyne duke thourayne lordes affyuite kept mater ſecretely fro ye duke berey ſhall ſhewe lady mary dought endowed countie bloys ſōme vi frankes yere duke berrey truſted reaſon doughters dowrie ye countie bloys ſhulde erles dethe duke berrey marueylous couytous prince duke burgoyne lyke wiſe truſted landes holande zelande heynalte bycauſe margarete eldeſt dought maried wylliam ſon̄e therle heynalte wherby thought outher bieng ſōe incident yt choſe landes ſhulde returne ſon̄e erle oſtrenant otherwyſe called iohn̄ burgoyne maried margarete eldeſt doughter therle heynalte thus kyng theſe ſaid lordes purpoſed yt deꝑtyng fro tourſe iii thourayn ryde blois ſe coſyn therle guy bloys eight myle fro tourſe caſtell owne called ye caſtell morant treate marchādiſe hym wyfe lady mary namure couytous lady valiant knight great prudence bayly blois called ſir raynolde sen ꝑfyte informacion buſynes meanes knowe nat whan knewe gret pyte therof loue therle lorde thought reaſon ſale lādes ſhuld diſhonored euer diſherite true rightfull heyres whiche ſhulde damnacion ſoule thought lette mater coude ſo rode fro blois ſpake therle ſaid ſir frenche kynge duke thourayn duke burdon lorde coucy cometh hyder yt true ꝙ therle ſpeke sir ꝙ ſay bycauſe ye ſhalbe requyred ſell enheritāce wherfore ye haue nede take good aduiſe therin thoſe wordꝭ therle great marueyle ſaid nat let men ſpeke
