make requeſtꝭ make ſuche bargayne ſell myne enherytaūce diſheryte myne heyres ſhame rebuke ſhall rather ſell ley pledge ye plate haue well ſit ꝙ knight remēbre well mater whan tyme haue ſhewed without dout bayly ꝙ erle nat ſo yong folyſſhe enclyne ſuche treaty thus bayly deꝑted fro therle rode againe blois wolde nat ſene kynges cōmynge whan kyng theſe ſaid lordes cāe caſtell erle made good chere reaſon erle counteſſe right ioyfull ye kyng wolde viſyte owne caſtell kynge drawe erle loue bring hym entent ſayd fayre coſyn ſe well ye lorde realme garnyſſhed honour large haue ben great coſt ayde ſomwhat recōpence wyll gyue ayde ſhall well worthe twentie thouſande frā kes countie blois therle thanked kyng gyfte neuer profite therof neuer nothyng kynge began treate erle ſell countie bloyes duke thourayn kynge duke burbone ſpake fyrſt founde therle colde tarre mater lordes drewe counteſſe bloyes ſhewed ſo many colored reaſons ſhe huſbandes dethe ſhe lyke poore lady wherfore ſaid moche better ryche lady puiſſaunt golde ſyluer iewelles poore sayeng howe ſhe lykely ouerlyue huſbade therfore deſyred counſayle huſbande make marchaundyſe counteſſe couytous lady loue haue floreyns ſhe enclyned deſyres ſhe dyd ſo moche helpe ayde varlet erles chambre called sohier borne malygnes ſonne weyuer clothes ſo great wt erle bloyes thynge done hym without hym nothyng done erle gyuen hym fee herytagꝭ fyue hundred frankes yere holde conſydre myſchefe great lordes brought vnto meane ſeruaūtes sohier nother wytte reaſon greatly alowed alonely folyſſhe loue maiſter hadde hym lykewiſe duke berrey ſame ſeaſon one hym called iaques thybaulte reputacion yet duke dyuers tymes gyuen hym ſōme two hundred thouſande frankes yet loſte sohier coulde nat excuſe hym ſelfe lyſted myght well haue broken marchā diſe yt therle mayſter made pleaſe kynge duke thourayne duke burbone lorde coucy coū teſſe agreed therto couitouſnes florens rowned ſo maiſters eare erle wente promyſe made bayly reuercion countie bloyes diſceaſe ſolde ſomme two hundred thouſande frankes duke thouraygne delyuer lady dunoyes dowrie whiche aſſygned ſixe thouſande frankes furthermore ſhulde haue made another ſale landes heynaulte duke thourayne haue payde two hundred thouſande frankes howe therin erle bloys reſerued knowe erle heynaltes pleaſure therin naturall lorde owed faythe homage thoſe landes howe yt kyng duke thourayn toke charge diſcharge erle ſoeuer ſhulde fall thus departed bounde erle promyſe writynges ſealed might well eaſely none coūſayle ſaue sohier neuer ſcole knewe letter boke moche maner went marchandiſe haue written mater iuſtely coude thentent herafter tyme come reaſon writyng trouthe ſhulde knowen erle guye bloys lorde mayſter ignorant yuell counſayled wyfe varlet sohier thā made yuell bargayne whan theſe mater concluded ſurely made kyng duke thourayne counſayle lordes toke leaue retourned fraūce great brute made theſe ſales dyuers country ¶howe ſir roger spaygne ſir eſpaygne du lyon ſpedde frenche kyng counſayle vicount chaſtelons buſyneſſe howe howe ſette poſſeſſion countie foiz money payde cap clxxxiii howe let v ſōwhat ſpeke ſir roger ſpaygne ſir eſpaygne du lyon ſhewe ſpedde aft retourned fro tourle go tholous byſſhop noyon lorde de la ryuer longe iourneyd came thyder welcome cōmynge fore deſyred ſhewed letter howe ſpedde ſemblaunt byſſhoppe lorde de la ryuer ioyouſe herytaūce ſhulde abyde vycount chaſtellon ſuche condycions written ſir roger cōpanyon thought take ſome payne ryde ye vycount chaſtellon counſayls foize bierne ſe euery thyng ſette good order departed fro tholous rode ſaynt gracyens vicount nat entre berne fayre caſtell called pau founde hym ioyfull cōmynge whan knewe frenche kyng gyuen vp tytell byeng coūtie foiz gladder money yt ſhulde paye wyſt well ynoughe haue moche ⸫ ⸫ ¶of great aſſemble made amyence frenche kynge counſayle kynge englandes vncles treatie peace cap clxxxiiii thynke haue ſufficiently treated buſyneſſe bierne foiz ſhulde reherſe thynges wolde requyre long writyng therfore wyll leaue ſpekyng therof create mater thus thyngꝭ cōcluded vicount chatellon erle foiz lorde berne lyke maner older erle helde ſuche ought ſo made homage hym departed largely ser yuan ſir gracien tholde erles baſtarde ſones ſuche wyſe content payde frēche kyng ſuche money ꝓmiſed payde mater nat ſone done ſomer firſt well onwarde ye biſſhop noyon ye lorde de la ryuer taryed ſtyll tholous tyll euery thyng ſet good order accordyng charged nowe let v ſpeke thaſſemble lordes fraū ce englande good cyte amyence treatie peace truce beyng yere lorde mccclxxx xi myddes lent great prouiſion made ther theſe lordꝭ cāe thider firſt frenche kyng eſtate thre vncles alſo great lordes fraūce euery man degre ſaid kyng richard englāde ſhulde wherfore many deſyred ſe ſuch neuer ſene beit came nat yet cāe douer thentent haue paſſed ſee thre vncles hym yt ſay ye duke lācaſtre yorke gloceſter whan came douer tooke aduyſe whyder mete kyng paſſe ſee nat thynges conſydred counſayle englande opinyon kyng ſhuld byde douer duke gloceter wt duke lancaſtre duke yorke therle hūtyngton therle derby ſir thomas percy byſſhops durham london ye kynges coūſaile paſſe ouer ſo came calais whan day aproched yt ſhulde mete amyēce deꝑted fro calysmo xiic horſe goodly ſyght ſe thē ryde good order frenche kyng ordayned thengliſſhmen came cali goyng abyding returnyng coſtes charge borne frenche kyngꝭ charge mete drīke lodgyng horſe mete ye duke lācaſtre duke yorke cāe coſyn dought ſuſter ye lorde coucy faire yōg lady called ye lady yrelāde ſhe wedded duke yrelāde lady cāe amyens ſe ye lorde father ye lorde coucy ſhe nat ſene hym moche wherfore ſhe hadde great deſyre ſe hym came lyke noble widowe hauyng ſmall ioye co age frenche kyng ordayned make englyſſhe men moche honour coude deuyſed foure duke ſaye duke thourayn frenche kynges brother duke burbon berrey burgoyne l • pte horſes rode towne mete engliſſhmen acō panyed many great lordes fyrſt mette thē duke loys thourayn well acōpanyed honorably receyued colyns englande cōmuned certayne ſpace thē toke leaue departed agayne company ſo rode ſtreight cytie kynge brother thre duke ye kynges vncles berrey burbone burgoyne mette englyſſhe duke felde made great chere honorable eche ioye ſe gētyll erle dolphyn auuergne ben hoſtager englande moche duke lacaſters company loued hym well came humbly ſaluted duke lancaſter whan duke ſawe enbraſed hym great token loue ſpake toguyder lytell duke berrey burgoyne came duke burbon lorde coucy therle • aynt poule came duke yorke erle huntyngton ſir thomas percye ſo • ode talkyng togyder amorous wordes tyll aproched cytie amyence duke lancaſtre rode bytwene duke berrey duke burgoyn thus rode thre front makyng honour eche tyll came byſſhoppes palais kynge duke thourayne lighted two duke ledde duke la • caſtre vp ſteres duke lordes folowed frenche lordes came kynges preſence made reuerence lefte englyſſhe duke ſtandyng alone lytell enclined ſelfe kyng kyng ca • e toke handes lytte vp ſpake ſwetely hym lordes fraunce fell talkynge lordes englande whan cōmaned ſeaſon toke leaue kyng brother vncles departed conueyed lodgynges cōſtable fraunce lorde coucy erle ſaynt poule ſir iohan vyenne lordes realme fraunce toke leaues deꝑted agayne kyng lady irelande doughter lorde coucy lodged father lodging cōpany ordayned frēche kyng counſayle thenglyſſhe lordꝭ came cytie amyence whiche ordynaūce publyſſhed proclamed openlye thentent ꝑſone ſhulde ignorant therof euery man beware • kyng artycle proclamacion payne lefyng heedes firſt maner perſon make riot gyue riotous wordes englyſſhman alſo knight ſquier ſpeke make chalenge armes englyſſhman payne kynges highe diſpleaſure company wt ſwete wordes goodly behauour yt towne lodgyngꝭ felde frenche page make debate riotte place payne dethe ſoeuer englyſſhman demaūdeth ſu •• peſably haue ho • vitayler demaunde money outher meate drinke ſuche cōmen charge alſo ordayned knight ſquyer fraunce ſhuld go night tyme without torche torch englyſſhmen ſhulde go pleaſure without cōtrolement frēchman mete englyſſhman night ſtrete yt ſhulde ſwetely gently conuey thē lodgyng company alſo ordayned four place cyte four watch ſet thouſande men euery watche fyre happe fall nyght incydence watche wyſe remoue maner cauſe ye ſo wnynge bell people drawe quē che fyre alſo ordayned yt frēch knight ſquier maner cauſe ſhulde preſume ſpeke king wtout ye kyng fyrſt dyde call hym alſo knightes ſquyers fraunce ſhulde talke comune toguyder long englyſſhe men preſent fynde comunynge paſtyme theym alſo ordayned hoſtes ſeruauntes anywyſe ſhulde nat conuey hyde bowes arrowes thynge parteyninge englyſſhe men without makynge large amendes without gyuen englyſſhmen curteſy take el nat theſe thynges determyned delyberacyon good counſayle englyſſhe men honoure truſted good concluſyon peace nighe euery day fiftene dayes toguyder theſe lordes counſayle brought nothyng cōcluſyon demaundes greatly different frenche men demaunded haue calais raſed beaten downe ſuche wyſe perſone ſhulde dwell englyſſhe men wolde wyſe agree treatie ought beleued calais ye towne worlde cōmons englande loued beſt longe lordes calays ſayde bare kayes fraunce vnder gyrdell thoughe lordes departed euery daye vnagreed yet departed ſō der right amiably euery daye poynted agayne nexte day bothe party truſtyng laſt cōclude ſome good poynt frenche kyng made thenglyſſhe men yt ſpace thre notable dyners palais lykewiſe ſo dyde duke thourayne duke berrey duke burgoyne duke burbone lorde coucy erle ſaynt poule eche theſe made englyſſhe men great dyner euery thyng englyſſhmen toke towne payd clerkes apoynted kynge counſayle write euery thyng euery man apoynted money chambre accomptes ought knowen iohan duke lancaſtre brother duke yorke come thyder truſt peace yet charge kyng englande counſayle ſoeuer treatie made wiſe ſhulde nouther gyue take maner thynge many opynion cōmynaltie englande rather enclyned warre peace tyme good kyng edwarde thirde ſon̄e prince wale ſo many fayre highe vyctories ye frenche men ſo great conqueſtes ſo moche money raunſomes ſellyng pateſynge townes countreis become marueylous riche many ſuche gentylmen byrthe reaſon hardyneſſe valyaunt aduentures wan conquered ſo moche golde ſyluer became noble roſe great honour ſo ſuch folowed wolde folowe ſame lyfe beit yt dayes ſayd kyng edwarde ye prince ſonne wyſdome highe enterprice ſir bertram cleſquy ayde good knyghtes fraūce englyſſhmen agayne ſore put backe duke glouceſtre ſonne ſayde kynge edwarde vncle kyng richarde beyng amyence dyuers lordes knightes ſquyers ſame opynion cōmons englande enclyned rather warre peace entent therby ſuſteyne eſtate occaſion therof peace harder driue yet kynge duke lancaſtre wolde fayne haue hadde peace meanes metynge amyēce apoynted howbeit wolde nat diſpleaſe cōmens englande englyſſhe men wolde gladlye haue hadde peace ſo myght reſtored agayne al ſuche landes agreed treaty charter frenche men ſhulde paye fourtene hundred thouſande frā kes whiche vnpayed whan warre began renewe ſeaſon thus great cōmunycacion cytie amyence treatie peace lordes bothe party toke great payne cauſe myght well marueyled peace toke none effecte ſpecialy duke burgoyne dyd coude frenche partie duke lancaſtre englyſſhe partie sauyng charge whiche durſt nat paſſe whan theſe lordes ſawe coulde come good concluſyon frenchemen ſomwhat apeaſe pleaſe englyſſhmen rather therby fall ſome reaſon offred enjoy ſtyll peaſably euer poſſeſſyon acquytayne nyne dyoces quite delyuered without reſorte ſo calays myght beaten downe alſo offred paye thre yere ſomme xiiii hundred thouſande frankes duke lancaſtre englyſſh counſayle anſwered ſayd syrs haue taried longe ſeaſon haue concluded nothyng canne nat conclude tyll retourned englande ſhall ſhewe deſyres offer kyng ſouerayne lorde thre eſtates realme one thinge ſure moch dyligence brother yorke ſhall doone bringe deſyre paſſe except ye beatyng downe calays dare nat ſpeke therof dyd ſhulde ryn indygnacyon hatred ye moſt parte realme englande yet better ſpeke worde therof theſe wordes ſomwhat contented french kynge coūſayle deſyred whan returned england dyligence mater ſaid wolde coude frenche party ſayeng howe warre endured ouer longe many yuell inconuenyentes hath enſued therby worlde conſidred bytwene party bycauſe truce fayled next mydſomer bytwene englande fraunce contynue lengar ſpace hole yere bothe lande ſee bytwene alyes adherentes therto lordes englande agreed frenche kynges counſayle deſyred ſende two french knightes go englande retourne bringe worde caſe ſhulde fynde realme englande duke lancaſtre ye duke yorke contente therwith ſhewed alſo apparaunce great howe frenche kynge deſyred greatly haue peace great brute ranne fraunce place howe lam • rabaquyn entred great puiſſaunce turkes realme hungry ſyr boucyquant thelder marſhall fraunce brought thoſe newes ſyr iohan charon newely retourned fro partyes grece turkey wherfore frenche kynge youthe great affectyon go voyage go ſe ſayd lamorabaquyn recouer realme armony whiche turkes wonne fro kynge lyon armony ſame tyme amyence ſhewed cauſe comynge thyder duke lancaſtre duke yorke knewe hym well ſene realme englande englande treate peace whan frenche kynge sluſe conſyderynge kynge armonyes buſyneſſe ende parlyamente frenche kynge ſayde duke lancaſtre fayre nephewe peace maye bytwene v kynge englande might make voyage tukey comfortyng kynge hungry emperour conſtantynople whome lamorabaquyn dothe moche trouble let v recouer realme armony whiche turkes kepe ſaye lamorabaquyn valyaunt man great enterpriſe agaynſt ſuche perſones contrary beleue daily dothe trouble greue v ought enclyne ſelfe defende cryſten faythe wherfore fayre nephewe helpe prouyde voyage realme englande duke lancaſtre promyſed deuoyre behalfe thus toke leaue eche counſayle amyence endured fyftene dayes englyſſhe men departed writyng cōcluſion treatie ſhewe kynge englande counſayle ducheſſe irelande departed fro amyēce toke leaue father lorde coucy retourned englyſſhe lordes fro tyme departed fro calais tyll came thyder agayne ſpent nothyng without lyſt french kynge made euery thynge payed bothe ſelfe horſes duke burgoyne retourned archoys cytie arras founde ducheſſe wyfe vyſited countrey flaunders duke thourayne duke berrey duke butbone taryed kynge kinge purpoſed go beamoys gyſors ſporte hym waye parys duke lancaſtre duke yorke certayne knightes fraunce wente englande ſyr iohan caſtell morante ſir taupyns cantmell bringe aunſwere agayne england ſir raynolde du roy lorde moncaurell ye lorde olde towne conueyed calays toke leaue englyſſhe men paſſed ouer ſee deuer founde kynge duke gloceſtre taryeng whan kyng ſawe great comunynge ſ • ate parlyamente amyence kynge well content vncles done duke gloceſtre alwayes harde agaynſt treatie peace ſayd howe coulde good concluſyon taken treatye tyll mater brought weſtmynſter generall counſayle thre aſtates realme folowe aduyſes none otherwyſe duke gloceſters wordes well herde manne wolde ſaye agaynſt hym greatly loue realme ſhewed knightes fraunce muſte go london otherwyſe coulde haue none anſwere two knightes obeyed reaſon kynge toke way lordes london whan kynge came darfforde tooke waye eltham refreſſhed quene came shene wente agaynſt ſaynte george feeſt wyndſore knyghtes fraunce anſwered ſhewe aunſwereꝭ wyll ſomewhat ſpeke frenche kynge aſſemble coūſayle amyence frenche kynge lacke good gydyng fell ſycke feuer wherfore counſayled chaunge ayre layde lytter caryed beamoys taryed byſſhops palays tyll hole recouered brother duke thourayne vncles duke berrey burbone helde eaſter whan kynge ſtronge myght well ryde rode gyſors entryng normādy haue ſporte huntynge theraboute many fayre wodes kyng beynge ſir bernarde armynake brother iohan armynake came kynge good array dolphyn auuergne company whome founde parys waye erle armynake erle rodays made reliefe homage kynge acordinge cuſtome lordes fraunce made relyefe ſuche landes helde fee kynge whan euery thyng writen regeſtred toke leaue retourned paris togyther fro thence countreys auuergne languedoc feeſt aſcenſyon tyde frenche kynge retourned parys good helthe lodged howſe ſaynte poll whiche ordeyned hym thyder come frenche quene duches thourayne nowe let v ſpeke ſyr iohan caſtell morante ſyr taupyn cantmell englande taryenge anſwere kyng counſayle wyndeſore ſaynte george feeſt kynge vncles great lordes englande theſe lordes counſayled togyther ſuche promyſe made frenche kyng counſayle amyence determyned delyuer two frenche knyghtes dayly called aunſwere theſe knyghtes ſente day ſayde thus syrs contente thinges conſydred ye canne haue v full anſwere tyme wolde harde nowe aſſemble togyther thre eſtates realme vntyll feeſt mychelmas whiche tyme muſte nedes parlyamente weſtmynſter excuſe ſhall write letter ſame purpoſe whiche ſeaſon partie fraūce wyll traueyle ſo farre come thyder ſhall haue reaſonable anſwere ſuche generally hole counſayle thre aſtates ſhall agre vnto whan frenche knyghtes ſawe aunſwere coulde haue none aunſwered ſayd syr contente ye haue ſayd lette v haue letter ſhall retourne letter delyuered ſo toke leaue kynge lordes ſo came fro wyndeſore london made thē redy departe kyng englande cauſed ceſtes charge payed conueyed douer taryed fyue dayes lacke wynde ſixte day departed aryued boloyne whanne horſes vnſhypped rode amyēce ſmall iourneys ſo paris founde kynge lordes aboute feeſt penthecoſt letter redde wherby vnderſtode ordynaūce englyſſhmen ſhewed kynge counſayle toke lytell regarde mater within ſeaſon moche ado place ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe ſyr peter craon yuell wyll ſubtyle crafte beate downe ſyr olyuer clyſſon wherwith kynge counſayle ſore diſpleaſed ca clxxxv ye haue well herde ser peter craon knyght great lygnage farre frenche kynges grace duke thourayns dyd ſomoche cauſe diſpleaſed dyd yuell ye haue herde alſo howe gone bretayne duke ſhewed hym yuell wyll kynge bare hym meanes ſyr olyuer clyſſon may well ſo enfourmed hadde ſo great hate conſtable ſir olyuer clyſſon ſtudyed euer howe dyſtroy hym thus whyle ſyr peter craon duke bretaygne wolde often tymes comune togyder deuiſe howe myght bringe ſyr olyuer clyſſon dethe ſayd one deed none yt wolde greatly reuenge dethe duke repēted hym nat ſlayne hym whan hym priſone wolde coſte hym hundred thouſande frankes hym agayne wyll whan ſyr peter craon ſawe duke ſuche hatred ſyr olyuer clyſſon purpoſed marueylous ymaginacien himſelfe apparaūce men ſhulde gyue iudgement knyght thought howe ſo euer wolde ſlee conſtable thought entende nothynge el tyll ſlayne hym owne handes cauſed hym ſlayne afterwarde entreat peace douted nothyng iohn̄ blois ſonne vicounte rohan wedded two conſtables doughters thought well ynough theym longe ye duke parte ſawe well ſtrengthe puyſſaunce bloys greatly feblyſſhed erle guy bloys ſolde herytage bloys duke thourayn whiche ſhulde haue ronne ſucceſſyon therle pointhycur iohan bloys wherby thought duke thourayne ſhewed hym ſmall loue alyaunce lynage bye away enherytaunce wherfore ſyr peter thought ſyr olyuer clyſſon deed ſone apeaſe kynges yuell wyll duke thourayns therby ſone ouercome lorde de la ryuer ſyr iohan mercyer montagu begue villayns ſyr iohan bulle kynges chambre ſuche ſuſteyned conſtable knewe well duke berrey duke burgoyne loued nothynge wardely whatſoeuer ſhewed outwardly thus ſir peter craon perceyuered ſtyll opynyon deuyſed imagynacion entyſyng dyuell neuer ſlepeth waketh enbraſeth harte yuell enclyneth exortacion thus dyuell dayly layde mater knyghtes eyen put mater execuſyon iuſtly ymagyned doutes parelles myſcheuouſneſſe myght fall yuell dede reaſone wyſe atemperaunce ſhulde haue cauſed hym haue done otherwyſe often tymes ſaid great deſyre man hath haue execuſyon thynge fallen often tymes quencheth reaſon wyſdome therfore often tymes vyces mayſters vertues vyolate corrupted bycauſe ſpecially ſyr peter craon ſo great affection dyſtructyon conſtable therfore lyghtly enclyned temptacion outrage folly thought myght ſlee conſtable returne agayne ſafely bretayne man wolde ſeke hym dyd truſted duke wolde excuſe hym worſte fell frenche kynge came thyder great puyſſaunce nyght entre ſhyppe ſo go burdeaux bay englande thought well ſhulde nat purſewed knewe well englyſſhe men hated conſtable bycauſe crueltyes doone conſented done ſythe tourned frenche howe done many notable ſeruyces englyſſhe men hath ben reherſed hyſtory sir peter craon accōplyſſh deſyre longe ſtudyed mynde howe brynge purpoſe paſſe kepte purpoſe cloſe ſecrete knowe nat ſhewed duke bretayne nat ſome thought • e bycauſe dede done hym company toke next way coude bretayne tooke ſauegarde duke bretaygne alſo dede done ſolde caſtelles herytage aniou duke bretaygne renyed homage frenche kynge ſayd howe wolde go ouer ſee theſe mater paſſe breuely ſhall declare dede ſyr iohan froyſart auctour hyſtory whan vnhappy dede doone ſyr peter craon agaynſte ſyr olyuer clyſſon ſame tyme paris wherfore ought well enfourmed mater acordyng enquery made therin knowe trouthe ſame tyme ſyr peter towne parys fayre houſe ſtandynge churche yarde ſaynt iohans dyuers lordes cytie pleaſure houſe keper ſyr peter craon ſent ſeruauntes parys prouyded largely houſe wyne corne fleſſhe ſalte prouyſyons alſo writen keper ſhulde bye certayne armure cote ſtele gauntletes ſtoles harneſſe xl men doone ſende hym worde therof thentente wolde ſende ſecretly done keper thought none yuell obey mayſters cōmaundement bought marchaūdyſe ſeaſon caſtell owne aniou called sable ſent one weke thre four ſeruauntes houſe parys ſo wekely tyll xl ſhewed nothynge cauſe ſent thyder charged kepe ſelfe cloſe howſe wyſe ſo euer lacked keper houſe ſhulde prouyde daye ſhall ſhewe cauſe ſende thyder ye ſhall haue good wage dyd commaunded came priuely parys entred houſe nyght mornynges gate parys nyght daye ſtode open aſſembled houſe ſo many togyther xl companyons hardy men outragyous howe ſome hadde knowen wherfore came thyderꝭ wolde nat haue come yet kepte ſelfe ſecrete ye feeſt pentecoſt ſyr peter craon came paris ſecretly entred howſe dyſguyſed lyke ſeruaunt called porter kepte gate ſayd cōmaunde payne thy lyfe let man woman chylde entre houſe none go without cōmaundement porter obeyed reaſon ſo dyd keper cōmaunded kepers wyfe chyldren kepe chambre nat iſſue therof wherin dyd wyſely woman chyldren gone abrode ſtreates comynge thyther ſyr peter craon knowe chyldren woman naturally harde kepe counſayle thynge man wolde haue kepte ſecrete thus ſyr peter company ſecretly howſe tyll day holy ſacramente euery day ſyr peter brode ſpyes brought worde ſtate ſyr olyuer clyſſon tyll daye coulde fynde tyme execute enterpriſe wherwith ſore diſpleaſed hym ſelfe ſaid day frenche kynge kepte feeſt open courte lordes alſo quene duches thourayne great ioy ſolace ſame day dyner yonge luſty knyghtes armed iuſted valyauntly preſence kynge quene ladyes damoſels contynued tyll nere nyght iudgement ladyes harauldes price gyuen ſyr gillyam flaunders erle namure kynge made lordes ladyes great ſupper ſupper daunced tyll one clock mydnyght euery man departed lodgynges ſome one place ſome another without feare doute thyng syr olyuer cliſſon conſtable fraunce departed fro kynges place laſt taken leaue kynge went duke thourayns chambre ſayde hym syr wyll ye tary nyght el go lodgyng poullayne poullayn duke treaſourer dwelte lytell beſyde ſygne lyon ſyluer duke ſayde conſtable nat tell yet whether tary el go thyder go ye waye lodgynge tyme ſyr olyuer toke leaue duke ſayd ſyr god ſende good nyght ſo departed ſtreate founde ſeruauntes horſe eyght perſones two torch rode forthe entre hygh ſtreate ſaynt kateryns sir peter craon ſame night layde good ſpyall ser olyuer cliſſon knewe well bydden behynde company kynge horſe taryed kynges gate hym moūted horſe company well armed couertly paſt nat ſire company knew entent whan came ſaynte katheryns ſtreate taryed abode priuely conſtables cōmyng ſone conſtable iſſued ſtreate ſaynt powle came hyghe ſtreate torch beſyde hym came rydynge talkyng ſquyer ſayenge morowe muſt haue dyner ye duke thourayne lorde coucy ſyr iohan vyen ſyr charles danger barone vrey dyuers wherfore ſpeke ſtewarde lacke nothynge ſayeng thoſe wordes ſyr peter craon company came hym firſt ſtrake torch whan conſtable herde ruſſhynge horſes behynde hym thought duke thourayne folowed ſported hym ſayde ah ſyr yuell doone pardon ye yonge full play ſporte thoſe wordes ſyr peter craon drewe ſwerde ſaid ſlee conſtable ſlee hym ſhall dye arte thou quod clyſſon ſpekeſt thoſe wordes peter craon thyne enemye thou haſt ſo often tymes dyſpleaſed nowe thou ſhalte make amēdes therwith ſtrake conſtable ſyr peter men drewe oute ſwordes ſtrake conſtable wepon ſhorte knyfe two foote length defended hym ſelfe well myght men without armure ſone put brode fro mayſter ſyr peter men ſayd ſhall ſlee yea quod ſir peter ſuche make defence defence ſmall eight perſones without armure sir peter demaunded nothynge dethe conſtable ſome whan knewe conſtable gaue faynte ſtrokes thynge doone trayſon doone cowardly without hardyneſſe conſtable defended hymſelfe valyauntly wepyn howe defence hadde vayled hym lytell great grace god nat ben styll ſate horſe tyll full ſtroke ye heed whiche ſtroke fell fro horſe ryght agaynſt baker dore vp buſy bake breed left dore halfe open whiche happy conſtable fell fro horſe fell agaynſte dore dore opened fell dore horſebacke coulde nat entre hym dore lowe lytell god ſhewed great grace conſtable fallen ſtreates dyde dore dore ſhytte ben ſlayn without remedy horſebacke durſte nat alyght alſo thought ſo dyd ſyr peter yt ſtroke heed laſte ſhulde dethes wounde ſyr peter ſayd go hence haue done ynough nat deed wyll dye ſtroke hathe heed great ſtroke therwith departed rode waye good pace gate ſaynte anthony rode therat gate open ben ten yere ſythe frenche kynge retourned fro batayle roſebeque ſayd conſtable put downe malles parys punyſſhed rebellyons thus ſyr olyuer clyſſon lefte caſe man halfe deed baker houſe ſore abaſſhed whan knewe conſtable men lytell hurte ſyr peter men loked nothynge haue ſlayne conſtable ſyr olyuers men aſſembled togyther entred baker houſe founde mayſter ſore hurte heed blode rennynge downe vyſage wherwith ſore abaſſhed good cauſe made great complayntes fyrſte feared ben deed anone tydinges hereof came kynges lodgynge ſayde kyng goynge bedde ah ſyr canne nat hyde fro great myſchiefe nowe ſodenly fallen parys myſchefe quod kynge syr quod conſtable ſyr olyuer cliſſon ſlayne slayne quod kynge howe ſo hath done dede syr quod canne nat tell myſchefe fallen hym ſtreate ſaynt kateryn well quod kynge light vp torch wyll go ſe hym torch anone lyghted vp kynge put cloke ſlyppers fete ſuche kept watche ſame nyght went forthe kynge ſuche bed herde theſe tydyngꝭ roſe vp haſt folowed kyng gone forthe ſmall company kynge taryed manne wente forthe theym chambre torch behynde mo chamberlayns hym ſir gaultier martell ſyr iohn̄ lygnac thus king came baker houſe entred certayne torch taryed without kynge founde conſtable nere deed ſhewed nat fully deed men taken geare ſe woundes howe hurte fyrſt worde hynge ſayd conſtable howe dere ſyr ꝙ ryght febly hath brought caſe quod kyng syr quod peter craon company traytourſly without defence conſtable quod kynge neuer dede ſo derely bought ſhall phyſycions ſurgeons ſent partes whan came kyng ſayd owne ſurgyons syrs looke caſe conſtable ſhewe trouthe ſory hurte ſerched woundes euery parte kynge demaunded ſayd syrs howe ſaye parell dethe anſwered ſayd ſyr ſurely ieoperdy dethe hym within theſe xv dayes ſhall able ryde aunſwere kynge ryght ioyous ſayd thanked god theſe good tydynges ſaid conſtable good chere care nothynge neuer treſpas ſorer punyſſhed ſhall vpon traytours haue done dede take mater myne owne conſtable feble voyce anſwered sir god rewarde grace noble vyſytacyon kyng toke leaue departed retourned lodgynge contynent ſente prouoſt paris tyme came clere day lyght kyng cōmaunded hym ſayd prouoſt get men togyther well horſed purſewe traytour ſir peter craon thus traytorouſly hath hurte nygh dethe conſtable ye nat v acceptable ſeruyce thanne purſewe take hym bring hym v prouoſt anſwered ſayd ſyr ſhall yt lyeth puyſſaunce syr canne grace knowe whiche waye gone enquyre quod kynge dylygence ¶howe great dylygence prouoſt parys purſewed ſyr peter craon cap clxxxvi tyme four ſouerayne gate cytie euer kepte opyn nyght day whiche ordynaunce made euerſythe batayle roſebeque frenche kyng diſconfited •• mynges pariſyēce wolde haue rebelled malettes laide downe entent kepe vnder pariſyence counſayle ſir olyuer clyſſon chaynes ſtreates layde downe gate taken hokes caſe cytie ten yere ſo euery man myght entre night daye parys ſo lyſt lo maye well conſydred fortune cōſtable gadred rodde wherwith hym ſelfe beaten gate parys ben cloſed chaynes lyfte vp ſir peter craon durſt neuer haue done dyde • coude nat haue gone towne dyde bycauſe knewe well might iſſue houres made execute yuell purpoſe wha departed fro conſtable thought ſurely ben ſlayne howe nat wherwith ſore diſpleaſed whan iſſue parys one clocke mydnight paſſed gate ſaynt anthony ſome ſayd paſſed ryuer seyne bridge charenton toke waye charter ſome ſayde iſſued parys gate ſaynte honour vnder mount marter paſſed ryuer seyne ponthieur ſo euer paſſed eight clocke charter ſuche well horſed hym folowed hym nat brake ſondre leſſe ſuſpeciouſneſſe feare purſute whan ſir peter craon came firſt parys lefte charter one chanons ben ſeruaunt beforetyme twentte freſſhe horſes ben better chanon neuer knowen hym purpoſe executynge therof knewe nothyng therin whan ſir peter retourned charter dranke chaū ged horſes dyde harneſſe toke waye mayne rode ſo faſt yt came caſtell owne called sable reſted hym ſelfe ſayde wolde go tyll herde tidynges ſir olyuer clyſſon howe mater went ye maye ſure ſame fryday dede done great brute ran cytie dede many blamed greatly ſir peter craon lorde coucy ſoone knewe therof mornynge lepte horſe eyght perſons hym rode conſtables lodgyng viſyte hym loued entierlye togyder called eche brother armes viſytacion dyd cōſtable gret good lyke maner lordes acordyng tourne came viſyted hym ſpecially duke thourayne ſore diſpleaſed dede kynge ſayd bothe howe ſir peter craon done dede diſpyte theym howe thyng prepenſed falſe traytours put realme trouble duke berrey than̄e parys diſſymuled mater made great buſyneſſe cauſe ſir iohan froiſſarte auctour cronycle credably enformed aduenture ben nothyng done duke berrey lyſte wolde myght well haue broken enterpriſe ſhall ſhewe reaſon howe ſame thurſday corpus chriſty day came duke berrey clerke ſecretorie ſir peter craon ſayde hym ſecrete maner ſir wyll ſhewe thyng ſecretneſſe whiche lykely come poore cō cluſyon ſir ye lykely remedye mater ꝙ duke sir quod ſhall ſhewe wolde nat named bringer oute therof spare nat quod duke ſhall beare mater well ynoughe well ſir quod clerke doubte greatlye ſir peter craon wyll ſlee cauſe murthered conſtable ſir olyuer clyſſon hath aſſembled toguyder houſe within churche yarde ſaynte iohanes great noumbre menne hath kepte couertly euerſyth feeſt whitſontyde ſir ſhulde dede kynge wyll ſore dyſpleapleaſed bringe realme great trouble therfore ſir ſhewe ſir abaſſhed therof ſelfe though ſir peter ſeruaunt haue made ſeruyce hym yet dare nat conſente outrage ſir ye prouyde nat mater none ſir goddeſſake take hede haue ſhewed ſir eſchewe maye falle dare nat retourne hym duke herde hym well ſaid abyde nyght morowe tymes ſhall enforme kyng therof nowe farforthe dayes wyll nat trouble kynge therwith morowe without faute ſhall prouyde mater ſithe ſir peter craon towne knewe nat therof thus duke draue matter meane tyme myſchiefe felle prouoſt mo than̄e threſcore horſes iſſued oute cytie gate ſaynt honour folowed tracke ſir peter craon came ponthieur paſſe ryuer seyne demaūded kepar bridge horſes paſſed waye mornynge ſayd yes howe paſſed twelue horſe ſawe knyght perſone knewe waye toke quod prouoſt ſir quod waye towardes wannes ah ꝙ prouoſt maye well thynke wyll ryde chierbourge than̄e prouoſte tooke waye leſte waye charter therby loſte iuſte purſute ſir peter craon whanne rydden tyll noone mette knyght countrey huntyng hare ſhewed hym howe ſawe ſame mornynge fyftene men horſebacke trauerſyng feldes thought toke waye charter prouoſt company entred waye charter ſo rode tyll nere hande nyght came charter ſhewed hym howe ſir peter craon hadde chanon aboute eyght clocke vnarmed hym toke freſſhe horſes prouoſt ſawe well loſt payne ſhulde folowe hym sayeng ſeyng ſo farre paſt saturdaye retourned parys bycauſe certentie whiche waye ſir peter craon toke nat knowen parys therfore kynge duke thourayne great affection haue ſir peter craon taken ſente ſir iohn̄ barrois threſcore horſe parys ſertche hym iſſued gate ſaynt anthony paſſed ryuers marne scyne bridge charenton rode countrey came towardes eſtampes finally dyner came charter herde ſure tidynges whan̄e barrois knewe yt ſir peter craon gone ſawe ſhulde traueyle vayne folowe retourned agayne ſondaye parys ſhewed kyng done lykewiſe ſo prouoſt done ſaturday founde vyllage went ſertchyng two ſquyers page parteynyng ſir peter craon taken brought parys ſette priſone mondaye beheeded firſt brought ye place dede done eche right hande ſtriken halle beheeded hanged gybet wedniſday kepar ſir peter craons houſe paris executed beheeded many men ſaid wrong bycauſe ſhewed nat cōmynge ſir peter parys put dethe lykewiſe yt chanon charter whō ſir peter dyde refreſſhe hym chaunged horſe accuſed taken put byſſhoppes priſone toke fro hym depriued hym benefyces condempned perpetuall priſone lyue breed water excuſacyons coude make auayled hym nothyng reputed towne charter noble wyſe man ſir peter craon beyng caſtell sable ſore diſpleaſed whan knewe ſir olyuer clyſſon nat deed hurte within ſixe wekes ſhulde hole conſydred nat good ſuretie caſtell feared encloſed ſuche wyſe ſhulde nat iſſue whan wolde than̄e tooke certayne hym iſſued ſecretly rode ſo longe came bretaygne foūde duke receyued hym knewe mater howe conſtable nat deed ſayde ah ſir peter craon ye vnhappy coude nat ſlee conſtable whan ye hym vnder youre handes sir quod ſir peter deuyll thynke deuylles hell dyde helde hym hādes companyons ſure ſtryken hym mo thanne threſcore ſtrokes ſwordes iauelyns whan̄e fell fro horſe dede thought ſurely bene deed ſo nat ben fortune fall baker dore whiche ſtode halfe opyn fallen ſtrete hadde neuer ryſen lyue well quod duke nowe wyll none otherwyſe ſure ſhall ſhortely ſome newes fro frenche kyng thynke ſhall haue warre hym ye haue kepe priuely ye mater ſhall nat thus reſt ſithe haue promyſed ayde ſuſteyne wyll kepe promyſe ⸫ ⸫ ¶of great army viage frenche kynge purpoſed make bretayne agaynſt duke bycauſe ſuſteyned ſir peter craon howe viage kynge fell ſicke wherby viage brake cap clxxxvii tidynges came frenche kynge laye parys duke bretayne hadde receyued ſir peter craon kyng counſayled ſuche priuye counſayle ſhulde incontynent ſende bretaygne duke cōmaundynge hym faythe homage ought crowne fraunce take traytour ſir peter craon ſende hym parys theſe letter written ſealed delyuered ſquiet rode ſo long came bretayne foūde duke caſtell ermyne delyuered letter duke toke reed ſaid meſſanger wolde write agayne kyng ſo dyd excuſyng hymſelfe sayeng ſir peter craon knewe nothynge wolde nat knowe aparteyned nat hym knowe hatered warre bytwene ſir olyuer clyſſon ſir peter craon toke regarde therto touched nothynge therfore thoſe mater prayed kyng holde hym excuſed letter ſealed delyuered kynges meſſanger ſo retourned agayne parys foūde kyng coūſayle ſore deſyrous tidinges bretaygne meſſanger delyuered letter kynge toke reed kynge ſayd brother counſayle excuſacion duke nat ſuffycient ſemeth well duke bretayne hath cauſed buſynes diſpyre outrage ſo great ought nat ſuffred toucheth gretlye myne honoure ſame ſeaſon duke berrey parys often tymes kynge wolde ſpeke hym treſpaſſe duke ſayd sir ſurely hath done great outrage myght founde reaſone made amendes fayre vncle quod kynge bretaygne duke wyll go ſeke hym ye ſhall go v duke diſſymuled mater ſayd sir ſhall pleaſe ye muſt haue alſo brother burgoyne wyll haue hym v quod kyng without hym wyll make voyage wyll go bretayne ſuche armye able reſyſt ennemyes maye ſe nowe openly duke loueth ſetteth v lytell proude preſumptuous ſhall entende nothynge tyll haue brought hym reaſone thus frenche kyng deuiſed duke berrey manyſſhed greatly duke bretayne aſſyſters duke berrey acorded ſayeng diſſymuled thought contrary frenche kyng hadde great affection reuenged diſpyte done cōſtable wherfore prepared hym ſelfe go bretayne fyrſt go aniou diſtroye beate downe ſir peter craons caſtel le duke bretayne ſayd bought yet kyng counſayle ſayd poynt duke heritage duke ſayde ſo excuſe ſuſteyne ſir peter craon wherfore perſonally kynges indignacyon yet ſame ſeaſon treatie maryage bytwene duke bretaygnes ſon̄e kynges doughter meane ſeaſon whyle voyage thus ordred great brute therof ſpoken throughe frauce retourned paris byſſhoppe noyon lorde de la ryuer fro foize bierne ſhewed kyng counſayle howe ſpedde well herde voyage bretayne buſyed ſo kyng counſayle leyſar entēde mater kynge wolde gladly conſtable ben hole might able ryde kyng went fro parys cōmaunded beaten downe ſir peter craōs houſe ſtode churche yarde ſaynt iohans kynge dyde gyue groūde make churche yarde burye deed bodyes frenche kyng made prouiſyon waye aniou mayne bretayne thourayne ryuer loyre entent go bretayne none durſt ſpeke contrary renome throughout paris well knowen ſir olyuer cliſſon cōſtable fraū ce whan laye thus ſicke hurtꝭ made teſtament entente heyres ſhulde knowe ye trouthe euery thyng heyres two doughters one maryed iohan bretayne erle ponthieur ſir olyuer quytte priſone englāde payde hym ſixſcore thou ſande frankes duke irelande hath ben ſhewed hyſtorie ſeconde doughter ſhulde vicoūtes rohan reaſon huſbāde ſomme teſtament mounted ſōme ſeuyntene hundred thouſande frankes beſyde heritage euery man yt herde therof great marueyle howe ſhulde gather toguider ſuche richeſſe ſpecially duke berrey burgoyne counſayls great marueyle therof ſpake largely ſayd deuyll howe maye conſtable hath gadered guider ſo many floreyns ſuche mouable goodes kyng hym ſelfe hath nat ſo moche maye well beleued knowen hath nat iuſt meanes thus mater paſſed ſuche loued hym nat thought neuertheleſſe thus ſuche kynge written vnto prepared ſelfe go hym bretaygne voiage pleaſed nothynge duke burgoyn ſayd warre without reaſon concluſion ther coulde take good ende realme fraunce duchy bretayne lordes knightes ſquyers thē nothynge warre bytwene ſir olyuer clyſſon ſir peter craon nede quod take payne traueyle make warre quarelles ſhulde rather ſuffre owne mē greue make warre eche vpon duke berrey ſame opinyon coude nat herde beleued kyng coūſayled contrary opinyons ſuche kyng loued better theſe duke coude nat tell howe breke enterprice whan ſawe none remedy obeyed ſlouthfully howe promocyon duke burgoyne erle oſtrenaunt written vnto kynge go hym iourney thre hū dred ſpeares erle loued dedes armes prouyded hym go kynge whan̄e redy aſſembled toguyder company great coſt charge countermaunded agayne wyſe ſhulde ſtyrre ⸪ ¶howe duke thourayn brother kyng reſigned duchy thourayne kynges handes howe exchaūge kynge gaue hym duchy orlyaūce ſo euer called duke orlyaunce cap clxxxvii ſame ſeaſon kyng thus nighe redy departe parys ſhewe toke buſyneſſe hym ſelfe exchaū ge made landes gretly profyte duke thourayne reſygned kynges handes duchy thourayne kyng gaue hym duchy orliaunce lyke maner aū ciently duke philyp orlyaunce helde whiche four tymes better value ſo thus fro henſ forthe hyſtorie ſhall name hym duke thourayne duke orlyaūce ¶whan ſir olyuer clyſſon hole might ryde frenche kyng right ioyfull ſaid howe wolde tary lengar ſo euenyng toke leaue quene iſabell wyfe newe ducheſſe orlyaunce ladyes damoſelles ſo dyde duke orlaūce lykewiſe departed rode ſupper mōtague duke burbone erle namure lorde coucy hym kyng laye dyned dyner departed laye night ſaynt germayns laye ſeuyn dayes ye kyng ſomwhat diſeaſed phiſicions wolde haue hym haue reſted hym ſelfe ye kyng ſo wyllyng iourney ſayde howe moche better eaſe dede whiche dyde gyue corage men ſet forwarde thā two vncles duke berrey burgoyne behynde ſhewed well maner ſame iourney greued wolde nat haue gone good wylles howe hadde made aſſemble ſaue honour obeyed folowed whan frenche kyng hadde reſted hym fyftene dayes ſaynt germayns armye aſſembled departed paſſed ryuer seyne toke waye charter ſo annens good towne caſtell parteyning lorde de la ryuer herytage wyues kynge brother duke orlyaunce duke burbone lorde de la ryreceyued kynge honorably taryed thre dayes rode charter montague byſſhoppe kynge lodged byſſhoppe palais two duke ſeconde day thyder came duke berrey erle marche cōpany fourh daye thider cāe duke burgoyne wher kynge ryght ioyfull people came dayle kyng ſayd wolde nat retourne parys tyll hadde brought duke bretayne reaſon ſo often tymes put hym payne trouble kynges counſayle hadde ſo ſette hym warre duke berrey burgoyne wolde gladly haue modered ye mater coulde nat herde wherwith ſore diſpleaſed ſo ſuche coūſayls ſaid eche ſurely mater coude nat long endure ſtate full lykely kynge realme ſhall haue ſome buſyneſſe ſithe kyng refuſeth counſaile vncles leaneth pleaſure nothyng lyke thē whan kyng taried charter ſeuyn dayes departed toke ye waye man men folowed ſome fro farre partes arthois beamoys vermandois picardy ſome ſaid one another ah duke bretayne maketh v haue moche putteth v great payne traueyle hath alwayes harde highe herted agaynſt crowne fraūce neuer loued honored coſyn erle flaunders ducheſſe burgone haue alwayes borne hym yet nat ben ben diſtroyed long go euerſyth lorde clyſſon tourned frenche neuer loued surelye likely • • de ••• yable dede hath alwayes 〈◊〉 ſir peter craon agaynſt kyng agaynſt conſtable ſayde lette kyng alone tyme hath ye mater ſo hert wyll bring duke reaſon retourne trewe ꝙ trayſon feare ſuche go kyng nat enemy ye duke may well 〈◊〉 durſt ſpeke ſome token ſome nyght daye coū ſayle kynge breke voyage whiche ſo troubleth kyng ſcant gette hym ſelfe helthe recouery laſte ſickeneſſe thus knightes ſquiers deuiſed among thē ſelfe rode coū trey styll kyng aproched cytie man kynge lodged caſtell lordes ye cytie men warre abrode countrey kyng taried thre wickes ſore vexed feuer phiſicions ſayde brother vncles lordes enſure ye yuell traueyle ye kyng good ſtate ryde reſt farre better hym ſythe came fro cytie amyens hath nat ben ſo good helthe ſhewed kynge ſo great affection go iourney wolde nother beleue yet phiſycions ſayde howe founde eaſe trauelyng reſtyng therfore ſo euer counſayle contrary ſhall nat pleaſe loueth nat anſwere coulde nat haue kyng euery day kyng wolde ſytte myddes counſayle tyll noon thentent none ſhulde laye lette iourney thus kyng man ſomwhat acomplyſſhe deſyers vncles ſent four notable knightes duke bretayne ſir raynolde du roy lorde varenſiers lorde caſtell morant ſir tāpyne cauten • l chateleyne gyſors charged ſhewe duke howe kyng counſaile reputed dyde great offence ſuſteyne kynges enemy realmes make amendes ſhulde ſēde ſir peter craon man kyng wherby meanes ſhulde foūde ſhulde take dōmage countrey kynges voyage thus deꝑted fro man xl ſperes paſſed cyte angiers laſt came cytie nauntes entred ſounde duke made good chere daye made dyner dyde meſſage declared ye kynges entent counſayls whervnto duke anſwered wiſely ſagely ſaid howe ſhulde harde hym delyuer ſir peter craon ſayd god myght helpe hym buſyneſſe knewe nat wherfore deſyred caſe holde hym excuſed ſayde well herde hym yere paſt loued nat ſir olyuer clyſſon wolde make mortall warre power ſoeuer ende came therof tyme demaunded hym gyuen ſir olyuer knowledge therof ſayd vtterly defyed wolde ſlee hym coude outher daye nyght ſoeuer coude fynde hym dedes knowe wherfore haue marueyle kynge wyll make warre agaynſt cauſe couynauntes maryage bytwene chyldren grace god ſhall nat broken parte wherfore haue done nothynge hym counſaile ſhulde make warre agaynſt aunſwere duke made frenche kynges meſſangers ſo whan hadde taryed daye nauntes toke leaue departed retourned man ye kyng thought longe tyll herde aunſwere ye haue herde declared ye kyng coūſayle duke berrey burgoyne well cōtent ye anſwere ſayd reaſonable kyng reaſon ſuche enformacion ſayde contrary ſayd ſithe ſo forewarde iourney wolde nat returne agayne fraunce parys tyll brought duke bretayne reaſon gladly two duke berrey burgoyne wolde haue modered voiage might nat herde kyng taken ſuche diſpleaſure duke bretayn bicauſe ſuſteyned ſir peter craon excuſacion coulde taken ſame tyme brute ranne fraunce quene aragon lady yolant bare coſyn germayne frenche kynge priſon cytie barcylona knyght man knewe name men ſuppoſed ben ſyr peter craon quene writen right amyably kynge ſygnyfyenge hym fyfte day moneth iuly knyght good eſtate aray came barcylona haue paſt ſce hyred money ſhyppe ſayd haue ſayled napoles bycauſe kepe paſſages ſtraunger ſhall paſſe without knowen knyght wyll nat ſhewe name therfore kepe hym priſone abaſſhment ſe thynke ſurely ſame perſon ye wold ſo fayne haue therfore write therof ye ſhulde ſende ſome perſon hyther ſuche knoweth ſir peter craon ſe nat ſo euer ſhall nat delyuered tyll haue aunſwere fro wolde theſe tydynges might agreable counſayle knoweth holy gooſt preſerue writen parpygnan nynth day iuly yolante bare quene aragon maiolles lady sardyne sardane ſuper ſcrypcion redouted kynge fraunce theſe tydynges ſomewhat modered dyuers mennes harte ſo nere poynte haue broken voyage howe ſuche ſir olyuer clyſſons frendes ſayde thoſe tydynges fayned tale made deuyſed breke kynges voyage ſayenge ſir peter craon none priſoneꝭ duke bretayne hath ſuſteyned hym dothe quene aragon lettre kynge made lyght ſayenge trayſon fable duke burgoyne ſayd syr yet leſte peaſe neſe quene aragon delyueraunce knight priſone petaduenture nothynge gylty treſpas ſende vnto ſhe may contente v content therwith quod kynge pleaſe beleue ſurely traytour ſyr peter craon none barcylona priſone aboute duke bretayne faythe owe ſaint denyce ſhall one make acompt therof coulde man turne kynge fro opinyon ſyr peter craon duke bretaygne duke bretayne well enfourmed buſyneſſe thought hymſelfe nat well aſſured ſawe well duke berrey burgoyne coulde nat bring purpoſe aboute ſyr olyuer clyſſons frendes led kynge lyſte duke prouyded kepe townes garyſons howe durſt kepe towne except wannes campell doll camper lermyn corātyne suſement wrote ſuche knyghtes ſquyers thought ſhulde ayde diſſymuled hym bycauſe knewe french kyng ſo ſore diſpleaſed hym alſo thought nat thynge couenable duke ſuſteyne ſyr peter craon agaynſt conſtable fraūce dyd duke maner repented hym done ſo moche howe corage herte ſo hygh dyſdayned ſpeke ſayde kynge came bretayne ſemed wolde begynnynge wolde let hym lone thanne ſhall ſe frendes foos wyll nat haſty make warre whan weneth moſt reſt wyll awake hym nat greed hym loue thus duke deuyſed ſomtyme counſayle thought ſurely ſhulde haue warre howe nat mater tourned otherwyſe great aduauntage therfore olde prouerbe nat poore yt happy duke fortunate reaſon apytuous incydence fell ſodaynly frenche kynge otherwyſe duke nat lykely haue ſcaped daūgers haue lyued peace dyd whan frenche kynge taryed ſpace thre wekes cytie man knyghtes retourned ſent bretayne ſayd ſyth herde duke anſwere wolde lenger tary ſayd taryenge greatly diſpleaſed wolde paſſe forthe bretaygne ſe enemy duke bretaygne ſuſteyd traytour ſyr peter craon entencyon kynge knyghtes ſquyers came agaynſt hym founde townes cloſed wolde put downe ye duke euer ſet gouernour countrey tyll duke chyldren lawfull age rendre berytage duke neuer haue parte theof opinyon king helde ſtyll man coude put hym therfro thus fayre daye aboute ten clocke kynge departed fro cytie man cōmaunded marſhalles nyght cauſe mye bothe behynde dyſloge drawe anger ſayde wolde nat retourne tyll ben bretayne dyſtroyed traytours put hym ſo moche payne trouble marſhalles dyd kinges cōmaundement day king departed marueylous hoote ſonne naturally cheife force entent declare trouth euery thyng ſame ſeaſon kynge lay man ſore traueyled dayly ſyttynge counſayle alſo nat perfytely hole nat ben ſeaſon feble brayne heed dyd eate drinke lytell nygh dayly hoote feuer ſo gretly anoyed payned alſo dyſpleaſure conſtables hurte full malencoly ſpirytes ſore troubled traueyled phyſicions ſpyed well ſo dyd vncles coulde nat remedy man durſte counſayle hym breke voyage bretaygne enfourmed rode forwarde foreſt man great ſygnifycacyon fell hym whiche doone well ſhulde haue called counſayle aboute hym well aduyſed hymſelfe gone sodaynly came kynge poore man bare heeded bare legged bare footed body poore whyte cote ſemed rather foole wyſe boldely ſodaynly toke brydell kynges horſe handes ſtopped horſe ſayd syr kyng tyde forward thou arte betrayed thoſe wordes entred kynges heed wherby worſe dyſpoſed helthe ſo herte blode moued kinges ſeruauntes ſtrake ſo poore man lette kynges horſe go made wordes fooles ſpekyng whiche foly dyuers men ſayde leſte ſhulde haue better examyned man haue ſene ben naturall foole haue knowen fro whence came dyde nat ſo lefte hym behynde neuer ſene mannes knowledge ſuche nere kynge herde hym ſpeke theſe wordes kynge paſſed forthe aboute twelue clocke kynge paſſed foreſt came great playne ſandy ſonne alſo heyght ſhone bright whoſe rayes marueylouſly hote wherby horſes ſore chafed ſuche perſons armed ſore oppreſſed heat knyghtes rode togyther companyes ſome ſome kynge rode ſomwhat parte bycauſe duſte duke berrey duke burgoyne rode lefte hande talkynge togyther acre brede lande fro kynge lordes erle marche ſir iaques burbone ſyr charles de la brethe ſyr phylyppe darthoys ſir henry ſir phylip bare ſyr peter nauer knyghtes rode companyes duke burbon lorde coucy ſyr charles danger baron dyuiry dyuers rode kynge nat company deuiſed talked togyther toke hede fell ſodaynly chefe perſonage company whiche kynges owne perſone therfore workes god marueylous ſcourges cruell douted creature hath ſene olde teſtament alſo newe many fygures example therof rede howe nabugodonoſor kynge aſſyryens reygned ſeaſon ſuche tryumphant glory none lyke hym ſodaynly greateſt force glory ſouerayne kynge lorde god kynge heuen erthe fourmer ordeyner thynges parelled ſayd kynge ſuche wyſe loſt wytte reygne ſeuen yers eſtate lyued acornes maſt fell fro okes wylde appels frutes hadde taſt bore ſwyne endured penaūce god reſtored hym agayne memory wytte ſayde danyell prophet none god god iſraell nowe father ſonne holy gooſt thre perſones one god hath ben euer ſhall puiſſaunt ſhewe warkes euer wherfore man ſhulde marueyle thyng dothe nowe purpoſe ſpeke theſe wordes great influence fro heuen fell ſayd daye vpon frenche kynge dyuers ſayd owne faute acordynge dyſpoſicyon body ſtate warnyng phyſicyons dyd gyue hym ſhulde nat haue rydden ſuche hoote day houre rather mornynge euenynge freſſhe ayre wherfore ſhame nere aboute hym ſuffre coūſayle hym dyd thus frenche kynge rode vpon fayre playne heate sonne whiche marueylous heyght kynge • ac • e couered blacke veluet whiche ſore chafed hym heed ſyngle bonet ſcarlet chapelet great perles whiche quene gyuen hym departure page rode behynde beatynge heed chapewe montaban bright clere ſhynynge agaynſt ſonne behynde page rode nother bearing kynges ſpeare paynted redde frynged ſylke ſharpe heed ſtele lord de la ryuer brought doſyn hym fro tholouſe one gyuen hole doſyn king kynge gyuen thre theym brother duke orlyaunce thre duke burbon rode thus forth page bare ſpeare whether neclygence fell ſlepe lette ſpeare fall page heed rode hym heed ſpeare made great claſſhe bright chapewe ſtele kynge rode fore noyſe ſodaynly ſtarted herte trymbled imagynacion ranne inpreſſyon wordes man ſtopped horſe foreſt man ran thought enemyes ranne hym ſlee diſtroy abuſyon fell wytte febleneſſe heed daſſhed ſpores horſe drewe ſworde tourned page hauynge knowledge man wenynge hymſelfe batayle incloſed enemyes lyfte vp ſworde ſtryke cared nat cryed ſayd vpon theſe traytours whan page ſawe kynge ſo inflamed ire tooke good hede themſelfe tyme thought kynge ben dyſpleaſed bycauſe ſpeare fell downe thanne ſtepte away fro kynge duke orleaunce nat than̄e farre fro kynge kynge came hym naked ſworde hande kynge ſuche franſey herte ſo feble nother knewe brother vncle whan duke orlyaunce ſawe kynge commynge hym ſworde naked ha • de • abaſſhed wolde nat abyde hym wyſte nat mente daſſhed ſpurres horſe rode awaye kynge hym duke burgoyne rode lytell waye fro kynge whan herde ruſſhyng horſes herde page crye regarded waye ſawe howe kynge naked ſworde chaſed brother duke orlyaunce ſore abaſſhed ſayd harowe myſchife kynge nat ryght mynde god helpe hym flye away nephewe flye away kynge wolde ſlee duke orlyance nat well aſſured ſelfe fledde awaye faſte horſe myght beare hym knyghtes ſquyers folowed euery man began drawe thyder farre thought chafed hare wolfe tyll laſt herd kynge nat well mynde duke orlyance ſaued himſelfe men armes came aboute kynge ſuffred hym wery hym ſelfe traueyled febler whan ſtrake man wolde fall downe ſtroke matter hurte many ouerthrowen none made defence fynally whan kyng well • eryed horſe ſore chafed ſw • te great heate knyght normandy one kynges chamber • aynes whome kynge loued well called gyllyam martell • came behynde kyng ſodaynely tooke hym armes helde hym ſtyll aproched toke ſworde handes tooke hym downe fro horſe dyd • acke thre refreſſhe hym came brother 〈◊〉 vncles clene loſt knowledge rolled eyen heed marueylouſly ſpake man lordes blode ſore abaſſhed wyſte nat ſayd duke berrey burgoyne ſayde behoueth v recourne man voyage doone tyme ſayde nat moche thought ſhewed ryght well whan came parys ſuche loued nat ye ſhall reaſonably conſydre thinges acordynge trouthe great pytie french kyng tyme reputed moſte noble puyſſaunt kynge cryſtendome fell ſo ſodaynly mynde remedy god wolde kynge layde horſe lyttoure ſo brought backe agayne cytie man marſhalles gaue knowledge armye ſhulde retourne howe voyage broken tyme ſome knowledge ſome nat nyght kynge came man phyſicyons moche hym lordes blode royall great trouble euery man ſpake dyuer • maners ſome ſayd ſuche hadde rule aboute kynge poyſoned hym brynge realme fraunce ſhame trouble theſe wordes multyplyed ſuche wyſe duke orlyance vncles lordes blode royall noted ſpake togyther ſayde howe ſaye ſyrs haue ye nat herde theſe wordes howe menne murmure dyuets place vpon theym hath gouernaunce kynge ſome ſaythe ſhulde poyſoned lette v ſertche howe maye knowen ſome ſayde howe ſhulde beſt knowen phyſycyons ought knowe acquaynted complexcyon phyſicyons ſent examyned anſwered howe kyng longe tyme engendred ſame malady knewe well wekenes brayne wold ſore trouble hym laſte ſhewe ſelfe haue ſayde moche tyme duke burgoyne ſayde syrs trewe therin ye dyd well acquyte ſelfe wolde neyther beleue v affeciyon ſo ſore ſette vpon voyage deuyſed yuell tyme voyage hathe dyſhonoured v better clyſſon thoſe affynyte ben deed many daye agone rather kynge haue taken malady theſe tydynges ſhall ſprede abrode many place ſeyng yt yonge man blame ſhall layde v vncles blode men wyll ſaye ſhulde otherwyſe haue counſayled hym thus ſhall laide faute without cauſe ſirs quod duke yeſterday whan wente dyner ye hym phyſicyons aunſwered ſayd yes dyd eate meate well quod duke certaynly quod dyd eate drinke lytle ſate muſed gaue hym drinke laſt quod duke syr quod canne nat tell ſoone table taken vp departed made v redy ryde chamberlayns butler canne tell beſt robert de tulle ſquyer pycardy ſent demaūded gaue kynge drinke laſte syrs quod ſyr robert lygnac ſent enquyred wyne kynge dranke laſt chambre whan wente horſe syr quod roberte tulle toke ſaye preſence kinge trewe quod roberte tulle ye nede nat doute therin haue ſuſpeciouſneſſe yet ſame wyne flagon wherof wyll drinke aſſaye duke berrey ſayd nede nat ſurely kynge nat poyſoned malady procedeth yuell counſayle tyme ſpeke mater nowe let alone tyll another ſeaſon ⸪ thus maner theſe lordes departed eche fro nyght went lodgyage kynges vncles ordeyned four knyghtes honour wayte aboute kynge ſyr raynolde du royꝭſyr raynolde toye lorde grauſeers ſir gyllyam marte kynges vncles ſent cōmaundement lorde dela ryuer ſyr iohn̄ mercyer montagu begu vyllayns ſyr gullyam bordes ſyr helyon lygnac ſhulde wyſe come aboute kynge tyll better eſtate nexte daye kynges vncles came ſe kynge founde hym ryght feble demaunded reſt taken nyght anſwered ſmall reſt poore newes quod duke burgoyn came duke orlyance ſo went togyder kynge demaunded hym howe dyd gaue none aunſwere loked ſtraungely loſte clene knowledge theſe lordes ſore abaſſhed comuned togyder ſayde haue kyng herde caſe trouble ayde good lette v recōmaunde hym chaumberlayns phyſicyons canne beſt take hede hym lette v go ſtudy howe realme maye gouerned el thinges wyll go amyſſe duke burgoyne ſayd duke berrey fayre brother beſt drawe parys ordayne haue kynge eaſely brought thyder better ſhall take hede hym theſe partyes whan let v aſſēble counſayle fraunce ordeyne ſhall haue gouernaūce realme duke orlayunce well ſayde quod duke berrey good ſtudyed beſt haue kynge lye myght ſoner recouer helth deuyſed ſhulde brought caſtell crayell good ayre fayre countrey ryuer oyſe whan ordeyned men warre leaue departe cōmaunded marſhalles euery man retourne peaſably owne countrey without doynge vyolence domage countreys ſhulde paſſe dyd lordes capytayns make mendes kynges two vncles chauncellour fraunce ſente anone ſoundry meſſangers good cyties townes fraunce ſhuld take good hede kepe well townes conſyderynge kynge nat well dyſpoſed helthe cōmaundementes fulfylled people realme fraunce fore abaſſhed whan knew howe king fallen ſycke franſey menne ſpake largely agaynſte counſayled kynge go bretaygne ſome ſayde howe kynge betrayed bare duke bretaygne ſyr peter craon agaynſt kyng men coulde nat lette wolde ſpeke mater ſo hygh wordes ranne therof dyuerſely thus fynally kyng brought crayell lefte kepynge phyſicyons ſayde four knyghtes euery man departed commaunded hyde kepe ſecrete kynges malady fro knowledge quene ſeaſone ſhe great chylde courte cōmaunded kepe ſecrete payne great punyſſhement thus kynge crayell march seulis compyen ryuer oyſe kept ſayd knyghtes phyſycions gaue hym medicyns recouered lytell helth ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe duke burgoyn berrey vncles kynge gouernaunce realme howe chaſed toke ſuche gouerned kynge cap clxxxix ſeaſone ye realme fraunce wyſe ſage phyſicyon brewte none lyke hym well loued lorde coucy natyue countrey tyme bydyng cyte laon called mayſter guylliam harſley whan knewe fyrſte kynges malady accydent fell ſycke ſayd thought hym ſelfe knowe kynges compleryon howe maladye fallen kynge faute complexyon holdeth moche ye moyſter ſee theſe wordes reported lord coucy paris duke orlyance ye kinges vncles coūſayle fraūce noble men prelate paris determyne ſhulde haue gouernaunce realme longe kyng ſhulde yt malady outher brother duke orlyance two vncles one thē vpon cōmunycacion xv dayes agreed fynally concluded bycauſe duke orlyaunce yonge take hym ſo great charge duke berrey burgoyne ſhulde haue gouernaunce realme ſpecyally duke burgoyne duches burgoyne ſhulde aboute quene ſeconde perſon thus haue ſayde lorde coucy ſhewed kynges vncles great wyſdome practyſe ſayd phyſycion mayſter guyllyam harſeley whan duke herde ſente hym ſo came parys lorde couey preſented hym kynges vncles ſayd lordes beholde mayſter guyllyam harſeley ſhewed ryght welcome quod duke receyued made good chere ordeyned hym go crayell vyſyte kynge abyde aboute hym tyll hadde recouered helthe ſayd mayſter cōmaundement went crayell kynge chiefe ouer ſyght mynyſtryng thynge kyng ſawe well kynges malady curable ſawe howe taken reaſone febleneſſe herte heed faute therfore dyd dylygence recouer helthe tydynges kynges malady ſpred farre abrode ſo euer ſorye ye maye well knowe duke bretaygne ſyr peter craon wepte neuer deale great ſorowe alſo whan pope boryface rome cardynals knowe trouthe right ioyfull drewe togyther conſiſtory ſayde howe greateſt enemy frenche kynge beaten cruell rodde ſeyng god taken fro hym wytte ſayde howe influence ſente hym fro heuen chaſtyce hym withall bycauſe ſo moche ſuſteyned pope auignon therfore cruell plage ſent hym cauſe hole realme better aduyſed therfore ſayd quarell ſtronger truely haue wyſely conſydred euery thynge great token haue cauſed cardynalles auygnon haue aduyſed made lytell force therof nother honour god realme pope auignon cardynalles ſayde howe reaſone kynge yonge wolde haue owne wyll therby fallen malady faute ſuche haue rule aboute hym haue nat doone duetie haue ſuffred hym rynne bridell ryde nyght daye exceſſyuely traueylynge body meaſure therfore ſuche hath rule ought charged therwith none faulte ordred hym youthe ſo contynued reaſonable regement haue folowed counſayle vncles ſyckneſſe nat fallen hym nowe alſo hath broken promeſſe againſt reaſon promyſed yere paſſed ſware wordes kynge wolde ſo ordayne dyſtroy antepape rome cardynals ſubdue ſyſme churche ſette mater trouble good eſtate whiche nothynge doone hathe doone contrary promeſſe wherwith god dyſpleaſed cauſe hym better aduyſe ſelfe hathe punyſſhed hym cruell rodde retourne helte may well ſhall behoue v ſende ſufficyent legate ſhewe hym wyſely defaute brekyng promeſſe forgette nat reaſon neclygēce thus pope cardynalles auignon ſpake comuned toguyder layde defaute kynges malady counſayle fraūce ſuche kynge chambre ſame oppinyon many folkes realme fraunce kynge ſence kynges offrynge towne called areſnecke countie heynaulte bytwene cambrey valencennes whiche towne churche parteyninge abbey ſaynt waſte arraſce wherin lyeth ſaynt called ſaint acquayre ſhrme ſyluer whiche pylgrimage ſought farre nere malady fraſey thyder ſente man waxe repreſentynge frenche kynge humbly offred ſaynt myght meane god aſſwage kynges malady ſende helthe lykewiſe kynges offrynge ſente ſaynt hermyer romayes whiche ſaynt meryce heale franſey lykewiſe • ryngꝭ ſent ī place ye ſame entent whā tidynges come englande kynge counſayle ſore troubled therwith ſpecially duke lancaſtre ſayd ſuche knyghtes ſquyers aboute hym sir ſurely great pytic frenche kynge ſemed man great enterprice great deſyre well ſayde amyence whan departed fro hym fayre coſyn lancaſtre deſyre hertely dylygence ferme peace maye made bytwene nephue kynge englande v oure realmes entent myght go togyder agaynſt lamorabaquyn hath conquered realme armony dothe diſtroye chriſtendome goyne thider faithe ſhulde exalted boū de therto nowe frenche kynges malady mater ſore letted hyndred ſhall neuer credence herde duke ſayde trewe lyke great trouble fraunce thus maner people bothe tarre nere ſpake deuyſed kynges maladye kyng laye ſtyll crayle kepynge foreſaid knyghtes maiſter guyllyam harſely man ſpake kynge entred caſtell ſuche ordayned therto somtyme duke orlyaunce duke burbone came thyder viſyte kynge duke berrey burgoyne laye ſtyll parys done nothynge newe purpoſe ſhortely ſomwhat agaynſt ſuche loued nat bycauſe hadde alwayes harde duke berrey ſaid duke burgoyne brother le ryuer clyſſon le mercyer begue vallayns whan kynge languedocke ccuelly punyſſhed dethe treaſourer good ſeruaunt betyſache euuy coude ſaye coulde nat gette hym handes ſaue lyre therfore nowe let beware ſhall paye agayn ſame money forged ye ſame forge lykewiſe duke burgoyne coude nat ioue gouerned kyng euer whane buſyneſſe courte euer agaynſt hym alſo ſame tyme ducheſſe burgoyne cruell lady quene chefe ruler non ſpake quene meanes lady hated mortally ſir olyuer clyiſone loue duke bretayne nere blode often tymes ſhe ſpake duke huſbande ſayeng howe greatlye blame beare ſo moche ſir olyuer cliſſon agaynſt ſo myghtie prince duke brecaygne duke burgoyne colde ſage ymaginatyue prince dyde buſyneſſe alwayes length wolde nat wyllyng bringe realme fraūce trouble alwayes wyllyng kepe ꝑties loue peace nere myght alſo yt neuer wyllyng diſpleaſe ye great lordꝭ anſwered right ſagely wyſely wyfe dame ꝙ good tymes ſōwhat diſſymnle mannes diſpleaſure true coſyn bretayne great lorde hath ſeignorie puiſſaunce ynough agaynſt ſir olyuer clyſſon hadde taken parte agaynſt clyſſon ſhulde greatly haue weaked realme fraunce ſir olyuer clyſſone ſaythe ſuſtayneth hate hath duke bretaygne ſuſtayne vp realme fraunce wherin haue great parte alſo cōmon renome fraūce alſo yet haue ſene artycle wherin ſhulde take parte coſyn bretaygne agaynſt ſir olyuer clyſſon therfore hath behoued diſſymule elles coude nat haue good wyll ye kyng realme wherto boūde faithe ſeruyce ye duke bretaygne nowe ſo kyng nat good caſe ye knowe well agaynſt lorde cliſſon ſhalbe ſuche haue gyuen coūſayle agaynſt v brother berrey kyng ſhulde procede iourney bretaygne rodde gadered wherwith ſhall ſhortely beaten corrected ye ſhall breuely yet wyll take lytell paciēce dame dame ſeaſon laſt payde fortune ſomtyme tourneth herte troubled ſomtyme agayne reioyceth none ioyfull ſomtyme ſorie troubled clyſſon le ryuer montague le mercyer le vyllayns haue done yuell ſhalbe ſhewed breuely ſuche lyke wordes duke burgoyne ducheſſe wyfe ſported thē toguyder daye happed ye duke burgoyne duke berrey cōmuned ſecretely togyder ſayde tyme began diſtroye haue diſhonored nephue kynge haue ledde hym wylles firſt let v begyn cōſtable ye gretteſt hath moſt leſe daye made teſtament ſeuyntene hūdred thouſāde frankes deuyll hath gadered toguyder richeſſe yet mary age doughter iohan bretayne delyuered priſon englād payde raūſome two hūdred thouſande frankes englande let v ſe poyntes lay reaſon nephue duke orleaunce beareth hym greatlye ſo dyuers barones fraunce howe ſtycke therto ſhall finde mater ynough lawe parlyament trewe quod duke burgoyne firſt tyme cometh ſpeke thynke wyll morowe night ſhall ſo receyue hym ſhall well knowe loue hym nat come good brother berrey lykewiſe ſhall done quod ſo departed tyme fortuned lorde clyſſon knewe nothynge good grace ſayde duke certayne knightes ſquiers ſuche hadde ſayd voyage kyng came conſtable ſente chaunceller treaſourers hym purſue money wage whervpon mornyng came ye houſe arthois parys ſhewe ſtate ye buſyneſſe duke burgoyne none bycauſe hadde hole gouernaunce realme fraunce whan̄e came thyder entred court porter lette hym lyghted mounted ſteares hall alone lye acompanyed one ſquyer hall foūde ii ſquyers duke demaunded might ſpeke wt duke nat sir ꝙ nat tell tary ſhall go knowe pleaſure ſquiers entred duke chambre foūde hym good leyſar talkyng heraude come fro great feeſt ben holden almaigne ſquiers ſayd sir conſtable hall ſaythe come ſpeke pleaſure goddeſname quod duke lette hym come good leyſar wyll ſay one ſquiers went hall ſaid conſtable ſir cōe lorde wyll haue cōe cōſtable entred whan duke ſawe hym chaunged colour repented cauſed hym come chambre yet gret deſyre ſpeke hym conſtable dyde hatte made reuerence duke ſayde sir come knowe ſtate gouernaunce realme howe euery thynge ſhalbe ordred reaſon myne offyce dayly called vpon nowe lorde berrey haue rule therfore may pleaſe ſhewe ſhall duke lightly aunſwered ſayde clyſſon clyſſon ye haue nothyng buſye gouernynge realme ye haue medled therwith long yuell tyme howe deuyll haue ye gadered ſuche rycheſſe ye made teſtament late kynge brother berrey haue nat ſo moche go youre waye departe preſence lette ſe nat ſhame ſhulde putte better eye therwith duke deꝑted lefte lorde clyſſon alone iſſued chambre hanged downe heed ſo paſſed hall courte toke horſe company retourned priuely lodgyng without ſpekyng worde ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe ſir olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraūce departed parys anſwere duke burgoyne made hym wente mount le heury fro then bretayne cap cxc whan lorde clyſſon retourned lodgynge many ymaginacyons remembre beſt hym parceyued wel mater went yuell hym wyſte nat whome make complaynt declare buſyneſſe duke orlyaunce crayell thoughe hadde parys yet laye nat power defende hym feared leſt duke burgoyne wolde haue cauſed hym areſted ſpoyle houſe wherfore durſt nat abyde aduenture ſhortely made hym redy ſhewed certayne ſeruauntes wolde agaynſt nyght wente lodgyng priuely backeſyde thre perſones hym iſſued parys gate ſaynt anchony paſſed ryuer seyne bridge charenton roode ſo longe came caſtell owne ſeuyn leages fro parys called mount le heury taryed tyll heroe tidynges ſame daye duke burgoyne ſpoken conſtable duke berrey mette toguyder aſſembled palays commune toguyder certayne matter touchynge realme duke burgoyne ſhewed brother ſayde ſir olyuer clyſſon duke berrey anſwered ſayd ye haue done well muſt haue begynnynge entre vpon theym ſurely clyſſon le ryuer mercier mō tague haue robbed realme fraunce tyme come ſhall leaue yea leſe lyues maye beleued ſame proper daye conſtable departed montague likewiſe departed ſecretely gate ſaynt anthony toke waye trois champayne burgoyne ſayd wolde nat reſt tyll came auygnon thyder ſent chiefe rycheſſe lefte certayne wyfe kepe eſtate curteſly ſawe well ſithe kyng loſt wytte mater ſhulde go yuell hym ſawe howe duke burgoyne berrey wolde nat ſpeke hym sir iohan mercier lykewiſe wolde fayne haue ben gone myght ſuche watche layde hym coude nat go lodgynge without knowledge ſuche goodes hadde ſaued ſtode hym right good ſtede afterwarde moche coude founde departed bytwene duke burgoyn berrey cōmytted priſone caſtell loure lykewyſe ſo cōmaunded begue vyllayns erle rebydewe spayne men ſente houſe montague nat founde man knewe yt become lykecase conſtables houſe haue hym priſon coude nat founde man kepar knewe nothynge become within two dayes knowen caſtell mount le heury whan duke loued hym nat knewe ordayned barroys barres ſir iohn̄ caſtell morant lorde coucy ſir wyllyam tremoyle thre hundred ſpeares go thyder cōmaunded beſiege towne caſtell nat departe then tyll brought ſir olyuer clyſſon thē outher quicke deed theſe knyghtes dyde cōmaunded durſte none otherwyſe two duke admyniſtracion realme departed fro parys thre hundred ſpeares nat one tyme fyue partes entent leſſe knowen god ayded ſo well conſtable ſo good frendes ſome company ſuche warnynge toke dōmage company departed rode couert wayes woodes lefte cloſed townes ſo laſte came ſurely bretaygne entred caſtell owne called caſtell ioſelyn taryed newes barrois barres knightes company lette nat enterprice charged came mount le heury entred towne beſieged caſtell taryed nyght wenynge conſtable hadde ben within gone ye haue herde nexte mornynge thought aſſaute caſtell ſeruaūtes within caſtell ſente knowe wolde haue demaunded ſayde wolde haue ſir olyuer clyſſon therfore come anſwered ſaid departed then foure dayes paſſed offred open gate ſertche hym knightes went caſtell company armed ſcare enbuſſhement within caſtell ſertched highe lowe founde trouthe nat than̄e departed retourned parys ſhewed howe ſped whan duke burgoyne berrey knewe ſir olyuer clyſſon ſcaped ſore diſpleaſed duke orlyaunce burbone ryght ioyfull duke burgoyne ſayde ſemeth well douteth hym ſelfe ſeynge fledde awaye yet yt ſo quytte ſhall cauſe hym come agayne ſhortely le ſhall leſe hath ſette handes haue laye charge dyuers artycles vnreſonable whiche requyre iudgement puniſyon ſuche great nat corrected mater ſhall nat equally proporcioned ſuche ſmall perſonages ſhall grudge ſaye haue wrong punyſſhed great ſcape therfore iuſtyce ought equall ſpare nother gret ſmall wherby enſample ſhulde growe thus duke burgoyn deuyſed ſir olyuer clyſſon bretaygne caſtell called ioſelyn whiche fortereſſe well prouyded thynges neceſſary whan barrois barres retourned parys ſhewed ſir olyuer clyſſon departed fro mount le heury gone caſtell ioſelyn bretayne thā cōmaunded go amyence take lorde de la ryuer next day rode companye amyence fayre fortereſſe beſyde charter whiche lorde de la ryuer helde right wyfe lady man greatly amended caſtell welbeloued men countrey loued alwayes nothyng trouth duke cōmiſſyoners came thyder dyde charge founde lorde de la ryuer wyfe chyldren knight loked nothyng el might haue ben gone lyſte knowledge ſir iohan mercyer erle ribydewe priſone conſtable fledde bretaygne counſayled one frendes ſaid hym sir ſaue ſelfe enuyous nowe reygne fortune nowe ſydes aunſwered ſayde el pleaſure god ſhulde flye hyde ſelfe ſhulde yelde ſelfe gyltie knowe ſelfe clere god hath gyuen haue maye take fro whan pleaſure wyll god fulfylled haue ſerued kynge charles nowe ſonne well trewly ſeruyce hath ben well knowen haue greatlye rewarded ſeyng haue ſo truely ſerued cōmaundementes traueyled buſyneſſe realme frā ce dare well abyde iudgement parlyament chambre parys fynde faute dedes wordes lette punyſſhed thus lorde de la ryuer ſayd wyfe coūſayle ſayd duke cōmyſſioners cāe caſtell laſte one ſhewed hym ſayd sir cometh ſuche men ſuche great armye nowe ſaye ſhall opyn gate nat yea quod elles welcome therwith went mette receyued one another right honorably thus entred caſtell man barroies barres whan within hall executed commaundement areſted lorde de la ryuer obeyed meke lye thus priſoner owne caſtell man may well thought good lady wyfe ſore diſcōfyted whan ſhe ſawe fortune courne whele agaynſt lorde huſbande alſo ſhe douted concluſyon thus lorde de la ryuer priſoner owne caſtell main anone ſente gouernaunce bothe temporaltie ſpirytualtie pope clement auignon nothyng realme fraunce meanes lorde de la ryuer brought parys ſet priſon caſtell loure many men realme fraunce great pytie hym howe durſt nat ſpeke priuely people cared nat ſo moche trouble ſir iohan mercyer dyde lorde de la ryuer alway ſwete curteſſe meke pacyent gencyll poore men good meane always myght nat herde ſayde daylye paris theſe priſoners ſhulde leſe heedes ſclaundre ran vpon howe traytours againſt crowne fraunce pylled realme therby kepte great porte eſtates made fayre houſes caſtelles buyldynges poore knightes ſquiers ſuche aduentured bodyes membres dedes armes ſerued truelye realme fraunce ſolde layde pledge herytages yet coude nat payde ſerued nother cōſtable none priſone hy mōtague fledde enuyous condempned iudged dye reaſon great daunger alſo ſayd counſaile kyng toke hym iourney bretaygne wherby fell maladye franſey gyuen hym drinkes poyſon pleaſure howe kynges phiſycions coude nat herde beleued reaſon suche mater layde lorde de la ryuers charge ſir iohan mercyer delyuered caſtell loure handes prouoſt paris putte caſtell ſaynt anthony kepyng vicount achy chateleyne whan knowen thā cōmon brute ran ſhulde executed dethe ſaye trouthe cauſe trouble ſuche hated coude fynde conſcyence cauſe ought dye euery daye borne hande ſayd theym sir thynke youre ſoules bodyes loſte ye iudged dye beheeded caſe priſone greate ſpace begue vyllayns ryght valyaunt knyght armes countrey beance priſone alſo ye ſame cauſe ſuche frendes ſo ayded delyuered priſon clene pardoned thynges ſuche lynage ſir barroys counſayled hym go caſtyle fayre herytages reaſon wyfe counteſſe ribydewe counſayled ſo dyede ſoone might departed fraunce went caſtyle two knightes remayned ſtyll priſon daunger loſyng lyues mouable vnmouable godes poſſeſſions parteyninge ſir iohan mercyer within parys without realme fraunce myght layde hande taken goodes forfaite gyuen perſons fayre houſe bridge aubumen dioces laon whiche coſt hym great good gyuen lorde coucy appurtenaūce knowe nat wheder lorde coucy deſyred nat ſir iohan mercier diſheryted heyres euer alſo lorde de la ryuer ſore handled trewe mouables taken awaye ſuche landes bought reſeruynge lady man wyfe herytages whiche came father mother alſo yonge damoſell doughter x yere age maryed yonge gentylman called iaques chaſtellon ſonne ſir hugh chaſtellon ben maiſter croſbowes fraunce heyre father fayre herytages lykely enioye howe agaynſt yonge mannes mynde diſmaryed maryed agayne another gentylwoman pleaſure duke burgoyne lorde de la tremoyle toke quarell ouer lorde de la riuer ſonne heyre whiche ſonne maryed ye doughter erle dampmartyne erle mo child nat lyke haue whiche doughter heyre duke wolde haue broken maryage haue maryed vnto heyre blode erle dampmartyne lyke valyaunt knight wolde nat ſayd long lorde de la ryuers ſonne hadde lyfe body doughter ſhulde haue none huſbande ſayde wolde putte herytage ſuche mēnes handes truſted ſuche wolde wrōgfully haue ſhulde nat attayne therto whan erles mynde knowen let hym alone maryage ſtode ſtyll fyrſt maryage broken pope clement made diſpenſacyon wheder wolde nat tyme pope puiſſaunce fraunce ſuche gouernours wolde conſente churche ſo ſubiecte reaſon sciſme gouerned fraunce many men ſpecially realme fraūce excuſed greatly lorde de la ryuer wolde nat ſerue none durſt ſpeke thoughe ſawe mater neuer ſo clere except onely valyāt lady iane boloyne ducheſſe berrey oftentymes good lady wolde fall knee huſbande holdynge vp handes ſayeng ah ſir ye ſuffre moche enuyous enforme ſo wrongfullye agaynſt valyaunt knight lorde de la ryuer hath clerely wronge none dare ſpeke hym ſir wyll ye knowe dye thus ſhall neuer haue ioye worlde ſhall alwayes contynue ſtyll ſorowe heuyneſſe trewe valyant knight ah ſir ye cōſyder lytell fayre ſeruyce hath done tyme ye paynes traueyle hath hadde bring v togyder maryage ſaye nat thyng boſtyng ſelfe lytell worthe comparyſon whan ye wolde nedes haue ye remembre howe harde erle foiz brought vp ſwete wordes wyſe demeanour lorde de la ryuer nat neuer come company ben rather nowe englāde duke lācaſtre wolde haue ſonne erle derby erle foiz enclyned rather waye thā right dere ſir ye ought remēbre ſay true wherfore requyre right hūbly gentyll knight brought haue dōmage body membres duke berrey ſawe wyfe fayre gentyll loued hert alſo knewe well ſhe ſayd true molifyed greatly herte towardes lorde de la ryuer apeaſe wyfe becauſe ſawe ſhe ſpake good herte ſayd vnto dame god helpe wolde coſt xx thouſāde frankes condycion lorde de la ryuer neuer made forfette crowne fraunce malady came kynge loued hym entierly tooke hym wyſe ſage knyght ſythe ye deſyre ſo effectuouſly hym wyll dyſpleaſure hym ſhall fare moche better inſtaunce ſake ſhall moche hym power may extende rather deſyre realme ſpoken hym ſurely ſe well almes helpe hym beleue hath aduocate thus lady well pleaſed lordes wordes ſurely ſhe nat ben deed ſake duke berrey dyſſymuled mater happy ſyr iohan mercyer lorde de la ryuer accuſed one cauſe wherfore duke conſcyence cauſe one dye nat howe promeſſe made yet thought ſelfe nat well aſſured lyues longe priſon ſawe well many enemyes thā reygned proſperyte ſome right angry ſaued ſo longe coulde amended syr iohan mercyer beynge priſone wepte ſo contynually almoſt loſt ſight pytie ſe lamentacyon whyle theſe two knyghtes thus priſone yere man knewe ende ſhulde come duke counſayle dyd coulde haue taken ſir olyuer clyſſon haue put hym fro honoure offyce rather haue hym reſydewe kepte hym ſelfe handes wherin dyd wyſely ben taken ſo ordeyned ſhulde haue iudgement deth without remedy enuy haue pleaſed therby aduerſary duke bretaygne neuer dyd good realme fraūce whan lordes ſawe yt ſcaped handes toke aduyſe dyd ye ſhall ſōmoned hym apere parlyamēt chamber parys anſwere ſuch article accuſed payne leſe honour banyſſhed realme fraunce certayne cōmyſſioners ſent bretaygne ſōmon hym apere ſente rode bretaygne demaūded came ſyr olyuer clyſſon ſayd howe ſente kynge ſpeke conſtable wherfore deſyred knowe men ſuche townes garyſons helde conſtable determyned aunſwere make ſayd ſyrs ye welcome ye wyll ſpeke coūſtable ye muſte go ſuche place thynke ye ſhall fynde hym without faute cōmyſſyoners ſente fro towne towne coude nat fynde ſo longe ſought wery ſo retourned parys declared ſene founde ſuche accuſed hym gladde dalte ſo ſayd falſneſſe playnely ſhewed therby acordyng reaſon ſaid ſhulde haue deſerued courſe parlyament proceded ſōmonynges thentent ſuche loued hym ſhulde nat ſay wronge enuy hatred whan xv ſō monynges accompilſſhed coulde tydynges hym aparaunce openly called parlyament chambre dore ſteyres courte ſeremonyes therto belongynge anſwere made hym proceſſe made agaynſt
