hym cruelly parlyament openly banyſſhed realme fraunce falſe traytour againſt crowne fraunce iudged pay hūdred thouſande marke ſyluer extorcyons doone ſo traftely tyme paſte occupyed offyce conſtablery fraunce therfore leſe euer without recouery ſayd offyce gyueng ſentence duke orleaunet deſyred preſent wolde nat excuſed hymſelfe duke berrey burgoyn many great lordes realme fraunce thus man may ſe wa • kes fortune howe ferme ſtable ſeynge howe good valyaunt knyght dayes ſo moche traueyled realme fraunce put ſo moche ſhame dyſgrated fro honoure goodes howe happy appered nat ſōmonynge ſurrly ſhamfully loſte lyfe duke orlyance durſt nat ſpeke hym ſhulde haue doone hym good nat douted duke bretaygne ſyr peter craon right ioyfull thoſe tydinges howe ſory nat priſoner parys well ſir iohan mercier lord de la ryuer ſhamfull banyſſhing great brute ranne therof realme fraunce elſ ſome compleyned ſecretly ſayd wronge ſome ſaid worthy hanged well deſerued moreouer ſayd howe dyuell coulde aſſemble togyder ſo moche rycheſſ myllyon halfe florayns coulde neuer gette ryghtwyſe meanes rather pollynge robbyng retaynyng hymſelfe wage poore knyghtes ſquyers realme fraunce deſerued may well appere chaunceryor treaſory euery thyng written regeſtred voyage kynge made flaunders reyſed great profyte owne vſe alſo voyage almayne maner tayles ſubſydyes reyſed realme paye men warre paſſed handes payed pleaſed hym reſt kept hymſelfe none durſte ſpeke agaynſt maner ſyr olyuer clyſſon accuſed many mennes mouthes ſayde olde prourebe hath myſfortune euery man offereth hym wronge frenche kynge duke berrey duke burgoyne nat ben duke bretaygne ben able haue ſubdued ſyr olyuer clyſſon ſeynge duke countrey ſuffred hym ſeaſon ſe howe mater ſhulde procede alſo ſawe well ſyr olyuer clyſſon ſet heyght fortune whele agayne ſawe howe caſt downe lyke leſe offyce thus duke bretayne ſyr peter craon ſet vpon fete workes fortune whiche neuer parmanent nowe vp nowe downe conſtable ſyr olyuer clyſſon lorde de la ryuer ſyr iohan mercyer principally acuſed chefe couſers kinges malady ſuche loued nat ſayd howe poyſoned kynge howe euery man maye conſydre reaſon nat ſo perſones ſhulde leſe moſte kynges malady wherfore thought ſought moſte helthe coulde nat beleued two knyghtes remayned ſtyll priſon daū ger openly haue loſte heedes lykelyhode ſo doone kynge nat recouered helth meane ducheſſe berrey made inſtante labour lorde de la ryuer lorde clyſſon ſtyll bretayne made ſore warre agaynſt duke duke agaynſt hym whiche warre coſt many mannes lyfe ye ſhall hyſtory trewe ſyckneſſe kyng tooke voyage towardes bretayne greatly abated ioye realme fraunce good cauſe whan heed ſicke body canne haue ioye man durſte openly ſpeke therof kepte priuy moche myght couertly kept fro quene tyll ſhe delyuered churched ſhe knewe nothynge therof whiche tyme ſhe doughter phyſycion mayſter guyllyam chefe charge healynge kynge ſtyll aboute hym ryght dyligent well acquyted hymſelfe wherby gate bothe honour profyte lytell lytell brought kynge good eſtate toke away ſeuer heate made hym haue taſte appetyte eate drinke ſlepe reſt knowledge euery thynge howe feble lytell lytell made kynge ryde huntynge hawkynge whanne tydynges knowen fraunce howe kynge well mended memory agayne euery man ioyfull thanked god kyng thus beyng crayell deſyred ſe quene wyfe dolphyn ſonne quene came thyder chylde brought thyder kynge made good chere ſo lytell lytell helpe god kynge recouered helthe whan mayſter guyllyam ſawe kynge ſo good caſe ryght ioyfull reaſone done fayre cure ſo delyuered hym duke orlyance berrey burgoyne burbone ſayd lordes thanked god kyng nowe good ſtate helth ſo delyuer hym beware lette man dyſpleaſe hym yet ſpyrytes nat fully ferme ſtable lytell lytell ſhall waxe ſtronge reaſonable dyſporte reſt myrthe ſhall moſte profytable hym trouble hym lytell may counſayles hath ſharpely handeled hote malady conſydred retaygne mayſter guylliam gyue hym ſhulde contente whiche ende phyſicions requyre haue gyftes rewardes deſyred abyde ſtyll aboute kynge excuſed himſelfe ſayd howe olde impotent man coulde nat endure maner courte wherfore deſyred returne owne countrey whan counſayle ſawe wolde none otherwyſe gaue leaue departing gaue thouſande crownes retayned hym wage four horſes whan ſo euer wolde reſorte courte howe beleue neuer came whan retourned cytie laon contynued dyed ryche man lefte behynde hym xxx thouſande frankes dayes one greateſt nygardes euer pleaſure get good ſpende nothynge howſe neuer ſpente paſt two ſouſes parys day wolde eate drinke mennes howſes myght get rodde lyghtly phyſicyons beaten ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe truſe whiche acorded bytwene englande fraūce thre yeres renewed cap cxci ye haue herde bokes hygh excellent hyſtory requeſt ryght hygh myghty prynce dere lorde mayſter guy chaſtellone erle blois lorde aueſnes chymay beaumont streumehont gode iohan froyſart preeſt chapeleyn ſaid lorde tyme treaſourer chanon chymay lyſle flaunders haue enterpriſed noble mater treatynge aduentures warres fraunce englande countreys conioyned lyed may apere clerely treaty therof made vnto date preſente day whiche excellent materꝭ longe lyue helpe god ſhall cōtynue folowe labour pleaſeth noble knyght ſquyer louynge feates armes perceyuer ſame therby experte made parfyte ſo laborynge noble mater delyte take pleaſure ¶it hath ben conteyned hyſtory howe truce made balyngham endure thre yere bytwene englande fraunce purpoſe erle ſaynt poll lorde caſtell morant ſyr taupyn cauteuell ambaſſadours fraūce ben englande duke lancaſtre duke yorke vnderſtande kinges pleaſure opynion cōmons englande comunycacyon parlyamente amyence poynte agrement peace vpon certayne artycles ſpecifyed reſeruynge agrement therto cōmons englande thus theſe ambaſſadours retourned fraunce anſwered howe feeſt ſaynt mychell nexte enſuynge ſhulde parlyament weſtmynſter thre eſtates englande whiche tyme mater ſhulde declared full aunſwere made whan tydynges come englande frenche kynges ſyckneſſe matter greatly hyndred howe kynge rycharde englande duke lancaſtre great affection haue peace ſo might haue entente peace ben made bytwene englande fraunce cō mynalte englande deſyred warre ſayenge howe warre fraunce conuenyent peace opynyon one kynges vncles th • ma duke gloceſtre erle perces conſtable englande welbeloued realme enclyned rather warre peace opynyon yonge gentylmen realme ſuche deſyred feates armes brother duke lancaſtre bycauſe eldeſt moſt puiſſaunce englande thought ſaid warre bytwene englande fraunce endured longe ynoughe peace mete▪ warre criſtende ſore febled great turke lamorabaquyn greate puyſſaunce fronters hūgery wherfore ſayd ſhulde honorable yonge luſty knyghtes ſquyers take waye thyder exercyſe dedes armes lette v wyſely conſydre duke lancaſters wordes ſpake good entent greatly traueyled warres fraunce conquered lytell ſore traueyled bodye brent dyſtroyed playne countreys waye retourne ſone recouered agayn ſawe warre drewe neuer n • ne • nde rather encreaſed alſo ſawe fortune ſhuld turne agaynſt ye englyſſh party great dōmage therof ſhulde enſue parceyued well kyng nephue enclyned moche rather peace warre iohan froyſart auctoure hyſtory canne nat well ſaye whether duke opinyon good nat ſhewed bycauſe duke lancaſtre ſawe two doughters maryed higher degree hymſelfe realme englande one quene spaygne quene portugale cauſed gretly enclyne peace knew well kynge spaygnes ſonne maryed doughter yonge daunger owne ſubgiettes knewe well ſhulde peaſably enioye herytage spaygne conuenyente englyſſhe men ſhulde kepe peace fraunce peace ſhulde broken incydent frenche men myght ſhortly reuenged realme spayne open entree well aragon chathalone bierne byſkay lady yolant bare quene aragone ſhe good frenche gouerned aragon chathalone bierne byſkay vycount chatellon heyre therle foiz ſo ſworne promyſed frenche quene wherby frenche men hadde many fayre entree spaygne without daunger kynge nauer wolde nat wyllyngly dyſpleaſe frenche kynge coſyn germayne ſyr peter nauerre brother frenche kynge alwayes apeaſed frenche kynges ire dyſpleaſure whan brother kynge nauer true frenche man neuer founde contrary theſe imagynacions duke lancaſtre hym ſelfe ſhewed mynde ſonne erle derby though yonge yet great wyſdome lykely come great honour whiche erle thre ſonne iohan humfrey thomas two doughters lady wyfe doughter heyre erle conſtable englande erle herforde northampton whiche lady helde great herytage concluſyon parlyament holden weſtmynſter thre eſtates realme trewce taken ſee lande bytwene fraunce englande frendes alyes endure fro feeſt ſaynt mychell feeſt ſaynt iohan baptyſt nexte ſuche cōmyſſioners frenche kynge ſent parlyament dyſpatched charter truce ſent ſealed whiche treuce well vpholden partyes frenche kynge ſore febled reaſon ſyckeneſſe phyſicyon mayſter guyllyam harſelay deed whan departed fro crayell fro kynge ordeyned many receytes kynge vſe wherby wynter ſeaſon recouered helth wherof louers frendes reioyſed hole cōmynalte fraūce well loued ſo quene came parys helde houſeholde moſt parte ſaynt powle ſomtyme loure longe wynter nyghtes paſſed ſeaſon daunſynge carollynge reuels dyſportes quene acompaned ducheſſe berrey ducheſſe orlyance ladyes ſame ſeaſon vycount chaſtellon come parys newly entred herytage erledome foize bierne ryght heyre releued ſayde erledom foiz dyd homage kyng nat bierne coūtrey helde themſelfe ſo noble condycion helde ſeruyce man lyuynge howe prince wale ſaid erle foiz laſt dyed ought releue haue reſorte duchy acquitayne alwayes ſayd erle denyed defended thought chalenge prince wale made thervnto ſettynge mouyng iohan erle armynake hath ben ſhewed hiſtory wherfore nowe wyll ouer paſſe whan vicount chaſtellon called fro henſeforthe erle foiz paris frenche kyng company hym coſyn ſyr yuan foize baſtarde ſonne laſte erle foize goodly knyght erle foiz dyed wolde haue made hym heyre nother baſtarde ſonnes called gracian dwelte kyng nauer knyghtes bierne wolde neuer conſent therto therfore mater reſted dyd erle dyed ſodaynly ye haue herde whan frenche kynge ſawe yonge knyght ſyr yuan foiz lyked hym marueylous well alſo kynge moche one age reaſon fauour kynge bare yonge knyght erle foiz ſhorter ſpede delyuered buſineſſe departed owne countrey ſyr yuan abode ſtyll kynge retayned one knyghtes chambre xii horſes thynges therto belongynge ¶of aduenture daunce made parys lykeneſſe wodehowſes wherin frenche kynge parell dethe cap cxcii fortuned ſone retaynmge foreſayd knyght maryage made kynges houſe bytwen yonge knyght vermandoys one quenes gentylwomen bycauſe bothe kynges houſe kinges vncles lordes ladyes damoſelles made great tryumphe duke orlyaunce berrey burgoyne wyues daunſynge makynge great ioye kynge made great ſupper lordes ladyes quene kepte eſtate deſirynge euery man mery ſquyer normandy called hogreymen genſay aduyſed make ſome paſtyme daye maryage whiche tueſday candelmas prouyded mummery agaynſt nyght deuyſed ſyxe cote made lynen clothe couered pytche theron flare lyke heare redy chambre kynge put one therle iouy yonge luſty knyght another ſyr charles poicters thyrde ſonne erle valentenoys ſyr yuan foiz another ſonne lord nanthorillet fyfte ſquyer hym ſelfe ſyxte whan thus arayed theſe ſayd cote ſowed faſt ſemed lyke wylde wode houſes full beare fro toppe heed ſowle ye foote deuyſe pleaſed well frenche kynge well content ſquyer aparelled theſe cote ſecretly chamre man knewe therof ſuch holpe whan ſyr yuan foiz well aduyſed theſe core ſayd kynge syr cōmaunde ſtraytely man aproche nere v torch fyre fyre faſten theſe cote ſhall brent without remedy king aunſwered ſayd yuan ye ſpeke well wyſely ſhall doone ye haue deuyſed incontynent ſent vſſher chambre cōmaundyng go chambre ladyes daūſed cōmaunde varlettes holdinge torch ſtande vp walles none aproche nere wovehouſes ſhulde come thyder daunce vſſher dyd kynges cōmaundement whiche fulfylled sone duke orlyance entred hall acompanyed four knyghtes ſyxe torch knewe nothynge kynges cōmaundement torch mummery cōmynge thyder thought holde daunſynge began hym ſelfe daunce therwith kynge fyue came ſo dyſguyſed flaxe man knewe fyue faſtened one another kynge loſe went led deuyſe whan entred hall euery man teke ſo great hede forgate torch kynge departed fro company went ladyes ſporte youth requyred ſo paſſed quene came ducheſſe berrey toke helde hym arme knowe kyng wolde nat ſhewe name duches ſayd ye ſhall nat eſcape tyll knowe name meane ſeaſon great myſchyefe fell reaſon duke orlyance howe ignoraunce agaynſt wyll conſydred miſchefe • ell wolde nat haue done dyd good worlde ſo deſyrous knowe perſonages fyue daunced put one torch ſeruaūtes helde ſo nere heate fyre entred flaxe wherin fyre take remedy ſodaynly bright flame ſo eche ſet fyre pytche ſo faſtened lynen clothe ſhyrtes ſo drye fyne ſo ioynynge fleſſhe began brenne cry helpe none durſte come nere theym dyd brente handes reaſon heate pytche one called nanthorillet aduyſed hym howe botry therby fled thyder caſt himſelfe veſſell full water wherin rynſed pottes whiche ſaued hym el ben deed yet ſore hurt fyre whan quene herde crye made ſhe douted kynge ſhe knewe well ſhulde one ſyxe wherwith ſhe fell ſowne knightes ladyes came comforted pyteous noyſe hall ducheſſe berrey delyuered kynge fro parell ſhe dyd caſte ouer trayne gowne couered fro fyre kynge wolde haue gone fro whyder wyll ye go quod ſhe ye ſe well howe company brennes ye kyng quod haſte quod ſhe gette apparell quene maye ſe ſhe great feare therwith kynge departed hall haſte chaunged apparell came quene ducheſſe berrey ſomwhat comforted ſhewed howe ſhe ſhulde ſe kynge ſhortely therwith kynge came quene ſoone ſhe ſawe hym ioy ſhe enbraſed hym fell ſowne ſhe borne chambre kynge wente baſtarde foiz fyre cryed euer loude voyce ſaue kynge ſaue kynge thus kynge ſaued happy hym went fro company el ben deed without remedy great myſcheife fell thus mydnyght hall ſaynt powle parys two brente dethe place two baſtarde foiz erle iouy borne lodgynges dyed within two dayes gret myſery payne thus feeſt maryage brake vp beuyneſſe howe remedy faulte onely duke orlyaunce yet thought none yuell whanne put downe torche duke ſayde syrs lette euery man knowe man blame cauſe onely ſelfe ame ſory therof thought moche ſhulde nat haue happened duke orlyaunce went kynge excuſe hym kyng toke excuſe caſe fell yere oure lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore twelue tueſday feeſt candelmas whiche fortune great brute ſpredde abrode realme fraūce countreys duke burgoyne berrey nat preſent ſeaſon hadde taken leaue kyng gone lodginges next daye theſe newes ſpredde abrode cytie euery manne merueyle therof ſome ſayd howe god ſente token enſample wyſedome kynge regarde withdrawe hym ſelfe fro ſuche yonge ydell wantonneſſe whiche vſed ouermoche beynge kyng cōmons cytie parys murmured ſayd beholde great myſhappe myſchiefe lykely haue fallen kynge myght well haue brent ſhulde haue fallen kynges vncles brother myght haue ben ſure none ſhulde haue ſcaped dethe yea knyghtes myght haue founde parys ſoone duke berrey burgoyne herde aduenture abaſſhed marueyled greatly lepte horſes rode kyng cō forted counſayled hym whiche neceſſary ſore troubled paryll ſtyll ymaginacion ſhewed vncles howe aunt berrey ſaued hym ſayde ſorie dethe erle iouye ſir yuan foiz ſir charles poicters vncles reconforted hym ſayde sir loſte canne nat recouered ye muſte forgette dethe thanke god fayre aduenture fallen owne perſone realme fraunce incydent myght haue ben great daunger leſynge ye maye thynke well theſe people parys wyll neuer ſtyll god knoweth myſfortune fallen wolde haue ſlayne v theriore ſir aparell eſtate royall lepe horſe ryde lady pylgrimage ſhall accompany ſhewe youre ſelfe people deſyre ſoore ſe kynge ſayde wolde ſo kynges vncles toke aparte duke orlyaūce curteſſe maner ſomwhat blamed hym yonge dede done aunſwered ſayde howe thought haue done none yuell anone 〈◊〉 ye kynge company lepte horſes rode throughe cytie apeaſe people came lady churche herde maſſe offred thanne retourned agayne houſe ſaynt poule lytell lytell mater forgotten obſequyes done deed bodyes ah erle gaſcoyne foiz fortuned thy lyfe dayes thou ſhuldeſt haue great diſpleaſure harde haue peaſed thou louedeſt hym entierly lordes ladyes realme fraūce elſwhere herde chaunce great marueyle therof ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe pope bonyface cardynals rome ſent frere wyſe clerke frenche kyng cap cxciii pope bonyface beyng rome cardinali e reioyſed ſaid aduenture bycauſe frenche kyng agaynſt thē pope ſayde token ſente fro god realme fraunce bycauſe ſupported pope auygnon proude preſumptuous neuer done good lyfe diſceyued worlde pope rhome cardynalles counſayle concluded ſende frenche kyng ſecretely man prudence frere mynor great clerke wiſely preche counſayle kyng folowe ye waye reaſon ſaid kyng toke wrōg waye ſeynge named chiefe kyng chriſtendome holy churche ought illumyned ayded wherfore charged frere go fraūce delyuered hym inſtructions effecte ſhulde ſaye done leyſar frere farre go alſo knewe nat whether ſhulde haue audyence whanne cam • thyder nat ¶nowe lette hym go iourney ſhall ſomwhat ſpeke buſyneſſe fraunce natwithſtandyng theſe aduē tures duke berrey burgoyne counſayls lefte nat purſue haue diſtroyed ye lorde de la ryuer ſir iohan le mercier priſone caſtell ſaynt anthony kepyng vycount archy ſaid ſhulde put dethe delyuered prouoſt chattelet ordayned ſone ſhulde come handes ſhulde beheded openly traytours agaynſt ye crowne fraunce ſo god nat prouyded ſpeciall inſtaunce requeſt ducheſſe berrey ſhe nat ben dethe haſted ſpecially ſhe prayed lorde de la riuer meanes ſhe brought fraunce maryage made bytwene duke berrey ſayde tyme duke huſbande wepyng sir layd lordes de la ryuer falſe ſelaundre done enuy ſir remembre payne traueyle toke bring v toguyder ye rewarde hym ſmally cōſent dethe thoughe landes goodes taken fro hym yet lette hym haue lyfe dye opyn ſhame ſhall neuer haue ioye herte sir ſaye nat fayned corage ſay hole hert wherfore ſir requyre prouyde delyueraunce whan duke herde wyfe ſpeke ſo effectuouſly alſo knewe well ſhe ſayde trouthe pytie ſwaged diſpleaſure lorde de la ryuer ſones delyuered ſir iohan mercier nat ſought wayes myght haue putte hym dethe whiche coude nat without bothe ſhulde haue dyed ſir iohan mercyer hadde wept ſo moche priſon ſight therby ſore febled folowed ducheſſe burgoyns counſayle ben putte execucyon longe ſhamefully without fauour ſhe hared bycauſe ſir olyuer clyſſon counſayled kynge go bretaygne warre agaynſt coſyn duke alſo ſhe ſayde clyſſon le ryuer mercyer cauſers kynges maladye howe kyng well recouered good eſtate duke berrey burgoyne kepte ſtyll gouernaūce realme fraunce great profyte therby apoynted ſuche perſones pleaſed kyng thoſe dayes kynge bare name kynge touchyng buſyneſſe parteynynge crowne fraunce lytell obeyed duke wolde ſe knowe howe euery thynge paſte ducheſſe burgoyne nexte perſone quene ducheſſe orlyaunce nothynge pleaſed ſhe wolde haue hadde honoure preemynence ſhe ſayde ſuche ſecrete ducheſſe burgoyne ought condycion go nat ſo nyghe crowne lorde huſbande brother kynge myght ſo fall ſhulde kynge quene wotte nat ſhe ſhulde take honour put behynde thus ſome enuy amonge theſe ladyes ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpeakynge retourne ſir olyuer clyſſon ye haue herde howe ſommoned fyftene dayes apere parlyament chambre certayne knyghtes ſente bretaygne ſeke ſir philyppe sauoiſes wente bretaygne ſertched hym place founde hym nat hydde hym ſelfe ſo couertly coulde neuer ſpeke hym hadde wolde haue reſted hym retourne fraunce made relacyon voyage iudged lordes parlyament ſir olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce hadde forfayted landes lyfe goodes ſo iuged hym banyſſhed euer realme fraunce leſe offyces herytages within realme bicauſe nat ſente martell whiche token offyce conſtablery ſō moned therfore offyce vacant voyde duke counſayls ſuche agaynſt ſir olyuer clyſſon thought neceſſary prouyde ſōe perſon occupy ſaid offyce whiche ſo noble ſo gret renome might nat long without gouernour incidentes myght happe fall aduyſed lorde coucy mete man layde hym excuſed ſelfe ſayd wyſe wolde medyll therwith wolde rather forſake realme fraunce whan ſawe wolde nat medyll therwith duke toke aduyſe ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe maryage treated lorde philyp arthoys erle ewe lady mary berrey wydowe doughter duke berey howe admytted conſtable fraunce cap cxciiii ſame ſeaſone treatie maryage bytwene lorde philyppe arthoys yong wydowe lady berrey ſomtyme called coūteſſe dunoys wyfe loyes bloys frenche kynge wolde gladly haue maryage auaunſed duke berrey natre wyllynge therto thought erldome ewe ſmall thyng regarde fyrſte huſbande wherfore thought mary highlyer dede lady beautifull endued vertues yt ſhulde aperteyne noble lady howe finally duke berrey lothe diſpleaſe kynge yet many offer made hym doughter yonge duke loreyne erle armynake ſonne heyre erle foiz kynge brake theſe maryages ſayd vncle fayre vncle berrey wyll nat ye ſhall putte coſyn youre doughter come floure delyce ſo farre countreys ſhall prouyde mariage mete wolde gladly haue nere v right mete ſhe aunt wyfe moche one age whan duke ſawe kynges entente • rayned hym ſelfe makynge promyſe perſone doughter alſo ſawe well kynge enclyned fauour coſyn lorde philyppe arthois yonge luſty knyght highe corage hadde endured many traueyls armes beyond ſee place atchyued many voyage great laude honour duke berrey burgoyne agreed bytwene thē kynge wolde gyue coſyn philyppe arthois offyce conſtablery fraunce whiche reputed voyde reaſon forfayture ſir olyuer clyſſon agree kynges pleaſure ſayd maryage duke berrey thought conſtable fraūce ſhulde haue ſuffycient mentayne eſtate two duke determyned ſpeke kynge ſo dyde ſaid hym sir counſayle generally agreed lorde philyp arthoys preferred offyce conſtableſhyp fraunce whiche nowe voyde iugement ꝑlyament olyuer clyſſon hath forfayted ye offyce whiche maye nat long vacant ſhulde preiudyce realme ſir bothe alſo bounde auaūce promote coſyn arthoys nere blode lynage v ſir ſeing office voyde nat tell ye ſhulde better enploy hym ſhall right well exerciſe welbeloued knyghtes ſquiers man without enuy couytouſneſſe theſe wordes pleaſed well kyng anſwered ſaid vncle voyde rather another kyngꝭ vncles ſued ſtyll lorde philyppe arthoys duke berrey hated ſir olyuer cliſſon bycauſe conſented diſtroye betyſache ſeruaunte duke burgoyne hated hym bycauſe made warre agaynſt duke bretaygne yet ducheſſe hated hym worſe finally kyng aſſented ſo duke berrey wolde agre maryage bytwene doughter ſaid lorde philyppe arthoys yet ſatiſfye kyng duke orlyaū ce bare ſir olyuer clyſſon offyce ſente ſir guyllyam bourdes ſir guyllyam martell bothe knyghtes kynges chambre ſir philyppe sauoiſes knyght duke berreys bretaygne ſpeke ſir olyuer clyſſon theſe knyghtes tooke iourney rode anger foūd quene hieruſalem iohan bretaygne receyued right honorably honour frenche kynge taryed two dayes demaunded newes ſir olyuer clyſſon sayeng curteſſe letter meſſage fro frē che kyng hym fro none perſone aunſwered man coude tell ſurely bretayne one fortreſſes ſaid ſo flyttyng fro one place another harde fynde hym theſe knightes departed toke leaue ye quene ſonne charles prince thatent iohan bretaygne erle pō thieu rode rennes duke bretayne ducheſſe wannes rode nat lightly forthe towne euer douted buſſhmentes ennemye ſir olyuer clyſſon ſo harde warre made bytwene mercy dethe thoughe duke lorde ſouerayne countrey yet neyther barone knyght ſquyer bretaygne wolde arme agaynſt ſir olyuer clyſſon diſſymuled ſayde warre touched nothyng wherfore ſatte ſtyll duke coude haue none conforte whan̄e theſe frenche knyghtes rennes enquered fynde ſir olyuer clyſſon coude certentie hym thanne coūſayled drawe caſtell ioſelyn ſir olyuer clyſſons men receyued well loue frenche kynge demaunded myght ſir olyuer clyſſon sayeng ſpeke hym fro frenche kynge duke orlyaunce none perſones men coude tell nothyng hym el wolde nat tell ſayd ſirs ſurely wyll harde fynde hym daye one place morowe another pleaſe ye maye ryde ouer duchy bretaygne ſertche ouer fortereſſes houſes none ſhall cloſed agaynſt whan ſawe coulde haue none aunſwere departed then rode viſyted fortreſſes great ſmall parteynynge lorde olyuer clyſſon than̄e came wannes founde duke bretaygne ducheſſe receyued taryed halfe daye dyſcouered nat duke ſecrete mater came thyder alſo duke examyned nothynge mater alſo coulde nat ſe ſir peter craon thus toke leaue duke ducheſſe retourned parys foūde kyng lordes reported kynge duke orlyaunce howe hadde ſought place townes parteynynge ſir olyuer clyſſon wyſe coulde fynde hym duke burgoyn berrey right gladde theſe newes wolde nat ben otherwiſe anone proceded maryage bytwene lorde philippe arthois lady mary berrey ſo lorde philyppe conſtable fraunce vſed offyce profytes aduauntages therto belongyng auncyent ordynaū ce yet lorde olyuer clyſſon nat renounced offyce delyuered vp martell whiche token conſtable fraunce contynued ſayd wolde abyde ſtyll cōſtable done cauſe leſe nouther kynge realme knewe well erle ewe profered haue offyce conſtable enioye profyttes therof conſente kynge howe hadde maryed doughter duke berrey lady mary toke lytell regarde knewe hym ſelfe true kynge crowne fraunce knewe well done agaynſt hym enuy hatered duke burg • yne berey againſt hym thus lorde clyſſon lette mater paſſe contynued ſtyll warre agaynſt ye duke bretayne whiche warre right fierſe cruell without mercy pytie lorde clyſſon rode ofter abrode layde buſſhmentes duke dyde lordes bretayne ſatte ſtyll wolde nat medyll duke dyde ſende lordes countrey came ſpeke hym knowe entent duke requyred ayde helpe agaynſt ennemy ſir olyuer clyſſon lordes bretayne vicoūt rohan lorde dignan lorde herman lyon dyuers excuſed ſayd knewe cauſe wolde nat make warre agaynſt lorde clyſſon ſaid wolde right gladlye endenour ſelfes bringe peace coude whan duke ſawe coude haue none conforte parceyued well howe loſt lykely leſe mo men warre ſir olyuer clyſſon conſented ſayde lordes ſhulde go ſir olyuer clyſſon treate peace bringe hym vnder ſaueconducte wannes ſpeke hym whiche tyme ſayd ſhulde founde tretable agre reaſon ſir olyuer done hym diſpleaſure myght haue amendes accordynge aduyſe theſe lordes well agreed thus ſo thre wente lorde olyuer clyſſon dyde ſo moche ſpake hym enformed caſtell io • elyn ſhewed duke entent moreouer bringe peace ſawe well warr̄ nat fytting bytwene greatly noyed noble men marchaūtes cōmons bretaygne ſayd lorde olyuer sir wyll pleaſe go ye duke ſhall bynde v abide ī caſtell tyll retourne doute nat ye beynge one preſence ye ſhall fynde ſo reſonable peace good accorde ſhalbe bitwene sir olyuer ſayd sir ſhall profyte deed thynke knowe nat duke bretayne ſo cruell ſo haute ſaueconducte ſoeuer ſaythe ſawe preſēce wolde neuer ceaſe tyll deed than̄e ſhulde dye lykewiſe men wolde ſoone ſlee without mercy wherfore beſt bothe ſaue lyues rather putte v daunger ſhall kepe fro hym lette hym kepe hym well fro than̄e lorde charles dignan ſayde fayre coſyn ye may ſaye pleaſe thynke ſurely thoughe ſawe wolde diſpleaſure offre good affection bringe accorde praye ye wyll thus ye lorde clyſſon ſayde sir beleue ſurely ye meane well enſure vpon aſſuraunce ſhall neuer go hym ſithe ye medell mater bytwene v ſhall nat thynke ſhalbe vnreſonable ſhall tell wyll retourne agayn duke ſaye wyll nat take pledge hoſtage lette hym ſende ſonne heyre maryed doughter fraūce ſhall abyde caſtell men tyll retourne agayne way thynke ſurer thā ye ſhulde abyde ye offre ſhulde than̄e entremedell buſyneſſe bytwene ye duke without meane ſhall neuer come accorde whan theſe lordes bretayne ſawe coude haue non anſwere tooke leaues retourned wānes duke ſhewed hym done wyſe duke wolde conſente ſende ſonne caſtell ioſelyn warre contynued ſtyll wherby perſone durſt ryde abrode marchaundyſe layde downe thoroughe whiche people good townes cyties ſore hindred poore laborer lette laboringe erthe ducheſſe burgoyn couertly ayded coſyn duke bretayne wt men armes aſwell burgoyne place duke coude get none countrey take parte quarell agaynſt ſir olyuer clyſſon alwayes diſſymuled mater except ſuche owne houſe duke orlyaunce parte loued well lorde olyuer clyiſon ſecretely ſo coured hym men ſente hym horſes sir olyuer glyſſon roode ofter abrode duke dyde fortuned day encountred two ſquyers duke one called ber • ard yuonet taken brought ſir olyuer gladde knewe well one hadde done hym ſeruyce tyme paſt nat done hym diſpleaſure ſir olyuer ſaid yuonet remembreſt thou nat howe caſtell ermyne thou ſheweddeſt ſmall curteſy thou bernarde haddeſt pyte dyddeſt putte thy gowne putte whā ſtode doublet ye pauement whiche kepte fro colde wyll nowe yelde thy curteſy thy lyfe ſhalbe ſaued thou falſe knaue traitour yuo net thou myghteſt haue done otherwyſe thā thou dyddeſt therfore thou ſhalte repent therwith drewe dagger ſtrake hym herte another tyme ye lorde cliſſon rode thre hundred ſpeares cō pany towarde caſtell alroy duke ducheſſe bretayne aboute mydſomer fortune encountred fourtie duke ſeruauntes hadde tyed horſes tree ſickels hādes cuttyng downe corne makynge truſſes cary lodgynges lyke forragers whan lorde olyuer came ſore afrayde lorde oliuer ſaid sir howe dare ye come feldes ſteale take awaye poore mēnes corne ye neuer ſowed yet ye cutte theym downe type ye begyn harueſt ſoone leape horſes take youre ſickels tyme wyll hurt ſaye duke breraygne alroy wyll come ſende men driue away ſhall fynde tyll ſonne goynge downe theſe poore men gladde ſo delyuered feared haue ben ſlayne retourned caſtell alroy ye •• ke ſhewed hym hadde herde ſene duke none men iſſued ye caſtell many ſcrimyſſhes made bretaygne bytwene duke ſir olyuer clyſſon countre medled nat bytwene ¶nowe wyll leaue ſpeke duke bretayne ſir oliuer clyſſon warre ſpeke buſyneſſe bytwene englande frāce ⸫ ⸫ ¶of forme peace made bitwene frenche kyng kyng englande meanes four duke vncles bothe kynges cap cxcv ye haue herde howe ꝑliamēt holden cytie amyence howe englyſſhe lordes departed vpon artycles howe frenche kynge ſent englande duke lācaſtre anſwere hadde englyſſhmen harde brought peace laye nat onely kyng duke lancaſtre yorke great parte laye commens englande archer ſeruyng men ſayd howe rather haue warre peace many yong knightes ſquiers yt ſame opynion reaſon warre maynteyned eſtates howe ꝑforce fayne obey kyng vncles wolde duke lācaſtre bycauſe ii doughters quenes one spaygne portugale alſo bycauſe ſawe kynge nephue enclyned haue peace ſayd warre endured longe ynoughe ſayde wolde take payne therin ſo myght honour kyng realme partie duke burgoyne dyde yt myght haue peace conſydring howe greatly charged wt buſyneſſe fraunce two nephues frenche kynge duke orlyaunce yonge age diſcrecion alſo conſydred howe enherytour duchy brabant thought euer flaunders brabant ſhulde vary agaynſt crowne fraūce ayde englande tymes done realme fraunce ſhulde haue ouer moche duke burgoyne wyſe farre caſtyng prince depely regarded buſyneſſes duke burgoyne duke lancaſtre tooke great payne haue parlyament agayn holden balynghm̄ whiche agreed bothe partyes ſuffycyently prouyded full auctorites conclude full peace counſayle holden balyngham moneth may nexte yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore xvii ſuche ſhulde aſſemble named apoynted firſte party kynge rycharde kinge englande apoynted two vncles duke lancaſtre ye duke glouceſtre greatly fauoure cōmons england ſuch yt loued berter haue warre peace ſhulde archebyſſhop yorke byſſhop london clerkes lawe apoynted theſe lordes ſhulde come calays dyd aboute myddes aprill anone feeſt ſaynte george holden caſtell wyndeſore kynge knyghtes ordre garter frenche party aiſygned duke bertey burgoyne counſaylours fraūce ordeyned ſhulde come towne boloyn frenche king ſhewed great affection haue peace bytwene englāde hym ſayde vncles wolde come nere parlyament myght wher vpon aduyſed frenche kinge ſhulde lye parlyament durynge balyngham someſayd ſaynt omers ſome ſayd thourayne ſome mutterell abuyle thynges conſydred aduyſed kynge ſhulde lye abuyle bycauſe towne ſtronge well fournyſſhed euery man ſhulde well lodged whan determyned drouſyon made kynge lodged abbay ſaynt peter abbay blacke monkes thyder came kynge duke orlyaunce counſayle lorde reynolde corby chauncellour fraunce duke berrey burgoyne ſuche cōmyſſion boloyne duke lancaſtre glouceſtre calays goodly beholde ſe ordre parlyament holden balyngham bytwene frenche men englyſſhmen tentes pauylyons pyght vp refreſſhe bothe partyes twyſe thryſe weke cōmyſſioners mette fayre tente ordayned purpoſe aboute nyne clocke fore noone cōmuned vpon many artycles whiche tyme iohan froyſart auctour booke abuyle deſyrous knowe effecte treatie enquyred trouth ſuche lordes thought ſhulde knowe certayntie ſhewed whan entred comunycaſion ſene eche others auctoryte perceyued full power conclude peace bothe lande ſee bytwene fraunce englande alyes one firſte demaundes yt frenche men deſyred haue calays raced downe ſuche maner ſhulde neuer habytacion therto duke lācaſtre glouceſtre anſwered ſaid ſuche auctorite cauſe calays beaten downe yt englande ſhulde holde demayne trewe herytage ſayd purpoſed entre tr • atye peace ſeace demaunde ſpeke therof whan duke 〈◊〉 berrey burgoyne herde two coſyns englande anſwere ſo quyckly 〈◊〉 ſeaſed ſpeke mat • er ſawe well traueyle ſhulde vayne ſo ſpake matter englyſſhe men demaunded haue •• ytucyon ſuche landes delyuered kynge rycharde ſoueraygne lorde kynge edwarde thyrde deputy commyſſioners alſo haue fully payed ſōme florayns lefte vnpayed tyme whan warre renewed bytwene england fraunce englyſſhe clerkes lawyer proued reaſonable lawfull lordes chauncelours fraunce argued contrary ſayd retourne landes agayne gouernynge kyng englande ſucceſſours impoſſyble done ſayenge howe ſuche landes cyties townes caſtels lordeſhyppes homage englyſſhe men demaunded gyuen awaye whan peace concluded bretygny confermed ſealed calays wherby clene put way fro kyng englande whiche peace grauntes made yere lorde god thouſande thre hūdred threſcore one thervpon frenche kyng graunted ſuche landes great lyberties othe writyng promeſſe whiche wyſe canne broken agayne reuoked wherfore ſayd englyſſhemen purpoſed haue peace ſhulde drawe ſome nerer poynt delyberacyon foure duke deuyſed frenche men well englyſſhmen ſhulde put demaundes writynge ſame delyuered eyther partye might regarded length bothe partes ſuche vnreaſonable raſed cancelled ſuch good vpholden ordynaūce ſemed party good reaſonable ordre taken ye ſour duke moche buſyneſſe ſpecyally englyſſhe men moche payne vnderſtande frenche men full ſubtyle wordes cloked perſwacions double vnderſtandynge whiche frenche men wolde rouine lyſt profyte aduauntage whiche englyſſhe men vſe nat langage ſpeche entent playne alſo engliſſhmen enfourmed frenche men nat alwayes vpholden artycles promyſes condycyons ratyfied artycles peace yet frenchman wold euer fynde one poynte writynges ſome ſubtyle cloked worde affermynge englyſſhe men broken peace nat wherfore whan englyſſhe men ſawe herde frenche men writynges darke cloked worde made examyned ſuche profoundly lerned lawe founde myſſe cauſed canſelled amended entent wolde leaue nothynge trouble englyſſhmen excuſe themſelfe wolde ſay frenche men letnynge ſuche ſubtylties youth muſte nedes ſubtyle somtyme ſuche frowarde wordes bytwene party greatly draue tyme treatie frenche men helde ſelfe fre thought ſhulde nat charged ſuche demaundes make reſtytucy landes apendances pertaynyng duchy acquytayne arerages hath ben leuyed ſyth warre renewed ye whiche wolde neuer acorde frenche men offred rendre countre terbe bygore countye piergourt pyergyns countie agen agenoys kaours rouer gue ouercy lymoſyn wold wyſe delyuer countie ponthyeur coūtie guyſnes englyſſh men hadde handes ſame tyme thus theſe lordes contynued fyftene dayes made concluſyon theſe duke determyned ſende worde two kynges gyue knowledge done frenche duke rode abbeuyle ſhewed kynge mater howe deſyred coſins englande write hole treatie kynge englande ſo ſayd promyſed enfourmed englyſſhe party duke gloceſtre harder entreat duke lancaſtre bycauſe common englande knewe ſomwhat entent therfore agreed ſhulde ſent treatye knewe well nothynge ſhulde paſſe hym without honour realme thus theſe four duke amyably departed eche fro concluded mete agayne nynth day thus theſe englyſſhe lordes retourned calays frenche lordes boloyne ſo abuyle tyme abuyle fayre garden cloſed ryuer somme whereas often tymes frenche kynge paſſed tyme ſayd brother orlyaunce counſayle beynge abbeuyle dyd hym moche good helthe ſame ſeaſone kynge kynge lyon armony newly come thyder grece thoſe march owne coūtrey durſt nat entre turkes conquered • except ſtronge towne conych ſtandynge ſee ſyde whiche geno way helde kepte doute turkes turkes gotten porte ſhulde haue doone moche yuell ſee cyprian rodes boundes cryſtendome kyng armony wolde gladly haue hadde peace bytwene englande fraunce truſt yonge knightes ſquyers ſhulde go grece helpe conquere agayne realme armony whan frenche kynges vncles come abbeuyle kynge gladde made theym good chere demaunded howe ſpedde ſhewed hym hole proceſſe vpon poynte departed wherof kynge gladde ſhewed glad haue peace lyke maner englyſſh duke whan came calays wrote kynge englande poyntes artycles treatye ſhortly agayne good aunſwere cōmaundynge procede peace ſayenge warre contynewed longe ynoughe cryſtendome therby ſore dōmaged thus daye prefyxed theſe duke mette agayne balyngham frenche lordes came kynge armony ſhewe lordes englande buſyneſſe neceſſyte well knowen duke glouceſtre ben englande whan frenche army ordeyned sluſe haue gone englande duke gloceſtre ſame tyme receyued kynge armony made hym good chere fayre place eſſer called plaſſhey balyngham alſo duke englande made kynge armony good chere glad hym ſpeke aunſwered hym gladly wolde ayde hym wherof kynge ryght ioyfull many thynges treated parlyament ſeaſon cardynall line lay abbeuyle ſente thyder legacyon hym called hym ſelfe pope clemente mater concernyng churche frenche duke aſſemble balyngham wolde haue certayne artycles compriſed treatie concernynge churche ſuſteynynge opynyons pope clemente robert geneue whan englyſſhe duke harde ſayd coſyns fraunce coſyns ye wyll ſhall fall poynte concluſion ſpeke cardynall haue nothyng hym matter buſynes without profyte effecte determyned vpon pope wyll obey wyll ſpekyng agaynſte hym medle thynge v ſhall departe god hence leaue togytder tyme mo wordes cardynall taried ſtyll abbcuyle theſe lordes proceded treaty duke lancaſtre well enclyned haue peace frenche kynge yere hadde ſore deſyred hym good meane entreate peace ſo promyſed howbeit brother duke glouceſtre hard agree layde forthe frenchemens dyſceytes colored wordes vſed alwayes writynges ſayenge howe frenche men wolde alwayes wreſtell armes dyſcouered whiche euer perceyued daye came ſquyer honour frenche man called robert hermyte ye duke glouceſtre one frenche kynges priuy chambre whether ſente duke gloceſtre came owne heed nat tell duke ſhewed englande plaſſhey ſquyer ſayd syr loue god nat agaynſt treatie peace ye ſe howe lordes fraunce dyligence bringe aboute ye ſhall almeſſe dede warre hath longe endured ſythe bothe kynges content haue peace ſubgiettes ought obey therto duke anſwered hym ſayd roberte nat agaynſt wyll nat ye frenche men amonge ye haue ſo many coloured wordes ſo darke obſcure vnderſtandynge ſo whan ye wyll warre whan ye lyſt peace thus haue ye ledde v vnto preſente daye kynge ſoueraygne lorde beleued ſuche realme boūde ſerue hym peace ſhulde neuer haue bytwene englande fraunce tyll reſtytucyon ben made v taken fro v without cauſe ſubtylte crafte god worlde knoweth ſythe kynge ſouerayne lorde enclyneth peace reaſone agree ſame therfore make peace acordyng deſyres bothe kynges ſythe aſſembled let well holden ſyde ſhall well kepte partye thus duke ſhewed roberte hermyte departed fro hym went company ſo theſe lordes contynewed ſtyll treatie wyll make proceſſe come concluſyon theſe foure duke aſſemble full power • auctorite kynges take tre •• ce make peace dyd ſo ſuche wyſe generall voyce 〈◊〉 towne abbeuyle peace taken vpon certayne artycles bytwene two kynges alyes conſyderates ſir iohan froyſſart auctour hyſtory beynge ſame tyme abbe •• yle coulde nat lerne certaynte artycles compriſed peace howe knewe peace taken endure four yeres kepte ferme ſtable bothe ſee lande concluded agreed within ſayde ſpace four yere ſhulde delyuered kynge englande euer perpetually kinges englande cōmyſſioners landes ſygnories countrey languedo • demayne herytage crowne englande doone accomplyſſhed agreed ſame ordynaunce certayne capitayns men helde ſome holdes fortreſſes realme fraunce ſhulde aduoyde departe ſuche made warre make warre vnder ſhadowe coloure kyng englande englyſſhe men nacyon ſo euer theſe artycles theſe lordes balyngham bounde writynges ſygned ſealed copyes therof ſent bothe kynges duke lancaſtre glouceſtre ſent harauld called marche letter kynge englande ſhewynge declarynge hole proceſſe ordynaunce concluded treatie vpon forme peace thus haraulde departed letter rode calys paſſed ouer deuer rode forthe tyll came kynge manoure owne beſyde london whan came kynges preſence delyuered letter whan kynge redde ryght ioyouſe gaue haraulde good tydynges bryngynge great giftes ſame haraulde ſhewed leyſare rode hym realme englande theſe foure duke fraunce englande ſtyll balyngham ſoiourned fayre tentes pauylyons well dylygently peruſed examyned artycles treatie wolde paſſe ſeale none tyll darke obſcure wordes clerely declared made perfyte nowe ſame ſeaſon happed fall great lette trouble matter wherby nyghe poynte haue broken made voyde reaſon tell cauſe entent hyſtory playne trewe ye haue herde frenche kyng great pleaſure lye abbeuyle alſo nere dayly howe ye treatie wente forwarde balyngham whan four duke poynt ye haue herde concluſyon mater duke lancaſtre glouceſtre ſayd howe entenſyon kynge rycharde kynge englande counſayle pope bonyface beynge rome whome romayns almayns hungaryons lumbardes venyſyans nacyons worlde chryſtened helde one pope named hym ſelfe clement degraded condēpned ſhulde deſyre frenche kynge take ſame way whan duke berrey burgoyne vnderſtode thoſe wordes duke burgoyne entent ſomewhat pleaſe coſyns englande entente treatie peace ſhulde nat hyndred therby ſayd fayre coſyns deſyre haue ſome reſpyte take counſayle vpon mater whiche graunted thervpon toke counſayle aunſwered duke burgoyne ſpake ſayd fayre coſyns mater queſtyon two pope nat couenable moued ſpoken amonge v marueyle ye put mater cōmunycacion fyrſt begynnyng treatie ye refuſed ſe ſpeke legate de la lyne yet abbeuyle wherfore reſt v whan cardynalles rome dyd choſe pope vrbayne dyſceaſe pope bonyface none party yet called electyon lykewyſe ſaye clement auygnon ſaye nat agaynſt great almes peaſe theym vny churche ſo myght entende lette v leaue mater lette vnyuerſitees clerkes determyne whan buſyneſſe concluded ferme peace ratifyed counſayle coſyn kynge almayne ſhall entende therto gladly partye lykewyſe partie aunſwere duke englande well content ſemed reaſonable aunſwered ſayde fayre coſyns ye haue ſayde well content ſame thus mater reſted fell nother great lette trouble frenche kynge layne towne abuyle great ſeaſon bycauſe great diſportes pleaſure paſtyme foūde ſodaynly fell agayne maladye franſy lyke maner ben yere fyrſt perceyued ſyr willyam martell knyght normandy alwayes nere kynges perſone priuy chambre ſame ſeaſone duke berrey burgoyne boloyne balyngham vpon thende parlyament manerall concluded ſeaſone ſoone duke orlyaūce brother kynge knewe chaunce kynges ſyckneſſe ſene hym ſente ſecrete ſquyer named bonyface vncles boloyne aduertiſynge ſecretly kynges dyſeaſe whanne duke knewe ryght ſorye departed redy taken leaues coſyns englande alſo departed calays taryed tydynges fro kyng nauerte fro duke bretaygne hadde moued treatie caſtell chyerbourge ſtandynge ſeeſyde vpon cloſe conſtantyne normandy whiche kynge englande gawge kepynge enfourmed ſōme threſcore thouſande noble englande frenche kynge ſhulde paye ſayd ſomme caſtell retourne kynge nauerre alſo ſtronge caſtell breſt englyſſhe men helde ſhulde retourne duke bretaygne duke berrey burgoyne abode nat concluſyon matter came abbeuyle founde kynge ryght yuell eſtate helthe ſory kynges ſyckneſſe kepte ſecrete longe myght nat longe ſuche aduentures ſoone ſpredde abrode thus lordes abbeuyle departed one another euery man home owne howſe determyned kynge ſhulde caryed horſe lytter caſtell crayll vpon oyſe thyder conueyed nyght tyme daye tyme reſted heate ſonne duke berrey duke orlyaunce rode crayell kynge duke burgoyne rode arthoys flaunders vyſitynge countreys founde ducheſſe wyfe caſtell hedyn mo wordes ſpoken lorde de la ryuer ſyr iohan mercyer forgoten man ſpake greuaunce delyueraunce ſeconde malady charles frenche kynge fallen dyd put away greatly ſpeakynge people wyſe ſage men fraunce feared greatly chaunce ſawe kynge lykely fall malady reaſon great exceſſe vſed tymes paſte febleneſſe heed mayſter willm̄ harſley newly deed ſuche nere ye kyng coude nat tell haue good ſure phiſicyon wayt vpon ye kyng howbeit dyd ye beſt coude deuiſe ¶of dethe pope clement auygnon lectyon pope benedic cap cxcvi tyme moneth septembre paſſed worlde auygnon roberte geneue named pope clement came hym alwayes ſaid whan man ſpake peace vny • n church wolde ſay alwayes howe wolde dye pope ſo dyd maner ye haue herde wrongfully ryghtfully wyll nat determyne cardynalles ſore abaſſhed ſtudyed whome myght choſe pope ſame tyme frenche kynge retourned agayne helth wherof ſuche loued great ioye ſpecyally good quene gyuen moche almeſſe done many pylgrymages kynge cauſed generall proceſſyons made parys enfourmed ye cardynals auygnon dyd electe choſe pope cardynall de la line ſpeke truely cardynall holy manne good lyfe electyon made condycionally frenche kynge counſayle content therwith el nat nowe regarde conſidre great ſubiectyon churche churche ſhulde free ſubmytted vnder ſuche ſhulde haue ben ordred theym thus cardynall de la lyne choſen pope named benedic gaue generall grace clerkes wolde come auignon coūſayle bretherne cardynalles wrote creacyon papalyte frenche kynge enfourmed kynge toke lytell regarde therto nat determyned whether ſhulde take hym pope nat ther vpon kynge ſent greateſt clerkes vnyuerſyte paris haue aduyſe counſayle mayſter iohan gyg • neourte mayſter pyer placyous prudence lernyng greateſt clerkes parys ſayde kynge name hole vnyuerſyte howe cyſme churche corrupted cryſten fayth howe myght nat long endure eſtate without cryſtendome ſhulde repent rynne great daunger ſpecially prelate preeſtes churche vnyuerſyte determyned ſende rolles auygnon clerkes haue grace pope benedyc frenche kynge ſawe well opynyons reaſonable wolde haue none clerkes enrolled ſeke pope grace tyll mater better determyned thus mater abode ſtyll eſtate howe duke berrey exalted greatly pope benedic ſent roll wherby moche people purueyed grace benedic duke burgoyne ducheſſe dyſſymuled mater kinge ſo dyd duke orlyaunce many great lordes fraunce ſome fauoure helde pope benedyc denyed man grace entent courte auygnon ſhulde full haue reputacyon duke bretaygne folowed frenche kynges opinyon tyme ſo abuſed enformacyon coſyn erle flaunders herte wolde neuer enclyne beleue pope clemente though clerkes bretaygne beleued helde hym pope whan promocyon voyde fraunce kynge promoted clerkes without gyuynge knowledge therof pope benedic wherwith cardynalles auygnon ſore abaſſhed douted leſte frenche kynge wolde reſtrayne ſuche rente profytes wonte haue benefytes gyuen realme fraunce determyned ſende legate fraunce ſpeke kynge counſayle knowe howe wolde ordre hym agaynſt churche ſhewe hym howe choſen pope vnder condycyon pleaſed abyde ſtyll pope el put hym papalyte cardynals entre agayne conclaue choſe one kynges pleaſure tyme come paris kynge freer mynour meke man ſente fraunce pope bonyface rome frenche kynge herde gladly freers prechynge came fraunce legate fro auygnon great ſubtyle clerke well langaged hole vnyuerſyte counſayled kynge ſayde howe well done eyther bonyface el benedyc put th • papalyte cardynalles putte cardynalyties ſtede choſyn good clerkes wyfemen good conſcyence well almayne fraunce nacyons ſette toguyder good delyberacyon counſayle without fauour yuell wyll ſette churche therby one poynt one pope ſayde ſawe well none waye bringe good concluſyon bycauſe pride enuy ſo reygned worlde prince lordes eche helde owne partie prepoſycion vnyuerſite hadde made kynge pleaſed right well kynge duke orlyaunce surgoyne kyng ſayd wolde write ſende meſſangers kynge almaygne bo • ſme hungry kyng englande thought hym ſelfe ſure ynough kynges caſtyle nauer aragon cicyle naples scotlāde wolde obey ſuche pope realme obeyed vnto vpon frenche kyng ſente letter meſſangers theſe ſayde kynges good leyſar bothe goyng cōmyng agayne anſwere yt meane tyme paſſed worlde parys noble clerke mayſters iohan gygencourt whoſe dethe kynge lordes ye hole vniuerſyte right ſorie laſte nat felowe behynde dayes taken great payne reforme churche haue brought perfyte vnyte ¶of clerke named mayſter iohn̄ warennes capi cxcvii ſame ſeaſon great clerke auignone bothe scyence prudence doctor lawes auditor palais caſion rā ne called maiſter iohan warennes reaſon ſuche ſeruice done pope clement greatly auaūted promoted benefice yt poynt byſſhop cardynall chapelayne one auygnone called ſaynte peter luſenbourge ſame maiſter iohan warēnes promocions reſigned thē retayned hymſelfe ſmall lyueng ſextenty lady churche renes worthe yere reſydent c frankes abſence xxx ſo deꝑted fro auignon came dwell nere renes village called ſaint ley ledde holy lyfe preched ye worde god exalted moche pope auygnon condēpned wordes pope rome viſited moche people countreis came ſe hym ſe ye holy lyfe ledde faſted euery day people ſayd ye cardynals auignon crafte ſubtylte hadde ſent hym thider exalte colour opinyon el come thider ſhewe holy lyfe wolde wyſe called holy man ſaynt ley audytor alwayes cōpany mother ſayd maſſe euery daye deuoutly gyuen wolde gyue agayne god deſſake wolde aſke nothyng man ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpekyng hym ſpeke buſyneſſe mater requyreth ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe king englande gaue duke lancaſtre heyres euer duchy acquytayne howe kyng prepared go irelande duke acquytayne cap cxcviii ye haue herde hyſtorie howe trewce taken bytwene englande fraunce adherē ce alyes bothe ſee lande yet robber pyllers languedocke whiche ſtraungers farre countreis gaſcoyne bierne almaygne amonge ſir iohan grayle baſtarde ſonne ſomtyme captall beuſes yonge experte knyght capitayne ſtronge caſtell bouteuyll theſe capitayns garyſons bigore marchynge realme arragone fronters xaynton marcheſſe rochell garyſon mortaygne ſore diſpleaſed myght natte ouer rynne countrey accuſtomed ſtraitlye commaunded payne greuous punyſſhment nothyng ſhulde ſoūde reproche peace ſeaſon agreed englande conſyderynge kynge yonge hadde peace ennemyes farre nere excepte irelande claymed lande enherytaūce predeceſſours written kyng lorde irelande kynge edwarde graunfather kynge rycharde made wayes warre iryſſhe men entente yonge knyghtes ſquyers englande ſhulde enploye ſelfe dedes armes therby augment encreaſe honour realme concluded kynge rycharde englande ſhulde make thyder voyage puyſſaū ce menne warre ſo entre irelande nat retourne agayne without hadde honourable compoſycion concluſyon ſame ſeaſon concluded duke lancaſtre greatlye traueyled bothe see lande augmentacyon honour reralme englande ſhulde make another voyage fyue hundred menne armes thouſande archer take ſhyppynge hampton plommouthe ſo ſayle guyane acquitaygne entencyon kynge rycharde conſent counſayle duke lancaſtre ſhulde haue euer hym heyres countrey acquitayne purtenaunces kyng edwarde father kyngꝭ duke acquitayne tyme holden optayned kyng rycharde yt tyme reſerued always homage ſhulde kynge englande kynges come obeyſaūces rente lordſhypes reuenewes ſhulde parteygne duke lā caſtre heyres euer kyng made hym clere graunt confyrmed vnder writyng ſeale gyfte duke lācaſtre well cōtent good cauſe duchy landes countreis great lorde maynteygne eſtate charter gyfte engroſed dewly examyned paſte great delyberacyon good aduyſe counſayle beynge preſent kynge two vncles duke yorke duke glouceſtre erle saliſbury erle arundell erle derby ſonne duke lancaſtre alſo therle marſhall erle rutlande erle northūberlande erle nottyngham lorde thomas percy lorde spenſar lorde beamonde lorde willyam arundell archebyſſhoppe caunterbury archebyſſhoppe yorke byſſhoppe london theſe preſente dyuers othe prelate barownes englande thanne duke lancaſtre purpoſed make prouiſyon paſſe see go acquitayne enioye gyfte kyng hadde gyuen hym lykewiſe great prouiſyon made kynges voyage irelande lordes apoynted ſuche ſhulde paſſe see kyng warnyng make thē redy ⸫ ⸫ ¶of dethe quene anne englande wyfe kynge richarde doughter kynge boeſme emperour almaygne capi cxcix thus haue ſhewed great preparacyons made porte hauyns kynge ſhulde take ſhyppepynge go irelande lykewyſe duke lancaſtre ſhulde paſſe go acquitayne voyage lette taryed ye ſpace two monethes lengar ſhulde haue ben ſhall tell ſame ſeaſon theſe preparacyons made quene named anne tooke ſickeneſſe wherby kynge lordes ryght ſore troubled ſhe ſo ſore ſicke ſhe paſſed worlde feeſt penthecoſt yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore fourtene whoſe dethe kynge loued ladyes damoſelles ſore troubled great heuyneſſe buryed poules london obſe • e done good leyſar king wolde haue done ſumptuouſly great habū daunce waxe taper torch ſo lyke hadde nat ben ſene kynge wolde haue ſo bycauſe ſhe emperours doughter rome kyng almaygne kynge loued ſo entierly maryed yonge howe ſhe dyed without iſſue thus one ſeaſon kynge duke lancaſtre erle derby wydowers ſpekynge remaryeng kyng wolde ſpekynge therof thus kynges voyage irelande ſomwhat retarded let howe prouiſyon lordes ſuche ſhulde go kynge paſſed ouer ſee landed duuelyn whiche alwayes englyſſhe archebiſſhoppe kynge anone mydſomer kynge departed fro marcheſſe london toke waye throughe wale huntyng ſportynge hym forgette dethe quene ſuche ſhulde go kynge ſette forwarde two kynges vncles edmonde duke yorke thomas duke glouceſtre conſtable englande ſette forwarde great arraye ſo dyde lordes erle rutlande ſonne duke yorke erle marſhall erle saliſbury erle arundell lorde wyllyam arundell erle northumberlande lorde percy lorde thom̄s percy brother great seneſchall englande erles deuonſhyre notyngham great nombre knightes ſquiers suche reſerued abode behynde kepe marcheſſe agaynſt ſcottes ſuche people neuer kepte truce promyſe lorde iohan hollande erle huntyngton waye ieruſalem ſaynt katheryns mount purpoſed retourne realme hungry paſſed fraūce hadde great chere kyng brother vncles herde howe kyng hungry great turke ſhulde haue batayle togyder therfore thought ſure lye iourney otherſyde duke lancaſtre came plomouthe ſhippes laye redy whan men come veſſelles charged wynde wyll toke ſhippyng diſancred ſayled towardes burdeaux ryuer gyron nowe lette v ſpeke kyng englande copany four thouſande men armes thyrtie thouſande archer ſhipped thre place brutowe holyheed herforde paſſed ouer daylye irelande redy valyaunt knyght englande called erle ormonde helde landes irelande ſo dyde predeceſſours debate erle marſhall englande hadde vowarde fyftene hundred ſpeares two thouſande archer kynge englande two vncles toke ſhyppinge herforde wale thus army paſſed ouer without dōmage lodged irelande apoyntement duke glouceſtre cōſtable englande marſhals abrode countrey beyond ye cytie duuelyn xxx myle countrey than̄e inhabytable howe laye wyſely ſurely feare yriſſhe men nede el myght haue taken great dōmage kynge vncles lodged cytie duuelyn ſhewed whyle largely prouyded vitayls englyſſhe men ſuche men warre well forage take aduaūtage make good prouiſyon thē ſelfe horſes fell voyage ſhall ſhewe enformed ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe ſir iohn̄ froiſſart arryued englande gyfte boke gaue kyng cap cc trewe ſir iohan froiſſart tyme treaſourer chanon chymay erldome heynaulte dioceſe liege great affectyon go ſe realme englande whan ben abbeuyle ſawe trewce taken bytwene realmes englande fraunce countreis conioyned adherentes endure four yeres see lande many reaſons moued make voyage one bycauſe youthe hadde brought vp court noble kynge edwarde thyrde quene philyppe wyfe amonge chyldren barones englande lyue whome founde nobleneſſe honour largeſſe courteſy fore deſyred ſe countre thynkynge therby ſhulde lyue moche lengar hadde nat xxviii yere thought though ſawe natte thoſe lordes lefte lyue yet leeſt ſhulde ſe heyres whiche ſhulde moche good ſe alſo iuſtifye hyſtories mater hadde written toke iourney ſpake duke aubert bauyere erle heynaulte hollande zelande lorde freeſe lorde wyllyam erle oſtrenaunt right honourable lady iahane ducheſſe brabant luſenbourge lorde eugerant lorde coucy gentyll knyght lorde gomegynes youthe myne toguyder englande kynges courte lykewiſe ſo ſene lorde coucy dyuers noble fraunce holden great houſholdes london whan laye hoſtage redempcion kynge iohan frenche kynge hath ſhewed hyſtorie theſe ſayd lordes ducheſſe brabant counſayled take iourney gaue letter recommendacyon kynge englande vncles ſauynge lorde coucy wolde nat write kynge bycauſe frenche man therfore durſte nat doughter called ducheſſe irelande engroſed fayre boke well enlumyned matter amour moralytees four twentie yeres hadde made compyled whiche greatly quickened deſyre go englande ſe kyng rycharde ſonne noble prince wale acquitayne hadde nat ſene kynge rycharde ſythe chriſtened cathedrall churche burdeaux whiche tyme thought haue goone prince iourney galycia spaygne whan̄e cytie aſte prince ſente backe englande quene mother theſe cauſes hadde great deſyre go englande ſe kynge vncles alſo hadde ſaid fayre boke well couered veluet garnyſſhed clapſes syluer gylte therof make preſent kynge fyrſt cominynge preſence hadde ſuche deſyre goo voyage payne traueyle greued nothyng thus prouyded horſes neceſſaries paſſed see calais came douer xii daye moneth iuly whan̄e came founde man knowledge ſo longe ſythe englande houſes newly chaūged yonge child become men ye woman knewe natte theym abode halfe daye nyght douer tueſdaye nexte daye nyne clocke came canterbury ſaynt thomas ſhrine tombe noble prince wale entered ryght richely herde maſſe made myne offrynge holy ſaynt thanne dyned lodgynge enformed howe kyng richarde ſhulde nexte daye pylgrimage whiche retourne irelande ben ſpace nyne moneches kyng hadde deuocyon viſyte ſaynt thomas ſhrine alſo bycauſe prince father buryed thought abyde kynge ſo dyde next daye kynge came thyder noble company lordes ladyes damoſelles whan among ſemed newe folkes knewe ꝑſone tyme ſore chaū ged xxviii yere kynge none vncles duke lā caſtre acquitayne duke yorke gloceſtre buſyneſſes ſo firſte abaſſhed ſene auncyent knyght ben kyng edwarde price ben well reconforted wolde haue gone hym coulde ſe none ſuche than̄e demaunded knyght called ſir rycharde seury whyder lyue nat ſhewed yes london thought go ye lorde thom̄s percy great ſeneſchall englade kyng ſo acquaynted hym founde hym right honorable gracyous offred preſent letter kynge wherof right ioyfull behoued haue ſome meanes bringe preſence ſuche prince kynge englande wente kynges chambre whiche tyme kynge gone ſlepe ſo ſhewed badde retourne lodgynge come agayne ſo dyde whan came byſſhoppes palays founde lorde thomas percy redy ryde oſpring counſayled make knowledge beynge folowe court ſayd wolde cauſe euer well lodged tyl kyng ſhulde fayre caſtell lede kent ordered coūſayle rode oſpring aduēture lodged houſe lodged gentyll knyght englande called ſir wyllyam lyſle taryed behynde kynge bycauſe payne heed nyght one kynges preuy chambre whan ſawe ſtraunger thought marcheſſe fraūce bycauſe langage fyll acquayncaunce toguyder gentylmen englande curceſſe treatable gladde acquayntaunce demaunded buſyneſſe thoſe party ſhewed hym great parte cōmynge thyder lorde thomas percy hadde ſayd ordred anſwered ſayde howe coulde nat haue better meane ye friday ye kyng ſhulde caſtell lede ſhewed whan came ſhuld fynde duke yorke kynges vncle wherof ryght gladde bycauſe letter dyrected hym alſo youthe hadde ſene courte noble kyng edwarde father ye quene mother friday mornyng ſir wylliam lyſle rode toguyder waye demaunded hym kynge voyage irelande anſwered yes demaunded hym maner hole irelande called ſaynt patrykes purgatorie trewe ſayde nat ſayde ſuretie ſuche hole hym ſelfe another knyght englande hadde ben whyle kynge laye duuelyn ſayd howe entred hoole cloſed ſonne goynge downe abode nyght nexte mornyng iſſued agayne ſon riſyng demaūded ſuche ſtrāge ſightes vyſions ſpoken ſayd howe whan felowe entred paſt gate yt called ye purgatorie ſaynt patryke diſcended gone downe thre four pace diſcendyng downe cellar certayne hoote wapure roſe agaynſt ſtrake ſo heedes fayne ſyt downe ſteres whiche ſtone ſytte ſeaſon great deſyre ſlepe ſo fell ſlepe ſlepte nyght demaū ded ſlepe knewe viſyons anſwered ſlepyng entred great ymaginacyōs marueylous dremes otherwyſe wont haue chambres mornynge iſſued within ſhorte ſeaſon clene forgate dreures viſyons wherfore ſayde thought mater fantaſy lefte ſpekyng matter bycauſe wolde fayne haue knowen hym done voyage irelande thought thā haue demaūded kyng done iourney company knyghtes came fell communycacion hym ſo lefte purpoſe tyme thus robe lede thyder came kyng cōpany founde lorde edmonde duke yorke went hym delyuered letter fro erle heynaulte coſyn fro erle oſtrenaunt duke knewe well made good chere ſayde sir iohan holde alwayes nere v ſhall ſhewe loue courteſy boūde therto loue tyme paſt loue lady olde quene mother whoſe courte ye haue good remembraunce therof thanked hym reaſon requyred aduaunſed reaſon hym ſir thomas percy ſir william lyſle meanes brought kynges chambre preſence meanes vncle duke yorke delyuered letter kyng toke reed thē good leyſar ſayd welcome hadde ben englyſſhe courte daye ſhewed nat kynge boke hadde brought hym ſo ſore occupyed wt great affayres leyſar preſent boke kyng ſore buſyed counſayle two great mightye mater firſt determynynge ſende ſufficient meſſangers therle rutlande coſyn germayne erle marſhall archbyſſhoppe dublyn byſſhoppe ely lorde loys clyſſorde lorde henry beaumonde lorde hughe spenſar many ouer see charles frenche kynge treate hym maryage hadde bytwene kyng englande frenche kynges eldeſt doughter named iſabell age eyght yeres ſecōde cauſe lorde de la barde lorde taryde lorde pyntherne lorde newcaſtell lorde neſque lorde copane counſaylours burdeux bayon daxe come englande quickely purſued mater ſythe kynges retourne irelande haue anſwere requeſtes proceſſe put forthe kyng gyfte kynge gyuen vncle duke lācaſtre landes ſeignories lordſhippes baronyes acquytayne whiche verifyed pertaygne kynge realme englande hadde alleged kynge counſayle gyfte myght nat paſſe ſo bycauſe vnprofytable mutyle ſayd thoſe landes helde right demayne crowne englande wherfore ſayde wolde nat diſioyne diſceuer thē fro crowne alleged furthermore many reaſonable cauſes ye ſhall proceſſe thus haue co • ſayle thoſe two great matter kynge ſente mooſt parte prelate lordes englande feeſt maudelyntyde manner kynges called eltham ſeuyn englyſſhe myles fro london whan taryed lede four dayes kyng retourned rocheſter ſo elthame ſo rode forthe kynges company ⸫ ⸫ ¶of refuce acquytayne made duke lancaſtre howe ſent englande kynge counſayle ſhewyng hym wyll hole coū trey acquytayne cap cci rydynge waye bytwene leades eltham demaunded ſyr willyam lyſle ſyr iohn̄ graily capitayne bouteuyll ye cauſe king drewe london warde great counſayle ſhulde aſſemble eltham tolde ſpecially ſyr iohan graily reherſed playnly ye lordes gaſcon come thyder counſaylours good townes cyties thus enfourmed knight knewe trouth often tymes amonge theym maner one countrey fronter ſayde thus surely whan duke lancaſtre came fyrſt acquytayne ſuffycyently fournyſſhed charter wrytinges engroſed ſealed great ſeale englande enrolled fermely decreed full accorde prelate lordes englande alſo conſente duke edmonde yorke erle cambridge thomas duke glouceſtre though ſayd herytages might ſucceſſion haue come kynge rycharde englande nephue chyldren theſe ſayd two duke brethern germayns father mother duke lancaſtre whiche duke anone come acquytayne ſente ſome counſayle cytie burdeaux ſhewe mayre counſaylours towne fourme tenoure requeſt cauſe come countrey whan herde greatly marueyled howe ioyfully receyued kynges duke cōmyſſioners honoure kynge whome ought ſeruyce obeyſaunce deſyred take coūſayle ſo dyd aunſwered ſaid duke lancaſtre ſonne kynge edwarde ben lorde welcome amōge none otherwyſe ſayde nat ſo farre forthe taken counſayle receyue hym ſouerayne lorde ſayd kyng rycharde ſoueraygne lorde done feaultie homage made quytāce aunſwered cōmyſſioners ſayd syrs feare nat ye ſhall haue ſuffycient dyſcharge behalfe ſo ye take duke ſouerayne lorde ye ſhall ſe content kinges charter ſhall neuer queſtyon made therof tyme come whan̄e burdeaux ſawe ſo nere touched founde theym another ſocoure ſayd fayre lordes cōmyſſion extendeth nat onely vpon v lykewyſe cytie bayon prelate barones gaſcoyne vnder obeyſaunce kynge englande ye ſhall drawe towardes ordre thē ſhall folowe ſame aunſwere cōmyſſioners coulde nat haue tyme burdeau • departed rode lyborne duke lancaſtre laye whan duke herde aunſwers imagyned hymſelfe •• ſyneſſe come thyder ſhulde nat ſo ſone atcheued truſted ſhulde haue ben ſent coūſayle cytie bayon ſped burdeaux ſo dyd anſwere coude haue none fynally prelate noble men counſaylours cytes good townes gaſcoyne vnder obeyſaunce kyng englande conioyned togyder concluded forme manner ſhall ſhewe ſayde wolde gladly receyue ye duke lancaſtre cyt • e townes caſtelles ſonne kyng edwarde vncle kinge rycharde englāde ſo entringes ſhulde ſolemply ſwere peſably good maner ſhulde entreat people enforſynge thynge pay reaſonably euery thynge ſhulde diſpende alſo ſwere ſhulde nat oppreſſe cauſe oppreſſed iuryſdictyon crowne englande maner waye accyon duke aunſwered ſayd nat come countrey greue oppreſſe people wolde rather kepe defende agaynſt men herytage deſyred requyred theym cōmaundement kynge englande myght obſerued acompliſſhed hole countrey comune voyce ſayd yt wyſe wolde departe fro crowne englande nat kynge englandes power gyue away another lorde put fro crowne englande theſe demaundes denyenges longe debatyng bytwene duke lancaſtre lordes townes gaſcon whan duke ſawe none remedy made requeſt countrey prelate noble men coūſaylours good townes ſhulde ſende ſuffycient perſonages kynge englande counſayle howe wolde ſende lykewyſe notable perſones counſayle loke ſo euer kyng counſayle ſhulde determyne cauſe promyſed ſurely abyde ther whether hym agaynſt gaſcon conſydred well requeſt reaſonable agreed duke deſyred duke rode burdeaur lodged abbey ſaint andrewes ben lodged tyme cytie bayon dar apoynted ſuffycient perſonages ſende englande baron gaſcon vnder kinges obeyſaunce ſent lyke wyſe alſo ye ſhall knowe whan ye frenche kyng vncles vnderſtode duke laucaſtre peaſably entred cytie burdeaux knewe nat entent whether wolde kepe breake trewce counſayle determyned ſende hym knowe ſomwhat entent apoynted go lorde boucyquant marſhall fraunce lorde iohan caſtell morante iohan barres barroys haue thouſande ſpeares thus rode forth tyll came cytie agen taryed ſent harauldes meſſnagers burdeaux duke lancaſtre ſhewynge hym howe wolde gladly ſpeke hym duke made theſe meſſangers good chere wrote agayne theſe lordes certifyeng great deſyre ſpeke hym lykewyſe ſame ſpeke bycauſe ſhulde take ye leſſe payne promyſed come mete bergerate whan frenche lordes ſawe letter gaue credence therto ordred ſone knewe duke come bergerate departed fro agen rode thyder receyued lodged towne company ſubbarbes theſe lordes ſpake duke ſhewed hym meſſage duke receyued ſwetely aunſwered ſayd howe wolde good kynde neyghbour frenche kyng realme kepe mayntayne trewce taken bytwene two kynges ſayde hym ſelfe one princypalles ayded make ordayn truce wherfore ſayd ought nat wold nat breke therof myght well aſſured duke aunſwere pleaſed greatly lordes fraunce thus duke louingly togyder duke gaue great dyner ſupper tooke leaue duke retourned burdeaux frenche men fraunce founde waye duke berrey cytie poyeters ſhewed hym doone duke berrey thought duke lancaſters anſwere reaſonable ſo dyd ye frenche kynge duke burgoyne ſo mater abode ſtyll eſtate cauſe quod ſir iohan graily duke lancaſtre hath ſent hyther englande counſayle ſyr wylliam pe • reer ſyr peter clyfton two clerkes lerned lawe mayſter iohan huche mayſter iohan rychard leycettour treate pleate mater kynge vncles cauſe kynge rydeth eltham ſhall thurſday nexte ſhall mary maudelyn daye ſhalbe done yet knowe nat enfourmed ſome englyſſhe men knowe ſomwhat duke glouceſtre wyll princypally opynion yt brother duke lancaſtre ſhulde abyde ſtyll guyen rather retourue agayne englande bycauſe ſo great kynge enſure duke glouceſtre maruaylous mynded man proude preſumptuous wolde rule hym ſelfe ſo beloued comynalte ſo euer ſaythe wyll enclyne cauſed valyaunte knyght lorde symon burle duke irelande archebyſſhoppe yorke many knyghtes kynges counſayle dye hatred yuell wyll durynge ſeaſone duke lancaſtre beyonde ſee caſtyle dred englande beloued nowe lette mater paſſe quod ſyr iohn̄ graily ſhall ſhewe nowe ſeconde buſyneſſe kynge hathe enfourmed kynges pleaſure remaryed hath ſertched ouer wyfe duke burgoyne erle haynalte doughter mary kynge wolde gladly haue one haue none ſuche maryed hath ben ſhewed kyng kynge nauarre hath bothe ſuffers doughters wyll nat entende yt wayes duke glouceſtre hath doughter able mary wolde gladly kyng ſhulde haue kynge wolde nat ſaid ſhe nere kynne ſhe coſyn germayne kynge enclyneth moſte mynde frenche kynges doughter wherof countrey hath great marueyle wolde take enemyes doughter kynge nat beſte beloued prince worlde people ſetteth lytell therby ſheweth always rather haue warre realme fraūce wherfore wolde haue good peace bytwene frenche kynge hym realmes kynge wyll often tymes ſaye warre hath endured longe bytwene many valyaunt men deed therby bothe party wherby chriſten faythe ſore mynyſſhed febled nat pleaſaunt realme englande ſhulde mary fraunce hath ben ſhewed hym doughter fraunce ouer yonge fyue ſyxe yere ſhe ſhall nat able kepe hym company therto hath aunſwered ſaythe ſhe ſhall growe ryght well age though faſte ſeaſon ſhall take well worth ſhall ordre meane ſeaſon pleaſure maner englande ſayenge alſo howe yet yonge ynough abyde tyll lady age man canne breke kynge purpoſe ye departe ye ſhall moche matter thus theſe cauſes kynge rydeth nowe eltham thus gentle knyght ſyr iohan graily deuyſed togyther rode bytwene rocheſtre dertforde knight capytayn bouteuyle baſtarde ſonne ſomtyme captall beuſz herde wordes gladly dyd put memory way bytwene leades eltham rode moſt parte company ſyr wylliam lyſle thus kynge came eltham tueſday wednyſday lordes coſtes began aſſemble thyder came duke glouceſtre erles derby arundell northumberlande kent rutlande erle marſhall archebyſſhoppes caunterbury yorke byſſhoppes london wyncheſter thurſday aboute houre thre aſſembled togyther kynges chambre kynges preſence knyghtes gaſcoyne ſent coūſaylours good townes alſo duke lancaſtres counſayle ſent nat preſēt might nat ſuffred none lordes counſayle debated mater four houres dyner fell acquayntaūce auncyent knyght whome knewe kynge edwardes dayes kynge rychardes priuy counſayle called ſyr rycharde sury knewe anone yet xxiiii yeres nat ſene whiche colbridge bruſelles houſe duke wyncelante brabant ducheſſe iahan brabant knyght ſir rycharde sury made good chere demaunded many thynges aunſwered hym knewe walked vp downe hym galery kynges chambre demaūded hym queſtyons counſayle deſyred hym tell myght concluſion taken herde well pauſed lytell afterwarde ſayd ſyr iohan ſhall ſhewe mater hydden kept ſecrete ſhortly ye ſhall theym publyſſhed openly ye knowe well quod iame ſure ye haue herde reherſed howe duke lancaſtre gone acquytayne reioyce gyft • kynge ſoueraygne lorde hath gyuen hym loue hathe hym hath doone kynge ryght good ſeruyce crowne englande therfore rewarde kynge hathe clerely gyuen hym heyres euer hole duchy acquitayne ſo e • tendeth mete lymytacyons ſeneſchalles baylyages ſygnories waſſelages clene quyteth holde hym faythe othe homage reſorte reſerued kynge hath reſerued crowne englande tyme come gyfte ſo ſufficyently confermed kynges vncles counſayle englande hath acorded ther kynge hathe gyuen ſpecyall commaundement ſubgiettes ſayd lymytacyons acquytayne obey poyntes without othermeane dere well beloued vncle duke iohan lancaſtre ye ſyght letter holde take hym ſouerayne lorde ſwere hym faythe homage holde hym truely haue auncyently done helde date thoſe letter gyuen kyng englande deputy cōmyſſioners ſoeuer rebelleth ſpeketh agaynſt kynges graūt condycyon ſo euer aunſwere therto within thre dayes kynge gaue vncle lancaſtre commyſſioners full power puyſſaunce correcte put hope haue retourne reſorte yet nat withſtandynge theſe letter ſtrayte cōmaundement kynge good townes cyties gaſcoyne vnder kynge englandes obeyſaūce lordes knyghtes gentleman countrey conioyned togyther kepe townes cloſe agaynſte duke wyll nat nat mynde obey duke caſe ſay haue ſayd yet ſuſteyne houre gyfte kynge hath gyuen vncle lancaſtre nat ſuffycient profytable ordre reaſon yt duke wolde nat wynne theym gentylneſſe herde pacyently defence inconuenyentes ſhulde enſue therfore counſayle counſayles come hyther debate declare cauſe nat obey kynges cōmaundement ſurely day haue right wyſely ſhewed anſwere layde forth certayne artycles reaſon haue ben well herde haue layde ſuche reaſons maner kynge counſayle thynke haue cauſe abyde quarell ſhall ſhewe howe wolde ye kept ſecrete tyll knowen abrod aunſwered wolde ſo well quod knyght one thought offyciall burdeaux ſpake partie firſt ſhewed forthe procutacyon auctorite entent myght better beleued beganne ſayde cytie burdeaux cyties bayon dax ſygnories lorſhyppes appendaunt lymyttes ſayd countreys cyties ſo noble condycyon kyng englande maner accyon dede may put awaye dyſceuer fro demayns crowne englande gyue alyenate chylde vncle brother reaſone maryage otherwiſe veryfie ſay aboue named townes cyties ſygnories ſuffyciently priueleged kynges englande haue ſworne faythfully holde kepe v ſo without reuocaſyon ſoone kynge englande entreth poſſeſſyon herytage crowne englande ſwereth ſufficiently euangelyſtes holde ferme ſtable without breakynge ye ryght dere ſyr kyng englande haue made lyke othe ſyr veryfie trouth beholde theſe writynges ther ſhewed forth letter charter vnder ſygnes notaryes imperyalles ſealed great ſeale englande gyuen ſame kynge rycharde beynge preſent openly redde frome clauſe clauſe charter well herde vnderſtande bothe laten frenche named ende many wytneſſes prelate great lordes englande ſuretie teſtes dede leſte nombre xi whanne kynges counſayle herde behelde eche loked kynge man ſpake worde made replycacion whan redde ouer folded put vp ſpake addreſſynge wordes kynge ſayde ryght dere ſyr redouted ſoueraygne lorde ryght dere lordes departynge countrey charged ſhewe counſaylours good cyties townes gaſcoyne beynge vnder obeyſaunce crowne englande hath well ouer ſene fourme maner commaūdement ſent vnto vnder ſeale whiche knewe right well yet thinke ſay cōmaundement may nat obeyed ſo cyties good townes guyen wolde enclyne receyue duke lancaſtre lorde acquyte euer homage obeyſaunce owe ſhulde greatly preiudyce crowne englande thoughe ſo tyme preſente duke lancaſtre kynges vncle ſubgiet well beloued wolde holde kepe poyntes artycles belongyng crowne englande yet maye ſo hap ſuche loue tenure may lyghtly loſt chaunge heyres reaſon maryages made bytwene lordes ladyes chaungynge fro one another though nere lygnage dyſpenſacyon pope ſometyme neceſſyte maryages made hyghe prince chyldren one another holde landes ſygnories loue amyte ſo myght fall ſuche heyres myght dyſcende duke lancaſtre ſhulde conioyne theym maryage chyldren ſome kynge fraunce duke berrey bretaygne erles foize armynake kynges nauarre duke aniou mayne beynge beyonde ſee peraduenture party fraunce ſhulde clayme enherytaunce therby put countrey guyen dyſcorde bring againſt crowne englande wherby kynge englande reygnynge realme alſo ſhulde haue peraduenture ouer moche payne recouer agayne ſo ryght put farre fro thence whervnto ſhulde retourne demayne crowne englande wherfore ryght dere ſyr redouted lordes noble counſaylours pleaſe conſydre theſe poyntes artycles haue purpoſed preſence determyne ye ſhall ſeme beſt ſyr full opynion countrey ſaye wyll abyde ſtyll obey ſaunce ryght redouted lorde kynge demayne noble crowne englande therwith offyciall helde peace prelate lordes eche regarded drewe togyther aproched kynge fyrſte two vncles erles derby arundell acquytayne cōmaunded departe tyll called agayne departed alſo two knightes come thyder fro duke lancaſtre kyng demaunded counſayle ſhulde done aunſwere ſhulde made prelate tourned aunſwere kynges vncles bycauſe mater touched rather fyrſt excuſed ſayeng myght nat well aunſwere mater cōmune ought debated cōmune counſayle nat lygnage fauour thus bode good ſpace fynally aunſwere layde duke glouceſtre prayed requyred ſaye aduyſe aunſwered ſayde howe herde thynge take way dyſanull gyfte kynge confermed ſealed acorde ſubgiettes delyberacyon ſpecyall counſayle wherfore ſayde ſubgiettes ſhuld rebell wolde nat obey wolde make kynge ſhulde nat lorde owne enheritaunce yt myght nat owne pleaſed hym ſome gloſed thoſe wordes ſome though • corage aunſwere nat reaſonable durſte nat ſaye agaynſt duke glouceſtre ſo ſore dred erle derby ſonne duke lancaſtre preſente furthered thoſe wordes ſayde fayre vncle ye haue well ſayd opinyon therwith counſayle began breke ſome murmured one another guyen yet duke lancaſters knightes nat called agayne tyme whan kynge ſawe mater dyſſimuled lytell entenſyon ſhulde aſſemble togyther agayne counſayle dyner ſe propre way myght taken honoure crowne englande kynge cauſed byſſhop caunterbury ſpeke gyuen hym charge mornynge ſpeke vpon ſtate maryage ſende fraunce lordes accorde named ſhulde go whiche archebyſſhoppe duuelyn erle rutlande erle marſhall lorde beaumonde lorde hughe spenſer lorde loys clyfforde twenty knyghtes xl ſquyers theſe ſent fraunce treat maryage frenche kynges doughter iſabell eyght yere age yet ſhe redy promyſed duke bretayns ſonne treatie yt made towrs thourayne nowe beholde howe myght broken frenche kynge vncles hadde ſealed duke bretayne yet thenglyſſhe ambaſſadours charge gyuen vnto ſo departed englande aryued calays taryed fyue dayes departed great araye tooke waye amyence ſente marche haraulde brought ſaueconducte goynge comyng beſyde lorde moncheuerell ſette guyde ſe ſerued thynges neceſſary ¶nowe ſhall leaue ſpeke retourne fyrſte purpoſe nowe haue ſhewed counſaylours cyties good townes acquytayne prayed kynge counſayle whome boude mayntayn lyberties fraunches demayne crowne englande ſworne affermynge ſurely wolde kepe auncyente lyberties wyll nat breke maner cauſe condycion holdynge thus opynyon foure partes counſayle cōmune voyce countrey reputed theym valyaunt worthy men duke glouceſtre another opinyon wolde brother duke lancaſtre ſhuld haue bydden ſtyll acquytayne thought ouer great englande nere kynge brother duke yorke cared nat duke yorke prince loued eaſe lytell buſyneſſe alſo fayre lady wyfe doughter erle kent whome pleaſure duke glouceſtre ſubtyle euer demaunded ſomwhat nephue kynge rycharde yet poore great lorde conſtable englande erle hertforde perces bokyngham alſo yerely kynges cofers foure thouſande noble neuer rode kinges buſyneſſe realme one daye without knewe wherfore theſe cauſes nat indyfferent mater acquytayne wolde haue brother lancaſtre haue bydden ſtill acquitayn euer thought wolde haue ſhyfted well ynoughe englande ſoone ſayd ſentence ye haue herde ſawe ſome murmured kynges chambre prelate lordes talked togyther two two iſſued ye chambre erle derby hym came
