hall e • tham made clothe layde table ſo ſate downe dynner lefte ſtyll talkynge togyther whan duke yorke knewe dyner went kepe hym company dyner whiche made ſhorte duke glouceſtre dyſſymuled mater tooke leaue kynge ſyttynge table ſo departed toke horſe rode london erle derby abode ſtyll lordes daye nexte daye thus acquytayne coulde haue none expedicyon delyueraunce haue delyght write mater length bycauſe enfourme trouthe auctour hyſtory preſente theſe mater valyaunt knyght ſyr rycharde surye ſhewed euery thynge ſo ſonday folowynge ſuche ben departed counſaylours except duke yorke abode ſtyll kynge lorde thomas percy ſyr rycharde sury ſhewed buſyneſſe kynge kynge deſyred ſe booke brought hym ſawe chambre layde redy bedde whanne kynge opened pleaſed hym well fayre enlumyned written couered crymſon veluet ten botons ſyluer gylte roſes golde myddes two great clapſes gylte rychely wrought kyng demaunded wherof treated ſhewed hym howe treated mater loue wherof kynge gladde loked reed many place coulde ſpeke rede frenche well tooke knyght chambre named ſir rycharde creadon beare ſecrete chambre ſame ſonday fell acquayntaunce squyer englande called henry caſtyde honeſt man wyſe coude well ſpeke frenche cōpanyed bicauſe ſawe kyng lordes made good chere alſo ſene boke gaue kynge alſo ſir richarde sury ſhewed hym howe maker hyſtories ſayd foloweth ⸫ ⸫ ¶the deuyſe conqueſt kyng richarde made irlāde howe brought obeyſaunce four kynges coū trey cap ccii sir iohan quod haue ye nat founde kynges courte ſythe ye came hyder man hath tolde voyage kyng made late irlande maner foure kynges irelande come obeyſaunce kynge englande aunſwered ſhall ſhewe ꝙ ſquyer entent ye maye putte perpetuall memorie whan ye retourne owne countrey haue leyſar therto reioyſed wordes thanked hym began thus ſayd sir iohan nat memorie euer kyng englande made ſuche appareyle prouiſion iourney make warre agaynſt yriſſhmen ſuche nombre men armes archer kyng nyne monethes marcheſſe irelande great coſt charge realme bare expēſes marchaūtes cyties good townes realme thought well beſtowed whan ſawe kynge retourne home agayne honour nombre thyder getylmen archer foure thouſande knyghtes xxx thouſande archer well payde wekely euery manne well pleaſed ſhewe bycauſe ye ſhulde knowe tronthe irelande one yuell countreis worlde make warre vpon bring vnder ſubiection cloſed ſtrongely wyldely highe foreſtes great water mareſſhes place inhabytable harde entre countrey dōmage ye ſhall fynde towne perſone ſpeke wt men drawe woodes dwell caues ſmall cotagꝭ vnder tree among buſſhes hedge lyke wylde ſauage beeſtes whan knowe man maketh warre agaynſt thē entred coūtreis drawe toguyder ſtraytes paſſages defende ſo man entre thē whan ſe tyme wyll ſone take aduauntage enemyes knowe countrey lyght people man armes beyng neuer ſo well horſed ron faſt yriſſhe men wyll ryn fote faſte ouertake hym yea leape vp vpon horſe behynde hym drawe hym fro horſe ſtronge men armes haue ſharpe weapon large blade wt two edge maner darte heedes wherwith wyll ſlee enemy repute nat man deed tyll haue cutte throte opyn bely taken herte cary awaye thē ſome ſaye ſuche knowe nature eate haue great delyte therin take man raunſome whan̄e ſe encountre ouermatched wyll departe ſonder go hyde theym ſelfe buſſhes wodes hedge caues ſo man ſhall finde theym alſo ſyr wylliam wyndſore hath moſte vſed warres thoſe party englyſſhe man yet coulde neuer lerne maner ye countrey knowe condycions herde people rude engen wytte dyuers frequentacyons vſage ſette nothyng iolyte freſſhe apparell nobleneſſe though rleame ſoueraynly gouerned kynges wherof haue plentie yet wyll take knowledge gentylneſſe wyll contynewe rudeneſſe acordynge brought vp trouthe foure princypall kynges moſte puyſſaunt maner countrey come obeyſaunce kynge englande loue fayreneſſe nat batayle conſtraynte erle ormonde marcheth vpon hath taken great payne hath ſo treated came duuelyn kynge ſubmytted hym vnder obeyſaunce crowne englande wherfore kyng realme reputeth great honourable dede thynketh voyage well ſtowed kynge edwarde good memory dyd neuer ſo moche vpon kynge rycharde dyde voyage honour great profite lytell though kynges yet man deuyſe ſpeke ruder perſonages shall ſhewe ſomwhat rudeneſſe entente maye enſample agayne people nacyons knowe well haue proued ſelues whan duuelyn hadde gouernaunce moneth kynges commauudement counſayle thentent ſhulde lerne vſe ſelfe accordyng vſage englande bycauſe coulde ſpeke language well frenche englyſſhe youthe brought vp amonge theym erle ormonde father erle nowe loued right well bycauſe coulde thā ryde handell horſe metely well fortuned one tyme ſayde erle maiſter ſent thre hundred ſpeares thouſande archer marcheſſe irelande make warre yriſſhe men alwayes englyſſhe men haue warre thē ſubdue putte vnder daye ſayd erle went agaynſt thē rode goodly horſe lyght ſwyfte thus rode folowed mayſter ſame day yriſſhe men layde buſſhement whan̄e came nere theym opyned buſſhement thanne engliſſhe archer began ſhote ſo egerly yriſſhe men coulde nat ſuffre ſimply armed therfore reculed wente backe than̄e erle mayſter folowed ye chaſe well horſed folowed hym nere coude fortuned ſo horſe afrayd toke bridell tethe ranne away whether wolde nat bare ſo farforthe amonge yriſſhe men one lyghtneſſe ronnynge lepte vp behynde enbraſed armes dyde none hurt ſo ledde way ſo rode ſtyll behynde ſpace two houres laſte brought ſecrete place thycke buſſhes founde company come thyder ſcaped daungers englyſſhe men purſued nat ſo farre ſhewed great ioye ledde towne ſtrō ge houſe amonge woodes water myres towne called harpely gētylman toke called brine coſteret goodly man hath ben ſhewed yet lyue aged brine coſteret kepte ſeuyn yere hym gaue doughter maryage hadde two doughters ſhall ſhewe howe delyuered happened ſeuin yeres ende one kynges named arthur mackemur kyng lynſter made armye agaynſt duke lyon clarence ſonne kyng edwarde englande agaynſt ſir wyllm̄ wynſore nat farre fro cytie lynſter englyſſhe men yriſſhe men mette toguyder many ſlayne taken bothe party englyſſhe men opteygned vyctorie yriſſhe men fledde kyng arthur ſaued hym ſelfe brine coſteret wyues father taken priſoner vnder duke clarence baner taken ſame courſer toke horſe well knowen amonge erle ormondes folkes ſhewed howe alyue maner harpelyn howe wedded doughter wherof duke clarence ſir wylliam wynſore englyſſhe men ryght gladde than̄e ſhewed hym wolde delyuered priſon ſhulde delyuer englyſſhe mennes hādes wyfe chyldren gret payne made bargayne loued well wyfe doughter chyldren whan ſawe coulde make fynaunce none otherwyſe accorded therto reteigned myne eldeſt doughter ſtyll wyfe ſeconde doughter retourned englande ſo went dwelte beſyde briſtowe ryuer syuerne two doughters maryed ſhe irelāde hath thre ſonnes two doughters ſhe brought hath foure ſonnes two doughters bycauſe langage yriſſhe redy englyſſhe tong haue alwayes cōtynued wyfe taught child ſame ſpeche therfore kyng ſouerayne lorde counſayle cōmaunded gyue attendaūce theſe four kynges gouerne bringe reaſon vſage cuſtomes englāde ſeyng hadde yelded vnder obeyſaunce crowne englāde ſworne holde euer yet enſure dyde power enſygne lerne good maner yet ryght rude groſe engyn moche payne hadde make ſpeke thyng fayre maner ſomwhat altred nat moche many caſes drewe naturall rudeneſſe kyng ſoueraygne lordes entent maner countenaunce apparell clothyng ſhulde vſe accordyng maner englande kynge thought make four knyghtes fayre houſe lodge duuelyn charged abyde ſtyll nat departe ſo two thre dayes ſuffred lyſt ſayde nothynge folowed owne appetytes wolde ſytte table make coūtenaunce nother good fayre thought ſhulde cauſe thē chaunge maner wolde cauſe myſtrelles ſeruauntes varlettes ſytte eate owne dyſſhe drinke cuppes ſhewed vſage countre good ſayd thynges except beddes lyued cōmen fourthe day ordayned table couered hall ye vſage englande made theſe four kynges ſytte hyghe table mynſtrels another borde ſeruantes varlettes another byneth wherof ſemynge diſpleaſed behelde eche wolde nat care ſayd howe wolde take fro good vſage wherin hadde noriſſhed anſwered ſmylyng peace theym nat honourable eſtates dyde muſt leaue vſe cuſtom englande kynges pleaſure ſhulde ſo charged ſo order whan harde ſuffred bycauſe putte ſelfe vnder obeyſaūce kyng englande parceuered ſame long yet hadde one vſe whiche knewe well vſed coū tre dyde breches cauſed breches lynen clothe made whyle cauſed leaue many rude thynges aſwell clothyng cauſes moche ado fyrſt cauſe weare gownes ſylke furred myneuere gray theſe kynges thought ſelfe well apparelled whan hadde mantell rode alwayes without ſadelles ſtyropes great payne made thē ryde vſage andon tyme demaunded thē beleue wherwith nat content ſayd howe beleued god trynite aſwell demaūded pope affection aunſwered hym rome than̄e demaunded wolde nat gladly receyue order knyghthode kyng englande ſhulde make thē knyghtes accordynge vſage fraū ce englande countreis aunſwered howe knyghtes redye ſuffyced theym aſked made knyghtes howe whan anſwered yt age ſeuyn yere made knyghtes irelande kynge maketh ſonne knyght ſonne haue father alyue nexte blode maye make hym knyght than̄e yonge knyght ſhall begyn iuſte ſmall ſpeares ſuche maye beare caſe rynne agaynſt ſhelde ſette ſtake felde ſpeares breaketh ſhalbe honoured knewe maner well ynough though dyde demaū de ſayd knighthode taken youthe ſuffyced nat kynge englande ſayde ſhulde gyue theym another maner demaunded howe aunſwered ſhulde holy churche whiche mooſt worthyeſt place enclyned ſomewhat wordes within two dayes erle ormonde came thē coude right well ſpeke langage ſome landes laye thoſe party ſente kynge coū ſayle honoured hym fell ſwete communycacion demaunded howe lyked aunſwered ſayde well hath well ſhewed v vſage countrey wherfore ought thanke ſo aunſwere pleaſed well erle ormonde entred lytell lytell ſpeke order chiualry whiche kyng wolde ſhulde receyue ſhewed fro poynt poynt howe ſhulde behaue ſelfe parteygned knyghthode erles wordes pleaſed moche theſe four kynges whoſe name theſe fyrſt great ancle kyng mecte ſeconde brine thomōde kynge thomonde thyrde arthure mackequemur kynge lynſter fourthe conhue kyng cheueno darpe made knightes kyng richarde englande cathedrall churche duuelyn dedycate ſaynt iohan baptyſt done lady day marche fell thurſday theſe four kynges watched night churche nexte daye highe maſſe tyme great ſolēpnyte made knightes ſir thomas orphen ſir ioatas pado ſir iohan pado coſyn theſe kynges ſate day table kyng rycharde regarded many folkes bicauſe behauyng ſtraunge maner englande countreis euer naturally men deſyre ſe newelties ſir iohn̄ froiſſart ſayde henry beleue well wolde coſt largely ſurely yere paſt hadde come hyder hadde nat herde dethe quene anne englande whiche dyde lette one thynge wolde deſyre knowe howe theſe four kynges irelande came ſo ſoone kynge englandes obeyſaunce whan kynge edwarde kynges graunfather ſo valyaunt prince ſo redouted ouer coude neuer ſubdue putte vnder yet alwayes warre thē ſubdued nowe ye ſayd treatie grace god dede grace god good ſo haue moche worthe ſene nowe dayes erthely prince getteth lytell wt puiſſaūce deſyre know whan ſhall cōe heynalt countrey ſhalbe examyned many thynges bothe duke aubert bauier erle heynalte holande zelande alſo ſonne wyllm̄ bauyere writeth hym ſelfe lorde freſe whiche great countrey puiſſaunt whiche coūtrey ſayd duke ſonne claymeth haue ryght ſucceſſyon ſo dyde predeceſſours freſons wolde neuer fall reaſon come vnder obeyſaūce yet nat vnto day anſwered ſir henry chriſtall ſayd sir iohan ſhewe trouth nat many one ſaythe ſuppoſe yt great puiſſaū ce yt kyng ouer taryed countrey nyne monethes euery man well payed abaſſhed yriſſhe men alſo ſee cloſed fro partes wherby lyuēges marchaū diſes myght nat entre countreys thoughe dwell farre within realme cared lytell knowe natte marchaundyſe meaneth lyue groſely rudely like vnto beeſtes yet ſuche lyueth marcheſſe england see cooſt vſe feate marchaundyſe v place kynge edwarde noble memorie tyme anſwere ſo many warres fraūce bretayne gaſcone scotlande ſo people deuyded dyuers place ſore occupyed wherfore coude nat ſende great nombre irelande whan iryſſhmen ſawe ye great nombre men warre kyng rycharde hadde irelande laſte iourney yriſſhmen aduyſed ſelfe came obeyſaūce dede olde tyme kyng englāde named edwarde ſaynt canonyſed honoured realme tyme ſubdued dane diſconfyted batayle see thre tymes ſaint edwarde kyng englande lorde irelande acquitayn yriſſhmen loued dredde hym moche kyng englande therfore ſouerayne lorde kyng richarde yere paſt whan irelande armory deuyſes lefte beryng armes englande lybardes flour delyces quarterly bare armes ſaynt edwarde croſſe patent golde goules four white martenettes felde wherof ſaid yriſſhmen well pleaſed ſoner enclyned hym trouthe ye predeceſſours theſe four kynges obeyed faithe homage ye ſayd kyng edwarde repute kynge richarde good man good cōſcience ſo haue done hym faithe homage ought like maner predeceſſours ſōtyme dyde ſaynt edwarde thus haue ſhewed maner kyng ſouerayne lorde hath yere accomplyſſhed furnyſſhed voyage ireland put memoriall entent whan ye ſhall retourne owne countrey ye may write cronicle many hyſtories depende ſame matter thanked hym ſayd ſhulde done toke leaue hym mette marche heraulde demaūded hym armes henry chriſtell bare ſhewed heraulde howe ſir henry ſhewed maner kynges torney irelande ſtate foure kynges ben ſayd gouernyng fyftene dayes duuelyn heraulde anſwered ſayd sir beareth armes syluer cheuerne goules thre beſans goules theſe thyngꝭ dyde putte writynge bycauſe wolde nat forgette thus taryed kynge englandes courte longe pleaſed nat always one place kynge often tymes remoued eltham lede kyngſtone shene charſey wyndſore aboute marcheſſe london enformed trouthe kyng wrote vncle duke lancaſtre acquitayne ſpedde ſo buſyneſſe countrey abode ſtyll crowne englande than̄e concluded generall counſayle englande gyfte kynge hadde gyuen duke lancaſtre muſt nedes abyde ſtyll owne howe duke glouceſtre wolde brother myght haue enioyed kynges gyfte ſaying coulde nat herde caſe realme englande bycauſe doutes caſualtyes tyme come herde well wordes theym burdeaux bayone conſydred well yf herytage acquitaygne putte fro crowne englande ſhulde tyme come great preiudice realme whiche wolde wiſe ſhulde fortune alwayes burdeux bayon frōters march gaſcon kept augmented greatly honour realme englande theſe thyngꝭ well cōſydred wyſe men kynges coūſayle ye duke glouceſtre abſent hym man durſt ſpeke ſo mater abode caſe ¶we ſhall leaue matter ſpeke kynge englandes ambaſſadours erle rutlande therle marſhall ſente fraunce treate maryage bytwene kynge rycharde lorde doughter charles frenche kyng eyght yeres age ſhall ſhewe howe ſpedde ⸫ ⸫ ¶of ambaſſade kynge englande ſente fraunce treate maryage bytwene lady iſable frēche kynges eldeſt doughter hym ſelfe louyng anſwere capi cciii theſe englyſſhe lordes rode fro calais amyence clermount beauuoſyn ſo parys ī euery place well receyued cōmaundement frenche kyng lodged yt croſſe tyrouer fyue hundred horſes frenche kynge lodged caſtell lour quene chyldren houſe ſaynt poule vpon ryuer seyne duke berrey houſe neſle duke burgoyne houſe arthoyſe duke burbone owne houſe duke orlyaūce erle ſaynt poule lorde coucy owne houſes kynge aſſembled counſayle entent make better anſwere thembaſſadours englande kyng cōmaūded euery day ſhulde delyuered theſe ambaſſadours two hūdred crownes frā ce ſmall expences horſes chiefe theſe englyſſhe lordes erle marſhall therle rutlāde often tymes kynge dyned hym good coulde deuyſed loue kynge englāde theſe lordes deſyred euer haue anſwere euer fedde forthe fayre wordes noble men fraunce great marueyle requeſtes englyſſhe men kynge englande wolde marry fraunce ſeynge warre ben ſo cruell ſo long endured ſome frenche kynges counſayle ſayd howe maye kyng agree gyue doughter maryage aduerſary treatie ſhulde made thynke ſhall haue peace englande ſome wayes though nat meanes maryage yt tyme valyaunt knyght frenche kynges counſayle called ſir raynalt corby farre caſtyng man conſydred myght fall tyme come than̄e ſayd kyng vncles lordes mayſters man ſhulde entre ryght dore houſe ſemeth kyng richarde englāde wolde nothyng realme loue fauour ſeynge reaſon maryage wolde alye hym two tymes counſaylours haue mette toguyder amyence balyngham treate peace yet coulde neuer take good concluſyon ſtate truce ſir well knowen thomas duke glouceſtre kyng richardes vncle cō trary opinyon againſt ye king two vncles duke lācaſtre yorke kyng nat make hym agre wyllingly haue peace howe puiſſaunce canne natte reſyſt kynges power therfore ſir myne opynyon receyue offre refuce nat treatie let theſe lordes haue ſuche aunſwere maye cōtent kyng vncles agreed therto ſpecially duke burgoyne ſo ſore charged reaſon warres yt gladly wolde haue peace prīcypall cauſe bycauſe flaū ders wherof claymed lorde reaſon wyfe bycauſe countrey marched vpon englande alſo hertes flemynges rather englyſſhe frenche bycauſe entrecourſe marchaundyſe bytwene england flaunders see lande concluded frenche kynges counſayle ſhulde good made englyſſhmen whether diſſymulacyon otherwyſe frenche men determyned make good ſwere aunſwere engliſſhe men put hope kynge englande ſhulde haue deſyre quene chyldren laye houſe faynt powleꝭ englyſſhe lordes deſyred ſe theym graunted ſpecyally ſe whome treatie ſhewed muſte content howe ſo euer founde ſayde ſhe yonge chylde eyght yere age wherfore ſayd coulde nat great wyſdome prudence howe ſhe indoctryned well ynough lordes founde well whan ſawe erle marſhall beynge knee ſayde fayre lady grace god ye ſhall lady quene englande aunſwered yonge lady well aduyſedly without counſayle perſon syr quod ſhe pleaſe god lorde father ſhall quene englande ſhall glad therof ſhewed ſhall great lady ſhe toke vp erle marſhall hande ledde quene mother great ioy anſwere ſhe made ſo herde maner countenaunce behauoure yonge lady pleaſed greatly ambaſſadours ſayd amonge ſelfe ſhe lykely lady hygh honoure great goodneſſe thus whan theſe lordes englande ben parys twenty dayes coſtes charge payed frenche kynge reaſonable aunſwere gyuen ſo put great hope bringe aboute came howe frenche men ſayd coulde nat doone ſhortly bycauſe lady ſo yonge alſo ſhe fyanſed duke bretayns eldeſt ſonne wherfore ſayd muſt treat breke promeſſe coude procede mater thervpon frenche kynge counſayle ſhulde ſende englande next lent ſhewe howe matter wente whan dayes begyn encreace waxe fayre kynge englande ſende agayne fraunce whome ſhulde pleaſe hym ſhulde welcome aunſwere englyſſhe men contented toke leaue quene doughter kynge departed fro paris toke ſame way came ſo retourned calays englande two erles rode poſt company bringe tydynges kyng▪ rode fro sandwiche wynd ſore leſſe thanne daye halfe kynge ryght ioyouſe comynge well contente frenche kynges aunſwere ſet mater ſo herte toke great pleaſure therin tooke hede none thynge ſtudyed howe myght bringe aboute haue frenche kinges doughter wyfe otherſyde frenche kynge counſayle ſtudyed daye nyght howe myght make maryage englande honour realme fraunce many realme fraunce ſayd called theſe treatyes wordes herde kynge englande ſhulde neuer haue doughter fraunce maner peace good ſhulde fraunce ſeynge trewce bytwene endured two yere come ſhall fall agayne warre eche v hate haue doone duke berrey orlyance ſame opynion dyuers lordes fraūce king duke burgoyne chauncellour fraunce enclyned maryage gladde haue peace reſeruyng alwayes honour realme ſame tyme ſquier fraunce nacyon normandy countrey caulx dayes ben ſore traueyled farre party newly retourned fraūce name robert le menuot called robert hermyte relygyous good lyfe age fyfty yere treaty holden balyngham whiche tyme well herde howe entred treatie ſhall ſhewe ⸪ ¶of squyer named roberte hermyte howe ſente treaty peace holden balyngham howe ſente englande kynge rycharde vncles cap cciiii whan roberte hermyte returned fraūce party surey toke ſhyppyng baruch whyle vpon ſee great tempeſt wynde roſe ſuche wyſe feared peryſſhed euery man tell make prayer god ende tempeſt wether began waxe fayre clere apered robert ye hermyte ymage clere cryſtall ſayd thu • robert thou ſhalte iſſue eſcape parell thy company loue god hath herde thyne oriſons prayer ſendeth worde thou ſhuldeſt make haſt fraunce go kynge ſhewe thyne aduenture ſay vnto wyſe enclyne haue peace aduerſary kynge rycharde englande amonge treater peace preace thou forthe ſhewe thyne aduyſyon thou ſhalte herde ſay ſuche contrary opinyon againſt peace ſhall bye derely lyfe tyme worlde therwith ye clereneſſe voyce vanyſſhed away robert abode great ſtudy remembred well hadde ſene herde deuyne inſpyracyon aduenture fayre wether wynde wyſſhynge aryued ryuer gennes robert hermyte toke leaue company went lande fro thence tyll came auygnon fyrſt thynge dyd went churche ſaynt peter foūde good vertuous man penytenſer hym cōfeſſed ſhewed hym aduenture demaunded counſayle beſt gooſtly father charged hym wyſe ſhulde ſpeke nothynge mater tyll ſhewed fyrſte frenche kynge loke counſayle kynge dyd gyue ſo robert folowed counſayle arayed hym ſelfe ſymple habyte gray ſo poorely departed fro auygnon iourneyed ſo longe came parys kynge abbeuyle treatie beganne balyngham bytwene frenche men englyſſhe men ye haue herde robert came abuyle drewe kynge knyght acquayntaunce brought kyng whiche knyght normandy called ſir willyam martell kynges priuy chambre roberte hermyte ſhewed kynge hole iourney aduēture kyng herde hym well bycauſe duke burgoyne ſyr raynolde corby chauncellour fraunce kynges opynyon haue peace balyngham ye treatie holden kynge ſayd robert counſayle nowe nat balyngham ye ſhall abyde whan retourned ſhall ſpeke myne vncle burgoyne chauncelloure ſhall mater ſhall aduyſe ſyr quod robert god wyll ſo ſame weke frenche kynges counſayle returned fro balyngham abbeuyle brought artycles maner peace whiche englyſſhe men deuyſed mater ſo weyghty treatie put ouer tyll another daye vnto ſuche tyme bothe kynges aduertyſed eche others demaundes pleaſures therin knowen ye frenche partie frenche kynge drewe parte vncle burgoyne chauncellour ſhewed enfourmacyon robert hermyt made vnto kynge demaunded thynge lyſytte lawfull beleue ſtudyed lytell laſt ſayde syr requyre youre grace lette v ſe hermyte hym ſpeke thervpon wyll take aduyſe ſent whan came kynge made reuerence thanne kynge ſayd roberte ſhewe v length hole mater ye enfourmed sir quod gladly nothynge abaſſhed reherſed hole mater ye haue herde whan doone departed kynge aſked vncle beſt done syr quod chauncellour ſhall take aduyſe agaynſt morowe well quod kynge ſo duke chauncellour counſayled togyther mater ſawe well kynge greatly enclyned robertes wordes therfore thought good aduyſe kynge ioyne robert cōmyſſion go agayne balyngham treatie peace thought langage ſo fayre ſo ſwete ſhulde ſtyrre harte ſhulde hym ſpeke haue peace ſhewe deuyne vyſion lordes englande thought lawfull ynough done nexte day ſhewed king whan duke chauncellour wente agayne balyngham roberte whan lordes frenche englyſſhe aſſembled togyder counſayle robert came well wiſely declared vyſion hadde ſee affermed inſpyracyon deuyne ſente god bycauſe wolde ſhulde ſo lordes englande toke good hede mater enclyned therto duke lancaſtre erle salyſbury lorde thomas percy byſſhops lyncolne london duke glouceſtre erle arundell toke hede ſet nothynge therby whan lodgynges ſayd fantaſies wordes fayned frenchman abuſe howe determyned write kynge rycharde maner ſayenge robert hermyte thervpon ſent knyght called rycharde credon kynge rychardeꝭ founde kent caſtell leades delyuered letter ſent fro ambaſſadours march calays wherin conteyned hole ſayenge robert kynge tooke great pleaſure theſe letter ſayd howe wolde gladly ſpeke robert hermyte beleued vyſion trouthe kyng wrote agayne duke lancaſtre erle salyſbury myght meanes good peace myght taken bytwene hym frenche kynge realmes alyes ſayde ſurely thought warre ouerlonge endured tyme haue peace ye haue herd howe treater bare lordes departed one fro another howe treuce taken endure foure yere entent lordes englyſſh party except duke glouceſtre thought whan ſo euer came englande neuer agree peace bytwene fraunce englande dyſſimuled moche might thentent pleaſe king brother lancaſtre thus meanes roberte le hermyte came knowledge ye haue herde erle rutlande therle marſhall archebyſſhop dunelyn lorde hugh spenſer lorde lewes clyfforde ſent fraunce treate kynge rychardes maryage retourned agayne englande brought kynge good tydynges ſo kynge well pleaſed ye haue herde mychelmas came generall coūſayle began ſuche englyſſhe men call terme wherin mater debated begynnynge ſayd terme duke lancaſtre returned gaſcon englande nat ben receyued thought ſhulde haue ye haue herde whan duke lancaſtre retourned kyng made hym good chere tydinges anone came fraunce howe duke lancaſtre retourned englande frenche kynge counſayle determyned ſende robert hermyte englande letter kynge deſyred ſe hym erle ſaynt poll ſhulde acquaynte hym ye kyng lordes myght hym ſpeake buſyneſſe surey tartary greate turke turkey ben longe thought lordes englande wolde gladly ſpeakyng ſuche mater robert hermyte warned make hym redy go englande cōmyſſion wherof greatly reioyſed bycauſe neuer letter delyuered hym dyrected kyng englande vncles thus robert departed fro parys ſeuen horſes coſt charge frenche kynge rode tyll came boloyne tooke ſee aryued douer ſpedde ſo iourneys came eltham founde kynge duke lancaſtre erles salyſbury huntyngdon lorde thomas percy honour frenche kynge well receyued ſpecyally kynge deſyred greatly ſe hym delyuered letter credence whiche redde ouer kynge lordes duke glouceſtre nat • eſſex caſtell called plaſſhey whan robert kynge duke lancaſtre eltham fyue day departed then goſe duke glouceſtre ſo toke leaue kynge lordes came london next day rode fyftene myle fro london towne called brendwode next day plaſſhey founde duke ducheſſe chyldren ryght goodly receyued hym acordyng degre robert delyuered hym letter ſent fro frenche kyng whan duke ſawe credence drewe robert parte demaunded credence robert aunſwered hym ſayd ſyr ſhall ſhewe therin good leyſer nat come departe agayne ſo ſoone well quod duke ye welcome robert knewe well ynough duke glouceſtre ſore dyſlymulynge prince contrary peace thought harde breke hym fro opinyon knewe well alwaies contrary peace whiche well ſene treaty balyngham neuer demaunded haue warre yet robert hermyte ſpared nat ſpeke duke forme peace alwayes founde duke colde aunſwers ſayd mater lay nat hym two elder bretherne duke lancaſtre duke yorke whome mater partayned rather hym alſo wolde conſent therto alone peraduenture lordes prelate counſaylours good townes wolde nat accepte well quod robert hermyte loue lorde iheſu chriſt ye nat contrarye peace ye maye moche alſo ye ſe well howe kyng nephue enclyneth peace wyll maryage haue frenche kynges doughter whiche coniunctyon ſhalbe gret alyaunce peace loue duke aunſwered ſayd though ye beleued herde tyme kynges lordes bothe realmes ye haue good audyēce counſaylours mater ſo hygh weyghty conuenyent greater perſonages ye ſhulde • le therwith haue tolde often tymes haue ſaid ſhall neuer contrary peace ſo honoure kynge realme englande tyme paſte peace taken bytwene king father brother prince wale kinge iohan fraūce frenche party ſworne bounde vppon payne ſentence pope yet helde nat frenchman fraudulently haue broken couenauntes haue taken agayne poſſeſſyon landes lordeſhyppes yelded delyuered peace makyng ſayd ſouerayne lorde father predeceſſours moreouer ſōme xxx thouſande frankes redempcyon mounted vnto yet paye ſyxe hūdred thouſande frankes wherfore ſuch mater remembre troubleth ſore corages many realme marueyle greatly howe kynge ſouerayne lorde leaneth ſo yonge aduyſe counſayle regardeth none otherwyſe tyme paſſed tyme preſent enclineth alye hym maryage aduerſary alyaunce dyſheryte crowne englande ſucceſſours come ye clayme fraunce ah ryght dere lorde quod robert lorde ieſu chriſt ſuffered paſſyon croſſe v ſynners pardoned dethe crucyfied lykewyſe man muſt pardon wyll come glory heuen ſir yuell wylles hate rancoures pardoned daye peace made ſealed calays predeceſſours nowe warres haue game newly renewed bytwene men thynke ſurely faulte bothe party whan prince wale duke acquytayne retourned spayne acquytayne certayne maner people callyng themſelfe companyons wherof moſte partye englyſſhe men gaſcons holdynge kynge englande prince wale theſe people aſſembled togyther entred realme fraunce without tytell reaſon wherby enſued mortall eruell warre greater theſe companyons called realme fraunce chambre ſo ſet yuell dedes yt coude nat reſyſted whan ye realme fraūce ſawe felte ſo harmed people ſawe well lengar contynewed multyplyed hurte dyd kyng charles fraūce ſonne kyng iohan coūſayled ſubgiettes reſyſt ſubdue ſuche enemyes outher warre otherwyſe many great baron gaſcoyne came frenche kyng ſuche ſaid ſore ouerlayde lorde prince wale many iniuryes done thē whiche ſhewed frenche kynge might nat wolde nat ſuffre lenger ſo beganne warre bycauſe reſorte prince wale kynge charles counſayle ſubgiettes enhardyed himſelfe warre theſe barones gaſcoyn mete againſt theſe companyons newe warre many lordes retourned frenche kynge dyuers lordeſhyppes cyties townes caſtels great oppreſſion prince wale dyd thē conſented done cōmyſſioners thus warre renewed wherby many great myſchyefes haue fallen dyſtruction moche people countreys faythe chriſt ſore febled decayed enemyes god ryſſen coraged haue redy conquered moche parte grece emperour conſtantynople hath nat power reſyſt puyſſaūce great turke called baſant lamorabaquyn hathe conquered realme armony excepte onely towne ſtandynge ſee ſyde called tourche whiche venyſians genouoys kepe agaynſt ye turke emperour conſtantyne noble blode ſonne emperoure hugues luzignen lady mary burbon coſyn germayne lady quene mother ſhall nat able longe reſyſt puyſſaūce gret turke peace maye bytwene englande fraunce truſt grace god ſhall knyghtes ſquyers ſuche demaunde dedes armes aduauncement ſhall drawe parte ſhall helpe kynge lyon armony recouer agayne herytage put turkes ſurely warre hath ouerlonge endured bytwene fraunce englande ſurely ſo euer wyll againſt peace ſhall derely aunſwere therto outher quycke deed howe knowe quod duke glouceſtre syr quod robert ſay cometh dyuyne inſpyracyon vyſione came vpon ſee retourned fro baruch • porte surey beſyde iſle rodes declared hole vyſion rather therby moue duke herte pytie reaſon duke herde herted agaynſt peace kept ſtyll opynion wordes condempned diſpyſed greatly frenche men yt euer robert hermyte coude ſay bycauſe robert ſtraū ger ſhewed wordes werkes wolde well alſo bycauſe duke ſawe kyng nephue enclyned haue peace dyſſymuled ſpake fayre ſo euer herte thought two dayes robert taryed plaſſhey duke good chere thyrde day departed retourned london fro thence wyndeſore kynge made hym good chere loue frenche kyng ſent thyder bycauſe wyſe eloquēt ſwete wordes honeſt nat doubted kynge demaūded hym howe founde vncle duke gloceſtre robert anſwered well poynte kyng knewe well vncle glouceſtre enclyned rather warre peace wherfore fauoured moche better two vncles duke lancaſtre yorke whan robert hermyte ben moneth king toke leaue departynge kynge gaue hym great gyftes ſo dyd duke lancaſtre yorke erles huntyngdon salyſbury lorde thomas percy kynge cauſed hym conueyed douer paſſed ouer fraunce founde frenche kyng quene vncles paris ſhewed kinge voyage good chere englande thus dayly meſſangers went bytwene theſe two kynges amyable letter ſent bytwene kynge englande deſyred nothyng ſo moche come maryage ſemblably frenche kynge lyke deſyre thought doughter ſhulde great eſtate ſhe might quene englande ¶of delyueraunce lorde de la ryuer ſyr iohan le mercyer howe put priſone cap ccv ye haue herde howe ye lorde de la ryuer ſir iohan le mercyer ieoperdy lyues remoued fro priſon priſon laſte delyuered prouoſt chatelet parys poynte loſe lyues hate enuye duke berrey burgoyne counſayle daunger two yere kyng ſocoured thē always ſtopped execuſion duke berrey burgoyne ſawe well alſo perceyued duke orlyaunce ayded moche might alſo duches berrey good meane ſpecially ye lorde de la ryuer alſo one coulde nat condempned without accuſed one cauſe prayer good folkes ryght togyther ayded theym regarded many high barones fraūce pytie ſayd ſuffred priſonement ouerlonge tyme ſhewe grace iohan le mercyer ſo moche wept priſon yt ſyght ſore decayed ſo coude ſcant ſe brute ranne realme blynd laſt ſentence gyuen grace kynge lorde de la ryuer reſtored agayne landes caſtels ye fayre caſtell aniou charged payne lyfe whan one caſtell aniowe ſhuld neuer repaſſe ryuer sayne without cōmaunded kynges owne mouthe ſyr iohan le mercyer retourne poūte de nonnon fayre houſe laonnoys nat repaſſe ryuer oyſe marne seyne without lykewyſe called kynges owne mouth thus bounde ſelfe take priſonment thought great grace ſcape ſo well ryght ioyouſe whan delyuered fro chatelet truſted whan came priſon haue ſpoken ye kynge haue thanked hym grace coulde nat ſuffred cōmaunded auoyde parys reſorte thyder cōmaūded thus delyuered wherof frendes great ioy ¶of peace hadde bytwene duke bretayne ſir olyuer clyſſon cap ccvi ye haue herde howe duke bretayne ſyr olyuer cliſſon warred longe togyther mortally bytwene toke none mercy ſurely ſyr olyuer clyſſon partie bare ſo valyaūtly thre twayne lordes bretaygne dyſſimnied duke men cyties good townes ſayde howe muſt nedes lyue vſe marchaundyſe ſo euer warre bytwene duke ſyr olyuer clyſſon ſayd touched nothinge wherfore wolde nat entermed • e bytwene euer vycount rohan lorde de leo • lorde dignan treated peace bytwene moch purſewed duke promyſed entreated ſo myght ſe ſyr olyuer preſence ſpeke thervpon theſe lordes day rode fortreſſe ſyr olyuers ſpeke ſhewed cauſe • come thyder howe got graūt duke ſende ſafeconducte ſafely go come ſpeke hym ſayeng yt ſurely thought one preſence yuell wyll diſpleaſures ſhulde clerely pardoned ſir olyuer ſayd sir ye frendes louers truſt great lye beleue duke hath promyſed ſaye thynke wolde gladly ſe preſēce ſo good helpe ſaynt yue vpon worde promiſe enſure wyll nat one iſſue houſe ſhall tell ye ſhall ſaye hym wyll haue come hym let hym ſende hyder pledge eldeſt ſonne whan than̄e wyll go ſpeke hym ſuche ende ſhall make ſonne ſhall make yf retourne ſhall lykewiſe abyde ſhall abide whan theſe lordes ſawe coude haue none ende tooke leaue retourned wannes duke ſhewed euery thynge herde duke coude haue none waye ſir olyuer bare hym ſelfe ſo valyauntly warre wanne loſt toke two tymes duke veſſell plate golde ſyluer dyuers iewelles wherof hadde great profyte concluſyon warre hate bytwene duke bretayne ſir olyuer clyſſon thus duke bretayne lyke great lorde ſawe well coude nat come entent ſir olyuer clyſſon ouer many frendes bretayne ſauyng alegiaūce ye duchy bretayne breton knyghtes ſquyers prelate men good cyties good townes enclyned lorde clyſſon duke highe baron diſſymuled aunſwered duke wolde nat entremedle warre ſayde wolde gladly ſette peace accorde bytwene thē alſo duke orlyaunce ſpecially conforted couertly many maner wayes ſir olyuer clyſſon alwayes ioyous whan herde good ſpede entreprices duke bretaygne ſubtyle prince ymaginatyfe endured moche payne duryng warre ſawe well nat well beloued owne people chyldren lorde charles bretayne one called charles bloyes ſlayne batayle alroy iohn̄ bretayne erle ponthieur lymogines wyfe doughter ſir olyuer cliſſon lorde henry bretayne brother ſuſter quene naples hieruſalem alſo duke ſawe began waxe olde chyldren yonge ꝑceyued well frendes fraūce except duke burgoyne duches wyfe ſawe well chyldren ſhulde haue fewe mother ſyde came iſſued membres braunches nauer whiche generacion nat ouermoche loued fraunce great myſcheues yt kynge charles nauerre father ducheſſe bretayne done tyme paſt fraunce wherof remembraunce endured duke ſawe dyed eſtate bothe ſir olyuer cliſſon erle ponthieur douted chyldren ſo yonge ſhulde haue ouer many great enemyes alſo ſawe alyaunce bytwene hym englande began waxe colde enformed kynge englande ſhulde haue wyfe doughter fraūce theſame lady promyſed hym ſonne heyre duke dyde caſt theſe doutes than̄e thynges conſydered ymagined breke herte without diſſimulacion make ferme peace ſir olyuer clyſſon iohan bretayne wolde putte hym ſelfe pleaſure make amendes wrathes forfaytes dōmages euer dyde hym men duryng warre wolde deſyre nothynge ſhulde take hym duke bretayne child hym accordyng artycles peace made bytwene hym chyldren ſir charles bloyes whiche charter peace wolde nat breke artycle compriſed therin alſo kepe vpholde euery thyng promyſed iohn̄ bloyes coſyn erle pōponthieur hadde nat parte herytage bretayne ſuffycient wolde putte ordring therof without diſſymulacion vicount rohan lordes dignan leon lauall beaumont lorde iohn̄ harpeden whan duke bretayne aduyſed hym ſelfe purpoſe without makynge man counſayle called hym ſecratorie chabre two alone cauſed hym write letter ſir olyuer clyſſon ſwetely amiably coude deuyſed deſyring hym might ſpeke toguyder ſecretely truſt haue good peace bytwene thē whan letter made deuyſed ſealed toke ſecrete perſon cōmaundyng hym go caſtell ioſſelyn ſaye ſende ſpeke coſyn ſir olyuer clyſſon ſalute hym fro delyuer hym letter bring agayne anſwere payne thy ly • e kepe ſecrete ſhewe creature whider thou goſt dothe ſende tooke iourney ſpedde hym ſo well cāe caſtell ioſſelyn porter marueyle whan herde hym ſaye cae fro duke ſpeke maiſter wente ſhewed lorde therof cōmaunded meſſanger ſhulde cōe hym ſo dyde well wiſely declared meſſage delyuered letter ſealed duke ſeale whiche ſir olyuer knewe ryght well opyned reed letter two thre tymes better vnderſtande redyng great marueyle ſwete wordes cretable amyable compriſed letter ſtudyed ſeaſon laſt ſayd howe wolde take aduyſe write agayne ſir olyuers men hadde great marueyle forborne man duke outher ſlayne putte priſone than̄e ſir olyuer wente lecrete chambre began muſe ymagyn vpon theſe newes laſt apeſed yuell wyll ye duke humyled hymſelfe ſo moche towardes wrote ſo ſwetely yet thought hym ſelfe proue duke aduentured hym ſelfe go duke thought toke hurte man wolde bewayle hym loſt hym ſelfe folly wrote letter duke ryght ſwete tretable concluſyon yf wolde haue hym come ſpeke hym ſhuld ſende ſon̄e heyre lye hoſtage hym tyll retourne letter delyuered duke varlet retourned therwith wannes duke delyuered letter duke reed ſtudyed lytell ſayd ſhall entence treate louyngly hym thē duke wrote letter vycount rohan caſtell cayre whan vycount ſawe duke letter came incontynent wannes duke ſhewed purpoſe entencyon ſayd vycount lorde mountburſier ſhall leade ſon̄e caſtell ioſſelyn leaue hym bringe lorde olyuer clyſſon wyll agree make peace hym vicoūt ſayd ſhulde done gladly toke duke ſonne heyre age eight yere ledde hym ye caſtell ioſſelyn lorde olyuer clyſſon receyued ryght honorably whan ſawe chylde good affection duke humyled apeſed herte greatlye knyghtes tolde hym ſayd ſir ye ſe good wyll duke hath ſpoken nothyng hert dothe agre ſame ſe well quod ſir olyuer ſe ꝑceyue good wyll ſhall put ſo farforthe ſhall yelde vnder obeyſaunce ſemeth ye ryght nere hym ſeynge putteth affiaunce truſt delyuer heyre bringe lye hoſtage tyll retourned wotte nat haue ſhewed hath written ſygned ſealed ſeale lordes anſwered ſaid sir hath well tolde v hath ryght great deſyre come peace accorde ye maye right well beleue v blode than̄e ſir olyuer went letter duke ſent hym reed sir quod conteyned letter hath ſaid vnto v vpon ſame eſtate hath ſent v hyder ſir olyuer ordaygned hym departe ſayd lordes toke duke ſonne agayne ſaid howe ſhulde bringe agayne chylde father ſayeng truſted right well ꝓmyſe cō ſydring proued hym ſo farre ſhewed ſuche humilyte douted nat herte vnyte came wannes duke apoynted ſir olyuer ſhulde tary freres without towne wannes duke ſhulde come ſpeke hym ordayned ſo done whan duke ſawe ſir olyuer brought agayne ſonne heyre reputed great curteſy well content therwt thus duke ſir olyuer mette freres two alone entred chambre cōmuned toguyder ſeaſon iſſued gardeyn came ryuer ſyde entred bote fro then entred ſhyppe laye ancre ſo whan farre fro people cōmuned longe ſeaſon toguyder wordes knowe nat dealynge ſhall ſhewe men went hadde ſtyll freres ſhewed thus ſhyppe two houres made good peace bytwene ſware faythe trouth eche without diſſymulacyon called agayne ye boteman brought agayne ſo entred agayne gardeyne ſyde freres anone duke cāe ledde ſir olyuer clyſſon ye hande ſo went towne wannes caſtell called le mote peace euery man greatly reioyſed ſe ſo amiably togyder ſo countrey makyng peace iohn̄ bloyes erle ponthieur loſt nat reuenewes therby augmented twētie thouſande crownes golde yere euer hym heyres peace maryage ordayned ye duke bretaynes doughters confyrme better loue alyaunces bytwene great newes ran fraunce englande peace ye haue herde howe ſir peter craon fell frenche kynges diſpleaſure duke orlyaunce bycauſe ſir olyuer clyſſon wolde haue ſlayne hym nyght went houſe warde howe duke bretayne ſuſteyned hym houſe whiche occaſyon frēche kyng wolde haue made warr̄ agaynſt duke ſickeneſſe tooke hym nat whiche incydentes kynges army brake vp alſo ye haue herde howe duke berrey burgoyne bare great diſpleaſure ſuche counſayled kyng therto ſir olyuer clyſſon lorde de la ryuer lorde iohan le mercyer montague afterwarde endured therby great priſonment howe two duke gouernaūce realme long kynge ſickeneſſe alſo hath ben ſhewed mortall warre bytwene duke bretaygne ſir olyuer clyſſon alſo howe lordes de la ryuer ſir iohan mercyer montague delyuered priſone whiche montague nat ſo moche trouble ſoone kyng returned helth toke mō tague agayne hym made excuſe reaſon theſe ſōdrie ſickeneſſes kyng dyuers tymes gretly troubled realme fraūce moche abated kynges puiſſaunce ſo nat euery thyng done accordyuge wyll ſeaſon ſir peter craon nothyng diſpleaſed kynges ſickeneſſe trouble counſayle hadde howe made ſute retourne agayne kynges fauour loue duke burgoyne lorde guy tremoyle aduocates treate hym lightly peace made duke orlyaunce nat ben letted treatie longe hate eudured bytwene ſir olyuer clyſſon duke bretaygne ſir peter craon coude come peace accorde whā ſurely knowen pea made bytwene duke ſir olyuer thā quarell agaynſt ſir peter craon molyfied well apeaſed ſame ſeaſon quene iane naples hieruſalem duches aniou plee parlyament agaynſt ſir peter craon ye ſōme cm frākes lady lay ſtyll paris better entende buſyneſſe ſir peter craon yt ſawe hym ſelfe yt dāger ſute ꝑlyament knewe nat howe buſyneſſe ſhulde paſſe outher hym agaynſt hym ladyes partie ſtrong good profe receyued money dayes kyng loyes huſbāde theſe thynges cōſydred ymagyned yt nat eaſy beare alſo knewe well hate frenche kyng duke orlyaunce duke ducheſſe burgoyne cōforted ayded hym aſmoche myght gate ſuche grace paris ſecretly houſe arthoys duches burgoyne ¶nowe ſhall leaue ſpeke hym tyme ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe kyng hungry wrote frenche kynge ſtate great turke howe iohn̄ burgoyn eldeſt ſonne duke burgoyne chefe heed army went thider cap ccvi ſayd ſeaſon hē ry kyng hūgry ſent ſwete amyable letter ye frē che king notable ambaſſade byſſhop ii knightes hungry ſame letter cōteyned great parte ye ſtate doyng great turke ſent worde kynge hungry yt wolde come fight hym ye myddes realme wolde go fro then cytie rome wolde make horſe eare otes vpon high auter ſaynt peter holde ſee imperyall wolde bringe emperour conſtantyne noble cōpany great baron realme grece eche thē kepe ſtyll owne lawe deſyred nothynge tytell ſignorie thus kyng hūgry letter prayed frenche kyng entende ayde ſocour buſineſſe farre coūtreis might publiſſhed abrode thentent knightes ſquyers myght prouyde come hungry reſyſt agaynſt lamorabaquy great turke thentent yt chriſtendome ſhulde nat violated pride boſt myght abated theſe letter conteygned many wordes great loue kynges coſyns write eche caſe neceſſyte ſente ſuffycient perſonages dyde ſo moche frenche kynge enclyned hert therto gladder ſette forwarde treatie ye mariage doughter kynge englande anone theſe newes hungry publyſſhed abrode written many countreis moue hertes gentylmen knightes ſquiers ſuche wolde auaunce get honour ſame ſeaſon theſe newes brought kyng parys duke burgoyne ducheſſe iohan burgoyne ſonne heyre erle neuers knyght lorde guye tremoyle lorde wyllyam brother many lordes realme fraunce duke burgoyne enclyned ſore viage ſpecially ſon̄e ſhulde enterprice ſayd voyage ſo myght chefe heed leader army ſhulde go viage iohan burgoyne yonge man age xxii yeres wyſe curteſſe tretable humble welbeloued knyghtes ſquyers burgone nacyons ſuche knewe hym wyfe doughter duke aubert bauier erle heynalte hollande zelāde good lady wyſe deuout two chyldren full lykely come great maryages one ſhewed iohan burgoyne howe frenche kyng wolde ſende hym voyage hungry ſe wolde ſaye ſayd pleace kynge duke father ſende chiefe armye ſhall pleaſe ryght well haue great deſyre auaunce ſelfe well ſir quod ye beſt ſpeke duke youre father maye ſpeke kynge without good wyll ye nothynge nat long iohan burgoyne ſpake father prayeng hym humbly conſent yt myght go voyage hungry ſame tyme hym ſir guye ſir wyllyam tremoyle ſaid duke sir requeſt ſonne maketh reſonable tyme take order knighthode nobly nat take goyng iourney agaynſt enemyes holy churche kynge wyll ſende perſonage voyage nat ſende honorable man than̄e owne coſyn germayne ſonne ye ſhall ſe many knyghtes go hym well owne auaūcementes loue duke ſaid well ſo ſhall nat lette good wyll ſonne ſhall ſpeke kyng therin ſhall ſe anſwere wyll make anone duke ſpake kynge therin kynge incontynent enclyned therto ſayd howe ſhulde well done went wyll ſhall go wyll make hym chefe iourney ye tidyngꝭ ſhewed throughe parys without iohan burgoyne great company knyghtes ſhulde go hungry ſe puyſſaunce great turke iourney atchyued thanne chriſten men go conſtātyne noble paſſe ouer arme ſaynt george ſo entre surrey delyuer hieruſalem panyms handes awaked ſuche knyghtes ſquyers deſyred aduauncement whan duke burgoyne ſawe ſonne ſhulde go voyage ſhulde chiefe army honored ambaſſadours hungry whan ſawe kynges good wyll duke frenchman gladde toke leaue kynge lordes fraunce ſo retourned countrey made relacyon ye kyng hungry howe ſpedde wherwith kynge greatly reioyſed made great prouiſyon agaynſt cōmynge frenche men ſent theſe ambaſſadours brother kyng almaigne open paſſages alſo coſyn duke auſtriche throughe ſtraytes auſtryche muſte nedes paſſe wayes cauſed great prouiſyon vitayle ordayned alſo wrote letter great mayſter pruce rhodes certifyeng cōmyng iohan burgoyne thouſande knyghtes ſquiers valyant men entent entre turkey reſyſt great boſt kyng baſant called great turke ſeaſon lorde coucy come parys newlye retourned fro voyage hadde ben hole yere whiche fronters gēnes certayne great men genowayes enformed ye duke orlyaunce hoole duchy geane deſyred haue chiefe lorde ſome noble perſone diſcended lynage flour delyce moche duke orlyaunce wedded doughter lorde myllaygne lande duchy geane ſhulde ryght mete hym duke orlyaunce inſtaunce lorde coucy thre hūdred ſpeares fyue hūdred croſ bowes paſſed ouer sauoye pyemont accorde conſent erle sauoye came aſte pyemont conſent lorde myllayne came cytie called alexandria ſo came fronters marcheſſe genowayes fell treatie know playnly entēcyons ꝑforce coulde nothyng without greatier puiſſaunce whan lorde coucy came firſt vpon fronters ryuer geane entree ſtronge conquere made defence lordes genowayes ſuche fauoured lorde coucy enformed duke orlyaunce wherby ſente thyder lorde coucy entreated amiably brought hym coūtreis offred hym caſtels lorde coucy ſage ſubtyle ymaginatyfe knewe right well nature lombardes genowayes wolde nat truſt ouermoche haue great confydence offer promyſes alwayes wyſely helde loue amyte longe amonge ledde forthe fayre wordes treaty many cōmunycacyons felde toguyder neuer fortreſſe euer comuned theym leſſe conquered gate genouoys made ſygne loue promyſed hym many thynges wolde haue hym haue gone cytie gennes porte vender lorde coucy durſt neuer aſſure hym offer concluſyon voyage ſuche gate nothynge whan ſawe coulde nat atcheue buſyneſſe ſignyfied eſtate duke orlyance whervpon remaunded ſo retourned parys came thyder ſame ſeaſon buſyneſſe iourney goynge hungery duke burgoyne reioyſed greatly retourne ducheſſe ſente hym houſe arthoyſe ſygne great loue ſayd syr truſt moche haue cauſed iohan ſonne heyre take hym enterpriſe ye honour god chriſtendome knowe well aboue knyghtes fraunce ye moſte vſed expert thynges wherfore derely requyre ye wolde companion ſonne voyage chyefe counſaylour wherof ſhall thanke deſerue lorde coucy ſaid lorde madame wordes requeſtes ought cōmaundement voyage ſhall go pleaſe god two cauſes firſt deuocyon defende faythe iheſu chriſt secondly ye ſomoche honour gyue charge lorde iohan ſonne ſhall acquyte truely power howe dede ye may well dyſcharge charge ſpecyally coſyn nere kyneſman lorde phylyppe arthoys erle ewe conſtable fraunce coſyn erle marche bothe two ought go hym voyage nere blode duke ſayd lorde coucy ye haue moche ſene theſe twayn haue knowe better orderynge army ſtraunge countreys outher coſyn ewe march therfore charge praye execute requeſtes aunſwered ſayd lorde prayer cōmaundement ſhall ſythe pleaſeth ayde helpe lorde guye tremoyle lorde guillyam brother admyrall fraunce anſwere duke ducheſſe great ioye theſe lordes prepared ſelues go iourney hūgery lordes knyghtes ſquyers deſyred go company many deſyred themſelfe go retaygned ſome went without mayſters ſome conſyderynge voyage hungery fro thence turkey ouer longe chargeable beynge nat retaygned waxed colde enterpryſe ſettynge forwarde yonge iohan burgoyne nothynge ſpared horſe harneſſe freſſhe clothes riche veſſell plate golde ſyluer offycers apoynted atendaūce money delyuered werke men payed barones knightes ſquiers honour iohn̄ burgoyne alſo auauncement body enforced make redy lorde phylyppe arthoys ordeyned hym ſo puyſſauntly nothynge ſpared wolde go voyage conſtable fraunce frenche kynge loued entierlye helped hym moche towarde charge ſo dyd lorde boucyquant marſhall fraunce duke burgoyne conſydered voyage ſonnes ſhulde coſte ouermoche fynaunce thought conuenyent ſtate ſonne ſhulde mayntayned fynde ſyluer mayntayne withall foūde ſubtelly backe tayle former tayle countreys cyties fortreſſes ben tayled ſaid backe tayle mounted burgoyne chyuallry ſyxe hundred thouſande crownes golde agayne duke made tolde knyghtes ladyes helde fee yonge olde ſhulde go hungery owne propre perſones ſonne el paye taxe ſyluer ſo taxed ſome thouſande poūde fyue hundred frankes eche man goodes valure landes ladyes auncyent knyghtes remembringe traueyle bodyes nat ſhapen made endure ſuche payne conpoū ded payed wyll duke yonge knyghtes ſquyers forborne payeng money ſaid ſhulde go lorde iohan owne coſte charge otherwyſe nat backe tayle duke reyſed lx thouſāde crownes ſo none forborne tydynges voyage ſpredde abrode whan came countrey haynalt knyghtes ſquyers ſuche deſyred auauncement ſpake togyther ſayde mete voyage lorde oſtrenant yonge brother erle neuers wente myght well go company erle oſtrenant beynge tyme queſnoy vnderſtode knyghtes ſquyers countrey ſayde thought leſſe thā dyd great affectyon go voyage whan herde ſpekyng mater wolde anſwere lytell dyſſymuled mater good entencyon ſpeke duke aubert bauyer erle haynalt wolde counſayle hym within whyle erle oſtrenant came hay holande father ducheſſe wyfe ſayd father lorde ſuche tydinges rynneth abrode fayre brother neuers hathe enterpriſed ſōmer go hungery fro then turkey whereby lykelyhode great dedes armes ſhall atchyued ſyr tyme wotte nat better enploye myſelfe dede armes wherin wolde gladly knowe youre pleaſure wolde go honourable voyage hundred knyghtes beare company fayre brother duke burgoyne lady duches ſhall gret thanke many knyghtes ſquyers haynalt wyll gladly holde company duke aubert man redy purueyed aunſwere ſayd guylliam haſte wyll haue go voyage hungery turkey ſeke armes vpon people countrey neuer dyd v forfeyte thou haſt tytell reaſon go vayneglory worlde lette iohan burgoyne coſins fraunce enterpriſe thy dedes aparte go thou freſe conquere herytage theſe freſones pride rudenes witholde fro v wyll come none obeyſaunte ſhall ayde wordes father ſonne lyghtened greatly herte therle oſtrenant aunſwered ſayd lorde ye ſaye well pleaſe ſhall voyage ſhall ryght good wyll ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe erle oſtrenant enterpriſed go freſe cap ccvii theſe wordꝭ bytwene father ſonne multyplyed ſo moche lytell lytell voyage freſe taken enter priſed one thynge helped moche matter forwarde erle oſtrenant tyme aboute hym nere counſayle ſquyer haynalte called ferebraſe otherwiſe called baſtarde vertayne wyſe man ſubtyll feates armes ſo whan herd ſaid erle syr lorde father ſpeketh well better honour ye make voyage rather hungery ordayne therto ye ſhall fynde knyghtes ſquyers haynalt elſwhere wyll gladde kepe company ſhall ayde power enterpriſe ye haue mynde thus wyll counſayle go englāde ſignyfy enterpriſe knyghtes ſquyers pray kynge englande coſyn wyll gyue lycence knyghtes ſquyers archer go freſe wage englyſſe men men dedes ye haue ye ſhall buſineſſe better ye may haue prayer coſyn therle derby company voyage ſhall moche fayrer enterpriſe renomed erle enclyned thoſe wordes ſemed hym counſayle good lykewyſe lorde gomegynes gaue hym counſayle ſo dyd dyuers theſe wordes anone ſpredde abrode haynalte acommaundement made knyghtes ſquiers heynalt none theym ſhulde go coūtrey go hungrey place el bycauſe erle oſtrenant ſhulde ocupy another waye ſhulde leade freſe ſhall leaue ſpeakynge buſyneſſe retourne voyage hungery thus knyghtes ſquiers many party cauſe awake take corage ye warres towarde ſeaſon well voyage hungery freſe erle neuers auaunced iourney knyghtes squyers named written ſhulde go prouiſion great well ordeyned wolde renomed voyage lyberall mad great large many knyghtes ſquyers ſhulde go bande voyage long coſtely wherfore nedefull thē haue ſome ayde towardes charge lordes conſtable fraūce erles ewe marche lordes henry phylippe bare lorde coucy lorde guy tremoyle lorde iohan vyen admyrall fraunce boucyquant marſhall fraunce raynolde du roy lordes ſaynt powle mutterell ſaynte pye haſell flaunders lorde loys breſe brother le bourge montquell nombre thouſande knyghtes thouſande ſquyers valyaunt men euery man departed fro owne houſes myddes marche ſo rode forth companyes alwayes founde wayes open kynge almayne cōmaūded realme almayne boeſme ſhulde haue thynges neceſſary vytayle ſhulde witholden fro theſe lordes fraūce thus rode forwarde ayde kyng hungery ſhulde haue batayle great turke puyſſaunce agaynſt puyſſaunce twenty day moneth may theſe lordes paſſed lorayne countie bare countie mountbelyart duchy burgoyn entred auſay paſſed coūtrey ryuer ryn ••• many place countie fierte ſo entered auſtriche whiche great coūtrey entres iſſues ſtronge great deſertes went ſo good wyll corage payne traueyle greued nothyng duke auſtriche made capytaynes countrey ſuche made lordes good chere ſpecyally iohn̄ burgoyne chiefe army theſe lordes apoynted aſſemble cytie hungery called bode ¶nowe let v ſpeke mater ye haue herde howe kynge england ſente ſame ſeaſon ſuffycient ambaſſade frenche kyng counſayle haue wyfe iſabell doughter fraunce whiche ambaſſadours archebyſſhop duuelyn byſſhoppe wyncheſter erle marſhall erle rutlande ſonne duke yorke lorde henry clyfforde lorde beamonde lorde spenſer many frenche kyng made good chere vncles counſayls whiche ambaſſade retourned englande vpon good hope atayne deſyres kynge englande parte wynter folowynge often tymes ſent frenche kynge conſernynge ſayd mater well enclyned haue peace haue ende warre whiche ouer longe endured theſe purſutes treaty toke ſuche effect two kynges writen ſo ſolemply eche mater drewe nere apoynte ſo ſuche ambaſſadours fyrſt ſent englande fraunce ſente agayne came parys lodged croſſe tyroner men ſtreat aboute nombre ſyxe hundred thus ſoiourned parys thre wekes ⸫ ⸫ ¶of iudgemēt made parlyament quene napoles agaynſt ſyr peter craone cap ccix ſame ſeaſone englyſſhe men paris quene iane duches aniowe wrote ſelfe quene napoles iheruſalem parys purſued dylygently buſyneſſe lady great corage ſhe pleted parlyament two cauſes fyrſt herytage countie rouſſey agaynſt erle brayne loys duke aniou lorde huſbande bought payed lady coūteſſe rouſſey ſomtyme wyfe lorde loys namure afterwarde ſhe deuorſed fro hym reaſonable cauſe ſayde ſeconde ſute quene agaynſt ſyr peter craon ſhe demaunded hym ſōme hundred thouſande frankes whiche ſhe redy proue receyued name lord mayſter loys kyng napoles cyſyll iheruſalem huſbande whiche money delyuered hym haue payed powell payed herde howe ſayd mayſter huſbande deed iourneyed returned agayne fraunce kept ſtyll ſayd ſōme money owne profyte neuer made acompte ſayde quene therof chyldren loys charles ſpente waſted money pride bobbans quene layde charge faute payment ſayd money realme napoles loſte conquered margarete dura heyres lorde charles de la paix reaſon ſuche ſoudyours huſbande mayntayne warres puell calabre nat payed wage wherby many tourned erle ſaynt seuyre margarete dura departed lefte warres theſe cauſes put parlyament chambre parys cauſes prepoſed ſhewed demaunded defence aunſweres herde partyes plee endured ſpace thre yeres though ſyr peter craon abſent fro parlyament yet aduocates defended cauſe ſayd though recyued ſayd ſōme name lorde mayſter yet mayſter moche bounde ſōme came good ſeruyce done plee endured ſo longe neceſſary haue concluſyon lady made importunate ſewte haue iudgement lordes parlyament conſydred thynges ſayd wolde gyue iudgement without party preſent ſyr peter craon durſte nat well apere parys bycauſe kynges dyſpleaſure duke orlyance offence doone ſyr olyuer clyſſon conſtable fraunce without preſent wolde gyue ſentence defynityue wher vpon ſayd lady purſewed ſet hym clere fraunce meanes pardoned ſo myght ryde go lyſt without daunger except ſute bytwene hym ſayd ſōme money clerely dyſcharged charge lordes ladyes made hym good chere wote nat whether diſſymulacyon otherwyſe thus agayne parys holdynge great eſtate euer dyd ſame tyme apoynted one theym receyue bringe englyſſhe ambaſſadours kynge knyght hadde ſene moche knewe moche honoure daye prefyxed iudgement concernynge quenes mater ſhulde determyned whiche day preſent parlyament great nombre lordes fraunce entent mater ſhulde autentyke quene cicyll iheruſalem ſonne charles prince thaurent iohan bloys called iohan bretaygne erle ponthyeure lymogynes duke orlyaunce berrey burgoyne burhone erle brayne byſſhoppe laon theym lady herde laye tytell countie rouſſey parte ſyr peter craon many lygnage fyrſte iudgement gyuen countye rouſſey herytage remyſſed iudged handes poſſeſſyon erle brayne heyres ſhulde dyſcende ryght braunche rouſſey reſerued quene ſhulde haue agayne repayed money kynge loys huſbande hadde payed counteſſe rouſſey laſte deed iudgement enherytours countie rouſſey herytage pertayned thanked greatly lordes parliament ſuche ordayned gyue ſeconde ſentence aroſe vp ſayde howe ſentence parlyament ſir peter craon ought pay quene napoles ducheſſe aniowe ſomme hundred thouſande frankes redy money el body go pryſone tyll ſhe contented ſatyſfyed iudgement ſayde lady thanked lordes parlyament • contynent cō playnte lady handes layde kynges commaundement ſo ledde caſtell loure ſurely kepte lordes departed fro parlyament thus theſe two iudgementes gyuen princypall occaſyon lady ducheſſe aniou ⸫ ⸫ ¶of concluſyon maryage • aken parys bytwene kynge englande iſabell eldeſt doughter frenche kynge howe duke lancaſtre remaryed cap ccx ambaſſadours englande frenche kynge parys xxii dayes good chere coulde deuyſed mater tooke ſuche effecte agreed kyng englande ſhuld haue maryage iſabell eldeſt doughter kynge charles vertue procuracyon erle marſhall fyaunced eſpouſed name kinge englande ſo ſhe called fro then forthe quene englande enfourmed goddly ſyght ſe behauour ſhe yonge ryght pleſauntly ſhe bare porte quene▪ mater concluded englyſſhe men tooke leaue frenche kynge quene doughter quene englande lordes ſo departed fro parys retourned calays ſo englande kynge opynyon glad retourne ſo euer gladde maryage duke glouceſtre vncle kynge made ioye ſawe well reaſone maryage alyaunce peace ſhulde bytwene kinges realmes whiche greued hym without ſhulde greatly honour kynge realme englande englyſſhe men myght ſame caſe better party gaſcoyne warres renewed agayne matter wolde often tymes ſpeke brother duke yorke drewe hym moche coulde opynions ſofte prince duke lancaſtre eldeſt brother durſte nat ſpeke ouer largely ſawe well kynges opynion well pleaſed kynges maryage princypally loue two doughters quene spaygne quene portugale ſame ſeaſon duke lancaſtre remaryed agayne thyrde tyme lady doughter knyght haynalte called ſyr paon ruette ben tyme noble quene phylyp englande nacyon haynalt ſhe called katheryn brought vp youthe duke lancaſters howſe ducheſſe blaunce lancaſtre dethe lady blaunce duke maryed lady cuſtaunce spaygne dayes duke kepte concubyne lady katheryne ruet hadde maryed knyght englande deed duke thre chyldren two ſonnes doughter eldeſt called iohan otherwyſe lorde beauforde lancaſtre duke loued hym entyerly called thomas duke brought vp aſque good clerke connynge bothe lawes great iuryſt legyſt byſſhoppe lyncolne duke lancaſtre loue chyldren wedded mother lady katheryn ruet wherof moche marueyle bothe englande fraunce ſhe baſe lynage regarde two wyues whan knowledge maryage duke lady kateryne ruet come great ladyes englande ducheſſe glouceſtre counteſſe derby counteſſe arundell ladyes dyſcended blode royall englande meruayled moche layd gret blame duke dede ſayde howe duke lancaſtre greatly dyſprayſe mary concubyne reaſon therof ſhe ſhulde ſeconde perſon honoure englande wherby ſayd quene ſhulde ſhamefully acompanyed ſayde howe ſurely wolde nat come place ſhe ſhulde preſente ouer ſayde ſhulde great ſhame theym ſuche ducheſſe come ſo baſe blode concubyne duke wyfes dayes ſhulde go haue preemynence ſayde hertes ſhulde breke ſorowe bothe duke glouceſtre ducheſſe wyfe ſpake mater ſayd howe duke lancaſtre nat wyſe fowle ouerſene marry concubyne ſayde wold neuer honoure call ſuſter duke yorke paſſed ouer lyghtly ynough euer lyghtly reſydente aboute kynge duke lancaſtre duke glouceſtre nother maner ſette man though yongeſt brother orgulous preſumptuous maner therto enclyned nature alwayes agaynſt kynges opynions counſaylours thus lady kateryne ruet ducheſſe lancaſtre ſeconde perſone englande moche aboute kynge ſhe knewe moche honour youth dayes ſhe ben brought vp therin duke loued greatly chyldren ſhewed well lyfe dethe ye haue herde howe iugement parliament gyuen agaynſt ſyr peter craon howe condempned hundred thouſande frankes payed quene napoles whan ſayde ſyr peter ſawe howe condempned ſore abaſſhed outher muſte paye ſōme el abyde ſtyll priſoner counſayled duke burgoyne ducheſſe yt ſhulde requyre yonge quene englande meane hym quene napoles myght releaſed oute pryſone fyftene dayes go abrode parys ſewe frendes pay fynaūce el fynd ſureties tyll myght go bretaygne gather amonge frendes ſame ſōme deſyre yonge quene englande quene napoles contente ſhulde go day abrode paris nyght alwayes yelde hymſelfe priſoner caſtell lowre remayne night rate went abrode ſewed many blode frendes coulde fynde none wolde abyde priſoner hym ſōme ſo great ende fyftene dayes fayne returne priſoner bothe day nyght kept ſtreyghter coſt charge nowe lette v lytell ſpeke iourney therle neuers lordes fraunce dyd ſame ſōmer hungery ſhall ſpeke goynge freſe erle haynalte erle oſtrenaunt erle neuers company many valyaunt men fraunce countreys whan come hungery great cytie called bode kyng hungery made good chere well deſerued come farre ſe entenſyon kynge ſette forwarde puyſſaunce ayde fraunce entre felde fyrſte ſome newes fro great turke called lamorabaquy ſent hym worde moneth february ſurely wolde hungery ende moneth maye wolde paſſe water dunce whiche meſſage many great marueyle ſome ſayde manner nothynge man maye conſyderynge turke valyaunt puyſſaūt deſyreth moche dedes armes therfore ſythe hath ſaid lykelyhode wyll paſſe nat dunce come hyther ſyde lette v paſſe ouer entre turkey puyſſaūce kynge hungery ſuche ayde hath ſtraungers ſhall well make hundred thouſande men ſuche nombre ſuche men well able conquere turkey go empyre perce may haue one iourney vyctory vpon great turke ſhall lyſt ſhall conquere surey holy lande iheruſalem ſhall delyuer fro handes sodayne enemyes god ſōmer nexte commynge frenche kynge kynge englande wyll conioyne togyther ſhall reyſe vp great nombre men armes archer ſhall fynde paſſages open receyue nothyng ſhall abyde v ſhall conquered put oure obeyſaunce whan ſhall go togyther thus deuyſed frenche men realme hungery whan moneth may come truſtynge tydynges lamorabaquy greate turke kynge hungery ſent paſſages ryuer dunce ſent realme aſſemble puiſſaunce togyder lordes rodes came hym ſtrongly moneth may taryed comyng ſarazyns tydynges coulde herde kynge hungery ſente ſuche knewe countrey beyonde ryuer dunce ſerche haue ſōme tydynges great turke suche wente ſertched countrey beyonde braſe ſaynt george march alexaundre dama antyoche coulde newes lamorabaquy none army towarde retourned ſhewed king herde ſene kynge aſſembled counſayle called lordes fraunce deſyred dedes armes kyng ſhewed howe ſente men turkey haue knowlege enemy dyd howe coulde tydinges lamorabaquy lykelyhode aprochyng ye promeſſe made paſſe dunce entre hūgery ſight cryſten men mydde may ſhulde paſſe wherfore kynge demaunded counſayle wolde gyue hym lorde coucy ſayd syr though lamorabaquy come nat forwarde acordynge promeſſe maketh • ape therof yet ought nat lette v dedes armes purſue enemyes ſeynge aſſembled yt purpoſe thus frenchman almayns ſtraungers ſhewed well howe great deſyre ſeke lamorabaquy fyght whiche great honour lorde coucyes wordes affyrmed ſtraungers opynyons howe coulde enploye ſeaſon tyme better ordeyned kynge marſhalles euery man ſhulde prepare hymſelfe redy ſette forwarde daye aſſygned whiche vtas ſaynt iohan baptyſt offycers ſeruauntes aparelled maiſters thynges neceſſary frenche men thynkynge freſſhe gay ſpared nouther golde ſyluer departure fro bode ſoueraygne cytie hungery goodly regarde conſtable hungery vowarde great nombre hungaryons almayns bycauſe knewe countreys nexte hym rode frenche menne conſtable fraunce erle de la marche lorde coucy ſyr henry ſyr phylyppe bare dyuers kynge rode great lordes countrey reaſone beſyde kyng rode iohan burgoyne often tymes deuyſed kyng felde threſcore thouſande horſe hadde fewe foote ſauynge ſuche folowers company cryſten men noble well ordred hungery many croſebowes horſebacke army iourneyed ſo longe came ryuer dunce paſſed ouer ſhyppes barge ſuche bridge ordeyned purpoſe eight dayes paſſed ouer paſſed lodged theym euery company taryenge ryuer dunce departeth ye realmes hungery turkey ſonder whan chriſten men ouer nothynge taryed behynde frōters turkey greatlye reioyſed deſyred greatly dedes armes toke counſayle determyned go ley ſiege towne turkey called coniecte ordayned ſo dyde beſieged myght well ſtode playne countrey ryuer ioynynge ſhyppes theron called necte heed cōmynge turkey fallynge ſee ryuer dunce ryuer dunce great ryuer thre hundred myles length fro begynnynge tyll entre see whiche mooſt profytable ryuer worlde realme hū gry ſhyppes theron myght iſſue therof see nat mouthe therof whan ſhulde iſſue ſee ryuer moū tayne whiche departeth ryuer two ꝑtes maketh ſuche brute noyſe maye well herde ſeuyn myle cauſe ſhyppe yt dare aproche nere longe ryuer ſyde fayre medowes paſtures wherby countrey well ſerued dyuers vynes whiche ſeaſone make good wynes whiche turkes make putte goot ſkynnes ſelleth vnto chriſten men accordyng lawe dare drinke wyne knowen defended payne lyfe eate reyſynges haue good frutes ſpyces wherof make drinke vſe greatly drinke gootes mylke whiche refreſſheth theym hote ſeaſon thus kynge hungry hooſt lodged cytie coniecte eaſe pleaſure manne troubled ſiege whan came cytie foūde frutes rype whiche great pleaſure made cytie dyuers aſſautes within defended ſelfe truſtyng dayly haue ayde ſocour lamorabaquy lorde reyſe ſiege puyſſaunce dyde nat wherby cytie taken force aſſaute diſtroyed great ſlaughter men woman chyldren chriſten men entred hadde mercy pytie whan̄e cytie thus wonne kyng hungry diſlodged wente forwarde turkey determyned go ley ſiege great cytie called nicopoly rode foūde waye towne quayre layde ſiege fyftene dayes finallye aſſaute clene diſtroyed ſo paſſed forthe waye founde another towne ſtronge caſtell called brehappe knyght turkey lorde therof within caſtell defende kyng army lodged within myle fayre ryuer towne none erle neuers made knight reyſed banner hym made mo thre hundred knyghtes company went brehap beſieged wan towne perforce within four dayes nat caſtell ſo ſtrong lorde brehap ſaued moche people byforce caſtell called corbodas right valyant knyght thre bretherne one named maladius another balachius thirde rufyn towne chriſten men caſtell ſeuyn dayes made dyuers aſſautes loſte wanne foure knyghtes bretherne yt within ſhewed well defence valyant men whan frenche men hadde conſydred well force caſtell valyaunt ordr •• ge turkes within defence made ſawe well than̄e loſte payne ſo diſlodged knowledge howe kyng hungry wolde go laye ſiege ſtronge towne nicopolye thus ſiege brehap brake vp within caſtell peace towne clene brent erle neuers lordes frā ce reſorted kynges armye ordring thē ſelfe go nicopoly whan̄e corbodas brehappe ſawe ſiege brokenne vp right ioyfull ſayde cōpany nede fere ſeaſon though towne brent exiled ſhall right well recouer agayne one thynge maru • yle greatly • newes fro lorde kyng beſant called lamorabaquy laſt tyme ſawe hym cytie nicopoly ſayde vnto may tyme wolde countrey entencyon paſſe great puyſſaunce braſe ſaynt george go hūgry fight chriſten men ſo • ent worde kyng hungry yet hath done nothyng thervpon hūgry fortifyed haue nowe great ſocour fraūce haue paſſed ryuer dunce entred turkey haue diſtroye countre reſiſtence made againſt thē thinke ſurely go lay ſiege nicopoly cytie ſtronge ynoughe reſyſt ſiege longe ſeaſon well defended kepte • bretherne knyghtes lynage kynge beſant ought bounde defende ryght therfore lette v order oure ſelfe ſhall ſhewe brother maladyus ſhall go cytie nicopoly ayde helpe defende brother balachyus ſhall abyde kepe caſtell brehap brother rufyne ſhall paſſe braſe ſaynt george go ſeke lamorabaquy ſhewe euery thynge paſt done aduyſe hym honoure entēde defende herytage come ſuche puyſſaunce maye reſyſt chriſten men breke purpoſe el ſhall leſe ye realme armony whiche hath conquered owne countrey alſo ymagynacyon kynge hungry chriſten men gadered thentent ſome great enterprice thre bretherne agreed ſayeng apoyntment prepared ſelfe departe ſeaſon ſiege laid nicopolye corbodas brehappe maladyus brother came entred nicopoly wherof cytie ryght ioyfull balachyus abode ſtyll brehappe kepe caſtell rufyn whan ſawe tyme nyght paſſed chriſten army knewe well countre paſſed ouer braſe ſaynt george • erched lamorabaquy ſame ſeaſon quayre ſoudane babylone haue ayde men hym rufyn foūde turke whan kynge beſant ſawe hym marueyle thought ſurely ſhulde ſome newes turkey than̄e demaunded tidynges ſir quod rufyn coū trey deſyreth ſore ſe ye kyng hungry puiſſaunce hath paſſed ryuer dunce entred turkey hath done great dōmage hath brent aſſayled fyue ſixe cloſed townes whan departed fro brehappe purpoſe go leye ſiege nicopoly corbodas maladyus brother ſuche men warre haue en • red nicopoly helpe defēde towne brother balachyus ſtyll brehappe kepe caſtell ſir ſuretie company kynge hungry goodlyeſt armye beſt apoynted come fraunce euer ſene wherfore ſir behoueth aſſemble hooſt frendes retourne turkey cauſe enemyes retourne agayne ouer ryuer dūce ye nat gret puyſſaūce wyll harde bring nombre quod lamorabaquy ſir quod mo hundred thouſande good lyeſt men • worlde beſt armed horſ backe lamorabaquy gaue none anſwere entred soudan chā bre ſhewed soudane hole mater knyght ſhewed hym ſoudane ſayd muſt prouyde ye ſhall haue men ynowe reſyſt thē nedes muſt defēde lawe herytage true ſir quod lamorabaquy nowe deſyres arre come paſſe haue alwayes deſyred none thynge kynge hungry puiſſaunce myght one come ouer ryuer dunce entre turkey begynnynge wyll ſuffre ſeaſon ende ſhall paye ſcotte hadde knowledge four monethes paſte great frende lorde myllayne ſente go haukes gerfaucons faucons nombre xii whiche beſt fayreſt euer ſawe preſent wrote name heedes chiefe capitayns barones fraunce ſuche ſhulde come make warre whiche letter alſo conteyned might get daunger ſhulde worthe myllyon floreyns alſo howe ſhulde company lymytees fraunce mo fyue hūdred knightes valyaunt men armes alſo duke myllaygne wrote ſurely wyll gyue batayle wherfore wyll prepare mete arte aduiſe good ordynaunce men great feate ſo valiaunt armes wyll nat flye recule worthy • thanke iſſue owne nacyon valyauntneſſe fynde dedes armes truſte accōplyſſhe deſyres within thre monethes ſo ſhall haue ynoughe cōſydre theſe wordes one ought greatly marueyle lorde galea erle vertues duke myllayne reputed chriſten man baptyſed regenerate chriſten lawe wolde ſeke requyre loue alyaunce kynge myſcreant lawe faythe ſende hym gyftes preſentes dyde euery yere dogges haukes fyne lynen clothes whiche ryght pleſaunt sarazins haue none cometh fro party alſo great turke ſent hym agayne preſentes ryche clothe golde precyous ſtones wherof sarazins haue great plentie thoſe dayes erle vertues duke myllayne ſir galea father reygned tyrantes ſo helde ſignories marueyle thynke dedes fyrſte howe entred opteygned ſignorie myllayne thre bretherne lorde manfres lorde galea lorde barnabo hadde vncle archebyſſhoppe myllayne ſo fortuned whan ye lorde charles luſenbourge kyng boeſme almayne emperour rome reigned kyng loyes bauyer opteygned empyre byforce neuer taken emperour ye churche excōmunycate curſed pope innocent reygned than̄e loyes bauyer went rome made hymſelfe crowned emperour pope xii cardynalles made ſoone crowned made almayns payed wage ouer ryn rome robbe pyll rewarde romayns receyuyng hym wherfore dyed excōmunicat ſentence pope cardynalles made without conſtreyn • came auignon ſubmytted ſelfes pope innocent reigned vrbayne fyfthe aſſoyled errours ¶nowe purpoſe howe lordes myllayne came fyrſt ſignorie ſhall ſhewe howe archebyſſhoppe myllayne tyme receyued kynge charles boeſme emperour ye cytie myllayne nobly tryumphantlye emperour axe chapell accomplyſſhed xl dayes accordyng vſage caſe parteyning great chere made emperour hundred thouſande ducates lent emperour made byſſhop vycoūt myllayne nephewes hym euer holde lande ſignorie mylayne free wyll vnto tyme emperour hadde payde agayne one tyme ſayd ſōme hundred thouſande ducates ſo byſſhoppe dyed ye lorde manfres nephue accorde emperour loue vncle receyued ſignorie myllayne two bretherne nat riche lorde galea lorde barnabo counſayled toguyder determyned reigne holde landes lōbardy bytwene thē cōioyne thē mariage ſome great lordes maynteyne eſtates cauſe men feare diſpleaſures ſo cauſed brother mā freſe ſlayne venyme otherwyſe whoſe dethe reygned puiſſauntly byforce polycy dayes lyued good accorde toguyder departed cyties lombardy bytwene lorde galea hadde tenne bycauſe eldeſt lorde bernabo nyne cytie myllayne gouerned one yere one brother another yere brother entent reigne puiſſauntly ſought wayes gader great rycheſſe rayſinge vp poſſyons ſubſydies gabelles many yuell cuſtomes wherby gadered great ſtore golde ſyluer cauſed townes cyties kepte ſoudyours ſtraungers almaygnes frē che men breton englyſſhmen nacyons excepte owne countrey men hadde truſt affiaunce feare rebellyon agaynſt thē theſe ſoudyours payed fro moneth moneth wherby ſo douted fered people none durſte diſpleaſe dyd ryſe dyde thyng agaynſt cruell vengeaunce taken vpon diſtroyed many one dayes gyue enſāple ſignories man hadde thynge atte pleaſure wolde tayle ryche man thre foure tymes yere ſayd lō bardes ouer proude preſūptuous richeſſe wherfore behouable kepe vnder ſubiection man durſt ſaye nay thyng cōmaunded theſe two bretherne maryed hyghlye bought wyues goodꝭ ſubſtaunce people lorde galea hadde wyfe ſuſter good erle sauoye named blaunche payde erle hundred thouſande ducates lorde barnabo maryed hym almaygne ſuſter duke breſnyche payde leſſe money brother dyd theſe two bretherne hadde many chyldren maryed highly richelye atteyne therby great alyaunces lorde galea ſone called galleas father vnderſtode whā kynge iohan fraunce come englande put raūſome xxxc thouſand frankes fraunce wyſt nat howe reyſe fyrſte payment than̄e treated frenche kynge coū ſayle haue one doughters galea ſonne kynge coūſayle entended treatie bycauſe knewe well lorde galea grounded richeſſe thus bought kyngꝭ doughter ſixe hundred thouſande frankes whiche tourned payment kynge englande ſo ſonne maryed kynge iohans doughter hym gyuen countie erldome vertues champaygne ſonne doughter iſſued doughter whiche byforce golde ſyluer maryed ſeconde ſonne kynge charles fraunce called loyes duke orlyaunce erle bloyes valoyes maryage coſt erle vertu father ſayde lady tenne hundred thouſaunde frankes countie bloyes bought erle guye bloyes hath ben conteyned hyſtorie thus theſe lordes galea barnabo acorded right well toguyder lyue dayes neuer varyed people toguyder therfore reigned great puiſſaunce man coude haue reaſon right pope cardynalles made warre agaynſt ſauyng alonely marque moūtferant meanes lorde iohan hacon englyſſhe men route companyons whiche iohan hacon brought prouynce lombardy made great warre laſt dyed lorde galea hym reigned ſonne erle vertues named galea great puyſſaūce begynnyng reigne gate great loue lombardy dred hymſelfe goodly maner like wyſe man put downe ſuche yuell cuſtomes father reyſed lōbardy ſo well beloued ſo good renome euery man ſayd well hym laſte whan̄e ſawe tyme ſpytted venyme whiche longe borne hert made day ye feldes great buſſhement wherby lorde bernabo vncle takē thought none yuell knewe nat welbeloued great fauour nephue takyng ſayd hym one lorde ynough reygne lombardy coude haue none grace laye nat hym than̄e make reſyſtence ledde caſtell nephue cauſed hym dye maner nat ſhewe ſir bernabo two fayre chyldren frenche quene doughter one doughters whiche wedded duke oſrtenaunt bauyere galea putte priſone vncles chyldren ſuche coulde gette tooke poſſeſſyon vncles ſeignories ioyned thē owne ſo reigned great puyſſaunce richeſſe reyſed vp ſuche mater wherby gathered toguyder great rycheſſe impoſycions gabels ſubſydies dyſmes extorcyons wherby moche dreed beloued helde errour opynyon father howe one ſhulde nother honoure worſhyppe god tooke fro abbeyes priory moche reuenewes toke hym ſelfe ſayd monkes delyciouſly noriſſhed good wynes delycious mete whiche ſuperfluyteis ſayd coude nat ryſe mydnight ſeruyce ſhulde ſayde ſaynt benet helde nat order relygion maner ſo ſaid wolde make lyue egges ſmall wyne clere voyces ſyng higher theſe lordes dayes lyued lyke pope dyde great diſpytes tyme men holy churche ſette nothyng pope curſe ſpecially ye ciſme began two pope one curſed aſſoyled lordes myllayne dyde mocke doynges ſo dyd many lordes ye worlde doughter lorde galea duke myllayne duches orl aūce whoſe condycions lyke father nat mother doughter kyng iohan fraunce lady high mynde enuyous couytous delytes ſtate worlde gladly ſhe wolde haue ſene duke huſbande haue attaygned crowne fraunce ſhe nat cared howe generall fame ſclaunder ran vpon infyrmiteis kyng whiche phiſycion coude remedye came ſortes artes chiefe diſcouerynge workes wherby ſhe great ſuſpecte ducheſſe orlyaunce named valantyne ſonne duke huſbande fayre chylde age dolphyn ſonne kynge tyme theſe two chyldren playeng toguyder ducheſſe orlyaunce chambre ſodaynly caſte downe apple full poyſon pauement ſame ſyde yt dolphyn thentent ſhulde haue taken
