eaten grace dyd nat duches ſon̄e ran apple toke ete therof wherwith poyſoned dyed nothynge coude ſaue hym ſuche hadde charles yong dolphyn kepe toke hym then neuer came duches chambre aduēture great brute murmuracyon ran throughe cytie parys place thus ſayde people ſo duke huſbande parceyued well brute ranne parys huſbande dyde nat putte awaye kynges courte wolde fetche awaye byforce cauſe dye people ſaid ſhe wolde enpoyſon kyng chyldren ſhe hadde enchaunted kyng kyng infyrmyteis wolde nat ſe quene none woman onlye ducheſſe orlyaunce vpon whiche ſayeng doute therof huſbāde awaye put houſe ſaynt poule parys ſente caſtell beſyde parys vpon waye beauoyes called aſynyers ſhe kepte longe ſeaſon neuer wente caſtell laſt ſhe ſent fro then newcaſtell ryuer loyre ye duke orlyaunce great diſpleaſure bycauſe aduēture ye dethe ſon reaſon yt chyldren ſōwhat brake diſpleaſure theſe tidynges came myllayne lorde galea enfourmed howe doughter trouble great daunger wherof ſore diſpleaſed frenche kyng counſayle ſent ſuffycient meſſanger ſir iaquemont weryne parys ye kyng counſayle excuſyng doughter ſayeng perſone wolde accuſe trayſon ſhulde fought vttraūce quarell whan theſe meſſangers cāe parys kynge good helth tooke hede thoſe meſſangers excuſe ſo ſhortely aunſwered nothyng pleaſure retourned lombardy declared duke myllayne ſene done duke gretter diſpleaſure reputed great iniury ſent defyaunce frenche kynge hole realme fraunce whan defyaunces brought parys lordes knightes frenche armye hūgry entred turkey ye diſpyte hate duke myllayne frenche kynge ſome counſayle therfore helde amyte alyaunce great turke ſhewed hym ſecretes fraūce ¶nowe ſhall leaue ſpekynge duke ſpeke great turke baron fraunce chriſten knyghtes turkey ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe great turke deſyred ſoudan many kynges ſarazyns ayde hym menne warre reſyſt agaynſt chriſten men howe many valyant ſarazyns came hym farre countreis cap ccxi nat longe great turke departed fro quayre fro soudan promyſed ſende hym ſhortely great ayde beſt men armes ſignories reſyſt agaynſt puiſſaunce kynge hungry frēche men great turke ſente realmes countreis thought haue ayde ſocour conſydred ſayd frenche men conquered turkey realmes adioyning ſhulde trimble feare therby faythe beleue ſhulde decaye become vnder ſubiection chriſten men whiche rather dye thus deſyres soudan great turke many kyngꝭ ſarazyns enclyned vnto deſyres perce mede trace alſo septentryon realme lecto boundes pruce asmoch enformed enemyes chriſten men flour chiualry theſe kynges ſarazins lordes lawe dyde chuſe among thē beſt traueylynge experte men armes countreis aſſembly coude nat ſodaynly done theirpuruy aunces ſo ſoone done great turke ſet hym ſelfe forwardes felde alwayes abyding people came hym fro farre coūtreis ſpecially tartary mede perce aſſembled many valyant ſarazins countreis deſyrous proue ſtrengthes agaynſt chriſten men ¶nowe lette v ſpeke chriſten men beyng nicopolye ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe lorde coucy lordes chriſtēmen v hundred ſpeares diſcōfited fyftene thouſande turkes duryng ſiege nicopoly cap ccxii beſiege ſtrong towne nycopolye defended themſelfe right valyantly ſore abaſſhed herde tydī ge great turke emperour conſtantyne noble written vnto thē party alexandre nat paſſed ye braſe ſaynt george cryſten men helde ſyege ſtyll nycopoly vytayles plentye good chepe came hungery march nere adioynynge day lorde coucy frenche men tooke pleaſure ryde forthe aduenture go ſe countrey departed fro ſiege nombre fyue hundred ſpeares many croſbowes archer horſemen lorde coucy capytayne iourney lorde raynolde roye lorde ſaynt pye company chateleyne beauoyre lorde mount caurell bourge mountquell dyuers guydes thē ſuche knewe countrey certayne fore ryders well mounted diſcouer coūtrey ſame weke armye turkes aſſembled togyther nombre twenty thouſande men enfourmed howe chryſten men abrode dyſtroyenge countrey reſyſtence therof aſſembled togyder came ſtrayte whiche cryſten men muſt paſſe wolde entre playne turkey coude nat well entre waye turkes taryed two dayes coude tydynges cryſten menne ſo thyrde daye thought haue retourned cryſten mennes foreryders came brechault nere turkes whan turkes ſaw aproche ſtode ſtyll cloſe togyther ſe dealynge cryſten men made token ſygne ſkrymyſſhe theſe cryſten men aproched nere turkes ſawe well great nombre yet coulde nat aduyſe whan well auewed reculed backe came lorde coucy ſhewed hym ſene whiche newes ye cryſten men ryght ioyfull lorde coucy ſaid mete go ſe theym nerer ſythe become ſo farre forwarde ſhall nat departe without fyghtynge ſhulde ſhall blame great rebuke true quod knyghtes herde hym euery man prepared hym ſelfe horſe rode towarde place turkes bytwene turkes lytell wode whan cryſten men came wode ſyde lorde coucy ſaid lorde raynolde roy lorde ſaynt pye syrs myne aduyſe entent drawe turkes ſtrēgth ye two ſhall take two hundred ſpeares reſt wyll abyde wode ryde ye ſo nere ye may cauſe come retourne ſuffre chaſe tyll ye paſte v wode ſodaynly tourne vpon ſhall cloſe theym behynde ſo ſhall haue wyll aduyſe knightes enclyned two hundred beſt horſed rode forthe reſt eyght hundred enbuſſhed ſelfe couertly wode taryed rode forthe came place turkes whan ſawe cryſten men come ryght ioyouſe wenynge mo ſo came holdes playne feldes whan cryſten men ſawe tyme turned fled made turkes chaſe ſo well horſed yt turkes coulde nat ouertake chaſed ſo longe paſſed wode enbuſſhement whan turkes paſſed cryſten men iſſued cryed lady lorde coucy ſo daſſhed behynde made great occiſion turkes helde cloſe togyther whan ſawe beſet behynde dyd put ſelfe defence well myght kept none ordre nat ware reregarde whan ſawe ſelfe ſo ſodaynly ſette abaſſhed frenche men dyd quyte ſelfe lyke valyaunte men armes ſlewe turkes pleaſure flyenge many ſlayne chryſten men toke none mercy happy coulde eſcape retourne fro then came criſten men done dede retourned hooſt nycopoly tydynges ran ouer hooſt howe lorde coucy wyſdome valyauntneſſe dyſcomfyted mo xv thouſande turkes many ſpake well therof erle ewe prayſed nothing dede ſayenge howe doone pride howe put cryſten men ſpecyally bande great aduenture parell ſayenge handefull men fought folyſſhely route twenty thouſande turkes ſhulde rather ſeynge wyl dedes armes turkes felde haue gyuen knowlege aſſayled enemyes hed capitayne lorde iohan burgoyne myght haue renome honour enterpriſe beſemynge erle ewe ſpake thoſe wordes enuy lorde coucy voyage loue bycauſe ſawe howe lorde coucy loue fauour company ſtraūgers whiche deſerued ryght well haue ryght nere frenche kynges blode bare armes floure de lyces alſo cōſtable fraunce thus engendred great hate yuell wyll couertly bytwene erle ewe lorde coucy whiche hatred laſt apered clerely wherby great myſchefe fell ſame ſeaſone vpon cryſten men ye ſhall ¶nowe ſhall leaue ſpeke tyme mater retourne ſpeke kynges englande fraunce ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe peace bytwen englande fraūce contynued maryage kynge englande doughter fraunce cap ccxiii ye haue herde mariage french kynges doughter kynge england whiche tyme aproched nere bothe party well wyllynge excepte duke thomas glouceſtre nothynge ioyfull therof ſawe well maryage ſhulde great confyderacyons alyaunces bytwene two kynges realmes lyue peace whiche lothe ſe deſyred rather haue warre ſame ſeaſon duke aboute hym knyght called ſyr iohan baquegay ſecrete man ſet alwayes ye duke haue warre ſame ſeaſone alſo duke guerles came englande ſe kynge vncles offred hym ſelfe lawfull ſeruyce kynge myght bounde therto faythe homage wolde gladly kynge ſhulde haue watre rather peace duke duke lancaſtre great cōmunycacyon togyder voyage erle haynalt erle oſtenaunt ſonne wolde make freſe ſame tyme fyerebraſe vertayne englande ſente thyder fro erle oſtrenant gette men armes archer go voyage freſe erle derby deſyred go voyage aydinge coſyns heynalt gentle erle hadde therto good affectyon ſayde howe wolde ryght gladly go voyage ſo pleaſed kynge father whan duke guerles came fyrſt englande duke lancaſtre demaunded thought voyage freſe aunſwered ſayd parylous voyage ye freſe countrey nat lyghtly wonne ſayenge howe tymes paſt dyuers erles holande heynalte haue claymed right gone thyder haue put ſubiectyon haue always loſt lyues affyrmynge howe freſons people without honour haue mercy prayſe loue lorde worlde ſo proude alſo countrey ſtronge enuyroned ſee cloſed iſſes rockes maryſſhes man tell howe gouerne ſelfe haue ben deſyred go voyage wyll nat counſayle coſyn ſonne erle derby nat entre voyage iourney hym thynke fayre brother oſtrenant wyll go hath great deſyre therto wyll haue bande haynowayes hym ſhall aduenture euer retourne whiche wordes cauſed duke lancaſtre thynke ſonne ſhulde nat go yt voyage ſo ſhewed ſonne entente badde hym delaye mater kynge wolde nat ſhulde go thus duke guerles dyd lette ayde erle haynalte ſhulde haue erle derby many thought nat well counſayled yet none honour duke guetles lyfe naturally enuyous preſumptuous proūde yet fierebraſe vertayn lette nat ſute gette ayde dyd ſo dyligence gate knightes ſquyers two hundred archer erle derby excuſed himſelfe whiche excuſe fayne take gree ſawe well wyll good go kynge father nat kynge auauncement coſyns haynalte made ordeyned ryuer thamyſe veſſelles ſhyppes men ſhulde go voyage freſe aryue encuſe towne countie haynalt entre holande towne ſtandeth ſee within twelue leages water realme freſe ſame ſeaſon ſente englande fro frenche kynge erle valeran ſaynt powle certayne artycles concernynge treatie peace ſent robert hermyte whome kynge englande gladde ſpeke erle ſaint powle founde kynge englande bretherne erles brenne huntyngdon duke lancaſtre kynges vncles manour eltham kynge receyued ioyouſly herde well meſſage ſayd hym parte fayre brother ſaynt powle treatie peace bytwene fayre father fraunce right well enclyned therto alone canne nat promote mater true bretherne two vncles lācaſtre yorke enclyne ryght well therto haue another vncle duke glouceſtre ryght paryllous marneylous man letteth moche dothe canne drawe londoner opynyon feare make rebellyon realme ſhulde reyſe people agaynſt whiche great paryll people englande ryſe agayne agaynſt haue myne vncle glouceſtre parte ſuche barones knyghtes realme opynion realme loſte without remedy myne vncle glouceſtre ſo ſecerte man canne knowe mynde syr quod erle ſaint powle behoueth wynne hym fayre ſwete louynge wordes gyue hym great gyftes demaunde thyng graunt way wherby ye ſhall wynne ye muſt flatter hym tyll peace made ye haue wyfe brought hyther doone ye maye take counſayle ye ſhall puyſſaunce oppreſſe rebelles frenche kynge nede ſhall ayde ye maye ſure name god ye ſaye well thus ſhall erle ſaynt powle lodged london often tymes went eltham ſe kynge duke lancaſtre often tymes cōmunycacion maryage therle ſaint poule ſayde howe frenche kynge ſhulde come ſaynt omers vncles bring hym doughter ſo kynge england wolde come calais ſo bytwene ſaynte omers calays two kynges ſhulde mete ſpeke togyther wherby reaſon ſyght ſpekynge togyther ſhulde encreaſe loue amyte theſe two kinges vncles ſhulde ſpeke togyder without companye forme peace conclude nat ſome peace yet leſte trewce myght relonged endure thyrty xl yere bytwene two realmes alies deuyſe ſemed right good kyng counſayle hervpon kynge lordes ſente calays make prouyſyon kynge deſyred vncle duke glouceſtre go hym iourney duches wyfe chyldren lyke wyſe duke ducheſſes yorke lancaſtre ſo whan euery thynge redy kynge erle ſaynt powle departed fro eltham rode towardes caunterbury folowed lordes ſuche ſhulde go voyage ſuche deſyred erle ſaynt powle paſſed ſee fyrſt entent aduertyſe frenche kynge ſo paſſed boloyne ſo paris declared frenche kynge vncles howe ſpedde wherwith well content ſo departed fro paris lytell lytell aproched cytie amyence kynge englande vncles came calais many lordes ladyes duke burgoyne one frenche kynges vncles came ſaynt omers meanes erle ſaynt powle robert hermyte duke burgoyne came calays ſe kynge englande vncles▪ nobly receyued coūſayled togyther certayne artycles peace wherto kynge englande lyghtly enclyned ſay trouth cared nat dyd ſo myght haue wyfe whan duke burgoyne ben calais two dayes cōmuned kynge englande artycles peace kynge ſayd howe wolde ſende proceſſe artycles ouer ſee englande beſhewed declared people ſayde nouther lordes englande coulde nat conclude fermely peace without generall conſentment people englande ouer kynge ſayde howe muſt fyrſt go ouer agayne hym ſelfe ſo retourne therby make one iourney well ſaid quod duke burgoyne youre retourne euery thynge ſhall concluded perfourmed thus duke burgoyne erle ſaynt powle departed fro calays retourned ſaynt omers fro then amyence foūde kyng quene doughter ſhulde quene englande ſame tyme duke bretaygne berrey great araye kynge englande vncles lordes retourned englande wyues taryed ſtyll calays tyl retourne ¶in meane ſeaſon voyage made freſe haynalte fyrſt erle heynalte holande zelande ſonne erle oſtrenaunt ye ſhall hyſtorie ¶howe erle heynalt erle oſtrenante ſonne made great army men armes knyghtes ſquyers go freſe cap ccxiiii ye haue herde howe duke auberte bauyer guylliam ſonne erle oſtrenant gret deſyre go freſe conquere countrey wherof ſayde duke aubert ryght ſucceſſion herytage ſhulde erle lorde therof auaunce ſame iourney erle oſtrenant ſent fyerebrace vertayne haue ſome ayde englyſſhe men ſpedde hym ſo well kynge rycharde englande honour coſyns ſent certayne men armes two hundred archer vnder guydyng thre gentleman one called cornewayle another colleuyll knyghtes thyrde aſquyer knowe nat name well enfourmed valyaunt man armes hadde chynne cutte fray lytell chynne made ſyluer tyed aboute heed laſe ſylke theſe englyſſhmen came encuſe tyme prefyxed duke • berte ſonne valyaunt man coūſayle called gylliam croenbourge greatly exorted theym warre hated greatly freſones doone many dyſpyghtes dyd ye ſhall thus duke aubert departed fro haye holande gyllyam ſonne erle oſtrenant ſo came countrey haynalte towne monts aſſembled togyther thre eſtates countrey ſhewed vnto great deſyre go freſe rightfull occaſion ſo cauſed openly ſhewed certayne letter patentes apoſtolykes imperyalles ryght noble autentyke ſealed vnder leade lyole entre whiche apered euydently ryght tytell ye ſignory freſe ſayd openly lordes valyaunt men ſubgettes ye knowe well euery man ought kepe defēde herytage man may laufully moue war • recouer lande herytage ye knowe alſo ye freſons ought right ſubgiettes inobedyent rebell agaynſt v ſygnory people without lawe faythe therfore good dere frendes ye know well without ayde bothe bodyes goodes canne nat fournyſſhe bringe execuſyon ſo hygh enterpriſe wherfore deſyre buſyneſſe ayde v ſay money men warre entent theſe inobedyent freſons maye ſubdued brought obedyence theſe wordes ſuche lyke ſpoken duke thre eſtates cōmune acord graūted lordes petycyon requeſt lyke ſuche people greatly deſyred alwayes done obedyent ſeruyce pleaſure lorde prince enfourmed cauſed haue redy money mountante ſōme thyrty thouſande pounde beſyde towne valencēnes lyke wyſe dyd deuoyre alſo towne monts theſe thynges thus concluded valyaunt prince good duke auberte giullyam ſonne erle oſtrenant ſeynge good wylles men ryght ioyfull whiche meruayle ſawe well well beloued ſubgiettes ſhulde well fournyſſhed money coūſayle ſende frenche kyng ſhewe enterpriſe voyage deſyre ayde hym thyder ſent two valyaunt wyſe men ſaye lorde lygne lorde ieumont two ryght valyaunt knyghtes well beloued frenche men ſpecyally lorde lygne kyng made hym one chamberlayns hym good fauoure ſpake kynge ſhewed hym duke entent requeſt whiche kynge counſayle fauourably agreed ſpecyally duke burgoyner bycauſe doughter maryed therle oſtrenāt wherby thought tyme come ſhulde profyte heyres howe many great lordes ſpake iourney dyuers maners ſayd purpoſe dothe theſe heyno wayes deſyre kyng ayde haue ben englande ſought ayde hath nat erle haynalt late taken hym blewe garter tye legge withall ye ordre englande ſemyth therby hath great affectyon fraunce ryght wyſe anſwered ſayd syr ye wronge ſay thus though erle oſtrenant haue taken ordre garter yet nat alyed englyſſhe men fermly alyed fraunce hath nat maryage lady katheryne doughter duke burgoyne whiche farre greater alyaūce garter therfore neuer ſay wyll loue pleaſure fraunce reaſon maryage rather englande y• garter wherfore kinge ſhall right honourably ayde hym thus frenche men deuyſed amonge ſelfe ſpake dyuers maners iourney alſo iourney hungery turkey agaynſt lamorabaquy turkes ⸫ ⸫ ¶of army french kyng ſente freſe ayde coſyns lorde valeran erle ſaynt powle lorde charles de la brete capytaynes cap ccxv frenche kynge aſſembled armye fyue hūdred ſpeares well pycardes frenchman made capytayns ouer thē lorde valeran erle ſaynt powle lorde charles de la bret valyaūt knyghtes well expert armes apoynted leade company towne encuſe baſe freſe whe • aſſemble ſhulde mete take ſee entre high freſe dyd whan theſe two knightes lorde lygne iumont ſawe kynges good wyll theſe men warre dyſpatched wage payed came kynge thanked toke leaue retourned heynalt lorde duke aubert lorde gillyam ſonne whome right welcome well ſped ſhewed good anſwere good chere gyftes great preſentes whan duke auberte knewe frenche kynge ſente hym fyue hundred ſpeares aſſembled noble men knyghtes ſquyers haynalt lorde vertayne ſeneſchall haynalte valyaunt man greatly renomed armes lordes lygne comygnes made marſhall lordes haureth nychelet lalyne hordayne chyne cantan queſnoy fleron iohn̄ brother lordes bouſet ieumont freſſhe knightes enemyes alſo robertle rour lordes mōth • aulr foūtayns seuls sars william hermes pynchart brother lordes lens verlamont auſealr traſcigmes octes seauſ • e gyrarde brother lorde dyctre iohan brother bridaulx montaguy damaulx de la powle guy brother lorde maſtynge ſyr florida villyers valyaunt man doone many dedes armes amonge turkes ſarazins ſir euſtace vertayn fierebras vertayne newly come englande ſyr raſe montiquy lorde rorſyn ſir iohan dandr • gntes perſant brother dyuers knightes ſquiers theſe aſſembled monts deſyred go hym euery man bringe hym company acordynge degree wolde auaunce towne encuſe baſe freſe theraboute ſo go hym ſeem hygh freſe myddes auguſt next ſayd wolde • ary wolde go thyder moue holanders zelanders ſerue hym lyke maner theſe ſayd knyghtes eſquyers haynalt without contradictyon acorded deſyre promyſinge hym ſeruyce trewe ſubgiettes whiche fulfylled dede dyligently prepared ſame ſo begynnyng moneth auguſt yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore ſyxtene redy aparelled aſſembled company anners take water fro thence encuſe hole aſſemble ſhulde mete ¶nowe whyle aſſemble thus made haynalte demaunded ladyes gentle woman ioyouſe iourney ought ſay naye ſawe father bretherne vncles huſbandes louers frendes departe yt peryllous warre ſome knewe well howe tyme paſte haynoways wente lorde freſe neuer retourned agayne wherfore feared leſte ſhulde hap ſo theſe dyd predeceſſours ducheſſe brabant defended men countrey brabant man ſo hardy go oute countrey iourney ladyes gentlewoman haynalt deſyred often tymes frendes louers leaue iourney coulde nat lette mater howe ſore diſpleaſed myndes baſterde vertayne fierebraſe ſaid one chyefe ſetters buſyneſſe thus duke aubert guillyam ſonne herde aunſwere men haynalte went zelande ſhewynge buſyneſſe aſſented requeſt chiefe ſettynge lorde de la vere ſyr floris de boeſell floris dabell lorde zenembrige ſyr clay de boyſell phylyp corteen dyuers gentleman theſe made ſelfes redy ſuche wyſe apered well dylygence great deſyre auaunce ſelfe iourney lyke wyſe duke ſonne went holande made lyke requeſtes ye lordes good townes done zelande holanders therof ryght ioyouſe men hated freſons euer warre togyther ſpecyally ſee border countrey therfore lordes holande ſuche lorde tarterell dyuers noble men knyghtes ſquyers herynge requeſtes lordes duke aubert erle oſtrenant offered themſelfe promyſynge comforte ayde beſt power well ſhewed incontynent made redy auaunced forwarde lyke wiſe dyd men good townes countrey ſent forthe theſe lordes great nombre croſbowes moriſpykes men warre daylye men aſembled towne encuiſe ſhyppes veſſelles came thyder ſuche wyſe maryners eſtemed nombre xxx thouſande ſayd came towne harle xii hū dred whiche ſhyppes well prouyded thynges neceſſary trouthe ladyes damoſelles ſoroufull heynalt lykewiſe ſo hollande zelande sir danyell marebbed guillyam oruenbourge durſt nat apere ladyes gentylwomen ſore ſette forwarde buſyneſſe hadde great wyll deſyre reuenged freſons bicauſe batayle hadde wherin erle wyllyam pituouſlye ſlayne loſt xxxiii cote armes lynage wherfore theſe two knyghtes wolde neuer take treſon mercy raūſome within certayne ſpace euery man come encuiſe fyrſt came englyſſhe men henous capyten ſeneſchall iumont lorde comegynes marſhall came hollander zelanders frēche men came nat ſo ſoone taryed xi dayes frenche men whiche ſeaſon fell debate bytwent hollander englyſſhe men erle oſtrenaunt nat ben englyſſhmen ben ſlayne whiche ſtryfe apeſed frenchman came great ioye made cōmaundement gyuen euery man ſhulde entre ſuche ſhyppes aſſygned vnto whiche done whan ſhypped hoyſed vp ſayles ſayled forthe wether fayre ſemed diſpoſed thē pleaſure ſo many ſhippes bē araynged one another wolde haue ſtretched fro encuſe boundes condren whiche highe freſe purpoſed arryue dyde whiche xii leages water ſayled front right ordinatly ¶nowe wyll leaue ſpekyng ſpeke freſons enformed aduertyſed long duke aubertes cōmyng great puyſſaunce whan freſons knewe vnderſtode ſhulde haue warre wyſe men countre aſſē bled toguyder take counſayle aduyſe ſhulde whan long debated mater entēcion fyght enemyes ſoone myght knowe entred countrey ſayeng howe rather dye fre freſons thā ſeruage vnder kynge prince vnder ſubiectyon therfore ſayd dye quarell wolde fight enemyes concluded amonge themſelfes take man raunſome howe great ſoeuer amonge one man farre excedynge greatneſſe aboue hygher man countrey heed called iuye iouer ſome called hym great freſone manne greatly commended pruce hungery turkey rodes cypre hadde done many noble feates armes ſo greatlye renomed whan̄e harde opynions ye freſons howe wolde fight enemyes aunſwered ſayde ¶o ye noble free freſons knowe trouthe chaunce maye tourne though valyantneſſe ye haue tyme diſcon •• ted ye heyno wayes hallanders zelanders knowe trouthe ſuche come nowe vpon people experte ye warr̄ thanne beleue verily ſhall otherwyſe predeceſſours dyde wyll nat gyue vp wyll menteyne dedes therfore wyll counſayle ſufire entre let v kepe fortereſſes lette kepe feldes ſhall beate ſelfes countrey nat ſuſteyne thē long haue many dyke canne nat go farre countrey canne nat ryde abrode countrey full yuell maye go foote wherby ſhalbe ſo werye ſhall waſte theym ſelfes ſo retourne agayne mooſt brenne tenne xii vyllages whiche ſhall natte greatly greue v ſhall ſoone made agayne ſhulde fight feare nat ſtronge ynough fyght one enformed nombre hundred thouſande armed heedes whiche trouthe many mo wordes conſented thre knightes freſons fyrſt named ſir fewe dorekerque ſeconde ſir gerarde canym thirde ſir tiny walturge people wolde wyſe conſente deuyſe wolde noble men called elyns ſaye gentylmen iudges cauſes replyed ſo great freſon cōcluded ſoone knewe enemyes entred countre ſhulde go fyght abode opinyon ſo made ſelfe redy ſaye trouthe poorelye armed many armure cootes wadmoll courſe groſe clothe armed lether ſome ruſtye mayle ſome ryght well armed thus armed theym whan redy wente church toke ye croſſes baners made thre batayls euery batayle ten thouſande fyghting men came narowe paſſage well viked nere ye place enemyes ſhulde lande ſawe well howe enemyes come great deſyre take lande whiche ſaynt bartylmewes daye ſonday foreſaid yere whan ye freſons ſawe thē aproche iſſued vpon dike ſire thouſande haue lette landynge enemyes among freſons ther woman apparelled blewe rage went fro freſons came nere heynowes within ſhotte bowe ſhe tourned backe towarde ye hey nowes plucked vp clothes ſhewed bare arſe cryeng langage ser take welcome ſoone ſawe leudneſſe woman ſhot arowes quarels ſo ſhe ſtryken • • legges loynes arowes came flyeng thycke ſnowe ſome lepte ſhippes water ran folyſſhe woman wt ſwerdes ouertoke hewed ſmall peces thā euery man iſſued veſſels ſo came agaynſt freſons receyued right valyantly putte longe pykes longe ſtaues bounde yron ſaye ye trouthe takyng lande many dedes armes done bothe party many ſlayne ſore hurte biforce engliſſhe archer croſ bowes heynaulte hollande zelande wanne dyke agaynſt freſons vpon dyke araynged baners good order taryeng cōpany reuke halfe myle longe freſons putte fro dyke came cōpany mo xxx thouſande cloſed toguyder grounde dyked rounde aboute great depe dyke nat ſo farre myght well ſe enemyes wheee raynged fyrſt dyke thus contynued tyll heynowayes lande baggage certayne tentes reyred vp reſted ſondaye mondaye aduiſynge freſons enemyes whiche two dayes dyuers ſcrymiſſhes made tueſday bothe party redy certayne newe knightes made ordayned fight freſons auauuced forewarde good order batayle archer amonge ſowned trumpettes clarion ſo cāe fayre paſe paſſe ouer dike freſons came defende paſſage archer ſhotte agaynſt fierſly freſōs couered ſelfes targes erthe dyke bytwene enemyes howe ſo nere aproched certayne holanders entred dyke made bridge ſperes pykes ſo valyant corage began enuade freſons defended force right valyantly gaue ſuche ſtrokes againſt wolde moūt vp dyke many ouerthrowen downe agayne heynowayes frenche men englyſſhe men hollander zelanders ſo well armed freſons coude dōmage hurt caſt downe grounde ſuche noble dedes done atchyued impoſſible ſhewe newe made knyghtes dyde nobly deuoyre freſons defended marueylouſly great bygge men yuell armed many barelegged bare foted aſſaut lorde lygne ſeneſhall heynault lorde iumont dyuers wente aboute dyke founde awaye wherby paſſed ouer dyke ſo came freſons poyntes ſperes wherof freſons fore abaſſhed ſo dyuers lepte dyke perforce freſons fayne opyn ſparcle abrode batayle great freſon ſlayne began flye chaſe horryble cruell none taken raūſome ſpecially holanders ſlewe myght attayne vnto ſo moche ſuche taken heynowes frenche men englyſſhe men hollander ſlewe handes amonge hollander lorde wyllyam oruenbourge two ſonnes iohn̄ henry made knyghtes ſame mornyng acquyted themſelfe maruey louſly well ſlewe many freſons ſemed well loued litell freſons thus finally freſons diſcōfyted mooſt parte ſlayne felde fewe takenne priſoners caryed haye hollande kepte long ſeaſon lorde cundren lorde coūtrey felde mondaye yelden duke aubert two ſonnes yet ye felde freſons two ſonnes longe ye duke diſconfyture entred countrey condren toke townes fortreſſes howe cōquered lytell freſons dyde thē great dōmage preuy encoūtrynges whan ſhulde take priſoners wolde neuer yelde fought dethe ſayeng rather dye free freſons vnder ſubiectyon prince lorde priſoners taken coude raunſome gotten frendes wolde nat quyte rather ſuffre dye priſone wolde neuer quyte none people withoute delyuer man man ſawe none people priſone wolde ſlee enemyes take priſoner thus ende v wekes heynous taken beaten downe certayne townes vyllages fortreſſes great valure leaſon beganne waxe colde marueylouſly rayned nerehāde euery day ſees full tempeſtes wyndes duke aubert ſonne conſydringe ſeaſon purpoſed returne baſe freſe fro whens came ſo hollande eaſy paſſe colde wynter departed came encuyſe gaue lycence euery man deꝑte ſpecially ſtraūgers payde thē truely wage thāked good ayde ſeruyce thus brake vp iourney freſe cōquered lytell ſeaſon within two yere ſayd two noble prince aſſembled agayn ſeconde tyme great armye wente freſe made great cōqueſt dyd many noble dedes armes ye ſhall nowe ſhall leaue ſpekyng therof declare ye maner maryage kynge englande doughter fraunce ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe mariage kyng englande doughter frāce ordred howe frenche kyng delyuered doughter kynge englande tente twene arde calys cap ccxvi ye haue herde howe kyng englande returned fro cali englande tyll michelmas ꝑlyament weſtmynſter ſhulde begyn meane ſeaſon great prouiſion made calais guyſnes kynge lordes ſent fro porte englande coſt great prouiſyon flaunders came ſee calais lykewiſe frenche kyng brother duke orlyaunce vncles prelate lordes fraunce great prouiſyon made ſaynt omers ayre tyrwyn arde mountoyre houſes abbeyes nothynge ſpared bothe party ſpecially abbey ſaynte bertyne well replenyſſhed thynges receyue theſe kynges ꝑlyament weſtmynſter began mychelmas ordeyned endure xl dayes abridged king wolde nat tary v dayes wherin declared thynges moſt neceſſary parteyning realme ſpecially mater touched hym ſelfe cauſe cāe fro calais done retourned towardes calais agayne hym two vncles lancaſtre glouceſtre prelate lordes englande ſuche cōmaunded go ſpedde ſo iourney came agayne calays duke yorke taryed ſtyll englande erle derby gouerne realme kynges abſence whan kyng englande thus returned calais lordes fraunce beyng picardy aduertiſed therof duke burgoyn ducheſſe wyfe came ſaynt omers lodged abbey ſaynt bertyne ſone frēche kyng knewe kynge englande come agayne calais ſente hym therle ſaynt poule ſhewe hym order taken fraunce concernyng maryage whiche kynge englande gladde than̄e duke lancaſtre ſonne beauforde lancaſtre duke glouceſter affren ſonne erle rutlande erle maſhall erle huntyngton kynges chamberleyne many lordes knyghtes ſquyers ladyes rode erle ſaynt poule ſaynt omers well receyued duke burgoyne ducheſſe thyder came duke bretaigne lefte frenche kynge ayre doughter hym ye maye well knowe chere yt coude deuyſed made englyſſhe lordes ladyes ſaynt omers ducheſſe burgoyne made great dyner ducheſſe lā caſtre ſonne two doughters great gyftes gyuen plate golde ſyluer nothynge ſpared ſo moche englyſſhe men hadde marueyle therof ſpecially duke gloceſtre ſayd coūſayle ſe well great rycheſſe realme fraunce moche gyuen hym entente abate molyfie rancour hadde agaynſte fraunce lordes fraunce knewe well alwayes harde agre peace wherfore ſhewed hym moche token loue honour coude toke euer gyftes alwayes rancour abode ſtyll hert euer frenche men coulde coulde nat molifye fell ſtomake always made herde anſwers treated peace frenche men ſubtyle yet coude gette hold hym wordes aunſwers alwayes ſo couert wyſt nat howe vnderſtāde whan duke burgoyne ſawe maner ſayde counſayle leſe euer duke glouceſtour longe lyueth ſhalbe ſure peace bytwene fraūce englande ſhall alwayes fynde newe inuencyons accydentes engender hate ſtryfe bytwene bothe realmes entēdeth thynketh none thynge nat truſte haue kyng englande wherby fare better kyng ſhulde nat haue wyfe coſyn fraunce whan duke ducheſſe burgoyne coūteſſe neuers counteſſe ſaynt poule lordes ladyes fraunce hadde greatly feeſted lordes ladyes englande cōmunicacion howe theſe two kynges ſhulde mete ſpeke toguyder howe lady ſhulde delyuered thervpon apoyntment made leaue taken partes englyſſhe ꝑtie returned cali kyng ſhewed chere preſentes ben gyuen theſe newes pleaſed well kyng gladde whan herde honour ſpoken frenche kyng ſo loue hym bycauſe doughter whome truſted haue quene anone frenche kyng came ſaynt omers lodged abbey ſaynt bertyne diſlodged duke bretayne company ordayned duke berrey burgoyne burbone ſhulde go cali ſpeke kynge englande came calays ioyouſlye receyued good chere coulde deuyſed theſe thre duke ſecrete communycacion kynge counſayle ſo many bothe fraunce englande reputed peace concluded bytwene fraunce englande dede nere poynt duke glouceſter agreed well therto tyme kyng englande hadde promyſed hym wolde agree peace gyue ſon affren erldome rocheſter herytaū ce make hym ſpende yerely reuenewes two thouſande pounde ſterlyng gyue hym ſelfe ſoone came englande redy money fyftie thouſande noble ſo reaſon theſe gyftes duke glouceſtours hardneſſe well aleyed lordes fraunce ſawe well opinyons nat ſo obſtynate founde hym ſwete meke whan̄e euery thynge ordeygned came tooke leaue kynge retourned ſaynt omers frenche kynge ſhewed howe hadde ſpedde frenche kyng wente baſtyde arde duke burgoyne mountoyre duke bretaygne towne eſque duke berrey balyngham euery ꝑte aboute pyght vp tentes pauilyons countrey full people fraūce englande kynge englande came guyſnes duke lancaſtre hym duke glouceſtre hā me thus fridaye beyng euyn symon iude yere oure lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore ſixtene tenne clocke forenoone two kynges departed oute tentes pyght nat farre aſondre came foote one ye met certayne place apoynted one ſyde araynged four hundred knyghtes fraunce armed ſwerdes hādes parte foure hundred englyſſhe knyghtes lyke maner two kynges paſſed duke lā caſtre glouceſtre ledde frenche kynge duke berrey burgoyne ledde kynge englande thus came foreby ſayd eight hundred knightes whan two kynges came iuſt toguyder eyght hundred knyghtes kneled downe grounde many wepte ioye thus two kynges mette toguyder bareheeded lytell enclyned tooke eche handes frenche kynge ledde kynge englande tente whiche noble ryche four duke tooke eche handes folowed two kynges knyghtes frenche men one ſyde englyſſhe men ſyde ſo ſtode regardyng eche good humble maner tyll done than̄e ordayned ſame place two kynges tooke eche hande ſhulde made founded chapell honoure lady ſhulde called lady grace nat tell whether made nat two kynges hande hā de entred frenche kynges tente foure duke kneled downe ye kynges reyſed vp ſo talked toguyder two kynges wente lytell parte talked certayne ſpace meane tyme wyne ſpyces brought duke berrey ſerued frenche kynge ſpyce duke burgoyne wyne duke lācaſtre gloceſter ſerued kyng englād thā knightes ſquiers ſerued prelate lordes ſo yt euery man wtin ye tent hadde parte meane tyme two kynges cōmuned toguyder buſyneſſe done paſte two kynges tooke leaue eche ſo retourned tentes tooke horſes rode towardes calais kyng guyſnes duke lancaſtre glouceſter hāmes calais frenche kyng rode cordre duke orlyaunce hym duke berrey dornam duke burgoyne mountoyre done daye tentes ſtode ſtyll feldes saturdaye feeſt ſaynt symon iude aboute xi clocke kynge englande vncles lordes cāe frenche kyng tent receyued right honorably euery manne talked felowe merily table ſette vp two kynges ſat one table alone frenche kynge ryght hande duke berrey burgoyne burbone ſerued two kynges thā duke burbone caſte forthe many ieſtyng wordes make kynges laughe ſuche table duke mery man ſayd openly addreſſynge wordes kynge englāde sir quod ye ought make good chere ye haue ye deſyre ye haue wife ſhall haue deliuered frenche kyng ſayd burbonoys wolde doughter ye age coſyn ſaynt poule condicyon coſt great good ſhe ſhulde take ſonne better good wyll kynge englande herde well thoſe wordes anſwered ſpekyng duke burbone bycauſe frēche kyng hadde compared doughter erle ſaynt poules doughter ſayd sir age wyfe ſhall pleaſeth right well loue nat ſo moche herytage loue realmes two beyng one accorde kynge chriſten able anoye v dyner thus done frenche kynges tent wyne ſpyces taken yonge quene brought forthe companyed great nombre ladyes damoſelles ſhe delyuered kyng englande whan yt done euery man toke leaue departe yonge quene ſette ryche lytter wente mo frenche ladyes lady coucy ladyes englande ducheſſes lancaſtre yorke glouceſtre irelande lady namure lady poynynges great nombre lady receyued quene great ioye thus kyng englande yonge quene company rode calais ſame nyght frenche kyng cō pany ſaynt omers tueſdaye whiche alhalowen day kyng englande maryed ſayd lady iſabell fraūce churche ſaynt nicholas calais archebyſſhop caūterbury wedded theym whiche tyme great feeſt great largeſſe thurſdaye came calais duke orlyaunce burbone ſe kynge quene friday tooke leaue departed rode ſaynt omers frenche kyng ſame day mornyng kyng quene toke ſhyppe hadde fayre paſſage ouer within thre houres kynge laye caſtell douer nexte daye rocheſtre dartforde ſo eltham than̄e lordes ladyes toke leaue fiftene dayes quene brought cytie london accompanyed many lordes ladyes damoſels laye fyrſt night towre london nexte day cōueyed along throughe cytie great ſolempnyte kynges palais weſtmynſter ther kyng redy receyue ſame daye londoner gaue quene great preſentes ordayned great iuſtes holden cytie lō xl knyghtes ſquyers chalēgers holden candelmas nexte whiche delyuered herauldes publyſſhe bothe ſydes realme scotlande whan frenche kyng cōe parys maryage doughter euery lorde departed home ranne great brute realme howe frenche kyng purpoſe begynnynge marche go great army lombardy dyſtroye lorde galea duke mylayne kyng ſuche diſpleaſure agaynſt hym man coulde tourne hym wolde make voyage kyng englande promyſed ſende hym ſyxe thouſande archer duke bretaygne offered go hym two thouſande ſpeares breton great prouyſyon made iourney dolphenry vyen countie sauoy whan duke bretayne departed fro frenche kynge retourne countrey ſyr peter craon condempned paye quene iheruſalem hundred thouſande frankes priſon caſtell loure parys requeſt duke bretaygne duke burgoyne dyd ſo moche kynge good meanes duke bretaygne ſyr peter craon hym thynke promyſed pay ſayd ſōme certayne dayes foreſayd quene wyll nowe leaue mater ſpeke aduētures turkey ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe ſiege nycopoly turkey reyſed lamorabaquy howe frenche men dyſcomfyted howe hungaryons fled cap cc xvii ye haue herde howe kynge hungery lordes fraunce paſſed ryuer dunce entred turkey ſōmer moneth iuly done many enterpriſes brought dyuers townes ſubiection none reſyſted beſieged ye towne nycopoly hadde nere brought ſmall eſtate nigh redy yelde coude newes lamorabaquy kyng hungery ſaid lordes fraūce syrs thanked god haue fayre ſeaſone haue dyſtroyed parte turkey reken towne nycopolyours whan lyſt ſo ſore ouerlayde canne nat longe holde wherfore thynges conſydred coūſayle towne one go ſeaſon ſhall drawe agayn ouer dunce realme hungery haue many cyties townes caſtelles redy furnyſſhed receyue reaſon ſeyng ye come ſo farre ayde make warre agaynſt turkes whome haue founde herde cruell enemyes wynter ſhall make newe prouyſion agaynſt next ſomer ſende worde frenche kyng caſe ſo nexte ſōmer maye refreſſhe v newe men beleue whan knoweth haue done howe euery thyng ſtandeth wyll haue great affection come hyther owne perſon yonge couragyous loueth dedes armes whether cometh nat grace god next ſōmer ſhall wynne realme armony paſſe braſe ſaynt george ſo surrey wynne porte iaphes baruth conquere iheruſalem holy lande ſowdan come forewarde ſhall fyght hym ſhall nat departe without batayle theſe lyke wordes ſayd kynge hungery lordes fraunce rekened nycopoly owne howe fortune fell otherwyſe ſeaſon kynge baſaach called lamorabaquy reyſed army ſarazyns ſome farre countreys perce many great men ſarazyns came ayde lamorabaquy dyſtroy cryſtendome paſſed braſe ſaynt george nombre two hūdred thouſande men ſay trouth chryſten men nat certayned nombre kynge baſaache men aproched nere nycopoly couerte wayes knewe feates warre moche myght kynge valyaunt man whiche ſhewed well reaſon polycy ordered bataylles thus hooſt maner wynges men compriſed well great myle grounde hooſt ſhewe face redye bande eyght thouſande turkes two wynges batayle open forefronte narowe behyndeand lamorabaquy herte batayle thus rode couerte theſe eyght thouſande turkes ordeyned make face yt ſone ſhulde ſe cryſten men ꝓche recule lytell lytell herte batayle two wynges whiche open cryſten men beyng one entred bytwene theym cloſe togyther ioyne one company fyght enemyes ordre batayle thus yere oure lorde god thouſande thre hūdred fourſcore ſyxtene monday feeſt ſaynt mychell ten clocke kyng hungery ſate dyner ſiege nycopoly tydynges came hooſt howe turkes comyng ſcoutes came ſhewed howe ſene turkes reporte nat trewe nat tydden ſo forwarde auewed two wynges batayle behynde ſene mo ye fore ryders bowarde ſoone ſene theym retourned ſame ſeaſone greateſt parte ye hoſt dyner tydynges brought erle neuers ingenerall ſcurers ſaid syrs arme quyckly ye nat ſurpriſed turkes comynge theſe tydynges greatly reioyſed cryſten men ſuche deſyred dedes armes euery man roſe fro dynners put table fro demaunded harneſſe horſes well chafed drynkynge wyne euery man drewe felde baners ſtanderdes dyſplayed euery man owne baner baner lady dyſplayed therwith valyaunt knyght ſir iohan vien admyrall fraunce frenche men fyrſt drewe felde freſſhely aparelled makynge ſmall accompte turkes knewe nat ſo great nombre lamorabaquy owne perſone theſe lordes fraunce felde came vnto theym kynge hungeryes marſhall great haſt valyaunte knyght called henry oſtenlenyhall vpon good horſe penon armes ſyluer croſſe ſable ancored called armure yron mylſtone whan came baner lady ſtode ſtyll moſte parte barones fraunce ſayd openly syrs ſent hyther fro kynge hungery deſireth ye ſat nat enemyes vntyll ſuche tyme ye haue worde agayne fro ought doughted leſt ſcoutes haue nat brought certaynte nombre turkes within theſe two houres ye ſhall tydynges haue ſent foreryders forth auewe enemyes ſubſtancially firſt dyd ſyrs ye maye ſure turkes ſhall nat indomage v ye tary tyll hole puyſſaunce togyder syrs ordre kynge counſayle hath ordered muſte retourne agayne kynge whan deꝑted french lordes aſſembled thē togyder knowe beſt demaunded lorde coucy thought beſt done anſwered ſaid wolde counſayle obey kyng hungeryes cōmaundement ordre ſemeth good enfourmed ſyr phylippe arthoys erle ewe conſtable fraunce nat contented aduyſe nat fyrſt haue ben demaunded hym pride diſpyght helde contrary opynyon ſayd ye ſyr ye kynge hungery wolde haue floure chiefe honour iourney haue vowarde hath graunted v nowe wolde take fro v agayne beleue hym wyll nat ſayd knyght bare banner name god ſaynt george ye ſhall ſeme daye good knyght whan lorde coucy herde conſtable ſpeke theſe wordes toke done great preſumpcyon loked ſyr iohan vyen bare ſtandarde lady demaūded hym thought beſt doone syr quod wyſe reaſone canne nat herde pride muſte reygne ſythe erle ewe wyll nedes ſet muſt nedes folowe howe ſhulde ſtronger puyſſaūce hole togyther thus deuyſed felde ſtyll turkes aproched two wynges eche lx thouſande men beganne aproche cloſe chryſten men bytwene ſo wolde haue reculed coulde nat cloſed ſarazyns wynges ſo thicke dyuers knyghtes well expert armes ſawe well iourney ſhulde agaynſt howe auaunced folowed baner lady borne valyaunt knight ſyr iohn̄ vien euery knyght fraunce cote armure euery man ſemed kinge ſo freſſhly aparelled ſhewed whan began fyrſte fyght turkes nat paſt ſeuen hundred men lo beholde great foly outrage taryed kynge hungery threſcore thouſande men lykely haue doone great acte pride loſt receyued ſuche dō mage ſythe batayle rounſeualx xii peres fraūce ſlayne cryſtendome receyued nat ſo great dōmage howe dyſcomfyted great nombre turkes ſlayne frenche men dyſcomfyted fyrſt batayle turkes chaſe tyll came valey lamorabaquy hole puyſſaunce frenchman wolde haue retourned hooſt coulde nat cloſed partes ſore batayle frenche men endured longe newes came kyng hungery howe frenche men englyſſhmen almayns fyghtyng turkes broken cōmaundement counſayle gyuen thē marſhall wherwith ſore dyſpleaſed nat without good cauſe ſawe well howe lykely leſe iourney ſaid great mayſter rodes hym syr ſhall day leſe iourney reaſon pride frenchman wolde haue beleued ſtronge ynough haue fought enemyes therwith kynge hungerye loked behynde hym ſawe howe men fled waye diſcomfyted ſelfe ſawe well recouery ſuche aboute hym cryed ſayd saue ſelfe ye ſlayne hungery loſte ye ſhall leſe felde daye reaſon pride frenche men valyaūtneſſe turneth folyſſh hardynes ſhall ſlayne taken none lykely ſcape therfore ſyr ye beleue v ſaue youre ſelfe ſcape daunger kynge hungery ſore dyſpleaſed whan ſawe howe loſt ye iourney dyſorderyng frenche men ſawe remedy flye el taken ſlayne great murder flyenge chaſed ſo ſlayne hungery fledde without ordre turkes chaſed theym howe god ayded kinge hūgery great mayſter rodes came ryuer dunce founde lytell barge parteynynge rodes entered ſeuen perſones ſo went ſhore el ſlayne taken turkes came ryuer ſyde ſlewe many cryſten man ſuche folowed kynge ſaue ſelfe nowe lette v ſpeke frenche men almayns fought valyauntly whan lorde mount caurell ryght valyaunt knyght arthoys ſawe dyſcomfyture ranne vpon hym ſonne yonge man ſayde ſquyer take ſonne leade hym away yonder wynge whiche open ſaue hym wyll abyde aduenture felowes whan chylde herde father ſay ſo ſayd howe wolde nat departe father dyd ſo moche perforce ſquyer led hym away parell came ryuer dunce chylde ſuche care father tooke ſmall regarde hym ſelfe ſo fell ye ryuer bytwene two barge drowned without remedy alſo ſyr wyllyam tremoyle fought batayle valyauntly ſlayne ſonne ſyr iohan vyen bearynge baner lady ſlayne baner handes thus lordes knightes fraūce diſtroyed maner ye haue herde syr iohan burgoyne erle neuers ſo rychely beſene lykewyſe ſo ſyr guy de la ryuer dyuers lordes knyghtes burgoyne taken priſoners two ſquiers picardy ryght valyaunt men called gyllyam dewe bourge maytequell theſe two valyauntneſſe two tymes paſſed felde euer retourned agayne dyd marueyls fynally ſhere ſlayne ſay trouthe frenche men ſtraūgers acquyted ſelfe valyauntly frenchman pride loſt knyght pycardy called ſyr iaques helley dwelte turkey ſerued lamorabaquy coude ſomwhat ſpeke langage turkey whan ſawe batayle loſte yelded hym ſelfe sarazyns couetous golde ſyluer toke ſaued hym alſo lquyer tornaſys called iaques du fay ſerued kynge tartary called tauburyn ſoone iaques knewe yt frenche men came make warre turkey toke leaue kynge tartary departed ſayd felde taken priſoner kyng tartary men ayde lamorabaquy kynge tauburyn tartary ſent hym great nombre men warre frenchman ſo richely arayed ſemed lyke kynges wherby taken lyues ſaued ſarazyns turkes couetous truſted haue great raunſomes theſe taken reputed greater lordes sir iohan burgoyn erle neuers taken priſoner lykewyſe erles ewe de la marche lorde coucy ſyr henry bare ſyr guy de la tremoyle bouciquant dyuers ſyr philyp bare ſyr iohan vyen willyam tremoyle ſonne ſlayne dyuers batayle endured thre houres fyghtynge kinge hungery loſt baggage plate iowelles gladde ſaue hym ſelfe ſeuen perſons lytell barge rodes el taken ſlayne without recouery mo men ſlayne chaſe batayle many drowned happy might ſcape maner meanes whan dyſcomfyture doone paſſed turkes ſuche ſent thyder sowdan withdrawen lodginges whiche tentes pauylyons conquered whiche founde well replenyſſhed wyne meate redy dreſſed wherwith refreſſhed made ioy reuell lyke ſuche people ateygned vyctorye enemyes lamorabaquy greate nombre mynſtrelles acordyng vſage countrey came kynge hungeryes chefe tent whiche goodly aparelled hanged riche ſtuffe toke great pleaſure glorifyed herte wynnyng iourney ſhanked god acordynge lawe vnarmed hym refreſſhe hym ſate downe tapyte ſylke cauſed great lordes come iangle talke made great myrthe myght ſayd howe wolde ſhortely great puyſſaunce paſſe realme hungery cōquere countrey countreys vpon cryſten men bringe obeyſaunce ſayd content euery man ſhulde lyue owne lawes deſyred nothynge ſignory ſayd wolde reygne lyke alyſaunder maſydone twelue yere kynge worlde whoſe lynage ſayde dyſcended yt herde agreed ſayenge madethre cōmaundemētes fyrſt ſo euer priſoner cryſten bringe hym forthe ſeconde daye preſence ſeconde deed bodyes ſhulde vyſyted ſertched ſuch likely noble men layde aparte ſelfe raymentes tyll came thyder hym ſelfe ſayd wolde ſe thyrde enquyre iuſtely kyng hungery deed lyue done cōmaunded whan lamorabaquy well refreſſhed hym paſſe tyme went ye place felde ſe deed bodyes ſhewed hym many men ſlayne batayle coſt hym greatly great marueyle coulde nat byleue mounted horſe great nombre hym two bretherne called baſaache surbaſaach ſome people ſayd wolde nat knowen ſayd bretherne whan came place batayle founde trouthe many deed ſlayne ſawe yt one cryſten man deed founde xxx turkes ſlayne wherwith marueylouſly dyſpleaſed openly ſayde hath cruell batayle marueylouſſly defended cryſten men ſhal make lyue bye derely kynge went lodgynge ſo paſſed nyght great furour hert mornyng vp moche people came tente knowe ſhulde chryſten priſoners renome ranne ſhulde put dethe without mercy lamorabaquy dyſpleaſure ordeyned ſuche cryſten men batayle great ray lykely great men ſhulde ſette togyther one parte ſhewed hym myght well pay great raunſomes alſo dyuers ſarazyns panyms perce tartary arabye ſuryens many priſoners whome thought haue great aduauntage dede hyd way ſo came nat knowledge amonge ſyr iaques helley brought lamorabaquy durſt nat hyde hym lenger syr iaques de helley beknowen ſome kynges ſeruaūtes toke hym fro whiche happy hym ye ſhall many cryſten men afterwarde cruelly ſlayne put dethe kynge baſaach cōmaunded enquyre whiche greateſt cryſten men ſhulde ſet ſyde entent ſaue lyues tryed ſet parte fyrſt lorde iohan burgoyne erle neuers chiefe aboue ſyr phylyppe arthoys erle ewe erle marche lorde coucy ſyr henry bare ſyr guy tremoyle nombre eyght perſones lamorabaquy went ſe ſpeke beheld longe ſeaſone coniured theſe lordes faythe lawe ſaye trouthe perſones named ſelfe ſayde ye yet knowe certaynte ſente frenche knyght ſyr iaques helley knowe ſerued lamorabaquy therfore lyfe graū ted hym demaunded knewe frenche knyghtes pryſoners aunſwered ſaid thynke iſe ſhall knowe cōmaunded go auewe theym ſhewe playnely name dyd cōmaūded whan came ſhewed aduenture howe ſente thyder knowe ſurely name ſayde ah ſyr iaques ye knowe v ye ſe well howe fortune agaynſt v daunger kynge therfore ſaue lyues make v rather greater dede ſhewe kyng ſuche men able pay great raunſomes ſyrs quod ſo ſhall boūde therto knight retourned lamorabaquy counſayle ſyd howe thoſe knyghtes whiche hadde ſpoken greateſt men fraunce kynges lyngage ſaid able pay great raunſomes lamorabaquy ſayd howe lyues ſhulde ſaued priſoners ſlayne hewen peces example kynge ſhewed hym ſelfe people aſſembled whome made lowe reuerence made lane hym paſſe thorough euery man ſworde naked hande ſo came thyder ſayd lordes fraunce ſtode togyther king wolde ſe correction whiche thynge ſarazyns deſyrous brought lamorabaquy naked ſhyrtes behelde lytell tourned fro warde made ſygne ſhuld ſlayne ſo brought ſarazyns redy naked ſwordes handes ſo ſlayne hewen peces without mercy cruell iuſtyce dyd lamorabaquy daye whiche mo thre hūdred gentleman dyuers nacyons tourmented ſlayne loue god whoſe ſoules ieſu haue mercy amonge ſlayne ſyr henry dantoigne heynalt ſo lord boucyquante marſhall fraunce one theym brought naked kynge ben ſlayne erle neuers nat eſpyed hym ſone ſawe hym went ſtreyght kynge kneled downe deſyred hym effectuouſly reſpyte fro dethe knyght ſyr boucyquant ſayenge howe great man fraūce able pay great raunſome lamorabaquy condyſcended requeſt erle neuers ſo ſyr boucyquant ſette amonge ſhulde ſaued thus cruell iuſtyce done day vpon cryſten men bycauſe lamorabaquy wolde vyctory ſhulde knowen fraunce apoynted thre frenche knyghtes come hym wher ſyr iaques helley one kyng demaūded erle neuers whiche tho thre knyghtes wolde choſe ſende fraunce kynge duke burgoyne father erle neuers ſayd ſyr pleaſe wolde knyght ſyr iaques helley ſhulde go thyder fro fro v ſyr iaques taryed lamorabaquy two knyghtes delyuered dethe ſo ſlayne whiche pytie lamorabaquy well apeaſed furoute vnderſtode howe kyng hungery ſcaped away lyue determyned retourne turkey cytie called burſe ſo dyd thyder ye priſoners brought army departed ſpecyally ſuche farre coūtreys tartary perce mede sury alerandre lecto ſyr iaques helley delyuered retourne fraunce cōmaunded retourne throughe lombardy recommaunde lamorabaquy duke myllayne alſo ſtreyghtly cōmaunded euery place paſſed manyfeſt publiſſhe victory lamorabaquy vpon cryſten men erle neuers wrote frenche kynge hym ſelfe company father duke burgoyne ducheſſe mother whan knyght charge well writyng credence departed toke way towardes fraunce departed ſworne promyſed ſoone done meſſage fraūce incontynent retourne agayne thyder whiche othe promeſſe acōplyſſhed lyke trewe knight nowe wyll leaue ſpeakynge tyme lamorabaquy lordes fraūce priſoners wyll ſpeke mater fell ſame ſeaſon ⸫ ⸫ ¶of pouertie myſery cryſten knightes fraunce nacyons endured commynge home countreys cap ccxviii great dyſcō fyture turkes vpon criſten men ſuche knyghtes could ſaue ſelfe dyd ſame mondaye thre hundred knyghtes ſquyers gone foragynge nat batayle whan knewe fledde batayle doone deſyre retourne agayne lodginges fledde well myght toke dyuers wayes flye fro ye turkes ther fled bothe frenchman engliſſhmen almayns ſcottes flemynges nacyons came countrey ioynynge hungery called blacquy countrey replenyſſhed dyuers people conquered vpon turkes tourned perforce cryſten faythe kepers porte townes caſtels ſuffered theſe cryſten men entre lodge nexte mornynge departure tooke fro theſe knyghtes ſquyers gaue poore cote lytell ſlyuer paſſe therwith one dayes iourney grace ſhewed gentleman yeoman varlettes ſpoyled naked ſore beaten yuell entreated without pytie paſſed coūtrey blacquy great pouerte hūgery coude ſcant get breed goddeſſake lordgyng nyght endured daunger paſſynge tyll came vyen auſtrich receyued ſwetely refreſſhed newe cladde ſo throughe realme boeſme hadde founde almaygnes ſo harde neuer tourned agayne rather dyed colde hunger euery man herde tell aduenture hadde pytie finally came fraunce paris ſhewed aduentures begynnynge coude nat beleued parys ſayde pytie theſe vnthriftes vnhanged drowned tellyng ſuche lie howe theſe tidynges dayly multiplyed wt reſortyng newe men whan frenche kynge vnderſtode theſe newes dayly renewed nothyng pleaſaunt hym great dōmage loſſe noble men blode good knyghtes ſquyers realme fraū ce cōmaunded man ſo hardye ſpeke mater tyll better enfourmed certentie cōmaunded ſuche come oute hungery ſhulde taken put priſone tyll trouth knowen many putte priſon kyng hadde ordayned newe nat trewe ſhulde drowned putte dethe ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe trewe tidynges batayle turkey knowen frenche kyngꝭ houſe capi ccxix chriſtēmas daye ſir iaques helley houre noone entred parys ſo toke lodgynge demaunded kyng ſhewed hym ſaynt poules ye ryuer seyn went thyder kyng duke orlyaunce brother duke berrey duke burgoyne duke burbone therle ſaynt poule dyuers noble men realme fraunce vſage ſuche noble men kynge ſuche highe feeſtes ſir iaques helley entred court boted ſpurred nat knowen long tyme haū ted farre countreis dyd ſo moche came kynges chambre ſayd howe came fro lamorabaquy oute turkey hadde ben batayle nicopolye chriſten men loſt iourney ſayd hadde letter fro erle neuers fro lordes fraunce ſuche priſoners brought kynge kneled downe wiſely declared meſſage well fro lamorabaquy fro erle neuers lordes fraunce priſoners turkey kynge gaue hym audyence ſwetely examyned hole mater euery thyng anſwered ſo diſcretely ye kyng well content hym ryght ſoroufull dōmage ye kyng hugry ſuſteyned howe gladde kyng hungery ſcaped without dethe priſonment ſayde ſhulde recouer ryght well agayne loſſe dōmage receyued tyme alſo ryght ioyfull erle neuers lordes eſcaped dethe priſoners ſade doute ſhulde raunſomed delyuered ſir iaques helley ſayd doute lamorabaquy wolde within ye yere put raūſome loued golde richeſſe ſir iaques ſayd knewe well bicauſe long ben conuerſaunt turkey ſerued lamorabaquyes father thre yere thus kynge ryght well receyued knyght ſo dyde lordes ſuche euery man ſayd happy worlde ſuche batayle haue acquayntaunce ſuche hethan kynge lamorabaquy ſayenge honoure lynage kyng cō maunded ſuche priſon delyuered wherof gladde thus theſe newes ſir iaques helley brought ſpredde anone brode fraunce place many right ſoroufull loſſe father bretherne huſbandes chyldren nat without good cauſe ſpecially ye gret ladyes fraunce ducheſſe burgoyne ſonne erle neuers doughter margarete heynault ſoroufull erle huſbande lykewyſe dolorous mary berrey counteſſe ewe huſbande lorde philyppe arthoiſe conſtable fraunce lykewiſe ſo counteſſe marche lady coucy dought bare lady sully many ladyes well fraunce place whan wepte ynoughe reconforted ſelfe natte ſlayne priſouers ſuche knewe huſbādes father bretherne chyldren frēdes deed lamētacions endured long fraūce duke burgon made moche knyght ſir iaques helley brought hym worde ſonne lyue gaue hym many ryche gyftes reteyned hym one knyghtes two hundred pounde reuenewes yerely duryng lyfe frenche kyng lordes gaue largely knight thā ſhewed howe muſt nedes returne agayne lamorabaquy promyſe departynge ſtoode priſoner ſayd howe hadde nat retourned meſſage fro lamorabaquy kynge thought reſonable ſhulde kepe promyſe kynge wrote theſe priſoners concluded counſayle frenche kyng ſhulde ſende knight honour lamorabaquy thentent myght retourne agayne bring newe tydynges caſe priſoners apoynted go voyage ſir iohn̄ caſtell morant wyſe knyght well languaged demaunded ſir iaques iowelles preſentes kynge myght beſt ſende lamorabaquy ſhulde beſt pleaſe entent priſoners ſhulde better entreated knight anſwered lamorabaquy toke gret pleaſure clothes arras made olde auncyent hyſtories alſo ſayd great delyte theſe whyte faucons called gerfaucons alſo ſayd fyne lynnen clothes fyne ſcarlettes moche made clothe golde ſylke hadde plentie pleaſed well frenche kyng duke burgonoe whoſe myndes ſette pleaſe lamorabaquy thus xii dayes ſir iaques helley taryed parys euery man gladde hym reporte ye aduentures turkey maner lamorabaquy whan deꝑted retourne kynge ſayd hym sir iaques take way make ſmall iourneys eaſe thynke ye wyll returne lombardy ſpeke duke myllayne great amyte bytwene hym lamorabaquy whiche waye ſo euer ye go wyll ſir iohan caſtell morant abyde hungry tyll ye haue gote hym ſaueconducte go lamorabaquy ſuche preſentes ſhall ſende hym entent ſhulde fauorable priſoners sir quod ſhalbe done departed tooke ſame waye came anone departure kynge duke burgoyne dyde prepare theſe preſentes ſir iohan caſtell morant diſpatched charge hym ſixe ſōmers laden preſētes two clothes arras goodlyeſt coude gote wrought ſtorie alexandre lyfe conqueſtes ryght pleaſaunt beholde two ſōmers charged fyne ſcarlettes whyte reed alſo moche payne kynge gate theſe whyte gerfaucons thus ſir iohan caſtell morant departed fro parys preſentes charge fyftene dayes ſir iaques helley departed mean ſeaſon kynge hungry retourned coūtre wherof people right ioyfull loued hym ſo came conforted hym ſayde sir though ye haue hadde dōmage tyme another tyme ye ſhall right well recouer thus kynge bare dōmage well myght ye parte lamorabaquy retourned countre came towne called burſe thyder priſoners brought ſette vnder ſure kepynge nothyng eaſe heate countrey dyette ſore chaunged hadde ben vſed ſwete delycate mete drinkes owne cooke offycers dyde prepare meates accordynge dyettes turkey ſarued contrarye groſe meates fleſſhe yuell ſodden dreſſed ſpyces ynough bredde made mylke clene fro nature fraū ce wyne great daunger thoughe great lordes ſmally regarded turkes lyue ſicke hole deed lyue wolde ben putte execuſyon theſe priſoners conforted eche within themſelfe ſawe none remedy ſo ſome thē nature chaunged fell ſickeneſſe made beſt chere countynaunce erle neuers dyde conforte companyons alſo ſir bouciquant erle marche ſir henry bare good conforte tooke euery thynge paciently sayeng honour armes glorie worlde coude nat hadde without payne ſomtyme metyng harde aduentures ſaid neuer ſo valyaunt happy alwayes euery thyng wyſſhed ſayde bounde thanke god hadde ſaued lyues conſydringe diſpleaſure lamorabaquy counſayle loſſe men one determyned ſhulde generally haue putte dethe bouciquaunt ſayd ought aboue thanke god lyfe poynt haue bē hewen peces company requeſt lorde erle neuers ſaued aduenture call good ſithe god hath delyuered v fro paryll wyll pleaſe hym delyuer v fro greatter ſoudyers ſake haue payne reaſon ſir iaques helley gone fraunce truſt within yere ſhall haue good comforte delyuered matter abyde thus frenche kyng duke burgoyn wyll nat forgette v ſome meanes raunſomed delyuered thus ſir boucyquaunt reconforted hym ſelfe tooke euery thyng good pacyence lorde coucy coude take cōforte whiche marueyle tyme lorde great wyſdome great coniorte neuer abaſſhed beyng thus priſon burſe turkey diſconforted malencoly ſayd ſure ſhulde neuer retourne fraūce sir henry bare conforted hym moche myght blamed hym diſconforte ſayeng howe ought gyue conforte howe ſame ſir henry ſore abaſſhed hym ſelfe oftentymes remembred wyfe wolde wepe pituouſly lykewiſe ſo dyd ſir philyppe arthoiſe erle ewe conſtable fraunce sir guye tremoyle good conforte ſo erle marche lamorabaquy content ſomtyme ſhulde haue ſome paſtyme ſomtyme wolde go hym ſelfe ſe iangle bourde right graciouſly wolde ſhulde ſe parte eſtate puyſſaunce ¶nowe lette v leaue ſomwhat ſpeke ſpeke ſir iaques helley ſir iohn̄ caſtell morant bothe ryding towardes hungry sir iaques helley taryed cytie bode hungry ten xii dayes abydinge ſir iohan caſtell morant whan cōe ſir iaques ioyfull deſyrous paſſe forthe turkey acquyte hym faythe promyſe ſe erle neuers lordes fraunce comforte whan kynge hungry ſawe ſir iohn̄ caſtelmorant made good chere loue ye frenche kynge vnderſtode frenche kyng ſent hym gret preſētes iowels lamoraba • wherwith ſore diſpleaſed mynde diſſymuled mater kepte couert tyll ſir iohan heley departed turkey warde ſaid ſuche priuye counſayle diſcouered mater vnto howe miſcreant dogge aduerſary lamorabaquy ſhulde haue preſē te fraunce fro place el laye power lette sir iohn̄ helley departed promyſed gette lamorabaquy ſaueconducte ſir iohan morant paſſe turkey repaſſe long trau • yled guydes came turkey cytie burſe lamorabaquy another cytie called poly ſo euer went priſoners caryed hym excepte lorde coucy taryed ſtyll burſe coude nat endure ryde ſo ſicke hym taryed coſyn grece right valyant barone diſcended lynage duke auſtriche called mathelyn whan ſir iaques come poley lamorabaquy gladde ſe hym bycauſe come fraunce ſir iaques right humbly ſaid right dere redouted ſir beholde priſoner beſt power haue meſſage ye ye gaue charge lamorabaquy ſayd thou arte welcōe thou haſt trewly acquyted thy ſel • e therfore acquyte thy raunſome priſon ſo thou mayſt go retourne tary thy pleaſure wherof ſir iaques right hūbly thā ked hym ſhewed howe frenche kyng duke burgoyne ſente knyght honoure embaſſade hym credēce brought hym certayne preſentes pleaſure fro frenche kyng lamorabaquy demaunded ſene nat knyght aunſwered ſir haue nat ſene knyght hath ye charge meſſage bode hungry ſir come ſhewe therof haue ſaueconducte ſayd knyght come retourne ſafely lamorabaquy ſayd wyll haue one thou wylte deuyſe wherof knyght thanked hym departed tyme another tyme ſir iaques ſpake lamorabaquy kneled downe hym humbly requyred myght ſe lordes knyghtes fraunce dyuers thynges ſaye countre lamorabaquy ſtudyed lytell aunſwered laſte ſayd thou ſhalte ſpeke one mo ſo ſent erle neuers alone whan come ſir helley kneled downe hym therle glad ſe hym demaunded howe frenche kynge duke father duches mother dyde knyght ſhewed hym knewe charged ſaye hym howe nat ſo good leyſar talke togyder wolde haue lamorabaquyes men preſent badde haue done ſayd thynges ſtande wayte vpon ſir iaques demaunded erle howe lordes fraunce dyde erle ſaid good caſe except ye lorde coucy ſomwhat diſeaſed cytie burſe ſir iaques ſhewed hym howe ſir iohan caſtell morant come fraunce fro kyng fro duke burgoyne ambaſſade lamorabaquy aſſwage yre hath ſent hym ryche iewelles preſentes bode hungry kyng come ſauecōduct hym come go whiche lamorabaquy hath graunted thynke ſhall retourne hym ſhortely herof therle right ioyous durſt make ſemblant feare turkes ſaid ſir iaques vnderſtande ye quyte raunſome priſon ye maye retourne whan pleaſeth fraūce whan ye come praye ſhewe kyng father deſyre treate ſhortely maye delyueraunce ſome marchauntes genowayes veniſyons agree fyrſt worde lomorabaquy ſhall deſyre raū ſome ſhulde make long treatie wt hym ſhalbe loſt euer vnderſtā de lamorabaquy trewe worde curteſſe ſhorte mater ſo taken poynt thus erle neuers ſir iaques departed whan ſaueconducte redy delyuered ſir iaques toke leaue lamorabaquy courte aquayntaunce rode ſo longe iourneys arryued bode hungry drewe ſir iohan moraunt thought longe hym ſir iaques ſayd ſir haue brought ſaueconducte go turkey youre company retourne agayne pleaſure gladde therof ꝙ knyght lette v go kyng hungry ſhewe hym therof morowe betymes lette v departe haue taryed longe ynoughe bothe togyder wente kyng chambre ſhewed hym mater kynge anſwered ſayde sir iohan moraunt ye helly ye welcome ye ſhall go youre pleaſure loue coſyns fraunce wolde gladde pleaſure alſo ye maye go come throughe realme pleaſure alſo turkey ye pleaſe preſentes ſir iohan haue brought fraūce wyll nat agree ye ſhall conuey hell hounde lamorabaquye ſhall neuer enryched therwith ſhulde tourne great ſhame rebuke ſhulde make auauut bycauſe hath victorie v hath daunger priſon certayne lordes frā ce feare therof ſhulde ſente hym riche preſentes gerfaucōs care nat foules flye lightly oute one countre another ſoone gyuen ſoone loſt riche hangynges arras thynges ſene endure euer wherfore ſir iohan morant ye wyll paſſe turkey ger faucōs go whan pleaſe thyng ye ſhall haue non thā knyght aunſwered ſayd certaynly ſir ſhulde nat myne honour pleaſāt frenche kynge lordes haue ſente hyder without myght accōplyſſhe voyage haue charge well quod kynge ye ſhall haue none waye tyme kynge went fro lefte two knightꝭ ſpekynge toguyder ſore troubled abuſyon kynge hungery counſayled toguyder beſt determyned ſende haſtye meſſangers frēche kynge duke burgoyne ſithe ſawe coulde haue none remedy wrote letter kyng duke burgoyne ſhulde ꝓuyde mater ſente letter poſte make haſt taryed ſtyll ſelfes bode kyng hungry abyding retourne meſſanger meſſanger ſpedde ſo well made ſuche dilygence came parys founde ye kyng duke burgoyn ſhewed le •• reed length whiche nothynge pleaſed marueyle kyng hungry wolde nat ſuffre preſentes paſſe throughe countre turkey duke berrey excuſed kynge hungry ſayde howe good cauſe dyde thyng humbly done kynge ſende ſuche preſentes hethan thyng duke burgoyne bycauſe mater touched hym contrary opinyon ſaid thyng reaſonable ſo ſith fortune hath ben ſo fauorable haue vyctorie ſuche batayle hath hadde kyng hungry chaſe hath taken priſoners ſuche noble men agaynſt hym iourney wherfore frēdes thoſe priſoners may well fynde meanes howe comforte delyueraunce duke wordes vp holden kynge dyuers counſayle kynge demaunded vncle berrey sayeng fayre vncle lamorabaquy ſoudan hethan kynge ſende ruby ryche iewell wheder wyll ye receyne nat sir quod wolde take aduyſe yt kyng ſayd paſſeth nat yet tenne yere ſythe ſoudan ſente ruby whiche coſt twentie thouſande frankes kynge hungries dede nat ſuſteygned ſayd yuell done ſtoppe goyng theſe preſentes ſhulde rather hynder priſoners auaunce thē kyng coūſayled write ye kyng hungry amyable letter deſyringe hym nat ſtoppe knyght ſuffre paſſe turkey preſētes meſſage letter written ſealed delyuered agayne ſame meſſāger ſo departed retourne hūgry ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe ducheſſe orlyaunce doughter duke myllayne ſuſpecte frenche kynges ſyckeneſſe cap ccxx ye haue harde howe frēche kyng lightly euery yere ſore enclyned fall frā ſey ſo nother phiſycion ſurgion coude remedy hym many ſaid wolde helpe hym whan̄e came poynt labour vayne kynges ſickeneſſe wolde nat ceaſe nother prayer medycins tyll ron full courſe phiſycions arioles charmer whan ſawe remedy ſaid ſurely howe kynge poyſoned wytched crafte ſorcerye whiche noyſe made lordes haue many ſuſpecte ſome theſe nigromancers affyrmed kynges ſickeneſſe came reaſon ſorcery charmes make thē beleue ſo ſayd knewe ſpyrites ſhewed theſe deuins arioles charmer certayne brente parys auignon ſpake ſo moche ſayd ducheſſe valentyne orlyaūce doughter duke myllayn hadde witched kynge entent attayne crowne fraunce ſo ſclaundred lady ye brute ran realme ſhe vſed ſuche craftes ſorcery ſayeng long ſhe kyng myght ſe kyng ſhulde nat amēde behoued lady auoyde ſclaunder flye fro paryll therof departe fro parys ſo ſhe wente aſyners fayre caſtell nere pontoyſe ꝑteyning huſbande duke orlyaūce afterwarde ſhe went dwelt newcaſtell ryuer loyre parteynynge huſbande ſore diſpleaſed hert ſuche brute ran vpon wyfe howe diſſymuled mater well myght dyd nat abſent hym ſelfe fro court moche buſyneſſe mater realme duke myllayne called galea well enformed howe doughter ducheſſe orlyaunce accuſed wherof ſore diſpleaſed ſente twyſe thriſe ambaſſadours frenche kyng coū ſayle offred fynde knyght fyght vttraūce man wolde accuſe doughter trayſon meſſā gers maner thretned ye duke wolde make warre fraunce bycauſe frenche kyng beyng good helthe balyngham bitwene ſaynt omers cali ſaid aſſone retourned fraū ce wolde entende nothyng make warre vpon duke myllayne alſo kyng englande called hym ſelfe ſonne bycauſe maryed doughter promyſed ſende hym thouſande ſperes ſixe thouſāde archer wherof frenche kyng right ioyfull prouiſyon made frenche kyng countie sauoy ye dolphenry kynges mynde entre waye lombardy make warre duke myllaygne iourney toke none effecte whan tidynges brought fraunce diſconfyture batayle nicopoly turkey ye dethe takynge lordes fraunce kynge duke burgoyne ſo charged buſyed behalfe iourney lombardy defected alſo ſawe well yt duke myllayne fauoure lamorabaquy ſo durſt nat diſpleaſe hym ſo lette hym alone ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe duke burgoyne ducheſſe wyfe toke great dylygence fynde meanes redeme priſone erle neuers ſonne priſoners beyng turkey cap ccxxi duke burgoyn duches ſtudyed wayes coulde deuyſe maner tretye myght gette ſonne pryſone knewe well coulde haue hym ſhulde fayne pay hym great raunſome myniſſhed houſholde kept meaner eſtate gathered moche golde ſyluer coulde without coulde nat bringe aboute purpoſe gate theym aquayntauuce marchauntes venycience genouoys ſuche thought meanes ſhulde rather come purpoſe duke burgoyne lay ſtyll paris kynge nephue chiefe gouernaunce realme wherby buſyneſſe better effecte ſame ſeaſone parys marchaunt turkey doynge lombardes knowen ſpoken worlde name called dyne reſponde hym exchaunges made good fauour kyng lordes iourney turkey batayle moche made often tymes duke burgoyne demaunded hym counſayle howe myght entre treatie lamorabaquy redempcion ſonne priſoners turkey sir ꝙ marchaūt lytell lytell ſome meanes wyll founde syr marchauntes gennes iſles knowen ouer occupyeth trade marchaūdyſe quayre alexandre dāmas danuet turkey farre countreys hethan ye knowe well marchaundyſe flyeth ouer worlde syr let kynge write amyably theym promeſſe great benefytes profytes wolde nothynge ouercome golde ſyluer alſo ſyr kynge cyper hath hadde warre kyng lamorabaquy may ryght well ayde syr ye may ſure wyll canne bounde therto nat marueyled though duke burgoyne duches ſought wayes howe might recouer agayne ſonne heyre therfore touched thē ryght nere ladyes fraunce tooke great ſorowe huſbandes louers ſpecyally lady coucy coude nat forget huſbande ſhe wepte pytuouſly nyght daye coulde take comforte duke lorayne ſyr henry two bretherne came ſaint gobyn ſe recomforte moche myght ſayd wolde ſende turkey knowe howe dyd ſaid vnderſtode howe gentyll priſone felowes lady coucy thanked greatly two bretherne counſayle great comforte ſhe deſyred ſir robert den valyaunt knyght cambreſys take payne go hungery turkey ſe condycyon huſbande lorde coucy knyght ſayd ſake content go thyder bringe certaynte eſtate thus made redy fiue perſones ladyes fraunce ſent lyke wyſe knowe caſe huſbandes ye haue herde howe kynge hungery wolde wyſe conſent ſir morant ſhulde paſſe turkey frenche kynges preſentes opynion kynge longe contynued whiche right dyſpleaſaunt ſir morant ſyr helley coude nat amende ſo happed yt great mayſter rodes came hungery cytie bode whome kyng made good chere wherto bounde daye batayle kynge ben ſlayne taken nat ben founde theſe two knyghtes fraunce came ſhewed hym howe kynge wolde nat ſuffre paſſe turkey ſuche preſentes frenche kynge ſent lamorabaquy wherof meruayle ſayde howe wolde ſpeke kynge therin ſhulde well knowe ſo dyd ſhewed kyng ſuche reaſons tourned kynges opynion ſo leaue paſſe turkey preſentes ſo paſſed forthe vnder ſure ſafe conduct came lamorabaquy receyued theym gyftes ryght honorably vſage made great ioye preſentes knyghtes yt ſpake one onely erle neuers good leyſare departynge erle ſayde syrs requyre recommaunde lorde father lady mother lorde berrey ſpecyally kynge ſalute fro frendes deſyre lamorabaquy wyll ſet v raunſome meanes marchauntes otherwyſe raunſomes may quyckly payed delyuered longe taryenge ſhall leſe ye begynnyng viii priſoners nowe xvi whiche xxiiii ſhall nat delyuered without delyuered one ſoone one lamorabaquy hath ſo promyſed ſurely wyll nat founde falſe worde ſyr morant ſyr helley aunſwered ſayd howe cōmaundement ſhulde doone whiche bounde departed retourned hungery way encountred meſſanger ſent fraunce kynge bringynge gayne letter fro frenche kynge kyng hungery meſſanger retourned agayne theym whan ſawe retourne done voyage turkey ſo retourned togyther fraunce ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe duke glouceſtre ſubtelly ſought meanes howe dyſtroye kynge rycharde englande nephue cap ccxxii long ſyth ſpake duke glouceſtre yongeſt ſonne kynge england edwarde thyrde tyme ſpeke tyll nowe bycauſe herte coude neuer loue frenche men therfore loſſe frenche men turkey rather gladde ſory ſame ſeaſone knyght hym called ſyr iohan laquyquay chiefe counſayle knowen ſayde lorde syr fume pride frenche men well bated reaſone iourney hungery turkey ſo full pride brage canne come good concluſion enterpriſe yt take hande trewe quod duke apered right well duryng warre dayes kynge father brother prince wale coulde neuer atayne iourney agaynſt englyſſhe men therfore canne nat tell ſhulde haue trewce warre open reaſon good tytell togyther ſhulde nowe make better warre euer made nowe floure chyualry fraunce outher taken ſlayne men englande deſyre haue warre rather peace canne better lyue warre peace lyenge ſtyll none aduauntage ſwere god may lyue two yere good helth war • ſhalbe renewed wyll nother ſpare trewce reſpyte aſſuraunce tyme paſte frenche men haue kept promeſſe v haue falſely craftely taken away herytage duchy acquytayn whiche gyuen delyuered agrement good treatie peace kynge father whiche often tymes haue ſhewed counſayle fraunce whan met comuned togyther fronter marcheſſe calays alwayes floryſſhed entētes ſo ſwete wordes myne opynion nat regarded belyued nouther kynge nephewe bretherne good heed kynge englande deſyred warre well wolde put payne recouer herytage whiche craftely falſely hath taken fro hym without good tytle reaſone ſhulde fynde englande hundred thouſande archer ſyxe thouſande men armes redy aparelled ſerue paſſe ſee put goodes lyues aduenture ſeruyce nat ſo ſuche kynge englande nowe loueth dedes armes wolde ſhewe hym ſelfe fraunce neuer ſo good tyme make warre fraūce ſoeuer goeth nowe ſhalbe fought withall whiche deſyre englyſſhmen haue truſt wynnyng tyme paſte dayes good kynge edwarde father brother dayes prince wale ye yongeſt bretherne englande may beleued ſhall fyrſt e yt ſhall renewe warre truſt recouer wronges frenchman haue done v dayly ſymple ſlouthfulneſſe monge v ſpecyally heed kynge nephue wyll nowe alye hymſelfe maryage frenche kinges doughter token wyll make warre eyen heuy careth nothyng meate drinke reſte dalyenge ladyes damoſelles lyfe men warre wyll deſerue haue honour prowes dedes armes yet remembre laſt iourney yt made fraunce thynke company two thou ſande ſpeares eyght thouſande archer ſo paſſed ſee entred realme fraunce fro calayesꝭ ſo wente longe realme foūde none ſtande none durſt fyght lyke wyſe ſo dyd ſyr robert canoll ſir hugh caurell thomas graūtſome ſyr phylyppe gyſſarde yet nat nombre yet parys demaunded batayle frenche kynge coulde neuer aunſwered founde perſon ſayd thyng ſo rode bretayne ſo longe realme fraunce fro calais burdeaux without hauynge batayle rencountre thynke ſurely ſo wolde nowe make ſuche iourney ſhulde fought calleth hym ſelfe kynge fraunce yonge hote great corage enterpriſe wolde ſurely fight ende ſo euer fell therof thynge deſyre loue nothynge ſo well haue batayle without batayle victory vpon frenche men ryche el ſhall haue recouery ſuffre loſſe haue done euer ſythe nephewe kyng englande thyng nat longe endure eſtate laſte realme englande ſhall perceyue mater repente kyng taketh ſhall take reyſe great tayles ye marchauntes wherwith nat content yet nat tell good becometh thus kynge enpouereth realme englande gyueth one largely yuell beſtowed people vyeth bargayne whiche ſhortely wyll growe rebellyon within realme people begyn clater murmure therat ſayeng howe wyll lēger ſuffre beare ſayeth ſtoppe people rumure trewce one concluded bytwene fraunce wyll make voyage irelande enploye men armes archer hath ben ſmall conqueſt irelāde lande great conqueſt profyte people rude yuell right poore countrey inhabytable looke wonne one yere loſte another laquynay laquynay quod duke haue ſayde trouth thus duke glouceſtre deuyſed knyght ſuche wordes well knowen hated kynge coulde ſpeke good worde though brother duke lācaſtre one greateſt ruler realme toke care therof whan kyng dyd ſende wolde come pleaſure ſometyme nat whyt whan came kynge wolde laſte ſhulde come firſt wolde departe counſayle one ſayd opynion wolde haue taken accepted el wolde diſpleaſed ſomtyme take leaue departe maner eſſex called plaſſhey chiefe abydynge duke great prince might well ſpende yere threſcore thouſande ducates duke glouceſtre erle eſſex buckingham conſtable englande ſo marueylous condycyons kynge douted hym vncles wordes wolde nat ſpare forbeare kynge kynge alwayes humble meke hym whatſoeuer wolde demaunde kynge wolde graunte hym duke cauſed englāde done many cruell haſty iugementes cauſed beheeded withoute tytell good reaſone noble knyght ſyr symon burle dyuers kynges counſayle chaſed englande archebyſſhop yorke duke irelande bycauſe ſo nygh kinges counſayle layde charge counſayled kynge wronge ledde hym lyſt ſpente reuenewes englande pleaſures duke two bretherne duke lancaſtre duke yorke theſe two euer kynge wherat duke glouceſtre hadde great enuy wolde ſay dyuers ſuche truſted robert byſſhop london whan came plaſſhey frendes two bretherne ouerchargeth greatly kynges houſe better home owne houſes duke ſubtyle couerte wayes drewe acorde ye londoner thought might ſure ſhulde ſone haue reſt realme acorde duke nephue ſonne doughter elder brother called lyonell duke clarence whiche doughter maryed lombardy ſonne ſyr galea duke myllayne duke lyonell dyed cytie aſte piemounte duke glouceſtre wolde gladly haue ſene nephue ſonne ye doughter duke clarence called iohan erle marche haue ben kynge englande haue nephue kynge rycharde depoſed ſayd howe kynge nat worthy holde gouerne realme englande wolde ſay truſted dyd ſo moch cauſed erle marche come houſe dyſcouered hym entent ſecretneſſe ſayde howe determyned make hym kynge englande kyng richarde put downe wyfe alſo kept priſon dutynge lyues ſo deſyred effectuouſly erle accept offre good wyll ſayenge howe wolde beſte coulde bringe aboute acorde alyaunce erle arundell therle warwyke dyuers prelate lordes englande erle marche ſore abaſſhed whan herde duke vncle ſpeke ſuche wordes howe lyke yonge man diſſymuled mater aunſwered wyſely thentent pleaſe duke ſaid howe wold glad ruled wolde haue hym ſayd wolde well aduyſed accepted ſuche promiſſe ſone wolde take therin aduyſe delyberacyon whan ye duke glouceſtre ſawe maner erle deſyred kepe mater ſecrete erle anſwered ſo wolde therle departed ſone coude ſo wente irelande herytage wolde neuer entende duke treatie alwayes excuſed ſelfe wyſely yet euer kept mater ſecrete ſawe well concluſyon ſhulde nat good ſayd howe duke glouceſtre ſought wayes coude ſet trouble englande ſtyrre londoner agaynſt kynge ſame yere truce made bytwene englande fraunce endure thyrty yere kynge retourned agayne englande yonge wyfe duke glouceſtre enfourmed londoner ſayd syrs make ye requeſt kynge ſhall reaſonable deſyre ſeynge hath peace enemyes ye may franke fre fro ſubſydies aydes hath ben graunted twenty yere paſt affyrmyng howe nat graunted durynge ſeaſone warre ye ſyrs quod duke marchauntes yuell entreated ſore oppreſſed pay euery hundred florens xiii theſe goodes ſpent ydleneſſe daū ſynge makynge feaſtes eatynge drinkynge ye pay wherby ye ſore traueyled ſhewe kynge howe ye wolde realme
