englande ſhulde gouerned acordinge auncyent cuſtomes ye may ſay whan kyng hath nede realme honour coūtrey defence therof howe ye wyll redy ayde ſuche wyſe kynge counſayle ſhall holde content thus ſettynge duke glouceſtre londoner counſayles dyuers cyties townes englande aſſembled theym togyther day came eltham ſeuen myle fro london kyng whan came kynge made requeſt theſe foreſayd thynges wolde ſhulde haue ben acomplyſſhed incontynent whan requeſt made kynge mo vncles two duke lancaſtre yorke kynge charged duke lancaſtre make theym aunſwere duke ſayd ſyrs kynges pleaſure ye departe home euery man owne within moneth aſſemble agayne togyder london weſtmynſter kynge wyll counſayle noble prelate wyll redy requeſtes loke ſhall thought neceſſary counſayle kynge wyll graunt ſuche wyſe ye ſhall well contente aunſwere pleaſed many nat ſome opinyon duke glouceſtre wolde haue ſhorter anſwere duke lancaſtre yorke apeaſed fayre ſwete wordes ſo departed tyme left nat purſute ſo next moneth aſſembled weſtmynſter ynge kynge counſayle preſent duke glouceſtre greatly enclyned demaundes makinge aunſwere ſpake nat thought hert diſſymuled mater entent kynge bretherne ſhulde nat perceyue mynde duke lancaſtre made aunſwere londoner kynge ſayd ye ſyrs london kynge hath cōmaunded gyue determynable anſwere requeſtes name counſayle conſent prelate noble men realme sir ye knowe well entent eſchewe parelles daungers myght come realme generall graunt made good cyties townes englande ſhulde rayſed tayle ſtate marchaundyſe maner fourme hath tynne nowe vpon ſyxe yere paye euery hundred xiii reaſon therof kynge graunted ſealed certayne frauncheſſes whiche nat mynde take fro rather encreaſe dayly acordyng deſertes ye nowe wolde repell agayne ye one wyllyngly agreed vnto graunted therfore openly repelyth agayne ſuche grace grauntes hath made tyme beholde theſe noble men prelate haue ſworne promeſſed kynge ayde ſuſtayne thynges lawfully gyuen graunted therfore ſyrs conſidre well ſtate king great chargeable augment one maner mynyſſheth another rente reuene turneth nat kynges profyte moche hath doone tyme paſte kinge counſayle hath ben great coſte charge ſythe warres renewed bytwene englande fraunce great charge hath kynge ſuche ambaſſadours haue treated bytwene party well beyonde ſee alſo purſuynge kynges maryage hath coſte gret goodes though nowe peace bytwene realmes yet charge great kepynge garyſons townes caſtelles beynge vnder kynges obeyſaunce well gaſcoyne burdeloys bayonois bygore march gyan calays alſo kepyng ſee porte hauens englande lykewyſe chargeable kepyng fronters scotlande whiche may nat vnprouyded alſo marcheſſe irelande theſe thynges conſernynge kynges eſtate honour realme draweth yerely great coſte charge whiche farre better knowen noble men ye realme medeleth marchaundyſe thanke god • irs ye thus peace take hede none paye without worthy occupye feate marchaundyſe well payeth ſtraungers ye ye freer marte fraunce lombardy realmes whyther youre marchaundyſe repayreth tayled retayled agayne two thre tymes yere ye paſſe reaſonable ordynaunce ſette aſſeſſed vpon marchaundyſe theſe wordes ſuche lyke ſpoken duke lancaſtre apeaſed greatly people ſette yuell ſettynge thus departed yt tyme without thynge doynge moſte parte theym well content ſuche wolde contrary made ſemblante therof tyme duke glouceſtre retourned maner plaſſhey ſawe well tyme coulde nat brynge purpoſe paſſe ſtyll ſtudyed howe make trouble englande fynde wayes howe renewe warre fraunce acorde wyfes vncle erle arundell deſyred nothynge warre doone ſo moche drawen acorde erle warwyke tthe kinge englande two bretherne mother one called thomas erle kente ſeconde ſir iohan holande valyaunt knyght wyfe doughter duke lācaſtre erle huntyngdon chamberlayne kynge ſlewe ſonne rycharde erle ſtafforde ye haue herde hyſtorie ſayde rycharde erle stafforde ſquyer ſonne duke glouceſtre erle huntyngdon moſte cōmonly euer courte kynge brother knewe dealynge duke glouceſtre dyd couertely wyſely made enquery alſo douted greatly duke knewe fell ſodayne hyghe mynded ſawe howe kept enemye aboute hym dethe yonge stafforde peace therof neuer made grudge therof contynued ſtyll kynge loued well brother bare againſt euery man kynge ſawe well howe vncle duke glouceſtre euer contrary hym euer conſpyre agaynſt ſtyrre realme rebellyon ſo kynge brother holande wolde often tymes comune togyther ſame ſeaſone frenche kyng ſent erle ſaynt powle englande ſe kyng doughter quene noriſſhe loue truce made ſuche maner cōdycion ſubgiettes myght repayre eche dyſpyte yuell wyllers kynge erle huntyngdon made good chere well honoure frenche kynge wedded ſuffer tyme duke lancaſtre yorke nat kynge began ſomwhat diſſymule ſawe well people englande beganne murmure dyuers place ſtate rewle kynge kept mater lykely go yuell thought wolde nat kinges cōmaundement people came reaſone duke glouceſtre company kynge englande ſpared nat ſhewe therle ſaint powle ſtate englande ſtode howe founde alwayes vncle duke glouceſtre harde rebell agaynſt hym ſhewed hym thynge yt knewe whan erle ſaynt powle herde kynge ſay wyſe great marueyle therof ſayde howe ought nat ſuffred ſayd syr ye ſuffre wyll dyſtroy ſayd fraūce howe duke glouceſtre entendeth nothynge breake peace renewe warre agayne lytell litell draweth hertes yonge men realme parte deſyre rather warre peace ſo auncyent wyſe men warre beganne ſtyrre ſhulde nat herde beleued reaſon right iuſtyce hath place audyence yuell reygneth therfore prouyde therfore rather betymes late better ye theym daunger theſe wordes erle ſaynte powle entered greatly kynges hert made hym ſore muſe erle ſaynt powle retourned fraunce ye kyng englande ſhewed mater brother erle huntyngdon ſaid kynge syr fayre brother ſaynt powle hath ſhewed trouth therfore take good aduyſe mater enfourmed aboute moneth erle ſaynte powle ben englande retourned fraunce paryllous fame renome ranne vpon kynge englande maner generall brewte erle ſaynt powles cōmynge englande treate kynge frenche men myght haue calayes handes brute greatly troubled moued people englāde ſo moche certayne london roode plaſſhey duke glouceſtre ſhewed hym matter duke apeaſed nat wordes rather augmented sayenge howe coulde nat therwith ſayd ſure frē che men wolde hadde coſte theym kynges doughters ſo might haue calais pleaſure anſwere ſet londoner fyre ſayde howe wolde ſpeke kynge ſhewe hym howe realme nat cōtent well quod duke ſhewe hym good maner make doute people wyll nat contente marke well anſwere maketh ſhewe therof nexte tyme ſpeke thervpon ſhall gyue counſayle ye ſhall farther maye well ſome falſe traytours counſayleth kynge ſame erle marſhall capytayne calays hath two tymes fraūce taryed parys one chiefe procurer treatie kynges maryage doughter fraunce theſe frenche men ryght ſubtyle driue purpoſe farre lytell lytell purſue entente wyll gyue largely bringe purpoſe acordynge duke counſayle londoner daye wente eltham kynge whiche tyme kynges two bretherne erle kent therle huntyngdon erle saliſbury archebyſſhoppes caūterbury duuelyn confeſſour lorde thomas percy lorde lyſle richarde credon iohan boulofer dyuers knyghtes kynges chambre theſe londoner right wiſely ſhewed kynge entente meke hūble maner ſayde howe brute ranne kynge delyuer vp calais frenche mennes handes kyng great marueile theſe newes touched hym nere hert right ſagely diſſymuled mater tyme apeſed londoner ſayd howe noiſe wronge nothyng ſo trouthe ſaid erle ſaynt poule come englande none entente ſporte hym ſent thider frenche kynge ſe hym quene wyfe marchaundyſe kynge ſayde none bytwene kynge ſware faythe owed god crowne englāde ſaid howe great marueyle wherof ſuche wordes ſhulde ryſe than̄e erle saliſbury ſayde sir ye good men london go home youre houſes well aſſured kynge counſayle wyll entende thynge ſhalbe honour profite realme englande ſo euer hath fyrſt brought vp theſe wordes yuell coūſayled ſhewe well howe wolde gladly haue realme trouble haue people ryſe agaynſt kyng whiche thynge ye london ought feare reaſon laſte rebellyon ye great paryll haue vtterly dyſtroyed whan yuell people vp gouerne iuſtyce reaſon hath place thoſe wordes apeaſed greatly londoner contented kynges anſwere ſo retourned cytie london kynge taryed eltham ryght penſyue full diſpleaſure reaſon wordes herde ſtylle hym two bretherne ſuche truſted beſte thought hym ſelfe natte well aſſured amogne vncles ſawe well howe abſented theym ſelfe fro courte kepte home owne houſes ſo halfe doute ſpecially duke glouceſtre ſo kepte dayly aboute hym garde thouſande archer yt enformed kynge englande ſuretie vncle ye duke glouceſtre erle arundell purpoſed puiſſaunce people take kyng yong quene putte caſtell kepte ſurely honeſt maner meate drinke neceſſaries alſo howe ſhulde ſet four gouernours realme duke lancaſtre duke yorke rewle fro temmys northwarde vnto ryuers hūbre thyne thay ronnyng cytie warwyke comprehendynge ſignories northumberlande boundes scotlande duke glouceſtre rule lō londoner eſſexe cō prehendyng boundes see thider ryuer hūbre entereth ſee alſo porte hauyns aboue london hampton cornwall erle arundell haue rule landes mouynge fro london bytwene suſſexe kent arundell surrey deuonſhyre barkeſhyre hole ſignories bytwene ryuer thamyſe briſtowe ryuer syuerne whiche departeth englande wale ſhall holde iuſtyce reaſon euery man entencyons fynde reaſonable waye moue agayne renewe warre bytwene englande fraunce ye frēche kyng wolde haue agayne doughter ſhulde ſithe ſhe eight yeres age paraduēture whan ſhe cometh xii yeres ſhe may repente refuce mariage bycauſe ſhe maryed youth alſo reaſon diſmary fro heyr bretaygne promiſed whan ſhe cometh perfyte age ſhe wyll nat refuce maryage ſhe muſt abyde right ſtyll quene englāde haue dowrye wyſe ſhe ſhulde crowned quene kynge dyed ſhe came laufull age purpoſe ſende agayne fraū ce father ſhewed ye king ſuche wordes ſpoken dyuers englyſſhe men ſpecially londoner coude nat loue kynge repented whan cōmons suſſexe kent eſſexe vp came london dyde breake purpoſe ſome cōfeſſed mynde haue ſlayne kyng erle saliſbury erle oxenforde kynges counſayle hadde ſo done meanes rebellyon londoner than̄e ſhulde ſoone haue made newe heed meanes duke glouceſtre haue founde ſome perſon haue crowne gouernynge realme therby haue brought realme better caſe than̄e thus londoner ſuche ſecte dayly murmured many ſecrete coū ſayls kynge enformed mooſt faute layde vpon duke glouceſtre king richarde abaſſhed tentymes whan herde ſawe ſuche couert hate yuell wyll borne againſt hym alwayes made louynge countynaunce vncle glouceſtre lōdoners aueyled hym nothyng daye kynge ſayd two vncles lancaſtre yorke sir goddes name requyre gyue aduiſe coū ſayls dayly enformed aſuretie brother myne vncle glouceſtre erle arundell complyces mynded take ꝑforce agrement londoner purpoſe cloſe caſtell order fyndynge certayne porcion wyfes lykewiſe yonge ſeperate fro kepe eſtate another place fayre vncles cruell maner ought nat ſuffred long maye withſtande ye haue doone homage ſworne trewe preſence kynge edwarde good memorie graūtfather whiche tyme great prelate lordꝭ realme ſware kepe maynteyn kynge xx yere paſte wherfore fayre vncles loue charyte othe promyſe ye haue made counſayle trewly ye bounde farre ymagin myne vncle gloceſtre entēdeth none thing might renewe agayne warre bitwene englande fraunce breake peace whiche haue confyrmed bothe realme ſweryng ſealyng ſame compoſycion ioyned maryage ye doughter fraūce without thynkyng yuell ye knowe well ſoeuer dothe contrary yt ſworne vnto hath ſealed ſame ſo proued dothe yuell ought puniſſhed therfore bothe body goodes alſo ye knowe well yt forbeare myne vncle glouceſtre moche may take regarde thretnyng whiche myght coſt derely vncles ye bounde coūſaile ſithe demaunde reaſon whan herde kyng ſpeke thus ſawe well howe mater ſore troubled mynde touched hym nere alſo know well moche ſayenge trewe ſayd sir ſuffre lette tyme ryn paſſe knowe well brother gloceſtre hath mooſt paryllous heed brayne manne englande knowe well man maye buylde one ſyde ſhall buylde long ye wyll ordred coūſaile ye ſhall nat nede care brother ſaythe often tymes many thyngꝭ wherof foloweth none effecte alone counſayle canne nat breke peace taken nat encloſe caſtell ſhall neuer ſuffre ſeperated fro wyfe ſaye ſo thinke foule abuſed therfore ſir humbly beſeche apeace youre ſelfe euery thyng ſhall turne well goddes grace man ſpeketh cōmeth nat effecte ſayth oftentymes nat accōplyſſhe thus duke lā caſtre yorke apeaſed nephewe kynge richarde theſe two duke ſawe well buſyneſſe englande began yuell parceyued gret hatered encreaſed dayly bytwene kyng duke gloceſtre thentent wolde nat entremedell bytwene departed fro kynges court company ſeruauntes ſo toke leaue yt kyng tyme went owne duke lancaſtre toke hym wyfe lady katheryn ruet hadde ben company yong quene englande went huntyng ye dere vſage englande kynge taryed london afterwarde kynges vncles repented deꝑted ye courte fell afterwarde ſuche mater englande ye realme trouble whiche nat ſo fortuned ben kynge wolde haue founde prouiſyon y• mater dyde counſayled kyng none kynges ſeruauntes greatly douted duke glouceſtre wolde gladly ben deed nat cared howe gentyll knight ſir thomas percy ben long ſouerayne ſquyer kynges houſe fraū ce mayſter ſeneſchall ſtate kynge paſſed throughe handes cōſydring great hatereddes yt encreſed bitwene kyng vncle gloceſtre among great lordes englande welbeloued like ſage knight ymagined concluſyons coude nat good thā gaue vp offyce honorably coulde tooke leaue kynge kynge gaue hym leaue full ſore agaynſt wyll howe made ſuche excuſacions departed another ſet offyce kyng yonge counſayle hym greatly douted duke glouceſtre oftentymes wolde ſaye kynge ryght dere ſir perylous thyng ſerue haue ſene ſuche haue ſerued tymes paſte ſuche ryght ſynguler fauoure yet haue ſmall guerdone sir symon burle ſage valyaunt knight good fauoure lorde father whome god pardone great payne traueyle fyrſt maryage yet vncle duke glouceſtour cauſed hym dye ſhamefully heed ſtryken lyke traytour worlde dyuers hath put dethe ye knowe well puiſſaunce ye ye coude nat ſaue ſir ſarue nowe looke ſame rewarde whan vncle cometh whiche nat often dare nat lyfte vp eyen loke vpon perſone loketh ſo hye ouer v thynketh hym moche wrōg ſo nere wherfore ſir knowe trouthe yt long liueth ſhall peace englande ye ſhall mā good alſo thretneth yor wife cloſe vp caſtell beholden vnder ſubiection lyue porcion ſir ye kyng loſt ye take nat good hede ſelf wife nedeth nat care ſhe yong doughter frenche kynge dare nat diſpleaſe moche yuell might come therby englāde vncle glouceſtre thentent make behated people hath ſowen dyuers ſclaūdorous wordꝭ vpon throughout lōdon place ſayeng howe ye nat worthy beare ye crowne holde ſo noble herytage ye realme englande ſythe ye haue taken wyfe doughter frenche kyng aduerſary wherby ſaythe ye haue greatly febled ſignorie realme englande hath ſore diſcoraged hertes noble valyant knightes ſquiers realme haue alwayes valyantly cō tynued warre yet wolde thus ſaye ye haue brought realme great paryll aduenture loſt affyrmyng howe pytie ye haue ſuffred contynue ſo long ye haue done alſo frenchemen bruteth ye wyll put armes tharmes fraūce wherwith people nat conte • hateth therfore thynke trewe bycauſe ye ſo redy gladde take truce thynke rather byforce loue noble men ye realme haue ſerued maynteyned warres neuer agreed therto alſo ſaye ye haue nat dilygently reuiſyted ouerſene letter patentes gyuen accorded ſworne ſealed kyng iohan ſomtyme frenche kyng ſonnes whiche graūt child lyueng nothyng vpholden craftely broken frenchman founde cautels ſubtelties wrongefull wayes renewe agayne yt warre therby toke vſurped right predeceſſurs quarell hath wonne therby landes countreis acquitany cyties caſtelles townes ſaye ye take hede haue loſte thoroughe neglygence hath ſhewed poore corage ye doute ennemyes haue nat purſued accydentes mater good iuſte quarell ye yet haue whiche quarell predeceſſours longe lyued firſt lorde father ye prince wale ac • tayne alſo good kyng edwarde graūtfather toke great payne dilygence augment ſignories thus ſir londoner ſaye ſo dothe day ſhall come ye ſhall repent therfore ſir lengar hyde theſe wordꝭ fro daylye renewed ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe duke gloceſtre taken erle marſhall cō maundement kyng cap ccxxiii king richarde englād noted well theſe ſayd wordes ye ſhewed hym ſecreteneſſe lyke ymaginatyfe price within ſeaſon vncles lā caſtre yorke departed courte kynge toke hardyneſſe hym ſaid hym ſelfe fyrſte better hym diſtroye another rather another ſhulde diſtroye hym thynkynge ſhortely wolde haue vncle glouceſtre ſuche caſe wolde aſſured hym ſhulde hym diſpleaſure bycauſe coulde nat bring purpoſe alone dyſcouered mynde ſuch truſted beſt therle marſhall coſyn erle notyngham ſhewed hym full mynde wolde haue doone erle marſhall loued kyng better duke gloceſtre dyde kepte kynges purpoſe ſecrete ſauīg ſuche wolde ayded coude nat ye kynges pleaſure alone day kyng maner goyng hū tynge rode haueryng boure xx myle fro london eſſexe within xx myle plaſſhey duke glouceſtre helde houſe dyner kyng deꝑted fro haueryng ſmall cōpany cāe plaſſhey v clocke ye weder fayre hote ſo kyng cāe ſodainly thyder tyme duke glouceſtre ſupped ſmall eater ſatte neuer long dyner ſupper whā herde kynges cōmynge went mete hym myddes court ſo dyde ducheſſe chyldren welcomed kynge kynge entred hall ſo chambre thā borde ſpredde kynges ſupper kynge ſatte nat longe ſayd fyrſt commyng fayre vncle cauſe fyue ſixe horſes ſadylled wyll praye ryde london morowe londoner wyll v wyll alſo myne vncles lācaſtre yorke dyuers noble men vpon londoner requeſtes wyll ordred accordyng counſayle cōmaunde ſtewarde folowe trayne lōdon ſhall fynde duke thought none yuell lightly agreed ye kynge whan kyng ſupped ryſen euery thynge redy kynge toke leaue ducheſſe child lepte horſbacke ye duke hym accompanyed onely ſeuyn ſeruauntes thre ſquyers foure yeoman tooke waye bondelay take playne waye eſchewe brēdwode london cōmon hyghe waye rode great pace talked way vncle hym ſo aproched stratforde ryuer thamiſe whan kyng came nere buſſhment layde rode fro vncle great pace lefte hym ſomwhat behynde hym ſodaynly erle marſhall bande came galopyng duke ouertoke hym ſaide sir areſt kynges name duke abaſſhed worde ſawe well betrayed began call loude ye kyng nat tell wheder kyng herde hym nat turned nat rode rather faſter dyde ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpekyng mater ſeaſon tyll retourne therto agayne ye haue herde hiſtorie howe ſir iohn̄ caſtell morant ſir iaques helley ſente turkey lamorabaquy fro frenche kyng fro duke burgoyne howe ſpedde whan retourned fraunce welcome kyng duke burgoyne duches bicauſe brought certayne tidynges fro erle neuers fro lordes hym ſaid kyng howe truſted lamorabaquy wolde gladly treat raūſoms yt ſayd knewe ſome yt priuye coūſayle feare leſt ſhulde dye priſone bycauſe owne naturall ayre turkes thynke delyueraūce ſhuld haue great fynaunce raunſome reaſon theſe wordes kynge duke burgoyne ducheſſe wyfe ſtudyed nyght day howe meanes might haue ſonne heyre delyuered ſayde oftentymes iourney ſiege nicopoly coſt ouer moche therby hadde deed thre bretherne baſtarde knyghtes valyaunt men entierly loued fyrſt haſell flaunders ſeconde ſir loyes brieſe thyrde ſir iohan ipre another yongeſt ſtyll home ſaye trouthe ye duches burgoyne coūteſſe flaunders ſtudyed ſyde howe delyuer ſonne ſo moche ſtuyed laſt founde meanes agre turkes moche payne nat ſodaynly done mater ſuche • red great leyſar gote lytell lytell ſame ſeaſon cytie burſe turkey dyed ye gentyll knyght fraūces anguerant lorde coucy erle saiſo • great lorde fraunce ſir robert deane ſent lady coucy goyng hym warde herde way howe deed herd vyen auſtriche ſo returned fraunce ſhewed certayne lorde coucies lynage nat good lady wyfe vntyll ſuche tyme chatellayne ſaynt goubayne ſent fetche deed body enbaulmed fraūce buryed thabbey nogent beſyde coucy receyued ducheſſe bare byſſhop leon dyuers abbottes gētyll knight buryed yere grace thouſāde thre hundred fourſcore ſeuyntene ye maye well knowe frenche kyng duke burgoyn alwayes ymagyned howe gette frendes priſon turkey sir dyne reſpōde alwayes coū ſayls ſayd euer marchaūtes veniſyās genowayes myght well helpe ayde buſyneſſe ſayd marchauntes myght go whider lyſt myght well knowen dealyng turkes tartary ye porte paſſages kynges ſoudans miſcreantes ſpecially reſorted quaire alexandre dāmas antyoche great puiſſaunt cyties sarazins dayly paſſe repaſſe daylye marchauntes chriſtened hath entrecours ſarazins exchaunge one nother marchaundyſe frenche kynge duke burgoyne ſought frendes meanes coulde gette forther hadde deſyre make warre vpon duke myllayne bycauſe vnderſtode gret lamorabaquy otherſyde kyng iames cypre thought well ſhulde haue great thanke frenche kyng duke burgoyne myght aſſwage furour lamorabaquy bringe hym ſome good reſonable poynt redemynge lordes fraunce ſuche priſone pleaſe kynge cypre cauſed ſhyppe made fyne golde right noble riche ye value well ſome tenne thouſande ducates whiche ſhyppe ſente lamorabaquy owne knightes ſhyppe ſo goodlye fayre great ioye beholde whiche gyfte ſoudan toke gree ſente agayne kynge cypre double value therof anone knowen fraūce marchauntes yt wrote therof dyne reſponde entente ſhulde ſhewe frenche kyng duke burgoyn haue thanke kynge kyng cypre good cauſe thus doute ye frenche kynges diſpleaſure bicauſe cauſed ſlayne murdered night brother valyaunt kynge peter dyde moche trouble sarazins toke saptalye alexandre sarazins douted hym kyng emperour chriſtened bicauſe valyātneſſe whiche dede ſayde kynge iames ſore repented hym ſelfe knewe well done yuell ſame dede fledde cypre el chriſten men wolde haue ſlayne hym entred galley gene beyng porte nicopoſſie ſo wente gene genowayes receyued hym ſome ſaid dyde foule murdre entyſement genoways anone genouois came puiſſaunce men warre galyes toke cytie famagous porte kepte puyſſaunce kynge cypre fayre yonge ſonne cyprience crowned chylde kynge crownyng lyued nat long dyed ſoone aft dethe genouois great puyſſaūce brought iaques cypre crowned hym kyng ſo reigned kyng cypre genowayes alwayes ſuſteyned hym agaynſt men wolde neuer rendre vp cytie famagous porte helde ſtyll tyme ye auctour wrot hyſtorie ſaye trouthe genowayes nat turkes wonne longe realme cipre brought obeyſaūce lykelyhode ſubdued yſles rodes yſles encloſed see venyce alwayes genoways veniſyās reſyſted whan ſawe turkes wonne realme armony toke ſtrong towne corque hermyne see ſyde ſo helde ſo nat ben dout paſſage ſtraytes corque xere cōſtantyne noble turkes ſore entred chriſtendome vpon border ſee whiche ſhulde haue great preiudyce yſle rodes yſles adioynyng thus theſe meanes fronters chriſten dome kepte defended ¶nowe let v retourne purpoſe kyng iaques cyper knewe hym ſelfe gylcy deth kynge brother wherby hatred cryſten kynges therfore dyd moche coude get agayne loue fauour tooke great honoure frenche kynge wrote fyrſt hym douted moſt ſo cauſe duke burbone ryght ſucceſſyon lynage luſygnan ought kynge heyres thoughe kynge iaques brother kyng peter cyper yet ryght crowne baſtarde knewe ryght well genouoys ſo whan made kynge made great alyaunce bytwene confermed nat broken genouoys defēde kepe heyres agaynſt therby atteygned great ſygnories frauncheſſes realme ciper euer dyd exaltynge iaques kynge cyper alwayes owne chiefe auauntage ſtronge againſt venycians haunte erercyſe feate marchaundyſe sarazyns landes kinge iaques longe lyued dyd coulde pleaſe frenche kynge meanes genouoys wolde wyſe dyſpleaſe hym therfore ſame ſeaſon kynge iaques ordeyned ſhyppe golde preſente lamorabaquy haue loue acquayntaūce whiche gyft ioyfully receyued moch prayſed turkes thought lorde dyne rreſponde meanes therof wrote therin genouoys maner otherwayes laboured myght delyueraunce erle neuers lordes fraunce whan duke burgoyne ducheſſe wyfe ſawe lamorabaquy began fall treatie cryſten priſoners newes therof greatly pleaſure apoynted ſage valyaunt knyght countie flaunders called ſyr gylberte linrenghen ſouerayne flaunders vnder duke ducheſſe ſent ſyr iaques helley bycauſe knewe wayes paſſages deſyred hym acompany ſyr gylberte treate lamorabaquy delyueraunce cryſten priſoners promyſed hym payne ſhulde well conſydred rewarded syr iaques promyſed ſo theſe two knyghtes departed rode ſo longe came realme hungery ſo drewe kynge letter hym kyng receyued ioyouſly loue frenche kynge alſo knewe well ſyr iaques helley ſhewed kyng cauſe cōmynge fraunce howe ſente turkey treate delyueraunce erle neuers lordes fraūce lamorabaquy wolde gyue herynge kynge ſayde well done redeme myght put raunſome ſayd aſſayenge therof coulde leſe nothynge beſydes kinge offred body goodes ayde theym maners wherof theſe two knyghtes thanked hym entre treatye lamorabaquy coulde come therto theſe knightes moche payne made great •• ygēce fyrſt ſyr iaques helley fayne go lamorabaquy requyre ſafe conducte companyon ſyr gylbert come turkey whan ateyned returned hungery ſo rode turkey ſouerayne flaunders receyued lamorabaquy men ryght nobly herde ſpeke ſo lytell lytell entred treatie ſame tyme haunted turkey marchaunt genouoy iſle sio vnder obeyſaunce genouoys marchaūt named bartylmew pologrine well loued turkey namely lamorabaquy syr dyne reſponde beynge parys thentent treatie myght haue better e • pedycionꝭ wrote letter ſayde marchaunt iſle sio knewe eche entent pleaſe frenche kynge duke burgoyne duches lady fraūce ſuche huſbandes frendes priſon turkey truſt well rewarded good wyll • wrote yt ſo euer ende made redempcyon wolde come • ettour ſomme money ſoone delyuered come power venyciens might certifyed therof incontynent wolde come hym ſelfe venyce ſe raunſomes payed delyuered theſe wordes written ſyr dyne reſponde ſayde marchaunt genouoye enclyned deſyre truſte well rewarded frenche kynge thought ſuche kyng good • ay • alſo enfourmed kynge cyper deſyre frenche kynge duke burgoyne ſente men ſpecyciall counſayle turkey lykewyſe ſyr mathelyn lorde damyne two great barones grece good fauoure lamorabaquy traueyled greatly auaunce treatie thentent pleaſure frenche kynge without ſuche meanes mater ſhulde neuer haue brought aboute bycauſe turkey great coūtrey yuell men traueyle hath nat ben accuſtomed therto whan lamorabaquy one condyſcended entre treatie ordeyned counſayle chryſten priſoners ſhulde brought togyder cytie burſe cōclude treatie priſoners brought thyder nombre xxv commynge thyder turkes brought dyd yuell entreate theym bete forwarde caſely horſed coulde nat go pace turkes • ete bycauſe ſawe ſhulde de delyuered wherwith ſore dyſpleaſed whan theſe knightꝭ thus brought cytie burſe turkey ſent thyder fro frenche kynge fro duke burgoyne fro kynge cypers fro genouoys venycyens receyued theſe priſoners gētylly ſo caſe priſone howe kept euer ſo ſtrayte coulde nat haue thyrde parte wylles lamorabaquy moſte ſpecyally herde euer ſoueraygne flaunders ſyr iaques helley hadde enfourmed hym howe one chyefe counſayle duke burgoyne lamorabaquy caſtell beſyde burſe thyther came ſayde meſſangers laſte greed theſe xxv priſoners ſhulde pay ſōme two hundred thouſande ducates whiche ſōme lordes mathelyn damyne grece marchaunt genouoy sio became dettours ſame taryed pledge lamorabaquy erle neuers ſware boūde ſelfe ſayd marchauntes ſone came venyce nat departe then tyll money payed thus concluded treatie concluded erle ewe ſo ſpeke feble alteracyon ayre courſe meates dyed loge grece kept priſoner wherof company ryght ſory coulde nat amende thus ſyr phylyppe arthois erle ewe conſtable fraunce deed enbawmed ſo brought fraunce buryed churche ſaynt laurence ewe whan lamorabaquy contented marchaundes bondes det ſayd ſōme ſoueraygne flaunders ſir iaques helley tooke leaue retourne fraunce lamorabaquy well contente therwith ordeyned theſe two knightes ſhuld haue ſōme ſhuld receyue twenty thouſande ducates rebated hole ſome kyng baſaache conſydered payne traueyle endured ſpecyally ſoueraygne flaunders greatly fauour theſe two knyghtes thanked kynge gyft toke leaue hym afterwarde frenche knyghtes lordes whan departed fro kynge came cytie burſe departed lefte erle neuers lordes fraunce ſtyll cytie burſe taryed lordes mathelyn damine ſhuld come thyder ſee receyue galees theſe two knyghtes toke galee paſſenger ſayle mathelyn departynge fro porte wether fayre temperate whanne abrode ſee wynde chaunged marueylous great tempeſt ſo ſoueraigne flaunders reaſon ſore traueyle tempeſt fell ſore ſycke ſee dyed came mathelyn wherof ſyr iaques helley • ight ſory remedy ſo ſayled forthe galee venyce paſſed rodes alwayes went publyſſhed redempcyon lordes fraunce wherof rodes ryght ioyfull laſt knyght came fraunce ſhewed kynge lordes ladyes howe ſpedde wherof kynge right ioyfull thanked knyght traueyle payne taken iourney whan redempcyon theſe lordes knyghtes fraunce apoynt lamorabaquy thought departed haue company ſhulde large better entreated reaſon ſythe lenger priſoners thought ſhulde ſe parte puyſſaunce ſtate whiche ſhewed marueylous great ſumptuous kepte moche people dayly aboute hym thus ſent noble men houſe bring preſence made good chere euery thynge delyuered ordinary courte acordynge vſage countrey euery daye kynge talked erle neuers truchman greatly honoured erle neuers ſawe well lyke great man fraunce ſonne great lordwherof well enfourmed whiche founde true reaſon great ſute made redempcyon great ſōme money agreed paye erle neuers company great marueyle great ſtate kept people laye euer felde towne coulde ſuffyce ſpence howſeholde charge meate drinke marueyle conſydre fro whence ſhulde come countrey ſo hote people ſobre dyet vſe moche ſpycery ſpecyally ſuger gotes mylke wherof haue great haboundaunce whiche cōmon drinke ſarazyns haue plenty bredde made grayne called mylle euer aboute hym ſeuen thouſande fawconers many hunter daye wente hawkynge flyght fawcon egle preſence erle neuers whiche flyght pleaſed nat lamorabaquy wherwith ſore dyſpleaſed ſhewed ſame faute poynte two thouſande fauconers haue loſte heedes bearyng hande nat dylygent kepynge hawkes another tyme preſence erle neuers woman came complayne kynge deſyringe haue ryght iuſtyce vpon ſeruaunt ſayenge syr kynge come ſoueraygne complayne ſeruaunt chambre ſhewed come ſame day howſe mylke gote chyldren hath dronken agaynſt wyll ſyr ſaid wolde wronge wolde complayne ſoone ſayde ſo gaue two great blowes wolde nat forbeare ſpake name therfore ſyr kynge iuſtyce ye ſworne people kinge marked well woman wordes ſo cauſed ſeruaunte come fore hym woman alſo cauſed woman renewe complaynt ſeruaunt began excuſe hym ſayd knewe nothynge matter woman ſpake wyſely affyrmed wordes trewe kynge ſayde woman aduyſe ye well fynde thy wordes vntrewe thou ſhalte dye yuell dethe syr quod ſhe content wordes nat true nede come preſēce iuſtyce deſyre none thyng thou ſhalt haue iuſtyce quod kynge haue ſworne ſo euery man woman kynge cauſed man taken cauſed bely opened ſe eaten dronken mylke nat founde dronke mylke nat turned digeſtyon whan kyng ſawe woman wordes trewe ſaid thou haddeſt good cauſe complayne go thy way quyte thou art well reuenged treſpaſe done ſhe good recompence man deed iudgement lordes fraunce ſawe herde ¶howe lordes fraunce returned ſee venyce iſles founde waye cap ccxxiiii whan erle neuers lordes fraūce ben taken priſoners batayle nycopoly turkey whan ſene ſeaſon ſtate maner lamorabaquy content euery thynge vnderſtode lorde mathelyn lorde damyne marchaunt sio come burſelle turkey gaue leaue departe came togyther lamorabaquy excepte erle ewe lorde coucy bothe deed thus toke leaue thanked hym curteſies lamorabaquy ſaid therle truch man iohan knowe well thou arte great lorde thy countrey ſonne great lorde thou art yonge pe • aduenture ſhall beare ſome blame ſhame aduenture hath fallen thy fyrſte chyualry excuſe thy ſelfe blame recouer thyne honour peraduenture thou wylt aſſemble puyſſaunce men come make warre agaynſt doute feare therof thou departed ſhulde cauſe ſwere thy lawe faythe yt neuer thou none thy company ſhulde beare armure make warre agaynſt wyll nother make ye none thy company make ſuche othe promeſſe wyll whan thou arte retourned arte thy pleaſure rayſe puyſſaunce thou wylte ſpare nat come agaynſt thou ſhalt fynde alwayes redy receyue thy company felde playne batayle ſay ſhewe whome thy lyſte able dedes armes euer redy conquere cryſtendome theſe hygh wordes erle neuers vnderſtode well ſo dyd company thought longe lyued tooke leaue conducted great nombre vnder leadynge aſſybaathe surbaſaache ſo delyuered lordes mathelyn damyne cauſe delyueraunce whan galees redy entred conducte retourned kynge ſayled tyll came ye porte mathelyn receyued great ioye lady mathelyn ryght honourable gentle well aſſured ſelfe lady grece youth ſhe ben brought vp emperour conſtantyne noble courte lady mary burbone ſhe lerned moche norture fraunce lordes ladyes honourable many coūtreys lady right ioyouſe ſe houſe erle neuers ſyr henry bare ſir guy tremoyle ſhe receyued ryght honourably great ioy dyd ſhe coude pleaſure firſt ſhe newly aparelled lordes knyghtes fraunce ſhyrtes gownes aparell fyne damaſke acordynge vſage grece euery man degre lady ſpared nothyng wherfore gaue great thanke greatly prayſed eſtate ordre lykewyſe thāked prayſed lordes mathelyn damyne made good chere honourable anone tydynges delyueraunce knowen rodes wherof great mayſter roodes knyghtes ryght ioyfull determyned arme forth two galees ſende theym come iſle rodes ſo dyd one galee ſette ſyr iaques braſſemont burgonyon marſhall rodes longe ſayled rowed aryued mathelyn marſhall well receyued euery man lady mathelyn theſe lordes refreſſhed foure dayes fyfte daye galees redy erle neuers tooke leaue lady mathelyn thanked greatly lordes alſo erle neuers ſayd bounde euer towne good wyll lady anſwered wyſely entred galees porte mathelyn wynde wether wyll ſayled ſo longe without daunger dōmage came aryued iſle rodes ſame place galees aryue cōmynge fro cyper fro barne fro partes ſee orientall many knyghtes roodes ought men valyaunt corage beare whyte croſſe ſignyfieng croſſe chriſt dyed toke payne redempcyon cryſten people nere hande daily theſe knightes haue ſkrymyſſhes aſſawtes ayde ſuſtayne chryſten faythe agaynſt myſcreaūtes wherfore theſe knyghtes ought valyaunte men nouryſſhed warre whan erle neuers company come iſle rodes great mayſter great priour acquytanye receyued frenche men honourably offred lende golde ſyluer paye ſmall charge coſtes whiche offre erle neuers company toke great curteſy hertely thanked great nede therof▪ great priour acquytanie right valyaunt knyght lente erle neuers thyrty thouſande frankes redy money ſyr reygnere potte ſtewarde erle neuers lorde rocheforde burgoyne receyued money thynke generally euery man ſhulde haue parte erle became dettour money thus taryed iſle rodes good ſeaſone refreſſhe theym ſette euery thynge good ordre ayre attēperate whe • ben turkey taryed thus rodes abydynge galees venyce ſyckeneſſe toke ſyr guy tremoyle lorde seully whiche ſyckneſſe dyed buryed churche ſaynte iohan rodes lordes fraunce dyd obſequy ryght reuerently ryght ſorye dethe remedy erle neuers knewe well duke burgoyne wolde ſore dyſpleaſed deth bycauſe always foūde hym ſage good counſayle laſte aryued galees venyce wherof frenche men ryght ioyous tooke leaue lordes rodes thus departed erle neuers ſir henry bare boucyquante guillyam tremoyle lorde rocheforde patrones galees pleaſure contente ſuffre refreſſhe theym iſles bytwene venyce rodes fyrſte came modon fyue hundred myle fro roodes refreſſhed parteyned venycyens fro modon ſayled wynde wether wyll ſo came iſle calefo refreſſhed theym fro thence iſle garre taryed came iſle chyfolignie landed founde great nombre ladyes damoſels ſygn • orite iſle receyued frenche men great ioye brought paſſe tyme aboute iſle whiche ryght fayre pleaſaunte ſuche knowe condycions iſle affyrmeth fayry nympes moche conuerſaunt marchauntes venyce geane landes ſuche haue aryued taryed ſeaſone eſchewe daunger ſee haue ſaid haue ſene ſome fairy haue proue • wordes trewe erle neuers company right ioyouſe company theſe ladyes ryght ioyouſly ladyes receyued ſayd howe cōmynge thyder dyd iſle great honoure bycauſe noble knyghtes men honoure hath nat acuſtomed none conuerſaunt amonge marchauntes iſle nat onely enhabyted woman men amonge woman haue ſoueraynte chefe rule worke woman ſylke worke make clothes ſylke ſo ſubtelly ſo well none lyke men iſle canne nat make cary ſell thynke haue moſt profyte woman abyde ſtyll ye iſle honour men ſayde cauſe haue profyte therof iſle condycion man dare aproche dōmage ſo euer dothe peryſſhed hath ben ſene proued therfore theſe ladyes endure euer peace dought man alſo marueylous ſwete gentle amyable humble whan wyll ſpeke fayry company whan erle neuers company refreſſhed iſle chyfoligne aboute fyue dayes toke leaue theſe ladyes lefte amonge theſe ladyes parte ſuche myght forbeare ſo ladyes gaue great thanke departynge ſo ſayled lande called raguſe reſted fro then clarence hundred myle fro venyce whyle thyther came ſquyer haynalt great recōmendacyon borne towne mon called brydoll came fro holy ſcpulcre fro quayre fro ſaynt katheryns mounte whan came clarence frenchman made good chere bycauſe borne haynalt counteſſe neuers doughter erle heynalte alſo bycauſe ben farre countreys demaunded newes fro thoſe party alſo ſtate kynge cyper aunſwered euery thynge ryght wyſely whan erle neuers refreſſhed hym ſeaſon ſayled forthe came porte parcuſe great galees coude go come ye porte venyce within certayne ſpace tooke ſmall ſhyppes paſſengers ſo came venyce receyued great ioye thanked god come thyder ſauegarde handes myſcreauntes one feare neuer haue come handes euery man wente logynge prepared commynge thyder knowen ſeruauntes come thyder prepared redye agaynſt commyng erle neuers founde redy parte ſeruauntes ſente thyder duke burgoyne father duches mother alſo redy ſyr dyne reſponde bycauſe raunſome clerkes ſette write letter meſſangers ſente forthe gyue knowledge frendes comynge theſe newes anone knowen ouer duke burgoyne ducheſſe ordeyned ſtate ſonne veſſell plate ſyluer golde aparell ſtuffe houſholde ſent venyce ſōmers lorde angyers ſyr iaques helley dyd conuey ſtuffe ſo came venyce lordes knyghtes frendes dyd ſende thyder lyke maner ye maye beleue well nat dooue without great coſte nothynge ſpared alſo laye venyce great coſte charge venyce one dereſt townes world ſtraungers lye thus theſe lordes kept eſtates therle neuers charged reaſone chiefe duke burgoyne ducheſſe ſette entente delyueraunce ſonne deſyred greatly ſe theym ſo dyd many duke ſayd without ayde men good frendes landes well burgoyne arthoys flaunders coulde nat tell howe atteyne ſomme money lamorabaquy ſhulde haue ſonnes raunſome beare coſtes dayly grewe occaſyon though raunſomes drewe two hundred thouſande floreyns thynges conſydred charge drewe moch ſayde receyte delyueraunce therof duke tooke counſayle money ſhulde reyſed ye duke coulde nat breke mynyſſhe eſtate nat mynde determyned ryche men good townes ſhulde tared ſpecyally flaunders bycauſe ryche reaſon marchaundyſe taracyon ſette forwarde whan gaunt called curteſly mater aunſwered ſayd wolde gladly helpe ayde en • erytour ſōme fyfty thouſande florayns lykewyſe bruges good townes flaunders redy ayde lorde duke ducheſſe thanked curteſly lykewiſe ſo dyde arthoiſe burgoyne alſo frenche kynge ayded well parte alſo coſt hym great rich ſendynge preſentes knightes hungry turkey howbe well contente therwith ſyth coſyns knyght bouciquaunt come venyce ſuretie therle neuers laye thus ſtyll venyce entēt nat deꝑte then tyll euery thynge payed diſcharge furnyſſhing fynaunce ſir dyne reſponde toke great payne entente pleace frenche kynge duke burgoyne ſuche buſyneſſe ſubtyle wyſe thus theſe frenche lordes knyghtes ſported eche ſame ſeaſon felle venyce great mortalyte began moneth auguſte dured without ceaſſynge tyll ſaynt andrewes tyde wherin dyed moche people dyed ſir henry barc eldeſt ſonne duke bare herytoure wyfe lorde coucyes landes excepte ladyes dowrye thus ſame ſeaſon bothe lady coucy widowes huſbandes deed whiche great dōmage body enbaulmed caryed fraunce buryed parys beleue obſequy done ſolempnely flye eſchewe fro deth venice erle neuers went taryed trenuſe eſtate taryed four monethes company thus erle neuers beynge trenuſe ſhewed kyng hungry roodes howe frenche lordes agreed lamorabaquy paye ſōmes two hundred thouſande florens kyng ſent letter byſſhoppe certayne knightes venice fauour frenche knyghtes alſo charged ſaye certayne wordes therle neuers ye ſhall whan cāe thider ſaid hym sir ſent hider fro ſouerayne lorde kyng hungry coſin ſaluteth v letter hath ſente vnto vnderſtādeth howe ye delyuered fro handes turkes aduerſaries certayne raūſome whiche otherwyſe ye coude nat haue ben deliuered wherof right ioyouſe ſir kynge knoweth well yt treatie coude nat haue ben made without great coſt charge beſyde ye loſt batayle raunſome charge hath ben dayly great wherfore ſir kyng ſayth myght ayde thyng wolde gladly thynketh ſelfe bounde therto well lynage otherwyſe ſir toke ſuche dōmage daye batayle nichopoly ye knowe well alſo reuenues realme yere ye next maner loſt whā hath recouery therof power ſaythe wyll ſo purney ye ſhalbe wel content hym thus good wyll ſir thentent ye ſhall gyue credence promiſe ſayeng hath cytie venyce yerely renenewes ſeuyn thouſande ducates ſir content ſolde venycience money ſhall ryſe therof ye ſhulde vſe ayde ſelfe therwith ye wolde owne goodes ſir ſhall delyuer quitaūces venicyence haue authorite ſo offre greatly pleaſed erle neuers coūſayle lorde rocheforde anſwered ſaid howe erle cō pany thanked greatly kynge hungry wolde ſell laye gage enherytaūce ayde sayeng howe •• nat refuſed forgotten deſyring take lytell counſayle mater ſo dyde within brefe tyme ſhewed kyng hūgeries ambaſſadours behalfe erle neuers ſhulde nat cōuenyent kyng hungry ſhulde ſell ley pledge enherytaunces mennes cauſes ſo ambaſſadours wolde ſo moche ſhewe venicyēce wolde ſo moche lende therle neuers certayne ſōme florence helpe paye erles charge paye agayne priour ſaynt iohn̄s acquitayne xxx thouſande florens lent thē iſle rodes thus doyng ſaide wolde highly thanke kynge hungry counſayle ambaſſadors ſaide wolde beſt aſſaye venicyēce wolde whan venycience moued mater anſwered coldly ſaid wolde take counſayle gyue anſwere within fyftene dayes whiche tyme anſwered enformed one anſwere gyueng kyng hungry wolde ſelle hoole realme venycience ſhulde redy bargayne hym pay hym redy money ſaid ſo lytell thynge ſcuyn thouſande ducates yere coulde make price valewre therof nother ſell wherfore ſaid wolde nat medell ſmall mater anſwere venycience made thought ymagined anſwere made waye diſſymulacion thoughe kynge hungry made offre yet agrement ye venicyens made anſwere thus mater abode ſtyll kyng hungry ſtyll poſſeſſyon reuenewes than̄e kynges ambaſſadours departed fro venyce retourned hungry erle neuers abode ſtyll trenuſe bycauſe mortalyte venyce ye haue herde howe lorde philyppe arthois erle ewe conſtable fraūce dyed ye cite burſe turkey whoſe dethe frendes ſorie ſpecially frenche kyng loued hym entierly office ſuche myght nat longe vacant whervpon lordes fraunce aſſembled togider take aduyſe ſhuld made conſtable moſt parte ye coū ſaile agreed valyant knight ſir loys sanxere ben long marſhall fraūce ſame tyme party languedoc ſo ſente incōtynent came paris ther made cōſtable voyde office marſhall ye kyng ſayd none ſhulde haue yt office alouely knyght ſir bouciquaunt euery man agreed therto well worthy whan choſen venyce ſhortely came paris raūſoms one payde lordes knightes fraūce returned home ſir bouciquaunt marſhall fraunce therle neuers drewe duke burgoyn father duches mother great chere made hym reaſon came fro longe voyage peryllous well receyued ī father countreis flaunders arthoys burgoyne place parteynyng father enherytaūce ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe returne lordes fraunce frenche kyng entended myght ſet concorde peace churche cap ccxxv therle neuers thus returned fraūce abode duke father viſyted lā de ſignories deſyre go ſe ye frēche kyng duke orlyaūce receyued hym great ioye kyng duke orlyaunce great appetyte therle ſpeke ye newes turkey aduentures ſtate lamoraba • therle anſwered wiſely cōplayned nothing lamorabaquy ſaid foūde hym ryght curteſſe howe well entreated forgat nat ſhewe ye kyng lady howe departyng lamorabaquy ſaid hym borne worlde dedes armes cōquere euer wolde nat cōmaūde thē whan priſoners ſhulde beare armes agaiſt hym ſaid wolde rather haue thē come agayne ſeconde thirde fourthe tyme nede dedes armes ſo required alſo ſaid howe entent ſe rome make horſe eate otes vppon ſaynt peter aulter alſo ſayde howe criſten faythe nothyng worth corrupted heedes ought gouerne wherat turkes make mocke wherfore ſayd ſhulde diſtruction chriſtendome ye tyme come dyuers turkes ſarazins ſayde kyng lamorabaquy borne lorde worlde turkey tartarye perce alexandre party ſarazins landes ſayde knewe well ſhulde ſo reaſone chriſten men abuſed vpon ii pope wherby chriſten men nat one accorde differedde beleuyng one pope ſome vpon ſarazins great marueyle howe heedes chriſtendome euery realme wolde ſuffre theſe wordes erle neuers made frenche kyng lordes greatly muſe ſome ſayd howe ſarazins good reaſon laugh mocke chriſtendome bycauſe ſuffred prelate churche medell ſo moche therfore ſome ſayde tyme abate pompes bringe thē reaſon clerkes vnyuerſite paris traueyled lerne coude nat come preferment benifyce reaſon sciſme churche two pope wherfore wolde gladly people ſhulde murmure agaynſt ryght gladde erle neuers ſayde turkes made great deriſion therof ſayd howe without frē che kynge kyng almaygne foūde ſome remedy euery thynge ſhulde worſe worſe ſaye trouthe ſuche helde neutre thought hadde taken beſt waye ſo euery man ought wolde bring churche good caſe alſo ſecretly ſhewed frenche kyng ſuche loued ſuche loued helthe howe cōmen opinyon realme fraūce ſhulde neuer haue perfitely helth vnto tyme churche brought another eſtate alſo ſhewed kynge howe kynge charles father whan laye dethe beed charged counſayle conſcyence great dout ſore abuſed thoſe two pope frēche kynge anſwered ſayd whan kyng father dyed yonge haue beleued hyder ſuche haue counſayled folly nat ſythe nowe enformed matter ſhall prouide remedy ſhalbe well ſene frenche kynge marked mater profoundely than̄e euer dyde ſayd coūſayle howe wolde prouyde mater ſpake therof brother duke orlyaunce erle bloyes valois agreed anone kynges wyll lykewiſe ſo dyde duke burgoyne though obeyed pope clement yet neuer ferme beleue hym prelate realme fraunce ſpecially guy roy archebyſſhoppe reyns archebyſſhoppes sen roen byſſhoppe oſtune brought duke beleue pope clement than̄e aduyſed kynges ſecrete coūſayle purpoſed bringe churche reſt peace haue accorde almayne ſente ſuffycient ambaſſadours clerkes bothe lawes maiſter philyppe playes one almayne kyng boeſme almayne wrote hym ſelfe kyng romayns mater went ſo forwarde yt day ſette kyng almayne counſaile frēche kyng coū ſayle ſhulde mete ꝑſonally cyte reynes mater done ſecretely bicauſe prelate cardynalles archebyſſhoppes byſſhoppes ſhulde nat breke purpoſe made noyſed metyng theſe two kynges counſayls reynes non purpoſe treate maryage bytwene ſonne marque blanquebourge brother kyng almayne doughter duke orlyaunce ſo reaſon vnder colour mater wolde common ſame ſeaſone dyed neſues heynaulte lorde guye chaſtellone erle bloyes brought valencēnes buryed ſaynt fraunces freres mynours chapell called chapell orthais done moche coſte cloſynge ſayd freres whan dyed ſo dette counteſſe mary namure forſoke al goodes durſt nat take admyniſtracyon teſtament retourned dowrie lande chinay beaumonde herytages went heyres duke orlyaunce hadde countie blois payed whyle erle guye lyued two hundred thouſande crownes fraūce landes hollande zelande heynaulte wente duke aubert bauyere erle heynaulte lande daueſnes landrecier lonnon terreaſſe fell iohan bloyes called iohn̄ bretaygne erle nat ſolde countie blois ſayd iohan bretaygne ſhulde haue heyre therof conſydre dōmage lorde may heyre gyueng credēce yuell counſayle god forgyue hym ¶nowe lette v retourne buſyneſſe englande ⸫ ⸫ ¶of dethe duke glouceſtre exle arūdell howe kynges vncles londoner toke mater capi ccxxvi ye haue herde couert hate bytwene kynge rycharde englande vncle thomas duke glouceſtre whiche kynge wolde beare lengar ſayd alſo counſayled rather diſtroye another man hymſelfe ye haue herde howe kyng plaſſhey crafte coloure brought hym owne houſe london waye x xi cloke nyght therle marſhall areſted hym kynges name cryed kynge yet kynge made deafe eare rode ſo ſame nyght kynge laye towre london duke glouceceſtre otherwiſe lodged byforce put barge barge ſhyppe laye thamiſe erle marſhall hym company dyde ſo moche nexte day night came calais without knoledge man excepte kynges offycers ſayd towne ye maye well knowe whan̄e takynge duke knowen pla • hey ducheſſe chyldren ſore troubled abaſſhed thought well matter went nat well ducheſſe demaunded coūſaile beſt ſir iohan laquyham knight anſwered beſt ſende bretherne duke lancaſtre yorke myght fynde ſome meanes apeace kynges dyſpleaſure ſayde thought kyng wolde nat diſpleaſe ducheſſe dyd knyght counſayled ſhe ſente incontynent meſſangers theſe two duke farre ſondre whanne herde therof ſored diſpleaſed ſente worde agayne ducheſſe ſhe ſhuld good cōforte ſayd knew well kyng wolde nat entreat hym laufull iudgement otherwiſe coude nat ſuffre thanne knewe natte ducheſſe chyldren ſomwhat conforted anſwere kynge nexte daye wente fro towre london eltham taryed ſame night brought towre london priſoners erle arundell erle warwyke wherof cytie london great marueyle made therof great murmurynge none durſt ſaye nay agaynſt kynges pleaſure maner people knightes ſquyers burgeſſes good cyties townes englāde ſaid haue well ſuffred duke lancaſtre duke yorke bretherne duke glouceſtre maye prouyde whanne pleaſe thē thynke wolde well haue prouyded mater hadde knowen kynges entent agaynſt brother gloceſtre bycauſe nat dilygent cauſe matter come yuell lyke haue yuell concluſyon whan duke gloceſtre brought caſtell calys feared hym ſelfe greatlye ſaid erle marſhall cauſe brought englande hyder calais thynke ye holde priſoner lette go abrode ſe fortreſſe aboute sir quod marſhall ye deſyre dare nat haue charge vpon payne lyfe kynge ſoueraygne lorde lytell myſcontente wherfore ye muſte take pacyence ſeaſone tyll newes ſhalbe ſhortely goddes grace ſir helpe god right ſorie trouble myght remedy ſir ye knowe well ſworne kynge wherfore muſt obey ſo wyll ſauynge myne honoure duke coude haue none aunſwere ſawe feared greatly lyfe daye deſyred preeſt ſange maſſe hym myght cō feſſed ſo good leyſar ſacrament deuout herte cryed god mercy ſore repentaunt ſynnes dede tyme ſo hym ſo dethe nerer hym ware enfourmed whan hadde dyned aboute haue waſſhen handes came chambre foure men caſte ſodaynlye towell aboute duke necke two one ende two drewe ſo ſore fell erthe ſo ſtrangled hym cloſed eyen whan deed diſpoyled hym bare hym beed layde hym bytwene ſhetes naked heed ſofte pyllowe couered clothes furred yſſued chambre hall well determyned wolde ſaye ſayde openly howe palueyſye hadde taken duke glouceſtre ſame night ſodaynly ſo dyed theſe wordes anon abrode towne calais beleued theym ſome natte within two dayes duke thus deed erle marſhall appareled hym ſelfe blacke bycauſe nere coſyn many knyghtes ſquyers calays dethe ſooner knowen fraunce flaunders englād frenche men gladde therof cōmon brute ſhulde good peace bytwene fraunce englande long lyued treaty bytwene fraūce englande euermore harder obſtynaier than̄e bretherne wherfore cared nat dethe lykewiſe many men englande bothe knyghtes ſquyers officer kynges feare hym bycauſe crueltie ſuche gladde dethe toke recorde cruell dedes ye duke irelāde exyled englande alſo ye deth valyant knight ſir symon burle ſir robert triuylien ſir nicholas bramble ſir iohan standyſſhe dyuers duke dethe lytell regarded englande excepte ſuche opinyon thus duke dyed calais body enbaumed ſeared leed couered ſo ſente see englande shyppe caryed hym arryued caſtell hadley vpon thamyſe ſyde fro then caryed chariot ſymply owne place plaſſhey buryed churche whiche ſayde duke hadde founded honoure hooly trynite wherin twelue chanonnes ſynge diuyne ſeruyce ye maye well knowe ducheſſe glouceſtre affren ſonne two ſuſters ſore diſcōfyted whan ſawe duke brought thyther deed ducheſſe double ſorowe richarde erle arundell vncle heeded openly kynges cōmaundemēt chepeſyde lorde durſt ſpeke contrary kynge beyng preſente ſame iuſtyce doynge done erle marſhall hadde wyfe doughter ſayde erle arundell yet bounde eyen hym ſelfe erle warwyke great daunger beheeded erle saliſbury kynges fauour deſyred kynge lyfe ſo dyde dyuers baron prelate englande kynge enclyned requeſtes ſo yt myght banyſſhed putte ſuche place ſhulde natte come fro kyng wolde nat clerely forgyue hym ſayde well deſerued dye bycauſe counſayle ye duke glouceſtre erle arundell haue brokē peace truce taken bitwene fraunce englande whiche artycle kyng ſayd deſerued dye peace taken bytwene ꝑties ſuche cōdycion yt ſo euer dyde breake ſhulde worthy dye erle saliſbury ben erle warwykes companyon dyuers tymes excuſyng ſaid howe olde man deſyred duke glouceſtre fayre wordes wherfore ſayd dyde natte owne mocyon affyrming howe neuer none ye beauchampes euer dyd trayſon agaynſt crowne englande thus erle warwyke pytie reſpyted fro dethe banyſſhed yſle wyght ſayde hym erle warwyke ye haue deſerued dye well erle arundell great ſeruyce ye haue done tyme paſt kynge edwarde prince ſonne crowne englande aſwell ſyde ſee byonde hath done great ayde kyng hath pyte hath graū ted lyfe ordayned iudgement yt ye ſhall go yſle wight lyue longe ye ſhall haue ſuffycient owne maynteyne eſtate ſoberly ye maye neuer departe then erle toke punyſſhement worthe thāked kyng counſayle ſauyng lyfe ſo made hym redy go thyder daye apoynted whiche yſle ſpace ſufficient lorde kepe eſtate enuyroned see thus paſſed forthe theſe iudgementes englande ſeaſon whiche multiplyed dayly worſe worſe ye ſhall whan dethe ye duke glouceſtre knowē duke lancaſtre yorke incō tinent knewe well kynge nephue cauſed hym ſlayne murdered calays theſe two duke nat toguyder eche thē owne plate wrote eche knowe beſt ſo came london knewe well londoner nat content dethe duke brother whan mette toguyder tooke coūſayle ſayd suche dedes ought nat ſuffred putte dethe ſo hyghe prīce brother ydell wordes falſe reportes ſayd though ſpake oftentymes breakyng ye peace yet neuer brake bytwene ſayenge doyng great difference reaſon wordes ought nat deſerue dethe ſuche cruell punycion theſe two duke caſe haue put englande great trouble ynowe redy counſayle therto ſpecially erle arundelles lynage erle staffordes whiche great kynred englande kyng elthā ſente ſuche helde hym chiefe redy aſſembled toguyder london kent eſſexe mo ten thouſande archer ſir iohan hollande brother hym therle marſhall erle saliſbury great nombre lordes knyghtes kyng ſent thē london ſhulde nat receyue duke lancaſtre anſwered ſayd knewe cauſe duke hadde done ſhulde refuce hym duke lancaſtre lōdon erle derby ſonne alſo duke yorke ſonne iohan erle rutlande kyng loued erle rutlande beyonde meaſure diſſymuled dethe vncle duke glouceſtre ſhewed howe wolde gladly ſe good peace bytwene party ſaid howe knew well vncle dyde wronge oftentymes agaynſt kynge londoner lykewyſe conſydred great myſchiefe yt myght fall englande diſcencyon bytwene kynges vncles kyng alyaunces alſo conſydred ſyth myſchefe fallen duke glouceſtres dethe recouery therin knewe well bycauſe ye duke glouceſtre laueſſe tonge wolde haue ſtyrred realme haue broken trewce bytwene englande fraunce wherfore ſuche wyſe men cytie diſſymuled mater thought tyme mende feared puyſſaūce fraunce leſynge marchaundyſe beganne treate went meane bytwene king duke lancaſtre many imagynacions dethe brother troubled ſore alſo ſawe howe nephue kynge rycharde alyed mariage frenche kyng alſo ye duke lancaſtre ii doughters lande one quene spayne nother quene portugale whome thought ſhulde haue great ayde made warre agaynſt nephue kynge rycharde thynges conſydred duke chaunged courage deſyre londoner prelate englande meane bytwene kyng hym meanes kynge agreed duke peace made kinge promyſed fro then forwarde gouerned duke lancaſtre nothyng counſayle aduyſe whiche promeſſe kynge nothynge fulfylled counſayled yonge wylde coūſayle whiche hurte great dōmage ye ſhall hyſtory thus kyng englande peace vncles bycauſe dethe duke glouceſtre beganne reygne fierſly dyd kynge went lay eſſex duke glouceſtre chiefe rule whiche ought haue pertaygned affcen ſonne heyre kynge toke ordynaunce englande kynge haue ye warde herytours chyldren orphelyns vnder age xxi yeres haue herytages thus kinge tooke wardeſhyppe coſyn duke glouceſtres herytour kynge toke poſſeſſion profyte duke lande kepte chylde hym ducheſſe glouceſtre two doughters quene duke glouceſtr • enherytaunce conſtable englande kynge toke offyce fro right heyre gaue coſyn erle rutlande kynge kept greate ſtate euer dyd nat ben kynge englande ſpente ſo moche yerely hundred thouſande noble dyd lyke wyſe kynge hym heyre erle arundell beheeded london bycauſe knyght belongyng duke glouceſtre called cerbe ſpake tyme certayne wordes agaynſt kynge counſayle taken beheeded syr iohan quynghay great parell whan ſawe mater went ſo dyuerſely dyd dyſſymuled moch might departed fro ducheſſe glouceſtres houſe wente dwelt place ¶in thoſe dayes none ſo great englande yt durſt ſpeake agaynſt thynge kyng dyd wolde counſayle mete appetyte exhorted hym lyſt kynge kept ſtyll wage ten thouſande archer night day wayted reputed himſelfe nat parfytely ſure vncles lygnage arundell ⸪ ⸪ ¶of great aſſemble made cytie reyns well emperour realme fraūce ſtate holy churche cap ccxxvii ſame ſeaſone great aſſēble gret lordes cytie reynes lordes empyre fraunce entent bring churche peace reſte frenche kynge dyd ſo moche requeſt coſyn kynge almayne came cytie reynes counſayle bycauſe wolde nat haue brewted aſſembled onely mater twent pope one rome auygnon made noyſed came thyder treate maryage ſonne ye marque blācquebourge doughter duke orlyaunce marque brother kynge almayne frenche kyng lay archebyſſhoppes palayes hym duke orlyaūce berrey burbon therle ſaynt powle dyuers hygh barones prelate fraunce whan kinge almayne entred cytie lordes prelate kynge charles nauer lykewyſe went mete hym receyued hym honourably fyrſte brought hym lady churche abbey ſaynt remy kynge almayne laye lordes aboute hym ordeyned frenche kinge ſo euer kynge almayne ſpent ſhulde frenche kynges coſt almayns euery day delyuered theym ten tonne herynge lent tyme eyght hundred carpes beſyde fyſſhes whiche great charge whan kyng almayne came firſt frenche kynge lordes went hym ſaynt remy ſo brought ye kynges palays whan theſe two kynges mette made great honoure eche great reuerence ſpecyally frenche kynge almayns nature rude groſe manered without take profyte therto experte redy ynough lordes fraunce almayne toke acquayntaunce eche louyng wordes countinaunce frenche kynge made kynge almayne company great dyner one table ſate fyrſt patryarke iheruſalem king almayne frenche kynge kynge nauer ſate mo table table ſate lordes prelate almayne lorde fraūce ſate day ſarued kynges borde meate brought duke berrey burbone erle ſaynt powle great lordes fraūce duke orlyaūce ſet euery man downe veſſell golde ſyluer ranne plentuouſly palays though ben wode erthe ſumptuous dyner enfourmed frenche kynge gaue coſyn kyng almayne veſſell plate gold ſyluer ſerued day palays dreſſer elſwhere hangynges habylymentes hall chambre whervnto kynge retrayed dynner ſpyces wyne taken gyft prayſed valewed two hundred thouſande florayns ouer gyuen almayns great gyftes goodly preſentes veſſell plate golde ſyluer wherof ſtraungers great marueyle ſtate puyſſaunce great ryches realme fraūce theſe kinges thus abydynge cytie reynes counſayles mette togyther dyuers tymes mater came thyder well maryage duke orlyaunces doughter marque blancque bourges ſonne reformacyon churche laſte maryage concluded openly publyſſhed cytie mater conſernynge pope nothynge knowen therof counſayle concluded counſayle kept ſecrete afterwarde enfourmed agreed maiſter peter daylly byſſhop cambraye ſhulde go legacyon fro frenche kynge fro kynge almayne rome hym called pope bonyface ſhulde ſubmyt hym ſelfe haue newe electyon pope lykewyſe ye pope auygnon ſo wolde nat agree therto abyde ordre theſe two kynges dyſgrated ryghtes churche kepte fro hym frenche kynge compriſe agrement ſonne lawe kynge englande kynge ſcottes kynge henry spayne kynge iohan portugale kynge charles nauer kyng aragon ye kinge almayne ſhulde compryſe brother loys kynge hungery realme boeſme almayne pruce ordeyned whan byſſhop cambrey retourned fro ſōmonyng theſe two pope go ſayd realmes alyes thus theſe two kynges ſware holde without varyacyon let thus ended counſayle tyme kynges lordes departed amyably euery man tooke leaue departed went home counſayle reynes duke burgoyne nat wolde nat • ſayd payne thynge loſte gyue thynge almayns kepe promeſſe couenaūt howe duke wordes nothynge left mater went forthe ye haue herde anon byſſhop cambraye made hym redy tooke waye rome alſo frenche kynge ſent great ambaſſade englande ſe ye kyng quene ſhewe mater ſo dyd whan retourned ſhewed frenche kynge howe kynge englande wolde take ſame way kynge almayne frenche kynge wolde concluded nede newter thus mater ſtode caſe kynge charles nauer fraūce ſe kynge coſyn truſtyng recouer herytage normandy countie ewrus whiche frenche kynge taken fro hym ye haue herde coulde nat attayne therto meanes ſo euer ſhewed ſayd whan kynge nauerre ſawe loſt payne labored vayne toke mater great dyſpleaſure toke leaue ſobrely coulde nat well contente frenche kynge counſayle ſo retourned realme nauerre ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpeakynge ſpeke accydentes fell englande wherby folowed ſo great yuell lyke hath nat ben written hyſtory foloweth entre begynnynge mater ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe erle marſhall englande apealed gage vtteraūce erle derby ſonne duke lancaſtre preſence kynge counſayle cap ccxxviii kinge richard englande hadde condycion loued man wolde make hym ſo great ſo nere marueyle conſydre man durſte ſpeke contrary alſo wolde lightly beleue ſoner kynge remembrance hym ſuche nere aboute hym grace tooke enſample ben great kyng duke irelande put englande alſo ſyr symon burle reaſon ſuche counſayle gaue kynge beheeded ſyr robert treuylyan ſyr nycholas bramble kynges counſayle wherfore ſuffred dethe duke glouceſtre dyd payne dyſtroy yet fynally loſte lyfe ye haue herde wherof ſuche aboute kynge nothynge ſory wherby ſome aboute kynge roſe ſuche pride marueyle ſo moche coulde nat coloure hyde ſpecyally erle marſhall great kynges fauoure myght entente pleaſe kynge flatter hym made kynge beleue trewe faythfull ſecrete ſeruaunt coulde nat endure worde ſpoken agaynſt kynge tolde kynge many thynges haue kynges loue howe often tymes man thynketh auaunced pulled backe ſo fortuned erle marſhall ſhall ſhewe howe ye muſte knowe erle derby duke glouceſtre deed wyues two ſuſters doughters erle herforde northamton conſtable englande ſo chyldren erle derby duke glouceſtre coſyn germayns mother ſyde within degre nere kynne father ſyde ſay trouth dethe duke glouceſtre ryght dyſpleaſaunt many great lordes englande often tymes wolde ſpeke murmure therat whan togyder kynge ſo hygh vppon whele man durſte ſpeke kynge knewe cauſed ſpoken abrode realme ſo euer ſpake word duke glouceſtre erle arundell ſhulde reputed traytour wherfore people durſt nat ſpeke day erle derby erle marſhall communed togyder dyuers mater laſt amonge ſpake ſtate kynge counſayle ſuche hym beleued ſo laſt erle derby ſpake certayne wordes whiche thought beſt wenynge ſhulde neuer haue ben called reherſall whiche wordes nouther vylenous outragyous ſayde thus saint mary fayre coſyn thynketh kynge oure coſyn wyll driue englande noble men within whyle ſhalbe none left ſemeth clerely wylleth nat augmentacyon realme erle marſhall gaue none aunſwere diſſimuled mater toke ſpake agaynſt kynge thought hymſelfe erle derby ryght lykely make great trouble englande bycauſe ſo great londoner dyuell redy ſtyre brayne thynge ſhall fall nat eſchewed thought ſhewe mater kynge whan noble mē ſhulde preſente day pleaſe kynge ſayde ryght dere ſyr youre lygnage ame lyege man marſhall englande wherfore ſir bounde myne alliegeaunce othe ſworne handes ſhulde place hearynge thynge contrarye mageſte royall ſhulde kepe ſecrete ought reputed falſe traytour whiche wyll nat wyll trewly acquyte agaynſt worlde kynge loked hym demaunded ſayd ſay theſe wordes wyll know right redouted ſouerayne lorde quod erle marſhall ſaye bycauſe canne nat ſuffre thynge ſhulde preiudyciall agaynſt grace ſyr cauſe erle derby come ſhall ſhewe erle derby ſente kynge cōmaunded erle marſhall ſtande vp knee whyle ſpake kynge whan erle derby kyng thought none yuell erle marſhall ſayde syr erle derby ſay ye haue thought yuell ſpoken otherwyſe ye ought agaynſte naturall lorde kynge englande whan ye ſayde nat worthy holde lande realme ſeynge without lawe iuſtyce without counſayle noble men diſtourbeth realme without tytell good reaſon putteth realme dyſtroyeth ought ayde ſuſteyne wherfore caſt gage wyll proue body agaynſt ye yuell falſe traytour erle derby ſore abaſſhed thoſe wordes ſtepte backe lytell ſtode ſtyll ſeaſon without demaundynge father aunſwere ſhulde make whan ſtudyed lytell ſtept forthe cappe hande came kynge erle marſhall ſayd erle marſhall ſaye thou arte yuell falſe traytour yt ſhall proue body agaynſt thyne quarell gauge therle marſhall whan herde howe apealed ſhewed howe deſyred batayle erle derby aunſwered ſayde ſette wordes kynges pleaſure lordes tourne wordes mocke myne true eche theſe erles drewe company lygnage ſo manner takynge wyne ſpyces lette paſſe kyng ſhewed hym ſelfe right ſore diſpleaſed ſo entred chambre left two vncles without chyldren erles salyſbury huntyngdon bretherne anone kynge ſent vncles entred chambre thanne kynge demaunded beſt mater syr quod cauſe conſtable come ſhall ſhewe opynyons erle rutlande conſtable ſente whan come commaunded go erle derby erle marſhall take ſuretye theym go nat realme englande without kynges lycence conſtable dyd cōmaunded retourned agayne kinges chambre ye maye well knowe matter greatly troubled courte many lordes knyghtes ſore dyſpleaſed aduenture ſecretly greatly blamed erle marſhall made though ſer nothyng mater hert ſo proude preſumptuous thus lordes departed yt day duke lācaſtre ſo euer coūtynaunce made ſore diſpleaſed theſe wordes thought kynge ſhulde nat haue taken mater dyd ſhulde rather haue tourned nothynge ſo thought moſte parte lordes englande erle derby went lay london helde eſtate owne lodgynge pledge duke lancaſtre father duke yorke erle northumberlande dyuers lordes erle marſhall ſente towre london helde eſtate theſe two lordes made prouyſyon neceſſary batayle erle derby ſent meſſangers lombardy duke myllayne ſyr galea haue armure pleaſure duke agreed erles deſyre cauſed knight erle ſent thyder whoſe name fraunces ſe duke armorye whan knyght choſen ſuche lyked duke furthermore loue erle derby ſent four ye beſt armorer lombardy erle englande knight entent ſhulde arme make armure acordynge erles entente erle marſhall parte ſent almayn place prouyde iourney charge theſe two lordes greate erle derby mooſt charge erle marſhall whan beganne buſyneſſe thought haue ayde kynge ſuche nere aboute kynge ſayd syr ye haue nothyng medle bytwene theſe two lordes dyſſymule mater let deale wyll well ynough sir ye knowe well erle derby well beloued realme ſpecyally londoner ſe ye ſhulde take parte erle marſhall ye lyke loſe loue therby euer kynge vnderſtode well wordes knew well trewe diſſymuled mater moche coulde ſuffred make prouyſyon lyſt newes ſpredde abrode dyuers countreys defyaunce bytwene erle derby erle marſhall many men ſpake therof dyuers maners ſpecyally fraunce ſayd lette theym alone knyghtes englande ouer proude length wyll dyſtroy eche worſte nacyon worlde vnder ſonne yt realme dwelleth moſte preſumptuous people canne ſpake ſo berly ſayde kynge englande ſhewed wyſdome nat well counſayled whanne wylde wordes ſuffre ſuche two noble men blode enterpriſe armes defyaunce ſhulde rather whan herde wordes fyrſte haue ſayde bothe ye two lordes blode lygnage wherfore cōmaunde bothe peace lette nouther hate rancoure engendre bytwene frendes louers coſyns togyther lande canne nat contente go countrey ye wyll ſeke aduentures armes kynge ſayde thoſe wordes apeaſed theſe lordes thus done wyſely duke lancaſtre ſore dyſpleaſed mynde ſe kynge nephewe myſſe vſe hym ſelfe dyuers thynges dyd conſydred tyme come lyke ſage prince ſomtyme ſayd ſuche truſted beſt nephue kynge englande wyll ſhame ceaſe beleueth lyghtly yuell counſayle ſhall diſtroy hym ſymply lyue longe wyll leſe realme hath goten moche coſte trauayle predeceſſours v ſuffreth engendre realme bytwene noble men hate dyſcorde ſhulde ſerued honoured lande kepte douted hath cauſed brother dye whiche one thynge noted erle arundell bycauſe ſhewed hym trouthe wolde nat none wolde coūſayle hym agaynſt appetyte canne nat better dyſtroye realme put trouble hatred bytwene noble men good townes frenche men right ſubtyle one myſchiefe falleth amonge v wolde ten otherwyſe canne nat recouer dōmages come entente owne meanes dyſcorde bytwene ſelfe weſe dayly realmes deuyded dyſtroyed hath ſene realme fraunce spayne naples landes churche maye ſe dayly two pope whiche ſhall dyſtructyon alſo hath ſene countrey flaunders howe owne meanes diſtroyed alſo preſently ſene lande frece whome coſyns haynalt warre howe frenche men amonge theym ſelfe dyſtroyed lykewyſe amonge ourſelfe without god prouyde v ſhall dyſtroy ſelfe apparaunce therof ſheweth greatly nowe kynge ſuffereth ſonne heyre ſhall batayle thynge nought father maye nat ſpeake contrary myne owne honoure ſonnes ſonne hathe body knyght mete entre armes agaynſt erle marſhall howe take beſt therof ſhall neuer loue agayne togyder dyd thus ſaid duke lancaſtre ſeaſone theſe two lordes dyd prouyde dedes armes vtteraunce duke lancaſtre came neuer ye kyng lytell ſonne dyd polycy duke knewe well yt ſonne marueylouſly well beloued englande noble men ſpecyally londoner promyſed ſayd hym syr ye good comforte buſyneſſe howeſoeuer matter tourne ye ſhall ſcape honour whether kynge wyll nat marmoſettes aboute hym knowe well mater made conueyed enuy entente driue realme bycauſe ye well beloued many men ſo ye departe trouble ye ſhall entre agayne ioye ye ought rather rule rycharde burdeaulx wyll ſeke profoundeneſſe mater maye well knowe fro whence ye came fro whence came wherby maye knowe yt ye nerer crowne englande rycharde burdeaulx though haue made hym faythe homage haue helde hym kyng thanne twenty yere fauour purchaſe grauntfather good kynge edwarde douted poynte nowe ſpeke tyme great queſtion made bytwene kyng edwarde grauntfather youre father ſyde duke henry lancaſtre grauntfather mother ſyde lady blaunche lancaſtre lordes englande reygned apeaſed matter kynge edwarde ſo valyaunt man ſo happy enterpriſes loue people poore riche alſo grauntfather lancaſtre wolde nothynge kynge well good ſerued kynge tyme nobly trewly ſo yet recommaunded theſe mater well conſydred kynge rycharde myght well repente hym better gouerned suche wordes theſe londoner ſpake thoughe knewe lytell trouth ſpake ſynguler fauoure erle derby receyued wordes well worthe dayly prepared batayle deſyred frendes iourney ſo euery man prepared hymſelfe accordynge erles deſyre kynge ſeaſon theſe two lordes prepared batayle many ymagynacyons whether ſhuld ſuffre fyght nat thoughe kynge englande douted kynge hym yet nyght daye kept hym garde two thouſande archer payed wage wekely kynge truſted nat greatly theym nexte blode excepte brother erle huntyngton erle saliſbury erle rutlande coſyn germayne ſonne duke yorke well kynges fauoure certayne knyghtes chambre cared lytell whan day aproched theſe two lordes ſhulde dedes armes hadde promyſed euery thynge redy prepared daye certayne kynges counſayle came kynge demaunded entencyon theſe two lordes ſhulde ſayde sir wyll ye ſuffre theym fyght ye truelye quod kyng ſhulde nat wyll ſe dedes armes paraduenture ſhall knowe therby knowe nat yet ſhulde right neceſſary knowe entente ſhulde prouyde none ſo great englande diſpleaſe ſhall cauſe hym make amendes ſhulde thynge ſubmytte ſubiettes wolde ſoone ouercome knowe certaygne ſome theym blode haue hadde dyuers treatyſe toguyder agaynſte myne eſtate mooſt princypall thē duke glouceſtre englande natte worſe hedde agaynſt nowe ſhall haue peace fro henſe forwarde ſhall well ynough ſirs praye ſhewe ye make demaūde sir quod bounde counſayle ſir often tymes wordes ſpoken ye canne nat ſir ye youre chambre abrode coū trey london many thynges ſpoken whiche greatlye toucheth v alſo sir tyme prouyde remedye ſo ye muſte sir counſayle beſt howe ſo quod kynge speke ſpare natte wyll euery thynge parteynyng reaſon minyſter iuſtyce realme sir quod renoume ronneth englande ſpecially cytie london whiche ſoueraygne cytie youre realme ſaye ye cauſe enterprice bytwene theſe two lordes ye haue ſette erle marſhall fyght erle derby londoner dyuers noble men prelate ye realme ſaye howe ye take ryght waye diſtroye lygnage realme englande whiche thynge ſaye wyll natte ſuffre londoner riſe agaynſte ſuche noble men wyll take parte ye ſhall puyſſaūce reſyſt theym alſo haue marueylous ſuſpecte bycauſe ye alyed maryage frenche kynge wherby ye worſe beloued youre people ſir knowe certayne ye ſuffre theſe two erles come place batayle ye ſhall nat lorde felde londoner ſuche lordes ꝑte wyll rule felde loue fauoure beare erle derby erle marſhall ſoore hated ſpecially londouers wolde ſlayne thre partes people englande ſaye whan ye harde yt wordes fyrſt bytwene theſe two erles ye ſhulde haue done otherwyſe ye dyd ye ſhulde haue broken quarell haue ſayd sir ye bothe coſyns lyegmen therfore commaunde kepe peace fro henſ forthe ſhulde haue taken erle derby hande haue ledde hym youre chambre haue ſhewed hym ſome ſigne loue bycauſe ye dyde nat thus brute ronneth ye beare fauour erle marſhalles partie agaynſt erle derby sir conſyder well theſe wordes ſhewe trewe sir ye neuer nede good counſayle ye haue nowe whan kynge herde theſe wordes chaunged countynaūce wordes ſo quickely ſpoken therwith kynge tourned fro leaned wyndowe ſtudyed certayne ſpace tourned agayne ſpoken hym archebyſſhoppe yorke erles saliſbury huntingdon bretherne thre knightes chambre ſayde sir haue well herde ſhulde refuce counſayle greatly blame wherfore ſirs conſyder beſte sir quod one theym ſpake matter haue ſpoken ryght peryllous ye muſte diſſymule mater ye wyll haue youre honour ſaued make peace ſir ye ought rather entertayne generaltie realme ydell wordes two knyghtes ſir brute thoroughe realme englande howe erle marſhall hathe greatlye treſpaſſed hath renewed many yuell thinges daylye reneweth realme taketh wordes vayne ſaith ydell word wolde reiſe ꝓceſſe agaynſt erle derby bringe lande trouble firſt ſay better abode payne erle derby quyte sir thynke ſhulde arme thē mete togyder ye ſhulde ſende cauſe thē bounde abyde youre ordynaunce enterpriſe whan furely bounde abyde youre ſentence ye maye gyue theym iudgemente within fyftene dayes erle marſhall auoyde realme without truſte euer retourne agayne therle derby lykewyſe auoyde realme banyſſhed tenne yere whan ſhall departe realme pleaſe people withall releaſe foure yere tenne ſo let hym banyſſhed ſixe yere without pardone counſayle ſir wyll gyue ſir wyſe let armed one agaynſt another inconuenyentes maye fall therby kynge ſtudyed lytell ſayde sir ye counſayle trewly ſhall folowe youre counſayle ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe kynge richarde gaue ſentence wherby banyſſhed englande therle derby x yere erle marſhall euer capi ccxxix anone coūſayle gyuen kynge aſſembled great nombre prelate grete lordes englande came hym elthā two vncles duke lancaſtre duke yorke erles northumberlande salyſbury huntyngton kynge ſente erle derby erle marſhall ſette eche ſeuerall chā bre kynge ſhewed howe wolde meane bytwene howe wordes hadde greatly diſpleaſed hym ſuche ought nat lyghtly pardoned wherfore wolde poyntes ſhulde ſubmytte ſelfe abyde ordynaunce behalfe ordayned conſtable englande foure great lordes go erle derby therle marſhall take bondes abyde kynges ordynaunce theſe lordes came ſayd erles ſhewed kynges pleaſure kynge wolde take matter hym bounde ſelfe abyde kynges order kynge ſayde ordaygne commaunde erle marſhall bycauſe hath brought realme trouble reaſon wordes wherin canne nat make profe ordayne ſelfe auoide realme englande goo dwell place lyſte therof banyſſhed ſuche wyſe neuer retourne agayne alſo ordayne erle derby coſyn bycauſe hathe diſpleaſed v chiefe cauſe banyſſhment therle marſhall within fyftene dayes auoyde realme englande banyſſhed tenne yeres without retournynge excepte repeale hym agayne whiche ſhall alwayes lye pleaſure ſentence greatly contented lordes preſent ſayde erle derby maye well ynoughe go ſporte hym realme two thre yeres yonge ynoughe thoughe haue ſore traueyled dayes farre country pruce holy sepulchre cayre ſaynt katheryns mount may yet goo ſome voyage paſſe tyme lyſte knoweth wyll ynoughe whider go hath two ſuſters one quene spaygne quene portugale maye well paſſe tyme alſo nowe warre whan cometh spaygne maye moue theym make warre vpon sarazyns make voyage granade wherby maye better employe tyme abydynge englande elles maye goo heynaulte brother coſyn erle oſtrenaunt wyll receyue hym great ioye retaygne hym ſor hathe warre freſons haynaulte maye dayly newes englande fro child natte go amyſſe goo wyll kynge maye repeale hym agayne good meanes whan ſhall pleaſe hym one fayreſt floures garlande ſhall nat longe abſente kynge purpoſe haue loue people erle marſhalle farre worſe caſe banyſſhed without hope euer retourne agayne ſaye trouthe hath well deſerued myſchiefe come hym wordes thus dyuers knyghtes ſquyers englande talked toguyder one another ſame daye kynge gaue ſayde iugemēt ⸪ ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe erle derby departed fro london go fraunce erle marſhall went flaunders ſo lombardy cap ccxxx ⸪ ⸪ whan theſe two erles ſawe ſentence ye kynge gyuen theym ryght ſore penſyue good cauſe erle marſhall ſore repented ſaid done whan began mater thought otherwyſe haue ben borne kyng hadde knowen moche wolde neuer haue begon matter whan ſawe remedy made hym redy made exchaung fro london bruges ſo cāe calays capitayne toke leaue ſo went bruges taryed fyftene dayes gaunt ſo maynges finally colloigne ¶lette v leaue ſpekyng hym ſpeke erle derby prepared hym ſelfe lykewiſe departe englande accordyng kynges ſentēce whan daye departure aproched came eltham kynge duke lācaſtre father duke yorke erle northumlande ſir henry percy ſonne great nombre knyghtes ſquyers englande ſuche loued hym ſoore diſpleaſed fortune muſt auoyde realme theſe lordes came thyder ſe ende kynge wolde make mater whoſe cōmyng kynge made ſemblaunt right ioyfull made great chere helde great court alſo erle saliſbury erle huntyngton brother kyng hadde wyfe duke lancaſtres doughter ſuſter erle derby theſe two lordes came therle derby knowe nat diſſymuled nat erles departynge kynge humyled hym greatly coſyn derby ſaid godde helpe right greatly diſpleaſeth wordes hath bytwene erle marſhalle ſentence haue gyuen beſte apeaſe therby people greatly murmured matter wherfore coſyn yet eaſe ſomwhat payne releaſe iudgement fro tenne yere ſyxe yere coſyn take worthe ordyne therafter erle anſwered ſayd sir thāke grace whan ſhall pleaſe ye ſhall grace lordes well contented kynge tyme euery man departed ſome went london erle derby erle made prouiſyon douer paſſe calays erle beyng london departure counſayled father go ſtreight frenche kynge coſyns fraunce accordynge father counſayle ſo dyde elles wolde haue gone erle oſtrenaunt brother coſyn whan erle
