departed fro london ſtretes mo thanne fourtie thouſande men wepyng cryeng hym pytie ſōe ſaid gentyll erle derby ſhall thus leaue realme ſhall neuer ioye tyll ye retourne agayne daye retourne longe enuy falſehed trayſon hath putte realme ye ought abyde rather thā many ye ſuche lynage ſo noble blode none ought compared gentyll erle ſhalle leaue ye neuer dyde thought yuell thus men woman pituouſly ſpake nat conueyed cytie inſtrumentes lamentable wepynges ſome ſayd ſecretelye cōſyder order theſe people diſpleaſure take ſmall occaſyon ſo euer wolde ſtyrre londoner ryſe agaynſt kyng might go ſeke flye realme rather erle derby nowe tyme ſithe duke lācaſtre father ſuffreth muſt nedes ſuffre mayre lō great nombre chiefe burgeſſes accompanyed therle derby cytie rode dartforde ſome douer ſawe hym take ſhippyng retourned erle derby came calais hadde ſent knyght heraulde frenche kyng brother duke orlyaunce ye kynges vncles duke berrey burbon burgoyn knowe kynges pleaſure wolde ſuffre erle abyde parys kepe houſe pay euery thyng men ſhulde take requeſt frenche kynge vncles lightly agreed ſhewed right ioyfull cōmynge ſaid howe ryght ſorie erles trouble theſe meſſangers returned calais fouude erle redy frē che kynge ſent ſir charles hanger open cyties townes bytwene calais paris receyue therle cō pany thus erle derby departed fro calays toke waye amyence euery place well receyued ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe lorde guillyam erle oſtrenaunt ſente coſyn therle derby certayne meſſangers howe therle came paris howe receyued capi ccxxxi erle oſtrenaūt beyng queſnoy aſſone knewe coſyn erle derby paſſed see come calais ordayned ſir auncell traſſagetes ſir fierebras vertayne ride calais deſyre erle derby come heynaulte ſporte hym abyde ſeaſon promyſynge hym haue good chere theſe two knyghtes departed fro queſnoy rode cambrey bapames herde newes erle departed fro calais hadde taken waye amayēce ſo go parys theſe two knyghtes mette hym waye ſpake hym dyde meſſage ſo erle thanked alſo coſyn ſent excuſed hym ſelfe ſayd howe made prouiſyon go fraunce tyme frenche kynge coſyns fraunce wolde nat renounce curteſy coſyn heynalt ſhewed hym theſe two knightes departed retourned ſhewed therle oſtrenaunt ſene done therle derby company rode ſo long aproched nere parys whā kyng duke orlyaunce vncles knewe erle derby came paris prepared chābers place ſaynt poule richely receyue therle cauſed lordes iſſue cytie receyue hym kyng taryed houſe ſaynt poule firſt mette hym duke berrey duke orlyaūce duke burgoyne duke burbon noble prelate lordes knightes metyng frendly chere ſo good order entred paris great ioye ſame daye one great myſfortune fell ſquyer named boniface mounted great courſar whiche horſe roſe vpright vpon hynder fete fell backewarde ſquyers hedde lyght vpon ſtones hedde cloue ſonder ſo dyed whoſe dethe duke orlyaunce ryght ſorie loued hym entierly ſo dyde lorde coucy dayes brought hym frū ce lombardy thus came houſe ofſaynt poule kynge receyued erle nobly therle ſage wyſe knewe moch parteyned honour made reuerēce acquaynted hym kynge good maner ſo moche greatly pleaſed kynge good loue gaue erle deuyſe weare whiche erle receyued ioyfully wordes bitwene nat tell well takyng ſpyce wyne erle toke leaue kyng went quene ſame houſe ſhe made hym ioyouſe chere erle departed toke horſe go lodgyng ſo conueyed thyder thus paſſed tyme lordes fraunce dyde often tymes kepe hym company cauſed hym paſſe ye tyme ſportes otherwyſe entent ſhulde thynke ſeaſon ſhorter bycauſe owne nacion ¶nowe lette v leaue ſpekyng erle derby ſomwhat ſpeke ordynaunce churche two pope benedic beyng auignon bonyface rome ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe treatie reynes bitwene frenche kyng kyng almaygne concernyng vnyte churche folowed howe byſſhoppe cābrey ſent ſayd kynge rome auygnon thē wrote ſelfe pope thē tent ſhulde depoſe thēſelfe fro papalytes ſubmyt thē order theſe two kynges capi cc xxxii ye haue herde howe yt kyng almaȳne ye kyng fraunce lordes thempire coūſails ben cytie reynes dyuers ſecrete counſayls entencion bring churche parfyte vnite folowe way churche helde errour great alſo ye haue herde howe mayſter peter de ailly byſſhoppe cambrey ſent legacion rome ſpeke pope boniface ſpedde hym ſo iourney came foūdes foūde pope boniface hym delyuered letter credence dyrected fro kynges almaygne fraunce pope receyued byſſhoppe right mekelye pope knewe well parte meſſage byſſhoppe declared ye cauſe cōmynge whan pope hadde well herde hym ſayde howe anſwere laye nat onely hym alſo cardy nalles choſen hym pope ſaid whan hadde ſpoken delyberate counſayle wolde make ſuche anſwere truſted content aunſwere ſuffycient tyme byſſhoppe dyned daye pope palyce certayne cardynalles hym pope departed fro foundes went rome pope aſſembled conuocacion cardynalles palyce beſyde ſaynt peter churche conſiſtorie none pope cardynalles pope ſhewed requeſt kynge almaygne frenche kyng made hym byſſhoppe cambrey demaunded coūſaile anſwere ſhuld make than̄e many reaſons alleged ſemed right contrary cardinalles put downe hadde made ſayde ſhulde greatly ſhame rebuke ſaid pope holy father cauſe theſe kynges good hope yt ye wyll obey ye muſt ſōwhat diſſymule y• mater ſaye howe ye wyll gladly obey thynge kynge almaygne kyng hungry kyng englande wyll counſayle vnto auignon writeth hym ſelfe pope benedic frenche kyng frenchman vpholde errour depoſe hym name papalyte thā wher ſo euer ſhall pleaſe ſayde kynges apoynt cōclaue ye wyll redy bretherne cardynalles counſayle pleaſed well pope boniface ſpeciall generall aunſwere byſſhoppe cambrey whan romayns vnderſtode ye kynges almaygne fraunce ſente pope ambaſſade haue leaue papalyte anone multiplyed great murmuracion cytie rome romayns douted greatly leſe pope ſiege whiche yerely gret profyte pardon ſhulde two yere vantage therof ſhulde growe cytie rome agaynſt pardone made great prouiſyon wherfore douted leſt ſhulde haue ben loſte whiche ſhulde greatly haue ben preiudyce mooſt notableſt perſones rome aſſembled togyder came pope ſhewed hym ſigne loue euer hadde done ſayd holy father ye trewe pope therfore leſe nat herytage patrimony churche whiche ſaynt peter take neuer counſayle contrarye abyde ſtyll pope ſoeuer agaīſt ſhall abyde ieoparde oure bodyes goodes defende youre right pope aunſwered ſayd welbeloued chyldren good confort well aſſured wyll abyde pope treatie kynge kynges contrary thus romayns contented apeaſed retourned houſes pope anſwere alwayes byſſhoppe cambrey whā parceyued clerely benedic depoſed hymſelfe ſaid wolde ordred ſayde kynges byſſhoppe retourned came almaygne founde kyng cō ualence ſhewed ye anſwere rome kyng almaygne ſayde well shewe brother coſyn frenche kynge ordreth hym ſelfe ſo ſhall order empyre farre ſe muſt begyn fyrſt whan hath putte downe pope ſhall putte downe byſſhoppe departed fro kyng rode tyll cāe parys wher foūde frenche kyng byſſhoppe ſhewed aunſwere whiche kepte ſecrete tyll kyng aſſembled toguyder nōbre noble men prelate realme whome wolde counſayled howe ſhulde ꝑcede ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe frenche kyng aſſēbled prelate noble men realme vniuerſyte paris take counſayle howe ſhulde order pope benedic auygnon cap ccxxxiii whan frenche kyng herde aunſwere pope bonyface rome howe kynge almayne lykewyſe aunſwered firſt pope benedyc muſte put dowue done wolde make conuocacyon prelate noble men realme come parys certayne prelate fraunce archebyſſhop rein ſyr guy roye archebyſſoppes rone sen byſſhoppes parys beauoys anxex ſore ſuſteyned opynyons pope benedyc auygnon ſpecyally clement bycauſe auaunced meanes theſe ſyxe prelate nat called kynge counſayle prelate vnyuerſyte parys whan byſſhop cambray ſhewed howe ſpedde rome aunſwere pope bonyface cardynals made hym aunſwere kynge almayne entred counſayle greed yt vnyuerſite ſhulde haue greatteſt voyce determyned vnyuerſite kyng ſhuld ſende ſyr bouciquant marſhall partyes auignon ſo moche treatie otherwyſe benedic ſhulde leaue papalyte ordeyne hym ſelfe poyntes kyng counſayle churche lymytacions realme fraū ce ſhulde newter tyll churche brought parfyte vnyte doone euery thynge returne true right counſayle thought good accepted kynge marſhall fraunce byſſhop cambray ordeyned go auignon departed fro parys rode tyll came lyon ryuer roſne • two departed ſōdre ordeyned marſhall ſhulde tary ther ſtyll tyll herd tydynges fro byſſhoppe rode forthe ſo came auygnon ſome cardynalles knewe well wherfore came diſſymuled mater knowe pope benedic wolde ſay whan byſſhop cambraye refreſſhed hym lodgynge chaunged apparell wente pope palayes whan came pope preſence made reuerence nat ſuch wyſe ought haue doone taken hym pope men dyd yet made hym byſſhoppe cambray promocyon meanes lordes fraunce byſſhoppe cambray well langaged bothe laten frenche ſpake ſhewed howe ſent thyder fro french kynge fro kynge almayne ſo beganne proces whan byſſhoppe came vtteraunce mater howe pope ſhulde reſygne depoſe hymſelfe fro papall dygnyte rome ſhulde likewyſe thoſe wordes pope beganne chaunge colour lyfte vp voyce ſayd haue endured great payne traueyle churche good election created pope nowe depoſe ſelfe ſhall neuer lyfe wyll frenche kynge knowe ordynaūce wyll nothynge therafter wyll kepe name papalyte tyll dye syr quod byſſhoppe cambray ſauyng grace toke prudent nowe fynde fyrſte demaūde counſayle bretherne cardynalles make aunſwere alone nat make reſyſtence agaynſt agree opynyon ye nat able reſyſte puyſſaunce kynges fraunce almayne two cardynalles ſuch pope made parceyuynge mater nat lykely well roſe ſayd pope holy father byſſhoppe cambray ſpeketh well ſyr deſyre herin coūſayle well quod pope contente departed tyme byſſhop went lodgynge went nat ſe cardynals dyſſymuled hym ſelfe nexte day tymes bell ſowned conſiſtory conuocacyon cardynalles iuygnon aſſembled palays entred conſiſtory thyder called byſſhop cambraye laten ſhewed length meſſage cauſe cōmyng thyder whan ſayd aunſwered howe pope ſhulde take counſayle anſwere meane tyme departe houſe ſo dyd meane ſeaſon benedic cardynalles counſayled togyder longe debatynge mater many thought herde contrary mater put downe created cardynall amyence ſpake ſayd lordes whether wyll nat muſt behoue v obey frenche kynge kinge almayne ſythe conioyned togyder without thē nat lyue howe ſhulde well ynough kyng almayne frenche kynge wolde take parte otherwyſe cōmaundeth v obey el wyll ſtoppe fro v fruites benefyces without whiche nat lyue trewe holy father haue created pope ye condycion power ye ſhuld ayde refourme churche bring parfyte vnyon ye haue alwayes ſayd mayntayned therfore ſyr aunſwere atemperately ſuche maner may prayſe ſyr ye ought better know owne corage dyuers cardynalles ſayd ſyr cardynall amyence ſayeth well wyſely wherfore ſyr pray generall ye wyll ſpeke ſhewe v ye wyll benedyc aunſwered ſaid vnyon churche deſyre haue taken great payne therin ſyth god deuyue grace hathe prouyded papalyte ye haue choſen therto longe lyue wyll pope wyll nat depoſe ſelfe nouther kyng duke erle treatie proceſſe meanes yt wyll abyde pope cardynals roſe vp togyder great murmurynge ſome ſayd ſpoken well ſome ſayd contrary thus dyffered dyſcorde moſt parte departed conſyſtory toke leaue pope retourned lodgynges ſuche pope fauour taryed ſtyll hym whan byſſhoppe cambray ſawe howe departed ſuche maner knewe well acorded nat well therwith auaunced hym ſelfe entred conſyſtory ſo came pope whyle ſate ſtyll ſee without doynge great reuerence ſayde syr gyue myne aunſwere ſythe ye haue counſayle aboute ye ought gyue myne aunſwere may retourne pope benedic great dyſpleaſure wordes cardynall amyence ſpoken ſayd byſſhoppe cambray haue counſayle dyuers bretherne cardynals hath created dignyte papall haue receyued ſolemynytyes therto belongyng writen named pope ſubgiettes pope wyll abyde longe lyue wyll nat contrary dye payne haue doone cauſe leſe ſaye ſonne fraunce hyther vnto haue taken good catholyke prince nowe byſyniſter meanes wyll entre great errour wyll repente praye ſay hym fro well aduyſed howe enclyneth thinge ſhulde trouble conſcyence therwith benedic roſe chayre went chambre certayne cardynalles hym byſſhoppe cambray retourned lodgynge dyned ſobrely toke horſe paſſed bridge rone came vile nefe nyght lay baignoulx whiche partaygned realme fraunce vnderſtode ſyr boucyquant marſhall fraunce come porte ſaynt andrewe nyne leages fro auygnon nexte day thyder came byſſhoppe cambray ſhewed hym aunſwere benedic whan marſhall vnderſtode pope benedic wolde nat obey kynge mayſters ordynaunce ſayd byſſhop ſyr ye beſt retourne fraunce ye haue ſhall execute cōmaunded kynge vncles next daye byſſhoppe departed toke way albenoys pyne marſhall ſet clerkes awarke write ſente knyghtes ſquyers men warre countrey viurays vyuieres auuergne mount pellyer cōmyſſyon ſo king alſo ſent ſeneſchall beaucayre ſhulde cloſe paſſages well ryuer rone lande entent nothynge ſhulde entre auignon wente hym ſelfe pownte ſaynt eſperyte cloſed paſſage ouer ryuer rone nothynge ſhulde entre way auygnon thus marſhall daily gathered men warre many came ſerue hym ſome obeyſaunce ſome pyll robbe theym auygnon came hym ſyr raymonde thourayne lorde de la lorde tornon lorde monclaue lorde duſes ſo yt marſhall great nombre men marſhall ſent haraulde defye pope benedic palays cardynals wolde take parte harde tydynges cardynals cytie auygnon knewe well coulde nat longe ſuſteyne warre agaynſt puyſſaunce frenche kynge determyned go ſpeake pope ſo dyd ſhewed hym howe coulde nat wolde nat ſuſteyne warre agaynſt frenche kynge ſayd muſt lyue haue marchaundyſe go well lande ryuer benedyc aunſwered folyſſhly ſayd ſyrs cytie ſtronge well prouyded wyll ſende men warre gennes place ſonne kynge aragon come ſerue whiche ſure wyll bounde therto two cauſes lygnage alſo ought obeyſant pope sir ye abaſſhed lytell cauſe go wayes kepe defende towne ſhall kepe palays aunſwere cardynals men cytie coulde nat haue benedyc euery man retourned home benedic longe tyme purueyed palays wyne corne larde oyle thinges parteynynge fortreſſe alſo perſon hygh cruell wolde nat abaſſhed lytell thynge marſhall fraunce departed fro pount ſaynt spyrite paſſed company towne orenge conſent prince orenge ſo entred countre venyce whiche lande parteygnynge churche whiche anone ouer rynne men warre paſſed ye bridge sourgnes ſo lordes ryuer marſhall taryed towne sourgnes gret nombre menne warre kepe towne paſſage alſo garyſone noues whiche partayned pope marſhall went lodged ſaynt verayne nere auignon men therabout dayly came thyder men warre ſo cytie auignon cloſed behinde lande ryuer ſo nothynge coulde entre iſſue without leaue towne noue without auygnon whiche partayned realme fraunce ſeneſchall beaucayre fyue hundred men kepte entre ſyde marſhall fraūce two thouſande men ſyde auignon ſent theym cytie without wolde obey open cytie wolde burne vynes houſes abrode countrey aboute ryuer dureuſe ſō monynge greatly abaſſhed men woman within cytie herytages laye without auignon vnto ryuer dureuſe went counſayle without knowledge pope called counſayle certayne cardynals cardynall amyence poictours newcaſtell viuyers dyuers ſuche moſte loſe ſhewed theſe cardynalles howe marſhall fraunce thretened brinne vynes howſes cauſed frenche kynge agaynſt whome coulde nat reſyſte puyſſaunce ſo nere thynges conſydred ſayde better obey frenche kynge holde paryllous opynyons benedyc coulde haue ayde comforte demaunded theſe cardynalles wolde ioyne take parte cardynals ſaid content take wayes vitayles beganne fayle theym alſo benefyces realme fraunce whiche ſayd wolde nat wyllyngly leſe entred treatie marſhall fraunce whiche toke ſuche effecte men warre entred cytie auignon apoynted beſiege palays couynaunt hurte dyſpleaſure cardynalles none men hole body towne marſhall promyſed entred auignon lodged eaſe lybertie paſſages well lande water opened entent maner bytayle myght come cytie wrote ſelfe pope benedyc beynge cloſed palays ſawe cardynals men cytie made treatie marſhall fraunce without counſayle aduyſe therwith ſore dyſpleaſed howe ſayd wolde nat ſubmytte hym ſelfe dye payne ſo kepte hym ſelfe cloſe palais ſtronge place worlde moſt eaſyeſt kepte ſo well vytayled pope ſent letter kynge aragone inſtantly ſocoure hym nede ſende men warre myght able reſyſt marſhall fraunce alſo ſente kynge worde letter coulde get hym then fro auignon wolde go kepe ſee apoſtolyke aragon parpygnon barcelone kynge aragon ſawe well pope letter made force ſayd coūſayle aboute hym weneth preeſt ſuſteyne hym argumentes ſhall enterpryſe make warre agaynſte frenche kyng ayde hym might well reputed fole syr quod counſayle ye ſay trouthe ye haue nede medle mater ſyr ye may ſure frenche kynge hath ſuche counſayle aboute hym yt wolde make warre agaynſt hym without iuſte cauſe lette clergy alone purpoſe lyue prelate muſt obey great lordes 〈◊〉 whome rente reuenues haue longe kept peace alſo ſyr • frenche kynge hath writen redy deſyringe determyne countrey newter wyll ſyr ye beſte ſo lady quene frenche kynges coſyn germayne content ſo ſo moſte parte realme clergy lykewyſe ſpecyally catelone spayne ſyr thynke beſt opynion criſten kynges nat ſame churche ſhall neuer come vnyte reaſone two pope thus kynge aragon counſayle deuyſed togyder pope benedic ſtyll palays truſtynge haue ayde kynge aragon dyſceyued marſhall fraūce cytie auygnon palays ſo kept none coulde iſſue entre lyued ſtore vytayles ſuffycient two thre yere lacked woode make fyre ſethe meate whiche made theym abaſſhed euery weke marſhall herde newes fro frenche kynge kynge fro hym kynge cōmaunded hym ſhulde nat departe then tyll atchyued enterpriſe thus pope coude nat iſſue ye palays ſuche watche layde hym concluſyon whan benedyc ſawe ſo ſtraytely kepte fyre fayled hym prouyſions dayly dyſcreaſed ſawe comforte ayde came hym fro parte laſte yelded requeſt certayne cardynalles treatie thus yt ſhulde nat departe auignon tyll made vnyon churche certayne garde ſette aboute hym cardynalles ryche men auignon bounde ſelfe kepe benedyc ſo ſtrayte ſhulde rendre accompte hym agayne outher quycke dede suche cardynals benefyces fraunce tooke great payne make treatie compoſycion ſayde one accorde wolde abyde frenche kynge thus buſyneſſe ended yt tyme euery man departed marſhall went parys anone ordeyned go realme hungery kynge hungery written frenche kynge howe lamorabaquy aſſembled great puyſſaunce men warre turkes arabyes tartaryes ſuryens dyuers ſecte fyght hym erle derby ſame ſeaſon beynge paris houſe clyſſone nere temple wyllynge go hungery whiche ſhulde leſſe coſte frenche kynge euery weke redy payed fyue hundred crownes golde erle thought hym ſelfe moche bounde frenche kynge grace whan tydynges came fro kynge hungery fraunce erle derby entended well mater thought hym ſelfe voyage ryght honourable hym paſſe tyme wherby ſhulde lightlyer forget tyme trouble ſpake ſpecyall counſayle counſayled hym go voyage ſo knewe fyrſt duke lancaſtre father pleaſure behalfe erle one knyghtes called dinorth englande knowe father pleaſure knyght came englande founde duke lancaſtre caſtell twenty myle fro london called hertforde ſhewed hym ſonnes entente whan duke vnderſtode mynde erle ſonne good wyll go hungery paſſe tyme banyſſment ryght well content ſayd knyght ſyr ye welcome wordes ſonnes lettre requyreth counſayle • ye ſhall reſt v ſeaſon meane whyle ſhall take aduyſe whyle ye may go ſe ſonnes chyldren ye muſte beare tydynges father syr quod knyght ye ſay true knyght ſyr dynorth taryed ſeaſon englande nowe frenche kinge good occaſyon write kynge almayne coūſayle caſe brought pope benedic cardynalles kynge ſent thyder noble ambaſſade patryarke iheruſalem ſyr charles hanger knightes founde kynge strawbourgh dyd meſſage wherwith kynge counſayle well content ſayd howe wolde determyne matter ſaid wolde gladly kyng englande ſhulde take ſame waye whiche feared ſhulde herde aunſwere ambaſſadours retourned fraunce ſhewed kynge doone ſene frenche kynge thentent bring purpoſe paſſe ſente agayne englande kynge rycharde meſſangers ſhewed kynge cauſe cōmynge kynge gaue good herynge mater nat prelate realme clergy hym nat ſo plyable folowe pleaſure fraunce folowe pleaſure kynge ſhewed frenche kynges meſſangers howe ſayde wolde deuoyre ſo dyd ſo meſſangers returned fraūce kynge rycharde daye weſtmynſter aſſembled prelate clergy englande whan ye kynge ſhewed wyſely dyfference churche howe frenche kynge delyberacyon aduyſe counſayle conſent vnyuerſite parys clerkes determyned newter lykewyſe ſo kynges spaygne scotlande aragone nauer howe almayne boeſme italy ſame opynyon lykewyſe kynge englande deſyred realme ſhuld folowe ſame whan prelate clergy knewe nothynge ſent herde mater great marueyle ſore abaſſhed ſome ſtode ſtyll ſpake worde ſome began murmure ſayde kynge become frenche entendeth nothynge dyſhonour diſtroy v ſhal nat wolde bringe v beleue maye ſo moche ſhall haue yuell therof let v nat folowe opynion ſythe frenche kynge taketh waye lette hym holde hym ſelfe newter let v holde ſtyll beleue lette man put fro v without greater apparaunce ſurer foundacyon ſe yet whan kyng rycharde ſawe dyfference murmurynge clergy cauſed byſſhoppe london demaunde clergy beſt aunſwered matter ſo great therin requyred great counſayle delyberacyon ſo departed euery man went lodgynge whan londoner knewe cauſe aſſemble requeſt kynge made ſore troubled agaynſt ye kyng people englande ſo fermely ſet beleuynge pope rome wolde nat leaue ſayde howe rycharde burdeaulx wolde diſtroy let alone herte ſo frenche canne nat hyde daye wyll come paye ſhall repente hym ſuche gyue hym ſuche counſayle ſo euer kynge ſayd haue people newter wolde wyſe agree therto frenche kynge nat well content ſonne kynge rycharde nat incontynent cauſed realme haue newter ſaye trouth kynge nat blame therin alſo ſuche accydentes fell ſoone whiche ſo great horryble lyke hath nat ben ſene hyſtorye vpon kynge cryſten except noble kynge peter luſygnen kyng cyper iheruſalem whome owne brother cypriens martyred ⸫ ⸫ ¶of aunſwere duke lancaſtre knyght ſent hym fro ſonne erle derby howe duke lancaſtre dyed cap cc xxxiiii whan ſir dinorth erle derby ſente englande father duke lancaſtre anſwere duke vyſyted erles landes ſene chyldren four ſonnes two doughters toke leaue retourne fraunce aunſwere howe duke wolde nat counſayle erle ſonne go hungery whan wery beynge fraūce rather go caſtell kynge ſuſter lyſte go go vyſite ſuſter quene portugale erle redde father letter two tymes ouer ſtudyed theron ſeaſon ſyr dinorth ſhewed phyſicions ſurgyons englande ſayd ſurely howe duke father hym paryllous ſyckneſſe whiche ſhuld dethe theſe wordes gretly letted erle take hym maner voyage ſo taryed ſtyll parys often tymes went ſawe frenche kyng duke orlyaunce kynges vncles alwayes made hym good chere ſo moche bounde ſayde kynge syr ye ſo moche honoure curteſy ſhewe ſo great ſygne loue knowe nat lyfe dayes howe deſerue euer come englande lady yt quene doughter power ſhall haue ſeruyce thanke coſyn quod kynge fell aboute feeſt cryſtmaſſe duke iohan lancaſtre lyued great dyſpleaſure bycauſe kynge banyſſhed ſonne realme ſo litell cauſe alſo bycauſe yuell gouernynge realme nephewe kynge rycharde ſawe well longe percepuered ſuffred contynewe realme lykely vtterly loſte theſe ymagynacyons duke fell ſycke wheron dyed whoſe dethe greatly ſorowed frendes louers kyng ſhewed toke great care dethe ſone forgotten certayne noble men englande ſawe well howe realme feblyſſhed ſythe duke lancaſtre deed duke glouceſtre brother ſlayne erle arundell erle derby banyſſhed ought duke lancaſtre ryght ſucceſſion ſome ſayde nowe ſhall ſe kynge wyll tyme nowe yt repeale home agayne coſyn derby pardone hym yuell wyll though haue cauſe dyſpleaſed hym tyme came entred landes duke lancaſtre suche wordes ranne brode realme dyuers place ſpecyally cytie london erle derby hundred tymes better beloued thanne kynge howe wordes murmuryng kyng counſayle knewe yet dyd nothynge therafter clene contrary yuell counſayled incontynent dethe duke lancaſtre ſente erle derby cōmynge haue frendely welcomed hym home haue called hym duke lancaſtre haue taken hym greateſt perſonage englande nexte hym ſelfe haue ſayde howe wolde gouerned poyntes aduyſe counſayle nothynge without aduyſe kynge done well lykely haue contynued eſtate kynge englande nat receyued yuell fortune fell hym ſhortly ye ſhall ¶howe dethe duke lā caſtre knowen fraunce kyng englande wrote maner ioye frenche kynge therof wrote nothyng therof therle derby duke ſon̄e cap cc xxxv tidynges duke lancaſters dethe came fraunce kyng rycharde englāde maner ioye wrote therof frenche kyng nat coſyn therle derby howe erle knewe ſoone frenche kynge ſoner ſuche men englande erle apparelled hym men blacke cauſed obſequy done right honorably whiche frenche kyng brother duke orlyaunce ye kynges vncles great nombre prelate great lordes fraunce erle derby welbeloued euery mā many right ſorie trouble pleaſaunt knight honeſt ꝑſon curteſſe ſwete meke euery man euery man ſawe hym ſaid howe ye kyng englande nat well counſayled repealed hym nat home agayne truely ſaye trouthe kynge englande wyſely regarded mater ben well counſayled mater nat tourned agaynſt hym dyde erle derby dethe father right enherytoure duke lancaſtre haue ſeconde perſone realme buſyneſſe realme ſhulde chiefely haue paſſed alſo kynge counſayle ought haue conſydred howe often tymes people englande hadde ſtyrred murmured agaynſt hym ſhulde haue knowen howe nat welbeloued people ſome knightes ye duke glouceſters dayes often tymes daunger perſone whan londoner counſaylles dyuers good townes englande cāe hym eltham made requeſtes ſubſidies ayes gyuen graunted within twentie yere ſhulde haue ben fruſtrate fordone el determyned conſent duke glouceſtre noble men realme haue taken kynge haue ſette another haue reygned place haue putte ye kyng quene place ſo haue hadde meate drinke long lyued ſomoche duke glouceſter hadde deſyred nephewe ſonne doughter duke clarence called iohan erle marche wolde haue taken hym charge gouernyng realme wolde haue made hym kyng ſame erle excuſed hym ſelfe honeſtly therfro theſe thynges apeaſed layde downe wyſe ſadde meanes prudence ſayde duke lancaſtre father ſayd erle derby kyng richarde wyſely conſydred theſe mat reigned gretter ꝓſperite euer kyng richarde knewe well ynough ſo yuell counſayle kynge cauſed colour loue duke glouceſtre taken ledde calays ſtrangled murdered wherof great brute throughe realme great grudge murmuracyons ſo poynt haue depoſed ſayde kyng richarde howe duke lancaſtre lyke ſage prudent price duke glouceſtre brother murderyng hym touched hym nere herte thynges conſyred coude nat recouer agayne brother wiſely amiably apeaſed theſe mater kynge nephue feared englāde kynge ought haue conſydred ſpecially howe therle derby better beloued people man within realme theſe thyngꝭ wyſely cōſidred dethe duke rf lā caſtre kyng ſhulde haue repealed therle derby agayne realme kyng mynde ſo dyd clene contrary incontynent ſente offycers duke lācaſters landes toke profites therof hym ſelfe ſayd longe therle derby ſtode banyſſhed man none ſhulde receyue reuenues landes within realme englande moreouer wherof kyng greatly blamed ſuche loued erle chyldren kyng gaue awaye landes parteynynge herytage duchy lancaſtre ſome ſeruauntes ſuche aſked whiche cauſe many knyghtes englande ſpake ſaid kyng ſheweth well oweth good wyll coſyn erle derby ſythe wyll nat repeale hym home agayne ſuffre landes gyuen awaye therle chyldren ſhulde great membres englande good ſtaffe kyng leane dothe contrary driueth hym awaye ſo wyll kepe hym daū ger worſe coude hath taken hym ſelfe heritage cauſeth offycers medell duke landes thoughe owne yt poore tenauntes complayne iniuryes done lordes abſence nat harde none yt wyll right alſo ſmall token loue kyng beareth erle derby chyldren herytage lācaſtre whiche ſhulde come thē right enherytaūce diſcended fro grandame lady blanche doughter duke henry lancaſtre kyng gyueth parte therof away pleaſeth hym ſuche landes ſhulde fall right lady mother doughter erle herforde northampton cōſtable englande kynge gyueth parte therof pleaſure moche done agaīſt ryght reaſon diſpleaſure noble men englande nat longe endure vnamended thus prelate noble men common englāde cōmuned murmured lykewiſe ye realme frā ce ſuche men honour herde ſpekynge mater hadde ſene erle derby parys hadde great marueyle therof ſayd one another thynke kynge englande hath takenne great diſpleaſure coſyn erle derby greatteſt man englad next hym ſelfe gracious knyght curteſſe meke tretable man good ſpoken vnto kyng englande knoweth ſome thynge hym elles kynge yuell counſayled marueyle frenche kynge brother duke orlyaunce kynges vncles nat attemper mater erle daylye amonge theym ſhulde fynde beſt prouiſyon caſe kynge englande wyll thē men bicauſe hath maried frenche kynges doughter ſythe nothynge therin beſt holde oure peace lette paſſe frenche kynge brother vncles thought nothyng good honoured loued greatly erle derby deſyred moche company ſawe well wydower marry duke berry hadde doughter wydowe two huſbandes ſhe yonge xxiii yere age named mary fyrſt huſbāde loys bloys died yonge ſecōde huſbande ye lorde philyppe arthoys erle ewe died retourne hungry ye haue herde maryage apoynt haue concluded fraūce knewe well duke lancaſtre great enherytoure englande frenche kynge well pleaſed therwith bycauſe doughter quene englande thought company thoſe two ladyes togyder ſhulde great pleaſure thē bothe ſythe ſo nere blode therby two realmes fraunce englande ſhulde ſurer conioyned toguyder loue peace whiche trewe might haue accomplyſſhed kyng richarde englande coūſayle brake mater fortune world whiche marueylous thynge ſhall canne nat eſchewed whiche fortune kynge richarde ſo marueylous harde thynke theron kynge myght well haue remedyed mater wolde ſhall ſhalbe ſhall ſhewe iohan froiſſarte auctour hyſtorie herde whan̄e yonge englande place called bertamſtede whiche tyme parteyned price wale father ſayde kynge rycharde yere grace thouſande thre hundred thre ſcore two bycauſe ye ſame tyme prince prince ſhulde departe englande go acq̄tayne kepe eſtate kyng edwarde father quene phillyppe maiſtres lyon duke clarence iohan duke lancaſtre lorde edmonde erle cambridge duke yorke chyldren come ſaid maner place ſe prince prince departed age xxiiii yere one ſaid lady quenes clerkes chambre ſatte benche herde knyght talkyng deuyſinge among dyuers ladyes damoſelles quenes ſayde booke countrey called bruſt many men ſaye marueylous prophycies accordynge booke realme crowne englande ſhulde nat retourne price wale yet duke clarence ſhulde kynges england though ſonnes kyng edwarde knyght ſayd accordyng boke crowne englande ſhulde come houſe lancaſtre ſame ſeaſon whan knyght ſpake theſe wordes ſayd hēry erle derby nat borne yet ſeuyn yere yet dayes ſame wordes tooke effecte ſawe ſame henry erle derby kynge englande ⸫ ⸫ ¶of treatie maryage bytwene erle derby duke berry doughter howe kyng rycharde englande dyde lette erle saliſbury capi cc xxxvi ſoone kyng rycharde kyng englande herde treatie maryage bytwene erle derby duke berryes doughter party nerehāde accorded toke thoſe newes great dyſpleaſure ſayd erle saliſbury great affyaunce ye muſt dayne go fraunce letter credence father lawe frenche kynge frendes brother vncles ſhewe fro v wyſe conclude treatie alyaunce maryage ſuche traytour erle derby wolde betray naturall ſouerayne lorde remynaunt mater ye wyſe ynough ſo therin maye thanke maryage maye broken erle saliſbury ſayde sir ſhall ryght well cōmaundement ſir myght broken ſome meanes ſome perſone requyre youre grace maye ſo sir quod kynge excuſe natte wyll alſo praye meſſage whatſoeuer ſhall fall therof ſhall ſuſtayne well ſir quod erle ſithe ye cōmaunde ſo ſpecially ſe mater toucheth nere ſhall thoughe lothe therto ye ſhall go quod kynge make haſte alyaunce concluded erle prepared departure letter credence written ſealed departed fro kynge tyme leades quene alſo erle made haſte came douer ſo toke see arryued calays founde erle huntyngton capitayne calais brother kynge erle ſhewed vnto hym buſyneſſe ſo taryed nat longe calays roode amyence ſo parys waye rode hadde good chere lodged whyte horſe whan chaūged wente kynge quene yt lordes delyuered letter credence whan kyng reed letter toke erle aparte demaunded credence erle length ſhewed charge named erle derby traytour agaynſt naturall lorde whan frenche kyng herde thoſe wordes great diſpleaſure loued ſo erle derby wolde none yuell ſpoken toke letter credence agayne erle saliſbury ſayd erle beleue well ynoughe ſonne englande ſore moued agaynſt oure coſyn derby marueyle greatly yuell wyll contyneweth ſo longe thynke ſhulde better furnyſſhed hym nexte counſayle sir quod erle saliſbury cōmaunded trewe quod kyng nat diſpleaſed paraduenture ſonne englande knoweth meſſage ye charged ſo dyde duke berrey alſo duke gaue none aunſwere therto wente kyng demaunded hym newes hadde englande kynge ſhewed hym erle saliſburye ſayde vpon thoſe newes kyng vncles aſſembled togyder ſecretely frenche kynge ſayd kynge englande lykelyhode douteth greatly therle derby elles paraduēture knoweth ſuche thynges knowe nat nat come oure knowledge ought rather owe fauoure kynge englande than̄e erle derby ſythe kynge ioyned v maryage wyll take great diſdayne ſythe enfourmed pleaſure ſhulde contrary marry erle derby counteſſe ewe behoueth v rather diſſymule kepe theſe newes ſecrete tyll erle saliſbury retourned vpon peynt kyng vncles reſted whan erle saliſbury done meſſage tooke leaue departed frenche kynge diſpleaſed cōmyng ioyfull delyuered agayne erle salyſbury letter credence wolde nat kepe loued ſo well erle derby knewe erle salyſburies beynge parys ſawe hym nat departed without ſpekyng retourned calays englande ſhewed kynge englande howe hadde ſpedde whan erle derby knewe erle saliſbury departed fro parys without ſpekynge hym mynde ſoore diſpleaſed thought matter went nat well counſayle ſayde hym sir ſhortely ye ſhall parceyue ſome mater ye haue nat herde yet thoughe kepte priuye fro theſe frenchman wyſe cloſe maye ſo kyng englande ſuche ſecte diſpleaſed frenche kyng maketh ſo good chere dothe paraduē ture ſpoken englande howe ye ſhulde mary duke berryes doughter whiche pleaſeth nat kynge englande therfore wyll breke maryage ſo ye ſhall ſhortly therof looke ymagined ſo within moneth erle saliſbury departed fro parys ſuche therle derby parte treatie ſayde maryage hande ſpake agayne mater duke berryes counſayle charge ſhulde anſwere ſayd ſirs whan lorde erle derby kynges preſence duke orlyaunce vncles preſente lette lorde erle derby ſpeke hym ſelfe ſaye mater therle derby thought none yuell thought thoſe wordes hadde ben ſpoken entent haue proched nerer poynt kynge counſayle made hym good chere thanne euer dyde erle thought ſpeke mater whan ſawe conuenyent tyme daye whan̄e ſawe kyng lordes togyder began ſpeke maryage duof burgoyne hadde charge aunſwere hym ſayde coſyn derby haue nothynge gyue maryage ouer coſyn traytour woorde erle derby greatly abaſſhed chaūged colour ſayd sir kynges preſence wyll anſwere neuer traytour neuer thought trayſon perſone yt wyll charge trayſon redy anſwere nowe whā ſhall pleaſe kynge beyng preſent nay coſyn quod kyng beleue ye ſhall fynde man fraunce wyll chalenge honoure wordes myne vncle hath ſpoken came englande erle kneled downe ſayd sir beleue well god defende frendes confounde myne ennemyes frenche kynge toke vp erle ſayd coſyn apeace ſelfe euery thynge ſhall tourne beſt whan̄e euery thynge agreed peace than̄e maye well ſpeke treate maryage fyrſt ye muſt take poſſeſſion duchy lancaſtre vſage fraunce dyuers countreis ſyde see lorde ſhall marry conſent ſoueraygne lorde muſt endowe wyfe therwith ſpyces wyne ceſſed cōmunycacion euery man departed owne lodgynges whan erle derby cōe lodgyng ſore diſpleaſed nat without cauſe whan reputed one treweſt knyghtes worlde preſēce frenche kyng loued hym well ſhewed many curteſies ſhuld reputed traytour thoſe wordes ſhulde cōe englande brought erle saliſburye therwith great malencoly counſayle apeaſed hym well coude ſayd sir wyll lyue worlde muſt endure ſomtyme trouble confort tyme pacient parauenture herafter ye ſhall haue great ioye glorie ſir al ye lordꝭ ſyde ſee frenche kyng loueth beſt ſe well wolde enploye payne brī ge ioye ſir ye ought gyue vncles great thāke kept mater ſecrete tyll erle saliſbury deꝑted yea ſirs quod erle thynke ben better ben ſhewed preſence myght haue made ſufficiēt excuſe yt kyng lordes thus ſhall abyde ſtyll blame tyll mater otherwyſe declared sir quod treſpaſſes nat amended fyrſt daye sir ſuffre let tyme ryn beleue buſyneſſe englande dothe better ye ware loue hertes people englande towardes good prayer ye grace god ſhall ſhortely delyuer daungers ſayd recōfort lorde ſore diſconforted ſayeng ſoner trewe ware anone knowen englande howe therle saliſbury ben fraūce frenche kynge vncles borne letter thyder conteynyng howe erle derby falſely ꝑiured traytour whiche dyuers noble men prelate ſore troubled nothynge contente erle saliſbury ſaid generally ſoore blame take hym charge beare fraunce ſuche wordes vpon trewe man lyued daye wyll come ſhall repent tyme yt euer ſpake worde ye maye well knowe londoner greatly diſpleaſed murmured agaynſt kyng counſayle ſayd gētyll knight erle derby great enuy agaynſt nat ſuffycient kynge counſayle driue realme alſo accuſe trayſon putte ſhame rebuke well euery thynge muſte haue tourne ala quod people faulte treſpaſſe hath child done kynge taketh thus awaye fro thē herytage whiche ought ryght ſucceſſyon thynge nat longe abyde caſe without chaunge nat ſuffre thus anone retourne erle saliſbury fraunce kyng richarde cauſed iuſtes cryed publyſſhed throughe realme scotlande wynſore xl knyghtes xl ſquyers agaynſt cōmers aparelled grene whyte faucon quene well acōpanied 〈◊〉 dye damoſels feeſt thus holden ye quene beyng ī gret neblenes fewe lordes noble men mo thā ii ꝑtes ye lordes knightes realme englande yt kyng ſuche hatered banyſſhyng erle derby iniuryes done chyldren dethe duke glouceſtre ſlayne caſtell calais dethe erle arū dell beheeded lōdon kynred theſe lordes came nat feeſt fewe ſame feeſt kynge ordayned go irelande enploy men voyage ſo departed lefte quene trayne ſtyll wyndſore kynge rode briſtowe made prouyſion ten thouſande knightes ſquiers ten thouſande archer whan̄e londoner knewe kyng goyng voyage began murmure ſaid amonge themſelfe nowe gothe richarde burdeaux waye briſtowe ſo yrelande whiche wyll diſtruction ſhall neuer retourne agayne ioye dyde kynge edwarde ſeconde great grauntfather folyſſhely gouerned moche beleuyng spē ſers lykewiſe rycharde burdeaulx hath belued ſo moche yuell counſayle nat hydden ſuffred lengar ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe kynge richarde ordayned go marcheſſe irelande cap ccxxxvii many knightes ſquyers kynges company ſhulde go hym irelāde nat cōtent hym wente maner yuell wyll ſayd oftentymes one another kynge gouerneth hym ſelfe foliſſhely beleueth yuell counſayle suche wordes ſo multiplyed lorde henry percy ſir henry ſon̄e ſpake certayne wordes whiche came kynges knowlege counſayle ſayd kyng sir wordes ought nat ſuffred erle northumberlande ſon̄e hath ſpoken ſette ſubiettes agaīſt muſt behoue correcte theſe rebelles one another wherby greatteſt ſhall doute take enſample trewe quod kyng beſte sir quod nat ought come whan become call erle saliſbury ſome ſhall pleaſe lette reherſed yuell wordes haue ſpoken againſt coūſayle thā ſhall anſwere wyll make thervpon ye maye taken aduyſe wheder ye wyll correcte priſon wyſe well ſirs quod kynge ye ſay well ſhalbe done erle northumberlande ſon̄e good frendes armye ſo ſome knewe kynges entent ſent ſuche worde erle ſonne ſhulde natte come kynges preſēce go iourney hadde worde dyde ſhulde nat welthe great dōmage kynge ſore enformed againſt whan warnynge ſtopped cōmyng kyng nat without good cauſe ſhewed came ſhulde ieopardye lyues whan ye kynges counſayle ſawe therle ſon̄e came nat ſayd kyng sir nowe ye maye ſe whyder dyde enforme trouthe nat ye maye ſe therle ſonne diſdayneth ſerue wyll nat come youre cōmaundement ſhall ye ſe ye ſende ſhall ſende quod kyng letter written ſente notable meſſangers therle lorde henry percy ſon content letter incontynent without delaye vpon ſight thoſe letter ſhulde come ye kyng duetie bounde theſe meſſangers iourneyed ſo longe came fayre caſtell erles ſtandyng fronter scotlande meſſanger acquyted hym well doynge meſſage cōmaūded therle reed letter length ſhewed ſonne toke aduiſe make meſſanger good chere write agayn kynge excuſynge ſelfes howe coulde nat come countrey tyme howe kyng men ynowe acōplyſſhe iourney beſyde meſſangers retourned kynge delyuered erles lettre kynge redde whiche anſwere nothynge pleaſaunt kynge counſayle thanne cauſe thynges layde erles charge ſonnes openly banyſſhed realme englande tyll ye kyng dyd repeale agayne publyſſhed cyties good townes englande ſpecyally london wherof londoner great marueyle coulde nat knowe iuſtly cauſe erle ſonne reputed noble valyaunt men within realme ſayd cōmeth ſome kynges counſayle hateth whiche counſayle wyll diſtroy kyng laſt peraduenture erle ſonne haue ſpoken ſome wordes vpon kynge counſayle yuell gouernynge realme coulde nat herde though ſaid trouth true ſayeng nowe puniſſhed thinke herafter wyll punyſſhed yt nowe iudge thus londoner ſpake mater erle brother valiaunt knight ſir thomas percy longe tyme done many noble ſeruyces kynge englande whan erle knewe ſonne banyſſhed realme toke vnreaſonable punyſſhment without cauſe ſente frendes countrey ſuche coulde get togyther many lygnage kynge go irelande erle toke counſayle beſt ſythe kynge banyſſhed hym without cauſe counſayled ſende realme scotlande deſyre king ſonne might abyde peaſably scotlande tyll kynge englande apeaſed dyſpleaſure thus therle ſent kynge robert scotlande kyng erle archambalt duglas lordes scotlande condiſcendyd lyghtly erles deſyre ſent erle worde howe ſhulde gladly receyued alſo neded fyue ſyre hundred ſpeares ſignyfied tyme ſhulde redy ſerue meſſage pleaſed greatly erle lygnage ſo erle taryed ſtyll countrey amonge frendes kynge rycharde counſayle ſo moche ſorte ſeaſon layſer dyſpleaſure erle ſonne ye ſhall hyſtory kinge rycharde thus beynge aboute briſtowe ſtate generally men englande began murmure ryſe one agaynſt another mynyſtrynge iuſtyce clene ſtopped vp courtes englande wherof valyaunt men prelate loued reſte peace glad paye duetyes greatly abaſſhed roſe realme companyes dyuers rowtes kepynge feldes hygh wayes ſo marchauntes durſte nat ryde abrode excercyſe marchaundyſe doute robbynge man knewe whome cōplayne ryght reaſone iuſtyce whiche thynges ryght preiudyciall dyſpleaſaunt good people englande contrary accuſtomable vſage people laborer marchauntes englande wonte lyue reſt peace occupy marchaundyſe peaſably laborer labour landes quyetly contrary whan marchauntes rode fro towne towne marchaundyſe outher golde ſyluer purces taken fro fro men labourer houſes theſe companyons wolde take whete ootes bufes mutton porkes pore men durſte ſpeke worde theſe yuell dedes dayly multyplyed ſo great complayntes lamentacyons made therof realme good people ſayde tyme chaunged vpon v fro good yuell euer ſythe dethe good kynge edwarde thyrde whoſe dayes iuſtyce well kepte mynyſtred dayes man ſo hardy englande take hen chekyn ſhepe without payed trewly • dayes haue taken fro v yet dare nat ſpeke theſe thinges canne nat longe endure englande lykely loſte without recouery haue kynge nowe wyll nothyng entendeth ydelneſſe acomplyſſhe pleaſure ſheweth careth nat howe euery thynge gothe ſo maye haue wyll tyme prouyde remedy el enemyes wyll reioyſe mocke v kynge hath ſette brother erle huntyngdon calais therby peraduenture may made ſome yuell treatie bargayne towne calays frenche men rendre handes thynge moſt neceſſary realme englande calays rendred frenche men englande neuer ſo abaſſhed ſhulde good cauſe ſhulde loſt chiefe key englande thus multyplyed lamentacyons murmurynge englande prelate ryche men realme came london dwell better ſuretie lygnages ſuche lordes kynge put dethe baniſſhed realme gladde wolde trouble ben realme cytezins lōdon ryche lyued marchaundyſe well coraunt ſee lande kepte therby great eſtate enſample remnaūt realme lyghtly folowed ſawe well great myſchiefe lykely folowe realme ſometyme kynge edwarde ſecondes dayes whan lorde spencer cauſed kynge put realme quene iſabell edward ſonne wolde haue diſtroyed wyſte nat ſo realme thre yere fynally whan men englande ſpecyally londoner ſawe howe kynge ſo aſotted ſyr hugh ſpenſer prouyded remedy ſente ſecretly quene iſabell ſhe coulde get thre hundred men warre come englande ſhe ſhulde fynde ye greateſt parte realme londoner redy receyue put poſſeſſyon realme whervpon quene founde lorde iohan haynalt lorde beaumont chynay brother erle guillyam haynalte loue pytie toke vyage brynge quene ſonne englande four hundred men warre ſo aryued englande ayde londoner quene atchyued enterpriſe without ayde wolde haue ben hard haue come paſſe ſo kynge edwarde taken caſtell briſtowe ſet priſone caſtell berkley ſuche fauoured ſlayne put execuſion edwarde ſonne crowned kynge weſtmynſter ye londoner ryght well remembred yonge herde reported elder ſome founde writynge ſayd ſecretly one nother father anteceſſours olde tyme prouyded theſe greate miſchiefes thinke neuer greater cauſe nowe preſent tyme ſuffer kyng rycharde haue wyll wyll waſte dyſtroy ſythe kynge hath nat englande ſuche proſperyte ſheweth nat prince wale ſhulde father wolde haue folowed condicions haue taken great pleaſure prowes nat lyue reſte eaſe dothe loueth nothynge ſporte ydelneſſe ladyes alwayes company beleue men ſmall reputacyon gather great rycheſſe diſtroy realme whiche thynges ought nat ſuffred bycauſe valyaunt man duke glouceſtre ſawe clerely yt mater englande went nat ſhulde right ſawe howe dayly worſe worſe bycauſe ſpake playnely therof traytours kinge cauſed hym murthered lykewyſe good erle arundell haue driuen realme valyaunt yonge knight henry lancaſtre erle derby whome realme myght ought counſayled ſuſteyned four ſonnes hath yet crueltie beſyde dōmage cauſe father ſuffre realme dyſenheryte chyldren herytage auntes lady dame blanche lancaſtre dayly gyuen awaye nat worthy haue theym alſo bycauſe erle northumberlande ſonne lorde henry percy haue ſomwhat ſpoken acordynge reaſone kynge rycharde hath banyſſhed well apparaūt ſhorte tyme ſhall neuer valyaunt man lefte realme wherfore wyll rynne nought without remedy founde ſhortely thynke beſt remedy ſende erle derby leſeth ſeaſon fraunce whan come lette hym haue gouernaunce realme may refourme yuell bringe good ſtate lette punyſſhed haue deſerued let richarde burdeaux taken ſette towre london fautes put writynge artycles whiche wyll founde great nombre tyme examined ſhall ſene clerely nat worthy beare crowne kepe realme owne de de ſhall confounde hym ¶howe archebyſſhop caunterbury ſente fraunce erle derby fro londoner counſayls englande haue returne englande cap ccxxxviii thus londoner cō munded togyder nat al onely alſo dyuers place realme chyefe murmuracyon people firſt ſet rynge london cōmons london chefe lyghtly cōmons wold ruled vpon myſchiefe ſawe apparaunt englande dyuers ſecrete counſayles gyther certayne prelate knyghtes realme concluded ſende fraunce erle derby determyned whan come ſhewe hym yuell gouernynge kynge rycharde put hym crowne gouernynge realme englande ſo make hym kynge heyres euer ſo wyll kepe realme good vſages thought ſhulde go meſſage muſt wyſe man good credence thought ſhulde great mater gette erle derby fraūce ſaid ſymple wordes meane meſſanger letter wolde gyue faythe rather thynke ſhulde betraye hym archebyſſhoppe caunterbury man honoure prudence deſyred meſſage cōmon profyte realme acorded go deſyres ordeyned departure ſo wyſely yt none knewe therof ſuche ought knowe ſo toke ſhyppe london ſeuen onely hym ſo paſt without parell came sluſe flaunders fro then ardenbourge ſo gaunte warpe athe brabant conde ſo valencennes toke lodgynge ſigne swanne market place taryed thre dayes refreſſed himſelfe rode nat lyke byſſhop lyke monke pylgryme dyſcouered man entended fourth day departed toke man guyde parys ſayenge howe wolde go pylgrymage ſaint dyd ſo moch came thyder erle derby place called vyncetour beſyde parys whan erle derby ſawe byſſhop caunterbury cōmynge herte ſpyrites reioyſed ſo dyd ſuche aboute thought well ſome newes oute englande byſſhoppe ſhewed nat cauſe cōmynge diſſymuled bycauſe euery man ſhuld nat knowe entent therfore couer buſyneſſe ſayd openly come pylgrymage ſaynt mors ſuche aboute erle thought ben ſo whan byſſhop ſawe tyme toke parte erle derby alone chambre cloſed dore byſſhop ſhewed erle debylyte realme englande deſolacyon therof howe iuſtyce place reygne faute good kinge howe certayne valyaunt men prelate londoner ingenerall deuiſed remedy cauſe ſente thyder hym deſyre retourne englande wolde make hym kynge bycauſe yt rycharde burdeaulx doone conſented done ſo many yuell dedes people ſorowed redy ryſe agaynſt hym therfore ſyr nowe tyme neuer ſeke delyueraūce profyte welth chyldren ye entende nat helpe ſelfe theym alſo none wyll rycharde burdeaux gyueth chambre dayly parte enherytaūce chyldrens whiche many valyaunt men londoner ſore dyſpleaſed therwith coude amended durſt neuer ſpeke tyll nowe bycauſe kynge hath yuell vſed hym ſelfe agaynſt agaynſt vncle duke glouceſtre taken nyght conueyed calays murdered erle arundell beheeded without tytell good reaſon erle warwyke exyled banyſſhed thus realme englande nere dyſheryted noble men whome realme ſhulde ſuſteyned alſo kynge hath banyſſhed erle northumberlande lorde percy ſonne bycauſe ſpake ſomewhat agaynſt kynges gouernaunce counſayle thus dayly encreaſe doynge yuell none dare ſpeke agaynſt great parte realme haue pytie therof therfore deſyre ſlepe lenger take leaue yt frenche kynge retourne englande ſhall receyued ioy haue ſayd wyll fyrmely vpholde deſyre haue none kynge ye ſo well beloued realme whan erle herde byſſhops wordes length nat haſty gyuenge aunſwere leaned wyndowe lokynge downe gardeyne ſtudyed certayne ſpace many imagynacions laſt tourned hym archebyſſhop ſayd syr wordes cauſeth ſtudy lothe wolde take enterpriſe lothe wolde leaue knowe well wyll longe canne retourne englande without ſame meanes ye haue declared lothe wolde enclyne wordes frenche kynge frenchman haue done wyll lyſt tary honour curteſye canne deſyre ſo reaſone wordes promeſſe londoner good frendes ſhulde apply agree wylles deſyre therby kynge rycharde ſhulde taken dyſtroyed ſhulde caſe beare great blame wherof wolde tyght lothe meanes might founde sir quod byſſhoppe ſent hyther hope goodneſſe call counſayle ſhewe haue ſayd ſhall alſo ſhewe cauſe cōmynge thynke wyll nat counſayle contrary ſhall quod erle ſuche weyghty mater requyreth counſayle erle called hym counſayle ſuche truſted beſt whan hym erle cauſed byſſhop ſhewe mater cauſe commynge thyder erle demaūded counſayle beſte hym aunſwered one voyce ſyr god hathe taken pytie howe ſo euer ye refuſe nat bargayne ye ſhal neuer haue better ſurely ſo euer wyll enquyre lygnage fro whence ye dyſcended ye ryght ſtocke generacyon ſaynt edwarde ſomtyme kynge englande ſyr thanke londoner good frendes wyll helpe delyuer daunger haue pytie chyldren deſolacyon realme englande ſyr remembre well wrōges iniuryes rycharde burdeaux hath done dothe dayly whan maryage bytwene counteſſe ewe nere poynte dyd nat erle salyſbury breke called traytoure preſence frenche kynge lordes whiche wordes nat pardoned ye ought deſyre howe reuenged sir ye wyll nat helpe yourſelfe ſhulde helpe ſyr take good aduyſe herin ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe erle derby toke leaue frenche kyng went coſyn duke bretaygne cap ccxxxix whanne erle herde coūſaylours ſo erneſtly counſayle ſpyrites opened ſayd syrs wyll ye wyll haue haue counſayle entente ſent syr quod ye ſaye well ſyr counſayle trewly power matter requyreth ſecretly coude ordeyned departure deuyſed howe might paſſe ſee knowledge therof ſhulde come englande deuyſed two wayes muſte take one outher go haynalte holande take ſee dordright el go bretaygne duke take ſee ſo lande plummouth god wolde englande thynges conſydred ſayd beſt way ſhulde bretaygne ſayd erle ſyr go take leaue frenche kynge thanke hym curteſy hath ſhewed vnto take leaue duke orlyance kynges vncles thanke theym good chere haue made deſyre kinge haue conducte go bretaygne ſayenge ye wyll go ſe duke coſyn tary ſeaſon hym erle acorded counſayle whan redy wente parys kynge acuſtomed euer whan came dore cloſed agaynſt laſt tyme ſpake wyſely kynge ſhewed hym howe wolde go ſporte hym ſeaſon bretayne ſe duke whome called vncle wyfe father ſuſter doughter kynge edwarde frenche kynge thought nothyng well ſo gaue hym lyghtly leaue erle deſyred haue conducte bringe hym thyder graunted deſyre make ſhorte erle ordeyned buſyneſſe great wyſdome toke leaue lordes fraunce ſuche gaue great gyftes kynges offycers offycers armes mynſtrelles howſe clyſſon made ſupper ſuche wolde come hym nexte daye toke horſe departed fro parys iſſued gate ſaynt iaques toke ye way eſtampes knight beawſey dyd guyde hym called ſyr guy baygneux longe rode came blois taryed viii dayes erle ſente knyght haraulde bretayne ſygnyfie duke cōmynge reaſon whan duke iohan bretaygne knewe nephewe erle derby cōmynge thyder therof ryght ioyfull loued alwayes duke lancaſtre bretherne ſayde knight brought worde called gillyam de la pierre sir dothe nephewe tary way cometh nat hyther ſtreyght knyght excuſed erle well myght well quod duke ſawe man ſeuen yere wolde gladder ſe nephewe erle derby retourne hym cauſe hym come ſhall fynde countrey redy open receyue hym aunſwere knyght gladde retourned ſhortely coulde came bloys ſhewed erle counſayle duke aunſwere next day rode forthe payed euery thynge erle derbyes company ſyr peter craon banyſſhed realme fraunce caſtelles rente reuenues ſeaſed ſōme hundred thouſande frankes iudged ducheſſe aniou quene napoles proces lawe thus erle derby came nauntes founde duke receyued nobly company ſyr guy le bayneux retourned fraunce erle taryed duke bretaygne made hym good chere coulde deuyſed ſeaſone byſſhoppe caunterbury ſtyll erle coūſayle duke ſpared nothynge vpon erle vpon men ſhewed loue worlde yet duke knewe well dyſpleaſure kynge rycharde agaynſte erle wherof pytie whan erle conſydred duke good wyll fauoure dyſcouered hym parte buſyneſſe touchynge duchy lancaſtre ſuche herytages duke father poſſeſſyon whan dyed deſyringe therin haue duke counſayle ſayenge nat repealed agayne kynge gyueth dayly away parte enherytaunces wherby ſhewed duke many noble men prelate englande nat well contente kynge realme therby great dyfference ſo moche dyuers noble men londoner ſent hym haue hym come englande promyſynge wolde make peace kynge ſet hym herytage whan duke herde ſayd fayre nephue many wayes beſt ought choſen kynge ye harde caſe ye demaunde counſayle wyll counſayle gyue credence frendes englande londoner myghty puyſſaunt ayde prelate lordes knyghtes realme ſhall bringe kynge agre deſyres nephewe ſhall ayde ſpyppes men warre reſyſte daungers vpon ſee offre erle thanked duke bretayne ⸪ ⸪ ¶howe erle derby aryued englande howe receyued londoner cap ccxl thus duke bretaygne erle derby louyngely concluded togyder erle taryed certayne ſpace made though wold haue taryed ſtyll meane ſeaſone erle made prouyſyon wannes whan thynge redy duke erle came thyder whan wynd ſerued erle derby company tooke ſee hym thre ſhyppes warre conducte hym englande ſayled better wynde ſo within two dayes two nyghtes aryed plūmouth englande iſſued ſhyppes entred towne lytell lytell bayly plūmouthe charge towne vnder kynge great marueyle whanne ſawe ſo moche people men warre entre towne byſſhop caunterbury apeaſed ſayd howe menne warre wolde harme realme englande ſent thyder duke bretaygne ſerue kynge realme therwith bayly contente erle derby kept hym ſelfe ſo priuy chaumbre none towne knewe hym byſſhoppe caunterbury wrote letter ſygned hande london ſygnyfienge cōmynge erle derby ſente ſuffycyent man poſt tooke freſſhe horſes waye came london ſame daye night paſſed ouer bridge ſo came mayres lodgynge bedde ſone mayre knewe meſſāger come fro byſſhop caunterbury roſe bedde made meſſanger entre chambre delyuered hym lettre fro byſſhoppe caunterbury mayre redde reioyſed greatly thoſe newes incontynent ſente ſeruauntes fro houſe howſe princypally ſuche counſayle ſendynge erle derby gladde tydynges contynent aſſembled togyther moſte notableſt men cytie nombre two hundred ſpake togyder helde longe counſayle caſe required nat ſayd lette v apparell ſelfe go receyue duke lancaſtre ſaythe agreed ſende hym archebyſſhoppe caunterbury hathe well doone deuoyre ſeynge hath brought hym englande dyd choſe certayne men go abrode publyſſhe erles cōmynge lordes knyghtes ſquyers ſuche party mo fyue hundred londoner tooke horſes ſo great deſyre go forthe lothe tarye one nother erle derby taryed nat longe plummouth nexte daye ſoone horſes vnſhypped rode towardes london ſeaſon ſir peter craon ye breton ſtyll erle mayre london hadde gouernyng cytie fyrſt mette erle feldes humbly receyued euer rode forwarde mette people fyrſt daye cāe laye guyldforde fyue twentie myle fro lōdon next day great nombre men woman chyldren london clergy came mete erle ſuche deſyre ſe hym whan cāe ſight cried welcome noble erle derby duke lancaſtre god ſende ioye welthe proſperyte sithe ye wente englande realme hath ben proſperyte nowe truſte ye ſhall bringe v reaſonable eſtate haue lyued great diſpleaſaunce deſolacyon meanes richarde burdeaux counſayle ſpecially ought mooſt chefe blamed kyng ſhulde gouerne realme people ought haue ſuche diſcrecyon knowe gode yuell aſondre otherwiſe nat worthy gouerne realme rycharde burdeaux hath done contrary whiche ſhalbe well knowen proued vpon ſuche wordes people brought erle london mayre rode cheke cheke hym whiche great pleaſure people ſe mayre ſometyme ſayde erle sir beholde howe people reioyſe cō myng trewe quod erle alwayes rode enclyned heed people euery ſyde thus erle brought lodgynge euery man departed tyll dyner mayre notable men cite dyuers lordes knyghtes prelate byſſhoppes abbottes ſuche london cam ſe erle alſo ducheſſe glouceſtre two doughters came ſe therle coſyn germayns affren brother kynge richarde feare than̄e loue theſe ladyes counteſſe arundell chyldren alſo counteſſe warwyke dyuers ladyes ſuche london people london ſo ioyfull erles cōmyng workynge london daye ben eaſter daye come concluſyon buſyneſſe people toke coū ſayle aduyſe ryde agaynſt kynge londoner named richard burdeaux kynge without tytell honour vyllaynes london hadde kyng ſuche hate payne ſpekynge hym cō dempnacion diſtruction hadde treated erle derby kynge moche ordred counſayle erle derby toke hym kyng ſo endure euer heyres therto londoner dyde ſwere ſeale promyſed reſydue realme ſhulde ſame ſo ſolempnely ſhulde neuer queſtyon made therof alſo promyſed hym aide aſſyſte hym alwayes theſe promyſes boundes one taken concluded ordayned xii hundred men london well armed ſhulde ryde erle towardes briſtowe ſo moche richarde burdeaux myght taken brought london take aduyſe ſhulde done hym iudged lawe thre eſtates realme alſo ordayned make leſſe brute ſclaundre men warre bretaygne ſuche come thyder erle ſhulde retourned home agayne ſayde howe hadde men ynoughe dedes without ſo erle breton hym thanked ſeruyce hadde done hym gaue great rewardes ſo well content ſo retourned plūmouthe ſhyppes ſo bretayne ¶nowe lette v ſpeke erle derby ordayned ryde briſtowe erle derby cheife armye reaſon touched hym moſt nereſt thus departed fro london rode countrey fell hym tidynges cāe kynges hoſt cōmyng erle derby londoner many knyghtes ſquyers knewe kynge hadde knowledge therof durſt nat ſpeke therof whan tidynges ſpredde abrode ſuche next kyng great feare knewe well kynge bothe lykely fall paryll bycauſe hadde ſo many ennemyes realme ſuche thā ennemyes hadde made good face many knightes ſquyers ſuche hadde ſerued kyng departed fro courte without lycence wente home owne houſes ſome toke nexte waye coude ſtreight erle derby ſerue hym ſoone affren glouceſtre rycharde ſon̄e erle arundell knewe erle derby londoner cōmynge gote men toguyder departed rode ſtreyght erle derby whome founde beyonde oxenforde towne called soucetour therle derby hadde great ioye whan̄e ſawe coſyns demaunded ſtate kynge howe departed fro hym aunſwered ſayde sir departynge ſpake nat hym ſoone knewe commynge lepte horſes departed come ſerue ayde reuenge dethe father whome richarde burdeaulx hathe cauſed ſlayne sir quod erle ye ryght welcome ye ſhall ayde ſhall helpe behouable oure coſyn rycharde burdeaux brought london ſo haue promyſed londoner wyll kepe promyſe therto wyll ayde haue men ynowe fyght hym nede wyll haue batayle ſhall haue ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe tidynges came kyng richarde cōmynge erle derby great puyſſaunce cap ccxli ſayd kynge whan mater coude lengar hydde sir aduyſe well ye haue nede good counſayle ſhortely londoner cometh agaynſt great puiſſaunce hath made therle derby coſyn chefe capitayne haue gote hym fraū ce hath nat done without great treatie whan kynge herde ſore abaſſhed wyſte nat ſaye ſpyrites trymbled thā ſaw well mater lykely go yuell agaynſt hym without coude gette puyſſaūce reſyſt kynge ſayd sir make men redy lende throughe realme ayde wyll nat flye ſubiettes sir quod mater gothe yuell men leaue flye awaye ye haue loſte one halfe reſt ſore abaſſhed leſeth coū tynaūce quod kyng wyll ye ſhall sir leaue felde ye nat able kepe gette ſome ſtronge caſtell tyll ſir iohan hollāde brother come aduertyſed mater whan̄e come ſhall fynde ſome remedy outher biforce armes elles treatie leeſt bring ſome better caſe ye preſent tyme ye kepe felde paraduenture ſome wyll forſake go hym coūſaile kyng agreed tyme erle saliſbury nat ye kyng countre whan herde howe erle derby londoner great puiſſaunce rode agaynſt kyng ymagined matter paryll hym kynge ſuche kyng ben counſayled ſo ſate ſtyll tidynges alſo duke yorke nat kyng ſonne erle rutlande alwayes ye kyng two cauſes one kyng richarde loued hym entierly another bycauſe conſtable englande therfore right ought kynge whan kyng ſupped newe tidynges cāe agayne hym ſayeng sir tyme take aduiſe howe ye wyll order ſelfe puyſſaūce nat ſufficient agaynſt thē cometh agaynſt nat aueyle make batayle agaynſt behoueth paſſe daunger ſadde aduyſe good counſayle wyſedome apeaſe yuel willers ye haue done tyme correcte leyſar caſtell xii myle hen called caſtell flynte whiche ſtronge counſayle go thider cloſe within tyll ye newes fro erle huntyngton brother frendes ſende irelande ſocours ye frē che kyng father lawe whan knoweth nede wyll conforte kyng folowed counſayle apoynted ſhulde ride hym caſtell flynt ordayned coſyn erle rutlande tary ſtyll briſtowe ſhulde redy ſette forwarde whan ſent power fyght enemyes nexte day kynge ſuche houſholde rode caſtell flynte entred caſtell without makynge ſemblaunt make warre abide defende caſtell aſſayled ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe kyng richarde yelded ſelfe erle derby go london cap ccxli erle derby londoner ſpies goyng cōmyng reported al ye ſtate kyng alſo erle knewe ſuche knyghtes ſquyers daylye came fro kynges parte therle ſure knowledge king gone caſtell flynt company ſuch owne houſholde ſemed wolde warr̄ ſcape daūger treatie therle determyned ryde thyder ſo moche haue ye kyng outher biforce treatie erle company rode thyder within two myle caſtell founde great vyllage erle taryed dranke determyned hym ſelfe ryde caſtell flynt two hundred horſe leaue reſt company ſtyll ſayde wolde coude fayre treatie entre caſtell loue nat perforce bring kynge fayre wordes aſſure hym fro paryll excepte goynge london promiſe hym ſhall haue hurte body meane hym londoner nat cō tent hym therles deuyſe ſemed good harde ſayd hym sir beware diſſymulacion rycharde burdeaux muſte taken outher quycke deed traytours hym counſayle ſo brought london ſette towre londoner wyll nat ſuffre contrary erle ſayde sir feare nat enterpriſed ſhall accomplyſſhed gette hym caſtell fayre wordes wyll canne nat ſhall ſende worde therof ye ſhall come laye ſiege caſtell wyll ſo moche force aſſaute wyll haue hym quicke deed caſtell well prignable thoſe wordes accorded well ye londoner erle departed fro army rode two hūdred men caſtell kyng amōg men right ſore abaſſhed erle came ridyng caſtell gate whiche faſte cloſed caſe requyred erle knocked gate porter demaūded erle anſwered henry lancaſtre come kynge demaunde myne herytage duchy lancaſtre ſhewe kynge fro sir quod within ſhall incontynent went hall • ongyon kyng ſuche knyghtes hym long tyme coūſayled hym theſe newes ſhewed kyng ſayd ſir coſyn derby ye gate demā deth ſet poſſeſſyon ye duchy lancaſtre enherytaunce kynge regarded ſuche aboute hym demaunded beſt ſaid ſir requeſt none yuell ye maye let hym come xii perſons company wyll ſay coſyn great lorde realme maye well make peace wyll greatly beloued realme ſpecially londoner ſente hym fraūce nowe ye chefe agaynſt sir ye muſt diſſymule tyll mater apeaſed tyll erle huntyngton brother cometh nowe yuell paſſe calais many nowe englande ryſen agaynſt knewe youre brother aboute wolde ſytte ſtyll durſt nat diſpleaſe yet hathe wyfe erle derbyes ſuſter meanes ſuppoſe ye ſhulde come peace cōcorde kyng agreed thoſe wordes ſaid go let hym come xii hym mo two knyghtes went downe gate opyned wycket iſſued made reuerence erle receyued hym gracious wordes knewe well hadde force reſyſt alſo knewe well londoner ſore diſpleaſed thē therfore ſpake fayre ſayde erle sir pleaſure kyng maſſe hath ſente v hyder ſpeke ſaye quod therle ye knowe well ought haue poſſeſſyon ouchy lancaſtre come partie cauſe alſo thynges wolde ſpeke kynge sir quod ye welcome kyng wolde gladde ſe hath commaunded ye come hym onely xii perſones erle anſwered pleaſeth well entred caſtell xii perſones gate cloſed agayne reſt cō pany taryed without nowe conſyder daūger therle derby kyng myght haue ſlayne hym ſuche hym eaſely byrde cage feared nat mater boldelye went kyng chaūged colour whan ſawe erle erle ſpake aloude without makynge great honour reuerence ſayd sir ye faſtynge kyng anſwered ſayd yea aſke tyme quod erle ye dyned ye haue great iourney ryde wheder ſhulde ryde quod kynge ye muſt ryde london quod therle wherfore counſayle eate drinke ye maye ryde myrthe kynge ſore troubled mynde maner afrayde thoſe wordes ſayde nat hungry haue luſte eate ſuche wereby gladde flatter therle derby ſawe well mater lyke go dyuerſly ſayde kynge sir beleue coſyn lancaſtre wyll nothyng good kyng ſayd well content couer table thanne kynge waſſhed ſatte downe ſerued erle demaunded wolde ſytte downe ſayde nat faſtynge mean ſeaſon whyle kyng ſatte dyner dyde eate lytell hert ſo full luſt eate countrey caſtell full men warre within caſtell myght ſe wyndowes kynge whan roſe fro table myght ſe hym ſelfe demaunded coſyn men appered ſo many feldes therle aunſwered ſayde mooſt parte thē londoner wolde haue quod kyng wyll haue quod therle bringe london putte towre none remedy ye ſcape none otherwyſe quod ye kyng ſore afrayde thoſe wordes knewe well lōdoners loued hym nat ſayde coſyn nat prouyde ſuretie wyll nat gladly putte hādes knowe well hate haue done long though kynge therle ſayd sir ſe none remedy yelde ſelfe priſoner whan knowe ye priſoner wyll hurte ye muſt ſo ordayne cōpany ryde lō priſoner towre london kyng ſawe hym ſelf harde caſe ſpyrites ſore abaſſhed douted greatly londoner wolde ſlee hym yelded hym ſelfe priſoner erle derby boūde hym ſelfe promyſed wolde haue hym lykewiſe knightes lquyers offycers yelded erle eſchewe daūger paryll erle receyued priſoners ordayned incontynent horſes ſadylled brought forthe courte gate opyned many men armes archer entred erle derby cauſed crye made payne dethe man ſo hardy take away thyng within ye caſtell laye handes vpon ꝑſone vnder erles ſauegarde protection whiche crye kept man durſt breke erle kyng downe courte talkyng toguyder cauſed kynges hole houſholde eſtate go forwarde cuſtome done without chaū gyng myniſſhynge thyng whyle euery thyng preparyng kyng erle cōmuned toguyder court well regarded londoner entormed kynge richarde grayhounde called mathe alwayes wayted vpon kynge wolde knowe man el whan ſoeuer kyng dyde ryde kept grayhounde dyde lette hym loſe wolde ſtreight rynne kynge fawne vpon hym leape tore fete vpon kynges ſhulders kyng erle derby talked togyder courte grayhounde wont lepe vpon kyng left kynge came erle derby duke lancaſtre made hym ſame frendly coūtinaū ce chere wonte kyng duke knewe nat grayhoūde demaunded kyng grayhounde wolde coſyn quod kyng gret good token yuell ſigne sir howe knowe quod duke knowe well quod kyng grayhounde maketh chere day kynge englande ye ſhalbe ſhalbe depoſed grayhoūde hath knowledge naturally therfore take hym wyll folowe forſake duke vnderſtode well thoſe wordes cheriſſhed grayhounde wolde neuer folowe kyng richarde folowed duke lā caſtre euery man lepte horſbacke departed fro caſtell flynt entred feldes thus duke henry lancaſtre called erle derby duke lācaſtre rode kyng oftentymes talked togider men warre behynde great nombre ſuche kynges courte rode toguyder company night laye oxenforde duke lancaſtre ledde kyng richarde caſtelles good townes feare ſtyring people alwayes kepte feldes duke gaue lycence great nombre people departe ſayd sir ye maye departe haue deſyre kynge nat flye ſcape fro v owne company ſhall bring hym london putte hym ſauegarde ye towre priſoners may bringe whider wyll therfore ſirs go wayes home tyll ye newes dyde duke cōmaunded thē toke way wyndſore came thyder mooſt parte lōdoners retourned london owne place duke lācaſtre deꝑted fro wynſore wolde nat ride colbroke toke way shene ſo cāe dyner cherſay ye king deſyred duke ſhulde nat bringe hym london waye cytie therfore tooke waye ſoone kynge thus handes ſente notable ꝑſones yong quene lede kent cāe lady coucy ſeconde perſone next quene ſayd madame make redy ye muſt deꝑte hen departyng make ſemblant diſpleaſure quene ſaye howe huſbande hath ſent doughter alſo ſaye loke accomplyſſhe payne lyfe axe ye queſtyons ye ſhalbe conueyed douer haue ſhyppe ſhall bring boloyne lady douted thoſe wordꝭ ſhe knewe well englyſſhemen cruell haſty ſaid ſirs god wyll redy ye wyll haue anone ſhe made redy horſes prouyded cō pany frenche men woman departed conueyed douer next tyde toke ſhippyng good wynde ſo arryued boloyne ⸫ ⸫ ¶of ſtate quene iſabell englande howe ſhe newe ꝑſones apoynted wayte vpon howe kyng richarde ſette towre london capi ccxlii ſtate quene ſo tourned broken lefte nouther man womon chylde ye nacion frā ce yet englande ſuche fauour kyng houſe newly furniſſhed ladyes damoſelles offycers ſeruauntes charged wyſe ſhuld nat ſpeke kynge nat one another thus duke lācaſtre departed fro cheriſay rode shene fro then nyght tyme conueyed kyng towre london ſuche knightes ſquyers kyng wolde nexte mornyng whan londoner knewe kynge towre gretly reioyſed great murmuring among thē bycauſe kyng conueyed thyder ſo ſecretely angry duke nat brought hym throughe london openly nat haue done honor ſhame hated hym ſo ſore beholde opinyon cōmon people whā vp agaynſt prince lorde ſpecially englande amonge remedy perylouſt people worlde moſt outragyouſt vp ſpecially londoner dede riche great nombre well lōdon axxiiii thouſāde men harneſſe complete axxx thouſande archer hardy hygh corage blode ſawe ſhedde leſſe abaſſhed ¶nowe lette v ſomwhat ſpeke erle rutlande conſtable englande ſonne duke yorke taryed briſtowe lorde spēſer hym ſuſter wyfe whan knewe yt caſtell flynte gyuen vp kynge taken brought london than̄e thought ſurely matter wente nat well kynge therfore thought lengar tary gaue leaue al men warre departe erle rutlande lorde spenſer rode toguyder owne ſeruauntes hull marcheſſe wale fayre māner lorde spenſers taryed tyll herde tidynges duke yorke laye ſtyll caſtell medled nothynge buſyneſſe englande dyde toke euer tyme aworthe came howbeit ſore diſpleaſed mynde ſe ſuche difference within ye realme bytwene nephues blode ¶nowe let v retourne ſpeke kynge richarde whan duke lancaſtre ſet coſyn kyng richard ye towre london certayne coū ſaylours ſette ſure kepynge thē fyrſt thyng duke ſent erle warwyke banyſſhed cōmaunded lye yſle wyght diſcharged hym clene therof ſecondly duke lancaſtre ſent therle northumberlande lorde percy ſonne ſhulde come hym ſo dyde enquered ſought haue foure companyons ſtrangled vncle duke glouceſtre caſtell calais ſo well ſought taken ſette priſone aparte lōdon duke lancaſtre coūſayle toke aduyſe ſhulde done kyng richarde beyng towre lōdon kyng iohan fraunce kept whyle kynge edwarde wente realme fraūce thought king rycharde ſhuld put fro royalte ioy hath lyued ſayd newes takynge ſhulde ſprede abrode realmes cryſtened kynge xxii yere determined kepe priſone regarded caſe realme ſtode dyd put dedes artycles nombre xxviii duke lancaſtre counſayle went towre london entred chambre kynge rycharde without reuerence makynge hym openly redde ſaid artycles whiche kynge made none aunſwere ſawe well true yt layde charge ſauynge ſayd haue doone paſſed counſayle demaunded gyuen coūſayle whome moſt ruled named truſt therby haue ben delyuered himſelfe accuſynge doone tyme truſtynge therby ſcape bringe daunger payne nat mynde loued hym nat ſo tyme ſpake departed duke lancaſtre went lodgynge ſuffred mayre men lawe procede went ye guyldhall mater cytie determyned moche people aſſēbled whan ſawe gouernours cytie go thyder thought ſome iuſtice ſhulde done dede ſhall ſhewe howe fyrſte artycles made agaynſt kynge whiche redde hym towre redde agayne openly ſhewed hym redde howe kynge hymſelfe denyed none confeſſed dyd theym counſayle four knightes chambre howe counſayle put dethe duke glouceſtre erle arūdell ſir thomas corbet howe longe encyted kynge thoſe dedes whiche dedes ſayd nat forgyuen demaunded punycion coūſayle iuſtyce right cloſed vp courtes englande weſtmynſter wherby many yuell dedes folowed companyes rowtes theues murderer roſe aſſembled togyther dyuers party realme robbed marchauntes wayes poore men houſes whiche meanes realme great parell haue ben loſt without recouery ymagyned fynally wolde haue rendred calais guyſnes bothe frenchmennes handes theſe wordes thus ſhewed people made many abaſſhed many beganne murmure ſayd theſe cauſes demaunde punycion may take enſample therby rycharde burdeaur depoſed nat worthy beare crowne ought depriued fro honour kept lyfe priſon breed water though ſome villaynes murmured ſaid hygh ſir mayre london ye haue iuſtyce handes mynyſter execute iuſtyce wyll ye ſpare man ye ſe well caſe ye haue ſhewed v demaūdeth iuſtyce cōtynent iudges vpon owne dedes mayre gouernours lawe went togyther chambre iudgement theſe four knyghtes iudged dye iudged foote towre kynge richarde might ſe drawen alonge dyke horſes eche throughe cytie chepeſyde heedes ſtryken ſette vpon london bridge bodyes drawen gybet hanged iudgement gyuen delyuered execucyon mayre london ſuche deputed mater wente fro guyldhall towre toke four knyghtes kynges whoſe name called ſir bernarde brokas ſyr marelays mayſter iohn̄ derby receyuour lyncolne mayſter stell kynges ſtewarde eche thē tyed two horſes preſence towre kynge myght well ſe wyndowes wherwith ſore deſcomforted kynge loked ſame caſe knewe london ſo cruell thus theſe four knyghtes drawen one another longe cyte tyll came chepe fyſſhers ſtall heedes ſtryken ſet vpon london bridge bodyes drawen ſhulders gybet hanged vp iuſtyce thus doone euery man went lodgynges kynge rycharde knowyng ſelfe taken daunger londoner great ſorowe herte rekened puyſſaunce nothynge ſawe howe euery man agaynſte hym ought hym fauour laye nat power hym ayde durſte nat ſhewe suche kynge ſayde syr haue ſmall truſt lyues may well apere whan coſyn lancaſtre came caſtell flynte owne good wyll ye yelded hym promyſed twelue ſhuld priſoners haue hurte nowe thoſe twelue four executed ſhamfully like paſſe ſame way cauſe theſe londoner hath cauſed duke lancaſtre coſyn dede hym ſo ſore bounde muſte wyll haue hym god dothe moche v ſuffre myght dye naturall deth nat ſhamfull dethe great pytie thynke thoſe wordes kyng rycharde began tēderly wepe wringe handes curſed houre euer borne rather haue ſuche ende suche aboute hym great pytie recomforted hym well might one knyghtes ſayd syr behoueth take comforte ſe well ſo worlde nothyng fortune ther marueylous ſomtyme tourne well vpon kinges prince vpon poore men frenche kynge whoſe doughter ye haue maryed canne nat nowe ayde farre ye myght ſcape myſchefe dyſſimulacyon ſaue lyfe good enterpriſe peraduenture yere two wolde ſome recouery ꝙ kynge wolde ye ſhulde nothynge wolde glad ſaue v therby syr quod knyght ſe trouthe theſe londoner wyll crowne coſyn lancaſtre kynge entent ſent hym ſo haue ayded hym nat poſſyble lyue without ye conſent crowned kynge wherfore ſyr wyll counſayle entent ſaue lyfe whan coſyn lancaſtre cōmeth demaunde thynge ſwete treatable wordes ſay hym howe ye wyll reſygne hym crowne englande ryght ye haue realme clerely purely handes howe ye wyll kynge therby ye ſhall greatly apeaſe londoner alſo deſyre hym effectuouſly ſuffre lyue v alſo el euery man parte ſhall pleaſe el baniſſhe v realme euer leſeth lyfe leſeth kynge rycharde herde thoſe wordes well fyxed ſurelye herte ſayd wolde counſayled hym ſawe hym ſelfe great daunger ſayd kepte hym howe wolde gladly ſpeke coſyn lancaſtre ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe kynge rycharde englande reſigned crowne realme handes erle derby duke lancaſtre cap ccxliiii ſhewed duke lancaſtre howe rycharde burdeaux deſyred ſpeke hym duke euenynge toke barge went towre water went kynge receyued hym curteſly humbled hym ſelfe greatly ſawe hym ſelfe great daunger ſayd coſyn lancaſtre regarde conſydre myne eſtate whiche nowe ſmall thanke god therof reygne gouerne people beare crowne thynke nat god helpe wolde deed naturall dethe frenche kinge agayne doughter haue yet gret ioy togyder ſyth brought englande coulde neuer haue loue people coſyn thynges cōſydred knowe well haue greatly treſpaſſed agaynſt agaynſt noble men blodde dyuers thynges perceyue ſhall neuer haue pardone come peace wherfore myne owne free lyberall wyll wyll reſygne herytage crowne englande requyre take gyfte therof reſignacyon whan duke herde ſayd ſyr conuenyent parte thre eſtates realme called theſe wordes haue ſent redy ſome noble men prelate counſaylours good townes englande truſte wyll within thre dayes ſuffycient make dewe reſygnacion meanes ye ſhal greatly apeaſe many men within realme withſtande ſuche enormyties yuels haue ben vſed realme faute iuſtyce place reygne ſent fro beyond ſee people wolde crowne renome rynneth englande haue ryght crowne ye haue whan grauntfather kynge edwarde thyrde dyd choſe make kynge ſame ſhewed hym loued ſo ſonne prince none coude breake purpoſe opinyon ſhulde kynge ye wolde haue folowed ſteppes father prince haue beleued counſayle good ſonne ought haue done ye myght haue ben ſtyll kyng haue contynued youre eſtate ye haue alwayes done contrary ſo cōmon renome rynneth england place ye neuer ſonne prince wale rather ſonne preeſt chanon haue herde certayne knightes prince howſe myne vncle howe knew well wyfe nat truely kepte maryage mother coſyn germayne kynge edwarde kynge beganne hate bycauſe ſhe coulde haue generacion alſo ſhe kynges goſſyp two chyldren fonte ſhe coulde well kepe prince bandon crafte ſubtylte ſhe made prince huſbande bycauſe ſhe coulde haue chylde ſhe douted prince ſhulde deuorſed fro ſhe dyd ſo moch ſhe chylde another fyrſt nat tell iudge bycauſe cōdicyons haue ben ſene contrary fro noble prowes prince therfore ſayd ye rather ſonne preſt chanon whan ye gotten borne burdeaux many yonge preeſtes ye prince houſe brute countrey workes haue well folowed ſame ye alwayes enclyned pleaſure french men take peace confuſyon dy ſhonoure realme englande bycauſe myne vncle glouceſtre erle arundell dyd coūſayle truly faythfully kepe honour realme folowe ſteppes aunceſtours ye haue traytourſly cauſed dye haue taken
