defende lyfe longe may pytie ſhall pray londoner herytours ye haue ſlayne banyſſhed ſame coſyn thanke quod yt kynge truſte ryght ye ſo ſhulde nat ben ye ben taken people depoſed great confuſyon ſlayne reaſone yuell workes kynge rycharde herde well duke wordes wyſt nat ſaye agaynſt ſawe well force argumentes coulde nat auelyle rather mekeneſſe humilyte wherfore humbled hym prayed duke ſaue lyfe whan duke lancaſtre ben towre two houres kynge rycharde ſhewed hym parte fautes retourned next day ſent forthe mo cōmaundementes party realme cauſe noble men come london vncle duke yorke came london erle rutlande ſonne erle northumberlande lorde thomas percy brother duke lancaſtre made good chere thyder came alſo great nombre prelate abbottes day duke lancaſtre acompanyed lordes duke prelate erles barones knyghtes notableſt men london good townes rode towre alyghted kynge rycharde brought hall aparelled lyke kynge robe eſtate ſepter hande crowne heed ſtode vp alone nat holden ſtayed man ſayde loude haue kynge englande duke acquytany lorde irelande aboute xxii yeres whiche ſygnory royalte cepter crowne herytage clerely reſygne coſyn henry lancaſtre deſyre hym open preſence entrynge ſame poſſeſſyon take ſeptour ſo delyuered duke toke kynge rycharde toke crowne fro heed bothe handes ſet hym ſayd fayre coſyn henry duke lancaſtre gyue delyuer crowne wherwith crowned kyng englande therwith right therto dependyng duke lancaſtre tooke archebyſſhop caunterbury toke duke handes reſygnacion thus done duke lancaſtre called notary demaunded haue letter wytneſſe prelate lordes beynge preſent rycharde burdeaux retourned agayne chambre fro whence came duke lancaſtre lept horſes crowne ceptour put cofer conueyed abbey weſtmynſter kept treaſory euery man wente lodgynges abode tyll day parliament counſayle ſhulde palays weſtmynſter ¶of coronacyon kyng henry duke lancaſtre conſent realme maner feeſt cap ccxlv yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred fourſcore nynetene laſt daye ſeptembre tuyſday began parlyament weſtmynſter holden henry duke lancaſtre whiche tyme aſſembled prelate clergy realme englande great nombre alſo duke erles barones euery towne certayne thus people aſſembled weſtmynſter beynge preſente duke lancaſtre ſame duke chalenged realme englande deſyred kynge thre reaſones fyrſt conqueſt ſecondly bycauſe heyre thyrdly bycauſe rycharde burdeaur reſygned realme handes free wyll preſence certayne duke erles prelate barones hall within towre london theſe thre cauſes ſhewed duke lancaſtre requyred people preſent well one ſhewe myndes entente behalfe people one voyce ſayd wylles haue kynge howe wolde haue none hym duke agayne ſayd people sir myndes one voyce ſayde ye ye duke ſate downe ſyege royall whiche ſeate reyſed vp hall couered clothe eſtate ſo yt euery man myght well ſe hym ſytte people lyfted vp handes hygh promyſing hym faythe allegyaunce thanne parlyament cōcluded day taken coronacyon ſaynt edwardes day monday xiii day octobre whiche tyme ſaturday coronacyon departed fro weſtmynſter rode towre london great nombre night ſuche ſquyers ſhulde made knyghtes nexte day watched nombre xlvi euery ſquier owne bayne ſelfe next day duke lancaſtre made theym knyghtes maſſe tyme longe cote ſtrayte ſleues furred wt mynyuer lyke prelate whyte lace hangynge ſhuldes dyner duke departed fro towre weſtmynſter rode way bareheeded aboute necke lyuery fraunce acompanyed ye prince ſonne ſyxe duke ſyxe erles xviii baron knyghtes ſquyers nyne hundred horſe kynge ſhorte cote clothe golde maner almayne mounted whyte cou • ſer garter left legge thus duke rode london great nombre lordes euery lordes ſeruaunt mayſters lyuery geſſes lombardes marchauntes london euery craft lyuerey deuyſe thus conueyed weſtmynſter nombre ſyxe thouſāde horſe ſtreates hanged paſſed ſame day next london rynnynge ſeuen cundyttes wyne whyte reed nyght duke bayned next mornynge confeſſed herde thre maſſes acuſtomed prelate clergy came fro weſtmynſter churche palays fetche kynge proceſſion ſo went churche proceſſion lordes hym robe ſcarlet furred menyuer barred ſhulders acordynge degree ouer kynge borne clothe eſtate blewe four belle golde borne four burgeſſes porte douer euery ſyde ſword borne one ye ſworde churche ſworde iuſtyce ſworde church ſonne prince dyd beare ſworde iuſtyce therle northumberlande dyd beare conſtable englande erle rutlande depoſed fro offyce erle weſtmerlande marſhall englande bare ceptour thus entred ye churche nyne clocke myddes churche hygh ſcaffolde couered reed myddes therof chayre royall couered clothe golde kyng ſate downe yt chayre ſo ſate eſtate royall ſauynge nat crowne ſate bare heeded four corner ſcaff olde archebyſſhop caunterbury ſhewed vnto people howe god ſent man kyng demaunded content ſhulde conſecrated crowned kynge one voyce ſayd yea helde vp handes promyſynge faythe obeyſaunce kynge roſe wente downe ſcaffolde hygh auter ſacred whiche conſecracyon two archbyſſhoppes ten byſſhops aulter • diſpoyled veſtures eſtate anoynted vi place heed breſt two ſhulders behynde handes bonet ſer heed whyle anoyntynge clergy ſange latyny ſuche ſeruyce ſynge halowing fonte yt kinge aparelled lyke prelate churche▪ cope reed ſylke payre ſpurres poynte without rowell ſworde iuſtyce drawen ſhethe halowed taken ye kyng dyd put agayne ſheth archebyſſhop caunterbury dyd gyrde ye ſworde hym ſaynt edwardes crowne brought forthe whiche cloſe aboue bleſſed archebyſſhop dyd ſette kynges heed maſſe kyng departed churche ſame eſtate went palays fountayne ranne dyuers braunches whyte wyne reed kyng entred hall ſo priuy chamber came agayne dyner fyrſt table ſate kynge ſeconde ye fyue peres realme thyrde valaunt men london fourth newe made knightes fyft knyghtes ſquiers honour kyng ſtode prince holdynge ſworde churche ſyde conſtable ſworde iuſtyce lytell aboue marſhall ceptour yt kynges borde ſate two archbyſſhops xvii byſſhoppes myddes dyner came knight called dinereth armed vpon good horſe rychely aparelled knyght hym bearyng ſpeare ſworde ſyde dagger knyght toke kyng lybell whiche red therin conteyned outher knight ſquyer gētylman wold ſay kyng henry nat right full kyng redy fyght quarell kynge ſhulde pleaſe hym apoynte byll cryed haraulde ſyxe place hall towne none wolde chalenge hym whan kynge dyned toke wyne ſpyces hall went chambre euery man departed went lodginges thus day paſſed kynge henryes coronacyon great ioy feeſt whiche endured next day erle salyſbury nat ſolēpnyte ſure priſon kinges coūſayle dyuers noble men londoner wolde heed ſhulde haue ben ſtryken openly chepe ſaid well deſerued bearynge letter credēce fro rycharde burdeaux frenche kyng reporte openly kyng henry falſe traytoure whiche faute ſayd ought nat ꝑdoned kyng henry gentyll ſo ſome pytie hym therle excuſed hym ſayd dyd kynges cōmaundement ſettyng four knyghtes beheeded kinge henry beleued well erles wordes coūſayle wolde nat beleue ſaid ſo dyd ye londoner ſhulde dye bycauſe deſerued deth thus erle salyſbury priſon great daunger lyfe ſyr iohan holande erle huntyngdon capytayne calais well enfourmed hole mater howe brother kyng rychard taken priſone towre london reſygned crowne howe henry lancaſtre kinge englande erle huntyngdon ſo euer dyſpleaſure trouble brother yet wyſely conſydred tyme aduentures ſawe well yt nat able ſtande power puyſſaunce realme alſo counteſſe wyfe coſyn germayne kynge henry ſayd syr muſt behoue paſſe diſpleaſure pacyently wyſely nat thynge wherby ye ſhall haue dōmage kyng may moche good ye ſe realme enclyneth hym ye ſhewe dyſpleaſure hym warde ye loſt wherfore ſyr requyre coūſayle dyſſimule matter well kynge henry nowe brother kyng richarde therfore ſyr ſtycke leane ye ſhall fynde hym good louer neuer rycher kynge englande may chyldren great good erle herde well wordes wyfe beleued enclyned hym kynge henry offred hym humble obeyſaunce promyſed hym faythe trouthe kyng receyued hym great ioy therof dyd ſo moche meanes frēdes therle salyſbury taken grace excuſacyons accepted clene pardoned ¶how newes taking kyng rycharde knowen fraunce cōmyng thyder lady coucy howe frenche kynge dyſpleaſed cap ccxlvi whan lady coucy aryued bouloyne ſhe haſted go parys great murmurynge fraunce ſodayne incidentes yt fall englāde knewe ſomwhat marchaūtes bruges whan lady coucy aryued trouth knowen went firſte huſbandes houſe reaſon anon frenche kynge herde worde howe lady coucy come parys kynge ſent lorde coucy ben nyght wyfe whan come kynge demaūded ſtate kynge rycharde englande quene doughter lorde durſt nat hyde trouth fro hym ſhewed hym playnely euery thynge wyfe ſhewed hym whiche newes ſore dyſpleaſaunt frenche kynge knewe well englyſſhmen ſore harde men apeaſe ſo dyſpleaſure frenche kynge retourned agayne olde ſicknes franſey wherof noble yt realme ſore diſpleaſed coude nat amende duke burgoyn ſaid thought neuer otherwyſe maryage without good reaſone whiche ſayd playnly ynough whan mater fyrſt ſpokē coulde nat herde knewe well ye londoner neuer loued parfytely kynge rycharde myſchefe engendred duke glouceſtre tyme nowe take hede engliſſhmen wyll ſythe haue taken kyng put priſon lykelyhode wyll put hym dethe neuer loued bycauſe loued warre peace wyll crowne kynge duke lancaſtre ſhall ſo bynde hym ſelfe whether wyll nat ſhall wyll ſayd moreouer nowe ſhall ſene burdeaux wyll borne well loued alſo bayon dax lymytes burdeloys good yt conſtable fraūce ſir loys sanxere ſignyfyed mater drewe hym yt fronters ſyr raynolde barroys barreys barones prelate treate brother duke berrey go poictou drawe fronters xaintes blaues mirebell wherby burdeaux wyll thynge entende treaty may receyued nowe ſhall haue neuer deuyſed ordeyned whiche ſubſtanciall deuyce whan burdeaux bayon dax vnderſtode kynge rycharde taken ſette towre london duke henry lancaſtre crowned kyng gret marueyle therof begynnyng wolde nat beleue lytle lytle knewe trouth therof ſayd thre townes cloſed man ſuffred iſſue entre ſore troubled ſorowfull ſpecyally cytie burdeaux kynge rycharde noryſſhed amonge therfore loued hym whyle kynge burdeloys came hym well receyued alwayes ye kinge redy fulfyll deſyres wherfore ſayd whan knewe trouth ah richarde gentle kyng ye noble man euer reigned realme trouble yt londoner haue cauſed coulde neuer loue ſpecyall ſythe ye alyed maryage frenche kyng myſchiefe ſo great nat ſuffre haue holden kynge xxii yere nowe condempe dethe ſythe ye priſon haue crowned duke lancaſtre wyll ſurely put deth burdeloys made great lamentacyons ſo moche ſeneſchall burdeaux ryght valyaunt knyght englande wrote letter therin conteynynge wordes lamentacyons cytie burdeaulx bayon dax alſo wrote howe nere poynte yelde vp townes frenche kyng ſent lettre truſty ſeruaūt ſee good wynde aryued cornewayle englāde rode ſo longe came london foūde kynge henry delyuered letter whiche dyrected kynge londoner opened reed kynge londoner tooke counſayle vpon mater london aunſwered lyke theym nothyng abaſſhed tydynges ſayde theſe townes wyll neuer tourne frenche nat lyue daunger canne nat ſuffre extorcion pollinge frenchman vnder v lyue franke free frenche men ſhulde lordes ouer ſhulde taxed tayled retayled two thre tymes yere whiche nat nowe acuſtomed vnto whiche ſhulde harde thyng nowe begynne alſo theſe thre cyties cloſed roūde great lordes good englyſſhe longe haue lorde pyuiers lorde muſydent lorde dura lorde landuras lorde copane lorde roſem lorde logeren dyuers barones knyghtes whome ſhulde haue warre handes ſhulde nat iſſue city ſhulde taken ſeneſchalles wrytynge haue doute yt ſhulde become frenche howe good ſende thyder ſome valyaunt wyſe man beloued amonge theym ſome ſuche hath gouerned lorde thomas percy thus deuyſed acomplyſſhed deſyred go thyder take hede coūtrey fulfylled kynges cōmaundement made hym redy departe chriſtmaſſe whiche tyme wyndes ſore ieoperdous toke ſhyppynge cornewayle two hundred men armes four hundred archer hym nephue hugh haſtynges thomas colleuyll gyllyam lyſle iohan graily baſtarde ſonne captall beufz guillyam traicton iohan danbreticourt diuers alſo byſſhop london mayſter rycharde doall taryed tyll mydde marche toke ſee came burdeaux duke burbon come cytie dagen treate theym burdeloys dyd ſo moche fayre wordes good aſſuraunce counſayles burdeaux bayon dax ſent cytie dagen duke receyued frendly gaue fayre wordes many promyſes ſhewed wolde turne frenche vnder obeyſaunce frenche kynge ſo euer wolde demaunde ſhulde graunted ſealed perpetually endure many thynges promyſed ſware ſeale kepe euer aunſwered whan retourned agayne cyties wolde ſhewe people ſo take counſayle gyue anſwere thus departed fro dagen fro duke burbon retourned townes ſhewed people tourned nothynge comynaltyes ſayde cyties conſydred buſyneſſe knewe well howe realme fraunce vexed troubled tayles fowages ſhamfull exaccions get money ſayd frenche men gouerne ouer v wyll bringe v ſame vſage yet better v englyſſhe kepe v franke free londoner haue depoſed kynge rycharde crowned kinge henry v haue ſhall haue alwayes kynge vnderſtande byſſhop london ſyr thomas percy ſhortely wyll ſhall enfourme v trouthe haue alſo marchaundyſe woll wyne clothe englyſſhe men frenchman let v ware make treatie wherby ſhulde repent v thus treatie frenche men broken lefte anone byſſhop london ye lorde percy charge men warre aryued burdeaux wherof moche people greatly reioyſed ſome diſpleaſed ſuche rather haue frenche englyſſhe theſe englyſſhe lordes lodged togyther abbey ſaint andrewe whan ſawe tyme ſhewed people ſtate englande ye cauſe ſent thyder dyd ſo moche euery thynge apeaſed bothe place harde haue cauſed haue tourned frenche determyned counſayle fraunce ſithe kyng ſyckneſſe reaſon diſpleaſure toke depoſyng ſonne lawe kynge rycharde yt ſhulde ſende ſome notable wyſe perſonage englande knowe ſtate quene meſſage apoynted ſyr charles de la brethe charles hanger cōmaunded departed fro parys came boloygne taryed ſent haraulde kynge henry without aſſuraūce durſt nat go truce bytwene bothe realmes kynge henry thought hym ſelfe moche bounde frenche kynge chere hadde fraunce toke counſayle concluded ſo haraulde anſwered kynges pleaſure company ſhulde come englande come ſtreyght way kyng nat ryde way without lycence haraulde retourned boloyne ſhewed done wherwith content ſo ſhypped horſes toke ſee aryued douer founde redy knyght kynges howſe • oho receyued theym ſene hym kyng henry fraunce wherby ſoner aquaynted ſo taryed douer tyll horſes vnſhypped rode caunterbury ſo euer bayted lay hoſtes payed laſte came eltham founde kyng henry parte counſayle kinge made good chere loue frenche kynge ſhewed kyng cauſe cōmynge kynge aunſwered ſayde sir ye ſhal go london wyll within foure dayes aſſemble counſayle ye ſhall haue aunſwere demaunde daye dyned kynge dyner rode london ſayde knyght kynges ſtyll ſawe well lodged kinge acordyng promyſe came weſtmynſter theſe frenche knyghtes knowlege kynges cōmynge thyder made redy go whan ſhulde ſent kynge counſayle hym deuyſed anſwere ſhuld haue ſent ſhewed deſyred ſe quene deſyre ſhulde nat denyed ſo wolde ſwere promeſſe nouther none menne ſhulde ſpeke worde fallen vpon king rycharde ſaid dyd ſhulde rynne great dyſpleaſure people great parell lyues two knightes ſayd wolde wyſe breake ordre ſette obey cōmaundement ſayd whan one ſene ſpoken wolde retourne departe anon erle northum berlande brought theym haueringe bowre yonge quene duches irelande doughter lorde coucy ye ducheſſe glouceſtre doughters ladyes damoſelles quene receyued ſwetely demaūded howe frenche kinge father dyd quene mother ſayde well ſo cōmuned gret ſeaſon kepte well promeſſe ſpake worde kynge rycharde tooke leaue quene retourned london ſhortely wente eltham kynge dyned ye kyng gaue fayre preſentes iowelles ryght amyably toke leaue kynge ſayd syrs ye may ſay whan ye come fraunce yt quene englande ſhall haue hurte trouble ſhall alwaies kepe eſtate belongeth ſhall enioy right yet ſhe ſhall nat knowe mutacyons worlde theſe wordes ſpoken kynges mouth two knyghtes well content ſo departed lay dertforde next day oſprynge ſo caunterbury douer coſtes charge commynge goynge kynges offycers payed tooke ſee aryued boloyne ſo parys founde kyng quene ſhewed ſene herde ¶nowe let v ſomwhat ſpeake englande ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe certayne lordes englande roſe vp army haue delyuered kyng rycharde haue dyſtroyed kynge henry howe ſlayne cap cc xivii diuers queſtyons argumētes made englande amonge noble men counſayls good townes yt richarde burdeaux deed ſlayne wherfore men ſpake hym well deſerued theſe poyntes kyng henry anſwered ſayd nay quod haue pytie dethe wyll neuer conſent therto kepe hym priſone ſuffycient haue warrā ted lyfe wyll kepe promyſe ſuche wolde haue hym deed ſayd sir ſe well ye haue pytie hym ye ſelfe perylous thyng long lyue though haue willyngly reſigned crowne englande euery man hath receyued kyng haue made faythe homage yet nat realme ſome loued hym yet wolde lightly ryſe agaīſt might ſe lykelyhode delyueraunce alſo frenche kynge ſore diſpleaſed trouble wolde ſoone reuenged yf myght great puyſſaunce ſuche ayde maye fynde englande kynge aunſwered ſayde longe ſe nat contrary frenche kyng wyll take parte agaynſt wyll kepe promyſe aunſwere kynge made nerehande haue ben owne diſtructyon erle huntyngton ſir iohan hollande brother kyng richarde hadde wyfe kynge henryes ſuſter coulde nat forgette aduenture brother coude erle saliſbury oxenforde ſecrete counſayle toguyder deuyſed might delyuer kynge richarde oute towre diſtroye kyng henry bring trouble agayne realme deuyſed make iuſtes twentie knyghtes twentie ſquyers beholden oxenforde howe wolde deſyre kyng priuely whyle ſhulde ſyttynge table ſlee hym deuyſed haue hadde men ynowe haue perfourmed entente redy preeſt called maladyn ſyngar kynge rychardes chapell haue putte hym kynges appareyle lyke kynge rycharde fauoure wolde haue made people haue beleued kynge richarde hadde delyuered returned fyrſt ſtate than̄e haue ſente worde dede frenche kynge ſhulde incontynent haue ſente englande ſome ſocoure erle ſaynt poule ſome deuyſed ſo dyde begynne cauſed feeſt oxenforde proclaymed twentie knyghtes twentie ſquyers well accōpanyed ladyes damoſelles hadde alſo partie yonge erle kente nephue ſir iohan hollande alſo another great lorde lorde spenſar beleued haue hadde partie erle iohan rutlande bycauſe kynge henry put hym offyce cōſtable ſhyppe englande fayled theym ſome ſayde hym bewrayed feeſt prouyded thau erle huntyngton came wyndſore kyng humbly made reuerence thought haue diſceyued kynge ſwete wordes haue gote hym haue come feeſt whiche deſyred kyng effectuouſly kyng thought none yuell graunted hym ſo wherof erle ryght ioyouſe departed fro kynge toke leaue layde chanon robſarde sir appareyle come feeſt promyſe mete felde ſhall gyue fayre encountre ſpeare ſir iohan robſarde ſayd sir kyng come feeſt ye ſhall nat fayle fynde erle ſtrake hande thanked hym ſo paſſed forthe dyuers knightes ſquyers prepared thē ſelfes feeſt armorer london lette worke trymme men harneſſe iuſtes suche kynges counſayle ſayde hym sir ye haue nothynge ye ſhall nat come aduyſe haue herde certayne wordes murmuryng whiche nat pleaſaunt agreable ſhall knowe ſhortely kynge beleued counſaile ſo came nat feeſt none knyghtes • came thyther ſuche wolde haue ſlayne whan erle saliſbury erle hūtyngton erle kente lorde spenſar ſawe hadde fayled entente coude nat haue kyng wolde counſayled toguyder ſayde lette v go wynſore ſtyrre vp countre ſhall putte madalyn eſtate royall ryde hym make people beleue kynge rycharde delyuered cut priſone ſuche ſhall ſe hym wyll beleue ſuche therof thus ſhall diſtroy ennemyes deuyſed ſo dyde aſſembled toguyder ſo fyue hundred men one dyd putte madalyn appareyle royall made hym ryde theym ſo rode towardes wyndſore kynge henry godde dyde ayde kynge henry tidynges came hym howe ſayd lordes cōmynge great nombre wynſore ſlee hym howe men ynowe wynne caſtell howe made madalyn veſture lyke kyng ryde thē made people beleue kynge rycharde delyuered moche people beleueth ſome ſaye haue ſene beleue verily wherfore ſir gette hen incontynent ryde lō cōmynge ſtreyght hyder kynge beleued counſayle ſo men lepte horſes departed fro wyndſore rode towardes london kynge nat farre gone theſe lordes came wyndſore entred gate caſtell none ſaye theym naye thanne wente ſertchynge fro chambre chambre chanons houſes wenyng fynde kynge fayled whanne ſawe wolde nat right ſore diſpleaſed departed fro wynſore lay nyght colebroke made moche people go byforce treatie sayeng howe kynge rycharde company ſome beleued ſome nat kyng henry douted trayſon haſted hym iourney cāe towre london ſecrete waye went richarde burdeux ſayd haue ſaued lyfe wt moche payne nowe ye wolde murder brother enterprice ſhalbe yuell richarde burdeaux excuſed hym greatly ſayd god myght helpe hym ſaue ſoule knewe nothynge therof wolde neuer deſire aſtate thus mater ſtode thā kyng henry ſent mayre london ſpeciall frendes ſhewed mater lō doners great marueyle therof ſaid sir ye muſt ſende men go agaynſt tymes multiply haue made kynge ſo ye ſhall contynue ſoeuer haue enuy therat thā letter written haſt meſſangers ſent forthe partes kyng wrote conſtable erle northumberlāde marſhall erle weſtmerlāde knyghtes ſquyers eſſexe place thought haue ayde men ſuche herde therof cāe kyng faſt might erles huntyngton saliſbury affynyte toke coūſayle aduyſe drawe towardes london ſayde coude nat none otherwyſe ſome londoner loued kynge rycharde ſuch ſaid wolde cōe take ꝑte departed fro colbroke went lodged braynforde ſeuyn myle fro london neuer lōdoner came drewe cytie whan theſe lordes ſawe nexte mornynge tooke waye ſaynt albons lodged taries day fro then went barcamſtede thus went countre ſtyll made reported madalyn kyng richarde ſo came good towne called suſcettour baylye ſette kynge henry kepyng towne countrey whan theſe lordes come suſcettour lodged one nyght reſte peace bayly nat ſtrōg ynough fyght thē therfore diſſymuled well myght nexte mornynge erle saliſbury lorde spenſar departed fro erle huntyngton fro erle kent ſayd howe wolde ride get turne mo men opinyon go ſe lorde bercley ryde long ryuer syuerne yuell counſayled whan departed one fro another ſo moche weaker erle huntyngton began treate bayly men suſcettour ſhewed howe kynge richarde delyuered howe lōdonets delyuered hym ſhulde within two dayes bayly aſſembled good nombre countrey ſayde contrarye trewe howe ſuche tidynges fro kyng henry fro londoner wolde execute cōmaundement whan therle hūtyngton herde thoſe wordes chaunged colour ſawe well diſceyued entred lodging armed hym cauſed mē ſame thought cōquere thoſe villayns batayle ſette towne fyre therby abaſſhe people baylye towne parte haſted hym aſſembled men certayne place archer two thouſande men lordes nat paſt thre hundred men howe came oute lodgynges began batayle archer ſhotte bothe partes ſo many hurte bayly great nombre came vpon without ſparynge ſpeciall cōmaundement fro kynge henry ſhulde outher take thē quicke deed myght ouercome finally erles menne fayne withdrawe houſes bayly men enuyroned lodgynges partes ſpecially two erles made ſuche aſſautes entred ꝑforce many hurte ſlayne therle hūtyngton defended ſelfe valyauntly longe myght ſo many agaynſt hym ſlayne hym yonge erle kente great ſorowe made dyuers partes englande fayre yonge man maner agaynſt wyll vncle erle saliſbury brought hym therto men suſcettour fierſe agaynſt thē ſtrake heedes ſent meſſanger mayre london therwith reioyce kyng londoner therle saliſbury lorde spenſar came lyke concluſyon certayne knightes ſquiers kynges toke ſtrake heedes ſente london many ſuche alyed putte execucion bothe knyghtes ſquyers realme good reſt peace ⸫ ⸫ ¶howe frenche kyng reyſed vp army ſende vpon fronters englande cap cc xlviii whan eaſter come yere lorde god four hundred frēche kyng brother vncles counſaile vnderſtode howe certayne englyſſhmen armes archer ſhulde paſſe ſee come calais guynes hāmes thoſe fronters cōmaundement made throughe fraunce euery knight ſquyer ſhulde redy leape horſ backe go thider ſhulde ſente ſpecially bolonois ſee ſyde well prouyded ſame tyme duke iohan bretayne died behynde hym lefte two ſonnes doughter eldeſt ſon̄e ſhulde haue maried frenche kynges ſecōde doughter might nat haue theldeſt bycauſe ſhe maryed englande kynge richarde treatie maryage fyrſt eldeſt doughter fraunce heyre bretayne cōcluded tourſe tourayn afterwarde kinges cōſent coūſaile thentent marry richely mariage broken bretayne ſhe maried englande dyuers lordes fraunce ſaid feared good ſhulde come therof concluded ye ſecōde doughter dethe duke bretaine aduiſed ye duke orlyaūce certayne nō bre men warre ſhulde drawe ye march bretayne ſpeke ye breton wt coūſaylours good townes know wolde heyre deſyre thē delyuer kept houſe fraūce duke orlyaūce dyde acording deuyſe certayne nōbre came ponthorſon reſted ſente worde cōmyng lordes bretaigne prelate lordes coūſaylours good townes ye name thre eſtates countre aſſembled togider determyned aunſwere make ſo came pounthorſon duke orlyaunce made anſwere one ſorte ſaid howe yonge lorde heyre bretayne wolde kepe hym thēſelfes owne countre duke orlyaūce ſeyng wolde none otherwiſe toke bō de gretteſt lordes bretayne ſuche chefe charge countre ſhulde delyuer hym frēche kyng whā childe ſhulde come age theſe writynges made ſealed duke deꝑted returned fraunce ſhewed kyng brother howe ſpedde well knowen englande howe frenche kyng hadde furnyſſhed garyſons cyties good townes caſtels fronters picardy bolonois howe frenchman cloſed ſo paſſagꝭ ouer ye water sōme marchandyſe corne thyng ſhulde nat paſſe abuyle ye marchaūtes englāde wont go frā ce marchaūdiſe durſt cōe frenche marchaūtes durſte nat come englande ſo fronters bothe ꝑties gret ruyne deſolacion yet made warr̄ togyder cōmaūdement ſo ſaid kyng hēry ſir aduyſe well ſemeth frenchman wyll make warre make great prouiſyon ſhyppes harflewe capitayns armye erle ſaynt poule ſir charles de la breth ſuppoſe erles huntyngton salyſbury lyue ſuche dedde frenchman wolde ſoone paſſe ouer ſee truſt haue great alyaunce ayde englande ſir longe richarde burdeaux lyue realme ſhalbe ſuretie beleue ye ſaye trewe quod kyng wyll nat cauſe hym ſlayne haue ſo promyſed hym wyll kepe promyſe without ꝑceyue worke trayſon agaynſt well ſir • abqod counſaill better deed rather lyue longe frenche men knowe lyueng wyll enforce make warre wyll hope alwayes bring agayne former eſtate bycauſe wyfe frenche kynges doughter kyng gaue none anſwere departed fro lefte coūſayle cōmunyng togyder kynge wente toke faucon hāde paſſed ouer mater ¶of dethe kyng richarde englande howe truſe bytwene englande fraunce reuewed alſo depoſicion pope benedic auignon cap cc xlix nat longe true tidynges ran thoroughe london howe richarde burdeaulx deed howe dyed meanes coulde nat tell whan wrote cronycle kynge rycharde deed layde lytter ſette chayre couered blacke baudkynne foure horſes blacke chayre two men blacke leadyng chayre four kynghtes blacke folowyng thus chare departed fro towre london brought long throughe london fayre ſoftely tyll cāe chepeſyde chefe aſſembly lōdon chare reſted ſpace two houres thyder came mo xxm perſons men woman ſe hym laye hedde blacke quiſſhen viſage open ſome hym pytie ſōe none ſayd long go deſerued dethe cōſyder well ye great lordes kynges duke erles barōs prelate men great lynage puiſſauce ſe beholde fortune worlde marueylous turne diuerſly kyng richarde reigned kynge englāde xxii yere great proſperite holdyng great eſtate ſignorie neuer kyng englande yt ſpente ſo moche houſe dyd cm florens euery yere ſir iohn̄ froiſſart chanon treaſourer chinay knewe wel court tha quarter yere togider made good chere bycauſe yt youthe clerke ſeruaūt noble kynge edwarde thirde grautfather lady philyp heynault quene englāde grandame whan deꝑted fro hym wynſore departynge kyng ſent knight called ſir iohn̄ golofer gob let ſyluer gylte weyeng two marke ſiluer within c noble yet better ſhalbe long lyue wherfore boūde praye god ſoule moche ſorowe write dethe bicauſe haue cōtynued hiſtorie therfore write therof folowe tyme haue ſene two thingꝭ though differ yet true ye cytie burdeux ſytting table whā kyng richarde borne ye whiche tuiſday x clocke ſame tyme cāe ſir richarde poūtcardon marſhall ac • tayne ſaid froiſſart write put memorie yt nowe lady priceſſe brought abeed fayre ſon twelfe daye yt day thre kynges ſon kynges ſon ſhalbe kyng gētyll knight ſaid trouthe kynge englande xxii yere whan knyght ſayd theſe wordes knewe full lytell ſhulde concluſyon ſame tyme kynge richarde borne father prince galyce whiche kyng dompeter gyuen cōquere realme vpon theſe thyngꝭ haue greatlye ymagined ſythe fyrſt yere cāe englāde ſeruyce quene philyppe kynge edwarde quene chyldren barcamſtede maner prince wale yonde london kynge quene came thyder take leaue ſofie prince prīceſſe goyng acquitayne herde aū cient knyght deuyſe amonge ladyes ſayde booke whiche called le bruſt deuyſeth prince wale eldeſt ſon king duke clarence duke gloceſtre ſhuld neuer kyng englāde ye realme crowne ſhuld returne ye houſe lacaſtre iohan froiſſart auctour cronycle cōſydring theſe thynges ſay theſe two knyghtes ſir richarde pountcardon ſir bartylmewe bruels layd bothe trouthe ſawe ſo dyde worlde rycharde burdeaux xxii yere kyng englande ye crowne retourned houſe lancaſtre yt whan kyng hēry kyng neuer ben richarde burdeaux dalte amyably hym londoner made hym kyng bycauſe pytie hym chyldren thus whan kynge richarde layne two houres chare chepe ſyde draue chayre forwarde whan foure knyghtes folowed chare ſote without london lept horſes whiche redy ſo rode tyll cāe vyllage called langle xxx myle lōdon kyng richarde buryed god haue mercy ſoule tydinges ſpredde abrode howe kyng richarde deed taryed euery daye euery man myght well conſydre ſhulde neuer come priſone lyue dethe long kepte hydde fro wyfe frenche kynge counſayle well enformed knightes ſquyers deſyred nothyng ye warre myght ryde vpon fronters howe counſayls well one realme toke aduyſe thought beſt vpholde ſtyll truſe taken thought ꝓfitable ye warre newe treatie deuyſed march calais bycauſe frēche kyng nat good caſe nat ſythe knewe trouble kyng richarde yet ſickeneſſe doubled whā knewe deed ſo duke burgoyne chefe rule ye realme came ſaynt omers burbour • duke burbone ſir charles de la breſt charles hangeers iohan caſtell morant prelate patriarke ieruſalem byſſhoppes paris beauoyes englyſſhe partie erle northumberlande erle rutlande erle deuonſhyre lorde henry percy erles ſonne yuan fitzwaren prelate byſſhoppes wyncheſter ely frenche men demaū ded haue agayne delyuered ye yong quene englande englyſſhe men wolde wyſe delyuer ſayd ſhe ſhulde lyue ſtyll englāde vpon dowrie though ſhe loſt huſbande wolde prouyde another yt ſhulde fayre yong gentyll ſhe ſhuld better pleaſed richard burdeaux olde ſhuld prince wale eldeſt ſofie kyng henry frenchman wolde nat agre wolde nat conſent therto without licēce kyng father nat good poynt farr̄ ye way medyſyn coude helpe hym mater layde aparte treatie truſe went forwarde ſuche wyſe cōſent bothe party ſware boūde kepe truſe xxvi yere four yeres endured whiche xxx yere accordynge fyrſt couenaūt vpon writynges made ſealed procuracyons bothe kyngꝭ done euery man returned countreis ¶i haue nat yet ſhewed became therle marſhall fyrſt theſe trybulacyons began realme englande nowe ſhall ſhewe venyce whā knewe kyng henry kyng kynge rycharde taken deed toke therof ſo great diſpleaſure ſorowe layde hym downe bedde fell franſy ſo dyed suche miſcheuouſneſſe fell thoſe dayes vpon great lordes englande ¶and yere oure lorde god thouſande four hundred one leſſe pope benedic auignon ben ſuſteyned long frenche men depoſed lykewiſe ſo kynge almaygne yuell dedes clectours empyre duke baron almaygne roſe agaynſt hym ſente hym boeſme kyng choſe another valyaunt wyſeman kyng almayne one bauyers called robert heleberge came coloygne crowned crowne almayne ayes wolde nat open towne hym duke guerles wolde nat vnder obeyſaunce newe kynge almaygne promyſed bring churche vnyte peace howe frēche kynge counſayle treated legeoys helde pope rhome dyde ſo moche meanes ſir baudwyn mount iardyne gouerned great parte ye byſſhoprike liege knyght frenche kynges ſo meanes deſyre frē che kyng countrey liege tourned become neuter ſo legeois ſente rome clergy yt countrey come certayne day el leſe benefyces countre whan herde returned fro rome cāe liege pope bonyface loſt moche tranſmutacion ſente legate almaygne preche amonge cauſe retourne agayne parte legate durſt nat paſſe coloigne ſent letter liege whanne thoſe letter reed ye meſſanger aunſwered payne drownyng ſhulde comeon ſuche meſſage ſayd many meſſanger cometh ſuche meſſage ſhalbe drowned ryuer moeuze finis totius froiſſart ¶thus endeth thirde fourthe boke ſir iohn̄ froiſſart cronycles englande fraūce spayne portyngale scotlande bretaygne flaunders place adioynynge tranſlated frenche maternall englyſſhe iohn̄ bourchier knyght lorde berners deputie generall kynges towne calais march ſame hyghe commaundement mooſt redouted ſouerayne lorde kyng henry eight kyng englande fraunce hyghe defender chriſten faythe c whiche two bokes cōpyled one volume fynyſſhed ſayd towne calais x day marche xvi yere ſaid ſouerayne lordes raigne imprinted london fleteſtrete rycharde pynſon printer kynges mooſt noble grace ended laſt day auguſt yere lorde god mdxxv ¶cum priuylegio rege dulto blazon coat arm
